8_21.translation: You are sinking in the sea of sorrow widened with tears and troubles. But you are stupid enough not to perceive your own wellbeing.
8_21.word_by_word: शोकव्यसनविस्तीर्णे widened with tears and troubles, दु:खसागरे in the ocean of sorrow, मज्जन्ती while you are sinking, मौर्ख्यात् out of stupidity, अनर्थदर्शिनी do not see (your own) wellbeing, आत्मानम् (your) own self, नावबुध्यसे you do not  perceive.

8_22.shloka: भविता राघवो राजा राघवस्यानु यस्सुतः।राजवंशात्तु कैकेयि भरतःपरिहास्यते।।2.8.22।।
8_22.translation: Rama, the scion of the Raghus, will become king. After Rama, his son will suceed him. O Kaikeyi, as for  Bharata, he will be debarred from royal succession (altogether).
8_22.word_by_word: राघव: the scion of the Raghus (Rama), राजा as king, भविता will become, राघवस्य अनुsuceeding Rama, य: who, सुत: (his) son( will become king), कैकेयि O Kaikeyi, भरत: तु on the contrary Bharata, राजवंशात् from royal dynasty, परिहास्यते will be debarred.

8_23.shloka: न हि राज्ञस्सुता स्सर्वे राज्ये तिष्ठन्ति भामिनि।स्थाप्यमानेषु सर्वेषु सुमहाननयो भवेत्।।2.8.23।।
8_23.translation: O lovely lady, not all the sons of the king will inherit the kingdom. If all of them are installed as kings, there will be great disorder.
8_23.word_by_word: भामिनि O lovely lady, राज्ञ: king's, सुता: sons, सर्वे all, राज्ये in the kingdom, न तिष्ठन्ति हि will not succeed, सर्वेषु of all, स्थाप्यमानेषु are installed as kings, सुमहान् very great, अनय:  mismanagement, भवेत् will happen.

8_24.shloka: तस्माज्ज्येष्ठे हि कैकेयि राज्यतन्त्राणि पार्थिवाः।स्थापयन्त्यनवद्याङ्गि गुणवत्स्वितरेष्वपि।।2.8.24।।
8_24.translation: O Kaikeyi of beautiful limbs, for that reason kings bestow the governance of the kingdom either on the eldest or on other virtuous sons.
8_24.word_by_word: अनवद्याङ्गि O one of beautiful limbs, कैकेयि Kaikeyi, तस्मात् for that reason, पार्थिवा: kings, ज्येष्ठे (either) in the eldest son, गुणवत्सु possessing virtues, इतरेष्वपि or in other sons, राज्यतन्त्राणि governance of a kingdom, स्थापयन्ति beston.

8_25.translation: O (Kaikeyi) dear cut off from royal succession as well as from its comforts, your son will become totally forlorn and brokenhearted.
8_25.word_by_word: वत्सले O dear( Kaikeyi), तव your, असौ this, पुत्र: son, अनाथवत् like an orphan,  सुखेभ्य: च from comforts, राजवंशाच्च from royal succession, अत्यन्तनिर्भग्न: very muchbrokenhearted, भविष्यति will become.

8_26.shloka: साऽहं त्वदर्थे सम्प्राप्ता त्वं तु मां नावबुद्ध्यसे।सपत्नि वृद्धौ या मे त्वं प्रदेयं दातुमिच्छसि।।2.8.26।।
8_26.translation: I am here to serve your interest. Nevertheless you do not understand me and you wish to confer gifts on me on the occasion of the prosperity of your cowife.
8_26.word_by_word: सा अहम् such as me, त्वदर्थे in your interest, सम्प्राप्ता have come, त्वं तु nevertheless, you, माम् me, नावबुध्यसे do not understand, या whom, त्वम् you, सपत्निवृद्धौ on the occasion of  prosperity of your cowife, मे to me, प्रदेयं दातुम् to confer gift, इच्छसि wish.

8_27.shloka: ध्रुवं तु भरतं रामः प्राप्य राज्यमकण्टकम्।देशान्तरं वा नयिता लोकान्तरमथाऽपि वा।।2.8.27।।
8_27.translation: Rama, having secured the thornless kingdom, will banish Bharata from the country or else send him to the other world. This is certain.
8_27.word_by_word: राम: Rama, अकण्टकम् free from thorns (enemies), राज्यम् kingdom, प्राप्य having obtained, भरतम् Bharata, देशान्तरं वा out of the country, अथापि वा or else, लोकान्तरम् to the other world, नयिता he will send, ध्रुवम्  this is certain.

8_28.shloka: बाल एव हि मातुल्यं भरतो नायितस्त्वया।सन्निकर्षाच्च सौहार्दं जायते स्थावरेष्वपि।।2.8.28।।
8_28.translation: Bharata has been sent by you right from his childhood to his maternal uncle's house.  Proximity creates friendship even amongst the inanimate objects.
8_28.word_by_word: त्वया by you, भरत: Bharata, बाल: एव even as a child, मातुल्यम् maternal uncle's house,नायित: हि has been sent off, सन्निकर्षात् from proximity, स्थावरेष्वपि even among the immobile (inanimate) objects, सौहार्दम् friendliness, जायते  is created.

8_29.shloka: भरतस्याप्यनुवशश्शत्रुघ्नोऽपि समं गतः।लक्ष्मणो हि यथा रामं तथाऽसौ भरतं गतः।।2.8.29।।
8_29.translation: Satrughna who is obedient to Bharata has followed him. Like Lakshmana who has taken refuge in Rama, he has also resorted to Bharata.
8_29.word_by_word: भरतस्य of Bharata, अनुवश: obedient, शत्रुघ्नोऽपि Satrughna also, समम् along with him, गत: has gone, लक्ष्मण: Lakshmana, रामम् to Rama, यथा as, असौ this Satrughna, तथा in that way, भरतम् to Bharata.

8_30.shloka: श्रूयते हि द्रुमः कश्चिच्छेत्तव्यो वनजीविभिः।सन्निकर्षादिषीकाभिर्मोचितः परमाद्भयात्।।2.8.30।।
8_30.translation: It is said that a tree intended to be cut down by those living on the forest is let off   due to entanglement of a kind of grass known as Ishika (thorny bushes) growing in its vicinity. (If Bharata had been at Ayodhya now, Dasaratha himself would have helped him.
8_30.word_by_word: वनजीविभि: by those living on the forest, छेत्तव्य: intended for felling, कश्चित् one such, द्रुम: tree, इषीकाभि: grass known as Ishika (thorny bushes), सन्निकर्षात् due to being in the close vicinity, परमात् from great, भयात् from fear, मोचित: set free, श्रूयते हि it is heard.

8_31.shloka: गोप्ता हि रामं सौमित्रिर्लक्ष्मणं चापि राघवः।अश्विनोरिव सौभ्रात्रं तयोर्लोकेषु विश्रुतम्।।2.8.31।।
8_31.translation: Just as Lakshmana protects Rama, Rama protects Lakshmana. Their brotherhood is renowned in the world like that of the Ashwins.
8_31.word_by_word: सौमित्रि: Lakshmana, रामम् Rama, गोप्ता हि surely going to protect, राघव: son of heRaghus (Rama), लक्ष्मणं चापि to Lakshmana also, अश्विनो: like of twin 'Ashwins', सौभ्रात्रं इव like brotherhood, तयो: their, लोकेषु in the worlds, विश्रृतम् is renowned.

8_32.shloka: तस्मान्न लक्ष्मणे रामः पापं किञ्चित्करिष्यति।रामस्तु भरते पापं कुर्यादिति न संशयः।।2.8.32।।
8_32.translation: Rama will do no harm to Lakshmana. As for Bharata, Rama will doubtless do him harm.
8_32.word_by_word: तस्मात् therefore, राम: Rama, लक्ष्मणे to Lakshmana, पापम् harm, किञ्चित् even little, न करिष्यति will not do, भरते तु as to but in respect of Bharata, राम: Rama, पापम् harm, कुर्यात् will do, इति in this, न संशय: there is no doubt.

8_33.shloka: तस्माद्राजगृहादेव वनं गच्छतु ते सुतः।एतद्धि रोचते मह्यं भृशं चापि हितं तव।।2.8.33।।
8_33.translation: Therefore let your son go to the forest straight from his uncle's palace only. That alone will please me. For you also this is highly beneficial.
8_33.word_by_word: तस्मात् therefore, ते सुत: your son, राजगृहादेव from Rajagriha (the place of Bharata's maternal uncle) straightaway, वनम् to the forest, गच्छतु let go, एतत् that only, मह्यम् for me, रोचते हि alone is pleasing, तवापि च for you also, भृशम् highly, हितम् beneficial.

8_34.shloka: एवं ते ज्ञातिपक्षस्य श्रेयश्चैव भविष्यति।यदि चेद्भरतो धर्मात्पित्र्यं राज्यमवाप्स्यसि।।2.8.34।।
8_34.translation: If Bharata secures the ancestral kingdom righteously, it will bring welfare to you and to your relations also.
8_34.word_by_word: भरत: Bharata, धर्मात् righteously, पित्र्यम् relating to his father,राज्यम् kingdom, अवाप्स्यसि यदि if he secures, एवं चेत् if it happens that way, ते to you, ज्ञातिपक्षस्य चैव and also to your relations, श्रेय: welfare, भविष्यति will happen.

8_35.shloka: स ते सुखोचितो बालो रामस्य सहजो रिपुः।समृद्धार्थस्य नष्टार्थो जीविष्यति कथं वशे।।2.8.35।।
8_35.translation: Your son, that young Bharata, is accustomed to comforts. He is a born enemy of Rama. How will he, deprived of all wealth, live under the control of Rama?
8_35.word_by_word: ते your, सुखोचित: accustomed to comforts, स: बाल: that young Bharata, रामस्य of Rama,  सहज:रिपु: is born enemy, नष्टार्थ: deprived of all wealth, समृद्धार्थस्य of prosperous (Rama), वशे under the control, कथम् how, जीविष्यति will live.

8_36.shloka: अभिद्रुतमिवारण्ये सिंहेन गजयूथपम्।प्रच्छाद्यमानं रामेण भरतं त्रातुमर्हसि।।2.8.36।।
8_36.translation: Like the leader of an elephantherd attacked by a lion in the forest, Bharata is going to be oppressed by Rama. You should save him.
8_36.word_by_word: अरण्ये in the forest, सिंहेन by a lion, अभिद्रुतम् being attacked, गजयूथपम्इव like the leader of the elephant herd, रामेण by Rama, प्रच्छाद्यमानम् being overpowered, भरतम् Bharata, त्रातुम् to save, अर्हसि it behoves you.

8_37.shloka: दर्पान्निराकृता पूर्वं त्वया सौभाग्यवत्तया।राममाता सपत्नी ते कथं वैरं न शातयेत्।।2.8.37।।
8_37.translation: Being fortunate (being the favourite wife of your husband) you slighted your cowifeearlier with pride. How will she, Rama's mother (Kausalya) remain without retaliating?
8_37.word_by_word: त्वया by you, सौभाग्यवत्तया being fortunate (being favourite wife of your husband), दर्पात् from pride, पूर्वम् earlier, निराकृता was slighted, ते your, सपत्नी cowife (Kausalya), राममाता Rama's mother, वैरम् grudge, कथम् how, न शातयेत् will not retaliate.

8_38.shloka: यदा हि रामः पृथिवीमवाप्स्यतिप्रभूतरत्नाकरशैलपत्तनाम्।तदा गमिष्यस्यशुभं पराभवंसहैव दीना भरतेन भामिनि।।2.8.38।।
8_38.translation: O lovely lady when Rama becomes the lord of this earth with its oceans, mountains and cities, then along with Bharata you will become miserable and fall into disgrace.
8_38.word_by_word: भामिनि O lovely lady, राम: Rama, यदा when, प्रभूतरत्नाकरशैलपत्तनाम् with its oceans, mountains and towns, पृथिवीम् to this earth, अवाप्स्यति secures, तदा then, भरतेन सहैव along with Bharata, दीना become miserable, अशुभम् disgrace, गमिष्यसि will attain.

8_39.shloka: यदा हि रामः पृथिवीमवाप्स्यतिध्रुवं प्रणष्टो भरतो भविष्यति।अतो हि सञ्चिन्तय राज्यमात्मजेपरस्य चैवाद्य विवासकारणम्।।2.8.39।।
8_39.translation: When Rama obtains this earth, Bharata will be certainly ruined. Therefore, right now think of the kingdom for your son and the means of banishment for your enemy, Rama.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे अष्टमस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the eighth sarga of Ayodhyakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
8_39.word_by_word: राम: Rama, यदा हि when, पृथिवीम् this earth, अवाप्स्यति obtains, भरत: Bharata, ध्रृवम् certainly, प्रणष्ट: ruined, भविष्यति will become, अत: for that reason, आत्मजे your son, राज्यम् kingdom, अद्यैव right now, परस्य enemy Rama's, विवासकारणम् means of banishment, सञ्चिन्तय think over.

9_1.shloka: [Instigated by Manthara, Kaikeyi enters the chamber of wrath.]एवमुक्ता तु कैकेयी क्रोधेन ज्वलितानना।दीर्घमुष्णं विनिश्वस्य मन्थरामिदमब्रवीत्।।2.9.1।।
9_1.translation: Thus spoken to, Kaikeyi, her face burning with anger, breathed a deep, hot sigh and said these words to Manthara:
9_1.word_by_word: एवम् thus, उक्ता spoken to (by Manthara), कैकेयी Kaikeyi, क्रोधेन (कोपेन) in anger, ज्वलितानना face burning (with anger), दीर्घम् deep, उष्णम् hot, विनिश्वस्य having breathed, मन्थराम् to Manthara, इदम् these words, अब्रवीत् said

9_2.shloka: अद्य राममितः क्षिप्रं वनं प्रस्थापयाम्यहम्।यौवराज्ये च भरतं क्षिप्रमेवाभिषेचये।।2.9.2।।
9_2.translation: Today I shall at once banish Rama from here into the forest and get Bharata coronated as heirapparent without delay.
9_2.word_by_word: अद्य today, अहम् I, रामम् to Rama, इत: from here itself, क्षिप्रम् quickly, वनम् to the forest,  प्रस्थापयामि shall send forth, भरतं च to Bharata also, क्षिप्रमेव without delay, यौवराज्ये as prince regent, अभिषेचये I shall consecrate (him).

9_3.shloka: इदं त्विदानीं सम्पश्य केनोपायेन मन्थरे।भरतः प्राप्नुयाद्राज्यं न तु रामः कथञ्चन।।2.9.3।।
9_3.translation: O Manthara now see, for sure, Bharata and not Rama will get the kingdom by anymeans.
9_3.word_by_word: मन्थरे O Manthara केन उपायेन, कथञ्चन by any means, राज्यम् kingdom, प्राप्नुयात् will get,राम: तु for sure, न shall not (obtain), इदम् this one, इदानीम् now, सम्पश्य do see.

9_4.shloka: एवमुक्ता तया देव्या मन्थरा पापदर्शिनी।रामार्थमुपहिंसन्ती कैकेयीमिदमब्रवीत्।।2.9.4।।
9_4.translation: Thus addressed by queen Kaikeyi, that evil minded Manthara said this to Kaikeyi  in order to spoil the interest of Rama:
9_4.word_by_word: तया देव्या by that queen, एवम् thus, उक्ता having been addressed, पापदर्शिनी evilminded  रामार्थम् Rama's interests, उपहिंसन्ती destroying, कैकेयीम् to Kaikeyi, इदम् this, अब्रवीत् said.

9_5.shloka: हन्तेदानीं प्रवक्ष्यामि कैकेयि श्रूयतां च मे।यथा ते भरतो राज्यं पुत्रः प्राप्स्यति केवलम्।।2.9.5।।
9_5.translation: O Kaikeyi, what a joy I shall now tell you how your son Bharata alone will secure the kingdom. Listen to me:
9_5.word_by_word: हन्त what joy, कैकेयि O Kaikeyi, केवलम् alone, ते पुत्र: your son, भरत: Bharata, यथा as, राज्यम् kingdom, प्राप्स्यति will get, प्रवक्ष्यामि I shall tell, मे my (word), श्रूयतां च listen.

9_6.shloka: किं न स्मरसि कैकेयि स्मरन्ती वा निगूहसे।यदुच्यमानमात्मार्थं मत्तस्त्वं श्रोतुमिच्छसि।।2.9.6।।
9_6.translation: O Kaikeyi, don't you remember in your own interest what I'm going to tell you or are you hiding it, wishing to hear from me?
9_6.word_by_word: कैकेयि O Kaikeyi, उच्यमानम् which is going to be told, आत्मार्थम् (the means) for your welfare, त्वम् you, मत्त: from me, श्रोतुम् to hear, यत् इच्छसि since you wish, न स्मरसि किम्   do you not remember that ?, स्मरन्ती remembering, निगूहसे वा or are you concealing it?

9_7.shloka: मयोच्यमानं यदि ते श्रोतुं छन्दो विलासिनि।श्रूयतामभिधास्यामि श्रुत्वा चापि विमृश्यताम्।।2.9.7।।
9_7.translation: O lovely Kaikeyi if it pleases you to hear from me, I shall tell you. Listen and think over it, too.
9_7.word_by_word: विलासिनि O lovely one (Kaikeyi), मया by me, उच्यमानम् while being told, श्रोतुम् to hear      (from me), ते to you, छन्द: यदि if it pleases, अभिधास्यामि I shall tell you, श्रूयताम् listen, श्रुत्वा having heard, विमृश्यताम् अपि च also think over it.

9_8.shloka: श्रुत्वैवं वचनं तस्या मन्थरायास्तु कैकेयी।किञ्चिदुत्थाय शयनात्स्वास्तीर्णादिदमब्रवीत्।।2.9.8।।
9_8.translation: After hearing Manthara's words, Kaikeyi got up a little from her wellspread bed and said this:
9_8.word_by_word: कैकेयी Kaikeyi, तस्या: मन्थराया: that  Manthara's, एवम् in this way, वचनम् words, श्रुत्वा (एव)  after hearing, स्वास्तीर्णात् from the wellspread, शयनात् from the bed, किञ्चित् a little, उत्थाय got up, इदम् this, अब्रवीत् said.

9_9.shloka: कथय त्वं ममोपायं केनोपायेन मन्थरे।भरतः प्राप्नुयाद्राज्यं न तु रामः कथञ्चन।।2.9.9।।
9_9.translation: O Manthara, tell me the means by which Bharata and not Rama will secure the kingdom in any circumstances.
9_9.word_by_word: मन्थरे O Manthara केन by what, उपायेन means, भरत: Bharata, राज्यम् kingdom, प्राप्नुयात् will secure, राम: तु as for Rama, कथञ्चन anyhow, न will not get, उपायम् means,  त्वम् you, मम to me, कथय speak.

9_10.shloka: एवमुक्ता तया देव्या मन्थरा पापदर्शिनी।रामार्थमुपहिंसन्ती कुब्जा वचनमब्रवीत्।।2.9.10।।
9_10.translation: Thus addressed by the queen (Kaikeyi), the evileyed hunchback, Manthara, said with the intention to damage Rama's interest.
9_10.word_by_word: तया देव्या by that queen, एवम् in this way, उक्ता having been spoken to, पापदर्शिनी evileyed, मन्थरा Manthara, रामार्थम् Rama's interest, उपहिंसन्ती ruining, कुब्जा hunchback, अब्रवीत् said.

9_11.shloka: तव दैवासुरे युद्धे सह राजर्षिभिः पतिः।अगच्छत्त्वामुपादाय देवराजस्य साह्यकृत्।।2.9.11।।दिशमास्थाय वै देवि दक्षिणां दण्डकान्प्रति।वैजयन्तमिति ख्यातं पुरं यत्र तिमिध्वजः।।2.9.12।।
9_11.translation: O queen during the war between gods and asuras, your husband went with royal saints intending to render assistance to Indra, king of the gods, taking you along with him. He set off in the southern direction of Dandaka forest to a renowned city called Vaijayanta where asura Timidhvaja lived.
9_11.word_by_word: देवि O queen तव your, पति: husband, दैवासुरे between gods and asuras, युद्धे in the war, देवराजस्य of the king of the gods (Indra's), साह्यकृत् one who rendered assistance, त्वाम् you, उपादाय having taken, दक्षिणां दिशम् the southern direction, आस्थाय having reached, दण्डकान् प्रति towards Dandaka, वैजयन्तम् इति known as Vaijayanta, ख्यातम् renowned, यत्र where, तिमिध्वज: Timidhvaja, पुरम् to the city, राजर्षिभि: सह along with royal saints, अगच्छत् went.

9_12.shloka: स शम्बर इति ख्यातश्शतमायो महासुरः।ददौ शक्रस्य सङ्ग्रामं देवसङ्घैरनिर्जितः।।2.9.13।।
9_12.translation: That mighty asura wellknown as Sambara, capable of a hundred deceitful forms, challenged Indra to a battle which could not be conquered by hosts of gods.
9_12.word_by_word: शम्बर: इति as Sambara, ख्यात: wellknown, शतमाय: possessing a hundred deceitfulforms, स: महासुर: that mighty asura, देवसङ्घै: by hosts of gods, अनिर्जित: could not be conquered, शक्रस्य for Indra, सङ्ग्रामम् battle, ददौ gave.

9_13.shloka: तस्मिन्महति सङ्ग्रामे पुरुषान्क्षतविक्षतान्।रात्रौ प्रसुप्तान्घ्नन्ति स्म तरसाऽऽसाद्य राक्षसाः।।2.9.14।।
9_13.translation: In that great battle, the rakshasas used to kill by force the warriors wounded by the weapons and those fast asleep during the night.
9_13.word_by_word: महति great, तस्मिन् सङ्ग्रामे in that war, क्षतविक्षतान् those wounded, रात्रौ during the night, प्रसुप्तान् those who were fast asleep, पुरुषान् the warriors, राक्षसा: by rakshasas, आसाद्य having approached, तरसा by force, घ्नन्ति स्म killed.

9_14.translation: There in that great battle the mightyarmed king Dasaratha lay wounded with weapons (used) by the asuras.
9_14.word_by_word: तदा then, दशरथ: राजा king Dasaratha, तत्र there, महद्युद्धम् great battle, अकरोत् fought, महाबाहु: one with mighty arms (Dasaratha), असुरै: च by asuras, शस्त्रै: with weapons, शकलीकृत: च his body was shattered to pieces.

9_15.shloka: अपवाह्य त्वया देवि सङ्ग्रामान्नष्टचेतनः।तत्रापि विक्षतश्शस्त्रैः पतिस्ते रक्षितस्त्वया।।2.9.16।।
9_15.translation: O queen you had protected your husband by carrying him away from the battlefieldwhen he lost his consciousness. He was saved by you. Once again you saved him when he lay wounded with weapons (hurled) by the asuras.
9_15.word_by_word: देवि O queen (Kaikeyi), नष्टचेतन: (Dasaratha) who lost consciousness, त्वया by you, सङ्ग्रामात् from the battlefield, अपवाह्य after being carried away, रक्षित: was protected, तत्रापि there also, शस्त्रै: by weapons, विक्षत: wounded, ते पति: your husband, त्वया by you,रक्षित: saved.

9_16.shloka: तुष्टेन तेन दत्तौ ते द्वौ वरौ शुभदर्शने।स त्वयोक्तः पतिर्देवि  यदेच्छेयं तदा वरौ।।2.9.17।।गृह्णीयामिति तत्तेन तथेत्युक्तं महात्मना।
9_16.translation: O auspiciouslooking one out of gratitude he had granted two boons to you (for saving him on two occasions). O queen then you told your husband that whenever you desire, you will ask for those boons. The magnanimous king said, 'So be it'.
9_16.word_by_word: शुभदर्शने O auspiciouslooking one, तुष्टेन by the gratified, तेन by him, ते to you, द्वौ two, वरौ boons, दत्तौ were given, देवि O queen त्वया by you, स: पति: that husband, Dasaratha, यदा whenever, इच्छेयम् I desire, तदा then, वरौ the boons, गृह्णीयाम् इति shall receive, उक्त: thus told, तत् that one, तथा इति 'So be it' saying so, तेन महात्मना by that magnanimous (king), उक्तम् has been told.

9_17.shloka: अनभिज्ञाम्ह्यहं देवि त्वयैव कथिता पुरा।।2.9.18।।कथैषा तव तु स्नेहान्मनसा धार्यते मया।रामाभिषेकसम्भारान्निगृह्य विनिवर्तय।।2.9.19।।
9_17.translation: O queen I did not know this indeed. Only you had related it to me earlier. Because of my affection towards you, I have retained it in my memory. (Now) prevent preparations for Rama's consecration by force.
9_17.word_by_word: देवि O queen अहम् I, अनभिज्ञा हि surely unaware of this, पुरा formerly, त्वयैव by yourself, कथिता was related, एषा कथा this story, तव your, स्नेहात् तु out of affection, मया by me, मनसा in mind, धार्यते retained, निगृह्य by force, रामाभिषेकसम्भारान् preparations for Rama's consecration, विनिवर्तय prevent.

9_18.shloka: तौ वरौ याच भर्तारं भरतस्याभिषेचनम्।प्रव्राजनं च रामस्य त्वं वर्षाणि चतुर्दश।।2.9.20।।
9_18.translation: Ask your husband for those two boons namely consecration of Bharata and banishment  of Rama for fourteen years.
9_18.word_by_word: भरतस्य Bharata's, अभिषेचनम् installation, चतुर्दश fourteen, वर्षाणि years, रामस्य Rama's, प्रव्राजनम् banishment, तौ those, वरौ two  boons, त्वम् you, भर्तारम् your husband, याच beg.

9_19.shloka: चतुर्दश हि वर्षाणि रामे प्रव्राजिते वनम्।प्रजाभावगतस्नेहस्स्थिरः पुत्रो भविष्यति।।2.9.21।।
9_19.translation: If Rama is banished into the forest for fourteen years your son will be firmly established in the kingdom by  affectionately winning the hearts of  the people.
9_19.word_by_word: रामे having Rama, चतुर्दश वर्षाणि for fourteen years, वनम् to the forest, प्रव्राजिते if banished, पुत्र: your son, प्रजाभावगतस्नेह: by affectionately winning the hearts of the people, स्थिर: भविष्यति will be firmly established.

9_20.translation: O Kaikeyi ,daughter of Ashwapati enter now the chamber of wrath like one in angry mood, wearing soiled garments and lie down on the bare ground.
9_20.word_by_word: अश्वपते: Ashwapati's, सुते daughter (Kaikeyi ), अद्य now, क्रुद्धेव like a person in angry mood, क्रोधागारम् chamber of wrath, प्रविश्य having entered, मलिनवासिनी wearing soiled garments, अनन्तर्हितायाम् not covered (with clothes, etc), भूमौ on the ground, शेष्व lie down.

9_21.shloka: मास्मैनं प्रत्युदीक्षेथा मा चैनमभिभाषथाः।रुदन्ती चापि तं दृष्ट्वा जगत्यां शोकलालसा।।2.9.23।।
9_21.translation: Immersed in grief and in tears, neither look at him (Dasaratha) nor even talk to him when you see him.
9_21.word_by_word: तम् him (Dasaratha), दृष्ट्वा having seen, शोकलालसा absorbed in grief, रुदन्ती in tears,  एनम् him, मा स्म प्रत्युदीक्षेथा: do not look at him, एनम् him, मा चैव अभिभाषथा: also do not talk with him.

9_22.shloka: दयिता त्वं सदा भर्तुरत्र मे नास्ति संशयः।त्वत्कृते स महाराजो विशेदपि हुताशनम्।।2.9.24।।
9_22.translation: No doubt, you have always been a beloved wife to your husband. For your sake the great king will even enter into the burning fire.
9_22.word_by_word: त्वम् you, सदा always, भर्तु: for your husband, दयिता  a beloved one, अत्र in this matter, मे to me, संशय: doubt, नास्ति not there, त्वत्कृते for your sake, स: महाराज: that great king, हुताशनम् in the burning fire, विशेदपि will enter.

9_23.shloka: न त्वां क्रोधयितुं शक्तो न क्रृद्धां प्रत्युदीक्षितुम्।तव प्रियार्थं राजा हि प्राणानपि परित्यजेत्।।2.9.25।।
9_23.translation: The king is afraid of inciting your ire. When you are angry, he dare not look at your indignant countenance. Indeed he will forsake even his life for your pleasure.
9_23.word_by_word: राजा king, त्वाम् you, क्रोधयितुम् to make angry, न शक्त: is not capable, क्रुद्धाम् at (your) angry face, प्रत्युदीक्षितुम् to look at, न is not possible, तव your, प्रियार्थम् for pleasure, प्राणानपि even his life, परित्यजेत् हि will forsake indeed.

9_24.shloka: न ह्यतिक्रमितुं शक्तस्तव वाक्यं महीपतिः।मन्दस्वभावे बुध्यस्व सौभाग्यबलमात्मनः।।2.9.26।।
9_24.translation: The king would not dare transgress your words. O wicked woman, recognise the power of your beauty.
9_24.word_by_word: महीपति: lord of the earth (king), तव your, वाक्यम् words, अतिक्रमितुम् to transgress, न शक्त:हि is not able, मन्दस्वभावे evilnatured, आत्मन: your own, सौभाग्यबलम् power of your beauty, बुध्यस्व recognise.

9_25.shloka: मणिमुक्तं सुवर्णानि रत्नानि विविधानि च।दद्याद्दशरथो राजा मास्म तेषु मनः कृथाः।।2.9.27।।
9_25.translation: King Dasaratha may give you gems, pearls, gold and different kinds of precious stones. Do not pay them any attention.
9_25.word_by_word: दशरथ: राजा king Dasaratha, मणिमुक्तासुवर्णानि gems, pearls and gold, विविधानि of different kinds, रत्नानि च precious stones also, दद्यात् may give, तेषु in them, मन: mind, मा कृथा: do not pay attention

9_26.shloka: यौ तौ दैवासुरे युद्धे वरौ दशरथोऽददात्।तौ स्मारय महाभागे सोऽर्थो न त्वामतिक्रमेत्।।2.9.28।।
9_26.translation: O fortunate Kaikeyi, make him recollect the two boons he had granted you in the war between gods and demons. You should not ignore your objective.
9_26.word_by_word: महाभागे O highly fortunate one, दशरथ: of Dasaratha, दैवासुरे युद्धे in the war between gods and demons, यौ which, तौ two, वरौ boons, अददात् had given, तौ those two, स्मारय remind, अर्थ: the objective, त्वाम् you, अतिक्रमेत् may not transgress.

9_27.shloka: यदातु ते वरं दद्यात्स्वयमुत्थाप्य राघवः।व्यवस्थाप्य महाराजं त्वमिमं वृणुया वरम्।।2.9.29।।
9_27.translation: When Dasaratha personally lifts you from the floor and  asks  you what you want  you may make him settle down and ask him for these boons:
9_27.word_by_word: राघव: the descendant of the Raghus (Dasaratha), स्वयम् personally, उत्थाप्य lifting you up from the floor, ते to you, वरम् boon, यदा when, दद्यात् gives then, त्वम् you, तं महाराजम् to that monarch, व्यवस्थाप्य making him settle down, इमम् वरम् this boon, वृणुया: you mayseek.

9_28.shloka: रामं प्रव्राजयारण्ये नव वर्षाणि पञ्च च।भरतः क्रियतां राजा पृथिव्याः पार्थिवर्षभः।।2.9.30।।
9_28.translation: 'O best of kings exile Rama into the forest for fourteen years and make Bharata king of the land'.
9_28.word_by_word: पार्थिवर्षभ: best of kings, रामम् to Rama, नव पञ्च वर्षाणि for fourteen years, अरण्ये in the forest, प्रव्राजय exile, भरत: Bharata, पृथिव्या: of this earth, राजा as king, क्रियताम् be made.

9_29.shloka: चतुर्दश हि वर्षाणि रामे प्रव्राजिते वनम्।रूढश्च कृतमूलश्च शेषं स्थास्यति ते सुतः।।2.9.31।।
9_29.translation: After Rama has been exiled into the forest for fourteen years your son grown strong and deeprooted will remain (king) for the rest of his life.
9_29.word_by_word: रामे of Rama, चतुर्दश वर्षाणि for fourteen years, वनम् to the forest, प्रव्राजिते having been exiled, ते सुत: your son, रूढ: च will grow strong, कृतमूल: च and deeprooted, शेषम् for the  remaining time, स्थास्यति shall remain (stable).

9_30.shloka: रामप्रव्राजनं चैव देवि याचस्व तं वरम्।एवं सिद्ध्यन्ति पुत्रस्य सर्वार्थास्तव भामिनि।।2.9.32।।
9_30.translation: O Devi demand Rama's exile as a boon. O lovely queen this way all the interestsof your son will be fulfilled (protected).
9_30.word_by_word: देवि O Devi रामप्रव्राजनं चैव Rama's exile, too, वरम् as a boon, तम् him, याचस्व solicit, भामिनि O lovely one, एवम् this way, तव your, पुत्रस्य son's, सर्वार्था: all the interests, सिद्ध्यन्ति willbe fulfilled (protected).

9_31.shloka: एवं प्रव्राजितश्चैव रामोऽरामो भविष्यति।भरतश्च हतामित्रस्तव राजा भविष्यति।।2.9.33।।
9_31.translation: Thus, if Rama is exiled he will no longer be Rama (be able to cause delight to the people). Bharata will become king  with his enemy subdued.
9_31.word_by_word: एवम् thus, प्रव्राजित: exiled, राम: Rama, अराम: will no longer cause any delight to people, भविष्यति will become, भरतश्च Bharata also, राजा as king, हतामित्रश्च with  enemies destroyed, भविष्यति will become.

9_32.shloka: येन कालेन रामश्च वनात्प्रत्यागमिष्यति।तेन कालेन पुत्रस्ते कृतमूलो भविष्यति।।2.9.34।।सुगृहीतमनुष्यश्च सुहृद्भिस्सार्धमात्मवान्।
9_32.translation: By the time Rama returns from the forest, your son (now) confident, would have become deep rooted by gaining the company of friends and the acceptability of the people.
9_32.word_by_word: येन कालेन by the time, राम: च Rama also, वनात् from the forest, प्रत्यागमिष्यति returns, तेन कालेन by then, ते your, आत्मवान् confident, पुत्र: son, सुगृहीतमनुष्य: people whose affection has been gained, सुहृद्भि: सार्धम् in the company of friends, कृतमूल: deeprooted, भविष्यति will become.

9_33.translation: I think the proper time has come (to ask for the boons). Without fear refrain the king forcibly from his intention of installing Rama.
9_33.word_by_word: राजानम् the king, प्राप्तकालं नु proper time has come, मन्ये I consider, वीतसाध्वसा devoid of fear, निगृह्य forcibly, रामाभिषेकसङ्कल्पात् from the intention of installing Rama, विनिवर्तय refrain.

9_34.shloka: अनर्थमर्थरूपेण ग्राहिता सा ततस्तया।।2.9.36।।हृष्टा प्रतीता कैकेयी मन्थरामिदमब्रवीत्।
9_34.translation: Thus, having been made to accept the evil design as a beneficial objective, Kaikeyi  understood (the entire matter) and in delight spoke to Manthara.
9_34.word_by_word: तया by her, अनर्थम् evil design, अर्थरूपेण as a beneficial objective, ग्राहिता having been made to accept, सा कैकेयी that Kaikeyi, तत: after that, प्रतीता having believed, हृष्टा with delight, मन्थराम् addressing Manthara, इदम् this word, अब्रवीत् said.

9_35.shloka: सा हि वाक्येन कुब्जायाः किशोरीवोत्पथं गता।।2.9.37।।कैकेयी विस्मयं प्राप्ता परं परमदर्शना।
9_35.translation: That Kaikeyi, even though endowed with sound foresight, expressed her sense of wonder at the words of the hunchback and chose a wrong path like a young (immature) girl.
9_35.word_by_word: परमदर्शना endowed with sound foresight, सा कैकेयी that Kaikeyi, कुब्जाया: hunchback, वाक्येन with the words of, परम् great, विस्मयम् गता experiencing surprise, किशोरीव like an (immature) young girl, उत्पथम् a wrong path, गता adopted.

9_36.shloka: कुब्जे त्वां नाभिजानामि श्रेष्ठां श्रेष्ठाभिथायिनीम्।।2.9.38।।पृथिव्यामसि कुब्जानामुत्तमा बुद्धिनिश्चये।
9_36.translation: (She said) O hunchback, I never knew that you can speak such excellent words or decide  things intelligently. You are the best among the hunchbacks of this world.
9_36.word_by_word: कुब्जे O hunchback श्रेष्ठाभिधायिनीम् speaking excellent words, त्वाम् you, श्रेष्ठाम् as the best,नाभिजानामि I did not recognise, बुद्धिनिश्चये in ascertaining intelligence, पृथिव्याम् in this world, कुब्जानाम् among the hunchbacks, उत्तमा असि you are the best one.

9_37.shloka: त्वमेव तु ममाऽर्थेषु नित्ययुक्ता हितैषिणी।।2.9.39।।नाहं समवबुध्येयं कुब्जे राज्ञश्चिकीर्षितम्।
9_37.translation: O hunchback you alone always show interest in my affairs and seek my welfare. I might not have known the intended (deceptive) action of the king (without you).
9_37.word_by_word: कुब्जे O hunchback, त्वमेव you alone, मम my, अर्थेषु in (my) affairs, नित्ययुक्ता always showing  interest, हितैषिणी seeking welfare, अहम् I, राज्ञ: king's, चिकीर्षितम् the intended action, न समवबुध्येयम् I might not have known.

9_38.shloka: सन्ति दुस्संस्थिताः कुब्जा वक्राः परमदारुणाः।।2.9.40।।त्वं पद्ममिव वातेन सन्नता प्रियदर्शना।त्वं पद्ममिव वातेन सन्नता प्रियदर्शना।
9_38.translation: There are many hunchbacks in this world, terribly ugly with their bodies misshaped and crooked. But you look beautiful like a lotus bent by the breeze.
9_38.word_by_word: कुब्जा: hunchbacks, दुस्संस्थिता: women physically retarded, वक्रा: crooked, परमदारुणा: terrible in appearance, सन्ति are, सन्नता bent, त्वम् you, वातेन by breeze, पद्ममिव like a lotus, प्रियदर्शना one with good looks.

9_39.shloka: उरस्तेऽभिनिविष्टं वै यावत्स्कन्धात् समुन्नतं।।2.9.41।।अधस्ताच्चोदरं शातं सुनाभमिव लज्जितम्।
9_39.translation: Your breasts are thick and are as high as your shoulders. Beneath them lies your belly with its beautiful navel (waist) looking slender as if out of bashfulness.
9_39.word_by_word: ते उर: your breasts, अभिनिविष्टम् are thick, यावत्स्कन्धात् up to the shoulders, समुन्नतम् is high, अधस्तात् beneath it, सुनाभम् beautiful naval, उदरं च belly also, लज्जितं इव as if bashful , शातम् is slender.

9_40.shloka: परिपूर्णं तु जघनं सुपीनौ च पयोधरौ।।2.9.42।।विमलेन्दुसमं वक्त्रमहोराजसि मन्थरे।
9_40.translation: You have full hips, round and plump breasts. Your countenance equals the bright moon. How passionate you look, Manthara
9_40.word_by_word: जघनम् hips, परिपूर्णम् full, पयोधरौ breasts, सुपीनौ round and plump, वक्त्रम् countenance, विमलेन्दुसमम् equals the bright moon, मन्थरे O Manthara अहो राजसि how passionate you look.

9_41.shloka: जघनं तव निर्घुष्टं रशनादामशोभितम्।।2.9.43।।जङ्घे भृशमुपन्यस्ते पादौ चाप्यायतावुभौ।
9_41.translation: Your hips, glitter with the jingling girdle. Strong are the  calfs of your legs and long are your feet.
9_41.word_by_word: तव your, रशनादामशोभितम् glittering with girdle, जघनम् hips, निर्घुष्टम् jingling, जङ्घे the calfs of the legs, भृशम् exceedingly, उपन्यस्ते are set strong, उभौ both, पादौ च your feet also, आयतौ are long.

9_42.shloka: त्वमायताभ्यां सक्थिभ्यां मन्थरे क्षौमवासिनी।।2.9.44।।अग्रतो मम गच्छन्ती राजहंसीव राजसे।
9_42.translation: O Manthara when clad in silk garment you walk in front of me with your heavythighs, you look like a female royal swan.
9_42.word_by_word: मन्थरे O Manthara, आयताभ्याम् heavy, सक्थिभ्याम् with both thighs, त्वम् you, क्षौमवासिनी clad in silk garment, मम my, अग्रत: in front of, गच्छन्ती walking, राजहंसीव like female royal swan, राजसे shine.

9_43.translation: In you reside a thousand deceitful means more than all the thousand mayas (tricks) of Sambara, king of the asuras, was capable of.
9_43.word_by_word: असुराधिपे king of the asuras, शम्बरे that Sambara, याः those, सहस्रश: मायाः a thousand deceitful means, आसन् lay, ताः those, सर्वाः all, भूयः many more, सहस्रशः in thousands, अन्याश्च others also, त्वयि in you, निविष्टाः reside.

9_44.shloka: तवेदं स्थगु यद्दीर्घं रथघोणमिवायतम्।।2.9.46।।मतयः क्षत्रविद्याश्च मायाश्चात्र वसन्ति ते।
9_44.translation: Your clever thoughts, magic powers and also the skills of kshatriyas are stored in your huge hump which is as wide as the hub of a chariot wheel.
9_44.word_by_word: आयतम् wide, रथघोणमिव like the hub of a chariot, दीर्घम् long, तव your, यत् which, इदम् this, स्थगु hump, अत्र here, ते your, मतय: thoughts, क्षत्रविद्या: skills of a kshatriya,  माया: च  also magic powers, वसन्ति are residing.

9_45.shloka: अत्र ते प्रतिमोक्ष्यामि मालां कुब्जे हिरण्मयीम्।।2.9.47।।अभिषिक्ते च भरते राघवे च वनं गते।
9_45.translation: O hunchback, with Rama gone to the forest and Bharata consecrated, I shall drape this hump with a golden garland.
9_45.word_by_word: कुब्जे O hunchback राघवे of the descendant of the Raghus (Rama), वनम् to the forest, गते having gone, भरते च Bharata also, अभिषिक्ते having been consecrated, अत्र here (on this hump), हिरण्मयीम् golden, मालाम् garland, प्रतिमोक्ष्यामि I shall deliver.

9_46.shloka: जात्येन च सुवर्णेन सुनिष्टप्तेन मन्थरे।।2.9.48।।लब्धार्था च प्रतीता च लेपयिष्यामि ते स्थगु।
9_46.translation: O Manthara, when my objective is accomplished and I am fully satisfied, I will smear your hump with the best of refined liquid gold.
9_46.word_by_word: मन्थरे O Manthara, लब्धार्था च after accomplishsing the objective, प्रतीता च also satisfied, जात्येन belonging to the best , सुनिष्टप्तेन highly refined, सुवर्णेन with gold, ते स्थगु your hump, लेपयिष्यामि will smear.

9_47.shloka: मुखे च तिलकं चित्रं जातरूपमयं शुभम्।।2.9.49।।कारयिष्यामि ते कुब्जे शुभान्याभरणानि च।
9_47.translation: O Manthara, I shall get a tilaka made of gold for your auspicious, lovely face and shall also order exquisite ornaments (for you).
9_47.word_by_word: कुब्जे O Manthara ते मुखे on  your face, जातरूपमयम् fully made of gold, चित्रम् wonderful, शुभम् auspicious, तिलकम् tilaka (a mark on the forehead), शुभानि beautiful, आभरणानि च ornaments also, कारयिष्यामि shall get them made.

9_48.shloka: परिधाय शुभे वस्त्रे देवतेव चरिष्यसि।।2.9.50।।चन्द्रमाह्वयमानेन मुखेनाप्रतिमानना।गमिष्यसि गतिं मुख्यां गर्वयन्ती द्विषज्जनम्।।2.9.51।।
9_48.translation: You shall move about wearing lovely garments like a goddess. With a peerless countenance, as if challenging the Moon and feeling proud, you will attain a state ofeminence amidst your enemies.
9_48.word_by_word: शुभे auspicious, वस्त्रे garments, परिधाय wearing, देवतेव like a goddess, चरिष्यसि you shall move about, चन्द्रम् of moon, आह्वयमानेन challenging, मुखेन with countenance, अप्रतिमानना with a peerless, द्विषज्जनम् amidst your enemies, गर्वयन्ती feeling proud, मुख्याम् eminent, गतिम् state, गमिष्यसि you will attain.

9_49.shloka: तवापि कुब्जाः कुब्जायास्सर्वाभरणभूषिताः।पादौ परिचरिष्यन्ति यथैव त्वं सदा मम।।2.9.52।।
9_49.translation: Other hunchbacks adorned with all sorts of ornament shall also serve you in the same manner as you are serving me.
9_49.word_by_word: त्वम् you, मम to me, यथैव in that manner, कुब्जाया: other hunchbacks, तव पादौ अपि your feet also, कुब्जा: other humpbacks, सर्वाभरणभूषिता: adorned with all ornaments, सदा परिचरिष्यन्ति will always serve you.

9_50.shloka: इति प्रशस्यमाना सा कैकेयीमिदमब्रवीत्।शयानां शयने शुभ्रे वेद्यामग्निशिखामिव।।2.9.53।।
9_50.translation: Flattered in this manner, Manthara addressed Kaikeyi who was lying on a white couch and looking like a flaming fire on the sacrificial altar:
9_50.word_by_word: इति thus, प्रशस्यमाना being praised, सा that(Manthara), वेद्याम् on a sacrificial altar, अग्निशिखामिव like a flaming fire, शुभ्रे white, शयने in the couch, शयानाम् lying down, कैकेयीम् addressing Kaikeyi, इदम् this, अब्रवीत् said.

9_51.shloka: गतोदके सेतुबन्धो न कल्याणि विधीयते।उत्तिष्ठ कुरु कल्याणि राजानमनुदर्शय।।2.9.54।।
9_51.translation: O fortunate one construction of a dike is not undertaken after the water has flowed down. Act before the king to the best of your interest.
9_51.word_by_word: कल्याणि O fortunate one, गतोदके after the water has flowed out, सेतुबन्ध: construction of a dam, न विधीयते not undertaken, उत्तिष्ठ you may arise, कल्याणम् auspicious act, कुरु perform, राजानम् (to the) king, अनुदर्शय show(such act).

9_52.shloka: तथा प्रोत्साहिता देवी गत्वा मन्थरया सह।क्रोधागारं विशालाक्षी सौभाग्यमदगर्विता।।2.9.55।।अनेकशतसाहस्रं मुक्ताहारं वराङ्गना।अवमुच्य वरार्हाणि शुभान्याभरणानि च।।2.9.56।।ततो हेमोपमा तत्र कुब्जावाक्यवशं गता।संविश्य भूमौ कैकेयी मन्थरामिदमब्रवीत्।।2.9.57।।
9_52.translation: That beautiful, largeeyed Kaikeyi, puffed with the pride of her intoxicating beauty, encourged and influenced by the words of that hunchback, entered the chamber of wrath. She cast off her highly precious pearl necklace worth many hundreds of thousands (of rupees) and other costly, beautiful ornaments. Thereafter that goldenhued Kaikeyi lay down on the floor and said to Manthara:
9_52.word_by_word: विशालाक्षी  largeeyed one, सौभाग्यमदगर्विता proud of her (intoxicating) beauty, वराङ्गना most beautiful lady, देवी queen, तथा that way, प्रोत्साहिता encouraged, कुब्जावाक्यवशंगता influenced by the words of the hunchback, मन्थरया सह with Manthara, क्रोधागारम् chamber of wrath, गत्वा having gone, अनेकशतसाहस्रम् with many hundreds of thousands, मुक्ताहारम् necklace of pearls, वरार्हाणि highly precious, शुभानि auspicious, आभरणानि च other ornaments also, अवमुच्य cast off, तत: after that, हेमोपमा resembling gold, तत्र there, भूमौ on the floor, संविश्य lying down, मन्थराम् to Manthara, इदम् this, अब्रवीत् spoke.

9_53.shloka: इह वा मां मृतां कुब्जे नृपायावेदयिष्यसि।वनं तु राघवे प्राप्ते भरतः प्राप्स्यति क्षितिम्।।2.9.58।।
9_53.translation: O hunchback, tell the king, either Bharata shall secure the kingdom on Rama's departure to the forest or else I will die here.
9_53.word_by_word: कुब्जे O hunchback, राघवे to the scion of the Raghus (Rama), वनं तु to the forest, प्राप्ते having gone, भरत: Bharata, क्षितिम् earth, प्राप्स्यति secures, वा or, इह here, माम् me, मृताम् as if dead, नृपाय for  king Dasaratha, आवेदयिष्यसि you will inform.

9_54.shloka: न सुवर्णेन मे ह्यर्थो न रत्नैर्न च भूषणैः।एष मे जीवितस्यान्तो रामो यद्यभिषिच्यते।।2.9.59।।
9_54.translation: I do not aspire for gold, nor gems nor ornaments. If Rama is installed, that will be the end of my life.
9_54.word_by_word: सुवर्णेन by gold, मे to me, अर्थ: aspiration, न not, रत्नै: with gems, न not, भूषणै: च with ornaments also, न not, राम: Rama, अभिषिच्यते यदि if installed, एष: this (will be), मे my, जीवितस्य life's, अन्त: end.

9_55.shloka: अथो पुनस्तां महिषीं महीक्षितोवचोभिरत्यर्थमहापराक्रमैः।उवाच कुब्जा भरतस्य मातरंहितं वचो राममुपेत्य चाहितम्।।2.9.60।।
9_55.translation: Addressing queen Kaikeyi, the mother of Bharata, with extremely powerful words, that hunchback again made these utterances beneficial to Bharata and detrimental to Rama:
9_55.word_by_word: अथो again, कुब्जा that hunchback, अत्यर्थमहापराक्रमै: with extremely powerful  (sharp), वचोभि: with words, महीक्षित: king's, महिषीम् wife, ताम् that, भरतस्य मातरम् addressing Bharata's mother, हितम् beneficial to her, रामम् उपेत्य relating to Rama, अहितम् harmful, वच: words, पुन: again, उवाच said.

9_56.shloka: प्रपत्स्यते राज्यमिदं हि राघवोयदि ध्रुवं त्वं ससुता च तप्स्यसे।अतो हि कल्याणि यतस्व तत्तथायथा सुतस्ते भरतोऽभिषेक्ष्यते।।2.9.61।।
9_56.translation: It is true that if Rama secures this kingdom, you along with your son are bound to suffer. O auspicious one, hence act in a way your son Bharata will be installed.
9_56.word_by_word: राघव: descendant of the Raghus (Rama), इदम् हि this indeed, राज्यम् kingdom, प्रपत्स्यते यदि if secures, ससुता along with son, त्वम् you, तप्स्यसे you will suffer, ध्रुवम् this is true, कल्याणि auspicious one, अत: for that reason, ते सुत: your son, भरत: Bharata, यथा in a manner in which, अभिषेक्ष्यते will be installed, तत् that act, तथा in that way, यतस्व strive for.

9_57.shloka: तथाऽतिविद्धा महिषी तु कुब्जयासमाहता वागिषुभिर्मुहुर्मुहुः।निधायहस्तौ हृदयेऽतिविस्मिताशशंस कुब्जां कुपिता पुनः पुनः।।2.9.62।।
9_57.translation: Repeatedly struck down by that hunchback's arrowsharp words greatly grieved queen Kaikeyi was inflamed against the king. Laying her hands on the chest again and again and expressing her amazement, she praised that hunchback.
9_57.word_by_word: कुब्जया by that hunchback, मुहुर्मुहु: repeatedly, वागिषुभि: by arrowsharp words, तथा in that manner, समाहता struck down, अतिविद्धा hard hit, महिषी queen, कुपिता inflamed, अतिविस्मिता amazed, हस्तौ her hands, हृदये on the chest, निधाय laying, पुन: पुन: again and again, कुब्जाम् to that hunchback, शशंस praised.

9_58.shloka: यमस्य वा मां विषयं गतामितोनिशाम्य कुब्जे प्रतिवेदयिष्यसि।वनं गते वा सुचिराय राघवेसमृद्धकामो भरतो भविष्यति।।2.9.63।।
9_58.translation: Tell the king that he will see either the fulfilment of Bharata's desire after Rama is banished into the forest for a long period or me gone to Yama's abode.
9_58.word_by_word: कुब्जे O hunchback, निशाम्य having seen, माम् me, इत: from here, यमस्य Yama's, विषयम् region, गताम् had gone, प्रतिवेदयिष्यसि वा or else inform the king, राघवे of Rama, वनम् tothe forest, गते had gone, भरत: Bharata, समृद्धकाम: having attained the objective, भविष्यति वा or would be done.

9_59.shloka: अहं हि नैवास्तरणानि न स्रजोन चन्दनं नाञ्जनपानभोजनम्।न किञ्चिदिच्छामि न चेह जीवितंन चेदितो गच्छति राघवो वनम्।।2.9.64।।
9_59.translation: If Rama does not go from here to the forest, I want neither a bed nor garlands nor sandalpaste nor unguents nor food nor water nor even life.
9_59.word_by_word: राघव: son of the Raghus (Rama), इत: from here, वनम् to forest, न गच्छति चेत् if does not go, अहम् myself, आस्तरणानि couch, न इच्छामि do not desire, स्रज: न nor garlands, चन्दनम् न nor sandalpaste, अञ्जनपानभोजनम् न nor collyrium, food, water, न किञ्चित् nothing, इह here, जीवितं च not even life, न do not desire.

9_60.shloka: अथैतदुक्त्वा वचनं सुदारुणंनिधाय सर्वाभरणानि भामिनी।असंवृतामास्तरणेन मेदिनींतदाऽधिशिश्ये पतितेव किन्नरी।।2.9.65।।
9_60.translation: Saying these ruthless words, that lovely Kaikeyi cast off all her ornaments like afallen  'kinnara' woman, and lay down on the floor with the carpet removed.
9_60.word_by_word: भामिनी that beautiful one (Kaikeyi), सुदारुणम् dreadful, एतत् वचनम् this word, उक्त्वा havingsaid, अथ after that, सर्वाभरणानि all ornaments, निधाय having removed, पतिता fallen, किन्नरी इव like a 'kinnar', तदा then, आस्तरणेन by a carpet, असंवृताम् uncovered, मेदिनीम् the earth, अधिशिश्ये lay down.

9_61.translation: Thus queen Kaikeyi's face enveloped by the darkness of violent anger and her body stripped of all valuable ornaments, she lay restless, looking like the dark sky without stars.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे नवमस्सर्गः।।Thus ends of the ninth sarga of Ayodhyakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
9_61.word_by_word: तथा thus, उदीर्णसंरम्भतमोवृतानना her face enveloped in the darkness of violent anger, अवमुक्तोत्तममाल्यभूषणा all valuable ornaments having been stripped off, विमना: mind restless, नरेन्द्रपत्नी king's wife, सा that Kaikeyi, तमोवृता filled with darkness, मग्नतारकाः bereft of stars, द्यौरिव like sky, बभूव became.

10_1.shloka: [King Dasaratha enters the palace of Kaikeyi who is in the chamber of wrath--tries to pacify her in different ways.]विदर्शिता यदा देवी कुब्जया पापया भृशम्।तदा शेते स्म सा भूमौ दिग्धविद्धेव किन्नरी।।2.10.1।।
10_1.translation: Perversely advised by the extremely sinful hunchback the queen (Kaikeyi) lay down on the ground like a kinnari struck as though by a poisonous arrow.
10_1.word_by_word: सा देवी that queen (Kaikeyi), भृशम् exceedingly, पापया sinful one, कुब्जया by hunchback (Manthara), यदा when, विदर्शिता perversely advised, तदा then, दिग्धविद्धेव as if struck by a poisonous arrow, किन्नरीव like a 'kinnari', भूमौ on the floor, शेते स्म lay down.

10_2.shloka: निश्चित्य मनसा कृत्यं सा सम्यगिति भामिनी।मन्थरायै शनैस्सर्वमाचचक्षे विचक्षणा।।2.10.2।।
10_2.translation: The intelligent, beautiful lady (Kaikeyi), having correctly decided the strategy in her mind, slowly unfolded everything to Manthara.
10_2.word_by_word: विचक्षणा intelligent, सा भामिनी that beautiful lady, इति thus, सम्यक् correctly, मनसा in her mind, कृत्यम् the strategy, निश्चित्य having decided, सर्वम् everything, शनै: slowly, मन्थरायै to Manthara, आचचक्षे told.

10_3.shloka: सा दीना निश्चयं कृत्वा मन्थरावाक्यमोहिता।नागकन्येव निश्वस्य दीर्घमुष्णं च भामिनी।।2.10.3।।मुहूर्तं चिन्तयामास मार्गमात्मसुखावहम्।
10_3.translation: That beautiful wretch (Kaikeyi) impressed by the words of Manthara heaved deep, hot sighs like a female serpent and  thought for a while about the means of bringing happiness to herself.
10_3.word_by_word: सा भामिनी that beautiful lady (Kaikeyi), मन्थरावाक्यमोहिता impressed by Manthara's words,दीना wretch, निश्चयं कृत्वा having decided, नागकन्येव like a female serpent, दीर्घम्  deeply, उष्णं च also hot, निश्वस्य having sighed, मुहूर्तम् for a while, आत्मसुखावहम् bringing  happiness to herself, मार्गम् means, चिन्तयामास thought of.

10_4.shloka: सा सुहृच्चार्थकामा च तं निशम्य सुनिश्चयम्।।2.10.4।।बभूव परमप्रीता सिध्दिं प्राप्येव मन्थरा।
10_4.translation: Manthara, Kaikeyi's friend, too, driven by a strong desire to fulfil her resolve was highly pleased and on hearing the firm determination of Kaikeyi, felt as if the accomplishment of the objective was at hand.
10_4.word_by_word: सुहृच्च also a friend, अर्थकामा च desiring to fulfil the resolve, सा मन्थरा that Manthara, तम् that, सुनिश्चयम् firm determination, निशम्य having heard, सिद्धिम् acomplishment of the objective, प्राप्येव as if, परमप्रीता highly pleased, बभूव became.

10_5.shloka: अथ सा रुषिता देवी सम्यक्कृत्वा विनिश्चयम्।।2.10.5।।संविवेशाबला भूमौ निवेश्य भृकुटीं मुखे।
10_5.translation: Then Kaikeyi finally took a firm decision. With a soiled body and a frowning face she lay down on the floor.
10_5.word_by_word: अथ then, देवी queen, सा अबला that woman,रुषिता soiled, सम्यक् completely, विनिश्चयम् firm decision, कृत्वा having taken, मुखे on the face, भृकुटीम् frown, निवेश्य having placed, भूमौ on the floor, संविवेश lay down.

10_6.shloka: ततश्चित्राणि माल्यानि दिव्यान्याभरणानि च।।2.10.6।।अपविद्धानि कैकेय्या तानि भूमिं प्रपेदिरे।
10_6.translation: Thereafter Kaikeyi flung away her multicoloured garlands along with her costly ornaments on to the ground.
10_6.word_by_word: तत: after that, तानि those, चित्राणि of different colours, माल्यानि garlands, दिव्यानि divine (costly), आभरणानि च also the ornaments, कैकेय्या by Kaikeyi, अपविद्धानि thrown off, भूमिम् to the ground, प्रपेदिरे resorted.

10_7.shloka: तया तान्यपविद्धानि माल्यान्याभरणानि च।।2.10.7।।अशोभयन्त वसुधां नक्षत्राणि यथा नभः।
10_7.translation: All the garlands and ornaments she scattered adorned the floor like the stars (illumining) the sky.
10_7.word_by_word: तया by her, अपविद्धानि thrown away, तानि माल्यानि all those garlands, आभरणानि च and the ornaments also, नक्षत्राणि stars, नभ: the sky, यथा like, वसुधाम् the ground, अशोभयन्त adorned.

10_8.shloka: क्रोधागारे निपतिता सा बभौ मलिनाम्बरा।।2.10.8।।एकवेणीं दृढं बद्वा गतसत्त्वेव किन्नरी।
10_8.translation: Tightly fastening her hair into a single braid and wearing soiled clothes, she lay down in the chamber of wrath in a lifeless state like a kinnari.
10_8.word_by_word: एकवेणीम् into a single braid, दृढम् tightly, बद्वा having fastened, क्रोधागारे in the chamber of wrath, निपतिता had fallen down, मलिनाम्बरा wearing soiled clothes, सा she, गतसत्त्वा in a lifeless state, किन्नरी इव like kinnari, बभौ shone.

10_9.translation: The king issued orders for Rama's installation ceremony, and taking leave of his close associates entered the palace.                        .
10_9.word_by_word: महाराज: तु as regards the king, राघवस्य Rama's, अभिषेचनम् installation ceremony, आज्ञाप्य having issued orders, उपस्थानम् very close associates, अनुज्ञाप्य having taken leave,निवेशनम् the palace, प्रविवेश entered.

10_10.shloka: अद्य रामाभिषेको वै प्रसिद्ध इति जज्ञिवान्।।2.10.10।।प्रियार्हां प्रियमाख्यातुं विवेशान्तःपुरं वशी।
10_10.translation: Aware of the fact that Rama's installation ceremony was known to everybody by then he who had subdued his senses entered the inner apartment to convey it to one worthy of such pleasant news.
10_10.word_by_word: वशी one who has subdued the senses, अद्य today, रामाभिषेक: Rama's installation, प्रसिद्ध: इति is known to everybody, जज्ञिवान् having come to know, प्रियार्हाम् to me who deserves to hear such pleasant news (to Kaikeyi), प्रियम् pleasant news, आख्यातुम् to communicate, अन्त: पुरम् the inner apartment, विवेश entered.

10_11.shloka: स कैकेय्या गृहं श्रेष्ठं प्रविवेश महायशाः।।2.10.11।।पाण्डुराभ्रमिवाकाशं राहुयुक्तं निशाकरः।
10_11.translation: The illustrious king entered the excellent abode of Kaikeyi like the Moon entering the mouth of Rahu in a sky overcast with pale clouds.
10_11.word_by_word: महायशा: renowned, स: he, निशाकर: moon, पाण्डुराभ्रम् with pale clouds, राहुयुक्तम्  accompanied by Rahu, आकाशमिव like the sky, श्रेष्ठम् excellent, कैकेय्या: गृहम् Kaikeyi's abode, प्रविवेश entered.

10_12.shloka: शुकबर्हिणसङ्घुष्टं क्रौञ्चहंसरुतायुतम्।।2.10.12।।वादित्ररवसङ्घुष्टं कुब्जा वामनिकायुतम्।लतागृहैश्चित्रगृहैश्चम्पकाशोकशोभितैः।।2.10.13।।दान्तराजतसौवर्णवेदिकाभि स्समायुतम्।नित्यपुष्पफलैर्वृक्षैर्वापीभिश्चोपशोभितम्।।2.10.14।।दान्तरजतसौवर्णैस्संवृतं परमासनैः।विविधैरन्नपानैश्च भक्ष्यैश्च विविधैरपि।।2.10.15।।उपपन्नं महार्हैश्च भूषितैस्त्रिदिवोपमम्।तत्प्रविश्य महाराजस्स्वमन्तः पुरमृद्धिमत्।।2.10.16।।न ददर्श प्रियां राजा कैकेयीं शयनोत्तमे।
10_12.translation: The maharaja entered the inner apartment of Kaikeyi's prosperous abode filled with parrots and peacocks, reverberating with cries of kraunchas and swans and sounds of musical instruments attended with hunchbacks and dwarfs decorated with champak and ashoka trees, bowers surrounded with creepers, picturegalleries, altars and sofas embellished with ivory, gold and silver. It was shining with pools and trees bearing flowers and fruits in all seasons. Various kinds of food, drinks and eatables were kept ready. With excellent decorations that abode of Kaikeyi resembled heaven. (But) the king did not see his beloved Kaikeyi in her best bed.
10_12.word_by_word: शुकबर्हिणसङ्घुष्टम् filled with parrots and peacocks, क्रौञ्चहंसरुतायुतम् full of cries of kraunchas and swans, वादित्ररवसङ्घुष्टम् echoing with the sounds of musical instruments, कुब्जा वामनिकायुतम् with hunchbacks and dwarfs (attendants moving here and there), चम्पकाशोकशोभितै: shining with champaka and ashoka trees, लतागृहै: by bowers surrounded with creepers, चित्रगृहै: च with picturegalleries, दान्तराजतसौवर्णवेदिकाभि: diases decorated with  ivory, gold and silver, समायुतम् filled with, नित्यपुष्पफलै: bearing flowers and fruits in all seasons, वृक्षै: (adorned) with trees, वापीभि: च with large pools, उपशोभितम् adorned, परमासनै: with excellent seats, विविधै: various kinds of, अन्नपानै: च  with food and drinks, भक्ष्यै: च eatables also, उपपन्नम् endowed with, भूषितै: decorations, महार्है: expensive, त्रिदिवोपमम् resembling heaven, पुरम़ृद्धिमत् prosperous abode, तत् that, स्वम् his own, अन्त: पुरम्  inner apartment, प्रविश्य having entered, महाराज: great king, राजा king (Dasaratha), शयनोत्तमे on  the best bed, प्रियाम् beloved, कैकेयीम् Kaikeyi, न ददर्श did not see.

10_13.shloka: कामबलसंयुक्तो रत्यर्थं मनुजाधिपः।।2.10.17।।अपश्यन्दयितां भार्यां पप्रच्छ विषसाद च।
10_13.translation: Charged with passion and seeking carnal pleasure, the king became dejected when he did not see his beloved wife. He enquired about her.
10_13.word_by_word: कामबलसंयुक्त: charged with passion, स: मनुजाधिप: the king, रत्यर्थम् seeking carnal pleasure, दयिताम् beloved, भार्याम् wife, अपश्यन् not seeing, विषसाद dejected, पप्रच्छ च also enquired.

10_14.shloka: न हि तस्य पुरा देवी तां वेलामत्यवर्तत।।2.10.18।।न च राजा गृहं शून्यं प्रविवेश कदाचन।
10_14.translation: Never before had queen Kaikeyi missed his time of arrival. Nor had the king ever entered her empty apartment.
10_14.word_by_word: पुरा previously, देवी queen (Kaikeyi), तस्य his, तां वेलाम् time, न अत्यवर्तत हि did not transgress, राजा king, कदाचन never, शून्यम् empty, गृहम् apartment, न प्रविवेश च did not enter.

10_15.shloka: ततो गृहगतो राजा कैकेयीं पर्यपृच्छत।।2.10.19।।यथा पूर्वमविज्ञाय स्वार्थलिप्सुमपण्डिताम्।
10_15.translation: Having entered her apartment, the king, unaware of that foolish Kaikeyi's selfish design enquired her whereabouts as usual.
10_15.word_by_word: तत: then, गृहगत: having reached the apartment, राजा king, अपण्डिताम् foolish lady, कैकेयीम् about Kaikeyi, स्वार्थलिप्सुम् seeking selfish interest, अविज्ञाय without realising, यथापूर्वम् as usual, पर्यपृच्छत enquired.

10_16.shloka: प्रतीहारी त्वथोवाच सन्त्रस्ता सुकृताञ्जलिः।।2.10.20।।देव देवी भृशं कृद्धा क्रोधागारमभिदृता।
10_16.translation: Thereafter, the frightened doorkeeper with folded palms said O monarch thequeen in a hot mood has rushed into the chamber of wrath.
10_16.word_by_word: अथ thereafter, सन्त्रस्ता frightened, प्रतीहरी doorkeeper, कृताञ्जलि: with folded palms, उवाच said, देव O monarch देवी queen, भृशम् कृद्वा mighty angry, क्रोधागारम् towards the chamber of wrath, अभिदृता swiftly went.

10_17.shloka: प्रतीहार्या वचश्शृत्वा राजा परमदुर्मनाः।।2.10.21।।विषसाद पुनर्भूयो लुलितव्याकुलेन्द्रियः।।
10_17.translation: Hearing the words of the doorkeeper, the melancholic king grieved all the more with his senses agitated and unstable.
10_17.word_by_word: परमदुर्मना: deeply melancholic, राजा king, प्रतीहार्या door keeper's, वच: words, शृत्वा having heard, लुलितव्याकुलेन्द्रिय: with his senses agitated and unstable, पुन: again, भूय: still more, विषसाद grieved.

10_18.shloka: तत्र तां पतितां भूमौ शयानामतथोचिताम्।।2.10.22।।प्रतप्त इव दुःखेन सोऽपश्यज्जगतीपतिः।
10_18.translation: The lord of the earth (Dasaratha) saw her (Kaikeyi) lying down on the floor of the chamber of wrath in an unbecoming manner and felt as if consumed by grief.
10_18.word_by_word: जगतीपति: lord of the earth, स: he, तत्र there (in that chamber of wrath), पतिताम् fallen down, भूमौ on the floor, शयानाम् lying down, अतथोचिताम् unbecoming manner, ताम् her, अपश्यत् saw,  दु:खेन with grief, प्रतप्त: इव as if consumed.

10_19.shloka: स वृद्धस्तरुणीं भार्यां प्राणेभ्योपि गरीयसीम्।।2.10.23।।अपापः पापसङ्कल्पां ददर्श धरणीतले।लतामिव विनिष्कृत्तां पतितां देवतामिव।।2.10.24।।किन्नरीमिव निर्धूतां च्युतामप्सरसं यथा।मायामिव परिभ्रष्टां हरिणीमिव संयताम्।।2.10.25।।
10_19.translation: The guileless, old king beheld his youthful wife who was dearer to him than his own life, filled with deceitful  intentions. She looked like a severed creeper, like a goddess fallen down, like a 'Kinnari' thrown down on earth, like an 'apsarasa' slipped from heaven, like an illusion torn, like a female deer tied down.
10_19.word_by_word: वृद्ध: aged, अपाप: guileless, स: he, तरुणीम् youthful lady, प्राणेभ्योऽपि more than his life, गरीयसीम् dearer, पापसङ्कल्पाम् a lady of sinful intentions, विनिष्कृत्ताम् severed, लतामिव like a creeper, पतिताम् fallen down, देवतामिव like a goddess, निर्धूताम् thrown down on earth, किन्नरीमिव like a 'kinnari', च्युताम् slipped (from heaven), अप्सरसं यथा like apsarasas, परिभ्रष्टाम् fallen down, मायामिव like illusion, संयताम् tied down, हरिणीमिव like a female deer, भार्याम् to wife, ददर्श saw.

10_20.shloka: करेणुमिव दिग्धेन विद्धां मृगयुना वने।महागज इवारण्ये स्नेहात्परिममर्श ताम्।।2.10.26।।
10_20.translation: Like a mighty sheelephant caressing her cow wounded with a poisoned arrow in the forest, he caressed her lovingly.
10_20.word_by_word: वने in the forest, दिग्धेन by a poisoned arrow, विद्धाम् struck down, करेणुमिव like a sheelephant, ताम् her, अरण्ये in the forest, महागज: इव like a mighty elephant, स्नेहात् lovingly, परिममर्श caressed.

10_21.translation: With a mind extremely terrified yet passionate, he caressed his lotuseyed wife with his hands, and said:
10_21.word_by_word: कामी passionate, अभिसन्त्रस्तचेतन: mind extremely terrified, कमलपत्राक्षीम् to one with eyes resembling lotuspetals, वनिताम् that woman, पाणिभ्याम् with both hands, परिमृश्य aftercaressing, इदम् this word, उवाच said.

10_22.shloka: न तेऽहमभिजानामि क्रोधमात्मनि संश्रितम्।देवि केनाभिशप्ताऽसि केन वाऽसि विमानिता।।2.10.28।।यदिदं मम दुःखाय शेषे कल्याणि पांसुषु।
10_22.translation: O auspicious queen, I do not know whether your anger is directed at me. I do not know the cause of your anger. By whom have you been offended or disrespected? Why are you lying in the dust? This is causing me great sorrow.
10_22.word_by_word: देवि O queen आत्मनि in me, संश्रितम् taken refuge in (you), ते your, क्रोधम् about anger, अहम् I, न अभिजानामि am not able to know, केन by whom, अभिशप्ता असि are you cursed, केन वा or by whom, विमानिता असि are you disrespected, कल्याणि O auspicious one, पांसुषु in the dust, यत् शेषे since you lie, इदम् this, मम my, दु:खाय is the source of my sorrow.

10_23.shloka: भूमौ शेषे किमर्थं त्वं मयि कल्याणचेतसि।।2.10.29।।भूतोपहतचित्तेव मम चित्तप्रमाथिनी।
10_23.translation: While I am here favourably disposed towards you, why are you lying down on the floor like one possessed by an evil spirit? Why are you afflicting my mind?
10_23.word_by_word: मयि in me, कल्याणचेतसि in a mind favourably disposed, त्वम् you, भूतोपहतचित्तेव like one possessed by evil spirits, मम my, चित्तप्रमाथिनी afflicting my mind, किमर्थम् why, भूमौ on the floor, शेषे are you lying down?

10_24.shloka: सन्ति मे कुशला वैद्यास्त्वभितुष्टाश्च सर्वशः।।2.10.30।।सुखितां त्वां करिष्यन्ति व्याधिमाचक्ष्व भामिनी।
10_24.translation: O lovely one there are, to my best satisfaction, expert physicians in all branches (of medical science). They will restore your health. Tell me your ailment.
10_24.word_by_word: भामिनि O lovely one कुशला: experts, सर्वश: in every way, अभितुष्टा: च completely satisfied too, मे my, वैद्या: सन्ति physicians are available, त्वाम् you, सुखिताम् करिष्यन्ति will restore your health, व्याधिम् ailment, आचक्ष्व you may tell.

10_25.shloka: कस्य वा ते प्रियं कार्यं केन वा विप्रियं कृतम्।।2.10.31।।कः प्रियं लभतामद्य को वा सुमहदप्रियम्।
10_25.translation: On whom do you wish to bestow favour? Who has caused you displeasure? To whom should I grant favour now? To whom should I cause great displeasure?
10_25.word_by_word: कस्य वा to whom, प्रियम् favour, ते by you, कार्यम् is to be done, केन वा by whom, विप्रियम् displeasure, कृतम् was done, क: who, अद्य now, प्रियम् favour, लभताम् let him obtain, को वा who, सुमहत् exceedingly great, अप्रियम् displeasure (shall obtain).

10_26.shloka: मा रोदीर्मा च कार्षीस्त्वं देवि संपरिशोषणम्।।2.10.32।।अवध्यो वध्यतां को वा को वा वध्यो विमुच्यताम्।दरिद्रः को भवत्वाढ्यो द्रव्यवान्वाऽप्यकिञ्चनः।।2.10.33।।
10_26.translation: O queen shed no tears. Drain not your health. Ask me, and I shall slay one who should not be slain or release one who should be slain. I shall make a poor man rich and a wealthy man poor. (Tell me who are such people).
10_26.word_by_word: देवि O queen मा रोदी: do not weep, त्वम् you, संपरिशोषणम् emaciation of body, मा च कार्षी: do not cause, अवध्य: who should not be slain, को वा or who, वध्यताम् shall be slain, वध्य: worthy of being slain, को वा or who, विमुच्यताम् shall be released, दरिद्र: is poor, को वा or who, आढ्य: should be made rich, भवतु shall become, द्रव्यवान्वापि whosoever is wealthy, अकिञ्चन: shall be rendered poor.

10_27.shloka: अहं चैव मदीयाश्च सर्वे तव वशानुगाः।न ते किञ्चिदभिप्रायं व्याहन्तुमहमुत्सहे।।2.10.34।।
10_27.translation: My kins and I are under your control. I will make no effort to go even a little  againstyour wishes.
10_27.word_by_word: अहं चैव I am also, मदीया: my relatives, सर्वे च all people, तव your, वशानुगा: under control, ते your, अभिप्रायम् opinion, किञ्चित् a little, व्याहन्तुम् to spoil, अहम् I, न उत्सहे will not make efforts.

10_28.shloka: आत्मनो जीवितेनापि ब्रूहि यन्मनसेच्छसि।बलमात्मनि जानन्ती न मां शङ्कितुमर्हसि।।2.10.35।।करिष्यामि तव प्रीतिं सुकृतेनापि ते शपे।
10_28.translation: If you want to do anything even if it means sacrificing my life, I shall do it. Since you know my strength, it does not behove you to doubt me. I swear on my  merits. I will do whatever pleases you.
10_28.word_by_word: अत्मन: my own, जीवितेनापि with life even, यत् whatever, मनसा with mind, इच्छसि wish, ब्रूहि tell, आत्मनि in your own self, बलम् strength, जानन्ती you know yourself, माम् me, शङ्कितुम् to doubt, न अर्हसि it does not behove you, सुकृतेनापि on my acquired merits, ते to you, शपे I swear, तव your, प्रीतिम् pleasure, करिष्यामि I will do.

10_29.shloka: यावदावर्तते चक्रं तावती मे वसुन्धरा।।2.10.36।।प्राचीनास्सिन्धुसौवीरा स्सौराष्ट्रा दक्षिणापथाः।वङ्गाङ्गमगधाः मत्स्याः समृद्धा काशिकोसलाः।।2.10.37।।
10_29.translation: My authority on the land is extended till such places the wheel of any chariot rotates such as the regions in the east, SindhuSauvira areas, Saurashtra, Southern regions, Banga, Anga, Magadha states, Matsya kingdom and KasiKosala countries which are prosperous places.
10_29.word_by_word: चक्रम् wheel of the chariot, यावत् till (such places), आवर्तते rotates, मे वसुन्धरा my land, तावती (is extended) up to that, प्राचीना: eastern regions, सिन्धुसौवीरा: SindhuSauvira areas, सौराष्ट्रा: Saurashtra, दक्षिणापथा: southern regions, वङ्गाङ्गमगधा: Banga, Anga, Magadha states, मत्स्या: Mathsya kingdom, काशिकोसला: Kasi and Kosala, समृद्धा: prosperous places.

10_30.shloka: तत्र जातं बहु द्रव्यं धनधान्यमजाविकम्।ततो वृणीष्व कैकेयि यद्यत्त्वं मनसेच्छसि।।2.10.38।।
10_30.translation: There wealth and foodgrains, sheep and goats and many things are produced. O Kaikeyi, ask whichever of these you wish.
10_30.word_by_word: तत्र there, धनधान्यम् wealth and food grains, अजाविकम् sheep and goats, बहु many, द्रव्यम् things, जातम् is produced, कैकेयि Kaikeyi, तत: from those, यद्यत् whichever, त्वम् you, मनसा  in mind, इच्छसि wish, वणीष्व ask.

10_31.shloka: किमायासेन ते भीरु उत्तिष्ठोत्तिष्ठ शोभने।तत्त्वं मे ब्रूहि कैकेयि यतस्ते भयमागतम्।।2.10.39।।तत्ते व्यपनयिष्यामि नीहारमिव रश्मिवान्।
10_31.translation: O lady why do you exert yourself? Arise, arise. O charming Kaikeyi, tell me the cause of your fear. I will dispel it just as the Sun dispels morning mists.
10_31.word_by_word: भीरु O lady, ते to you, आयासेन with exertion, किम् what is the use? शोभने O charming one, उत्तिष्ठ उत्तिष्ठ arise, arise, कैकेयि O Kaikeyi ते to you, यत: from whom, भयम् fear, आगतम् has come, तत् that, त्वम् you, मे me, ब्रूहि tell, ते your, तत् the cause for that fear, रश्मिवान् Sun, नीहारमिव like morning mist, व्यपनयिष्यामि I will dispel.

10_32.shloka: तथोक्ता सा समाश्वस्ता वक्तुकामा तदप्रियम्।।2.10.40।।परिपीडयितुं भूयो भर्तारमुपचक्रमे।
10_32.translation: Thus spoken to, she (Kaikeyi) breathed a sigh of relief. Intending to tell him the unpleasant thing (which was in her mind), she began tormenting her husband all the more.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे दशमस्सर्गः।।Thus ends  the tenth sarga of Ayodhyakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
10_32.word_by_word: तथा thus, उक्ता spoken to, सा she, समाश्वस्ता breathing a sigh of relief, तत् that, अप्रियम् unpleasant thing, वक्तुकामा intending to tell, भर्तारम् to her husband, भूयः still more,     परिपीडयितुम् for tormenting, उपचक्रमे started.

11_1.shloka: [Kaikeyi reminds king Dasaratha about the boons--seeks consecration of Bharata as princeregent and exile of Rama to the forest.]तं मन्मथशरैर्विद्धमं कामवेगवशानुगम्।उवाच पृथिवीपालं कैकेयी दारुणं वचः।।2.11.1।।
11_1.translation: To the ruler of the earth (the king), struck by the darts of Kamadeva and overtaken by passion Kaikeyi spoke (these) dreadful words.
11_1.word_by_word: कैकेयी Kaikeyi, मन्मथशरैः with the darts of Kamadeva, विद्धम् struck, कामवेगवशानुगम् overtaken by passion, तं पृथिवीपालम् to the ruler of earth (Dasaratha), दारुणम् dreadful, वचः words, उवाच said.

11_2.shloka: नास्मि विप्रकृतादेव केनचिन्नावमानिता।अभिप्रायस्तु मे कश्चित्तमिच्छामि त्वया कृतम्।।2.11.2।।
11_2.translation: O king I have neither been offended nor disregarded by any one, but I have a purpose which you should fulfil.
11_2.word_by_word: देव O king, केनचित् by any one, विप्रकृता offended, नास्मि I am not, न अवमानिता nor disregarded, तु but, मे my, कश्चित् certain, अभिप्रायः purpose, तम् that one, त्वया by you, कृतं इच्छामि you should fulfil.

11_3.shloka: प्रतिज्ञां प्रतिजानीष्व यदि त्वं कर्तुमिच्छसि।अथ तद्व्याहरिष्यामि यदभिप्रार्थितं मया।।2.11.3।।
11_3.translation: If you are inclined to accomplish my desire, then promise me that you will fulfil them. Thereafter I shall reveal it to you.
11_3.word_by_word: त्वम् you, कर्तुम् to accomplish, इच्छसि यदि if you are inclined, प्रतिज्ञां प्रतिजानीष्व promise to fulfil, अथ thereafter, मया by me, यत् whatever, अभिप्रार्थितम् sought for, तत् that one, व्याहरिष्यामि I will tell you.

11_4.shloka: तामुवाच महातेजाः कैकेयीमीषदुत्स्मितः।कामी हस्तेन संगृह्य मूर्धजेषु शुचिस्मिताम्।।2.11.4।।
11_4.translation: The mighty king steeped in passion gently held Kaikeyi's hair in his hands  and with a clear, bright smile said:
11_4.word_by_word: महातेजाः mighty, कामी steeped in passion, ईषत् a little, उत्स्मितः with a visible smile, शुचिस्मिताम् with a pure (bright) smile, तां कैकेयीम् to that Kaikeyi, मूर्धजेषु  her hair, हस्तेन with hand, संगृह्य holding (gently), उवाच said.

11_5.shloka: आवलिप्ते न जानासि त्वत्तः प्रियतरो मम।मनुजो मनुजव्याघ्राद्रामादन्यो न विद्यते।।2.11.5।।
11_5.translation: O proud lady, don't you know there exists for me no woman dearer than you and      no man other than Rama who is the best among men.
11_5.word_by_word: आवलिप्ते  woman swollen with pride, न जानासि do you not know?, मम to me, त्वत्तः more than you, प्रियतरः dearer, मनुजव्याघ्रात् other than the tiger (best) among men, रामात् than Rama, अन्यः other, मनुजः man, न विद्यते does not exist.

11_6.shloka: तेनाजय्येन मुख्येन राघवेण महात्मना।शपे ते जीवनार्हेण ब्रूहि यन्मनसेच्छासि।।2.11.6।।
11_6.translation: I swear in the name of the scion of the Raghu dynasty, the invincible, broadmindedRama, the best among men worthy of long life. Tell me what you have in mind.
11_6.word_by_word: अजय्येन invincible one, मुख्येन chief (among men), जीवनार्हेण by one worthy to live, महात्मना broadminded, तेन राघवेण by that scion among the Raghus (Rama), शपे swear, मनसा in mind, यत् which, इच्छसि (you) wish, ब्रूहि tell.

11_7.shloka: यं मुहूर्तमपश्यंस्तु न जीवेयमहं ध्रुवम्।तेन रामेण कैकेयि शपे ते वचनक्रियाम्।।2.11.7।।
11_7.translation: O Kaikeyi, in the name of Rama without seeing whom I, for sure, cannot live a momment, I swear I will fulfil your desire.
11_7.word_by_word: कैकेयि Kaikeyi, यम् whom, अपश्यन् without seeing, अहम् I, मुहूर्तम् even for a moment, ध्रुवम्  this is certain, न जीवेयम् cannot live, तेन रामेण by such Rama, ते your, वचनक्रियाम् in accordance with your wish, शपे I swear.

11_8.shloka: आत्मना वात्मजैश्चान्यैर्वृणेयं मनुजर्षभम्।तेन रामेण कैकेयि शपे ते वचनक्रियाम्।।2.11.8।।
11_8.translation: O Kaikeyi I wish the best among men Rama well.Even at the expense of my life or the lives of the rest of my sons I swear in his name I shall fulfil your wish.
11_8.word_by_word: कैकेयि Kaikeyi, आत्मना वा by myself, अन्यैः by others, आत्मजैश्च my sons, यम् whom,  मनुजर्षभम् best among men, वृणे I choose, तेन रामेण by that Rama, ते your, वचनक्रियाम्  to fulfil your wish, शपे swear.

11_9.shloka: भद्रे हृदयमप्येतदनुमृशोद्धरस्व मे।एतत्समीक्ष्य कैकेयि ब्रूहि यत्साधु मन्यसे।।2.11.9।।
11_9.translation: O gentle lady my heart is sinking. Touch my heart and deliver me from distress. O Kaikeyi considering all this, tell me what you think is good.
11_9.word_by_word: भद्रे O gentle lady मे my, एतत् this, हृदयम् heart, अनुमृश्य having touched, उद्धरस्व save,कैकेयि O Kaikeyi, एतत् this, समीक्ष्य after considering, यत् which, साधु as good, मन्यसे you may consider, ब्रूहि you may tell.

11_10.shloka: बलमात्मनि जानन्ती न मां शङ्कितुमर्हसि।करिष्यामि तव प्रीतिं सुकृतेनापि ते शपे।।2.11.10।।
11_10.translation: You know fully the authority you wield over me. Therefore, it does not behove you to doubt me. I swear on my acquired merits that I shall do whatever pleases you.
11_10.word_by_word: आत्मनि  in yourself, बलम् power, जानन्ती you know fully, माम् me, शङ्कितुम् to doubt, न अर्हसि it does not behove you, सुकृतेनापि on my merits, ते to you, शपे I swear, तव your, प्रीतिम् pleasure, करिष्ये I shall do.

11_11.shloka: सा तदर्थमना देवी तमभिप्रायमागतम्।निर्माध्यस्थ्याच्च हर्षाच्च बभाषे दुर्वचं वचः।।2.11.11।।
11_11.translation: Bent upon her interests, the queen cheered and expressed in unutterable words her premeditated  wish which had no alternative.
11_11.word_by_word: तदर्थमनाः  bent upon her interests, देवी queeni, आगतम् her mind has set upon, तम् अभिप्रायम् her wish, निर्माध्यस्थ्यात् with no alternate path, हर्षात् च rejoiced, दुर्वचम् unutterable, वचः words, बभाषे uttered.

11_12.translation: Delighted by the words (of the king), Kaikeyi disclosed him her highly dreadful wish which entered her mind like a sudden visitation of death:
11_12.word_by_word: तेन वाक्येन by those  words, संहृष्टा delighted, अभ्यागतम् suddenly struck, अन्तकमिव like death, महाघोरम् highly dreadful, आगतम् that has come to her mind, तम् अभिप्रायम् her wish, व्याजहार spoke.

11_13.shloka: यथा क्रमे शपसि वरं मम ददासि च।तच्छृण्वन्तु त्रयस्त्रिंशद्देवास्साग्निपुरोगमाः।।2.11.13।।
11_13.translation: You are repeatedly swearing to grant me boons. Let the thirtythree crore gods headed by  the firegod, listen.
11_13.word_by_word: साग्निपुरोगमाः with firegod in the forefront, त्रयस्त्रिंशद्देवाः thirtythree (crore) gods, क्रमेण successively, यथा like, शपसि your are swearing, मम my, वरम् boon, ददासि च are giving, तत् that, शृण्वन्तु listen.

11_14.shloka: चन्द्रादित्यौ नभश्चैव ग्रहा रात्र्यहनी दिशः।जगच्च पृथिवी चेयं सगन्धर्वा सराक्षसा।।2.11.14।।निशाचराणि भूतानि गृहेषु गृहदेवता।यानि चान्यानि भूतानि जानीयुर्भाषितं तव।।2.11.15।।
11_14.translation: Let the Moon and the Sun, the sky, the planets, night and day, the (ten) quarters the world, gandharvas, rakshasas, this earth, the nocturnal spirits all beings, family deities of every house and all other beings listen to your words of promise.
11_14.word_by_word: चन्द्रादित्यौ Moon and Sun, नभः च एव and the sky also, ग्रहाः the planets, रात्र्यहनी night and day, दिशः the (ten) quarters, जगच्च the world, सगन्धर्वा with all gandharvas, सराक्षसा with all rakshasas, इयम् this, पृथिवी earth, निशाचराणि nightrangers, भूतानि all beings, गृहेषु in the houses, गृहदेवताः family deities, अन्यानि all other, यानि whosoever, भूतानि beings, तव your, भाषितम्  words of promise, जानीयुः let them know.

11_15.shloka: सत्यसन्धो महातेजाः धर्मज्ञः सुसमाहितः।वरं मम ददात्येष तन्मे श्रृण्वन्तु दैवताः।।2.11.16।।
11_15.translation: King Dasaratha who is true to his vows, heroic and knows the ways of righteousness is granting me boons with a wellcomposed mind. Let all the gods  stand witness to this (declared Kaikeyi).
11_15.word_by_word: सत्यसन्ध: true to his vows, महातेजाः heroic, धर्मज्ञः knows the ways of righteousness, सुसमाहितः wellcomposed, एषः this (Dasaratha), मम my, वरम् boon, ददाति is giving, दैवताः gods, तत् that one, मे for my sake, शृण्वन्तु hear.

11_16.shloka: इति देवी महेष्वासं परिगृह्याभिशस्य च।ततः परमुवाचेदं वरदं काममोहितम्।।2.11.17।।
11_16.translation: Clasping the great archer, the infatuated king, conferer of boons and flattering him (to the top of her bent), the queen said:
11_16.word_by_word: देवी queen, महेष्वासम् great archer, परिगृह्य having seized, अभिशस्य च having flattered, ततः परम् च afterwards, वरदम् conferer of boons, काममोहितम् infatuated, इदम् this word, उवाच said.

11_17.shloka: स्मर राजन् पुरावृत्तं तस्मिन् दैवासुरे रणे।तत्र चाच्यावयच्छत्रुस्तव जीवितमन्तरा।।2.11.18।।
11_17.translation: O king, recall the event that happened long ago in the war between gods and asuras where the enemy destroyed all your forces except your life.
11_17.word_by_word: राजन् O king, पुरा long ago, तस्मिन् that, दैवासुरे between gods and asuras, रणे in the  war, वृत्तम् event, स्मर recollect, तत्र there, शत्रु: च enemy too, तव your, जीवितम् अन्तरा except your life, अच्यावयत् pulled down.

11_18.shloka: तत्र चापि मया देव यत्त्वं समभिरक्षितः।जाग्रत्या यतमानायास्ततो मे प्राददा वरौ।।2.11.19।।
11_18.translation: O king, I rescued you there. Since I was alert to protect you, you granted me twoboons.
11_18.word_by_word: देव O king तत्र च there too, यत् since, त्वम् you, मया by me, समभिरक्षितः were rescued, ततः for that reason, जाग्रत्याः fully alert, यतमानायाः making efforts to protect you, मे to me,  वरौ two boons, प्राददाः you conferred.

11_19.shloka: तौ तु दत्तौ वरौ देव निक्षेपौ मृगयाम्यहम्।तथैव पृथिवीपाल सकाशे सत्यसङ्गर।।2.11.20।।
11_19.translation: O protector of the earth, O king, honest in keeping promises, I (now) seek those two boons which were reserved as deposits.
11_19.word_by_word: पृथिवीपाल O protector of the earth, सत्यसङ्गर  one who is honest in keeping promises, देव O king तव your, सकाशे एव with, निक्षेपौ preserved as deposit (to be given in course of time), तौ those, दत्तौ given, वरौ तु boons, अहम् I, मृगयामि seeking.

11_20.shloka: तत् प्रतिश्रुत्य धर्मेण न चेद्दास्यसि मे वरम्।अद्यैव हि प्रहास्यामि जीवितं त्वद्विमानिता।।2.11.21।।
11_20.translation: The boons you have vowed to give shall rightfully be given to me. If not, disgraced by you I shall give up my life right away.
11_20.word_by_word: तत् that, प्रतिश्रुत्य having vowed, मे my, वरम् boon, धर्मेण rightfully, न दास्यसि चेत् if you do not grant, त्वद्विमानिता disgraced by you, अद्यैव right away, जीवितम् life, प्रहास्यामि हि shall give up.

11_21.shloka: वाङ्मात्रेण तदा राजा कैकेय्या स्ववशे कृतः।प्रचस्कन्द विनाशाय पाशं मृग इवात्मनः।।2.11.22।।
11_21.translation: The king now came under the control of Kaikeyi by his own words like a deer that jumps into the trap for its own destruction.
11_21.word_by_word: तदा then, कैकेय्या by Kaikeyi, वाङ्मात्रेण with words only, स्ववशे under the control, कृतःcaught, राजा च king also, मृगः इव like a deer, आत्मनः for his own, विनाशाय  for destruction, पाशम् trap, प्रचस्कन्द jumped into.

11_22.shloka: ततः परमुवाचेदं वरदं काममोहितम्।वरौ यौ मे त्वया देव तदा दत्तौ महीपते।।2.11.23।।तौ तावदहमद्यैव वक्ष्यामि शृणु मे वचः।
11_22.translation: Thereafter, she said to the infatuated king who had promised to confer her boons, O lord of the earth, O king, right now I shall speak to you about the two boons granted by you. Listen to my words.
11_22.word_by_word: ततः परम् thereafter, काममोहितम् overcome by passion, वरदम् conferer of boons, इदम् this word, उवाच said, महीपते O lord of earth, देव my lord, तदा then, मे to me, त्वया by yourself, यौ वरौ those two boons, दत्तौ were given, तौ about them, अद्यैव तावत् right now, वक्ष्यामि I shall speak out , मे वचः my words, शृणु listen.

11_23.translation: Preparations for Rama's consecration have been made. With these very materials for installation, my son Bharata should be consecrated.
11_23.word_by_word: राघवस्य Rama's, अभिषेकसमारम्भः preparations for consecration, उपकल्पितः have been  made, अनेन अभिषेकेणैव with these materials for installation, मे my, भरतः Bharata, अभिषिच्यताम् shall be crowned.

11_24.shloka: यो द्वितीयो वरो देव दत्तः प्रीतेन मे त्वया।।2.11.25।।तदा दैवासुरे युद्धे तस्य कालोऽयमागत।
11_24.translation: Then in the war between gods and asuras, O lord, pleased with me you havepromised a second boon and the time has come to grant it.
11_24.word_by_word: तदा then, दैवासुरे युद्धे in the war between gods and asuras, प्रीतेन pleased, त्वया by you, देव Lord मे  to me, यः which, द्वितीय: second, वरः boon, दत्तः was given, तस्य for that, अयम् this, कालः  time, आगतः has come.

11_25.shloka: नव प़ञ्च च वर्षाणि दण्डकारण्यमाश्रितः।।2.11.26।।चीराजिनजटाधारी रामो भवतु तापसः।
11_25.translation: Consigned to the Dandaka forest for fourteen years, clad in bark and deer skin and wearing matted hair, Rama shall live like an ascetic.
11_25.word_by_word: रामः Rama, नव पञ्च च वर्षाणि for fourteen (nine and five) years, दण्डकारण्यम् Dandaka forest, आश्रितः resorted to, चीराजिनजटाधारी clad in tattered (bark) and deer skin and wearing matted locks, तापसः like an ascetic, भवतु shall remain (in the forest.)

11_26.shloka: भरतो भजतामद्य यौवराज्यमकण्टकम्।।2.11.27।।एष मे परमः कामो दत्तमेव वरं वृणे।अद्य चैव हि पश्येयं प्रयान्तं राघवं वनम्।।2.11.28।।
11_26.translation: Let Bharata be princeregent without any rivals. This is my great desire. I am asking for an already granted boon. Let me see Rama's departure to the forest today itself.
11_26.word_by_word: अद्य now, भरतः Bharata, अकण्टकम् without any thorns(rivals), यौवराज्यम् as princeregent, भजताम् let him enjoy, एषः this, मे my, परमः great, कामः desire, दत्तं वरमेव already granted boon, वृणे I am asking for, अद्य चैव now itself, वनम् to the forest, प्रयान्तं departing to the forest, राघवम् to the scion of the Raghus (Rama), पश्येयम् I shall see.

11_27.shloka: स राजराजः भव सत्यसङ्गरःकुलं च शीलं च हि रक्ष जन्म च।परत्रवासे हि वदन्त्यनुत्तमंतपोधनास्सत्यवचो हितं नृणाम्।।2.11.29।।
11_27.translation: O king of kings, by being true to your vow, protect your race, character and lineage. Those sages whose ascetism is their wealth maintain that there is no merit superior to truthfulness which can confer man a place in the other world.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे एकादशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the eleventh sarga of Ayodhyakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
11_27.word_by_word: राजराजः king of kings, सः you are such, सत्यसङ्गरः भव  be true to your vows, कुलं च your race , शीलं च character, जन्म च birth, रक्ष हि protect, नृणाम् for men, परत्र in the other world, वासे for existence, सत्यवचः merits of truth, अनुत्तमम् no superior, हितम् welfare, तपोधनाः those having ascetism as wealth, sages, वदन्ति हि are saying.

12_1.shloka: [Lamentations of king Dasaratha.]ततश्शृत्वा महाराजः कैकेय्या दारुणं वचः।चिन्तामभिसमापेदे मुहूर्तं प्रतताप च।।2.12.1।।
12_1.translation: After hearing the dreadful words of Kaikeyi, the maharaja (Dasaratha), engulfed in grief, was extremely distressed for a moment.
12_1.word_by_word: महाराजः maharaja कैकेय्याः Kaikeyi's, दारुणम् dreadful, वचः words, श्रुत्वा having heard, ततः thereafter, चिन्ताम् grief, अभिसमापेदे got, मुहूर्तम् for a moment, प्रतताप च was extremely distressed.

12_2.shloka: किन्नु मे यदि वा स्वप्नश्चित्तमोहोऽपि वा मम।अनुभूतोपसर्गो वा मनसो वाप्युपद्रवः।।2.12.2।।
12_2.translation: ' Is this a dream? Or a hallucination of the mind? Or some foreboding evil I am going to experience or a malady of my mind'? (wondered Dasaratha)
12_2.word_by_word: मे my, स्वप्नः किं नु is this a dream?, यदि वा or, मम my, चित्तमोहोऽपि वा or hallucination of the mind?, अनुभूतोपसर्गो वा or some  foreboding of evil I am going to experience , मनसः mind's, उपद्रवः वा or a malady.

12_3.shloka: इति सञ्चिन्त्य तद्राजा नाध्यगच्छत्तदासुखम्।प्रतिलभ्य चिरात्संज्ञां कैकेयीवाक्यताडितः।।2.12.3।।व्यथितो विक्लबश्चैव व्याघ्रीं दृष्ट्वा यथा मृगः।असंवृतायामासीनो जगत्यां दीर्घमुच्छवसन्।।2.12.4।।मण्डले पन्नगो रुद्धो मन्त्रैरिव महाविषः।अहो धिगिति सामर्षो वाचमुक्त्वा नराधिपः।।2.12.5।।मोहमापेदिवान्भूय श्शोकोपहतचेतनः।
12_3.translation: The King absorbed in such thoughts did not get solace. He was startled  and distressed like a deer beholding a tigress. He had long lost the senses struck by the (ruthless) words of Kaikeyi. He sank down upon the bare floor heaving deep sighs like  a venomous serpent lying confined in a circle. 'What a pity' said the king with indignation and with his senses overwhelmed  by sorrow  fell into a stupor again.
