17_10.word_by_word: रामः Rama, सुहृदाम् friends, एताः these, अन्याश्च other, आत्मसम्पूजनीः words praising him, शुभाः favourable, कथाः words, शृण्वन् hearing, उदासीनः remaining indifferent, महापथम्  highway, ययौ passed along.

17_11.shloka: न हि तस्मान्मनः कश्चिच्चक्षुषी वा नरोत्तमात्।।2.17.13।।नर श्शक्नोत्यपाक्रष्टुमतिक्रान्तेऽपि राघवे।
17_11.translation: Even though Rama, the best among men had driven past them none was able to withdraw his mind or eyes from him. (They continued).
17_11.word_by_word: राघवे son of the Raghus (Rama), अतिक्रान्तेऽपि even though he passed them, कश्चित् नरःno man, तस्मात् नरोत्तमात् from that best of men, मनः mind, चक्षुषी his eyes, अपाक्रष्टुम् to withdraw, न शक्नोति हि was never able.

17_12.shloka: यश्च रामं न पश्येत्तु यं च रामो न पश्यति।।2.17.14।।निन्दित स्सर्वल्लोकेषु स्वात्माऽप्येनं विगर्हते।
17_12.translation: 'Whoever does not see Rama or Rama does not see him, will be blamed by all men in the (three) worlds. Even his self will blame him.
17_12.word_by_word: यश्च who, रामम् Rama, न पश्येत्तु does not see, यं च whom, रामः Rama, न पश्यति does not see, सर्वलोकेषु among all men, निन्दित: will be blamed, स्वात्माऽपि his self also, एनम् him, विगर्हते will blame.

17_13.shloka: सर्वेषु हि स धर्मात्मा वर्णानां कुरुते दयाम्।।2.17.15।।चतुर्णां हि वयः स्थानां तेन ते तमनुव्रताः।
17_13.translation: That righteous Rama shows compassion to all, to the four castes, to the young and the old. So they were devoted to him.
17_13.word_by_word: धर्मात्मा righteous one, सः he, चतुर्णाम् four, वर्णानाम् relating to castes, सर्वेषु in all people, वयःस्थानाम् to the young and old, दयाम् compassion, कुरुते does, तेन so, ते they, तम् him, अनुव्रताः were devoted.

17_14.shloka: चतुष्पथान्देवपथांश्चैत्यान्यायतनानि च।।2.17.16।।प्रदक्षिणं परिहरन् जगाम नृपते स्सुतः।
17_14.translation: The son of the king proceeded, leaving on his right, squares (intersections of four roads), and roads leading to temples, monuments and shrines too.
17_14.word_by_word: नृपतेः सुतः king's son (Rama), चतुष्पथान् junction of four roads, देवपथान् roads leading to temples, चैत्यान् monuments, आयतनानि च also temples, प्रदक्षिणम् ensuring that they come  on to his right, परिहरन् crossing, जगाम proceeded.

17_15.shloka: स राजकुलमासाद्य मेघसङ्घोपमै श्शुभैः।।2.17.17।।प्रासादशृङ्गैर्विविधैःकैलास शिखरोपमैः।आवारयद्भिर्गगनं विमानैरिव पाण्डुरैः।।2.17.18।।वर्धमानगृहैश्चापि रत्नजालपरिष्कृतैः।तत्पृथिव्यां गृहवरं महेन्द्रसदनोपमम्।।2.17.19।।राजपुत्रः पितुर्वेश्म प्रविवेश श्रिया ज्वलन्।
17_15.translation: That prince (Rama) arrived at the excellent palace of the king, which looked like the abode of Indra on earth, blazing with splendour. The various towers of the palace touching the sky resembled clusters of white clouds, like auspicious peaks of Kailasa, and like white aerial chariots decorated with gems.
17_15.word_by_word: सः राजपुत्रः that king's son (Rama), राजकुलम् royal residence, आसाद्य having reached, मेघसङ्घोपमैः resembling flakes of clouds, शुभैः auspicious, कैलासशिखरोपमैः resembling the peaks of Kailasa, पाण्डुरैः pale white, विमानैरिव like aerial chariots, गगनम् sky, आवारयद्भिः covering, विविधैः various, प्रासादशृङ्गै: on the top of the palace, रत्नजालपरिष्कृतैः decorated with clusters of gems, वर्धमानगृहैश्चापि with palaces not having doors to the south, पृथिव्याम् on this earth, महेन्द्रसदनोपमम् comparable to the abode of Indra, गृहवरम् excellent  residence, तत् that, वेश्म palace, श्रिया with splendour, ज्वलन् blazing, प्रविवेश entered.

17_16.shloka: स कक्ष्या धन्विभिर्गुप्तास्तिस्रोऽतिक्रम्य वाजिभिः।।2.17.20।।पदातिरपरे कक्ष्ये द्वे जगाम नरोत्तमः।
17_16.translation: Rama, the best among men, crossed the first three courtyards which were protected by bowmen on horses and crossed the remaining two on foot.
17_16.word_by_word: नरोत्तमः best among men(Rama), सः he, धन्विभिः bowmen, गुप्ताः protected, तिस्रः कक्ष्याः three courtyards, वाजिभिः on horses, अतिक्रम्य having crossed over, अपरे the remaining, द्वे कक्ष्ये two courtyards, पदातिः on foot, जगाम proceeded.

17_17.shloka: स सर्वा स्समतिक्रम्य कक्ष्या दशरथात्मजः।सन्निवर्त्य जनं सर्वं शुद्धान्तः पुरमभ्यगात्।।2.17.21।।
17_17.translation: Crossing the courtyards on his way Rama sent back his followers and entered theprivate apartment of the king.
17_17.word_by_word: सः दशरथात्मजः that son of Dasaratha, सर्वाः all, कक्ष्याः enclosures, समतिक्रम्य having crossed over, सर्वं जनम् all followers, सन्निवर्त्य having sent them, शुद्धान्तःपुरम् the private apartment, अभ्यगात् reached.

17_18.shloka: तस्मिन् प्रविष्टे पितुरन्तिकं तदा जन स्स सर्वो मुदितो नृपात्मजे।प्रतीक्षते तस्य पुनः स्म निर्गमं यथोदयं चन्द्रमसस्सरित्पतिः।।2.17.22।।
17_18.translation: When the prince approached his father all the people were delighted and  awaited his return like the ocean waiting for the rise of the Moon.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे सप्तदशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the seventeenth sarga of Ayodhyakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
17_18.word_by_word: तस्मिन् that, नृपात्मजे king's son, तदा then, पितुः father's, अन्तिकम् near, प्रविष्टे having entered, सः those, सर्वः all, जनः people, मुदितः were delighted, सरित्पतिः lord of rivers (ocean), चन्द्रमसः Moon's, उदयं यथा like the rise, तस्य his, पुनः निर्गमम् for his return, प्रतीक्षते स्म were waiting.

18_1.shloka: [Rama enquires Kaikeyi the reasons for his father's grief-- she informs him about the two boons bestowed by the king -- urges him to uphold the promise given by his father and live in the forest for fourteen years.]स ददर्शासने रामो निषण्णं पितरं शुभे।कैकेयीसहितं दीनं मुखेन परिशुष्यता।।2.18.1।।
18_1.translation: Rama beheld his father reclined on an auspicious couch and by his side was seated Kaikeyi. He looked wretched with a pale face.
18_1.word_by_word: सः रामः that Rama, शुभे on an auspicious, आसने in the couch, निषण्णम् reclined, कैकेयी सहितम् with kaikeyi, परिशुष्यता मुखेन with a pale face, दीनम् looking wretched, पितरम् father, ददर्श saw.

18_2.shloka: स पितुश्चरणौ पूर्वमभिवाद्य विनीतवत्।ततो ववन्दे चरणौ कैकेय्या स्सुसमाहितः।।2.18.2।।
18_2.translation: With all humility and wellcomposed mind, he made reverential salutation first at his father's feet and thereafter at Kaikeyi's.
18_2.word_by_word: सः he, विनीतवत् with all humility, सुसमाहितः with a wellcomposed mind, पूर्वम् first, पितुः his father's, चरणौ feet, अभिवाद्य having made reverential salutation, ततः thereafter, कैकेय्याः Kaikeyi's, चरणौ feet, ववन्दे saluted.

18_3.shloka: रामेत्युक्त्वा तु वचनं बाष्पपर्याकुलेक्षणः।शशाक नृपतिर्दीनो नेक्षितुं नाभिभाषितुम्।।2.18.3।।
18_3.translation: Dasaratha uttered the word 'Rama', but thereafter could neither say any more in  distress nor look at him becuase his eyes were brimming with tears.
18_3.word_by_word: नृपतिः king, राम इति saying 'Rama', वचनम् word, उक्त्वा having uttered, बाष्पपर्याकुलेक्षणः eyes full of tears, दीनः wretched, ईक्षितुम् to look at, न शशाक was not able, अभिभाषितुम् to speak,न not possible.

18_4.shloka: तदपूर्वं नरपतेर्दृष्ट्वा रूपं भयावहम्।रामोऽपि भयमापन्नः पदा स्पृष्ट्वेव पन्नगम्।।2.18.4।।
18_4.translation: Never before did Rama see such frightful appearance of his father. He was seized with fear as if  he trampled a serpent.
18_4.word_by_word: अपूर्वम् unprecedented, भयावहम् frightful, नरपतेः king's, तत् रूपम्  that appearance, दृष्ट्वा having seen, रामोऽपि Rama also, पन्नगम् serpent, पदा with foot, स्पृष्ट्वेव touched, भयम् आपन्नः experienced fear.

18_5.shloka: इन्द्रियैरप्रहृष्टैस्तं शोकसन्तापकर्शितम्।निश्श्वसन्तं महाराजं व्यथिताकुलचेतसम्।।2.18.5।।ऊर्मिमालिनमक्षोभ्यं क्षुभ्यन्तमिव सागरम्।उपप्लुतमिवादित्यमुक्तानृतमृषिं यथा।।2.18.6।।
18_5.translation: Maharaja (Dasaratha) with his senses dulled had become emaciated due to sorrow and suffering. With an agitated and troubled mind, he was breathing heavily. Although unshakable, he looked agitated like an ocean with successive rows of waves, like  the  Sun in eclipse, like an ascetic who has uttered falsehood.
18_5.word_by_word: अप्रहृष्टैः without delight, इन्द्रियैः with senses, शोकसन्तापकर्शितम् emaciated with sorrow and suffering, व्यथिताकुलचेतसम् with an agitated and troubled mind, निश्श्वसन्तम् breathing heavily, ऊर्मिमालिनम् crowned with a row of waves, अक्षोभ्यम् unshakable, क्षुभ्यन्तम् shaking, सागरम् इव like a sea, उपप्लुतम् covered (eclipsed), आदित्यम् इव like the Sun, उक्तानृतम् uttering falsehood, ऋषिं यथा like an ascetic, तं महाराजम्  to that maharaja (Dasaratha).

18_6.shloka: अचिन्त्यकल्पं हि पितुस्तं शोकमुपधारयन्।बभूव संरब्धतर स्समुद्र इव पर्वणि।।2.18.7।।
18_6.translation: The more Rama reflected on the incomprehensible sorrow of the king, the more he became perturbed like an ocean on the new Moon day.
18_6.word_by_word: अचिन्त्यकल्पम् beyond imagination, नृपतेः king's,तं शोकम् such  sorrow, उपधारयन् reflecting, पर्वणि on fullmoon day, समुद्र इव like an ocean, संरब्धतरः highly perturbed बभूव became.

18_7.shloka: चिन्तयामास च तदा रामः पितृहिते रतः।किं स्विदद्यैव नृपतिर्न मां प्रत्यभिनन्दति।।2.18.8।।
18_7.translation: Devoted to his father's wellbeing, Rama reflected, Why does not father reciprocate my greeting (like on other days)?
18_7.word_by_word: पितृहिते रतः devoted to the wellbeing of his father, रामः Rama, चिन्तयामास reflected, अद्यैव today only, नृपतिः the king, किं स्वित् why is it, माम् me, न प्रत्यभिनन्दति not reciprocating mygreeting.

18_8.shloka: अन्यदा मां पिता दृष्ट्वा कुपितोऽपि प्रसीदति।तस्य मामद्य संप्रेक्ष्य किमायासः प्रवर्तते।।2.18.9।।
18_8.translation: On other occasions even though angry he would feel pleased. But today  why does he feel sad even after seeing me?
18_8.word_by_word: अन्यदा in other times, पिता father, कुपितोऽपि even though angry (displeased), माम् me, दृष्ट्वा on seeing, प्रसीदति feels pleased, तस्य for him, अद्य today, माम् me, संप्रेक्ष्य having seen, किं why आयासः sorrow, प्रवर्तते caused.

18_9.shloka: स दीन इव शोकार्तो विषण्णवदनद्युतिः।कैकेयीमभिवाद्यैव रामो वचनमब्रवीत्।।2.18.10।।
18_9.translation: With a sorrowful countenance Rama made salutation to Kaikeyi and said like a wretch tormented with grief:
18_9.word_by_word: सः रामः that Rama, दीन इव like a wretch, शोकार्तः tormented with grief, विषण्णवदनद्युतिः with a sorrowful countenance, कैकेयीम् Kaikeyi, अभिवाद्यैव having made salutations, वचनम् words, अब्रवीत् said.

18_10.shloka: कच्चिन्मया नापराद्धमज्ञानाद्येन मे पिता।कुपितस्तन्ममाचक्ष्व त्वं चैवैनं प्रसादय।।2.18.11।।
18_10.translation: Have I committed any offence unknowingly? Please tell me why my father is angry with me. You alone can pacify him.
18_10.word_by_word: मया by me, अज्ञानात् unknowingly, नापराद्धम् कञ्चित् have I committed any offence, येन why, पिता father, मे with me, कुपितः angry, तत् that, मम to me, आचक्ष्व tell, त्वमेव you alone, एनम् him, प्रसादय propitiate.

18_11.shloka: अप्रसन्नमनाः किन्नु सदा मां प्रति वत्सलः।विवर्णवदनो दीनो न हि मामभिभाषते।।2.18.12।।
18_11.translation: Father has always been affectionate to me but today why is he in a dejected mood?  Why does his countenance look pale and wretched? Why does he not speak to me?
18_11.word_by_word: सदा always, मां प्रति to me, वत्सलः affectionate, अप्रसन्नमनाः किं नु why does he look displeased?, विवर्णवदनः of pale countenance, दीनः wretched, माम् to me, नाभिभाषते हि  does not speak?

18_12.shloka: शरीरो मानसो वापि कच्चिदेनं न बाधते।सन्तापोवाऽभितापो वा दुर्लभं हि सदा सुखम्।।2.18.13।।
18_12.translation: Is he suffering from any physical ailment or mental agony? It is affliction of either the body or the mind. (For) perpetual happiness is indeed rare.
18_12.word_by_word: शारीरः relating to the body, संतापो वाऽपि some ailment, मानसः (relating to) mind, अभितापो वाgreat distress, एनम् him, न बाधते कच्चित् does not trouble him, सदा always, सुखम्  happiness, दुर्लभं हि rare indeed.

18_13.shloka: कच्चिन्न किञ्चिद्भरते कुमारे प्रियदर्शने।शत्रुघ्ने वा महासत्त्वे मात्रूणां वा ममाशुभम्।।2.18.14।।
18_13.translation: Has any misfortune befallen the handsome Bharata or the mighty Satrughna or any of my mothers?
18_13.word_by_word: प्रियदर्शिने with a pleasing appearance, भरते for Bharata, महासत्त्वे possessing great strength, शत्रुघ्ने with regard to Satrughna, मम my, मात्रूणां वा relating to mothers, किंचित् any, अशुभम् misfortune, न कच्चित् did not happen, (I hope)

18_14.shloka: अतोषयन्महाराजमकुर्वन्वा पितुर्वचः।मुहूर्तमपि नेच्छेयं जीवितुं कुपिते नृपे।।2.18.15।।
18_14.translation: If I have (ever) displeased the maharaja, my father or disobeyed his command which has angered him, I do not wish to live for a moment৷৷
18_14.word_by_word: महाराजम् to the maharaja (Dasaratha), अतोषयन् displeased, पितुः father's, वचः words, अकुर्वन् disobeying, नृपे कुपिते when the king has become angry, मुहूर्तमपि even for a moment, जीवितुम् to live, नेच्छेयम् do not wish.

18_15.shloka: यतोमूलं नरः पश्येत्प्रादुर्भावमिहात्मनः।कथं तस्मिन्नवर्तेत प्रत्यक्षे सति दैवते।।2.18.16।।
18_15.translation: How can a man who owes his origin (birth) in this world to him (father) who still exists as a visible god not conduct himself (as per his wish)?
18_15.word_by_word: नरः a man, इह in this world, आत्मनः his own, प्रादुर्भावम् coming into existence, यतो मूलम् source of his origin (birth), पश्येत् sees, प्रत्यक्षे in a visible, दैवते god, तस्मिन् in him (father), सति exists, कथम् how, न वर्तेत does not conduct.

18_16.shloka: कच्चित्ते परुषं किञ्चिदभिमानात्पतिता मम।उक्तो भवत्या कोपेन यत्रास्य लुलितं मनः।।2.18.17।।
18_16.translation: Have you said anything harsh to my father out of anger or (injured) selfrespect for which his mind has been shaken?
18_16.word_by_word: मम पिता my father, ते your, अभिमानात् because of selfrespect, भवत्या by you, कोपेन out of anger, परुषम् harsh, किञ्चित् anything, कच्चित् उक्तः has said?, यत्र (येन) due to which, अस्य his, मनः mind, लुलितम् has been shaken.

18_17.shloka: एतदाचक्ष्व मे देवि तत्त्वेन परिपृच्छतः।किं निमित्तमपूर्वोयं विकारो मनुजाधिपे।।2.18.18।।
18_17.translation: O Devi I am repeatedly asking you the cause of this unprecedented change in the king please tell me the truth.
18_17.word_by_word: देवि O queen, परिपृच्छत: am repeatedly asking, मे to me, एतत् this matter, तत्त्वेन truly,  आचक्ष्व tell, मनुजाधिपे in the king, अयम् this, अपूर्व: विकार: unprecedented change, किं निमित्तम् for what reason.

18_18.shloka: एवमुक्ता तु कैकेयी राघवेण महात्मना।उवाचेदं सुनिर्लज्जा धृष्टमात्महितं वचः।।2.18.19।।
18_18.translation: When Kaikeyi was thus asked by the magnanimous scion of the Raghus (Rama) sheuttered unashamed these impudent words in her own interest.
18_18.word_by_word: महात्मना magnanimous, राघवेण by the scion of the Raghus (Rama), एवम् thus, उक्ता spoken,  कैकेयी Kaikeyi, सुनिर्लज्जा without any sense of shame, धृष्टम् impudent, आत्महितम् in her own interest, इदं वच: these words, उवाच said.

18_19.shloka: न राजा कुपितो राम व्यसनं नास्य किञ्चन।किञ्चिन्मनोगतंत्वस्य त्वद्भयान्नाभिभाषते।।2.18.20।।
18_19.translation: O Rama, the king is neither angry, nor has any misforturne befallen him. But out of fear for you he is not able to speak out what he has in mind.
18_19.word_by_word: राम Rama, राजा king, न कुपित: is not angry, अस्य for him, किञ्चन not even a little, व्यसनम्  misfortune, न did not befall, तु but, अस्य for him, किञ्चित् some issue, मनोगतम् in mind, त्वद्भयात् afraid of you, नाभिभाषते does not speak.

18_20.shloka: प्रियं त्वामप्रियं वक्तुं वाणी नास्योपवर्तते।तदवश्यं त्वया कार्यं यदनेनाश्रुतं मम।।2.18.21।।
18_20.translation: The goddess of speech does not permit him to say an unpleasant thing to you for you are his beloved son. So you must fulfil the promise he has made to me.
18_20.word_by_word: प्रियम् beloved, त्वाम् to you, अप्रियम् unpleasant, वक्तुम् to say, अस्य for him, वाणी goddess of speech, नोपवर्तते does not permit, अनेन by him, यत् which, मम to me, आश्रुतम् has been promised, तत् that, त्वया by you, अवश्यम् definitely, कार्यम् fit to be done.

18_21.shloka: एष मह्यं वरं दत्त्वा पुरा मामभिपूज्य च।स पश्चात्तप्यते राजा यथाऽन्यः प्राकृतस्तथा।।2.18.22।।
18_21.translation: In the past the king had honoured me with (two) boons. Now like any other common man he is repenting (for the same).
18_21.word_by_word: स: he, एष: राजा this king, पुरा earlier, माम् me, अभिपूज्य च having honoured, (मह्यं to me)  वरम् boons, दत्त्वा having bestowed, अन्य: other, प्राकृत: common man, यथा as, तथा like that, पश्चात्तप्यते repenting.

18_22.shloka: अतिसृज्य ददानीति वरं मम विशांपतिः।स निरर्थं गतजले सेतुं बन्धितुमिच्छति।।2.18.23।।
18_22.translation: The king bestowed on me boons saying, 'I shall grant you two boons'. But now he wishes in vain to build a dam when the water has run down.
18_22.word_by_word: स: विशांपति that king, ददानि इति saying 'I shall give you', मम to me, वरम् two boons, अतिसृज्य having bestowed, गतजले at a place where the water has drained, सेतुम् dam, निरर्थम् in vain, बन्धितुम् to construct, इच्छति wishes.

18_23.shloka: धर्ममूलमिदं राम विदितं च सतामपि।तत्सत्यं न त्यजेद्राजा कुपितस्त्वत्कृते यथा।।2.18.24।।
18_23.translation: O Rama, this (truth) is the basis of righteousness. The virtuous also know this. The king being angry (with me), should not abandon the truth for your sake.
18_23.word_by_word: राम O Rama, इदम् this (truth), धर्ममूलम् is the basis of righteousness, सतामपि to the virtuous also, विदितम् is made known thus, कुपित: being angry, राजा king, तत् सत्यम् that truth, यथा as to how, त्वत्कृते on your account, न त्यजेत् may not abandon.

18_24.shloka: यदि तद्वक्ष्यते राजा शुभं वा यदि वाऽशुभम्।करिष्यसि ततस्सर्वमाख्यास्यामि पुनस्त्वहम्।।2.18.25।।
18_24.translation: If you fulfil whatever the king says, pleasant or unpleasant, I shall relate to you everything.
18_24.word_by_word: शुभं वा be it auspicious, अशुभं यदि वा or inauspicious, तत् that truth, राजा king, वक्ष्यते यदि if shall tell (you), करिष्यसि (यदा) you will fulfil, अहं पुनस्तु I again, तत: after that, सर्वम् all, आख्यास्यामि shall relate.

18_25.shloka: यदि त्वभिहितं राज्ञा त्वयि तन्न विपत्स्यते।ततोऽहमभिधास्यामि न ह्येष त्वयि वक्ष्यति।।2.18.26।।
18_25.translation: If you do not transgress the word given by the king I shall tell you everything. The king on his own will not tell you.
18_25.word_by_word: राज्ञा by the king, अभिहितम् told, तत् that, त्वयि in you, न विपत्स्यते will not go in vain, तत: then, अहम् I, अभिधास्यामि I shall speak, एष: the king, त्वयि in you, न वक्ष्यति हि will not tell.

18_26.shloka: एतत्तु वचनं श्रुत्वा कैकेय्या समुदाहृतम्।उवाच व्यथितो रामस्तां देवीं नृपसन्निधौ।।2.18.27।।
18_26.translation: Very much depressed on hearing the words of Kaikeyi, Rama thus said to her in the presence of the king:
18_26.word_by_word: कैकेय्या by Kaikeyi, समुदाहृतम् uttered, एतत् this, वचनम् word, श्रुत्वा having heard, राम:   Rama, व्यथित: depressed, नृपसन्निधौ in the presence of the king, तां देवीं to that lady, उवाच said.

18_27.shloka: अहो धिङ्नार्हसे देवि वक्तुं मामीदृशं वचः।अहं हि वचनाद्राज्ञः पतेयमपि पावके।।2.18.28।।भक्षयेयं विषं तीक्ष्णं मज्जेयमपि चार्णवे।नियुक्तो गुरुणा पित्रा नृपेण च हितेन च।।2.18.29।।
18_27.translation: Alas, what a pity, O queen, it does not behove you to speak to me such words. I can jump into fire. Since he is my father, preceptor and wellwisher, I shall consumedeadly poison or even get drowned in the sea if he so commands.
18_27.word_by_word: देवी O devi, अहो alas, धिक् what a pity, माम् to me, ईदृशम् such, वच: words, वक्तुम् to speak, नार्हसे it does not behove you, हि because, अहम् I, राज्ञ: king's, वचनात् on the word, पावकेऽपि even in fire, पतेयम् will jump, नृपेण by the king, हितेन च who desires my  welfare, गुरुणा by the gurus, पित्रा by father, नियुक्त: ordered, तीक्ष्णं विषम् deadly poison, भक्षयेयम् will drink, अपि च and also, अर्णवे in the ocean, मज्जेयम् shall get drowned.

18_28.shloka: तद्ब्रूहि वचनं देवि राज्ञो यदभिकाङ्क्षितम्।करिष्ये प्रतिजाने च रामो द्विर्नाभिभाषते।।2.18.30।।
18_28.translation: Hence tell me, O Devi Whatever be the desire of the king: I promise I shall carry out, Rama does not say two things (does not go back on his word).
18_28.word_by_word: तत् hence, देवि O Devi राज्ञः for the king, यत् whatever, अभिकांक्षितम् is his desire, वचनम् in words, ब्रूहि tell, करिष्ये I shall carry out, प्रतिजाने च I promise, रामा Rama, द्वि two times, नाभिभाषते will not utter.

18_29.shloka: तमार्जवसमायुक्तमनार्या सत्यवादिनम्।उवाच रामं कैकेयी वचनं भृशदारुणम्।।2.18.31।।
18_29.translation: To Rama who was devoted to truth and to rectitude of conduct the ignobale Kaikeyi said:
18_29.word_by_word: अनार्या ignoble, कैकेयी Kaikeyi, आर्जवसमायुक्तं devoted to rectitude of conduct, सत्यवादिनम्  truthful, तं रामम् addressing that Rama, भृशदारुणम् extremely cruel, वचनम् words, उवाच said.

18_30.shloka: पुरा दैवासुरे युद्धे पित्रा ते मम राघव।रक्षितेन वरौ दत्तौ सशल्येन महारणे।।2.18.32।।
18_30.translation: O descendant of Raghu in the great war between gods and demons in the past your father had granted me two boons for protecting him when he was wounded by a shaft.
18_30.word_by_word: राघव O (Rama) descendant of Raghu, पुरा in the past, दैवासुरे युद्धे in the war between gods and demons, महारणे great war, सशल्येन wounded by shafts, रक्षितेन protected (by me), ते पित्रा by your father, मम to me, वरौ two boons, दत्तौ granted.

18_31.shloka: तत्र मे याचितो राजा भरतस्याभिषेचनम्।गमनं दण्डकारण्ये तव चाद्यैव राघव।।2.18.33।।
18_31.translation: O scion of the Raghus, hence I have asked the king for consecration of Bharata and your departure to Dandaka forest today itself.
18_31.word_by_word: राघव (Rama) scion of the Raghus, तत्र there (so), राजा the king, भरतस्य Bharata's, अभिषेचनम् consecration, अद्यैव today itself,  दण्डकारण्ये to Dandaka forest, तव your, गमनम् departure, याचितः has been asked.

18_32.shloka: यदि सत्यप्रतिज्ञं त्वं पितरं कर्तुमिच्छसि।आत्मानं च नरश्रेष्ठ मम वाक्यमिदं शृणु।।2.18.34।।
18_32.translation: O the best of men if you want to be true to the word given by you and your father, listen to what I say.
18_32.word_by_word: नरश्रेष्ठ O best among men, त्वम् you, पितरम् your father, आत्मानं च yourself as well, सत्यप्रतिज्ञम् truthful to promise, कर्तुम् to make, इच्छसि यदि if you want, मम my, इदं वाक्यम् these words, शृणु listen.

18_33.shloka: सन्निदेशे पितुस्तिष्ठ यथा तेन प्रतिश्रुतम्।त्वयाऽरण्यं प्रवेष्टव्यं नव वर्षाणि पञ्च च।।2.18.35।।
18_33.translation: Abide by your father's command. As promised by him go to the forest for fourteen years.
18_33.word_by_word: पितु: father's, सन्निदेशे by the command, तिष्ठ abide by, तेन by him, यथा in this way, प्रतिश्रुतम् promised, त्वया by you, नव पंच च nine and five (fourteen), वर्षाणि years, अरण्यम् forest, प्रवेष्टव्यम् enter (and stay).

18_34.shloka: भरतस्त्वभिषिच्येत यदेतदभिषेचनम्।त्वदर्थे विहितं राज्ञा तेन सर्वेण राघव।।2.18.36।।
18_34.translation: Bharata shall be consecrated, O descendant of the Raghu dynasty with all these preparations made by the king to install you.
18_34.word_by_word: राघव O son of the Raghu dynasty (Rama), राज्ञा by the king, त्वदर्थे for your sake, यत् which, एतत् this, अभिषेचनम् installation, विहितम् has been arranged, तेन सर्वेण with all these (preparations), भरतः Bharata, अभिषिच्येत shall be consecrated.

18_35.shloka: सप्त सप्त च वर्षाणि दण्डकारण्यमाश्रितः।अभिषेकमिमं त्यक्त्वा जटाजिनधरो वस।।2.18.37।।
18_35.translation: Forsake this consecration, wear matted locks and deerskin and take refuge in Dandaka forest for fourteen years.
18_35.word_by_word: इमम् अभिषेकम् this consecration, त्यक्त्वा having forsaken, जटाजिनधर: with matted hair anddeerskin, दण्डकारण्यम् आश्रितः taking refuge in Dandaka forest, सप्त सप्त च वर्षाणि seven and seven (fourteen) years, वस live.

18_36.shloka: भरतः कोसलपुरे प्रशास्तु वसुधामिमाम्।नानारत्न समाकीर्णां सवाजिरथकुञ्जराम्।।2.18.38।।
18_36.translation: Let Bharata live in Ayodhya, the capital of Kosala and rule this kingdom rich in gems of different kinds in horses, chariots and elephants.
18_36.word_by_word: भरतः Bharata, कोशलपुरे in Ayodhya, the capital of Kosala country, नानारत्न समाकीर्णाम् abounding in different kinds of gems, सवाजिरथकुञ्जराम् with horses, chariots and elephants, इमां वसुधाम् this earth, प्रशास्तु let (him) rule.

18_37.shloka: एतेन त्वां नरेन्द्रोऽयं कारुण्येन समाप्लुतः।शोकसंक्लिष्ट वदनो न शक्नोति निरीक्षितुम्।।2.18.39।।
18_37.translation: This is why the king with his face tortured by tears and (his heart) overwhelmed with compassion for you, is unable to look at you.
18_37.word_by_word: एतेन  therefore, अयं नरेन्द्रः this king, कारुण्येन on account of compassion, समाप्लुतः was overwhelmed, शोकसंक्लिष्ट वदनः with a face fortured by tears, त्वाम् you, निरीक्षितुम् to see, न शक्नोति not able.

18_38.shloka: एतत्कुरु नरेन्द्रस्य वचनं रघुनन्दन।सत्येन महता राम तारयस्व नरेश्वरम्।।2.18.40।।
18_38.translation: O Joy of the Raghus, O son of the Raghu race, carry out the word of promise given by the king and save him by helping him keep the truth which is great.
18_38.word_by_word: रघुनन्दन  O Joy of the Raghus, O son of the Raghu race, नरेन्द्रस्य king's, एतत् वचनम् this word of promise, कुरु carry out, राम Rama, महता सत्येन with your great truthfulness, नरेश्वरम् the king, तारयस्व save.

18_39.shloka: इतीव तस्यां परुषं वदन्त्यांन चैव रामः प्रविवेश शोकम्।प्रविव्यथे चापि महानुभावोराजा तु पुत्रव्यसनाभितप्तः।।2.18.41।।
18_39.translation: Even though she was speaking harsh words, Rama did not come to grief. But the magnanimous king was greatly afflicted to see the calamity on his son.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे अष्टादशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the eighteenth sarga of Ayodhyakanda of the oly Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
18_39.word_by_word: इतीव in this way, तस्याम् she (Kaikeyi), परुषम् harsh words, वदन्त्याम् was speaking, रामः Rama, शोकम् sorrow, नचैव प्रविदेश did not enter, महानुभावः dignified, राजा तु king, पुत्रव्यसनाभितप्तः afflicted with the son's calamity, प्रविव्यथे was greatly pained.

19_1.shloka: [Rama hears from Kaikeyi about the boons promised by Dasarathaconsents to leave for the forest goes to meet Kausalya.]तदप्रियममित्रघ्नो वचनं मरणोपमम्।श्रुत्वा न विव्यथे रामः कैकेयीं चेदमब्रवीत्।।2.19.1।।
19_1.translation: The destroyer of enemies (Rama) did not feel distressed to hear these words painful like death. To Kaikeyi he said:
19_1.word_by_word: अमित्रघ्नः destroyer of enemies, रामः Rama, अप्रियम् unpleasant, मरणोपमम् like death, तत्वचनम् those words, श्रुत्वा having heard, न विव्यथे was not pained, कैकेयीम् to Kaikeyi, इदम् these words, अब्रवीत् said.

19_2.shloka: एवमस्तु गमिष्यामि वनं वस्तुमहं त्वितः।जटाजिनधरो राज्ञः प्रतिज्ञामनुपालयन्।।2.19.2।।
19_2.translation: Be it so I shall go from here to the forest and live there with matted hair and deerskin to keep the promise of the king.
19_2.word_by_word: एवम् अस्तु be it so अहम् I, राज्ञः king's, प्रतिज्ञाम् promise, अनुपालयन् while obeying, जटाजिनधरः wearing matted locks and deer skin , इतः from here, वनम् to the forest, वस्तुम् to live, गमिष्यामि shall go.

19_3.shloka: इदं तु ज्ञातुमिच्छामि किमर्थं मां महीपतिः।नाभिनन्दति दुर्धर्षो यथापूर्वमरिन्दमः।।2.19.3।।
19_3.translation: Nevertheless I would like to know why king Dasaratha, an unassailable subduer of enemies does not greet me as usual.
19_3.word_by_word: दुर्धर्षः unassailable, अरिन्दमः subduer of enemies, महीपतिः lord of the earth (king Dasaratha), यथापूर्वम् as usual, माम् me, किमर्थम् why, नाभिनन्दति does not greet, इदं तु this nevertheless, ज्ञातुम् to know, इच्छामि (I) wish.

19_4.shloka: मन्युर्न च त्वया कार्यो देवि ब्रूमि तवाग्रतः।यास्यामि भव सुप्रीता वनं चीरजटाधरः।।2.19.4।।
19_4.translation: O Devi you should not grieve. I declare in your presence that I shall go to the forest wearing tattered clothes (bark) and matted locks. Rejoice (to hear this).
19_4.word_by_word: देवि O Devi त्वया by you, मन्युः indignation, न कार्यः should not be expressed, तव your, अग्रतः in front of, ब्रूमि am telling, चीरजटाधरः wearing tattered clothes (bark robes) and with matted locks, वनम् to the forest, यास्यामि shall go, सुप्रीता भव rejoice.

19_5.shloka: हितेन गुरुणा पित्रा कृतज्ञेन नृपेण च।नियुज्यमानो विस्रब्धः किं न कुर्यामहं प्रियम्।।2.19.5।।
19_5.translation: Ordered by my father who is my wellwisher, my guru, one with a sense of gratidude and, above all a king, shall I not, without hesitation do what pleases him?
19_5.word_by_word: हितेन seeking wellbeing, गुरुणा by guru, कृतज्ञेन grateful person, नृपेण च also the king, पित्रा by father, नियुज्यमानः having been ordered, अहम् I, विस्रब्ध without hesitation, प्रियम् what pleases (him), न कुर्यां किम् shall I not do?

19_6.shloka: अलीकं मानसं त्वेकं हृदयं दहतीव मे।स्वयं यन्नाह मां राजा भरतस्याभिषेचनम्।।2.19.6।।
19_6.translation: One thing which hurts me is that the king himself did not tell me about Bharata'sconsecration. That alone is burning my heart.
19_6.word_by_word: भरतस्य Bharata's, अभिषेचनम् consecration, राजा king, स्वयम् himself, माम् to me, यत् नाह which he did not tell, एकम् that one, मानसम् in my mind, अलीकम् one which hurts, मे my , हृदयम् heart, दहतीव as if burning.

19_7.shloka: अहं हि सीतां राज्यं च प्राणानिष्टान्धनानि च।हृष्टो भ्रात्रे स्वयं दद्यां भरतायाप्रचोदितः।।2.19.7।।
19_7.translation: Unurged, I would have gladly given to Bharata the kingdom, wealth, my mostcoveted life, and even Sita.
19_7.word_by_word: अहम् I, अप्रचोदितः unurged, हृष्टः pleased, भ्रात्रे to my  brother, भरताय for Bharata, सीताम् Sita, राज्यम् kingdom, प्राणान् life, इष्टान् most coveted, धनानि च wealth also, स्वयम् myself, दद्याम् shall give.

19_8.shloka: किं पुनर्मनुजेन्द्रेण स्वयं पित्रा प्रचोदितः।तव च प्रियकामार्थं प्रतिज्ञामनुपालयन्।।2.19.8।।
19_8.translation: In order to keep the promise I shall do everything to fulfil your desire. Needless to say that my father has ordered this.
19_8.word_by_word: पित्रा by father, मनुजेन्द्रेण by the king, स्वयम् on his own, प्रचोदितः having been ordered, तव your, प्रियकामार्थम् for the sake of (your) pleasure, प्रतिज्ञाम् promise, अनुपालयन् to keep up, किं पुन: needless to say.

19_9.shloka: तदाश्वासय हीमं त्वं किन्विदं यन्महीपतिः।वसुधासक्तनयनो मन्दमश्रूणि मुञ्चति।।2.19.9।।
19_9.translation: Please console him. Why is it that the king with his eyes fixed upon the ground is shedding tears drop by drop?
19_9.word_by_word: तत् further, त्वम् you, इमम् him, आश्वासय console, महीपतिः king, वसुधासक्तनयनः with eyes fixed upon the ground, मन्दम् slowly, अश्रूणि tears, मुञ्चति इति यत् is shedding, इदं this, किं नु why indeed?

19_10.translation: With the king's orders let messengers go right away on swift horses to fetch Bharata from his maternal uncle's house.
19_10.word_by_word: नृपशासनात् by the king's order, मातुलकुलात् from his maternal uncle's house, भरतम् Bharata, आनयितुम् to bring back, दूताः messengers, शीघ्रजवैः speedy, हयैः horses, अद्यैव (today itself) right now, गच्छन्तु let go.

19_11.shloka: दण्डकारण्यमेषोऽहमितो गच्छामि सत्वरः।अविचार्य पितुर्वाक्यं समा वस्तुं चतुर्दश।।2.19.11।।
19_11.translation: As for me, without deliberating on the propriety of my father's orders, I shall go from here at once to Dandaka forest to live (there) for fourteen years.
19_11.word_by_word: एषः अहम् as for me, पितुः father's, वाक्यम् word, अविचार्य without deliberating, सत्वरः at once, चतुर्दश fourteen, समाः years, वस्तुम् to live, इतः from here, दण्डकारण्यम् to Dandaka  forest, गच्छामि will go.

19_12.shloka: सा हृष्टा तस्य तद्वाक्यं श्रुत्वा रामस्य कैकयी।प्रस्थानं श्रद्धधाना हि त्वरयामास राघवम्।।2.19.12।।
19_12.translation: Kaikeyi, happy to hear the words of the son of the Raghus as she was convinced that his departure (to the forest) was certain, hastened him (to set out).
19_12.word_by_word: सा कैकयी that Kaikeyi, तस्य रामस्य such Rama's, तत् वाक्यम् those words, श्रुत्वा having heard, हृष्टा happy, प्रस्थानम् departure, श्रद्धधाना believing,  राघवम् to Rama, त्वरयामास hastened (him).

19_13.shloka: एवं भवतु यास्यन्ति दूता श्शीघ्रजवैर्हयैः।भरतं मातुलकुलादुपावर्तयितुं नराः।।2.19.13।।
19_13.translation: Let it be so. Messengers shall go at once on swift horses to bring Bharata from his maternal uncle's house.
19_13.word_by_word: एवं भवतु let it happen, मातुलकुलात् from maternal uncle's house, भरतम् to Bharata, उपावर्तयितुम् to bring him back, दूताः messengers, नराः men, शीघ्रजवैः swiftfooted, हयैः by horses, यास्यन्ति will go.

19_14.shloka: तव त्वहं क्षमं मन्ये नोत्सुकस्य विलम्बनम्।राम तस्मादित श्शीघ्रं वनं त्वं गन्तुमर्हसि।।2.19.14।।
19_14.translation: Since you are eager (to go to the forest), I do not think it is proper to delay. O Rama therefore it behoves you to proceed immediately from here to the forest.
19_14.word_by_word: तु but, उत्सुकस्य eager (to go to the forest), तव your, विलंबनम् delay, क्षमम् appropriate,  अहम् I, न मन्ये do not think, राम Rama, तस्मात् therefore, त्वम् you, इतः from here, शीघ्रम् immediately, वनम् to the forest, गन्तुम् to go, अर्हसि behoves you.

19_15.shloka: व्रीडान्वित स्स्वयं यच्च नृपस्त्वां नाभिभाषते।नैतत्किञ्चिन्नरश्रेष्ठ मन्युरेषोऽपनीयताम्।।2.19.15।।
19_15.translation: Out of shame the king is unable to speak to you. There is nothing other than this. O Rama, the best of men, dispel this distress (of mind).
19_15.word_by_word: नरश्रेष्ठ best among men, Rama, व्रीडान्वित: being ashamed, नृपः king, स्वयम् himself, त्वाम्  you, यत् since, नाभिभाषते does not speak, एतत् this one, न किञ्चित् is nothing, एषः this, मन्युः distress, अपनीयताम् you may dispel.

19_16.shloka: यावत्त्वं न वनं यातः पुरादस्मादभित्वरन्।पिता तावन्न ते राम स्नास्यते भोक्ष्यतेऽपि वा।।2.19.16।।
19_16.translation: O Rama, as long as you do not hasten to leave this city for the forest, your father will neither bathe nor eat.
19_16.word_by_word: राम Rama, त्वम् you, अभित्वरन् hastening up, अस्मात् this, पुरात् from this city, यावत् as long as, वनम् to the forest, न यातः do not go, तावत् till then, ते your, पिता father, स्नास्यते will neither bathe, न भोक्ष्यतेपि वा nor will eat.

19_17.shloka: धिक्कष्टमिति निःश्वस्य राजा शोकपरिप्लुतः।मूर्छितो न्यपतत्तस्मिन्पर्यङ्के हेमभूषिते।।2.19.17।।
19_17.translation: 'Fie, what a calamity' sighing thus, the king, overwhelmed with sorrow, fainted and fell back on the golden couch.
19_17.word_by_word: राजा king, धिक् fie, कष्टम् what a calamity, इति thus, निःश्वस्य sighing, शोकपरिप्लुतः overwhelmed with sorrow, मूर्छितः having fainted, हेमभूषिते adorned with gold, तस्मिन् पर्यङ्के on that couch, न्यपतत् fell down.

19_18.shloka: रामोऽप्युत्थाप्य राजानं कैकेय्याभिप्रचोदितः।कशयेवाहतो वाजी वनं गन्तुं कृतत्वरः।।2.19.18।।
19_18.translation: Rama lifted up the king and, urged by Kaikeyi, hastened to depart for the forest like a horse flogged by a whip.
19_18.word_by_word: कैकेय्या by Kaikeyi, अभिप्रचोदितः urged, रामोऽपि Rama also, राजानम् the king, उत्थाप्य having lifted, कशया by a whip आहतः flogged, वाजीव like a horse, वनम् to the forest, गन्तुम् to depart, कृतत्वरः hastened

19_19.shloka: तदप्रियमनार्याया वचनं दारुणोदयम्।श्रुत्वा गतव्यथो रामः कैकेयीं वाक्यमब्रवीत्।।2.19.19।।
19_19.translation: Rama listened to the dreadful, cruel words of the ignoble woman but, without feeling any sorrow, said to Kaikeyi, these words:
19_19.word_by_word: रामः Rama, अनार्यायाः of that ignoble (lady), दारुणोदयम् of dreadful consequence, अप्रियम्unpleasant, तत् वचनम् those words, श्रुत्वा having heard, गतव्यथः bereft of pain, कैकेयीम् to Kaikeyi, वाक्यम् words, अब्रवीत् said.

19_20.translation: O Devi, I have no desire to live in this world for the sake of wealth. Know me as one with the sages who are devoted only to righteousness.
19_20.word_by_word: देवि O Devi, अहम् I, अर्थपरः interested in wealth, न not, लोकम् this world, आवस्तुम् to live,उत्सहे am striving, केवलम् only, धर्मम् righteousness, आस्थितम् devoted to, माम् me, ऋषिभिः with ascetics, तुल्यम् similar, विद्धि know.

19_21.shloka: यदत्र भवतः किञ्चिच्छक्यं कर्तुं प्रियं मया।प्राणानपि परित्यज्य सर्वथा कृतमेव तत्।।2.19.21।।
19_21.translation: If I am able to do anything which pleases my venerable father, it shall be done in every possible manner, may be even at the cost of my life.
19_21.word_by_word: मया by me, अत्र भवतः to the venerable (father), किञ्चित् even a little, यत् प्रियम् which pleases him, कर्तुम् to do, शक्यम् is possible, तत् that one, प्राणान् life, परित्यज्यापि even by giving up, सर्वथा in every way, कृतमेव it is done.

19_22.shloka: न ह्यतो धर्मचरणं किञ्चिदस्ति महत्तरम्।यथा पितरिशुश्रूषा तस्य वा वचनक्रिया।।2.19.22।।
19_22.translation: There is no greater observance of righteousness than doing service to one's father or carrying out his orders.
19_22.word_by_word: पितरि in respect of one's father, शुश्रूषा service, तस्य his, वचनक्रिया वा or carrying out orders, यथा as, अतः than that, महत्तरं greater, धर्मचरणम् observing righteousness, किञ्चित् anything, नास्ति हि is not there.

19_23.shloka: अनुक्तोऽप्यत्रभवता भवत्या वचनादहम्।वने वत्स्यामि विजने वर्षाणीह चतुर्दश।।2.19.23।।
19_23.translation: Though this has not been said by my respectable father himself, I shall live in the forlorn forest for fourteen years in accordance with your word.
19_23.word_by_word: अहम् I, अत्र भवता by this venerable (father), अनुक्तोपि even without being told, भवत्याः your, वचनात् by your word, इह now, चतुर्दश वर्षाणि fourteen years, विजने solitary, वने in the forest, वत्स्यामि will live.

19_24.shloka: न नूनं मयि कैकयि किञ्चिदाशंससे गुणम्।यद्राजानमवोचस्त्वं ममेश्वरतरा सती।।2.19.24।।
19_24.translation: Since in my case you have exercised more authority (than my father) and pleaded with the king, it follows, you, for sure, do not see any virtue in me, O Kaikeyi (Or else, you should not have asked for Bharata's kingship).
19_24.word_by_word: कैकेयि O Kaikeyi, त्वम् you, मम in my affair, ईश्वरतरा सती even though capable of exercising greater authority, राजानम् to the king, यत् अवोचः for which you pleaded, मयि in me, किञ्चित् even a little, गुणम् virtue, न आशंससे do not expect, नूनम् this is certain.

19_25.shloka: यावन्मातरमाप्नच्छे सीतां चानुनयाम्यहम्।ततोऽद्यैव गमिष्यामि दण्डकानां महद्वनम्।।2.19.25।।
19_25.translation: After taking leave of my mother and consoling Sita, today itself I shall go to that wild  Dandaka forest.
19_25.word_by_word: मातरम् my mother, यावत् आप्नच्छे until I take leave, सीतां च Sita also, अहम् I, अनुनयामि  console, ततः after that, अद्यैव today itself, महत् great (wild), दण्डकानां वनम् Dandaka forest, गमिष्यामि I shall go.

19_26.shloka: भरतः पालयेद्राज्यं शुश्रूषेच्च पितुर्यथा।तथा भवत्या कर्तव्यं स हि धर्म स्सनातनः।।2.19.26।।
19_26.translation: It is your bounden duty to see that Bharata rules the kingdom and serves father.
19_26.word_by_word: भरतः Bharata,  यथा so that, राज्यम् the kingdom, पालयेत् rules, पितुः for father, शुश्रूषेच्च serves, तथा thus, भवत्या by you, कर्तव्यम् it should be done, सः that, सनातनः eternal, धर्मः हि duty indeed.

19_27.shloka: स रामस्य वचश्श्रृत्वा भृशं दुःखहतः पिता।शोकादशक्नुवन्वकतुं प्ररुरोद महास्वनम्।।2.19.27।।
19_27.translation: Father (Dasaratha), too tormented with grief to speak cried out loudly on hearing the words of Rama.
19_27.word_by_word: रामस्य Rama's, वचः words, श्रुत्वा having heard, पिता father, सः that (Dasaratha), भृशम् greatly, दुःखहतः hit with grief, शोकात् out of sorrow, वक्तुम् to speak, अशक्नुवन् was not able, महास्वनम् with a loud voice, प्ररुरोद cried.

19_28.shloka: वन्दित्वा चरणौ रामो विसंज्ञस्य पितुस्तथा।कैकेय्याश्चाप्यनार्यायाः निष्पपात महाद्युतिः।।2.19.28।।
19_28.translation: Effulgent Rama  bowed at the feet of his father who had fallen into a swoon. He bowed at the feet of the ignoble Kaikeyi and set out.
19_28.word_by_word: महाद्युतिः effulgent, रामः Rama, विसंज्ञस्य who had fallen into a swoon, पितुः father's, चरणौ feet, तथा and, अनार्यायाः of the ignoble, कैकेय्याश्चापि those of Kaikeyi, वन्दित्वा bowing down with respect, निष्पपात set out.

19_29.shloka: स रामः पितरं कृत्वा कैकेयीं च प्रदक्षिणम्।निष्क्रम्यान्तःपुरात्तस्मात्स्वं ददर्श सुहृज्जनम्।।2.19.29।।
19_29.translation: Hardly had Rama withdrawn from the harem after circumambulating his father and Kaikeyi when he saw his friends .
19_29.word_by_word: सः रामः that Rama, पितरम् father, कैकेयीं च also, Kaikeyi, प्रदक्षिणं कृत्वा having made circumambulation, तस्मात् from that, अन्तःपुरात् from that harem, निष्क्रम्य after stepping out, स्वम् own, सुहृज्जनम् friends, ददर्श saw.

19_30.shloka: तं बाष्पपरिपूर्णाक्षः पृष्ठतोऽनुजगाम ह।लक्ष्मणः परमक्कृध्दः स्सुमित्रानन्दवर्धनः।।2.19.30।।
19_30.translation: Lakshmana, the enhancer of Sumitra's delight, with his eyes brimming with tears, followed him in a rage.
19_30.word_by_word: सुमित्रानन्दवर्धनः enhancer of the delight of Sumitra, लक्ष्मणः Lakshmana, परमक्कृद्धः furious, बाष्पपरिपूर्णाक्षः with eyes full of tears, तम् him, पृष्ठतः behind, अनुजगाम ह followed.

19_31.shloka: अभिषेचनिकं भाण्डं कृत्वा रामः प्रदक्षिणम्।शनैर्जगाम सापेक्षो दृष्टिं तत्राविचालयन्।।2.19.31।।
19_31.translation: Rama circumambulated the vessels meant for the consecration ceremony and steadily glancing at them with attention slowly moved away.
19_31.word_by_word: रामः Rama, अभिषेचनिकम् pertaining to consecration, भाण्डम् vessels, प्रदक्षिणम् कृत्वा having  circumambulated, सापेक्षः with attention, तत्र there, दृष्टिम् glance, अविचालयन् without moving, शनैः slowly, जगाम moved away.

19_32.shloka: न चास्य महतीं लक्ष्मीं राज्यनाशोऽपकर्षति।लोककान्तस्य कान्तत्वाच्छीतरश्मेरिव क्षपा।।2.19.32।।
19_32.translation: Rama was the beloved of the people. Loss of kingdom did not diminish his splendour just like night cannot diminish the splendour of the coolrayed Moon.
19_32.word_by_word: कान्तत्वात् because of his loveliness, लोककान्तस्य of the beloved of the people, अस्य his, महतीम् great, लक्ष्मीम् splendour, शीतरश्मेः of coolrayed (of Moon), क्षपा इव like night, राज्यनाशः loss of kingdom, न अपकर्षति did not diminish.

19_33.shloka: न वनं गन्तुकामस्य त्यजतश्च वसुन्धराम्।सर्वलोकातिगस्येव लक्ष्यते चित्तविक्रिया।।2.19.33।।
19_33.translation: Rama was determined to renounce the kingdom and go to the forest. So none could see any change in his mind. (For) he was one beyond all worldly affairs.
19_33.word_by_word: वनम् to the forest, गन्तुकामस्य having determined to go, वसुन्धराम् the earth, त्यजतश्च renouncing, सर्वलोकातिगस्येव who is beyond all worldly affairs, चित्तविक्रिया change of mind, नलक्ष्यते could not to be seen.

19_34.shloka: प्रतिषिध्य शुभं छत्रं व्यजने च स्वलङ्कृते।विसर्जयित्वा स्वजनं रथं पौरांस्तथा जनान्।।2.19.34।।धारयन् मनसा दुःखमिन्द्रियाणि निगृह्य च।प्रविवेशात्मवान्वेश्म मातुरप्रियशंसिवान्।2.19.35।।
19_34.translation: Selfpossessed Rama held back his sorrow within his mind, abandoned theauspicious umbrella, welldecorated fans and chariot, sent away kinsmen, citydwellers and others and entered his mother's residence to break the unpleasant news.
19_34.word_by_word: आत्मवान् selfpossessed, शुभम् auspicious, छत्रम् umbrella, स्वलङ्कृते welldecorated, व्यजने च also two fans, प्रतिषिध्य preventing, स्वजनम् (his) own kinsmen, रथम् chariot, तथा and, पौरान् citydwellers, जनान् people, विसर्जयित्वा sending forth, मनसा with mind, दुःखम् sorrow, धारयन् holding, इन्द्रियाणि senses, निगृह्य च having controlled, अप्रियशंसिवान् with a view to communicate the unpleasant news, मातुः mother's, वेश्म residence, प्रविवेश entered.

19_35.translation: All the glorious people around him did not observe any change in the countenance of that dignified and truthful Rama.
19_35.word_by_word: श्रीमान् glorious, सर्वः all, अभिजनः people around him, श्रीमतः of the dignified, सत्यवादिनः of the truthful, रामस्य Rama's, आनने in the countenance, किंचित् even a little, आकारम् change, नालक्षयत did not see.

19_36.translation: The mightyarmed (Rama) did not leave his habitual cheerfulness like the autumnal Moon his own brightness.
19_36.word_by_word: महाबाहुः mightyarmed, समुदीर्णांशुः with profuse radiance, शारदः autumnal, चन्द्र: the Moon, आत्मजम् his own, तेज इव like brightness, आत्मनः his own, उचितम् fitting, हर्षम् cheer, न जहौ did not leave.

19_37.shloka: वाचा मधुरया रामस्सर्वं सम्मानयञ्जनम्।मातुस्समीपं धीरात्मा प्रविवेश महायशाः।।2.19.38।।
19_37.translation: Firmminded and illustrious Rama treated all people with sweet words and approached his mother.
19_37.word_by_word: धीरात्मा firmminded, महायशाः illustrious, रामः Rama, मधुरया वाचा in sweet words, जनम् people, सम्मानयन् honouring, मातुः mother's, समीपम् presence, प्रविवेश entered.

19_38.shloka: तं गुणैस्समतां प्राप्तो भ्राता विपुलविक्रमः।सौमित्रिरनुवव्राज धारयन्दुःखमात्मजम्।।2.19.39।।
19_38.translation: Mighty Lakshmana as virtuous as his brother held the sorrow in his mind and followed him.
19_38.word_by_word: गुणैः in virtues, समतां equality, प्राप्तः obtained, विपुलविक्रमः with great power, भ्राता brother, सौमित्रिः Lakshmana, आत्मजम् born in his mind, दुःखम् sorrow, धारयन् controlling, तम् him, अनुवव्राज followed.

19_39.shloka: प्रविश्य वेश्मातिभृशं मुदाऽन्वितंसमीक्ष्य तां चार्थविपत्तिमागताम्।न चैव रामोऽत्रजगामविक्रियांसुहृज्जनस्यात्मविपत्तिशङ्कया।।2.19.40।।
19_39.translation: Rama entered  the palace which was full of great rejoicing. He did not disclose the obstruction that had come on the way of achieving his objective for fear of causing distress to his friends.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे एकोनविंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the nineteenth sarga of Ayodhyakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
19_39.word_by_word: रामः Rama, अतिभृशम् very great, मुदा rejoicing, अन्वितम् filled with, प्रविश्य having entered, वेश्म palace, आगताम् arrived, ताम he, अर्थविपत्तिम् obstruction to the objective, समीक्ष्य having seen, अत्र there, सुहृज्जनस्य for his friends, आत्मविपत्तिशङ्कया with the fear that they will be distressed, विक्रियाम् change, न चैव जगाम did not obtain.

20_1.shloka: [Rama enters to the inner apartment of his mother Kausalya--informs her of his exile to the forest--lamentations of Kausalya.]तस्मिंस्तु पुरुषव्याघ्रे निष्क्रामति कृताञ्जलौ।आर्तशब्दो महान् जज्ञे स्त्रीणामन्तःपुरे तदा।।2.20.1।।
20_1.translation: When the tiger among men (Rama) was coming out with folded palms, there arose a huge cry of distress among the ladies of the harem:
20_1.word_by_word: तदा then, पुरुषव्याघ्रे tiger among men, तस्मिन् that Rama, कृताज्ञलौ with folded palms, निष्क्रामति while (he was) leaving, अन्तःपुरे in the inner apartment, स्त्रीणाम् women's, महान्great, आर्तशब्दः cries of distress, जज्ञे arose.

20_2.shloka: कृत्येष्वचोदितः पित्रा सर्वस्यान्तःपुरस्य च।गतिर्यश्शरणं चापि स रामोऽद्य प्रवत्स्यति।।2.20.2।।
20_2.translation: Rama was the refuge and protector of all the inmates lot of the inner apartment although it was not his duty nor was he forced by his father to safeguard them. That Rama is now going on exile.
20_2.word_by_word: यः who (Rama), पित्रा by father, कृत्येषु in his duty, अचोदितः without being urged, सर्वस्य entire, अन्तः पुरस्य for the inner apartment, गतिः refuge, शरणं च (आसीत्) was protector, सः रामः that Rama, अद्य now, प्रवत्स्यति is now going on exile.

20_3.shloka: कौशल्यायां यथा युक्तो जनन्यां वर्तते सदा।तथैव वर्ततेऽस्मासु जन्मप्रभृति राघवः।।2.20.3।।
20_3.translation: Rama conducted himself towards us in the same way as he did towards his mother Kausalya right from the begining.
20_3.word_by_word: जन्मप्रभृति right from birth, राघवः Rama, जनन्याम् with regard to his mother, कौशल्यायाम् in Kausalya, सदा always, युक्तः devoted, यथा how, वर्तते is conducting himself, अस्मासु in allof us, तथैव in the same way, वर्तते is conducting.

20_4.shloka: न क्रुध्यत्यभिशप्तोऽपि क्रोधनीयानि वर्जयन्।क्रुद्धान्प्रसादयन्सर्वान् स इतोऽद्य प्रवत्स्यति।।2.20.4।।
20_4.translation: Rama who used to avoid deeds that caused anger, pacified those who were angry with him, and never lost his cool even when cursed, that Rama is going on exile today.
20_4.word_by_word: क्रोधनीयानि deeds that cause anger, वर्जयन् avoiding, क्रुद्धान् सर्वान् all cholerictempered persons, प्रसादयन् pacifying them, अभिशप्तोऽपि even cursed, न क्रुध्यति does not get angry, सः such Rama, अद्य today, इतः from here, प्रवत्स्यति is going on exile.

20_5.shloka: अबुद्धिर्बत नो राजा जीवलोकं चरत्ययम्।यो गतिं सर्वभूतानां परित्यजति राघवम्।।.2.20.5।।
20_5.translation: Alas our king who has lost his brain, who has ordered the banishment of Rama, the refuge of all living beings, (on the other hand) is moving about in the world.
20_5.word_by_word: बत alas यः who (Dasaratha), सर्वभूतानाम् of all beings, गतिम् who is the refuge, राघवम् to the son of the Raghus (Rama), परित्यजति is abandoning, अयम् this, नः राजा our king, अबुद्धि: devoid of intellect, जीवलोकम् in the world of living beings, चरति moving.

20_6.shloka: इति सर्वा महिष्यस्ता विवत्सा इव धेनवः।पतिमाचुक्रुशुश्चैव सस्वरं चापि चुक्रुशुः।।2.20.6।।
20_6.translation: Thus all the queens like calfless cows cried loudly blaming their husband.
20_6.word_by_word: इति thus, सर्वाः all, ताः महिष्यः the king's wives, विवत्साः calfless, धेनवः इव like cows, सस्वरम् loudly, चुक्रुशुः च अपि cried and also, पतिम् husband, अचुक्रुशुश्च एव blamed also.

20_7.shloka: स हि चान्तःपुरे घोरमार्तशब्दं महीपतिः।पुत्रशोकाभिसन्तप्तः श्रुत्वा व्यालीयताऽसने।।2.20.7।।
20_7.translation: Tormented with grief on account of his son, the king sank in his seat on hearing the cries of distress from the inner apartment
20_7.word_by_word: सः महीपतिः that lord of the earth (king), अन्तःपुरे in the harem, घोरम् painful, आर्तशब्दम् cries of distress, श्रुत्वा having heard, पुत्र शोकाभिसन्तप्तः tormented with grief on account of his son, आसने in his seat, व्यालीयत sank down.

20_8.shloka: रामस्तु भृशमायस्तो निश्श्वसन्निव कुञ्जरः।जगाम सहितो भ्रात्रा मातुरन्तःपुरं वशी।।2.20.8।।
20_8.translation: Deeply pained yet selfpossessed Rama, heaving sighs like an elephant went towards the inner apartment of his mother along with his brother.
20_8.word_by_word: वशी having selfcontrol, रामस्तु Rama however, भृशम् highly, आयस्तः troubled, कुञ्जरः इव like an elephant, निःश्वसन् heaving sighs, भ्रात्रा brother, सहितः together with, मातुः mother's, अन्तःपुरम् towards inner apartment, जगाम went.

20_9.shloka: सोऽपश्यत्पुरुषं तत्र वृद्धं परमपूजितम्।उपविष्टं गृहद्वारि तिष्ठतश्चापरान्बहून्।।2.20.9।।
20_9.translation: Rama beheld a highly venerable elderly man seated at the entrance of the residence and many others standing (nearby).
20_9.word_by_word: सः he, तत्र there, गृहद्वारि at the entrance of the residence, उपविष्टम् seated, परमपूजितम् highly venerable, वृद्धं पुरुषम् aged man, तिष्ठतः standing, बहून् many, अपरांश्च others, अपश्यत् beheld.

20_10.shloka: दृष्ट्वैव तु तदा रामं ते सर्वे सहसोत्थिताः।जयेन जयतां श्रेष्ठं वर्धयन्ति स्म राघवम्।।2.20.10।।
20_10.translation: On seeing Rama, all the eminent among the victors got up immediately and greeted him, saying, 'Victory to you'.
20_10.word_by_word: तदा then, रामम् Rama, दृष्ट्वैव on seeing, ते सर्वे all of them, सहसा immediately, उत्थिताः stood up, जयताम् among victors, श्रेष्ठम् best, राघवम् to the scion of the Raghu dynasty (Rama), जयेन with victory, वर्धयन्ति स्म caused prosperity.

20_11.translation: With the first courtyard crossed, Rama saw in the second aged brahmins versed in the Vedas, and duly honoured by the king.
20_11.word_by_word: सः he (Rama), प्रथमां कक्ष्याम् first courtyard, प्रविश्य having entered, द्वितीयायाम् in the second courtyard, वेदसम्पन्नान् learned in the Vedas, राज्ञा by the king, अभिसत्कृतान् wellhonoured, वृद्धान् aged, ब्राह्मणान् brahmins, ददर्श saw.

20_12.shloka: प्रणम्य रामस्तान्विप्रांस्तृतीयायां ददर्श सः।स्त्रियो वृद्धास्तथा बाला द्वाररक्षणतत्पराः।।2.20.12।।
20_12.translation: Rama wished the brahmins and saw old men, women and children vigilantly guarding the door in the third courtyard.
20_12.word_by_word: सः राम that Rama, तान् विप्रान् those brahmins, प्रणम्य having paid obeisance, तृतीयायाम् in the third courtyard, द्वाररक्षणतत्पराः vigilantly guarding the door, स्त्रियः women, वृद्धा: the old, तथा as also, बालाः young children, ददर्श saw.

20_13.shloka: वर्धयित्वा प्रहृष्टास्ताः प्रविश्य च गृहं स्त्रियः।न्यवेदयन्त त्वरिता राममातुः प्रियं तदा।।2.20.13।।
20_13.translation: Wellpleased, the women then greeted him wishing prosperity. They hurried into the abode of Kausalya and gave her the happy news (of Rama's arrival).
20_13.word_by_word: तदा then, ताः those, स्त्रियः women, प्रहृष्टाः were very pleased, वर्धयित्वा greeting him with   words wishing prosperity, त्वरिताः in great haste, गृहम् in the apartment, प्रविश्य having entered, राममातुः Rama's mother, (Kausalya), प्रियम् pleasant (tidings), न्यवेदयन्त informed.

20_14.shloka: कौशल्यापि तदा देवी रात्रिं स्थित्वा समाहिता।प्रभाते त्वकरोत्पूजां विष्णोः पुत्रहितैषिणी।।2.20.14।।
20_14.translation: Having spent the night with a composed mind (abosorbed in meditation), Kausalya was worshipping lord Visnu in the early morning to secure her son's welfare.
20_14.word_by_word: तदा then, कौशल्या Kausalya, रात्रिम् night, समाहिता with composed mind, स्थित्वा remaining (in meditation), प्रभाते in the early morning, पुत्रहितैषिणी to secure her son's welfare, विष्णोः Visnu's, पूजाम् worship, अकरोत् performed.

20_15.shloka: सा क्षौमवसना हृष्टा नित्यं व्रतपरायणा।अग्निं जुहोति स्म तदा मन्त्रवत्कृतमङ्गला।।2.20.15।।
20_15.translation: Always engaged in the observance of vows, Kausalya (then) clad in silk cloth was performing rituals of auspiciousness, offering oblations to the firegod in accordance with mantras (Vedic hymns).
20_15.word_by_word: नित्यम् always, व्रतपरायणा devoted to performing vows, सा she, क्षौमवसना clad in silk cloth, हृष्टा in delight, कृतमङ्गला having performed the rituals of auspiciousness, मन्त्रवत् in accordance with mantras, अग्निं fire, जुहोति स्म offered oblations.

20_16.shloka: प्रविश्य च तदा रामो मातुरन्त:पुरं शुभम्।ददर्श मातरं तत्र हावयन्तीं हुताशनम्।।2.20.16।।
20_16.translation: Rama entered the auspicious inner apartment of his mother and saw her exhorting the priests to offer sacrificial oblations to Agni (firegod).
20_16.word_by_word: तदा then, रामः Rama, शुभम् auspicious, मातु: अन्तःपुरम् inner apartment of his mother, प्रविश्य having entered, तत्र there, हुताशनम् to Agni, हावयन्तीम् exhorting the priests to offer sacrificial oblations, मातरम् to mother, ददर्श saw.

20_17.shloka: देवकार्यनिमित्तं च तत्रापश्यत्समुद्यतम्।दध्यक्षतं घृतं चैव मोदकान्हविषस्तथा।।2.20.17।।लाजान्माल्यानि शुक्लानि पायसं कृसरं तथा।समिध: पूर्णकुम्भांश्च ददर्श रघुनन्दनः।।2.20.18।।
20_17.translation: There Rama saw  curd, grains of rice, clarified butter, sweetmeats, oblations, parched grain, white garlands, porridge of cooked rice mixed with sesame seeds, sacrirficial faggots, vessels filled with water, etc. kept ready for religious rites.
20_17.word_by_word: रघुनन्दनः scion of the Raghus or delight of the Raghu race (Rama), तत्र there, देवकार्यनिमित्तम् on account of religious acts, समुद्यतम् (things) kept ready, अपश्यत् saw, दध्यक्षतम् curd, grains of rice (smeared with turmeric), घृतं चैव also clarified butter, मोदकान् sweetmeats, तथा as also, हविषः oblations, लाजान् parched grain, शुक्लानि white, माल्यानि garlands of flowers, पायसम् porridge, कृसरम् sesame seeds mixed with cooked rice, समिधः sacrirficial faggots, पूर्णकुम्भान् vessels filled with water, ददर्श saw.

20_18.shloka: तां शुक्लक्षौमसंवीतां व्रतयोगेन कर्शिताम्।तर्पयन्तीं ददर्शाद्भिर्देवतां देववर्णिनीम्।।2.20.19।।
20_18.translation: Kausalya, emaciated due to observance of vows and clad in white silk looked like a celestial being. She was engaged in offering libations to the deities.
20_18.word_by_word: शुक्लक्षौमसंवीताम् wearing white silk, व्रतयोगेन due to observance of vows, कर्शिताम् emaciated, देववर्णिनीम् having divine complexion, अद्भिः with water, देवताम् to deities, तर्पयन्तीम् engaged in propitiating, ताम् her (Kausalya), ददर्श beheld.

20_19.shloka: सा चिरस्यात्मजं दृष्ट्वा मातृनन्दनमागतम्।अभिचक्राम संहृष्टा किशोरं बडबा यथा।।2.20.20।।
20_19.translation: Seeing her son who had come after a long time and who is a source of joy to hismother, Kausalya approached him with great delight like a mare to her young calf.
20_19.word_by_word: सा she, चिरस्य after a long time, आगतम् arrived, मातृनन्दनम् delight to mother, आत्मजम् her son, दृष्ट्वा having seen, संहृष्टा in great delight, बडबा mare, किशोरं यथा like its offspring, अभिचक्राम went towards him.

20_20.translation: The scion of the Raghus saw his mother coming and bowed her. She held him in both her arms and kissed his forehead.
20_20.word_by_word: सः राघवः that scion of the Raghus (Rama), अभिक्रान्ताम् who had come to him, मातरम् mother, उपसंगृह्य with respectful salutations, बाहुभ्याम् with both arms, परिष्वक्तः was embraced, मूर्धनि on his forehead, उपाघ्रातश्च was kissed.

20_21.shloka: तमुवाच दुराधर्षं राघवं सुतमात्मनः।कौशल्या पुत्रवात्सल्यादिदं प्रियहितं वचः।।2.20.22।।
20_21.translation: Out of love for her son, the invincible scion of the Raghu dynasty, Kausalya spoke with gentle and pleasant words:
20_21.word_by_word: कौशल्या Kausalya, दुराधर्षम् invincible, आत्मनः her own, सुतम् son, तं राघवम् that Rama, पुत्रवात्सल्यात् out of filial affection, प्रियहितम् pleasant and beneficial, इदम् these, वचः words, उवाच spoke.

20_22.shloka: वृद्धानां धर्मशीलानां राजर्षीणां महात्मनाम्।प्राप्नुह्यायुश्च कीर्तिं च धर्मं चोपहितं कुले।।2.20.23।।
20_22.translation: May you attain long life and fame like those of the aged, virtuous and great rajarsis  who upheld the righteousness in the race.
20_22.word_by_word: वृद्धानाम् of the aged, धर्मशीलानाम् of the virtuous, महात्मनाम् great, राजर्षीणाम् of the rajarsis, आयुश्च long life, कीर्तिं च fame, कुले in the race, उपहितम् maintained over a long time, धर्मं च righteousness, प्राप्नु हि you may attain.

20_23.shloka: सत्यप्रतिज्ञं पितरं राजानं पश्य राघव।अद्यैव हि त्वां धर्मात्मा यौवराज्येऽभिषेक्ष्यति।।2.20.24।।
20_23.translation: O scion of the Raghu race see the king, your righteous and truthful father, who will consecrate you as princeregent today itself.
20_23.word_by_word: राघव scion of the Raghu dynasty (Rama), सत्यप्रतिज्ञम् true to his promise, पितरम् your father, राजानम् king, पश्य see, धर्मात्मा righteous one, त्वाम् you, अद्यैव today, यौवराज्ये as heirapparent, अभिषेक्ष्यति will coronate you.

20_24.translation: Invited (by Kausalya) to partake the food, Rama out of abashment only touched the seat provided to him and having stretched his folded palms spoke to his mother.
20_24.word_by_word: भोजनेन with food, निमन्त्रितः a man invited, राघवः Rama, दत्तम् provided, आसनम् seat, आलभ्य having touched, व्रोडात् out of shame, किञ्चित् a little, अञ्जलिम् with folded hands, प्रसार्य having stretched, मातरम् to mother, अब्रवीत् said.

20_25.shloka: स स्वभावविनीतश्च गौरवाच्च तदा नतः।प्रस्थितो दण्डकारण्यमाप्रष्टुमुपचक्रमे।।2.20.26।।
20_25.translation: Modest by nature, Rama with respectful humility began seeking her permission for his departure to Dandaka forest:
20_25.word_by_word: स्वभावविनीतश्च by nature modest, तदा then, गौरवात् out of reverence (for his mother), नतः च humble also, सः he, दण्डकारण्यम् to Dandaka forest, प्रस्थितः for his departure, अप्रष्टुम् to seek her permission, उपचक्रमे commenced.

20_26.shloka: देवि नूनं न जानीषे महद्भयमुपस्थितम्।इदं तव च दुःखाय वैदेह्या लक्ष्मणस्य च।।2.20.27।।
20_26.translation: O mother surely you do not know that a great misfortune has befallen, causing distress to you, Sita and Lakshmana, too.
20_26.word_by_word: देवि O Devi, नूनम् certainly, उपस्थितम् has befallen, महत् great, भयम् misfortune, न जानीषे you do not know, इदम् this one, तव च to you, वैदेह्याः of Sita, लक्ष्मणस्य च of Lakshmana also, दुःखाय for distress.

20_27.shloka: गमिष्ये दण्डकारण्यं किमनेनासनेन मे।विष्टरासनयोग्यो हि कालोऽयं मामुपस्थितः।।2.20.28।।
20_27.translation: I am setting forth to Dandaka forest.  What is this seat for? A time has come for me when I am fit for a seat of kusa grass.
20_27.word_by_word: दण्डकारण्यम् to Dandaka forest, गमिष्ये setting forth, मे for me, अनेन आसनेन with this seat, किम् what is the purpose, विष्टरासनयोग्यः worthy of a mat made of kusa grass, अयम् this, कालः time, मम for me, उपस्थितः has come.

20_28.shloka: चतुर्दश हि वर्षाणि वत्स्यामि विजने वने।मधुमूलफलैर्जीवन्हित्वा मुनिवदामिषम्।।2.20.29।।
20_28.translation: Abstaining from eating meat like hermits and living on honey, fruits and roots, I am to live in the solitary forest for fourteen years.
20_28.word_by_word: अमिषम् all meat, हित्वा abstaining, मुनिवत् like a hermit, मधुमूलफलैः honey, fruits and roots, जीवन् while living on, चतुर्दश fourteen, वर्षाणि years, विजने in a solitary, वने in the forest, वत्स्यामि am to dwell.

20_29.shloka: भरताय महाराजो यौवराज्यं प्रयच्छति।मां पुनर्दण्डकारण्ये विवासयति तापसम्।।2.20.30।।
20_29.translation: The great king is conferring the status of heirapparent on Bharata while he is banishing me to Dandaka forest to live like an ascetic.
20_29.word_by_word: महाराजः great king, भरताय to Bharata, यौवराज्यम् status of heirapparent, प्रयच्छति is conferring, मां पुनः for me again, तापसम् like an ascetic, दण्डकारण्ये in Dandaka forest, विवासयति  sending in exile.

20_30.shloka: स षट्चाष्टौ च वर्षाणि वत्स्यामि विजने वने।आसेवमानो वन्यानि फलमूलैश्च वर्तयन्।।2.20.31।।
20_30.translation: Living on things available in the forest, on fruits and roots, I am to dwell in the uninhabited jungle for fourteen years.
20_30.word_by_word: सः that (I am), वन्यानि forest products, आसेवमानः eating, फलमूलैः fruits and roots, वर्तयन् while living, षट्चाष्टौ च six and eight (fourteen), वर्षाणि years, विजने वने in the desolate forest, वत्स्यामि shall dwell.

20_31.shloka: सा निकृत्तेव सालस्य यष्टिः परशुना वने।पपात सहसा देवी देवतेव दिवश्च्युता।।2.20.32।।
20_31.translation: All on a sidden Kausalya fell down on the ground like the branch of a sal tree in the forest severed by an axe, like a goddess dropped from heaven.
20_31.word_by_word: सा देवी that Kausalya, परशुना with an axe, वने in the forest, निकृत्ता severed, सालस्य sal tree's, यष्टिः इव like a stick (branch), दिवः from heaven, च्युता fallen down, देवतेव like a celestial, सहसा suddenly, पपात fell down.

20_32.shloka: तामदुःखोचितां दृष्ट्वा पतितां कदलीमिव।रामस्तूत्थापयामास मातरं गतचेतसम्।।2.20.33।।
20_32.translation: Seeing his mother who had done nothing to deserve (this) suffering and who had fallen down like a plantain tree, deprived of her senses, Rama raised her up (from the ground).
20_32.word_by_word: अदुःखोचिताम् who does not deserve sorrow, पतिताम् fallen on the ground, कदलीमिव like aplantain tree, गतचेतसम् deprived of her senses, तां मातरम् to that mother, दृष्ट्वा having seen, रामः Rama, उत्थापयामास lifted her up.

20_33.shloka: उपावृत्त्योत्थितां दीनां बडबामिव वाहिताम्।पांसुकुण्ठितसर्वाङ्गीं विममर्श च पाणिना।।2.20.34।।
20_33.translation: Rama gently wiped away the dust that had covered her body as Kausalya stood miserable, like a mare who stands up after having rolled on the ground while pulling the load.
20_33.word_by_word: उपावृत्त्य rolled on the ground, उत्थिताम् arisen, वाहिताम् for drawing (heavy burden), बडबामिव like a mare, दीनाम् miserable, पांसुकुण्ठितसर्वाङ्गीम् all her body covered with dust, पाणिना  with the hand, विममर्श caressed (wiped away).

20_34.translation: Kausalya who deserved happiness yet was struck down by (this) distress spoke to Rama, the tiger among men who was sitting nearby, while Lakshmana was listening.
20_34.word_by_word: असुखार्ता struck by lack of happiness, सुखोचिता deserving happiness, सा she Kausalya, लक्ष्मणे in Lakshmana, उपशृण्वति while listening, उपासीनम् sitting nearby, पुरुषव्याघ्रम् to the tiger (the best) among men, राघवम् to Rama, उवाच said.

20_35.shloka: यदि पुत्र न जायेथा मम शोकाय राघव।न स्म दुःखमतो भूयः पश्येयमहमप्रजाः।।2.20.36।।
20_35.translation: O my son, if you were not born to me, I, even as a woman without  progeny, would not have experienced grief, more intense than this.
20_35.word_by_word: पुत्र O my son, राघव Rama, मम to me, शोकाय to cause sorrow, न जायेथाः यदि if you werenot born, अहम् I, अप्रजाः without progeny, अतः more than this, भूयः greater, दुःखम् sorrow, न स्म पश्येयम् would not have seen.

20_36.shloka: एक एव हि वन्ध्याया श्शोको भवति मानसः।अप्रजाऽस्मीति सन्तापो न ह्यन्यः पुत्र विद्यते।।2.20.37।।
20_36.translation: O my son a barren woman has only one mental agony that she has no progeny.  Except that she does not have any other sorrow.
20_36.word_by_word: पुत्र O my son, वन्ध्यायाः for a barren woman, अप्रजाः issueless, अस्मि I am, इति thus, मानसः in mind, एकः one, शोकः affliction, भवति हि surely happens, अन्यः any other, सन्तापः sorrow, न विद्यते हि does not exist.

20_37.shloka: न दृष्टपूर्वं कल्याणं सुखं वा पतिपौरुषे।अपि पुत्रे ऽपि पश्येयमिति रामाऽस्थितं मया।।2.20.38।।
20_37.translation: I did not have the fortune, O Rama, to enjoy any auspicious moment or pleasure earlier when my husband was in authority. I exist with the hope that I will have it when my son assumes authority.
20_37.word_by_word: राम O Rama, पतिपौरुषे when my husband was exercising authority, कल्याणम् auspicious moment, सुखं वा or pleasure, न दृष्टपूर्वम् was not seen earlier, पुत्रेऽपि in son, पश्येयम् can Isee, इति thus, मया by me, आस्थितम् life is sustained.

20_38.shloka: सा बहून्यमनोज्ञानि वाक्यानि हृदयच्छिदाम्।अहं श्रोष्ये सपत्नीनामवराणां वरा सती।।2.20.39।।
20_38.translation: I, being the eldest (of the queens) will have to listen to many heartbreaking and unpleasant words from my fellowwives who are younger to me.
20_38.word_by_word: सा अहम् such am I वरा सती being the eldest (of the queens), अवराणाम् by the younger ones, हृदयच्छिदाम् heartbreaking, सपत्नीनाम् cowives, अमनोज्ञानि unpleasant, बहूनि many,वाक्यानि words, श्रोष्ये will have to listen.

20_39.shloka: अतो दुःखतरं किं नु प्रमदानां भविष्यति।मम शोको विलापश्च यादृशोऽयमनन्तकः।।2.20.40।।
20_39.translation: There cannnot be greater distress for any woman than such unending grief and lamentation (which I am now experiencing).
20_39.word_by_word: मम to me, अनन्तकः unending, यादृश: शोकः such sorrow, विलापश्च lamentation, अतः now, प्रमदानाम् for women, दुःखतरम् more distress, किं नु भविष्यति  what else can be there?

20_40.shloka: त्वयि सन्निहितेऽप्येवमहमासं निराकृता।किं पुनः प्रोषिते तात ध्रुवं मरणमेव मे।।2.20.41।।
20_40.translation: O child even when you are nearby I am neglected like this. What to say when you are banished. Death is certain to me.
20_40.word_by_word: तात O child, त्वयि you, सन्निहितेऽपि even when you are nearby, अहम् I, एवम् in this way, निराकृता आसम् I am rejected, प्रोषिते when you are banished, किं पुनः what to say again, मे  for me, मरणम् death, ध्रुवम् is certain.

20_41.translation: Treating me as an equal or inferior to the attendants of Kaikeyi and making mealways dependent, my husband has greatly suppressed me.
20_41.word_by_word: कैकेय्याः of Kaikeyi's, परिवारेण attendants, समा वा equal to, अथवा or, अवरा inferior, अतन्त्रिता  without independence, नित्यम् always, भर्तुः by husband, अत्यन्तनिगृहीता अस्मि am greatly repressed.

20_42.shloka: योऽहि मां सेवते कश्चिदथवाप्यनुवर्तते।कैकेय्याः पुत्रमन्वीक्ष्य स्वश्चि जनो नाभिभाषते।।2.20.43।।
20_42.translation: Any one who serves me or follows me will not talk to me after seeing Bharata (installed as heirapparent).
20_42.word_by_word: यः whoever, कश्चित् any one, माम् me, सेवते serving, अथवा or, अनुवर्तते following me, सः जनः such person, कैकेय्याः Kaikeyi's, पुत्रम् son, अन्वीक्ष्य having seen, नाभिभाषते हि will not talk to me.

20_43.shloka: नित्यक्रोधतया तस्याः कथं नु खरवादितत्।कैकेय्या वदनं द्रष्टुं पुत्र शक्ष्यामि दुर्गता।।2.20.44।।
20_43.translation: Fallen into an unfortunate state how can I look at Kaikeyi's face who is always harsh and in temper?
20_43.word_by_word: पुत्र O son, दुर्गता fallen into a bad state, नित्यक्रोधतया due to being always in temper, खरवादि speaking harsh words, तस्याः कैकेय्याः that Kaikeyi's, तत्वदनम् that face, द्रष्टुम् to look at, कथं नु how, शक्ष्यामि will be able?

20_44.shloka: दश सप्त च वर्षाणि जातस्य तव राघवअतितानि प्रकाङ्क्षन्त्या मया दुःखपरिक्षयम्।।2.20.45।।
20_44.translation: O Rama, I have spent the last seventeen years after your birth with the expectaion that my sorrows would come to an end.
20_44.word_by_word: राघव Rama, तव जातस्य after you were (re) born (after your investiture with the sacred thread regarded as second birth), दश सप्त च ten and seven (seventeen), वर्षाणि years, दुःखपरिक्षयम् end of my sorrows, प्रकाङ्क्षन्त्या longing, मया by me, अतितानि have been spent.

20_45.shloka: तदक्षयं महद्दुःखं नोत्सहे सहितुं चिरम्।विप्रकारं सपत्नीनामेवं जीर्णाऽपि राघव।।2.20.46।।
20_45.translation: Therefore, O Rama, I cannot at this old age endure this great, endless sorrow and the insults from cowives for long.
20_45.word_by_word: राघव Rama, तत् for that reason, एवम् like this, जीर्णापि grown old, अक्षयम् unending, महत् great, दुःखम् sorrow, सपत्नीनाम् of my cowives, विप्रकारम् insult, चिरम् for long time, सहितुम् to tolerate, नोत्सहे do not desire.

20_46.shloka: अपश्यन्ती तव मुखं परिपूर्णशशिप्रभम्।कृपणा वर्तयिष्यामि कथं कृपणजीविकाम्।।2.20.47।।
20_46.translation: Without beholding your face that is as bright as the full Moon, how can this wretched woman live this pitiable life?
20_46.word_by_word: कृपणा wretched I am, तव your, परिपूर्णशशिप्रभम् as bright as the full Moon, मुखम् face, अपश्यन्ती without beholding, कृपणजीविकाम् pitiable means of existence, कथम् how, वर्तयिष्यामि will live.

20_47.shloka: उपवासैश्च योगैश्च बहुभिश्च परिश्रमैः।दुःखं संवर्धितो मोघं त्वं हि दुर्गतया मया।।2.20.48।।
20_47.translation: Through meditation, through fasts and with a great deal of efforts you have been brought up by this luckless (mother). But alas this is all in vain.
20_47.word_by_word: त्वम् you, दुर्गतया मया by me so unfortunate, उपवासैश्च through fasts, योगैश्च through meditation, बहुभिः many, परिश्रमैश्च with efforts, दुःखम् with difficulty, मोघम् in vain, संवर्धितः have been brought up.

20_48.shloka: स्थिरं तु हृदयं मन्ये ममेदं यन्न दीर्यते।प्रावृषीव महानद्या स्पृष्टं कूलं नवाम्भसा।।2.20.49।।
20_48.translation: I think my heart must be very firm (hard) like the bark of a great river which, touched by (a flood of) fresh water in the rainy season does not disintegrate.
20_48.word_by_word: प्रावृषि in rainy season, नवाम्भसा with fresh water, स्पृष्टम् contacted, महानद्याः mighty river's, कूलम् इव like bank, मम my, इदम् this, हृदयम् heart, यत् for which reason, न दीर्यते does not break, स्थिरम् firm (hard), मन्ये am thinking.

20_49.shloka: ममैव नूनं मरणं न विद्यतेन चावकाऽशोस्ति यमक्षयेऽमम।यदन्तकोऽद्यैव न मां जिहीर्षति।प्रसह्य सिंहो रुदतीं मृगीमिव।।2.20.50।।
20_49.translation: There is no room for me in the abode of Yama (the god of death). If he does notcarry me off forcibly like a lion carrying away a crying female deer, certainly there is no death for me.
20_49.word_by_word: सिंहः lion, रुदतीम् crying, मृगीमिव like a female deer, माम् myself, अन्तकः Yama, (the god of death), प्रसह्य forcibly, अद्यैव now itself, यत् since, न जिहीर्षति is not willing to carry, मम to me, नूनम् certainly, मरणम् death, न विद्यते does not befall, मम for me, यमक्षये in the abode of (the god of death), Yama, अवकाशः opportunity, नास्ति not there.

20_50.shloka: स्थिरं हि नूनं हृदयं ममायसंन भिद्यते यद्भुवि नावदीर्यते।अनेन दुःखेन च देहमर्पितंध्रुवं ह्यकाले मरणं न विद्यते।।2.20.51।।
20_50.translation: Surely my still (hard) heart is made of iron. It neither bursts nor breaks down on the ground. Pervaded by grief, there is no untimely death for this my body, too.
20_50.word_by_word: नूनम् assuredly, मम my, स्थिरम् still (hard), हृदयम् heart, आयसम् is made of iron, यत् since, न भिद्यते is not breaking, भुवि on this earth, नावदीर्यते does not disintegrate, अनेन this, दुःखेन due to sorrow, देहम् body, अर्पितम् surrendered (pervaded), अकाले untimely, मरणम् death, न विद्यते may not be possible, ध्रुवम् this is certain.

20_51.shloka: इदं हि दुःखं यदनर्थकानि मेव्रतानि दानानि च संयमाश्च हि।तपश्च तप्तं यदपत्यकारणात्सुनिष्फलं बीजमिवोप्तमूषरे।।2.20.52।।
20_51.translation: My regret is that all my mortifications, gifts of charity and penances are of no avail. Even the asceticism which I practised for the sake of progeny was fruitless like a seed sown in a barren land.
20_51.word_by_word: मे my, व्रतानि mortifications, दानानि च charitable gifts, संयमाश्च selfrestraint, अनर्थकानीति यत् are all meaningless, इदम् this, दुःखम् regret, अपत्यकारणात् for the sake of progeny, तप्तम् practised, यत् which, तपः asceticism, ऊषरे in a barren land, उप्तम् sown, बीजम् इव like a seed, सुनिष्फलम् was fruitless.

20_52.shloka: यदि ह्यकाले मरणं स्वयेच्छयालभेत कश्चिद्गुरुदुःखकर्शितः।गताहमद्यैव परेतसंसदंविना त्वया धेनुरिवात्मजेन वै।।2.20.53।।
20_52.translation: If any one, tormented with great sorrow, could willingly commit suicide I would have gone the way to the assembly of Yama (the lord of death) right away as without you I will be now like a cow without a calf.
20_52.word_by_word: कश्चित् any one, गुरुदुःखकर्शितः tormented with deep grief, स्वया of one's own, इच्छया by free will, अकाले untimely, मरणम् death, लभेत यदि if he gets, अहम् I, अद्यैव now itself, आत्मजेन विना without offspring, धेनुरिव like a cow, त्वया विना without you, परेतसंसदम् to theassembly of Yama, गता would have reached.

20_53.shloka: अथापि किं जीवितमद्य मे वृथात्वया विना चन्द्रनिभाननप्रभ।अनुव्रजिष्यामि वनं त्वयैव गौस्सुदुर्बला वत्समिवानुकाङ्क्षया।।2.20.54।।
20_53.translation: What is the use of this life now? What is life without you whose countenance glows like the full Moon? Like a cow emaciated by its search for the calf, I will follow you into the forest.
20_53.word_by_word: अथापि even then, चन्द्रनिभाननप्रभ one having a countenance resembling the splendour of the full Moon, त्वया विना without you, मे my, जीवितम् life, अद्य today, किम् what use, वृथा fruitless, सुदुर्बला  enfeebled, गौः cow, वत्सम् इव like a calf, अनुकाङ्क्षया in its affection, त्वयैव with you alone, अद्य now, वनम् to the forest, अनुव्रजिष्यामि shall follow.

20_54.shloka: भृशमसुखममर्षिता तदाबहु विललाप समीक्ष्य राघवम्।व्यसनमुपनिशम्य सा महत्सुतमिव बद्धमवेक्ष्य किन्नरी।।2.20.55।।
20_54.translation: Kausalya, filled with anger due to extreme sorrow reflected over her misfortune, and burst into harrowing tears, looking at Rama, like a kinnari looking at her grownup son taken captive.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे विंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the twentieth sarga of Ayodhyakanda of the the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
20_54.word_by_word: सा that (Kausalya), राघवम् Rama, समीक्ष्य having seen, महत् great, व्यसनम् misfortune, उपनिशम्य having heard, बद्धम् is made captive, सुतम् son, अवेक्ष्य looking on, किन्नरीव like a kinnari, तदा then, असुखम् unhappy, अमर्षिता wrathful, भृशम् extremely, बहु much, विललाप lamented.

21_1.shloka: [ Angry Lakshmana urges Rama to assume authority over the kingdom forcibly--Rama convinces Kausalya and Lakshmana to allow him to obey the command of his father.]तथा तु विलपन्तीं तां कौसल्यां राममातरम्।उवाच लक्ष्मणो दीनस्तत्कालसदृशं वचः।।2.21.1।।
21_1.translation: While Rama's mother, Kausalya was lamenting, miserable Lakshmana said to her these words appropriate to the occasion:
21_1.word_by_word: लक्ष्मणः Lakshmana, दीनः miserable, तथा thus, विलपन्तीम् lamenting, राममातरम् Rama's mother, तां कौशल्याम् to that Kausalya, तत्कालसदृशम् befitting to the occasion, वचः words, उवाच said.

21_2.shloka: न रोचते ममाप्येतदार्ये यद्राघवो वनम्।त्यक्त्वा राज्यश्रियं गच्छेत् स्त्रिया वाक्यवशं गतः।।2.21.2।।
21_2.translation: O venerable one, I do not like that Rama should go to the forest yielding to thewords of a woman and renouncing the welfare of the kingdom.
21_2.word_by_word: आर्ये O venerable one, राघवः Rama, स्त्रियाः a woman's, वाक्यवशं गतः yielding to the words, राज्यश्रियम् the welfare of the kingdom, त्यक्त्वा renouncing, वनम् to the forest, गच्छेत् (इति) यत् should go , एतत् all this, ममापि to me also, न रोचते is not pleasing.

21_3.shloka: विपरीतश्च वृद्धश्च विषयैश्च प्रधर्षितः।नृपः किमिव न ब्रूयाच्चोद्यमानस्समन्मथः।।2.21.3।।
21_3.translation: The king  has a perverse nature. He is aged. He is overpowered by passions. He is under the spell of carnal pleasures and is incited (by Kaikeyi). Such a man can speak anything.
21_3.word_by_word: विपरीतश्च man of perverse nature, वृद्धश्च aged also, विषयैः by carnal pleasures, प्रधर्षितः च  struck, समन्मथः ruled by passion, नृपः king, चोद्यमानः incited by (Kaikeyi), किमिव whatever words, न ब्रूयात् not speak.

21_4.shloka: नास्यापराधं पश्यामि नापि दोषं तथाविधम्।येन निर्वास्यते राष्ट्राद्वनवासाय राघवः।।2.21.4।।
21_4.translation: I do not see any fault in Rama nor any offence committed by him for which he is exiled from the kingdom.
21_4.word_by_word: राघवः Rama, येन for which, राष्ट्रात् from the kingdom, वनवासाय to dwell in the forest, निर्वास्यते is  banished, तथाविधम् such, अस्य his, अपराधं offence, न पश्यामि do not see, दोषम् अपि fault also, न not.

21_5.shloka: न तं पश्याम्यहं लोके परोक्षमपि यो नरः।स्वमित्रोऽपि निरस्तोऽपि योऽस्य दोषमुदाहरेत्।।2.21.5।।
21_5.translation: I do not find anybody in this world, even an adversary or one defeated, who finds fault with him even in his absence.
21_5.word_by_word: स्वमित्रोऽपि even an adversary, निरस्तोऽपि or the defeated, यः नरः any man, परोक्षमपि in his absence also, अस्य his, दोषम् fault, उदाहरेत् can cite, तम् him, अहम् I, लोके in this  world, न पश्यामि do not find.

21_6.shloka: देवकल्पमृजुं दान्तं रिपूणामपि वत्सलम्।अवेक्षमाणः को धर्मं त्यजेत्पुत्रमकारणात्।।2.21.6।।
21_6.translation: With no cause nor concern for righteousness, will any one abandon his son who is nearly equal to god, upright, selfrestrained and loved even by his enemies ?
21_6.word_by_word: धर्मम् righteousness, अवेक्षमाणः without caring, कः who, देवकल्पम् equal to god, ऋजुम्  upright, दान्तम् with subdued passions, रिपूणामपि even for his enemies, वत्सलम् a loved man, पुत्रम् son, अकारणात् without any cause, त्यजेत् will abandon.

21_7.shloka: तदिदं वचनं राज्ञःपुनर्बाल्यमुपेयुषः।पुत्रः को हृदये कुर्याद्राजवृत्तमनुस्मरन्।।2.21.7।।
21_7.translation: Will any son with the ideals of a king in mind accept such words of this king who has entered his chilhood again ?
21_7.word_by_word: राजवृत्तम् leading the life of a king, अनुस्मरन् remembering, कः पुत्रः which son, पुनः again, बाल्यम् childhood, उपेयुषः regained, राज्ञः king's, तत् इदं वचनम् that such words, हृदये in the heart, कुर्यात् will accept?

21_8.shloka: यावदेव न जानाति कश्चिदर्थमिमं नरः।तावदेव मया सार्धमात्मस्थं कुरु शासनम्।।2.21.8।।
21_8.translation: Before this news is known to any one bring the kingdom under your control with my assistance.
21_8.word_by_word: कश्चित् any one, नरः man, इमम् अर्थम् this information, यावदेव until, न जानाति does not come to know, तावदेव before that period, मया साधे with my assistance, शासनम् authority (over the kingdom ), आत्मस्थम् under your control, कुरु do (assume).

21_9.shloka: मया पार्श्वे सधनुषा तव गुप्तस्य राघव।क स्समर्थोऽधिकं कर्तुं कृतान्तस्येव तिष्ठतः।।2.21.9।।
21_9.translation: O Rama who can commit excesses on you, when you stand like  Yama, god of death, protected by me with my bow?
21_9.word_by_word: राघव O Rama, पार्श्वे by your side, स धनुषा with bow, मया by me, गुप्तस्य protected, कृतान्तस्येव like Yama, (god of death), तिष्ठतः (yourself) standing, अधिकम् excess, कर्तुं to challenge, कः who, समर्थः is able?

21_10.shloka: निर्मनुष्यामिमां कृत्स्नामयोध्यां मनुजर्षभ।करिष्यामि शरैस्तीक्ष्णैर्यदि स्थास्यति विप्रिये।।2.21.10।।
21_10.translation: O best of men, if the whole of Ayodhya stands against you I shall depopulate it with my sharp arrows.
21_10.word_by_word: मनुजर्षभ O best among men, विप्रिये against you, स्थास्यति यदि if any one stands up, इमाम् this, कृत्स्नाम् entire, अयोध्याम् Ayodhya, तीक्ष्णैः with sharp, शरैः arrows, निर्मनुष्याम्  depopulate, करिष्यामि I shall do.

21_11.shloka: भरतस्याथ पक्ष्यो वा यो वाऽस्य हितमिच्छति।सर्वानेतान्वधिष्यामि मृदुर्हि परिभूयते।।2.21.11।।
21_11.translation: I shall slay all of them who support Bharata and those who seek his prosperity. A gentleman is treated with disgrace indeed.
21_11.word_by_word: अथ even so, भरतस्य Bharata's, पक्ष्यो वा or any supporter, यो वा or any one, अस्य his, हितम्  welfare, इच्छति seeking, एतान् सर्वान् all those, वधिष्यामि I shall slay, मृदुः a soft (person), परिभूयते हि is treated with disgrace indeed.

21_12.shloka: प्रोत्साहितोऽयं कैकेय्या स दुष्टो यदि नः पिता।अमित्रभूतो निस्सङ्गं वध्यतां बध्यतामपि।।2.21.12।।
21_12.translation: Even if our father instigated by Kaikeyi becomes our enemy, he shall be imprisoned or even slain regardless of our relationship with him.
