21_12.word_by_word: कैकेय्या by Kaikeyi, प्रोत्साहितः instigated, सः that, दुष्टः vicious, नः पिता our father, अमित्रभूतः यदि becomes enemy, निस्सङ्गं without caring for any relationship, अयम् I will, बध्यताम् shall be imprisoned, वध्यतामपि also shall be slain.

21_13.shloka: गुरोरप्यवलिप्तस्य कार्याकार्यमजानतः।उत्पथं प्रतिपन्नस्य कार्यं भवति शासनम्।।2.21.13।।
21_13.translation: Even a preceptor who follows the unrighteous path and is filled with haughtiness and does not know how to discriminate between good and bad, deserves to be disciplined (punished).
21_13.word_by_word: अवलिप्तस्य filled with haughtiness, कार्याकार्यम् acts good and bad, अजानतः  of one who does not know, उत्पथम् unrighteous path, प्रतिपन्नस्य of one who has resorted to, गुरोरपि even of a preceptor, शासनम् discipline, कार्यम् duty, भवति becomes.

21_14.shloka: बलमेष किमाश्रित्य हेतुं वापुरुषर्षभ।दातुमिच्छति कैकेय्यै राज्यं स्थितमिदं तव।।2.21.14।।
21_14.translation: O best of men, under what authority or reason this king wants to confer on Kaikeyi the kingdom  that rightfully belongs to you?
21_14.word_by_word: पुरुषर्षभ O best of men, तव your, स्थितम् belongings, इदम् this, राज्यम् kingdom, एषः he, किम् what, बलम् power, हेतुं वा or reason, आश्रित्य resorting to, कैकेय्यै to Kaikeyi, दातुम् to confer, इच्छति wishes.

21_15.shloka: त्वया चैव मया चैव कृत्वा वैरमनुत्तमम्।काऽस्य शक्तिश्श्रियं दातुं भरतायारिशासन।।2.21.15।।
21_15.translation: What authority, O Rama, chastiser of foes, this king has to bestow the kingdom upon Bharata by entering into undesirable hostility towards you and me?
21_15.word_by_word: अरिशासन O chastiser of foes, त्वया चैव with you, मया चैव with me, अनुत्तमम् undesirable, वैरम् hostility, कृत्वा having created, अस्य for him, भरताय to Bharata, श्रियम् kingdom, दातुम् to bestow, का शक्तिः what strength he has?

21_16.shloka: अनुरक्तोऽस्मि भावेन भ्रातरं देवि तत्त्वतः।सत्येन धनुषा चैव दत्तेनेष्टेन ते शपे।।2.21.16।।
21_16.translation: O mother, (Lakshmana now tells Kausalya) I am truly loyal to my brother from the bottom of my heart. I swear this by my bow, on my merits earned through charity, by my truthfulness and by the good deeds I have done.
21_16.word_by_word: देवि mother, तत्त्वत: truly, भावेन from the bottom of my heart, भ्रातरम् my brother, अनुरक्तः अस्मि I am loyal, सत्येन truthfully, धनुषा चैव with bow also, दत्तेन on charity, इष्टेन on sacrifice, ते to you, शपे I swear.

21_17.shloka: दीप्तमग्निमरण्यं वा यदि रामः प्रवेक्ष्यति।प्रविष्टं तत्र मां देवि त्वं पूर्वमवधारय।।2.21.17।।
21_17.translation: O mother rest assured should Rama enter a blazing fire or a forest I must have already entered it.
21_17.word_by_word: देवि O mother, रामः Rama, दीप्तम् blazing, अग्निम् fire, अरण्यं वा or to the forest, प्रवेक्ष्यति यदि if  he enters, पूर्वम् prior, माम् me, तत्र there, प्रविष्टम् one who entered, त्वम् you, अवधारय know.

21_18.shloka: हरामि वीर्याद्दुःखं ते तम स्सूर्य इवोदितः।देवी पश्यतु मे वीर्यं राघवश्चैव पश्यतु।।2.21.18।।
21_18.translation: Like the rising Sun dispelling darkness, I shall eliminate your sorrow. O mother Let Rama see my valour. You, too.
21_18.word_by_word: उदितः arisen, सूर्यः Sun, तम इव like darkness, वीर्यात् with my valour, ते दुःखम् your sorrow, हरामि shall take away, देवी mother, मे वीर्यम् my valour, पश्यतु one shall see, राघवश्चैव Rama also, पश्यतु shall see.

21_19.shloka: एतत्तु वचनं श्रुत्वा लक्ष्मणस्य महात्मनः।उवाच रामं कौशल्या रुदन्ती शोकलालसा।।2.21.19।।
21_19.translation: Having heard the words of the magnanimous Lakshmana, Kausalya, depressed and weeping, said to Rama:
21_19.word_by_word: महात्मनः of the magnanimous, लक्ष्मणस्य Lakshmana's, एतत् वचनम् these words, श्रुत्वा having heard, कौशल्या Kausalya, रुदन्ती weeping, शोकलालसा depressed with sorrow, रामम्   to Rama, उवाच said.

21_20.shloka: भ्रातुस्ते वदतः पुत्र लक्ष्मणस्य श्रुतं त्वया।यदत्रानन्तरं कार्यं कुरुष्व यदि रोचते।।2.21.20।।
21_20.translation: O my son you have heard what your brother Lakshmana said and if it pleases you, do later what is to be done.
21_20.word_by_word: पुत्र O son, ते your, भ्रातुः brother's, लक्ष्मणस्य of Lakshmana, वदतः saying, त्वया by you, श्रुतम्  has been heard, रोचते यदि if it pleases (you), अत्र in this matter, अनन्तरम् later, यत् what, कार्यम् is to be done, कुरूष्व you may do it.

21_21.shloka: न चाधर्म्यं वच श्रुत्वा सपत्न्या मम भाषितम्।विहाय शोकसन्तप्तां गन्तुमर्हसि मामितः।।2.21.21।।
21_21.translation: By heeding the unrighteous words of my cowife (Kaikeyi) it does not behove you to leave me griefstricken and go away from here.
21_21.word_by_word: मम my, सपत्न्या by (my) cowife (Kaikeyi), भाषितम् spoken, अधर्म्यम् unrighteous, वचः words, श्रुत्वा having heard, शोकसन्तप्ताम् stricken with grief, माम् me, विहाय leaving, इतः from here,गन्तुम् to go, नार्हसि does not behove you.

21_22.shloka: धर्मज्ञ यदि धर्मिष्ठो धर्मं चरितुमिच्छसि।शुश्रूष मामिहस्थस्त्वं चर धर्ममनुत्तमम्।।2.21.22।।
21_22.translation: You are righteous. You know your duty. If you wish to follow the path of righteousness, stay here, serve me and follow the best of dharma.
21_22.word_by_word: धर्मज्ञ O knower of duties, धर्मिष्ठः pious, धर्मम् righteousness, चरितुम् to follow, इच्छसि यदि if you wish, त्वम् you, इहस्थः by staying here, माम् me, शुश्रूष serve, अनुत्तमम् best, धर्मम् of virutes, चर follow.

21_23.shloka: शुश्रूषुर्जननीं पुत्र स्वगृहे नियतो वसन्।परेण तपसा युक्तः काश्यपस्त्रिदिवं गतः।।2.21.23।।
21_23.translation: O son Kasyapa who led a life of selfdiscipline and served his mother at home, attained heaven credited with (the merit of) the highest penance.
21_23.word_by_word: पुत्र O son, काश्यपः Kasyapa, जननीम् his mother, शुश्रूषुः by serving, नियतः with selfdiscipline, स्वगृहे in his own home, वसन् while dwelling, परेण with the highest, तपसा with penance, युक्तः engaged in, त्रिदिवम् heaven, गतः went.

21_24.shloka: यथैव राजा पूज्यस्ते गौरवेण तथाऽस्म्यहम्।त्वां नाहमनुजानामि न गन्तव्यमितो वनम्।।2.21.24।।
21_24.translation: Just as the king is worthy of your respectful homage, so am I. I will not permit you to go from here to the forest.
21_24.word_by_word: राजा king, गौरवेण out of reverence, ते to you, यथैव how, पूज्यः is worthy of homage, अहम् I, तथा हि in the same manner, अहम् I, त्वाम् to you, नानुजानामि will not permit, इतः from here, वनम् to the forest, न गन्तव्यम् shall not go.

21_25.shloka: त्वद्वियोगान्न मे कार्यं जीवितेन सुखेन वा।त्वया सह मम श्रेयस्तृणानामपि भक्षणम्।।2.21.25।।
21_25.translation: Separated from you, I have no use of this life or happiness. I prefer to live with you even if it means eating grass.
21_25.word_by_word: त्वद्वियोगात् by being separated from you, मे for me, जीवितेन with life, सुखेन वा or with happiness, कार्यम् any purpose, न not, त्वया सह along with you, मम to me, तृणानाम् ofgrass, भक्षणम् अपि feeding also, श्रेयः is preferable.

21_26.shloka: यदि त्वं यास्यसि वनं त्यक्त्वा मां शोकलालसाम्।अहं प्रायमिहासिष्ये न हि शक्ष्यामि जीवितुम्।।2.21.26।।
21_26.translation: If you depart for the forest leaving me griefstricken I cannot live. Here I shall seek death by fasting.
21_26.word_by_word: शोकलालसाम् overtaken by sorrow, माम् me, त्यक्त्वा after leaving, त्वम् you, वनम् to the forest, यास्यसि यदि if you depart, अहम् I, इह here, प्रायम् असिष्ये I shall seek death by fasting, जीवितुम् to live, न शक्ष्यामि हि I am not able.

21_27.shloka: ततस्त्वं प्राप्स्यसे पुत्र निरयं लोकविश्रुतम्।ब्रह्महत्यामिवाधर्मात्समुद्र स्सरितां पतिः।।2.21.27।।
21_27.translation: O son you will then fall into hell. As wellknown in the world, the ocean, the lord of rivers, incurred the guilt of slaying a brahmin through unrighteous conduct.
21_27.word_by_word: ततः after that, पुत्र O son, त्वम् you, सरितां पतिः lord of all rivers, समुद्रः ocean, अधर्मात्  through unrighteous conduct, ब्रह्महत्यामिव like slaying a brahmin, लोकविश्रुतम् renowned  in the world, निरयम् hell, प्राप्स्यसे will attain.

21_28.shloka: विलपन्तीं तथा दीनां कौसल्यां जननीं ततः।उवाच रामो धर्मात्मा वचनं धर्मसंहितम्।।2.21.28।।
21_28.translation: Thereafter, virtuous Rama addressed these words consistent with righteousness to his miserable mother Kausalya who was thus lamenting:
21_28.word_by_word: ततः thereafter, धर्मात्मा virtuous, रामः Rama, दीनाम् miserable lady, तथा in that way, विलपन्तीम् lamenting, जननीम् to his mother, कौशल्याम् to Kausalya, धर्मसंहितम् consistent with righteousness, वचनम् words, उवाच said.

21_29.shloka: नास्ति शक्तिः पितुर्वाक्यं समतिक्रमितुं मम।प्रसादये त्वां शिरसा गन्तुमिच्छाम्यहं वनम्।।2.21.29।।
21_29.translation: I do not have the power to transgress the orders of my father. Bowing my head I beseech you,  allow me to go to the forest.
21_29.word_by_word: पितुः father's, वाक्यम् words (order), समतिक्रमितुम् to transgress, मम for me, शक्तिः power, नास्ति is not there, अहम् I, शिरसा bowing my head, प्रसादये I am propitiating, वनम् to forest, गन्तुम् to depart, इच्छामि wishing.

21_30.shloka: ऋषिणा च पितुर्वाक्यं कुर्वता व्रतचारिणा।गौर्हता जानता धर्मं कण्डुनाऽपि विपश्चिता।।2.21.30।।
21_30.translation: Learned sage Kandu who knew what is righteousness and a strict observant of vows, slew a cow for carrying out the command of his father.
21_30.word_by_word: ऋषिणा by the sage, व्रतचारिणा by a man observing the vows, धर्मम् righteousness, जानता by the knower, विपश्चिता by a learned man, अपि even, कण्डुना by Kandu, पितुः father's, वाक्यम् command, कुर्वता carrying out, गौ: cow, हता slew.

21_31.translation: Earlier the sons of Sagara, born in our family, while excavating the earth by the order of their father met a terrible death.
21_31.word_by_word: पूर्वम् earlier, अस्माकम् in our, कुले च race, पितुः of father, सगरस्य Sagara's, आज्ञया by command, भूमिम् earth, खनद्भि: by those excavating, सागरैः by the sons of Sagara, सुमहान् very great (fearful), वधः slaughter, आवाप्तः was met with.

21_32.shloka: जामद्ग्न्येन रामेण रेणुका जननी स्वयम्।कृत्ता परशुनाऽरण्ये पितुर्वचनकारिणा।।2.21.32।।
21_32.translation: Parasurama, son of Jamadagni himself in obedience to the words of his father, decapitated his mother Renuka in the forest with an axe.
21_32.word_by_word: पितुः father's, वचनकारिणा in obedience to the words, जामदग्न्येन by the son of Jamadagni, रामेण by Parasurama, जननी his mother, रेणुका Renuka, स्वयम् himself, अरण्ये in the forest, परशुना by an axe, कृत्ता was severed.

21_33.shloka: एतैरन्यैश्च बहुभिर्देवि देवसमैः कृतम्।पितुर्वचनमक्लीबं करिष्यामि पितुर्हितम्।।2.21.33।।
21_33.translation: All of them including many other godlike persons, O Mother fulfilled the words of their father. I shall also make my father's wish come true.
21_33.word_by_word: देवि O Devi, एतैः by these, देवसमैः by godlike people, बहुभिः many, अन्यैश्च by others also, पितुः father's, वचनम् words, अक्लीबम् fruitful, कृतम् was made, पितुः father's, हितम् wish, करिष्यामि I will do.

21_34.shloka: न खल्वेतन्मयैकेन क्रियते पितृशासनम्।एतैरपि कृतं देवि ये मया तव कीर्तिताः।।2.21.34।।
21_34.translation: I am not O Devi the only one obeying my father's command. All I have mentioned to you did.
21_34.word_by_word: देवि O Devi, मया by me, एकेन by me alone, एतत् this, पितृशासनम् father's command, न क्रियते has not been obeyed, मया by me, ये all those, तव to you, कीर्तिताः have been mentioned, एतैरपि even by them, कृतम् it has been done.

21_35.shloka: नाहं धर्ममपूर्वं ते प्रतिकूलं प्रवर्तये।पूर्वैरयमभिप्रेतो गतो मार्गोऽनुगम्यते।।2.21.35।।
21_35.translation: I am not advancing anything new, contrary to the existing practice. I am only following the trodden path of our ancestors.
21_35.word_by_word: अहम् I, प्रतिकूलम् contrary to the old practice, अपूर्वम् anything new, धर्मम् practice, ते to you, न प्रवर्तये I am not advancing, पूर्वैः by ancestors, अभिप्रेतः acceptable, गतः followed by them, अयम् this, मार्गः path, अनुगम्यते is being followed.

21_36.shloka: तदेतत्तु मया कार्यं क्रियते भुवि नान्यथा।पितुर्हि वचनं कुर्वन्न कश्चिन्नाम हीयते।।2.21.36।।
21_36.translation: I will not do as duty anything contrary to what is done by others in this world. No one who obeys the commands of his father falls off the path of righteousness.
21_36.word_by_word: भुवि in this world, कार्यम् duty, तत् एतत् that this(compliance with the command), मया by me, अन्यथा in any other manner, न क्रियते will not be done, पितुः father's, वचनम् orders, कुर्वन् while carrying out, कश्चित् any one, न हीयते नाम will not perish.

21_37.translation: One who is the best among the knowers of speech and best of all archers, Rama spoke to his mother in this manner and then said to Lakshmana:
21_37.word_by_word: वाक्यविदाम् of the knowers of speech, श्रेष्ठः best man, सर्वधनुष्मताम् among all archers,  श्रेष्ठः best man, तां जननीम् his mother, एवम् thus, उक्त्वा having spoken, पुनः again, लक्ष्मणम् to Lakshmana, अब्रवीत् spoke.

21_38.shloka: तव लक्ष्मण जानामि मयि स्नेहमनुत्तमम्।विक्रमं चैव सत्त्वं च तेजश्च सुदुरासदम्।।2.21.38।।
21_38.translation: I know, O Lakshmana, your profound affection for me. I also know your valour,  strength and unassailable energy.
21_38.word_by_word: लक्ष्मण O Lakshmana, तव your, मयि in me, अनुत्तमम् exceedingly great, स्नेहम् affection, विक्रमं चैव also valour, सत्त्वं च also strength, सुदुरासदम् unassailable, तेजश्च energy, जानामि I know.

21_39.shloka: मम मातुर्महद्दुःखमतुलं शुभलक्षण।अभिप्रायमविज्ञाय सत्यस्य च शमस्य च।।2.21.39।।
21_39.translation: O Lakshamana of auspicious qualities, since my mother is not aware of the significance of truth and selfrestraint, she is overcome with grief, great and incomparable.
21_39.word_by_word: शुभलक्षण O one of auspicious qualities (Lakshmana), सत्यस्य च of truth, शमस्य च of selfrestraint, अभिप्रायम् the meaning, अविज्ञाय without realising, मम मातुः my mother's, अतुलम् incomparable, महत् दुःखम् great grief.

21_40.shloka: धर्मो हि परमो लोके धर्मे सत्यं प्रतिष्ठितम्।धर्मसंश्रितमेतच्च पितुर्वचनमुत्तमम्।।2.21.40।।
21_40.translation: Righteousness alone is supreme in this world and truth is established in righteousness. This excellent command of our father is supported by righteousness.
21_40.word_by_word: धर्मः righteousness, लोके in this world, परमो हि is supreme, धर्मे in righteousness, सत्यम्truth, प्रतिष्ठितम् is established, एतत् this, उत्तमम् excellent, पितुः father's, वचनं च words, धर्मसंश्रितम् is supported by righteousness.

21_41.shloka: संश्रुत्य च पितुर्वाक्यं मातुर्वा ब्राह्मणस्य वा।न कर्तव्यं वृथा वीर धर्ममाश्रित्य तिष्ठता।।2.21.41।।
21_41.translation: Any one, O hero, who has taken recourse to righteousness should not  allow the promise made to his father,  mother or a brahmin to go in vain.
21_41.word_by_word: वीर O hero, पितुः of father, मातुर्वा or of mother, ब्राह्मणस्य वा or of brahmins, संश्रुत्य having promised, धर्मम् righteouness, आश्रित्य having taken recourse, तिष्ठता by one who abides in, वाक्यम् words, वृथा in vain, न कर्तव्यम् is not to be done.

21_42.shloka: सोऽहं न शक्ष्यामि पितुर्नियोगमतिवर्तितुम्।पितुर्हिवचनाद्वीर कैकेय्याऽहं प्रचोदितः।।2.21.42।।
21_42.translation: O hero I cannot transgress the command of my father since at his instance only Kaikeyi urged me (to go to the forest).
21_42.word_by_word: वीर O warrior, सः अहम् such me, पितुः father's, नियोगम् command, अतिवर्तितुम् to transgress, न शक्ष्यामि I am not competent, पितुः father's, वचनात् from the words, अहम् I, कैकेय्या by Kaikeyi, प्रचोदितः हि urged.

21_43.shloka: तदेतां विसृजानार्यां क्षत्रधर्माश्रितां मतिम्।धर्ममाश्रय मा तैक्ष्ण्यं मद्बुद्धिरनुगम्यताम्।।2.21.43।।
21_43.translation: Therefore, leave this ignoble thought, resort to the duty of a kshatriya, take the righteous path. Do not adopt violence. Follow my decision.
21_43.word_by_word: तत् for that reason, अनार्याम् ignoble, क्षत्रधर्माश्रिताम् resorting to the duty of a kshatriya, मतिम् intellect, विसृज you may give up, धर्मम् righteousness, आश्रय adopt, तैक्ष्ण्यम् violence, मा do not follow, मद्बुद्धिः my thought, अनुगम्यताम् be followed.

21_44.shloka: तमेवमुत्त्वा सौहार्दाद्भ्रातरं लक्ष्मणाग्रजः।उवाच भूयः कौसल्यां प्राञ्जलिश्शिरसानतः।।2.21.44।।
21_44.translation: Speaking affectionately to his brother Lakshmana, Rama with folded hands and head bowed  again addressed Kausalya:
21_44.word_by_word: लक्ष्मणाग्रजः elder brother of Lakshmana, Rama, तम् that, भ्रातरम् his brother, सौहार्दात्affectionately, एवम् in this way, उत्त्वा having spoken, प्राञ्जलिः with folded hands, शिरसा with head, नतः down, भूयः again, कौशल्याम् to Kausalya, उवाच said.

21_45.shloka: अनुमन्यस्व मां देवि गमिष्यन्तमितो वनम्।शापिताऽसि मम प्राणैः कुरु स्वस्त्ययनानि मे।।2.21.45।।
21_45.translation: I have decided, O mother to go to the forest from here. Grant me the permission to do so. I swear on my life. Perform all the ceremonies for securing prosperity for me.
21_45.word_by_word: देवि O Devi, इतः from here, वनम् to the forest, गमिष्यन्तम् one who has decided to go, अनुमन्यस्व you may permit, मम me, प्राणैः with life, शापिता असि you are sworn, मे to me, स्वस्त्ययनानि all ceremonial means of securing prosperity, कुरु perform.

21_46.shloka: तीर्णप्रतिज्ञश्च वनात्पुनरेष्याम्यहं पुरीम्।ययातिरिव राजर्षिःपुरा हित्वा पुनर्दिवम्।।2.21.46।।
21_46.translation: Like rajarshi Yayati of yore who lost heaven and rejained it, I shall return from theforest to the city (of Ayodhya) after the vow is fulfilled.
21_46.word_by_word: पुरा in the past, ययातिः Yayati, राजर्षिः rajarshi, दिवम् heaven, हित्वा having left,  पुनः again, दिवम् इव like heaven, अहम् I, तीर्ण प्रतिज्ञः having fulfilled my vow, वनात् from the forest, पुनः again, पुरीम् to the city (of Ayodhya), एष्यामि shall return.

21_47.shloka: शोकस्सन्धार्यतां मात र्हृदये साधु मा शुचः।वनवासादिहैष्यामि पुनः कृत्वा पितुर्वचः।।2.21.47।।
21_47.translation: Do not grieve, O mother Be prudent enough to subdue your sorrow in your heart. Having fulfilled father's words, I shall come back from my sojourn in the forest.
21_47.word_by_word: मात O mother, शोकः sorrow, हृदये in the heart, साधु prudently, सन्धार्यताम् be subdued, मा शुचः do not grieve, पितुः father's, वचः words, कृत्वा having fulfilled, वनवासात् from exile, पुनः again, इह here, एष्यामि will come back.

21_48.shloka: त्वया मया च वैदेह्या लक्ष्मणेन सुमित्रया।पितुर्नियोगे स्थातव्यमेष धर्मस्सनातनः।।2.21.48।।
21_48.translation: You, Sita, Lakshmana, Sumitra and I -- all of us shall abide by the words of my father. This indeed is eternal law.
21_48.word_by_word: त्वया by you, मया च by me, वैदेह्या by Sita, लक्ष्मणेन by Lakshmana, सुमित्रया by Sumitra, पितुः  father's, नियोगे by the orders, स्थातव्यम् we shall abide, एषः this alone, सनातनः eternal, धर्मः law.

21_49.shloka: अम्ब संहृत्य सम्भारान् दुःखं हृदि निगृह्य च।वनवासकृता बुद्धिर्मम धर्म्याऽनु वर्त्यताम्।।2.21.49।।
21_49.translation: O mother in withdrawing the articles (for consecration) and also in subduing the sorrow in your heart approve of my plan to dwell in the forest.
21_49.word_by_word: अम्ब O mother, सम्भारान् articles (for consecration), संहृत्य after withdrawing, दुःखम् sorrow, हृदि in the heart, निगृह्य च also after subduing, वनवासकृता relating to my dwelling in the forest, धर्म्या conforming to duty, मम बुद्धि: my thinking, अनुवर्त्यताम् follow.

21_50.shloka: एतद्वचस्तस्य निशम्य मातासुधर्म्यमव्यग्रमविक्लबं च।मृतेव संज्ञां प्रतिलभ्य देवीसमीक्ष्य रामं पुनरित्युवाच।।2.21.50।।
21_50.translation: Having heard these words so unruffled and tranquil which conformed to  righteousness, mother (Kausalya), like a dead person regaining consciousness spoke to Rama again:
21_50.word_by_word: माता mother, देवी Devi (Kausalya), तस्य that Rama's, सुधर्म्यम् conforming to virtue, अव्यग्रम्unruffled, अविक्लबं च also without getting distressed, एतत् all this, वचः words, निशम्य having heard, मृतेव like a dead person, संज्ञाम् consciousness, प्रतिलभ्य having regained, रामम् Rama, समीक्ष्य having looked at intently, पुनः again, इति thus, उवाच said.

21_51.shloka: यथैव ते पुत्र पिता तथाऽहंगुरु स्स्वधर्मेण सुहृत्तया च।न त्वाऽनुजानामि न मां विहायसुदुःखितामर्हसि गन्तुमेवम्।।2.21.51।।
21_51.translation: By virtue of my own duty and affection towards you, O my son I am as much your preceptor as your father is. I will not grant you permission. You should not go, leaving me deeply distressed.
21_51.word_by_word: पुत्र O my son, स्वधर्मेण by virtue of one's own duty, सुहृत्तया च out of affection, ते your, पिता father, यथैव as he is to you, तथा like that, अहम् I, गुरुः preceptor, त्वा you, न अनुजानामि do not permit, सुदुःखिताम् highly distressed, माम् me, विहाय leaving, एवम् in this manner, गन्तुम् to go, नार्हसि does not behove you.

21_52.shloka: किं जीवितेनेह विना त्वया मेलोकेन वा किं स्वधयाऽमृतेन।श्रेयो मुहूर्तं तव सन्निधानंममेह कृत्स्नादपि जीवलोकात्।।2.21.52।।
21_52.translation: What is the purpose of my life in this world without you? What purpose do I have with  the other world or with the oblations (offered to manes) or with nectar (availble to the gods). I would prefer one moment in your company to the whole world of living beings (without you).
21_52.word_by_word: त्वया विना without you, मे to me, इह here, जीवितेन with life, किम् what is the purpose, लोकेन with the other world, स्वधया with the oblations (offered to manes), अमृतेन वा or with nectar or immortality available to the gods, किम् what use, मम for me, इह here,कृत्स्नात् entire, जीवलोकात् अपि even more than the world of human beings, मुहूर्तम् even for a moment, तव your, सन्निधानम् presence, श्रेयः more desirable.

21_53.translation: At the (inconsolable) lamentations of his mother, Rama was in flames (within) like a mighty elephant prevented from entering the highway by men with fireworks.
21_53.word_by_word: रामः Rama, एवम् in this way, करुणम् pitiful, जनन्याः mother's, विलापम् lamentation, निशम्य having heard, नरैः by men, उल्काभिः by meteors (fireworks), अपोह्यमानः being prevented, अध्वानम् the way, अनुप्रविष्टः entered, महागजः इव like a mighty elephant, भूयः still more, प्रजज्वाल was burning (within).

21_54.shloka: स मातरं चैव विसंज्ञकल्पामार्तं च सौमित्रिमभिप्रतप्तम्।धर्मे स्थितो धर्म्यमुवाच वाक्यंयथा स एवार्हति तत्र वक्तुम्।।2.21.54।।
21_54.translation: Rama, centred on righteousness, again addressed his mother who had almost  fainted and Lakshmana who was deeply distressed. As his words were consistent with righteousness, he alone was competent to speak that way.
21_54.word_by_word: धर्मे in righteousness, स्थितः abiding, सः that Rama, विसंज्ञकल्पाम् like one who has fallen into a swoon, मातरं चैव to his mother also, अभिप्रतप्तम् tormented with suffering, सौमित्रिम् to Lakshmana, तत्र at that time, यथा in such a way, वक्तुम् to speak, स एव he alone, अर्हति is competent (in that way), धर्म्यम् endowed with  righteousness, वाक्यम् words, उवाचsaid.

21_55.shloka: अहं हि ते लक्ष्मण नित्यमेवजानामि भक्तिं च पराक्रमं च।मम त्वभिप्रायमसन्निरीक्ष्यमात्रा सहाभ्यर्दसि मां सुदुःखम्।।2.21.55।।
21_55.translation: I know your devotion (to me) and your valour, O Lakshmana But now, without understanding my intention you are causing me and mother severe pain and torment.
21_55.word_by_word: लक्ष्मण O Lakshmana, अहम् I, नित्यमेव always, ते your, भक्तिं च also devotion, पराक्रमं च valour too, जानामि know, तु but, मम my, अभिप्रायम् intention, असन्निरीक्ष्य without probing, मात्रा सह along with my mother, माम् me, सुदुःखम् severe pain, अभ्यर्दसि you are tormenting.

21_56.shloka: धर्मार्थकामाः खलु तात लोकेसमीक्षिता धर्मफलोदयेषु।ते तत्र सर्वे स्युरसंशयं मेभार्येव वश्याऽभिमता सुपुत्रा।।2.21.56।।
21_56.translation: Dharma,artha and kama, O my dear are adjudged in this world according to the fruits of righteous action. All these three are doubtless there (in my decision to go to the forest), like obedience in a wife and love for the mother in good sons.
21_56.word_by_word: तात O dear one, लोके in this world, धर्मफलोदयेषु obtaining the fruits of righteousness, धर्मार्थकामाः righteousness, wealth and objects of desire, समीक्षिताः are considered, वश्या obedient, अभिमता beloved, सुपुत्रा having good sons, भार्येव like a wife, तत्र in that  (righteousness), ते सर्वे all these (dharma, artha and kama), स्युः will remain, मे to me, असंशयम् there is no doubt.

21_57.shloka: यस्मिंस्तु सर्वे स्युरसन्निविष्टाधर्मो यत स्स्यात्तदुपक्रमेत।द्वेष्यो भवत्यर्थपरो हि लोकेकामात्मता खल्वपि न प्रशस्ता।।2.21.57।।
21_57.translation: If actions which combine these three (dharma, artha and kama), cannot be performed (which is likely), resort to righteousness. (For) one who seeks wealth is abhorred and one who seeks fulfilment of desires does not attract admiration in this world.
21_57.word_by_word: यस्मिन् in whichever man, सर्वे all these (three), असन्निविष्टाः स्युः are not combined, यतः by which, धर्मः righteousness, स्यात् is present, तत् that one, उपक्रमेत should be performed, लोके in the world, अर्थपरः a seeker of wealth, द्वेष्यः is abhorred, भवति हि happens, कामात्मतापि subjecting to fulfilment of desires also, न प्रशस्ता खलु is not  admired (by the wise).

21_58.shloka: गुरुश्च राजा च पिता च वृद्धःक्रोधात्प्रहर्षाद्यदि वाऽपि कामात्।यद्व्यादिशेत्कार्यमवेक्ष्य धर्मंकस्तन्न कुर्यादनृशंसवृत्तिः।2.21.58।।
21_58.translation: Whatever a preceptor, an old man, a king and a father commands whether it is out of anger or pleasure or passion must be carried out as dharma. Who will not do it unless he is heartless?
21_58.word_by_word: गुरुश्च the precepter, राजा च the king also, वृद्धः च an old man, पिता च also father, क्रोधात् due to anger, प्रहर्षात् due to joy, यदि वा or, कामात् अपि even due to passion, यत् such, कार्यम् act, व्यादिशेत् commands, तत् that one, धर्मम् as rightful duty, अवेक्ष्य having seen, अनृशंसवृत्तिः no tendency to cruelty, कः who, न कुर्यात् will not do.

21_59.shloka: स वै न शक्नोमि पितुः प्रतिज्ञामिमामकर्तुं सकलां यथावत्।स ह्यावयोस्तात गुरुर्नियोगेदेव्याश्च भर्ता स गति स्सधर्मः।।2.21.59।।
21_59.translation: It is impossible for me not to execute the promise completely, O my dear, he (Dasaratha) is our preceptor and, therefore, fit to command us. Even for  mother Kausalya, he is her husband, her refuge and her dharma.
21_59.word_by_word: सः that kind of me, पितुः father's, सकलाम् completely, इमां प्रतिज्ञाम् this promise, यथावत् as it is, अकर्तुम् not to execute, न शक्नोमि वै for sooth I am not competent, तात O my dear, सः he, नियोगे in command, आवयोः for both of us, गुरुः हि is preceptor, देव्याश्च of mother also, सः he,  भर्ता husband, सः he, गतिः is refuge, धर्मः virtue.

21_60.shloka: तस्मिन्पुनर्जीवति धर्मराजेविशेषतस्स्वे पथि वर्तमाने।देवी मया सार्धमितोऽपगच्छेत्कथं स्विदन्या विधवेव नारी।।2.21.60।।
21_60.translation: While the righteous king is living, more importantly treading the righteous path, howcan mother Kausalya, like an ordinary widow, accompany me leaving this city?
21_60.word_by_word: धर्मराजे when the king of righteousness, तस्मिन् himself, जीवति while he is living, विशेषतः specially, स्वे his own, पथि in the path, वर्तमाने while he is moving, देवी mother Kausalya, अन्या other, विधवा नारीव like a widow, मया सार्धम् along with me, कथं स्वित्  how, इतः from here, अपगच्छेत् shall come away.

21_61.shloka: सा माऽनुमन्यस्व वनं व्रजन्तंकुरुष्व न स्स्वस्त्ययनानि देवि।यथा समाप्ते पुनराव्रजेयंयथा हि सत्येन पुनर्ययातिः।।2.21.61।।
21_61.translation: Grant me permission O mother, to depart for the forest. Bless me and perform ceremonies for my wellbeing so that I shall return (to the city) after completion (of my exile) like Yayati (who came back to heaven) with the strength of truth.
21_61.word_by_word: देवि O mother, सा such you, वनम् to the forest, व्रजन्तम् departing, मा me, अनुमन्यस्व allow, सत्येन by the strength of truth, ययातिः Yayati, यथा just like, पुनः again, समाप्ते after completion of the term, यथा as, पुनः again, अव्रजेयम् I shall come back, स्वस्त्ययनानि ceremonies causing prosperity, कुरुष्व you may perform.

21_62.shloka: यशो ह्यहं केवलराज्यकारणान्न पृष्ठतः कर्तुमलं महोदयम्।अदीर्घकाले न तु देवि जीवितेवृणेऽवरामद्य महीमधर्मतः।।2.21.62।।
21_62.translation: I will not forsake this great glory (of fulfilling my father's promise) for the sake of the kingdom. In this transient existence O mother, I do not wish to acquire this insignificant earth unrighteously.
21_62.word_by_word: केवलराज्यकारणात् only for the sake of the kingdom, अहम् I, महोदयम् great, यशः glory, पृष्ठतः कर्तुम् to push it back, न अलम् must not, देवि O Mother, अदीर्घकाले in a short duration, जीविते in life, अद्य now, अवराम् insignificant, महीम् earth, अधर्मतः unrighteously, न वृणे will not choose.

21_63.shloka: प्रसादयन्नरवृषभ स्समातरंपराक्रमाज्जिगमिषुरेव दण्डकान्।अथानुजं भृशमनुशास्य दर्शनंचकार तां हृदि जननीं प्रदक्षिणम्।।2.21.63।।
21_63.translation: Rama, the best among men, thus pacified his mother insisting on his desire to depart for Dandaka forest with courage. And elaborately instructed his brother about his good intentions after which he circumambulated his mother with all his heart.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे एकविंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the twentyfirst sarga of Ayodhyakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
21_63.word_by_word: सः that, नरवृषभः excellent among men, पराक्रमात् courageously, दण्डकान् to Dandaka forest, जिगमिषुरेव wishes to go to, मातरम् to mother, प्रसादयन् while pacifying, अथ thereafter, अनुजम् to brother, भृशम् exceedingly, दर्शनम् good intention, अनुशास्य ह having disciplined (instructed), हृदि in his heart, तां जननीम् his mother, प्रदक्षिणं चकार circumambulated.

22_1.shloka: [Rama convinces Lakshmana that destiny is allpowerful--cancels all arrangements for his consecration ceremony.]अथ तं व्यथया दीनं सविशेषममर्षितम्।श्वसन्तमिव नागेन्द्रं रोषविस्फारितेक्षणम्।।2.22.1।।आसाद्य रामस्सौमित्रिं सुहृदं भ्रातरं प्रियम्।उवाचेदं स धैर्येण धारयन्सत्त्वमात्मवान्।।2.22.2।।
22_1.translation: The selfpossessed Rama held his composure and approached his beloved, intimate brother Lakshmana who was (looking) miserable with his mental agony. To him, who was hissing like a king cobra, he said:
22_1.word_by_word: अथ thereafter, आत्मवान् selfpossessed, सः रामः that Rama, धैर्येण with fortitude, सत्त्वम् composure, धारयन् holding, व्यथया with mental agony, दीनम् miserable, सविशेषम्   especially, अमर्षितम् indignant, नागेन्द्रमिव like a king cobra, श्वसन्तम् hissing, रोषविस्फारितेक्षणम्  eyes widened with wrath, सुहृदम् to the intimate, प्रियं भ्रातरम् beloved brother, सौमित्रिम् to Lakshmana, आसाद्य having approached, इदम् these words, उवाच said.

22_2.shloka: अथ तं व्यथया दीनं सविशेषममर्षितम्।श्वसन्तमिव नागेन्द्रं रोषविस्फारितेक्षणम्।।2.22.1।।आसाद्य रामस्सौमित्रिं सुहृदं भ्रातरं प्रियम्।उवाचेदं स धैर्येण धारयन्सत्त्वमात्मवान्।।2.22.2।।
22_2.translation: The selfpossessed Rama held his composure and approached his beloved, intimate brother Lakshmana who was (looking) miserable with his mental agony. To him, who was hissing like a king cobra, he said:
22_2.word_by_word: अथ thereafter, आत्मवान् selfpossessed, सः रामः that Rama, धैर्येण with fortitude, सत्त्वम् composure, धारयन् holding, व्यथया with mental agony, दीनम् miserable, सविशेषम्   especially, अमर्षितम् indignant, नागेन्द्रमिव like a king cobra, श्वसन्तम् hissing, रोषविस्फारितेक्षणम्  eyes widened with wrath, सुहृदम् to the intimate, प्रियं भ्रातरम् beloved brother, सौमित्रिम् to Lakshmana, आसाद्य having approached, इदम् these words, उवाच said.

22_3.shloka: निगृह्य रोषं शोकं च धैर्यमाश्रित्य केवलम्।अवमानं निरस्येमं गृहीत्वा हर्षमुत्तमम्।।2.22.3।।उपक्लृप्तं हि यत्किञ्चिदभिषेकार्थमद्य मेसर्वं विसर्जय क्षिप्रं कुरु कार्यं निरत्ययम्।।2.22.4।।
22_3.translation: Restrain your anger and sorrow. Dismiss this humiliation (from the mind). Achieve great happiness through fortitude. Remove whatever preparations have been made for the purpose of (my) consecration today, and act quickly so that there is no obstacle.
22_3.word_by_word: रोषम् anger, शोकं च also sorrow, निगृह्य after restraining, केवलम् only, धैर्यम् fortitude, आश्रित्य resorting to, इमम् this, अवमानम् insult, निरस्य after discarding, उत्तमम् great, हर्षम् happiness, गृहीत्वा after securing, अद्य today, मे my, अभिषेकार्थम् for the purpose of consecration, यत्किञ्चित् whatever, उपक्लुप्तम् is arranged, सर्वम् all that, विसर्जय you maydiscard, क्षिप्रम् quickly, निरत्ययम् safe, कार्यम् act, कुरु perform.

22_4.shloka: सौमित्रे योऽभिषेकार्थे मम सम्भार सम्भ्रमः।अभिषेकनिवृत्त्यर्थे सोऽस्तु संभारसम्भ्रमः।।2.22.5।।
22_4.translation: O Lakshmana the same enthusiasm with which preparations for my consecration were made be shown for the cessation of those arrangements.
22_4.word_by_word: सौमित्रे O Lakshmana मम my, अभिषेकार्थे for (my) consecration, यः which, संभारसम्भ्रमः  perseverance with which preparations have been made, सः that, अभिषेकनिवृत्यर्थे for cessation of those arrangements, अस्तु let there be.

22_5.shloka: यस्या मदभिषेकार्थे मानसं परितप्यते।माता मे सा यथा न स्यात्सविशङ्का तथा कुरु।।2.22.6।।
22_5.translation: Act in such a way that our mother (Kaikeyi), whose heart ached due to my consecration should not entertain any doubt.
22_5.word_by_word: मदभिषेकार्थे in the matter of my consecration, यस्याः whose, मानसम् (heart), परितप्यते ached, सा मे माता that my mother (Kaikeyi), सविशङ्का with doubt, यथा how, न स्यात् will not entertain, तथा accordingly, कुरु act.

22_6.shloka: तस्याश्शङ्कामयं दुःखं मुहूर्तमपि नोत्सहे।मनसि प्रतिसंजातं सौमित्रेऽहमुपेक्षितुम्।।2.22.7।।
22_6.translation: Even for a moment, O Lakshmana I am not inclined to ignore her sorrow caused by the apprehension in her mind (about the possibility of Rama's coronation).
22_6.word_by_word: सौमित्रे O Lakshmana, अहम् I, तस्याः her, मनसि in mind, प्रतिसंजातम् arisen, शङ्कामयम्  apprehensive, दुःखम् sorrow, मुहूर्तमपि even for a moment, उपेक्षितुम् to neglect, नोत्सहे I amnot inclined.

22_7.shloka: न बुद्धिपूर्वं नाबुद्धं स्मरामीह कदाचन।मातृ़णां वा पितुर्वाऽहं कृतमल्पं च विप्रियम्।।2.22.8।।
22_7.translation: I do not remember to have done anything any time with a motive or without understanding which might have caused even a little displeasure to father or mothers.
22_7.word_by_word: अहम् I, मातृणां of mothers, पितुर्वा or of father, इह here, कदाचन at any time, बुद्धिपूर्वम् intentional, कृतम् done, अल्पम् little, विप्रियं च displeasure, न स्मरामि I do not remember, अबुद्धम् anything done for want of understanding, न not.

22_8.shloka: सत्यस्सत्याभिसन्धश्च नित्यं सत्यपराक्रमः।परलोकभयाद्भीतो निर्भयोऽस्तु पिता मम।।2.22.9।।
22_8.translation: Let my father who is always truthful, who is really valiant, who is always striving for truth and who is afraid of the next world, be fearless.
22_8.word_by_word: सत्यः one who is truthful, सत्यपराक्रमः truly valiant, परलोकभयात् for fear of the other world, भीतः frightened, मम पिता my father, नित्यम् always, सत्याभिसन्धः a man striving for truth, निर्भयः fearless, अस्तु let him be.

22_9.shloka: तस्याऽपि हि भवेदस्मिन्कर्मण्यप्रतिसंहृते।सत्यं नेति मनस्तापस्तस्य तापस्तपेच्च माम्।।2.22.10।।
22_9.translation: If the preparations for the consecration are not withdrawn, my father will suffer mental agony for the fear that his word has not come true and his agony will torment me.
22_9.word_by_word: अस्मिन् कर्मणि if this act (my consecration), अप्रतिसंहृते if not withdrawn, तस्यापि for him also, सत्यं न his word has not come true, इति thus, मनस्तापः mental agony, भवेत् he will experience, तस्य his, तापः pain, माम् me, तपेच्च will torment.

22_10.shloka: अभिषेकविधानं तु तस्मात्संहृत्य लक्ष्मण।अन्वगेवाहमिच्छामि वनं गन्तुमितःपुनः।।2.22.11।।
22_10.translation: Therefore, O Lakshmana I want the arrangement for coronation withdrawn before I proceed to the forest from here itself.
22_10.word_by_word: लक्ष्मण O Lakshmana, तस्मात् therefore, अभिषेकविधानम् this arrangement for consecration, संहृत्य after withdrawing, अहम् I, अन्वगेव afterwards, इतः from here, वनम् to the forest, गन्तुम् to go, इच्छामि I am desiring.

22_11.shloka: मम प्रव्राजनादद्य कृतकृत्या नृपात्मजा।सुतं भरतमव्यग्रमभिषेचयिता ततः।।2.22.12।।
22_11.translation: Immediately after my departure to the forest, the king's (Kekaya's) daughter having accomplished her objective, will enthrone Bharata without any distraction.
22_11.word_by_word: नृपात्मजा king's daughter (Kaikeyi), अद्य now, मम my, प्रव्राजनात् departure, कृतकृत्या having accomplished her purpose, ततः afterwards, अव्यग्रम् without any distraction, सुतम् son, भरतम् Bharata, अभिषेचयिता will coronate.

22_12.shloka: मयि चीराजिनधरे जटामण्डलधारिणि।गतेऽरण्यं च कैकेय्या भविष्यति मनस्सुखम्।।2.22.13।।
22_12.translation: Kaikeyi will attain peace of mind only after my departure to the forest in tatteredclothes, an antelope skin and a crown of matted locks.
22_12.word_by_word: मयि I, चीराजिनधरे wearing tattered clothes (bark) and antelope skin, जटामण्डलधारिणि wearing a crown of matted hair, अरण्यम् to the forest, गते when I leave, कैकेय्याः Kaikeyi, मनस्सुखम् peace of mind, भविष्यति will attain.

22_13.shloka: बुद्धिः प्रणीता येनेयं मनश्च सुसमाहितम्।तं तु नार्हामि संक्लेष्टुं प्रव्रजिष्यामि मा चिरम्।।2.22.14।।
22_13.translation: With wellcomposed mind this decision has been taken. I do not like to inflict pain (on Dasaratha or Kaikeyi). I shall, therefore, depart to the forest without delay.
22_13.word_by_word: येन since, इयम् this, बुद्धि: intellect, प्रणीता is advanced, मनश्च mind also, सुसमाहितम् is wellcomposed, तम् him, संक्लेष्टुम् to inflict pain, नार्हामि I do not deserve, प्रव्रजिष्यामि I shall depart, चिरम् delay, मा not.

22_14.shloka: कृतान्तस्त्वेव सौमित्रे द्रष्टव्यो मत्प्रवासने।राज्यस्य च वितीर्णस्य पुनरेव निवर्तने।।2.22.15।।
22_14.translation: If the award of the kingdom to me is revoked, O Lakshmana, and if I am banished in this manner, see, it is destiny.
22_14.word_by_word: सौमित्रे O Lakshmana, मत्प्रवासने in my exile, वितीर्णस्य of the awarded, राज्यस्य  kingdom, पुनरेव again, निवर्तने च in revocation, कृतान्तस्त्वेव destiny (as cause), द्रष्टव्यः  should be seen.

22_15.shloka: कैकेय्याः प्रतिपत्तिर्हि कथं स्यान्मम पीडने।यदि भावो न दैवोऽयं कृतान्तविहितो भवेत्।।2.22.16।।
22_15.translation: If this thought and my misfortune were not caused in Kaikeyi by destiny, how could she muster such determination to inflict pain on me?
22_15.word_by_word: अयम् this, भावः thought, (तस्याः for her), कृतान्तविहितः is caused by destiny, दैवः misfortune, न भवेत् यदि if it were not to be so, कैकेय्याः for Kaikeyi, मम my, पीडने in inflicting pain, प्रतिपत्तिः determination, कथम् how, स्यात् will ever take place.

22_16.shloka: जानासि हि यथा सौम्य न मातृषु ममान्तरम्।भूतपूर्वं विशेषो वा तस्या मयि सुतेऽपि वा।।2.22.17।।
22_16.translation: You know, O gentle Lakshmana that never in the past had I any feeling of  distinction amongst my mothers. And Kaikeyi never differentiated between me and her son.
22_16.word_by_word: सौम्य O gentle (Lakshmana), मातृषु amongst my mothers, मम to me, यथा how, अन्तरम्  feeling of distinction, न भूतपूर्वम् was never in the past, तस्याः for her, मयि in me, सुते पि वा or in her son Bharata, विशेषः difference, जानासि you know.

22_17.translation: I do not find any reason other than destiny for the cruel and brutal words spoken by Kaikeyi with the objective of preventing my coronation and exiling me.
22_17.word_by_word: सः अहम् such me, अभिषेकनिवृर्त्त्थैः to prevent my consecration, प्रवासार्थैश्च for my banishment also, दुर्वचैः by the harsh words, उग्रैः cruel, तस्याः her, वाक्यैः with words, दैवात् other than destiny, अन्यत् any other, न समर्थये I will not propose.

22_18.shloka: कथं प्रकृतिसम्पन्ना राजपुत्री तथागुणा।ब्रूयात्सा प्राकृतेव स्त्री मत्पीडां भर्तृसन्निधौ।।2.22.19।।
22_18.translation: If destiny is not the cause behind this, how could Kaikeyi who is gifted with virtues and a noble nature speak such painful words to me before her husband, like an ordinary woman?
22_18.word_by_word: प्रकृतिसम्पन्ना noble natured, तथागुणा having such virtues, राजपुत्री princess, सा she, प्राकृता ordianry, स्त्री इव like a woman, भर्तृ सन्निधौ in the presence of her husband, मत्पीडाम् words causing me pain, कथम् how, ब्रूयात् will say.

22_19.shloka: यदचिन्त्यन्तु तद्दैवं भूतेष्वपि न विहन्यते।व्यक्तं मयि च तस्यां च पतितो हि विपर्ययः।।2.22.20।।
22_19.translation: Inconceivable is the power of destiny. Its impact on all beings cannot be averted. That  an adversity has befallen me and Kaikeyi is (therefore) evident.
22_19.word_by_word: अचिन्त्यम् inconceivable, यत् such, दैवम् destiny, तत् that one, भूतेष्वपि in all beings, न (वि)हन्यते cannot be averted, मयि च in me also, तस्यां च in her as well, विपर्ययः adversity, पतितः हि had fallen indeed, व्यक्तम् this is evident.

22_20.shloka: कश्चिद्दैवेन सौमित्रे योद्धुमुत्सहते पुमान्।यस्य न ग्रहणं किञ्चित्कर्मणोऽन्यत्र दृश्यते।।2.22.21।।
22_20.translation: O Lakshmana which mortal has the power to fight with destiny the grip of which can be comprehended  by following its course only through its effect and nowhere else.
22_20.word_by_word: सौमित्रे O Lakshmana, पुमान् (कः) which man, दैवेन with destiny, योद्धुम् to fight, उत्सहते can attempt, यस्य destiny's, ग्रहणम् grip, कर्मणः by following it course, अन्यत्र any other, किञ्चित् nothing, न दृश्यते cannot be seen.

22_21.shloka: सुखदुःखे भयक्रोधौ लाभालाभौ भवाभवौ।यच्च किञ्चित्तथाभूतं ननु दैवस्य कर्म तत्।।2.22.22।।
22_21.translation: Happiness or misery, fear or anger, gain or loss, birth or death, and all such things  are surely the acts of destiny.
22_21.word_by_word: सुखदुःखे happiness or misery, भयक्रोधौ fear or anger, लाभालाभौ gain or loss, भवाभवौ birth or death, तथाभूतम् that happens, यच्च किञ्चित् whatever is there, तत् that, दैवस्य destiny's, कर्म ननु is surely its act.

22_22.translation: Even rishis with severe austerities are tormented by destiny and are swerved from  their observances because of anger and passion.
22_22.word_by_word: उग्रतपसः practising severe austerities, ऋषयोऽपि rishis also, दैवेन by destiny, अभिप्रपीडिताः tormented, तीव्रान् severe, नियमान् observances, उत्सृज्य setting aside, काममन्युभिः with anger and passion, भ्रश्यन्ते are fallen.

22_23.shloka: असङ्कल्पितमेवेह यदकस्मात्प्रवर्तते।निवर्त्यारम्भमारब्धं ननु दैवस्य कर्म तत्।।2.22.24।।
22_23.translation: Any unanticipated and sudden hindrance to the action undertaken shall be deemed to be the act of destiny.
22_23.word_by_word: इह here, आरब्धम् undertaken, आरम्भम् initiation, निवर्त्य having stopped, असङ्कल्पितम् एव unanticipated, अकस्मात् suddenly, यत् such hindrance, प्रवर्तते takes place, तत् that one, दैवस्य destiny's, कर्म ननु is the result of action.

22_24.shloka: एतया तत्त्वया बुद्ध्या संस्तभ्यात्मानमात्मना।व्याहतेऽप्यभिषेके मे परितापो न विद्यते।।2.22.25।।
22_24.translation: Even though my consecration was thwarted, there is no feeling of sadness in me. In fact I controlled my mind by my intellect.
22_24.word_by_word: अभिषेके when my consecration, व्याहतेऽपि even though prevented, तत्त्वया in principle, एतया बुद्ध्या with the intellect, आत्मानम् my mind, आत्मना by myself, संस्तभ्य after controlling, मे my, परितापः sorrow, न विद्यते not there.

22_25.translation: Therefore, be free from grief like me and revoke all the arrangements made for the consecration ceremony immediately.
22_25.word_by_word: तस्मात् therefore, त्वमपि you also, माम् me, अनुविधाय having followed, अपरितापः bereft of grief, क्षिप्रम् immediately, अभिषेचनिकीम् relating to coronation, क्रियाम् acts, प्रतिसंहारय withdraw.

22_26.shloka: एभिरेव घटै स्सर्वैरभिषेचनसम्भृतैः।मम लक्ष्मण तापस्ये व्रतस्नानं भविष्यति।।2.22.27।।
22_26.translation: With these very pots (of holy water) brought for the purpose of consecration, O Lakshmana I shall take bath at the time of taking vow for practising penance.
22_26.word_by_word: लक्ष्मण O Lakshmana, अभिषेचनसम्भृतैः brought for the consecration, एभिः by these, सर्वैः by all, घटैरेव with pots of water, मम my, तापस्ये fit for practising penance, व्रतस्नानम् bathing before the commencement of a vow, भविष्यति will be.

22_27.shloka: अथवा किं ममैतेन राजद्रव्यमयेन तु।उद्धृतं मे स्वयं तोयं व्रतादेशं करिष्यति।।2.22.28।।
22_27.translation: Or else, for me what is the use of these pots of holy water which are the king's property? The water drawn with my own hands will be made use of for my religious bath.
22_27.word_by_word: अथवा otherwise, राजद्रव्यमयेन with the royal property, एतेन with this, मम for me, किम् what is the use, स्वयम् myself, उद्धृतम् drawn, तोयम् water, मे for me, व्रतादेशम् direction for observance of vows, करिष्यति will be made.

22_28.shloka: मा च लक्ष्मण सन्तापं कार्षीर्लक्ष्म्या विपर्यये।राज्यं वा वनवासो वा वनवासो महोदयः।।2.22.29।।
22_28.translation: Do not grieve, O Lakshmana, over the loss of the kingdom. Living in exile is more glorious than running the kingdom.
22_28.word_by_word: लक्ष्मण Lakshmana, लक्ष्म्याः of kingdom, विपर्यये due  to its loss, सन्तापम् sorrow, मा कार्षीः do not experience, राज्यं वा either kingdom, वनवासो वा or exile, वनवासः dwelling in the forest, महोदयः is glorious.

22_29.shloka: न लक्ष्मणास्मिन्खलु कर्मविघ्नेमाता यवीयस्यतिशङ्कनीया।दैवाभिपन्ना हि वदत्यनिष्टंजानासि दैवं च तथा प्रभावम्।।2.22.30।।
22_29.translation: O Lakshmana our younger mother (Kaikeyi) cannot be blamed for her obstruction to my coronation. Overpowered by destiny, she is speaking such unpleasant words. This you know is the impact of destiny.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे द्वाविंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the twentysecond sarga of Ayodhyakanda of  the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
22_29.word_by_word: लक्ष्मण O Lakshmana अस्मिन् in this matter, कर्मविघ्ने obstruction to my coronation, यवीयसी माता younger mother, न अतिशङ्कनीया खलु should not by apprehensive, दैवाभिपन्ना overpowered by destiny, अनिष्टम् unpleasant (words), वदति हि is speaking, दैवं च for destiny, तथा प्रभावम् has such influence, जानासि you know.

23_1.shloka: [Lakshmana speaks of his valour-- condemns destiny as feeble and powerless-- urges Rama to  get consecrated--  Rama resolves to obey his father's command.]इति ब्रुवति रामे तु लक्ष्मणोऽधश्शिरा मुहुः।श्रृत्वा मध्यं जगामेव मनसा दुःखहर्षयोः।।2.23.1।।
23_1.translation: While Rama was speaking thus, Lakshmana listened to him with his head down, experiencing both grief and joy.
23_1.word_by_word: रामे when Rama, इति like this, ब्रुवति was speaking, श्रुत्वा having heard, लक्ष्मणः Lakshmana, अधश्शिरा: with his head down, मनसा in his mind, मुहुः repeatedly, दुःखहर्षयो: in grief and joy, मध्यम् midway, जगामेव as if entered.

23_2.shloka: तदा तु बध्द्वा भ्रुकुटीं भ्रुवोर्मध्ये नरर्षभः।निशश्वास महासर्पो बिलस्थ इव रोषितः।।2.23.2।।
23_2.translation: Lakshmana, frowning between his eyebrows, hissed like a great serpent seized with anger in its hole.
23_2.word_by_word: नरर्षभः best  among men (Lakshmana), तदा तु then, भ्रुवो: brows, मध्ये in between, भ्रुकुटीम्   a frown, बध्द्वा having knitted, बिलस्थः in its hole, रोषितः seized with anger, महासर्पः great serpent, इव like, निशश्वास hissed.

23_3.shloka: तस्य दुष्प्रतिवीक्षं तद्भ्रुकुटीसहितं तदा।बभौ क्रुद्धस्य सिंहस्य मुखस्य सदृशं मुखम्।।2.23.3।।
23_3.translation: With his frown, his face looked frightening like the face of a lion provoked.
23_3.word_by_word: तदा then, दुष्प्रतिवीक्षम् frightening to look at, भ्रुकुटी सहितम् with frown, तत् that, तस्य his, मुखम् face, क्रुद्धस्य of angry ones, सिंहस्य of a lion, सदृशम् similar, बभौ shone.

23_4.shloka: अग्रहस्तं विधुन्वंस्तु हस्ती हस्तमिवात्मनः।तिर्यगूर्ध्वं शरीरे च पातयित्वा शिरोधराम्।।2.23.4।।अग्राक्ष्णा वीक्षमाणस्तु तिर्यग्भ्रातरमब्रवीत्।
23_4.translation: Shaking his forearm like an elephant raising its trunk, moving his neck horizontally and vertically and casting a pointed and oblique look at his brother, Lakshmana said:
23_4.word_by_word: हस्ती elephant, आत्मनः its own, हस्तम् इव like its trunk, अग्रहस्तम् forearm, विधुन्वन् shaking, शिरोधराम् neck, शरीरे in the body, तिर्यक् horizontally, ऊर्ध्वंच upward, पातयित्वा casting, अग्राक्ष्णा with pointed look, भ्रातरम् to brother, तिर्यक् obliquely, वीक्षमाणः looking, अब्रवीत् said.

23_5.shloka: अस्थाने सम्भ्रमो यस्य जातो वै सुमहानयम्।।2.23.5।।धर्मदोष प्रसङ्गेन लोकस्यानतिशङ्कया।कथंह्येतदसम्भ्रान्तस्त्वद्विधो वक्तुमर्हति।।2.23.6।।यथा दैवमशौडीरं शौण्डीर क्षत्रियर्षभ।
23_5.translation: O Rama, the greatest among the brave kshatriyas you say this because of your fear that (by disobeying father's command) harm will be done to righteousness. This great haste is unwarranted for there is the least apprehension about people's verdict (in favour of exile). How do you, of all persons, speak about destiny as allpowerful in these circumstances when it is powerless?
23_5.word_by_word: शौण्डीर क्षत्रियर्षभ great among brave kshatriyas, यस्य whose, धर्मदोषप्रसङ्गेन (your) stand that harm will be done to  righteousness, लोकस्य of the world, अनतिशङ्कया apprehending verdict in favour of exile, अस्थाने at improper time, अयम् this, सुमहान् great, सम्भ्रमः haste, जातः वै was born, त्वद्विधः men such as you are, असम्भ्रान्तः without apprehension, अशौण्डीरम् devoid of strength, दैवम् destiny, यथा as, एतत् all this, कथम् how, वक्तुम् to tell, अर्हति is fit for you.

23_6.shloka: किन्नाम कृपणं दैवमशक्तमभिशंससि।।2.23.7।।पापयोस्ते कथं नाम तयोश्शङ्का न विद्यते।
23_6.translation: Why do you extol this pitiable and powerless destiny? Why don't you doubt those two vicious persons (Dasaratha and Kaikeyi)?
23_6.word_by_word: कृपणम् pitiable, अशक्तम् powerless, दैवम् destiny, किम् नाम what for, अभिशंससि you are extoling, पापयोः of two vicious people, तयोः of both of them, ते to you, शङ्का apprehension, कथं नाम how, न विद्यते does not arise.

23_7.shloka: सन्ति धर्मोपधा श्लक्ष्णाः धर्मात्मन्किं न बुध्यसे।।2.23.8।।तयोस्सुचरितं स्वार्थं शाठ्यात्परिजिहीर्षतोः।
23_7.translation: Why don't you realise, O virtuous one that there are soft means of creating hindrances in their plan without trangressing dharma. You know dharma. Why don't you understand that their acts of deception wear the guise of dharma?
23_7.word_by_word: धर्मात्मन् O virtuous one, शाठ्यात् perfidiously, स्वार्थम् for selfish ends, सुचरितम् of good conduct, परिजिहीर्षतोः for both of them repudiating, तयोः of both of them, श्लक्ष्णाः soft ones, धर्मोपधा acts of deception in the guise of righteousness, सन्ति exist, किं why, न बुध्यसे do you not know.

23_8.shloka: यदि नैवं व्यवसितं स्याद्धि प्रागेव राघव।।2.23.9।।तयोः प्रागेव दत्तश्च स्याद्वरः प्रकृतश्च सः।
23_8.translation: If both of them had not decided before, O Rama the boon granted to Kaikeyi naturally would have been fulfilled long ago.
23_8.word_by_word: राघव O Rama, प्रागेव even before, तयोः their own, व्यवसितम् decision, एवम् in this way, न स्याद्धि if it was not like that, प्रकृतः by nature, सः that, वरः boon, प्रागेव दत्तः स्यात् would have been given long before.

23_9.shloka: लोकविद्विष्टमारब्धं त्वदन्यस्याभिषेचनम्।नोत्सहे सहितुं वीर तत्र मे क्षन्तुमर्हसि।।2.23.10।।
23_9.translation: The consecration of any one other than you, O valiant one is universally detested. I do not want to tolerate (this act). You should pardon me in this matter.
23_9.word_by_word: वीर O valiant one, लोकविद्विष्टम् universally detested, आरब्धम् commenced, त्वदन्यस्य anyone other than you, अभिषेचनम् consecration, सहितुम् to tolerate, नोत्सहे I do not desire, तत्र in this matter, मे to me, क्षन्तुम् pardon, अर्हसि it behoves you.

23_10.shloka: येनेय मागता द्वैधं तव बुद्धिर्महामते।स हि धर्मो मम द्वेष्यः प्रसङ्गाद्यस्य मुह्यसि।।2.23.11।।
23_10.translation: O noble minded one I hate this righteousness which has deluded your intellect and created this dilemma about this issue.
23_10.word_by_word: महामते O nobleminded one, येन by which, तव your, (इदम् this), बुद्धि: intellect, द्वैधम् dilemma, आगता attained, यस्य whose, प्रसङ्गात् concern, मुह्यसि you are deluded, सः धर्मः that righteousness, मम to me, द्वेष्यः deserve to be hated.

23_11.shloka: कथं त्वं कर्मणा शक्तः कैकेयीवशवर्तिनः।करिष्यसि पितुर्वाक्यमधर्मिष्ठं विगर्हितम्।।2.23.12।।
23_11.translation: When you are able to counter (this move), why do you want to execute the unjustifiable and contemptible words of the king who is under the spell of Kaikeyi?
23_11.word_by_word: कर्मणा by your act, शक्तः being powerful, त्वम् you, कैकेयीवशवर्तिनः who is under the influence of Kaikeyi, पितुः father's, अधर्मिष्ठम् unjustifiable, विगर्हितम् contemptible, वाक्यम् words, कथम् how, करिष्यसि can you carry out?

23_12.shloka: यद्ययं किल्बिषाद्भेदः कृतोऽप्येवं न गृह्यते।जायते तत्र मे दुःखं धर्मसङ्गश्च गर्हितः।।2.23.13।।
23_12.translation: I am grieved that even though this plot has been hatched by a treacherous mind, you are not taking it in the right perspective. Censurable is adherence to virtue.
23_12.word_by_word: अयम् this, भेदः treachery, किल्बिषात् out of guilty mind, कृतोऽपि even done, एवम् in this way, न गृह्यते यदि is not taken in its right sense, तत्र in that matter, मे to me, दुःखम् grief, जायते is arising, धर्मसङ्गश्च attachment to virtue, गर्हितः is censurable.

23_13.shloka: मनसाऽपि कथं कामं कुर्यास्त्वं कामवृत्तयोः।तयोस्त्वहितयोर्नित्यं शत्र्वोः पित्रभिधानयोः।।2.23.14।।
23_13.translation: As both of them are steeped in passion, they never thought of your wellbeing. How will you fulfil the wishes of these enemies miscalled parents?
23_13.word_by_word: कामवृत्तयोः of both steeped in passion, नित्यम् always, अहितयोः of both hostile, पित्रभिधानयोः known as parents, शत्र्वोः enemies, कामम् passion, त्वम् you, मनसा अपि even in mind, कथम् how, कुर्याः will you carry out?

23_14.shloka: यद्यपि प्रतिपत्तिस्ते दैवी चापि तयोर्मतम्।तथाप्युपेक्षणीयं ते न मे तदपि रोचते।।2.23.15।।
23_14.translation: It might be your opinion that their dictate is the decree of destiny. Even then, it does not satisfy me. It (destiny) should be ignored.
23_14.word_by_word: तयोः of both of them, प्रतिपत्ति: dictates, दैवी च is the decree of destiny, ते your, मतं यद्यपि even if it is your opinion, तथापि even then, तदपि that one also, ते to you, उपेक्षणीयम् should be ignored, न रोचते it does not please me.

23_15.shloka: विक्लबो वीर्यहीनो यस्स दैवमनुवर्तते।वीरास्सम्भावितात्मानो न दैवं पर्युपासते।।2.23.16।।
23_15.translation: Those who are timid and cowardly alone depend on destiny.The valiant with ofselfrespect will not accept it.
23_15.word_by_word: यः who, विक्लबः timid, वीर्यहीनः weak, सः that one, दैवम् the destiny, अनुवर्तते follows, सम्भावितात्मानः respected souls, वीराः the valiant, दैवम् destiny, न पर्युपासते do not depend upon.

23_16.shloka: दैवं पुरुषकारेण यः समर्थः प्रबाधितुम्।न दैवेन विपन्नार्थः पुरुषस्सोऽवसीदति।।2.23.17।।
23_16.translation: In the case of one capable of striking destiny with human efforts it cannot defeat his objective and bring him despondency.
23_16.word_by_word: यः पुरुषः such a  man, पुरुषकारेण with human effort, दैवम् destiny, प्रबाधितुम् to strike,  समर्थः is capable, सः he, दैवेन by destiny, विपन्नार्थः with defeated objectives, न अवसीदति will not grieve.

23_17.shloka: द्रक्ष्यन्ति त्वद्य दैवस्य पौरुषं पुरुषस्य च।दैवमानुषयोरद्य व्यक्ता व्यक्तिर्भविष्यति।।2.23.18।।
23_17.translation: Today all will witness the power of destiny and the power of man. The difference between man and destiny will be manifested today.
23_17.word_by_word: अद्य today, दैवस्य destiny's, पुरुषस्य च also man's, पौरुषम् power, द्रक्ष्यन्ति will see, अद्य today, दैवमानुषयोः of destiny and man, व्यक्तिः difference, व्यक्ता will manifest, भविष्यति will become.

23_18.shloka: अद्य मत्पौरुषहतं दैवं द्रक्ष्यन्ति वै जनाः।यद्दैवादाहतं तेऽद्य दृष्टं राज्याभिषेचनम्।।2.23.19।।
23_18.translation: Today people will see destiny defeated by my valour just as they saw your consecration defeated (obstructed) by destiny.
23_18.word_by_word: अद्य today, ते your, राज्याभिषेचनम् installation as heirapparent, यद्दैवात् by which divinity, आहतम् as prevented, दृष्टम् has been seen, दैवम् destiny, अद्य today, जनाः people, मत्पौरुषहतम् defeated by my valour, द्रक्ष्यन्ति वै shall witness.

23_19.shloka: अत्यङ्कुशमिवोद्दामं गजं मदबलोद्धतम्।प्रधावितमहं दैवं पौरुषेण निवर्तये।।2.23.20।।
23_19.translation: I will make destiny, the elephant, running wild on the strength of the rut, unmanageable (even) by the goad, turn back with my valour.
23_19.word_by_word: अहम् I, अत्यङ्कुशम् unmanageable by the goad, उद्दामम् unrestrained, मदबलोद्धतम् uncontrollable through the strongth of nut, प्रधावितम् running away, गजम् इव like an elephant, दैवम् destiny, पौरुषेण with valour, निवर्तये I will turn back.

23_20.shloka: लोकपालास्समस्ता स्ते नाद्य रामाभिषेचनम्।न च कृत्स्नास्त्रयो लोका विहन्युः किं पुनः पिता।।2.23.21।।
23_20.translation: All the guardians of the quarters and all the three worlds united cannot prevent the consecration of Rama today, what to speak of our father (king Dasaratha).
23_20.word_by_word: अद्य today, ते those, समस्ताः all, लोकपालाः guardians of the quarters, रामाभिषेचनम् consecration of Rama, न विहन्युः cannot obstruct, कृत्स्नाः all, त्रयः लोकाः च the three worlds, न cannot, पिता father, किं पुनः needless to say again.

23_21.shloka: यैर्निवासस्तवारण्ये मिथो राजन्समर्थितः।अरण्ये ते निवत्स्यन्ति चतुर्दश समास्तथा।।2.23.22।।
23_21.translation: O king those who, with mutual support banished you to the forest, will themselves  dwell in the forest for fourteen years.
23_21.word_by_word: राजन् O king, यैः by whom, अरण्ये in the forest, तव your, निवासः live, मिथः mutual, समर्थितः support, ते they, तथा in the same way, चतुर्दश समाः fourteen years, अरण्ये in the forest,निवत्स्यन्ति they shall reside.

23_22.shloka: अहं तदाशां छेत्स्यामि पितुस्तस्याश्च या तव।अभिषेकविघातेन पुत्रराज्याय वर्तते।।2.23.23।।
23_22.translation: Therefore, I shall frustrate the desire of father and of  Kaikeyi who plans the kingdom for her son by obstructing your consecration.
23_22.word_by_word: तत् for that reason, अहम् I, पितुः father's, या Kaikeyi, तव your, अभिषेकविघातेन by obstructing your consecration, पुत्रराज्याय the kingdom for her son, वर्तते is intending, तस्याश्च her, आशाम् desire, छेत्स्यामि I will break asunder.

23_23.shloka: मद्बलेन विरुद्धाय न स्याद्दैवबलं तथा।प्रभविष्यति दुःखाय यथोग्रं पौरुषं मम।।2.23.24।।
23_23.translation: Any one who opposes my terrible valour will come to grief. The power of destiny will not cause that much sorrow as my valour will.
23_23.word_by_word: मद्बलेन with my valour, विरुद्धाय any one who opposes, उग्रम् terrible, मम पौरुषम् my valour, यथा how, दुःखाय for sorrow, प्रभविष्यति will result, तथा like that, दैव बलम् the power  of destiny, न स्यात् may not be.

23_24.shloka: ऊर्ध्वं वर्षसहस्रान्ते प्रजापाल्यमनन्तरम्।आर्यपुत्राः करिष्यन्ति वनवासं गते त्वयि।।2.23.25।।
23_24.translation: When after ruling the subjects for a thousand years you withdraw into the forest (for yativrata) your sons will rule them.
23_24.word_by_word: प्रजापाल्यमनन्तरं afte ruling the subjects, वर्ष सहस्रान्ते after a thousand years, त्वयि you, वनवासं गते after you have withdrawn to the forest, आर्यपुत्राः your sons, करिष्यन्ति will rule them.

23_25.shloka: पूर्वं राजर्षिवृत्त्या हि वनवासो विधीयते।प्रजा निक्षिप्य पुत्रेषु पुत्रवत्परिपालने।।2.23.26।।
23_25.translation: Leaving their sons to look after the subjects as their own children, the rajarsis in  ancient times used to retire into the forest as per practice.
23_25.word_by_word: पुत्रेषु in sons, प्रजाः subjects, पुत्रवत् like sons, परिपालने in ruling, निक्षिप्य after entrusting, वनवासः retiring into the forest, पूर्वं राजर्षिवृत्त्या as rajarsis did in ancient times, विधीयते हि is established.

23_26.shloka: स चेद्राजन्यनेकाग्रे राज्यविभ्रमशङ्कया।नैवमिच्छसि धर्मात्मन् राज्यं राम त्वमात्मनि।।2.23.27।।प्रतिजाने च ते वीर माऽभूवं वीरलोकभाक्।राज्यं च तव रक्षेयमहं वेलेव सागरम्।।2.23.28।।
23_26.translation: O righteous one, if you apprehend chaos in the kingdom for want of wholehearted support from the (feudatory) kings then, O my valiant brother, I swear to you, I will protect your kingdom like the shore protecting the ocean. Or else, I shall never attain the afterworld of heroes.
23_26.word_by_word: धर्मात्मन् O righteous one, राम Rama, राजनि when the king, अनेकाग्रे in many directions (and unable to decide), राज्यविभ्रमशङ्कया with apprehension that disturbances  in the kingdom will arise, सः त्वम् such you, एवम् in this way, राज्यम् kingdom, आत्मनि to you, न इच्छसि चेत् if it is not desired, ते to you, प्रतिजाने च I am swearing, वीर O valient one, वीरलोकभाक् attaining the afterworld of heroes, माऽभूवम् let it not be my fate, अहम् I, वेला shore, सागरम् इव like ocean, तव your, राज्यम् kingdom, रक्षेयम् I will protect.

23_27.shloka: मङ्गलैरभिषिञ्चस्व तत्र त्वं व्यापृतो भव।अहमेको महीपालानलं वारयितुं बलात्।।2.23.29।।
23_27.translation: The consecration may be performed with these auspicious materials. I am alone capable of facing these kings with my valour.
23_27.word_by_word: त्वम् you, मङ्गलैः with auspicious materials, अभिषिञ्चस्व you may continue the consecration ceremony, तत्र in this matter, व्यापृतः getting engaged in, भव become, अहम् I, एकः singlehanded, बलात् by my valour, महीपालान् the kings, वारयितुम् to prevent, अलम् am competent.

23_28.shloka: न शोभार्थाविमौ बाहू न धनुर्भूषणाय मे।नाऽसिराबन्धनार्थाय न शरास्तम्भहेतवः।।2.23.30।।अमित्रदमनार्थं मे सर्वमेतच्चतुष्टयम्।
23_28.translation: These my arms are not intended to enhance the beauty (of my body). This bow is not for decoration. The sword is not for the sake of strapping my waist. The arrows are not meant to be fixed to my quiver. All these four are meant for taming my enemies.
23_28.word_by_word: इमौ this, मे बाहू my two arms, शोभार्थौ for purposes of enhancing beauty, न not, धनुः bow, भूषणाय for decorating, न not, असिः sword, आबन्धनार्थाय for fastening on my waist, न not, शराः arrows, स्तम्भहेतवः remain fixed, न not, मे my, सर्वम् all this, एतत् this, चतुष्टयम् four weapons, अमित्रदमनार्थम् only for subduing enemies.

23_29.shloka: न चाहं कामयेऽत्यर्थं यस्स्याच्छत्रुर्मतो मम।।2.23.31।।असिना तीक्ष्णधारेण विद्युच्चलितवर्चसा।प्रगृहीतेन वै शत्रुं वज्रिणं वा न कल्पये।।2.23.32।।
23_29.translation: Any one who turns my enemy will not be allowed to remain alive. Holding my sharpedged sword, lustrous as a flash of lightning, I shall  exterminate my enemy even if it were Indra, the bearer of thunder.
23_29.word_by_word: अहम् I, यः who, मम my, शत्रुः as enemy, मतः स्यात् is considered, अत्यर्थम् exceedingly, न कामये I do not desire (to endure), तीक्ष्णधारेण with a sharpedged, विद्युच्चलितवर्चसा with the  lustre of flashing lightning, प्रगृहीतेन by holding, असिना with sword, शत्रुम् to the enemy, वज्रिणं वा or Indra, (bearer of thunder), न कल्पये will not spare.

23_30.translation: This entire earth will become impenetrable and impassable, scattered with the trunks, thighs and heads of elephants, horses and warriors hacked off with my sword.
23_30.word_by_word: मे my, खड्गनिष्पेषनिष्पिष्टैः by those hacked off with the sword, हस्त्यश्वनरहस्तोरुशिरोभिः with trunks of elephants, horses, hands, thighs and heads of warriors, मही the earth, गहना impenetrable, दुश्चरा impassable, भविता shall become.

23_31.shloka: खड्गधाराहता मेऽद्य दीप्यमाना इवाद्रयः।पतिष्यन्ति द्विपा भूमौ मेघा इव सविद्युतः।।2.23.34।।
23_31.translation: The elephants, struck by the blows of my sword, will fall on earth like mountains engulfed in flames and like clouds with lightning.
23_31.word_by_word: अद्य now, (हया: horses), मे my, खङ्गधाराहताः struck by the blows of my sword, दीप्यमानाः burning, अद्रय इव like mountains, सविद्युतः with lightning, मेघा इव like clouds, भूमौ on the earth, पतिष्यन्ति will fall down.

23_32.shloka: बद्धगोधाङ्गुलित्राणे प्रगृहीतशरासने।कथं पुरुषमानी स्यात्पुरुषाणां मयि स्थिते।।2.23.35।।
23_32.translation: When I stand before men (enemies) wearing godha and fingerprotector, holding the bow ready, who amongst men will boast of his manliness?
23_32.word_by_word: मयि when I, बद्धगोधाङ्गुलित्राणे while donning the godha (a leather fence fastened round the left arm to prevent injury from the bowstring) and fingerprotector (a contrivancelike a thimble used by archers to protect the thumb or finger from being injured by bowstring), प्रगृहीतशरासने while holding the bow, स्थिते while I stand, पुरुषाणाम् among men, पुरुषमानी one who considers himself manly, कथम् how, स्यात् will it be.

23_33.translation: Striking each of my foes with many arrows and many with one arrow, I shall aim them at the vitals of men, horses and elephants.
23_33.word_by_word: अहम् I, बहुभिः with many (arrows), एकम् only one, अत्यस्यन् striking and throwing, एकेन with one arrow, बहून् जनान् (striking) many men, बाणान् arrows, नृवाजिगजमर्मसु at the vitals of men, horses and elephants, विनियोक्ष्यामि I will aim at.

23_34.shloka: अद्य मेऽस्त्रप्रभावस्य प्रभावः प्रभविष्यति।राज्ञश्चाप्रभुतां कर्तुं प्रभुत्वं तव च प्रभोः।।2.23.37।।
23_34.translation: O Lord today you shall see the power of my glorious weapons in depriving the king (Dasaratha) of his authority and establishing your supremacy over the kingdom.
23_34.word_by_word: प्रभो O Lord, अद्य today, मे my, अस्त्रप्रभावस्य of glorious weapons, प्रभावः strength, राज्ञः of the king (Dasaratha), अप्रभुताम् having no power over the kingdom, तव your, प्रभुत्वं च  supremacy over the kingdom, कर्तुम् to make, प्रभविष्यति is competent.

23_35.shloka: अद्य चन्दनसारस्य केयूरामोक्षणस्य च।वसूनां च विमोक्षस्य सुहृदां पालनस्य च।।2.23.38।।अनुरूपाविमौ बाहू राम कर्म करिष्यतः।अभिषेचनविघ्नस्य कर्तृ़णां ते निवारणे।।2.23.39।।
23_35.translation: These arms, O Rama which are fit for sandalwood cream, for wearing armlets, for distributing wealth and for protecting friends, will perform the worthy act of subduing those who are creating obstruction to your consecration.
23_35.word_by_word: राम O Rama , अद्य today, चन्दन सारस्य of sandalwood cream, केयूरामोक्षणस्य of wearing armlets, वसूनाम् of wealth, विमोक्षस्य for distributing, सुहृदाम् friends, पालनस्य for protection, अनुरूपौ worthy, इमौ these (hands), ते your, अभिषेचनविघ्नस्य obstruction to your consecration, कर्तृ़णाम् those who are causing, निवारणे in preventing, कर्म act, करिष्यतः will take up.

23_36.shloka: ब्रवीहि कोऽद्यैव मया वियुज्यताम्तवा सुहृत्प्राणयशस्सुहृज्जनैः।यथा तवेयं वसुधा वशे भवेत्तथैव मां शाधि तवास्मि किङ्करः।।2.23.40।।
23_36.translation: Tell me your enemy who should be deprived of his life, fame and friends. Command me as to how this earth shall come under your control. Now itself I shall do that. I am your servant.
23_36.word_by_word: तव your, असुहृत् enemy, कः who, अद्यैव now itself, मया by me, प्राणयशस्सुहृज्जनैः with life, fame and friends, वियुज्यताम् shall be separated, ब्रवीहि you may tell me, इयम् this, वसुधा earth, यथा how, तव your, वशे under control, भवेत् shall come under, तथैव in the way, माम् me, शाधि you may command, तव your, किङ्करः servant, अस्मि I am.

23_37.shloka: विमृज्य बाष्पं परिसान्त्व्यचासकृत्स लक्ष्मणं राघववंशवर्धनः।उवाच पित्र्ये वचने व्यवस्थितंनिबोध मामेष हि सौम्य सत्पथः।।2.23.41।।
23_37.translation: Wiping the tears again and again and having consoled Lakshmana for more than once, Rama, the enhancer of the glory of the Raghu dynasty said, O handsome one know, for sure, that I am firm in abiding by the words of our father. This is the true path (for me).इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे त्रयोविंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the twentythird sarga of Ayodhyakanda of  the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
23_37.word_by_word: सः that, राघववंशवर्धनः source of prosperity for the Raghu dynastry, Rama, बाष्पम् tears, विमृज्य wiping, असकृत् again and again, परिसान्त्व्य च consoling, लक्ष्मणम् addressing Lakshmana, उवाच said, सौम्य O gentle one (Lakshmana), माम् me, पित्र्ये to father, वचने words, व्यवस्थितम् abiding, निबोध you may know, एषः that, सत्पथः हि is the right path.

24_1.shloka: [Kausalya insists on Rama to take her along with him to the forest --Rama tells her that service to one's husband is the supreme virtue--Kauslaya allows Rama to proceed.]तं समीक्ष्य त्ववहितं पितुर्निर्देश पालने।कौशल्या बाष्पसंरुद्धा वचो धर्मिष्ठमब्रवीत्।।2.24.1।।
24_1.translation: Having perceived that Rama was determined to carry out his father's command, Kausalya with her throat choked with tears said these words of piety:
24_1.word_by_word: तम् him, पितुः father's, निर्देशपालने in carrying out the command, अवहितम्  determined, समीक्ष्य having perceived, कौशल्या Kausalya, बाष्पसंरुध्दा with choked tears, धर्मिष्ठम् pious, वचः words, अब्रवीत् said.

24_2.shloka: अदृष्टदुःखो धर्मात्मा सर्वभूतप्रियंवदः।मयि जातो दशरथात्कथमुञ्छेन वर्तयेत्।।2.24.2।।
24_2.translation: How will this righteous Rama, born to me through Dasaratha, who speaks pleasantly to all, and who has not experienced any sorrow before live on the grains gleaned?
24_2.word_by_word: अदृष्टदुःखः one who had never experienced sorrow, धर्मात्मा righteous, सर्वभूतप्रियंवदः one who speaks pleasantly to all, दशरथात् of Dasaratha, मयि to me, जातः born, उञ्छेन by collecting the grains fallen on the ground, कथम् how, वर्तयेत् will maintain.

24_3.shloka: यस्य भृत्याश्च दासाश्च मृष्टान्यन्नानि भुञ्जते।कथं स भोक्ष्यतेऽनाथो वने मूलफलान्ययम्।।2.24.3।।
24_3.translation: How will Rama live on roots and fruits in the forest hereafter when his servants and attendants enjoy delicious food (here)?
24_3.word_by_word: यस्य whose, भृत्याश्च servants,दासाश्च attendants, मृष्टानि delicious, अन्नानि cooked rice,भुञ्जते enjoy, अथः hereafter, सः अयम् such Rama, वने in the forest, मूलफलानि roots and fruits, कथम् how, भोक्ष्यते will eat?

24_4.shloka: कः एतच्छ्रद्दधेच्छ्रुत्वा कस्य वा न भवेद्भयम्।गुणवान्दयितो राज्ञा राघवो यद्विवास्यते।।2.24.4।।
24_4.translation: Who will believe that the virtuous and affectionate scion of the Raghus is exiled this way by the king? Who will not tremble in fear to hear this?
24_4.word_by_word: गुणवान् virtuous, दयितः affectionate, राघवः Rama, राज्ञा by the king, विवास्यते इति यत् will be exiled in this way, एतत् all this, श्रुत्वा having heard,  कः who, श्रद्धधेत् will believe,  कस्य वा to whom, भयम् fear, न भवेत् will not cause.

24_5.shloka: नूनं तु बलवान् लोके कृतान्तस्सर्वमादिशन्।लोके रामाभिरामस्त्वं वनं यत्र गमिष्यसि।।2.24.5।।
24_5.translation: O Rama if you, being the delight of the world, are (ordered) to go to the forest, ithas to be said certainly that destiny which rules everything is allpowerful.
24_5.word_by_word: राम O Rama, लोके अभिरामः delight of this world, त्वम् you, वनम् to the forest, यत्र गमिष्यसि  if ordered to go, लोके in the world, सर्वम् everything,  आदिशन् while ordering, कृतान्तः destiny, नूनम् certainly, बलवान् allpowerful.

24_6.shloka: अयं तु मामात्मभव स्तवादर्शनमारुतः।विलापदुःखसमिधो रुदिताश्रुहुताहुतिः।।2.24.6।।चिन्ताबाष्पमहाधूमस्तवागमनचित्तजः।कर्शयित्वा भृशं पुत्र निश्वासायाससम्भवः।।2.24.7।।त्वया विहीनामिह मां शोकाग्निरतुलो महान्।प्रधक्ष्यति यथा कक्षं चित्रभानुर्हिमात्यये।।2.24.8।।
24_6.translation: After your departure, O son, an incomparably huge fire of grief with sighs of exhaustion will burst from my body, fanned by the wind of your absence and fuelled by lamentation and affliction. My wailing tears will be the oblations. My anxiety will be the great smoke rising vapour. This fire of grief will leave me very much emaciated and burn me like fire burns a forest of dead trees or a bunch of dry grass in summer.
24_6.word_by_word: पुत्र O son, आत्मभवः born from the body, तव अदर्शन मारुतः (my) sighs that will suggest your absence, विलापदुःखसमिधः with fuels of lamentation and affliction, रुदिताश्रुहुताहुतिः invoking with the offering of oblations of (my) wailing tears, चिन्ताबाष्पमहाधूमः with great  smoke of vapour arising from anxious thoughts, तव your, आगमन चित्तजः born from the thought of your return, निश्वासायाससम्भवः produced from sighs of exhaustion, अतुलः incomparable, महान् great, अयं शोकाग्नि: this fire of grief,  इह now, त्वया by you, विहीनाम्  deprived, माम् me, भृशम् very much, कर्शयित्वा having emaciated, हिमात्यये in summer, चित्रभानुः fire, कक्षं यथा like or a bunch of dry grass, प्रधक्ष्यति will burn.

24_7.shloka: कथं हि धेनु स्स्वं वत्सं गच्छन्तं नानुगच्छति।अहं त्वाऽनुगमिष्यामि यत्र पुत्र गमिष्यसि।।2.24.9.।।
24_7.translation: I shall follow you wherever you go, my son, like a cow following its calf. How is it possible for a cow not to follow its wandering calf?
24_7.word_by_word: धेनुः cow, गच्छन्तम् wandering, स्वं वत्सम् its calf, कथं हि how, नानुगच्छति will not follow, पुत्र son, यत्र whereever, गमिष्यसि you will go, अहम् I, त्वा you, अनुगमिष्यामि will follow.

24_8.shloka: तथा निगदितं मात्रा तद्वाक्यं पुरुषर्षभः।श्रुत्वा रामोऽब्रवीद्वाक्यं मातरं भृशदुःखिताम्।।2.24.10।।
24_8.translation: At these words of his mother who was deeply afflicted Rama, best among men replied:
24_8.word_by_word: पुरुषर्षभः best among men, रामः Rama, मात्रा by mother, तथा that way, निगदितम् spoken, तद्वाक्यम् those words, श्रुत्वा on hearing, भृशदुःखिताम् deeply afflicted, मातरम् addressing hismother, वाक्यम् words, अब्रवीत् said.

24_9.shloka: कैकेय्या वञ्चितो राजा मयि चारण्यमाश्रिते।भवत्या च परित्यक्तो न नूनं वर्तयिष्यति।।2.24.11।।
24_9.translation: The king was deceived by Kaikeyi. If you also desert him after I have gone to the forest, surely he will not live.
24_9.word_by_word: कैकेय्या by Kaikeyi, वञ्चितः was deceived, राजा king, मयि when I, अरण्यम् forest, आश्रिते will be resorting to, भवत्या च by you also, परित्यक्तः deserted, न वर्तयिष्यति he will not live, नूनम् this is certain.

24_10.shloka: भर्तुः किल परित्यागो नृशंसः केवलं स्त्रियाः।स भवत्या न कर्तव्यो मनसाऽपि विगर्हितः।।2.24.12।।
24_10.translation: For a woman, to desert her husband is a cruel act. You must not do that which is  contemptible even to think.
24_10.word_by_word: स्त्रियाः for a woman, भर्तुः husband's, परित्यागः desertion, केवलम् only, नृशंसः किल is a cruel  act indeed, विगर्हितः is abominable, सः that, भवत्या by you, मनसापि even in mind, न कर्तव्यः  must not be done.

24_11.shloka: यावज्जीवति काकुत्स्थः पिता मे जगतीपतिः।शुश्रूषा क्रियतां तावत्सहि धर्मस्सनातनः।।2.24.13।।
24_11.translation: As long as the king, my father, the lord of the earth, a descendant of Kakutshta lives, you shall serve him. This is eternal virtue (in a woman).
24_11.word_by_word: मे पिता my father, जगतीपतिः lord of the earth, काकुत्स्थः  the descendant of Kakutstha, यावत् as long as, जीवति lives, तावत् till then, शुश्रूषा service, क्रियताम् be done, सः that one, धर्मः हि सनातनः it is eternal virtue.

24_12.shloka: एवमुक्ता तु रामेण कौशल्या शुभदर्शना।तथेत्युवाच सुप्रीता राममक्लिष्टकारिणम्।।2.24.14।।
24_12.translation: At these words of Rama, unshakable in action, auspiciouslooking Kausalya, exceedingly pleased said 'Be it so'.
24_12.word_by_word: रामेण by Rama, एवम् thus, उक्ता having been said, शुभदर्शना auspiciouslooking lady, कौशल्या Kausalya, सुप्रीता exceedingly pleased, अक्लिष्टकारिणम् unshakable in actions, रामम् to Rama, तथेति 'Be it so', उवाच said.

24_13.shloka: एवमुक्तस्तु वचनं रामो धर्मभृतां वरः।भूयस्तामब्रवीद्वाक्यं मातरं भृशदुःखिताम्।।2.24.15।।
24_13.translation: Thus addressed, Rama, the foremost among upholders of righteousness, said to his mother who was in deep grief:
24_13.word_by_word: धर्मभृतां among upholders of rightcouness, वरः foremost, रामः Rama, एवम् in this way, वचनम् words, उक्तः having been spoken to, भृश दुःखिताम् in deep grief, ताम् her, मातरम् to mother, भूय: again, वाक्यम् words, अब्रवीत् said.

24_14.shloka: मया चैव भवत्या च कर्तव्यं वचनं पितुः।राजा भर्ता गुरु श्श्रेष्ठस्सर्वेषामीश्वरः प्रभुः।।2.24.16।।
24_14.translation: You and I should obey father's words. He is the king, supporter, preceptor, the best (among men) and  lord and master of all of us.
24_14.word_by_word: मया चैव by me as well, भवत्या च by you also, पितुः father's, वचनम् words, कर्तव्यम् fit to be carried out, राजा king, भर्ता supporter husband, गुरुः guru, श्रेष्ठः best, सर्वेषाम् for all, ईश्वरः is the lord, प्रभुः master.

24_15.shloka: इमानि तु महारण्ये विहृत्य नव पञ्च च।वर्षाणि परमप्रीतः स्थास्यामि वचने तव।।2.24.17।।
24_15.translation: Roaming the wild forest for fourteen years I shall abide by your words with supreme pleasure.
24_15.word_by_word: इमानि these, नव पञ्च च nine plus five (fourteen), वर्षाणि years, महारण्ये in the wild forest, विहृत्य having roamed, परमप्रीतः with supreme pleasure, तव your, वचने words (obeying your word), स्थास्यामि shall abide by.

24_16.shloka: एवमुक्ता प्रियं पुत्रं बाष्पपूर्णानना तदा।उवाच परमार्ता तु कौशल्या पुत्रवत्सला।।2.24.18।।
24_16.translation: Thus addressed by Rama, the affectionate Kausalya, deeply distressed, her eyes filled with tears, said to her beloved son:
24_16.word_by_word: तदा then, एवम् thus, उक्ता addressed, पुत्रवत्सला affectionate towards (her) son, कौशल्या Kausalya, परमार्ता a greatly distressed, बाष्पपूर्णानना with her face (eyes) filled with tears, प्रियम् beloved, पुत्रम् son, उवाच said.

24_17.shloka: आसां राम सपत्नीनां वस्तुं मध्ये न मे क्षमम्।नय मामपि काकुत्स्थ वनं वन्यां मृगीं यथा।।2.24.19।।यदि ते गमने बुद्धिः कृता पितुरपेक्षया।
24_17.translation: O Rama, I am not able to live in the midst of these cowives. O descendant of Kakutstha, if you have resolved to go to the forest as per the wishes of your father take mea wild deeralong with you into the forest.
24_17.word_by_word: राम O Rama, मे for me, आसाम् of these, सपत्नीनाम् of cowives, मध्ये in the midst of, वस्तुम्  to live, न क्षमम् not able, काकुत्स्थ scion of the Kakutstha race (Rama), पितुः with regard to your father, अपेक्षया with wish, गमने in going away, ते to you, बुद्धि: decision, कृता यदि if it is made, मामपि also me, वन्याम् relating to the forest (wild), मृगीं यथा like a female deer, वनम् to the forest, नय take me.

24_18.shloka: तां तथा रुदतीं रामो रुदन्वचनमब्रवीत्।।2.24.20।।जीवन्त्या हि स्त्रिया भर्ता दैवतं प्रभुरेव च
24_18.translation: Adding his tears to his mother's who was wailing Rama said As long as a woman lives, her husband is her god and also her lord (master).
24_18.word_by_word: रामः Rama, तथा that way, रुदतीम् wailing, ताम् to her, रुदन् while (himself) sobbing, वचनम् words, अब्रवीत् said, जीवन्त्या for a living lady, स्त्रियाः for a woman, भर्ता husband alone, दैवतम् is god, प्रभुरेव च is also lord (master).

24_19.shloka: भवत्या मम चैवाद्य राजा प्रभवति प्रभुः।न ह्यनाथा वयं राज्ञा लोकनाथेन धीमता।।2.24.21।।
24_19.translation: The powerful king has authority over you as well as over me. As long as he is the sagacious lord of the entire world, how can we be without a master?
24_19.word_by_word: प्रभुः powerful one, राजा king, अद्य now, भवत्याः for you, मम च for me also, प्रभवति has the authority to command, लोकनाथेन by lord of the entire world, धीमता by sagacious one, राज्ञा by king, वयम् we, अनाथाः without master, न हि are not.

24_20.shloka: भरतश्चापि धर्मात्मा सर्वभूतप्रियंवदः।भवतीमनुवर्तेत स हि धर्मरतस्सदा।।2.24.22।।
24_20.translation: Bharata, who is virtuous and speaks pleasantly to all beings and who is alwaysattached to righteousness will surely remain obedient to you.
24_20.word_by_word: धर्मात्मा virtuous, सर्वभूतप्रियंवदः who speaks pleasantly to all beings, भरतश्चापि Bharata also, भवतीम् you, अनुवर्तेत will follow, सः he, सदा always, धर्मरतः हि is attached to righteousness.

24_21.shloka: यथा मयि तु निष्क्रान्ते पुत्रशोकेन पार्थिवः।श्रमं नावाप्नुयात्किञ्चिदप्रमत्ता तथा कुरु।।2.24.23।।
24_21.translation: After my departure, you must see that the king is not  overpowered by grief for his son and struggles as little as possible.
24_21.word_by_word: मयि me, निष्क्रान्ते having departed to the forest, पार्थिवः king, पुत्रशोकेन with grief for his son, यथा how, किञ्चित् even a little, श्रमम् effort, न अवाप्नुयात् will not obtain, तथा in that way, अप्रमत्ता with attention, कुरु do.

24_22.shloka: दारुणश्चाप्ययं शोको यथैनं न विनाशयेत्।राज्ञो वृद्धस्य सततं हितं चर समाहिता।।2.24.24।।
24_22.translation: See that the old king does not succumb to this terrible grief. Serve him with a composed mind.
24_22.word_by_word: दारुणः terrible, अयं शोकः this  grief, एनम् him, यथा in a manner, न विनाशयेत् will not ruin (his health), समाहिता with composed mind, वृद्धस्य of the old, राज्ञः of the king, सततम् always, हितम् good, चर act.

24_23.shloka: व्रतोपवासनिरता या नारी परमोत्तमा।भर्तारं नानुवर्तेत सा तु पापगतिर्भवेत्।।2.24.25।।
24_23.translation: A woman may be highly pious engaged in vows and fastings, but if she does not follow her husband, she will be condemned to hell.
24_23.word_by_word: या नारी whichever woman, व्रतोपवासनिरता engaged in vows and fastings, परमोत्तमा highly pious, भर्तारम् husband, नानुवर्तेत does not follow, सा she, पापगतिः hell a, भवेत् will get.

24_24.shloka: भर्तु श्शुश्रूषया नारी लभते स्वर्गमुत्तमम्।अपि या निर्नमस्कारा निवृत्ता देवपूजनात्।।2.24.26।।
24_24.translation: A woman who serves her husband will attain the highest heaven even if she pays no homage to gods and abstains from worshipping them.
