24_24.word_by_word: या who, निर्नमस्कारा pays no respect, देवपूजनात् from worshipping gods, निवृत्ता has abstained, नारी अपि woman also, भर्तुः husband's, शुश्रूषया with service, उत्तमम् highest, स्वर्गम् heaven, लभते will attain.

24_25.shloka: शुश्रूषामेव कुर्वीत भर्तुः प्रियहिते रता।एष धर्मः पुरा दृष्टो लोके वेदे श्रुतः स्मृतः।।2.24.27।।
24_25.translation: A wife who serves her husband and who is engaged in doing good to him is righteous. This dharma exists in this world since ancient times, declared in the Vedas and the smritis.
24_25.word_by_word: भर्तुः husband's, प्रियहिते wellbeing, रता engaged, शुश्रूषामेव service alone, कुर्वीत shall do, एषः this, पुरा in ancient times, लोके in this world, दृष्टः is seen, वेदे in the Vedas, श्रुतः is heard, स्मृतः declared in Smritis, धर्मः is truth.

24_26.shloka: अग्निकार्येषु च सदा सुमनोभिश्च देवताः।पूज्यास्ते मत्कृते देवि बाह्मणाश्चैव सुव्रताः।।2.24.28।।
24_26.translation: For my sake, O devi worship the firegod with offerings of oblations and flowers, and brahmins who are true to religious vows.
24_26.word_by_word: देवि O devi, मत्कृते for my sake, सदा always, देवताः the gods, अग्निकार्येषु in offering oblations to the firegod, सुमनोभिश्च with flowers, ते to you, पूज्याः worthy of worship, सुव्रताः true to their religious vows, ब्राह्मणाश्चैव brahmins also.

24_27.shloka: एवं कालं प्रतीक्षस्व ममागमनकाङ्क्षिणी।नियता नियताहारा भर्तृशुश्रूषणे रता।।2.24.29।।
24_27.translation: Looking forward to my return, spend your time this way with moderate intake, a mind under control and a life devoted to the service of your husband.
24_27.word_by_word: एवम् in this maner, मम my, आगमनकाङ्क्षिणी looking forward to my return, नियता selfpossessed lady, नियताहारा observing discipine in food, भर्तृ शुश्रूषणे in the service of your husband, रता devoted, कालम् time, प्रतीक्षस्व wait for.

24_28.shloka: प्राप्स्यसे परमं कामं मयि प्रत्यागते सति।यदि धर्मभृतां श्रेष्ठो धारयिष्यति जीवितम्।।2.24.30।।
24_28.translation: If my father, who is the best among the upholders of righteousness, survives till I come back, you will have your highest desires fulfilled.
24_28.word_by_word: मयि when I, प्रत्यागते सति having returned, धर्मभृताम् of protcetor of dharma, श्रेष्ठः best, जीवितम् life, धारयिष्यति यदि if  he contains, परमम् highest, कामम् desire, प्राप्स्यसे will obtain.

24_29.shloka: एवमुक्ता तु रामेण बाष्पपर्याकुलेक्षणा।कौशल्या पुत्रशोकार्ता रामं वचनमब्रवीत्।।2.24.31।।
24_29.translation: To these words of Rama, Kausalya, distressed with grief for her son, replied with her eyes filled with tears:
24_29.word_by_word: रामेण by Rama, एवम् in this manner, उक्ता having been said, कौशल्या Kausalya, पुत्रशोकार्ता distressed with grief for her son, बाष्पपर्याकुलेक्षणा with her eyes filled with tears, रामम् toRama, वचनम् these words, अब्रवीत् said.

24_30.shloka: गमने सुकृतां बुद्धिं न ते शक्नोमि पुत्रक।विनिवर्तयितुं वीर नूनं कालो दुरत्ययः।।2.24.32।।
24_30.translation: I am unable to dissuade you, O my brave son, from your firm resolve to go to the forest. It is surely difficult (for me) to bide time.
24_30.word_by_word: वीर O valiant one, पुत्रक my child, गमने to go to the forest, सुकृताम् firmly resolved, ते बुध्दिम् your mind, विनिवर्तयितुम् to revert, न शक्नोमि I am not able, नूनम् certainly, कालः time, दुरत्ययः difficult to overcome (pass).

24_31.shloka: गच्छ पुत्र त्वमेकाग्रो भद्रं तेऽस्तु सदा विभुः।पुनस्त्वयि निवृत्ते तु भविष्यामि गतव्यथा।।2.24.33।।
24_31.translation: Go with a steadfast mind, O my son May god be gracious. Only with your return, I shall be relieved of my suffering.
24_31.word_by_word: पुत्र O Son त्वम् you, एकाग्रः with resolute mind, गच्छ go, विभुः god, ते to you, सदा always, भद्रम् safety, अस्तु be it, त्वयि when you, पुनः again, निवृत्ते तु on your coming back,  गतव्यथा relieved of suffering, भविष्यामि I shall become.

24_32.shloka: प्रत्यागते महाभागे कृतार्थे चरितव्रते।पितुरानृण्यतां प्राप्ते त्वयि लप्स्ये परं सुखम्।।2.24.34।।
24_32.translation: O reverend one, when you come back after having accomplished your purpose, performed your vows and acquitted yourself of the debt you owe your father, I shall attain supreme happiness.
24_32.word_by_word: महाभागे when the reverend one, त्वयि you, कृतार्थे with your purpose accomplished, चरितव्रते when your vow is fulfilled, पितुः father's, आनृण्यताम् acquittal of debt, प्राप्ते obtained, प्रत्यागते on coming back, परम् supreme, सुखम् happiness, लप्स्ये I will attain.

24_33.shloka: कृतान्तस्य गतिः पुत्र दुर्विभाव्या सदा भुवि।यस्त्वां सञ्चोदयति मे वच आच्छिद्य राघव।।2.24.35।।
24_33.translation: O Rama inconceivable is the course of destiny which is inciting you to go to the forest disregarding my words.
24_33.word_by_word: पुत्र O son, राघव O Rama, यः whichever (destiny), मे my, वचः words, आच्छिद्य  cuttingasunder (disregarding), त्वा you, सञ्चोदयति is prompting, कृतान्तस्य destiny's, गतिः course, सदा always, भुवि in this world, दुर्विभाव्या is inconceivable.

24_34.shloka: गच्छेदानीं महाबाहो क्षेमेण पुनरागतः।नन्दयिष्यसि मां पुत्र साम्ना वाक्येन चारुणा।।2.24.36।।
24_34.translation: Go now, O my mightyarmed son and come back safe. And on your return, delight me with your sweet, gentle utterances.
24_34.word_by_word: महाबाहो O mighty armed one, इदानीम् now, गच्छ go, पुत्र O son, क्षेमेण safely, पुनः आगतः again on your return, साम्ना in a gentle voice, चारुणा by sweet, वाक्येन  utterances, माम् me, नन्दयिष्यसि please.

24_35.shloka: अपीदानीं स कालस्स्याद्वनात्प्रत्यागतं पुनः।यत्त्वां पुत्रक पश्येयं जटावल्कलधारिणम्।।2.24.37।।
24_35.translation: O my dear child, how pleasing would it be, if today were to be the day of your returnfrom the forest when I can see you wearing matted hair and robes of bark
24_35.word_by_word: पुत्रक O my dear child, वनात् from the forest, पुनः again, प्रत्यागतम् have returned, जटावल्कल  धारिणम् wearing matted hair and bark, त्वाम् you, यत् since, पश्येयम् will see, सः कालः that time, इदानीम् now itself, अपि स्यात् can it be now itself?

24_36.shloka: तथा हि रामं वनवासनिश्चितंसमीक्ष्य देवी परमेण चेतसा।उवाच रामं शुभलक्षणं वचोबभूव च स्वस्त्ययनाभिकाङ्क्षिणी।।2.24.38।।
24_36.translation: Seeing Rama full of auspicious qualities resolved to go to the forest and having spoken to him with the fullness of her heart, Devi Kausalya now braced herself up to perform ceremonies in the interest of  Rama's wellbeing.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे चतुर्विंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the twentyfourth sarga of Ayodhyakanda of  the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
24_36.word_by_word: देवी Devi (Kausalya), रामम् Rama, तथा like that, वनवासनिश्चितम् determined to go to the forest, समीक्ष्य (ददर्श) seeing, परमेण चेतसा with supreme consciousness, शुभलक्षणम् with auspicious qualities (virtues), रामम् to Rama, वचः words, उवाच said, स्वस्त्ययनाभिकाङ्क्षिणी wishing to perform ceremonies for (his) wellbeing, बभूव became.

25_1.shloka: [Kausalya performs benedictory rites for Rama and offers prayers to all gods to protect him Rama departs for the palace of Sita.]साऽवनीय तमायासमुपस्पृश्य जलं शुचिः।चकार माता रामस्य मङ्गलानि मनस्विनी।।2.25.1।।
25_1.translation: Highminded mother Kausalya, her anguish subdued, performed the sipping rite (achamana) and her self rendered pure, performed auspicious ceremonies for Rama.
25_1.word_by_word: मनस्विनी highminded lady, माता mother, सा she, तम् आयासम् such anguish, अवनीयrestraining, जलम् water, उपस्पृश्य having performed the sipping (achamana), शुचिः rite sure, रामस्य of Rama, मङ्गलानि auspicious ceremonies, चकार performed.

25_2.shloka: न शक्यसे वारयितुं गच्छेदानीं रघूत्तम।शीघ्रं च विनिवर्तस्व वर्तस्व च सतां क्रमे।।2.25.2।।
25_2.translation: I am unable to dissuade you, O the best among the descendants of Raghus, from going into the forest. Go now and return soon. Follow in the footsteps of the virtuous.
25_2.word_by_word: रघूत्तम O the best among descendants of Raghu, वारयितुम् to dissuade, न शक्यसे not able,  इदानीम् now, गच्छ go, शीघ्रम् soon, विनिवर्तस्व return, सताम् of good men, क्रमे in footsteps, वर्तस्व follow.

25_3.shloka: यं पालयसि धर्मं त्वं धृत्या च नियमेन च।स वै राघवशार्दूल धर्मस्त्वामभिरक्षतु।।2.25.3।।
25_3.translation: The duty which you are carrying out with courage and selfdiscipline, O tiger among the descendants of Raghu will alone protect you.
25_3.word_by_word: राघवशार्दूल O tiger among the descendants of Raghu त्वम् you, धृत्या with courage, नियमेन च with selfdiscipline, यं धर्मम् which duty, पालयसि you are carrying out, सः धर्मः वै that duty alone, त्वाम् you, अभिरक्षतु let it protect.

25_4.shloka: येभ्यः प्रणमसे पुत्र चैत्येष्वायतनेषु च।ते च त्वामभिरक्षन्तु वने सह महर्षिभिः।।2.25.4।।
25_4.translation: O my son may the gods in the temples and in other sacred places and the maharshis you bow to protect you in the forest
25_4.word_by_word: पुत्र son, चैत्येषु in sacred places, आयतनेषु च in temples, येभ्यः to whom, प्रणमसे you are saluting, ते they, महर्षिभिः सह together with maharshis, त्वाम् you, वने in the forest,  अभिरक्षन्तु protect you.

25_5.shloka: यानि दत्तानि तेऽस्त्राणि विश्वामित्रेण धीमता।तानि त्वामभिरक्षन्तु गुणैस्समुदितं सदा।।2.25.5।।
25_5.translation: May the weapons endowed with mantric qualities, which were bestowed on you by sagacious Viswamitra always protect you
25_5.word_by_word: धीमता by the sagacious, विश्वामित्रेण by Viswamitra, ते to you, यानि अस्त्राणि those weapons, दत्तानि were bestowed, तानि they, गुणैः with (mantric) qualities, समुदितम् endowed, त्वाम् you, सदा always, अभिरक्षन्तु may protect.

25_6.shloka: पितृशुश्रूषया पुत्र मातृशुश्रूषया तथा।सत्येन च महाबाहो चिरं जीवाभिरक्षितः।।2.25.6।।
25_6.translation: O my mighty armed son protected by the service to your father, mother and totruth, live long
25_6.word_by_word: महाबाहो O mighty armed, पुत्र son, पितृशुश्रूषया in the service of your father, तथा also,  मातृशुश्रूषया in the service of your mother, सत्येन with truth, अभिरक्षितः you have been  protected, चिरं जीव live long.

25_7.shloka: समित्कुश पवित्राणि वेद्यश्चायतनानि च।स्थण्डिलानि विचित्राणि शैला वृक्षाः क्षुपा ह्रदाः।।2.25.7।।पतङ्गाः पन्नगास्सिंहास्त्वां रक्षन्तु नरोत्तम।
25_7.translation: O best of men may sacrificial fuel, kusa grass and sacred rings made of kusha grass, sacrificial altars, temples, various levelled sacrificial grounds, mountains, trees, plants, lakes, birds, serpents and lions protect you
25_7.word_by_word: नरोत्तम best among men, समित्कुश पवित्राणि sacrificial fuel, kusha grass and sacred finger rings made of kusa grass, वेद्यश्च sacrificial altars, आयतनानि च temples also, विचित्राणि various one, स्थण्डिलानि levelled sacrificial grounds, शैलाः mountains, वृक्षाः trees, क्षुपा:plants, ह्रदाः lakes, पतङ्गा: birds, पन्नगाः serpents, सिंहाः lions, त्वाम् you, रक्षन्तु may protect.

25_8.shloka: स्वस्तिसाध्याश्च विश्वे च मरुतश्च महर्षयः।स्वस्ति धाता विधाता च स्वस्ति पूषा भगोऽर्यमा।।2.25.8।।लोकपालाश्च ते सर्वे वासवप्रमुखास्तथा।
25_8.translation: May all gods known as Sadhyas, Visvedevatas, Maruts, great ascetics, the sustainer (Virat Purusha), the preserver of creation (lord Brahma), Sun, Bhaga, Aryama, and all other important guardians of the world headed by Indra bestow their blessings on you
25_8.word_by_word: साध्याश्च devatas known as 'Sadhyas', विश्वे च viswe devatas, मरुतश्च maruts (windgod), महर्षयः the great ascetics, स्वस्ति expiatory mantras, धाता sustainer (Virat Purusha), विधाता च the preserver of creation (lord Brahma), स्वस्ति bestow blessings to you, पूषा Sun, भगः the Sun known as Bhaga, अर्यमा the Sun known as Aryama, तथा also, वासवप्रमुखाः others headed by Indra, सर्वे all, ते लोकपालाश्च guardians of the world.

25_9.shloka: ऋतवश्चैव पक्षाश्च मासा स्संवत्सराः क्षपाः।।2.25.9।।दिनानि च मुहूर्ताश्च स्वस्ति कुर्वन्तु ते सदा।
25_9.translation: May the six seasons, years, months, fortnights, nights, days and moments bring good to you
25_9.word_by_word: ऋतवश्चैव six seasons also, पक्षाश्च two fort nights, मासाः months, संवत्सराः years, क्षपा: nights, दिनानि च days also, मुहूर्ताश्च moments (each 48 minutes), ते to you, सदा always,  स्वस्ति कुर्वन्तु may bring propitiousness to you.

25_10.shloka: स्मृतिर्धृतिश्च धर्मश्च पातु त्वां पुत्र सर्वतः।।2.25.10।।स्कन्दश्च भगवान्देव स्सोमश्च स बृहस्पतिः।सप्तर्षयो नारदश्च ते त्वां रक्षन्तु सर्वतः।।2.25.11।।
25_10.translation: O my son may Smriti, Dhriti and Dharma always guard you. May divine personages and gods, Skanda, Soma, Brihaspati, the seven rishis and Narada protect you at all times
25_10.word_by_word: पुत्र O my son, स्मृतिः memory, धृतिश्च resolution(Dhriti), धर्मश्च Dharma, त्वाम् you, सर्वतः always, पातु may guard, भगवान् of divine personages, देवः god, स्कन्दश्च Skanda, सोमश्च Soma, सः that, बृहस्पतिः Brihaspati (preceptor of gods), ते to you, सप्तर्षयः seven rishis,  नारदश्च Narada, त्वाम् you, सर्वतः everywhere, रक्षन्तु protect you.

25_11.shloka: याश्चापि सर्वतस्सिध्दा दिशश्च सदिगीश्वराः।स्तुता मया वने तस्मिन्पान्तु त्वां पुत्र नित्यशः।।2.25.12।।
25_11.translation: May Siddhas, guardians of the quarters invoked by me protect you from all  directions in that forest at all times, O my son
25_11.word_by_word: पुत्र O my son, सिद्धाः Siddhas, सदिगीश्वरा: along with the guardians of the quarters, याः दिशश्च those quarters, मया by me, स्तुताः are invoked, तस्मिन् वने in that forest, त्वाम् you, सर्वतः from all sides, नित्यशः at all times, पान्तु protect.

25_12.shloka: शैलास्सर्वे समुद्राश्च राजा वरुण एव च।द्यौरन्तरिक्षं पृथिवी नद्यस्सर्वास्तथैव च।।2.25.13।।नक्षत्राणि च सर्वाणि ग्रहाश्च सहदेवताः।अहोरात्रे तथा सन्ध्ये पान्तु त्वां वनमाश्रितम्।।2.25.14।।
25_12.translation: When you dwell in the forest may all the mountains, seas, lord Varuna, heaven, space, and earth and also all rivers, all stars and planets with their presiding deities, day, night, dawn and dusk protect you
25_12.word_by_word: सर्वे all, शैलाः mountains, समुद्राश्च also seas, राजा lord, वरुण एव च Varuna, द्यौः the heaven, अन्तरिक्षम् the space, पृथिवी च the earth as well, तथैव च also, सर्वाः all,  नद्यः rivers, सर्वाणि all,नक्षत्राणि च the stars, सहदेवताः together with their presiding deities,  ग्रहाश्च planets, अहोरात्रे day and night, तथा and, सन्ध्ये dawn and dusk, आश्रितम् having taken refuge, त्वाम् you, पान्तु may protect.

25_13.shloka: ऋतवश्चैव षट्पुण्या मासास्संवत्सरास्तथा।कलाश्च काष्ठाश्च तथा तव शर्म दिशन्तु ते।।2.25.15।।
25_13.translation: May all the six pious seasons, months, years, kala and kashta contribute to your wellbeing
25_13.word_by_word: पुण्याः pious, षट् six, ऋतवश्चैव seasons, ते to you, मासाः months, तथा also, संवत्सराः years,  कलाश्च kala, काष्ठाश्च kashta (kala and kashta are the names for the minute divisions of time), तव your, शर्म welfare, दिशन्तु you may offer.

25_14.shloka: महावने विचरतो मुनिवेषस्य धीमतः।तवादित्याश्च दैत्याश्च भवन्तु सुखदास्सदा।।2.25.16।।
25_14.translation: May gods and demons always give you happiness when you wander in that great forest clad in ascetic garb
25_14.word_by_word: मुनिवेषस्य clad in ascetic garb, महावने in the wild forest, विचरतः wandering, धीमतः sagacious, तव your, आदित्याश्च sons of Aditi, devatas, दैत्याश्च sons of Diti, daityas, सदाalways, सुखदाः bestowers of happiness, भवन्तु be.

25_15.shloka: राक्षसानां पिशाचानां रौद्राणां क्रूरकर्मणाम्।क्रव्यादानां च सर्वेषां मा भूत्पुत्रक ते भयम्।।2.25.17।।
25_15.translation: Let there be no fear from rakshasas who are fearful to look at and commit cruel acts, from pisachas (evil spirits) and from flesheating animals, O my child
25_15.word_by_word: पुत्रक O my child, ते to you, रौद्राणाम् of the fearful, क्रूरकर्मणाम् of those committing cruelacts, राक्षसानाम् of rakshasas, पिशाचानाम् of pisachas, 'सर्वेषाम् of all, क्रव्यादानां च of flesheating animals, भयम् fear, माभूत may not be.

25_16.shloka: प्लवगा वृश्चिका दंशामशकाश्चैव कानने।सरीसृपाश्च कीटाश्च मा भूवन्गहने तव।।2.25.18।।
25_16.translation: May monkeys, scorpions, wild gnats, mosquitoes, reptiles and insects in that inaccessible forest not trouble you
25_16.word_by_word: गहने in an inaccessible, कानने in the forest, तव to you, प्लवगाः monkeys,  वृश्चिकाः scorpions, दंशाः wild gnats, मशकाश्च mosquitoes also, सरीसृपाश्च reptiles also, कीटाश्च insects too, मा भूवन् may not be there.

25_17.shloka: महाद्विपाश्च सिंहाश्च व्याघ्रा ऋक्षाश्च दंष्ट्रिणः।महिषा श्शृङ्गिणो रौद्रा न ते द्रुह्यन्तु पुत्रक।।2.25.19।।
25_17.translation: May the mighty elephants, lions with pointed incisors, tigers, bears and fierce, wild, horned buffaloes, do you no harm, O my dear son
25_17.word_by_word: पुत्रक my dear son, महाद्विपाश्च mighty elephants also, दंष्ट्रिणः with pointed incisors, सिंहाश्च lions, व्याघ्राः tigers, ऋक्षाश्च bears and, शृङ्गिणः with horns, रौद्राः fierce ones, महिषाः wild buffaloes, ते to you, न द्रुह्यन्तु may not harm.

25_18.shloka: नृमांसभोजना रौद्रा ये चान्ये सत्वजातयः।मा च त्वां हिंसिषुः पुत्र मया संपूजितास्त्विह।।2.25.20।।
25_18.translation: May the ferocious breed of cernivores I worship not harm you, O my child
25_18.word_by_word: पुत्र O my child, नृमांसभोजिनः cannibals, रौद्राः frightening ones, ये अन्ये all others, सत्वजातयः ferocious breeds of animals, इह here, मया by me, संपूजिताः have been worshipped, त्वाम् you, मा च हिंसिषुः may not harm.

25_19.shloka: आगमास्ते शिवास्सन्तु सिध्यन्तु च पराक्रमाः।सर्वसम्पत्तये राम स्वस्तिमान्गच्छ पुत्रक।।2.25.21।।
25_19.translation: O Rama may your path be auspecious May your valour be fruitful Go safel and achieve success in everything
25_19.word_by_word: पुत्रक O my child, राम Rama, ते your, आगमाः paths, शिवाः safe (auspecious), सन्तु be, पराक्रमाश्च valour also, सिध्यन्तु be accomplished, स्वस्तिमान् safe man, सर्वसंपत्तये achieve success in everything, गच्छ go.

25_20.shloka: स्वस्ति ते ऽस्त्वन्तरिक्षेभ्यः पार्थिवेभ्यः पुनः पुनः।सर्वेभ्यश्चैव देवेभ्यो ये च वै परिपन्थिनः।।2.25.22।।
25_20.translation: May gods from the sky, the earth and all other gods protect you and let there be no harm to you from your foes.
25_20.word_by_word: अन्तरिक्षेभ्यः from the sky, पुनः again, पार्थिवेभ्यः from earthly gods (kings), पुनः again, सर्वेभ्यः from all, देवेभ्यश्चैव from devatas also, ये ते परिपन्थिन from all those who obstruct your path, ते to you, स्वस्ति अस्तु safety be yours.

25_21.shloka: गुरुस्सोमश्च सूर्यश्च धनदोऽथ यमस्तथा।पान्तु त्वामर्चिता राम दण्डकारण्यवासिनम्।।2.25.23।।
25_21.translation: Propitiated by my worship, O Rama may Brihaspati, Moon, Sun, Kubera and Yama protect you when you are in Dandaka forest
25_21.word_by_word: राम Rama, गुरुः Guru or Brihaspati, सोमश्च Moon also, सूर्यश्च Sun too, अथ also, धनदः Kubera, तथा also, यमः Yama, अर्चिताः having been worshipped, दण्डकारण्यवासिनम् living in Dandaka forest, त्वाम् you, पान्तु may protect you.

25_22.shloka: अग्निर्वायुस्तथा धूमो मन्त्राश्चर्षिमुखाच्च्युताः।उपस्पर्शनकाले तु पान्तु त्वां रघुनन्दन।।2.25.24।।
25_22.translation: May Fire, Wind, Smoke and Mantras emanated from the mouths of rishis protect you when you take your ablutions, O Son of the Raghu race O Joy of the Raghus
25_22.word_by_word: रघुनन्दन O Joy of the Raghus O Son of the Raghu race, उपस्पर्शनकाले at the time of taking bath, त्वाम् you, अग्नि: fire,  वायुः wind, तथा also, धूमः smoke, ऋषिमुखात् from the mouths of rishis, च्युताः released,  मन्त्राश्च mantras, पान्तु protect you.

25_23.shloka: सर्वलोकप्रभुर्ब्रह्मा भूतभर्ता तथर्षयः।ये च शेषास्सुरास्ते त्वां रक्षन्तु वनवासिनम्।।2.25.25।।
25_23.translation: May Siva, lord of all the worlds, Visnu, supporter of living beings, Brahma, rishis and all the rest of the gods protect you while you dwell in the forest
25_23.word_by_word: सर्वलोकप्रभुः lord of all the worlds, Siva, ब्रह्मा Brahma, भूतभर्ता supporter of beings, Visnu, तथा also, ऋषयः rishis, शेषाः the remaining, ये सुराः those gods, ते to you,  वनवासिनम् dwelling in the forest, त्वाम् you, रक्षन्तु protect.

25_24.translation: Thus illustrious, largeeyed Kausalya worshipped hosts of gods by offering them garlands and fragrant substances with appropriate prayers.
25_24.word_by_word: यशस्विनी illustrious lady, आयतलोचना largeeyed (Kausalya), इति thus, माल्यैः with garlands, गन्धैश्चापि with fragrant susbtances, अनुरूपाभिः by appropriate articles, स्तुतिभिश्च with prayers, सुरगणान् hosts of gods, आनर्च worshipped.

25_25.shloka: ज्वलनं समुपादाय ब्राह्मणेन महात्मना।हावयामास विधिना राममङ्गलकारणात्।।2.25.27।।
25_25.translation: After collecting the sacred fire through great brahmins she duly offered oblations to the gods for the welfare of Rama.
25_25.word_by_word: ज्वलनम् the sacred fire, समुपादाय having arranged, राममङ्गल कारणात् for the welfare of Rama, महात्मना great, ब्राह्मणेन by the brahmin (priest), विधिना duly, हावयामास offered oblations.

25_26.shloka: घृतं श्वेतानि माल्यानि समिधश्श्वेतसर्षपान्।उपसम्पादयामास कौशल्या परमाङ्गना।।2.25.28।।
25_26.translation: Noble Kausalya procured clarified butter, garlands of white flowers, sacred fuel, and grains of white mustard seed (for oblations to the gods).
25_26.word_by_word: परमाङ्गना noble lady, कौशल्या Kausalya, घृतम् clarified butter, श्वेतानि white,  माल्यानि garlands of flowers, समिधः sacred fuel, श्वेत सर्षपान् white grains of mustard seed,  उपसंपादयामास obtained.

25_27.shloka: उपाध्याय स्सविधिना हुत्वा शान्तिमनामयम्।हुतहव्यावशेषेण बाह्यं बलिमकल्पयत्।।2.25.29।।
25_27.translation: The officiating priest performed the ritual of sacrificial offerings strictly in accordance   with rules for peace and happiness of Rama. With the remainder of the offerings, he performed whatever ceremonies were to be done externally.
25_27.word_by_word: सः उपाध्यायः that officiating priest, विधिना duly, अनामयम् sound health, शान्तिं हुत्वा having performed sacrificial offerings for peace, हुतहव्यावशेषेण with the remainder of the offerings, बाह्यम् external, बलिम् ceremonies, अकल्पयत् performed.

25_28.translation: Thereafter she made the brahmins pronounce benedictory prayers, offering honey, curd, rice and clarified butter.Then she got mantras (expiatory rites) recited for averting evil to Rama while in the forest.
25_28.word_by_word: मधु दध्यक्षतघृतैः with honey, curds, rice and clarified butter, द्विजान् brahmins, स्वस्तिवाच्य  who pronounced benedictory prayers, ततः thereafter, वने in the forest, रामस्य of Rama, स्वस्त्ययनक्रियाः reciting mantras preparatory for averting evil, वाचयामास got recited.

25_29.shloka: ततस्तस्मै द्विजेन्द्राय राममाता यशस्विनी।दक्षिणां प्रददौ काम्यां राघवं चेदमब्रवीत्।।2.25.31।।
25_29.translation: The illustrious Kausalya, mother of Rama gave abundant gifts to the best of the brahmins and thereafter said to him:
25_29.word_by_word: यशस्विनी illustrious, राममाता Rama's mother, ततः thereafter, तस्मै that, द्विजेन्द्राय best among brahmins, काम्याम् as desired, दक्षिणाम् appropriate gifts, प्रददौ gave, राघवम् to Rama, इदम् these words, अब्रवीत् च also spoke.

25_30.shloka: यन्मङ्गलं सहस्राक्षे सर्वदेवनमस्कृते।वृत्रनाशे समभवत्तत्ते भवतु मङ्गलम्।।2.25.32।।
25_30.translation: May the same blessings bestowed by all the gods on the thousandeyed Indra at the time of killing Vritra be with you
25_30.word_by_word: वृत्रनाशे at the time of slaying of Vritra, सर्वदेवनमस्कृते salutations bestowed by all gods,  सहस्राक्षे on god of a thousand eyes (Indra), यत् whichever, मङ्गलम् blessings, समभवत् was bestowed, तत् मङ्गलम् that auspiciousness, ते भवतु may happen to you.

25_31.shloka: यन्मङ्गलं सुपर्णस्य विनताऽकल्पयत्पुरा।अमृतं प्रार्थयानस्य तत्ते भवतु मङ्गलम्।।2.25.33।।
25_31.translation: May you be conferred with the same blessings which Vinata bestowed on Garuda at the time of bringing nectar
25_31.word_by_word: पुरा formely, अमृतम् nectar, प्रार्थयानस्य while seeking, सुपर्णस्य for Garuda,  विनता Vinata, यत् मङ्गलम् which blessings, अकल्पयत् created, तत् मङ्गलम् that auspiciousness, ते भवतु happen to you.

25_32.shloka: अमृतोत्पादने दैत्यान् घ्नतो वज्रधरस्य यत्।अदितिर्मङ्गलं प्रादात्तत्ते भवतु मङ्गलम्।।2.25.34।।
25_32.translation: May you be bestowed with the same blessings conferred by Aditi on Indra, the wielder of thunder for the killing of daityas at the time nectar was generated
25_32.word_by_word: अदितिः Aditi, अमृतोत्पादने at the time of churning out nectar, दैत्यान् the daityas, घ्नतः slew, वज्रधरस्य of the wielder of thunder (Indras's), तत् मङ्गलम् blessings, प्रादात् gave, तत् मङ्गलम् blessings, ते भवतु may be yours.

25_33.shloka: त्रीन्विक्रमान्प्रक्रमतो विष्णोरमिततेजसः।यदासीन्मङ्गलं राम तत्ते भवतु मङ्गलम्।।2.25.35।।
25_33.translation: O Rama by occupying three footsteps of space, highly lustrous Visnu owned the three worlds and obtained glory. May you obtain similar auspiciousness
25_33.word_by_word: राम O Rama, त्रीन् three, विक्रमान् strides, प्रक्रमतः of him who was occupying, अमिततेजसःhighly lustrous, विष्णोः Visnu's, यत् मङ्गलम् whichever auspiciousness, आसीत् was to be, तत् मङ्गलानि that auspiciousness, ते भवतु may be yours.

25_34.shloka: ऋतवस्सागरा द्वीपा वेदा लोका दिशश्च ते।मङ्गलानि महाबाहो दिशन्तु शुभमङ्गलाः।।2.25.36।।
25_34.translation: O mightyarmed Rama may the auspicious and prosperous seasons, seas, islands. the Vedas, the worlds and the quarters bless you
25_34.word_by_word: महाबाहो O mightyarmed one, शुभमङ्गलाः auspicious happenings, ऋतवः seasons, सागराः seas, द्वीपाः islands, वेदाः the Vedas, लोकाः worlds, दिशश्च the quarters, ते to you,  मङ्गलानि blessings, दिशन्तु let them bestow.

25_35.shloka: इति पुत्रस्य शेषांश्च कृत्वा शिरसि भामिनी।गन्धैश्चापि समालभ्य राममायतलोचना।।2.25.37।।ओषधीं चापि सिद्धार्थां विशल्यकरणीं शुभाम्।चकार रक्षां कौशल्या मन्त्रैरभिजजाप च।।2.25.38।।
25_35.translation: The largeeyed Kausalya placed the remains of the offerings on his (Rama's) head and  applied sandal cream to his body. She tied an auspicious medicinal herb known as Vishalyakarani to his arm for attainment of his objectives, repeatedly mutteringprayers.
25_35.word_by_word: आयतलोचना largeeyed lady, भामिनी beautiful lady, कौशल्या Kausalya, इति in this way uttering, पुत्रस्य son's, शिरसि on the head, शेषाश्च the remains (of offerings), कृत्वा having offered, रामम् Rama, गन्धैश्चापि with sandalpaste also, समालभ्य having applied, सिद्धार्थां  for fruitful attainment, शुभाम् auspicious, विशल्यकरणीम् Vishalyakarani, (capable of removing extraneous substances causing great pain in the body), ओषधीम् medicinal herb, रक्षाम् armlet, चकार made, मन्त्रै: with sacred prayers, अभिजजाप च muttered repeatedly in a low tone.

25_36.shloka: उवाचातिप्रहृष्टेव सा दुःखवशवर्तिनी।वाङ्ग्मात्रेण न भावेन वाचाऽसंसज्जमानया।।2.25.39।।
25_36.translation: Even though Kausalya was filled with distress, she appeared as if she was very much happy. She uttered  mere words in a confusing tone without applying her mind.
25_36.word_by_word: दुःखवशवर्तिनी filled with distress, सा she, अतिप्रहृष्टेव as if she was exceedingly happy,  संसज्जमानया with confused, वाचा with a tone, वाङ्मात्रेण in mere words, उवाच said, भावेन न not with mind.

25_37.shloka: आनम्य मूर्ध्नि चाघ्राय परिष्वज्य यशस्विनी।अवदत्पुत्र सिद्धार्थो गच्छ राम यथासुखम्।।2.25.40।।
25_37.translation: Illustrious Kausalya embraced Rama, bending his head down and smelt his forehead. And then said O Rama go in peace and come back after accomplishing the objective.
25_37.word_by_word: यशस्विनी illustrious lady, आनम्य bending him down, मूर्ध्नि on his forehead, आघ्राय having smelt, परिष्वज्य having embraced, अवदत् spoke, पुत्र O son, राम Rama, सिद्धार्थः having fulfilled your objective, यथा सुखम् in peace and happiness, गच्छ go.

25_38.shloka: अरोगं सर्वसिद्धार्थमयोध्यां पुनरागतम्।पश्यामि त्वां सुखं वत्स सुस्थितं राजवर्त्मनि।।2.25.41।।
25_38.translation: O my son I shall be happy to behold you back in Ayodhya in sound healthsuccessful in your objectives and firmly established in the kingdom.
25_38.word_by_word: वत्स O my son, अरोगम् without illness, सर्वसिद्धार्थम् accomplishing all objectives, सुखम्  happily (in good health), पुनः again, अयोध्याम् to Ayodhya, आगतम् having reached,  राजवर्त्मनि on the royal path (as king), सुस्थितम् firmly standing, त्वाम् you, पश्यामि I shall behold.

25_39.translation: When you return from the forest like the full Moon rising, I shall behold you with my anxieties gone and my face sparkling with joy.
25_39.word_by_word: वनात् from the forest, प्राप्तम् having received, त्वाम् you, उदितम् rising, पूर्णचन्द्रमिव like full moon, प्रणष्टदुःखसंकल्पा having removed my sorrowful thoughts, हर्षविद्योतितानना my face sparkling with joy, द्रक्ष्यामि shall behold.

25_40.shloka: भद्रासनगतं राम वनवासादिहागतम्।द्रक्ष्यामि च पुनस्त्वां तु तीर्णवन्तं पितुर्वचः।।2.25.43।।
25_40.translation: After you have fulfilled your father's words and returned from your exile I shall behold you seated on the throne, O Rama
25_40.word_by_word: राम O Rama, पितुः वचः father's words, तीर्णवन्तम् having crossed (fuliflled), वनवासात् from your exile, इह here, पुनः again, आगतम् having arrived, त्वाम् you, भद्रासनगतम् sitting on the throne,  द्रक्ष्यामि I shall see.

25_41.shloka: मङ्गलैरुपसपन्नो वनवासादिहागतः।वध्वा मम च नित्यं त्वं कामान्संवर्ध याहि भोः।।2.25.44।।
25_41.translation: O Rama, credited with auspicious events on return from the forest, fulfil my desires and those of my daughterinlaw (Sita).
25_41.word_by_word: भोः O Rama, वनवासात् from the forest, इह here, आगतः having returned, मङ्गलै: with auspicious events, उपसम्पन्नः endowed with, त्वम् you, वध्वाः of my daughterinlaw (Sita's), मम च for me also, कामान् desires, नित्यम् always, संवर्ध enhance, याहि go.

25_42.shloka: मयाऽर्चिता देवगणाश्शिवादयोमहर्षयो भूतमहासुरोरगाः।अभिप्रयातस्य वनं चिराय तेहितानि काङ्क्षन्तु दिशश्च राघव।।2.25.45।।
25_42.translation: O son of the Raghu race Lord Siva and other gods, the great rishis, bhutas, great asuras and serpents and four quarters worshipped by me will always promote your welfare when you dwell in the forest.
25_42.word_by_word: राघव O son of the Raghu race मया by me, अर्चिताः worshipped, शिवादयः Siva and others, देवगणाः gods, महर्षयः the great rishis, भूतमहासुरोरगाः bhutas, great asuras, serpents,दिशश्च four quarters, वनम् to the forest, अभिप्रयातस्य having exiled, ते your, हितानि welfare,  चिराय for a long time, काङ्क्षन्तु may wish for.

25_43.shloka: इतीव साऽश्रुप्रतिपूर्णलोचनासमाप्य च स्वस्त्ययनं यथाविधि।प्रदक्षिणं चैव चकार राघवंपुनः पुनश्चापि निपीड्य सस्वजे।।2.25.46।।
25_43.translation: Thus with her eyes brimming with tears, she duly completed the benedictory rites and  circumambulated the scion of the Raghus and embraced him again and again holding him tight.
25_43.word_by_word: इतीव speaking thus, सा she, अश्रुप्रतिपूर्णलोचना eyes filled with tears, यथाविधि duly, स्वस्त्ययनम् benedictory rites, समाप्य च having completed, राघवम् to the descendant of the Raghu dynasty, प्रदक्षिणं चकार circumambulate, पुनः पुनः च अपि repeatedly, निपीड्य holding him tight, सस्वजे embraced.

25_44.shloka: तथा तु देव्या स कृतप्रदक्षिणोनिपीड्य मातुश्चरणौ पुनः पुनः।जगाम सीतानिलयं महायशास्स राघवः प्रज्वलित स्स्वया श्रिया।।2.25.47।।
25_44.translation: Circumambulated by mother Kausalya, the illustrious scion of the Raghu race clasped his mother's feet again and again. And shining in his glory, proceeded to the palace of Sita.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे पञ्चविंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the twentyfifth sarga of Ayodhyakanda of  the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
25_44.word_by_word: देव्या by Devi Kausalya, तथा that way, कृतप्रदक्षिणः having circumambulated, सः Rama,  मातुः his mothers, चरणौ feet, पुनः पुनः again and again, निपीड्य holding fast, महायशाः illustrious, सः राघवः that son of the Raghu race, स्वया by his own, श्रिया with glory, प्रज्वलितः glowing, सीतानिलयम् to the palace of Sita, जगाम went.

26_1.shloka: [Sita enquires why Rama is distressedRama informs her about his impending banishment and instructs her to stay back in Ayodhya.]अभिवाद्य च कौसल्यां राम स्संप्रस्थितो वनम्।कृतस्वस्त्ययनो मात्रा धर्मिष्ठे वर्त्मनि स्थितः।।2.26.1।।विराजयन्राजसुतो राजमार्गं नरैर्वृतम्।हृदयान्याममन्थेव जनस्य गुणवत्तया।।2.26.2।।
26_1.translation: After the benedictory rites were performed by his mother Kausalya, Rama paid obeisance to her and staying on the righteous path decided to depart to the forest. He entered the highway thronged with people and illumining it with his lustre and stirred their hearts with (remembrances of) his excellent virtues.
26_1.word_by_word: राजसुतः prince, रामः Rama, मात्रा by mother, कृतस्वस्त्ययन: having been greeted with benedictory rites, कौशल्याम् to Kausalya, अभिवाद्य च after paying obeisance, धर्मिष्ठे in the righteous, वर्त्मनि on the path, स्थितः fixed, वनम् to the forest, सम्प्रस्थितः set out, नरैः (जनैः) by the people, वृतम् surrounded with, राजमार्गम् highway, विराजयन् illuminating (with his lustre), गुणवत्तया by excellent virtues, जनस्य people's, हृदयानि hearts, अममन्थेव मपहीला् (stirred).

26_2.shloka: अभिवाद्य च कौसल्यां राम स्संप्रस्थितो वनम्।कृतस्वस्त्ययनो मात्रा धर्मिष्ठे वर्त्मनि स्थितः।।2.26.1।।विराजयन्राजसुतो राजमार्गं नरैर्वृतम्।हृदयान्याममन्थेव जनस्य गुणवत्तया।।2.26.2।।
26_2.translation: After the benedictory rites were performed by his mother Kausalya, Rama paid obeisance to her and staying on the righteous path decided to depart to the forest. He entered the highway thronged with people and illumining it with his lustre and stirred their hearts with (remembrances of) his excellent virtues.
26_2.word_by_word: राजसुतः prince, रामः Rama, मात्रा by mother, कृतस्वस्त्ययन: having been greeted with benedictory rites, कौशल्याम् to Kausalya, अभिवाद्य च after paying obeisance, धर्मिष्ठे in the righteous, वर्त्मनि on the path, स्थितः fixed, वनम् to the forest, सम्प्रस्थितः set out, नरैः (जनैः) by the people, वृतम् surrounded with, राजमार्गम् highway, विराजयन् illuminating (with his lustre), गुणवत्तया by excellent virtues, जनस्य people's, हृदयानि hearts, अममन्थेव मपहीला् (stirred).

26_3.shloka: वैदेही चापि तत्सर्वं न शुश्राव तपस्विनी।तदेव हृदि तस्याश्च यौवराज्याभिषेचनम्।।2.26.3।।
26_3.translation: Sita, her mind preoccupied with thoughts about consecration, was engaged in religious austerities and hence could not hear of all this (development).
26_3.word_by_word: तपस्विनी engaged in religious austerities (for consecration), वैदेही चापि Sita also, तत्सर्वम् all that, न शुश्राव did not hear, तस्याः her, हृदि in heart, तत् that, अभिषेचनम् एव  only consecration (was reflecting).

26_4.shloka: देवकार्यं स्वयं कृत्वा कृतज्ञा हृष्टचेतना।अभिज्ञा राजधर्माणां राजपुत्रं प्रतीक्षते।।2.26.4।।
26_4.translation: Experienced in palace rituals, Sita, grateful (to God) after performing worship of the deities was awaiting in a happy mood the arrival of the prince.
26_4.word_by_word: कृतज्ञा grateful (to god), राजधर्माणाम् duties of a king (palace rituals), अभिज्ञा experienced in, हृष्टचेतना with pleased mind, स्वयम् herself, देवकार्यम् worship of gods, कृत्वा having made,  राजपुत्रम् prince, प्रतीक्षते was awaiting.

26_5.shloka: प्रविवेशाथ रामस्तु स्वं वेश्म सुविभूषितम्।प्रहृष्टजनसम्पूर्णं ह्रिया किञ्चिदवाङ्मुखः।।2.26.5।।
26_5.translation: His head bent down in embarrassment, Rama entered his welldecorated residence thronged with excited people.
26_5.word_by_word: अथ thereafter, रामस्तु Rama, ह्रिया with embarrassment, किञ्चित् a little, अवाङ्मुखः with his head bent down, प्रहृष्टजनसम्पूर्णम् thronged with excited people, सुविभूषितम् welldecorated, स्वं वेश्म his own residence, प्रविवेश entered.

26_6.shloka: अथ सीता समुत्पत्य वेपमाना च तं पतिम्।अपश्यच्छोकसन्तप्तं चिन्ताव्याकुलितेन्द्रियम्।।2.26.6।।
26_6.translation: Sita got up suddenly, (her limbs) trembling to see her husband distressed with grief and agitated with anxiety.
26_6.word_by_word: अथ thereafter, सीता Sita, समुत्पत्य entering suddenly, वेपमाना च a trembling, शोकसन्तप्तम् distressed with grief, चिन्ताव्याकुलितेन्द्रियम् senses agitated due to anxiety, तं पतिम् her husband, अपश्यत् beheld.

26_7.shloka: तां दृष्ट्वा स हि धर्मात्मा न शशाक मनोगतम्।तं शोकं राघवः सोढुं ततो विवृततां गतः।।2.26.7।।
26_7.translation: On seeing her, virtuous Rama could not contain the sorrow in his mind which  manifested (through his external appearance).
26_7.word_by_word: धर्मात्मा virtuous, सः that, राघवः son of the Raghus (Rama), ताम् her, दृष्ट्वा having seen, मनोगतम् in mind, तं शोकम् that sorrow, सोढुम् to endure (control), न शशाक was not able, ततः for that reason, विवृतताम् गतः manifested.

26_8.shloka: विवर्णवदनं दृष्ट्वा तं प्रस्विन्नममर्षणम्।आह दुःखाभिसन्तप्ता किमिदानीमिदं प्रभो।।2.26.8।।
26_8.translation: On seeing Rama with a pale face. indignant and heavily perspiring, Sita, consumed  with grief said, My Lord, why are you now like this?
26_8.word_by_word: विवर्णवदनम् pale face, प्रस्विन्नम् heavily perspiring, अमर्षणम् indignant, तम् him, दृष्ट्वा having seen, दुःखाभिसन्तप्ता  consumed with grief, आह uttered, प्रभो O Lord, इदानीम् now, इदम् this, किम् what?

26_9.shloka: अद्य बार्हस्पत श्श्रीमान्युक्तः पुष्योऽनु राघव।प्रोच्यते ब्राह्मणैः प्राज्ञैः केन त्वमसि दुर्मनाः।।2.26.9।।
26_9.translation: O scion of the Raghu race, today has been declared by learned brahmins a suitable and auspicious day for consecration under Pushya star with Brihaspati as presiding deity. Then why are you dejected?
26_9.word_by_word: राघव O scion of the Raghu race, अद्य today, श्रीमान् auspicious one, बार्हस्पतः with Brihaspati presiding over, पुष्यः Pushya star, युक्तः as suitable, प्राज्ञैः by learned ones, ब्राह्मणैः by brahmins, प्रोच्यते is declared, त्वम् you, केन for what reason, दुर्मनाः असि are dejected?

26_10.shloka: न ते शतशलाकेन जलफेननिभेन च।आवृतं वदनं वल्गु छत्रेणापि विराजते।।2.26.10।।
26_10.translation: How is it that your charming face shines not today under a hundredribbed umbrella (white) like foam in water?
26_10.word_by_word: वल्गु charming, ते your, वदनम् face, शत शलाकेन with a hundred ribs, जलफेननिभेन (white) like foam in water, छत्रेण by umbrella, आवृतम् having been covered, न विराजते does not shine.

26_11.shloka: व्यजनाभ्यां च मुख्याभ्यां शतपत्रनिभेक्षणम्।चन्द्रहंसप्रकाशाभ्यां वीज्यते न तवाननम्।।2.26.11।।
26_11.translation: (How is it that) your face, with its lotuslike eyes is not being fanned by excellent fans of the colour of the Moon or the swan.
26_11.word_by_word: शतपत्रनिभेक्षणम् eyes resembling lotus, तव आननम् your face, चन्द्रहंस प्रकाशाभ्याम् with the glow of the moon or swan, मुख्याभ्याम् by the excellent, व्यजनाभ्याम् with fans, न वीज्यते is not being fanned.

26_12.shloka: वाग्मिनो वन्दिनश्चापि प्रहृष्टास्त्वां नरर्षभ।स्तुवन्तो नात्र दृश्यन्ते मङ्गलैः स्सूतमागधाः।।2.26.12।।
26_12.translation: (How is it that) O best among men eloquent panegyrists, charioteers, bards are not seen singing your praise with auspicious words?
26_12.word_by_word: नरर्षभ O best among men वाग्मिन: eloquent men, वन्दिनश्चापि panegyrists, सूतमागधाः charioteers and bards, प्रहृष्टाः delighted, त्वाम् you, मङ्गलैः with auspicious words, स्तुवन्तः praising, अत्र here, न दृश्यन्ते are not seen.

26_13.shloka: न ते क्षौद्रं च दधि च ब्राह्मणा वेदपारगाः।मूर्ध्नि मूर्धाभिषिक्तस्य ददति स्म विधानतः।।2.26.13।।
26_13.translation: How is it that brahmins versed in the Vedas have not duly sprinkled the mixture of honey and curd on your head (prior to your consecration)?
26_13.word_by_word: वेदपारगाः versed in the Vedas, ब्राह्मणाः brahmins, मूर्धाभिषिक्तस्य having been consecrated,   ते your, मूर्ध्नि on head, विधानतः conforming to rites, क्षौद्रं च honey also, दधि च curds, न ददति स्म did not sprinkle.

26_14.shloka: न त्वां प्रकृतय स्सर्वा श्श्रेणीमुख्याश्च भूषिताः।अनुव्रजितुमिच्छन्ति पौरजानपदास्तथा।।2.26.14।।
26_14.translation: How is it that welladorned ministers, citizens from towns and villages, heads of guilds and others do not follow you?
26_14.word_by_word: सर्वाः all, प्रकृतयः ministers, श्रेणीमुख्याश्च also the heads of guilds, तथा also, पौरजानपदाः citizens of towns and villages, भूषिताः adorned, त्वाम् you, अनुव्रजितुम् to follow, न इच्छन्ति do not seek.

26_15.shloka: चतुर्भिर्वेगसम्पन्नैर्हयैः काञ्चनभूषितैः।मुख्यः पुष्यरथो युक्तः किं न गच्छति तेऽग्रतः।।2.26.15।।
26_15.translation: How is it that the chief ceremonial chariot, decorated with gold and harnessed by four galloping horses is not preceding you?
26_15.word_by_word: वेगसम्पन्नैः running swiftly, काञ्चनभूषितैः decorated with gold, चतुर्भिः four, हयैः horses, युक्तःharnessed, मुख्यः important, पुष्यरथः ceremonial chariot, किम् why, ते अग्रतः preceding you, न गच्छति is not going.

26_16.shloka: हस्ती चाग्रत श्श्रीमां स्तव लक्षणपूजितः।प्रयाणे लक्ष्यते वीर कृष्णमेघगिरि प्रभः।।2.26.16।।
26_16.translation: How is it that the elephant, whose lustre resembles that of a mountain or a dark cloud and endowed with auspicious features is not seen leading your procession, O valiant one
26_16.word_by_word: वीर O valiant one, तव your, प्रयाणे in your journey, अग्रतः in front, लक्षणपूजितः endowed with good features and revered, कृष्णमेघगिरिप्रभः with the lustre of a dark cloud or a  mountain, श्रीमान् auspicious one, हस्ती an elephant, न लक्ष्यते is not seen.

26_17.shloka: न च काञ्चनचित्रं ते पश्यामि प्रियदर्शन।भद्रासनं पुरस्कृत्य यान्तं वीर पुरस्कृतम्।।2.26.17।।
26_17.translation: O heroic one O handsome one how is it that I do not see your attendants proceeding in front with the throne carved in gold?
26_17.word_by_word: वीर O heroic one, प्रियदर्शन O one with a pleasant countenance, काञ्चनचित्रम् carved in gold, ते to you, भद्रासनम् throne, पुरस्कृत्य keeping in front of, यान्तम् proceeding, पुरस्कृतम् keeping in front, न च पश्यामि I do not see.

26_18.shloka: अभिषेको यथा सज्जः किमिदानीमिदं तव।अपूर्वो मुखवर्णश्च न प्रहर्षश्च लक्ष्यते।।2.26.18।।
26_18.translation: How is it that when arrangements are under way now for your consecration, the complexion of your countenance does not look like what it was before? There is no joy on your face.
26_18.word_by_word: अभिषेकः consecration, यथा as, सज्जः arranged, तव your, मुखवर्णः complexion of your face, अपूर्वः unusual, प्रहर्षश्च delightful, न लक्ष्यते not seen, इदानीम् now, इदम् this, किम् why?

26_19.shloka: इतीव विलपन्तीं तां प्रोवाच रघुनन्दनः।सीते तत्र भवांस्तातः प्रव्राजयति मां वनम्।।2.26.19।।
26_19.translation: O Sita my venerable father is banishing me to the forest, said Rama, the scion of the Raghus, the joy of the Raghu race, seeing her thus lamenting.
26_19.word_by_word: इतीव in this way, विलपन्तीम् lamenting, ताम् to her, रघुनन्दनः Rama, प्रोवाच said , सीते O Sita,तत्रभवान् venerable, तातः father, माम् me, वनम् to the forest, प्रव्राजयति  banishing.

26_20.shloka: कुले महति सम्भूते धर्मज्ञे धर्मचारिणि।शृणु जानकि येनेदं क्रमेणाभ्यागतं मम।।2.26.20।।
26_20.translation: You were born in a noble family. You know and practise dharma. I shall tell you how this banishment has come about. Do listen.
26_20.word_by_word: महति in a noble, कुले family, सम्भूते born in, धर्मज्ञे knower of righteousness, धर्मचारिणि for an observer of righteousness, जानकि Sita, येन क्रमेण in such course, इदम् this, अभ्यागतम् has befallen, शृण listen.

26_21.shloka: राज्ञा सत्यप्रतिज्ञेन पित्रा दशरथेन च।कैकेय्यै मम मात्रे तु पुरा दत्तौ महावरौ।।2.26.21।।
26_21.translation: My father, king Dasaratha, true to his promise, had earlier granted two great boonsto my mother Kaikeyi.
26_21.word_by_word: राज्ञा by the king, सत्यप्रतिज्ञेन true to his promise, पित्रा my father, दशरथेन by Dasaratha, पुरा earlier, मम मात्रे to my mother, कैकेय्यै to Kaikeyi, महावरौ two great boons, दत्तौ were given.

26_22.shloka: तयाऽद्य मम सज्जेऽस्मिन्नभिषेके नृपोद्यते।प्रचोदित स्स समयो धर्मेण प्रतिनिर्जितः।।2.26.22।।
26_22.translation: When the king was preparing for my consecration, she reminded him of the promise and in the name of righteousness he has been cornered.
26_22.word_by_word: अद्य now, नृपोद्यते the king was getting ready, मम my, अस्मिन् अभिषेके for this consecration, सज्जे in the preparation, तया by her, सः that, समयः promise, प्रचोदितः was urged, धर्मेण in the name of righteousness, प्रतिनिर्जितः has been conquered.

26_23.shloka: चतुर्दश हि वर्षाणि वस्तव्यं दण्डके मया।पित्रा मे भरतश्चापि यौवराज्ये नियोजितः।।2.26.23।।
26_23.translation: I am to dwell in the Dandaka forest for fourteen years while father has appointed  Bharata princeregent.
26_23.word_by_word: मया by me, चतुर्दश वर्षाणि fourteen years, दण्डके in Dandaka forest, वस्तव्यम् am to dwell, मे पित्रा by my father, भरतश्चापि Bharata also, यौवराज्ये as heirapparent,  नियोजितः has been appointed.

26_24.shloka: सोऽहं त्वामागतो द्रष्टुं प्रस्थितो विजनं वनम्।भरतस्य समीपे तु नाहं कथ्यः कदाचन।।2.26.24।।बुद्धियुक्ता हि पुरुषा न सहन्ते परस्तवम्।तस्मान्नते गुणाः कथ्या भरतस्याग्रतो मम।।2.26.25।।
26_24.translation: I have come to see you before departing for the desolate Dandaka forest. You should never praise me in the presence of Bharata because intellectuals cannot tolerate others being praised before them. You should never extol my virtues before him.
26_24.word_by_word: विजनम् desolate, वनम् forest, प्रस्थितः set to depart, सः अहम् such me, त्वाम् you, द्रष्टुम् to see, आगतः I have come, भरतस्य Bharata's, समीपे in the presence of, कदाचन at any time, अहम् I, न कथ्यः not to be told , बुद्धियुक्ताः intellectuals, पुरुषाः men, परस्तवम् praising others ,न सहन्ते हि cannot endure, तस्मात् for that reason, भरतस्य Bharata's, अग्रतः infront of, ते those, मम गुणाः my virtues, न कथ्याः should not be mentioned.

26_25.shloka: नापि त्वं तेन भर्तव्या विशेषेण कदाचन।अनुकूलतया शक्यं समीपे त्वस्य वर्तितुम्।।2.26.26।।
26_25.translation: Never expect special treatment from Bharata. You can (continue to) stay with him (here) by conducting yourself in a favourable manner.
26_25.word_by_word: त्वम् you, तेन by him, कदाचन at any time, विशेषेण with a special treatment, न भर्तव्या  should not be supported, अनुकूलतया तु by being favourable only, अस्य his, समीपे in his vicinity, वर्तितुम् to remain, शक्यम् is possible.

26_26.shloka: तस्मै दत्तं नृपतिना यौवराज्यं सनातनम्।स प्रसाद्यस्त्वया सीते नृपतिश्च विशेषतः।।2.26.27।।
26_26.translation: O Sita the king has conferred the hereditary regency on him. Therefore, O Sita, you must make efforts to win his favour, especially a king's.
26_26.word_by_word: नृपतिना by the king, तस्मै for him, सनातनम् perpetual, यौवराज्यम् regency, दत्तम् given, सीते O Sita, सः he, त्वया by you, प्रसाद्यः has to be pleased, नृपतिश्च king also, विशेषतः especially.

26_27.shloka: अहं चापि प्रतिज्ञां तां गुरोस्समनुपालयन्।वनमद्यैव यास्यामि स्थिरा भव मनस्विनी।।2.26.28।।
26_27.translation: I am leaving for the forest right away for fulfilling my father's pledge. O highminded Sita be steady.
26_27.word_by_word: अहं चापि I also, गुरोः father's, तां प्रतिज्ञाम् that promise, समनुपालयन् while fulfilling, अद्यैव now itself, वनम् to the forest, यास्यामि shall go, मनस्विनि highminded, Sita, त्वम् you, स्थिरा भवkeep steady.

26_28.shloka: याते च मयि कल्याणि वनं मुनिनिषेवितम्।व्रतोपवासपरया भवितव्यं त्वयाऽनघे।।2.26.29।।
26_28.translation: O sinless, auspicious one engage yourself in vratas and fasting after my departure to the forest inhabited by ascetics.
26_28.word_by_word: अनघे O sinless one, कल्याणि O auspicious one, मयि me, मुनिनिषेवितम् inhabited byascetics, वनम् to the forest, याते when I am gone, त्वया by you, व्रतोपवास परया engaged in vratas and fasting, भवितव्यम् should be done.

26_29.shloka: काल्यमुत्थाय देवानां कृत्वा पूजां यथाविधि।वन्दितव्यो दशरथः पिता मम नरेश्वरः।।2.26.30।।
26_29.translation: You must rise in time and with the (household) gods duly worshipped, pay obeisance to my father, king Dasaratha.
26_29.word_by_word: काल्यम् fimely, उत्थाय rising, यथाविधि according to the prescribed rituals, देवानाम् of the gods, पूजाम् कृत्वा having worshipped, मम पिता my father, नरेश्वरः lord of the people, दशरथः to Dasaratha, वन्दितव्यः is worthy of homage (by you).

26_30.shloka: माता च मम कौशल्या वृद्धा सन्तापकर्शिता।धर्ममेवाग्रतः कृत्वा त्वत्त स्सम्मानमर्हति।।2.27.31।।
26_30.translation: You should give importance to duty(dharma) and show respect to my aged motherwho is emaciated due to grief.
26_30.word_by_word: सन्तापकर्शिता emaciated due to grief, वृद्धा aged, मम माता च my mother, कौशल्या Kausalya, धर्ममेव duty only, अग्रतः कृत्वा placing ahead, त्वत्तः by you, सम्मानम् respect, अर्हति  deserves.

26_31.shloka: वन्दितव्याश्च ते नित्यं या श्शेषा मम मातरः।स्नेह प्रणयसम्भोगै स्समा हि मम मातरः।।2.26.32।।
26_31.translation: In terms of love, affection and service, the rest of my mothers are all equal. Therefore, you must pay them due respect regularly.
26_31.word_by_word: शेषाः the rest of them, या मम मातरः my mothers, ते to you also, नित्यम् always, वन्दितव्याः should be respected, मम my, मातरः mothers, स्नेहप्रणय सम्भोगैः with love, affection and service, समाः हि are equal.

26_32.shloka: भ्रातृपुत्रसमौ चापि द्रष्टव्यौ च विशेषतः।त्वया भरतशत्रुघ्नौ प्राणैः प्रियतरौ मम।।2.26.33।।
26_32.translation: What is more important is that you should look on Bharata as your brother and Satrughna as your son. They are dearer to me than my life.
26_32.word_by_word: मम to me, प्राणैः  more than life , प्रियतरौ dearer, भरतशत्रुघ्नौ Bharata and Satrughna, विशेषतः specially, त्वया by you, भ्रातृपुत्रसमौ as your brother and your sons, द्रष्टव्यौ च are to be looked after.

26_33.shloka: विप्रियं न च कर्तव्यं भरतस्य कदाचन।स हि राजा प्रभुश्चैव देशस्य च कुलस्य च।।2.26.34।।
26_33.translation: Now Bharata is the king of the country and head of the family. Therefore, you should never do anything disagreeable to him.
26_33.word_by_word: कदाचन at any time, भरतस्य of Bharata, विप्रियम् disagreeable, न कर्तव्यम् should not be done, सः he, देशस्य च of the country, कुलस्य च of the family also, राजा king, प्रभुश्चैव  also the lord.

26_34.shloka: आराधिता हि शीलेन प्रयत्नैश्चोपसेविताः।राजान स्सम्प्रसीदन्ति कुप्यन्तिच विपर्यये।।2.26.35।।
26_34.translation: Kings are gratified if they are served with zeal and good conduct. If the contrary happens, they get provoked.
26_34.word_by_word: राजान: kings, शीलेन with good conduct, आराधिताः are gratified, प्रयत्नैः with endeavours, उपसेविताः having been served, सम्प्रसीदन्ति are satisfied, विपर्यये in contrary to that, कुप्यन्तिच are also enraged.

26_35.translation: Kings abandon (even) their own sons if they are harmful and receive capable people even if they are strangers.
26_35.word_by_word: नराधिपाः kings, अहितकारिणः harmful men, औरसान् पुत्रानपि even their own sons, त्यजन्ति will abandon, समर्थान् capable men, जनानपि even other people, सम्प्रगृह्णन्ति accept.

26_36.shloka: सा त्वं वसेह कल्याणि राज्ञस्समनुवर्तिनी।भरतस्य रता धर्मे सत्यव्रतपरायणा।।2.26.37।।
26_36.translation: O auspicious one live here by being obedient to king Bharata. Absorbed in righteousness, follow truth and (religious) vows.
26_36.word_by_word: कल्याणि O auspicious one, सा त्वम् so you, राज्ञः of the king, भरतस्य of  Bharata, समनुवर्तिनी an obedient lady, धर्मे in righteousness, रता absorbed one, सत्यव्रत परायणा following the truth and the vows, इह वस live here.

26_37.shloka: अहं गमिष्यामि महावनं प्रियेत्वया हि वस्तव्यमिहैव भामिनि।यथा व्यलीकं कुरुषे न कस्य चित्तथा त्वया कार्यमिदं वचो मम।।2.26.38।।
26_37.translation: O my beloved Sita I am going to the wild forest. Stay here and never cause displeasure to any one in any way. Could you carry out these words of mine?इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे षड्विंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the twentysixth sarga of Ayodhyakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
26_37.word_by_word: प्रिये O beloved one, भामिनि beauty (Sita), अहम् I, महावनम् to the great forest, गमिष्यामि I am going, त्वया by you, इहैव here itself, कस्यचित् to any one, यथा in any way, व्यलीकम् harm, न कुरुषे would not do, तथा in that way, वस्तव्यम् you shall live here, मम my, इदं वचः these words, कार्यम् should be done.

27_1.shloka: [Sita prays Rama to take her along with him to the forest.]एवमुक्ता तु वैदेही प्रियार्हा प्रियवादिनी।प्रणयादेव संक्रुद्धा भर्तारमिदमब्रवीत्।।2.27.1।।
27_1.translation: When the sweettongued daughter of Videha (Sita) who deserved affection, heard this she was very angry out of her love (for Rama). She said these wordsto her husband (in reply):
27_1.word_by_word: प्रियवादिनी speaking pleasant words, प्रियार्हा deserving affection, वैदेही Sita, एवम् thus, उक्ता spoken to, प्रणयादेव out of love, संक्रुद्धा mighty angry, भर्तारम् to her husband, इदम् these words, अब्रवीत् said.

27_2.shloka: किमिदं भाषसे राम वाक्यं लघुतया ध्रुवम्।त्वया यदपहास्यं मे श्रुत्वा नरवरात्मज।।2.27.2।।
27_2.translation: O Rama why are you speaking so lightly? O prince if you hear these very same words (spoken to you), you will ridicule me.
27_2.word_by_word: नरवरात्मज O Prince, राम Rama, यत् since, लघुतया lightly, त्वया by you, ध्रुवम् certainly, अपहास्यम् fit to be ridiculed, श्रुत्वा having heard, मे to me (by me also), इदम् these, किं वाक्यम् what words, भाषसे are speaking.

27_3.shloka: आर्यपुत्र पिता माता भ्राता पुत्रस्तथा स्नुषा।स्वानि पुण्यानि भुञ्जानाः स्वं स्वं भाग्यमुपासते।।2.27.3।।
27_3.translation: O son of a noble monarch father, mother, brother, son or daughterinlaw   (everybody) experiences the merit (of their past deeds) and receives what is due from destiny.
27_3.word_by_word: आर्यपुत्र O son of a noble monarch, पिता father, माता mother, भ्राता brother, पुत्रः son, तथा also, स्नुषा daughterinlaw, स्वानि their own, पुण्यानि merits, भुञ्जानाः while enjoying, स्वं स्वम् due to each of them, भाग्यम् destiny, उपासते are receiving.

27_4.shloka: भर्तुर्भाग्यं तु भार्यैका प्राप्नोति पुरुषर्षभ।अतश्चैवाहमादिष्टा वने वस्तव्यमित्यपि।।2.27.4।।
27_4.translation: A wife alone, O best of men shares the destiny of her husband. I am also therefore, ordered to dwell in the forest. ( a command to you is a command to me).
27_4.word_by_word: पुरुषर्षभ O best of men, (Rama), भर्तुर्भाग्यं the destiny of husband, एका only, भार्या wife, प्राप्नोति receives, अतश्च therefore, अहमपि I also, वने in the forest, वस्तव्यमिति should dwell, अदिष्टा एव ordered.

27_5.shloka: न पिता नात्मजो नात्मा न माता न सखीजनः।इह प्रेत्य च नारीणां पतिरेको गतिस्सदा।।2.27.5।।
27_5.translation: It is not her father or mother, nor her son or herself, nor her friends but her husband alone gives a woman the permanent refuge in this or in the next world.
27_5.word_by_word: पिता father, न not, आत्मजः son, न not, आत्मा own self, न not, माता mother, न not, सखीजनः friends, न not, नारीणाम् for women, इह here, प्रेत्य च in the next world also, सदा always, एकः alone, पतिः husband, गतिः is the ultimate refuge.

27_6.shloka: यदि त्वं प्रस्थितो दुर्गं वनमद्यैव राघव।अग्रतस्ते गमिष्यामि मृद्नन्ती कुशकण्टकान्।।2.27.6।।
27_6.translation: O son of the Raghus if you set out for the impenetrable forest now itself, I shall also go, walking ahead of you and crushing the thorns and (spiky) kusa grass (rendering the path  comfortable for you to walk).
27_6.word_by_word: राघव son of the Raghus (Rama), अद्यैव now itself, त्वम् you, दुर्गम् impenetrable, वनम् forest, प्रस्थितः यदि if you set out, कुशकण्टकान् on thorns and on Kusa grass, मृद्नन्ती crushing, ते अग्रतः in front of you, गमिष्यामि I shall go.

27_7.shloka: ईर्ष्यारोषौ बहिष्कृत्य भुक्तशेषमिवोदकम्।नय मां वीर विस्रब्धः पापं मयि न विद्यते।।2.27.7।।
27_7.translation: Do take me with you, O valiant one without hesitation. Dismiss all anger and envy (from your mind) like the leftover water after drinking (anger because she disobeys and envy because she, too, like Rama, is willing to brave the hazards of forest life). There is no fault on my part.
27_7.word_by_word: वीर O Valiant one, ईर्ष्यारोषौ anger and jealousy, भुक्तशेषम् leftover after drinking, उदकम् इव like water, बहिष्कृत्य dismissing, विस्रब्ध: without hesitation, माम् me, नय take me, मयि in me, पापम् fault, न विद्यते does not exist.

27_8.shloka: प्रासादाग्रैर्विमानैर्वा वैहायसगतेन वा।सर्वावस्थागता भर्तुः पादच्छाया विशिष्यते।।2.27.8।।
27_8.translation: Every woman, everywhere be it on the top of mansions or in lovely palaces or flying in the sky should take shelter at his (her husband's) feet (or follow his footsteps).
27_8.word_by_word: प्रासादाग्रैः on top of mansions, विमानैर्वा or in lovely palaces, वैहायसगतेन वा moving in air, सर्वावस्थागता in all stages of  life, भर्तुः husband's, पादच्छाया shelter at his feet, विशिष्यते is preferable.

27_9.shloka: अनुशिष्टाऽस्मि मात्रा च पित्रा च विविधाश्रयम्।नाऽस्मि सम्प्रति वक्तव्या वर्तितव्यं यथा मया।।2.27.9।।
27_9.translation: I have been so instructed by my parents about diverse duties in all stages of life that I need not be told anything (about my duties) now.
27_9.word_by_word: मात्रा च by mother, पित्रा च by father, विविधाश्रयम् with regard to diverse duties,  अनुशिष्टाअस्मि I have been instructed, मया by myself, यथा in such a way, वर्तितव्यम् to abide, संप्रति now, वक्तव्या नास्मि need not be told to me.

27_10.shloka: अहं दुर्गं गमिष्यामि वनं पुरुषवर्जितम्।नानामृगगणाकीर्णं शार्दूलवृकसेवितम्।।2.27.10।।
27_10.translation: I will also go to the forest, which is impassable, uninhabited, teeming with various kinds of animals and infested with tigers and wolves.
27_10.word_by_word: अहम् I, दुर्गम् impassable, पुरुषवर्जितम् uninhabited by men, नानामृगगणाकीर्णम् teeming with various kinds of animals, शार्दूलवृकसेवितम् inhabited by tigers and wolves, वनम् forest, गमिष्यामि I shall go.

27_11.shloka: सुखं वने निवत्स्यामि यथैव भवने पितुः।अचिन्तयन्ती त्रीन्लोकांश्च्चिन्तयन्ती पतिव्रतम्।।2.27.11।।
27_11.translation: Free from any anxiety about the three worlds, my only concern will be my duties towards my husband. I shall dwell as happily in the forest as I did in my father's abode.
27_11.word_by_word: त्रीन् लोकान् the three worlds, अचिन्तयन्ती without thinking, पतिव्रतम् duties to the husband, चिन्तयन्ती while thinking, वने in the forest, पितुः father's, भवने in the palace, यथैव the same way, सुखम् happily, निवत्स्यामि I shall dwell.

27_12.shloka: शुश्रूषमाणा ते नित्यं नियता ब्रह्मचारिणी।सह रंस्ये त्वया वीर वनेषु मधुगन्धिषु।।2.27.12।।
27_12.translation: I shall wander with you, O heroic Rama in the honeyscented forest remaining selfpossessed, always doing  your service, and observing the vow of celibacy.
27_12.word_by_word: वीर O hero , नित्यम् always, ते to you, शुश्रूषमाणा doing service, नियता self possessed, ब्रह्मचारिणी observing vow of celibacy, मधुगन्धिषु honeyscented, वनेषु in forests, त्वया सह with you, रंस्ये I shall sport.

27_13.shloka: त्वं हि शक्तो वने कर्तुं राम सम्परिपालनम्।अन्यस्यापि जनस्येह किं पुनर्मम मानद।।2.27.13।।
27_13.translation: O respector of individuals when you are capable of protecting other people in the forest, what of me?
27_13.word_by_word: मानद O bestower of honour, राम Rama, त्वम् you, इह here, वने in the forest, अन्यस्य of others, जनस्य man's, सम्परिपालनमपि protection also, कर्तुम् to do, शक्त: हि is capable, मम about my protection, किं पुनः why again say?

27_14.shloka: सह त्वया गमिष्यामि वनमद्य न संशयः।नाहं शक्या महाभाग निवर्तयितुमुद्यता।।2.27.14।।
27_14.translation: There is no doudt that I shall go with you to the forest today. O distinguished one I cannot be restrained from this resolve.
27_14.word_by_word: अद्य today, त्वया सह along with you, वनम् to the forest, गमिष्यामि shall go, संशयः न no doubt about it, महाभाग O distinguished one, उद्यता resolved, अहम् I, निवर्तयितुम् to restrain, न शक्या not able.

27_15.shloka: फलमूलाशना नित्यं भविष्यामि न संशयः।न ते दुःखं करिष्यामि निवसन्ती सह त्वया।।2.27.15।।
27_15.translation: Do not doubt that I shall not be able to live on fruits and roots or that I will create difficulty for you while living with you.
27_15.word_by_word: नित्यम् always, फलमूलाशना living on fruits and roots, भविष्यामि I will become, संशयः  न no doubt, त्वया सह with you, निवसन्ती while living, ते to you, दुःखम् hardship, न करिष्यामि  will not do.

27_16.shloka: इच्छामि सरितश्शैलान्पल्वलानि वनानि च।द्रष्टुं सर्वत्र निर्भीता त्वया नाथेन धीमता।।2.27.16।।
27_16.translation: Living with you sans fear, O my sagacious husband, I wish to see the rivers, mountains, lakes and forests here and there.
27_16.word_by_word: धीमता with the sagacious, नाथेन by my lord, त्वया along with you, सर्वत्र everywhere, निर्भीता  without fear, सरितः rivers, शैलान् mountains, पल्वलानि lakes and, वनानि च and the forests, द्रष्टुम् to see, इच्छामि I wish.

27_17.shloka: हंसकारण्डवाकीर्णाः पद्मिनीस्साधुपुष्पिताः।इच्छेयं सुखिनी द्रष्टुं त्वया वीरेण सङ्गता।।2.27.17।।
27_17.translation: I wish to enjoy the lotus lakes in full bloom, abounding in swans and ducks in the company of a brave husband like you.
27_17.word_by_word: वीरेण by a warrior (like you), त्वया with you, सङ्गता in company of, सुखिनी happy, हंसकारण्डवाकीर्णाः abounding in swans and ducks, साधु पुष्पिताः fully bloomed, पद्मिनी: lotus ponds, द्रष्टुम् to see, इच्छेयम् I wish.

27_18.shloka: अभिषेकं करिष्यामि तासु नित्यं यतव्रता।सह त्वया विशालाक्ष रंस्ये परमनन्दिनी ।।2.27.18।।
27_18.translation: Observing such vows and bathing daily in the lotus lakes, I shall be very much happy to sport with you, O largeeyed one
27_18.word_by_word: विशालाक्ष O largeeyed one, यतव्रता observing such vows, नित्यम् daily, तासु in those lotus ponds, अभिषेकम् bathing, करिष्यामि will take, परमनन्दिनी attaining great happiness, त्वया सह along with you, रंस्ये I will sport.

27_19.shloka: एवं वर्षसहस्राणां शतं वाऽहं त्वया सह।व्यतिक्रमं न वेत्स्यामि स्वर्गोऽपि न हि मे मतः।।2.27.19।।
27_19.translation: Thus living in your company for a thousand years or even  a hundred thousand years, I shall not feel the passing of time. I shall not desire even heaven.
27_19.word_by_word: एवम् in this way, अहम् I, त्वया सह with you, वर्षसहस्राणाम्  a thousand years, शतं वापि or even a hundred thousand years (of living with you), व्यतिक्रमम् bassing of time, न वेत्स्यामि   I shall not feel, मे to me, स्वर्ग: अपि even heaven, न मतः हि is not desirable.

27_20.shloka: स्वर्गेऽपि च विना वासो भविता यदि राघव।त्वया मम नरव्याघ्र नाहं तमपि रोचये।।2.27.20।।
27_20.translation: O Raghava, tiger among men, if I were given heaven to live in without you, even that I shall not covet.
27_20.word_by_word: नरव्याघ्र O best of men, राघव Rama, त्वया विना without you, मम to me, स्वर्गेऽपि even in heaven, वासः living, भविता यदि if it were to happen, अहम् I, तमपि that one also, न रोचये Ido not like.

27_21.shloka: अहं गमिष्यामि वनं सुदुर्गमंमृगायुतं वानरवारणैर्युतम्।वने निवत्स्यामि यथा पितुर्गृहेतवैव पादावुपगृह्य संयता।।2.27.21।।
27_21.translation: I shall go (along with you) to the highly impenetrable forest infested with animals likemonkeys and elephants. I shall live in the forest in (full) discipline as in my father's abode, taking shelter at your feet.
27_21.word_by_word: अहम् I, सुदुर्गमम् highly impenetrable, मृगायुतम् full of animals, वानरवारणैः with monkeys and elephants, वनम् to the forest, गमिष्यामि shall go, तव your, पादावेव feet alone, उपगृह्य taking refuge, संयता restraining myself, वने in the forest, पितुः father's, गृहे यथा like in his house, निवत्स्यामि I shall reside.

27_22.shloka: अनन्यभावामनुरक्तचेतसंत्वया वियुक्तां मरणायनिश्चिताम्।नयस्व मां साधु कुरुष्व याचनाम्न ते मयाऽतो गुरुता भविष्यति।।2.27.22।।
27_22.translation: Since I have no thought other than you and my heart is (irretrievably) attached to youI have resolved to die if separated from you. Pray, be favourably disposed to take me. I shall not be a burden to you.
27_22.word_by_word: अनन्यभावाम् without any other thought, अनुरक्तचेतसम् with heart deeply attached, त्वया by you, वियुक्ताम् separated (from you), मरणाय for death, निश्चिताम् resolved, माम् me, नयस्व take, याचनाम् my prayer, साधु be welldisposed, कुरुष्व do, अतः for that, ते for you, मया by me, गुरुता burden, न भविष्यति will not be.

27_23.shloka: तथा ब्रुवाणामपि धर्मवत्सलोन च स्म सीतां नृवरो निनीषति।उवाच चैनां बहु सन्निवर्तनेवने निवासस्य च दुःखितां प्रति।।2.27.23।।
27_23.translation: Although Sita was thus appealing, Rama, devoted to righteousness, was (still) unwilling to take her. In order to dissuade her, he began to describe to the mournful Sita the many hardships of forest life.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे सप्तविंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the twentyseventh sarga of Ayodhyakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
27_23.word_by_word: धर्मवत्सलः devoted to righteousness, नृवरः best of men, तथा that way, ब्रूवाणामपि though speaking, सीताम् tp Sita, न निनीषति स्म was unwilling to take, सन्निवर्तने  to dissuade her, एनाम् to her, वने in the forest, निवासस्य of stay, दुःखितां प्रति to the grieved, बहु in many ways, उवाच च said.

28_1.shloka: [Rama relates to Sita the hardships of forest life-- dissuades her from accompanying him to the forest.]स एवं ब्रुवतीं सीतां धर्मज्ञो धर्मवत्सलः।न नेतुं कुरुते बुद्धिं वने दुःखानि चिन्तयन्।।2.28.1।।
28_1.translation: Rama, who knew his duties and was devoted to righteousness, reflected on the difficulties of forest (life) and did not agree to take Sita even though she was pleading the way she did.
28_1.word_by_word: धर्मज्ञः knower of righteousness, धर्मवत्सलः devoted to righteousness, सः he, एवम् thus, ब्रुवतीम् speaking, सीताम् to Sita, नेतुम् to take, बुद्धिम् decision, वने in the forest, दुःखानि difficulties, चिन्तयन् while reflecting so, न कुरुते did not make.

28_2.shloka: सान्त्वयित्वा पुनस्तां तु बाष्पदूषितलोचनाम्।निवर्तनार्थे धर्मात्मा वाक्यमेतदुवाच ह।।2.28.2।।
28_2.translation: Righteous Rama consoled Sita whose eyes were blurred with tears, and in order to dissuade her (from going to the forest) said again:
28_2.word_by_word: धर्मात्मा righteous, बाष्पदूषितलोचनाम् whose eyes were blurred with tears, ताम् her, सान्त्वयित्वा having consoled, निवर्तनार्थे to dissuade, पुनः again, एतत् this, वाक्यम् word, उवाच ह said.

28_3.shloka: सीते महाकुलीनाऽसि धर्मे च निरता सदा।इहाऽचर स्वधर्मं त्वं मे यथा मनसस्सुखम्।।2.28.3।।
28_3.translation: Born in a noble race, O Sita, you are always devoted to duty. Follow your duty, here. It will make me happy.
28_3.word_by_word: सीते O Sita, महाकुलीना born in a noble race, सदा always, धर्मे to duty ,निरता असि you are devoted, इह here, यथा as, मे मनसः to my mind, सुखम् brings happiness, त्वम् you, स्वधर्मम् your duty, आचर practise.

28_4.shloka: सीते यथा त्वां वक्ष्यामि तथा कार्यं त्वयाऽबले।वने हि बहवो दोषा वदतस्तान्निबोध मे।।2.28.4।।
28_4.translation: Do as I tell you, O delicate Sita. There are, indeed, many hardships in the forest. I shall tell you all about them. Listen to me.
28_4.word_by_word: अबले O frail one, सीते O Sita, त्वाम् you, यथा as, वक्ष्यामि I shall tell you, तथा like that, त्वया by you, कार्यम् should be done, वने in the forest, बहवः many, दोषाः हि hardships are thereindeed, वदतः being told, मे by me, तान् about them, निबोध pray attention.

28_5.shloka: सीते विमुच्यतामेषा वनवासकृता मतिः।बहुदोषं हि कान्तारं वनमित्यभिधीयते।।2.28.5।।
28_5.translation: Give up the desire to live in the forest, O Sita Living in the dreary jungle, it is said, has many hardships.
28_5.word_by_word: सीते O Sita, वनवासकृता to live in the forest, एषा this, मति: mind, विमुच्यताम् give up, कान्तारम् a dreary forest, वनम् forest, बहुदोषं (बहुदोषयुतं) has many hardships, अभिधीयते हि is being said.

28_6.shloka: हितबुद्ध्या खलु वचो मयैतदभिधीयते।सदा सुखं न जानामि दुःखमेव सदा वनम्।।2.28.6।।
28_6.translation: I am saying all this in your interest. The forest is a haven of hardships. I know of nohappiness in the forest.
28_6.word_by_word: मया by me, एतत् वचः these words, हितबुद्ध्या with prudence, अभिधीयते हि is being said, वनम् forest, सदा always, सुखम् as happy, न जानामि I do not know, सदा always, दुःखमेव grief only.

28_7.shloka: गिरिनिर्झरसम्भूता गिरिकन्दर वासिनाम्।सिंहानां निनदा दुःखा श्श्रोतुं दुःखमतो वनम्।।2.28.7।।
28_7.translation: It is frightening to hear the sounds of  waterfalls and the roar of lions living in the mountain caves. Therefore forest life is painful (fearful).
28_7.word_by_word: गिरिनिर्झरसम्भूताः arising from the falling waters from mountains, निनदाः sounds, गिरिकन्दर वासिनाम् living in the mountain caves, सिंहानाम् of lions, श्रोतुम् to hear, दुःखाः fearful, अतः therefore, वनम् forest, दुःखम् source of  pain, दुःखमतो painful.

28_8.shloka: क्रीडमानाश्च विस्रब्धा मत्ता श्शून्ये महामृगाः।दृष्ट्वा समभिवर्तन्ते सीते दुःखमतो वनम्।।2.28.8।।
28_8.translation: Big, wild animals, moving about freely and sporting in the deserted forest, attack on seeing a human. Thus forest is full of danger.
28_8.word_by_word: विस्रब्धाः fearless, मत्ताः wild, शून्ये in a deserted place, क्रीडमानाः while sporting, महामृगाः great animals, दृष्ट्वा on seeing, समभिवर्तन्ते attack, सीते Sita, अतः therefore, वनम् forest, दुःखम् is a source of danger.

28_9.shloka: सग्राहा स्सरितश्चैव पङ्कवत्यस्सु दुस्तराः।मत्तैरपि गजैर्नित्यमतो दुःखतरं वनम्।।2.28.9।।
28_9.translation: The rivers, infested with crocodiles and filled with mud are difficult to cross even for elephants in rut. Hence forest life is always extremely dangerous.
28_9.word_by_word: सग्राहाः with crocodiles, पङ्कवत्यः च filled with mud, सरितश्चैव rivers also, मत्तै: intoxicated, गजैरपि by elephants also, दुस्तराः difficult to cross, अतः therefore, वनम् the forest, नित्यम् always, दुःखतरम् more dangerous.

28_10.shloka: लताकण्टकसङ्कीर्णाः कृकवाकूपनादिताः।निरपाश्च सुदुर्गाश्च मार्गा दुःखमतो वनम्।।2.28.10।।
28_10.translation: .The paths full of thorny creepers, echoing with the noise of wild fowls, and with no water (to drink) are difficult to tread. So forest is a source of suffering.
28_10.word_by_word: मार्गाः the paths, लताकण्टकसङ्कीर्णाः full of thorny creepers, कृकवाकूपनादिताः echoing with the noise of wild fowls, निरपाः with no water, सुदुर्गाः च are  extremely difficult to traverse, अतः therefore, वनम् forest, दुःखम् is a difficult place.

28_11.shloka: सुप्यते पर्णशय्यासु स्वयं भग्नासु भूतले।रात्रिषु श्रमखिन्नेन तस्माद्दुःखतरं वनम्।।2.28.11।।
28_11.translation: Exhausted with struggles one has to sleep at night on a bed of leaves fallen on their own on the ground. Therefore, forest life is extremely painful.
28_11.word_by_word: स्वयम् on their own, भग्नासु broken (fallen), पर्णशय्यासु bed of leaves, भूतले on the ground, श्रमखिन्नेन exhausted with struggles, रात्रिषु at night, सुप्यते will have to sleep, तस्मात्  therefore, वनम् forest life, दुःखतरम् is extremely painful.

28_12.shloka: अहोरात्रं च सन्तोषः कर्तव्यो नियतात्मना।फलैर्वृक्षावपतितै स्सीते दुःखमतो वनम्।।2.28.12।।
28_12.translation: With the senses under control night and day, O Sita, one must be satisfied with the fruits fallen from trees. Therefore, forest life is full of suffering.
28_12.word_by_word: सीते O Sita, अहोरात्रम् night and day, नियतात्मना with senses under control, वृक्षावपतितैः fallen down the trees, फलैः with fruits, सन्तोषः satisfaction, कर्तव्यः to be derived, अतः therefore, वनम् forest life, दुःखम् is full of suffering.

28_13.shloka: उपवासश्च कर्तव्यो यथा प्राणेन मैथिलि।जटाभारश्च कर्तव्यो वल्कलाम्बरधारिणा।।2.28.13।।
28_13.translation: One has to wear robes of bark and matted hair and take to fasting as long as one can, O daughter of Mithila
28_13.word_by_word: मैथिलि O Daughter of Mithila, यथाप्राणेन according to one's ability, उपवासश्च fasting also, कर्तव्यः has to be undertaken, वल्कलाम्बरधारिणा wearing robes of bark, जटाभारश्च also burden of matted hair, कर्तव्यः has to be borne.

28_14.shloka: देवतानां पित्रूणां कर्तव्यं विधिपूर्वकम्।प्राप्तानामतिथीनां च नित्यशः प्रतिपूजनम्।।2.28.14।।
28_14.translation: One has to worship gods and ancestors according to tradition and extend hospitality to guests, (who arrive unexpectedly).
28_14.word_by_word: देवतानाम् of devatas, पित्रूणां च also of ancestors, प्राप्तानाम् of those arrived, अतिथीनां च of guests also, विधिपूर्वकम् duly, नित्यशः always, प्रतिपूजनम् worship, कर्तव्यम् needs to be done.

28_15.shloka: कार्यस्त्रिरभिषेकश्च काले काले च नित्यशः।चरता नियमेनैव तस्माद्धुःखतरं वनम्।।2.28.15।।
28_15.translation: One has to wander about all the while (like an ascetic) as per the customs and take ablutions three times a day at prescribed hours. Hence life in the forest is extremely hard.
28_15.word_by_word: नियमेनैव as per rule, चरता while wandering (like an ascetic), नित्यशः always, काले काले at prescribed hours, त्रिः three times, अभिषेकः bathing, कार्यः will have to be done, तस्मात् therefore, वनम् life in the forest, दुःखतरम् is extremely difficult.

28_16.shloka: उपहारश्च कर्तव्यः कुसुमै स्स्वयमाहृतैः।आर्षेण विधिना वेद्यां बाले दुःखमतो वनम्।।2.28.16।।
28_16.translation: Flowers collected with one's own hands, O innocent one, should be offered on the altar as per injunction of the Vedas. Therefore (life in the) forest is difficult.
28_16.word_by_word: बाले O innocent one, स्वयम् on your own, आहृतैः has been brought, कुसुमैः with flowers, आर्षेण विधिना as per the injunction of the Vedas, वेद्याम् on the altar, उपहारश्च offering, कर्तव्यः needs to be made, अतः therefore, वनम् living in the forest, दुःखम् is difficult.

28_17.shloka: यथालब्धेन कर्तव्यः सन्तोषस्तेन मैथिलि।यताहारैर्वनचरै र्नित्यं दुःखमतो वनम्।।2.28.17।।
28_17.translation: The wanderers in the jungle, O daughter of Mithila, have to be satisfied daily with whatever little food is available. So forest (life) is a hard life.
28_17.word_by_word: मैथिलि O daughter of Mithila, वनचरैः by wanderers in the forest, यताहारैः with limited food, यथालब्धेन  whatever is available, तेन with that alone, सन्तोषः satisfaction, कर्तव्यः should be derived, अतः for that reason, वनम् forest life, दुःखम् is difficult.

28_18.shloka: अतीव वातास्तिमिरं बुभुक्षा चात्र नित्यशः।भयानि च महान्त्यत्र ततो दुःखतरं वनम्।।2.28.18।।
28_18.translation: There is extreme wind and darkness, hunger and fear. Therefore forest (life) is difficult.
28_18.word_by_word: अत्र there (in the forest), वाताः wind, तिमिरम् darkness, अतीव is extreme, नित्यशः always, बुभुक्षा hunger, महान्ति great, भयानि च fears also, ततः therefore, वनम् forest life, दुःखतरम् is extremely difficult.

28_19.shloka: सरीसृपाश्च बहवो बहुरूपाश्च भामिनि।चरन्ति पृथिवीं दर्पात्ततो दुःखतरं वनम्।।2.28.19।।
28_19.translation: There are various forms of fierce reptiles fearlessly crawling on the ground. So (living in the) forest is extremely dangerous.
28_19.word_by_word: भामिनि O Beautiful lady, बहुरूपाः च of various forms too, बहवः many, सरीसृपाः च reptilesalso, दर्पात् fiercely, पृथिवीम् on the ground, चरन्ति move about, ततः therefore, वनम् to live in the forest, दुःखतरं is extremely dangerous.

28_20.shloka: नदी निलयना स्सर्पा नदीकुटिलगामिनः।तिषठ्न्त्यावृत्य पन्थानं ततो दुःखतरं वनम्।।.2.28.20।।
28_20.translation: The serpents that live in and move like meandering rivers always obstruct  the paths. Therefore, living in the forest is tremendously difficult.
28_20.word_by_word: नदी निलयनाः live in rivers, नदीकुटिलगामिनः meandering like rivers, सर्पाः serpents, पन्थानम् the path, आवृत्य having obstructed, तिष्ठन्ति stay, ततः therefore, वनम् life in the forest, दुःखतरम् is full of sufferings.

28_21.shloka: पतङ्गा वृश्चिकाः कीटा दंशाश्च मशकै स्सह।बाधन्ते नित्यमबले सर्वं दुःखमतो वनम्।।2.28.21।।
28_21.translation: Birds, scorpions, insects, gnats and mosquitoes always create trouble. Therefore, life in the forest is all suffering.
28_21.word_by_word: पतङ्गा: birds, वृश्चिकाः scorpions, कीटाः insects, मशकैः सह with mosquitoes, दंशाश्च gnats, नित्यम् always, सर्वम् everyone, बाधन्ते trouble,  अतः therefore, वनम् the life in forest, दुःखम् is a source of suffering.

28_22.shloka: द्रुमाः कण्टकिनश्चैव कुशा: काशाश्च भामिनि।वने व्याकुलशाखाग्रास्तेन दुःखतरं वनम्।।2.28.22।।
28_22.translation: O lovely Sita there are thorny trees with branches on the top interlaced with one another. There are kusa grass and reeds. So forest life is very hard.
28_22.word_by_word: भामिनि O lovely Sita, वने in the forest, द्रुमाः trees, कुशा काशाः च kusa grass and reeds,  कण्टकिनश्चैव thorny ones, व्याकुलशाखाग्राः with tops of branches interlaced with each other, तेन therefore, वनम् forest life, दुःखतरम् is full of difficulties.

28_23.shloka: कायक्लेशाश्च बहवो भयानि विविधानि च।अरण्यवासे वसतो दुःखमेव ततो वनम्।।2.28.23।।
28_23.translation: There are various physical afflictions and fears for one who lives in the forest. Therefore, forest brings suffering.
28_23.word_by_word: अरण्यवासे living in the forest, वसतः while living, बहवः many, कायक्लेशाः physical afflictions, विविधानि various, भयानि च fears, ततः therefore, वनम् forest, दुःखमेव is full of difficultiesonly.

28_24.shloka: क्रोधलोभौ विमोक्तव्यौ कर्तव्या तपसे मतिः।न भेतव्यं च भेतव्ये नित्यं दुःखमतो वनम्।।2.28.24।।
28_24.translation: Anger and greed have to be given up, with the mind preoccupied with ascetic practices. One should not be afraid of fearful situations. Hence forest (life) always very hard.
28_24.word_by_word: क्रोधलोभौ anger and greed, विमोक्तव्यौ should be given up, तपसे in asceticism, मतिः mind, कर्तव्या must be fixed, भेतव्ये even in alarming situations, न भेतव्यम् one should not be afraid, अतः therefore, वनम् life in the forest, नित्यम् always, दुःखम् full of misery.

28_25.shloka: तदलं ते वनं गत्वा क्षमं न हि वनं तव।विमृशन्निह पश्यामि बहुदोषतरं वनम्।।2.28.25।।
28_25.translation: Thus forest life is not suitable for you. On reconsideration, I see that there are many dangers in forest life.
28_25.word_by_word: तत् for that reason, ते to you, वनम् to the forest, गत्वा going, अलम् is not desirable, तव for you, वनम् forest life, क्षमम् न हि is not fit, इह now, विमृशन् while reconsidering, वनम् forest life, बहुदोषतरम् is full of great dangers, पश्यामि I see.

28_26.shloka: वनन्तु नेतुं न कृता मतिस्तदाबभूव रामेण यदा महात्मना।न तस्य सीता वचनं चकार तत्ततोऽब्रवीद्राममिदं सुदुःखिता।।2.28.26।।
28_26.translation: When the great Rama decided not to take her along with him to the forest, Sita, deeply grieved said these words.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे अष्टाविंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the twentyeighth sarga of Ayodhyakanda of  the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
28_26.word_by_word: महात्मना by the great, रामेण by Rama, यदा when, वनम् to the forest, नेतुम् to take, मतिः mind (decision), कृता has been made, न बभूव did not happen, तदा then, सीता Sita, तस्य his, तत्  that, वचनं words, न चकार did not follow, ततः threafter, सुदुःखिता deeply grieved, रामम् to Rama, इदम् these words, अब्रवीत् said.

29_1.shloka: [Sita insists on going with Rama]एतत्तु वचनं श्रुत्वा सीता रामस्य दुःखिता।प्रसक्ताश्रुमुखी मन्दमिदं वचनमब्रवीत्।।2.29.1।।
29_1.translation: Having heard the words of Rama, thus spoke Sita in a faint voice in sadness, with tears flowing incessantly from her eyes:
29_1.word_by_word: सीता Sita, रामस्य Rama's, एतत् these, वचनम् words, श्रुत्वा तु having heard, दुःखिता sad, प्रसक्ताश्रुमुखी with tears flowing incessantly from her face, मन्दम् in a faint  voice, इदं वचनम् these words, अब्रवीत् spoke.

29_2.shloka: ये त्वया कीर्तिता दोषा वने वस्तव्यतां प्रति।गुणानित्येव तान्विद्धि तव स्नेहपुरस्कृतान्।।2.29.2।।
29_2.translation: Understand that the difficulties of forest life described by you will be turned into advantages if they are accompanied by your affection.
29_2.word_by_word: वने in the forest, वस्तव्यतां प्रति about dwelling in the forest, त्वया by you, ये those, दोषाःdifficulties, कीर्तिताः described, तव your, स्नेहपुरस्कृतान् accompanied by your affection, तान् them, गुणानित्येव as virtues only, विद्धि understand.

29_3.shloka: मृगा स्सिंहा गजाश्चैव शार्दूला श्शरभास्तथा।पक्षिण स्सृमराश्चैव ये चान्ये वनचारिणः।।2.29.3।।अदृष्टपूर्वरूपत्वात्सर्वे ते तव राघव।रूपं दृष्ट्वाऽपसर्पेयुर्भये सर्वे हि बिभ्यति।।2.29.4।।
29_3.translation: O scion of the Raghu race antelopes, lions, elephants, tigers, sarabhas, birds, srimaras and other wild beasts wandering in the forest have not seen your beauty before. Now on seeing you, they will flee away. In fact, who will not be afraid of seeing an object of fear?.
29_3.word_by_word: राघव Rama, मृगाः antelopes, सिंहाः lions, गजाश्चैव elephants also, शार्दूला: tigers, तथा also, शरभाः sarabhas (a fabulous deer said to have eight legs), पक्षिणः birds, सृमराश्चैव srimaras (a kind of deer), अन्ये other, ये all, वनचारिणः wild beasts wandering in the forest, ते सर्वे all those, तव your, अदृष्टपूर्वरूपत्वात् which had not been seen by you before, रूपम् your appearance, दृष्ट्वैव on seeing alone, अपसर्पेयुः will flee away, भये when fear arises, सर्वे all, बिभ्यति हि are afraid of.

29_4.shloka: त्वया च सह गन्तव्यं मया गुरुजनाज्ञया।त्वद्वियोगेन मे राम त्यक्तव्यमिह जीवितम्।।2.29.5।।
29_4.translation: In accordance with the command of the elders, I must accompany you to the forest. If I am separated from you, I will give up my life here itself.
