29_4.word_by_word: गुरुजनाज्ञया with the command of elders, त्वया सह along with you, मया च गन्तव्यम् I should follow, राम Rama, त्वद्वियोगेन if separated from you, मे my, जीवितम् life, इह here, त्यक्तव्यम् will have to be given up.

29_5.shloka: न हि मां त्वत्समीपस्थामपि शक्नोतिराघव।सुराणामीश्वर श्शक्रः प्रधर्षयितुमोजसा।।2.29.6।।
29_5.translation: If I am  in your company, O Rama even the lord of the gods, Indra with all his might will not be able to hurt me.
29_5.word_by_word: राघव O Rama, त्वत्समीवस्थाम् in your company, माम् me, सुराणाम् for gods, ईश्वरः lord, शक्र:  अपि even Indra, ओजसा with his might, प्रधर्षयितुम् to injure, न शक्नोति will not be able

29_6.shloka: पतिहीना तु या नारी न सा शक्ष्यति जीवितुम्।काममेवं विधं राम त्वया मम निदर्शितम्।।2.29.7।।
29_6.translation: Your salutary instruction to me, O Rama, is 'A woman cannot live without her husband'. This truth is greatly applicable to me.
29_6.word_by_word: या नारी a woman, पतिहीना without her husband, सा she, जीवितुम् to live, न शक्ष्यति cannot live, राम Rama, त्वया by you, कामम् greatly, एवं विधम् in this manner, मम to me, निदर्शितम्  has been illustrated.

29_7.shloka: अथ चापि महाप्राज्ञ ब्राह्मणानां मया श्रुतम्।पुरा पितृगृहे सत्यं वस्तव्यं किल मे वने।।2.29.8।।
29_7.translation: O highly sagacious Rama  I had also heard in my father's house long ago, from brahmins prophesing that some day I shall have certainly to dwell in the forest.
29_7.word_by_word: महाप्राज्ञ O Sagacious one, अथ चापि moreover, पुरा formerly, पितृगृहे at my father's  house, मया by me, ब्राह्माणानाम् brahmins' (word), श्रुतम् has been heard, मे about me, सत्यम् in sooth, वने in the forest, वस्तव्यं किल to dwell certainly.

29_8.shloka: लक्षणिभ्यो द्विजातिभ्य श्शृत्वाऽहं वचनं पुरा।वनवासकृतोत्साहा नित्यमेव महाबल।।2.29.9।।
29_8.translation: O mighty hero ever since I heard the prophesies from the brahmin palmists I am yearning to dwell in the forest.
29_8.word_by_word: महाबल O mighty one, अहम् I, पुरा long ago, लक्षणिभ्यः from palmist, द्विजातिभ्यः from brahmins, वचनम् words, शृत्वा having heard, नित्यमेव always, वनवासकृतोत्साहा I have become eager to dwell in the forest.

29_9.shloka: आदेशो वनवासस्य प्राप्तव्य स्स मया किल।सा त्वया सह तत्राहं यास्यामि प्रिय नान्यथा।।2.29.10।।
29_9.translation: Therefore, O my beloved I must certainly obtain such a command to dwell in the forest. I must accompany you to the forest and it cannot be otherwise.
29_9.word_by_word: प्रिय O beloved Rama, मया by me, वनवासस्य to dwell in the forest, सः आदेशः such orders, प्राप्तव्यः किल certainly needs to be obtained, सा अहम् such I am, त्वया सह along with you, तत्र there, यास्यामि I shall accompany, अन्यथा न not otherwise.

29_10.shloka: कृतादेशा भविष्यामि गमिष्यामि सह त्वया।कालश्चायं समुत्पन्न स्सत्यवाग्भवतु द्विजः।।2.29.11।।
29_10.translation: I will go with you, true to the prediction of the brahmin. That time has come and let his prediction come to pass.
29_10.word_by_word: कृतादेशा carrying out the orders, भविष्यामि I shall become, त्वया सह along with you, गमिष्यामि shall go, अयम् this, कालश्च time, समुत्पन्नः has come, द्विज: brahmin, सत्यवाक् true to his words, भवतु let him be.

29_11.shloka: वनवासेऽभिजानामि दुःखानि बहुथा किल।प्राप्यन्ते नियतं वीर पुरुषैरकृतात्मभिः।।2.29.12।।
29_11.translation: I am aware, O valiant one, that there are hardships of every  kind in forest life. But they befall those whose senses are not under their  control.
29_11.word_by_word: वीर O valiant one, वनवासे while residing in the forest, दुःखानि hardships, बहुथा किल  certainly of every kind, अभिजानामि I am aware, अकृतात्मभिः by those whose senses are not under their control, पुरुषैः by men, नियतम् definitely, प्राप्यन्ते will be experienced.

29_12.shloka: कन्यया च पितुर्गेहे वनवास श्शृतो मया।भिक्षिण्या स्साधुवृत्ताया मम मातुरिहाग्रतः।।2.29.13।।
29_12.translation: When I was young in my father's house, a holy female mendicant foretold in the presence of my mother that I would dwell in the forest (in this life).
29_12.word_by_word: पितुः father's, गेहे in the house, कन्यया when I was young, मया by me, मम मातुः my mother's, अग्रतः in the presence, साधुवृत्तायाः a saint, भिक्षिण्या a female mendicant, इह  inthis world, वनवासः forest life, श्रुतः heard.

29_13.shloka: प्रसादितश्च वै पूर्वं त्वं मे बहुतिथं प्रभो।गमनं वनवासस्य काङ्क्षितं हि सह त्वया।।2.29.14।।
29_13.translation: Pleased with my long entreaties in the past  to dwell with you in the forest, O lord, you had granted my desire.
29_13.word_by_word: प्रभो O Lord, पूर्वम् in the past, त्वम् you, बहुतिथम् for a long time, मे for me, प्रसादितश्च वै  favoured, त्वया सह along with you, वनवासस्य गमनम् to go to the forest, काङ्क्षितं हि is wished for.

29_14.shloka: कृतक्षणाऽहं भद्रं ते गमनं प्रति राघव।वनवासस्य शूरस्य चर्या हि मम रोचते।।2.29.15।।
29_14.translation: Since then I have been counting time for this forest life. It pleases me to follow my valiant hero as he lives in the forest. Rama, prosperity to you
29_14.word_by_word: राघव Rama, ते to you, वनवासस्य of forest life, गमनं प्रति about departure, अहम् I, कृतक्षणा counting time, ते भद्रम् prosperity to you, शूरस्य of a valiant one,  चर्या movement, मम to me, रोचते हि is pleasing.

29_15.shloka: शुद्धात्मन्प्रेमभावाध्दि भविष्यामि विकल्मषा।भर्तारमनुगच्छन्ती भर्ता हि मम दैवतम्।।2.29.16।।
29_15.translation: O my purehearted one by following my husband with love I shall become sinless, because my husband is my god.
29_15.word_by_word: शुद्धात्मन् O purehearted one, प्रेमभावात् with feeling of love, भर्तारम् husband, अनुगच्छन्ती following, विकल्मषा sinless, भविष्यामि I shall become, भर्ता husband, मम to me, दैवतं हि is a god.

29_16.shloka: प्रेत्यभावे हि कल्याण स्सङ्गमो मे सह त्वया।श्रुतिर्हि श्रूयते पुण्या ब्राह्मणानां यशस्विनाम्।।2.29.17।।इहलोके च पितृभिर्या स्त्री यस्य महामते।अद्भिर्दत्ता स्वधर्मेण प्रेत्यभावेऽपि तस्य सा।।2.29.18।।
29_16.translation: My union with you, O highminded one, is auspicious even beyond death. A woman, given away by her parents in accordance with traditional offerings of water belongs to him even after death and lives with him. This is a statement from the Vedas quoted by famous brahmins.
29_16.word_by_word: प्रेत्यभावेऽपि even after death, त्वया सह with you, मे to me, कल्याणः auspiciousness, सङ्गमः union, यशस्विनाम् by the famous, ब्राह्मणानाम् brahmins', पुण्या pious, श्रुतिः statement from the Vedas, श्रूयते is heard, महामते O highminded one, या स्त्री that woman, इह लोके in this world, पितृभिः by parents, यस्य to whom, स्वधर्मेण in accordance with one's own tradition, अद्भि: with waters, दत्ता is given, प्रेत्यभावेऽपि even after death, सा she, तस्य belongs to him.

29_17.shloka: एवमस्मात्स्वकां नारीं सुवृत्तां हि पतिव्रताम्।नाभिरोचयसे नेतुं त्वं मां केनेह हेतुना।।2.29.19।।
29_17.translation: Why don't you want to take to the forest your own wife who is loyal and devoted, and is of good conduct.
29_17.word_by_word: त्वम् you, केन हेतुना for what reason, इह now, एवम् this way, सुवृत्ताम् a woman of good conduct, पतिव्रताम् faithful and loyal wife, स्वकां नारीम् your own woman, माम् me, अस्मात्  from this place, नेतुम् to take, नाभिरोचयसे you are not willing.

29_18.shloka: भक्तां पतिव्रतां दीनां मां समां सुखदुःखयोः।नेतुमर्हसि काकुत्स्थ समान सुखदुःखिनीम्।।2.29.20।।
29_18.translation: O Rama, I am faithful and devoted to you. I have equal disposition to happiness and sorrow. I equally share your prosperity and adversity. Therefore, you should  take your wife (to the forest). In this time of distress.
29_18.word_by_word: काकुत्थ्स O descendant of Kakutstha, भक्ताम् devotee, पतिव्रताम् faithful to the husband, दीनां distressed, सुखदुःखयोः in happines and sorrow, समाम् having equal disposition, समान सुख दुःखिनीम् equally share your prosperity and adversity, माम् me, नेतुम् अर्हसि should take.

29_19.shloka: ययदि मां दुःखितामेवं वनं नेतुं न चेच्छसि।विषमग्निं जलं वाऽहमास्थास्ये मृत्युकारणात्।।2.29.21।।
29_19.translation: If you do not wish to take your wife in this time of distress to the forest I shall die by consuming poison or throwing myself into fire or drowning in water.
29_19.word_by_word: एवम् in this, दुःखिताम् distressed, माम् me, वनम् to the forest, नेतुम् to take, न च इच्छसि यदि if you do not wish, मृत्युकारणात् to seek death, विषम् poison, अग्निम् fire, जलं वा or water, आस्थास्ये I shall take refuge.

29_20.shloka: एवं बहुविधं तं सा याचते गमनं प्रति।नानुमेने महाबाहुस्तां नेतुं विजनं वनम्।।2.29.22।।
29_20.translation: Despite Sita's  pleadings with him in various ways the mightyarmed Rama would not consent to take her to the desolate forest.
29_20.word_by_word: एवम् in this way, सा she, गमनं प्रति about her departure, बहुविधम् in several ways, तम् him, याचते requested, महाबाहुः mightyarmed Rama, ताम् her, विजनम् desolate, वनम् forest, नेतुम्  to take, नानुमेने did not consent.

29_21.shloka: एवमुक्ता तु सा चिन्तां मैथिली समुपागता।स्नापयन्तीव गामुष्णैरश्रुभिर्नयनच्युतैः।।2.29.23।।
29_21.translation: Thus spoken to (prevented), Sita was filled with grief and cried, drenching the ground with warm tears that fell from her eyes.
29_21.word_by_word: एवम् in this way, उक्ता spoken, सा मैथिली that daughter from Mithila, नयनच्युतैः fallen from her eyes, उष्णैः by warm, अश्रुभिः tears, गाम् the ground, स्नापयन्तीव as if drenching, चिन्ताम् grief, समुपागता obtained.

29_22.shloka: चिन्तयन्तीं तथा तां तु निवर्तयितुमात्मवान्।ताम्रोष्ठीं स तदा सीतां काकुत्स्थो बह्वसान्त्वयत्।।2.29.24।।
29_22.translation: That selfpossessed scion of the Kakutstha dynasty consoled the copperredlipped Sita in several ways to dissuade her (from going to the forest).इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे एकोनत्रिंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the twentyninth sarga of Ayodhyakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
29_22.word_by_word: आत्मवान् selfpossessed, सः काकुत्स्थ: that scion of the Kakutstha dynasty, तथा that way, चिन्तयन्तीम् grieving, ताम्रोष्ठीम् to the lady with copperred lips, तां सीताम् to that Sita, तदा then, निवर्तयितम् to dissuade her (from going to the forest), बहु many ways, असान्त्वयत् consoled.

30_1.shloka: [Rama consents to take Sita to the forest--instructs her to distribute their precious possessions on the eve of their departure]सान्त्व्यमाना तु रामेण मैथिली जनकात्मजा।वनवासनिमित्ताय भर्तारमिदमब्रवीत्।।2.30.1।।
30_1.translation: In response to Rama's consolation with regard to her stay in the forest, the daughter of Janaka, Maithili (Sita) said:
30_1.word_by_word: वनवासनिमित्ताय for stay in forest, रामेण by Rama, सान्त्व्यमाना consoled, जनकात्मजा Janaka's daughter, मैथिली Maithili, भर्तारम्   to husband, इदम् these words, अब्रवीत् said.

30_2.shloka: सा तमुत्तमसंविग्ना सीता विपुलवक्षसम्।प्रणयाच्चाभिमानाच्च परिचिक्षेप राघवम्।।2.30.2।।
30_2.translation: Sita agitated over a supreme cause upbraided the broadchested scion of the Raghu race out of love and injured selfrespect.
30_2.word_by_word: उत्तमसंविग्ना agitated for  a supreme cause, सा सीता that Sita, विपुल वक्षसम् man of broadchested, राघवम् scion of the Raghu dynasty, प्रणयात् out of love, अभिमानाच्च injured selfrespect, परिचिक्षेप blamed.

30_3.shloka: किं त्वाऽमन्यत वैदेहः पिता मे मिथिलाधिपः।राम जामातरं प्राप्य स्त्रियं पुरुषविग्रहम्।।2.30.3।।
30_3.translation: O Rama while accepting you as soninlaw did my father, king of Mithila and lord of Videha ever think that you are a woman in the guise of a man?
30_3.word_by_word: राम O Rama, पुरुषविग्रहम् in the form of a man, स्त्रियम् a woman, त्वा you, जामातरम् as  soninlaw, प्राप्य having obtained, मिथिलाधिपः king of Mithila, वैदेहः lord of Videha, मे पिता my father, किम् what, अमन्यत thought of.

30_4.shloka: अनृतं बत लोकोऽयमज्ञानाद्यदि वक्ष्यति।तेजो नास्ति परं रामे तपतीव दिवाकरे।।2.30.4।।
30_4.translation: Alas that will be a falschood if people out of ignorance say that there is no supreme splendour in Rama like the shining Sun.
30_4.word_by_word: तपति in a blazing, दिवाकरे इव like in the Sun, रामे in Rama, परम् great, तेजः splendour, नास्ति is not  to be found, अयं लोकः this world, अज्ञानात् out of ignorance, वक्ष्यति यदि if they say so, then that one, अनृतम् is a falsehood, बत alas

30_5.shloka: किं हि कृत्वा विषण्णस्त्वं कुतो वा भयमस्ति ते।यत्परित्यक्तुकामस्त्वं मामनन्यपरायणाम्।।2.30.5।।
30_5.translation: What may be the cause for your fear and depression behind your desire to desert one who is so exclusively devoted to you?
30_5.word_by_word: त्वम् you, अनन्यपरायणाम् with none else as her refuge, माम् me, परित्यक्तुकामः (इति) यत् that you want to desert, त्वम् you, किं हि कृत्वा for what reason, विषण्णः depressed,  ते to you, कुतः वा from where, भयम् fear, अस्ति exists.

30_6.shloka: द्युमत्सेनसुतं वीर सत्यवन्तमनुव्रताम्।सावित्रीमिव मां विद्धि त्वमात्मवशवर्तिनीम्।।2.30.6।।
30_6.translation: Know, O valiant one, that by remaining subordinate to you, I am as faithful to you as Savitri was to her husband, Satyavanta, son of Dyumatsena.
30_6.word_by_word: वीर O valiant one, माम् me, द्युमत्सेन सुतम् son of Dyumatsena, सत्यवन्तम् Satyavanta, अनुव्रताम् faithfully following, सावित्रीमिव like Savitri, आत्मवशवर्तिनीम् remaining under your subordination, विद्धि know.

30_7.shloka: न त्वहं मनसाऽप्यन्यं द्रष्टाऽस्मि त्वदृतेऽनघ।त्वया राघव गच्छेयं यथाऽन्या कुलपांसिनी।।2.30.7।।
30_7.translation: O sinless son of the Raghus I am not like other women who bring disgreace to the family. I have not looked at any one except you, even with my mind's eye. I will go (to the forest) along with you.
30_7.word_by_word: अनघ O sinless one, राघव Rama, कुलपांसनी a woman who bring disgrace to the family, अन्या यथा like any other ordinary woman, अहम् I, त्वदृते except you, अन्यम् other one, मनसापि even in mind, न द्रष्टास्मि not see, त्वया with you, गच्चेयम् I shall go to the forest.

30_8.shloka: स्वयं तु भार्यां कौमारीं चिरमध्युषितां सतीम्।शैलूष इव मां राम परेभ्यो दातुमिच्छसि।।2.30.8।।
30_8.translation: I have been living with you for a long time, O Rama I am young and chaste. Why do you, like an actor, wish to hand me over to others.
30_8.word_by_word: राम O Rama कौमारीम् young, चिरम् for a long time, अध्युषिताम् living with you, सतीम् chaste, भार्याम् wife, माम् me, शैलूषः इव like an actor, स्वयम् on your own accord, परेभ्यः to others, दातुम् to give, इच्छसि wish.

30_9.shloka: यस्य पथ्यं च रामाऽत्थ यस्य चार्थेऽवरुध्यसे।त्वं तस्य भव वश्यश्च विधेयश्च सदाऽनघ।।2.30.9।।
30_9.translation: You, O sinless Rama, may become subservient and obedient to them about whose wellfare you are speaking of and on account of whom you are preventing me to go (along with you).
30_9.word_by_word: अनघ O sinless, राम O Rama यस्य whose, पथ्यम् welfare, आत्थ are speaking, यस्य च अर्थेon account of whom, अवरुध्यसे you are preventing me, त्वम् you, तस्य for him, सदा always, वश्यः च subservient, विधेयः च also obedient, भव shall be.

30_10.shloka: स मामनादाय वनं न त्वं प्रस्थातुमर्हसि।तपो वा यदि वाऽरण्यं स्वर्गो वा स्यात्सह मे त्वया।।2.30.10।।
30_10.translation: You should not depart for the forest without taking me. Be it for penance or for the forest or for heaven, I wish to be with you.
30_10.word_by_word: सः त्वम् such as you, माम् me, अनादाय without taking me, वनम् to the forest, प्रस्थातुम् to set forth, नार्हसि it does not behove you, तपो वा either for penance, यदि वा or, अरण्यम् to forest, स्वर्गो वा or to heaven, मे me, त्वया सह स्यात् to be with you.

30_11.shloka: न च मे भविता तत्र कश्चित्पथि परिश्रमः।पृष्ठतस्तव गच्छन्त्या विहारशयनेष्विव।।2.30.11।।
30_11.translation: While following you, I will feel no fatigue there on the way as if I am going on a pleasurestroll or in a comfortable couch.
30_11.word_by_word: तव your, पृष्ठतः behind, गच्छन्त्याः going, मे to me, तत्र there, पथि on the way, विहारशयनेष्विव on a pleasure stroll or in a (luxurious) couch, कश्चित् even a little, परिश्रमः strain, न भविता will not be.

30_12.shloka: कुशकाशशरेषीका ये च कण्टकिनो द्रुमाः।तूलाजिनसमस्पर्शा मार्गे मम सह त्वया।।2.30.12।।
30_12.translation: The white reeds, the kusha, the sara and the ishika grasses and thorny trees on the way will feel as soft as cotton or as the skin of a black antelope.
30_12.word_by_word: त्वया सह along with you, मार्गे on the way, कुशकाशशरेषीकाः Kusha, white reeds, Sara and  Ishika grasses, कण्टकिनः thorny, ये द्रुमाः च other trees, तूलाजिन समस्पर्शाः shall feel like thetouch of cotton and the skin of a black antelope.

30_13.shloka: महावातसमुद्धूतं यन्मामपकरिष्यति।रजो रमण तन्मन्ये परार्थ्यमिव चन्दनम्।।2.30.13।।
30_13.translation: I shall regard, O charming Rama, the harmful dust raised by the stormy wind and settled on me as the most excellent sandal powder.
30_13.word_by_word: रमण O Charming one महावातसमुद्धूतम् raised by the stormy wind, यत् which, रजः dust, माम् me, अपकरिष्यति will harm, तत् that one, परार्थ्यम् most excellent, चन्दनम् इव like sandal powder, मन्ये shall consider.

30_14.shloka: शाद्वलेषु यथा शिश्ये वनान्ते वनगोचर।कुथास्तरणतल्पेषु किं स्यात्सुखतरं ततः।।2.30.14।।
30_14.translation: O rover of the forest I will feel happier when I sleep on the meadows (of tender green grass) on the outskirts of the forest than when I sleep on the couch spread with carpets.
30_14.word_by_word: वनगोचर Rover of the forest, वनान्ते on the outskirts of the forest,  शाद्वलेषु on the meadows (of tender green grass), यथा as, शिश्ये I will lie down, ततः more than that, कुथास्तरणतल्पेषु in the couch spread with carpets, सुखतरम् more comfortable, स्यात्किम् what shall be?

30_15.shloka: पत्रं मूलं फलं यत्त्वमल्पं वा यदि वा बहु।दास्यसि स्वयमाहृत्य तन्मेऽमृतरसोपमम्।।2.30.15।।
30_15.translation: Whatever leaves or roots or fruits you collect with your own hands for me little or much, they will be nectar to me.
30_15.word_by_word: त्वम् you, यत् whichever, पत्रम् leaf, मूलम् root, फलम् fruit, अल्पं वा even a little, यदि वा or,  बहु much, स्वयम् on your own, आहृत्य having collected, दास्यसि you will give me, तत् thatone, मे to me, अमृतरसोपमम् like nectar, (भवेत् shall become).

30_16.shloka: न मातुर्न पितुस्तत्र स्मरिष्यामि न वेश्मनः।आर्तवान्युपभुञ्जाना पुष्पाणि च फलानि च।।2.30.16।।
30_16.translation: Enjoying the seasonal flowers and fruits in the forest, I will not remember my mother or father or home.
30_16.word_by_word: तत्र there, आर्तवानि seasonal, पुष्पाणि flowers, फलानि च also fruits, उपभुञ्जाना while enjoying, मातुः mother, न स्मरिष्यामि will not remember, पितुः न not about father, वेश्मनः  about home, न will not.

30_17.shloka: न च तत्र ततः किञ्चिद्द्रष्टुमर्हसि विप्रियम्।मत्कृते न च ते शोको न भविष्यामि दुर्भरा।।2.30.17।।
30_17.translation: Therefore, you should not anticipate any problem from me in the forest. Neither shall I be burdensome to you nor shall I make you experience any sorrow on my account.
30_17.word_by_word: ततः for that reason, तत्र there, किञ्चित् even a little, विप्रियम् unpleasant, द्रष्टुम् to see, नार्हसि does not behove you, मत्कृते on my account, ते to you, शोकः sorrow, न will not come, दुर्भरा burden, न भविष्यामि I will not be.

30_18.shloka: य स्त्वया सह स स्वर्गो निरयो यस्त्वया विना।इति जानन्परां प्रीतिं गच्छ राम मया सह।।2.30.18।।
30_18.translation: Wherever I be with you is heaven and without, hell. O Rama, recognise this truth, and derive great pleasure in my company.
30_18.word_by_word: त्वया सह in your company, यः that  which is obtained, सः that alone, स्वर्गः is heaven, त्वया विना without you, निरयः is hell, इति thus, जानन् while being aware, राम Rama, मया सह along with me, पराम् great, प्रीतिम् pleasure, गच्छ obtain.

30_19.shloka: अथ मामेवमव्यग्रां वनं नैव नयिष्यति।विषमद्यैव पास्यामि मा विशं द्विषतां गमम्।।2.30.19।।
30_19.translation: If you do not take me to the forest without the least hesitation I shall consume poison right now, but not live under the control of enemies (at Ayodhya).
30_19.word_by_word: अथ otherwise, एवम् in this way, अव्यग्राम् with unhesitant disposition, माम् me, वनम् to the forest, नैव नयिष्यति यदि if you do not at all take, अद्यैव rightaway, विषम् poison, पास्यामि will drink, द्विषताम् enemies', वशम् in the company of, मा गमम् not go.

30_20.shloka: पश्चादपि हि दुःखेन मम नैवास्ति जीवितम्।उज्झितायास्त्वया नाथ तदैव मरणं वरम्।।2.30.20।।
30_20.translation: If forsaken, O Lord I shall not live a life of sorrow. Instant death is better (than abandoned existence).
30_20.word_by_word: नाथ O Lord, त्वया by you, उज्झितायाः of an abandoned lady, मम to me, पश्चादपि even afterwards, दुःखेन through grief, जीवितम् life, नैवास्ति will not be there, तदैव than abandonment, मरणम् death, वरम् is better.

30_21.shloka: इमं हि सहितुं शोकं मुहूर्तमपि नोत्सहे।किं पुनर्दशवर्षाणि त्रीणि चैकं च दुःखिता।।2.30.21।।
30_21.translation: I cannot bear this grief even for a moment, what to speak of fourteen (ten and threeand one) years of grieving.
30_21.word_by_word: इमम् this, शोकम् grief, मुहूर्तमपि even for a moment, सहितुम् to endure, नोत्सहे will not agree, दश ten, त्रीणि three, एकं च one, वर्षाणि years, दुःखिता a grieving woman, किं पुनः what to say again?

30_22.shloka: इति सा शोकसन्तप्ता विलप्य करुणं बहु।चुक्रोश पतिमायस्ता भृशमालिङ्ग्य सस्वरम्।।2.30.22।।
30_22.translation: Tormented with grief, Sita piteously and profusely lamented, and then exhausted,  embraced her husband  tightly and cried bitterly.
30_22.word_by_word: सा that Sita, शोकसन्तप्ता tormented with grief, आयस्ता exhausted, इति thus, करुणम्  piteously, बहु profusely, विलप्य lamenting, पतिम् husband, आलिङ्ग्य embracing, सस्वरम् with loud voice, भृशम् tightly, चुक्रोश cried.

30_23.shloka: सा विद्धा बहुभिर्वाक्यैर्दिग्धैरिव गजाङ्गना।चिरसन्नियतं बाष्पं मुमोचाग्निमिवारणिः।।2.30.23।।
30_23.translation: Pierced by so many words (of objection from  Rama), Sita felt like a cowelephant penetrated by poisonsmeared arrrows. And shed her longsuppressed tears like arani (a firekindling stick) kindling fire.
30_23.word_by_word: दिग्धै: arrows smeared with poison, गजाङ्गना इव like a cowelephant, सा she, बहुभिः many, वाक्यैः with words, विद्धा was pierled, चिरसन्नियतम् longsuppressed, बाष्पम् tears, आरणिः अग्निमिव like fire produced by arani (a firekindling stick), मुमोच released.

30_24.shloka: तस्या स्फटिकसङ्काशं वारि सन्तापसम्भवम्।नेत्राभ्यां परिसुस्राव पङ्कजाभ्यामिवोदकम्।।2.30.24।।
30_24.translation: Crystallike tears arising out of distress flowed from her eyes like water trickling from two lotuses.
30_24.word_by_word: तस्याः her, नेत्राभ्याम् from the eyes, सन्तापसम्भवम् arising out of distress, स्फटिक सङ्काशम्  like crystal, वारि water, पङ्कजाभ्याम् from two lotuses, उदकमिव like water, परिसुस्राव flowed.

30_25.translation: Her face with large eyes assumed the brightness of an immaculate Moon and withered with tears like a lotus plucked out of water.
30_25.word_by_word: अमलचन्द्राभम् possessing the brightness of the stainless Moon, आयतलोचनम् having large eyes, तत् that, मुखंचैव from the face, जलोद्धृतम् plucked from water, अम्बुजमिव like a lotus, बाष्पेण with tears, पर्यशुष्यत withered.

30_26.shloka: तां परिष्वज्य बाहुभ्यां विसंज्ञामिव दुःखिताम्।उवाच वचनं रामः परिविश्वासयंस्तदा।।2.30.26।।
30_26.translation: With his arms Rama embraced Sita who had almost fainted in grief. And in order to create confidence in her he said these words:
30_26.word_by_word: तदा then, रामः Rama, दुःखिताम् in grief, विसंज्ञामिव as if fainted, ताम् her, बाहुभ्याम् with arms,  परिष्वज्य having embraced, परिविश्वासयन् creating her confidence, वचनम् words, उवाच said.

30_27.shloka: न देवि तव दुःखेन स्वर्गमप्यभिरोचये।न हि मेऽस्ति भयं किञ्चित्स्वयम्भोरिव सर्वतः।।2.30.27।।
30_27.translation: When you are in grief O Devi I do not desire even heaven. Like the selfcreated Brahma, I have no fear for any one.
30_27.word_by_word: देवि O Devi, तव your, दुःखेन with grief, स्वर्गमपि even heaven, न अभिरोचये I do not desire, मे to me, स्वयम्भोरिव like selfcreated Brahma, सर्वतः from everything, किञ्चित् even a little, भयम् fear, नास्ति हि is not there.

30_28.shloka: तव सर्वमभिप्रायमविज्ञाय शुभानने।वासं न रोचयेऽरण्ये शक्तिमानपि रक्षणे।।2.30.28।।
30_28.translation: O Sita of auspicious countenance even though I am capable of protecting you I did not like your stay in the forest as I did not know your intentions.
30_28.word_by_word: शुभानने O one possessing auspicious countenance, रक्षणे in protecting you, शक्तिमानपि even though powerful, तव your, सर्वम् fully, अभिप्रायम् intention, अविज्ञाय without  knowing, अरण्ये in the forest, वासम् your residing, न रोचये do not like.

30_29.shloka: यत्सृष्टाऽसि मया सार्धं वनवासाय मैथिलि।न विहातुं मया शक्या कीर्तिरात्मवता यथा।।2.30.29।।
30_29.translation: Since you, O daughter of Mithila, were born to go along with me to the forest, I cannot abandon you just as a selfrespecting man cannot forsake his reputation.
30_29.word_by_word: मैथिलि O daughter of Mithila (Sita), यत् since, मयासार्धम् along with me, वनवासाय for living in the forest, सृष्टासि created, आत्मवता by selfrespecting, कीर्तिर्यथा like reputation, मया by me, विहातुम् to abandon, न शक्या is not possible.

30_30.shloka: धर्मस्तु गजनासोरु सद्भिराचरितः पुरा।तं चाहमनुवर्तेऽद्य यथा सूर्यं सुवर्चला।।2.30.30।।
30_30.translation: O one  with (shapely) thighs like the trunk of an elephant follow only the path of righteousness practised earlier by the virtuous as Suvarchala follows the Sun.
30_30.word_by_word: गजनासोरु O Lady with thighs like the trunk of an elephant, धर्मः righteousness, पुरा formerly, सद्भिः by virtuous men, आचरितः is practised, सुवर्चला wife of Sun (Suvarchala), सूर्यं यथा like Sun, तम् that righteousness, अहम् I, अद्य now, अनुवर्ते shall follow.

30_31.shloka: न खल्वहं न गच्छेयं वनं जनकनन्दिनि।वचनं तन्नयति मां पितु स्सत्योपबृंहितम्।।2.30.31।।
30_31.translation: Not that I shall not go to the forest (go I must). My father's word nourished by truth isleading me there, O daughter of Janaka
30_31.word_by_word: जनकनन्दिनि O daughter of Janaka, अहम् I, वनम् to the forest, न खलु न गच्छेयम् it is not that I shall not go, पितुः father's, सत्योपबृंहितम् nourished by truth, तत् वचनं that word, माम् me, नयति is leading.

30_32.shloka: एष धर्मस्तु सुश्रोणि पितुर्मातुश्च वश्यता।अतश्च तं व्यतिक्रम्य नाहं जीवितुमुत्सहे।।2.30.32।।
30_32.translation: Obedience to parents is a righteous act. Therefore, O one with fair hips I cannot live and disobey the word of truth.
30_32.word_by_word: सुश्रोणि O one with beautiful posteriors, पितुः of father, मातुश्च of mother, वश्यता in obedience, एषः this one, धर्मस्तु is a righteous act, अतश्च for that reason, तम् that (word of truth), व्यतिक्रम्य disobeying, अहम् I, जीवितुम् to live, न उत्सहे do not wish.

30_33.shloka: अस्वाधीनं कथं दैवं प्रकारैरभिराध्यते।स्वाधीनं समतिक्रम्य मातरं पितरं गुरुम्।।2.30.33।।
30_33.translation: Mother, father and preceptor are present before us. By overstepping them, how can we, in various ways, worship God who is beyond reach (not visible)?
30_33.word_by_word: स्वाधीनम् within our reach, मातरम् mother, पितरम् father, गुरुम् preceptor, समतिक्रम्य over stepping, अस्वाधीनम् beyond reach, दैवम् God, प्रकारैः in various ways, कथम् how, अभिराध्यते is worshipped?

30_34.shloka: यत्त्रयं तत्त्रयो लोकाः पवित्रं तत्समं भुवि।नान्यदस्ति शुभापाङ्गे तेनेदमभिराध्यते।।2.30.34।।
30_34.translation: Where these three(mother,father and preceptor) equal to the three worlds are, O one with loverly sideglances, there is none in this world as holy. Therefore, they areto be worshipped.
30_34.word_by_word: शुभापाङ्गे O one having lovely side glances, यत्र which, त्रयम् all the three (father, motherand preceptor), तत्र that, त्रयः three, लोकाः worlds, तत्समम् equal to those three, पवित्रम् अन्यत् any other holy thing, लोके in the world, नास्ति none, तेन therefore, इदम् this, अभिराध्यते is worshipped.

30_35.shloka: न सत्यं दानमानौ वा न यज्ञाश्चाप्तदक्षिणाः।तथा बलकरा स्सीते यथा सेवा पितुर्हिता।।2.30.35।।
30_35.translation: Truth or munificence or homage or distribution of gifts to the revered ones or sacrifices, O Sita, are  not considered as efficacious as service to father.
30_35.word_by_word: सीते O Sita, पितुः of father, सेवा service, यथा as, हिता salutary, तथा so,  सत्यम् truth, न not, दानमानौ charity, honour, न not, आप्तदक्षिणाः gifts for the revered ones, यज्ञाःच sacrifices, बलकराः न not strengthening.

30_36.shloka: स्वर्गो धनं वा धान्यं वा विद्याः पुत्रास्सुखानि च।गुरुवृत्त्यनुरोधेन न किञ्चिदपि दुर्लभम्।।2.30.36।।
30_36.translation: By fulfilling father's wish, nothing is difficult to achieve, whether it is heaven, or wealth, or foodgrains, or learning, or sons or other comforts.
30_36.word_by_word: गुरुवृत्त्यनुरोधेन fulfilling father's desire, स्वर्गः is heaven, धनं वा or wealth, धान्यं वा or  foodgrains, विद्याः learning, पुत्राः sons, सुखानि च comforts, किञ्चिदपि anything, दुर्लभम् difficult to obtain, न not.

30_37.translation: Great men who are devoted to the service of their parents attain the world of the gods, of gandharvas, of cows, of Visnu, of Brahma and other worlds.
30_37.word_by_word: मातापितृपरायणाः people devoted to the service of parents, महात्मानः great men,देवगन्धर्वगोलोकान् the world of the gods, gandharvas, and the cows or Visnu, ब्रह्मलोकम्  the world of Brahma, तथा and, अपरान् other worlds, प्राप्नुवन्ति will attain.

30_38.shloka: स मां पिता यथा शास्ति सत्यधर्मपथे स्थितः।तथा वर्तितुमिच्छामि स हि धर्मस्सनातनः।।2.30.38।।
30_38.translation: My father who follows the path of truth and dharma whatever be his commands, I wish to obey. He is, indeed, dharma eternal.
30_38.word_by_word: सत्यधर्मपथे On the path of truth and dharma, स्थितः firmly fixed, सः पिता such father, माम्   me, यथा as, शास्ति commands, तथा accordingly, वर्तितुम् to abide by, इच्छामि wish सः that one, सनातनः eternal, धर्मः हि is truth indeed.

30_39.shloka: मम सन्ना मतिस्सीते त्वां नेतुं दण्डकावनम्।वसिष्यामीति सा त्वं मामनुयातुं सुनिश्चिता।।2.30.39।।
30_39.translation: O Sita, my discretion fails me in deciding whether to take you to Dandaka forest or not. You are, however, firmly determined to follow me, saying, you can live in the forest.
30_39.word_by_word: सीते O Sita, त्वाम् you, दण्डकावनम् to Dandaka forest, नेतुम् to take you, मम my, मतिः mind, सन्ना is determined, सा त्वम् such you, वसिष्यामि I can live in the forest, इति like that, माम् me, अनुयातुम् to follow, सुनिश्चिता firmly determined.

30_40.shloka: सा हि सृष्टाऽनवद्याङ्गि वनाय मदिरेक्षणे।अनुगच्छस्व मां भीरु सहधर्मचरी भव।।2.30.40।।
30_40.translation: O one with fascinating eyes and exquisite beauty you were born to live in the forest. O gentle lady, assist me in carrying out my duties.
30_40.word_by_word: मदिरेक्षणे O one with fascinating eyes, अनवद्याङ्गि exquisitely beautiful, सा you, वनाय to the forest, सृष्टा you have been created, भीरु O gentle lady, माम् me, अनुगच्छस्व followme, सहधर्मचरी carrying out together duties, भव become,

30_41.shloka: सर्वथा सदृशं सीते मम स्वस्य कुलस्य च।व्यवसायमनुक्रान्ता कान्ते त्वमतिशोभनम्।।2.30.41।।
30_41.translation: You, O my lovely beloved Sita, have taken in the right time a highly dignified decision befitting in all ways your family, myself and yourself.
30_41.word_by_word: कान्ते O my lovely beloved, सीते Sita, त्वम् you, मम for me, स्वस्य your own, कुलस्य च of the family, सर्वथा in all ways, सदृशम् befitting, अतिशोभनम् highly dignified, व्यवसायम् resolution,  अनुक्रान्ता done in due order.

30_42.shloka: आरभस्व शुभश्रोणि वनवासक्षमाः क्रियाः।नेदानीं त्वदृते सीते स्वर्गोऽपि मम रोचते।।2.30.42।।
30_42.translation: O Sita, begin right now all preparations necessary for residing in the forest. O one, with beautiful buttocks, without you even the very heaven does not please me.
30_42.word_by_word: शुभश्रोणि O One with beautiful buttocks Sita, वनवासक्षमाः suitable for residing in the forest, क्रियाः those acts, इदानीम् now, आरभस्व commence, सीते O Sita, त्वदृते without you, मम to me, स्वर्गोपि even heaven, न रोचते does not please.

30_43.shloka: ब्राह्मणेभ्यश्च रत्नानि भिक्षुकेभ्यश्च भोजनम्।देहि चाशंसमानेभ्य स्सन्त्वरस्व च मा चिरम्।।2.30.43।।
30_43.translation: Give away your jewels to brahmins who need them and food to religious mendicants. Hurry up Do not delay.
30_43.word_by_word: आशंसमानेभ्यः for the needy, ब्राह्मणेभ्यः to brahmins, रत्नानि च jewels, भिक्षुकेभ्यः to mendicants, भोजनं च food also, देहि you may bestow, सन्त्वरस्व च hasten, मा चिरम् do not delay.

30_44.shloka: भूषणानि महार्हाणि वरवस्त्राणि यानि च।रमणीयाश्च ये केचित्क्रीडार्थाश्चाप्युपस्कराः।।2.30.44।।शयनीयानि यानानि मम चान्यानि यानि च।देहि स्वभृत्यवर्गस्य ब्राह्मणानामनन्तरम्।।2.30.45।।
30_44.translation: Distribute among your attendants highly valuable ornaments and excellent clothing, charming articles meant for (court) sport, my couches, chariots and all other things. Offer the rest to brahmins.
30_44.word_by_word: महार्हाणि highly valuable, यानि all, भूषणानि ornaments, वरवस्त्राणि excellent clothing, रमणीयाः charming, ये केचित् whichever, क्रीडार्थाः meant for sport, उपस्कराः articles, मम my, शयनीयानि couches, यानानि chariots, अन्यानि other, यानि च all things, स्वभृत्यवर्गस्य to your attendants, देहि give, अनन्तरम् after that, ब्राह्मणानाम् to brahmins.

30_45.shloka: अनुकूलं तु सा भर्तुर्ज्ञात्वा गमनमात्मनः।क्षिप्रं प्रमुदिता देवी दातुमेवोपचक्रमे।।2.30.46।।
30_45.translation: Having come to know that her departure to the forest is acceptable to her husband, Sita, highly delighted, quickly got ready to give away (things).
30_45.word_by_word: सा देवी Devi, आत्मनः her own, गमनम् departure, भर्तुः with her husband, अनुकूलम् is favourable, ज्ञात्वा having come to know, प्रमुदिता happy, क्षिप्रम् quickly, दातुमेव to gift away, उपचक्रमे began.

30_46.shloka: ततः प्रहृष्टा प्रतिपूर्णमानसायशश्विनी भर्तुरवेक्ष्य भाषितम्।धनानि रत्नानि च दातुमङ्गनाप्रचक्रमे धर्मभृतां मनस्स्विनी।।2.30.47।।
30_46.translation: Having heard her husband, the glorious and broadminded Sita was delighted with her desires fulfiled. She made preparations to gift away her wealth including jewels to the virtuous.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे त्रिंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the thirtieth sarga of Ayodhyakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic  composed by sage Valmiki.

31_1.shloka: [Lakshmana gets ready to accompany Rama takes leave of his friends and collects divine weapons from preceptor Vasistha--Rama asks Lakshmana to  distribute his wealth among brahmins.]एवं शृत्वा तु संवादं लक्ष्मणः पूर्वमागतः।बाष्पपर्याकुलमुखः शोकं सोढुमशक्नुवन्।।2.31.1।।स भ्रातुश्चरणौ गाढं निपीड्य रघुनन्दनः।सीतामुवाचातियशां राघवं च महाव्रतम्।।2.31.2।।
31_1.translation: Lakshmana who had already reached there heard the conversation (between Sita and Rama). His eyes brimming with tears, he was unable to bear the grief. He held the feet of his brother tightly and said to the illustrious Sita and Rama of great resolve:
31_1.word_by_word: पूर्वम् previously, आगतः had come, लक्ष्मणः Lakshmana, एवम् in this way, संवादम् conversation, श्रुत्वा having heard, शोकम् sorrow, सोढुम् to endure, अशक्नुवन् being unable, बाष्पपर्याकुलमुखः (बाष्पपर्याकुलेक्षणः) with his eyes filled with tears, सः that, रघुनन्दनः delight of the Raghu race, Lakshmana, भ्रातुः brother's, चरणौ feet, गाढम् tightly, निपीड्य pressing, महाव्रतम् of great resolve, राघवं च to Rama, अतियशाम् illustrious, सीताम् Sita, उवाच said.

31_2.shloka: एवं शृत्वा तु संवादं लक्ष्मणः पूर्वमागतः।बाष्पपर्याकुलमुखः शोकं सोढुमशक्नुवन्।।2.31.1।।स भ्रातुश्चरणौ गाढं निपीड्य रघुनन्दनः।सीतामुवाचातियशां राघवं च महाव्रतम्।।2.31.2।।
31_2.translation: Lakshmana who had already reached there heard the conversation (between Sita and Rama). His eyes brimming with tears, he was unable to bear the grief. He held the feet of his brother tightly and said to the illustrious Sita and Rama of great resolve:
31_2.word_by_word: पूर्वम् previously, आगतः had come, लक्ष्मणः Lakshmana, एवम् in this way, संवादम् conversation, श्रुत्वा having heard, शोकम् sorrow, सोढुम् to endure, अशक्नुवन् being unable, बाष्पपर्याकुलमुखः (बाष्पपर्याकुलेक्षणः) with his eyes filled with tears, सः that, रघुनन्दनः delight of the Raghu race, Lakshmana, भ्रातुः brother's, चरणौ feet, गाढम् tightly, निपीड्य pressing, महाव्रतम् of great resolve, राघवं च to Rama, अतियशाम् illustrious, सीताम् Sita, उवाच said.

31_3.shloka: यदि गन्तुं कृताबुद्धिर्वनं मृगगजायुतम्।अहं त्वानुगमिष्यामि वनमग्रे धनुर्धरः।।2.31.3।।
31_3.translation: If you have decided to go to the forest where deer and elephants abound, I shall also accompany you by walking before you, holding the bow.
31_3.word_by_word: मृगगजायुतम् abounding in deer and elephants, वनम् to the forest, गन्तुम् to go, बुद्धि: decision, कृता यदि if made, अहम् I, अग्रे in front, धनुर्धरः one holding a bow, त्वा you, वनम् to the forest, अनुगमिष्यामि I shall follow.

31_4.shloka: मया समेतोऽरण्यानि बहूनि विचरिष्यसि।पक्षिभिर्मृगयूथैश्च संघुष्टानि समन्ततः।।2.31.4।।
31_4.translation: Accompanied by me, you will roam the forests echoing with the cries of birds and sounds of herds of animals.
31_4.word_by_word: समन्ततः from all sides, पक्षिभिः with birds, मृगयूथैः च with herds of animals, संघुष्टानि echoing with the sounds of, बहूनि many, अरण्यानि forests, मया by me, समेतः accompanied by, विचरिष्यसि you will roam.

31_5.shloka: न देवलोकाक्रमणं नामरत्वमहं वृणे।ऐश्वर्यं वापि लोकानां कामये न त्वया विना।।2.31.5।।
31_5.translation: Without you, I do not want victory over the gods or sovereignty over the worlds or even immortality.
31_5.word_by_word: अहम् I, त्वया विना without you, देवलोकाक्रमणम् the seizure of the world of devatas, न वृणे do not wish to choose, अमरत्वम् immortality, न not, लोकानाम् of the worlds, ऐश्वर्यं वापि sovereignty, न कामये do not desire.

31_6.translation: When Rama tried to dissuade Lakshmana with many words of consolation Lakshmana who was determined to go to the forest said again:
31_6.word_by_word: वनवासाय to dwell in the forest, निश्चितः having decided, एवम् in this way, ब्रुवाणः speaking, सौमित्रिः Lakshmana, रामेण by Rama, बहुभिः with many, सान्त्वैः with the words of consolation, निषिद्धः dissuaded, पुनः again, अब्रवीत् said.

31_7.shloka: अनुज्ञातश्च भवता पूर्वमेव यदस्म्यहम्।किमिदानीं पुनरिदं क्रियते मन्निवारणम्।।2.31.7।।
31_7.translation: You have granted permission to me earlier.Why are you now preventing me?
31_7.word_by_word: अहम् I, भवता by you, पूर्वमेव even earlier, अनुज्ञातः  was permitted, अस्मि यत् I have been, इदानीम्  now, पुनः again, इदम् this, (मत्)निवारणम् prevention (of me), किम् why, क्रियते is being done?

31_8.shloka: यदर्थं प्रतिषेधो मे क्रियते गन्तुमिच्छतः।एतदिच्छामि विज्ञातुं संशयो हि ममानघ।।2.31.8।।
31_8.translation: I wish to know, O sinless one, the reason why you are dissuading me, when I am willing to go with you. This creates a doubt in my mind.
31_8.word_by_word: अनघ O sinless one, गन्तुम् to go, इच्छतः desiring, मे my, प्रतिषेधः restriction, यदर्थम् for what reason, क्रियते is being done, एतत् all this, विज्ञातुम् to  know, इच्छामि desiring, मम to me, संशयः हि I have a doubt.

31_9.shloka: ततोऽब्रवीन्महातेजा रामो लक्ष्मणमग्रतः।स्थितं प्राग्गामिनं वीरं याचमानं कृताञ्जलिम्।।2.31.9।।
31_9.translation: Addressing the heroic Lakshmana in front of him imploring with folded hands to take him to the forest so that he may walk ahead (and guard them), the effulgent Rama said:
31_9.word_by_word: ततः after that, महातेजाः brilliant, रामः Rama, अग्रतः in front of him, स्थितम् standing, प्राग्गामिनम् ready to walk ahead of, वीरम् heroic one, याचमानम् imploring, कृताञ्जलिम् with folded palms, लक्ष्मणम् to Lakshmana, अब्रवीत् said.

31_10.shloka: स्निग्धो धर्मरतो वीरस्सततं सत्पथे स्थितः।प्रियः प्राणसमो वश्यो भ्राता चापि सखा च मे।।2.31.10।।
31_10.translation: You are affectionate, you are devoted to dharma. You are valiant. You always walk the path of virtue. You are dear to me like my own life. You are not only an obedient brother but also a friend.
31_10.word_by_word: स्निग्धः affectionate, धर्मरतः engaged in righteous activites, वीरः valiant, सततम् always, सत्पथे on the path of virtue, स्थितः abiding, मे to me, प्राणसमः like my own life, प्रियः dear, वश्यः obedient, भ्राता चापि brother also, सखा च friend.

31_11.shloka: मयाऽद्य सह सौमित्रे त्वयि गच्छति तद्वनम्।को भरिष्यति कौसल्यां सुमित्रां वा यशस्विनीम्।।2.31.11।।
31_11.translation: O Lakshmana, if you also accompany me to the forest, who will take care of mother Kausalya and the illustrious Sumitra?
31_11.word_by_word: सौमित्रे O Lakshmana, त्वयि if you, अद्य today, मया सह along with me, तत् वनम् to the forest, गच्छति go, कौशल्याम् to Kausalya, यशस्विनीम् illustrious, सुमित्रां च Sumitra, कः who, भरिष्यति will take care?

31_12.shloka: अभिवर्षति कामैर्यः पर्जन्यः पृथिवीमिव।स कामपाशपर्यस्तो महातेजा महीपतिः।।2.31.12।।
31_12.translation: Dasaratha, the mighty king like Parjanya (the raingod), lord of the earth used to shower favours on earth. But now he is bound by the noose of passion.
31_12.word_by_word: महातेजाः mighty one, यः that, महीपतिः lord of the earth, पृथिवीम् the earth, पर्जन्यः इव like Parjanya (Indra), कामैः favours (desires), अभिवर्षति showers, सः he, कामपाशपर्यस्तः he is bound by cords of passion.

31_13.shloka: सा हि राज्यमिदं प्राप्य नृपस्याश्वपते स्सुता।दुःखितानां सपत्नीनां न करिष्यति शोभनम्।।2.31.13।।
31_13.translation: Once the daughter of king Aswapati (Kaikeyi) gains control over the kingdom, she will do nothing to help her afflicted cowives (Kausalya and Sumitra).
31_13.word_by_word: नृपस्य king, अश्वपतेः Aswapati's, सुता daughter, सा that (Kaikeyi), इदं राज्यम् this kingdom, प्राप्य having obtained, दुःखितानाम् afflicted ladies, सपत्नीनाम् of her cowives, शोभनम् welfare, न करिष्यति हि will not extend.

31_14.shloka: न स्मरिष्यति कौसल्यां सुमित्रां च सुदुःखिताम्।भरतो राज्यमासाद्य कैकेय्यां पर्यवस्थितः।।2.31.14।।
31_14.translation: When Bharata secures the kingdom, his confidence reposed in Kaikeyi he will not bother about the miserable Kausalya and Sumitra.
31_14.word_by_word: भरतः Bharata, राज्यम् kingdom, आसाद्य having obtained, कैकेय्याम् in Kaikeyi, पर्यवस्थितः repose confidence, कौशल्याम् Kausalya, सुदुःखिताम् grieved, सुमित्रां च also Sumitra, न स्मरिष्यति will not remember.

31_15.shloka: तामार्यां स्वयमेवेह राजानुग्रहणेन वा।सौमित्रे भर कौशल्यामुक्तमर्थमिमं चर।।2.31.15।।
31_15.translation: Either by yourself or by seeking the favour of the king, O son of Sumitra, lend support to venerable  Kausalya. This is the objective you must accomplish.
31_15.word_by_word: सौमित्रे स्वयमेव by yourself, राजानुग्रहणेन वा or by seeking the favour of king, इह stay here, आर्याम् venerable, तां कौशल्याम् that Kausalya, भर maintain, इमम् this, उक्तम्  what is told, अर्थम् objective, चर accomplish.

31_16.shloka: एवं मम च ते भक्तिर्भविष्यति सुदर्शिता।धर्मज्ञ गुरुपूजायां धर्मश्चाप्यतुलो महान्।।2.31.16।।
31_16.translation: If you do this, your devotion to me will be amply demonstrated. Service to the elders, O dutiful one, is a virtue, great and unequalled.
31_16.word_by_word: धर्मज्ञ O knower of dharma (duty), एवम् in this way, मम in me, ते your, भक्तिः devotion,सुदर्शिता is welldemonstrated, भविष्यति will become, गुरुपूजायाम् in worshipping  the elders, अतुलः unequalled, महान् great, धर्मश्च is virtue also.

31_17.shloka: एवं कुरुष्व सौमित्रे मत्कृते रघुनन्दन।अस्माभिर्विप्रहीणाया मातुर्नो न भवेत्सुखम्।।2.31.17।।
31_17.translation: O delight of the Raghu race, do this for my sake, since deprived of us, there will be no happiness for our mother, O son of Sumitra
31_17.word_by_word: रघुनन्दन O delight of the Raghu race, सौमित्रे O Son of Sumitra, मत्कृते for my sake, एवम् like this, कुरुष्व you may act, अस्माभिः by us, विप्रहीणायाः lady deprived of, नः our, मातुः for mother, सुखम् happiness, न भवेत् will not be.

31_18.shloka: एवमुक्तस्तु रामेण लक्ष्मण श्श्लक्ष्णया गिरा।प्रत्युवाच तदा रामं वाक्यज्ञो वाक्यकोविदम्।।2.31.18।।
31_18.translation: Thus addressed by Rama who was an adept in the use of words, eloquent Lakshmana gently replied:
31_18.word_by_word: रामेण by Rama, एवम् in this way, उक्तः addressed, वाक्यज्ञः eloquent, लक्ष्मणः Lakshmana, तदा then, वाक्यकोविदम् proficient in the use of words, रामम् Rama, श्लक्ष्णया in gentle voice, गिरा in words, प्रत्युवाच replied.

31_19.shloka: तवैव तेजसा वीर भरतः पूजयिष्यति।कौसल्यां च सुमित्रां च प्रयतो नात्र संशयः।।2.31.19।।
31_19.translation: Aware of your power O valiant one, Bharata will undoubtedly pay respect to Kausalya and Sumitra with all humility.
31_19.word_by_word: वीर O heroic one, भरतः Bharata, तव your, तेजसैव with your power, प्रयतः in humble manner, कौसल्यां च Kausalya and, सुमित्रा च also Sumitra, पूजयिष्यति he will honour, अत्र here, संशयः doubt, न not.

31_20.shloka: कौशल्या बिभृयादार्या सहस्रमपि मद्विधान्।यस्यास्सहस्रं ग्रामाणां सम्प्राप्त मुपजीवनम्।।2.31.20।।
31_20.translation: Noble Kausalya has under her charge a thousand villages for her sustenance. She can support a thousand men like me.
31_20.word_by_word: यस्याः for (Kausalya), उपजीवनम् sustenance, ग्रामाणाम् of villages, सहस्रम् one thousand, सम्प्राप्तम् has been obtained, आर्या noble lady, कौशल्या Kausalya, मद्विधान् men like me, सहस्रमपि even one thousand, बिभृयात् she can support.

31_21.shloka: तदात्मभरणे चैव मम मातुस्तथैव च।पर्याप्ता मद्विधानां च भरणाय यशस्विनी।।2.31.21।।
31_21.translation: Illustrious Kausalya is competent enough to support herself, my mother and men  like me.
31_21.word_by_word: तत् for that, यशस्विनी illustrious Kausalya, आत्मभरणे चैव to support herself, तथैव च also, मम मातुः my mother's, मद्विधानां च of men like me, भरणाय च to support, पर्याप्ता is competent.

31_22.shloka: कुरुष्व मामनुचरं वैधर्म्यं नेह विद्यते।कृतार्थोऽहं भविष्यामि तव चार्थः प्रकल्पते।।2.31.22।।
31_22.translation: Make me your follower. There is no breach of virtue in this. I will have my purposeaccomplished. Your object also will be fulfilled.
31_22.word_by_word: माम् me, अनुचरम् as your follower, कुरुष्व make (take) me, इह in this, वैधर्म्यम् breach of virtue, न विद्यते is not considered, अहम् I, कृतार्थः accomplish my purpose, भविष्यामि I will become, तव your, अर्थः च object also, प्रकल्पते will be fulfilled.

31_23.translation: Holding the bow and arrows and carrying a crowbar and a basket, I shall go in front of you leading the way.
31_23.word_by_word: सशरम् (stringed) with arrows, धनुः bow, आदाय holding, खनित्रपिटकाधरः holding a basket and a crowbar, ते your, अग्रतः in front of, पन्थानम् the way, अनुदर्शयन् indicating, गमिष्यामि I shall go.

31_24.shloka: आहरिष्यामि ते नित्यं मूलानि च फलानि च।वन्यानि यानि चान्यानि स्वाहाराणि तपस्विनाम्।।2.31.24।।
31_24.translation: I shall daily collect roots, fruits and other forest products fit for ascetics.
31_24.word_by_word: मूलानि roots, फलानि च fruits also, तपस्विनाम् for ascetics, स्वाहाराणि eatables, वन्यानि available in the forest, यानि those, अन्यानि च other products, नित्यम् daily, ते to you, आहरिष्यामि shall collect.

31_25.shloka: भवांस्तु सह वैदेह्या गिरिसानुषु रंस्यते।अहं सर्वं करिष्यामि जाग्रत स्स्वपतश्च ते।।2.31.25।।
31_25.translation: When you go about for pleasure on mountain slopes along with Sita, I shall do everything for you, whether you are awake or asleep.
31_25.word_by_word: भवांस्तु you, वैदेह्या सह with Sita, गिरिसानुषु on mountain slopes, रंस्यते you will go sporting, ते you, जाग्रतः while you are awake, स्ववतश्च while you are asleep, अहम् I,सर्वम् all tasks, करिष्यामि I will do.

31_26.shloka: रामस्त्वनेन वाक्येन सुप्रीतः प्रत्युवाच तम्।व्रजापृच्छस्व सौमित्रे सर्वमेव सुहृज्जनम्।।2.31.26।।
31_26.translation: Pleased with his words Rama said, O Lakshmana go and take leave of all your friends.
31_26.word_by_word: रामस्तु Rama also, अनेन वाक्येन with these words, सुप्रीतः immensely pleased man, तम् to him, प्रत्युवाच replied, सौमित्रे O Lakshmana, व्रज go forth, सर्वमेव all, सुहृज्जनम् friends, आपृच्छस्व ask leave of them.

31_27.shloka: ये च राज्ञो ददौ दिव्ये महात्मा वरुण स्स्वयम्।जनकस्य महायज्ञे धनुषी रौद्रदर्शने।।2.31.27।।अभेद्यकवचे दिव्ये तूणी चाक्षयसायकौ।आदित्यविमलौ चोभौ खड्गौ हेमपरिष्कृतौ।।2.31.28।।सत्कृत्य निहितं सर्वमेतदाचार्यसद्मनि।सर्वमायुधमादाय क्षिप्रमाव्रज लक्ष्मण।।2.31.29।।
31_27.translation: O Lakshmana in the great sacrifice performed by the highsouled Janaka, Varuna himself gave him two aweinspiring celestial bows, two impenetrable divine armours, two quivers with inexhaustible arrows, two swords plated with gold and as bright as the sun. All these weapons are deposited in the house of our preceptor (sage Vasistha) where they are being worshipped. Go and bring them swiftly.
31_27.word_by_word: लक्ष्मण O Lakshmana, महात्मा highsouled, वरुणः Varuna, स्वयम् himself, राज्ञः of the king, जनकस्य Janaka's, महायज्ञे in the great sacrifice, दिव्ये divine, रौद्रदर्शने awesome, ये those, धनुषी bows, दिव्ये divine, अभेद्यकवचे impenetrable armour, अक्षयसायकौ two sets of inexhaustible arrows, तूणी च two quivers, हेमपरिष्कृतौ plated with gold, आदित्यविमलौ as bright as the sun, उभौ both, खड्गौ swords, ददौ gave, एतत् that, सर्वम् everything, सत्कृत्य after having worshipped, आचार्य सद्मनि in the house of the preceptor (sage Vasistha), निहितम् is deposited, सर्वम् all, आयुधम् weaponry, आदाय after collecting , क्षिप्रं swiftly, आव्रज come forth.

31_28.translation: Lakshmana, who was resolved to go to the forest, took leave of his friends, and collected from the house of Vasistha, preceptor of the Ikshvaku race, the powerful weapons deposited with him.
31_28.word_by_word: वनवासाय to live in the forest, निश्चित: one who was determined, सः Lakshmana, सुहृज्जनम् friends, आमन्त्र्य taking leave of, इक्ष्वाकुगुरुम् preceptor of the Ikshvakus, Vasistha, आगम्य having reached, उत्तमम् powerful, आयुधम् weapons, जग्राह received.

31_29.shloka: तद्धिव्यं राजशार्दूल सत्कृतं माल्यभूषितम्।रामाय दर्शयामास सौमित्रिस्सर्वमायुधम्।।2.31.31।।
31_29.translation: Lakshmana, tiger among princes, brought all those divine weapons sanctified and  decorated with garlands and showed them to Rama.
31_29.word_by_word: राजशार्दूलः tiger among princes, सौमित्रिः Lakshmana, दिव्यम् divine, सत्कृतम् sanctified, माल्यभूषितम् decorated with garlands, सर्वम् all, तत् आयुधम् those weapons, रामाय to Rama, दर्शयामास showed.

31_30.shloka: तमुवाचात्मवान् रामः प्रीत्या लक्ष्मणमागतम्।काले त्वमागत सौम्य काङ्क्षिते मम लक्ष्मण।।2.31.32।।
31_30.translation: O handsome Lakshmana, you have come at the expected time, said the selfpossessed Rama affectionately when he saw him arrive.
31_30.word_by_word: आत्मवान् selfpossessed, रामः Rama, आगतम् having arrived, तं लक्ष्मणम् to that Lakshmana, प्रीत्या affectionately, उवाच said, सौम्य O handsome, लक्ष्मण Lakshmana, त्वम् you, मम to me, काङ्क्षिते काले at the desired moment, आगतः have come.

31_31.shloka: अहं प्रदातुमिच्छामि यदिदं मामकं धनम्।ब्राह्मणेभ्यस्तपस्विभ्यस्त्वया सह परन्तप।।2.31.33।।
31_31.translation: Let us give away, O tormentor of enemies (Lakshmana) my belogings to the ascetic brahmins.
31_31.word_by_word: परन्तप O tormentor of enemies, अहम् I, त्वया सह with you, यत् all that, इदम् this, मामकम् my belonging, धनम् wealth, तपस्विभ्यः to ascetics, ब्राह्मणेभ्यः to brahmins, प्रदातुम् to give away, इच्छामि I wish.

31_32.shloka: वसन्तीह दृढं भक्त्या गुरुषु द्विजसत्तमाः।तेषामपि च मे भूयस्सर्वेषाञ्चोपजीविनाम्।।2.31.34।।
31_32.translation: Here live the best of brahmins who are deeply devoted to their teachers along with those who are dependent on me for their livelihood.
31_32.word_by_word: इह here, गुरुषु among teachers, दृढम् deep, भक्त्या with devotion, द्विजसत्तमाः best of  brahmins, वसन्ति are living, तेषामपि च for them, भूयः also, सर्वेषाम् for all, मे my, उपजीविनां च to my dependents.

31_33.shloka: वशिष्ठपुत्रं तु सुयज्ञमार्यंत्वमानयाशु प्रवरं द्विजानाम्।अभिप्रयास्यामि वनं समस्तानभ्यर्च्य शिष्टानपरान् द्विजातीन्।।2.31.35।।
31_33.translation: Fetch Suyajna, son of Vasistha, best among the brahmins along with all other distinguished brahmins to whom I will pay my homage and leave for the forest.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे एकत्रिंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the thirtyfirst sarga of Ayodhyakanda of  the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
31_33.word_by_word: त्वम् you, द्विजानाम् among the brahmins, प्रवरम् best, वशिष्ठपुत्रम् son of Vasistha, आर्यम्  venerable, सुयज्ञम् Suyajna, आशु swiftly, आनय bring, शिष्टान् distinguished, अपरान् other, समस्तान् all, द्विजातीन् brahmins, अभ्यर्च्य having paid homage, वनम् to the forest, अभिप्रयास्यामि I shall go.

32_1.shloka: [Rama honours Suyajna with valuable gifts--distributes his wealth to dependents, brahmins and to sageTrijata.]ततश्शासन माज्ञाय भ्रातु श्शुभतरं प्रियम्।गत्वा स प्रविवेशाशु सुयज्ञस्य निवेशनम्।।2.32.1।।
32_1.translation: Lakshmana having understood the very auspicious and welcome order (of Rama)  immediately  proceeded to the house of Suyajna.
32_1.word_by_word: ततः thereafter, सः he, भ्रातुः brother's, शुभतरम् very much auspicious, प्रियम् pleasing, शासनम् command, आज्ञाय having understood, आशु immediately, गत्वा having gone, सुयज्ञस्य Suyajna's, निवेशनम् house, प्रविवेश entered.

32_2.shloka: तं विप्रमग्न्यगारस्थं वन्दित्वा लक्ष्मणोऽब्रवीत्।सखेऽभ्यागच्छ पश्य त्वं वेश्म दुष्करकारिणः।।2.32.2।।
32_2.translation: Lakshmana paid homage to him who was in the firesanctuary, and said O friend, come and see the palace of Rama who is the accomplisher of all difficult tasks.
32_2.word_by_word: लक्ष्मणः Lakshmana, अग्न्यगारस्थम् staying in the firesanctuary, तं विप्रम् that brahmin, वन्दित्वा after saluting, अब्रवीत् said, सखे O friend, अभ्यागच्छ come, त्वम् you, दुष्करकारिणः  accomplisher of all difficult tasks , वेश्म palace of Rama, पश्य behold.

32_3.shloka: ततस्सन्ध्यामुपास्याशु गत्वा सौमित्रिणा सह।जुष्टं तत्प्राविशल्लक्ष्म्या रम्यं रामनिवेशनम्।।2.32.3।।
32_3.translation: After performing the twilight prayers, Suyajna along with Lakshmana went straight away and entered the beautiful and prosperous palace of Rama.
32_3.word_by_word: ततः thereafter, सन्ध्याम् the twilight prayers, उपास्य having performed, सौमित्रिणा सह along with Lakshmana, आशु swiftly, गत्वा went, लक्ष्म्या with prosperity, जुष्टम् endowed with, रम्यम् beautiful, तत् that, रामनिवेशनम् Rama's palace, प्राविशत् he entered.

32_4.translation: On the arrival of sage Suyajna wellversed in the Vedas, both Rama and Sita offered obeisance to him as to firegod and circumambulated him.
32_4.word_by_word: राघवः Rama, प्राञ्जलिः folded hands, आगतम् who has come, वेदविदम् versed in Vedas, तं सुयज्ञम् that Suyajna, अर्चितम् worshipped, अग्निम् इव like fire, सीतया सह with Sita, अभिचक्राम circumambulated.

32_5.shloka: जातरूपमयैर्मुख्यैरङ्गदैः कुण्डलैः शुभैः।सहेमसूत्रैर्मणिभिः केयूरैर्वलयैरपि।।2.32.5।।अन्यैश्च रत्नैर्बहुभिः काकुत्स्थः प्रत्यपूजयत्।सुयज्ञं स तदोवाच रामस्सीता प्रचोदितः।।2.32.6।।
32_5.translation: Rama, scion of the Kakutstha dynasty, worshipped Suyajna with a collection of golden ornaments such as earrings, anklets, armlets, bracelets and many other ornaments of precious stones. Then urged by Sita, Rama said to him:
32_5.word_by_word: काकुत्स्थ: scion of the Kakutstha dynasty, जातरूपमयैः by golden, मुख्यैः with excellent, अङ्गदैः anklets, शुभैः auspicious, कुण्डलैः with earrings, सहेमसूत्रैः with golden strings, मणिभिः gems, केयूरैः bracelets, वलयैरपि armlets also, अन्यैः others, बहुभिः many, रत्नैश्च jewels, सुयज्ञम् to Suyajna, प्रत्यपूजयत् worshipped, तदा then, सः रामः that Rama, सीताप्रचोदितः urged by Sita, उवाच said.

32_6.shloka: हारं च हेमसूत्रं च भार्यायै सौम्य हारय।रशनां चाधुना सीता दातुमिच्छति ते सखे।।2.32.7।।
32_6.translation: O handsome friend now Sita intends to give away to your wife her necklace, her golden chain and girdle. Could you accept them?
32_6.word_by_word: सौम्य O handsome, सखे friend, सीता Sita, अधुना at this time, हारं च necklace also, हेमसूत्रं च golden chain, रशनां च also girdle, ते to you, दातुम् to give,  इच्छति wishes, भार्यायै to your wife, हारय take them.

32_7.shloka: अङ्गदानि विचित्राणि केयूराणि शुभानि च।प्रयच्छति सखे तुभ्यं भार्यायै गच्छती वनम्।।2.32.8।।
32_7.translation: Sita is departing for the forest and offers your wife her armlets, wonderful and elegant  bracelets.
32_7.word_by_word: सखे O friend, वनम् to the forest, गच्छती departing Sita, भार्यायैः to your wife, अङ्गदानि anklets, विचित्राणि wonderful, शुभानि auspicious, केयुराणि च bracelets, तुभ्यम् to you, प्रयच्छति is offering.

32_8.translation: Sita also wishes to give away a couch with an exquisite cover, encrusted with a variety of precious stones.
32_8.word_by_word: वैदेही Sita, अग्य्रास्तरणम् exquisite bed cover, नानारत्नविभूषितम् encrusted with various gems, तं पर्यङ्कम् that couch, अपि also, त्वयि in you, प्रतिष्ठापयितुम् to place (in your house), इच्छति wishes.

32_9.shloka: नाग श्शत्रुञ्जयो नाम मातुलोऽयं ददौ मम।तं ते गजसहस्रेण ददामि द्विजसत्तम।।2.32.10।।
32_9.translation: I am gifting you, O best among brahmins a thousand elephants including Satrunjaya an elephant my maternal uncle had given me.
32_9.word_by_word: द्विजसत्तम O best among brahmins, अयम् this one, शत्रुञ्जयो नाम by name Satrunjaya, नागः an elephant, मातुलः my maternal uncle, मम to me, ददौ gave, तम् to that (elephant), गजसहस्रेण along with a thousand elephants, ते to you, ददामि I am giving.

32_10.shloka: इत्युक्तस्स हि रामेण सुयज्ञः प्रतिगृहृयतत्।रामलक्ष्मणसीतानां प्रयुयोजाशिष श्शुभाः।।2.32.11।।
32_10.translation: Thus addressed by Rama, Suyajna accepted the gifts and conferred auspicious blessings on Rama, Lakshmana and Sita.
32_10.word_by_word: रामेण by Rama, इति thus, उक्तः spoken, सः सुयज्ञः that Suyajna, तत् that, प्रतिगृह्य having accepted, रामलक्ष्मणसीतानाम् to Rama, Lakshmana and Sita, शुभाः auspicious, आशिषः blessings, प्रयुयोज bestowed.

32_11.shloka: अथ भ्रातरमव्यग्रं प्रियं रामः प्रियंवदः।सौमित्रिं तमुवाचेदं ब्रह्मेव त्रिदशेश्वरम्।।2.32.12।।
32_11.translation: Sweettongued Rama calmly said to his brother (Lakshmana) like Brahmaaddressing Indra:
32_11.word_by_word: अथ thereafter, प्रियंवद: sweettongued, रामः Rama, प्रियम् to his beloved, भ्रातरम् to his brother, तं सौमित्रिम् to Lakshmana, ब्रह्मा creator, त्रिदशेश्वरम् इव like lord of heaven, Indra, अव्यग्रम् without haste, इदम् this word, उवाच said.

32_12.shloka: अगस्त्यं कौशिकं चैव तावुभौ ब्राह्मणोत्तमौ।अर्चयाहूय सौमित्रे रत्नैस्सस्यमिवाम्बुभिः।।2.32.13।।
32_12.translation: O Lakshmana invite Agastya and Kausika, the two celebrated brahmins, and bestow on them with reverence plenty of precious gems like showers of rain on standing crops.
32_12.word_by_word: सौमित्रे Lakshmana, अगस्त्यम् sage Agasthya, कौशिकं चैव to sage Kausika, उभौ both, तौ ब्राह्मणोत्तमौ two eminent brahmins, आहूय having invited, रत्नैः gems, सस्यं crops, अम्बुभिः इवlike rain waters, अर्चय worship.

32_13.shloka: तर्पयस्व महाबाहो गोसहस्रैश्च मानद।सुवर्णै रजतैश्चैव मणिभिश्च महाधनैः।।2.32.14।।
32_13.translation: Satisfy them, O highlyarmed Lakshmana, O bestower of honour with a thousand cows, gold, silver and with the great wealth of gems.
32_13.word_by_word: महाबाहो O mightyarmed Lakshmana, मानद O bestower of honour, गोसहस्रैश्च with  a thousand cows, सुवर्णैः gold, रजतैश्चैव and also silver, महाधनैः great wealth, मणिभिश्च with gems also, तर्पयस्व you satisfy them.

32_14.shloka: कौसल्यां च य आशीर्भिर्भक्तः पर्युपतिष्ठति।आचार्यस्तैत्तिरीयाणामभिरूपश्च वेदवित्।।2.32.15।।तस्य यानं च दासीश्च सौमित्रे सम्प्रदापय।कौशेयानि च वस्त्राणि यावत्तुष्यति स द्विजः।।2.32.16।।
32_14.translation: O Lakshmana, give away chariots, maidservants, silk clothes to learned brahmins of Taittiriya branch and wellversed in the Vedas, to agreeable and faithful brahmins attending on Kausalya with their blessings till they are fully satisfied.
32_14.word_by_word: सौमित्रे O Lakshmana, तैत्तिरीयाणाम् of the Taittiriya branch of the Vedas, आचार्यः learned preceptor, अभिरूपश्च agreeable man, वेदवित् versed in the Vedas, यः who, भक्तः devotee,आशीर्भिः with blessings, कौशल्याम् of  Kausalya, पर्युपतिष्ठति attends on her, तस्य to him, सः द्विजः that brahmin, यावत् till such time, तुष्यति is fully satisfied, यानं च chariots, दासीश्च  maidservants, कौशेयानि वस्त्राणि च silk clothes also, संप्रदापय arrange to give away.

32_15.shloka: सूतश्चित्ररथश्चार्य सचिवस्सुचिरोषितः।तोषयैनं महार्हैश्च रत्नैर्वस्त्रैर्धनैस्तथा।।2.32.17।।पशुकाभिश्च सर्वाभिर्गवां दशशतेन च।
32_15.translation: Noble counsellor (of our father) and charioteer Chitraratha has been in our service for many years. Gratify him with invaluable jewels, clothes, wealth, with young female calves and a thousand cows.
32_15.word_by_word: आर्यसचिवः noble counsellor (of our father), चित्ररथः Chitraratha, सूतः charioteer, सुचिरोषितः lived with us for many years, एनम् him, महार्है: with invaluable, रत्नैश्च with jewels, वस्त्रै: clothes, तथा similarly, धनैः with wealth,सर्वाभिः with all ,पशुकाभिः च with young female calves, गवाम् cows, दशशतेन च by (a thousand) ten hundreds, तोषय you may gratify him.

32_16.shloka: ये चेमे कठकालापा बहवो दण्डमाणवाः।।2.32.18।।नित्यस्वाध्यायशीलत्वान्नान्यत्कुर्वन्ति किञ्चन।अलसा स्वादुकामाश्च महतां चापि सम्मताः।।2.32.19।।तेषामशीतियानानि रत्नपूर्णानि दापय।शालिवाहसहस्रं च द्वे शते भद्रकां स्तथा।।2.32.20।।व्यञ्जनार्थं च सौमित्रे गोसहस्रमुपाकुरु।
32_16.translation: O Lakshmana many brahmacharis with a staff (as a mark of religious authority) wellversed in Katha and Kalapa portions of the Vedas engaged daily in the study of the Vedas and nothing else. Not active otherwise, they are fond of delicious food and are respected even by great people. Give them eighty carts filled with gems, a thousand bulls capable of carrying paddy, and two hundred oxen capable of  ploughing land and a thousand cows for preparing food (with milk products).
32_16.word_by_word: कठकालापाः men versed in Katha and Kalapa portions of the Vedas, ये which, इमे these, बहवः many, दण्डमाणवाः brahmacharis holding a staff (as authority given to an ascetic), नित्यस्वाध्यायशीलत्वात् engaged daily in the study of Vedas, अन्यत् other, किञ्चन any work, न कुर्वन्ति not doing, अलसाः inactive people, स्वादुकामाश्च fond of delicious food, महतां चापि even for great people, सम्मताः are highly respected, तेषाम् for them, रत्नपूर्णानि filled with gems, अशीतियानानि eighty carts, शालिवाहसहस्रं च a thousand bulls capable of carrying corn, द्वे शते two hundred, भद्रकान् bulls, दापय arrange to give away, सौमित्रे O Lakshmana व्यञ्जनार्थम् for preparing food (with milk products), गोसहस्रम् a thousand cows, उपाकुरु arrange to give away.

32_17.shloka: मेखलीनां महासङ्घः कौसल्यां समुपस्थितः।।2.32.21।।तेषां सहस्रं सौमित्रे प्रत्येकं सम्प्रदापय।
32_17.translation: Give each of the large number of brahmacharis wearing girdles and working under Kausalya a thousand (cows or gold coins), O Lakshmana
32_17.word_by_word: सौमित्रे O Lakshmana मेखलीनाम् of brahmacharis (who wear a triple girdle worn by the first three castes), महासङ्घः in large numbers, कौशल्याम् of Kausalya, समुपस्थितः depending on, तेषाम् to them, प्रत्येकम् for each of them, सहस्रम् thousand (cows), सम्प्रदापय  gift away.

32_18.shloka: अम्बा यथा च सा नन्देत्कौसल्या मम दक्षिणाम्।।2.32.22।।तथा द्विजातीस्ता न्सर्वान् लक्ष्मणार्चय सर्वशः।
32_18.translation: You should, O Lakshmana treat all those brahmins in such a way that my mother shall be pleased on seeing my respectful offerings.
32_18.word_by_word: लक्ष्मण O Lakshmana, अम्बा mother, सा कौशल्या Kausalya, मम my, दक्षिणाम् respectful offerings, यथा in whichever way, नन्देत् that pleases, तथा in that way, तान् those, सर्वान् all, द्विजातीन् brahmins, सर्वशः in all ways, अर्चय you may honour.

32_19.shloka: तत स्सपुरुषव्याघ्रस्तद्धनं लक्ष्मणः स्वयम्।।2.32.23।।यथोक्तं ब्राह्मणेन्द्राणांमददाद्धनदो यथा।
32_19.translation: Thereupon Lakshmana, a tiger among men, personally distributed like Kubera, gifts of riches to all those Indras among brahmins (best of brahmins) in accordance with the instructions of Rama.
32_19.word_by_word: ततः thereupon, पुरुषव्याघ्रः tiger among men (best of men), सः लक्ष्मणः that Lakshmana, धनदो यथा like Kubera, bestower of wealth, तत् धनम् that wealth, यथोक्तम् as told (by Rama), स्वयम् personally, ब्राह्मणेन्द्राणाम् to the Indras among brahmins (best brahmins), अददात् gave.

32_20.translation: Rama then bestowed abundant wealth on each of the dependents as they stood with their throats choked with tears, saying:
32_20.word_by_word: अथ thereafter, बाष्पकलान् men with their throats choked with tears, तिष्ठतः remaining, उपजीविनः dependents, एकैकस्य for each one of them, बहु abundance of, द्रव्यम् wealth, उपजीवनम् as subsistence, सम्प्रदाय having bestowed, अब्रवीत् said.

32_21.shloka: लक्ष्मणस्य च यद्वेश्म गृहं च यदिदं मम।।2.32.25।।अशून्यं कार्यमेकैकं यावदागमनं मम।
32_21.translation: Till I come back, guard each of the palaces of Lakshmana and mine and ensure that they are not left unattended.
32_21.word_by_word: लक्ष्मणस्य Lakshmana's, यत् which, वेश्म palace, मम my, इदम् this, यत् which, गृहं च palace also, एकैकम् each one, मम my, यावदागमनम् till I return, अशून्यम् without being unattended, कार्यम् fit to be done.

32_22.shloka: इत्युक्त्वा दुःखितं सर्वं जनं तमुपजीविनम्।।2.32.26।।उवाचेदं धनाध्यक्षं धनमानीयतामिति।
32_22.translation: Having spoken thus to all dependents who were overcome with grief, Rama ordered the  treasury officer to bring the entire treasure.
32_22.word_by_word: दुःखितम् filled with grief, उपजीविनम् dependents, सर्वम् all, तं जनम् to that group, इति thus, उक्त्वा having said, धनम् treasure, आनीयताम् bring, इति thus, इदम् this word, धनाध्यक्षम् to treasury officer, उवाच said.

32_23.translation: When all the dependents fetched the entire wealth of Rama, they were pleased to see the great heap of wealth.
32_23.word_by_word: ततः after that, उपजीविनः dependents, अस्य Rama's, सर्वमेव entire, धनम् wealth, आजह्रुः brought, तत्र there, सुमहान् extremely great, सः राशिः that heap of wealth, दर्शनीयः pleasing to see, अदृश्यत beheld.

32_24.translation: Rama, best among men, got the entire wealth distributed among indigent brahmins, and young and old alike with the help of Lakshmana.
32_24.word_by_word: ततः then, पुरुषव्याघ्रः tiger among men (best of men), सः that Rama, सहलक्ष्मणः along with Lakshmana, तत् धनम् that wealth, द्विजेभ्यः to brahmins, बालवृद्धेभ्यः to the young and old, कृपणेभ्यः to the poor, अदापयत् got it distributed.

32_25.shloka: तत्रासीत्पिङ्गलो गार्ग्यस्त्रिजटो नाम वै द्विजः।।2.32.29।।क्षतवृत्तिर्वने नित्यं फालकुद्दाललाङ्गली।
32_25.translation: A brahmin by name, Trijata, a descendant of sage Garga and of reddishbrown colour used to live in that region earning his livelihood in the forest by digging the earth with an ironspade and a plough.
32_25.word_by_word: तत्र there, नित्यम् always, फालकुद्दाललाङ्गली with an ironspade and a plough, वने in the forest, क्षतवृत्ति: digging the earth as profession, पिङ्गलः a man of reddishbrown colour,गार्ग्यः descendant of sage Gargya, त्रिजटो नाम by name Trijata, द्विजः brahmin, आसीत् lived.

32_26.shloka: तं वृद्धं तरुणी भार्या बालानादाय दारकान्।।2.32.30।।अब्रवीद्बाह्मणं वाक्यं दारिद्र्येणाभिपीडिता।
32_26.translation: His young wife, highly distressed due to poverty, keeping her young sons before her said to the aged brahmin:
32_26.word_by_word: तरुणी young, भार्या wife, दारिद्र्येण due to poverty, अभिपीडिता highly distressed, बालान् young, दारकान् sons, आदाय after presenting, वृद्धम् aged, तं ब्राह्मणम् to that brahmin, अब्रवीत् said.

32_27.shloka: अपास्य फालं कुद्दालं कुरुष्व वचनं मम।।2.32.31।।रामं दर्शय धर्मज्ञं यदि किञ्चिदवाप्स्यसि।
32_27.translation: Listen to me throw away this ironspade. Go and see the righteous Rama.You may obtain something.
32_27.word_by_word: फालम् iron, कुद्दालम् spade, अपास्य throwing away, मम my, वचनम् words, कुरुष्व implement, धर्मज्ञम् knower of  righteousness, रामम् to Rama, दर्शय you may present yourself, किञ्चित् something, अवाप्स्यसि यदि if at all you may obtain.

32_28.shloka: स भार्यावचनं श्रुत्वा शाटीमाच्छाद्य दुश्छदाम्।।2.32.32।।स प्रातिष्ठत पन्थानं यत्र रामनिवेशनम्।
32_28.translation: At the words of his wife, Trijata took the path to Rama's palace, having wrapped  himself with a torn upper garment .
32_28.word_by_word: सः that Trijata, भार्यावचनम् wife's words, श्रुत्वा having heard, दुःश्छदाम् tattered clothes, शाटीम् upper garment, आच्छाद्य having wrapped, रामनिवेशनम् Rama's palace, यत्र where it is located, पन्थानम् about the path, प्रातिष्ठत he set forth.

32_29.shloka: भृग्वङ्गिरसमं दीप्त्या त्रिजटं जनसंसदि।।2.32.33।।आपञ्चमायाः कक्ष्यायाः नैनं कश्चिदवारयत्।
32_29.translation: No one in the crowd stopped Tirjata until he reached the fifth courtyard as he looked like Bhrigu and Angirasa in brilliance.
32_29.word_by_word: जनसंसदि in the crowd, दीप्त्या in lustre, भृग्वङ्गिरसमम् like Bhrugu and Angirasa, एनम् this, त्रिजटम् Trijata, आपञ्चमायाः कक्ष्यायाः up to the fifth courtyard, कश्चित् any one, न अवारयत् did not stop him.

32_30.shloka: स राजपुत्रमासाद्य त्रिजटो वाक्यमब्रवीत्।।2.32.34।।निर्धनो बहुपुत्रोऽस्मि राजपुत्र महायशः।उञ्छवृत्तिर्वने नित्यं प्रत्यवेक्षस्व मामिति।।2.32.35।।
32_30.translation: Trijata approached Rama and said O illustrious prince I am a destitute and have many children. I am  living in the forest by collecting leftover grains. Look at me.
32_30.word_by_word: सः त्रिजटः that Trijata, राजपुत्रम् prince Rama, आसाद्य having approached, वाक्यम् these  words, अब्रवीत् uttered, महायशः O illustrious one, राजपुत्र O Prince, निर्धनः I am a destitute, बहुपुत्रः father of many children, नित्यम् daily, वने in the forest, उञ्छवृत्ति: अस्मि living on collecting the leftover grain of the field, माम् me, प्रत्यवेक्षस्व look at, इति thus.

32_31.shloka: तमुवाच ततो राम: परिहास समन्वितम्।गवां सहस्रमप्येकं न नु विश्राणितं मया।।2.32.36।।परिक्षिपसि दण्डेन यावत्तावदवाप्स्यसि।
32_31.translation: Rama jokingly replied to him, I have not yet gifted one thousand cows. Throw your staff and the cows on the space your staff covers will be yours.
32_31.word_by_word: ततः then, रामः Rama, परिहाससमन्वितम् jokingly, तम् him, उवाच said, मया by me, एकम् one, गवां सहस्रमपि thousand cows, न च विश्राणितम् not yet given away, दण्डेन with staff, यावत् as far as, परिक्षिपसि you will hurl, तावत् till such place, अवाप्स्यसि you will obtain.

32_32.shloka: स शाटीं त्वरितः कट्यां सम्भ्रान्तः परिवेष्ट्य ताम्।।2.32.37।।आविद्ध्य दण्डं चिक्षेप सर्वप्राणेन वेगितः।
32_32.translation: Bewildered Trijata swiftly tightened up his upper garment around his waist, set the direction for his staff and hurled it with all his might.
32_32.word_by_word: सः Trijata, सम्भ्रान्तः bewildered, त्वरितः swiftly, तां शाटीम् his upper garment, कट्याम् on his waist, परिवेष्ट्य after throwing round, दण्डम् staff, आविद्ध्य after setting the direction, वेगितः swiftly, सर्वप्राणेन with all his might, चिक्षेप hurled.

32_33.shloka: स तीर्त्वा सरयूपारं दण्डस्तस्य कराच्च्युतः।।2.32.38।।गोव्रजे बहुसाहस्रे पपातोक्षणसन्निधौ।
32_33.translation: The staff he hurled crossed the bank of the river Sarayu and fell near a bull in the midst of a thousands cows.
32_33.word_by_word: तस्य his, करात् from the hand, च्युतः released, सः दण्डः that staff, सरयूपारम् the bank of  Sarayu river, तीर्त्वा having crossed, बहुसाहस्रे in very many thousands, गोव्रजे in the midst of  multitude of cows, उक्षणसन्निधौ near a bull, पपात fell.

32_34.shloka: तं परिष्वज्य धर्मात्मा आतस्मात्सरयूतटात्।।2.32.39।।आनयामास ता गोपै स्त्रिजटायाश्रमं प्रति।
32_34.translation: The virtuous Rama embraced Trijata, and despatched all the cattle extending up to the bank of Sarayu to his hermitage.
32_34.word_by_word: धर्मात्मा virtuous , तम् him, परिष्वज्य having embraced, तस्मात् that, आसरयूतटात् up to the bank of Sarayu river, ताः those cows, गोपैः by herdsmen, त्रिजटाय Trijata's, आश्रमं प्रतिtowards the hermitage, आनयामास brought them.

32_35.shloka: उवाच स ततो रामस्तं गार्ग्यमभिसान्त्वयन्।मन्युर्न खलु कर्तव्यः परिहासो ह्ययं मम।।2.32.40।।
32_35.translation: Afterwards Rama sought to placate Trijata, that descendant of Ganga, saying: This was a joke. Do not be angry.
32_35.word_by_word: ततः afterwards, रामः Rama, तं गार्ग्यम् that Gargya, अभिसान्त्वयन् consoling (him), उवाच said, मन्युः anger, न खलु कर्तव्यः should not be made, अयम् this, मम my, परिहासः a joke.

32_36.shloka: इदं हि तेजस्तव यद्दुरत्ययंतदेव जिज्ञासितुमिच्छता मया।इमं भवानर्थमभि प्रचोदितोवृणीष्व किं चेदपरं व्यवस्यति।।2.32.41।।
32_36.translation: Your power is unsurpassable and to ascertain this, I incited you to do this act. Ifthere is anything else, ask for it.
32_36.word_by_word: तव your, दुरत्ययम् unsurpassable, यत् which, तेजः power, तत् that, जिज्ञासितुम् to ascertain, इच्छता एव indeed desiring, मया by me, भवान् you, इमम् this, अर्थम् act, अभिप्रचोदितः incited, अपरम् other, किम् any other, व्यवस्यति चेत् if sought, वृणीष्व you may ask for.

32_37.shloka: ब्रवीमि सत्येन नतेऽस्ति यन्त्रणाधनं हि यद्यन्मम विप्रकारणात्।भवत्सु सम्यक्प्रतिपादनेन तन्मयार्जितं प्रीतियशस्करं भवेत्।।2.32.42।।
32_37.translation: Truly speaking, there is no limit to seeking wealth. My wealth is specifically meant for brahmins. By distributing all the wealth earned by me, I get pleasure and renown.
32_37.word_by_word: सत्येन truly, ब्रवीमि I speak, ते to you, यन्त्रणा restraint (to seek this much only), नास्ति is not there, मम my, यद्यत् whichever, धनम् wealth, विप्रकारणात् हि indeed for  brahmins only, मया by me, र्जितम् earned, तत् that, भवत्सु in you, सम्यक् correctly,  प्रतिपादनेन by offering, प्रीतियशस्करम् भवेत् gives me pleasure and renown.

32_38.shloka: तत स्सभार्य स्त्रिजटो महामुनिर्गवामनीकं प्रतिगृह्य मोदितः।यशोबलप्रीतिसुखोपबृंहणीस्तदाशिष: प्रत्यवदन्महात्मनः।।2.32.43।।
32_38.translation: Thereafter that great sage Trijata along with his wife, immensely happy to receive multitudes of cows, pronounced blessings on the magnanimous Rama for glory, power, pleasure and prosperity.
32_38.word_by_word: ततः thereafter, सभार्यः along with his wife, महामुनिः great sage, त्रिजटः Trijata, गवाम् cows, अनीकम् multitude, प्रतिगृह्य having accepted, मोदितः delighted, तदा then, महात्मनः magnanimous (Rama), यशोबलप्रीतिसुखोपबृंहणीः enhancing glory, power, pleasure and prosperity, आशिषः blessings, प्रत्यवदत् gave in reply.

32_39.shloka: स चापि रामः प्रतिपूर्णमानसोमहद्धनं धर्मबलैरुपार्जितम्।नियोजयामास सुहृज्जनेऽचिराद्यथार्हसम्मानवचः प्रचोदितः।।2.32.44।।
32_39.translation: Prompted by the deserving words of acclaim from his friends, Rama distributed with joy and without delay the entire wealth earned by him through dharma.
32_39.word_by_word: सः that, राम: चापि Rama also, प्रतिपूर्णमानसः with completely satisfied mind, धर्मबलैः through dharma, उपार्जितम् earned, महत् धनम् vast wealth, अचिरात् without delay, यथार्हसम्मानवचः प्रचोदितः prompted by the deserving words of acclaim, सुहृज्जने among his friends, नियोजयामास offered.

32_40.shloka: द्विज स्सुहृद्भृत्यजनोऽथवा तदादरिद्रभिक्षाचरणश्च योऽभवत्।न तत्र कश्चिन्न बभूव तर्पितोयथार्हसम्मानन दान सम्भ्रमैः।।2.32.46।।
32_40.translation: Thus there was none among those brahmins, attendants, poor people, and beggars, who was not satisfied with the honour (received) or with the charity.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे द्वात्रिंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the thirtysecond sarga of Ayodhyakanda of the holy Ramayana, the firstepic composed by sage Valmiki.
32_40.word_by_word: तत्र there, तदा then, यः such, द्विज: a brahmin, सुहृत् friend, अथवा or, भृत्यजनः servant, दरिद्र भिक्षाचरणश्च poor or beggar, कश्चित् any one, यथार्हसम्माननदानसम्भ्रमैः with the befitting honour or with charity, न तर्पितः not satisfied, न बभूव there was none.

33_1.shloka: [Rama along with Sita and Lakshmana goes to the residence of Kaikeyi--hears comments on the way.]दत्त्वा तु सह वैदेह्या ब्राह्मणेभ्यो धनं बहु।जग्मतुः पितरं द्रष्टुं सीतया सह राघवौ।।2.33.1।।
33_1.translation: After giving away plenty of wealth to brahmins in charity, Rama and Lakshmana along with Sita set out to see their father, king Dasaratha.
33_1.word_by_word: राघवौ Rama and Lakshmana, वैदेह्या सह along with Sita, ब्राह्मणेभ्यः to brahmins, बहु plenty, धनम् wealth, दत्वा having given (in charity), पितरम् to father, द्रष्टुम् to see, सीतया सह along with Sita, जग्मतुः both of them set out.

33_2.shloka: ततो गृहीते दुष्प्रेक्षे त्वशोभेतां तदायुधे।मालादामभिराबद्धे सीतया समलङ्कृते।।2.33.2।।
33_2.translation: The pair of dazzling weapons held (by Rama and Lakshmana) looked splendid decorated with flower garlands by Sita.
33_2.word_by_word: ततः then, दुष्प्रेक्षे dazzling, गृहीते held, सीतया by Sita, मालादामभिः with garlands, अबद्धे bound, समलङ्कृते decorated, तदायुथे pair of weapons of Rama and Lakshmana, अशोभेताम् shone.

33_3.shloka: ततः प्रासादहर्म्याणि विमानशिखराणि च।अधिरुह्य जनश्श्रीमानुदासीनो व्यलोकयत्।।2.33.3।।
33_3.translation: The rich climbed their palaces and mansions, terraces of sevenstoried buildings and watched them sadly.
33_3.word_by_word: ततः then, श्रीमान् prosperous, जनः people, प्रासादहर्म्याणि palaces and mansions, विमानशिखराणि च terraces of sevenstoried buildings, अधिरुह्य having climbed, उदासीनःsad, व्यलोकयत् looked.

33_4.shloka: न हि रथ्याः स्म शक्यन्ते गन्तुं बहुजनाकुलाः।आरुह्य तस्मात्प्रासादान् दीनाः पश्यन्ति राघवम्।।2.33.4।।
33_4.translation: The streets were so thronged with multitudes of citizens that they were impassable. Therefore, people felt miserable and ascended their mansions and gazed at Rama.
33_4.word_by_word: बहुजनाकुलाः thronged with multitudes of citizens, रथ्याः streets, गन्तुम् to walk, न शक्यन्ते स्म हि indeed were unable, तस्मात् for that reason, दीनाः miserable,  प्रासादन् the palace, आरुह्य having ascended, राघवम् Rama, पश्यन्ति were looking.

33_5.shloka: पदातिं वर्जितच्छत्रं रामं दृष्ट्वा जनास्तदा।ऊचुर्बहुविधा वाच श्शोकोपहतचेतसः।।2.33.5।।
33_5.translation: Seeing Rama walking without the royal umbrella, people were very much shocked. They expressed their reaction in so many words:
33_5.word_by_word: तदा then, जनाः people, पदातिम् pedestrian, वर्जितच्छत्रम् without the (royal) umbrella, रामम् to Rama, दृष्ट्वा having seen, शोकोपहतचेतसः griefstricken, बहुविधाः in many ways, वाचः words, ऊचुः uttered.

33_6.shloka: यं यान्तमनुयाति स्म चतुरङ्गबलं महत्।तमेकं सीतया सार्धमनुयाति स्म लक्ष्मणः।।2.33.6।।
33_6.translation: Whenever Rama went out, powerful army of four divisions used to follow him. Today he is walking alone followed by Lakshmana and Sita.
33_6.word_by_word: यान्तम् while going, यम् whom, महत् powerful, चतुरङ्गबलम् army of four divisions, अनुयाति स्म used to follow, तम् such, एकम् alone, सीतया सार्धम् along with Sita, लक्ष्मणः Lakshmana, अनुयाति स्म followed.

33_7.shloka: ऐश्वर्यस्य रसज्ञः सन् कामिनां चैव कामदः।नेच्छत्येवानृतं कर्तुं पितरं धर्मगौरवात्।।2.33.7।।
33_7.translation: Rama who enjoyed the comforts of affluence gratifies those who have desires. Out of veneration for righteousness, he does not want to prove his father false (to his promise).
33_7.word_by_word: ऐश्वर्यस्य of affluence, रसज्ञः सन् while enjoying, कामिनाम् for those who have desires, कामदः चैव fulfiller of desires (Rama), धर्मगौरवात्  out of veneration for righteousness, पितरं to father, अनृतम् false, कर्तुम् to make, नेच्छत्येव does not wish.

33_8.shloka: या न शक्या पुरा द्रष्टुं भूतैराकाशगैरपि।तामद्य सीतां पश्यन्ति राजमार्गगता जनाः।।2.33.8।।
33_8.translation: It was not possible even for the creatures wandering in the sky (birds) to have a glimpse of Sita before. Now passersby walking the highway can behold her.
33_8.word_by_word: पुरा earlier, या Sita, आकाशगैः by those wandering in the sky (birds), भूतैरपि creatures, द्रष्टुम् to see, न शक्या not possible, तां सीताम् to that Sita, अद्य now, राजमार्गगताः those walking on the highway, जनाः passersby, पश्यन्ति are beholding.

33_9.shloka: अङ्गरागोचितां सीतां रक्तचन्दनसेविनीम्।वर्षमुष्णं च शीतं च नेष्यन्त्याशु विवर्णताम्।।2.33.9।।
33_9.translation: Sita who used to apply fragrant unguents and smear the body with redsandalcream will now be exposed to the rain, the heat and the cold which will quickly discolour her body.
33_9.word_by_word: अङ्गरागोचिताम् used to fragrant unguents, रक्तचन्दन सेविनीम् smeared with red sandalpaste, सीताम् Sita, वर्षम् rain, उष्णं च heat, शीतं च cold, आशु quickly, विवर्णताम्  discoloured, नेष्यन्ति will render.

33_10.shloka: अद्य नूनं दशरथस्सत्त्वमाविश्य भाषते।न हि राजा प्रियं पुत्रं विवासयितुमर्हति।।2.33.10।।
33_10.translation: Surely king Dasaratha possessed of an evil spirit spoke the way he did today. Otherwise, should a king banish his beloved son?
33_10.word_by_word: अद्य today, नूनम् surely, दशरथः Dasaratha, सत्त्वम् by evil spirit, आविश्य after being  possessed by, भाषते is speaking, राजा king, प्रियम् beloved, पुत्रम् son, विवासयितुम् to banish, न अर्हति हि is not fit enough.

33_11.shloka: निर्गुणस्यापि पुत्रस्य कथं स्याद्विप्रवासनम्।किं पुनर्यस्य लोकोऽयं जितो वृत्तेन केवलम्।।2.33.11।।
