41_12.translation: The stars were shorn of their radiance. The brilliance of the planets diminished. Shrouded in smoke the Visakha constellation appeared in the sky.
41_12.word_by_word: नक्षत्राणि the constellation of stars, गतार्चींषि shorn of their radiance, ग्रहाश्च planets also, गततेजसः diminished  their brilliance, विशाखास्तु as for Visakha stars, सधूमाः with smoke, नभसि in the sky, प्रचकाशिरे were shining.

41_13.shloka: कालिकानिलवेगेन महोदधिरिवोत्थितः।रामे वनं प्रव्रजिते नगरं प्रचचाल तत्।।2.41.13।।
41_13.translation: After Rama left for the forest, dark clouds appeared (in the sky) like the (waves of) the great ocean uplifted by the speed of the wind which shook the city.
41_13.word_by_word: महोदधिः great ocean, कालिकानिलवेगेन इव like windblown dark clouds, उत्थितः aroused, रामे Rama, वनम् to the forest, प्रव्रजिते having been exiled, तत् नगरम् that city (of Ayodhya), प्रचचाल was shaken.

41_14.shloka: दिशः पर्याकुलास्सर्वा स्तिमिरेणेव संवृताः।न ग्रहो नापि नक्षत्रं प्रचकाशे नकिञ्चन।।2.41.14।।
41_14.translation: As if covered with darkness, all the cardinal points became agitated. No planet, no star nor was anything (any heavenly body) shining (in the sky).
41_14.word_by_word: सर्वाः all, दिशः cardinal points, पर्याकुलाः agitated, तिमिरेण with darkness, संवृताः इव covered, ग्रहः planet, न प्रचकाशे did not shine, नक्षत्रमपि even stars, किञ्चन anything, न not shining.

41_15.shloka: अकस्मान्नागरस्सर्वो जनो दैन्यमुपागमत्।आहारे वा विहारे वा न कश्चिदकरोन्मनः।।2.41.15।।
41_15.translation: All of a sudden the people of the city became miserable. No one was interested in eating and enjoying (life).
41_15.word_by_word: सर्वः all, नागरः relating to the city, जनः people, अकस्मात् suddenly, दैन्यम् helplessness, उपागमत् obtained, आहारे वा either in nourishment, विहारे वा or in recreation, कश्चित् none, मनः their mind, न अकरात् not done.

41_16.shloka: शोकपर्यायसन्तप्त स्सततं दीर्घमुच्छवसन्।अयोध्यायां जनस्सर्व श्शुशोच जगतीपतिम्।।2.41.16।।
41_16.translation: All the citizens of Ayodhya, afflicted with a series of grief and heaving deep sighs  ceaselessly bewailed at the sight of the lord of the world (Dasaratha).
41_16.word_by_word: अयोध्यायाम् in Ayodhya, सर्वः all, जनः people, शोकपर्यायसन्तप्तः afflicted with a series of grief, सततम् always, दीर्घम् deeply, उच्छवसन् heaving, जगतीपतिम् the lord of the world, शुशोचbewailed.

41_17.shloka: बाष्पपर्याकुलमुखो राजमार्गगतो जनः।न हृष्टो लक्ष्यते कश्चित्सर्व श्शोकपरायणः।।2.41.17।।
41_17.translation: The faces of the people on the highway were turbid with tears. None looked happy. All were plunged in sorrow.
41_17.word_by_word: राजमार्गगतः in the royal highway, जनः people, बाष्पपर्याकुलमुखः faces full of tears, कश्चित् any body, हृष्टः happy, न लक्ष्ययते could not be seen, सर्वः all, शोकपरायणः was plunged in sorrow.

41_18.shloka: न वाति पवन श्शीतो न शशी सौम्यदर्शनः।न सूर्यस्तपते लोकं सर्वं पर्याकुलं जगत्।।2.41.18।।
41_18.translation: The breeze did not blow cool. No more did the Moon look pleasant. The Sun did not give warmth to the world. All the world was agitated.
41_18.word_by_word: पवनः wind, शीतः cool, न वाति does not blow, शशी Moon, सौम्यदर्शनः with pleasant appearance, न not, सूर्यः Sun, लोकम् the world, न तपते did not warm, सर्वम्  entire, जगत् world, पर्याकुलम् was agitated.

41_19.shloka: अनर्थिनस्सुताः स्त्रीणां भर्तारो भ्रातरस्तथा।सर्वे सर्वं परित्यज्य राममेवान्वचिन्तयन्।।2.41.19।।
41_19.translation: Mothers stopped thinking of their sons and husbands of their wives. Brothers were no longer interested in each other. Every one deserted every one and thought only of Rama.
41_19.word_by_word: सुताः sons, भर्तारः husbands, स्त्रीणाम् towards women, अनर्थिनः had no concern, तथा similarly, भ्रातरः brothers, अनर्थिनः had no mutual interest, सर्वे all, सर्वम् everything, परित्यज्य having deserted, राममेव about Rama only, अन्वचिन्तयन् they thought.

41_20.shloka: ये तु रामस्य सुहृद स्सर्वे ते मूढचेतसः।शोकभारेण चाक्रान्ता श्शयनं न जहुस्तदा।।2.41.20।।
41_20.translation: All the friends of Rama were stupefied. Afflicted with the burden of sorrow they did not leave their bed.
41_20.word_by_word: तदा then, रामस्य Rama's, ये सुहृदः those friends, ते सर्वे all of them, मूढचेतसः bewildered, शोकभारेण with burden of sorrow, आक्रान्ताः afflicted, शयनम् couches, न जहुः did not leave.

41_21.shloka: ततस्त्वयोध्या रहिता महात्मनापुरन्दरेणेव मही सपर्वता।चचाल घोरं भयशोकपीडितासनागयोधाश्वगणा ननाद च।।2.41.21।।
41_21.translation: Without magnanimous Rama, Ayodhya thereafter looked like the earth along with its mountains bereft of Indra. Afflicted with fear and sorrow it started shaking dreadfully with the sounds of horses, elephants and warriors.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे एकचत्वारिंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the fortyfirst sarga of Ayodhyakanda of  the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
41_21.word_by_word: ततः thereafter, पुरन्दरेण by Indra, रहिता without, सपर्वता with mountains, महीव like earth, महात्मना magnanimous Rama, रहिता without, अयोध्या Ayodhya, भयशोकपीडिता agitated by fear and sorrow, घोरम् dreadfully, चचाल had shaken, सनागयोधाश्वगणा filled with hosts of  warriors, elephants and horses, ननाद च made sounds.

42_1.shloka: [Grief stricken Dasaratha falls down-- denounces Kaikeyi--reaches the chamber of Kausalya.]यावत्तु निर्यतस्तस्य रजोरूपमदृश्यत।नैवेक्ष्वाकुवरस्तावत्सञ्जहारात्मचक्षुषी।।2.42.1।।
42_1.translation: As long as the dust raised by the wheels of the chariot of Rama (who was departing to the forest) was visible, Dasaratha, the best of the Ikshvakus, could not withdraw his eyes (from  Rama).
42_1.word_by_word: तस्य that Rama, निर्यतः as he was going, रजोरूपम् the form of dust, यावत् as long as, अदृश्यत was visible, तावत् so long, इक्ष्वाकुवरः the best of Ikshvaku dynasty, king Dasaratha, आत्मचक्षुषी his eyes, नैव सञ्जहार did not withdraw.

42_2.shloka: यावद्राजा प्रियं पुत्रं पश्यत्यत्यन्तधार्मिकम्।तावद्व्यवर्धते वास्य धरण्यां पुत्रदर्शने।।2.42.2।।
42_2.translation: So long as king Dasaratha was able to see his exceedingly virtuous and beloved  son (Rama), it appeared that his body kept rising from the earth to have a sight of his son.
42_2.word_by_word: राजा king, प्रियम् beloved, अत्यन्तधार्मिकम् exceedingly virtuous, पुत्रम् son, यावत् as long as, पश्यति was able to see, तावत् so long, अस्य his, पुत्रदर्शने for the sight of the son, धरण्याम् the dust on the earth, व्यवर्धतेव appeared growing.

42_3.shloka: न पश्यति रजोऽप्यस्य यदा रामस्य भूमिपः।तदाऽऽर्तश्च विषण्णश्च पपात धरणीतले।।2.42.3।।
42_3.translation: When the king could no longer see even the dust, he fell on the ground, despondent and grief stricken.
42_3.word_by_word: भूमिपः the king, यदा when, अस्य रामस्य that Rama's, रजोऽपि even the dust, न पश्यति couldnot see, तदा then, आर्तः च stricken with grief, विषण्णः च with despondency, धरणीतले on the earth, पपात fell down.

42_4.shloka: तस्य दक्षिणमन्वागात्कौसल्या बाहुमङ्गना।वामं चास्यान्वगात्पार्श्वं कैकेयी भरतप्रिया।।2.42.4।।
42_4.translation: Kausalya reached for the right hand of Dasaratha (to raise him up) and Kaikeyi the beloved (mother) of Bharata reached for his left.
42_4.word_by_word: अङ्गना wife, कौशल्या Kausalya, तस्य his, दक्षिणं बाहुम् right hand, अन्वगात् reached,  ,भरतप्रिया beloved (mother) of Bharata, कैकेयी च Kaikeyi, वामम् left, पार्श्वम् side, अन्वगात् reached.

42_5.shloka: तां नयेन च सम्पन्नो धर्मेण विनयेन च।उवाच राजा कैकेयीं समीक्ष्य व्यथितेन्द्रियः।।2.42.5।।
42_5.translation: The king, endowed with rectitude, virtue and also humility, stared at  and said to Kaikeyi with pain.
42_5.word_by_word: नयेन with rectitude, धर्मेण with virtue, विनयेन च also with humility, सम्पन्नः endowed with, राजा king, तां कैकेयीम् to that Kaikeyi, समीक्ष्य having seen, व्यथितेन्द्रियः one with painful senses reeling, उवाच said.

42_6.shloka: कैकेयि मा ममाङ्गानि स्प्राक्षीस्त्वं दुष्टचारिणी।न हि त्वां द्रष्टुमिच्छामि न भार्या न च बान्धवी।।2.42.6।।
42_6.translation: O Kaikeyi you are a woman of evil conduct. Do not touch my body. I do not wish to see you. You are not my wife or my relation.
42_6.word_by_word: कैकेयि O Kaikeyi, दुष्टचारिणी a woman of evil conduct, त्वम् you, मम my, अङ्गानि limbs, मा स्प्राक्षीः do not touch, त्वाम् you, द्रष्टुम् to look at, न हि इच्छामि do not wish, भार्या wife, न not, बान्धवी relation, न not.

42_7.shloka: ये च त्वामनुजीवन्ति नाहं तेषां न ते मम।केवलार्थपरां हि त्वां त्यक्तधर्मां त्यजाम्यहम्।।2.42.7।।
42_7.translation: Your dependents have nothing to do with me nor I with them. I denounce you since you are a selfseeker without any sense off righteousness.
42_7.word_by_word: ये च who, त्वाम् you, अनुजीवन्ति depend upon you for subsistence, तेषाम् their, अहम् I, न not, ते they, मम to me, न not, केवलार्थपराम् seeking your selfish interests alone, त्यक्तधर्माम्  deserting righteousness, त्वाम् you, अहम् I, त्यजामि abandon.

42_8.shloka: अगृह्णां यच्च ते पाणिमग्निं पर्यणयं च यत्।अनुजानामि तत्सर्वमस्मिन् लोके परत्र च।।2.42.8।।
42_8.translation: I renounce the relationship established with you through marriage by taking your hand and circumambulating the fire, both in this world and in the next.
42_8.word_by_word: ते your, पाणिम् hand, अगृह्णां (इति) यत् the fact of holding, अग्निम् of (to) fire, पर्यणयं च (इति) यत् the fact of having circumambulated, तत्सर्वम् all that, अस्मिन् in this, लोके world, परत्र च  in the next orld also, अनुजानामि renouncing.

42_9.shloka: भरतश्चेत्प्रतीतः स्याद्राज्यं प्राप्येदमव्ययम्।यन्मे स दद्यात्पित्रर्थं मामां तद्दत्तमागमत्।।2.42.9।।
42_9.translation: If Bharata feels pleased to secure this imperishable kingdom, then may his obsequial offerings at my funeral not reach me
42_9.word_by_word: अव्ययम् imperishable, (इदं) राज्यम् this kingdom, प्राप्य having secured, भरतः Bharata, प्रतीतः स्यात् चेत् if he is pleased, सः he, पित्रर्थम् in the form of funeral offerings, मे to me, यत् which, दद्यात् gives, तद्दत्तम् given by him, माम्  me, मागमत् may it not reach.

42_10.shloka: अथ रेणुसमुध्वस्तं समुत्थाप्य नराधिपम्।न्यवर्तत तदा देवी कौशल्या शोककर्शिता।।2.42.10।।
42_10.translation: Then Kausalya, emaciated due to sorrow, lifted the king who was thoroughly coated with dust and returned to the palace.
42_10.word_by_word: अथ then, रेणुसमुध्वस्तम् coated with dust, तं नराधिपम् to that king, समुत्थाप्य having lifted,देवी queen, कौशल्या Kausalya, शोककर्शिता emaciated due to sorrow, तदा then, न्यवर्तत  returned to her palace.

42_11.shloka: हत्वेव ब्राह्मणं कामात् स्पृष्ट्वाग्निमिव पाणिना।अन्वतप्यत धर्मात्मा पुत्रं सञ्चिन्त्य तापसम् ।।2.42.11।।
42_11.translation: That virtuous Dasaratha, recalling (the sight of) his son with the robes of an ascetic, burned with remorse as if he had intentionally slain a brahmin or placed his hand in fire.
42_11.word_by_word: धर्मात्मा virtuous one, तापसम् wearing the robes of an ascetic, पुत्रम् son, सञ्चिन्त्य remembering, कामात् intentionally, ब्राह्मणम् to a brahmin, हत्वेव as if slew, पाणिना with hand, अग्निम् to fire, स्पृष्ट्वा इव as if touched, अन्वतप्यत plunged in grief.

42_12.shloka: निवृत्त्यैव निवृत्त्यैव सीदतो रथवर्त्मसु।राज्ञो नातिबभौ रूपं ग्रस्तस्यांशुमतो यथा।।2.42.12।।
42_12.translation: Turning back again and again at the trail of (Rama's) chariot, the grieving king appeared lustreless like the Sun in eclipse.
42_12.word_by_word: रथवर्त्मसु trail of the chariot, निवृत्त्यैव निवृत्त्यैव turning again and again, सीदतः grieving, राज्ञः  the king's, रूपम् countenance, ग्रस्तस्य as if swallowed by Rahu, अंशुमत: यथा like Sun,  नातिबभौ did not shine.

42_13.shloka: विललाप च दुःखार्तः प्रियं पुत्रमनुस्मरन्।नगरान्तमनुप्राप्तं बुध्वा पुत्रमथाब्रवीत्।।2.42.13।।
42_13.translation: The griefstricken king began to lament thinking of his beloved son, and (suddenly) realizing that his son had crossed the limits of the city, said:
42_13.word_by_word: प्रियम् beloved, पुत्रम् son, अनुस्मरन् reflecting, दुःखार्तः tortured with sorrow, विललाप च  lamented, अथ then, पुत्रम् son, नगरान्तम् end of the city, अनुप्राप्तम् havng reached, बुध्वाhaving realised, अब्रवीत् said.

42_14.shloka: वाहननां च मुख्यानां वहतां तं ममात्मजम्।पदानि पथि दृश्यन्ते स महात्मा न दृश्यते।।2.42.14।।
42_14.translation: I can see the marks of the hooves of the splendid horses carrying my son on the highway but not that magnanimous Rama.
42_14.word_by_word: मम my, आत्मजम् son, तम् that Rama, वहताम् carrying, मुख्यानाम् preeminent, वाहनानाम्  horses', पदानि hoofprints, पथि in the path, दृश्यन्ते are seen, महात्मा magnanimous, सः Rama, न दृश्यत is not to be seen.

42_15.shloka: यः सुखेषूपधानेषु शेते चन्दनरूषितः।वीज्यमानो महार्हाभिः स्त्रीभिर्मम सुतोत्तमः।।2.42.15।।स नूनं क्वचिदेवाद्य वृक्षमूलमुपाश्रितः।काष्ठं वा यदि वाश्मानमुपधाय शयिष्यते।।2.42.16।।
42_15.translation: Rama, the best of all my sons who, smeared with sandalpaste and fanned by graceful women used to sleep (with his head) on comfortable cushions will surely, from now on, lie down somewhere at the foot of a tree, (his head) pillowed upon a piece of wood or stone.
42_15.word_by_word: यः मम सुतोत्तमः best among my  sons, चन्दनरूषितः daubed with sandal cream, महार्हाभिः graceful, स्त्रीभिः by women, वीज्यमानः being fanned, सुखेषु luxurious, उपधानेषु on cushions, शेते was sleeping, सः such Rama, अद्य today, नूनम् surely, क्वचिदेव some where, वृक्षमूलम् at the foot of a tree, उपाश्रितः taking refuge, काष्ठं a log, यदि वा or, आश्मानम् a stone, उपधाय using as pillow, शयिष्यते he will sleep.

42_16.shloka: उत्थास्यति च मेदिन्याः कृपणः पांसुकुण्ठितः।विनिश्श्वसन् प्रस्रवणात्करेणूनामिवर्षभः।।2.42.17।।
42_16.translation: That unfortunate Rama, having been covered with dust, will get up from the ground sighing like a bull elephant rising from mount Prasravana.
42_16.word_by_word: करेणूनाम् of female elephants, ऋषभः lord, bull elephant, प्रस्रवणात् इव like from Prasravana mountain, विनिश्वसन् heaving sighs, पांसुकुण्ठितः crusted with dust, कृपणः unfortunate     Rama, मेदिन्याः from the ground, उत्थास्यति च will rise up.

42_17.shloka: द्रक्ष्यन्ति नूनं पुरुषा दीर्घबाहुं वनेचराः।राममुत्थाय गच्छन्तं लोकनाथमनाथवत्।।2.42.18।।
42_17.translation: Surely the forestrovers will be gazing upon the longarmed Rama, protector of the world, as he rises (from the ground) and wanders in the jungle unprotected.
42_17.word_by_word: दीर्घबाहुम् longarmed, लोकनाथं lord of the world, अनाथवत् like without a protector, उत्थाय  rising (from the ground), गच्छन्तम् walking, रामम् Rama, नूनम् surely, वनेचराः forestdwellers, पुरुषाः men, द्रक्ष्यन्ति they will see.

42_18.shloka: सा नूनं जनकस्येष्टा सुता सुखसदोचिता।कण्टकाक्रमणाक्लान्ता वनमद्य गमिष्यति।।2.42.19।।
42_18.translation: Sita, beloved daughter of Janaka, who is accustomed to comforts, will now wander in the forest troubled by piercing thorns.
42_18.word_by_word: सुखसदोचिता accustomed to comforts, जनकस्य Janaka's, इष्टा beloved, सुता daughter, सा Janaki, कण्टकाक्रमणक्लान्ता troubled due to piercing of thorns, अद्य now, वनम् to the forest, गमिष्यति will go.

42_19.shloka: अनभिज्ञा वनानां सा नूनं भयमुपैष्यति।श्वापदानर्दितं श्रुत्वा गम्भीरं रोमहर्षणम्।।2.42.20।।
42_19.translation: Sita who knows not the forest will now live in terror, listening to the hairraising, horrible roars of wild animals.
42_19.word_by_word: वनानाम् of the forests, अनभिज्ञा un acquainted, सा Sita, नूनम् surely, गम्भीरम् deep and fearful, रोमहर्षणम् causing horripilation, श्वापदानर्दितम् roaring of wild animals, श्रुत्वा having heard, भयम् fear, उपैष्यति will obtain.

42_20.shloka: सकामा भव कैकेयि विधवा राज्यमावस।न हि तं पुरुषव्याघ्रं विना जीवितुमुत्सहे।।2.42.21।।
42_20.translation: O Kaikeyi, your desire is fulfilled.  Rule the kingdom as a widow. Without Rama, the best of men, I don't desire to live.
42_20.word_by_word: कैकेयि Kaikeyi, सकामा भव desire be fulfilled, विधवा as widow, राज्यम् kingdom, आवस inhabit, पुरुषव्याघ्रम् tiger among men, तं विना without him, जीवितुम् to live, न उत्सहे हि do not desire.

42_21.shloka: इत्येवं विलपन् राजा जनौघेनाभिसंवृतः।अपस्नात इवारिष्टं प्रविवेश पुरोत्तमम्।।2.42.22।।
42_21.translation: Thus the king, who looked like one after the inauspicious (funeral) bath, surroundedby streams of people entered the most beautiful city (Ayodhya) which portended misfortune.
42_21.word_by_word: इत्येवम् in this manner, विलपन् lamenting, राजा king, जनौघेन by the multitude of people, अभिसंवृतः surrounded, अपस्नातः one who has taken inauspicious (funeral) bath, अरिष्टं इव like an ominous, पुरोत्तमम् best of cities (Ayodhya), प्रविवेश entered.

42_22.shloka: शून्यचत्वरवेश्मान्तां संवृतापणदेवताम्।क्लान्तदुर्बलदुःखार्तां नात्याकीर्णमहापथाम्।।2.42.23।।तामवेक्ष्य पुरीं सर्वां राममेवानुचिन्तयन्।विलपन् प्राविशद्राजा गृहं सूर्य इवाम्बुदम्।।2.42.24।।
42_22.translation: There the mansions and squares on the highways were all deserted. The temples and marketplaces were closed. The people were weak, fatigued and tormented with grief. The highways were not much crowded. Having seen such a sight of the city on all sides, lamenting and brooding over Rama, Dasaratha entered his palace like the Sun plunging into a cloud.
42_22.word_by_word: शून्यचत्वरवेश्मान्ताम् where the courtyards or the mansions were deserted, संवृतापणदेवताम् where temples and marketplaces were closed, क्लान्तदुर्बलदुःखार्ताम् weak and exhausted with with grief, नात्याकीर्णमहापथाम् the highways no longer crowded, ताम् that, सर्वाम् entire, पुरीम् to city of Ayodhya, आवेक्ष्य having seen, राजा king, राममेव about Rama only, अनुचिन्तयन् thinking, विलपन् lamenting, सूर्यः sun, अम्बुदम् इव like clouds, प्राविशत् entered.

42_23.shloka: महाह्रदमिवाक्षोभ्यं सुपर्णेन हृतोरगम्।रामेण रहितं वेश्म वैदेह्या लक्ष्मणेन च।।2.42.25।।
42_23.translation: The palace without Rama, Lakshmana and Sita, stood like a vast, unperturbed lake with serpents snatched away by Suparna (Garuda).
42_23.word_by_word: रामेण with Rama, वैदेह्या with Sita, लक्ष्मणेन च also with Lakshmana, रहितम् absent, वेश्म palace, सुपर्णेन by Suparna, हृतोरगम् a serpent snatched away, अक्षोभ्यम् an unperturbed, महाह्रदम् इव like a great tank

42_24.shloka: अथ गद्गदशब्दस्तु विलपन्मनुजाधिपः।उवाच मृदुमन्दार्थं वचनं दीनमस्वरम्।।2.42.26।।
42_24.translation: Thereupon Dasaratha lamenting with his throat choked addressed (his attendants) in a low, feeble, melancholic, gentle voice:
42_24.word_by_word: अथ thereupon, मनुजा (वसुधा) धिपः lord of men, गद्गदशब्दः with choked throat, विलपन्  lamenting, मृदु gently, मन्दार्थम् in low voice, अस्वरम् feeble, दीनं वचनम् in melancholic tones, उवाच said.

42_25.shloka: कौशल्यायां गृहं शीघ्रं राममातुर्नयन्तु माम्।न ह्यन्यत्र ममाश्वासो हृदयस्य भविष्यति।।2.42.27।।
42_25.translation: Take me quickly to the apartment of Rama's mother, Kausalya. There is no other place where my heart can find solace.
42_25.word_by_word: राममातुः Rama's mother, कौशल्यायाः Kausalya's, गृहम् apartment, माम् me, शीघ्रम् quickly, नयन्तु be taken, मम हृदयस्य for my heart, अन्यत्र in any other place, आश्वासः solace, न भविष्यति हि not possible.

42_26.shloka: इति ब्रुवन्तं राजानमनयन् द्वारदर्शिनः।कौशल्याया गृहं तत्र न्यवेश्यत विनीतवत्।।2.42.28।।
42_26.translation: Having heard the king, the doorkeepers took  him to the apartment of Kausalya and  there respectfully made him rest.
42_26.word_by_word: इति in this way,  ब्रुवन्तम् while saying, राजानम् king Dasaratha, द्वारदर्शिनः  doorkeepers, कौशल्यायाः Kausalya's, गृहम् apartment, अनयन् brought him, तत्र there, विनीतवत् respectfully, न्यवेश्यत he was made to rest.

42_27.shloka: ततस्तस्य प्रविष्टस्य कौशल्याया निवेशनम्।अधिरुह्यापि शयनं बभूव लुलितं मनः।।2.42.29।।
42_27.translation: His mind tossed restlessly although he entered Kausalya's palace and climbed into the couch.
42_27.word_by_word: ततः then, कौशल्यायाः Kausalya's, निवेशनम् residence, प्रविष्टस्य having entered, तस्य his, मनः mind, शयनम् couch, अधिरुह्यापि though having climbed, लुलितम् बभूव was tossed about.

42_28.shloka: पुत्रद्वयविहीनं च स्नुषयापि विवर्जितम्।अपश्यद्भवनं राजा नष्टचन्द्रमिवाम्बरम्।।2.42.30।।
42_28.translation: To the king, the palace deserted by his two sons and his daughterinlaw, seemed like the sky without the Moon.
42_28.word_by_word: राजा king, पुत्रद्वयविहीनम् without his two sons, स्नुषयापि also by daughterinlaw, विवर्जितम् deserted, भवनम् palace, नष्टचन्द्रम् devoid of the Moon, अम्बरम् इव like the sky, अपश्यत् he saw.

42_29.shloka: तच्च दृष्ट्वा महाराजो भुजमुद्यम्य वीर्यवान्।उच्चैस्स्वरेण चुक्रोश हा राघव जहासि माम्।।2.42.31।।
42_29.translation: The valiant maharaja looked around that palace, lifted up his arms and shouted in a loud voice, Oh scion of the Raghus (Rama) you have forsaken me.
42_29.word_by_word: वीर्यवान् valiant, महाराजः the great king, तत् that palace, दृष्ट्वा having seen, भुजम् his hands, उद्यम्य  having lifted up, हा राघव Oh Rama, माम् me, जहासि are forsaking, उच्चौः स्वरेण in loud voice, चुक्रोश screamed.

42_30.shloka: सुखिता बत तं कालं जीविष्यन्ति नरोत्तमाः।परिष्वजन्तो ये रामं द्रक्ष्यन्ति पुनरागतम्।।2.42.32।।
42_30.translation: Oh how fortunate are those best of men who will live until that time to see Rama return and embrace him.
42_30.word_by_word: ये नरोत्तमाः those fortunate people, तं कालम् till that tme, जीविष्यन्ति will live, पुनः again, आगतम् return, रामम् Rama, परिष्वजन्तः while embracing, सुखिताः happily, द्रक्ष्यन्ति will see, बतwhat a pity?

42_31.shloka: अथ रात्र्यां प्रपन्नायां कालरात्र्यामिवात्मनः।अर्धरात्रे दशरथः कौशल्यामिदमब्रवीत्।।2.42.33।।
42_31.translation: In the middle of the night which, for him, felt like the night of death Dasaratha said to Kausalya thus:
42_31.word_by_word: अथ then, दशरथः Dasaratha, आत्मनः for himself, कालरात्र्यामिव like the night of death, रात्र्याम् night, प्रपन्नायाम् had set in, अर्धरात्रे in the middle of the night, कौशल्याम् addressing Kausalya, इदम् these words, अब्रवीत् spoke.

42_32.shloka: रामं मेऽनुगता दृष्टिरद्यापि न निवर्तते।न त्वा पश्यामि कौसल्ये साधु मां पाणिना स्पृश।।2.42.34।।
42_32.translation: O Kausalya, my sight that had followed Rama has not yet returned. I cannot see you clearly. Please touch me with your hand.
42_32.word_by_word: कौशल्ये O Kausalya, रामम् Rama, अनुगता having followed, मे दृष्टिः my sight, अद्यापि even now, न निवर्तते has not returned, त्वा you, साधु clearly, न पश्यामि unable to see, माम् me, पाणिना with your hand, स्पृश touch.

42_33.shloka: तं राममेवानुविचिन्तयन्तंसमीक्ष्य देवी शयने नरेन्द्रम्।उपोपविश्याधिकमार्तरूपाविनिश्वसन्ती विललाप कृच्छ्रम्।।2.42.35।।
42_33.translation: Having seen the king in bed brooding over Rama, the queen, (Kausalya), sitting by his side, sighed and lamented, deeply anguished.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे द्विचत्वारिंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the fortysecond sarga of Ayodhyakanda of  the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
42_33.word_by_word: देवी Kausalya, शयने in bed, रामम् एव Rama alone, अनुविचिन्तयन्तम् one who was continuously brooding, तं नरेन्द्रम् that king, समीक्ष्य having seen, उपोपविश्य sitting by his side, अधिकम् extremely, आर्तरूपा distressed, विनिश्वसन्ती sighing deeply, कृच्छ्रम् being in painful situation, विललाप lamented.

43_1.shloka: [Lamentations of Kausalya.]ततः समीक्ष्य शयने सन्नं शोकेन पार्थिवम्।कौशल्या पुत्रशोकार्ता तमुवाच महीपतिम्।।2.43.1।।
43_1.translation: Struck by the grief of her son's departure, Kausalya looked at the king who lay on the couch completely exhausted and said to him.
43_1.word_by_word: ततः then, पुत्रशोकार्ता struck by grief on account of her son's departure, कौशल्या  Kausalya, शयने on the couch, शोकेन due to grief, सन्नम् exhausted, पार्थिवम् king, समीक्ष्य having gazed, तं महीपतिम् to that lord of the world, Dasaratha, उवाच said.

43_2.shloka: राघवे नरशार्दूले विषमुप्त्वाहिजिह्मगा।विचरिष्यति कैकेयी निर्मुक्तेव हि पन्नगी।।2.43.2।।
43_2.translation: Moving crookedly like a snake, Kaikeyi has released her venom on Rama, the best among men. Now she will move about freely like a sheserpent that has cast off its slough.
43_2.word_by_word: अहिजह्मगा moving obliquely like a serpent, कैकेयी Kaikeyi, नरशार्दूले tiger (best) among men, राघवे in Rama, विषम् venom, उप्त्वा having sown out, निर्मुक्ता casting off the slough, पन्नगी इव like a sheserpent, विचरिष्यति will wander about.

43_3.shloka: विवास्य रामं सुभगा लब्धकामा समाहिता।त्रासयिष्यति मां भूयो दुष्टाहिरिव वेश्मनि।।2.43.3।।
43_3.translation: Having banished Rama, she is now happy with her desires fulfilled. And like a vicious serpent living in the house she will again frighten me.
43_3.word_by_word: सुभगा happly, (Kaikeyi), रामम् Rama, विवास्य having banished, लब्दकामा having satisfied her desires, भूयः again, वेश्मनि in the house, दुष्टाहिरिव like a vicious serpent, माम् me, समाहिता accomplished, त्रासयिष्यति will torture me.

43_4.shloka: अथ स्म नगरे रामश्चरन् भैक्षं गृहे वसेत्।कामकारो वरं दातुमपि दासं ममात्मजम्।।2.43.4।।
43_4.translation: It would have been better had I offered her my son as a slave. He would have lived on in the house by doing his duties and begging his food in the city.
43_4.word_by_word: मम my, आत्मजम् son, दासम् as slave, दातुम् अपि even to give, वरम् is better, अथ  thereafter, रामः Rama, कामकारः discharging the duties, नगरे in the city (Ayodhya), भैक्षम् food obtained by begging, चरन् moving about, गृहे in the house, वसेत् would have lived.

43_5.shloka: पातयित्वा तु कैकेय्या रामं स्थानाद्यथेष्टतः।प्रदिष्टो रक्षसां भागः पर्वणीवाहिताग्निना।।2.43.5।।
43_5.translation: You have thrown away Rama from his place as per the whim of Kaikeyi, like the share of offering meant for gods given away to rakshasas by the sacrificers on the new Moon days.
43_5.word_by_word: कैकेय्या of Kaikeyi, यथेष्टतः according to her whim, रामम् to Rama, स्थानात् from his place, पातयित्वा having thrown down, अहिताग्निना by the sacrificers, पर्वणि on the new moon days, रक्षसाम् to rakshasas, भागः इव like the share, प्रदिष्टः is given.

43_6.shloka: गजराजगतिर्वीरो महाबाहुर्धनुर्धरः।वनमाविशते नूनं सभार्य स्सह लक्ष्मणः।।2.43.6।।
43_6.translation: My mightyarmed son, a great archer and a hero, Rama whose gait is like that of the king of elephants, must be entering the forest along with his consort Sita and Lakshmana.
43_6.word_by_word: गजराजगतिः having the gait of the king of the elephants, वीरः hero, महाबाहुः mightyarmed,  धनुर्धरः archer Rama, सभार्यः with wife, सहलक्ष्मणः with Lakshmana, नूनम् surely, वनम् forest, आविशते is entering.

43_7.shloka: वने त्वदृष्टदुःखानां केकय्यानुमते त्वया।त्यक्तानां वनवासाय कान्ववस्था भविष्यति।।2.43.7।।
43_7.translation: You have banished them as per the desire of Kaikeyi. What will be their plight in the forest, for they have never experienced any hardship earlier
43_7.word_by_word: अदृष्टदुःखानाम् who have never seen suffering, कैकेय्याः Kaikeyi's, अनुमते her desire, त्वया by you, वनवासाय to dwell in the forest, त्यक्तानाम् have been abandoned, वने in the  forest, का नु what, अवस्था भविष्यति will be their state.

43_8.shloka: ते रत्नहीनास्तरुणाः फलकाले विवासिताः।कथं वत्स्यन्ति कृपणाः फलमूलैः कृताशनाः।।2.43.8।।
43_8.translation: Deprived of all costly things they have been banished at the tender age of youth, a time for enjoying their lives. How will they lead a miserable life subsisting on fruits and roots?
43_8.word_by_word: रत्नहीनाः deprived of best of things, फलकाले at the time of fruition (enjoyment), विवासिताः having been exiled, तरुणाः young people, ते they, कृपणाः living in misery, फलमूलैः fruits and roots, कृताशनाः for food, कथम् how, वत्स्यन्ति will they live?

43_9.shloka: अपीदानीं स कालस्स्यान्मम शोकक्षय श्शिवः।सभार्यं यत्सह भ्रात्रा पश्येयमिह राघवम्।।2.43.9।।
43_9.translation: Will there ever be that auspicious moment to end my sorrow? When I can see  Rama here along with his wife and brother?
43_9.word_by_word: यत् when, सभार्यम् with wife, राघवम् Rama, सह भ्रात्रा with Lakshmana, इह here, पश्येयम् I shall see, शोकक्षयः annhilation of sorrow, शिवः auspcious, सः कालः that time, इदानीम्  now, मम to me, अपि स्यात् will it come?

43_10.shloka: श्रृत्वैवोपस्थितौ वीरौ कदायोध्या भविष्यति।यशस्विनी हृष्टजना सूच्छ्रितध्वजमालिनी।।2.43.10।।
43_10.translation: When will the city of Ayodhya attain that glory when having heard that both the brave brothers have come back the people will rejoice and fill it with uplifted banners?
43_10.word_by_word: वीरौ the two heroes, उपस्थितौ having returned, श्रुत्वैव hearing, यशस्विनी famous, अयोध्या Ayodhya, हृष्टजना with cheerful people, सूच्छ्रितध्वजमालिनी uplifted flags, कदा when?, भविष्यति will it be?

43_11.shloka: कदा प्रेक्ष्य नरव्याघ्रावरण्यात्पुनरागतौ।नन्दिष्यति पुरी हृष्टा समुद्र इव पर्वणि।।2.43.11।।
43_11.translation: When will, like the swelling sea on a full Moon day, the city hail the return of Rama and Lakshmana, the best among men?
43_11.word_by_word: अरण्यात् from the forest, पुनः again, आगतौ having come back, नरव्याघ्रौ tigers (best) among men, Rama and Lakshmana, प्रेक्ष्य having seen, पुरी the city of Ayodhya, पर्वणि on a fullmoon day, समुद्र इव like the sea, हृष्टा overflow (overjoyed), कदा when, नन्दिष्यति will it rejoice?

43_12.shloka: कदाऽयोध्यां महाबाहुः पुरीं वीरः प्रवेक्ष्यति।पुरस्कृत्य रथे सीतां वृषभो गोवधूमिव।।2.43.12।।
43_12.translation: When will the mightyarmed hero (Rama) enter the city of Ayodhya with Sita in front in the chariot, like a bull following the cow?
43_12.word_by_word: महाबाहुः mightyarmed, वीरः hero, वृषभः bull, गोवधूमिव like cow, सीताम् Sita, रथे on the chariot, पुरस्कृत्य placing in front, अयोध्यां पुरीम् to the city of Ayodhya, कदा when, प्रवेक्ष्यति will enter?

43_13.translation: When will the people in their thousands shower the parched grain on the highway when my sons (Rama and Lakshmana), subduers of enemies, enter the city?
43_13.word_by_word: प्रविशन्तौ when they enter, अरिन्दमौ subduers of enemies, मम my, आत्मजौ sons, राजमार्गे on the highway, प्राणिसहस्राणि thousands of people, लाजैः with parched grain, कदा when, अवकिरिष्यन्ति shower.

43_14.shloka: प्रविशन्तौ कदाऽयोध्यां द्रक्ष्यामि शुभकुण्डलौ।उदग्रायुधनिस्त्रिंशौ सश्रृङ्गाविव पर्वतौ।।2.43.14।।
43_14.translation: When shall I see both of them wearing auspicious earrings and holding poweful weapons (bows) and swords high, like two mountain peaks?
43_14.word_by_word: अयोध्याम् of Ayodhya, प्रविशन्तौ when they enter, शुभकुण्डलौ wearing auspicious earrings, उदग्रायुधनिस्त्रिंशौ with powerful weapons and swords raised high, सश्रृङ्गौ with peaks, पर्वताविव like mountains, कदा when, द्रक्ष्यामि shall I see?

43_15.shloka: कदासुमनसः कन्याद्विजातीनां फलानि च।प्रदिशन्तः पुरीं हृष्टाः करिष्यन्ति प्रदक्षिणम्।।2.43.15।।
43_15.translation: When will I see them delightfully moving round the city with young brahmin girls offering them flowers and fruits.
43_15.word_by_word: हृष्टाः delighted, कन्याद्विजातीनाम् to young girls and to brahmins, सुमनसः flowers, फलानि च fruits also, प्रदिशन्तः while offering, कदा when, पुरीम् the city, प्रदक्षिणम् circling, करिष्यन्ति will do?

43_16.shloka: कदा परिणतो बुद्ध्या वयसा चामरप्रभः।अभ्युपैष्यति धर्मज्ञस्त्रिवर्ष इव मां ललन्।।2.43.16।।
43_16.translation: When will Rama, the knower of righteousness, possessing the lustre of gods, and fully mature in age and wisdom come back to me playfully like a threeyearold boy?
43_16.word_by_word: अमरप्रभः possessing the lustre of gods, धर्मज्ञः knower of righteousness (Rama), बुद्ध्या in wisdom, वयसा च in age, परिणतः fully mature, त्रिवर्षः इव like a three year old boy, ललन् playfully, माम् me, कदा when, अभ्युपैष्यति will he reach?

43_17.shloka: निस्संशयं मया मन्ये पुरा वीर कदर्यया।पातुकामेषु वत्सेषु मातृ़णां शातितास्स्तनाः।।2.43.17।।
43_17.translation: O valiant one, in my previous birth I must have undoubtedly hacked off the udders of cows when the calves were thirsting for milk from their mothers.
43_17.word_by_word: वीर O valiant one, कदर्यया out of avarice, मया by myself, निस्संशयम् undoubtedly, पुरा formerly, वत्सेषु calves, पातुकामेषु thirsting for milk, मातृ़णाम् of mothers, स्तनाः udders, शातिताः hacked by me.

43_18.shloka: साहं गौरिव सिंहेन विवत्सा वत्सला कृता।कैकेय्या पुरुषव्याघ्र बालवत्सेव गौर्बलात्।।2.43.18।।
43_18.translation: O best of men I have been forcibly separated from my affectionate son by Kaikeyi just like a cow from its calf by a lion.
43_18.word_by_word: पुरुषव्य्राघ्र O tiger among men, बालवत्सा young calf, गौरिव like cow, वत्सला having affectionin the calf, सा अहम् I, कैकेय्या by Kaikeyi, सिंहेन by lion, गौरिव like cow, बलात् forcibly, विवत्सा separated from the calf, कृता is rendered.

43_19.shloka: न हि तावद्गुणैर्जुष्टं सर्वशास्त्रविशारदम्।एकपुत्रा विना पुत्रमहं जीवितुमुत्सहे।।2.43.19।।
43_19.translation: I cannot live without my only son who is adept in all scriptures and endowed with all virtues.
43_19.word_by_word: एकपुत्रा having only one son, अहम् I, तावद्गुणैः with such virtue, जुष्टम् endowed with, सर्वशास्त्रविशारदम् adept in all shastras, पुत्रं विना without my son, जीवितुम् to live, न उत्सहे हि I do not desire.

43_20.shloka: न हि मे जीविते किञ्चित्सामर्थ्यमिह कल्प्यते।अपश्यन्त्याः प्रियं पुत्रं महाबाहुं महाबलम्।।2.43.20।।
43_20.translation: Without seeing my beloved son, longarmed and mighty, I have but little strength to live in this world.
43_20.word_by_word: महाबाहुम् mightyarmed, महाबलम् immensely strong, प्रियं पुत्रम् beloved son, अपश्यन्त्या: without seeing him, मे for me, इह in this world, जीविते in this life,  किञ्चित् little, सामर्थ्यम् ability, न कल्प्यते हि is not provided.

43_21.shloka: अयं हि मां दीपयते समुत्थितःतनूजशोकप्रभवो हुताशनः।महीमिमां रश्मिभिरुद्धतप्रभःयथा निदाघे भगवान् दिवाकरः।।2.43.21।।
43_21.translation: I am consumed by this blazing fire of grief caused by separation from my son like the earth scorched in summer by the Sungod with his oppressive raysइत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे त्रिचत्वारिंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the fortythird sarga of Ayodhyakanda of  the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
43_21.word_by_word: तनूजशोकप्रभवः born out of the grief of separation from my son, अयम् this, हुताशनः fire, समुत्थितः having arisen, निदाघे in summer, उद्धतप्रभः immense heat, भगवान्  divine, दिवाकरः Sun, रश्मिभिः with his rays, इमाम् this, महीं यथा like earth, माम् me, दीपयते is burning.

44_1.shloka: [Sumitra consoles Kausalya.]विलपन्ती तथा तां तु कौसल्यां प्रमदोत्तमाम्।इदं धर्मे स्थिता धर्म्यं सुमित्रा वाक्यमब्रवीत्।।2.44.1।।
44_1.translation: While Kausalya, the best of women was thus lamenting, virtuous Sumitra spoke to her these righteous words:
44_1.word_by_word: धर्मे in virtues, स्थिता abiding, सुमित्रा Sumitra, तथा then, विलपन्तीम् lamenting, प्रमदोत्तमाम् best among women, तां कौशल्याम् to that Kausalya, धर्म्यम् conforming to righteousness, इदं वाक्यम् these words, अब्रवीत् said.

44_2.shloka: तवार्ये सद्गुणैर्युक्तः पुत्र स्स पुरुषोत्तमः।किं ते विलपितेनैवं कृपणं रुदितेन वा।।2.44.2।।
44_2.translation: My venerable lady, your son Rama is the greatest among men and is endowed with every virtue. Why do you lament in this way? Why do you weep bitterly?
44_2.word_by_word: आर्ये O venerable one, सद्गुणैः with every good quality, युक्तः endowed with, तव your, सः पुत्रः such a son, पुरुषोत्तमः the greatest among men, एवम् in this way, ते you, विलपितेन withlamentation, कृपणम् bitterly, रुदितेन वा or by weeping, किम् what is the use?

44_3.shloka: यस्तवार्ये गतः पुत्रस्त्यक्त्वा राज्यं महाबलः।साधु कुर्वन् महात्मानं पितरं सत्यवादिनम्।।2.44.3।।शिष्टैराचरिते सम्यक्छश्वत्प्रेत्यफलोदये।रामो धर्मे स्थित श्रेष्ठो न स शोच्यः कदाचन।।2.44.4।।
44_3.translation: In order to vindicate the words of his great and truthful father, O noble lady,your mighty son has renounced the kingdom and has gone (to the forest). He has stuck to the path so scrupulously followed by the wise, the everlasting results of which can be fully realised in the world to come. Such a peerless son is never to be grieved over.
44_3.word_by_word: आर्ये O noble lady, महाबलः mighty, यः Rama, तव पुत्रः your son, महात्मानम्   magnanimous, पितरम् father, साधु worthy of, सत्यवादिनम् as truthful one, कुर्वन् to do, राज्यम् kingdom, त्यक्त्वा renouncing, शिष्टैः by virtuous men, सम्यक् fully, शश्वत्  everlasting, आचरिते followed, प्रेत्य in the next world, फलोदये at the time of fruition, धर्मे in virtues, स्थितः stuck, श्रेष्ठः best, सः that, रामः Rama, कदाचन at any point, शोच्यः न  not to be grieved over.

44_4.shloka: वर्तते चोत्तमां वृत्तिं लक्ष्मणोऽस्मिन् सदानघः।दयावान् सर्वभूतेषु लाभस्तस्य महात्मनः।।2.44.5।।
44_4.translation: Blameless Lakshmana, compassionate to all beings, has acted most nobly in this matter for the benefit of his great soul.
44_4.word_by_word: अनघः blameless one, सर्वभूतेषु in all creatures, दयावान् compassionate, लक्ष्मणः Lakshmana, अस्मिन् in the matter (of Rama), सदा always, उत्तमाम् highest, वृत्तिम् conduct, वर्तते doing(showing), महात्मनः great soul, तस्य to him, लाभः is benefit.

44_5.shloka: अरण्यवासे यद्दुःखं जानती वै सुखोचिता।अनुगच्छति वैदेही धर्मात्मानं तवात्मजम्।।2.44.6।।
44_5.translation: The daughter of Videha (Sita) who was used to comforts has knowingly followed your virtuous son into the hardships of forest life.
44_5.word_by_word: सुखोचिता used to comforts, वैदेही Sita, अरण्यवासे living in the forest, यत् दुःखम् those hardships, जानती वै knowingly, धर्मात्मानम् virtuous, तव your, आत्मजम् son, अनुगच्छति is following.

44_6.shloka: कीर्तिभूतां पताकां यो लोके भ्रमयति प्रभुः।धर्मसत्यव्रतधनः किं न प्राप्तस्तवात्मजः।।2.44.7।।
44_6.translation: Your allcompetent son who considers righteousness and truth as wealth, is waving  the flag of fame in this world. What is that which your son did not gain ?
44_6.word_by_word: प्रभुः competent, यः who, कीर्तिभूताम् renowned, पताकाम् the banner, लोके in this world, भ्रमयति waving, धर्मसत्यव्रतधनः one who considers righteousness and truth as wealth, तव आत्मजः your son, किम् what, न प्राप्तः did not gain.

44_7.shloka: व्यक्तं रामस्य विज्ञाय शौचं माहात्म्यमुत्तमम्।न गात्रमंशुभि स्सूर्य स्सन्तापयितुमर्हति।।2.44.8।।
44_7.translation: Knowing Rama's sterling purity and greatness the Sun evidently dare not scorch his body with its rays.
44_7.word_by_word: रामस्य Rama's, शौचम् purity, उत्तमम् excellent, माहात्म्यम् greatness, विज्ञाय having known, सूर्यः sun, अंशुभिः with rays, गात्रम् body, सन्तापयितुम् to torment, न अर्हति will not be inclined,  व्यक्तम् this is evident.

44_8.shloka: शिवस्सर्वेषु कालेषु काननेभ्यो विनिस्सृतः।राघवं युक्तशीतोष्णस्सेविष्यति सुखोऽनिलः।।2.44.9।।
44_8.translation: A pleasant yet moderately hot and cold breeze blowing through the woodlands will serve Rama at all seasons.
44_8.word_by_word: शिवः gracious, काननेभ्यः from the woodlands, विनिस्सृतः blowing out, युक्तशीतोष्णः with moderate heat and cold, सुखः pleasant, अनिलः breeze, राघवम् of Rama, सर्वेषु कालेषु at all seasons, सेविष्यति will attend.

44_9.translation: While that sinless Rama sleeps at night, the Moon will comfort him by touching him with cool beams like a father embracing his son.
44_9.word_by_word: चन्द्रमा the Moon, रात्रौ at night, अनघं sinless man, शयानम् while asleep, शीतैः cool, रश्मिभिः with rays, संस्पृशन् while touching, पितेव like father, अभिपरिष्वजन् while embracing, आह्लादयिष्यति delight.

44_10.shloka: ददौ चास्त्राणि दिव्यानि यस्मै ब्रह्मा महौजसे।दानवेन्द्रं हतं दृष्ट्वा तिमिध्वजसुतं रणे।।2.44.11।।स शूरः पुरुषव्याघ्रः स्वबाहुबलमाश्रितः।असन्त्रस्तोऽप्यरणस्थो वेश्मनीव निवत्स्यति।।2.44.12।।
44_10.translation: To the mighty, heroic Rama, that best of men, Brahmalike Viswamitra has bequeathed many divine weapons, seeing him slay Timidhwaja's son (Subahu), lord of demons, in the battle. He will stay fearless in the forest, relying on the strength of his own arms as though he were living in the palace.
44_10.word_by_word: रणे in war, दानवेन्द्रम् lord of demons, तिमिध्वजसुतम् Timidhwaja's son, हतम् having been killed, दृष्ट्वा having seen, महौजसे having great lustre, यस्मै to that Rama, ब्रह्मा like second Bramha, (Viswamitra), दिव्यानि divine, अस्त्राणि weapons, ददौ gave, शूरः brave, पुरुषव्याघ्रः best of men, सः that Rama, अरण्यस्थोऽपि though staying in the forest, स्वबाहुबलम् with the strength of his arms, आश्रितः taking refuge, असन्त्रस्तः without fear, वेश्मनीव like in his own palace, निवत्स्यति will reside.

44_11.shloka: यस्येषुपथमासाद्य विनाशं यान्ति शत्रवः।कथं न पृथिवी तस्य शासने स्थातुमर्हति।।2.44.13।।
44_11.translation: When enemies who are targets of his arrows are destoyed, how can this earth, not stay under the command of Rama?
44_11.word_by_word: यस्य whose, इषुपथम् range of arrows, आसाद्य having received, शत्रवः enemies, विनाशम्  destruction, यान्ति will meet, तस्य such Rama's, शासने in the command, पृथिवी earth, कथम् how, स्थातुम् to subordinate, नार्हति is unfit.

44_12.shloka: या श्री श्शौर्यं च रामस्य या च कल्याणसत्वता।निवृत्तारण्यवास स्स क्षिप्रं राज्यमवाप्स्यति।।2.44.14।।
44_12.translation: On return from his sojourn in the forest, Rama, endowed with splendour, valour and a strength that brings wellbeing will quickly regain his kingdom.
44_12.word_by_word: रामस्य Rama's, या श्रीः that splendour, शौर्यं च valour, या कल्याणसत्वता that auspicious  strength, निवृत्तारण्यवासः having returned from forest life, सः that Rama, क्षिप्रम्  quickly, (स्वं) राज्यम् his kingdom, अवाप्स्यति will regain.

44_13.shloka: सूर्यस्यापि भवेत्सूर्यो ह्यग्नेरग्नि प्रभोः प्रभुः।श्रियः श्रीश्च भवेदग्र्या कीर्तिः कीर्त्याः क्षमाक्षमा।।2.44.15।।दैवतं दैवतानां च भूतानां भूतसत्तमः।तस्य के ह्यगुणा देवि वने वाप्यथवा पुरे।।2.44.16।।
44_13.translation: O Devi Rama is the Sun (light) of the Sun, fire (splendour) of the fire, master (command) of masters, prosperity of the prosperous, the fame of the famous, forbearance of the forbearing, god of the gods and supreme among all beings. Whether he dwells in the forest or in the city, he has no demerit whatsoever.
44_13.word_by_word: देवि O Devi (Kusalya), सूर्यस्यापि for the sun, सूर्यः भवेत् he will act as light of the Sun, अग्नेः for fire, अग्निः lustre of fire, प्रभोः for a ruler, प्रभुः as supreme ruler, श्रियश्च prosperity, श्रीः as prosperity, कीर्त्याः for fame, अग्र्या as supreme, कीर्तिः fame, क्षमा for tolerance, क्षमा as tolerance, दैवतानाम् for gods, दैवतम् as god, भूतानाम् for all beings, भूतसत्तमः as supreme being, भवेत् shall be, तस्य for such Rama, वने वापि even in forest, अथवा or, पुरे or in town, अगुणाः demerits, के हि where are they?.

44_14.shloka: पृथिव्या सह वैदेह्या श्रिया च पुरुषर्षभः।क्षिप्रं तिसृभिरेताभि स्सह रामोऽभिषेक्ष्यते।।2.44.17।।
44_14.translation: Rama, the best among men, will soon be coronated with these three namely the earth, the goddess of fortune and Sita.
44_14.word_by_word: पुरुषर्षभः eminent among men, रामः Rama, पृथिव्या सह with earth, वैदेह्य along with Sita, श्रिया च with the goddess of fortune, एताभिः with these, तिसृभिः सह with three, क्षिप्रम् quickly, अभिषेक्षयते will be consecrated.

44_15.shloka: दुःखजं विसृजन्त्यस्रं निष्क्रामन्तमुदीक्ष्य यम्।अयोध्यायां जनास्सर्वे शोकवेगसमाहताः।2.44.18।।कुशचीरधरं देवं गच्छन्तमपराजितम्।सीतेवानुगता लक्ष्मी स्तस्य किं नाम दुर्लभम्।।2.44.19।।
44_15.translation: When the people of Ayodhya saw the godlike Rama departing, clad in robes of kusha and bark, they were moved to tears of grief. What is impossible for him who is unconquerable and whom Sita, like the goddess of fortune, follows.
44_15.word_by_word: निष्क्रामन्तम् when he was leaving, यम् whom, उदीक्ष्य having seen, अयोध्यायाम् in Ayodhya, सर्वे all, जनाः inhabitants, शोकवेगसमाहताः whipped by the speed of sorrow, दुःखजम्  caused by sorrow, अस्रम् tears, विसृजन्ति are shedding, कुशचीरधरम् clad in bark and kusa robes, गच्छन्तम् departing, अपराजितम् the unconquerable, देवम् divine one, लक्ष्मीः goddess of fortune, सीतेव like Sita, अनुगता has followed, तस्य to him, किं नाम what, दुर्लभम् isdifficult?

44_16.shloka: धनुर्ग्रहवरो यस्य बाणखड्गास्त्रभृत्स्वयम्।लक्ष्मणो व्रजति ह्यग्रे तस्य किं नाम दुर्लभम्।।2.44.20।।
44_16.translation: What is impossible for Rama ahead of whom moves Lakshmana, the best of archers, weilding swords, arrows and other weapons?
44_16.word_by_word: धनुर्ग्रहवरः the most skilled archer, लक्ष्मणः Lakshmana, स्वयम् himself, बाणखड्गास्त्रभृत् bearing arrows, swords and other weapons, यस्य to whom, अग्रे in the forefront, व्रजति going, तस्य for that Rama, किं नाम what, दुर्लभम् is the difficulty?

44_17.shloka: निवृत्तवनवासं तं द्रष्टासि पुनरागतम्।जहिशोकं च मोहं च देवि सत्यं ब्रवीमि ते।।2.44.21।।
44_17.translation: I tell you the truth, Kausalya, that you will see Rama's return when the period of exile is complete. Hence give up your sorrow and delusion.
44_17.word_by_word: देवि O Kausalya, निवृत्तवनवासम् on completion of exile, पुनः again, आगतम् having returned, तम् that Rama, द्रष्टासि will see, शोकं च sorrow, मोहं च delusion, जहि you may give up, ते  to you, सत्यम् truth, ब्रवीमि am telling.

44_18.shloka: शिरसा चरणावेतौ वन्दमानमनिन्दितेपुनर्द्रक्ष्यसि कल्याणि पुत्रं चन्द्रमिवोदितम्।।2.44.22।।
44_18.translation: O irreproachable and auspicious one you will see your son, like the rising Moon, touching your feet with his head.
44_18.word_by_word: अनिन्दिते irreproachable one, कल्याणि O auspicious one, एतौ चरणौ at these feet, शिरसा with head, वन्दमानम् paying homage, पुत्रम् son, उदितम् rising, चन्द्रमिव Moonlike, पुनः again, द्रक्षयसि will see.

44_19.shloka: पुनः प्रविष्टं दृष्ट्वा तमभिषिक्तं महाश्रियम्।समुत्स्रक्ष्यसि नेत्राभ्यां क्षिप्रमानन्दजं पयः।।2.44.23।।
44_19.translation: Soon you will see him enthrouned shining in full glory on his return from exile whiletears of joy will flow from your eyes.
44_19.word_by_word: पुनः again, प्रविष्टम् having entered, अभिषिक्तम् enthroned, महाश्रियम् shining in glory, तम् him, दृष्ट्वा having seen, क्षिप्रम् soon, नेत्राभ्याम् from your eyes, अनन्दजम् arising out of joy, पयः water, समुत्स्रक्ष्यसि pour out.

44_20.shloka: मा शोको देवि दुःखं वा न रामे दृश्यतेऽशिवम्।क्षिप्रं द्रक्ष्यसि पुत्रं त्वं ससीतं सहलक्ष्मणम्।।2.44.24।।
44_20.translation: Desist from grief or tear for Rama, O Devi nothing inauspicious will happen to him you will soon see your son along with Sita and Lakshmana.
44_20.word_by_word: देवि O Devi (Kausalya) शोकः grief, दुःखं वा or distress, मा do not entertain, रामे in Rama, अशिवम् inauspiciousness, न दृश्यते is not to be seen, त्वम् you, ससीतम् with Sita, सहलक्ष्मणम् with Lakshmana, पुत्रम् son, क्षिप्रम् soon, द्रक्षयसि you will see.

44_21.shloka: त्वया शेषो जनश्चैव समाश्वास्यो यदाऽनघे।किमिदानीमिदं देवि करोषि हृदि विक्लबम्।।2.44.25।।
44_21.translation: O sinless lady, O queen when you are overcome by fear, how can you consoleothers?
44_21.word_by_word: अनघे sinless lady, देवि O Devi शेषः the remaining, जनः people, त्वया by you, यदा when, समाश्वास्यः एव are to be consoled, इदानीम् in this manner, हृदि in your heart, विक्लबम्  overcome with fear, करोषि doing, इदम् this, किम् what?

44_22.shloka: नार्हा त्वं शोचितुं देवि यस्यास्ते राघवस्सुतः।न हि रामात्परो लोके विद्यते सत्पथे स्थितः।।2.44.26।।
44_22.translation: O Kausalya,  with a son like Rama, you should not grieve. There is none in this world superior to Rama who stands steady in the path of virtue.
44_22.word_by_word: देवि O Kausalya, यस्याः whose, ते to you, राघवः Rama, सुतः as son, त्वम् you, शोचितुम् to          grieve, नार्हा are not fit, रामात् compared to Rama, परः superior, सत्पथे on the path of virtue, स्थितः abiding, लोके in this world, न विद्यते हि is not found.

44_23.shloka: अभिवादयमानं तं दृष्ट्वा ससुहृदं सुतम्।मुदाऽश्रृ मोक्ष्यसे क्षिप्रं मेघलेखेव वार्षिकी।।2.44.27।।
44_23.translation: Like a flake of cloud in monsoon, you are going to shed tears of joy soon seeing your son along with his friends bowing to you in reverence.
44_23.word_by_word: अभिवादयमानम् one while bowing to you in reverence, ससुहृदम् along with friends, तं सुतम् to your son, दृष्ट्वा seeing, क्षिप्रम् soon, वार्षिकी pertaining to rainyseason, मेघलेखेव like a streak of clouds, मुदा delightfully, अश्रु tears, मोक्ष्यसे you are going to shed.

44_24.shloka: पुत्रस्ते वरदः क्षिप्रमयोध्यां पुनरागतः।पाणिभ्यां मृदुपीनाभ्यां चरणौ पीडयिष्यति।।2.44.28।।
44_24.translation: Your son, bestower of boons, will soon return to Ayodhya and press your feet with his soft, tender hands.
44_24.word_by_word: वरदः one who confers boons, ते पुत्रः your son, क्षिप्रम् soon, अयोध्याम् to Ayodhya, पुनः again, आगतः having returned, मृदुपीनाभ्याम् tender and plump, पाणिभ्याम् hands, चरणौ your feet, पीडयिष्यति will press.

44_25.shloka: अभिवाद्य नमस्यन्तं शूरं ससुहृदं सुतम्।मुदाऽस्रैः प्रोक्ष्यसि पुनर्मेघराजिरिवाचलम्।।2.44.29।।
44_25.translation: While paying obeisance to you, you will drench your brave son, surrounded by friends, with tears of joy like a mass of clouds drenching the mountain.
44_25.word_by_word: अभिवाद्य greeting, नमस्यन्तम् offering salutations, शूरम् brave ससुहृदम् with friends, सुतम् to your son, मुदा with delight, अस्रैः with tears, मेघराजिः mass of clouds, अचलमिव like a mountain, पुनः again, प्रोक्ष्यसि will be drenched.

44_26.shloka: आश्वासयन्ती विविधैश्च वाक्यैर्वाक्योपचारे कुशलाऽनवद्या।रामस्य तां मातरमेवमुक्त्वादेवी सुमित्रा विरराम रामा।।2.44.30।।
44_26.translation: Irreproachable and skilful in the use of words, queen Sumitra of cheerful disposition fell silent after thus consoling Rama's mother in various ways.
44_26.word_by_word: वाक्योपचारे serving with words, कुशला skilled, अनवद्या irreproachable, रामा cheerful nature, देवी queen, सुमित्रा Sumitra, विविधैः various, वाक्यैः words, आश्वासयन्ती while consoling, रामस्य Rama's, तां मातरम् to his mother, एवम् in that way, उक्त्वा having said, विरराम fell silent.

44_27.shloka: निशम्य तल्लक्ष्मणमातृवाक्यंरामस्य मातुर्नरदेवपत्न्या:।सद्यश्शरीरे विननाश शोकःशरद्गतो मेघ इवाल्पतोयः।।2.44.31।।
44_27.translation: On hearing the words of Lakshmana's mother the grief in the heart of the queen (Kausalya), mother of Rama, instantly disappeared like the autumnal cloud that holds but little rain.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे चतुश्चत्वारिंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the fortyfourth sarga of Ayodhyakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
44_27.word_by_word: तत् that, लक्ष्मणमातृवाक्यम् words of Lakshmana's mother, निशम्य having heard, नरदेवपत्न्या: queen, रामस्य मातुः of Rama's mother, शोकः grief, शरद्गतः relating to autumn, अल्पतोयः with slight moisture, मेघ इव like cloud, सद्यः instantly, शरीरे in the body, विननाश destroyed.

45_1.shloka: [Rama reaches the banks of Tamasa river.]अनुरक्ता महात्मानं रामं सत्यपराक्रमम्।अनुजग्मुः प्रयान्तं तं वनवासाय मानवाः।।2.45.1।।
45_1.translation: When the highsouled Rama whose strength was his sense of truth set out for the forest, the faithful people followed him.
45_1.word_by_word: अनुरक्ताः devoted, मानवाः men, वनवासाय to dwell in the forest, प्रयान्तम् setting out, महात्मानम् great, सत्यपराक्रमम् to one whose truth is his power, तं रामम् that Rama, अनुजग्मुः followed him.

45_2.shloka: निवर्तितेऽपि च बलात्सुहृद्वर्गे च राजनि।नैव ते संन्यवर्तन्त रामस्यानुगता रथम्।।2.45.2।।
45_2.translation: The king and the hosts of friends were forcibly sent back but they did not return. They continued to follow the chariot of Rama.
45_2.word_by_word: सुहृद्वर्गे when hosts of friends, राजनि च and when the king, बलात् forcibly, निवर्तितेऽपि चthough sent back, रामस्य Rama's, रथम् chariot, अनुगताः followers, ते those people, नैव     संन्यवर्तन्त did not return.

45_3.shloka: अयोध्यानिलयानां हि पुरुषाणां महायशाः।बभूव गुणसम्पन्नः पूर्णचन्द्र इव प्रियः।।2.45.3।।
45_3.translation: The illustrious and virtuous Rama was as dear to the inhabitants of Ayodhya as thefull Moon.
45_3.word_by_word: महायशाः illustrious, गुणसम्पन्नः endowed with virtue of every kind, अयोध्यानिलयानाम् dwelling in Ayodhya, पुरुषाणाम् for men, पूर्णचन्द्र इव like the full Moon, प्रियः बभूव हि became dear.

45_4.shloka: स याच्यमानः काकुत्स्थः स्वाभिः प्रकृतिभिस्तदा।कुर्वाणः पितरं सत्यं वनमेवान्वपद्यत।।2.45.4।।
45_4.translation: Although entreated by his subjects (not to go) Rama proceeded to the forest  to make his father's vow come true.
45_4.word_by_word: सः that, काकुत्स्थ: descendant of the Kakutsthas (Rama), तदा then, स्वाभिः his own, प्रकृतिभिः by the subjects, याच्यमानः although pleaded, पितरम् father's, सत्यम् as truthful, कुर्वाणः doing, वनमेव to the forest, अन्वपद्यत proceeded.

45_5.shloka: अवेक्षमाणः सस्नेहं चक्षुषा प्रपिबन्निव।उवाच रामः स्नेहेन ताः प्रजाः स्वाः प्रजा इव।।2.45.5।।
45_5.translation: Looking at the people with love as if they were his own children and as thoughdrinking them with his glances, Rama appealed to them:
45_5.word_by_word: रामः Rama, चक्षुषा with eyes, प्रपिबन्निव as if drinking, ताः those, प्रजाः people, स्वाः his own, प्रजाः इव like children, सस्नेहम् (स्नेहेन) with affection, अवेक्षमाणः seeing, उवाच said.

45_6.shloka: या प्रीतिर्बहुमानश्च मय्ययोध्यानिवासिनाम्।मत्प्रियार्थं विशेषेण भरते सा निवेश्यताम्।।2.45.6।।
45_6.translation: O citizens of Ayodhya may the love and respect you have shown to please me be bestowed specially on Bharata
45_6.word_by_word: अयोध्यानिवासिनाम् of residents of Ayodhya, मयि in me, या प्रीतिः which love, बहुमानश्च also respect, सा that one, विशेषेण specially, मत्प्रियार्थं for endearing me, भरते in Bharata, निवेश्यताम् be placed on Bharata.

45_7.shloka: स हि कल्याणचारित्रः कैकेय्यानन्दवर्धनः।करिष्यति यथावद्वः प्रियाणि च हितानि च।।2.45.7।।
45_7.translation: Bharata, enhancer of the delight of Kaikeyi, possesses an auspicious character. He will do for you everything appropriate, agreeable and beneficial.
45_7.word_by_word: कल्याणचारित्रः one having auspicious character, कैकेय्यानन्दवर्धनः enhancer of  Kaikeyi's delight, सः that Bharata, यथावत् appropriate, वः to you, प्रियाणि agreeable, हितानि च beneficial acts also, करिष्यति हि will do.

45_8.shloka: ज्ञानवृद्धो वयोबालो मृदुर्वीर्यगुणान्वितः।अनुरूपः स वो भर्ता भविष्यति भयापहः।।2.45.8।।
45_8.translation: Though tender in age Bharata is mature in intellect. Gentle, valiant and virtuous, he will dispel all your fears and act as a true protector.
45_8.word_by_word: ज्ञानवृद्धः old in wisdom, वयोबालः young in age, मृदुः gentle, वीर्यगुणान्वितः endowed with valour and virtues, सः he, वः to you, अनुरूपः worthy one, भयापहः eliminating fears, भर्ता भविष्यति will be protector.

45_9.shloka: स हि राजगुणैर्युक्तो युवराजः समीक्षितः।अपि चापि मया शिष्टैः कार्यं वो भर्तृशासनम्।।2.45.9।।
45_9.translation: Endowed with kingly qualities, he is recognised as heirapparent. Therefore, as I did, all of  you should obey the order of the king.
45_9.word_by_word: राजगुणैः royal qualities, युक्तः endowed with, सः that, युवराजः as heirapparent, समीक्षितः is recognised, अपि च also, मया by me, शिष्टैः by others, वः to  you, भर्तृशासनम् king's order, कार्यम् should be obeyed.

45_10.shloka: न च सन्तप्येद्यथा चासौ वनवासं गते मयि।महाराजस्तथा कार्यो मम प्रियचिकीर्षया।।2.45.10।।
45_10.translation: If you desire to please me, act in such a way that the king does not grieve after I have gone to the forest.
45_10.word_by_word: मयि when I, वनवासम् to the forest, गते had left, असौ महाराजः this king, यथा as, न च सन्तप्येत्  does not grieve, तथा in that way, मम to me, प्रिय चिकीर्षया with a desire to please, कार्यः fit to be done.

45_11.shloka: यथा यथा दाशरथि र्धर्म एवास्थितोऽभवत्।तथा तथा प्रकृतयो रामं पतिमकामयन्।।2.45.11।।
45_11.translation: The more the son of Dasaratha (Rama) committed to righteousness, the more the subjects desired that he should be their king.
45_11.word_by_word: दाशरथिः Dasaratha's son, Rama, यथा यथा such as, धर्मे एव in righteousness only, आस्थितः अभवत् became committed, तथा तथा in the same way, प्रकृतयः subjects, रामम्  Rama, पतिम् as king, अकामयन् desired.

45_12.shloka: बाष्पेण पिहितं दीनं रामः सौमित्रिणा सह।चकर्षेव गुणैर्बद्ध्वा जनं पुरनिवासिनम्।।2.45.12।।
45_12.translation: Rama along with Lakshmana attracted the citydwellers who, choked with tears, were looking miserable. It appeared they were bound with his virtues.
45_12.word_by_word: सौमित्रिणा सह accompanied by the son of Sumitra (Lakshmana), रामः Rama, बाष्पेण with tears, पिहितम् concealed, दीनम् piteous, पुरनिवासिनम् citydwellers, जनम् people, गुणैः with his virtues, बद्ध्वा इव as if bound by, चकर्ष attracted.

45_13.shloka: ते द्विजास्त्रिविधं वृद्धा ज्ञानेन वयसौजसा।वयः प्रकम्पशिरसो दूरादूचुरिदं वचः।।2.45.13।।
45_13.translation: Those brahmins who were senior (to him) on three counts like age, wisdom and spirtuality spoke to him from a distance with their heads shaking with age:
45_13.word_by_word: ज्ञानेन in wisdom, वयसा in age, ओजसा in spiritual energy, त्रिविधम् in all the three ways, वृद्धाः aged, ते द्विजाः those brahmins, वयः प्रकम्पशिरसः shaking due to old age, दूरात् from a distance, इदम् these, वचः words, ऊचुः spoke.

45_14.shloka: वहन्तो जवना रामं भो भो जात्यास्तुरङ्गमाः।निवर्तध्वं न गन्तव्यं हिता भवत भर्तरि।।2.45.14।।
45_14.translation: O horses of noble breed, turn back Do not carry your master swiftyly any farther. Do good to him.
45_14.word_by_word: रामम् Rama, वहन्तः conveying, जवनाः swift, जात्याः of noble breed, भो भो तुरङ्गमाः O horses, निवर्तध्वम् turn back, न गन्तव्यम् do not proceed, भर्तरि in your master (Rama), हिताः  भवत be good.

45_15.shloka: कर्णवन्ति हि भूतानि विशेषेण तुरङ्गमाः।यूयं तस्मान्निवर्तध्वं याचनां प्रतिवेदिताः।।2.45.15।।
45_15.translation: All animals, especially horses have a keen sense of hearing. Therefore, having listened to our entreaty, turn back.
45_15.word_by_word: भूतानि animals, कर्णवन्ति हि have keen sense of hearing, तुरङ्गमाः horses, विशेषेण especially, तस्मात् therefore, याचनाम् entreaty, प्रतिवेदिताः having known, यूयम् you, निवर्तध्वम् turn back.

45_16.shloka: धर्मतः स विशुद्धात्मा वीरः शुभदृढव्रतः।उपवाह्यस्तु वो भर्ता नापवाह्यः पुराद्वनम्।।2.45.16।।
45_16.translation: Your master has a purity of heart. He is righteous, virtuous, brave and firm in resolve, carry him backward and not forward from the city into the forest.
45_16.word_by_word: धर्मतः righteous, विशुद्धात्मा a purified soul, वीरः brave, शुभदृढव्रतः auspicious and firm in resolve, सः वः भर्ता your master, उपवाह्यः should be carried back, पुरात् from the city, वनम्to the forest, न अपवाह्यः should not carry.

45_17.shloka: एवमार्तप्रलापांस्तान् वृद्धान् प्रलपतो द्विजान्।अवेक्ष्य सहसा रामो रथादवततार ह।।2.45.17।।
45_17.translation: Having seen the aged brahmins muttering pitiful lamentations in this manner, Rama immediately alighted from the chariot.
45_17.word_by_word: एवम् in this manner, आर्तप्रलापान् pitiful lamentations, प्रलपतः muttering, वृद्धान् aged, तान्द्विजान् those brahmins, अवेक्ष्य having seen, रामः Rama, सहसा immediately, रथात् from the chariot, अवततार ह alighted.

45_18.shloka: पद्भ्यामेव जगामाथ ससीत स्सहलक्ष्मणः।सन्निकृष्टपदन्यासो रामो वनपरायणः।।2.45.18।।
45_18.translation: Then Rama along with Sita and Lakshmana began walking on foot with slow steps towards the forest.
45_18.word_by_word: अथ then, स सीतः along with Sita, सहलक्ष्मणः and Lakshmana, रामः Rama, वनपरायणः(moving) towards the forest, सन्निकृष्टपदन्यासः with a slow pace, पद्भ्याम् एव on foot alone, जगाम went.

45_19.shloka: द्विजातींस्तु पदातींस्तान् रामश्चारित्रवत्सलः।न शशाक घृणाचक्षुः परिमोक्तुं रथेन सः।।2.45.19।।
45_19.translation: Rama a man of probity and compassion could not ride off in his chariot while those brahmins were trudging far behind.
45_19.word_by_word: चारित्रवत्सलः fond of probity, घृणाचक्षुः compassionate eyes, सः रामः that Rama, पदातीन् those walking on foot, तान् द्विजातीन् those brahmins, रथेन with the chariot, परिमोक्तुम् to leave them, न शशाक was not possible.

45_20.shloka: गच्छन्तमेव तं दृष्ट्वा रामं सम्भ्रान्तचेतसः।ऊचुः परमसन्तप्ता रामं वाक्यमिदं द्विजाः।।2.45.20।।
45_20.translation: Having seen Rama thus going towards the forest, those brahmins, highly agitated and distressed, said to him:
45_20.word_by_word: द्विजाः brahmins, गच्छन्तमेव thus going, तं रामम् that Rama, दृष्ट्वा having seen, सम्भ्रान्तचेतसः with agitated mind, परमसन्तप्ताः deeply distressed, इदं वाक्यम् these words, ऊचुः said.

45_21.translation: This entire order of brahmins with the sacrificial fires on their hsoulders is following you, their wellwisher.
45_21.word_by_word: सर्वम् all, एतत् these, ब्राह्मण्यम् order of brahmins, ब्रह्मण्यम् seeking good of the brahmins, त्वाम् you, अनुगच्छति is following, अमी these, अग्नयः अपि sacred fires also, द्विजस्कन्धाधिरूढाः mounting on the shoulders of brahmins, त्वाम् you, अनुयान्ति following.

45_22.shloka: वाजपेयसमुत्थानि छत्राण्येतानि पश्य नः।पृष्ठतोऽनुप्रयातानि मेघानिव जलात्यये।।2.45.22।।
45_22.translation: See these umbrellas acquired by us while performing Vajapeya sacrifice are following you like the clouds at the end of the rainy season.
45_22.word_by_word: वाजपेयसमुत्थानि acquired while performing Vajapeya sacrifice, नः पृष्ठतः behind us, अनुप्रयातानि are coming, एतानि these, छत्राणि umbrellas, जलात्यये at the end of the rainy season, मेघानिव like clouds, पश्य please see.

45_23.translation: You do not have a royal umbrella and you are scorched by the rays of the Sun. We will offer you shade with the umbrellas acquired during Vajapeya sacrifice.
45_23.word_by_word: अनवाप्तातपत्रस्य for one without an umbrella, रश्मिसन्तापितस्य of a man scorched with the rays of the Sun, ते to you, वाजपेयिकैः acquired during Vajapeya sacrifice, स्वैः by your own, छत्रैः with umbrellas, छायाम् shade, करिष्यामः will extend.

45_24.shloka: या हि नः सततं बुद्धिर्वेदमन्त्रानुसारिणी।त्वत्कृते सा कृता वत्स वनवासानुसारिणी।।2.45.24।।
45_24.translation: O dear child, our minds always pursue the study of vedic hymns. For your sake now they are made to follow the life in the forest.
45_24.word_by_word: वत्स dear child, न: our, या बुद्धि: mind, सततं always, वेदमन्त्रानुसारिणी follows Vedic hymns that one, त्वत्कृते for your sake, वनवासानुसारिणी one seeking the forest life, कृता is made.

45_25.shloka: हृदयेष्वेव तिष्ठन्ति वेदा ये नः परं धनम्।वत्स्यन्त्यपि गृहेष्वेव दाराश्चारित्ररक्षिताः।।2.45.25।।
45_25.translation: The Vedas are our greatest wealth and they reside in our hearts. Our wives, protected by their fidelity, shall stay at home.
45_25.word_by_word: नः our, परं धनम् greatest wealth, ये those, वेदाः the Vedas, हृदयेष्वेव in our hearts, तिष्ठन्ति are remaining, दारा अपि our wives also, चारित्ररक्षिताः protected by fidelity, गृहेष्वेव at home, वत्स्यन्ति shall stay.

45_26.shloka: न पुनर्निश्चयः कार्यस्त्वद्गतौ सुकृता मतिः।त्वयि धर्मव्यपेक्षे तु किं स्याद्धर्मपथे स्थितम्।।2.45.26।।
45_26.translation: We are not going to revoke our decision. We have made up our minds to follow you (into the forest). If you have no regard for this decision, then who will adhere to the path of righteousness?
45_26.word_by_word: पुनः again (another), निश्चयः decision, न कार्यः should not be taken, त्वद्गतौ on your journey, मतिः mind, सुकृता is well set, त्वयि in you, धर्मव्यपेक्षे reluctant to follow 'dharma', धर्मपथे in the path of righteousness, किम् what?, स्थितं स्यात् is left now?

45_27.translation: O Rama, you are firm in your duty.We beseech you, our heads bowed with swanwhite hair and soiled with dust, to return to Ayodhya.
45_27.word_by_word: निभृताचार ever firm in duty, महीपतनपांसुलैः soiled with the dust fallen on the ground, हंसशुक्लशिरोरुहैः having hairs white like the (plumes of a) swan, नः our, शिरोभिः with our  heads, याचितः beg of you, निवर्तस्व you may return.

45_28.shloka: बहूनां वितता यज्ञा द्विजानां य इहागताः।तेषां समाप्तिरायत्ता तव वत्स निवर्तने।।2.45.28।।
45_28.translation: Many of those brahmins who arrived here have commenced their sacrifices. O dear child, their consummation depends on your return.
45_28.word_by_word: ये who, इह here, आगताः have arrived, बहूनाम् many, द्विजानाम् brahmins, यज्ञाः sacrifices, वितताः commenced, वत्स O dear child, तेषाम् their, समाप्तिः consummation, तव your, निवर्तने returning, आयत्ता is dependent.

45_29.shloka: भक्तिमन्ति हि भूतानि जङ्गमाजङ्गमानि च।याचमानेषु राम त्वं भक्तिं भक्तेषु दर्शय।।2.45.29।।
45_29.translation: O Rama, all these living beings, movable and immovable, are devoted to you and are entreating you with devotion to return. Show consideration to those supplicants.
45_29.word_by_word: राम Rama, जङ्गमाजङ्गमानि movable and immovable, भूतानि living beings, भक्तिमन्ति हि are  devoted to you, त्वम् you, याचमानेषु supplicants, भक्तेषु in devotees, भक्तिम् devotion, दर्शय show.

45_30.shloka: अनुगन्तुमशक्ता स्त्वां मूलैरुद्धतवेगिनः।उन्नता वायुवेगेन विक्रोशन्तीव पादपाः।।2.45.30।।
45_30.translation: Although the trees uplifted by the speed of the wind, intend to follow you, their movement is stalled by their roots. Unable, they appear to be weeping.
45_30.word_by_word: मूलैः with their roots, उद्धतवेगिनः crushed with their speed, पादपाः trees, त्वाम् you, अनुगन्तुम्  to follow, अशक्ताः unable, वायुवेगेन with the speed of wind, उन्नताः uplifted, विक्रोशन्तीव weeping like.

45_31.translation: Even the birds instead of foraging for food are sitting motionless on the trees at one place. They are imploring you, you who are compassionate to all creatures, to return to Ayodhya.
45_31.word_by_word: पक्षिणोऽपि even the birds, निश्चेष्टाहारसञ्चाराः without foraging for food and wanderings,  वृक्षैकस्थानविष्ठिताः perched on the trees at one place, सर्वभूतानुकम्पिनम् one compassionate to all creatures, प्रयाचन्ते are imploring.

45_32.shloka: एवं विक्रोशतां तेषां द्विजातीनां निवर्तने।ददृशे तमसा तत्र वारयन्तीव राघवम्।।2.45.32।।
45_32.translation: While those brahmins were thus crying out, river Tamasa came into view as if seeking  Rama to turn back to Ayodhya.
45_32.word_by_word: एवम् in this way, निवर्तने seeking his return, तेषां द्विजातीनाम् those brahmins, विक्रोशताम्  crying, तत्र there, तमसा Tamasa river, राघवम् Rama, वारयन्तीव as if preventing, ददृशे appeared.

45_33.translation: Then Sumantra also unyoked the fatigued horses from the chariot and quickly allowed  them to roll and relax on the ground. Having made the horses drink and dipin water, he released them for grazing not far from Tamasa river.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे पञ्चचत्वारिंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the fortyfifth sarga of Ayodhyakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
45_33.word_by_word: ततः then, सुमन्त्रोऽपि Sumantra also, श्रान्तान् fatigued, हयान् horses, रथात् from the chariot, विमुच्य having unyoked, शीघ्रम् quickly, सम्परिवर्त्य allowing them to roll and relax, पीतोदकान्  making them drink water, तोयपरिप्लुताङ्गान् bathing them in water, तमसाविदूरे not far from river Tamasa, अचारयत् made them graze.

46_1.shloka: [Rama, Sita and Lakshmana stay on the bank of Tamasa river -- at dawn they proceed,  leaving behind the citizens of Ayodhya.]ततस्तु तमसातीरं रम्यमाश्रित्य राघवः।सीतामुद्वीक्ष्य सौमित्रिमिदं वचनमब्रवीत्।।2.46.1।।
46_1.translation: The scion of the Raghus (Rama), having taken shelter on the lovely bank of Tamasa, glanced at Sita and said to Lakshmana thus:
46_1.word_by_word: ततः then, राघवः scion of the Raghus (Rama), रम्यम् lovely, तमसातीरम् bank of Tamasa, आश्रित्य having taken refuge, सीताम् Sita, उद्वीक्ष्य having looked at, सौमित्रिम् Sumitra's son (Lakshmana), इदं वचनम् these words, अब्रवीत् said.

46_2.shloka: इयमद्य निशा पूर्वा सौमित्रे प्रहिता वनम्।वनवासस्य भद्रं ते स नोत्कण्ठितुमर्हसि।।2.46.2।।
46_2.translation: O Lakshmana, this happens to be the first night of our exile. You should not have any longing in your mind. Wish you well
46_2.word_by_word: सौमित्रे O Lakshmana, वनम् to the forest, प्रहिताः having been sent, अद्य today, इयम् this, वनवासस्य exile in the forest, पूर्वा first, निशा night, उत्कण्ठितुम् longing in your mind, न अर्हसि does not behove you, ते भद्रम् wish you well.

46_3.translation: Look at the deserted forest. The wild animals and birds have returned to their hideouts. They fill the air with their cries.
46_3.word_by_word: यथानिलयम् to their respective abodes, आयद्भिः by those returning, मृगद्विजैः by wild animals and birds, निलीनानि concealed themselves in their hideouts, शून्यानि deserted,  अरण्यानि forests, समन्ततः all over, रुदन्तीव as if crying, पश्य see.

46_4.shloka: अद्यायोध्या तु नगरी राजधानी पितुर्मम।सस्त्रीपुंसा गतानस्माञ्शोचिष्यति न संशयः।।2.46.4।।
46_4.translation: There is no doubt that now the men and women of Ayodhya, father's capital city must be bewailing our departure.
46_4.word_by_word: अद्य now, मम पितुः my father's, राजधानी capital, अयोध्या नगरी city of Ayodhya, सस्त्रीपुंसा   with men and women, गतान् having gone ( to the forest), अस्मान् about us, शोचिष्यति must be mourning, नसंशयः no doubt.

46_5.shloka: अनुरक्ता हि मनुजा राजानं बहुभिर्गुणैः।त्वां च मां च नरव्याघ्र शत्रुघ्न भरतौ तथा।।2.46.5।।
46_5.translation: O best of men because of our many virtues, the people (of Ayodhya) are indeed loyal to the king, to you, to me and to Satrughna and Bharata, too.
46_5.word_by_word: नरव्याघ्र O tiger (best) among men, मनुजाः the people, बहुभिः many, गुणैः virtues, राजानम् to the king, त्वां च to you, मां च to me, तथा similarly, शत्रुघ्न भरतौ to Satrughna and Bharata, अनुरक्ताः हि are indeed attached.

46_6.shloka: पितरं चानुशोचामि मातरं च यशस्विनीम्।अपि वान्धौ भवेतां तु रुदन्तौ तावभीक्ष्णशः।।2.46.6।।
46_6.translation: What distresses me is the thought that both father and illustrious mother maybecome blind by repeated weeping (over us).
46_6.word_by_word: पितरं च also father, यशस्विनीम् illustrious, मातरं च also mother, अनुशोचामि I am distressed, तौ both of them, अभीक्ष्णशः repeatedly, रुदन्तौ while weeping, अन्धौ blind, अपि वा भवेताम् will they become.

46_7.shloka: भरतः खलु धर्मात्मा पितरं मातरं च मे।धर्मार्थकामसहितैर्वाक्यैर्वाश्वासयिष्यति।।2.46.7।।
46_7.translation: Righteous Bharata will indeed console parents with words in conformity with  dharma, artha and kama.
46_7.word_by_word: धर्मात्मा righteous, भरतः Bharata, धर्मार्थकामसहितैः with dharma, artha and kama, वाक्यैः  words, मे my, पितरम् father, मातरं च and mother, आश्वासयिष्यति खलु will console indeed.

46_8.shloka: भरतस्यानृशंसत्वं विचिन्त्याहं पुनः पुनः।नानुशोचामि पितरं मातरं चापि लक्ष्मण।।2.46.8।।
46_8.translation: As I reflect again and again on the benevolent nature of Bharata, there is no concern in me about my parents, O Lakshmana
46_8.word_by_word: लक्ष्मण Lakshmana, अहं I, भरतस्य Bharata's, अनृशंसत्वम् lack of wickedness, पुनः पुनः again again, विचिन्त्य after reflecting about, पितरम् father, मातरं च and mother, नानुशोचामि have no regrets.

46_9.shloka: त्वया कार्यं नरव्याघ्र मामनुव्रजता कृतम्।अन्वेष्टव्या हि वैदेह्या रक्षणार्थे सहायता।।2.46.9।।
46_9.translation: You, O Lakshmana, the best among men, have done a good job by accompanying me. Otherwise assistance for Sita's protection would have been sought (necessary).
46_9.word_by_word: नरव्याघ्र O best of men, माम् me, अनुव्रजता while accompanying, त्वया by you, कार्यम् good deed, कृतम् has been done, वैदेह्याः Sita, रक्षणार्थे for protection, सहायता assistance,  अन्वेष्टव्या हि to be sought for.

46_10.shloka: अद्भिरेव तु सौमित्रे वत्स्याम्यद्य निशामिमाम्।एतध्दि रोचते मह्यं वन्येऽपि विविधे सति।।2.46.10।।
46_10.translation: O Lakshmana, I shall live this night on water alone. I prefer it, though various kinds of forest products are available.
46_10.word_by_word: सौमित्रे O Lakshmana, अद्य today, इमां निशाम् this night, अद्भिरेव with water only, वत्स्यामि I will live, विविधे different kinds, वन्ये forest products, सत्यपि available, एतत् this one, मह्यम् to me, रोचते हि is my preference.

46_11.shloka: एवमुक्त्वा तु सौमित्रिं सुमन्त्रमपि राघवः।अप्रमत्तस्त्वमश्वेषु भव सौम्येत्युवाच ह।।2.46.11।।
46_11.translation: Having said so to Lakshmana, he turned to Sumantra to say O gentle friend, tend the horses with care.
46_11.word_by_word: राघवः Rama, सौमित्रिम् to Lakshmana, एवम् in this way, उक्त्वा having said, सौम्य O gentle one, त्वम् अश्वेषु about horses, अप्रमत्तः भव be careful, इति thus, सुमन्त्रमपि to Sumantra also, उवाच ह said.

46_12.shloka: सोऽश्वान्सुमन्त्रः संयम्य सूर्येऽस्तं समुपागते।प्रभूतयवसान् कृत्वा बभूव प्रत्यनन्तरः।।2.46.12।।
46_12.translation: As the Sun was setting, Sumantra tethered the horses, fed them with abundant fodder and sat close to them.
46_12.word_by_word: सः सुमन्त्रः that Sumantra, सूर्ये Sun, अस्तम् was setting, समुपागते was setting, अश्वान् horses, संयम्य tethered, प्रभूतयवसान् with abundant fodder, कृत्वा having made, प्रत्यनन्तरःबभूव sat in their proximity.

46_13.shloka: उपास्य तु शिवां सन्ध्यां दृष्ट्वा रात्रिमुपस्थिताम्।रामस्य शयनं चक्रे सूतः सौमित्रिणा सह।।2.46.13।।
46_13.translation: Then the charioteer worshipping the auspicious Sandhya (twilight), and seeing the night approach made  bed for Rama and Lakshmana.
46_13.word_by_word: सूतः charioteer, शिवाम् auspicious, सन्ध्याम् Sandhya, उपास्य having worshipped, रात्रिम्  night, उपस्थिताम् having arrived, दृष्ट्वा having seen, सौमित्रिणा सह along with Lakshmana, रामस्य of Rama, शयनम् bed, चक्रे made.

46_14.shloka: तां शय्यां तमसातीरे वीक्ष्य वृक्षदलैः कृताम्।रामः सौमित्रिणा सार्धं सभार्यस्संविवेश ह।।2.46.14।।
46_14.translation: Having seen the bed of leaves made ready on the bank of Tamasa, Rama lay down there along with Sita and Lakshmana.
46_14.word_by_word: तमसातीरे on the bank of Tamasa, वृक्षदलैः with leaves of trees, कृताम् made, तां शय्याम् that bed, वीक्ष्य having seen, रामः Rama, सभार्यः along with his wife, सौमित्रिणा सार्धम along with Lakshmana, संविवेश ह lay down.

46_15.shloka: सभार्यं सम्प्रसुप्तं तं भ्रातरं वीक्ष्य लक्ष्मणः।कथयामास सूताय रामस्य विविधान् गुणान्।।2.46.15।।
46_15.translation: Having seen that his brother along with his wife had fallen asleep, Lakshmana narrated the many virtues of Rama to Sumantra.
46_15.word_by_word: लक्ष्मणः Lakshmana, सम्प्रसुप्तम् fallen asleep, सभार्यम् along with wife, तं भ्रातरम् that brother, वीक्ष्य having seen, सूताय to the charioteer (Sumantra), रामस्य Rama's, विविधान् various  गुणान् virtues, कथयामास narrated.

46_16.shloka: जाग्रतो ह्येव तां रात्रिं सौमित्रेरुदितो रविः।सूतस्य तमसातीरे रामस्य ब्रुवतो गुणान्।।2.46.16।।
46_16.translation: Lakshmana continued to describe Rama's virtues to the charioteer, keeping awake that entire night on the bank of Tamasa until the Sun rose.
46_16.word_by_word: तमसातीरे on the bank of river Tamasa, रामस्य Rama's, गुणान् virtues, सूतस्य (in) the chrioteer's (presence), ब्रुवतः telling, सौमित्रेः Lakshmana, तां रात्रिम् that night, जाग्रतोह्येव by keeping awake, रविः the Sun, उदितः arose.

46_17.shloka: गोकुलाकुलतीरायास्तमसाया विदूरतः।अवसत्तत्र तां रात्रिं रामः प्रकृतिभिस्सह।।2.46.17।।
46_17.translation: Rama spent the night with his subjects not very far from the bank of Tamasa which was crowded with herds of cattle.
46_17.word_by_word: रामः Rama, प्रकृतिभिः with the subjects, गोकुलाकुलतीरायाः of that bank crowded with herds of cattle, तमसायाः Tamasa, विदूरतः not very far, तां रात्रिम् that night, तत्र there, अवसत् lived.

46_18.shloka: उत्थाय स महातेजाः प्रकृतीस्ता निशाम्य च।अब्रवीद्भ्रातरं रामो लक्ष्मणं पुण्यलक्षणम्।।2.46.18।।
46_18.translation: On getting up, the brilliant Rama looked at his subjects and said to his brother Lakshmana full of noble qualities:
46_18.word_by_word: महातेजाः brilliant, सः रामः that Rama, उत्थाय च having risen, ताः those, प्रकृतीः subjects, निशाम्य च having seen, पुण्यलक्षणम् having auspicious qualities, भ्रातरम् brother, लक्ष्मणम् addressing Lakshmana, अब्रवीत् he said.

46_19.shloka: अस्मद्व्यपेक्षान् सौमित्रे निरपेक्षान् गृहेष्वपि।वृक्षमूलेषु संसुप्तान् पश्य लक्ष्मण साम्प्रतम्।।2.46.19।।
46_19.translation: O Lakshmana, son of Sumitra look at these people, fast alseep under the trees. Out of affection for us, they are even indifferent to their home.
46_19.word_by_word: लक्ष्मण O Lakshmana, सौमित्रे son of Sumitra, अस्मद्व्यपेक्षान् due to their affection for us, गृहेष्वपि even in their homes, निरपेक्षान् indifferent, साम्प्रतम् now, वृक्षमूलेषु at the foot of the trees, संसुप्तान् are fast asleep, पश्य you may see.

46_20.shloka: यथैते नियमं पौराः कुर्वन्त्यस्मन्निवर्तने।अपि प्राणान्न्यसिष्यन्ति न तु त्यक्ष्यन्ति निश्चयम्।।2.46.20।।
46_20.translation: On seeing the people's resolve to take us back, it appears they are prepared to give up their lives rather than abandon their determination.
46_20.word_by_word: एते पौराः these citizens, अस्मन्निवर्तने on our return, यथा as, नियमम् resolve,  कुर्वन्ति are doing, प्राणानपि even life also, न्यसिष्यन्ति will give up, निश्चयं तु determination, न त्यक्ष्यन्ति will not abandon.

46_21.shloka: यावदेव तु संसुप्ता स्तावदेव वयं लघु।रथमारुह्य गच्छामः पन्थानमकुतोभयम्।।2.46.21।।
46_21.translation: While they are asleep, we shall quickly mount the chariot and fearlessly proceed on the way.
46_21.word_by_word: यावदेव so long as, संसुप्ताः they are asleep, तावदेव so long, वयम् we, लघु quickly, रथम् chariot, आरुह्य mounting, अकुतोभयम् without fear, पन्थानम् on our way, गच्छाम we shall go.

46_22.shloka: अतो भूयोऽपि नेदानीमिक्ष्वाकुपुरवासिनः।स्वपेयुरनुरक्ता मां वृक्षमूलानि संश्रिताः।।2.46.22।।
46_22.translation: These loyal inhabitants of Ayodhya, the city of the Ikshvakus will no more sleep again shelterd under the trees.
46_22.word_by_word: अतः therefore, माम् about me, अनुरक्ताः attached, इक्ष्वाकुपुरवासिनः inhabitants of the city of the Ikshvakus, भूयोऽपि again, वृक्षमूलानि at the foot of the trees, संश्रिताः having taken refuge, इदानीम् now, भूयोऽपि again, न स्वपेयुः should not sleep.

46_23.shloka: पौरा ह्यात्मकृताद्दुःखाद्विप्रमोच्या नृपात्मजैः।न तु खल्वात्मना योज्या दुःखेन पुरवासिनः।।2.46.23।।
46_23.translation: The prince should deliver the citizens from the sufferings caused by themselves but should not make them suffer on their account.
46_23.word_by_word: पौराः the citizens, नृपात्मजैः by the sons of the king, आत्मकृतात् done by themselves, दुःखात्  from the sufferings, विप्रमोच्या हि are to be delivered, पुरवासिनः people of the city, आत्मना  by themselves, दुःखेन suffering, न योज्याः हि are not to be united.

46_24.shloka: अब्रवील्लक्ष्मणो रामं साक्षाद्धर्ममिवस्थितम्।रोचते मे तथा प्राज्ञ क्षिप्र मारुह्यतामिति।।2.46.24।।
46_24.translation: Lakshmana said to Rama who was the very image of like righteousness O wise one, I like this (proposal). Let us quickly mount the chariot.
46_24.word_by_word: साक्षात् incarnate of, धर्ममिव righteousness, स्थितम् remaining, रामम् to Rama, लक्ष्मणः Lakshmana, प्राज्ञ O sagacious, मे to me, तथा that way, रोचते is agreeable, क्षिप्रम् quickly, आरुह्यताम् let us board the chariot, इति thus, अब्रवीत् spoken.

46_25.shloka: अथ रामोऽब्रवीच्छ्रीमान्सुमन्त्रं युज्यतां रथः।गमिष्यामि ततोऽरण्यं गच्छ शीघ्रमितः प्रभो।।2.46.25।।
46_25.translation: Then glorious Rama addressing Sumantra said O master charioteer, harness the chariot. I shall (let us) quickly leave for the forest.
46_25.word_by_word: अथ then, श्रीमान् glorious, रामः Rama, सुमन्त्रम् addressing Sumantra, अब्रवीत् said, प्रभो O master charioteer, रथः chariot, युज्यताम् be yoked, ततः then, अरण्यम् to the forest, गमिष्यामि  shall go, इतः from here, शीघ्रम् quickly, गच्छ I shall go.

46_26.shloka: सूतस्तत स्सत्त्वरितः स्यन्दनं तैर्हयोत्तमैः।योजयित्व्राऽथ रामाय प्राञ्जलिः प्रत्यवेदयत्।।2.46.26।।
46_26.translation: Thereupon the charioteer hurriedly harnessed the splendid horses to the chariot and informed Rama with folded hands:
46_26.word_by_word: ततः thereupon, सः सूतः that charioteer (Sumantra), त्वरितः in haste , स्यन्दनम् the chariot, तैः those, हयोत्तमैः splendid horses, योजयित्वा having harnessed, अथ and, प्राञ्जलिः with folded palms, रामाय for Rama, प्रत्यवेदयत् informed.

46_27.shloka: अयं युक्तो महाबाहो रथस्ते रथिनां वर।त्वमारोहस्व भद्रं ते ससीत स्सहलक्ष्मणः।।2.46.27।।
46_27.translation: O best among riders the chariot has been harnessed. O mightyarmed one, board it along with Sita and Lakshmana. All the best
46_27.word_by_word: महाबाहो O longarmed one, रथिनाम् among the charioteers, वर best, ते for you, अयं रथः  this chariot, युक्तः has been yoked, त्वम् you, स सीतः with Sita, सह लक्ष्मणः with Lakshmana, अरोहस्व mount, ते भद्रम् all the best.

46_28.translation: Rama (along with others) mounted the chariot with his belongings, crossed the rapidly flowing Tamasa agitated with whirlpools.
46_28.word_by_word: सपरिच्छदः with his belongings, राघवः Rama, तं स्यन्दनम् that chariot, अधिष्ठाय having mounted, शीघ्रगाम् rapidly flowing, आकुलावर्ताम् agitated with whirlpools, तमसां नदीम्Tamasa river, अतरत् crossed.

46_29.shloka: स सन्तीर्य महाबाहुः श्रीमान् शिवमकण्टकम्।प्रापद्यत महामार्गमभयं भयदर्शिनाम्।।2.46.29।।
46_29.translation: Having crossed the river, the mightyarmed and gracious Rama proceeded on the auspicious and thornless highway arousing confidence even in the timid.
