46_29.word_by_word: महाबाहुः mightyarmed, श्रीमान् gracious, सः that Rama, सन्तीर्य having crossed, शिवम्  auspicious, अकण्टकम् without thorns (sufferings), भयदर्शिनाम् even for the timid, अभयम् arousing confidence, महामार्गम् highway, प्रापद्यत reached.

46_30.shloka: मोहनार्थं तु पौराणां सूतं रामोऽब्रवीद्वचः।उदङ्मुखः प्रयाहि त्वं रथमास्थाय सारथे।।2.46.30।।मुहूर्तं त्वरितं गत्वा निवर्तय रथं पुनः।यथा न विद्युः पौरा मां तथा कुरु समाहितः।।2.46.31।।
46_30.translation: With the intention of confusing the citizens, Rama said to the charioteer, O Sumantra, having seated in the chariot proceed speedly for a while in northerly direction and again turn back the chariot. Accomplish this feat in such a manner that the citizens will not know (where we have gone).
46_30.word_by_word: रामः Rama, पौराणाम् citizens', मोहनार्थम् to elude, सूतम् to the charioteer, वचः those words, अब्रवीत् said, सारथे O charioteer, त्वम् you, रथम् chariot, आस्थाय having mounted, उदङ्मुखः in northerly direction, प्रयाहि you may proceed, मुहूर्तम् for a while, त्वरितम् speedily, गत्वा having gone, रथम् chariot, पुनः again, निवर्तय turn back, माम् about me, पौराः citizens, यथा how, न विद्युः will not know, तथा in that manner, समाहितः accomplish, कुरु you may act.

46_31.shloka: रामस्य वचनं श्रुत्वा तथा चक्रे स सारथिः।प्रत्यागम्य च रामस्य स्यन्दनं प्रत्यवेदयत्।।2.46.32।।
46_31.translation: The charioteer did as instructed by Rama, returned to him with the chariot and informed (of its readiness).
46_31.word_by_word: सः सारथिः that charioteer, रामस्य Rama's, वचनम् words, श्रुत्वा having heard, तथा as instructed, चक्रे having done, प्रत्यागम्य having retuned, रामस्य to Rama, स्यन्दनम् chariot, प्रत्यवेदयत्  informed.

46_32.shloka: तौ सम्प्रयुक्तं तु रथं समास्थितौतदा ससीतौ रघुवंशवर्धनौ।प्रचोदयामास ततस्तुरङ्गमान्स सारथिर्येन पथा तपोवनम्।।2.46.33।।
46_32.translation: When Rama and Lakshmana, perpetuaters of the Raghu race along with Sita were seated on the wellyoked chariot, Sumantra urged the horses to move.
46_32.word_by_word: तदा then, स सीतौ with Sita, रघुवंशवर्धनौ perpetuating the race of Raghu, Rama and Lakshmana, सम्प्रयुक्तम् wellyoked, रथम् chariot, समास्थितौ were seated, ततः then, सः सारथिः the charioteer, येन पथा that way, तपोवनम् penancegroves, तुरङ्गमान् horses, प्रचोदयामास urged.

46_33.shloka: तत स्समास्थाय रथं महारथःससारथिर्दाशरथिर्वनं ययौ।उदङ्मुखं तं तु रथं चकार सप्रयाणमाङ्गल्य निमित्तदर्शनात्।।2.46.34।।
46_33.translation: As it augurs well to travel north Sumantra placed the chariot in that direction. Thereafter that great charioteer, Rama, Sita and Lakshmana boarded the chariot and departed.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे षट्चत्वारिंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the fortysixth sarga of Ayodhyakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
46_33.word_by_word: ततः then, सः he Sumantra, प्रयाणमाङ्गल्यनिमित्तदर्शनात् having seen the auguries of auspiciousness during the journey, तं रथम् that chariot, उदङ्मुखम् northerly direction, चकार made, महारथः that great chariot, दाशरथिः Rama , ससारथिः with the charioteer, रथम् chariot, (सम्) आस्थाय having mounted, वनम् to the forest, ययौ went.

47_1.shloka: [Disappointed citizens return to Ayodhya.]प्रभातायां तु शर्वर्यां पौरास्ते राघवं विना।शोकोपहतनिश्चेष्टा बभूवुर्हतचेतसः।।2.47.1।।
47_1.translation: When the night advanced towards dawn the citizens were stunned not to see the scion of the Raghus (Rama). Overwhelmed with sorrow they lost their senses.
47_1.word_by_word: प्रभातायां शर्वर्याम् when the night advanced towards dawn, ते पौराः those citizens, राघवं विना not beholding Rama, हतचेतसः deprived of  their senses, शोकोपहतचेतसः crushed with grief, निश्चेष्टाः बभूवुः were stunned.

47_2.shloka: शोकजाश्रुपरिद्यूना वीक्षमाणास्ततस्ततः।आलोकमपि रामस्य न पश्यन्ति स्म दुःखिताः।।2.47.2।।
47_2.translation: Anguished and drenched with tears of grief they looked hither and thither but could not find even a trace of Rama.
47_2.word_by_word: शोकजाश्रुपरिद्यूनाः drenched in the tears of grief, ततस्ततः hither and thither, वीक्षमाणाःlooking, दुःखिताः anguished, रामस्य Rama's, आलोकमपि even his light (trace), न पश्यन्ति स्म could not see.

47_3.shloka: ते विषादार्तवदना रहितास्तेन धीमता।कृपणाः करुणा वाचो वदन्ति स्म मनस्विनः।।2.47.3।।
47_3.translation: Those highminded people with sorrowful faces due to separation from sagacious Rama expressed themselves in piteous words:
47_3.word_by_word: मनस्विनः highminded people, ते those men, धीमता by the sagacious, तेन रहिताः separated from him (Rama), विषादार्तवदनाः with faces marked with grief, कृपणाः piteous, करुणाः evoking compassion, वाचः words, वदन्ति स्म talked about.

47_4.shloka: धिगस्तु खलु निद्रां तां ययाऽपहृतचेतसः।नाद्य पश्यामहे रामं पृथूरस्कं महाभुजम्।।2.47.4।।
47_4.translation: Fie on this sleep which robbed us of our senses. We are unable to see (now) that broadchested and mightyarmed Rama.
47_4.word_by_word: यया by which, अपहृतचेतसः senses robbed of, अद्य now, पृथूरस्कम् broadchested, महाभुजम्  mightyarmed, रामम् Rama, न पश्यामहे we cannot see, तां निद्राम् to that sleep, धिक् अस्तु fie on it.

47_5.shloka: कथं नाम महाबाहु स्स तथावितथक्रियः।भक्तं जनं परित्यज्य प्रवासं राघवो गतः।।2.47.5।।
47_5.translation: How is it that the mightyarmed Rama who never renders services done to him fruitless has deserted his devoted people and gone into exile?
47_5.word_by_word: तथा in that way, अवितथक्रियः one to whom services rendered never go fruitless, महाबाहुः mightyarmed, सः राघवः that Rama, भक्तम् devoted, जनम् people, परित्यज्य abandoning, कथं नाम how, प्रवासम्   exile, गतः has gone.

47_6.shloka: यो नः सदा पालयति पिता पुत्रानिवौरसान्।कथं रघूणां स श्रेष्ठस्त्यक्त्वा नो विपिनं गतः।।2.47.6।।
47_6.translation: How could he, the best among the kings of Raghu dynasty, who used to protect us as a father protects his own children, go to the forest, abandoning us?
47_6.word_by_word: रघूणाम् among the kings of Raghu dynasty, श्रेष्ठः the best, यः such Rama, पिता father, औरसान् पुत्रान् sons born to him, नः us, सदा always, पालयति protect, सः such Rama , नः us, त्यक्त्वा deserting, विपिनम् to the forest, कथम् how, गतः could he go?

47_7.shloka: इहैव निधनं यामो महाप्रस्थानमेव वा।रामेण रहितानां हि किमर्थं जीवितं हि नः।।2.47.7।।
47_7.translation: We all will die here. We will go on the everlasting journey to death. Of what use is this life to us without Rama?
47_7.word_by_word: इहैव here itself, निधनम् death, यामः we will meet with, महाप्रस्थानमेव वा everlasting journey, रामेण by Rama, रहितानाम् bereft of, नः for us, जीवितम् life, किमर्थम् what is the use?

47_8.shloka: सन्ति शुष्काणि काष्ठानि प्रभूतानि महान्ति च।तैः प्रज्वाल्य चितां सर्वे प्रविशामोऽथ पावकम्।।2.47.8।।
47_8.translation: There are plenty of dry logs of wood. We will prepare a pyre with them, set fire to it and we all will enter it.
47_8.word_by_word: महान्ति huge, प्रभूतानि plenty, शुष्काणि dry, काष्ठानि सन्ति are logs here, अथ or, तैः with them, चिताम् pyre, प्रज्वाल्य flaming it, सर्वे all, पावकम् fire, प्रविशामः will enter.

47_9.shloka: किं वक्ष्यामो महाबाहुरनसूयः प्रियंवदः।नीत स्स राघवोऽस्माभिरिति वक्तुं कथं क्षमम्।।2.47.9।।
47_9.translation: What shall we say (to the people)? How can we say, 'We have conducted him (to the forest), that scion of the Raghus, that mightyarmed Rama, who is of gentle speech and free from malice?
47_9.word_by_word: किम् what, वक्ष्यामः shall say, महाबाहुः mightyarmed, अनसूयः free from malice, प्रियंवदः saying pleasing words, सः such, राघवः Rama, अस्माभिः by us, नीतः conducted  to the forest, इति thus, कथम् how, वक्तुम् to tell, क्षमम् is possible?

47_10.shloka: सा नूनं नगरी दीना दृष्ट्वाऽस्मान् राघवं विना।भविष्यति निरानन्दा सस्त्रीबालवयोधिका।।2.47.10।।
47_10.translation: Seeing us return without Rama, the women, children and  the aged of the city (Ayodhya) will certainly feel miserable and cheerless.
47_10.word_by_word: राघवं विना without Rama, अस्मान् us, दृष्ट्वा having seen, सस्त्रीबालवयोधिका with women, children and the aged, सा नगरी that city, (Ayodhya), नूनम् certainly, दीना will be dejected, निरानन्दा without joy, भविष्यति will be.

47_11.shloka: निर्यातास्तेन वीरेण सह नित्यं जितात्मना।विहीनास्तेन च पुनः कथं पश्याम तां पुरीम्।।2.47.11।।
47_11.translation: Having left (that city) with the valiant and selfrestrained Rama, how can we now return without him ?
47_11.word_by_word: नित्यम् always, जितात्मना by the selfcontrolled, तेन वीरेण सह with that valiant one, निर्याताः  having left (that city), तेन च with him, विहीनाः devoid of, तां पुरीम् to that city, कथम् how, पश्याम will see.

47_12.shloka: इतीव बहुधा वाचो बाहुमुद्यम्य ते जनाः।विलपन्ति स्म दुःखार्ता विवत्सा इव धेनवः।।2.47.12।।
47_12.translation: All of them with grief distressed, and with their arms thrown up lamented like cows deprived of their calves.
47_12.word_by_word: ते जनाः those people, दुःखार्ताः distressed men with grief, बाहुम् arms, उद्यम्य having uplifted, बहुधा in many ways, इतीव like this, वाचः words, विवत्साः deprived of calves, धेनवः इव like cows, विलपन्ति स्म lamented.

47_13.shloka: ततो मार्गानुसारेण गत्वा किञ्चित् क्षणं पुनः।मार्गनाशाद्विषादेन महता समभिप्लुताः।।2.47.13।।
47_13.translation: For a short while they followed the tracks (of the chariot) and after having gone a little distance, they missed the way. They were again submerged in deep sorrow.
47_13.word_by_word: ततः then, क्षणम् for a short while, मार्गानुसारेण following the track, किञ्चित् for a little, गत्वा having gone, मार्गनाशात् by missing the way, पुनः again, महता great, विषादेन with grief,  समभिप्लुताः were overcome.

47_14.shloka: रथस्य मार्गनाशेन न्यवर्तन्त मनस्विनः।किमिदं किं करिष्यामो दैवेनोपहता इति।।2.47.14।।
47_14.translation: When they could not find the tracks of the chariot, those highminded people turned back and said to themselves 'What is this? We have been deceived by fate. What are we to do now?'
47_14.word_by_word: मनस्विनः highminded people, रथस्य chariot's, मार्गनाशेन disappearance of the track, किमिदम् what is this?, दैवेन by destiny, उपहताः struck, किं करिष्यामः what are we to do?, इति  thus (saying), न्यवर्तन्त returned.

47_15.shloka: ततो यथागतेनैव मार्गेण क्लान्तचेतसः।अयोध्यामागमन्सर्वे पुरीं व्यथितसज्जनाम्।।2.47.15।।
47_15.translation: Thereafter, all of them, the virtuous people grieving, their minds fatigued, returned to Ayodhya the same way they had come.
47_15.word_by_word: ततः thereafter, सर्वे all of them, क्लान्तचेतसः with their minds, यथागतेनैव they had come, मार्गेण way, व्यथितसज्जनाम् with virtuous people grieving, अयोध्याम् to Ayodhya, पुरीम् city, आगमन् had come back.

47_16.shloka: आलोक्य नगरीं तां च क्षयव्याकुलमानसाः।आवर्तयन्त तेऽश्रूणि नयनैः शोकपीडितैः।।2.47.16।।
47_16.translation: On seeing  the city the minds of the people were agitated due to the loss (of their prince). Tears streamed down their eyes, oppressed with sorrow.
47_16.word_by_word: ते they, तां नगरीम् that city, आलोक्य having seen, क्षयव्याकुलमानसाः minds agitated, शोकपीडितैः oppressed with sorrow, नयनैः with eyes, अश्रूणि tears, आवर्तयन्त shed.

47_17.shloka: एषा रामेण नगरी रहिता नातिशोभते।आपगा गरुडेनेव ह्रदादुद्धृतपन्नगा।।2.47.17।।
47_17.translation: This city without Rama just as a river with serpents lifted away by Garuda from its depths looks no longer beautiful.
47_17.word_by_word: रामेण रहिता without Rama, एषा नगरी this city, ह्रदात् from the deep, गरुडेन by Garuda, उद्धृतपन्नगा the snakes having been lifted away, आपगा इव like a river, नातिशोभते does not look beautiful.

47_18.translation: Plunged in grief, they saw the city deprived of all joy, looking like a sky without the Moon and an ocean without water.
47_18.word_by_word: विचेतसः overcome with grief, ते they, निहतानन्दम् with their joys destroyed , नगरम् that city, चन्द्रहीनम् without Moon, आकाशम् इव like sky, तोयहीनम् without water, आर्णवम् इव like an ocean, अपश्यन् saw.

47_19.shloka: ते तानि वेश्मानि महाधनानिदुःखेन दुःखोपहता विशन्तः।नैव प्रजज्ञुः स्वजनं जनं वानिरीक्षमाणाः प्रविनष्टहर्षाः।।2.47.19।।
47_19.translation: Those people devoid of delight entered their rich mansions with great difficulty. Even though they, stricken with sorrow, looked at men and their own kinsmen they could not recognise them.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे सप्तचत्वारिंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the fortyseventh sarga of Ayodhyakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
47_19.word_by_word: प्रविनष्टहर्षाः with their happiness destroyed, ते they, महाधनानि endowed with plenty of wealth, तानि such, वेश्मानि houses, दुःखेन with great difficulty, विशन्तः while entering, दुःखोपहताः stricken with sorrow, निरीक्षमाणाः looking at, स्वजनम् their own people, जनं वा or others, नैव प्रजज्ञुः could not recognise.

48_1.shloka: [Lamentations of women in Ayodhya.]तेषामेवं विषण्णानां पीडितानामतीव च।बाष्पविप्लुतनेत्राणां सशोकानां मुमूर्षया।।2.48.1।।अनुगम्य निवृत्तानां रामं नगरवासिनाम्।उद्गतानीव सत्वानि बभूवुरमनस्विनाम्।।2.48.2।।
48_1.translation: The people afflicted with sorrow followed Rama and returned to the city deeply distressed. Eyes overflowing with tears, they longed for death. Smitten with grief, they lost their highmindedness and looked as if their life had been drained out.
48_1.word_by_word: एवं in this manner, विषण्णानाम् of dejected ones, अतीव deeply, पीडितानाम् distressed, बाष्पविप्लुतनेत्राणाम् of men with their eyes overflowing with tears, सशोकानाम् of those  smitten with grief, मुमूर्षया desirng death, रामम् Rama, अनुगम्य having followed, निवृत्तानाम् of those who returned, अमनस्विनाम् of disinterested men, तेषाम् their, नगरवासिनाम् citizens', सत्वानि vital airs, उद्गतानीव were as if leaving the body.

48_2.shloka: तेषामेवं विषण्णानां पीडितानामतीव च।बाष्पविप्लुतनेत्राणां सशोकानां मुमूर्षया।।2.48.1।।अनुगम्य निवृत्तानां रामं नगरवासिनाम्।उद्गतानीव सत्वानि बभूवुरमनस्विनाम्।।2.48.2।।
48_2.translation: The people afflicted with sorrow followed Rama and returned to the city deeply distressed. Eyes overflowing with tears, they longed for death. Smitten with grief, they lost their highmindedness and looked as if their life had been drained out.
48_2.word_by_word: एवं in this manner, विषण्णानाम् of dejected ones, अतीव deeply, पीडितानाम् distressed, बाष्पविप्लुतनेत्राणाम् of men with their eyes overflowing with tears, सशोकानाम् of those  smitten with grief, मुमूर्षया desirng death, रामम् Rama, अनुगम्य having followed, निवृत्तानाम् of those who returned, अमनस्विनाम् of disinterested men, तेषाम् their, नगरवासिनाम् citizens', सत्वानि vital airs, उद्गतानीव were as if leaving the body.

48_3.shloka: स्वं स्वं निलयमागम्य पुत्रदारैस्समावृता।अश्रूणि मुमुचुस्सर्वे बाष्पेण पिहिताननाः।।2.48.3।।
48_3.translation: The subjects reached their respective homes  and surrounded by their sons and wives  broke down their faces flooded with tears.
48_3.word_by_word: सर्वे all of them, स्वं स्वम् their respective, निलयम् homes, आगम्य having reached, पुत्रदारैः  with their sons and wives, समावृताः surrounded, बाष्पेण with tears, पिहिताननाः with their faces covered, अश्रूणि tears, मुमुचुः shed.

48_4.shloka: न चाहृष्यन् नचामोदन् वणिजो न प्रसारयन्।न चाशोभन्त पण्यानि नापचन् गृहमेधिनः।।2.48.4।।
48_4.translation: The people had no joy in life nor did they find cheer in anything. The merchants did not offer their wares for sale. The marketplace looked graceless (lifeless). (The stocks were empty). The householders did not cook their food.
48_4.word_by_word: न अहृष्यन् च not rejoiced, न अमोदन् च not delighted, वणिजः traders, न प्रसारयन् did not offer for sale, पण्यानि च marketplaces also, न अशोभन्त did not look graceful, गृहमेधिनः  householders, नापचन् did not cook.

48_5.shloka: नष्टं दृष्ट्वा नाभ्यनन्दन् विपुलं वा धनागमम्।पुत्रं प्रथमजं लब्ध्वा जननी नाभ्यनन्दत।।2.48.5।।
48_5.translation: Neither loss nor acquisition of wealth mattered (to the people). No mother rejoiced over getting her firstborn son.
48_5.word_by_word: नष्टम् loss, दृष्ट्वा having seen, नाभ्यनन्दन् stood indifferent, विपुलम् vast, धनागमं वा or acquired wealth, जननी mother, प्रथमजम् firstborn, पुत्रम् son, लब्ध्वा having obtained,  नाभ्यनन्दत not rejoiced.

48_6.shloka: गृहे गृहे रुदन्त्यश्च भर्तारं गृहमागतम्।व्यगर्हयन्त दुःखार्ता वाग्भिस्तोत्रैरिव द्विपान्।।2.48.6।।
48_6.translation: In every house, women wept and in anguish heaped abuses on their husbands on their arrival at home with words (sharp) like goads on elephants:
48_6.word_by_word: दुःखार्ताः afflicted with sorrow, गृहे गृहे in every house, रुदन्त्यः while crying, तोत्रैः with goads, द्विपान् इव like elephants, वाग्भि: with words, गृहम् आगतम् arrival at home, भर्तारम् husband, व्यगर्हयन्त they reproached.

48_7.shloka: किं नु तेषां गृहैः कार्यं किं दारै: किं धनेन वा।पुत्रैर्वा किं सुखैर्वापि ये न पश्यन्ति राघवम्।।2.48.7।।
48_7.translation: For those who do not see Rama, of what use are the houses or spouses or sons orfortunes or delight?
48_7.word_by_word: ये whosoever, राघवम् Rama, न पश्यन्ति do not see, तेषाम् their, गृहैः homes, किम् what use, दारैः with wives, किं कार्यम् what use, धनेन वा with wealth, किम् what use, पुत्रैः वा or with sons, सुखैर्वापि comforts, किम् what use?.

48_8.shloka: एकः सत्पुरुषो लोके लक्ष्मण स्सह सीतया।योऽनुगच्छति काकुत्स्थं रामं परिचरन् वने।।2.48.8।।
48_8.translation: Lakshmana is the only fortunate person in the world who has followed Rama of the Kakutstha race along with Sita to serve them.
48_8.word_by_word: लोके in this world, एकः only, लक्ष्मणः Lakshmana, सत्पुरुषः is a (fortunate) pious person, यः who, सीतया सह with sita, काकुत्स्थम् of Kakutstha race, रामम् Rama, वने in the forest, परिचरन् attending on them, अनुगच्छति follows.

48_9.shloka: आपगाः कृतपुण्यास्ता पद्मिन्यश्च सरांसि च।येषु स्नास्यति काकुत्स्थो विगाह्य सलिलं शुचि।।2.48.9।।
48_9.translation: The rivers and the lotuspools have done some meritorious acts in the past as a result of which Rama having plunged into their holy waters will make his ablution.
48_9.word_by_word: येषु in which, शुचि pure, सलिलम् waters, विगाह्य enters, काकुत्स्थ: Rama, स्नास्यति bathes, ताः   those, आपगाः rivers, पद्मिन्यः tanks with lotuses, सरांसि च the lakes, कृतपुण्याः for the meritorious acts done (in the past).

48_10.shloka: शोभयिष्यन्ति काकुत्स्थमटव्यो रम्यकाननाः।आपगाश्च महानूपाः सानुमन्तश्च पर्वताः।।2.48.10।।
48_10.translation: Forests with beautiful groves rivers with vast expanse of waters, mountains with their slopes will enhance the lustre of the scion of the Kakutsthas (Rama).
48_10.word_by_word: रम्यकाननाः with beautiful groves, अटव्यः forests, महानूपाः expanse of waters, आपगाः च rivers, सानुमन्तः having slopes, पर्वताः mountains, काकुत्स्थम् scion of the Kakutstha dynasty (Rama), शोभयिष्यन्ति will enhance his lustre.

48_11.shloka: काननं वापि शैलं वा यं रामोऽधिगमिष्यति।प्रियातिथिमिव प्राप्तं नैनं शक्ष्यन्त्यनर्चितुम्।।2.48.11।।
48_11.translation: Whichever hill or forest Rama visits, people will receive him there like a welcome  guest and will not fail to render hospitality to him.
48_11.word_by_word: रामः Rama, यम् शैलं वा any hill, काननं वापि or forest, अधिगमिष्यति approaches, they, प्राप्तं  having arrived, प्रियातिथिम् इव like a welcome guest, एनम् him, अनर्चितुम् without extending hospitality, न शक्ष्यन्ति cannot.

48_12.shloka: विचित्रकुसुमापीडा बहुमञ्जरि धारिणः।राघवं दर्शयिष्यन्ति नगा भ्रमरशालिनः।।2.48.12।।
48_12.translation: Trees with bunches of cololurful flowers and clusters of blossoms hovering over with black bees will present themselves to the son of the Raghus (Rama).
48_12.word_by_word: विचित्रकुसुमापीडा bunches of colourful flowers, बहुमञ्जरिधारिणः wearing many clusters of blossoms, भ्रमरशालिनः with bees, नगाः trees, राघवम् Rama, दर्शयिष्यन्ति will present themselves.

48_13.shloka: अकाले चापि मुख्यानि पुष्पाणि च फलानि च।दर्शयिष्यन्त्यनुक्रोशाद्गिरयो राममागतम्।।2.48.13।।
48_13.translation: The hills will exhibit their excellent flowers and fruits off season out of compassion in order to welcome Rama.
48_13.word_by_word: गिरयः mountains, अनुक्रोशात् in sympathy, अकालेचापि even out of season, मुख्यानि excellent, पुष्पाणि flowers, फलानि च fruits also, आगतम् arrived, रामम् Rama, दर्शयिष्यन्ति will adornthemselves.

48_14.shloka: प्रस्रविष्यन्ति तोयानि विमलानि महीधराः।विदर्शयन्तो विविधान् भूयश्चित्रांश्च निर्झरान्।।2.48.14।।
48_14.translation: The mountains, displaying various wonderful streams here and there, will flow with pellucid waters (for Rama).
48_14.word_by_word: महीधराः mountains, विविधान् various, चित्रांश्च picturesque, निर्झरान् waterfalls, भूयः again and  again, विदर्शयन्तः showing, विमलानि pellucid, तोयानि water, प्रस्रविष्यन्ति will flow.

48_15.shloka: पादपाः पर्वताग्रेषु रमयिष्यन्ति राघवम्।यत्र रामो भयं नात्र नास्ति तत्र पराभवः।।2.48.15।।
48_15.translation: The trees on the mountain summits will enchant Rama. Where Rama goes, there will be no room for fear or dishonour.
48_15.word_by_word: पर्वताग्रेषु on mountain summits, पादपाः trees, राघवम् Rama, रमयिष्यन्ति will enchant, यत्र where, रामः Rama is, अत्र there, भयम् fear, न not, तत्र there, पराभवः disrespect, नास्ति not.

48_16.shloka: स हि शूरो महाबाहुः पुत्रो दशरथस्य च।पुरा भवति नोदूरादनुगच्छाम राघवम्।।2.48.16।।
48_16.translation: Before that valiant, strongarmed son of Dasaratha goes too far away (from us), we should follow him.
48_16.word_by_word: शूरः valiant, महाबाहुः strongarmed, दशरथस्य Dasaratha's, पुत्रः son, सः that Rama, नः for us, दूरात् from a distance, पुरा भवति before being away, राघवम् Rama, अनुगच्छाम will follow.

48_17.shloka: पादच्छाया सुखा भर्तुस्तादृशस्य महात्मनः।स हि नाथो जनस्यास्य स गति स्सपरायणम्।।2.48.17।।
48_17.translation: The shadow of the feet of this magnanimous lord will give us happiness. He alone is the goal and protector of all these people. He is the supreme refuge.
48_17.word_by_word: तादृशस्य such, महात्मनः magnanimous, भर्तुः master's, पादच्छाया shadow of his feet, सुखा is happy, अस्य of these, जनस्य people's, सः he alone, नाथ: हि is the protector, सः he, गतिःgoal, सः he, परायणम् supreme refuge.

48_18.shloka: वयं परिचरिष्यामः सीतां यूयं तु राघवम्।इति पौरस्त्रियो भर्तृ़न् दुखार्तास्तत्तदब्रुवन्।।2.48.18।।
48_18.translation: We will serve Sita. You will serve Rama. Such were the words of the distressed women of the city to their husbands. (They continued).
48_18.word_by_word: वयम् we, सीताम् Sita, परिचरिष्यामः will serve, यूयं तु you also, राघवम् to Rama, इति like this, पौरस्त्रियः women of the city, दुःखार्ताः distressed in sorrow, भर्तृ़न् to their husbands तत्तत् that kind of words, अब्रुवन् spoke.

48_19.shloka: युष्माकं राघवोऽरण्ये योगक्षेमं विधास्यति।सीता नारीजनस्यास्य योगक्षेमं करिष्यति।।2.48.19।।
48_19.translation: In the forest, Rama will look after your wellbeing and Sita will ensure our, women folk's security.
48_19.word_by_word: राघवः Rama, अरण्ये in the forest, युष्माकम् for you, योगक्षेमम् aquisition and protection of desired objects, विधास्यति will provide, सीता sita, अस्य (नारी) जनस्य of these (womenfolk), योगक्षेमम् security of possessions, करिष्यति will make.

48_20.shloka: को न्वनेनाऽप्रतीतेन सोत्कण्ठितजनेन च।सम्प्रियेतामनोज्ञेन वासेन हृतचेतसा।।2.48.20।।
48_20.translation: The people here are choked with grief. Who will like to stay here where life is disagreeable, cheerless, full of despondency and distress?
48_20.word_by_word: अप्रतीतेन disagreeable, सोत्कण्ठितजनेन च people who are choked with grief, अमनोज्ञेन not delighted, हृतचेतसा senses seized with distress, अनेन वासेन with this kind of living, कः नु who, सम्प्रियेत who will be pleased?

48_21.shloka: कैकेय्या यदि चे द्राज्यं स्यादधर्म्यमनाथवत्।न हि नो जीवितेनार्थः कुतः पुत्रैः कुतो धनैः।।2.48.21।।
48_21.translation: If Kaikeyi rules this kingdom unethically, we do not want to live here like orphans. What is the use of our progeny or property (in such a place)?
48_21.word_by_word: अधर्म्यम् unethically, अनाथवत् like orphans (unprotected), राज्यम् kingdom, कैकेय्याः to Kaikeyi, स्याद्यदि  if happens, नः for us, जीवितेन on this life, अर्थः purpose, न हि is not there, पुत्रैः by sons, कुतः what use?, धनैः with wealth, कुतः what use?

48_22.shloka: यया पुत्रश्च भर्ता च त्यक्तावैश्वर्यकारणात्।कं सा परिहरेदन्यं कैकेयी कुलपांसनी।।2.48.22।।
48_22.translation: Can Kaikeyi, who has brought disgrace to the race by abandoning her husband and son for the sake of wealth, spare others?
48_22.word_by_word: यया by whom, ऐश्वर्यकारणात् for the sake of wealth, पुत्रश्च son's, भर्ता च husband as well, त्यक्ता abandoned, कुलपांसनी a woman who is the disgrace to the race, सा कैकेयी that Kaikeyi, अन्यम् others, कम् whom, परिहरेत् will she spare?

48_23.shloka: कैकेय्या न वयं राज्ये भृतका निवसेमहि।जीवन्त्या जातु जीवन्त्यः पुत्रैरपि शपामहे।।2.48.23।।
48_23.translation: We swear on our sons that as long as Kaikeyi lives, or we live, we will never stay in her kingdom as servants.
48_23.word_by_word: कैकेय्याः Kaikeyi, जीवन्त्याः while she is alive, वयम् we, जीवन्त्यः living, राज्ये in this kingdom, भृतकाः as servants, जातु never, न निवसेमहि will not live, पुत्रैरपि on our sons also, शपामहे we swear.

48_24.shloka: या पुत्रं पार्थिवेन्द्रस्य प्रवासयति निर्घृणा।कस्तां प्राप्य सुखं जीवेदधर्म्यां दुष्टचारिणीम्।।2.48.24।।
48_24.translation: Who can live with pleasure under the rule of Kaikeyi of  unrighteous character and wicked behaviour, one who without compassion banished Rama, son of Dasaratha, king of kings?
48_24.word_by_word: या that Kaikeyi, निर्घृणा unkind, पार्थिवेन्द्रस्य king's, पुत्रम् son, प्रवासयति has banished, अधर्म्याम्  unrighteous, दुष्टचारिणीम् of wicked behaviour, ताम् her, प्राप्य having her (as a ruler), कः who, सुखम् with pleasure, जीवेत् will live?

48_25.shloka: उपद्रुतमिदं सर्वमनालम्बमनायकम्।कैकेय्या हि कृते सर्वं विनाशमुपयास्यति।।2.48.25।।
48_25.translation: The entire kingdom, for the sake of Kaikeyi, is under a great calamity. With no support or leader it will definitely go to ruin.
48_25.word_by_word: इदम् this, सर्वम् entire kingdom, उपद्रुतम् is affected by a great calamity, अनालम्बम् without support, अनायकम् without any leader, कैकेय्याः कृते for Kaikeyi, विनाशम् destruction, उपयास्यति will receive.

48_26.shloka: न हि प्रव्रजिते रामे जीविष्यति महीपतिः।मृते दशरथे व्यक्तं विलापस्तदनन्तरम्।।2.48.26।।
48_26.translation: Now that Rama has been banished, the king will not live (long). After his death there will be evidently only lamentations.
48_26.word_by_word: रामे Rama, प्रव्रजिते is banished, महीपतिः king, न जीविष्यति हि will not survive, दशरथे Dasaratha, मृते is dead, तदनन्तरम् after that,  विलापः lamentations, व्यक्तम् this is evident.

48_27.shloka: ते विषं पिबतालोड्य क्षीणपुण्या स्सुदुर्गताः।राघवं वानुगच्छध्वमश्रुतिं वापि गच्छत।।2.48.27।।
48_27.translation: Where you are in deep trouble with merits exhausted, it is better to take poison, or follow Rama or walk into the unknown.
48_27.word_by_word: क्षीणपुण्याः merits exhausted, सुदुर्गताः in deep troubles, ते you, विषम् poison, आलोड्य seeing this, पिबत drink, राघवं वा or Rama, अनुगच्छध्वम् follow, अश्रुतिं वा unseen (distant) place,  गच्छत go there.

48_28.shloka: मिथ्याप्रव्राजितो राम स्ससीत स्सहलक्ष्मणः।भरते सन्निसृष्टास्स्म स्सौनिके पशवो यथा।।2.48.28।।
48_28.translation: Rama along with Sita and Lakshmana has been deceitfully exiled and all of us delivered to Bharata like beasts to a butcher (for protection).
48_28.word_by_word: ससीतः along with Sita, सहलक्ष्मणः with Lakshmana, रामः Rama, मिथ्या deceitfully, प्रव्राजितः has been exiled, यथा पशवः like beasts, सौनिके to a butcher, भरते Bharata, सन्निसृष्टाः स्मः have been delivered.

48_29.shloka: पूर्णचन्द्रानन श्श्यामो गूढजत्रुररिन्दमः।आजानुबाहुः पद्माक्षो रामो लक्ष्मणपूर्वजः।।2.48.29।।पूर्वाभिभाषी मधुर स्सत्यवादी महाबलः।सौम्यस्सर्वस्य लोकस्य चन्द्रवत्प्रियदर्शनः।।2.48.30।।नूनं पुरुषशार्दूलो मत्तमातङ्गविक्रमः।शोभयिष्यत्यरण्यानि विचरन् स महारथः।।2.48.31।।
48_29.translation: Rama, elder brother to Lakshmana is a tiger among men, a subduer of enemies, powerful like an intoxicated elephant, and a great charioteer. Blue in complexion, he has a face like the full Moon. He has lotuslike eyes, kneelong arms and fleshy clavicles. Endowed with a sweet nature, he always speaks the truth and the first to speak to others. When he roams the forest, charming like the Moon and pleasing to the whole world, he will surely make it look graceful.
48_29.word_by_word: पूर्णचन्द्राननः a man with his countenance resembling the full moon, श्यामः bluehued,गूढजत्रुः with clavicles, अरिन्दमः subduer of enemies, अजानुबाहुः one with kneelong arms, पद्माक्षः lotuseyed, लक्ष्मण पूर्वजः the elder brother of Lakshmana, पूर्वाभिभाषी the first to address others, मधुरः sweetnatured, सत्यवादी one who always speaks the truth, महाबलः mighty, सौम्यः pleasing, सर्वस्य लोकस्य of the entire world, चन्द्रवत् like the Moon, प्रियदर्शनः of charming appearance, पुरुषशार्दूलः tiger among men, मत्तमातङ्गविक्रमः powerful like an intoxicated elephant, महारथ: great charioteer, स रामः that Rama, नूनम् certainly, अरण्यानि in the forest, विचरन् moving about, शोभयिष्यति will add grace.

48_30.shloka: तास्तथा विलपन्त्यस्तु नगरे नागरस्त्रियः।चुक्रुशु र्दुःखसन्तप्ता मृत्योरिव भयागमे।।2.48.32।।
48_30.translation: Such was the lamentation of the women of the city. Overcome with grief as if frightened at the approach of death, they wept bitterly.
48_30.word_by_word: नगरे in the city, ताः those, नागरस्त्रियः women of the city, तथा in that way, विलपन्त्यः lamenting, मृत्योः at the approach of death, भयागमे इव as if frightened, चुक्रुशुः wept र्दुःखसन्तप्ता affected with grief

48_31.shloka: इत्येवं विलपन्तीनां स्त्रीणां वेश्मसु राघवम्।जगामास्तं दिनकरो रजनी चाभ्यवर्तत।।2.48.33।।
48_31.translation: As the women of the city were thus lamenting over the scion of the Raghus (Rama) (sitting) at home, the sun set. Night fell.
48_31.word_by_word: वेश्मसु at home, स्त्रीणाम् women, इत्येवम् like this, राघवम् about Rama, विलपन्तीनाम्  while lamenting, दिनकरः sun, अस्तम् set, जगाम् reached, रजनी च night also, अभ्यवर्तत also arrived.

48_32.shloka: नष्टज्वलनसन्तापा प्रशान्ताध्यायसत्कथा।तिमिरेणाभिलिप्तेव सा तदा नगरी बभौ।।2.48.34।।
48_32.translation: With sacrificial fires extinguished and the reading of holy scriptures and sacred recitations stopped, Ayodhya looked as if besmeared with darkness.
48_32.word_by_word: तदा then, नष्टज्वलनसन्तापा with the (sacrificial) flames extinguished, प्रशान्ताध्यायसत्कथा with cessation of the study of holy scriptures and sacred recitations, सा नगरी that city, तिमिरेण in darkness, अभिलिप्तेव बभौ looked as if smeared.

48_33.translation: With markets closed, the city of Ayodhya cheerless and shelterless looked like the sky without stars.
48_33.word_by_word: उपशान्तवणिक्पण्या the markets of the traders remaining closed, नष्टहर्षा with delight destroyed, निराश्रया without support, अयोध्या नगरी city of Ayodhya, नष्टतारम् starless, अम्बरमिव sky, आसीत् appeared.

48_34.shloka: तथा स्त्रियो रामनिमित्तमातुरायथा सुते भ्रातरि वा विवासिते।विलप्य दीना रुरुदुर्विचेतसस्सूतैर्हि तासामधिको हि सोऽभवत्।।2.48.36।।
48_34.translation: The women grieved over Rama as if a son or a brother had been exiled. Depressed and distressed, they wept and sobbed. For them, Rama was indeed more than their sons.
48_34.word_by_word: स्त्रियः women, सुते when a  son, भ्रातरिवा or brother, विवासिते exiled, यथा तथा in the same manner, राम निमित्तम् for the sake of Rama, आतुराः grieving, दीनाः dejected, विचेतसः with troubled minds, विलप्य having lamented, रुरुदुः wept, तासाम् for them, सः Rama, सुतैः more than sons, अधिकः more, अभवत् हि became indeed.

48_35.shloka: प्रशान्तगीतोत्सवनृत्तवादनाव्यपास्तहर्षा पिहितापणोदया।तदा ह्ययोध्या नगरी बभूव सामहार्णव स्सङ्क्षपितोदको यथा।।2.48.37।।
48_35.translation: With the cessation of singing, celebrations, dance and music, there was no rejoicing in the city. The markets displaying merchandise were shut down. The city of Ayodhya looked like the ocean with its waters diminished.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे अष्टचत्वारिशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the fortyeighth sarga of Ayodhyakanda of  the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
48_35.word_by_word: प्रशान्तगीतोत्सवनृत्तवादना with cessation of singing, celebrations, dance and music,  व्यपास्तहर्षा pleasure expelled, पिहितापणोदया stalls without display merchandise, सा that, अयोध्या नगरी city of Ayodhya, तदा then, सङ्क्षपितोदकः waters diminished, महार्णवः ocean, यथा like that, बभूव became.

49_1.shloka: [Rama crosses the frontiers of the kingdom of Kosala -- crosses rivers Vedasruti and Gomatispeaks to Sumantra.]रामोऽपि रात्रिशेषेण तेनैव महदन्तरम्।जगाम पुरुषव्याघ्रः पितुराज्ञामनुस्मरन्।।2.49.1।।
49_1.translation: Recollecting his father's command, Rama, the foremost among men, covered a long distance during the remaining part of the night.
49_1.word_by_word: पुरुषव्याघ्रः foremost  among men, रामोऽपि Rama also, पितुः father's, आज्ञाम् command,  अनुस्मरन् recollecting, तेन by that, रात्रिशेषेणैव in the remaining part of the night, महत् vast, अन्तरम् distance, जगाम covered.

49_2.shloka: तथैव गच्छतस्तस्य व्यपायाद्रजनी शिवा।उपास्य शिवां सन्ध्यां विषयान्तं व्यगाहत।।2.49.2।।
49_2.translation: While Rama was thus travelling, the auspicious night ended. With the sandhya (morning twilight), worship over, he reached the frontiers of the country.
49_2.word_by_word: तस्य for him, तथा in that manner, गच्छतः एव thus travelling, शिवा auspicious, रजनी night, व्यपायात् ended, (सः he), शिवाम् auspicious, सन्ध्याम् sandhya (morning twilight), उपास्य having worshipped, विषयान्तम् frontiers of the country, व्यगाहत reached.

49_3.shloka: ग्रामान् विकृष्टसीमान्तान् पुष्पितानि वनानि च।पश्यन्नतिययौ शीघ्रं शनैरिव हयोत्तमैः।।2.49.3।।शृण्वन् वचो मनुष्याणां ग्रामसंवासवासिनाम्।
49_3.translation: Watching the villages furrowed at the outskirts, forests in blossom, hearing the gossips of the people living in the midst of villages, Rama felt he was moving very slowly whereas he had actually covered a long distance with those excellent (swift) horses.
49_3.word_by_word: विकृष्टसीमान्तान् ploughed outskirts, ग्रामान् villages, पुष्पितानि flowered, वनानि च forests, पश्यन् seeing, ग्रामसंवासवासिनाम् living in the midst of villages, मनुष्याणाम् of the people, वचः discussions, शृण्वन् hearing, हयोत्तमैः on those excellent horses, शीघ्रम् quickly travelling, शनैरिव as if going slowly, अतिययौ went a long distance.

49_4.shloka: राजानं धिग्दशरथं कामस्य वशमागतम्।।2.49.4।।हा नृशंसाद्य कैकेयी पापा पापानुबन्धिनी।तीक्ष्णा सम्भिन्नमर्यादा तीक्ष्णकर्मणि वर्तते।।2.49.5।।या पुत्रमीदृशं राज्ञः प्रवासयति धार्मिकम्।वनवासे महाप्राज्ञं सानुक्रोशं जितेन्द्रियम्।।2.49.6।।
49_4.translation: (The villagers were speaking among themselves) Fie on the king who is overtaken by passion Alas, the heartless, sinful Kaikeyi, indulging in evil has banished into the forest this prince who is righteous and sagacious, compassionate and selfrestrained. How could this cruel Kaikeyi, by breaking all limits of decorum resort to such atrocious action?
49_4.word_by_word: कामस्य to passion, वशमागतम् overtaken by, राजानम् king, दशरथम् Dasaratha, धिक् fie on him, हा what a pity, नृशंसा wicked, पापा sinful, कैकेयी Kaikeyi, अद्य now, पापानुबन्धिनी is committed to sins, या that Kaikeyi, धार्मिकम् righteous, महाप्राज्ञम् sagacious,  सानुक्रोशम् full of compassion, जितेन्द्रियम् one who has control over his senses, ईदृशम् such a person, राज्ञः पुत्रम् king's son, वनवासे to dwell in the forest, प्रवासयति has  banished, तीक्ष्णा cruel, सम्भिन्नमर्यादा breaking all limits of decency, तीक्ष्णकर्मणि in an  extremely cruel act, वर्तते is committed.

49_5.shloka: कथं नाम महाभागा सीता जनकनन्दिनी।सदा सुखेष्वभिरता दुःखान्यनुभविष्यति।।2.49.7।।
49_5.translation: How will Sita, highly fortunate daughter of Janaka and used to comforts endure these sufferings?
49_5.word_by_word: महाभागा highly fortunate, जनकनन्दिनी Janaka's daughter, सदा always, सुखेषु in luxury, अभिरता always attached, सीता  Sita, कथं नाम how, दुःखानि discomforts, अनुभविष्यति will experience.

49_6.shloka: अहो दशरथो राजा निस्नेहः स्वसुतं प्रियम्।प्रजानामनघं रामं परित्यक्तुमिहेच्छति।।2.49.8।।
49_6.translation: Alas, the loveless king Dasaratha now intends to abandon his own sinless son Rama who is dear to the subjects.
49_6.word_by_word: राजा king, दशरथः Dasaratha, स्वसुतम् own son, प्रजानाम् of the subjects, प्रियम् dear, अनघम् sinless, रामम् Rama, निस्नेहः without affection, इह here, परित्यक्तुम् to abandon, इच्छति wishes, अहो alas

49_7.shloka: एता वाचो मनुष्याणां ग्रामसंवासवासिनाम्।शृण्वन्नतिययौ वीरः कोसलान् कोसलेश्वरः।।2.49.9।।
49_7.translation: Such were the words of people living in villages and hamlets that Rama the valiant lord of Kosala happened to hear as he was crossing the boundaries of Kosala.
49_7.word_by_word: वीरः valiant, कोसलेश्वरः lord of Kosala Rama, ग्रामसंवासवासिनाम् living in villages and hamlets, मनुष्याणाम् people's, एताः these, वाचः words, शृण्वन् while listening, कोसलान्  boundaries of Kosala kingdom, अति ययौ crossed.

49_8.shloka: ततो वेदश्रुतिं नाम शिववारिवहां नदीम्।उत्तीर्याभिमुखः प्रायादगस्त्याध्युषितां दिशम्।।2.49.10।।
49_8.translation: He then crossed the river Vedasruti flowing with sacred waters and went in the southern direction where sage Agastya resided.
49_8.word_by_word: ततः thereafter, शिववारिवहाम् carrying the auspicious waters, वेदश्रुतिं नाम by nameVedasruti, नदीम् river, उत्तीर्य having crossed, अगस्त्याध्युषिताम् where Agastya was  residing, दिशम् quarter, अभिमुखः in the direction of, प्रायात् went.

49_9.shloka: गत्वा तु सुचिरं कालं ततः शीतजलां नदीम्।गोमतीं गोयुतानूपामतरत्सागरङ्गमाम्।।2.49.11।।
49_9.translation: Travelling for a long time along the river Gomati full of cool waters on whose marshy bank cows grazed, Rama crossed it at the point where it flows into the sea.
49_9.word_by_word: ततः then, सुचिरं कालम् for a long time, गत्वा having travelled, शीत जलाम् of cool waters, गोयुतानूपाम् cows abounding in marshy areas, सागरङ्गमाम् flowing into the sea, गोमतीम्  Gomati, नदीम् river, अतरत् crossed.

49_10.shloka: गोमतीं चाप्यतिक्रम्य राघवः शीघ्रगैर्हयैः।मयूरहंसाभिरुतां ततार स्यन्दिकां नदीम्।।2.49.12।।
49_10.translation: Gomati gone, Rama with the swiftmoving horses crossed the river Syandika echoing with the cries of peacocks and swans.
49_10.word_by_word: राघवः Rama, शीघ्रगैः with swiftmoving, हयैः with horses, गोमतीं चापि Gomati river also, अतिक्रम्य having crossed, मयूरहंसाभिरुताम् echoed with the cries of peacocks and swans,  स्यन्दिकाम् नदीम् river Syandika, ततार crossed.

49_11.shloka: स महीं मनुना राज्ञा दत्तामिक्ष्वाकवे पुरा।स्फीतां राष्ट्रावृतां रामो वैदेहीमन्वदर्शयत्।।2.49.13।।
49_11.translation: Rama showed Sita vast tracts of land encircled by kingdoms which were formerly bestowed upon Ikshvaku by emperor Manu.
49_11.word_by_word: सः रामः that Rama, पुरा formerly, राज्ञा by the king, मनुना by Manu, इक्ष्वाकवे to Ikshvaku, दत्ताम् bestowed, स्फीताम् vast tracts, राष्ट्रावृताम् encircled by  kingdoms, महीम् land, वैदेहीम् to Sita, अन्वदर्शयत् showed.

49_12.shloka: सूत इत्येव चाभाष्य सारथिं तमभीक्ष्णशः।हंसमत्तस्वरश्श्रीमानुवाच पुरुषर्षभः।।2.19.14।।
49_12.translation: Graceful Rama, best among men with a voice resembling that of an intoxicated swan, called the charioteer again and again and said:
49_12.word_by_word: हंसमत्तस्वरः resembling the intoxicated voice of swans, पुरुषर्षभः the best among men,श्रीमान् graceful, सूत इत्येव O charioteer saying so, तं सारथिम् that charioteer, अभीक्ष्णश: repeatedly, आभाष्य having uttered, उवाच said.

49_13.shloka: कदाऽहं पुनरागम्य सरय्वा पुष्पिते वने।मृगयां पर्यटिष्यामि मात्रा पित्रा च सङ्गतः।।2.49.15।।
49_13.translation: When shall I return and reunite with my father and mother and go hunting in the blooming forest on the bank of the river Sarayu?
49_13.word_by_word: अहम् I, पुनः again, आगम्य having returned, मात्रा with mother, पित्रा च also with father, सङ्गतः united with, सरय्वा: Sarayu river's, पुष्पिते blossoming, वने groves, मृगयाम् hunting, कदा when, पर्यटिष्यामि I shall roam about.

49_14.translation: In this world, hunting is a unique pleasure. It is regarded as a delightful sport forroyal sages. But I do not have a great longing for hunting in the forest on the bank of river Sarayu.
49_14.word_by_word: एषा this hunting, लोके in this world, अतुला incomparable, राजर्षिगणसम्मता is accepted by royal sages, रतिर्हि is delightful (sport indeed), सरयूवने in the Sarayu forest of, मृगयाम् hunting, अत्यर्थम् greatly, नाभिकाङ्क्षामि do not desire.

49_15.shloka: राजर्षीणां हि लोकेऽस्मिन् रत्यर्थं मृगया वने।काले कृतां तां मनुजैर्घन्विनामभिकाङ्क्षिताम्।।2.49.17।।
49_15.translation: In this world, hunting in the woods is a pleasure for royal sages and is greatly sought after by bowmen. This was later resorted to by others.
49_15.word_by_word: अस्मिन् in this, लोके world, वने in the woods, मृगया hunting, राजर्षीणाम् of royal sages, रत्यर्थं हि is for their pleasure, मनुजैः by people, काले in appropriate times, कृताम् is undertaken,धन्विनाम् for the bowmen, अभिकाङ्क्षिताम् a sought after one, ताम् that (hunting I do not seek.)

49_16.shloka: स तमध्वानमैक्ष्वाकस्सूतं मधुरया गिरा।तं तमर्थमभिप्रेत्य ययौ वाक्यमुदीरयन्।।2.49.18।।
49_16.translation: The descendant of Ikshvaku related to the charioteer in a sweet voice the thoughts that came to him and went on the way (continued his journey).इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे एकोनपञ्चाशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the fortyninth sarga of Ayodhyakanda of  the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
49_16.word_by_word: सः ऐक्ष्वाकः that descendant of Ikshvaku, Rama, तम् that, सूतम् to charioteer, मधुरया in sweet, गिरा words, तम् तम् these and other, अर्थम् thoughts, अभिप्रेत्य regarding, वाक्यम् words, उदीरयन् pronouncing, अध्वानम् the path, ययौ went (covered).

50_1.shloka: [Rama reaches Srngiberapura on the bank of the Ganga--Guha, chief of the nishadas welcomes Rama.]विशालान् कोसलान् रम्यान् यात्वा लक्ष्मणपूर्वजः।अयोध्याभिमुखो धीमान् प्राञ्जलिर्वाक्यमब्रवीत्।।2.50.1।।
50_1.translation: Having crossed the vast, beautiful kingdom of Kosala, the sagacious elder brother of Lakshmana stood facing Ayodhya with folded palms and said:
50_1.word_by_word: लक्ष्मणपूर्वजः Lakshmana's elder brother, धीमान् sagacious, रम्यान् beautiful, विशालान् vast, कोसलान् kingdom of Kosala, यात्वा  gone beyond, अयोध्याभिमुखः facing Ayodhya, प्राञ्जलिः with folded hands, वाक्यम् these words, अब्रवीत् spoke.

50_2.shloka: आपृच्छे त्वां पुरीश्रेष्ठे काकुत्स्थपरिपालिते।दैवतानि च यानि त्वां पालयन्ति वसन्ति च।।2.50.2।।
50_2.translation: O Ayodhya, the best of cities ruled by those born in the Kakutstha race I take leave of you and of all those gods inhabiting and guarding you.
50_2.word_by_word: काकुत्स्थपरिपालिते a city ruled by the Kakutsthas, पुरीश्रेष्ठे best among cities, त्वाम् you, यानि दैवतानि all those gods, वसन्ति inhabiting, पालयन्ति च are guarding  you also, आपृच्छे I am taking leave.

50_3.shloka: निवृत्तवनवासस्त्वामनृणो जगतीपतेः।पुनर्द्रक्ष्यामि मात्रा च पित्रा च सह सङ्गतः।।2.50.3।।
50_3.translation: On completion of exile and my filial obligations to king Dasaratha, lord of the world, discharged, I shall, reunited with my parents, see you again.
50_3.word_by_word: जगतीपतेः lord of the world (king Dasaratha), अनृणः free from debt, निवृत्तवनवासः having completed forest life, मात्रा च with mother, पित्रा च with father, सङ्गतः reunited, त्वाम्  you, पुनः again, द्रक्ष्यामि will see.

50_4.shloka: ततो रुधिरताम्राक्षो भुजमुद्यम्य दक्षिणम्।अश्रुपूर्णमुखो दीनोऽब्रवीज्जानपदं जनम्।।2.50.4।।
50_4.translation: He looked miserable, his copperred eyes filled with tears. He raised his right handand said to the villagers who had come to see him:
50_4.word_by_word: ततः then, अश्रुपूर्णमुखः face filled with tears, रुधिरताम्राक्षः eyes copperred, दीनः dejected, दक्षिणम् right, भुजम् arm, उद्यम्य having raised, जानपदम् pertaining to villages, जनम् people, अब्रवीत् said.

50_5.shloka: अनुक्रोशो दया चैव यथार्हं मयि वः कृतः।चिरं दुःखस्य पापीयो गम्यतामर्थसिद्धये।।2.50.5।।
50_5.translation: You have aptly shown your kindness and compassion to me. It is not proper to prolong one's grief. So do go and altend to your duties.
50_5.word_by_word: मयि in me, यथार्हम् appropriately, वः to you, दया चैव kindness, अनुक्रोशः compassion, कृतः  has been done, दुःखस्य of suffering, चिरम् for long, पापीयः is sinful, अर्थसिद्धये to discharge your duties, गम्यताम् go.

50_6.shloka: तेऽभिवाद्य महात्मानं कृत्वा चापि प्रदक्षिणम्।विलपन्तो नरा घोरं व्यतिष्ठन्त क्वचित् क्वचित्।।2.50.6।।
50_6.translation: All of them paid their homage by circumambulating the highsouled Rama. Cryingbitterly, they stood here and there.
50_6.word_by_word: ते नराः those people, महात्मानम् highsouled, अभिवाद्य having paid respect, प्रदक्षिणं चापि circumambulation, कृत्वा having made, घोरम् frightfully, विलपन्तः  lamenting, क्वचित् क्वचित् hither and thither, व्यतिष्ठन्त stood (looking at him).

50_7.shloka: तथा विलपतां तेषामतृप्तानां च राघवः।अचक्षुर्विषयं प्रायाद्यथार्कः क्षणदामुखे।।2.50.7।।
50_7.translation: Not yet satisfied (they wanted to linger longer), they stood weeping, while Rama went out of sight just as the Sun disappears at nightfall.
50_7.word_by_word: अतृप्तानाम् not satisfied, तेषाम् them, तथा in that manner, विलपताम् lamenting, राघवः Rama, क्षणदामुखे at nightfall, अर्कः the Sun, यथा like that, अचक्षुर्विषयम् out of sight, प्रायात् went.

50_8.shloka: ततो धान्यधनोपेतान् दानशीलजनान् शिवान्।अकुतश्चिद्भयान् रम्यांश्चैत्ययूपसमावृतान्।।2.50.8।।उद्यानाम्रवनोपेतान् सम्पन्नसलिलाशयान्।तुष्टपुष्टजनाकीर्णान् गोकुलाकुलसेवितान्।।2.50.9।।लक्षणीयान्नरेन्द्राणां ब्रह्मघोषाभिनादितान्।रथेन पुरुषव्याघ्रः कोसलानत्यवर्तत।।2.50.10।।
50_8.translation: Rama, the best  of men, crossed the auspicious land of Kosala which was worth seeing by kings. It looked charming with sacrificial posts and altars, pleasure gardens and mango groves and tanks filled with water. It was rich with herds ofcattle, wealth and foodgrains. It was inhabited by charitable, contented and wellnourished people free from fear from any quarter. And it reverberated with the sounds of Vedic recitations.
50_8.word_by_word: ततः then, पुरुषव्याघ्रः tiger (best) among men (Rama), धान्यधनोपेतान् rich in wealth and foodgrain, दानशीलजनान् with charitable people, शिवान् auspicious, अकुतश्चिद्भयान् free from fear, रम्यान् charming, चैत्ययूपसमावृतान् surrounded by sacrificial altars and posts, उद्यानाम्रवनोपेतान् filled with pleasure gardens and mango groves, सम्पन्नसलिलाशयान् tanks filled with water, तुष्टपुष्टजनाकीर्णान् full of contented and wellnourished people, गोकुलाकुलसेवितान् with herds of cattle, नरेन्द्राणाम् for kings, लक्षणीयान् fit to be seen, ब्रह्मघोषाभिनादितान् echoed with the sounds of Vedic recitations, कोसलान् Kosala kingdom, रथेन by the chariot, अत्यवर्तत crossed over.

50_9.shloka: मध्येनमुदितं स्फीतं रम्योद्यानसमाकुलम्।राज्यं भोग्यं नरेन्द्राणां ययौ धृतिमतां वरः।।2.50.11।।
50_9.translation: Rama, the greatest among those endowed with fortitude, travelled through themiddle of the kingdom which was pleasing, prosperous and full of ravishing gardens fit to be enjoyed by kings.
50_9.word_by_word: धृतिमताम् among those endowed with fortitude, वरः best, मुदितम् pleased, स्फीतम्  prosperous, रम्योद्यानसमाकुलम् full of ravishing gardens, नरेन्द्राणाम् of kings, भोग्यम् fit to be enjoyed, राज्यम् of that kingdom, मध्येन in its middle, ययौ went.

50_10.shloka: तत स्त्रिपथगां दिव्यां शिवतोयामशैवलाम्।ददर्श राघवो गङ्गां पुण्यामृषिनिषेविताम्।।2.50.12।।
50_10.translation: There Rama saw the holy Ganga flowing in three (worlds) with her sacred waters, free from moss, and worshipped by sages.
50_10.word_by_word: तत्र there, राघवः Rama, त्रिपथगाम् flowing in three worlds, रम्याम् beautiful, शिवतोयाम् sacred waters, आशैवलाम् free from moss, पुण्याम् holy, ऋषिसेविताम्  worshipped by sages, गङ्गाम् Ganga, ददर्श saw.

50_11.translation: The holy Ganga, adorned with graceful hermitages situated not far away is visited at times by delightful nymphs who sport in her lakes.
50_11.word_by_word: अविदूरस्थैः by those situated not far away, श्रीमद्भिः by the graceful, आश्रमैः by hermitages, समलङ्कृताम् adorned with, काले at times, हृष्टाभिः delightful, अप्सरोभिः by nymphs, सेविताम्भोह्रदाम् sport in her lakes, शिवाम् auspicious  (Ganga).

50_12.translation: The Ganga is graced by devatas, danavas, gandharvas and kinneras. Wives of several gandharvas always visit this auspicious river.
50_12.word_by_word: देवदानवगन्धर्वैः by devatas, danavas, and gandharvas, किन्नरैः by kinneras, उपशोभिताम्  looking splendid, नानागन्धर्वपत्नीभिः by wives of several gandharvas, सततम् always, सेविताम्, inhabited, शिवाम् auspicious(Ganga).

50_13.translation: Since this river flows through heavens for the gods, it is wellknown as 'Devapadmini' where celestial lotuses grow. The river embraces hundreds of hills serving as sporting places and pleasuregardens for gods.
50_13.word_by_word: देवाऽऽक्रीडशताकीर्णां filled with hundreds of hills serving as sporting places for devatas देवोद्यानशतायुताम् hundreds of pleasuregardens for devatas, देवार्थम् for the sake of devatas, आकाशगमाम् flowing through heaven, देवपद्मिनीम् as Devapadmini, where celestial lotuses grow, विख्याताम् is wellknown.

50_14.translation: The sound of dashing waters of the Ganga is like her laughter and the foam like her sparkling smile. Here she flows straight like the braid of a maiden and there in whirlpools.
50_14.word_by_word: जलाघाताट्टहासोग्राम् ferocious with the sound of dashing waters resembling loud laughter, फेननिर्मलहासिनीम् with the sparkling smile of foam, क्वचित् at some places, वेणीकृतजलाम्  with waters flowing straight like a maiden's braid, क्वचित् at some places, आवर्तशोभिताम् shining with whirlpools.

50_15.translation: Here the Ganga runs deep but quiet, there she looks perturbed due to fastflowing waters, here she flows with a deep groan and there with a dreadful roar.
50_15.word_by_word: क्वचित् at places, स्तिमितगम्भीराम् was deep and quiet, क्वचित् at places, वेगजलाकुलाम् perturbed due to fastflowing waters, क्वचित् at places, गम्भीरनिर्घोषाम् making majestic sound, क्वचित् at some place, भैरवनिस्वनाम् makes dreadful sounds.

50_16.translation: Here hosts of celestials take their ablutions and there she shines with lilies of pure blue. Here her banks are curved and there her bed is dotted with patches of white sand.
50_16.word_by_word: देवसङ्घाप्लुतजलाम् in the waters of which hosts of celestials take ablutions, निर्मलोत्पलशोभिताम् decked with pure blue lilies, क्वचित् at some places, अभोगपुलिनाम् with curved banks, क्वचित् at some places, निर्मलवालुकाम् white sands.

50_17.translation: The river reverberates with the cries of swans, cranes and chakravakas (ruddy goose). It rings intermittently with the chirpings of birds charged with endless pasison.
50_17.word_by_word: हंससारससङ्घुष्टाम् reverberating with cries of swans and cranes, चक्रवाकोपकूजिताम् filled with cries of chakravakas (ruddy geese), सदामदैः विहगैः always filled with passionate birds, अभिसन्नादितान्तराम् filled with sounds at intervals.

50_18.translation: Here on her banks stand trees adorned as though with garlands, and there in her waters abound fullblown lilies and a forest of lotuses.
50_18.word_by_word: क्वचित् at some places,तीररुहैः grown on the banks,वृक्षैः with trees, मालाभिरिव like  garlands,शोभिताम् decorated, क्वचित् at some places, फुल्लोत्पलच्छन्नाम् covered with fulblown waterlilies, क्वचित् at some places, पद्मवनाकुलाम् spread with multitudes of lotuses.

50_19.translation: Here she is decked with hosts of waterlilies and halfblown flowers while elsewhere she looks intoxicated with the pollen fallen from various flowers.
50_19.word_by_word: क्वचित् at some places, कुमुदषण्डैश्च with hosts of waterlilies,  कुड्मलैः halfblown flowers, उपशोभिताम् adorned, नानापुष्परजोध्वस्ताम् pollen from different kinds of flowers, क्वचित् in some places, समदाम् इव as if intoxicated with passion.

50_20.translation: The river, cleansed of heaps of impurities, appears like a transparent gem. The interiors of forests on her banks always resounds with the trumpeting of mighty, intoxicated, wild elephants guarding the quarters, fit to be the vehicles of gods.
50_20.word_by_word: व्यपेतमलसङ्घाताम् cleansed of heaps of impurities, मणिनिर्मलदर्शनाम् appearing like atransparent gem, दिशागजैः by the elephants gaurding the quarters, मत्तैश्च by intoxicated ones, वनगजैः wild elephants, देवोपवाहैः by those suitable for carrying gods,  वरवारणैः with excellent elephants, मुहुः repeatedly, सन्नादितवनान्तराम् resounding in the interiors of the forest.

50_21.shloka: प्रमदामिव यत्नेन भूषितां भूषणोत्तमैः।।2.50.23।।फलैः पुष्पैः किसलयैर्वृतां गुल्मैर्द्विजैस्तथा।शिंशुमारैश्च नक्रैश्च भुजङ्गैश्च निषेविताम्।।2.50.24।।
50_21.translation: Just like a lady, Ganga is decorated with the best of ornaments her banks are filled with fruits, flowers, tender leaves or shoots and (flowering) shrubs. It is inhabited by birds and brahmins and infested with sisumaras (small whales), crocodiles and serpents.
50_21.word_by_word: फलैः with fruits, पुष्पैः with flowers, किसलयैः with tender leaves or shoots, गुल्मैः with shrubs, तथा similarly, द्विजैः with birds, वृताम् encompassed, भूषणोत्तमैः with excellent ornaments, यत्नेन carefully, भूषिताम् decorated, प्रमदामिव like a woman,  शिंशुमारैश्च small whales, नक्रैश्च with crocodiles, भुजङ्गैश्च with serpents, निषेविताम् is served.

50_22.shloka: विष्णुपादच्युतां दिव्यामपापां पापनाशिनीम्।तां शङ्करजटाजूटाद्भ्रष्टां सागरतेजसा।।2.50.25।।समुद्रमहिषीं गङ्गां सारसक्रौञ्चनादिताम्।आससाद महाबाहुः शृङ्गिबेरपुरं प्रति।।2.50.26।।
50_22.translation: Mightyarmed Rama reached Srngaberapura on the bank of this consort of the ocean, this Ganga loud with the cries of kraunchas and herons. This sinless, divine Ganga, destroyer of sins who flows from the feet of lord Visnu and by the effulgence (penance) of Sagara's son (Bhagiratha) emerged from the matted locks of lord Siva.
50_22.word_by_word: महाबाहुः mightyarmed, विष्णुपादच्युताम् dropped from the feet of lord Visnu, दिव्याम् divine, अपापाम् sinless, पापनाशिनीम् destroyer of sins, सागरतेजसा due to the effulgence (penance) of Sagara's son (Bhagiratha), शङ्कर जटाजूटात् from the matted hair of lord Siva, भ्रष्टाम्dropped, समुद्रमहिषीम् consort of the Ocean, सारसक्रौञ्चनादिताम् echoed with the cries of kraunchas and herons, तां गङ्गाम् that Ganga, शृङ्गिबेरपुरं प्रति towards Srngiberapura, आससाद reached.

50_23.translation: Beholding river Ganga full of waves and whirlpools, the great chariotwarrior (Rama) said to Sumantra: We shall spend the night here.
50_23.word_by_word: महारथः great chariotwarrior, ऊर्मिकलिलावर्ताम् river full of tumultuous waves with  whirlpools, ताम् that, अन्ववेक्ष्य on beholding, सूतम् charioteer, सुमन्त्रम् Sumantra, अब्रवीत् said, अद्य today, अत्रैव here itself, वसामहे will spend.

50_24.translation: O charioteer there is a very large ingudi (almond) tree not far from the river, luxuriant with flowers and budding leaves. We shall stay there tonight.
50_24.word_by_word: सारथे O charioteer, नद्याः river's, अविदूरात् not far from, बहुपुष्पप्रवालवान् having many flowers and budding leaves, सुमहान् very large, अयम् this, इङ्गुदीवृक्षः Ingudi tree, अत्रैव here itself, वसामः shall stay.

50_25.translation: We shall watch Ganga, the best among rivers, whose holy waters are respected by gods, demons, gandharvas, beasts, serpents, men and birds alike.
50_25.word_by_word: देवदानवगन्धर्वमृगमानुषपक्षिणाम् for devas, danavas, gandharvas, beasts, serpents, men and birds, शिवाम् auspicious one, सम्मान्यसलिलाम् a river of venerable (holy) waters, सरितां श्रेष्ठाम्  best among rivers, द्रक्ष्यामः we shall see.

50_26.shloka: लक्ष्मणश्च सुमन्त्रश्च बाढमित्येव राघवम्।उक्त्वा तमिङ्गुदीवृक्षं तदोपययतुर्हयैः।।2.50.30।।
50_26.translation: Lakshmana and Sumantra agreed with Rama, saying 'Be it so' and turned the horses towards that ingudi tree.
50_26.word_by_word: लक्ष्मणश्च Lakshmana, सुमन्त्रश्च Sumantra, राघवम् Rama, बाढमित्येव 'Be it so', उक्त्वा   saying, तदा then, हयैः with horses, तम् that, इङ्गुदीवृक्षम् ingudi tree, उपययतुः bothapproached.

50_27.translation: Rama, delight of the Ikshvakus, along with his consort and Lakshmana reached that beautiful tree and alighted from the chariot.
50_27.word_by_word: इक्ष्वाकुनन्दनः the delight of the Ikshvakus, रामः Rama, रम्यम् beautiful, तं वृक्षम् that tree, अभियाय having reached, सभार्यः with his consort, सहलक्ष्मणः with Lakshmana, तस्मात्  from that, रथात् chariot, अवातरत् alighted.

50_28.translation: Sumantra also got off the chariot, unyoked the horses and with folded palms stood near Rama who had already reached the foot of the tree.
50_28.word_by_word: सुमन्त्रोऽपि Sumantra also, अस्मात् from that chariot, अवतीर्य having alighted, हयोत्तमान् the best of horses, मोचयित्वा having unyoked, कृताञ्जलिः with folded palms, वृक्षमूलगतम् sittingat the foot of the tree, रामम् Rama, उपतस्थे stood near.

50_29.shloka: तत्र राजा गुहो नाम रामस्यात्मसमस्सखा।निषादजात्यो बलवान् स्थपतिश्चेति विश्रुतः।।2.50.33।।
50_29.translation: There lived the mighty king Guha who was born in the race of nishadas (hunters) and became famous as their lord. He was a friend to Rama who was like his own self.
50_29.word_by_word: तत्र there, रामस्य to Rama, आत्मसमः like his own self, सखा friend, निषादजात्यः hunter by  race, बलवान् powerful, स्थपतिश्चेति lord of nishada tribe, विश्रुतः wellknown, गुहो नाम Guha by name, राजा king.

50_30.shloka: स शृत्वा पुरुषव्याघ्रं रामं विषयमागतम्।वृद्धैः परिवृतोऽमात्यैः ज्ञातिभिश्चाभ्युपागतः।।2.50.34।।
50_30.translation: Having come to know that Rama, the best among men, had arrived in his region Guha accompanied by senior ministers and people of his clan came to greet him.
50_30.word_by_word: सः he, पुरुषव्याघ्रम् (best) among men, रामम् Rama, विषयम् to his region, आगतम् having arrived, शृत्वा having heard, वृध्दै: by the aged, अमात्यैः by the ministers, ज्ञातिभिश्च by the people of his clan, परिवृतः surrounded by, अभ्युपागतः approached him.

50_31.shloka: ततो निषादाधिपतिं दृष्ट्वा दूरादुपस्थितम्।सह सौमित्रिणा राम स्समागच्छद्गुहेन सः।।2.50.35।।
50_31.translation: When Rama and Lakshmana saw from a distance that Guha, king of the nishadas, was approaching them, they went forward to receive him.
50_31.word_by_word: ततः then, उपस्थितम् approaching, निषादाधिपतिं king of the nishadas, दूरात् from a distance, दृष्ट्वा having seen, सौमित्रिणा सह along with Lakshmana, सः रामः that Rama, गुहेन with Guha, समागच्छत् went forward.

50_32.shloka: तमार्तस्सम्परिष्वज्य गुहो राघवमब्रवीत्।यथाऽयोध्या तथेयं ते राम किं करवाणि ते।।2.50.36।।ईदृशं हि महाबाहो कः प्राप्स्यत्यतिथिं प्रियम्।
50_32.translation: Overwhelmed with grief (to see Rama in bark), Guha embraced Rama and said This is just like Ayodhya to you. What can I do for you? O mightyarmed Rama, who can have the good fortune of receiving  such a beloved guest like you?
50_32.word_by_word: आर्तः in anguish, गुहः Guha, तं राघवम् to Rama, सम्परिष्वज्य having embraced, अब्रवीत्  said, राम O Rama, ते to you, अयोध्या Ayodhya, यथा as how,  इयम् this city, तथा like that, ते to you, किम् what, करवाणि shall I do?, महाबाहो O mightyarmed one, ईदृशम् such, प्रियम्  beloved, अतिथिम् guest, कः who, प्राप्स्यति will get.

50_33.shloka: ततो गुणवदन्नाद्यमुपादाय पृथग्विधम्।।2.50.37।।अर्घ्यं चोपानयत्क्षिप्रं वाक्यं चेदमुवाच ह।
50_33.translation: Thereafter he quickly brought rice and various kinds of tasty food and drink as welcome offerings and said to him:
50_33.word_by_word: ततः thereafter, पृथग्विधम् various kinds of, गुणवत् of good quality, अन्नाद्यम् rice and other eatables, उपादाय having brought, क्षिप्रम् quickly, अर्घ्यं च drinks also, उपानयत् he brought, इदम् वाक्यं च these words, उवाच ह also spoke.

50_34.shloka: स्वागतं ते महाबाहो तवेयमखिला मही।।2.50.38।।वयं प्रेष्या भवान्भर्ता साधु राज्यं प्रशाधि नः।
50_34.translation: O mightyarmed prince, welcome to you This entire land belongs to you. You are our master and we, your servants. Rule this kingdom happily.
50_34.word_by_word: महाबाहो O mightyarmed one, ते to you, स्वागतम् welcome, अखिला entire, इयं मही this land, तव is yours, वयम् we, प्रेष्याः are attendants, भवान् you, भर्ता master, नः for us, राज्यम् thiskingdom, साधु worthy of, प्रशाधि rule.

50_35.shloka: भक्ष्यं भोज्यं च पेयं च लेह्यंचेदमुपस्थितम्।।2.50.39।।शयनानि च मुख्यानि वाजिनां खादनं च ते।
50_35.translation: All kinds of food to be taken by biting, chewing, drinking and licking are here for you. There is an excellent bed ready. There are also enough fodder for the horses.
50_35.word_by_word: भक्ष्यम् food to be eaten by biting, भोज्यम् food to be eaten by chewing, पेयम् food fit for drinking, लेह्यं च food fit for licking, मुख्यानि excellent, शयनानि beds, ते for you,  वाजिनाम् for horses, खादनं च also fodder, इदम् here, उपस्थितम् awaits.

50_36.shloka: एवं ब्रुवाणं तु गुहं राघवः प्रत्युवाच ह।।2.50.40।।अर्चिताश्चैव हृष्टाश्च भवता सर्वथा वयम्।पद्भ्यामभिगमाच्चैव स्नेहसन्दर्शनेन च।।2.50.41।।
50_36.translation: Hearing (the words of) Guha, Rama replied By coming on foot to meet us and by displaying your friendliness, you have amply honoured us and pleased us.
50_36.word_by_word: एवम् in this way, ब्रुवाणम् speaking, गुहम् to Guha, राघवः Rama, प्रत्युवाच ह replied, वयम् we, सर्वथा in every way, भवता by you, पद्भ्याम् on foot, अभिगमाच्चैव coming to meet  us, स्नेहसन्दर्शनने च showing your friendliness, अर्चिताश्चैव we have been worshipped,  हृष्टाश्च also pleased.

50_37.shloka: भुजाभ्यां साधु पीनाभ्यां पीडयन्वाक्यमब्रवीत्।।दिष्ट्या त्वां गुह पश्यामि ह्यरोगं सह बान्धवैः।अपि ते कुशलं राष्ट्रे मित्रेषु च धनेषु च।।2.50.42।।
50_37.translation: Rama embracing him tightly with his strong arms said, O Guha it is fortunate that I am able to see you and your relations in good health. Hope, all is well with your friends, kingdom and (collection of) revenue.
50_37.word_by_word: पीनाभ्याम् strong, भुजाभ्याम् with his arms, साधु tightly, पीडयन् pressing together, वाक्यम् words, अब्रवीत् said, गुह O Guha, दिष्ट्या luckily, सह बान्धवै: with all relations, अरोगम् hale and hearty, त्वाम् you, पश्यामि am seeing, ते your, राष्ट्रे kingdom, मित्रेषु in friends, धनेषु च wealth also, अपि कुशलम् (hope) all is well.

50_38.shloka: यत्त्विदं भवता किञ्चित्प्रीत्या समुपकल्पितम्।सर्वं तदनुजानामि न हि वर्ते प्रतिग्रहे।।2.50.43।।
50_38.translation: I must give you back whatever you have offered me so affectionately. I am not in a position to accept anything.
50_38.word_by_word: भवता by you, प्रीत्या with affection, इदम् now, यत् किञ्चित् whatever, समुकल्पितम् has been arranged, तत् सर्वम् all that, अनुजानामि I am accepting (giving you back), प्रतिग्रहे in acceptance, न वर्ते हि unable.

50_39.shloka: कुशचीराजिनधरं फलमूलाशिनं च माम्।विद्धि प्रणिहितं धर्मे तापसं वनगोचरम्।।2.50.44।।
50_39.translation: You must know me as an ascetic devoted to righeousness,and as a wanderer in the forest wearing garments made of bark, kusa grass and antelope skin, subsisting on fruits and roots.
50_39.word_by_word: माम् me, कुशचीराजिनधरम् wearing garments made of bark, kusa grass and antelope skin, फलमूलाशिनम् susbsisting on fruits and roots, धर्मे in righteousness, प्रणिहितम् initiated, वनगोचरम् wandering in the forest, तापसम् like an ascetic, विद्धि you may know.

50_40.shloka: अश्वानां खादनेनाहमर्थी नान्येन केनचित्।एतावताऽत्र भवता भविष्यामि सुपूजितः।।2.50.45।।
50_40.translation: What I now need is fodder for the horses. Nothing more. If you can do this much, I'll deem it a great honour.
50_40.word_by_word: अहम् I, अश्वानाम् for horses, खादनेन with fodder, अर्थी I am a seeker, अन्येन by other thing, केनचित् with any one, न not, अत्र here, एतावता to this extent, भवता by you, सुपूजितः wellhonoured, भविष्यामि shall become.

50_41.shloka: एते हि दयिता राज्ञः पितुर्दशरथस्य मे।एतैस्सुविहितैरश्वै भविष्याम्यहमर्चितः।।2.50.46।।
50_41.translation: If these horses which are the favourites of my father, king Dasaratha are wellfed, I shall consider myself honoured.
50_41.word_by_word: एते these horses, मे पितुः my father's, दशरथस्य राज्ञः king Dasaratha's, दयिताः liked, सुविहितैः welltended, एतैः by these, अश्वैः with horses, अहम् I, अर्चितः worshipped,  भविष्यामि shall become.

50_42.shloka: अश्वानां प्रतिपानं च खादनं चैव सोऽन्वशात्।गुहस्तत्रैव पुरुषां स्त्वरितं दीयतामिति।।2.50.47।।
50_42.translation: Guha ordered the men standing there Give these horses liquids like water and forage.
50_42.word_by_word: सः that, गुहः Guha, तत्रैव there itself, पुरुषान् men, अश्वानाम् for the horses, प्रतिपानं च liquids like water, खादनं चैव forage, त्वरितम् quickly, दीयतामिति be given, अन्वशात् ordered.

50_43.shloka: ततश्चीरोत्तरासङ्गः सन्ध्यामन्वास्य पश्चिमाम्।जलमेवाददे भोज्यं लक्ष्मणेनाऽऽहृतं स्वयम्।।2.50.48।।
50_43.translation: Rama wearing the upper garment then offered oblations to Sandhya and partook of only water as refreshment, brought by Lakshmana.
50_43.word_by_word: ततः then, चीरोत्तरासङ्ग: upper robe, पश्चिमां सन्ध्याम् Sandhya,  अन्वास्य offering oblations,लक्ष्मणेन by Lakshmana, स्वयम् himself, आहृतम् which has been brought, जलमेव water only, भोज्यम् as food, आददे partook.

50_44.shloka: तस्य भूमौ शयानस्य पादौ प्रक्षाल्य लक्ष्मणः।सभार्यस्य ततोऽभ्येत्य तस्थौ वृक्षमुपाश्रितः।।2.50.49।।
50_44.translation: Lakshmana washed the feet of Rama who along with his consort lay upon the ground, and returned to take rest under the tree.
50_44.word_by_word: लक्ष्मणः Lakshmana, भूमौ on the ground, शयानस्य for sleeping, सभार्यस्य with his consort, तस्य his, पादौ feet, प्रक्षाल्य having washed, ततः then, अभ्येत्य having gone towards, वृक्षम् tree, उपाश्रितः took refuge, तस्थौ he stood.

50_45.shloka: गुहोऽपि सह सूतेन सौमित्रिमनुभाषयन्।अन्वजाग्रत्ततो राममप्रमत्तो धनुर्धरः।।2.50.50।।
50_45.translation: Guha, bow in hand, conversing with Sumantra and Soumitri (Son of Sumitra, Lakshmana) then kept vigil over Rama by remaining awake (all night).
50_45.word_by_word: गुहोऽपि Guha also, सूतेन सह along with the charioteer, सौमित्रिम् to Lakshmana, अनुभाषयन् while talking, ततः then, धनुर्धरः bow in hand, अप्रमत्तः by being vigilant, रामम् about Rama, अन्वजाग्रत् kept awake.

50_46.shloka: तथा शयानस्य ततोऽस्य धीमतोयशस्विनो दाशरथेर्महात्मनः।अदृष्टदुःखस्य सुखोचितस्य सातदाव्यतीयाय चिरेण शर्वरी।।2.50.51।।
50_46.translation: As the wise, illustrious, magnanimous son of Dasaratha (Rama) who was used to pleasures and not discomfort lay on the ground, the long night slipped away.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे पञ्चाशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the fiftieth sarga of Ayodhyakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
50_46.word_by_word: ततः then, अदृष्टदुःखस्य one who never experienced troubles, सुखोचितस्य used to comforts, धीमतः sagacious, यशस्विनः illustrious, महात्मनः magnanimous, तदा then, तथा like that, शयानस्य lying down, अस्य दाशरथेः for this son of Dasaratha (Rama), सा that, शर्वरी  night, चिरेण as of long duration, व्यतीयाय passed.

51_1.shloka: [Lakshmana tells Guha about events which might overtake Ayodhya after Rama's exile]तं जाग्रतमदम्भेन भ्रातुरर्थाय लक्ष्मणम्।गुहः सन्तापसन्तप्तो राघवं वाक्यमब्रवीत्।।2.51.1।।
51_1.translation: Deeply moved to see Lakshmana, scion of the Raghus, keeping awake all night without any pretence for his brother's sake, Guha spoke.
51_1.word_by_word: गुहः Guha, भ्रातुः brother, अर्थाय for the sake of, जाग्रतम् keeping awake, राघवम् Raghava born in the family of the Raghus, तं लक्ष्मणम् to that Lakshmana, अदम्भेन without any pretence, सन्तापसन्तप्तः tormented with grief, वाक्यम् these words, अब्रवीत् said.

51_2.shloka: इयं तात सुखा शय्या त्वदर्थमुपकल्पिता।प्रत्याश्वसिहि साध्वस्यां राजपुत्र यथासुखम्।।2.51.2।।
51_2.translation: O dear prince this comfortable bed has been arranged for you. Rest happily on this bed.
51_2.word_by_word: तात O dear, इयम् this, सुखा comfortable, शय्या bed, त्वदर्थम् for your sake, उपकल्पिता has been arranged, राजपुत्र O prince, अस्याम् on this, यथासुखम् comfortably, साधु well, प्रत्याश्वसि हि take rest.

51_3.shloka: उचितोऽयं जनस्सर्वः क्लेशानां त्वं सुखोचितः।गुप्त्यर्थं जागरिष्यामः काकुत्स्थस्य वयं निशाम्।।2.51.3।।
51_3.translation: We are used to all kinds of suffering and you, to comfort. We will keep vigil during the night for the protection of Rama, descendant of the Kakutsthas.
51_3.word_by_word: सर्वः all, अयं जनः these people, myself, क्लेशानाम् for all kinds of suffering, उचितः accustomed, त्वम् you, सुखोचितः accustomed to comforts, काकुत्स्थस्य for Ramadescendant of the Kakutsthas, गुप्त्यर्थंम् for the sake of protection, वयम् we, निशाम् allnight, जागरिष्यामः will keep awake.

51_4.shloka: न हि रामात्प्रियतमो ममास्ति भुवि कश्चन।ब्रवीम्येतदहं सत्यं सत्येनैव च ते शपे।।2.51.4।।
51_4.translation: For me, there is none dearer than Rama in this world. I speak the truth. I swear by truth.
51_4.word_by_word: मम for me, रामात् more than Rama, प्रियतमः dearer, कश्चन none, भुवि in this world, नास्ति हि not there, अहम् I, एतत् this one, सत्यम् true, ब्रवीमि I am saying, सत्येनैव by word of truth, ते to you, शपे I swear.

51_5.shloka: अस्य प्रसादादाशंसे लोकेस्मिन् सुमुहद्यशः।धर्मावाप्तिं च विपुलामर्थावाप्तिं च केवलम्।।2.51.5।।
51_5.translation: I am seeking supreme fame in this world through the attainment of dharma and acquisition of abundant artha by the grace of Rama alone.
51_5.word_by_word: अस्य by this Rama's, प्रसादात् grace, अस्मिन् in this, लोके world, सुमहत् supreme, यशः fame, धर्मावाप्तिं च attainment of dharma, विपुलाम् abundantly, अर्थावाप्तिं च and also acquisition of artha (wealth), केवलम् alone, आशंसे I am seeking.

51_6.shloka: सोऽहं प्रियसखं रामं शयानं सह सीतया।रक्षिष्यामि धनुष्पाणि स्सर्वतो ज्ञातिभि स्सह।।2.51.6।।
51_6.translation: I along with my kinsmen, bow in hand, will protect my dear friend, Rama with Sita from every side.
51_6.word_by_word: सः such, अहम् I, ज्ञातिभिः with kinsmen, सह along with, धनुष्पाणिः bow in hand, सीतया सह along with sita, शयानम् resting, प्रियसखं dear friend, रामम् Rama, सर्वतः from every side,  रक्षिष्यामि I will protect.

51_7.shloka: न हि मेऽविदितं किञ्चिद्वनेऽस्मिंश्चरतस्सदा।चतुरङ्गं ह्यपिबलं सुमहत्प्रसहेमहि।।2.51.7।।
51_7.translation: Wandering about in this forest all the time there is nothing unknown to me (here). We can withstand even  a vast army of four divisions.
51_7.word_by_word: सदा always, अस्मिन् वने in this forest, चरतः while wandering, मे to me, अविदितम् unknown, किञ्चित् nothing, न हि not there, सुमहत् vast, चतुरङ्गम् four divisions of army, बलम् अपि army also, प्रसहेमहि will endure.

51_8.shloka: लक्ष्मणस्तं तदोवाच रक्ष्यमाणास्त्वयानघ।नात्र भीता वयं सर्वे धर्ममेवानुपश्यता।।2.51.8।।
51_8.translation: Lakshmana said to Guha, O sinless one when all of us are under your righteous protection we have nothing to fear.
51_8.word_by_word: तदा then, लक्ष्मणः Lakshmana, तम् to Guha, उवाच adressed, अनघ O Sinless me, धर्ममेव rigteousness, अनुपश्यता keeping in view, त्वया by you, रक्ष्यमाणाः being protected, वयं सर्वे all of us, अत्र here, न not, भीताः afraid of.

51_9.shloka: कथं दशरथौ भूमौ शयाने सह सीतया।शक्या निद्रा मया लब्धुं जीवितं वा सुखानि वा।।2.51.9।।
51_9.translation: When Rama, son of Dasaratha, sleeps on the ground with Sita how can I sleep orlive or enjoy pleasures?
51_9.word_by_word: दाशरथौ while the son of Dasaratha, सीतया सह along with Sita, भूमौ on the ground, शयाने is sleeping, मया by me, निद्रा sleep, जीवितं वा or life, सुखानि वा or pleasures, लब्धुम् to acquire, कथम् how, शक्या is it possible?

51_10.shloka: यो न देवासुरैः सर्वैः शक्यः प्रसहितुं युधि।तं पश्य सुखसंविष्टं तृणेषु सह सीतया।।2.51.10।।
51_10.translation: Look at that Rama whom all the gods and demons cannot face in war sleeps so comfortably on the grass with Sita.
51_10.word_by_word: यः who, युधि in war, सर्वैः by all, देवासुरैः gods and demons, प्रसहितुम् to face him, न शक्यः not possible, सीतया सह with sita, तृणेषु on the blades of grass, सुखसंविष्टम् sleeping comfortably, तम् that Rama, पश्य see.

51_11.shloka: यो मन्त्रतपसा लब्धो विविधैश्च पराश्रमैः।एको दशरथस्येष्टः पुत्रः सदृशलक्षणः।।2.51.11।।अस्मिन् प्रव्राजिते राजा न चिरं वर्तयिष्यति।विधवा मेदिनी नूनं क्षिप्रमेव भविष्यति।।2.51.12।।
51_11.translation: This favourite son of Dasaratha who has similar traits like his father was born after he rigorously practised austerities accompanied by (Vedic) mantras. When he is banished, the king will not live long. Surely this land will soon be widowed.
51_11.word_by_word: यः whoever, दशरथस्य Dasaratha's, सदृशलक्षणः similar traits, एकः only, इष्टः favourite one, मन्त्रतपसा with austerities accompanied by mantras, विविधैश्च various, पराश्रमैः with much efforts, लब्धः obtained, पुत्रः son, अस्मिन् this (Rama), प्रव्राजिते is banished, राजा king, चिरम् for long, न वर्तयिष्यति not live, नूनम् certainly, मदिनां earth क्षिप्रमिव quickly, विधवा widow, भविष्यति will become.

51_12.shloka: विनद्य सुमहानादं श्रमेणोपरताः स्त्रियः।निर्घोषोपरतं चातो मन्ये राजनिवेशनम्।।2.51.13।।
51_12.translation: All the women having cried so much must have quietened down out of sheer exhaustion. That is why perhaps the sounds from the royal palace have ceased.
51_12.word_by_word: स्त्रियः women, सुमहानादम् loud sound, विनद्य having raised, श्रमेण because of exhaustion,उपरताः ceased, अतः for that reason, राजनिवेशनम् king's palace, निर्घोषोपरतम् sounds have ceased, मन्ये I consider.

51_13.shloka: कौशल्या चैव राजा च तथैव जननी मम।नाशंसे यदि जीवन्ति सर्वे ते शर्वरीमिमाम्।।2.51.14।।
51_13.translation: I doubt whether all of them -- the king, Kausalya and my mother -- can survive this night.
51_13.word_by_word: कौशल्या चैव Kausalya also, राजा च and the king, तथैव in the same way, मम जननी my mother, ते सर्वे all of them, इमाम् this, शर्वरीम् night, यदि जीवन्ति if they live, नाशंसे I do not expect.

51_14.shloka: जीवेदपि हि मे माता शत्रुघ्नस्यान्ववेक्षया।तद्दुःखं यत्तु कौशल्या वीरसूर्विनशिष्यति।।2.51.15।।
51_14.translation: My mother may live looking forward to Satrughna. But, alas Kausalya may die, separated from her valiant son.
51_14.word_by_word: शत्रुघ्नस्य Satrughna's, अन्ववेक्षया looking forward, मे माता my mother, जीवेदपि हि if at all may live, वीरसूः valiant son, कौशल्या Kausalya, यत् विनशिष्यति if she perishes, तत् that one, दुःखम् is a sorrowful thing.

51_15.translation: That city (of Ayodhya) is full of loyal people. It brings them happiness. It is dear to them. It will perish due to the sad demise of the king.
51_15.word_by_word: अनुरक्तजनाकीर्णा filled with loyal people, सुखा causing pleasure, लोकप्रियावहा that brings happiness to the people, सा पुरी that city, राजव्यसनसंसृष्टा overtaken by sorrow due to thedeath of the king, विनशिष्यति will perish.

51_16.shloka: कथं पुत्रं महात्मानं ज्येष्ठं प्रियमपश्यतः।शरीरं धारयिष्यन्ति प्राणा राज्ञो महात्मनः।।2.51.17।।
51_16.translation: How can the noble king survive unable to see his highsouled, beloved, eldest son?
51_16.word_by_word: महात्मानम् great one, ज्येष्ठम् eldest, प्रियम् beloved, पुत्रम् son, अपश्यतः unable to see, महात्मनः noble, राज्ञः king's, प्राणाः vital air, शरीरम् body, कथम् how?, धारयिष्यन्ति will he hold.

51_17.shloka: विनष्टे नृपतौ पश्चात्कौसल्या विनशिष्यति।अनन्तरं च माताऽपि मम नाशमुपैष्यति।।2.51.18।।
51_17.translation: Subsequent to the death of the king, Kausalya will die and my mother will follow her.
51_17.word_by_word: नृपतौ when the king, विनष्टे dies, पश्चात् following that, कौशल्या Kausalya, विनशिष्यति will also die, अनन्तरं च after that, मम मातापि my mother, नाशम् destruction, उपैष्यति will attain.

51_18.shloka: अतिक्रान्तमतिक्रान्तमनवाप्य मनोरथम्।राज्ये राममनिक्षिप्य पिता मे विनशिष्यति।।2.51.19।।
51_18.translation: Past is past (irreversible). My father, brooding over his desire of installing Rama as king unfulfilled, will perish.
51_18.word_by_word: मे पिता my father, अतिक्रान्तमतिक्रान्तम् past is past, मनोरथम् his desire, अनवाप्य without fulfilling, राज्ये in the kingdom, रामम् Rama, अनिक्षिप्य without installing, विनशिष्यति will die.

51_19.shloka: सिद्धार्थाः पितरं वृत्तं तस्मिन्कालेऽप्युपस्थिते।प्रेतकार्येषु सर्वेषु संस्करिष्यन्ति भूमिपम्।।2.51.20।।
51_19.translation: Those who will remain present around the king, my father, at the time of his death and perform the funeral rites have their desires fulfilled (for they could attend the king's obsequies).
51_19.word_by_word: तस्मिन् at that, काले time indeed, उपस्थिते present, सिध्दार्थाः those who accomplished their purpose, वृत्तम् laid in that state, पितरम् father, भूमिपम् lord of the land, king, सर्वेषु for all, प्रेतकार्येषु funeral rites, संस्करिष्यन्ति will perform.

51_20.shloka: रम्यचत्वरसंस्थानां सुविभक्तमहापथाम्।हर्म्यप्रासादसम्पन्नाम् गणिकावरशोभिताम्।।2.51.21।।रथाश्वगजसम्बाधां तूर्यनादविनादिताम्।सर्वकल्याणसम्पूर्णां हृष्टपुष्टजनाकुलाम्।।2.51.22।।आरामोद्यानसम्पन्नां समाजोत्सवशालिनीम्।सुखिता विचरिष्यन्ति राजधानीं पितुर्मम।।2.51.23।।
51_20.translation: They will roam about happily in the capital city of my father with its lovely squares, wellaligned broad highways, its mansions and palaces, full of chariots, elephants, horses. It will be echoing with the sound of trumpets. It will be full of the welfare of all. It will be graced by the fairest of courtesans. Filled with wellnourished and contented people, the city dotted with several pleasuregardens and parks, will looksplendid with community festivals and fairs.
51_20.word_by_word: रम्यचत्वरसंस्थानाम् with lovely squares laid, सुविभक्तमहापथाम् wellaligned broad highways, हर्म्यप्रासादसम्पन्नाम् rich with mansions and palaces, गणिकावरशोभिताम् graced with the fairest of courtesans, रथाश्वगजसम्बाधाम् thronged with chariots, elephants and horses, तूर्यनादविनादिताम् echoed with the sounds of trumpets, सर्वकल्याणसम्पूर्णाम् with the welfare of all, हृष्टपुष्टजनाकुलाम् filled with wellnourished and contended people, आरामोद्यानसम्पन्नाम् endowed with pleasure gardens and parks, समाजोत्सवशालिनीम् splendid with community festivals, मम पितुः my father's, राजधानीम् capital city, सुखिताः happily, विचरिष्यन्ति will be going about.

51_21.shloka: अपि जीवेद्दशरथो वनवासात्पुनर्वयम्।प्रत्यागम्य महात्मानमपि पश्येम सुव्रतम्।।2.51.24।।
51_21.translation: Will the king be still alive? Will we see the noble king again on our return from exile after the fulfilment of his vows?
51_21.word_by_word: दशरथः Dasaratha, अपि जीवेत् if lives, वयम् we, वनवासात् from our exile, प्रत्यागम्य on return, सुव्रतम् observing vows, महात्मानम् magnanimous, पुनः again, अपि पश्येम will we see him?

51_22.shloka: अपि सत्यप्रतिज्ञेन सार्धं कुशलिना वयम्।निवृत्ते वनवासेऽस्मिन्नयोध्यां प्रविशेमहि।।2.51.25।।
51_22.translation: Will we ever be able, after completion of the exile, to enter the city of Ayodhya along with Rama who is true to his promise?
51_22.word_by_word: अस्मिन् this (Rama), निवृत्तवनवासे after completion of the exile, कुशलिना safe, सत्यप्रतिज्ञेन सार्धं with him who is always true to his promise, वयम् we, अयोध्याम् Ayodhya, अपि प्रविशेमहि will enter?

51_23.shloka: परिदेवयमानस्य दुखार्तस्य महात्मनः।तिष्ठतो राजपुत्रस्य शर्वरी साऽत्यवर्तत।।2.51.26।।
51_23.translation: While that noble prince (Lakshmana), tormented with grief, stood thus wailing, the night passed off.
51_23.word_by_word: महात्मनः of the highsouled, दुःखार्तस्य tormented with grief, राजपुत्रस्य of the prince, परिदेवयमानस्य while he was wailing, तिष्ठतः standing by, सा शर्वरी that night, अत्यवर्तत passed away.

51_24.shloka: तथा हि सत्यं ब्रुवति प्रजाहितेनरेन्द्रपुत्रे गुरुसौहृदाद्गुहः।मुमोच बाष्पं व्यसनाभिपीडितोज्वरातुरो नाग इव व्यथातुरः।।2.51.27।।
51_24.translation: Out of great friendship with Guha, Lakshmana thus told the true story of prince (Rama) in the interest of his subject (Guha). (On hearing it) Guha was deeply afflicted with grief and pain and began shedding tears like an elephant suffering from fever.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्यकाण्डे एकपञ्चाश स्सर्गः।।Thus ends the fiftyfirst sarga of Ayodhyakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
51_24.word_by_word: प्रजाहिते seeking the wellfare of people, नरेन्द्रपुत्रे king'son, गुरुसौहृदात् out of great friendship, तथा like that, सत्यम् truth ब्रुवति telling, गुहः Guha, व्यथातुरः afflicted, व्यसनाभिपीडितः overcome with grief, ज्वरातुरः feverstricken, नागः इव like elephant, बाष्पम् tears, मुमोच shed.

52_1.shloka: [Guha arranges a boat to help Rama, Lakshmana and Sita cross Ganga  Rama asks Sumantra to return to Ayodhya and serve the king  Sita worships Ganga for the safe return from exile.]प्रभातायां तु शर्वर्यां पृथुवक्षा महायशाः।उवाच रामः सौमित्रिं लक्ष्मणं शुभलक्षणम्।।2.52.1।।
