52_1.translation: As the night advanced towards dawn, broadchested Rama of great renown said to Lakshmana, son of Sumitra, who had auspicious marks on his body:
52_1.word_by_word: शर्वर्याम् after the night passed, प्रभातायां तु at dawn, पृथुवक्षाः broadchested, महायशाः of great fame, रामः Rama, शुभलक्षणम् of auspicious signs (on his body), सौमित्रिम्  Sumitra'sson, लक्ष्मणम् Lakshmana, उवाच said.

52_2.shloka: भास्करोदयकालोऽयं गता भगवती निशा।असौ सुकृष्णो विहगः कोकिलस्तात कूजति।।2.52.2।।
52_2.translation: O dear Lakshmana the holy night is over and it is time for sunrise. The deep dark bird, the cuckoo is singing.
52_2.word_by_word: तात dear Lakshmana, अयम् now it is, भास्करोदयकालः time for sunrise, भगवती venerable, निशा night, गता is over, सुकृष्ण: deep dark, विहगः bird, असौ कोकिलः cuckoo, कूजति is singing.

52_3.shloka: बर्हिणानां च निर्घोषः श्रूयते नदतां वने।तराम जाह्नवीं सौम्य शीघ्रगां सागरङ्गमाम्।।2.52.3।।
52_3.translation: Listen to the screams of the peacocks in the forest. The Ganga is flowing fast to merge in the sea. We need to cross it.
52_3.word_by_word: वने forest, नदताम् screaming, बर्हिणानाम् of the peacocks, निर्घोषः sound, श्रूयते heard, सौम्य handsome, शीघ्रगाम् flowing rapidly, सागरङ्गमाम् to merge in the sea, जाह्नवीम् to Ganga,तराम need to cross.

52_4.shloka: विज्ञाय रामस्य वचः सौमित्रिर्मित्रनन्दनः।गुहमामन्त्र्य सूतं च सोऽतिष्ठद्भ्रातुरग्रतः।।2.52.4।।
52_4.translation: In response to Rama's desire, Lakshmana, son of Sumitra, one who brings joy to his friends, called Guha and the charioteer (Sumantra) and stood before his brother.
52_4.word_by_word: मित्रनन्दनः one who keeps his friends happy, सः सौमित्रि: that Lakshmana the son of Sumitra, रामस्य Rama's, वचः words, विज्ञाय knowing, गुहम् to Guha, सूतं च to the charioteer also, आमन्त्र्य calling, भ्रातुः brother's, अग्रतः in front, अतिष्ठत् stood.

52_5.shloka: स तु रामस्य वचनं निशम्य प्रतिगृह्य च।स्थपतिस्तूर्णमाहूय सचिवानिदमब्रवीत्।।2.52.5।।
52_5.translation: Having heard and accepted Rama's proposal, the king of the nisadas called his ministers at once and said:
52_5.word_by_word: सः स्थपतिः that king (of the nisadas), रामस्य Rama's, वचनम् words, निशम्य having heard, प्रतिगृह्य च accepting (the proposal), तूर्णम् quickly, सचिवान् ministers, आहूय calling, इदम् these words, अब्रवीत् said.

52_6.shloka: अस्य वाहनसंयुक्तां कर्णग्राहवतीं शुभाम्।सुप्रतारां दृढां तीर्थे शीघ्रं नावमुपाहर।।2.52.6।।
52_6.translation: Get quickly to the sacred bank (of  Ganga) a strong, auspicious boat equipped with rowing rods and helmsmen who can help cross the river with ease
52_6.word_by_word: वाहनसंयुक्ताम् along with the boat, कर्णग्राहवतीम् with  helmsmen, शुभाम् auspicious, सुप्रताराम् with a rowing rod, दृढाम् strong, नावम् boat, शीघ्रम् swiftly, अस्य with one who can row the boat, तीर्थे to the sacred bank (of Ganga), उपाहर fetch.

52_7.shloka: तं निशम्य समादेशं गुहामात्यगणो महान्।उपोह्य रुचिरां नावं गुहाय प्रत्यवेदयत्।।2.52.7।।
52_7.translation: The ministers heard the orders, soon brought  a beautiful boat and informed Guha (that his orders have been carried out).
52_7.word_by_word: महान् great, गुहामात्यगणः ministers of Guha, तम् his, समादेशम् order, निशम्य having heard, रुचिराम् beautiful, नावम् boat, उपोह्य having brought, गुहाय to Guha, प्रत्यवेदयत् informed.

52_8.shloka: ततः स प्राञ्जलिर्भूत्वा गुहो राघवमब्रवीत्।उपस्थितेयं नौर्देव भूयः किं करवाणि ते।।2.52.8।।
52_8.translation: Then Guha with folded palms said to Rama: O king, the boat ready. Tell me what else can I do for you.
52_8.word_by_word: ततः then, सः गुहः that Guha, प्राञ्जलि: भूत्वा with folded hands, राघवम् to Rama, अब्रवीत् said, देवः O king, इयम् this, नौः boat, उपस्थिता is kept here, ते for you, भूयः agian, किम् what, करवाणि I will do?

52_9.shloka: तवामरसुतप्रख्य तर्तुं सागरगां नदीम्।नौरियं पुरुषव्याघ्र तां त्वमारोह सुव्रत।।2.52.9।।
52_9.translation: O best among men, renowned like a god's son and constantly engaged in vows, here is the boat for you to cross the Ganga flowing into the sea. Do board it.
52_9.word_by_word: पुरुषव्याघ्र tiger among men, अमरसुतप्रख्य reputed like a god's son, सागरगाम् flowing to the sea, नदीम् river, तर्तुम् to cross, तव your, इयम् this, नौः boat, सुव्रत engaged in vows, त्वम् you, ताम् that,  आरोह climb up.

52_10.shloka: अथोवाच महातेजा रामो गुहमिदं वचः।कृतकामोऽस्मि भवता शीघ्रमारोप्यतामिति।।2.52.10।।
52_10.translation: Thereafter the radiant Rama said to Guha, You have fulfilled my desire. Keep all our belongings in the boat.
52_10.word_by_word: अथ thereafter, महातेजाः luminous, रामः Rama, गुहम्, to Guha इदम् these, वचः words, उवाच said, भवता through you, कृतकामः accomplished the work, अस्मि am, शीघ्रम् quickly, आरोप्यताम् getting on to the boat.

52_11.shloka: ततः कलापान् सन्नह्य खड्गौ बध्वा च धन्विनौ।जग्मतुर्येन तौ गङ्गां सीतया सह राघवौ।।2.52.11।।
52_11.translation: Rama and Lakshmana then put on their quivers, fastened their swords and holding their bows went towards Ganga along with Sita.
52_11.word_by_word: ततः then, तौ राघवौ Rama and Lakshmana, सीतया सह with Sita, कलापान् quivers, सन्नह्य having tied, खड्गौ च swords, बध्वा wearing, धन्विनौ holding the bows, येन गङ्गाम् towards Ganga, जग्मतुः went on.

52_12.shloka: राममेव तु धर्मज्ञमुपगम्य विनीतवत्।किमहं करवाणीति सूतः प्राञ्जलिरब्रवीत्।।2.52.12।।
52_12.translation: The charioteer (Sumantra) approached the righteous Rama and asked him with folded hands: What can I do?
52_12.word_by_word: सूतः charioteer, प्राञ्जलि: with folded hands, विनीतवत् humbly, धर्मज्ञम् righteous, राममेव तु near Rama, उपगम्य going towards, अहम् I, किम् what, करवाणि do you want me to do , इति this, अब्रवीत् asked.

52_13.shloka: ततोऽब्रवीद्दाशरथिः सुमन्त्रंस्पृशन् करेणोत्तमदक्षिणेन।सुमन्त्र शीघ्रं पुनरेव याहिराज्ञः सकाशे भव चाप्रमत्तः।।2.52.13।।
52_13.translation: Rama then caressed  Sumantra with his right hand and said, Sumantra, go back immediately and never be inattentive in serving the king.
52_13.word_by_word: ततः then, दाशरथिः son of Dasaratha (Rama), सुमन्त्रम्  to Sumantra, उत्तमदक्षिणेन with his right hand, करेण  स्पृशन् touching, अब्रवीत् said, सुमन्त्र Sumantra, पुनरेव again, शीघ्रम् immediately, याहि proceed, राज्ञः सकाशे to the king, अप्रमत्तः च inattentive in looking after, भव be.

52_14.shloka: निवर्तस्वेत्युवाचैव ह्येतावद्धि कृतं मम।रथं विहाय पद्भ्यां तु गमिष्यामि महावनम्।।2.52.14।।
52_14.translation: You have done enough. I shall now leave the chariot and walk into the great forest.
52_14.word_by_word: मम myself, एतावत् till here, कृतं हि brought, निवर्तस्व return, रथम् chariot, विहाय leaving, पद्भ्याम् on foot, महावनम् the great forest, गमिष्यामि wiill go, इति this, उवाच said.

52_15.translation: Having been permitted to go, Sumantra, the distressed charioteer, said to Rama, the best among men, and a descendant of the Ikshvaku race:
52_15.word_by_word: सारथिः charioteer, सः सुमन्त्रः Sumantra, आत्मानम् self, अभ्यनुज्ञातम् permitted to go, अवेक्षय having seen, आर्तः pained, पुरुषव्याघ्रम् (best) among men, इक्ष्वाकम् of the Ikshvakus, इदम् this, अब्रवीत् said.

52_16.shloka: नातिक्रान्तमिदं लोके पुरुषेणेह केनचित्।तव सभ्रातृभार्यस्य वासः प्राकृतवद्वने।।2.52.16।।
52_16.translation: None else in this world would be able to live in the forest as you have resolved to, like a common man, along with your brother and spouse.
52_16.word_by_word: सभ्रातृभार्यस्य of one with brother and wife, तव your, प्राकृतवत् like a common man, वने in the forest, वासः residing, इदम् this, इह लोके in this world, केनचित् पुरुषेण by any person, नातिक्रान्तम् not overcome.

52_17.shloka: न मन्ये ब्रह्मचर्येऽस्ति स्वधीते वा फलोदयः।मार्दवार्जवयोर्वापि त्वां चेद्व्यसनमागतम्।।2.52.17।।
52_17.translation: If your celibacy and your grief are the consequences of your study of the Vedic lore, your compassionate nature and simplicity of character, I think there is no use of all these (virtues).
52_17.word_by_word: त्वाम् to you, व्यसनम् grief, आगतं चेत् has come, ब्रह्मचर्ये celibacy, स्वधीते वा learning the Vedas, मार्दवार्जवयोर्वापि compassionate and pure, फलोदयः this is the result, नास्ति no use, मन्ये I think so.

52_18.shloka: सह राघव वैदेह्या भ्रात्रा चैव वने वसन्।त्वं गतिं प्राप्स्यसे वीर त्रीन् लोकांस्तु जयन्निव।।2.52.18।।
52_18.translation: Valiant scion of the Raghus dwelling in the forest along with Vaidehi (Sita) and brother Lakshmana you will attain the status as if you have won the three worlds.
52_18.word_by_word: वीर valiant, राघव scion of the Raghu race (Rama), त्वम् you, वैदेह्या सह with Vaidehi, भ्रात्रा चैव and brother, वने forest, वसन् residing, त्रीन् three, लोकान् worlds, जयन्निव as if winning, गतिम् good status, प्राप्स्यसे will acquire.

52_19.shloka: वयं खलु हता राम ये त्वयाप्युपवञ्चिताः।कैकेय्या वशमेष्यामः पापाया दुःखभागिनः।।2.52.19।।
52_19.translation: Deprived of you, O Rama we will come under the control of that sinful Kaikeyi. We will suffer and die.
52_19.word_by_word: राम Rama, वयम् we, हताः खलु are destroyed, ये by, त्वयापि you also, उपवञ्चिताः deprived of, दुःखभागिनः full of sorrow, पापायाः sinful, कैकेय्याः Kaikeyi, वशम् under the control, एष्यामः caught up like that.

52_20.shloka: इति ब्रुवन्नात्मसमं सुमन्त्रः सारथिस्तदा।दृष्ट्वा दूरगतं रामं दुःखार्तो रुरुदे चिरम्।।2.52.20।।
52_20.translation: Rama was like his (Sumantra's) own self. When Sumantra, the charioteer, saw that  Rama was preparing to go afar for a long time, he started weeping aloud in deep distress.
52_20.word_by_word: तदा then, सारथिः charioteer, सुमन्त्रः Sumantra, इति thus, ब्रुवन् saying, दूरगतम् gone afar, आत्मसमम् like his own self, रामम् Rama, दृष्ट्वा seeing, दुःखार्तः agonised, चिरम् long time, रुरुदे cried.

52_21.shloka: ततस्तु विगते बाष्पे सूतं स्पृष्टोदकं शुचिम्।रामस्तु मधुरं वाक्यं पुनः पुनरुवाच तम्।।2.52.21।।
52_21.translation: After the flow of tears ceased Sumantra took a sip of water and became sanctified. Then Rama addressed him with sweet words over and over again:
52_21.word_by_word: ततः then, बाष्पे tears, विगते shedding, स्पृष्टोदकम् taking a sip of water, शुचिम् pure, तं सूतम् to that charioteer, रामस्तु Rama, पुनः पुनः again and again, मधुरम् sweet, वाक्यम् words, उवाच said.

52_22.shloka: इक्ष्वाकूणां त्वया तुल्यं सुहृदं नोपलक्षये।यथा दशरथो राजा मां न शोचेत्तथा कुरु।।2.52.22।।
52_22.translation: I find none else like you as friendly as you are to the Ikshvaku race. So do whatever you like  to see that king Dasaratha does not brood over me.
52_22.word_by_word: इक्ष्वाकूणाम् of the Ikshvaku family, त्वया you, तुल्यम् like, सुहृदम् friend, नोपलक्षये do not see, राजा king, दशरथः Dasaratha, माम् me, यथा as, न शोचेत् not think, तथा like that, कुरु you do.

52_23.translation: I tell you this because the lord of the earth (Dasaratha), is in deep distress. He is old. And he is under the control of his passion.
52_23.word_by_word: जगतीपतिः lord of the world (Dasaratha), शोकोपहतचेताश्च consciousness overwhelmed with grief, वृद्धश्च and old also, कामभावावसन्नश्च full of passion, तस्मात् therefore, ते to you, एतत् all this, ब्रवीमि  I am telling.

52_24.shloka: यद्यदाज्ञापयेत्किञ्चित्स महात्मा महीपतिः।कैकेय्याः प्रियकामार्थं कार्यं तदविकाङ्क्षया।।2.52.24।।
52_24.translation: To make Kaikeyi  happy, do whatever little the great king Dasaratha orders you to do.
52_24.word_by_word: महात्मा great, सः that, महीपतिः king Dasaratha, यद्यत् in that way, किञ्चित् a little, कैकेय्याः Kaikeyi, प्रियकामार्थम् to make happy, आज्ञापयेत् orders, तत् that, अविकाङ्क्षया all that, कार्यम् tasks be done.

52_25.shloka: एतदर्थं हि राज्यानि प्रशासति नरेश्वराः।यदेषां सर्वकृत्येषु मनो न प्रतिहन्यते।।2.52.25।।
52_25.translation: The minds of kings create no hurdles in all that they want to do. That is why they rule kingdoms.
52_25.word_by_word: एषाम् whatever, मनः in the mind, सर्वकृत्येषु to do all those, यत् न प्रतिहन्यते creater no obstacles, एतदर्थम् that is why, नरेश्वराः king, राज्यानि kingdom, प्रशासति हि rule.

52_26.shloka: यद्यथा स महाराजो नालीकमधिगच्छति।न च ताम्यति दुःखेन सुमन्त्र कुरु तत्तथा।।2.52.26।।
52_26.translation: Sumantra do things exactly in the manner the great king desires so that he does not feel sad or disappointed.
52_26.word_by_word: सुमन्त्र Sumantra, सः महाराजः that great king, यत् those tasks, यथा in whatever manner, अलीकम् sad, नाधिगच्छति not feel, दुःखेन in grief, न च ताम्यति not feel distressed, तत् those tasks, तथा in that way, कुरु do.

52_27.shloka: अदृष्टदुःखं राजानं वृद्धमार्यं जितेन्द्रियम्।ब्रूयास्त्वमभिवाद्यैव मम हेतोरिदं वचः।।2.52.27।।
52_27.translation: After offering your salutations, tell these words, on my behalf, to the king who is respectable, bent with age and who has conquered his senses and never experienced any sorrow before.
52_27.word_by_word: अदृष्टदुःखम् one who has not experienced any sorrow, वृद्धम् old, आर्यम् respectable, जितेन्द्रियम् one who has conquered the senses, राजानम् to king, मम हेतोः on my behalf, अभिवाद्यैव offering respects, इदम् these, वचः words, त्वम् you, ब्रूयाः tell.

52_28.shloka: नैवाहमनुशोचामि लक्ष्मणो न च मैथिली।अयोध्यायाश्च्युताश्चेति वने वत्स्यामहेति च।।2.52.28।।
52_28.translation: I do not regret my banishment from Ayodhya to live in the forest. Neither Lakshmana nor Sita does.
52_28.word_by_word: अयोध्यायाः from Ayodhya, च्युताश्चेति having been removed, वने in the forest, वत्स्यामहेति च have to dwell, अहम् we, नैव अनुशोचामि do not regret, लक्ष्मणः Lakshmana, मैथिली च and Sitaalso, न not.

52_29.shloka: चतुर्दशसु वर्षेषु निवृत्तेषु पुनः पुनः।लक्ष्मणं मां च सीतां च द्रक्ष्यसे क्षिप्रमागतान्।।2.52.29।।
52_29.translation: Very quickly these fourteen years will come to an end and we will return (to Ayodhya). Then you will see me, Lakshmana and Sita off and on.
52_29.word_by_word: चतुर्दशसु fourteen, वर्षेषु years, निवृत्तेषु on completion, क्षिप्रम् quickly, आगतान् coming, लक्ष्मणम् Lakshmana, मां च I also, सीतां च and Sita, पुनः पुनः again and again, द्रक्ष्यसे will keep seeing.

52_30.shloka: एवमुक्त्वा तु राजानं मातरं च सुमन्त्र मे।अन्याश्च देवीस्सहिताः कैकेयीं च पुनः पुनः।।2.52.30।।आरोग्यं ब्रूहि कौशल्यामथ पादाभिवन्दनम्।सीताया मम चाऽऽर्यस्य वचनाल्लक्ष्मणस्य च।।2.52.31।।
52_30.translation: Having said this to the king, O Sumantra tell my mother, the other queens including Kaikeyi again and again about my wellbeing and the wellbeing of Lakshmana and Sita. Convey our respectful salutations at the feet of mother Kausalya.
52_30.word_by_word: राजानम् to the king, एवम् all this, उक्तवा having told, सुमन्त्र Sumantra, मे मातरं च to my mother also, सहिताः with, अन्याः other, देवीश्च queens, कैकेयीं च Kaikeyi, पुनः पुनः again and again, आरोग्यम् wellbeing, ब्रूहि convey, अथ and, सीतायाः Sita's, मम च mine, आर्यस्य लक्ष्मणस्य च Lakshmana's also, पादाभिवन्दनम् prostection at the feet, कौशल्याम् Kausalya.

52_31.shloka: ब्रूयाश्च हि महाराजं भरतं क्षिप्रमानय।आगतश्चापि भरतः स्थाप्यो नृपमते पदे।।2.52.32।।
52_31.translation: Tell the king to send for Bharata quickly, and on his arrival, he be placed in the position of the king as per his own desire.
52_31.word_by_word: महाराजं to the maharaja, is also, ब्रूयाः tell, भरतम् Bharata, क्षिप्रम् quickly, आनय send for, आगतश्चापि and on arrival, भरतः Bharata, नृपमते according to the king's desire, पदे king's position, स्थाप्यः be given.

52_32.shloka: भरतं च परिष्वज्य यौवराज्येऽभिषिच्य च।अस्मत्सन्तापजं दुःखं न त्वामभिभविष्यति।।2.52.33।।
52_32.translation: On embracing Bharata and making him the crownprince the sorrow due to our departure will not affect you.
52_32.word_by_word: भरतम् Bharata, परिष्वज्य embracing, यौवराज्ये crown prince, अभिषिच्य च having coronated, अस्मत्संतापजम् arising out of our absence, दुःखम् sorrow, त्वाम् you, न अभिभविष्यति will not affect you.

52_33.shloka: भरतश्चापि वक्तव्यो यथा राजनि वर्तसे।तथा मातृषु वर्तेथाः सर्वास्वेवाविशेषतः।।2.52.34।।
52_33.translation: You should tell Bharata that just as he treats the king so should he treat all the mothers without differentiating betwen them.
52_33.word_by_word: भरतश्चापि Bharata also, वक्तव्यः should be told, राजनि at the king, यथा just as, वर्तसे treats, सर्वास्वेव at all, मातृषु mothers, तथा likewise, अविशेषतः without differentiating, वर्तेथाः behave.

52_34.shloka: यथा च तव कैकेयी सुमित्रा च विशेषतः।तथैव देवी कौशल्या मम माता विशेषतः।।2.2.35।।
52_34.translation: Just as you treat Kaikeyi and Sumitra in a special manner, so should you treat Devi Kausalya, my mother.
52_34.word_by_word: तव your, कैकेयी Kaikeyi, यथा च just as, सुमित्रा च Sumitra also, विशेषतः in a specialmanner, देवी Devi, sumitra विशेषतः specially, मम माता my mother, कौशल्या Kausalya, तथैव in the same way.

52_35.shloka: तातस्य प्रियकामेन यौवराज्यमपेक्षता।लोकयोरुभयोः शक्यं त्वया यत्सुखमेधितुम्।।2.52.36।।
52_35.translation: Princeregency is awaiting you because of our father's loving desire. See that through you (your actions) he is able to attain happiness in both the worlds.
52_35.word_by_word: तातस्य father's, प्रियकामेन loving desire, यौवराज्यम् princeregency, अपेक्षता waits, त्वया your, उभयोः both, लोकयोः worlds, यत् also, सुखम् happiness, एधितुम् to attain, शक्यम् able.

52_36.shloka: निवर्त्यमानो रामेण सुमन्त्रः शोककर्शितः।तत्सर्वं वचनं श्रुत्वा स्नेहात्काकुत्स्थमब्रवीत्।।2.52.37।।
52_36.translation: When Sumantra was asked by Rama to go back, he grew griefstricken. Having heard all that was said by the scion of the Kakutsthas, he replied:
52_36.word_by_word: रामेण by Rama, निवर्त्यमानः sent back, सुमन्त्रः Sumantra, शोककर्शितः afflicted with grief, तत् then, सर्वम् all, वचनम् words, श्रुत्वा having heard, स्नेहात् out of affection, काकुत्स्थम् Rama of Kakutstha race, अब्रवीत् said.

52_37.shloka: यदहं नोपचारेण ब्रूयां स्नेहादविक्लबः।भक्तिमानिति तत्तावद्वाक्यं त्वं क्षन्तुमर्हसि।।2.52.38।।
52_37.translation: I beg your pardon for what I have told you out of love. Accept it as the words of a devotee expressed without fear or formality.
52_37.word_by_word: स्नेहात् out of love, अविक्लबः without fear, नोपचारेण informally, अहम् I am, यत् वाक्यम् these words, ब्रूयाम् telling, तत् then, भक्तिमान् इति like a devotee, त्वम् you, क्षन्तुम् to excuse, अर्हसि तावत् that.

52_38.shloka: कथं हि त्वद्विहीनोऽहं प्रतियास्यामि तां पुरीम्।तव तावद्वियोगेन पुत्रशोकाकुलामिव।।2.52.39।।
52_38.translation: Without you how can I go back to the city (of Ayodhya) which, separated from you, is grieving like a lady who has lost her son?
52_38.word_by_word: अहम् I, त्वद्विहीनः leaving you, तव your, वियोगेन तावत् being separated from you, पुत्रशोकाकुलामिव like one who has lost her son, ताम् that, पुरीम् to the city (of Ayodhya), कथं हि how can I, प्रतियास्यामि return.

52_39.shloka: सराममपि तावन्मे रथं दृष्ट्वा तदा जनः।विना रामं रथं दृष्ट्वा विदीर्येतापि सा पुरी।।2.52.40।।
52_39.translation: The people who had seen Rama board the chariot will be brokenhearted to see it without him.
52_39.word_by_word: तदा then, जनः people, सराममपि with Rama, मे रथम् my chariot, दृष्ट्वा seeing, तावत् then, विना रामम् without Rama, रथम् chariot, दृष्ट्वा seeing, सा पुरी (people of) that city, विदीर्येतापि will be brokenhearted.

52_40.shloka: दैन्यं हि नगरी गच्छेद्दृष्ट्वा शून्यमिमं रथम्।सूतावशेषं स्वं सैन्यं हतवीरमिवाऽहवे।।2.52.41।।
52_40.translation: Seeing the empty chariot the people of the city will look pitiable just like an army left only with the charioteer after its hero is killed in the war.
52_40.word_by_word: शून्यम् empty, इमम् this, रथम् chariot, दृष्ट्वा seeing, आहवे हतवीरम् the hero killed in war, सूतावशेषम् with only the charioteer left, स्वम् they, सैन्यम् इव like the army, नगरी entering the city, दैन्यम् pitiable, गच्छेत् हि as will become.

52_41.shloka: दूरेऽपि निवसन्तं त्वां मानसेनाग्रतः स्थितम्।चिन्तयन्तोऽद्य नूनं त्वां निराहाराः कृताः प्रजाः।।2.52.42।।
52_41.translation: Although living at a distance, the subjects feel in their minds that you are just ahead of them. Today they will certainly go without food, brooding over you.
52_41.word_by_word: प्रजाः people, अद्य today, दूरे at a distance, निवसन्तम् अपि although living, मानसेन in their minds, अग्रतः in front, स्थितम् staying, त्वाम् you, चिन्तयन्त्यः thinking, निराहाराः without food, कृताः done, नूनम् certainly.

52_42.shloka: दृष्टं तद्धि त्वया राम यादृशं त्वत्प्रवासने।प्रजानां सङ्कुलं वृत्तं त्वच्छोकक्लान्तचेतसाम्।।2.52.43।।
52_42.translation: At the time of your departure, O Rama, you have seen all that happened, the hearts of the people exhausted with grief.
52_42.word_by_word: राम Rama, त्वत्प्रवासने by your departure, त्वच्छोकक्लान्तचेतसां their minds exhausted with sorrow,  प्रजानाम् people, वृत्तम् that which has happened, यादृशम् all their sorrow, सङ्कुलम् full of agony, तत् then, त्वया you, दृष्टं हि have seen.

52_43.shloka: आर्तनादो हि यः पौरैर्मुक्तस्त्वद्विप्रवासने।सरथं मां निशाम्यैव कुर्युः शतगुणं ततः।।2.52.44।।
52_43.translation: You have witnessed the cry of agony raised by the citizens at the time of your banishment. Now when they see the (empty) chariot, they will make it (raise their cry) a hundredfold.
52_43.word_by_word: त्वद्विप्रवासने at the time of your banishment, पौरैः by citizens, यः how much of, आर्तनादः cry of agony, मुक्तः released (raised), सरथम् with chariot, माम् me, निशाम्यैव on seeing, ततः then, शतगुणम् a hundredfold, कुर्युः will make.

52_44.shloka: अहं किं चापि वक्ष्यामि देवीं तव सुतो मया।नीतोऽसौ मातुलकुलं सन्तापं मा कृथा इति।।2.52.45।।
52_44.translation: What shall I say to Kausalya? Shall I say 'O venerable queen I have left your son at his maternal uncle's, hence don't grieve'.
52_44.word_by_word: असौ Alas, सुतः son, मया myself, मातुलकुलम् to the maternal uncle's, नीतः took, सन्तापम् grief, मा कृथाः do not make, इति this, अहम् I, देवीम् Kausalya, वक्ष्यामि किं चापि what can I say?

52_45.shloka: असत्यमपि नैवाहं ब्रूयां वचनमीदृशम्।कथमप्रियमेवाहं ब्रूयां सत्यमिदं वचः।।2.52.46।।
52_45.translation: How can I lie to her? How can I tell her the unpleasent truth?
52_45.word_by_word: अहम् I, असत्यम् untrue, ईदृशम् like this, वचनमपि words too, नैव ब्रूयाम् not tell, अहम् I, अप्रियम् unpleasant, सत्यम् truth, इदं वचः such words, कथम् how can, ब्रूयाम् I speak.

52_46.shloka: मम तावन्नियोगस्थास्त्वद्बन्धुजनवाहिनः।कथं रथं त्वया हीनं प्रवक्ष्यन्ति हयोत्तमाः।।2.52.47।।
52_46.translation: How can these excellent horses who used to carry you and your friends till now draw this chariot without you even though they are at my command?
52_46.word_by_word: त्वद्बन्धुजनवाहिनः carrying your king, मम my, नियोगस्था under command, हयोत्तमाः excellent horses, त्वया हीनम् without you, रथम् chariot, कथम् how, प्रवक्ष्यन्ति will draw.

52_47.translation: That is why, O sinless one I cannot go back to Ayodhya without you. Allow me to accompany you into your exile.
52_47.word_by_word: तत् that is why, अनघ O sinless one, त्वदृते without you, अहम् I, अयोध्याम् to Ayodhya, गन्तुम् to go, न शक्ष्यामि cannot, माम् me, वनवासानुयानाय to accompany you in exile,  अनुज्ञातुम् to give consent, अर्हसि behoves you.

52_48.shloka: यदि मे याचमानस्य त्यागमेव करिष्यसि।सरथोऽग्निं प्रवेक्ष्यामि त्यक्तमात्र इह त्वया।।2.52.49।।
52_48.translation: If you forsake me in spite of my request I shall immediately enter fire along with my chariot.
52_48.word_by_word: याचमानस्य request, मे my, त्यागमेव forsaking, करिष्यसि यदि if you, त्वया by you, त्यक्तमात्रः immediately after being forsaken, इह here, सरथः with the chariot, अग्निम् into fire प्रवेक्ष्यामिI will enter.

52_49.shloka: भविष्यन्ति वने यानि तपोविघ्नकराणि ते।रथेन प्रतिबाधिष्ये तानि सत्त्वानि राघव।।2.52.50।।
52_49.translation: With my chariot I shall retaliate and prevent all those animals in the forest causing obstacles to your austerities, O Rama
52_49.word_by_word: राघव O Rama, वने in the forest, यानि all those, ते to you, तपोविघ्नकराणि causing obstacles to your austerity, भविष्यन्ति are expected, तानि सत्त्वानि all those animals, रथेन with my chariot, प्रतिबाधिष्ये will avert by retaliating.

52_50.shloka: त्वत्कृते न मयाऽवाप्तं रथचर्याकृतं सुखम्।आशंसे त्वत्कृते नाहं वनवासकृतं सुखम्।।2.52.51।।
52_50.translation: By your grace I experienced the pleasure of driving your chariot, and by your grace, too, I am looking forward to deriving the pleasure of dwelling in the forest.
52_50.word_by_word: त्वत्कृतेन by your grace, मया by me, रथचर्याकृतम् by driving the chariot, सुखम् pleasure, अवाप्तम् is experienced, त्वत्कृते न by your favour, अहम् I, वनवासकृतम् dwelling in the forest,सुखम् pleasure, आशंसे I am looking forward.

52_51.shloka: प्रसीदेच्छामि तेऽरण्ये भवितुं प्रत्यनन्तरः।प्रीत्याऽभिहितमिच्छामि भव मे प्रत्यनन्तरः।।2.52.52।।
52_51.translation: Be pleased. I wish to stay with you in the forest I long to hear from you these favourable words, 'Stay with me'.
52_51.word_by_word: प्रसीद be pleased, आरण्ये in the forest, ते to you, प्रत्यनन्तरः very close, भवितुम् to become, इच्छामि desirng, मे to me, प्रत्यनन्तरः be favourable (close), भव to me, प्रीत्या affectionately, अभिहितम् to be told,  इच्छामि wish.

52_52.shloka: इमे चापि हया वीर यदि ते वनवासिनः।परिचर्यां करिष्यन्ति प्राप्स्यन्ति परमां गतिम्।।2.52.53।।
52_52.translation: O valiant one, if these horses too could render services to you while you dwell in the forest, they would attain the supreme state.
52_52.word_by_word: वीर O valiant one, इमे these, हयश्चापि horses also, वनवासिनः dwelling in the forest, ते to you, परिचर्याम् service, करिष्यन्ति if they do, यदि if so, परमाम् supreme, गतिम् state, प्राप्स्यन्ति will attain.

52_53.shloka: तव शुश्रूषणं मूर्ध्ना करिष्यामि वने वसन्।अयोध्यां देवलोकं वा सर्वथा प्रजहाम्यहम्।।2.52.54।।
52_53.translation: As I dwell in the forest, I shall serve you with my head bowed. For this I may altogether relinquish Ayodhya or even heaven.
52_53.word_by_word: वने in the forest, वसन् while dwelling, मूर्ध्ना with my head, तव your, शुश्रूषणम् service, करिष्यामि will render, अयोध्याम् to Ayodhya, देवलोकं वा or the world of the gods, अहम् I, सर्वथा altogether, प्रजहामि relinquish.

52_54.shloka: न हि शक्या प्रवेष्टुं सा मयाऽयोध्या त्वया विना।राजधानी महेन्द्रस्य यथा दुष्कृतकर्मणा।।2.52.55।।
52_54.translation: Just as a sinner cannot enter the capital of Indra (heaven), it is impossible for me to enter Ayodhya without you.
52_54.word_by_word: त्वया विना without you, मया by me, दुष्कृतकर्मणा by the wicked, महेन्द्रस्य Indra's, राजधानी यथा like the capital, सा अयोध्या that Ayodhya, प्रवेष्टुम् to enter, न हि शक्या not possible.

52_55.shloka: वनवासे क्षयं प्राप्ते ममैष हि मनोरथः।यदनेन रथेनैव त्वां वहेयं पुरीं पुनः।।2.52.56।।
52_55.translation: It is my cherished desire to take you after the completion of your exile, back to the city (Ayodhya) in this chariot alone.
52_55.word_by_word: मम myself, एषः हि this alone, मनोरथः cherished desire, यत् that, वनवासे in the forest, क्षयम् completion, प्राप्ते gaining, अनेन by this, रथेनैव chariot alone, त्वाम् you, पुनः again, पुरीम् to the city (Ayodhya), वहेयम् shall take.

52_56.shloka: चतुर्दश हि वर्षाणि सहितस्य त्वया वने।क्षणभूतानि यास्यन्ति शतसङ्ख्यान्यतोऽन्यथा।।2.52.57।।
52_56.translation: If I accompany you into the forest, fourteen years will pass like a moment, otherwise it will seem like a hundred years.
52_56.word_by_word: वने in the forest, त्वया with you, सहितस्य accompanied, चतुर्दश वर्षाणि fourteen years, क्षणभूतानि like a moment, यास्यन्ति will pass, अत: more than this, अन्यथा in any other way,  शतसङ्ख्यानि (will seem like) a hundred years.

52_57.shloka: भृत्यवत्सल तिष्ठन्तं भर्तृपुत्रगते पथि।भक्तं भृत्यं स्थितं स्थित्यां त्वं न मां हातुमर्हसि।।2.52.58।।
52_57.translation: O Rama you are affectionate towards your servants. I abide in the path followed by you, my master's son. I am your devoted servant. It does not behove you to forsake me who is faithful.
52_57.word_by_word: भृत्यवत्सल one who is affectionate towards the servants, भर्तृपुत्र master's son, पथि on the path, तिष्ठन्तम् standing, भक्तम् devotee, भृत्यम् servant, स्थित्याम् on duty, स्थितम् fixed, माम् me, त्वम् you, हातुम् to forsake न अर्हसि does not behove.

52_58.shloka: एवं बहुविधं दीनं याचमानं पुनः पुनः।रामो भृत्यानुकम्पी तु सुमन्त्रमिदमब्रवीत्।।2.52.59।।
52_58.translation: Repeatedly implored in various ways by the miserable Sumantra, Rama who is compassionate to his servants replied:
52_58.word_by_word: भृत्यानुकम्पी compassionate towards servants, रामः Rama, एवम् in this way, बहुविधम् in many ways, पुनः पुनः again and again, याचमानम् requesting, दीनम् miserable, सुमन्त्रम् to Sumantra, इदम् these words, अब्रवीत् spoke.

52_59.shloka: जानामि परमां भक्तिं मयि ते भर्तृवत्सल।शृणु चापि यदर्थं त्वां प्रेषयामि पुरीमितः।।2.52.60।।
52_59.translation: O Sumantra, listen I know your deep devotion to me (I also know) you are loyal to your master (Dasaratha). So I am sending you to the city (Ayodhya) from here.
52_59.word_by_word: भर्तृवत्सल one loyal to the master, ते your, मयि in me, परमाम् supreme, भक्तिम् devotion, जानामि I know, इतः from here, त्वम् you, यदर्थम् for the reason, पुरीम् to Ayodhya, प्रेषयामि I am sending, शृणु चापि please listen.

52_60.shloka: नगरीं त्वां गतं दृष्ट्वा जननी मे यवीयसी।कैकेयी प्रत्ययं गच्छेदिति रामो वनं गतः।।2.52.61।।
52_60.translation: When my younger mother Kaikeyi sees that you have returned to Ayodhya, she will believe that Rama has really gone to the forest.
52_60.word_by_word: नगरीम् to the city of Ayodhya, गतम् gone, त्वाम् you, दृष्ट्वा on seeing, मे my, यवीयसी younger, जननी mother, कैकेयी Kaikeyi, रामः Rama, वनम् to the forest, गतः had gone, इति thus, प्रत्ययम् conviction, गच्छेत् will have.

52_61.shloka: परितुष्टा हि सा देवी वनवासं गते मयि।राजानं नातिशङ्केत 'मिथ्यावादी'ति धार्मिकम्।।2.52.62।।
52_61.translation: If queen Kaikeyi is fully satisfied that I have gone to dwell in the forest, she will no longer have any doubt and will believe that righteous king Dasaratha is not a liar.
52_61.word_by_word: मयि when I, वनवासम् dwell in the forest, गते having gone, सा देवी that queen, परितुष्टा completely satisfied, धार्मिकम् righteous, राजानम् about king Dasaratha, 'मिथ्यावादी'ति   claimed to be a liar, नातिशङ्केत not have any doubt.

52_62.shloka: एष मे प्रथमः कल्पो यदम्बा मे यवीयसी।भरतारक्षितं स्फीतं पुत्रराज्यमवाप्नुयात्।।2.52.63।।
52_62.translation: My prime resolve is that my younger mother should enjoy this prosperous and vast kingdom ruled by her son Bharata.
52_62.word_by_word: एषः this is, मे my, प्रथमः prime, कल्पः resolve, यत् that, मे my, यवीयसी younger, अम्बा mother, भरतारक्षितम् ruled by Bharata, स्फीतम् prosperous, पुत्रराज्यम् son's kingdom, अवाप्नुयात् will receive.

52_63.shloka: मम प्रियार्थं राज्ञश्च सरथस्त्वं पुरीं व्रज।सन्दिष्टश्चासि यानर्थांस्तां स्तान् ब्रूयास्तथा तथा।।2.52.64।।
52_63.translation: Sumantra, return to the city with the chariot for my pleasure and also for the pleasure of the king and convey to each of the persons concerned the message exactly as instructed.
52_63.word_by_word: त्वम् you, सरथः along with the chariot, मम my, राज्ञश्च king's, प्रियार्थम् for the sake of (my) pleasure, पुरीम् to the city (Ayodhya), व्रज return, यान् अर्थान् those messages intended for every one, सन्दिष्टः असि you have been advised, तान्तान् all such, तथा तथा in the same way, ब्रूयाः please tell.

52_64.shloka: इत्युक्त्वा वचनं सूतं सान्त्वयित्वा पुनः पुनः।गुहं वचनमक्लीबो रामो हेतुमदब्रवीत्।।2.52.65।।
52_64.translation: Having spoken to the charioteer and consoling him again and again, indefatigable Rama spoke to Guha words full of reasoning:
52_64.word_by_word: अक्लीबः indefatigable, रामः Rama, सूतम् to the charioteer, इति thus, वचनम् words, उक्त्वा having said, पुनः पुनः again and again, सान्त्वयित्वा after consoling, गुहम् to Guha, हेतुमत् reasonable, वचनम् words, अब्रवीत् said.

52_65.shloka: नेदानीं गुह योग्योऽयं वासो मे सजने वने।आवश्यं ह्याश्रमे वासः कर्तव्यस्तद्गतो विधिः।।2.52.66।।
52_65.translation: Guha this forest where people live is not suitable for my stay. It is necessary that I live in a hermitage. So please do the needful.
52_65.word_by_word: गुह Guha, इदानीम् now, मे to me, सजने with people, वने in the forest, अयम् this, वासः abode, न योग्यः not suitable, आश्रमे in the hermitage, वासः dwelling, अवश्यम् is necessary, तद्गतः pertaining to that, विधिः prescribed acts, कर्तव्यः to be done.

52_66.shloka: सोऽहं गृहीत्वा नियमं तपस्वि जनभूषणम्।हितकामः पितुर्भूयः सीताया लक्ष्मणस्य च।।2.52.67।।जटाः कृत्वा गमिष्यामि न्यग्रोधक्षीरमानय।
52_66.translation: Seeking the welfare of my father, Sita and Lakshmana I shall enter the forest with matted hair and practise the prescribed austerities which are the adornments of ascetics. Do fetch me the sap of a banyan tree.
52_66.word_by_word: सः अहम् that I, तपस्विजनभूषणम् the adornment of ascetics, नियमम् prescribed austerities, गृहीत्वा accepting, पितुः father's, भूयः also, सीतायाः Sita's, लक्ष्मणस्य च also Lakshmana's, हितकामः seeking their good, जटाः कृत्वा having matted my locks of hair, गमिष्यामि shall go, न्यग्रोधक्षीरम् latex of banyan tree, आनय fetch.

52_67.translation: Guha fetched the latex quickly and gave it to the prince (Rama) and with that Rama matted his own hair and  Lakshmana's.
52_67.word_by_word: गुहः Guha, क्षिप्रम् quickly, राजपुत्राय for the prince (Rama), तत् that, क्षीरम् milk, उपाहरत् brought  , रामः Rama, तेन with that, लक्ष्मणस्य for Lakshmana, आत्मनश्चैव of his own, जटाः matted locks of hair, अकरोत् made.

52_68.shloka: दीर्घबाहुर्नरव्याघ्रो जटिलत्वमधारयत्।।2.52.69।।तौ तदा चीरवसनौ जटामण्डलधारिणौ।आशोभेतामृषिसमौ भ्रातरौ रामलक्ष्मणौ।।2.52.70।।
52_68.translation: The longarmed Rama, the best of men, put on locks of matted hair. As the twobrothers, Rama and Lakshmana stood dressed in bark wearing crowns of matted hair, they resembled two resplendent ascetics.
52_68.word_by_word: दीर्घबाहुः longarmed, नरव्याघ्रः tiger (best) among men, जटिलत्वम् their hair twisted and matted,  अधारयत् put on, तदा then, चीरवसनौ wearing the robes (of bark), जटामण्डलधारिणौ wearing crown of matted locks, भ्रातरौ brothers, रामलक्ष्मणौ Rama and Lakshmana, ऋषिसमौ resembling sages, अशोभेताम् shone.

52_69.shloka: ततो वैखानसं मार्गमास्थितः सह लक्ष्मणः।व्रतमादिष्टवान् रामः सखायं गुहमब्रवीत्।।2.52.71।।
52_69.translation: Having adopted the path of ascetics along with Lakshmana, Rama said to his friend Guha:
52_69.word_by_word: ततः thereafter, सहलक्ष्मणः along with Lakshmana, वैखानसम् relating to sages, मार्गम् the path, आस्थितः having resorted to, रामः Rama, व्रतम् religious vow, आदिष्टवान् having accepted, सखायम् his friend, गुहम् to Guha, अब्रवीत् said.

52_70.shloka: अप्रमत्तो बले कोशे दुर्गे जनपदे तथा।भवेथा गुह राज्यं हि दुरारक्षतमं मतम्।।2.52.72।।
52_70.translation: O Guha you must be vigilant about your army, treasury, forts and provinces. A kingdom, it is (rightly) said, is protected with great difficulty.
52_70.word_by_word: गुह Guha, बले in the army, कोशे in the treasury, दुर्गे in the fort, तथा similarly, जनपदे in the provinces, अप्रमत्तः alert, भवेथाः you shall be, राज्यम् kingdom, दुरारक्षतमम् with great difficulty, मतं हि it is said.

52_71.shloka: ततस्तं समनुज्ञाय गुहमिक्ष्वाकुनन्दनः।जगाम तूर्णमव्यग्रः सभार्यः सह लक्ष्मणः।।2.52.73।।
52_71.translation: Rama, Delight of the Iksvakus, then permitted Guha to take leave. And departed quickly with his consort and Lakshmana in peace.
52_71.word_by_word: ततः then after, इक्ष्वाकुनन्दनः Delight of (also son of) the Iksvakus (Rama), तं गुहम् to that Guha, समनुज्ञाय after permitting him to leave, अव्यग्रः peacefully, सभार्यः with his consort, सहलक्ष्मणः with Lakshmana, तूर्णम् swiftly, जगाम went.

52_72.shloka: स तु दृष्ट्वा नदीतीरे नावमिक्ष्वाकुनन्दनः।तितीर्षुः शीघ्रगां गङ्गामिदं लक्ष्मणमब्रवीत्।।2.52.74।।
52_72.translation: Seeing the boat on the river bank and intending to cross the swiftly flowing Ganga, Rama, descendant of the Iksvakus said to Lakshmana:
52_72.word_by_word: सः इक्ष्वाकुनन्दनः Rama, descendant of the Ikshvakus, नदीतीरे on the bank of the river, नावम् boat, दृष्ट्वा having seen, शीघ्रगाम् swiftly flowing, गङ्गाम् Ganga, तितीर्षुः intending to cross, लक्ष्मणम् Lakshmana, इदम् these words, अब्रवीत् said.

52_73.shloka: आरोह त्वं नरव्याघ्र स्थितां नावमिमां शनैः।सीतां चारोपयान्वक्षं परिगृह्य मनस्विनीम्।।2.52.75।।
52_73.translation: O Lakshmana, the best of men the boat stands ready, get into it slowly (carefully), and then help the noble Sita board it by holding the beam (which balances the boat).
52_73.word_by_word: नरव्याघ्रः (best) among men (Lakshmana), त्वम् you, स्थितम् standing, इमाम् this, नावम् boat, शनैः slowly, आरोह board, अन्वक्षम् along with the beam, मनस्विनीम् highminded, सीतां च Sita also, परिगृह्य holding her, आरोपय help her to get in.

52_74.shloka: स भ्रातुः शासनं श्रुत्वा सर्वमप्रतिकूलयन्।आरोप्य मैथिलीं पूर्वमारुरोहाऽऽत्मवां स्ततः।।2.52.76।।
52_74.translation: Having heard his brother's command the selfcontrolled Lakshmana did as he was told.He first helped Sita get into the boat and  thereafter boarded it himself.
52_74.word_by_word: आत्मवान् selfcontrolled, सः that Lakshmana, भ्रातुः brother, शासनम् command, श्रुत्वा on hearing, सर्वम् all, अप्रतिकूलयन् without acting contrarily, पूर्वम् first, मैथिलीम् Sita, आरोप्य having helped her board, ततः thereafter, आरुरोह got in

52_75.shloka: अथारुरोह तेजस्वी स्वयं लक्ष्मणपूर्वजः।ततो निषादाधिपतिर्गुहो ज्ञातीनचोदयत्।।2.52.77।।
52_75.translation: With the boat boarded by the glorious Rama, Lakshmana's elder brother, Guha, king of the nishadas urged his kinsmen (to row the boat).
52_75.word_by_word: अथ then after, तेजस्वी glorious, लक्ष्मणपूर्वजः Lakshmana's elder brother, स्वयम् himself, आरुरोह boarded, निषादाधिपतिः king of nishadas, गुहः Guha, ज्ञातीन् kinsmen, आचोदयत् unged (to row the boat).

52_76.shloka: राघवोऽपि महातेजा नावमारुह्य तां ततः।ब्रह्मवत् क्षत्रवच्चैव जजाप हितमात्मनः।।2.52.78।।
52_76.translation: Resplendent Rama boarded the boat and muttered for his own safety mantras befitting brahmins and kshatriyas.
52_76.word_by_word: महातेजाः राघवोऽपि even resplendent Rama, तां नावम् that boat, आरुह्य having boarded, ततः then, ब्रह्मवत् befitting brahmins, क्षत्रवच्चैव and also befitting kshatriyas, आत्मनः his own, हितम् welfare, जजाप muttered mantras.

52_77.shloka: आचम्य च यथाशास्त्रं नदीं तां सह सीतया।प्राणमत्प्रीतिसंहृष्टो लक्ष्मणश्चामितप्रभः।।2.52.79।।
52_77.translation: Rama of undimmed radiance sipped the waters (of the Ganga) in accordance with the scriptures and with great pleasure and paid obeisance to the river with Sita and Lakshmana.
52_77.word_by_word: सीतया सह along with Sita, यथाशास्त्रम् as per the scriptures, आचम्य च sipping (the water of Ganga), प्रीतिसंहृष्टः with great pleasure, तां नदीम् that river, प्राणमत् paid obeisance, अमितप्रभः of unlimited radiance, लक्ष्मणश्च Lakshmana also.

52_78.shloka: अनुज्ञाय सुमन्त्रं च सबलं चैव तं गुहम्।आस्थाय नावं रामस्तु चोदयामास नाविकान्।।2.52.80।।
52_78.translation: Having permitted Sumantra and Guha with his army to leave, Rama seated on the boat urged the boatmen to proceed.
52_78.word_by_word: रामस्तु as for Rama, सुमन्त्रम् Sumantra, सबलम् along with his army, तं गुहम् to that Guha, अनुज्ञाय permitting (to leave), नावम् boat, आस्थाय having seated, नाविकान् boatmen, चोदयामास directed to proceed.

52_79.shloka: ततस्तैश्चोदिता सा नौः कर्णधारसमाहिता।शुभस्फ्यवेगाभिहता शीघ्रं सलिलमत्यगात्।।2.52.81.।।
52_79.translation: The wellruddered boat rowed by the helmsmen and propelled by strong oars, swiftly crossed the waters of the river.
52_79.word_by_word: ततः then, कर्णधारसमाहिता wellruddered by the helmsmen, सा नौः that boat, तैः by them, चोदिता rowed, शुभस्फ्यवेगाभिहता propelled by the speed of strong oars, शीघ्रम् swiftly, सलिलम् waters, अत्यगात् crossed.

52_80.shloka: मध्यं तु समनुप्राप्य भागीरथ्यास्त्वनिन्दिता।वैदेही प्राञ्जलिर्भूत्वा तां नदीमिदमब्रवीत्।।2.52.82।।
52_80.translation: When the boat reached the midstream that unblemished Sita with palms folded invoked the river thus:
52_80.word_by_word: अनिन्दिता blameless, वैदेही Sita, भागीरथ्याः river Bhagheerathi's, मध्यम् middle, समनुप्राप्य having reached, प्राञ्जलिः भूत्वा with folded palms, तां नदीम् to that river, इदम् these words, अब्रवीत् uttered.

52_81.shloka: पुत्रो दशरथस्यायं महाराजस्य धीमतः।निदेशं पारयित्वेमं गङ्गे त्वदभिरक्षितः।।2.52.83।।चतुर्दश हि वर्षाणि समग्राण्युष्य कानने।भ्रात्रा सह मया चैव पुनः प्रत्यागमिष्यति।।2.52.84।।ततस्त्वां देवि सुभगे क्षेमेण पुनरागता।यक्ष्ये प्रमुदिता गङ्गे सर्वकामसमृद्धिनी।।2.52.85।।
52_81.translation: O Ganga, protected by you, this son (Rama) of Dasaratha, the sagacious maharaja, will carry out his father's command. He along with his brother will return after living in the forest for full fourteen years. O fortunate Devi, he will worship you in delight for fulfilling all his desires after his safe return.
52_81.word_by_word: गङ्गे O Ganga, धीमतः of the sagacious, महाराजस्य of the maharaja, दशरथस्य Dasaratha's, पुत्रः son, अयम् Rama, त्वदभिरक्षितः protected by you, इमम् this, निदेशम् command, पालयित्वा having obeyed, भ्रात्रा सह with brother, मया चैव with me also, चतुर्दश fourteen, वर्षाणि years,समग्राणि full, कानने in the forest, उष्य having stayed, पुनः again, प्रत्यागमिष्यति will come back, सुभगे देवी O fortunate Devi, गङ्गे Ganga, ततः then, क्षेमेण safely, पुनः again, आगता reaching, प्रमुदिता highly delighted, सर्वकामसमृध्दिनी having fulfilled all my desires, त्वाम् you, यक्ष्ये worship.

52_82.shloka: त्वं हि त्रिपथगा देवि ब्रह्मलोकं समीक्षसे।भार्या चोदधिराजस्य लोकेऽस्मिन् सम्प्रदृश्यसे।।2.52.86।।
52_82.translation: O Devi, you are Tripathaga, flowing in three directions (worlds). You behold the region of Brahma and happen to be the spouse of the king of the ocean in this world (of mortals).
52_82.word_by_word: देवि O Devi, त्रिपथगा one flowing in the three worlds, त्वम् you, ब्रह्मलोकम् the region of Brahma, the creator, समीक्षसे हि are seeing, अस्मिन् in this, लोके world, उदधिराजस्य king of the ocean, भार्या च are a spouse, संप्रदृश्यसे appear (to mortals).

52_83.shloka: सा त्वां देवि नमस्यामि प्रशंसामि च शोभने।प्राप्तराज्ये नरव्याघ्रे शिवेन पुनरागते।।2.52.87।।गवां शतसहस्राणि वस्त्राण्यन्नं च पेशलम्।ब्राह्मणेभ्यः प्रदास्यामि तव प्रियचिकीर्षया।।2.52.88।।
52_83.translation: O Devi O lovely Ganga I offer you my obeisance and my adorations. After the safe return of Rama, the tiger (best) among men, from the forest and after he regains the kingdom I shall give a hundred thousand cows, clothing and delicious food to brahmins as a mark of regard, which will please you.
52_83.word_by_word: देवि O Devi, शोभने O lovely one, सा that me, त्वाम् you, नमस्यामि pay homage, प्रशंसामि च adore, शिवेन safely, पुनः again, आगते on return, नरव्याघ्रे (best) among men, प्राप्तराज्ये having regained the kingdom, तव to you, प्रियचिकीर्षया to with the intention of pleasing, गवाम् of cows, शतसहस्राणि one hundred thousand, वस्त्राणि clothes, पेशलम् very delicious, अन्नं च food also, ब्राह्मणेभ्यः to brahmins, प्रदास्यामि will give.

52_84.shloka: सुराघटसहस्रेण मांसभूतौदनेन च।यक्ष्ये त्वां प्रयता देवि पुरीं पुनरुपागता।।2.52.89।।
52_84.translation: O Devi after my return to Ayodhya  purified by my austerities, I shall worship you by offering a thousand pots of nectar and food in the form of meat.
52_84.word_by_word: देवि O Devi, पुनः again, पुरीम् Ayodhya, उपागता having reached, प्रयता purified by austerities, सुराघटसहस्रेण with a thousand pots of nectar, मांसभूतौदनेन च food in the form of meat, यक्ष्ये offer you and worship you.

52_85.shloka: यानि त्वत्तीरवासीनि दैवतानि च सन्ति हि।तानि सर्वाणि यक्ष्यामि तीर्थान्यायतनानि च।।2.52.90।।
52_85.translation: I shall worship all those deities inhabiting your banks and all sacred spots and temples.
52_85.word_by_word: यानि all those, दैवतानि deities, त्वत्तीरवासीनि inhabiting your banks, सन्ति are found तानि all, सर्वाणि of them, तीर्थानि all sacred spots, आयतनानि च all temples, यक्ष्यामि I will worship.

52_86.shloka: पुनरेव महाबाहुर्मया भ्रात्रा च सङ्गतः।अयोध्यां वनवासात्तु प्रविशत्वनघोऽनघे।।2.52.91।।
52_86.translation: O sacred one may the blemishless, mightyarmed Rama accompanied by me andhis brother reenter Ayodhya after the exile.
52_86.word_by_word: अनघे O sacred one, अनघः blemishless, महाबाहुः mightyarmed, मया with me, भ्रात्रा च and also with brother, सङ्गतः together with, वनवासात् after the exile in the forest, पुनरेव again, अयोध्याम् to Ayodhya, प्रविशतु may enter.

52_87.shloka: तथा सम्भाषमाणा सा सीता गङ्गामनिन्दिता।दक्षिणा दक्षिणं तीरं क्षिप्रमेवाभ्युपागमत्।।2.52.92।।
52_87.translation: While the unblemished, auspicious Sita was thus addressing (the river), the boat swiftly reached the south bank.
52_87.word_by_word: अनिन्दिता blameless, दक्षिणा auspicious, सा सीता that sita, तथा thus, सम्भाषमाणा addressing, क्षिप्रमेव quickly, दक्षिणम् southern, तीरम् side, अभ्युपागमत् reached.

52_88.shloka: तीरं तु समनुप्राप्य नावं हित्वा नरर्षभः।प्रातिष्ठत सह भ्रात्रा वैदेह्या च परन्तपः।।2.52.93।।
52_88.translation: Rama, the best of men and tormentor of enemies, after  reaching  the other side of the river, left the boat and proceeded with Sita and his brother.
52_88.word_by_word: नरर्षभः the best of men, परन्तपः tormentor of enemies, तीरम् bank, समनुप्राप्य having reached, नावम् the boat, हित्वा leaving, भ्रात्रा सह with his brother, वैदेह्या च and Sita, प्रातिष्ठत proceeded forward.

52_89.shloka: अथाब्रवीन्महाबाहुः सुमित्रानन्दवर्धनम्।भव संरक्षणार्थाय सजने विजनेऽपि वा।।2.52.94।।
52_89.translation: The longarmed Rama then said to Lakshmana,  enhancer of the joy of Sumitra: Whether in populated areas  or in solitary places, excercise alacrity in the matter of protection.
52_89.word_by_word: अथ then, महाबाहुः one with long arms, सुमित्रानन्दवर्धनम् to Lakshmana, enhancer of the joy of Sumitra, अब्रवीत् said, सजने in populated areas, विजनेऽपि वा or in solitary places, संरक्षणार्थाय for protection, भव be ready.

52_90.shloka: अवश्यं रक्षणं कार्यमदृष्टे विजने वने।अग्रतो गच्छ सौमित्रे सीता त्वामनुगच्छतु।।.2.52.95।।
52_90.translation: In this desolate forest which we had never seen before we must certainly be concerned about our protection. O Lakshmana , let Sita follow you
52_90.word_by_word: अदृष्टे unseen, विजने devoid of people, वने in the forest, अवश्यम् certainly, रक्षणम्  protection, कार्यम् is to be rendered, सौमित्रे O Lakshmana, अग्रतः in front, गच्छ go, सीता Sita, त्वाम् you, अनुगच्छतु may follow.

52_91.shloka: पृष्ठतोऽहं गमिष्यामि त्वां च सीतां च पालयन्।अन्योन्यस्येह नो रक्षा कर्तव्या पुरुषर्षभ।।2.52.96।।
52_91.translation: O best of men, I will follow you and Sita and keep watch. We must ensure  mutual protection.
52_91.word_by_word: अहम् I, त्वां च you also, सीतां च also Sita ,पालयन् protecting, पृष्ठतः behind, गमिष्यामि I will keep walking, पुरुषर्षभ best of men, इह here, न: for us, अन्योन्यस्य mutually, रक्षा protection, कर्तव्या fit to be done.

52_92.shloka: न हि तावदतिक्रान्ता सुकरा काचन क्रिया।अद्य दुःखं तु वैदेही वनवासस्य वेत्स्यति।।2.52.97।।
52_92.translation: We have not yet confronted any hardship. From now on Sita will come to know the difficulties of forest life.
52_92.word_by_word: अतिक्रान्ता a thing of the past, काचन क्रिया any task, सुकरा difficult, न हि तावत् not possible, अद्य now, वैदेही Sita, वनवासस्य life in the forest, दुःखम् difficulties, वेत्स्यति will come to know.

52_93.shloka: प्रणष्टजनसम्बाधं क्षेत्रारामविवर्जितम्।विषमं च प्रपातं च वनमद्य प्रवेक्ष्यति।।2.52.98।।
52_93.translation: Now she will enter the forest which is devoid of concourse of people, farms and pleasure groves and which is uneven and inaccessible and full of deep ditches.
52_93.word_by_word: प्रणष्टजनसम्बाधम् devoid of concourse of people, क्षेत्रारामविवर्जितम् devoid of farms and gardens, विषमम् च uneven and inaccessible, प्रपातं च with deep ditches, वनम् forest, अद्य now, प्रवेक्ष्यति will enter.

52_94.shloka: श्रुत्वा रामस्य वचनं प्रतस्थे लक्ष्मणोऽग्रतः।अनन्तरं च सीताया राघवो रघुनन्दनः।।2.52.99।।
52_94.translation: Having heard the words of Rama, Lakshmana went ahead and Rama, delight of the Raghus, walked behind Sita.
52_94.word_by_word: लक्ष्मणः Lakshmana, रामस्य at Rama's, वचनम् words, श्रुत्वा having heard, अग्रतः ahead, प्रतस्थे went, सीतायाः Sita's, अनन्तरम् behind, रघुनन्दनः delight of the Raghus, राघवः Rama.

52_95.shloka: गतं तु गङ्गापरपारमाशुरामं सुमन्त्रः प्रततं निरीक्ष्य।अध्वप्रकर्षाद्विनिवृत्तदृष्टिर्मुमोच बाष्पं व्यथित स्तपस्वी।।2.52.100।।
52_95.translation: The wretched Sumantra kept gazing at Rama who swiftly reached the other side of the Ganga and only when he could not see him because of long distance, he turned away his gaze and, overcome with grief, shed tears.
52_95.word_by_word: तपस्वी the miserable, सुमन्त्रः Sumantra, आशु swiftly, गङ्गापरपारम् other side of Ganga, गतम् reached, रामम् of Rama, प्रततम् continuously, निरीक्ष्य having gazed, अध्वप्रकर्षात् due to long distance, विनिवृत्तदृष्टिः turning away his sight, व्यथितः distressed, बाष्पम् मुमोच shed tears.

52_96.shloka: स लोकपालप्रतिमप्रभाववांस्तीर्त्वा महात्मा वरदो महानदीम्।ततः समृद्धान् शुभसस्यमालिनःक्रमेण वत्सान् मुदितानुपागमत्।।2.52.101।।
52_96.translation: Having crossed that mighty river, the highsouled Rama, bestower of boons and equal in splendour, to the Protector of the world reached Vatsa by and by, a highly prosperous country inhabited by happy people.
52_96.word_by_word: महात्मा highsouled, वरदः bestower of boons, लोकपालप्रतिप्रभाववान् equal in splendour to the Protector of the world, सः he (such Rama), महानदीम् mighty river, तीर्त्वा having crossed, ततः then, क्रमेण gradually, समृद्धान् highly prosperous, मुदितान् with happy people, वत्सा (country known as) Vatsa, उपागमत् reached.

52_97.shloka: तौ तत्र हत्वा चतुरो महामृगान्वराहमृश्यं पृषतं महारुरुम्।आदाय मेध्यं त्वरितं बुभुक्षितौवासाय काले ययतुर्वनस्पतिम्।।2.52.102।।
52_97.translation: Famished, they (Rama and Lakshmana) killed a boar, a rishya (whitefooted male antelope), a spotted deer and a great deer with black stripes. They partook the meat and reached a tree by evening where they rested for the night.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे द्विपञ्चाश स्सर्गः।।Thus ends the fiftysecond sarga of Ayodhyakanda of  the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
52_97.word_by_word: बुभुक्षितौ famished, तौ they, तत्र there, वराहम् a boar, ऋश्यम् a whitefooted male antelope, पृषतम् spotted deer, महारुरुम् a great deer with black stripes, चतुरः four, मृगान् animals, हत्वा killed, मेध्यम् pure meat, त्वरितम् quickly, आदाय partaking as food, काले in the evening, वासाय for rest, वनस्पतिम् under a tree, ययतुः reached.

53_1.shloka: [Rama's mind goes back to Kaikeyi and to Kausalya and Sumitra  asks Lakshmana to go back  Lakshmana declines]स तं वृक्षं समासाद्य सन्ध्यामन्वास्यपश्चिमाम्।रामो रमयतां श्रेष्ठ इति होवाच लक्ष्मणम्।।2.53.1।।
53_1.translation: On reaching the foot of the tree, Rama offered oblations to Sandhya of the west. And then he who is the best in keeping people in good humour said to Lakshmana:
53_1.word_by_word: रमयताम् among those who bring delight to others, श्रेष्ठः best, सः रामः that Rama, तं वृक्षम् to that tree, समासाद्य having reached, पश्चिमाम् western, सन्ध्याम् sandhya, अन्वास्य having offered oblations, लक्ष्मणम् looking at Lakshmana, इति these words, उवाच ह spoke.

53_2.shloka: अद्येयं प्रथमा रात्रिर्याता जनपदाद्बहिः।या सुमन्त्रेण रहिता तां नोत्कण्ठितुमर्हसि।।2.53.2।।
53_2.translation: We will have to spend this first night without Sumantra and away from human habitation. (Yet) you need not worry.
53_2.word_by_word: अद्य today, सुमन्त्रेण Sumantra, रहिता without, या इयम् this, प्रथमा रात्रिः first night, जनपदात्   away from human habitation, बहिः outside, याता will be spent, ताम् about that night, उत्कण्ठितुम् to feel anxiety, नार्हसि does not behove.

53_3.shloka: जागर्तव्यमतन्द्रिभ्यामद्यप्रभृति रात्रिषु।योगक्षेमौ हि सीताया वर्तेते लक्ष्मणावयोः।।2.53.3।।
53_3.translation: O Lakshmana, from now on we must be sleeplessly vigilant at night. The welfare and safety of Sita depend on us both.
53_3.word_by_word: लक्ष्मण O Lakshmana, अद्य प्रभृति from now on, रात्रिषु during the nights, अतन्द्रिभ्याम्  sleeplessly, जागर्तव्यम् keep awake, सीतायाः Sita's, योगक्षेमौ acquisition and protection, अवयोः on both of us, वर्ते हि depends.

53_4.shloka: रात्रिं कथञ्चिदेवेमां सौमित्रे वर्तयामहे।अपावर्तामहे भूमावास्तीर्य स्वयमार्जितैः।।2.53.4।।
53_4.translation: O Lakshmana, we will have to somehow pass this night, sleeping on the ground spread with whatever we have procured.
53_4.word_by_word: सौमित्रे O Lakshmana, इमां रात्रिम् this night, कथञ्चिदेव somehow, वर्तयामहे pass, स्वयम् by ourselves, आर्जितैः procured, भूमौ on the ground, आस्तीर्य spread with, उपावर्तामहे we will lie down.

53_5.shloka: स तु संविश्य मेदिन्यां महार्हशयनोचितः।इमाः सौमित्रये रामो व्याजहार कथाः शुभाः।।2.53.5।।
53_5.translation: Rama who deserved a luxurious bed lay down on the ground and uttered these beneficial words to Lakshamana:
53_5.word_by_word: महार्हशयनोचितः fit to rest on luxurious bed, सः Rama, मेदिन्याम् on the ground, संविश्य lying down, सौमित्रये to Lakshmana, शुभाः beneficial, इमाः कथाः these words, व्याजहार uttered.

53_6.shloka: ध्रुवमद्य महाराजो दुःखं स्वपिति लक्ष्मण।कृतकामा तु कैकेयी तुष्टा भवितुमर्हति।।2.53.6।।
53_6.translation: O Lakshmana, the maharaja must be having a painful sleep tonight. But Kaikeyi with her desires fulfilled, ought to feel satisfied.
53_6.word_by_word: लक्ष्मण O Lakshmana, अद्य at this time, महाराजः the great king, ध्रुवम् surely, दुःखम् withdifficulty, स्वपिति sleeps, कृतकामा with the desires fulfilled, कैकेयी तु however Kaikeyi, तुष्टा satisfed, भवितुम् अर्हति should become.

53_7.shloka: सा हि देवी महाराजं कैकेयी राज्यकारणात्।अपि न च्यावयेत्प्राणान् दृष्ट्वा भरतमागतम्।।2.53.7।।
53_7.translation: After the arrival of Bharata, I hope queen Kaikeyi does not deprive the king of his life for the sake of the kingdom?
53_7.word_by_word: सा that, देवी queen, कैकेयी Kaikeyi, आगतम् arrived, भरतम् Bharata, दृष्ट्वा having seen, राज्यकारणात् for the sake of kingdom, महाराजम् king, प्राणान् life, न च्यावयेदपि will not deprive  of.

53_8.shloka: अनाथश्च हि वृद्धश्च मया चैव विनाकृतः।किं करिष्यति कामात्मा कैकेयी वशमागतः।।2.53.8।।
53_8.translation: That lustful king, having come under the hold of Kaikeyi, has been deprived of my presence. What can that forlorn and aged king do?
53_8.word_by_word: अनाथश्च forlorn, वृद्धश्च aged, मया by me, विना च कृतः separated, कामात्मा that lustful one, कैकेयीवशम् under the influence of Kaikeyi, आगतः having come, किं what, करिष्यति can he   do?

53_9.shloka: इदं व्यसनमालोक्य राज्ञश्च मतिविभ्रमम्।काम एवार्थधर्माभ्यां गरीयानिति मे मतिः।।2.53.9।।
53_9.translation: Reflecting on the calamity and mental aberration of the king, I think passion is stronger than wealth and righteousness.
53_9.word_by_word: इदम् this, व्यसनम् calamity, राज्ञः king's, मतिविभ्रमं च mind's aberration, आलोक्य having seen, अर्थधर्माभ्याम् between wealth (artha) and righteousness (dharma), काम एव passion only, गरीयान् is stronger, इति thus, मे मतिः is my thinking.

53_10.shloka: को ह्यविद्वानपि पुमान् प्रमदायाः कृते त्यजेत्।छन्दानुवर्तिनं पुत्रं तातो मामिव लक्ष्मण।।2.53.10।।
53_10.translation: O Lakshmana, will even an illiterate man for the sake of a woman ever abandon his son like me who is faithful and obedient, as did my father?
53_10.word_by_word: लक्ष्मण O Lakshmana, तातः father, मामिव as in my case, प्रमदायाः कृते for the sake of a woman, छन्दानुवर्तिनम् obedient, पुत्रम् son, अविद्वानपि even an illiterate man, कः पुमान् who is the man, त्यजेत् will abandon?

53_11.shloka: सुखी बत सभार्यश्च भरतः केकयीसुतः।मुदितान् कोसलानेको यो भोक्ष्यत्यधिराजवत्।।2.53.11।।
53_11.translation: Bharata, son of Kaikeyi, with his wife will alone enjoy like an emperor this kingdom of Kosala full of happy people.
53_11.word_by_word: यः he, एकः alone, अधिराजवत् like an emperor, मुदितान् with happy people, कोसलान् Kosala country, भोक्ष्यति will enjoy, सभार्यः with his spouse, कैकयी सुतः Kaikeyi's son, भरतः Bharata, सुखी  with happniess, बतः may be.

53_12.shloka: स हि सर्वस्य राज्यस्य मुखमेकं भविष्यति।ताते च वयसाऽतीते मयि चारण्यमास्थिते।।2.53.12।।
53_12.translation: The king is advanced in age and I have to dwell in the forest. Therefore, Bharataalone will be the chief of this entire kingdom.
53_12.word_by_word: ताते dear one, वयसा with age, अतीते advanced, मयि च I also, अरण्यम् the forest, आस्थिते dwelling, सः that Bharata, सर्वस्य entire, राज्यस्य kingdom, एकम् alone, मुखम् chief man, भविष्यति will remain.

53_13.shloka: अर्थधर्मौ परित्यज्य य काममनुवर्तते।एवमापद्यते क्षिप्रं राजा दशरथो यथा।।2.53.13।।
53_13.translation: Any king who abandons dharma and artha and adopts a life of pleasure will very soon reach this state as Dasaratha has attained.
53_13.word_by_word: यः he, अर्थधर्मौ dharma and artha (prosperity and righteousness), परित्यज्य having abandoned, कामम् pleasure, अनुवर्तते seeks, राजा such a king, दशरथो यथा like Dasaratha, क्षिप्रम् soon, एवम् in this way, आपद्यते will reach such a state.

53_14.shloka: मन्ये दशरथान्ताय मम प्रव्राजनाय च।कैकेयी सौम्य सम्प्राप्ता राज्याय भरतस्य च।।2.53.14।।
53_14.translation: O handsome Lakshmana I think Kaikeyi has come to our house for the destruction of Dasaratha, for my banishment and enthronement of Bharata in the kingdom.
53_14.word_by_word: सौम्य handsome, कैकेयी Kaikeyi, दशरथान्ताय for the destruction of Dasaratha, मम my,  प्रव्राजनाय च for banishment, भरतस्य Bharata's, राज्याय च for kingdom, सम्प्राप्ता arrived, मन्ये I consider.

53_15.shloka: अपीदानीं तु कैकेयी सौभाग्यमदमोहिता।कौसल्यां च सुमित्रां च सम्प्रबाधेत मत्कृते।।2.53.15।।
53_15.translation: Intoxicated with her good fortune will not Kaikeyi torment Kausalya and Sumitra for my sake?
53_15.word_by_word: कैकेयी Kaikeyi, सौभाग्यमदमोहिता intoxicated with good fortune, मत्कृते because of me, कौसल्यां च Kausalya, सुमित्रां च and also Sumitra, इदानीम् now, अपि न संप्रबाधेत will not torment?

53_16.shloka: मा स्म मत्कारणाद्देवी सुमित्रा दुःखमावसेत्।अयोध्यामित एव त्वं काल्ये प्रविश लक्ष्मण।।2.53.16।।
53_16.translation: O Lakshmana, because of me mother Sumitra should not live in sorrow. Therefore, tomorrow morning go back to Ayodhya from here itself.
53_16.word_by_word: लक्ष्मण Lakshmana, मत्कारणात् because of me, देवी mother, सुमित्रा Sumitra, दुःखम् in sorrow, मा आवसेत् स्म should not experience, त्वम् you, काल्ये in the morning, इत एव from here, अयोध्याम् to Ayodhya, प्रविश enter.

53_17.shloka: अहमेको गमिष्यामि सीतया सह दण्डकान्।अनाथाया हि नाथस्त्वं कौशल्याया भविष्यसि।।2.53.17।।
53_17.translation: I shall go with Sita into the Dandaka forest and you be the protector of the helpless, Kausalya.
53_17.word_by_word: अहम् myself I, एकः alone, सीतया सह along with Sita, दण्डकान् Dandaka forest, गमिष्यामि  shall go, अनाथायाः for the helpless, कौशल्यायाः for Kausalya, त्वम् you, नाथः (भविष्यसि) be a protector.

53_18.shloka: क्षुद्रकर्मा हि कैकेयी द्वेष्यमन्याय्यमाचरेत्।परिदद्याहि धर्मज्ञे भरते मम मातरम्।।2.53.18।।
53_18.translation: Kaikeyi who is a woman of heinous deeds may follow, out of hostility, an unjust way in respect of my mother. In that case my mother may be entrusted to the care of Bharata who is righteous.
53_18.word_by_word: क्षुद्रकर्मा one of heinous deeds, कैकेयी Kaikeyi, द्वेष्यम् in hostility, अन्याय्यम् unjust actions, आचरेत् follows, मम my, मातरम् mother, धर्मज्ञे with the righteous, भरते to Bharata, परिदद्याः हि you may entrust.

53_19.shloka: नूनं जात्यन्तरे कस्मिन् स्त्रियः पुत्रैर्वियोजिताः।जनन्या मम सौमित्रे तस्मादेतदुपस्थितम्।।2.53.19।।
53_19.translation: O Lakshmana, surely in one of her previous births did my mother separate women from their sons. That is why this (calamity) has befallen her.
53_19.word_by_word: सौमित्रे Lakshmana, मम जनन्या by my mother, कस्मिन् जात्यन्तरे in some previous birth,स्त्रियः women, पुत्रैः with sons, वियोजिताः separated, तस्मात्  for that reason, एतत् all this, उपस्थितम् befallen, नूनम् certainly.

53_20.shloka: मया हि चिरपुष्टेन दुखसंवर्धितेन च।विप्रयुज्यत कौशल्या फलकाले धिगस्तु माम्।।2.53.20।।
53_20.translation: Kausalya nurtured me for a long time and reared me with great difficulty. When she was going to enjoy the fruits of her labour, I have been separated from her. Fie upon me
53_20.word_by_word: चिरपुष्टेन nurtured for a long time, दुःखसंवर्धितेन reared with great dificulty, मया me, कौशल्या Kausalya, फलकाले at the moment of fuition, विप्रायुज्यत has been separated, माम् me, धिक् अस्तु shame on me.

53_21.shloka: मा स्म सीमन्तिनी काचिज्जनयेत्पुत्रमीदृशम्।सौमित्रे योऽहमम्बाया दद्मि शोकमनन्तकम्।।2.53.21।।
53_21.translation: O Lakshmana, I am causing endless sorrow to my mother. May no mother give birth to a son like me
53_21.word_by_word: सौमित्रे Lakshmana, यः अहम् am I, अम्बायाः to my mother, अनन्तकम् infinite, शोकम् pain, दद्मि am giving, ईदृशम् such, पुत्रम् a son, काचित् सीमन्तिनी (जननी) any mother, मा स्म जनयेत् may not give birth.

53_22.shloka: मन्ये प्रीतिविशिष्टा सा मत्तो लक्ष्मण शारिका।यस्यास्तच्छ्रूयते वाक्यं शुक पादमरेर्दश।।2.53.22।।
53_22.translation: (On hearing my banishment) her myna would say to her parrot, 'O parrot, bite the foot of the enemy (Kaikeyi)'. I think  that bird is  a greater source of joy to my mother than I, O Lakshmana
53_22.word_by_word: लक्ष्मण O Lakshmana, यस्याः myna's, शुक parrot, अरेः enemy's, पादम् foot, दश bite, तत् वाक्यम् such statement, श्रूयते heard, सा शारिका that myna, मत्तः more than I, प्रीतिविशिष्टाmore pleased, मन्ये I think.

53_23.shloka: शोचन्त्या अल्पभाग्याया न किञ्चिदुपकुर्वता।पुत्रेण किमपुत्राया मया कार्यमरिन्दम।।2.53.23।।
53_23.translation: My mother has less fortune and more grief like a woman without a son, O Lakshmana, subduer of enemies For her, what is the use of a son like me who cannot render any service to her?
53_23.word_by_word: अरिन्दम conquerer of enemies, शोचन्त्याः experiencing great sorrow, अल्पभाग्यायाः less fortunate, अपुत्रायाः without a son, किञ्चित् little, नोपकुर्वता could not be helped, पुत्रेण by the son, मया by me, किम् what, कार्यम् can be done?

53_24.shloka: अल्पभाग्या हि मे माता कौशल्या रहिता मया।शेते परमदुःखार्ता पतिता शोकसागरे।।2.53.24।।
53_24.translation: My mother is unlucky as she has been separated from me. Extremely distressed, she must have plunged into an ocean of grief.
53_24.word_by_word: अल्पभाग्या less fortunate, मे माता my mother, कौशल्या Kausalya, मया with me, रहिता bereft of, परमदुःखार्ता extremely distressed, शोकसागरे ocean of sorrow, पतिता fallen into, शेते  must be lying.

53_25.shloka: एको ह्यहमयोध्यां च पृथिवीं चापि लक्ष्मण।तरेयमिषुभिः क्रुद्धो ननु वीर्यमकारणम्।।2.53.25।।
53_25.translation: Once enraged, O Lakshmana I can overpower Ayodhya, even the whole world all by myself with my arrows. But exhibition of prowess without any reason is not desirable.
53_25.word_by_word: लक्ष्मण Lakshmana, अहम् I, क्रुद्धः am enraged, एकः alone, अयोध्यां च Ayodhya, पृथिवीं चापि and also the whole earth, इषुभिः with arrows, तरेयम् will cross, वीर्यम् prowess, अकारणं ननुwithout reason.

53_26.shloka: अधर्मभयभीतश्च परलोकस्य चानघ।तेन लक्ष्मण नाद्याह मात्मानमभिषेचये।।2.53.26।।
53_26.translation: O sinless one, I did not get myself coronated owing to fear of unrighteous conduct and fear of the other world.
53_26.word_by_word: अनघ O sinless one, अहम् I, अधर्मभयभीतश्च with the fear of unrighteous conduct, परलोकस्य च for the other world also, लक्ष्मण Lakshmana, तेन therefore, अद्य at this time, आत्मानम् myself, नाभिषेचये did not get crowned.

53_27.shloka: एतदन्यश्च करुणं विलप्य विजने वने।अश्रुपूर्णमुखो रामो निशि तूष्णीमुपाविशत्।।2.53.27।।
53_27.translation: Like this and in many other ways Rama lamented pitifully in that desolate forest. When his face was filled with tears, he sat silently in the night.
53_27.word_by_word: रामः Rama, निशि in the night, विजने in the desolate, वने in the  forest, एतत् all these, अन्यच्च and other, करुणम् pitiful, विलप्य lamenting, अश्रुपूर्णमुखः face filled with tears, तूष्णीम् silently, उपाविशत् sat.

53_28.translation: Lakshmana consoled Rama who ceased to lament like fire with extinguished flames or like a motionless sea:
53_28.word_by_word: विलप्य having lamented, उपरतम् ceased, गतार्चिषम् with extinguished flames, अनलम् इव  like fire, निर्वेगम् without moving, समुद्रमिव like the sea, रामम् Rama, लक्ष्मणः Lakshmana, आश्वासयत consoled.

53_29.shloka: ध्रुवमद्य पुरी राजन्नयोध्यायुधिनां वर।निष्प्रभा त्वयि निष्क्रान्ते गतचन्द्रेव शर्वरी।।2.53.29।।
53_29.translation: O Rama, foremost of warriors, it is certain that since your departure, the city of Ayodhya must be lustreless like night without the Moon.
53_29.word_by_word: आयुधिनाम् among wielder of weapons, वर foremost, राजन् O king, अद्य now, अयोध्यापुरी city of Ayodhya, त्वयि when you, निष्क्रान्ते had departed, गतचन्द्र without moon, शर्वरीव like night, निष्प्रभा without lustre, ध्रुवम् certain.

53_30.shloka: नैतदौपयिकं राम यदिदं परितप्यते।विषादयसि सीतां च मां चैव पुरुषर्षभ।।2.53.30।।
53_30.translation: This is not the way you should lament, O Rama. O foremost of men, by doing so you are disheartening me and Sita as well.
53_30.word_by_word: राम O Rama, इदम् in this manner, यत् परितप्यते that you are lamenting, एतत् all this, औपयिकम् proper, न not, पुरुषर्षभ foremost of men, सीतां च Sita, मां चैव me also, विषादयसि disheartening.

53_31.shloka: न च सीता त्वया हीना न चाहमपि राघव।मुहूर्तमपि जीवावो जलान्मत्स्याविनोद्धृतौ।।2.53.31।।
53_31.translation: Without you Sita or I will not survive even for a moment like a fish taken out ofwater, O Rama
53_31.word_by_word: राघव O Rama, त्वया by you, हीना without, सीता Sita, न not,  अहमपि I also, न not, जलात्  from water, उद्धृतौ removed, मत्स्याविव like fish, मुहूर्तमपि even for a moment, न जीवावः will not survive.

53_32.shloka: नहि तातं न शत्रुघ्नं न सुमित्रां परन्तप।द्रष्टुमिच्छेयमद्याहं स्वर्गं चापि त्वया विना।।2.53.32।।
53_32.translation: Without you, O Rama, tormentor of enemies, I wish to see neither father nor Satrughna nor Sumitra nor even heaven itself
53_32.word_by_word: परन्तप O tomentor of enemies, Rama, अहम् I, अद्य now, त्वया विना without you, तातम्  father, द्रष्टुम् see, न हि इच्छेयम् shall not desire, शत्रुघ्नम् Satrughna, न not, सुमित्राम्  Sumitra, स्वर्गं चापि even heaven.

53_33.shloka: ततस्तत्र सुखासीनौ नातिदूरे निरीक्ष्य ताम्।न्यग्रोधे सुकृतां शय्यां भेजाते धर्मवत्सलौ।।2.53.33।।
53_33.translation: Thereafter Rama and Sita, the duo, nurturers of righteousness, from their comfortable  seats moved to the bed wellmade under the banyan tree not far (from there where they were sitting) and lay down (to sleep).
53_33.word_by_word: ततः thereafter, तत्र there, सुखासीनौ seated comfortably, धर्मवत्सलौ attached to righteousness, नातिदूरे not far (from there), न्यग्रोधे under a banyan tree, सुकृताम् wellmade,  तां शय्याम् that bed, निरीक्ष्य having seen, भेजाते lay down.

53_34.shloka: स लक्ष्मणस्योत्तमपुष्कलं वचोनिशम्य चैवं वनवासमादरात्।समाः समस्ता विदधे परन्तपःप्रपद्य धर्मं सुचिराय राघवः।।2.53.34।।
53_34.translation: Rama, the tormentor of enemies, listened, out of love, to the excellent and copious words of Lakshmana and permitted him to live in the forest for the entire period of fourteen years by observing the prescribed code of conduct as enjoined on  life in the forest.
53_34.word_by_word: परन्तपः tormentor of enemies, सः राघवः that Rama, एवम् thus, लक्ष्मणस्य Lakshmana's, उत्तमपुष्कलम् excellent and copious, वचः utterances, आदरात् out of love, निशम्य havingheard, सुचिराय for a long period, धर्मम् that code of conduct of forest life, प्रपद्य having obtained, समस्ता: all, समाः the years, वनवासम् life in the forest, विदधे resorted to.

53_35.shloka: ततस्तु तस्मिन् विजने वने तदामहाबलौ राघववंशवर्धनौ।न तौ भयं सम्भ्रममभ्युपेयतुर्यथैव सिंहौ गिरिसानुगोचरौ।।2.53.35।।
53_35.translation: Then the two mighty perpetuators of the Raghu race, who were like two lions dwelling on the slopes of mountains, lived in that lonely forest  without fear or hesitation.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे त्रिपञ्चाशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the fiftythird sarga of Ayodhyakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
53_35.word_by_word: ततः thereafter, तदा then, विजने in desolation, तस्मिन् that, वने in the  forest, महाबलौ very strong, तौ the two, राघववंशवर्धनौ perpetuators of the Raghu race, (Rama and Lakshmana), गिरिसानु गोचरौ dwelling on the slopes of mountains, सिंहौ यथैव  like two lions, भयम् fear, सम्भ्रमम् hesitation, न अभ्युपेयतुः did not feel.

54_1.shloka: [Rama, Sita and Lakshmana depart for Dandaka forest -- reach the hermitage of sage Bharadwaja -- seek advice for a dwelling -- place -- Bharadwaja suggests Chitrakuta at the confluence of rivers Ganga and Yamuna -- they set out after a night's stay.]ते तु तस्मिन्महावृक्षे उषित्वा रजनीं शिवाम्।विमलेऽभ्युदिते सूर्ये तस्माद्देशात्प्रतस्थिरे।।2.54.1।।
54_1.translation: They (Rama, Sita and Lakshmana) spent that auspicious night under that great tree and set out from there after the bright sun rose.
54_1.word_by_word: ते they (Rama, Sita and Lakshmana), शिवाम् auspicious, रजनीम् night, तस्मिन् that, महावृक्षे big tree, उषित्वा having remained, विमले when the bright, सूर्ये Sun, अभ्युदिते had risen, तस्मात् देशात् from that region, प्रतस्थिरे set out.

54_2.shloka: यत्र भागीरथीं गङ्गां यमुनाभिप्रवर्तते।जग्मुस्तं देशमुद्दिश्य विगाह्य सुमहद्वनम्।।2.54.2।।ते भूमिभागान्विविधान् देशांश्चापि मनोरमान्।अदृष्टपूर्वान् पश्यन्तस्तत्र तत्र यशश्विनः।।2.54.3।।
54_2.translation: Illustrious Rama, Sita and Lakshmana entered the deep forest and saw the different regions of the land and other enchanting places which they had never seen before and proceeded towards the region where the river Yamuna merged with Bhagirathi Ganga.
54_2.word_by_word: यशश्विनः illustrious, ते they, सुमहत् very great, वनम् forest, विगाह्य having entered, विविधान् different, भूमिभागान् regions of the land, अदृष्टपूर्वान् hithertounseen, मनोरमान् enchanting, देशांश्चापि regions also, तत्र तत्र here and there, पश्यन्तः viewing, यमुना Yamuna, यत्र where, भागीरथीम् Bhagirathi, गङ्गाम् Ganga's, अभिप्रवर्तते flows into, तं देशम् that place, उद्दिश्य intending (to reach), जग्मुः went.

54_3.shloka: यथा क्षेमेण गच्छन् स पश्यंश्च विविधान् द्रुमान्।निवृत्तमात्रे दिवसे रामः सौमित्रिमब्रवीत्।।2.54.4।।
54_3.translation: Walking on the safe path and observing various kinds of trees Rama said to Lakshmana at the end of the day:
54_3.word_by_word: सः रामः that Rama, यथा क्षेमेण on a safe way, गच्छन् going, विविधान् various, द्रुमान् trees, पश्यंश्च looking at, दिवसे day, निवृत्तमात्रे when ended, सौमित्रिम् to Lakshmana, अब्रवीत् said.

54_4.shloka: प्रयागमभितः पश्य सौमित्रे धूममुन्नतम्।अग्नेर्भगवतः केतुं मन्ये सन्निहितो मुनिः।।2.54.5।।
54_4.translation: O son of Sumitra, look at the column of smoke rising like the banner of the venerable firegod near Prayaga. I think an ascetic dwells nearby.
54_4.word_by_word: सौमित्रे O son of Sumitra, Lakshmana, प्रयागम् अभितः near Prayaga, उन्नतम् rising high, भगवतः of the venerable, अग्नेः fire's, केतुम् the banner, धूमम् smoke, पश्य look, मुनिः the sage, सन्निहितः close by, मन्ये I think.

54_5.shloka: नूनं प्राप्ताः स्म सम्भेदं गङ्गायमुनयोर्वयम्।तथा हि श्रूयते शब्दो वारिणो वारिघट्टितः।।2.54.6।।
54_5.translation: We have surely reached the confluence of Ganga and Yamuna which can be ascertained from the sounds of clashing water.
54_5.word_by_word: वयम् we, गङ्गायमुनयोः Ganga and Yamuna, सम्भेदम् confluence, प्राप्ताः स्म have reached,  नूनम् it is certain, तथा हि as for, वारिघट्टितः dashed by waters, वारिणः waters, शब्दः sound, श्रूयते is heard.

54_6.shloka: दारूणि परिभिन्नानि वनजैरुपजीविभिः।भरद्वाजाश्रमे चैते दृश्यन्ते विविधा द्रुमाः।।2.54.7।।
54_6.translation: Here are logs of wood cut into pieces by forestdwellers, living on forest products. You can see various trees near the hermitage of sage Bharadwaja.
54_6.word_by_word: वनजैः by the foresters, उपजीविभिः those people subsisting on them, परिभिन्नानि are broken,  दारूणि logs of wood, भरद्वाजाश्रमे in the hermitage of Bharadwaja, एते all these, विविधाः different, द्रुमाश्च trees also, दृश्यन्ते are seen.

54_7.shloka: धन्विनौ तौ सुखं गत्वा लम्बमाने दिवाकरे।गङ्गायमुनयोस्सन्धौ प्रापतुर्निलयं मुनेः।।2.54.8।।
54_7.translation: The two archers (Rama and Lakshmana) reached comfortably (walking at an easy pace) by evening the hermitage of sage Bharadwaja near the confluence of Ganga and Yamuna.
54_7.word_by_word: धन्विनौ the two archers, तौ those two, सुखम् comfortably, गत्वा having gone,  दिवाकरे Sun, लम्बमाने was hanging, गङ्गायमुनयोः of Ganga and yamuna, सन्धौ at the confluence, मुनेः of sage Bharadwaja, निलयम् hermitage, प्रापतुः arrived.

54_8.translation: Seeing Rama approaching the hermitage the deer and the birds were frightened. Proceeding on the path, for a while Rama reached (the place of) Bharadwaja.
54_8.word_by_word: रामः Rama, अश्रमम् hermitage, आसाद्य having approached, मृगपक्षिणः animals and birds, त्रासयन् frightening, मुहूर्तम् for a moment, अध्वानम् on the path, गत्वा proceeding, भरद्वाजम् Bharadhwaja, उपागमत् reached.

54_9.translation: Thereafter the two heroes followed by Sita arrived at the hermitage and, wishing to see the sage, waited at a distance.
54_9.word_by_word: ततः then, सीतया by Sita, अनुगतौ followed, वीरौ those two heroes, आश्रमम् hermitage, आसाद्य having reached, मुनेः ascetic's, दर्शनकाङ्क्षिणौ wishing to see, दूरादेव at a distance, अवतस्थतुः stood.

54_10.shloka: स प्रविश्य महात्मानमृषिं शिष्यगणैर्वृतम्।संशितव्रतमेकाग्रं तपसा लब्धचक्षुषम्।।2.54.11।।हुताग्निहोत्रं दृष्ट्वैव महाभागं कृताञ्जलिः।रामः सौमित्रिणा सार्धं सीतया चाभ्यवादयत्।।2.54.12।।
54_10.translation: Rama entered the hermitage and saw that highsouled Bharadwaja surrounded by his disciples. He was a distinguished sage who (himself) kindled sacrficial fires and acquired spiritual insight by practising rigid austerities with concentration of mind and ascetic powers. Rama, Lakshmana and Sita paid their obeisance to that great sage.
54_10.word_by_word: सः रामः Rama, प्रविश्य having entered, संशितव्रतम् one practising rigorous austerities, एकाग्रम् with concentration of mind, तपसा with asceticism, लब्दचक्षुषम् one who has obtained spiritual insight, हुताग्निहोत्रम् one who has kindled fire in sacrificial rituals, महाभागम् distinguished, शिष्यगणैः with disciples, वृतम् surrounded by, महात्मानम् highsouled, ऋषिम् sage, दृष्ट्वैव having seen, सौमित्रिणा Lakshmana, सार्धम् along with, सीतया च Sita too, अभ्यवादयत् paid obeisance.

54_11.shloka: न्यवेदयत चात्मानं तस्मै लक्ष्मणपूर्वजः।पुत्रौ दशरथस्यावां भगवन् रामलक्ष्मणौ।।2.54.13।।
54_11.translation: Lakshmana's elder brother (Rama) introduced himself (to Bharadwaja), O venerable one, we are both sons of Dasaratha, Rama and Lakshmana.
54_11.word_by_word: लक्ष्मणपूर्वजः Lakshmana's elder brother (Rama), तस्मै to that sage, आत्मानम् himself, न्यवेदयत introduced, भगवन् O venerable one, अवाम् both of us, दशरथस्य Dasaratha's, पुत्रौ sons, रामलक्ष्मणौ Rama and Lakshmana.

54_12.shloka: भार्या ममेयं वैदेही कल्याणी जनकात्मजा।मां चानुयाता विजनं तपोवनमनिन्दिता।।2.54.14।।
54_12.translation: This blessed one is my consort, Sita, daughter of Janaka. Irreproachable she has followed me to the desolate grove of penance (hermitage).
54_12.word_by_word: इयम् this, कल्याणी auspicious one, मम my, भार्या consort, जनकात्मजा daughter of Janaka, वैदेही Vaidehi (Sita), अनिन्दिता irreproachable, माम् me, विजनम् desolate, तपोवनम् penacegrove, अनुयाता has followed.

54_13.shloka: पित्रा प्रव्राज्यमानं मां सौमित्रिरनुज प्रियः।अयमन्वगमद्भ्राता वनमेव दृढव्रतः।।2.54.15।।
54_13.translation: This is the son of Sumitra, my beloved younger brother, a man of firm resolve. He has accompanied me when I was sent on exile to the forest by my father.
54_13.word_by_word: दृढव्रतः of firm resolve, भ्राता brother, अनुजः younger, प्रियः dear, अयं सौमित्रिः this son of Sumitra, पित्रा by father, प्रव्राज्यमानम् being sent on exile, माम् me, वनमेव to the forest, अन्वगमत् followed.

54_14.shloka: पित्रा नियुक्ता भगवन् प्रवेक्ष्यामस्तपोवनम्।धर्ममेव चरिष्याम स्तत्र मूलफलाशनाः।।2.54.16।।
54_14.translation: O venerable one on my father's command we entered the desolate forest of penance. Subsisting on roots and fruits, I shall practise the righteous way of life.
54_14.word_by_word: भगवन् O venerable one, पित्रा by father, नियुक्ताः ordered by, तपोवनम् penancegrove प्रवेक्ष्यामः we will enter, तत्र there, मूलफलाशनाः subsisting on roots and fruits, धर्ममेव following righteous ways, चरिष्यामः will practise.

54_15.shloka: तस्य तद्वचनं श्रुत्वा राजपुत्रस्य धीमतः।उपानयत धर्मात्मा गामर्घ्यमुदकं ततः।।2.54.17।।
54_15.translation: Sage Bharadwaja heard the words of sagacious Rama and offered a bull, water (for washing feet) and arghya (offering to a guest).
54_15.word_by_word: धर्मात्मा sage Bharadwaja, धीमतः of the sagacious, तस्य that, राजपुत्रस्य prince's,  तत् वचनम् those words, श्रुत्वा having heard, ततः then, गाम् bull, अर्घ्यम् for arghya, उदकम् water, उपानयत brought.

54_16.shloka: नानाविधानन्नरसान् वन्यमूलफलाश्रयान्।तेभ्यो ददौ तप्ततपा वासं चैवाभ्यकल्पयत्।।2.54.18।।
54_16.translation: The ascetic who practised severe penance offered them different kinds of food and drink made from roots and fruits available in the forest. He also provided them a place to rest in.
54_16.word_by_word: तप्ततपाः one who practised severe penance, नानाविधान् different kinds of, वन्यमूलफलाश्रयान् made from the fruits and roots, अन्नरसान् food and drink, तेभ्यः for them, ददौ gave, वासं चैव restingplace also, अकल्पयत् arranged.

54_17.translation: There the sage sat, surrounded by hermits, animals and birds after having welcomed Rama with due honour.
54_17.word_by_word: मृगपक्षिभिः by animals and birds, मुनिभिश्च by hermits also, समन्ततः surrounded, आसीनः seated, मुनिः sage (Bharadwaja), आगतम् arrived, तं रामम् to that Rama, स्वागतेन with  welcome, अभ्यर्च्य having paid homage, आह uttered.

54_18.shloka: प्रतिगृह्य च तामर्चामुपविष्टं स राघवम्।भरद्वाजोऽब्रवीद्वाक्यं धर्मयुक्तमिदं तदा।।2.54.20।।
54_18.translation: Rama accepted the hospitality of Bharadwaja and took a seat in front of the sage, who spoke to him these words in conformity with righteousness:
54_18.word_by_word: सः भरद्वाजः that Bharadwaja, तदा then, ताम् that, अर्चाम् hospitality, प्रतिगृह्य having  received, उपविष्टम् seated in front, राघवम् to Rama, धर्मयुक्तम् in conformity with  righteousness, इदं वाक्यम् these words, अब्रवीत् said.

54_19.shloka: चिरस्य खलु काकुत्स्थ पश्यामि त्वामिहागतम्।श्रुतं तव मया चेदं विवासनमकारणम्।।2.54.21।।
54_19.translation: O descendant of the Kakutstha dynasty, I am able to see you on your arrival here after a long time. I have also heard about your unwarranted banishment.
54_19.word_by_word: काकुत्स्थ O descendant of the Kakutstha dynasty, चिरस्य after a long time, इह here, आगतम् arrived here, त्वाम् you, पश्यामि खलु I see indeed, अकारणम् without any reason, तव your, इदम् this, विवासनम् banishment, मया by me, श्रुतं च is heard too.

54_20.shloka: अवकाशो विविक्तोऽयं महानद्योस्समागमे।पुण्यश्च रमणीयश्च वसत्विह भवान् सुखम्।।2.54.22।।
54_20.translation: This sacred and solitary region near the confluence of two great rivers (Ganga and Yamuna) is a pleasant place. You may stay here comfortably.
54_20.word_by_word: महानद्योः of two great rivers, समागमे at the confluence, अयम् this, अवकाशः region, विविक्तः solitary, पुण्यश्च is also sacred, रमणीयश्च pleasant, भवान् you, इह here, सुखम् comfortably, वसतु can dwell.

54_21.shloka: एवमुक्तस्तु वचनं भरद्वाजेन राघवः।प्रत्युवाच शुभं वाक्यं रामः सर्वहिते रतः।।2.54.23।।
54_21.translation: Rama, ever devoted to the wellbeing of every one, heard Bharadwaja and replied to him with these auspicious words:
54_21.word_by_word: सर्वहिते for the wellbeing of all, रतः devoted, राघवः born in the dynasty of Raghu, रामः Rama, भरद्वाजेन by Bharadwaja, एवम् in this way, वचनम् these words, उक्तः having been addressed, शुभम् auspicious, वाक्यम् words, प्रत्युवाच spoke in reply.

54_22.shloka: भगवन्नित आसन्नः पौरजानपदो जनः।सुदर्शमिह मां प्रेक्ष्य मन्येऽहमिममाश्रमम्।।2.54.24।।आगमिष्यति वैदेहीं मां चापि प्रेक्षको जनः।अनेन कारणेनाहमिह वासं न रोचये।।2.54.25।।
54_22.translation: O venerable sage, I feel the people living in nearby villages and towns, perceiving that we can be easily seen here, will frequent this ashram. This is the reason I don't wish to stay here.
54_22.word_by_word: भगवन् O venerable one, इतः from here, पौरजानपदः inhabiting towns and villages, जनः subjects, आसन्नः living closely, इह here, माम् me, सुदर्शम् easily to be seen, प्रेक्ष्य having seen, जनः people, वैदेहीम् Sita, मां चापि me too, प्रेक्षकः in order to see, इमम् आश्रमम् to this hermitage, आगमिष्यति will frequent, अहम् I, मन्ये think so, अनेन कारणेन for this reason, अहम् I, इह here, वासम् to reside, न रोचये do not desire.
