54_23.shloka: एकान्ते पश्य भगवन्नाश्रमस्थानमुत्तमम्।रमेत यत्र वैदेही सुखार्हा जनकात्मजा।।2.54.26।।
54_23.translation: O revered one, Janaka's daughter (Sita) deserves comfort. Suggest a solitary and agreeable place for our hermitage where she can enjoy herself.
54_23.word_by_word: भगवन् revered one, सुखार्हा deserves comfort, जनकात्मजा Janaka's daughter, वैदेही Vaidehi, यत्र where, रमेत may enjoy, एकान्ते in a solitary, उत्तमम् agreeable, आश्रमस्थानम् hermitage, पश्य see.

54_24.shloka: एतछ्रुत्वा शुभं वाक्यं भरद्वाजो महामुनिः।राघवस्य ततो वाक्यमर्थग्राहकमब्रवीत्।।2.54.27।।
54_24.translation: On hearing the auspicious words of Rama conveying his intention, the great sage Bharadwaja replied to him thus:
54_24.word_by_word: महामुनिः great sage, भरद्वाजः Bharadwaja, राघवस्य Rama's, एतत् these, शुभम् auspicious, वाक्यम् words, श्रुत्वा having heard, ततः after that, अर्थग्राहकम् conveying the meaning, वाक्यम् words, अब्रवीत् said.

54_25.shloka: दशक्रोश इतस्तात गिरिर्यत्रनिवत्स्यसि।महर्षिसेवितः पुण्यः सर्वतः सुखदर्शनः।।2.54.28।।गोलाङ्गूलानुचरितो वानरर्क्षनिषेवितः।चित्रकूट इति ख्यातो गन्धमादनसन्निभः।।2.54.29।।
54_25.translation: O my son ten krosas (about twenty miles) from here is a mountain wellknown as  Chitrakuta, resembling 'Gandhamadana'. That mountain frequented by maharshis is sacred. It looks pleasant from all sides. Monkeys, apes and bears wander there and it is an appropriate place for you to live in.
54_25.word_by_word: तात O dear, महर्षिसेवितः inhabited by sages, पुण्यः sacred, सर्वतः from all sides, सुखदर्शनः whose sight causes delight, गोलाङ्गूलानुचरितः full of wandering apes, वानरर्क्षनिषेवितः inhabited by monkeys and bears, चित्रकूटः इति by name Chitrakuta, ख्यातः wellknown, गन्धमादनसन्निभः like 'Gandhamadana' mountain, गिरिः mountain, इतः from here, दशक्रोशे at a distance of ten krosas, यत्र there, निवत्स्यसि you can live.

54_26.shloka: यावता चित्रकूटस्य नरशृङ्गान्यवेक्षते।कल्याणानि समाधत्ते न पापे कुरुते मनः।।2.54.30।।
54_26.translation: As long as one beholds the peaks of mount Chitrakuta, he will be inspired to do good deeds and will not employ his mind in sinful thoughts.
54_26.word_by_word: नरः a man, यावता as long as, चित्रकूटस्य Chitrakuta mountain's, शृङ्गानि peaks, आवेक्षते beholds, कल्याणानि auspicious deeds, समाधत्ते will perform, पापे in sinful thoughts, मनः the mind, न कुरुते will not employ.

54_27.shloka: ऋषयस्तत्र बहवो विहृत्य शरदां शतम्।तपसा दिवमारूढाः कपालशिरसा सह।।2.54.31।।
54_27.translation: On the Chitrakuta mountain many ascetics wandered about (lived) for hundreds of years carrying on penance. In the process they became so much emaciated that they looked as if they were left (only) with the skulls on their heads. (In the end) they ascended heaven.
54_27.word_by_word: तत्र there, बहवः many, ऋषयः ascetics, शरदां शतम् for hundreds of years, तपसा with austerities, विहृत्य having roamed about, कपालशिरसा सह with the skulls on their heads, दिवम् heaven, आरूढाः have ascended.

54_28.shloka: प्रविविक्तमहं मन्ये तं वासं भवतस्सुखम्।इह वा वनवासाय वस राम मया सह।।2.54.32।।
54_28.translation: O Rama, I think you will enjoy your stay there in a solitary place. Or else, you may live with me here during the period of banishment.
54_28.word_by_word: राम Rama, प्रविविक्तम् solitary, तं वासम् that abode, भवतः for your, सुखम् happiness, अहम् I,  मन्ये think, मया सह with me, इह वा or here, वनवासाय for the period of banishment, वस you may live.

54_29.shloka: स रामं सर्वकामैस्तं भरद्वाजः प्रियातिथिम्।सभार्यं सह च भ्रात्रा प्रतिजग्राह धर्मवित्।।2.54.33।।
54_29.translation: Bharadwaja, who knows his duty honoured Rama, his beloved guest with his consort and brother by extending all kinds of hospitality.
54_29.word_by_word: धर्मवित् one who knows his duty, सः भरद्वाजः that Bharadwaja, सभार्यम् with his consort, भ्रात्रा सह with brother, च and, प्रियातिथिम् beloved guest, तं रामम् that Rama, सर्वकामैः with all desires, प्रतिजग्राह honoured.

54_30.shloka: तस्य प्रयागे रामस्य तं महर्षिमुपेयुषः।प्रपन्ना रजनी पुण्याः चित्राः कथयतः कथाः।।2.54.34।।
54_30.translation: At Prayaga, while the great sage Bharadwaja was narrating to Rama sitting near him several interesting anecdotes, the holy night set in.
54_30.word_by_word: प्रयागे at Prayaga, तं महर्षिम् that great sage, उपेयुषः sitting near, रामस्य of Rama, चित्राः interesting, कथाः tales, कथयतः while conversing, पुण्या that holy, रजनी night, प्रपन्ना had set in.

54_31.shloka: सीतातृतीयः काकुत्स्थः परिश्रान्तः सुखोचितः।भरद्वाजाश्रमे रम्ये तां रात्रिमवसत्सुखम्।।2.54.35।।
54_31.translation: The exhausted scion of the Kakutsthas, used to comforts, stayed in the lovely hermitage of Bharadwaja for the night with Sita, as the third member (of the group).
54_31.word_by_word: सुखोचितः used to comforts, परिश्रान्तः exhausted, सीतांतृतीयः Sita counted as the third, काकुत्स्थ: Rama, रम्ये in the lovely, भरद्वाजाश्रमे hermitage of Bharadwaja, तां रात्रिम् that night, सुखम् happily, अवसत् stayed.

54_32.shloka: प्रभातायां रजन्यां तु भरद्वाजमुपागमत्।उवाच नरशार्दूलो मुनिं ज्वलिततेजसम्।।2.54.36।।
54_32.translation: When the night passed into dawn, Rama the best of men approached the resplendent Bharadwaja and said.
54_32.word_by_word: नरशार्दूलः tiger (best) among men, रजन्याम् after the night, प्रभातायाम् at dawn, भरद्वाजम् to Bharadwaja, उपागमत् approached, ज्वलिततेजसम् with blazing lustre, मुनिम् the sage, उवाच said.

54_33.shloka: शर्वरीं भगवन्नद्य सत्यशील तवाश्रमे।उषिताः स्मेह वसतिमनुजानातु नो भवान्।।2.54.37।।
54_33.translation: O venerable sage devoted to truth, we have spent the night in your hermitage. Please permit us to depart for the dwellingplace (suggested by you).
54_33.word_by_word: सत्यशील O truthful, भगवन् O venerable, इह here, तव आश्रमे in your hermitage, शर्वरीम् the night, उषिता स्म we have spent, अद्य to day, नः us, भवान् you, वसतिम् dwellingplace, अनुजानातु permit.

54_34.shloka: रात्र्यां तु तस्यां व्युष्टायां भरद्वाजोऽब्रवीदिदम्।मधुमूलफलोपेतं चित्रकूटं व्रजेति ह।।2.54.38।।
54_34.translation: When the night came to a close, Bharadwaja said (to Rama): You may proceed to Chitrakuta which abounds in roots, fruits and honey.
54_34.word_by_word: तस्याम् रात्र्याम् when that night, व्युष्टायाम् had come to a close, भरद्वाजः Bharadwaja, मधुमूलफलोपेतम् abounding in honey, roots, and fruits, चित्रकूटम् to Chitrakuta, व्रज go, इति thus, इदम् these words, अब्रवीत् said.

54_35.shloka: वासमौपयिकं मन्ये तव राम महाबलनानानगगणोपेतः किन्नरोरगसेवितः।मयूरनादाभिरुतो गजराजनिषेवितः।।2.54.39।।गम्यतां भवता शैल श्चित्रकूटः स विश्रुतः।पुण्यश्च रमणीयश्च बहुमूलफलायुतः।।2.54.40।।
54_35.translation: O mighty Rama, I think mount Chitrakuta is the right place for you to stay. Go there. That mountain is full of trees of every kind, is inhabited by kinneras and uragas (serpents). It echoes with the cries of peacocks, is frequented by mighty tuskers. Filled with fruits and roots, it is sacred and pleasant.
54_35.word_by_word: महाबल O mighty one, राम Rama, तव your, औपयिकम् right, वासम् place for your stay, मन्ये I think, नानानगगणोपेतः full of various types of trees, किन्नरोरगसेवितः inhabited by kinneras, serpents, मयूरनादाभिरुतः echoing with cries of peacocks, गजराजनिषेवितः frequented by mighty tuskers, पुण्यश्च sacred, रमणीयश्च delightful, बहुमूलफलायुतः abounding in many roots and fruits, विश्रुतः wellknown, सः that, चित्रकूटः Chitrakuta, शैलः mountain, भवता by you, गम्यताम् go.

54_36.shloka: तत्र कुञ्जरयूथानि मृगयूथानि चाभितः।विचरन्ति वनान्तेस्मिन् तानि द्रक्ष्यसि राघव।।2.54.41।।
54_36.translation: You will see, O Rama, herds of elephants and deer ranging in the forest.
54_36.word_by_word: राघव Rama, तत्र there, अस्मिन् वनान्ते in the middle of the forest, अभितः throughout, कुञ्जरयूथानि herds of elephants, मृगयूथानि च and herds of deer, विचरन्ति range about, तानि all that, द्रक्षयसि you will see.

54_37.shloka: सरित्प्रस्रवणप्रस्थान् दरीकन्दरनिर्झरान्।चरतः सीतया सार्धं नन्दिष्यति मनस्तव।।2.54.42।।
54_37.translation: Your heart will be filled with joy while you wander with Sita beholding rivers,waterfalls, plateaus, caverns and mountaintorrents.
54_37.word_by_word: सीतया सार्धम् along with Sita, सरित्प्रस्रवणप्रस्थान् rivers, waterfalls, plateaus, दरीकन्दरनिर्झरान्  caverns and mountaintorrents, चरतः while wandering, तव your, मनः mind, नन्दिष्यति will be joyful.

54_38.shloka: प्रहृष्टकोयष्टिककोकिलस्वनैर्विनादितं तं वसुधाधरं शिवम्।मृगैश्च मत्तैर्बहुभिश्च कुञ्जरैः सुरम्यमासाद्य समावसाश्रमम्।।2.54.43।।
54_38.translation: The auspicious mountain (Chaitrakuta) resounds with the note of cheerful lapwings and cuckoos. Intoxicated elephants and deer move about in the enchanting mountain. There you may settle down in a hermitage.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे चतुःपञ्चाश स्सर्गः।।Thus ends the fiftyfourth sarga in Ayodhyakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
54_38.word_by_word: प्रहृष्टकोयष्टिककोकिलस्वनैः with the notes of cheerful lapwings and cuckoos, विनादितम् echoed, बहुभिः by many, मृगैश्च deer (animals), मत्तै: intoxicated, कुञ्जरैश्च by elephants, सुरम्यम् exceedingly charming, तं वसुधाधरम् that mount Chitrakuta, आसाद्य having reached, आश्रमम् hermitage, समावस dwell there.

55_1.shloka: [The trio cross Yamuna -- decide to reside on the river bank -- Sita rejoices getting her favourite flowers and fruits.]उषित्वा रजनीं तत्र राजपुत्रावरिन्दमौ।महर्षिमभिवाद्याथ जग्मतुस्तं गिरिं प्रति।।2.55.1।।
55_1.translation: After spending the night, the princes, destroyers of enemies, offered obeisance to thatgreat sage (Bharadhwaja) and went towards that mount Chitrkuta.
55_1.word_by_word: अरिन्दमौ destroyers of enemies, राजपुत्राः the (two) princes, तत्र there, रजनी night, उषित्वा having spent, अथ thereafter, महर्षिम् great sage (Bharadwaja), अभिवाद्य having offered obeisance, तं गिरिं प्रति in the direction of that mountain, जग्मतुः went.

55_2.shloka: तेषां चैव स्वस्त्ययनं महर्षि स्स चकार ह।प्रस्थितांश्चैव तान्प्रेक्ष्य पिता पुत्रानिवान्वगात्।।2.55.2।।
55_2.translation: Seeing them setting forth, the great sage blessed them for a safe journey and followed them like a father following his children.
55_2.word_by_word: सः महर्षिः that great sage, तेषाम् to them, स्वस्त्ययनम् blessings for their safe journey, चकार ह made, प्रस्थितान् set forth, तान् them, प्रेक्ष्य having seen, पिता father, पुत्रानिव like his own children, अन्वगात् च followed also.

55_3.shloka: ततः प्रचक्रमे वक्तुं वचनं स महामुनिः।भरद्वाजो महातेजा रामं सत्यपराक्रमम्।।2.55.3।।
55_3.translation: Then that great effulgent sage Bharadwaja began to speak to Rama whose strength was truth.
55_3.word_by_word: ततः then, महातेजाः effulgent, महामुनिः great sage, सः भरद्वाजः that Bharadwaja, सत्यपराक्रमम् to one whose strength is truth, रामम् to Rama, वचनम् words, वक्तुम् to tell, प्रचक्रमे began.

55_4.translation: Reaching the confluence of rivers Ganga and Yamuna, O Rama and Lakshmana best among men proceed along the Kalindi (Yamuna) river flowing westward.
55_4.word_by_word: मनुजर्षभौ two (best) among men, गङ्गायमुनयोः सन्धिम् the confluence of Ganga and Yamuna, गत्वा having reached, पश्चान्मुखाश्रिताम् flowing westward, कालिन्दी नदीम् river Kalindi (Yamuna), अनुगच्छेताम् proceed along.

55_5.shloka: अथाऽसाद्य तु कालिन्दी शीघ्रस्रोतसमापगाम्।तस्यास्तीर्थं प्रचलितं पुराणं प्रेक्ष्य राघवौ।।2.55.5।।तत्र यूयं प्लवं कृत्वा तरतांशुमतीं नदीम्।
55_5.translation: On reaching that swiftflowing river Yamuna, O Rama and Lakshmana O scions of the Raghu race, you will find an ancient spot (on the river bank). There make a raft and cross Kalindi, daughter of the Sun.
55_5.word_by_word: राघवौ the scions of the Raghus (Rama and Lakshmana), अथ then, शीघ्रस्रोतसम् rapidiy flowing आपगाम् river, कालिन्दीम् Kalindi (Yamuna), आसाद्य having reached, प्रचलितम् served by many, पुराणम् ancient, तस्याः तीर्थम् spot on the river bank, प्रेक्ष्य finding, तत्र there, यूयम् you, प्लवम् a raft, कृत्वा having made, अंशुमतीम् that daughter of the Sun (Yamuna), नदीम् river, तरत cross over.

55_6.shloka: ततो न्यग्रोधमासाद्य महान्तं हरितच्छदम्।।2.55.6।।विवृद्धं बहुभिर्वृक्षै श्श्यामं सिद्धोपसेवितम्।तस्मै सीताञ्जलिं कृत्वा प्रयुञ्जीताशिषश्शिवाः।।2.55.7।।
55_6.translation: There you will find a large, banyan tree with its lush green leaves, looking dark with its densely grown trees. It is inhabited by siddhas. Sita should offer with folded palms invocations for her wellbeing.
55_6.word_by_word: ततः हरितच्छदम् with lush green leaves, महान्तम् large, बहुभि: by many, वृक्षै: trees, विवृध्दम्  densely grown, सिध्दोपसेवितम् inhabited by siddhas (sages who have attained perfection), श्यामम् dark (shady), न्यग्रोधम् banyan tree, आसाद्य having approached, सीता Sita, तस्मै to it, अञ्जलिम् folded palms, कृत्वा having made, शिवाः auspicious, आशिष: invocations, प्रयुञ्जीत offer.

55_7.shloka: समासाद्य तु तं वृक्षं वसेद्वातिक्रमेत वा।क्रोशमात्रं ततो गत्वा नीलं द्रक्ष्यथ काननम्।।2.55.8।।पलाशबदरीमिश्रं रम्यं वंशैश्च यामुनैः।
55_7.translation: Reaching that tree, you may tarry or proceed further. A krosa from there, you will see a beautiful forest filled with dark trees mixed with Palasas and badaris and bamboos on the Yamuna.
55_7.word_by_word: तम् वृक्षम् that tree, समासाद्य having reached, वसेद्वा one may tarry or, अतिक्रमेत वा or can go past, तत: from there, क्रोशमात्रम् at a distance of a krosa, गत्वा having gone, नीलम् dark, पलाशबदरीमिश्रम् mixed with Palasa and Badari trees, यामुनै: on Yamuna, वंशै: च with bamboos also, रम्यम् beautiful, काननम् forest, द्रक्ष्यथ you will see.

55_8.shloka: स पन्थाश्चित्रकूटस्य गत स्सुबहुशो मया।।2.55.9।।रम्यो मार्दवयुक्तश्च वनदावैर्विवर्जितः।
55_8.translation: That path leads to Chitrakuta. I had travelled through it several times. It is beautiful, smooth and safe from forest fires.
55_8.word_by_word: स: that one, चित्रकूटस्य of Chitrakuta, पन्था: path, मया by me, बहुश: several times, गत: gone, रम्य beautiful, मार्दवयुक्तश्च marked with smoothness, वनदावै: forest fires, विवर्जित: is without.

55_9.shloka: इति पन्थानमावेद्य महर्षिस्सन्यवर्तत।।2.55.10।।अभिवाद्य तथेत्युक्त्वा रामेण विनिवर्तितः।
55_9.translation: The great sage returned after instructing Rama about the path. So be it, said Rama and offering obeisance requested Bharadhwaja to go back.
55_9.word_by_word: स: महर्षि: that great sage, इति thus, पन्थानम् path, आवेद्य after directing, रामेण by Rama, तथेति 'so be it', उक्त्वा having said, अभिवाद्य paying obeisance, विनिवर्तित: having been requested to return, न्यवर्तत turned back.

55_10.shloka: उपावृत्ते मुनौ तस्मिन्रामो लक्ष्मणमब्रवीत्।।2.55.11।।कृतपुण्याः स्म सौमित्रे मुनिर्यन्नोऽनुकम्पते।
55_10.translation: With the sage gone, Rama said, O Saumitri (son of Sumitra) we are lucky, for the sage has been so kind.
55_10.word_by_word: तस्मिन् मुनौ the sage (Bharadhwaja), उपावृत्ते having turned back, राम Rama, लक्ष्मणम् to Lakshmana, अब्रवीत् said, सौमित्रे son of Sumitra, Lakshmana, कृतपुण्या: स्म we are fortunate indeed, यत् since, मुनिः the sage, न: on us, अनुकम्पते is showing compassion.

55_11.shloka: इति तौ पुरुषव्याघ्रौ मन्त्रयित्वा मनस्विनौ।सीतामेवाग्रतः कृत्वा कालिन्दीं जग्मतुर्नदीम्।।2.55.12।।
55_11.translation: Thus talking with one another, the two nobleminded tigers (best) among men advanced towards river Kalindi (Yamuna) with Sita walking in front.
55_11.word_by_word: मनस्विनौ nobleminded, तौ those two, पुरुषव्याघ्रौ tigers (best) among men, इति thus, मन्त्रयित्वा conversing, सीताम् to Sita, अग्रत: इव ahead of them, कृत्वा keeping, कालिन्दीं नदीम्     towards river Kalindi (Yamuna), जग्मतु: proceeded.

55_12.shloka: अथाऽसाद्य तु कालिन्दीं शीघ्रस्रोतोवहां नदीम्।चिन्तामापेदिरे सर्वे नदीजलतितीर्षवः।।2.55.13।।
55_12.translation: Thereafter, they all reached the rapidly flowing river Kalindi and began pondering how to cross it.
55_12.word_by_word: अथ thereafter, सर्वे all of them, शीघ्रस्रोतोवहाम् rapidly flowing, कालिन्दीं नदीम् river Kalindi, आसाद्य having reached, नदीजलतितीर्षव: wishing to cross the river, चिन्ताम् अपेदिरे pondered.

55_13.shloka: तौ काष्ठसङ्घातमथो चक्रतु स्सुमहाप्लवम्।शुष्कैर्वंशै स्समास्तीर्णमुशीरैश्च समावृतम्।।2.55.14।।
55_13.translation: Then they both made a big wooden float by joining logs of wood, spreading bamboos on it and covering it with the (fragrant roots of) Ushira bushes.
55_13.word_by_word: अथ then, तौ both of them, शुष्कै: with dry, वंशै: bamboos, समास्तीर्णम् wellspread, उशीरै:fragrant roots of Ushira bush, समावृतम् covered with, काष्टसङ्घातम् with logs of wood joined together, महाप्लवम् big float, चक्रतु: made.

55_14.shloka: ततो वेतसशाखाश्च जम्बूशाखाश्च वीर्यवान्।चकार लक्ष्मणश्छित्वा सीताया स्सुखमासनम्।।2.55.15।।
55_14.translation: The valiant Lakshmana cut the stems of reeds and branches of the Jambu tree to prepare a comfortable seat for Sita (on that float).
55_14.word_by_word: तत: then, वीर्यवान् valiant, लक्ष्मण: Lakshmana, वेतसशाखाश्च stems of reeds, जम्बूशाखाश्च   branches from Jambu tree, छित्वा after cutting, सीताया: for Sita, सुखम् comfortable, आसनम् seat, चकार made.

55_15.shloka: तत्र श्रियमिवाचिन्त्यां रामो दाशरथिः प्रियाम्।ईषत्संलज्जमानां तामध्यारोपयतप्लवम्।।2.55.16।।
55_15.translation: Rama, son of Dasaratha helped his beloved (Sita), who was looking inconceivably like Lakshmi (goddess of wealth) and was feeling a little bashful while stepping on to the float.
55_15.word_by_word: दाशरथि: Dasaratha's son, रामः Rama, तत्र there, श्रियमिव looking like Lakshmi (goddess of wealth), अचिन्त्याम् inconceivable (majesty), ईषत् a little, संलज्जमानाम् feeling shy, ताम् प्रियाम् that beloved Sita, प्लवम् float, अध्यारोपयत ascended.

55_16.shloka: पार्श्वे च तत्र वैदेह्या वसने भूषणानि च।प्लवे कठिनकाजं च रामश्चक्रे सहायुधैः।।2.55.17।।
55_16.translation: Rama placed robes and ornaments on the float by the side of Sita and a spade and a basket along with weapons.
55_16.word_by_word: राम: Rama, तत्र there, प्लवे on the float, वैदेह्याः Sita's, पार्श्वे on the side of, वसने clothes, भूषणानि च ornaments, कठिनकाजं a crowbar and a basket, आयुधै: weapons, चक्रे placed.

55_17.shloka: आरोप्य प्रथमं सीतां सङ्घाटं परिगृह्य तौ।तत प्रतेरतुर्यत्तौ वीरौ दशरथात्मजौ।।2.55.18।।
55_17.translation: Those valiant sons of Dasaratha held the float (firmly) to help Sita step on to it. Then they crossed the river carefully.
55_17.word_by_word: वीरौ heroes, तौ those two, दशरथात्मजौ Dasratha's sons, सङ्घाटम् that float, प्रतिगृह्य  tightly holding, प्रथमम् at first, सीताम् Sita, आरोप्य making her board, ततः then, यत्तौ carefully, प्रतेरतुः crossed.

55_18.shloka: कालिन्दीमध्यमायाता सीता त्वेनामवन्दत।स्वस्ति देवि तरामि त्वां पारये न्मे पतिर्व्रतम्।।2.55.19।।यक्ष्ये त्वां गोसहस्रेण सुराघटशतेन च।स्वस्ति प्रत्यागते रामे पुरी मिक्ष्वाकुपालिताम्।।2.56.20।।
55_18.translation: On reaching the middle of the river Yamuna, Sita made reverential salutations to her saying O goddess, I am crossing you, may safety be ours and may my husband fulfil his vow After Rama's (safe) return to the city (of Ayodhya) ruled by the Ikshvaku kings, I shall worship you with a thousand cows and a hundred pots of wine.
55_18.word_by_word: कालिन्दीमध्यम् the middle of the river Kalindi (Yamuna), आयाता on reaching, सीता Sita, एनाम् to this river, अवन्दत made reverential salutation, देवी O goddess, त्वाम् you, तरामि crossing,  स्वस्ति let safety be ours, मे my, पति: husband, व्रतम् vow, पारयेत् may fulfil, रामे Rama, स्वस्ति safely, इक्ष्वाकुपालिताम् ruled by Ikshvaku kings, पुरीम् city of Ayodhya, प्रत्यागते on his return, त्वाम् you, गोसहस्रेण with the offer of a thousand cows, सुराघटशतेन च with a hundred pots of wine, यक्षे will worship.

55_19.shloka: कालिन्दी मथ सीता तु याचमाना कृताञ्जलिः।तीरमेवाभिसम्प्राप्ता दक्षिणं वरवर्णिनी।।2.55.21।।
55_19.translation: While Sita with her fair complexion was thus invoking river Yamuna with folded hands they reached the southern bank.
55_19.word_by_word: वरवर्णिनी lady of fair complexion, सीता Sita, कालिन्दीम् Yamuna, कृताञ्जलि: folding her  hands, याचमाना in supplication, अथ thereafter, दक्षिणं तीरमेव southern bank, अभिसम्प्राप्ता reached.

55_20.shloka: तत प्लवेनांशुमतीं शीघ्रगामूर्मिमालिनीम्।तीरजै र्बहुभिर्वृक्षै स्सन्तेरुर्यमुनां नदीम्।।2.55.22।।
55_20.translation: They crossed the swiftflowing river Yamuna, daughter of the Sungod, full of waves and with trees growing thick on her banks.
55_20.word_by_word: तत: then, शीघ्रगाम् swiftflowing, ऊर्मिमालिनीम् full of waves, तीरजै: growing on the banks, बहुभि: many, वृक्षै: trees, अंशुमतीम् daughter of the Sungod, यमुनां नदीम् river Yamuna, सन्तेरु: crossed.

55_21.shloka: ते तीर्णाः प्लवमुत्सृज्य प्रस्थाय यमुनावनात्।श्यामं न्यग्रोध मासेदु श्शीतलं हरितच्छदम्।।2.55.23।।
55_21.translation: Having crossed the river, they left the float and proceeded from the adjoining forest of Yamuna and reached the dark, cool banyan tree covered with lush green leaves.
55_21.word_by_word: तीर्णा: having crossed, ते they, प्लवम् raft, उत्सृज्य after leaving, यमुनावनात् from the forest adjoining Yamuna river, प्रस्थाय after starting, हरितच्छदम् a place full of greenery, शीतलम्  cool, श्यामम् dark, न्यग्रोधम् banyan tree, असेदु: reached.

55_22.shloka: न्यग्रोधं तमुपागम्य वैदेही वाक्यमब्रवीत्।नमस्तेऽस्तु महावृक्ष पारयेन्मे पतिर्व्रतम्।।2.55.24।।कौशल्यां चैव पश्येयं सुमित्रां च यशश्विनीम्।इति सीताऽञ्जलिं कृत्वा पर्यगच्छद्वनस्पतिम्।।2.55.25।।
55_22.translation: Having reached the banyan tree, Sita invoked it, saying, 'O great tree I offer you my salutations. May my husband fulfil his vow May I behold Kausalya and the illustrious Sumitra on my return. Saying so, she went round the tree offering reverential salutations with folded hands.
55_22.word_by_word: वैदेही Sita, तं न्यग्रोधम् that banyan tree, उपागम्य having reached, वाक्यम् these words, अब्रवीत् said, महावृक्ष O great tree, ते to you, नम:अस्तु my salutations, मे पतिः my husband, व्रतम् vow, पारयेत् may fulfil, कौशल्यां च and Kausalya, यशश्विनीम् illustrious, सुमित्रां च also Sumitra, पश्येयम् may I behold, सीता Sita, इति in this way, अञ्जलिं कृत्वा offering reverential salutations with folded hands, वनस्पतिम् to the tree, पर्यगच्छत् went round.

55_23.shloka: अवलोक्य तत स्सीतामायाचन्तीमनिन्दिताम्।दयितां च विधेयां च रामो लक्ष्मणमब्रवीत्।।2.55.26।।
55_23.translation: Beholding the obedient, blemishless, beloved Sita invoking blessings, Rama said to Lakhsmana:
55_23.word_by_word: तत: then, रामः Rama, अयाचन्तीम् who was seeking blessings, अनिन्दिताम् blemishless, दयिताम् beloved, विधेयां च and obedient, सीताम् Sita, अवलोक्य having seen, लक्ष्मणम् to Lakshmana, अब्रवीत् said.

55_24.shloka: सीतामादाय गच्छत्वमग्रतो भरतानुज।पृष्ठतोऽहं गमिष्यामि सायुधो द्विपदां वर।।2.55.27।।
55_24.translation: O Lakshmana, best among bipeds (men) and brother of Bharata walk ahead with Sita and I shall follow with weapons.
55_24.word_by_word: द्विपदां वर best among bipeds (men), भरतानुज brother of Bharata (Lakshmana), त्वम् you, सीताम् Sita, आदाय taking with you, अग्रत: ahead, गच्छ go, अहम् I, सायुध: armed with weapons, पृष्ठत: from behind, गमिष्यामि will follow.

55_25.shloka: यद्यत्फलं प्रार्थयते पुष्पं वा जनकात्मजा।तत्तत्प्रदद्या वैदेह्या यत्राऽस्या रमते मनः।।2.55.28।।
55_25.translation: Whatever fruit or flower the daughter of Janaka asks for, get it. Whatever pleases her mind give it.
55_25.word_by_word: जनकात्मजा daughter of Janaka, यद्यत्फलम् whichever fruit, पुष्पं वा or flower, प्रार्थयते requests for, तत्तत् that one, अस्या: वैदेह्या: for this Sita, मन: mind, यत्र where, रमते takes pleasure, प्रदद्य give.

55_26.shloka: गच्छतोऽस्तु तयोर्मध्ये बभूव जनकात्मजा।मातङ्गयोर्मध्यगता शुभा नागवधूरिव।।2.55.29।।
55_26.translation: The daughter of Janaka walked between them like a sheelephant between two males.
55_26.word_by_word: गच्छतोः going like that, तयोः of both, मध्यगता moving in the middle, जनकात्मजा daughter of Janaka, मातङ्गयोः of two male elephants, मध्यगता in between, शुभा auspicious, नागवधूरिवlike a female elephant, बभूव remained.

55_27.shloka: एकैकं पादपं गुल्मं लतां वा पुष्पशालिनीम्।अदृष्टपूर्वां पश्यन्ती रामं पप्रच्छ साऽबला।।2.55.30।।
55_27.translation: That gentle lady enquired of Rama about a tree or a shrub or a creeper in full bloom which she did not see before.
55_27.word_by_word: सा अबला that gentle lady, एकैकम् one by one, पादपम् tree, गुल्मम् shrub, अदृष्टपूर्वाम् never seen before, पुष्पशालिनीम् flowering, लतां वा or a creeper, पश्यन्ती seeing, रामम् to Rama, पप्रच्छ asked.

55_28.translation: Cheered by Sita's indents, Lakshmana brought her various beautiful plants and stocks of flowers.
55_28.word_by_word: लक्ष्मणः Lakshmana, सीतावचनसंरब्धः cheered by the indent of Sita, कुसुमोत्कटान् laden with flowers, रमणीयान् beautiful, बहुविधान् various, पादपान् trees, आनयामास brought.

55_29.shloka: विचित्रवालुकजलां हंससारसनादिताम्।रेमे जनकराजस्य सुता प्रेक्ष्य तदा नदीम्।।2.55.32।।
55_29.translation: Beholding the river Yamuna with its wonderful water and sand echoing with the cackle of swans and cranes, Sita went ecstatic.
55_29.word_by_word: तदा then, जनकराजस्य सुता daughter of king Janaka (Sita), विचित्रवालुकजलाम् wonderful water and sand, हंससारसनादिताम् echoing with the sounds of swans and cranes, नदीम् river Yamuna, प्रेक्ष्य beholding, रेमे exceedingly delighted.

55_30.shloka: क्रोशमात्रं ततो गत्वा भ्रातरौ रामलक्ष्मणौ।बहून्मेध्यान्मृगान्हत्वा चेरतुर्यमुनावने।।2.55.33।।
55_30.translation: After walking a krosa into the forest on the bank of Yamuna, the two brothers killed many deer suitable for sacrifice and ate them.
55_30.word_by_word: तत: then, भ्रातरौ the two brothers, रामलक्ष्मणौ Rama and Lakshmana, क्रोशमात्रम् a krosa, गत्वा having gone, मेध्यान् suitable for sacrifice (pure), बहून् many, मृगान् deer, हत्वा having slain, यमुनावने in the forest on the bank of Yamuna, चेरतु: ate.

55_31.shloka: विहृत्य ते बर्हिणपूगनादिते शुभे वने वानरवारणायुते।समं नदीवप्रमुपेत्य सम्मतं निवास माजग्मु रदीनदर्शनाः।।2.55.34।।
55_31.translation: They reached the tableland on the bank of that river and moved in high spirit in the lovely forest resounding with cries of flocks of peacocks and teeming with monkeys and elephants. Finally they selected  a spot for their stay.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे पञ्चपञ्चाशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the fiftyfifth sarga in Ayodhyakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
55_31.word_by_word: अदीनदर्शना: appearing in high spirits, ते they, बर्हिणपूगनादिते resounding with the melody of peacocks, वानरवारणायुते inhabited by monkeys and elephants, शुभे वने in that lovely forest, विहृत्य roaming about, समम् levelled, सम्मतम् convenient, नदीवप्रम् bank of the river, उपेत्य having reached, निवासम् dwelling, आजग्मतु: made.

56_1.shloka: [Chitrakuta described -- Rama meets sage Valmiki -- Lakshmana builds a leafthatched cottage -- Rama enters the cottage at an auspicious time after due worship of respective deities.]अथ रात्र्यां व्यतीतायामवसुप्तमनन्तरम्।प्रबोधयामास शनैर्लक्ष्मणं रघुनन्दनः।।2.56.1।।
56_1.translation: When the night was over, Rama, Delight of the Raghus, gently awakened Lakshmana who was asleep.
56_1.word_by_word: अथ thereafter, रघुनन्दन: Delight of the Raghus (Rama), रात्र्याम् night, अतीतायाम् had passed, अनन्तरम् then, अवसुप्तम् sleeping, लक्ष्मणम् Lakshmana, शनै: gently, प्रबोधयामास awakened.

56_2.shloka: सौमित्रे श्रुणु वन्यानां वल्गु व्याहरतां स्वनम्।सम्प्रतिष्ठामहे काल प्रस्थानस्य परन्तप।।2.56.2।।
56_2.translation: Listen to the songs of the forest birds, O son of Sumitra O tormentor of foes it is time we set out.
56_2.word_by_word: सौमित्रे  Saumitri (son of Sumitra), वल्गु sweet, व्याहरताम् singing, वन्यानाम् of the sylvan birds, स्वनम् voices, श्रुणु you may listen, परन्तप O tormentor of enemies, प्रस्थानस्य  to set out, काल: time, सम्प्रतिष्ठामहे we shall set out.

56_3.shloka: स सुप्तस्समये भ्रात्रा लक्ष्मणः प्रतिबोधितः।जहौ निद्रां च तन्द्रीं च प्रसक्तं च पथि श्रमम्।।2.56.3।।
56_3.translation: Awakened by his brother in time, Lakshmana shook off his sleep, his drowsiness and his fatigue due to journey.
56_3.word_by_word: सुप्त: one asleep, स: लक्ष्मण: that Lakshmana, समये in time, भ्रात्रा by his brother, प्रतिबोधित: awakened, निद्रां च sleep, तन्द्रीं च and drowsiness, पथि during journey, प्रसक्तम् associatedwith, श्रमं च fatigue, जहौ cast off.

56_4.shloka: तत उत्थाय ते सर्वे स्पृष्ट्वा नद्या श्शिवं जलम्।पन्थानमृषिणाऽदिष्टं चित्रकूटस्य तं ययुः।।2.56.4।।
56_4.translation: Then they all rose, touched the river's auspicious waters and went the way the sage had directed -- towards mount Chitrakuta.
56_4.word_by_word: तत: then, ते सर्वे they all, उत्थाय rising, नद्या: river's, शिवम् auspicious, जलम् water, स्पृष्ट्वा having touched, ऋषिणा by the sage (Bharadwaja), आदिष्टम् directed, तम् that, चित्रकूटस्य of Chitrakuta, पन्थानम् path, ययु: went.

56_5.shloka: ततस्सम्प्रस्थितः काले रामस्सौमित्रिणा सह।सीतां कमलपत्राक्षीमिदं वचनमब्रवीत्।।2.56.5।।
56_5.translation: Early in the morning Rama set out with Lakshmana and said this to Sita with eyes like lotus petals:
56_5.word_by_word: तत: then, काले at the proper time, सौमित्रिणा सह along with Lakshmana, सम्प्रस्थित:  setting out, राम: Rama, कमलपत्राक्षीम् eyes like lotus petals, सीताम् addressing Sita, इदं वचनम् these words, अब्रवीत् said.

56_6.shloka: आदिप्तानिव वैदेहि सर्वतः पुष्पितान्नगान्।स्वैः पुष्पैः किंशुकान् पश्य मालिनशिशिरात्यये।।2.56.6।।
56_6.translation: O daughter of Videha behold these kimsuka trees in full bloom everywhere. With the passing of winter, they appear bright as though they are garlanded by their own flowers.
56_6.word_by_word: वैदेहि O daughter of Videha (Sita), शिशिरात्यये at the end of winter, सर्वत: all over, पुष्पितान् in full bloom, आदीप्तानिव as if illuminated, स्त्वै: by their own, पुष्पै: flowers, मालिन: garland, किंशुकान् नगान् Kimsuka trees, पश्य see.

56_7.shloka: पश्य भल्लातकान् फुल्लान्नरै रनुपसेवितान्।फलपत्रैरवनता न्नूनं शक्ष्याम जीवितुम्।।2.56.7।।
56_7.translation: Behold these bhallataka trees in full bloom though there are none to enjoy them. They are bent with fruits and leaves. Surely, we can live here. (This place is fit for our habitation).
56_7.word_by_word: फुल्लान् in full bloom, फलपत्रै: with fruits and leaves, अवनतान् bent low, नरै: by people, अनुपसेवितान् not enjoyed, भल्लातकान् bhallataka trees, पश्य see, नूनम् surely, जीवितुम् to reside, शक्ष्याम able.

56_8.shloka: पश्य द्रोणप्रमाणानि लम्बमानानि लक्ष्मण।मधूनि मधुकारीभि स्सम्भृतानि नगे नगे।।2.56.8।।
56_8.translation: O Lakshmana see the honeycombs of the size of wooden vessels crowded by the honeybees hanging down from every tree.
56_8.word_by_word: लक्ष्मण O Lakshmana, नगे नगे in every tree, मधुकारीभि: by bees, सम्भृतानि assembled, द्रोणप्रमाणानि of the size of wooden vessels, लम्बमानानि hanging down, मधूनि honey, पश्य see.

56_9.shloka: एष क्रोशति नत्यूहस्तं शिखी प्रतिकूजति।रमणीये वनोद्देशे पुष्पसंस्तरसङ्कटे।।2.56.9।।
56_9.translation: In this delightful forest region strewn with fallen flowers the peacock is responding to the screaming of natyuha bird.
56_9.word_by_word: पुष्पसंस्तरसङ्कटे on the ground strewn with fallen flowers, रमणीये in a delightful, वनोद्धेशे in the forest region, एष: this, नत्यूह: natyuha (a type of cuckoo), क्रोशति is screaming, तम् that bird, शिखी peacock, प्रतिकूजति responding with its screaming.

56_10.translation: See these flocks of singing birds followed by herds of elephants. See this mount Chitrakuta with its towering peaks.
56_10.word_by_word: मातङ्गयूथानुसृतं followed by the herds of elephants, पक्षिसंङ्घानुनादितम् with flocks of singing birds, प्रवृद्धशिखरम् with very towering peaks, इदम् this, गिरिम् mountain, पश्य see.

56_11.shloka: समभूमितले रम्ये द्रुमैर्बहुभिरावृते।पुण्ये रंस्यामहे तात चित्रकूटस्य कानने।।2.56.11।।
56_11.translation: O dear this sacred forest of Chitrakuta standing on a level land is full of various trees. Let us enjoy it.
56_11.word_by_word: तात O dear, समभूमितले on the even ground, बहुभि: by several, द्रुमैः by trees, आवृते covered with, पुण्ये sacred, चित्रकूटस्य Chitrakuta's, कानने in the forest, रंस्यामहे we will enjoy.

56_12.shloka: ततस्तौ पादचारेण गच्छन्तौ सह सीतया।रम्यमासेदतुश्शैलं चित्रकूटं मनोरमम्।।2.56.12।।
56_12.translation: Then they both along with Sita walked to that lovely, delightful Chitrakuta mountain.
56_12.word_by_word: तत: then, सीतयासह with Sita, पादचारेण walking on foot, गच्छन्तौ going, तौ both (Rama and Lakshmana), रम्यम् beautiful, मनोरमम् delightful, चित्रकूटं शैलम् Chitrakuta mountain, आसेदतुः reached.

56_13.shloka: तन्तु पर्वतमासाद्य नानापक्षिगणायुतम्।बहुमूलफलं रम्यं सम्पन्नं सरसोदकम्।।2.56.13।।
56_13.translation: Rama arrived at that enchanting mountain full of various kinds of birds, fruits and roots, and sweet water. (And said to Lakshmana:)
56_13.word_by_word: नानापक्षिगणायुतम् filled with various kinds of birds, बहुमूलफलम् with varieties of roots and fruits, रम्यम् enchanting, सम्पन्नम् rich, सरसोदकम् of tasty water, तं पर्वतम् that mountain, आसाद्य having reached, (Rama said).

56_14.shloka: मनोज्ञोऽयं गिरिस्सौम्य नानाद्रुमलतायुतः।बहुमूलफलो रम्य स्स्वाजीवः प्रतिभाति मे।।2.56.14।।
56_14.translation: O gentle one this enchanting mountain with different kinds of trees and creepers and many roots and fruits appears to be a happy place to live in.
56_14.word_by_word: सौम्य O gentle one, मनोज्ञ: pleasing to the heart, नानादृमलतायुत: with various kinds of trees and creepers, बहुमूलफल: with many roots and fruits, रम्य: beautiful, अयं गिरि: this mountain, स्वाजीव: a happy place to live in, मे to me, प्रतिभाति appears.

56_15.shloka: मुनयश्च महात्मानो वसन्त्यस्मि शिलोच्चये।अयं वासो भवेत्तावदत्र सौम्य रमेमहि।।2.56.15।।
56_15.translation: Great sages reside on this high mountain. Let it be our habitation and let us enjoy our life here, O handsome one
56_15.word_by_word: सौम्य O handsome one, अस्मिन् in this, शिलोच्चये on the mountain, महात्मन: great, मुनयश्च sages, वसन्ति reside, अयम् this, वास: habitation, भवेत्तावत् let it be, अत्र here, रमेमहि will enjoy.

56_16.shloka: इति सीता च रामश्च लक्ष्मणश्च कृताञ्जलिः।अभिगम्याऽश्रमं सर्वे वाल्मीकि मभिवादयन्।।2.56.16।।
56_16.translation: Thus Rama, Sita and Lakshmana approached the hermitage of sage Valmiki and paid obeisance to him with folded hands.
56_16.word_by_word: इति thus, सीता च Sita, रामश्च Rama, कृताञ्जलि: with folded palms, लक्ष्मणश्च Lakshmana also, सर्वे all, आश्रमम् hermitage, अभिगम्य having approached, वाल्मीकिम् to sage Valmiki, अभिवादयन् paid obeisance.

56_17.shloka: तान्महर्षि प्रमुदितः पूजयामास धर्मवित्।अस्यतामिति चोवाच स्वागन्तु निवेद्य च।।2.56.17।।
56_17.translation: The great sage Valmiki conversant with righteousness was delighted. He honoured them by extending welcome and said 'Be seated'.
56_17.word_by_word: धर्मवित् conversant with righteousness, महर्षि: the great sage (Valmiki), प्रमुदित: full of delight, तान् them, पूजयामास honoured, स्वागतम् welcome, निवेद्य having offered, अस्यताम् इति be seated, उवाच च and said.

56_18.translation: The mightyarmed elder brother of Lakshmana revealed his identity to the sage by duly introducing himself. And said then to Lakshmana:
56_18.word_by_word: तत: then, महाबाहु: mightyarmed, प्रभु: master, लक्ष्माणाग्रज: the elder brother of Lakshmana, आत्मानम् himself, यथान्यायम् duly, ऋषये to the ascetic, सन्निवेद्य having introduced, लक्ष्मणम् to Lakshmana, अब्रवीत् said.

56_19.shloka: लक्ष्मणाऽऽनय दारूणि दृढानि च वराणि च।कुरुष्वाऽवसथं सौम्य वासे मेऽभिरतं मनः।।2.56.19।।
56_19.translation: O handsome Lakshmana, make a hut with strong, sound logs of wood. My mind impels me to stay here.
56_19.word_by_word: सौम्य लक्ष्मण O handsome Lakshmana, दृढानि strong, वराणि च good, दारूणि logs of wood,आनय fetch, अवसथम् a dwelling, कुरुष्व build, मे मन: my mind, वासे in staying, अभिरतम् is eager.

56_20.shloka: तस्य तद्वचनं श्रुत्वा सौमित्रिर्विविधान् द्रुमान्।आजहार तत श्चक्रे पर्णशालामरिन्दमः।।2.56.20।।
56_20.translation: Having heard Rama, Saumitri, the subduer of enemies fetched different kinds of logs of wood, and with them made a hut and thatched it with leaves.
56_20.word_by_word: सौमित्रि: son of Sumitra (Lakshmana), तस्य Rama's, तत् वचनम् those words, श्रुत्वा on hearing, विविधान् different kinds of, दृमान् logs of wood, आजहार fetched, अरिन्दम: subduer of enemies, तत: then, पर्णशालाम् cottage thatched with leaves, चक्रे built.

56_21.shloka: तां निष्ठितां बद्धकटां दृष्ट्वा रामस्सुदर्शनाम्।शुश्रूषमाणमेकाग्रमिदं वचनमब्रवीत्।।2.56.21।।
56_21.translation: Rama saw the goodlooking leafhut with mats tied around as walls, and said to Lakshmana who was awaiting further command with rapt attention:
56_21.word_by_word: राम: Rama, निष्ठितान् firmly fixed, बद्दकटाम् with mats tied around as walls, सुदर्शनाम् goodlooking, ताम् दृष्ट्वा having seen it, शुश्रूषमाणम् on listening (to further command), एकाग्रम् with attention, इदं वचनम् these words, अब्रवीत् said.

56_22.shloka: ऐणेयं मांसमाहृत्य शालां यक्ष्यामहे वयम्।कर्तव्यं वास्तुशमनं सौमित्रे चिरजीविभिः।।2.56.22।।
56_22.translation: O Lakshmana those who intend to live for long (in this hut), should pacify the deity presiding over here. Therefore, we shall bring the venison of a black antelope and make necessary offerings.
56_22.word_by_word: सौमित्रे O Lakshmana, ऐणेयं मांसम् venison of black antelope, आहृत्य having brought, वयम् we, शालाम् this hut, यक्ष्यामहे will worship, चिरजीविभि: those who intend to live longer, वास्तुशमनम् pacification of household deity, कर्तव्यम् should be done.

56_23.shloka: मृगं हत्वाऽऽनय क्षिप्रं लक्ष्मणेह शुभेक्षण।कर्तव्य श्शास्त्रदृष्टो हि विधिर्धर्ममनुस्मर।।2.56.23।।
56_23.translation: Slay an antelope and bring it here quickly. O Lakshmana The rites as prescribed by the scriptures will have to be carried out. You may recollect that tradition.
56_23.word_by_word: शुभेक्षण one who has auspicious looks, लक्ष्मण Lakshmana, मृगम् an antelope, हत्वा  having killed, क्षिप्रम् quickly, इह here, आनय bring, शास्त्रदृष्ट: as prescribed by the  scriptures, विधि: rites, कर्तव्यः हि will have to be carried out, धर्मम् the tradition, अनुस्मर recollect.

56_24.shloka: भ्रातुर्वचनमाज्ञाय लक्ष्मणः परवीरहा।चकार स यथोक्तं च तं राम पुनरब्रवीत्।।2.56.24।।
56_24.translation: Lakshmana, slayer of heroes on the enemy's side, understood and implemented what he was told. Rama again said to him:
56_24.word_by_word: परवीरहा slayer of heroes of the enemy's side, स लक्ष्मण: that Lakshmana, भ्रातु: brother' s, वचनम् words, आज्ञाय having understood, यथोक्तम् as told, चकार carried out, राम: Rama, तम् him, पुन: again, अब्रवीत् said.

56_25.shloka: ऐणेयं श्रपयस्वैतच्छालां यक्ष्यामहे वयम्।त्वर सौम्य मुहूर्तोऽयं ध्रुवश्च दिवसोऽप्ययम्।।2.56.25।।
56_25.translation: Cook this venison, O handsome one We will offer it to the presiding deity of this hut. Hasten, the day and time are fixed (for the rites)
56_25.word_by_word: सौम्य O handsome one, एतत् this, ऐणेयम् venison, श्रपयस्व cook, वयम् we, शालाम् hut, यक्ष्यामहे will worship, अयम् this, दिवस: day, अयम् this, मुहूर्त:अपि this moment also, ध्रुवश्च is fixed, त्वर hasten.

56_26.shloka: स लक्ष्मणः कृष्णमृगं मेध्यं हत्वा प्रतापवान्।अथ चिक्षेप सौमित्रिस्समिद्धे जातवेदसि।।2.56.26।।
56_26.translation: Then the powerful son of Sumitra killed a black antelope fit for offering, and offered it to the wellkindled fire.
56_26.word_by_word: अथ then, सौमित्रि: son of Sumitra, प्रतापवान् powerful, स: लक्ष्मण: that Lakshmana, मेथ्यम् fit for offering pure, कृष्णमृगम् black antelope, हत्वा having killed, समिद्धे in a wellkindled, जातवेदसि fire, चिक्षेप offered.

56_27.shloka: तन्तु पक्वं परिज्ञाय निष्टप्तं छिन्नशोणितम्।लक्ष्मण: पुरुषव्याघ्रमथ राघवमब्रवीत्।।2.56.27।।
56_27.translation: With the blood drained out of the venison, Lakshmana roasted it and cooked it well, and then said to Rama, the tiger (best) among men.
56_27.word_by_word: लक्ष्मण: Lakshmana, निष्टप्तम् roasted well, छिन्नशोणितम् with blood drained out, तम् that, पक्वम्  cooked, परिज्ञाय having found, अथ then, पुरुषव्याघ्रम् tiger (best) among men, राघवम् to Rama, अब्रवीत् said.

56_28.shloka: अयं सर्व: समस्ताग्ङ: श्रृत: कृष्णमृगो मया।देवतां देवसङ्काश यजस्व कुशलो ह्यसि।।2.56.28।।
56_28.translation: This black antelope with all its limbs is wellcooked. O divine sire, you may make theoffering to Vastu devata in which you are proficient.
56_28.word_by_word: समस्ताङ्ग: with all the limbs, अयम् this, कृष्णमृग: black antelope, सर्व: completely, मया by me, श्रुत: is wellcooked, देवसङ्काश like a god, देवता: devatas, यजस्व offer with sacrifice, कुशल: असि हि you are proficient.

56_29.shloka: राम: स्नात्वा तु नियतो गुणवान् जप्यकोविदः।सङ्ग्रहेणाकरोत् स्रवार्न मन्त्रान् सत्रावसानिकान्।।2.56.29।।
56_29.translation: Virtuous Rama, who was an expert in the recitation of mantras, took his bath and his mind controlled, intoned briefly all the mantras appropriate to the completion of the ritual.
56_29.word_by_word: गुणवान् virtuous,जप्यकोविद: expert in reciting appropriate mantras, राम: Rama, स्नात्वा having bathed, नियत: with his senses restrained, सत्रावसानिकान् rites performed at the end of the ritual, सर्वान् all that, मन्त्रान् mantras, सङ्ग्रहेण briefly, अकरोत् performed (intoned).

56_30.shloka: इष्ट्वा देवगणान्सर्वान्विवेशाऽवसथं शुचिः।बभूव च मनोह्लादो रामस्यामिततेजसः।।2.56.30।।
56_30.translation: Sanctified with the worship of all the gods, Rama of immeasurable lustre felt a great happiness on entering the hut.
56_30.word_by_word: सर्वान् all, देवगणान् gods, इष्ट्वा having worshipped by offering, शुचिः becoming pure, अवसथम् the leafhut, विवेश entered, अमिततेजस: immeasurable lustre, रामस्य to Rama, मनोह्लादः cheer of mind, बभूव च caused.

56_31.shloka: वैश्वदेवबलिं कृत्वा रौद्रं वैष्णव मेव च।वास्तुसंशमनीयानि मङ्गलानि प्रवर्तयन्।।2.56.31।।जपं च न्यायत कृत्वा स्नात्वा नद्यां यथाविधि।पापसंशमनं राम श्चकार बलिमुत्तमम्।।2.56.32।।
56_31.translation: Rama, offered oblations to Visvadevas, Rudra and Visnu,  performed the auspices for the appeasement of the household deity. And having muttered japa silently in conformity with tradition, he took his ablution in the river as enjoined (by the sastras) and offered his final oblations for the expiation of his sins.
56_31.word_by_word: राम: Rama, वैश्वदेवबलिम् oblations to Visvadevas (the entire pantheon of gods), रौद्रम् to Rudra, वैष्णवमेव च to Visnu, कृत्वा having offered, वास्तुसंशमनीयानि propitiation of the household deity (Vastu devata), मङ्गलानि auspices, प्रवर्तयन्  doing, न्यायत: according to precept, जपं च कृत्वा muttering the silent prayers, नद्याम् in the river, यथाविधि duly, स्नात्वा after bathing, पापसंशमनम् for the expiation of sins, उत्तमं बलिम् final oblation, चकार made.

56_32.translation: Rama, son of the Raghus, made altars in all the quarters, places of worship and sacred spots for fire befitting a hermitage.
56_32.word_by_word: राघव: the scion of the Raghus (Rama), आश्रमस्य of the hermitage, अनुरूपाणि befitting, वेदिस्थलविधानानि making of altars, चैत्यानि places of worship, आयतनानि च sacred places for fire, स्थापयामास established.

56_33.shloka: वन्यैर्माल्यैः फलैर्मूलैः पक्वैर्मांसैर्यथाविधि।अद्भिर्जपैश्च वेदोक्तैर्दर्भैश्च ससमित्कुशैः।।2.56.34।।तौ तर्पयित्वा भूतानि राघवौ सह सीतया।तदा विविशतु श्शालां सुशुभां शुभलक्षणौ।।2.56.35।।
56_33.translation: Bestowed with auspicious qualities, Rama and Lakshmana along with Sita propitiated those celestial beings with garlands of forest flowers, fruits and roots, wellcooked venison, water, muttering of prayers as expounded in the Vedas, faggots and kusa grass and entered that auspicious hermitage.
56_33.word_by_word: शुभलक्षणौ bestowed with auspicious qualities, राघवौ Rama and Lakshmana, सह सीतया accompanied by Sita, वन्यै: माल्यै: with garlands of forest flowers, फलै: with fruits, मूलै: with roots, पक्वै: with wellcooked, मांसै: with venison, अद्भिः with water, वेदोक्तै: as expounded in the Vedas, जपैश्च with muttering of prayers, दर्भैश्च with darbha grass,    सुसमित्कुशै: with faggots and kusa grass, भूतानि all beings, तर्पयित्वा after propitiating, तदा then, शुभाम् auspicious, शालाम् hut, विविशतुः entered.

56_34.shloka: तां वृक्षपर्णच्छदनां मनोज्ञां यथाप्रदेशं सुकृतां निवाताम्।वासाय सर्वे विविशुस्समेतास्सभां यथा देवगणास्सुधर्माम्।।2.56.36।।
56_34.translation: Just like the gods enter the court of Sudharma, they all stepped into the hut to dwell there. The hut was charming wellbuilt on a suitable site and protected against storm.
56_34.word_by_word: वृक्षपर्णच्छदनाम् covered with the leaves of trees, मनोज्ञाम् charming, यथाप्रदेशम् built on a suitable site, सुकृताम् wellbuilt, निवाताम् protected against storm, ताम् that hut, सर्वे all, समेता together, वासाय for purposes of living, देवगणाः gods, सुधर्माम् Sudharma, सभां यथा like the court, विविशु: entered.

56_35.shloka: अनेकनानामृगपक्षिसङ्कुले विचित्रपत्रस्तबकैर्द्रुमैर्युते।वनोत्तमे व्यालमृगानुनादिते तदा विजह्रु स्सुसुखं जितेन्द्रियाः।।2.56.37।।
56_35.translation: Then they with their senses conquered, enjoyed perfect happiness in that splendid forest teeming with many varieties of animals and birds, with trees full of brilliant clusters of flowers and echoing with the sounds of wild animals.
56_35.word_by_word: तदा then, जितेन्द्रियाः who had conquered the senses, अनेकनानामृगपक्षिसङ्कुले filled with  many varieties of animals and birds, विचित्रपुष्पस्तबकै: with bunches of bright flowers, द्रुमै with trees, युते full of, व्यालमृगानुनादिते echoing with the sounds of wild animals, वनोत्तमे in that splendid forest, सुसुखम् very happily, विजह्रु: wandered.

56_36.shloka: सुरम्यमासाद्य तु चित्रकूटं नदीं च तां माल्यवतीं सुतीर्थाम्।ननन्द हृष्टो मृगपक्षिजुष्टां जहौ च दुखं पुरविप्रवासात्।।2.35.38।।
56_36.translation: Having reached the marvellous mount Chitrakuta and river Malyavati with excellent holy places and full of animals and birds, Rama shed the sorrow of his banishment from the city (of Ayodhya) and rejoiced with a gladdened heart.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे षट्पञ्चाशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the fiftysixth sarga in Ayodhyakanda of  the  holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
56_36.word_by_word: सुरम्यम् marvellous, चित्रकूटम् mount Chitrakuta, आसाद्य having reached, सुतीर्थाम् withexcellent holy places, मृगपक्षिजुष्टाम् full of animals and birds, ताम् that, माल्यवतीं नदीं च that Malyavati river, हृष्ट: filled with delight, ननन्द rejoiced, पुरविप्रवासात् banishment from the city, दुखम् sorrow, जहौ च left.

57_1.shloka: [Sumantra returns to Ayodhya and reports to king Dasaratha -- Dasaratha and Kausalya fall into a swoon on hearing about Rama in exile.]कथयित्वा सुदुःखार्तस्सुमन्त्रेण चिरं सह।रामे दक्षिणकूलस्थे जगाम स्वगृहं गुहः।।2.57.1।।
57_1.translation: Until Rama reached the southern bank, Guha kept talking with Sumantra for long and returned home with great sorrow.
57_1.word_by_word: रामे Rama, दक्षिणकूलस्थे had reached the southern bank (of the river), गुह: Guha, सुमन्त्रेण सह with Sumantra, चिरम् for a long while, कथयित्वा after talking, सुदुःखार्तः tormented with anguish, स्वगृहम् his home, जगाम reached.

57_2.shloka: भरद्वाजाभिगमनं प्रयागे च सहाऽसनम्।आगिरेर्गमनं तेषां तत्रस्थैरुपलक्षितम्।।2.57.2।।
57_2.translation: Positioned there, they could mark their arrival at Bharadwaja's at Prayaga, their stay (nighthalt) and their onward journey to Chitrakuta mountain.
57_2.word_by_word: तेषाम् their, भरद्वाजाभिगमनम् arrival at the hermitage of Bharadwaja, प्रयागे at Prayaga, सहाऽसनम् stay with him, आगिरेः till that Chitrakuta mountain, गमनम् journey, तत्रस्थैः by the men waiting there, उपलक्षितम् has been observed.

57_3.shloka: अनुज्ञातस्सुमन्त्रोऽथ योजयित्वा हयोत्तमान्।अयोध्यामेव नगरीं प्रययौ गाढदुर्मनाः।।2.57.3।।
57_3.translation: Permitted by Rama to leave, Sumantra harnessed the best of horses and set out for the city of Ayodhya with a heavy heart.
57_3.word_by_word: अथ after this, अनुज्ञातः having been permitted by Rama to leave, सुमन्त्रः Sumantra, हयोत्तमान् best of horses, योजयित्वा harnessing, गाढदुर्मनाः with a heavy heart, अयोध्यां नगरीमेव to the city of Ayodhya, प्रययौ set out.

57_4.shloka: स वनानि सुगन्धीनि सरितश्च सरांसि च।पश्यन्नतिययौ शीघ्रं ग्रामाणि नगराणि च।।2.57.4।।
57_4.translation: Beholding the fragrancefilled forests, rivers, lakes, villages and  towns on the way, Sumantra quickly crossed them.
57_4.word_by_word: सः that, सुगन्धीनि fragrant, वनानि forests, सरितः च rivers as well, सरांसि च lakes also, ग्रामाणि villages, नगराणि च towns also, पश्यन् seeing, शीघ्रम् swiftly, अतिययौ passed through them.

57_5.shloka: तत स्सायाह्न समये तृतीयेऽहनि सारथिः।अयोध्यां समनुप्राप्य निरानन्दां ददर्श ह।।2.57.5।।
57_5.translation: The charioteer reached Ayodhya on the third day at dusk and found the city cheerless.
57_5.word_by_word: सारथिः charioteer, तृतीये on the third, अहनि day, सायाह्न समये at dusk, निरानन्दाम् cheerless, अयोध्याम् Ayodhya, समनुप्राप्य having reached, ददर्श ह saw.

57_6.shloka: स शून्यामिव निश्शब्दां दृष्ट्वा परमदुर्मनाः।सुमन्त्रश्चिन्तयामास शोकवेगसमाहतः।।2.57.6।।
57_6.translation: Beholding the silent city, almost empty, the deeply depressed Sumantra, afflicted with gushing tears reflected:
57_6.word_by_word: सः सुमन्त्रः that Sumantra, निश्शब्दाम् silent, शून्यामिव almost empty, दृष्ट्वा having seen, परमदुर्मनाः deeply dejected, शोकवेगसमाहतः afflicted with gushing tears, चिन्तयामास reflected.

57_7.shloka: कच्चिन्न सगजा साऽश्वा सजना सजनाधिपा।रामसन्तापदुःखेन दग्धा शोकाग्निना पुरी।।2.57.7।।
57_7.translation: Has the city along with its elephants, horses, people and its king perished in the fire of grief for Rama?
57_7.word_by_word: सगजाः with elephants, साऽश्वाः with horses, सजनाः with its people, सजनाधिपा with the king, पुरी city, रामसन्तापदुःखेन in the sorrow caused by Rama's suffering, शोकाग्निना by the fire of sorrow, दग्धा burnt.

57_8.shloka: इति चिन्तापरस्सूतो वाजिभिश्शीघ्रपातिभिः।नगरद्वारमासाद्य त्वरितः प्रविवेश ह।।2.57.8।।
57_8.translation: Absorbed in these thoughts, the charioteer came to the citygate, carried by the swiftfooted horses, and quickly entered the city.
57_8.word_by_word: इति in this way, चिन्तापरः absorbed in this thought, सूतः the charioteer, शीघ्रपातिभिः by the swiftrunning, वाजिभिः horses, नगरद्वारम् entrance to the city, आसाद्य having arrived, त्वरितः quickly, प्रविवेश ह entered.

57_9.shloka: सुमन्त्रमभियान्तं तं शतशोऽथ सहस्रशः।क्व राम इति पृच्छन्तस्सूतमभ्यद्रवन्नराः।।2.57.9।।
57_9.translation: Meanwhile as the charioteer was moving towards the city, hundreds and thousands of men came pouring towards him enquiring, 'Where is Rama?'
57_9.word_by_word: अथ thereafter, अभियान्तम् moving towards, तम् that, सूतम् charioteer, सुमन्त्रम् Sumantra, रामः Rama, क्व where?, इति thus, पृच्छन्तः enquiring, नराः people, शतशः in hundreds, सहस्रशः in thousands, अभ्यद्रवन् poured towards him.

57_10.shloka: तेषां शशंस गङ्गायामहमापृच्छ्य राघवम्।अनुज्ञातो निवृत्तोऽस्मि धार्मिकेण महात्माना।।2.57.10।।
57_10.translation: I took leave of the great, righteous Rama on the bank of the Ganga and have returned with his permission. (replied Sumantra).
57_10.word_by_word: अहम् I, गङ्गायाम् river Ganga, राघवम् Rama, आपृच्छ्य having taken leave, धार्मिकेण by the  righteous, महात्मना great (Rama), अनुज्ञातः having been permitted, निवृत्तः अस्मि I have returned, तेषाम् to them, शशंस said.

57_11.shloka: ते तीर्णा इति विज्ञाय बाष्पपूर्णमुखा जनाः।अहो धिगिति निश्श्वस्य हा रामेति च चुक्रुशुः।।2.57.11।।
57_11.translation: Hearing that they had (the trio) crossed the river Ganga, the people, with their faces filled with tears sighed and saying 'Fie upon us Alas, Rama' cried out aloud.
57_11.word_by_word: ते they, तीर्णाः इति crossed the river, thus, विज्ञाय having come to know, जनाः people, बाष्पपूर्णमुखाः faces filled with tears, अहो Oh, धिक् O fie upon us, इति thus, निश्श्वस्य sighing, हा राम इति saying 'Alas Rama', चुक्रुशुः च cried aloud.

57_12.shloka: शुश्राव च वचस्तेषां बृन्दं बृन्दं च तिष्ठताम्।हतास्म खलु ये नेह पश्याम इति राघवम्।।2.57.12।।
57_12.translation: He saw them gathering in groups, saying, Henceforth we will not be able to see Rama and without him, we are lost indeed.
57_12.word_by_word: ये all of us, इह here, राघवम् Rama, न पश्यामः unable to see, हताः स्म खलु indeed we are  lost (deprived), इति thus saying, बृन्दम् बृन्दम् in groups, तिष्ठताम् standing, तेषाम् their, वचः words, शुश्राव च also heard.

57_13.shloka: दानयज्ञविवाहेषु समाजेषु महत्सु च।न द्रक्ष्यामः पुन र्जातु धार्मिकं राममन्तरा।।2.57.13।।
57_13.translation: No longer will we see Rama at sacrifices, weddings, great assemblies and at places of charitable activity.
57_13.word_by_word: दानयज्ञविवाहेषु in acts of charity, sacrifices and weddings, महत्सु in great, समाजेषु च  assemblies also, अन्तरा in their midst, धार्मिकम् righteous, रामम् Rama, पुनः again, जातु ever, न द्रक्ष्यामः will not see.

57_14.shloka: किं समर्थं जनस्यास्य किं प्रियं किं सुखावहम्।इति रामेण नगरं पितृवत्परिपालितम्।।2.57.14।।
57_14.translation: Rama looked after his people like a father always thinking what was good for them, dear to them and comfortable to them.
57_14.word_by_word: अस्य जनस्य to these people, किम् what, समर्थम् is meaningful, किम् what, प्रियम् pleases, किम् what, सुखावहम् brings happiness, इति in this way, रामेण by Rama, नगरम् this city of Ayodhya, पितृवत् like father, परिपालितम् looked after.

57_15.translation: (He) heard wailings of women looking through the window and of the people in marketplaces burning with sorrow over Rama's exile.
57_15.word_by_word: वातायनगतानाम् looking through the windows, स्त्रीणाम् women's, अन्वन्तरापणम् in the stalls, रामशोकाभितप्तानाम् burning with sorrow due to Rama's exile, परिदेवनम् bewailings, शुश्राव heard.

57_16.shloka: स राजमार्गमध्येन सुमन्त्रः पिहिताननः।यत्र राजा दशरथस्तदेवोपययौ गृहम्।।2.57.16।।
57_16.translation: Sumantra with his face muffled, drove along the highway straight to the palace of king Dasaratha.
57_16.word_by_word: सः सुमन्त्रः that Sumantra, पिहिताननः with his face muffled, राजमार्गमध्येन along the highway, राजा दशरथः king Dasaratha, यत्र where, तत् that, गृहम् house, उपययौ reached straight.

57_17.shloka: सोऽवतीर्य रथाच्छीघ्रं राजवेश्म प्रविश्य च।कक्ष्या स्सप्ताभिचक्राम महाजनसमाकुलाः।।2.57.17।।
57_17.translation: Quickly alighting from the chariot, he entered  the king's palace and crossed the seven courtyards overcrowded with people.
57_17.word_by_word: सः that, रथात् from the chariot, अवतीर्य alighting, शीघ्रम् quickly, राजवेश्म king's palace, प्रविश्य च having entered, महाजनसमाकुलाः overcrowded with people, सप्त seven, कक्ष्याः courtyards, अभिक्राम crossed.

57_18.shloka: हर्म्यै र्विमानैः प्रासादैरवेक्ष्याथ समागतम्।हाहाकारकृता नार्यो रामदर्शनकर्शिताः।।2.57.18।।
57_18.translation: Women from mansions, sevenstoried buildings and from royal palaces, sighted him and pained at not seeing Rama cried out 'Alas, Alas'.
57_18.word_by_word: अथ thereafter, नार्यः women, हर्म्यैः from mansions, विमानैः from sevenstoried buildings, प्रासादैः from royal palaces, समागतम् arrived, आवेक्ष्य having seen, रामदर्शन कर्शिताः sad at not seeing Rama, हाहाकारकृताः cried out 'Alas, Alas'.

57_19.translation: The women in great anguish stood silently looking at one another, their large eyesflooded with overflowing tears.
57_19.word_by_word: स्त्रियः women, आर्ततराः in greater anguish,आयतैः large,विमलैःclean, अश्रुवेगपरिप्लुतैः flooded with the force of tears, नेत्रैः with eyes, अव्यक्तम् silently  अन्योन्यम् one another, अभिवीक्षन्ते were looking.

57_20.shloka: ततो दशरथस्त्रीणां प्रासादेभ्य स्तत स्ततः।रामशोकाभितप्तानां मन्दं शुश्राव जल्पितम्।।2.57.20।।
57_20.translation: From different spots in the palace, Sumantra heard the sobs and whispers of Dasaratha's wives who were tormented with the sorrow of Rama's exile.
57_20.word_by_word: ततः then, ततस्ततः here and there, प्रासाद्येभ्यः from palaces, रामशोकाभितप्तानाम् afflicted withsorrow due to Rama's exile, दशरथस्त्रीणाम् of the wives of Dasaratha, मन्दम् जल्पितम् whispers, शुश्राव heard.

57_21.shloka: सह रामेण निर्यातो विना राम मिहागतः।सूतः किन्नाम कौसल्यां शोचन्तीं प्रतिवक्ष्यति।।2.57.21।।
57_21.translation: The charioteer left with Rama and returned without him. What can he say to the wailing Kausalya?
57_21.word_by_word: रामेण सह with Rama, निर्यातः went out, विना रामम् without Rama, इह here, आगतः returned, सूतः charioteer, शोचन्तीम् worrying, कौशल्याम् Kausalya, किं नाम what can, प्रतिवक्ष्यति will he say?

57_22.shloka: यथा च मन्ये दुर्जीवमेवं न सुकरं ध्रुवम्।आच्छिद्य पुत्रे निर्याते कौसल्या यत्र जीवति।।2.57.22।।
57_22.translation: I think it is indeed difficult for Kausalya to live wherever and whichever way she tries as she has been separated from her son. (the queens said).
57_22.word_by_word: पुत्रे when the son, आच्छिद्य severing all connections, निर्याते had set out, कौसल्या Kausalya, यथा in whichever way, यत्र जीवति wherever surviving still, दुर्जीवम् it is difficult to live, मन्ये I consider, एवम् like this, सुकरम् easily, न not, ध्रुवम् certain.

57_23.shloka: सत्यरूपं तु तद्वाक्यं राज्ञ: स्त्रीणां निशामयन्।प्रदीप्तमिव शोकेन विवेश सहसा गृहम्।।2.57.23।।
57_23.translation: Listening to the correct words of the king's wives, he immediately entered the palace as if in flames (of grief).
57_23.word_by_word: राज्ञ: king's, स्त्रीणाम् wives, सत्यरूपम् truth embodied, तत् वाक्यम् that word, निशामयन्  listening, सहसा immediately, शोकेन with grief, प्रदीप्तमिव as if burning, गृहम् house, विवेश entered.

57_24.translation: On entering the eighth courtyard, he saw in a pale white chamber king Dasaratha desolate, anguished and withered with the sorrow of separation from his son.
57_24.word_by_word: सः he (Sumantra), अष्टमीम् eighth, कक्ष्याम् courtyard, प्रविश्य having entered, पाण्डुरे in pale white, गृहे chamber, दीनम् desolate, आतुरम् anguished, पुत्रशोकपरिम्लानम् withered by sorrow over his son, राजानम् king, अपश्यत् saw.

57_25.shloka: अभिगम्य तमासीनं नरेन्द्रे मभिवाद्य च।सुमन्त्रो रामवचनं यथोक्तं प्रत्यवेदयत्।।2.57.25।।
57_25.translation: Sumantra approached the king who was seated, paid obeisance to him and conveyed Rama's words verbatim.
57_25.word_by_word: सुमन्त्रः Sumantra, असीनम् seated, नरेन्द्रम् king, अभिगम्य having approached, अभिवाद्य paying  obeisance, रामवचनम् Rama's words, यदोक्तम् verbatim, प्रत्यवेदयत् conveyed.

57_26.shloka: स तूष्णीमेव तच्छ्रुत्वा राजा विभ्रान्तचेतनः।मूर्छितो न्यपतद्भूमौ रामशोकाभिपीडितः।।2.57.26।।
57_26.translation: The king silently listened to Rama's message. Bewildered and tormented by the grief of Rama's absence, he fell down on the ground in a swoon.
57_26.word_by_word: सः that, राजा king, तूष्णीमेव silently, तत् those words, श्रुत्वा having listened, विभ्रान्तचेतनः  with a bewildered mind, रामशोकाभिपीडितः tormented by the grief due to Rama's absence, मूर्छितः with senses lost, भूमौ on the ground, न्यपतत् fell.

57_27.shloka: ततोऽन्तःपुरमाविद्धं मूर्छिते पृथिवीपतौ।उद्धृत्य बाहू चुक्रोश नृपतौ पतितेक्षितौ।।2.57.27।।
57_27.translation: The moment the lord of the earth fell down on the ground unconscious, the women in the inner apartment burst into tears, raising their arms.
57_27.word_by_word: ततः then, पृथिवीपतौ when lord of the earth (the king), मूर्छिते had fallen unconscious, अन्तःपुरम्  inner apartment, आविद्धम् broken down, नृपतौ king, क्षितौ on the ground, पतिते had fallen, बाहू arms, उद्धृत्य having raised, चुक्रोश cried loudly.

57_28.shloka: सुमित्रया तु सहिता कौसल्या पतितं पतिम्।उत्थापयामास तदा वचनं चेदमब्रवीत्।।2.57.28।।
57_28.translation: Having seen her husband collapsed on the ground, Kausalya assisted by Sumitra lifted him up and said to him thus:
57_28.word_by_word: तदा then, सुमित्रया सहिता together with Sumitra, कौशल्या Kausalya, पतितम् fallen on the ground, पतिम् husband, उत्थापयामास lifted him up, इदम् these, वचनम् words, अब्रवीत् said.

57_29.shloka: इमं तस्य महाभाग दूतं दुष्करकारिणः।वनवासादनुप्राप्तं कस्मान्न प्रतिभाषसे।।2.57.29।।
57_29.translation: O distinguished king, why are you not enquiring from the messenger about him  (Rama) who is capable of performing arduous tasks?
57_29.word_by_word: महाभाग O distinguished one, वनवासात् from the forest, अनुप्राप्तम् returned, दुष्करकारिणःone who had accomplished arduous tasks, तस्य Rama's, इमम् this, दूतम् messenger, कस्मात् why, न प्रतिभाषसे are not talking.

57_30.shloka: अद्यैवमनयं कृत्वा व्यपत्रपसि राघव।उत्तिष्ठ सुकृतं तेस्तु शोके नस्या त्सहायता।।2.57.30।।
57_30.translation: O descendant of the Raghus are you ashamed of having done an injustice? Arise. you may be a blessed one (for fulfilling your promise). If you grieve, none will help you.
57_30.word_by_word: राघव O descendant of the Raghus, अनयम् injustice, कृत्वा having done, अद्य now, एवम् in this way, व्यपत्रपसि are feeling ashamed, उत्तिष्ठ rise, ते to you, सुकृतम् the merit (of having fullfilled your word), अस्तु obtained, शोके in this sorrow, सहायता help, न स्यात् will not get.

57_31.shloka: देव यस्या भयाद्रामं नानुपृच्छसि सारथिम्।नेह तिष्ठिति कैकेयी विस्रब्धं प्रतिभाष्यताम्।।2.57.31।।
57_31.translation: Kaikeyi for fear of whom you dare not ask the charioteer about Rama, O king is not here. You may speak to him without fear.
57_31.word_by_word: देव O king, यस्याः by whose, भयात् from fear, सारथिम् charioteer, रामम् about Rama, नानुपृच्छसि you are not enquiring, कैकेयी Kaikeyi, इह now, न तिष्ठति not here, विस्रब्धम् without fear, प्रतिभाष्यताम् you may speak.

57_32.shloka: सा तथोक्त्वा महाराजं कौसल्या शोकलालसा।धरण्यां निपपाताऽशु बाष्पविप्लुतभाषिणी।।2.57.32।।
57_32.translation: Absorbed in grief, Kausalya spoke to the maharaja in a voice choked with tears and then collapsed on the floor.
57_32.word_by_word: बाष्पविप्लुतभाषिणी speaking with a voice choked with tears, शोकलालसा absorbed in grief, सा कौशल्या that Kausalya, महाराजम् to the maharaja, तथा that way, उक्त्वा having said, आशु suddenly, धरण्याम् on the ground, निपपात fell down.

57_33.shloka: एवं विलपतीं दृष्ट्वा कौसल्यां पतितां भुवि।पतिं चावेक्ष्य ता स्सर्वा सुस्वरं रुरुदुः स्त्रियः।।2.57.33।।
57_33.translation: All those women saw weeping Kausalya as well as their husband fallen on the ground and wailed loudly in a chorus.
57_33.word_by_word: सर्वाः all, ताः स्त्रियः those women, एवम् thus, विलपतीम् lamenting, भुवि पतिताम्  fallen on the ground, कौशल्याम् Kausalya, दृष्ट्वा having seen, पतिं च also their husband, अवेक्ष्य having seen, सुस्वरम् in chorus, रुरुदुः wailed loudlly.

57_34.shloka: तत स्तमन्तःपुरनादमुत्थितं समीक्ष्य वृद्धा स्तरुणाश्च मानवाः।स्त्रियश्च सर्वा रुरुदु स्समन्ततः पुरं तदासीत्पुनरेव सङ्कुलम्।।2.57.34।।
57_34.translation: Having heard the sound emanating from the inner apartment, people, old, young and women, of the city lamented. The city was crowded again.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे सप्तपञ्चाशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the fiftyseventh sarga in Ayodhyakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
57_34.word_by_word: ततः thereafter, उत्थितम् rising, तम् that, अन्तःपुरनादम् sound from the inner apartment, समीक्षय having seen, वृद्धा: old, तरुणाश्च young, मानवाः people, सर्वाः all, स्त्रीयश्च also women, समन्ततः all around, रुरुदुः lamented, तदा then, पुरम् city, पुनरेव again, सङ्कुलम् आसीत् was filled (with people).

58_1.shloka: [Sumantra conveys the message of Rama to the wailing king and Kausalya.]प्रत्याश्वस्तो यदा राजा मोहात्प्रत्यागतं पुनः।अथाऽजुहाव तं सूतं रामवृत्तान्तकारणात्।।2.58.1।।
58_1.translation: When the king regained his consciousness and was consoled, he summoned the   charioteer to hear news about Rama.
58_1.word_by_word: अथ thereafter, राजा king, यदा when, प्रत्याश्वस्तः consoled, मोहात् from loss ofconsciousness, पुनः again, प्रत्यागतम् having regained his senses, रामवृत्तान्त कारणात् due to the news about Rama, तं सूतम् that charioteer, आजुहाव called for him.

58_2.shloka: अथ सूतो महाराजं कृताञ्जलिरुपस्थितः।राममेवानुशोचन्तं दुःखशोकसमन्वितम्।।2.58.2।।वृद्धं परमसन्तप्तं नवग्रहमिव द्विपम्।विनिश्वसन्तं ध्यायन्तमस्वस्थ मिव कुङञरम्।।2.58.3।।
58_2.translation: Then the charioteer with folded palms approached the king who, deeply afflicted with grief and pain, was brooding over Rama alone. Aged Dasaratha was heaving deep sighs like a newlycaptured, indisposed elephant.
58_2.word_by_word: अथ then, सूतः the charioteer, कृताञ्जलिः with folded palms, राममेव Rama alone, अनुशोचन्तम् thinking of Rama, दुःखशोकसमन्वितम् by grief and sorrow, वृद्धम्  aged, परमसन्तप्तम् deeply afflicted, नवग्रहम् newlycaptured, द्विपमिव like an elephant, विनिःश्वसन्तम् heaving deep sighs, अस्वस्थम् indisposed, कुञ्जरमिव like an elephant, ध्यायन्तम् brooding, महाराजम् king, उपस्थितः approached.

58_3.shloka: राजा तु रजसा सूतं ध्वस्ताङ्गं समुपस्थितम्।अश्रुपूर्णमुखं दीनमुवाच परमार्तवत्।।2.58.4।।
58_3.translation: Seeing the dejected charioteer standing before him, the desolate king covered all over with dust and his face bathed in tears, said to him in extreme grief:
58_3.word_by_word: राजा king, रजसा with dust, ध्वस्ताङ्गम् covered all over, अश्रुपूर्णमुखम् face bathed in tears, दीनम् dejected, समुपस्थितम् standing nearby,  सूतम् charioteer, परमार्तवत् filled with extreme grief, उवाच said.

58_4.shloka: क्वनु वत्स्यति धर्मात्मा वृक्षमूलमुपाश्रितः।सोऽत्यन्तसुखित स्सूत किमशिष्यति राघवः।।2.58.5।।
58_4.translation: O charioteer Rama is rightous and he is acustoomed to all sorts of comfort. Taking refuge at the foot of a tree how shall he live and what shall he eat?
58_4.word_by_word: सूत the charioteer, धर्मात्मा righteous (Rama), वृक्षमूलम् foot of the tree, उपाश्रितः having taken refuge, क्वनु where, वत्स्यति will he live?, अत्यन्त सुखितः enjoyed supreme luxury, स: राघवः that Rama, किम् what?, अशिष्यति will he eat?

58_5.shloka: दुःखस्यानुचितो दुःखं सुमन्त्र शयनोचितः।भूमिपालात्मजो भूमौ शेते कथमनाथवत्।।2.58.6।।
58_5.translation: How can the son of the guardian of the earth who is accustomed to a comfortable bed and not to undeserved suffering lie down on the ground like an orphan, O Sumantra
58_5.word_by_word: सुमन्त्र Sumantra, दुःखस्य to sorrow, अनुचितः not deserving, शयनोचितः accustomed to comfortable couches, भूमिपालात्मजः son of the guardian of the earth (prince Rama),  अनाथवत् like an orphan, भूमौ on the ground, दुःखम् sadly, कथम् how?, शेते can lie down?

58_6.shloka: यं यान्तमनुयान्ति स्म पदातिरथकुञ्जराः।स वत्स्यति कथं रामो विजनं वन माश्रितः।।2.58.7।।
58_6.translation: Wherever Rama went, elephants, chariots and footsoldiers followed him. How can he (now) live in the desolate forest where he has taken refuge?
58_6.word_by_word: यान्तम् when he went out, यम् whom, पदातिरथकुञ्जरा: footsoldiers, chariots and elephants, अनुयान्ति स्म followed, सः that, रामः Rama, विजनम् desolate, वनम् forest, आश्रितः having taken shelter, कथम् how, वत्स्यति can live.

58_7.shloka: व्यालैर्मृगैराचरितं कृष्णसर्पनिषेवितम्।कथं कुमारौ वैदेह्या सार्धं वन मुपस्थितौ।।2.58.8।।
58_7.translation: How can the two young men along with Vaidehi live in the forest infested with black cobras and wicked, wild animals?
58_7.word_by_word: कुमारौ the two youths (Rama and Lakshmana), वैदेह्या सार्धम् with Vaidehi also, व्यालैः by wicked wild elephants, मृगैः animals, आचरितम् ranging about, कृष्णसर्पनिषेवितम् abounding in black cobras, वनम् forest, कथम् how, उपस्थितौ exist.

58_8.shloka: सुकुमार्या तपस्विन्या सुमन्त्र सह सीतया।राजपुत्रौ कथं पादैरवरुह्य रथाद्गतौ।।2.58.9।।
58_8.translation: O Sumantra how did those two princes along with pitiable, delicate Sita, alight from the chariot, and enter the forest on foot?
58_8.word_by_word: सुमन्त्र Sumantra, राजपुत्रौ king's sons, सुकुमार्या along with delicate, तपस्विन्या by the pitiable, सीतया सह with Sita, रथात् from the chariot, पादैः on foot, अवरुह्य  alighting, कथम् how, गतौ did they go.

58_9.shloka: सिद्धार्थः खलु सूत त्वं येन दृष्टौ ममाऽत्मजौ।वनान्तं प्रविशन्तौ तावश्विनाविवमन्दरम्।।2.58.10।।
58_9.translation: You are blessed indeed, O charioteer to have seen my sons entering the outskirts of the forest like Aswinis stepping into the region of the Mandara mountain.
58_9.word_by_word: सूत O charioteer, येन by you, अश्विनौ Aswinis, मन्दरम् इव like Mandara mountain, वनान्तम् on the outskirts of the forest, प्रविशन्तौ entering, मम my, आत्मजौ sons, दृष्टौ have been seen, त्वम् you, सिद्धार्थः खलु are blessed indeed.

58_10.shloka: किमुवाच वचो रामः किमुवाच च लक्ष्मणः।सुमन्त्र वनमासाद्य किमुवाच च मैथिली।।2.58.11।।
58_10.translation: Upon reaching the forest, O Sumantra what did Rama, Lakshmana and Sita say?
58_10.word_by_word: सुमन्त्र Sumantra, वनम् forest, आसाद्य on reaching, रामः Rama, किम् what?, वचः words, उवाच did speak, लक्ष्मणः Lakshmana, किम् what, उवाच did say, मैथिली च and Sita, किम् what, उवाच did say.

58_11.shloka: आसितं शयितं भुक्तं सूत रामस्य कीर्तय।जीविष्यामहमेतेन ययातिरिव साधुषु।।2.58.12।।
58_11.translation: Tell me, O charioteer where Rama sat, where he slept, what (food) he ate. Only your words will enable me to live like Yayati among saints.
58_11.word_by_word: सूत charioteer, रामस्य Rama's, आसितम् seat, शयितम् bed, भुक्तम् food, कीर्तय describe, अहम् I, ययातिः Yayati, साधुषु इव as in the company of saints, एतेन with this, जीविष्यामि shall live.

58_12.shloka: इति सूतो नरेन्द्रेण बोधित स्सज्जमानया।उवाच वाचा राजानं स बाष्पपरिबद्धया।।2.58.13।।
58_12.translation: Thus questioned by the king the charioteer, his voice choked with tears and words faltering in grief, addressed the king:
58_12.word_by_word: नरेन्द्रेण by the king, Dasaratha, इति in this way, बोधितः questioned, सः सूतः that charioteer, बाष्पपरिबद्धया with voice choked with tears, सज्जमानया faltering with grief, वाचा  with words, राजानम् to the king, उवाच said.

58_13.shloka: अब्रवीन्मां महाराज धर्ममेवानुपालयन्।अञ्जलिं राघवः कृत्वा शिरसाऽभिप्रणम्य च।।2.58.14।।
58_13.translation: With palms folded and head bowed, O great king Rama offered his salutations to you in confirmity with righteousness and said to me:
58_13.word_by_word: महाराज O great king, राघवः the descendant of the Raghu race (Rama), धर्ममेव righteousness also, अनुपालयन् guarding, अञ्जलिम् with folded hands, कृत्वा having set, शिरसा bowing his head, अभिप्रणम्य च offering  salutations, माम् to me, अब्रवीत् said.

58_14.shloka: सूत मद्वचनात्तस्य तातस्य विदितात्मनः।शिरसा वन्दनीयस्य वन्द्यौ पादौ महात्मनः।।2.58.15।।
58_14.translation: 'Convey on my behalf, O charioteer to my illustrious father who is known for his selfknowledge, and is worthy of homage, that I am saluting his feet with my head bowed.
58_14.word_by_word: सूत O charioteer, मद्वचनात् as my words, विदितात्मनः knower of the self, महात्मनः illustrious, वन्दनीयस्य worthy of salutations, तस्य that, तातस्य father's, पादौ feet, शिरसा head, वन्द्यौ are worthy of salutations.

58_15.shloka: सर्वमन्तःपुरं वाच्यं सूत मद्वचनात्त्वया।आरोग्यमविशेषेण यथार्हं चाभिवादनम्।।2.58.16।।
58_15.translation: 'On my behalf convey, O charioteer, without any distinction, my salutations to all thewomen befitting their status and tell them I was enquiring about their wellbeing.
58_15.word_by_word: सूत O charioteer, त्वया by you, मद्वचनात् at my words, सर्वम् entire, अन्तःपुरम् inmates of the inner apartment, अविशेषेण without distinction, आरोग्यम् wellbeing, यथार्हम् befitting their status, अभिवादनं च salutations, वाच्यम् fit to be conveyed.

58_16.shloka: माता च मम कौसल्या कुशलं चाभिवादनम्।अप्रमादं च वक्तव्या ब्रूयाश्चैनामिदं वचः।।2.58.17।।
58_16.translation: 'Convey my mother carefully my saluations and my wellbeing and tell her:
58_16.word_by_word: मम my, माता mother, कौसल्या Kausalya, कुशलम् welfare, अभिवादनं च salutations, अप्रमादं च  alertness, वक्तव्या is worthy of conveying, इदम् this, वचश्च word, ब्रूयाः tell.

58_17.shloka: धर्मनित्या यथाकालमग्न्यगारपरा भव।देवि देवस्य पादौ च देववत्परिपालय।।2.58.18।।
58_17.translation: 'O mother, adhering to the righteous path and performing in time the rituals in the chamber of sacrificial fire, offer your services at the feet of king Dasaratha as if he were a god.
58_17.word_by_word: देवि O mother, धर्मनित्या adhering to the righteous path, यथाकालम् in time, अग्न्यगारपरा भव perform the rituals in the chamber of sacrificial fire, देवस्य (your) lord's (king Dasaratha's), पादौ च feet also, देववत् like a god, परिपालय serve.

58_18.shloka: अभिमानं च मानं च त्यक्त्वा वर्तस्व मातृषु।अनु राजानमार्यां च कैकेयीमम्ब कारय।।2.58.19।।
58_18.translation: 'O mother, conduct yourself with other mothers without pride and egoism. Ensure that venerable Kaikeyi remains welldisposed towards the king.
58_18.word_by_word: अभिमानं च egoism, मानं च pride, मातृषु towards mothers, वर्तस्व conduct yourself, अम्ब O mother, आर्याम् venerable, कैकेयीम् Kaikeyi, राजानम् अनु welldisposed towards the king, कारय mould her.

58_19.shloka: कुमारे भरते वृत्तिर्वर्तितव्या च राजवत्।अर्थज्येष्ठा हि राजानो राजधर्ममनुस्मर।।2.58.20।।
58_19.translation: 'Behave towards young Bharata as to a king. Irrespective of age, a king is a king. (Hence should be honoured). You should keep this rajadharma (royal prerogative) in mind.
58_19.word_by_word: कुमारे young, भरते towards Bharata, राजवत् like a king, वृत्ति: conduct, वर्तितव्या to be followed, राजानः kings, अर्थज्येष्ठाः हि senior by virtue of their royalty, राजधर्मम् prerogative of kings, अनुस्मर remember.

58_20.shloka: भरतः कुशलं वाच्यो वाच्यो मद्वचनेन च।सर्वास्वेव यथान्यायं वृत्तिं वर्तस्व मातृषु।।2.58.21।।
58_20.translation: 'Tell Bharata of my welfare and tell him on my behalf that he should honour all our mothers equally.
58_20.word_by_word: भरतः Bharata, कुशलम् welfare, वाच्यः deserves to be told, मद्वचनेन by my word, वाच्यः च  is to be told, सर्वासु among all, मातृषु mothers, यथान्यायम् rightly, वृत्तिम् behaviour, वर्तस्व follow.

58_21.word_by_word: इक्ष्वाकुकुलनन्दनः delight of the race of Ikshvaku, महाबाहुः mightyarmed, वक्तव्यश्च deserves be told this way, यौवराज्यस्थः crowned as prince regent, राज्यस्थम् being in the kingdom, पितरम् father, अनुपालय rule the kingdom (by being obedient to him).

58_22.shloka: अतिक्रान्तवया राजा मास्मैनं व्यवरोरुधः।कुमार राज्ये जीव त्वं तस्यैवाज्ञाप्रवर्तनात्।।2.58.23।।
58_22.translation: 'The king is advanced in age. Do not restrict him in any manner. Carry out his orders as prince regent, and live happily'.
58_22.word_by_word: राजा king Dasaratha, अतिक्रान्तवयाः is advanced in age, एनम् him, मा स्म व्यवरोरुधः do not restrict him, त्वम् you, तस्यैव that king's, आज्ञाप्रवर्तनात् carrying out the commands, कुमारराज्ये as prince regent, जीव live.

58_23.shloka: अब्रवीच्चापि मां भूयो भृशमश्रूणि वर्तयन्।मातेव मम माता ते द्रष्टव्या पुत्रगर्धिनी।।2.58.24।।
58_23.translation: Shedding profuse tears, Rama continued, 'Look after my mother who is covetous of her son as your own mother'.
58_23.word_by_word: भृशम् excessively, अश्रूणि tears, वर्तयन् shedding, माम् addressing me, भूयः more, अब्रवीच्चापि uttered, पुत्रगर्धिनी covetous of her son, मम माता my mother, ते  by you, मातेव as your mother, द्रष्टव्या worthy of being looked after.

58_24.shloka: इत्येवं मां महराज ब्रुवन्नेव महायशाः।रामो राजीवताम्राक्षो भृशमश्रूण्यवर्तयत्।।2.58.25।।
58_24.translation: While saying this the red lotuslike eyes of illustrious Rama streamed with tears, O maharaja
58_24.word_by_word: महाराज O king, महायशाः renowned, राजीवताम्राक्षः with red lotuslike eyes, रामः Rama, माम् to me, इत्येवम् thus, ब्रुवन्नेव while saying, भृशम् copious,  अश्रूणि tears, अवर्तयत् shed.

58_25.translation: But Lakshmana, seething with anger and sighing said, 'For what offence has this king's son  been banished'?
58_25.word_by_word: लक्ष्मणस्तु Lakshmana, सुसङ्कृद्धः mighty angry, निश्श्वसन् sighing, वाक्यम् words, अब्रवीत् said, अयम् this, राजपुत्रः king's son, केन by what, अपराधेन offence, विवासितः has been banished?

58_26.shloka: राज्ञा तु खलु कैकेय्या लघुत्वाश्रित्य शासनम्।कृतं कार्यमकार्यं वा वयं येनाभिपीडिताः।।2.58.27।।
58_26.translation: 'The king, too, submitting to the trash command of Kaikeyi has perpetrated an act, just or unjust (he knows better), for which we are made to suffer so much.
58_26.word_by_word: राज्ञा तु by the king also, कैकेय्याः of Kaikeyi, लघु trash, शासनम् command, आश्रित्य having taken refuge, अकार्यम् a forbidden act, कार्यं वा or a worthy act, कृतम् has been done, येन by which, वयम् we, अभिपीडिताः have been made to suffer.

58_27.shloka: यदि प्रव्राजितो रामो लोभकारणकारितम्।वरदाननिमित्तं वा सर्वथा दुष्कृतं कृतम्।।2.58.28।।
58_27.translation: 'Whether it was out of greed (for the kingdom) or for (the execution of) the boon bestowed, this act of banishment is by all means wicked'.
58_27.word_by_word: रामः Rama, लोभकारणकारितम् out of greed (for the kingdom), वरदाननिमित्तं वा or on account of the boons bestowed, प्रव्राजितः यदि if banished, सर्वथा by all means, दुष्कृतम् wicked act, कृतम् has been done.

58_28.shloka: इदं तावद्यथाकाममीश्वरस्य कृते कृतम्।रामस्य तु परित्यागे न हेतु मुपलक्षये।।2.58.29।।
58_28.translation: 'Or he might have thought he is the overlord and can do as he likes. (Or, he might have done this for fear of God) Otherwise, I do not see any reason for the abandonment of Rama'.
58_28.word_by_word: इदं तावत् this one, ईश्वरस्य कृते for (fear of) God, यथाकामम् this act, कृतम् done, रामस्य Rama's, परित्यागे in abandonment, हेतुम् reason, न उपलक्षये I do not see.

58_29.shloka: असमीक्षय समारब्धं विरुद्धं बुध्दिलाघवात्।जनयिष्यति सङ्क्रोशं राघवस्य विवासनम्।।2.58.30।।
58_29.translation: 'Unjustly, foolishly and without (proper) consideration Rama has been banished. This will (definitely) cause sorrow'.
58_29.word_by_word: बुद्धिलाघवात् out of lack of intelligence, असमीक्ष्य without (proper) consideration, समारब्धम् commenced, विरुद्धम् contrary (to justice), राघवस्य Rama's, विवासनम् banishment,सङ्क्रोशम् bewailment, जनयिष्यति will produce.

58_30.shloka: अहं तावन्महाराजे पितृत्वं नोपलक्ष्ये।भ्राता भर्ता च बन्धुश्च पिता च मम राघवः।।2.58.31।।
58_30.translation: 'I do not regard the great king as my father. Rama alone is my brother, protector, friend and father.
58_30.word_by_word: अहम् I, महाराजे in that great king, पितृत्वम् fatherhood, नोपलक्ष्ये I do not see, मम to me, राघवः Rama alone, भ्राता च brother, भर्ताच also protector, बन्धुश्च friend, पिता father.

58_31.shloka: सर्वर्लोकप्रियं त्यक्त्वा सर्वलोकहिते रतम्।सर्वलोकोऽनुरज्येत कथं त्वाऽनेनकर्मणा।।2.58.32।।
58_31.translation: 'How can anyone in this world be pleased with you for deserting Rama, the beloved of all, and ever devoted to their welfare?
58_31.word_by_word: सर्वलोकप्रियम् beloved to all, सर्वलोकहिते in the welfare of all, रतम् devoted, त्यक्त्वा after deserting, अनेन कर्मणा with this act, त्वा towards you, सर्वलोकः entire world, कथम् how, अनुरज्येत will be pleased?

58_32.shloka: सर्वप्रजाभिरामं हि रामं प्रव्राज्य धार्मिकम्।सर्वलोकं विरुध्येमं कथं राजा भविष्यसि।।2.58.33।।
58_32.translation: 'Having banished the righteous Rama, the delight of all subjects and, thereby,antagonizing the entire world, how can you claim to be their king?'
58_32.word_by_word: सर्वप्रजाभिरामम् Delight of all subjects, धार्मिकम् righteous, रामम् to Rama, प्रव्राज्य having used banishment, इमम् this, सर्वलोकम् entire world, विरुध्य antagonizing, राजा king, कथम् how, भविष्यसि will continue to rule?

58_33.shloka: जानकी तु महाराज निश्श्वसन्ती मनस्विनी।भूतोपहतचित्तेव विष्ठिता विस्मृता स्मिता।।2.58.34।।
58_33.translation: O great king as for that sensitive Janaki, she stood sighing, stupefied and oblivious (of the past), yet smiling as though her mind was possessed by an evil spirit.
58_33.word_by_word: महाराज O great king, मनस्विनी sensitive lady, जानकी तु Janaki, निश्श्वसन्ती heaving sighs, भूतोपहतचित्तेव like one possessed, विस्मृता स्मिता like one unconcerned with the surroundings and yet smiling, विष्ठिता stood stupefied.

58_34.shloka: अदृष्टपूर्वव्यसना राज्यपुत्री यशस्विनी।तेन दुःखेन रुदती नैव मां किञ्चिदब्रवीत्।।2.58.35।।
58_34.translation: That glorious princess Sita who had never experienced any adversity earlier, weeping with sorrow, could not even speak to me anything.
58_34.word_by_word: अदृष्टपूर्वव्यसना who had never experienced adversity, यशस्विनी celebrated, राजपुत्री that princess, तेन that, दुःखेन with sorrow, रुदती weeping, माम् to me, किञ्चित् even a little, नैव  अब्रवीत् did not at all say.

58_35.shloka: उद्वीक्षमाणा भर्तारं मुखेन परिशुष्यता।मुमोच सहसा बाष्पं मां प्रयान्तमुदीक्ष्य सा।।2.58.36।।
58_35.translation: When she saw me leaving, she looked at her husband with a dry (pale) face and suddenly burst into tears.
58_35.word_by_word: सा she, प्रयान्तम् moving, माम् me, उदीक्ष्य having seen, परिशुष्यता with driedup, मुखेन face, भर्तारम् husband, उद्वीक्षमाणा beholding, सहसा suddenly, बाष्पम् tears, मुमोच shed.

58_36.shloka: तथैव रामोऽश्रुमुखः कृताञ्जलिः स्थितोऽभवल्लक्ष्मणबाहुपालितः।तथैव सीता रुदती तपस्विनी निरीक्षते राजरथं तथैव माम्।।2.58.37।।
