58_36.translation: Supported by Lakshmana's arms, Rama stood, his face streaming with tears and palms folded, while the wretched Sita, glaring at me and the royal chariot, weeping.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे अष्टपञ्चाशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the fiftyeighth sarga in Ayodhyakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
58_36.word_by_word: तथैव thus, रामः Rama, अश्रुमुखः with his face filled with tears, कृताञ्जलिः with folded hands, लक्ष्मणबाहुपालितः supported by the arms of Lakshmana, स्थितः अभवत् stood, तपस्विनी pitiable, सीता Sita, रुदती weeping, राजरथम् king's chariot, माम् me, निरीक्षते kept gazing.

59_1.shloka: [Sumantra describes the shadow of sorrow over Ayodhya -- withering plants and flowers, driedup ponds, immobile animals -- Dasaratha pines for Rama.]इति ब्रुवन्तं तं सूतं सुमन्त्रं मन्त्रिसत्तमम्।ब्रूहि शेषं पुनरिति राजा वचनमब्रवीत्।।2.59.1।।
59_1.translation: Listening to the charioteer, the best of ministers (Sumantra), the king asked him to tell the rest.
59_1.word_by_word: राजा king, इति thus, ब्रुवन्तम् while speaking, सूतम् charioteer, मन्त्रिसत्तमम् best of  ministers, तं सुमन्त्रम् that Sumantra, शेषम् the rest, पुनः again, ब्रूहि tell, इति thus, वचनम् words, अब्रवीत् said.

59_2.shloka: तस्य तद्वचनं श्रुत्वा सुमन्त्रो बाष्पविक्लबः।कथयामास भूयोऽपि रामसन्देशविस्तरम्।।2.59.2।।
59_2.translation: Having heard him, Sumantra, overcome with tears, related further details of Rama's message.
59_2.word_by_word: सुमन्त्रः Sumantra, तस्य his, वचनम् words, श्रुत्वा having heard, बाष्पविक्लबः overcome with tears, रामसन्देशविस्तरम् details of Rama's message, भूयोऽपि once again, कथयामास narrated.

59_3.shloka: जटाः कृत्वा महाराज चीरवल्कलधारिणौ।गङ्गामुत्तीर्य तौ वीरौ प्रयागाभिमुखौ गतौ।।2.59.3।।
59_3.translation: O King the heroes in bark robes and with matted hair crossed the Ganga and proceeded towards Prayaga.
59_3.word_by_word: महाराज O king, चीरवल्कलधारिणौ wearing the bark robes, तौ वीरौ those heroes, जटाः matted hair, कृत्वा having made, गङ्गाम् the river Ganga, उत्तीर्य having crossed, प्रयागाभिमुखौ towards Prayaga, गतौ went.

59_4.shloka: अग्रतो लक्ष्मणो यातः पालयन्रघुनन्दनम्।तांस्तथा गच्छतो दृष्ट्वा निवृत्तोऽस्म्यवशस्तदा।।2.59.4।।
59_4.translation: Lakshmana walked ahead guarding Rama, the delight of the Raghus. While I returned helplessly seeing them go.
59_4.word_by_word: लक्ष्मणः Lakshmana, रघुनन्दनम् Rama, पालयन् protecting, अग्रतः ahead of him, यातः had gone, तथा that way, गच्छतः going, तान् him, दृष्ट्वा having seen, तदा then, अवशः helplessly, निवृत्तः अस्मि returned.

59_5.shloka: ममत्वश्वा निवृत्तस्य न प्रावर्तन्त वर्त्मनि।उष्णमश्रु प्रमुञ्चन्तो रामे सम्प्रस्थिते वनम्।।2.59.5।।
59_5.translation: When Rama set out for the forest, and I turned back, my horses shedding hot tears were reluctant to walk the path.
59_5.word_by_word: रामे Rama, वनम् for the forest, सम्प्रस्थिते when setting out, निवृत्तस्य when I returned, मम my, अश्वा: तु as for horses, उष्णम् hot, अश्रुप्रमुञ्चन्तः shedding tears, वर्त्मनि on the path, न प्रावर्तन्त did not proceed.

59_6.shloka: उभाभ्यां राजपुत्राभ्यामथ कृत्वाहमञ्जलिम्।प्रस्थितो रथमास्थाय तद्दुःखमपि धारयन्।।2.59.6।।
59_6.translation: Thereafter, controlling my grief and paying obeisance to both the princes with foldedpalms, I ascended the chariot and returned.
59_6.word_by_word: अथ thereafter, अहम् I, उभाभ्याम् to both, राजपुत्राभ्याम् princess, अञ्जलिम् folded palms, कृत्वा having made, तत् that, दुःखम् अपि grief, धारयन् controlling, रथम् chariot, आस्थाय ascending, प्रस्थितः set out.

59_7.shloka: गुहेन सार्धं तत्रैव स्थितोऽस्मि दिवसान्बहून्।आशया यदि मां रामः पुन श्शब्दापयेदिति।।2.59.7।।
59_7.translation: There along with Guha I waited for (three) days that Rama might call me back.
59_7.word_by_word: रामः Rama, पुनः again, माम् me, शब्दापयेत् यदि if calls me, इति thus, आशया with hope, तत्रैव there itself, गुहेन सार्धम् with Guha, बहून् many (three), दिवसान् अस्मि I waited.

59_8.shloka: विषये ते महाराज रामव्यसनकर्शिताः।अपि वृक्षाः परिम्लानास्सपुष्पाङ्कुरकोरकाः।।2.59.8।।
59_8.translation: O great king even trees with their flowers, buds and shoots throughout your empire have withered because of the calamity on Rama.
59_8.word_by_word: महाराज O great king, ते विषये throughout your empire, वृक्षाः अपि even trees, सपुष्पाङ्कुरकोरकाः with flowers, buds and shoots, रामव्यसनकर्शिताः oppressed on account of the calamity on Rama, परिम्लानाः withered.

59_9.shloka: उपतप्तोदका नद्यः पल्वलानि सरांसि च।परिशुष्कपलाशानि वनान्युपवनानि च।।2.59.9।।
59_9.translation: Water in rivers, ponds and lakes has heated up while all the foliage in the forests and gardens have shrivelled.
59_9.word_by_word: नद्यः rivers, उपतप्तोदकाः with heated waters, पल्वलानि ponds, सरांसि च lakes, वनानि forests, उपवनानि च gardens, परिशुष्कपलाशानि have their foliage shrivelled.

59_10.shloka: न च सर्पन्ति सत्त्वानि व्यासा न प्रचरन्ति च।रामशोकाभिभूतं तन्निष्कूजमभवद्वनम्।।2.59.10।।
59_10.translation: No living being move about and even wild animals roam no more. Overwhelmed with grief on account of Rama a great silence pervades the forest.
59_10.word_by_word: सत्त्वानि living beings, न च सर्पन्ति are not moving, व्यालाः च wild animals also, नप्रचरन्ति not ranging, तत् वनम् that forest, रामशोकाभिभूतम् overpowered by grief on account of Rama, निष्कूजम् silent, अभवत् became.

59_11.translation: The water in the lotus lakes, O king, has become turbid. The blue lotuses have withered and their shrivelled petals are submerged in water. The fishes and aquatic birds are hidden under waters.
59_11.word_by_word: नरेन्द्र O king, पद्मिन्यः lotus lakes, लीनपुष्करपत्राः च with the shrivelled blue lotus leaves submerged in water, कलुषोदकाः with waters turbid, सन्तप्तपद्माः withered lotuses, लीनमीनविहङ्गमाः devoid of fishes and birds.

59_12.shloka: जलजानि च पुष्पाणि माल्यानि स्थलजानि च।नाद्य भान्त्यल्पगन्धीनि फलानि च यथापुरम्।।2.59.12।।
59_12.translation: Bunches of flowers grown in water and on land, as well as fruits with their scant fragrance do not shine as before.
59_12.word_by_word: जलजानि born in water, पुष्पाणि flowers, स्थलजानि born on the land, माल्यानि garlands of flowers, फलानि च fruits, अद्य now, अल्पगन्धीनि with scant fragrance, यथापुरम् as before, न भान्ति do not shine.

59_13.shloka: अत्रोद्यानानि शून्यानि प्रलीनविहगनि च।न चाभिरामा नारामान्पश्यामि मनुजर्षभ।।2.59.13।।
59_13.translation: Pleasuregardens are all deserted as the birds have vanished. O best of men, as such they do not look beautiful.
59_13.word_by_word: अत्र there, उद्यानानि gardens, शून्यानि are deserted, प्रलीनविहगानि च with birds vanished (into the depth of woods), मनुजर्षभ O (best) among men, आरामान् parks, अभिरामन् as beautiful, न पश्यामि I do not see.

59_14.shloka: प्रविशन्तमयोध्यां मां न कश्चिदभिनन्दति।नरा राममपश्यन्तो निश्श्वसन्ति मुहुर्मुहुः।।2.59.14।।
59_14.translation: None greeted me when I entered Ayodhya, People heaved sighs repeatedly when they did not see Rama.
59_14.word_by_word: अयोध्यायाम् Ayodhya, प्रविशन्तम् entering, कश्चित् any one, न अभिनन्दति is not greeting, नराः people, रामम् Rama, अपश्यन्तः without beholding, मुहुर्मुहुः again and again, निश्श्वसन्ति are heaving sighs.

59_15.shloka: देव राजरथं दृष्ट्वा विना राममिहागतम्।दुःखादश्रुमुखस्सर्वो राजमार्गगतो जनः।।2.59.15।।
59_15.translation: Beholding the royal chariot arrive without Rama, all were on the highway shedding tears of anguish.
59_15.word_by_word: देव O lord, विना रामम् without Rama, इह here, आगतम् arrived, राजरथम् royal chariot, दृष्ट्वा having seen, राजमार्गगतः thronged the highway, सर्वः all, जनः people, दुःखात् due to agony, अश्रुमुखः with tears on their faces.

59_16.translation: When the women from mansions, sevenstoried buildings and from royal palaces saw the chariot without Rama, they, overwhelmed with sorrow, cried, 'Alas, Alas'.
59_16.word_by_word: नार्य: women, हर्म्यै: from mansions, विमानैः from sevenstoried buildings, प्रासादैः fromroyal palaces, आगतम् arrived, रथम् chariot, अवेक्ष्य having seen, रामादर्शनकर्शिताः afflicted by the absence of Rama, हाहाकारकृताः cried 'Alas, Alas'.

59_17.translation: The women, with their large, bright eyes flooded with gushing tears looked in silence at one another in deep anguish.
59_17.word_by_word: स्त्रियः women, आर्ततराः in deep anguish, आयतैः with large, विमलैः bright, अश्रुवेगपरिप्लुतैः flooded with gushing tears, नेत्रै: with their eyes, अव्यक्तम् silently, अन्योन्यम् one another, अभिवीक्षन्ते are looking at.

59_18.translation: I did not see any difference in the degree of anguish among friends, those who are not friends and and those who are indifferent. (The degree of agony was same in all).
59_18.word_by_word: अहम् I, आर्ततया in great agony, अमित्राणाम् among those who are not friends, किञ्चित् even a little, विशेषम् diference, न उपलक्षये could not see, मित्राणाम् among friends, उदासीनजनस्य of people indifferent, न could not see.

59_19.shloka: अप्रहृष्टमनुष्या च दीननागतुरङ्गमा।आर्तस्वरपरिम्लाना विनिश्श्वसितनिस्स्वना।।2.59.19।।निरानन्दा महाराज रामप्रव्राजनातुरा।कौसल्या पुत्रहीनेव अयोध्या प्रतिभाति मा।।2.59.20।।
59_19.translation: O maharaja, Ayodhya is filled with cheerless people with deep sighs, agonised voices and pale faces depressed and distressed due to Rama's exile. (Even) elephants and horses look spiritless. For me it (the city) resembles (dejected) Kausalya deprived of her son.
59_19.word_by_word: महाराज O great king, अप्रहृष्टमनुष्या च people cheerless, दीननागतुरङ्गमा spiritless elephants and horses, आर्तस्वरपरिम्लाना with agonised voices and pale faces, विनिश्वसित निस्स्वना with deep sighs, निरानन्दा depressed, रामप्रव्राजनातुरा distressed due to Rama's exile, पुत्रहीना deprived of her son, कौसल्या इव like Kausalya, मा प्रतिभाति appears to me.

59_20.shloka: सूतस्य वचनं श्रुत्वा वाचा परमदीनया।बाष्पोपहतया राजा तं सूतमिदमब्रवीत्।।2.59.21।।
59_20.translation: At these words of the charioteer, the king in deep distress replied with a voice chokedwith tears:
59_20.word_by_word: राजा king, सूतस्य charioteer's, वचनम् words, श्रुत्वा having heard, परमदीनया deeply dejected, बाष्पोपहतया choked with tears, वाचा with a voice, तं सूतम् to the charioteer, इदम् these words, अब्रवीत् said.

59_21.shloka: कैकेय्या विनियुक्तेन पापाभिजनभावया।मया न मन्त्रकुशलैर्वृद्धैस्सह समर्थितम्।।2.59.22।।
59_21.translation: Incited by Kaikeyi of sinful relations and sinful motive, I did not consult expert, elderly counsellers.
59_21.word_by_word: पापाभिजनभावया by one who has wicked relations and sinful intention, कैकेय्या by Kaikeyi, विनियुक्तेन having been incited, मया by me, मन्त्रकुशलैः with men skilled in giving advice, वृद्धै: सह with seniors, न समर्थितम् was not consulted.

59_22.shloka: न सुहृद्भिर्नचामात्यैर्मन्त्रयित्वा न नैगमैः।मयायमर्थस्सम्मोहात् स्त्रीहेतो स्सहसा कृतः।।2.59.23।।
59_22.translation: For the sake of a woman, this act was committed in great haste, without consulting friends or ministers or men of prudence.
59_22.word_by_word: सुहृद्भि: with friends, अमात्यैः with ministers, नैगमैः च with men of prudence, न मन्त्रयित्वा without consulting, मया by me, अयम् this, अर्थः act, स्त्रीहेतो: for the sake of a woman, सहसा in great haste, कृतः committed.

59_23.shloka: भवितव्यतया नूनमिदं वा व्यसनं महत्।कुलस्यास्य विनाशाय प्राप्तं सूत यदृच्छया।।2.59.24।।
59_23.translation: Surely it is destiny and this calamity has befallen for the wilful destruction of the (entire) race, O charioteer
59_23.word_by_word: सूत O charioteer, वा otherwise, इदम् this, महत् great, व्यसनम् calamity, भवितव्यतया because it was destined to happen this way, अस्य this, कुलस्य race's, विनाशाय for destruction, यदृच्छया wilfully, प्राप्तम् has befallen, नूनम् surely.

59_24.shloka: सूत यद्यस्ति ते किञ्चिन्मया तु सुकृतं कृतम्।त्वं प्रापयाऽऽशु मां रामं प्राणास्सन्त्वरयन्तिमाम्।।2.59.25।।
59_24.translation: O Charioteer, if ever I have rendered you any favour, quickly  take me to Rama. My life is hastening me (fast running out).
59_24.word_by_word: सूत O Charioteer, मया by me, ते to you, किंचित् even a little, सुकृतम् favour, कृतम् अस्ति यदि  if it has been rendered, त्वम् you, आशु quickly, माम् me, रामम् to Rama, प्रापय take, प्राणाः life, माम् me, संत्वरयन्ति are hastening me up.

59_25.shloka: यद्यद्यापि ममैवाज्ञा निवर्तयतु राघवम्।न शक्ष्यामि विना रामं मुहूर्तमपि जीवितुम्।।2.59.26।।
59_25.translation: If my command prevails today, Rama may be brought back. Without Rama I cannot live for a moment even.
59_25.word_by_word: अद्यापि even now, मम my, आज्ञैव by command, राघवम् Rama, निवर्तयतु be brought back, रामं विना without Rama, मुहूर्तमपि even for a moment, जीवितुम् to live, न शक्ष्यामि am not able.

59_26.shloka: अथवाऽपि महाबाहुर्गतो दूरं भविष्यति।मामेव रथमारोप्य शीघ्रं रामाय दर्शय।।2.58.27।।
59_26.translation: Otherwise if (you think) the mightyarmed (Rama) has gone too far then quickly put me in the chariot, and show me Rama (Carry me to him).
59_26.word_by_word: अथवा or otherwise also, महाबाहुः mightyarmed, दूरम् far away, गतः भविष्यति must have gone, मामेव me alone, रथम् on the chariot, आरोप्य placing, शीघ्रम् quickly, रामाय to Rama, दर्शय show.

59_27.shloka: वृत्तदंष्ट्रो महेष्वासः क्वासौ लक्ष्मणपूर्वजः।यदि जीवामि साध्वेनं पश्येयं सीतया सह।।2.59.28।।
59_27.translation: Where is that Rama, elder brother to Lakshmana who has wellshaped teeth and wields a mighty bow? If I can see him along with Sita I will survive.
59_27.word_by_word: वृत्तदंष्ट्रः one with wellshaped teeth, महेष्वासः a great archer, असौ that, लक्ष्मणपूर्वजः elder brother of Lakshmana, Rama, क्व where is he?, एनम् him, सीतया सह along with Sita, साधु well, पश्येयं यदि if I can see him, जीवामि I can live.

59_28.shloka: लोहिताक्षं महाबाहुमामुक्तमणिकुण्डलम्।रामं यदि न पश्येयं गमिष्यामि यमक्षयम्।।2.59.29।।
59_28.translation: If I cannot see Rama of redcoloured eyes, the mightyarmed one and wearing earrings bedecked with precious stones I shall surely go to the abode of Yama, the god of death.
59_28.word_by_word: लोहिताक्षम् one with redcoloured eyes, महाबाहुम् mightyarmed, आमुक्तमणिकुण्डलम् wearing earrings bedecked with gems, रामम् Rama, न पश्येयं यदि if I cannot see him, यमक्षयम् kingdom of Yama, lord of death, गमिष्यामि I will go.

59_29.shloka: अतो नु किं दुःखतरं सोऽहमिक्ष्वाकुनन्दनम्।इमामवस्थामापन्नो नेह पश्यामि राघवम्।।2.59.30।।
59_29.translation: What else can be of greater sorrow to me who having reached this state, am still unable to see Rama?
59_29.word_by_word: इमाम् this, अवस्थाम् condition, आपन्नः having reached, सः अहम् such me, इक्ष्वाकुकुलनन्दनम्  Delight of the Ikshvakus, राघवम् Rama, इह now, न पश्यामि see not, अतः than this, दुःखतरम् greater sorrow,  किं नु what more.

59_30.shloka: हा राम रामानुज हा हा वैदेहि तपस्विनि।न मां जानीत दुःखेन म्रियमाणतमनाथवत्।।2.59.31।।
59_30.translation: Ah Rama, Ah Lakshmana, Ah unfortunate Vaidehi, you do not know that I am dying  like an orphan because of my grief.
59_30.word_by_word: हा राम Ah Rama, हा रामानुज Ah Lakshmana, तपस्विनि the unfortunate, हा वैदेहि Ah Vaidehi,  माम् me, दुःखेन due to grief, अनाथवत् like an orphan, म्रियमाणम् dying, न जानीत you do not know.

59_31.shloka: स तेन राजा दुःखेन भृशमर्पितचेतनः।अवगाढस्सुदुष्पारं शोकसागरमब्रवीत्।।2.59.32।।
59_31.translation: The king whose mind was extremely enfeebled due to grief and who was immersed ina sea of tears which he was unable to cross continued:
59_31.word_by_word: तेन दुःखेन by that sorrow, भृशम् extremely, अर्पित चेतनः with enfeebled mind,  सः राजा that king, सुदुष्पारम् difficult to cross, शोकसागरम् sea of sorrow, अवगाढः immersed, अब्रवीत् said.

59_32.shloka: रामशोकमहाभोगस्सीताविरहपारगः।श्वसितोर्मि महावर्तो बाष्पफेनजालाविलः।।2.59.33।।बाहुविक्षेपमीनौघो विक्रन्दित महास्वनः।प्रकीर्णकेशशैवालः कैकेयीबडबामुखः।।2.59.34।।ममाश्रुवेगप्रभवः कुब्जावाक्यमहाग्रहः।वरवेलो नृशंसाया रामप्रव्राजनायतः।।2.59.35।।यस्मिन्बत निमग्नोऽहं कौसल्ये राघवं विना।दुस्तरो जीवता देवि मयाऽयं शोकसागरः।।2.59.36।।
59_32.translation: O queen Kausalya, I am completely immersed in this ocean of sorrow. The misfortune due to Rama's separation is its breadth. Sita's separation is the other end of the shore. Sighs are its turbulent waves and whirlpools. Tears are its foam and turbid waters. Waving of arms is its fishes. Cries of agony are its roars. My dishevelled hair is its moss. Kaikeyi is the mouth of Badaba. My copious tears are its source. Words of the hunchback (Manthara) are the monstrous crocodiles. The cruel boons to Kaikeyi are its shores. Without Rama I cannot cross  this sea of sorrow alive. Ah, whata pity
59_32.word_by_word: देवि O queen, कौशल्ये Kausalya, अहम् I, यस्मिन् in which, निमग्नः immersed, (असौ this,शोकसागरः ocean of sorrow), रामशोकमहाभोगः sorrow due to Rama's separation as its breadth, सीताविरहपारगः Sita's separation as its other shore, श्वसितोर्मिमहावर्तः sighs as its turbulent waves and whirlpools, बाष्पफेनजलाविलः tears as its foam and turbid waters, बाहुविक्षेपमीनौघः waving of the arms as fishes, विक्रन्दितमहास्वनः cries of agony as its roar, प्रकीर्णकेशशैवालः dishevelled hair as its moss, कैकेयीबडबामुखः Kaikeyi as mouth of Badaba mythical seamare, मम to me, अश्रुवेगप्रभवः source of copious tears, कुब्जावाक्यमहाग्रहः the words of hunchback (Manthara) as monstrous crocodiles, नृशंसायाः cruel, वरवेल boons as shores, रामप्रव्राजनायतः exile of Rama as its expanse, अयम् this, शोकसागरः sea of sorrow, राघवं विना without Rama, मया by me, जीवता with my life, दुस्तरः difficult to cross, बत on what a pity

59_33.shloka: अशोभनं योऽहमिहाद्य राघवं दिदृक्षमाणो न लभे सलक्ष्मणम्।इतीव राजा विलपन्महायशाः पपात तूर्णं शयने समूर्छितः।।2.59.37।।
59_33.translation: Though I wish I cannot see Rama together with Lakshmana. Indeed this is very unfortunate. Lamenting thus, king Dasaratha of great reknown fell on the bed, unconscious.
59_33.word_by_word: यः he who, अहम् I, अद्य now, दिदृक्षमाणः wishing to see, सलक्ष्मणम् with Lakshamana, राघवम् Rama, इह here, न लभे unable to get them, अशोभनम् inauspicious, इतीव in this way, महायशाः of great reknown, सः राजा that king, विलपन् lamenting, मूर्छितः lying unconcsious, तूर्णम् immediately, शयने on the bed, पपात fell.

59_34.shloka: इति विलपति पार्थिवे प्रणष्टे करुणतरं द्विगुणं च रामहेतोः।वचनमनुनिशम्य तस्य देवी भयमगमत्पुनरेव राममाता।।2.59.38।।
59_34.translation: Wailing, Dasaratha fell unconscious. He was doubly grieved due to his yearning for Rama. Rama's mother was seized with fear hearing those lamentations.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे एकोनषष्टितमस्सर्गः।।Thus ends  the fiftyninth sarga in Ayodhyakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
59_34.word_by_word: पार्थिवे king, रामहेतोः for the sake of Rama, करुणतरम् in greater grief, द्विगुणं च doubly, विलपति lamenting, प्रणष्टे losing senses, राममाता Rama's mother, देवी queen Kausalya, तस्य वचनम् his words, अनुनिशम्य having heard, पुनरेव once again, भयम् fear, अगमत् seized.

60_1.shloka: [Sumantra consoles Kausalya.]ततो भूतोपसृष्टेव वेपमाना पुनः पुनः।धरण्यां गतसत्त्वेव कौसल्या सूतमब्रवीत्।।2.60.1।।
60_1.translation: Thereafter Kausalya, trembling as if possessed by an evil spirit and rolling on the floor like one who her senses now and again, said to the charioteer (Sumantra):
60_1.word_by_word: ततः thereafter, कौशल्या Kausalya, भूतोपसृष्टेव as if possessed by an evil spirit, वेपमाना trembling, गतसत्त्वेव like one who has his senses lost, पुनः पुनः again and again, धरण्याम् on the floor, सूतम् to the  charioteer (Sumantra), अब्रवीत् said.

60_2.shloka: नय मां यत्र काकुत्स्थस्सीता यत्र च लक्ष्मणः।तान्विना क्षणमप्यत्र जीवितुं नोत्सहेह्यहम्।।2.60.2।।
60_2.translation: Take me where Rama, Sita and Lakshmana are. I do not wish to live even for a moment without them.
60_2.word_by_word: काकुत्स्थः Rama, सीता च Sita, यत्र wherever, लक्ष्मणः Lakshmana, यत्र wherever, तत्र there, माम् to me, नय take, तान् विना without them, अत्र here,  क्षणमपि even for a moment, जीवितुम्  to live, अहम् I, न उत्सहे do not wish.

60_3.shloka: निवर्तय रथं शीघ्रं दण्डकान्नय मामपि।अथ तान्नानुगच्छामि गमिष्यामि यमक्षयम्।।2.60.3।।
60_3.translation: 'Turn back your chariot immediately and take me to the Dandaka forest. If I do not follow them, I shall enter the world of Yama'.
60_3.word_by_word: रथम् chariot, शीघ्रम् quickly, निवर्तय turn back, मामपि me also, दण्डकान् to Dandaka, नय  take, अथ if, तान् them, नानु गच्छामि if I do not follow, यमक्षयम् to the world of Yama, गमिष्यामि shall go.

60_4.shloka: बाष्पवेगोपहतया स वाचा सज्जमानया।इदमाश्वासयन्देवीं सूतः प्राञ्जलिरब्रवीत्।।2.60.4।।
60_4.translation: With folded hands and faltering words choked by his fastflowing tears the charioteer tried to console Kausalya:
60_4.word_by_word: सः सूतः that charioteer, बाष्पवेगोपहतया prevented by fastflowing tears, सज्जमानया faltering, वाचा with words, देवीम् to Kausalya, आश्वसयन् consoling, प्राञ्जलिः with folded palms, इदम् these words, अब्रवीत् said.

60_5.shloka: त्यज शोकं च मोहं च सम्भ्रमं दुःखजं तथा।व्यवधूय च सन्तापं वने वत्स्यति राघवः।।2.60.5।।
60_5.translation: Abandon your tears, delusion and despair arising out of sorrow. Rama is going to livein the forest, brushing aside all agony.
60_5.word_by_word: शोकम् grief, मोहम् delusion, तथा also, दुःखजम् arising out of sorrow, सम्भ्रमं च despair, त्यज abandon, राघवः Rama, सन्तापम् difficulties, व्यवधूय after brushig aside, वने in the forest, वत्स्यति is going to live.

60_6.shloka: लक्ष्मणश्चापि रामस्य पादौ परिचरन्वने।आराधयति धर्मज्ञः परलोकं जितेन्द्रियः।।2.60.6।।
60_6.translation: Selfcontrolled Lakshmana, aware of his duty, serves Rama in the forest. By this he is securing his next world.
60_6.word_by_word: धर्मज्ञ: knower of duty, लक्ष्मणश्चापि also Lakshmana, वने in the forest, जितेन्द्रियः one whose senses are controlled, रामस्य to Rama' s, पादौ feet, परिचरन् serving at, परलोकम् the other world, आराधयति is accomplishing.

60_7.shloka: विजनेऽपि वने सीता वासं प्राप्य गृहेष्विव।विस्रम्भं लभतेऽभीता रामे सन्न्यस्तमानसा।।2.60.7।।
60_7.translation: Sita with her mind fixed on Rama is living confidently in that desolate forest without any fear as if it were her home.
60_7.word_by_word: सीता Sita, विजने in the desolate, वनेपि in the forest also, गृहेष्विव like at home, वासम् living, प्राप्य having obtained, रामे in Rama, सन्न्यस्तमानसा with her mind fixed, अभीता without fear, विस्रम्भम् confidence, लभते  is getting.

60_8.shloka: नास्या दैन्यं कृतं किञ्चित्सुसूक्ष्ममपि लक्ष्यते।उचितेव प्रवासानां वैदेही प्रतिभाति मा।।2.60.8।।
60_8.translation: I could not see even the slightest depression in Sita as if she was accustomed to staying away from home.
60_8.word_by_word: अस्याः of her, सुसूक्ष्ममपि even the slightest, दैन्यम् dejection, किञ्चित् not even a little, कृतम् done, न लक्ष्यते not to be seen, वैदेही Sita, प्रवासानाम् for staying away from home, उचितेव as if accustomed, मा to me, प्रतिभाति appears.

60_9.shloka: नगरोपवनं गत्वा यथा स्मरमते पुरा।तथैव रमते सीता निर्जनेषु वनेष्वपि।।2.60.9।।
60_9.translation: Earlier, just as Sita used to revel in the gardens of the city, so does she now in those desolate forests.
60_9.word_by_word: सीता Sita, पुरा earlier, नगरोपवनम् to the pleasuregardens of the city, गत्वा having gone, यथा as, रमतेस्म was enjoying, निर्जनेषु in desolate, वनेष्वपि even in the forest, तथैव in the same way, रमते enjoying.

60_10.shloka: बालेव रमते सीताऽबालचन्द्रनिभानना।रामा रामे ह्यधीनात्मा विजनेऽपि वने सती।।2.60.10।।
60_10.translation: Charming Sita whose face resembles the full Moon, with her mind fixed on Rama, is enjoying even the desolate forest like a child.
60_10.word_by_word: रामा charming lady, रामे in Rama, अधीनात्मा one with absorbed mind, अबालचन्द्रनिभानना countenance resembling the full Moon, सीता Sita, विजने desolate, वने in the forest also, सती अपि staying, बालेव like a child, रमते is enjoying.

60_11.shloka: तद्गतं हृदयं ह्यस्यास्तदधीनं च जीवितम्।अयोध्यापि भवेऽत्तस्या रामहीना तदा वनम्।।2.60.11।।
60_11.translation: Her heart is ever united with Rama, and her life is under his control. Without Rama, even Ayodhya would become a forest for her.
60_11.word_by_word: अस्याः her, हृदयम् heart, तद्गतम् united with Rama, जीवितं च life also, तदधीनम् under his control, अयोध्यापि even Ayodhya too, रामहीना without Rama, तदा then, तस्याः to her, वनम् forest, भवेत् would have become.

60_12.shloka: परिपृच्छति वैदेही ग्रामांश्च नगराणि च।गतिं दृष्ट्वा नदीनां च पादपान्विविधानपि।।2.60.12।।रामं हि लक्ष्मणं वापि पृष्ट्वा जानाति जानकी।अयोध्या क्रोशमात्रे तु विहारमिव संश्रिता।।2.60.13।।
60_12.translation: Seeing villages, cities, trees of different kinds and courses of rivers, Sita is enquiringfrom Rama or Lakshmana about them. She feels as though she is sporting in the pleasuregarden just a krosa from Ayodhya.
60_12.word_by_word: अयोध्या क्रोशमात्रे at the distance of a krosa from Ayodhya, विहारम् pleasuregarden, संश्रिता इव as if sporting, वैदेही Sita, ग्रामांश्च villages, नगराणि च cities,नदीनाम् rivers', गतिं च   courses, विविधान् different kinds of, पादपानपि trees also, दृष्ट्वा seeing, रामम् to Rama, परिपृच्छति enquiring, लक्ष्मणं वापि or Lakshmana, पृष्ट्वा asking, जानाति knowing.

60_13.shloka: इदमेव स्मराम्यस्यास्सहसैवोपजल्पितम्।कैकेयी संश्रितं वाक्यं नेदानीं प्रतिभाति मा।।2.60.14।।
60_13.translation: Sita did say something about Kaikeyi, but now I do not remember what.
60_13.word_by_word: अस्याः her, इदमेव this much, स्मरामि I remember, सहसैव suddenly, उपजल्पितम् utterance, कैकेयी संश्रितम् about Kaikeyi, वाक्यम् words, इदानीम् now, मा to me, न प्रतिभाति does not come to my mind.

60_14.shloka: ध्वंसयित्वा तु तद्वाक्यं प्रमादात्पर्युपत्स्थितम्।ह्लादनं वचनं सूतो देव्या मधुरमब्रवीत्।।2.60.15।।
60_14.translation: Diverting the context of what he uttered inadvertently relating to Kaikeyi, the charioteer said pleasing words of consolation to Kausalya.
60_14.word_by_word: सूतः charioteer, प्रमादात् inadvertently, पर्युपत्स्थितम् uttered by all means, तद्वाक्यम् those words relating to Kaikeyi, ध्वंसयित्वा holding back, देव्याः to Kausalya, ह्लादनम् causing delight, मधुरम् pleasing, वचनम् words, अब्रवीत् said.

60_15.shloka: अध्वना वातवेगेन सम्भ्रमेणाऽऽतपेन च।न विगच्छति वैदेह्याश्चन्द्रांशु सदृशी प्रभा।।2.60.16।।
60_15.translation: Just like the beams of the Moon, Sita's glow is not affected by the fatigue of the journey or by the speed of the wind or by the scorching heat.
60_15.word_by_word: वैदेह्याः Sita's, चन्द्रांशु सदृशी resembling the beams of the Moon, प्रभा lustre, अध्वना on the way, वातवेगेन or by the speed of the wind, सम्भ्रमेण or due to haste, आतपेन च or due to scorching heat also, न विगच्छति does not fade.

60_16.shloka: सदृशं शतपत्रस्य पूर्णचन्द्रोपमप्रभम्।वदनं तद्वदान्याया वैदेह्या न विकम्पते।।2.60.17।।
60_16.translation: The countenance of Sita with her gentle eloquence resembles a hundredpetalled lotus. She has the luminance of the full Moon that has not wilted.
60_16.word_by_word: वदान्यायाः of that munificent, वैदेह्याः Sita, शतपत्रस्य a hundredpetalled lotus, सदृशम् similar to, पूर्णचन्द्रोपमप्रभम् like the splendour of the full Moon, तत् वदनम् that countenance, न विकम्पते does not change at all.

60_17.translation: Her feet, now devoid of lacdye, still look red like lac and shine like the lotus bud.
60_17.word_by_word: अलक्तरसक्ताभौ shining red like the liquid lac, अलक्तरसवर्जितौ no longer tinted with such liquid, तस्याः her, चरणौ feet, अद्यापि even now, पद्मकोशसमप्रभौ are shining like the lotus buds.

60_18.shloka: नूपुरोद्घुष्टहेलेव खेलं गच्छति भामिनी।इदानीमपि वैदेही तद्रागान्नयस्त भूषणा।।2.60.19।।
60_18.translation: Casting off her ornaments, the damsel (Sita) is gracefully walking as if dalliant with her tinkling anklets for her love for him (Rama).
60_18.word_by_word: भामिनी damsel (Sita), नूपुरोद्घुष्ट हेलेव tinkling anklets proclaiming dalliance, खेलम् (as if) playing, गच्छति going, वैदेही Sita, इदानीमपि even now, तद्रागात् due to affection for Rama, नयस्तभूषणा cast off the ornaments.

60_19.shloka: गजं वा वीक्ष्य सिंहं वा व्याघ्रं वा वनमाश्रिता।नाऽहारयति सन्त्रासं बाहू रामस्य संश्रिता।।2.60.20।।
60_19.translation: Though in the forest, Sita, under the protection of Rama's arms, is afraid of neither elephants nor lions nor tigers.
60_19.word_by_word: वनम् forest, आश्रिता resorted, रामस्य Rama's, बाहू arms, संश्रिता having taken refuge, गजं वा elephant, सिंहं वा or lion, व्याघ्रं वा or tiger, वीक्ष्य having seen, सन्त्रासं fear, नाऽहारयति does not get.

60_20.shloka: न शोच्यास्ते न चात्मनश्शोच्यो नापि जनाधिपः।इदं हि चरितं लोके प्रतिष्ठास्यति शाश्वतम्।।2.60.21।।
60_20.translation: You need not lament for them or for yourself or for the king. This story of Rama will endure permanently in the world.
60_20.word_by_word: ते they, न शोच्याः need not be pitied, आत्मनः च yourself, न not, जनाधिप अपि king also, इदम् this, चरितम् history, लोके in the world, शाश्वतम् permanently, प्रतिष्ठास्यति will endure.

60_21.shloka: विधूय शोकं परिहृष्टमानसा महर्षियाते पथि सुव्यवत्स्थिताः।वनेरता वन्यफलाशनाः पितुश्शुभां प्रतिज्ञां परिपालयन्ति ते।।2.60.22।।
60_21.translation: They are upholding the sacred promise of their father with cheerful hearts, grief given the goby, steadfastly pursuing the path established by maharsis, subsisting on forest fruits and enjoying the forest life.
60_21.word_by_word: ते they, शोकम् grief, विधूय shaking off, परिहृष्टमानसाः with cheerful hearts, महर्षियाते  established by maharshis, पथि in the path, सुव्यवत्स्थिताः firmly fixed, वने in the forest, रताः  are enjoying, वन्यफलाशनाः subsisting on forest fruits, पितुः father's, शुभाम् auspicious, प्रतिज्ञाम् promise, परिपालयन्ति are upholding.

60_22.shloka: तथापि सूतेन सुयुक्तवादिना निवार्यमाणा सुतशोककर्शिता।न चैव देवी विरराम कूजितात्प्रियेति पुत्रेति च राघवेति च।।2.60.23।।
60_22.translation: Though Sumantra was speaking with befitting words to prevent Kausalya from weeping over her son which had enfeebled her, she did not stop crying, 'O my beloved', 'O my son', 'O Rama'.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे षष्टितमस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the sixtieth sarga in Ayodhyakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
60_22.word_by_word: सुयुक्तवादिना by one who was speaking befittingly, सूतेना by Sumantra, तथा like that, निवार्यमाणापि though prevented, देवी queen Kausalya, सुतशोककर्शिता enfeebled with weeping over her son, प्रियेति 'O My beloved', पुत्रेति 'O my son', राघवेति च 'O Rama', कूजितात् from crying, नचैव विरराम did not stop.

61_1.shloka: [Kausalya condemns Dasaratha's action -- Dasaratha loses his senses out of intense grief.]वनं गते धर्मपरे रामे रमयतां वरे।कौसल्या रुदती स्वार्ता भर्तारमिदमब्रवीत्।।2.61.1।।
61_1.translation: When Rama, the greatest among those who please the people, he who was conscious of his duty left for the forest. Kausalya, sobbing in bitter anguish, said to her husband:
61_1.word_by_word: धर्मपरे dutiful, रमयताम् pleasing others, वरे greatest, रामे Rama, वनम् forest, गते had gone, कौशल्या Kausalya, स्वार्ता in bitter anguish, रुदती sobbing, भर्तारम् to her husband, इदम् these words, अब्रवीत् said.

61_2.shloka: यद्यपि त्रिषु लोकेषु प्रथितं ते महद्यशः।सानुक्रोशो वदान्यश्च प्रियवादी च राघवः।।2.61.2।।
61_2.translation: Your great fame has spread all over the three worlds. People know you as compassionate, generous and sweetspeaking scion of the Raghus.
61_2.word_by_word: राघवः Dasaratha, scion of the Raghu dynasty, सानुक्रोशः compassionate, वदान्यश्च generous, प्रियवादी च sweettongued, ते your, महत् great, यशः fame, त्रिषु three, लोकेषु in worlds, प्रथितं यद्यपि even though very popular.

61_3.shloka: कथं नरवरश्रेष्ठ पुत्रौ तौ सह सीतया।दुःखितौ सुखसंवृद्धौ वने दुःखं सहिष्यतः।।2.61.3।।
61_3.translation: O Dasaratha, the best among kings, how will your two sons and Sita brought up in great comfort now tolerate the hardships of forest life?
61_3.word_by_word: नरवरश्रेष्ठ best among kings (Dasaratha), सुखसंवृद्धौ brought up with comfort, तौ पुत्रौ your two sons, सीतया सह with Sita, दुःखितौ stricken with grief, वने in the forest, दुःखम्  suffering, कथम् how?, सहिष्यतः endure?

61_4.shloka: सा नूनं तरुणी श्यामा सुकुमारी सुखोचिता।कथमुष्णं च शीतं च मैथिली प्रसहिष्यते।।2.61.4।।
61_4.translation: How can the daughter of Mithila (Sita) who in the prime of her life, accustomed to comforts, endure  heat and cold indeed?
61_4.word_by_word: तरुणी young, श्यामा in the prime of life, सुकुमारी delicate, सुखोचिता accustomed to comfort, सा मैथिली that Sita, उष्णं च heat, शीतं च cold, नूनम् surely, कथम् how?, प्रसहिष्यते will bear.

61_5.shloka: भुक्त्वाऽशनं विशालाक्षी सूपदं शान्वितं शुभम्।वन्यं नैवारमाहारं कथं सीतोपभोक्ष्यते।।2.61.5।।
61_5.translation: How can the largeeyed Sita having enjoyed delicious food mixed with condiments and soup now partake the food prepared with wild grains?
61_5.word_by_word: विशालाक्षी largeeyed, सीता Sita, सूपदं शान्वितम् with condiments and soup, शुभम् wellprepared, अशनम् food, भुक्त्वा having partaken, वन्यम् in the forest, नैवारम् made with wild rice, आहारम् food, कथं उपभोक्ष्यते how will she eat?

61_6.shloka: गीतवादित्रनिर्घोषं श्रुत्वा शुभमनिन्दिता।कथं क्रव्यादसिंहानां शब्दं श्रोष्यत्यशोभनम्।।2.61.6।।
61_6.translation: How can the blameless Sita, used to the soft sound of songs and musicalinstruments hear the frightful roars of lions and other carnivorous animals?
61_6.word_by_word: अनिन्दिता blameless, शुभम् auspicious, गीतवादित्रनिर्घोषम् sounds of songs and musical instruments, श्रुत्वा having heard, अशोभनम् inauspicious, क्रव्यादसिंहानाम् carnivorous animals' and lions', शब्दम् sound, कथम् how?, श्रोष्यति can hear.

61_7.shloka: महेन्द्रध्वजसङ्काशः क्व नु शेते महाभुजः।भुजं परिघसङ्काशमुपधाय महाबलः।।2.61.7।।
61_7.translation: Where will that mightyarmed and powerful Rama, as lofty as Indra's banner, sleep using his ironbarlike arm as pillow?.
61_7.word_by_word: महेन्द्रध्वजसङ्काशः resembling mighty Indra's banner, महाभुजः longarmed one, महाबलः mighty, परिघसङ्काशम् like a sword, भुजम् arm, उपधाय using as a pillow, क्व where, शेते नुis he sleeping?

61_8.shloka: पद्मवर्णं सुकेशान्तं पद्मनिश्श्वासमुत्तमम्।कदा द्रक्ष्यामि रामस्य वदनं पुष्करेक्षणम्।।2.61.8।।
61_8.translation: When shall I see Rama with his lotushued face, his beautiful locks of hair, breath of lotus fragrance and eyes like blue lotus?
61_8.word_by_word: पद्मवर्णम् lotuslike complexion, सुकेशान्तम् having beautiful hairends, पद्मनिश्श्वासम् breath of lotus fragrance, पुष्करेक्षणम् eyes like blue lotus, उत्तमम् excellent, रामस्य वदनम् Rama's countenance, कदा when, द्रक्ष्यामि shall I behold?.

61_9.shloka: वज्रसारमयं नूनं हृदयं मे न संशयः।अपश्यन्त्या न तं यद्वै फलतीदं सहस्रधा।।2.61.9।।
61_9.translation: No doubt my heart must be made of thunderbolt, since unable to see Rama it does not split into a thousand pieces.
61_9.word_by_word: मे हृदयम् my heart, वज्रसारमयम् is made of thunderbolt, नूनम् surely, संशयः doubt, न not, यत् since, तम् Rama, अपश्यन्त्याः without seeing, इदम् this heart, सहस्रधा thousand pieces, न फलति वै does not shatter.

61_10.shloka: यत्त्वयाऽकरुणं कर्म व्यपोह्य मम बान्धवाः।निरस्ताः परिधावन्ति सुखार्हाः कृपणा वने।।2.61.10।।
61_10.translation: (O king) It is because of your heartless action, my Rama and my relatives who deserve to enjoy pleasures at this age have been banished and are miserably wandering in wilderness.
61_10.word_by_word: त्वया by you, करुणम् heartless, कर्म act, व्यपोह्य cast away, सुखार्हाः deserve pleasures, मम बान्धवाः my relations, निरस्ताः are banished, कृपणाः the miserable ones, वने in the forest, यत् since, परिधावन्ति are running around.

61_11.shloka: यदि पञ्चदशे वर्षे राघवः पुनरेष्यति।जह्याद्राज्यं च कोषं च भरतो नोपलक्षयते।।2.61.11।।
61_11.translation: Even if Rama returns in the fifteenth year, it is unlikely that Bharata will give up the kingdom and royal treasury (in favour of Rama).
61_11.word_by_word: राघवः Rama, पञ्चदशे वर्षे in the fifteenth year, पुनः एष्यति यदि if returns, भरतः Bharata, राज्यं च kingdom, कोषं च treasury too, जह्यात् will give up, नोपलक्ष्यते it does not appear.

61_12.shloka: भोजयन्ति किल श्राद्धे केचित्स्वानेव बान्धवान्।ततः पश्चात्समीक्षन्ते कृतकार्या द्विजर्षभान्।।2.61.12।।
61_12.translation: Some first feed their own relatives in shraddha ceremony and thereafter look for the best of brahmins to feed.
61_12.word_by_word: केचित् some people, श्राद्धे in the shraddha ceremony, स्वान् own, बान्धवानेव relatives only, भोजयन्ति किल feed them, कृतकार्याः having completed this ceremony, ततः पश्चात्  thereafter, द्विजर्षभान् bulls (best) among brahmins, समीक्षन्ते will look for.

61_13.shloka: तत्र ये गुणवन्तश्च विद्वांसश्च द्विजातयः।न पश्चात्तेऽभिमन्यन्ते सुधामपि सुरोपमाः।।2.61.13।।
61_13.translation: The godlike brahmins who are virtuous and learned will not accept the food after others have partaken even if it is ambrosia.
61_13.word_by_word: तत्र there, ये those, गुणवन्तश्च virtuous, विद्वांसश्च learned, सुरोपमाः similar to devatas, द्विजातयः ते those brahmins, पश्चात् after others, सुधामपि even ambrosia, न अभिमन्यन्ते will not accept.

61_14.shloka: ब्राह्मणेष्वपि तृप्तेषु पश्चाद्भोक्तुं द्विजर्षभाः।नाभ्युपैतुमलं प्राज्ञा श्शृङ्गच्छेदमिवर्षभाः।।2.61.14।।
61_14.translation: The bulls (best) among the wise brahmins would not like to accept the food after it is tasted by other brahmins, just as bulls dislike their horns being shorn.
61_14.word_by_word: तृप्तेषु contented, ब्राह्मणेष्वपि even if they are brahmins, प्राज्ञाः the wise, द्विजर्षभाः bulls (best) among brahmins, ऋषभाः like bulls, श्रुङ्गच्छेदमिव shorn of their horns, पश्चात् afterwards, भोक्तुम्  to partake, अभ्युपैतुम् to accept, नालम् should not.

61_15.shloka: एवं कनीयसा भ्रात्रा भुक्तं राज्यं विशाम्पते।भ्राता ज्येष्ठो वरिष्ठश्च किमर्थं नावमंस्यते।।2.61.15।।
61_15.translation: O Lord of the world why not the eldest and the most distinguished among the brothers likewise disdain the kingdom enjoyed by the younger brother?
61_15.word_by_word: विशाम्पते O Lord of the world (Dasaratha), एवम् likewise, ज्येष्ठः eldest, वरिष्ठश्च most distinguished one, भ्राता brother, कनीयसा by the younger, भ्रात्रा brother, भुक्तम् enjoyed, राज्यम् kingdom, किमर्थम् why, नावमंस्यते will not disdain.

61_16.shloka: न परेणाऽहृतं भक्ष्यं व्याघ्रः खादितुमिच्छति।एवमेतन्नरव्याघ्रः परलीढं न मन्यते।।2.61.16।।
61_16.translation: Just as a tiger will not eat the food acquired by another beast, Rama, the tiger (best) among men will not accept the kingdom enjoyed by others.
61_16.word_by_word: व्याघ्रः tiger, परेण by some other animal, आहृतम् procured, भक्ष्यम् food, खादितुम् to eat,        न  इच्छति does not like, एवं in the same way, नरव्याघ्रः the (best) among men (Rama), एतत् परलीढम् enjoyed by others, न मन्यते will not accept.

61_17.shloka: हविराज्यं पुरोडाशाः कुशा यूपाश्च खादिराः।नैतानि यातयामानि कुर्वन्ति पुनरध्वरे।।2.61.17।।
61_17.translation: Havis, sacrificial offerings like ghee, cakes, kusha grass, and sacrificial posts made from khadira wood, once used in the sacrifice cannot be used again.
61_17.word_by_word: हविः offering to the Firegod, आज्यम् ghee, पुरोडाशाः sacrificial cakes, कुशाः kusha grass, खादिराः khadira wood, यूपाश्च sacrificial posts, यातयामानि after the lapse of one Yama (three hours), एतानि all these, अध्वरे in the sacrifice, पुनः again, न कुर्वन्ति will not be used.

61_18.shloka: तथा ह्यात्तमिदं राज्यं हृतसारां सुरामिव।नाभिमन्तुमलं रामो नष्टसोममिवाध्वरम्।।2.61.18।।
61_18.translation: In the same way Rama will not accept this kingdom enjoyed by others like liquour or soma juice drained of its essence.
61_18.word_by_word: तथा in the same way, रामः Rama, आत्तम् enjoyed by others, इदं राज्यम् this kingdom, हृतसाराम् its essence taken away, सुरामिव like liquour, नष्टसोमम् like the run out soma juice, अध्वरमिव like a sacrifice, अभिमन्तुम् to accept, नालम् should not.

61_19.shloka: न चेमां धर्षणां राम सङ्गच्छेदत्यमर्षणः।दारयेन्मन्दरमपि स हि क्रुद्धश्शितैश्शरैः।।2.61.19।।
61_19.translation: Rama, highly determined will not suffer this indignity. If enraged, he can split open even mount Mandara with his sharp arrows.
61_19.word_by_word: अत्यमर्षण: highly determined, रामः Rama, इमाम् this, धर्षणाम् indignity, न सङ्गच्छेत् will notsuffer, क्रुद्ध: if angered, सः he, शितैः with sharp, सरैः with arrows, मन्दरमपि even mount Mandara, दारयेत् हि will split open.

61_20.shloka: त्वां तु नोत्सहते हन्तुं महात्मा पितृगौरवात्।ससोमार्कग्रहगणं नभस्ताराविचित्रितम्।।2.61.20।।पातयेद्योदिवं क्रुद्धस्सत्वां न व्यतिवर्तते।प्रक्षोभयेद्वारये द्वा महीं शैलशताचिताम्।।2.61.21।।
61_20.translation: Out of respect for his father magnanimous Rama is not inclined to kill you. He has not defied the anger, the Sun, the Moon and the sky looking wonderful with stars can be pulled down. He will not even shake or break the earth surrounded by hundreds of mountains.
61_20.word_by_word: तु but, महात्मा great, पितृगौरवात् out of respect for a father, त्वाम् you, हन्तुम् to kill,  नोत्सहते is not showing interest, क्रुद्ध: inflamed, यः who, ससोमार्कग्रहगणम् with Sun, Moon and planets, ताराविचित्रितम् looking wonderful with stars, नभः sky, दिवम् heaven, पातयेत् may pull down, नः he, त्वाम् you, न व्यतिवर्तते is not disobeying,  शैलशत चिताम् surrounded by hundreds of mountains, महीम् earth, प्रक्षोभयेद्वा will shake, दारयेद्वा or may break.

61_21.shloka: नैवं विधमसत्कारं राघवो मर्षयिष्यति।बलवानिव शार्दूलो वालधेरभिमर्शनम्।।2.61.22।।
61_21.translation: A powerful tiger will not allow its tail to be twisted. In the same way Rama also will not tolerate an insult of this sort.
61_21.word_by_word: बलवान् strong, शार्दूलः tiger, वालधेः of its tail, अभिमर्शनम् इव like twisting, राघवः Rama, एवं विधम् such, असत्कारम् insult, न मर्षयिष्यति will not tolerate.

61_22.shloka: नैतस्य सहिता लोका भयं कुर्युर्महामृथे।अधर्मंत्विह धर्मात्मा लोकं धर्मेण योजयेत्।।2.61.23।।
61_22.translation: Even if all the worlds were to unite and fight against him, he will not fear. Thisrighteous Rama will reestablish justice in this unrighteous world.
61_22.word_by_word: महामृथे in the great war, लोकाः worlds, सहिताः united, एतस्य for him, भयम् fear, न कुर्युः will not create, धर्मात्मा virtuous, अधर्मम् unrighteous, लोकम् world, धर्मेण with righteousness, योजयेत् will confer.

61_23.shloka: नन्वसौ काञ्चनैर्बाणैर्महावीर्यो महाभुजः।युगान्त इव भूतानि सागरानपि निर्दहेत्।।2.61.24।।
61_23.translation: Valiant and mightyarmed Rama, with his golden shafts can annihilate all living beings and oceans like at the time of  deluge everything is consumed in fire.
61_23.word_by_word: महावीर्यः mighty, महाभुजः longarmed, असौ this Rama, काञ्चनैः golden, बाणैः with shafts, युगान्तः इव like at the time of deluge, भूतानि all beings, सागरानपि all the oceans, निर्दहेत् will be consumed in fire.

61_24.shloka: स तादृशस्सिंहबलो वृषभाक्षो नरर्षभः।स्वयमेव हतः पित्रा जलजेनात्मजो यथा।।2.61.25।।
61_24.translation: Such Rama, the best among men, powerful like a lion, with eyes fierce like that of a bull has been destroyed by his own father just as the big fish destroys its own offsprings.
61_24.word_by_word: तादृशः such, सिंहबलः powerful as lion, वृषभाक्षः his eyes resembling a bull's, सः नरर्षभः that one, a bull among men, जलजेन by fish, आत्मजो यथा its own offspring, पित्रैव by his father himself, स्वयम् by himself, हतः killed.

61_25.shloka: द्विजातिचरितो धर्मश्शास्त्रदृष्टस्सनातनः।यदि ते धर्मनिरते त्वया पुत्रे विवासिते।।2.61.26।।
61_25.translation: You have banished your son who is devoted to righteousness. Is it in accordance with the scriptures and the eternal tradition followed by the twiceborn?
61_25.word_by_word: धर्मनिरते devoted to righteousness, पुत्रे son, त्वया by you, विवासिते has been banished, ते  to you, शास्त्रदृष्टः seen in the scriptures, सनातनः eternal, द्विजातिचरितः followed by the twiceborn, धर्मः यदि is it righteous act?

61_26.shloka: गतिरेका पतिर्नार्या द्वितीया गतिरात्मजः।तृतीया ज्ञातयो राजंश्चतुर्थी नेह विद्यते।।2.61.27।।
61_26.translation: O king for a woman the first refuge is the husband, the second her son, the third her relatives and there is no fourth alternative in this world.
61_26.word_by_word: राजन् O king, नार्याः for a woman,पतिः husband, एका one, गतिः refuge, आत्मजः son, द्वितीया गतिः second refuge, ज्ञातयः relatives, तृतीया third, चतुर्थी fourth, इह in this world, न विद्यते does not exist.

61_27.shloka: तत्र त्वं चैव मे नास्ति रामश्च वनमाश्रितः।न वनं गन्तुमिच्छामि सर्वथा निहता त्वया।।2.61.28।।
61_27.translation: You are nonexistent for my purpose. Rama has taken refuge in the forest and I do not like to go there. You have destroyed me in all possible ways.
61_27.word_by_word: तत्र in these three states, त्वम् you, नैवासि is not, रामस्तु as for Rama, वनम् forest, अश्रितः has taken refuge, वनम् forest, गन्तुम् to go, न इच्छामि I do not desire, सर्वथा in all possible ways, त्वया by you, निहता I am destroyed.

61_28.shloka: हतं त्वया राज्यमिदं सराष्ट्रं हतस्तथाऽत्मा सह मन्त्रिभिश्च।हता सपुत्राऽस्मि हताश्च पौरास्सुत श्च भार्या च तव प्रहृष्टौ।।2.61.29।।
61_28.translation: You have destroyed this kingdom, and the state along with its inhabitants. You have ruined yourself along with your ministers. You have brought disaster to me and to my son. Your son (Bharata) and your wife (Kaikeyi) are the only persons who are happy.
61_28.word_by_word: त्वया by you, सराष्ट्रम् with kingdom, इदम् राज्यम् this kingship, हतम् is destroyed, तथा also, मन्त्रिभिः सह along with ministers, आत्मा yourself, हतः are destroyed, सपुत्राः me along with my son, हता: are ruined, पौराश्च inhabitants of the city of Ayodhya, हताः destroyed, तव your, सुतश्च son Bharata, भार्या wife Kaikeyi, प्रहृष्टौ happy.

61_29.shloka: इमां गिरं दारुणशब्द संश्रितां निशम्य राजाऽपि मुमोह दुःखितः।तत स्स शोकं प्रविवेश पार्थिवस्स्वदुष्कृतं चापि पुनस्तदा स्मरन्।।2.61.30।।
61_29.translation: Hearing the words uttered in harrowing accents, the king overcome with deep distress became senseless. Recollecting his folly thereafter he fell into a sad state.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे एकषष्टितमस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the sixtyfirst sarga in Ayodhyakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
61_29.word_by_word: राजापि the king too, दारुणशब्दसंश्रिताम् uttered with cruel words, इमाम् this, गिरम् utterances, निशम्य having heard, दुःखितः was distressed, मुमोह became senseless, ततः thereafter, सः पार्थिवः that king, तदा then, स्वदुष्कृतम् his own folly, पुनः again, स्मरन् recollecting, शोकम् in sad state, प्रविवेश entered.

62_1.shloka: [Sudden flash of a thought in the mind of Dasaratha about an evil act done by him in the past -- Dasaratha attributes present misfortune to the past action -- seeks forgiveness of Kausalya.]एवं तु क्रुद्धया राजा राममात्रा सशोकया।श्रावितः परुषं वाक्यं चिन्तयामास दुःखितः।।2.62.1।।
62_1.translation: Forced to hear the harsh words of angry Kausalya, the king, deeply distressed, was absorbed in sad thought.
62_1.word_by_word: क्रुद्धया in anger, सशोकया afflicted with sorrow, राममात्रा by Rama's mother, एवम् in that way, परुषम् harsh, वाक्यम् words, श्रावितः was forced to hear, राजा king, दुःखितः distressed, चिन्तयामास sadly reflected.

62_2.shloka: चिन्तयित्वा स च नृपो मुमोह व्याकुलेन्द्रियः।अथ दीर्घीण कालेन संज्ञामाप परन्तपः।।2.62.2।।
62_2.translation: The king (Dasaratha) tormentor of enemies, for a while, lost his consciousness, his senses bewildered. After a long time he regained his senses.
62_2.word_by_word: सः that, नृपः king, चिन्तयित्वा having thought over, व्याकुलेन्द्रियः with bewildered senses, मुमोह lost consciousness, अथ thereafter, परन्तपः tormentor of enemies, दीर्घेण कालेन  after a long while, संज्ञाम् the senses, आप regained.

62_3.shloka: स संज्ञामुपलभ्यैव दीर्घमुष्णं च निश्श्वसन्।कौसल्यां पार्श्वतो दृष्ट्वा पुन श्चिन्तामुपागमत्।।2.62.3।।
62_3.translation: When he regained his senses, the king heaved deep, hot sighs. Seeing Kausalya by his side he relapsed into a state of anxiety.
62_3.word_by_word: सः he, संज्ञाम् senses, उपलभ्यैव after getting back, दीर्घम् deep, उष्णं च hot, निश्श्वसन् sighing, पार्श्वतः by the side, कौसल्याम् Kausalya, दृष्ट्वा having seen, पुनः again, चिन्ताम् anxieties, उपागमत् got into.

62_4.shloka: तस्य चिन्तयमानस्य प्रत्याभात्कर्म दुष्कृतम्।यदनेन कृतं पूर्वमज्ञानाच्छब्दवेधिना।।2.62.4।।
62_4.translation: While he was thus reflecting on a sinful act he had inadvertently comitted long ago, the act of discharging an arrow that could hit its target following the sound, flashed in his mind.
62_4.word_by_word: चिन्तयमानस्य as he was thinking, तस्य his, पूर्वम् formerly, अनेन by such, शब्दवेधिना Capable of hitting the target by following the sound, अज्ञानात् without knowledge, यत् which, कृतम् has been committed, दुष्कृतम् sinful, कर्म act, प्रत्यभात् flashed back.

62_5.shloka: अमनास्तेन शोकेन रामशोकेन च प्रभुः।द्वाभ्यामपि महाराज श्शोकाभ्यामन्वतप्यत।।2.62.5।।
62_5.translation: The great king, the lord with a broken heart started regretting deeply about both the grievous acts he had committed previously (one is shooting at the son of a sage and the other, banishing Rama).
62_5.word_by_word: तेन शोकेन with that grief, रामशोकेन with the grief of Rama's separation, अमनाः with a broken heart, प्रभुः lord, महाराजः maharaja, द्वाभ्याम् by both, शोकाभ्याम् अपि the sorrows also, अन्वतप्यत started regretting.

62_6.shloka: दह्यामान स्सशोकाभ्यां कौसल्यामाह भूपतिः।वेपमानोऽञ्जलिं कृत्वा प्रसादार्थमवाङ्मुखः।।2.62.6।।
62_6.translation: Consumed by the double sorrow, the king trembling, with head down and folding his hands said to Kausalya in order to appease her:
62_6.word_by_word: शोकाभ्याम् with those two sad incidents, दह्यमानः being afflicted, सः भूपतिः that king (Dasaratha), वेपमानः trembling, आवाङ्मुखः with his head bending downwards, प्रसादार्थम्to appease, अञ्जलिम् with folded palms, कृत्वा having made, कौशल्याम् to Kausalya, आह said.

62_7.shloka: प्रसादये त्वां कौसल्ये रचितोऽयं मयाऽञ्जलिः।वत्सला चानृशंसा च त्वं हि नित्यं परेष्वपि।।2.62.7।।
62_7.translation: O Kausalya I entreat you with folded palms. Be merciful. Forever affectionate, you are not cruel even towards your enemies.
62_7.word_by_word: कौशल्ये O Kausalya, त्वाम् you, प्रसादये be merciful, मया by me, अयम् this, अञ्जलिः folded  palms, रचितः set, त्वम् you, परेष्वपि even towards enemies, नित्यम् always, वत्सला is affectionate, अनृशंसा च हि not cruel.

62_8.shloka: भर्ता तु खलु नारीणां गुणवान्निर्गुणोऽपि वा।धर्मं विमृशमानानां प्रत्यक्षं देवि दैवतम्।।2.62.8।।
62_8.translation: O Devi for women who have regard for righteousness, a husband, whether virtuous or not, is a god incarnate.
62_8.word_by_word: देवि O Devi, धर्मम् righteousness, विमृशमानानाम् pondering over, नारीणाम् for women, गुणवान् virtuous, निर्गुणोपि वा or not virtuous, भर्ता husband, प्रत्यक्षम् visible, दैवतं खलु indeed god to them.

62_9.shloka: सा त्वं धर्मपरा नित्यं दृष्टलोक परावरा।नार्हसे विप्रियं वक्तुं दुखिःताऽपि सुदुःखितम्।।2.62.9।।
62_9.translation: You always adhere to righteousness. You have seen both the extremes (good and bad) of this world. Athough you yourself are in grief it does not behove you to speak unpleasant words to one who is suffering from a greater grief.
62_9.word_by_word: नित्यम् always, धर्मपरा righteousminded one, दृष्टलोकवरावरा knower of both the extremities, सा त्वम् such as you, दुःखितापि although grieved, सुदुःखितम् one who is weighed down with grief, विप्रियम् unpleasant words, वक्तुम् to speak, नार्हसि does notbehove you.

62_10.shloka: तद्वाक्यं करुणं राज्ञः श्रुत्वा दीनस्य भाषितम्।कौसल्या व्यसृजद्बाष्पं प्रणालीव नवोदकम्।।2.62.10।।
62_10.translation: Kausalya heard the pitiable words uttered by the king who was in a wretched condition. She shed tears like a water channel discharging fresh rainwater.
62_10.word_by_word: कौशल्या Kausalya, दीनस्य of the wretched, राज्ञः king's, करुणम् pitiable, भाषितम् utterances, तत् वाक्यम् those words, श्रुत्वा having heard, प्रणाली water conduit, नवोदकमिव like discharging fresh rainwater, बाष्पम् tears, व्यसृजत् shed.

62_11.shloka: सा मूर्ध्निबध्वा रुदती राज्ञः पद्ममिवाञ्जलिम्।सम्भ्रमादब्रवीत् त्रस्ता त्वरमाणाक्षरं वचः।।2.62.11।।
62_11.translation: Frightened Kausalya, weeping and raising her palms folded like lotus on to her head,  and charged with emotions said with stumbling syllables:
62_11.word_by_word: सा that Kausalya, रुदती crying, पद्ममिव like lotus, राज्ञः king's, अञ्जलिम् folded palms,  मूर्ध्नि on her head, बध्वा setting, त्रस्ता frightened, सम्भ्रमात् out of emotion, त्वरमाणाक्षरम्   stumbling syllables, वचः words, अब्रवीत् said.

62_12.shloka: प्रसीद शिरसा याचे भूमौ निपतितास्मि ते।याचितास्मि हता देव क्षन्तव्याऽहं न हि त्वया।।2.62.12।।
62_12.translation: O lord, by falling on the ground at your feet, bowing my head I beg of you to be pleased. By your act of beseeching me, I have been badly hurt. I do deserve to be pardoned.
62_12.word_by_word: देव O lord, प्रसोद be pleased, भूमौ on the earth, निपतिता अस्मि I have fallen down, शिरसा bowing down my head, याचे I beg of you, ते your (by you), याचिता besought, हता अस्मि I have been hit, अहम्  I, त्वया by you, न क्षन्तव्या हि unfit to be pardoned.

62_13.shloka: नैषा हि सा स्त्री भवति श्लाघनीयेन धीमता।उभयोर्लोकयोर्वीर पत्या या सम्साद्यते।।2.62.13।।
62_13.translation: O heroic one a woman, who is entreated by her sagacious and praiseworthy husband, loses both the worlds.
62_13.word_by_word: वीर O heroic one, या whoever, श्लाघनीयेन by the praiseworthy, धीमता sagacious one, पत्या by the husband, सम्प्रसाद्यते is appeased, सा एषा such this, स्त्री woman, उभयोः both, लोकयोः worlds, न भवति हि does not belong.

62_14.shloka: जानामि धर्मं धर्मज्ञ त्वां जाने सत्यवादिनम्।पुत्रशोकार्तया तत्तु मया किमपि भाषितम्।।2.62.14।।
62_14.translation: O righteous one I know the path of dharma. I also know that you are a truthful. Afflicted with grief on account of my son, I spoke somewhat harshly.
62_14.word_by_word: धर्मज्ञ O righteous one, धर्मम् righteousness, जानामि I know, त्वाम् you, सत्यवादिनम् truthful, जाने know, तु but, पुत्रशोकार्तया by one afflicted with grief over a son, मया by me, तत् that, किमपि somewhat improper, भाषितम् spoken.

62_15.shloka: शोको नाशयते धैर्यं शोको नाशयते श्रुतम्।शोको नाशयते सर्वं नास्ति शोकसमो रिपुः।।2.62.15।।
62_15.translation: Grief destroys fortitude. Grief destroys knowledge of the scriptures, grief destroys  everything. There is no enemy equal to grief.
62_15.word_by_word: शोकः grief, धैर्यम् patience, नाशयते destroys, शोकः grief, श्रुतम् knowledge of the scriptures, नाशयते destroys, शोकः grief, सर्वम् everything, नाशयते destroys, शोकसमः equal to grief, रिपुः enemy, नास्ति not there.

62_16.shloka: शक्य आपतित स्सोढुं प्रहारो रिपुहस्ततः।सोढुंमापतितश्शोकस्सुसूक्ष्मोऽपि न शक्यते।।2.62.16।।
62_16.translation: One can endure an unexpected blow from the enemy's hand but to endure unexpected  grief, however slight it may be, is impossible.
62_16.word_by_word: रिपुहस्तः from the enemy's hand, आपतितः suddenly fallen, प्रहारः blow, सोढुम् to endure, शक्यः possible, शोकः grief, सुसूक्ष्मोऽपि however slight, सोढुम् to endure, न शक्यते not possible.

62_17.shloka: धर्मज्ञा श्श्रुतिमन्तोऽपि छिन्नधर्मार्थसंशयाः।यतयो वीर मुह्यन्ति शोकसम्मूढचेतसः।।2.62.17।।
62_17.translation: O heroic one even learned ascetics who are well versed in ethics and scriptures and who are free from doubts with regard to dharma and artha, are deluded by grief.
62_17.word_by_word: वीर O heroic one, धर्मज्ञाः men wellversed in ethics, श्रुतिमन्तः learned men, छिन्नधर्मार्थसंशयाः  those free from doubts about dharma and artha, यतयः अपि even ascetics,  शोकसम्मूढचेतसः with their senses overwhelmed with grief, मुह्यन्ति are deluded.

62_18.shloka: वनवासाय रामस्य पञ्चरात्रोऽद्य गण्यते।य श्शोकहतहर्षायाः पञ्चवर्षोपमो मम।।2.62.18।।
62_18.translation: This is the fifth night of Rama's exile, but it is like five years to me whose joy has been destroyed by sorrow.
62_18.word_by_word: वनवासाय for exile in the forest, रामस्य Rama's, पञ्चरात्रः five nights, अद्य today, गण्यते has been counted, यः such a period, शोकहतहर्षायाः whose joy has been destroyed by sorrow, मम to me, पञ्चवर्षोपमः equal to five years.

62_19.shloka: तं हि चिन्तयमानाया श्शोकोऽयं हृदि वर्धते।नदीनामिव वेगेन समुद्रसलिलं महत्।।2.62.19।।
62_19.translation: As I think of Rama, my heart swells with sorrow just as the ocean rises with rushing rivers.
62_19.word_by_word: तम् Rama, चिन्तयमानायाः while thinking of, हृदि in my heart, अयम् this, शोकः sadness, नदीनाम् by river waters, वेगेन by speed, महत् great, समुद्रसलिलमिव like seawaters, वर्धते is increasing.

62_20.shloka: एवं हि कथयन्त्यास्तु कौसल्यायाश्शुभं वचः।मन्दरश्मिरभूत्सूर्यो रजनी चाभ्यवर्तत।।2.62.20।।
62_20.translation: While Kausalya was speaking these hearttouching words, the rays of the Sun began to fade and the night fell.
62_20.word_by_word: कौशल्यायाः of Kausalya, एवम् in that manner, शुभम् auspicious, वचः words, कथयन्त्याः speaking, सूर्यः the Sun, मन्दरश्मिः आभूत् faded rays, रजनी च night, अभ्यवर्तत had set in.

62_21.shloka: तथा प्रसादितो वाक्यैर्देव्या कौसल्यया नृपः।शोकेन च समाक्रान्तो निद्राया वशन्तोमेयिवान्।।2.62.21।।
62_21.translation: Thus consoled by Kausalya the king, overcome with grief, came under the spell of sleep.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे द्विषष्टितमस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the sixtysecond sarga in Ayodhyakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
62_21.word_by_word: देव्या by the queen, कौशल्यया by Kausalya, तथा like that, प्रसादितः consoled, नृपः king, शोकेन by sorrow, समाक्रान्तः च was overcome with grief, निद्रायाः sleep, वशम् influence of, एयिवान्  obtained.

63_1.shloka: [Dasaratha recalls the past he had shot an arrow at a hermit boy while he was filling a pot with water, mistaking the sound to be that of an elephant -- Dasaratha realizes the unintentional mistake in killing the boy.]प्रतिबुद्धो मुहूर्तेन शोकोपहतचेतनः।अथ राजा दशरथस्सचिन्तामभ्यपद्यत।।2.63.1।।
63_1.translation: Waking up in a moment tormented with grief, the king began to ponder once again.
63_1.word_by_word: अथ thereafter, सः राजा that king, मूहूर्तेन in a moment, प्रतिबुद्धः was awakened, शोकोपहतचेतनः with his spirit gripped by sorrow, चिन्ताम् worry, अभ्यपद्यत obtained.

63_2.translation: Indralike Dasaratha due to banishment of Rama and Lakshmana, was besieged by a great calamity like the Sun enveloped by demonic dark at the time of eclipse.
63_2.word_by_word: रामलक्ष्मणयोः Rama and Lakshmana, विवासात् due to banishment, वासवोपमम् like Indra, तम् him, असुरम् relating to that asura, तमः darkness, सूर्यमिव like the Sun, उपसर्गः great calamity, आविवेश took possesion of.

63_3.shloka: सभार्ये निर्गते रामे कौसल्यां कोशलेश्वरः।विवक्षुरसितापाङ्गां स्मृत्वा दुष्कृतमात्मनः।।2.63.3।।
63_3.translation: After Rama had left along with his wife the king of Kosala (Dasaratha) recollected his former evil deed and wanted to narrate it to the darkeyed Kausalya.
63_3.word_by_word: सभार्ये with his wife, रामे when Rama, निर्गते सति had departed, कोशलेश्वरः king of Kosala (Dasaratha), आत्मनः his own, दुष्कृतम् evil deed, स्मृत्वा remembering, असितापाङ्गाम् with black eye ball, कौशल्याम् to Kausalya, विवक्षुः wished to speak.

63_4.shloka: स राजा रजनीं षष्ठीं रामे प्रव्राजिते वनम्।अर्धरात्रे दशरथ स्संस्मरन् दुष्कृतं कृतम्।।2.63.4।।
63_4.translation: After the banishment of Rama the king spent the sixth night, recalling the evil deed done by him in the past.
63_4.word_by_word: रामे Rama, वनम् to forest, प्रव्राजिते was banished, राजा king, सः दशरथः Dasaratha, षष्ठीम् sixth, रजनीम् night, अर्धरात्रे in the middle of the night, कृतम् done in the past, दुष्कृतम् evil deeds, संस्मरन् recalled.

63_5.shloka: स राजा पुत्रशोकार्तः स्मृत्वा दुष्कृतमात्मनः।कौसल्यां पुत्रशोकार्तामिदं वचनमब्रवीत्।।2.63.5।।
63_5.translation: King Dasaratha distressed by the separation from his son, pondered over his past misdeed, and said to helpless Kausalya, who was equally grieving over the separation from Rama:
63_5.word_by_word: पुत्रशोकार्तः griefstricken because of (separation from) the son, सः राजा the king, आत्मनः his own, दुष्कृतम् misdeed, स्मृत्वा having remembered, पुत्रशोकार्ताम् grieving helplessly due to the separation from his son, कौशल्याम् to Kausalya, इदम् these, वचनम् words, अब्रवीत् said

63_6.shloka: यदाचरति कल्याणि शुभं वा यदि वाऽशुभम्।तदेव लभते भद्रे कर्ता कर्मजमात्मनः।।2.63.6।।
63_6.translation: O gentle auspicious lady a man has to reap the fruit of his action, good or evil.
63_6.word_by_word: कल्याणि O auspicious lady, भद्रे o gentle lady, कर्ता the agent of an act, शुभं वा good or, यदि वा or if, अशुभम् evil, यत् whichever, आचरति (कुरुते) performs, आत्मनः his, कर्मजम् result of action, तदेव the same only, लभते will attain.

63_7.shloka: गुरुलाघवमर्थानामारम्भे कर्मणां फलम्।दोषं वा यो न जानाति न बाल इति होच्यते।।2.63.7।।
63_7.translation: He who, at the commencement of any action, does not foresee the good or evil consequences of his action in considered a child.
63_7.word_by_word: यः whoever, कर्मणाम् actions, आरम्भे at the beginning, अर्थानाम् the benefits, गुरुलाघवम् relative value, फलम् fruit, दोषं वा or blemish, न जानाति does not know, सः that one, बालः इति as a boy, उच्यते ह is considered.

63_8.shloka: कश्चिदाम्रवणं छित्त्वा पलाशां श्च निषिञ्चति।पुष्पं दृष्ट्वा फले गृध्नु स्स शोचति फलागमे।।2.63.8।।
63_8.translation: If some one cuts down mango trees and plants palasa trees and waters them will repent when he sees only flowers while he expects fruit.
63_8.word_by_word: कश्चित् some one, पुष्पम् flowers, दृष्ट्वा having seen, फले fruit (of that tree), गृध्नुः greed, आम्रवणम् mango trees, छित्वा having cut, पलाशाम् palasa tree, निषिञ्चति waters, सः he, फलागमे when the fruits are borne, शोचति will repent.

63_9.shloka: अविज्ञाय फलं यो हि कर्म त्वेवानुधावति।स शोचेत्फलवेलायां यथा किंशुकसेचकः।।2.63.9।।
63_9.translation: Without foreseeing the fruits of his action, he who runs after action only will regret at the time of fruition like the one who waters the palasa tree.
63_9.word_by_word: यः whoever, फलम् fruit, आविज्ञाय not knowing, कर्म तु एव action only, अनुधावति runs after, सः he, किंशुकसेचकः इव like the one who waters kimsuka tree (palasa), फलवेलायाम् at the time of reaping the fruits of action, शोचेत् will regret.

63_10.shloka: सोऽहमाम्रवणं छित्वा पलाशांश्च न्यषेचयम्।रामं फलागमे त्यक्त्वा पश्चाच्छोचामि दुर्मतिः।।2.63.10।।
63_10.translation: So I have cut the mango trees and watered palasa trees. In utter foolishness, I have banished Rama at the time of fruition and  regretting later.
63_10.word_by_word: सः अहम् such me, आम्रवणम् mango trees, छित्वा cutting, पलाशान् च palasa trees, न्यषेचयम् have watered, दुर्मतिः unwise, फलागमे at the time of bearing fruit, रामम् Rama, त्यक्त्वा leaving, पश्चात् repenting, शोचामि I am grieving.

63_11.shloka: लब्धशब्देन कौसल्ये कुमारेण धनुष्मता।कुमारश्शब्दवेधीति मया पापमिदं कृतम्।।2.63.11।।
63_11.translation: O Kausalya in my youth I was a great archer who could hit the target by its sound. As such I committed this sin.
63_11.word_by_word: कौशल्ये O Kausalya, शब्दवेधी one who can shoot arrows aiming at the target by sound, कुमारः इति in chidhood itself, लब्धशब्देन attaining knowledge of sound, कुमारेण in my youth, धनुष्मता as an archer, मया by me, इदम् this, पापम् sin, कृतम् was done.

63_12.shloka: तदिदं मेऽनुसंम्प्राप्तं देवि दुःखं स्वयं कृतम्।सम्मोहादिह बालेन यथा स्याद्भक्षितं विषम्।।2.63.12।।
63_12.translation: Just as a boy consumes poison out of delusion, O Devi, this sorrow has befallen me as a result of my own action.
63_12.word_by_word: देवि Kausalya, इह in this world, सम्मोहात् out of delusion, बालेन like a boy, भक्षितम् eats, विषम् poison, यथा as, स्यात् may be, स्वयम् one's own self, कृतम् has been done, तत् इदम्  that this, दुःखम् calamity, मे to me, अनुसंप्राप्तम् has befallen.

63_13.shloka: यथान्यः पुरुषः कश्चित्पलाशैर्मोहितो भवेत्।एवं ममाऽप्यविज्ञातं शब्दवेध्यमयं फलम्।।2.63.13।।
63_13.translation: Like some one who is deluded by palasa trees I too did not realise the consequences of shooting the target following the direction of the sound.
63_13.word_by_word: अन्यः other, कश्चित् some one, पुरुषः man, पलाशैः by palasa trees, यथा as, मोहितः deluded, भवेत् becomes, एवम् like that, ममापि to me, शब्दवेध्यमयम् the act of shooting the target on hearing the sound, फलम् the consequences, अविज्ञातम् was not premeditated.

63_14.shloka: देव्यनूढा त्वमभवो युवराजो भवाम्यहम्।ततः प्रावृडनुप्राप्ता मदकामविवर्धिनी।।2.63.14।।
63_14.translation: O Kausalya, you were not married then. I was prince regent. The rainy season that inflames passion and pride had just set in.
63_14.word_by_word: देवि O Kausalya, त्वम् you, अनूढा not married, अभवः you were, युवराज: भवामि I was prince regent, ततः at that time, मदकामविवर्धिनी inflaming passion and pride, प्रावृट् rainy season, अनुप्राप्ता had set in.

63_15.shloka: उपास्य च रसान्भौमां स्तप्त्वा च जगदंशुभिः।परेताचरितां भीमां रविराविशते दिशम्।।2.63.15।।
63_15.translation: Having sucked the waters of the earth and scorching the world with its rays, the Sun had entered the frightful southern quarter ranged by departed souls.
63_15.word_by_word: रविः Sun, भौमान् relating to the earth, रसान् juices, उपास्य sucking, जगत् world, अंशुभिः by the rays, तप्त्वा च scorching, परेता चरिताम् ranged by departed souls, भीमाम् fearful, दिशम् quarter, आविशते enter sattained.

63_16.shloka: उष्णमन्तर्दधे सद्य स्स्निग्धा ददृशिरे घनाः।ततो जहृषिरे सर्वे भेकसारङ्गबर्हिणः।।2.63.16।।
63_16.translation: At that time the heat subsided, glistening clouds appeared. The frogs, geese and peacocks began to rejoice.
63_16.word_by_word: सद्यः instantaneously, उष्णम् heat, अन्तर्दधे vanished, स्निग्धा: glistening, घनाः clouds, ददृशिरे were seen, ततः thereafter, सर्वे all, भेकसारङ्गबर्हिणः frogs, geese and peacocks, जहृषिरे rejoiced.

63_17.translation: The birds with their plummage moistened  as if they had dipped in water reached with great difficulty the tops of the trees which were shaken by the wind and rain.
63_17.word_by_word: क्लिन्न पक्षोत्तराः with the plummage moistened, पतत्रिणः birds, स्नाताः bathed, वृष्टिवातावधूताग्रान्the tops shaken by wind and rain, पादपान् trees, कृच्छ्रात् इव as if with great difficulty, अभिपेदिरे reached.

63_18.translation: Engulfed by torrents of rain that continued to fall ceaselessly, the mountain visited by intoxicated antelopes looked like a mass of water.
63_18.word_by_word: पतितेन dropped, असकृत् ceaselessly, पतमानेन dropping, अम्भसा with rain water, छन्नः covered, मत्तसारङ्गः intoxicated antelopes, अचलः mountain, तोयराशिरिव like a mass of water, अबभौ looked like.

63_19.translation: Although pure, the rapidly flowing water from the mountains mixed with the minerals in the soil turned white and red in colour and flowed like a serpent.
63_19.word_by_word: विमलान्यपि as though the waters were pure, स्रोतांसि the rapid flow, गिरिधातुभ्यः of mineralores, सभस्मानि mixed with ashes, पाण्डुरारुणवर्णानि white and red in colour, भुजङ्गवत् like a serpent, सुस्रुवुः flowed.

63_20.translation: The streams that were pure, mixed with red soil flowed red, deviating from their natural course.
63_20.word_by_word: जलदागमे at the advent of the rainy season, स्रोतांसि streams, विमलान्यपि although pure, आकुलारुण तोयानि mixed up with marshy red soil, उन्मार्गजलवाहिनी by flowing in different directions, बभूवुः became.

63_21.translation: In that highly delightful season, wishing to go hunting I, armed with bow and arrows, rode my chariot towards  river Sarayu.
63_21.word_by_word: अतिसुखे highly delightful, तस्मिन् काले in that season, व्यायामकृतसङ्कल्पः determined to go hunting, धनुष्मान् holding bow, इषुमान् holding arrows, रथी a charioteer, सरयूनदीम् river Sarayu, अन्वगाम् went.

63_22.shloka: निपाने महिषं रात्रौ गजं वाऽभ्यागतं नदीम्।अन्यं वा श्वापदं कञ्चिज्जिघांसु रजितेन्द्रियः।तस्मिं स्तत्राहमेकान्ते रात्रौ विवृतकार्मुकः।।2.63.22।।
63_22.translation: And there, with no control over my senses, I hid  in a lonely place with my bow in readiness intending to shoot a buffalo or an elephant or any other wild animal that might come to the spot for drinking water in the night.
63_22.word_by_word: अहम् I, अजितेन्द्रियः without any control over my senses, तस्मिन् there, निपाने in a spot fordrinking water, नदीम् river, रात्रौ in the night, अभ्यागतम् having arrived, महिषम् buffalo, गजं वा or elephant, अन्यम् any other, श्वापदं वा any wild animal, जिघांसुः desirous of killing, तत्र there, रात्रौ in the night, एकान्ते in a lonely place, विवृतकार्मुकः with bow strung.

63_23.shloka: तत्राहं संवृतं वन्यं हतवांस्तीरमागतम्।अन्यं चापि मृगं हिंस्रं शब्दं श्रुत्वाऽभ्युपागतम्।।2.63.23।।
63_23.translation: Hiding and waiting there, following the sounds of animals I killed two animals that had reached the bank of the river.
63_23.word_by_word: तत्र there, अहम् I, तीरम् आगतम् reached the bank of the river, वन्यम् forest, अभ्युपागतम्arrived, अन्यम् some other, ह्रिंस्रम् cruel, मृगं च also animal, शब्दम् sound, श्रुत्वा having heard, संव़ृतम् secretly, हतवान् killed.

63_24.shloka: अथान्धकारे त्वश्रौषं जले कुम्भस्य पूर्यतः।अचक्षुर्विषये घोषं वारणस्येव नर्दतः।।2.63.24।।
63_24.translation: Then at a place that was out of the range of my sight in darkness I heard the sound of a pitcher being filled with water which resembled the sound of an elephant.
63_24.word_by_word: अथ thereafter, अन्धकारे in the darkness, अचक्षुर्विषये not within the range of sight, नर्दतः making sounds, वारणस्येव like the sound of an elephant, जले in water, पूर्यतः being filled, कुम्भस्य a pitcher, घोषम् sound, अश्रौषम् heard.

63_25.shloka: ततोऽहं शरमुधृत्य दीप्तमाशीविषोपमम्।शब्दं प्रति गजप्रेप्सुरभिलक्ष्य त्वपातयम्।।2.63.25।।
63_25.translation: Wishing to kill the elephant, I seized my arrow glowing like a venomous snake and aimed it towards the sound.
63_25.word_by_word: ततः then, अहम् I, गजप्रेप्सुः wishing to get the elephant, दीप्तम् bright, आशीविषोपमम् like avenomous serpent, शरम् shaft, उधृत्य शब्दं प्रति in the direction of the sound, अभिलक्ष्य aiming at, अपातयम् released.

63_26.shloka: अमुञ्चं निशितं बाणमहमाशीविषोपमम्।तत्र वागुषसि व्यक्ता प्रादुरासीद्वनौकसः।।2.63.26।।हाहेति पततस्तोये बाणाभिहतमर्मणः।।2.63.27।।
63_26.translation: Then I discharged a sharp shaft like a venomous serpent. In the morning twilight I saw that the shaft had hit the vital part of the body of a forest dweller and his cry of 'Alas', was clearly heard as he fell in the water.
63_26.word_by_word: अहम् I, आशीविषोपमम् like a venomous serpent, निशितम् sharp, बाणम् shaft, अमुञ्चम्dischrged, तत्र there, उषसि in the morning twilight, बाणाभिहतमर्मणः with the vital organ hit by the shaft, तोये in water, पततः falling, वनौकसः forestdweller, हा हा इति saying 'Alas', व्यक्ता screaming aloud, वाक् words, प्रादुरासीत् arose.

63_27.shloka: तस्मिन्निपतिते बाणे वागभूत्तत्र मानुषी।कथमस्मद्विधे शस्त्रं निपतेत्तु तपस्विनि।।2.63.28।।
63_27.translation: When the arrow hit him, a man's voice was heard saying, 'How can an arrow be discharged at a person like me who is an ascetic?'
63_27.word_by_word: तस्मिन् when that, बाणे arrow, निपतिते fell, तत्र there, मानुषी man's, वाक् voice, अभूत् came, अस्मद्विधे with people like me, तपस्विनि at a sage, शस्त्रम् arrow, कथम् how, निपतेत्तु can be discharged?

63_28.shloka: प्रविविक्तां नदीं रात्रावुदाहाऽरोहमागतः।इषुणाऽभिहतः केन कस्य वा किं कृतं मया।।2.63.29।।
63_28.translation: 'I have come to this lonely spot of the river to take water. Who has hit me with this arrow? What (harm) have I done to any one?'
63_28.word_by_word: अहम् I, उदाहारः in order to take water, रात्रौ at night, प्रविविक्ताम् lonely, नदीम् river, आगतः have come, इषुणा by an arrow, केन by whom, अभिहतः hit, मया by me, कस्य to any, किम् what offence, कृतम् done.

63_29.shloka: ऋषेर्हिन्यस्तदण्डस्य वने वन्येन जीवतः।कथं नु शस्रेण वधो मद्विधस्य विधीयते।।2.63.30।।
63_29.translation: 'Renouncing violence I live the life of an ascetic on forest produce. Why should any one kill me with a weapon?
63_29.word_by_word: न्यस्तदण्डस्य renouncing violence, वने in  the forest, वन्येन forest produce जीवतःsubsisting,मद्विधस्य men like me, ऋषेः for an ascetic, शस्त्रेण with weapon, वधः killing, कथं नु in what way?, विधीयते is perpetrated.

63_30.shloka: जटाभारधरस्यैव वल्कलाजिनवाससः।को वधेन ममर्थी स्यात्किंवाऽस्यापकृतं मया।।2.63.31।।
63_30.translation: 'Who wants to kill me who lives like an ascetic with matted hair and wearing bark or the skin of an antelope? What harm have I done to him?
63_30.word_by_word: जटाभारधरस्यैव with matted hair, वल्कलाजिनवाससः wearing bark and skin of an antelope, मम my, वधेन by killing, अर्थी interested, कः who?, स्यात् मया could be?, अस्य to him, किं वा what, अपकृतम् harm?

63_31.shloka: एवं निष्फलमारब्धं केवलानर्थसंहितम्।न कश्चित्साधु मन्येत यथैव गुरुतल्पगम्।।2.63.32।।
63_31.translation: 'Whoever it is, he has committed only a mischievous and senseless act. This sin like a disciple sleeping on the bed of his preceptor none will approve of.
63_31.word_by_word: एवम् in this way, केवलानर्थसंहितम् only for mischief, निष्फलम् fruitless, आरब्धम् effort, कश्चित्some one, गुरुतल्पगं यथैव like one who occupies the teacher's bed, साधु मन्येत will consider this proper.

63_32.shloka: नाहं तथाऽनु शोचामि जीवितक्षयमात्मनः।मातरं पितरं चोभावनुशोचामि मद्वधे।।2.63.33।।
63_32.translation: 'I do not regret so much about the loss of my own life as  about my mother and father after I am dead.
63_32.word_by_word: अहम् I, आत्मनः my own, जीवितक्षयम् loss of life, तथा not so much, नानुशोचामि do not regret, मद्वधे after my killing, मातरम् mother, पितरं च and father, उभौ both, अनुशोचामि I am grieving.

63_33.shloka: तदेतन्मिथुनं वृद्धं चिरकालभृतं मया।मयि पञ्चत्वमापन्ने कां वृत्तिं वर्तयिष्यति।।2.63.34।।
63_33.translation: 'So long I have been supporting this aged couple. After I am dead, how will they live?
63_33.word_by_word: मयि when I, पञ्चत्वम् with five elements, आपन्ने reduced to, मया by me, चिरकालभृतम् supported for a long time, वृद्धम् in old age, एतत् this, मिथुनम् couple, काम् what, वृत्तिम् life, वर्तयिष्यति will live in future.

63_34.shloka: वृद्धै च मतापितरावहं चैकेषुणा हता।केन स्मनिहता स्सर्वे सुबालेनाकृतात्मना।।2.63.35।।
63_34.translation: 'My aged parents along with me are killed by a single arrow. Who is that maliciousknave  who has slain us?
63_34.word_by_word: वृद्धौ aged, मातापितरौ my parents, अहं च me also, एकेषुणा with one single arrow, हताः killed, अकृतात्मना one with malicious intention, सुबालेन by a good boy, केन by whom, सर्वे निहताः स्म all of us are killed.

63_35.shloka: तां गिरं करुणां श्रुत्वा मम धर्मानुकाङ्क्षिणः।कराभ्यां सशरं चापं व्यथितस्यापतद्भुवि।।2.63.36।।
63_35.translation: On hearing the piteous voice the bow and arrow dropped from my (trembling) hands since I was keen on following the righteous path.
63_35.word_by_word: करुणाम् piteous, तां गिरम् words, श्रुत्वा on hearing, धर्मानुकाङ्क्षिणं keen on following the righteous path (fearing that an unrighteous act has been performed), व्यथितस्य worrying, मम my, कराभ्याम् from my hands, सशरम् along with the arrow, चापम् bow भुवि on the land, अपतत् fell down.

63_36.shloka: तस्याहं करुणं श्रुत्वा निशि लालवतो बहु।सम्भ्रान्त श्शोकवेगेन भृशमासं विचेतनः।।2.63.37।।
63_36.translation: Having heard his pathetic lamentations at night, I was extremely frightened by the force of grief and stood bewildered.
63_36.word_by_word: अहम् I, निशि at night, बहु highly, लालवतः lamenting, तस्य his, करुणम् pathetic words, श्रुत्वा having heard, शोकवेगेन through excess of grief, सम्भ्रान्तः frightened, भृशम् extremely, विचेतनः unable to think, आसम् I remained.

63_37.shloka: तं देशमहमागम्य दीनसत्त्वस्सुदुर्मनाः।अपश्यमिषुणा तीरे सरय्वास्तापसं हतम्।।2.63.38।।अवकीर्ण जटाभारं प्रविद्धकलशोदकम्।पांसुशोणितदिग्धाङ्गं शयानं शल्यपीडितम्।।2.63.39।।
63_37.translation: With dissipated energy and intensely troubled mind, I reached the bank of river Sarayu and there I saw the ascetic lying struck by the arrow and with scattered locks of hair. The water pitcher was thrown away and his body smeared with blood and dust as he lay on the ground.
63_37.word_by_word: अहम् I, दीनसत्त्वः in a dissipated state, सुदुर्मनाः with troubled mind, तं देशम् that place, आगम्य having reached, सरय्वाः Sarayu, तीरे on the bank, इषुणा by the arrow, हतम् struck,अवकीर्णजटाभारम् with scattered locks of hair, प्रविद्धकलशोदकम् with water pitcher thrown away, पांसुशोणितदिग्धाङ्गम् body smeared with blood and dust, शयानम् lying, शल्यपीडितम् pierced by the arrow, तापसम् the sage, अपश्यम् I saw.

63_38.shloka: स मामुद्वीक्ष्य नेत्राभ्यां त्रस्तमस्वस्थचेतसम्।इत्युवाच ततः क्रूरं दिधक्षन्निव तेजसा।।2.63.40।।
63_38.translation: I was mentally stricken and frightened. He looked up as if buring me with the energy of his eyes. Then he uttered the words 'A cruel act'
63_38.word_by_word: सः he, त्रस्तम् frightened, अस्वस्थचेतसम् shaken up mentally, माम् me, तेजसा with his energy, दिधक्षन्निव as if burning, नेत्राभ्याम् with both eyes, उवदीक्ष्य looked up, ततः then, क्रूरम् cruel, इति thus, उवाच said.

63_39.shloka: किं तवापकृतं राजन्वने निवसता मया।जिहीर्षुरम्भो गुर्वुर्थं यदहं ताडितस्त्वया।।2.63.41।।
63_39.translation: 'O king you have struck me when I was trying to carry water to my parents. I am a forestdweller. What harm have I done to you?
63_39.word_by_word: राजन् O king, गुर्वर्थम् for the sake of my parents, अम्भ: water, जिहीर्षुः wishing to take, अहम् I, त्वया you, ताडितः have been struck, वने in the forest, निवसता residing, मया by me, तव your, किम् what, अपकृतम् harm.

63_40.shloka: एकेन खलु बाणेन मर्मण्यभिहते मयि।द्वावन्धौ निहतौ वृद्धौ माता जनयिता च मे।।2.63.42।।
63_40.translation: 'By striking at the vital part of my body with one arrow, you have killed both my aged and blind mother and father too.
63_40.word_by_word: एकेन by one, बाणेन arrow, मयि at me, मर्मणि vital part, अभिहते when struck, मे my, माता mother, जनयिता च father, अन्धौ blind, द्वौ both, वृद्धौ old ones, निहतौ खलु are killed indeed.

63_41.shloka: तौ कथं दुर्बलावन्धौ मत्प्रतीक्षौ पिपासितौ।चिरमाशाकृतां तृष्णां कष्टां सन्धारयिष्यतः।।2.63.43।।
63_41.translation: 'How will the two who are frail, thirsty and blind wait for me for long controlling their thirst with great difficulty with the expectation (that I would fetch them water)?
63_41.word_by_word: दुर्बलौ weak ones, अन्धौ blind, पिपासितौ thirsty, तौ both of them, कष्टाम् difficult, आशाकृताम् due to expectation, तृष्णाम् thirst, चिरम् for a long time, कथम् how, सन्धारयिष्यतः will control.

63_42.shloka: न नूनं तपसो वास्ति फलयोगश्श्रुतस्य वा।पिता यन्मां न जानाति शयानं पतितं भुवि।।2.63.44।।
63_42.translation: 'My father does not know that I am lying on the ground. It is true that there is no reward either for asceticism or for scriptural knowledge.
63_42.word_by_word: नूनम् surely, तपसो वा either for asceticism, श्रुतस्य वा or for scriptural knowledge, फलयोगः attainment of fruit, नास्ति not there, यत् since, पिता my father, भुवि on this earth, पतितम् fallen, शयानम् lying, माम् me, न जानाति not know.

63_43.shloka: जानन्नपि च किं कुर्यादशक्तिरपरिक्रमः।भिद्यमानमिवाशक्त स्त्रतुमन्यो नगो नगम्।।2.63.45।।
63_43.translation: 'What can my weak father who has no strength to walk do, even if he knows about it? Like a tree which cannot protect another which is being severed, he is helpless.
63_43.word_by_word: अशक्ति: without energy, अपरिक्रमः who cannot walk, भिद्यमानम् being severed, नगम् tree, त्रातुम् to protect, अशक्तः is incapable, अन्यः other, नगः tree, इव like, जानन्नपि knowing also, किम् what, कुर्यात् can it do?

63_44.shloka: पितुस्त्वमेव मे गत्वा शीघ्रमाचक्ष्य राघव।न त्वामनुदहेत्क्रुद्धो वनं वह्निरिवैधितः।।2.63.46।।
63_44.translation: O scion of the Raghus (Dasaratha) Go at once and inform my father, lest in anger heshould burn you like ignited fire consuming the forest.
63_44.word_by_word: राघव O scion of the Raghus (Dasaratha), त्वमेव you yourself, शीघ्रम् quickly, गत्वा having gone, मे पितुः to my father, आचक्ष्व inform, क्रुद्ध in wrath, एधितः ignited, वह्निः fire, वनमिव like a forest, त्वाम् you, नानुदहेत् will not be burnt.

63_45.shloka: इयमेकपदी राजन्यतो मे पितुराश्रमः।तं प्रसादय गत्वा त्वं न त्वां स कुपितश्शपेत्।।2.63.47।।
63_45.translation: 'O king, this footpath leads to my father's hermitage. Go and beg his forgiveness so that he may not curse you out of anger.
63_45.word_by_word: राजन् O king, यतः from whichever side, मे पितुः my father's, आश्रमः hermitage, इयम् this, एकपदी footpath, त्वम् you, गत्वा having  gone, तम् him, प्रसादय beg his forgiveness, सः he, कुपितः in wrath, त्वाम् you, न शपेत् may not curse.

63_46.shloka: विशल्यं कुरु मां राजन्मर्म मे निशितश्शरः।रुणद्धि मृदुसोत्सेधं तीरमम्बुरयो यथा।।2.63.48।।
