63_46.translation: 'Gently remove the arrow from my body, O king the sharp arrow is piercing deep intomy vital just like the current of the river hits its elevated bank'.
63_46.word_by_word: राजन् O king, माम् me, विशल्यम् with weapon taken out, कुरु make, निशितः sharp, शरः arrow, मे मर्म my vital part of the body, मृदु gently, सोत्सेधम् elevated, तीरम् bank, अम्बुरयः like the flow of water, यथा in the same manner, रुणद्धि is preventing.

63_47.shloka: सशल्यः क्लिश्यते प्राणैर्विशल्यो विनशिष्यति।इति मामविशच्चिन्ता तस्य शल्यापकर्षणे।।2.63.49।।
63_47.translation: The thought of removing the arrow kept me pondering. If not removed, it will be painful, and if removed, he will die.
63_47.word_by_word: सशल्यः one with a weapon piercing the body, प्राणैः life, क्लिश्यते is pained, विशल्यः if the arrow is removed, विनशिष्यति he will die, इति चिन्ता with this thought, तस्य his, शपकर्षणे in removing the arrow, माम् me, अविशत् has entered.

63_48.shloka: दुःखितस्य च दीनस्य मम शोकातुरस्य च।लक्षयामास हृदये चिन्तां मुनिसुतस्तदा।।2.63.50।।
63_48.translation: The son of the ascetic noticed my anguish and seeing me thus distressed, wretched and afflicted with sorrow, said:
63_48.word_by_word: तदा then, मुनिसुतः son of the ascetic, दुःखितस्य of a distressed man, दीनस्य wretched, शोकातुरस्य च full of grief, मम my, हृदये in the heart, चिन्ताम् anguish, लक्षयामास perceived.

63_49.shloka: ताम्यमानस्स मां कृच्छ्रादुवाच परमार्तवत्।सीदमानो विवृत्ताङ्गो वेष्टमानो गतः क्षयम्।।2.63.51।।
63_49.translation: Suffering from excruciating pain, sinking with his limbs twisting and writhing and plunging into death and destruction, with intense agony he uttered the following words with great difficulty:
63_49.word_by_word: ताम्यमानः tormented, सीदमानः plunging into death, विवृत्ताङ्गः with twisted limbs, वेष्टमानः writhing, क्षयम् destruction, गतः having reached, सः he, परमार्तवत् intensely grieved, कृच्छ्रात् with difficulty, माम् me, उवाच said.

63_50.shloka: संस्तभ्य शोकं धैर्येण स्थिरचित्तो भवाम्यहम्।ब्रह्महत्याकृतं पापं हृदयादपनीयताम्।।2.63.52।।
63_50.translation: 'I am now calm. I bear my pain with patience. Remove the fear from your mind that you have committed a sin by slaying a brahmin.
63_50.word_by_word: अहम् I, धैर्येण patiently, शोकम् sorrow, संस्तभ्य restraining, स्थिरचित्तः with a firm mind, भवामि I am, ब्रह्महत्याकृतम् killed a brahmin, पापम् sin, हृदयात् from your mind, अपनीयताम् may be removed.

63_51.shloka: न द्विजातिरहं राजन्मा भूत्ते मनसो व्यथा।शूद्रायामस्मि वैश्येन जातो जनपदाधिप।।2.63.53।।
63_51.translation: 'O king Dasaratha, lord of the land, I am not a brahmin. Feel no sense of guilt in your mind. I was born of a sudra mother and a vaisya father.
63_51.word_by_word: जनपदाधिप O Lord of the land (Dasaratha), राजन् king, न not, अहम् I am, द्विजातिः a brahmin, न not, ते your, मनसः to mind, व्यथा fear, माभूत् may not happen, वैश्येन by a vaisya, शूद्रायाम् to a sudra woman, जातः born, अस्मि I am.

63_52.shloka: इतीव वदतः कृच्छ्राद्बाणाभिहतमर्मणः विघूर्णतो विचेष्टस्य वेपमानस्य भूतले।तस्यत्वानम्यमानस्य तं बाणमहमुद्धरम् स मामुद्वीक्ष्य सन्त्रस्तो जहौ प्राणांस्तपोधनः।।2.63.54।।
63_52.translation: While that ascetic struck by the arrow in the vital part of the body, trembling, turningand rolling on the ground writhing in pain spoke these words to me, I bent down and pulled out the arrow from his body. I was frightened when he looked up at me and gave up his life.
63_52.word_by_word: इतीव in this way, कृच्छ्रात् with great difficulty, वदतः speaking, बाणाभिहतमर्मणः one hit in the vital part of the body by an arrow, विघूर्णतः turning and twisting the body, विचेष्टस्य  writhing in pain, भूतले on the ground, वेपमानस्य trembling, आनम्यमानस्य bent, तस्यत from there, बाणम् that arrow, अहम् I, उद्धरम् pulled out, सः तपोधनः that sage whose asceticism is his wealth, माम् me, उदीक्ष्य having looked up, सन्त्रस्तः frightened, प्राणान् life, जहौ gave up.

63_53.shloka: जलार्द्रगात्रन्तु विलप्य कृच्छ्रान्मर्मव्रणं सन्ततमुच्छवसन्तम्।तत स्सरय्वां तमहं शयानं समीक्ष्य भद्रेऽस्मि भृशं विषण्णः।।2.63.55।।
63_53.translation: O gentle Kausalya having seen him crying due to the pain caused by the wound in the vital part, sighing ceaselessly, drenched in water and lying on the bank of river Sarayu, I was greatly shaken.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे त्रिषष्टितम स्सर्गः।।Thus ends the sixtythird sarga in Ayodhyakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
63_53.word_by_word: भद्रे O gentle one, (कौशल्या Kausalya), जलार्द्रगात्रम् body drenched in water, कृच्छ्रात् due to pain, विलप्य lamenting, सन्ततम् ceaselessly, उच्छवसन्तम् sighing, मर्मव्रणम् wound in the vital part, सरय्वाम् on the bank of river Sarayu, शयानम् lying, तम् him, समीक्ष्य having seen, अहम् I, ततः then, भृशम् greatly, विषण्णः dejected, अस्मि I was.

64_1.shloka: [Dasaratha relates to Kausalya  the event of the noble ascetic's curse on him -- death of Dasaratha]वधमप्रतिरूपं तु महर्षेस्तस्य राघवः।विलपन्नेव धर्मात्मा कौसल्यां पुनरब्रवीत्।।2.64.1।।
64_1.translation: Grieving for having unfairly killed the great sage the rightenous descendant of the Raghus (Dasaratha) coutinued to tell Kausalya about it:
64_1.word_by_word: धर्मात्मा the righteous one, राघवः descendant of the Raghu's (Dasaratha), तस्य महर्षेः that maharsi's, अप्रतिरूपम् unique, वधम् killing, विलपन्नेव while lamenting, पुनः again, कौशल्याम् to Kausalya, अब्रवीत् said.

64_2.shloka: तदज्ञानान्महत्पापं कृत्वाहं सङ्कुलेन्द्रियः।एकस्त्वचिन्तयं बुध्या कथं नु सुकृतं भवेत्।।2.64.2।।
64_2.translation: Having committed the sin unwittingly, I was greatly agitated. I reflected in my mind asto how to atone for this great sin.
64_2.word_by_word: अहम् I, अज्ञानात् in ignorance, तत् that, महत् great, पापम् sin, कृत्वा having done, सङ्कुलेन्द्रियः with agitated senses, एकस्तु myself alone, कथं नु how, सुकृतम् well done, भवेत् shall be, बुध्या in my mind, अचिन्तयम् reflected.

64_3.shloka: ततस्तं घटमादाय पूर्णं परमवारिणा।आश्रमं तमहं प्राप्य यथाऽख्यातपथं गतः।।2.64.3।।
64_3.translation: Holding the pot filled with clean water I reached the hermitage following the path as directed.
64_3.word_by_word: ततः then, परमवारिणा with clean water, पूर्णम् filled, तम् that, घटम् pot आदाय taking hold of, यथाऽख्यातपथम् the path as directed, प्राप्य having reached, अहम् I, अश्रमम् hermitage, गतः entered.

64_4.shloka: तत्राहं दुर्बलावन्धौ वृद्धावपरिणायकौ।अपश्यं तस्य पितरौ लूनपक्षाविव द्विजौ।।2.64.4।।तन्निमित्ताभिरासीनौ कथाभिरपरिश्रमौ।तामाशां मत्कृते हीनावुदासीनावनाथवत्।।2.64.5।।
64_4.translation: There I found his weak, blind, old parents. With no supporter, they looked like birds with clipped wings. They sat there helplessly like orphans and passively talking about their son, their only hope that I have deprived them of.
64_4.word_by_word: तत्र there, अहम् I, दुर्बलौ frail, अन्धौ blind, वृद्धौ old, अपरिणायकौ without any supporter, लूनपक्षौ with wings severed, द्विजौ इव like birds, तन्निमित्ताभिः on account of their son, कथाभिः with stories, आसीनौ seated, अपरिश्रमौ without any work, मत्कृते  done by me, ताम् आशाम् their hope, हीनौ deprived of, अनाथवत् like orphans, उदासीनौ passive, तस्य his, पितरौ parents, अपश्यम् I saw.

64_5.translation: Smitten with grief and my heart throbbing with fear I reached the hermitage and my sorrow became manifold.
64_5.word_by_word: शोकोपहत चित्तः च with mind smitten with grief, भयसन्त्रस्तचेतनः mind charged with apprehension, अहम् I, तत् that, आश्रमपदम् hermitage, गत्वा having reached, भूयः once again, शोकम् sorrow, गतः obtained.

64_6.shloka: पदशब्दं तु मे श्रुत्वा मुनिर्वाक्यमभाषत।किं चिरायसि मे पुत्र पानीयं क्षिप्रमानय।।2.64.7।।
64_6.translation: Hearing the sound of my footsteps, the sage said 'O son why have you delayed? Bring me some water quickly'.
64_6.word_by_word: मे my, पदशब्दम् sound of footsteps, श्रुत्वा having heard, मुनिः sage, वाक्यम् words, अभाषत spoke this, पुत्र son, किम् why, चिरायसि are you delaying, क्षिप्रम् quickly, मे to me, पानीयम् water, आनय bring.

64_7.shloka: यन्निमित्तमिदं तात सलिले क्रीडितं त्वया।उत्कण्ठिता ते मातेयं प्रविश क्षिप्रमाश्रमम्।।2.64.8।।
64_7.translation: 'O Dear child, whatever be the reason, you have been sporting in the water so long, come at once to the hermitage. Your mother is anxious.
64_7.word_by_word: तात O Dear child, त्वया by you, यन्निमित्तम् for whatever reason, सलिले in the water, इदम् this, क्रीडितम् sported, इयम् this, ते माता your mother, उत्कण्ठिता with anxicty, क्षिप्रम् quickly, आश्रमम् hermitage, प्रविश enter.

64_8.shloka: यद्व्यलीकं कृतं पुत्र मात्रा ते यदि वा मया।न तन्मनसि कर्तव्यं त्वया तात तपस्विना।।2.64.9।।
64_8.translation: 'O Child, O Son if your mother or I have done anything disagreeable, do not take it to heart, for you are an ascetic.
64_8.word_by_word: पुत्र son, ते your, मात्रा mother, यदिवा or, मया by myself, यत् any, व्यलीकम् displeasing act, कृतम् has been done, तात O Child, तपस्विना by being ascetic, त्वया by you, तत् that one,मनसि in the mind, न कर्तव्यम् should not be taken seriously.

64_9.shloka: त्वं गतिस्त्वगतीनां चक्षुस्त्वं हीनचक्षुषाम्।समासक्तास्त्वयि प्राणाः किं त्वं नो नाभिभाषसे।।2.64.10।।
64_9.translation: 'You are a support to the supportless, eyes to the blind, you are our very vital life. Why don't you speak to us'?
64_9.word_by_word: अगतीनाम् for us with no support, त्वम् you, गतिः are support, अचक्षुषाम् for us who have no eyes, त्वम् you, चक्षुः हि are our eyes, प्राणाः our vital life, त्वयि in you, समासक्ताः are attached, त्वम् you, नः to us, किम् why, नाभिभाषसे are not talking?

64_10.shloka: मुनिमव्यक्तया वाचा तमहं सज्जमानया।हीनव्यञ्जनया प्रेक्ष्य भीतचित्त इवाब्रुवम्।।2.64.11।।
64_10.translation: As I saw him, my heart was filled with terror and I stammered as I spoke in garbled sentences.
64_10.word_by_word: अहम् I, तं मुनिम् that sage, प्रेक्ष्य having seen, भीतचित्त इव with a frightened mind, अव्यक्तया indistinctly, सज्जमानया stammering, हीनव्यञ्जनया with slurring syllables, वाचा with words, अब्रुवम् I uttered.

64_11.shloka: मनसः कर्म चेष्टाभिरभिसंस्तभ्य वाग्बलम्।आचचक्षे त्वहं तस्मै पुत्रव्यसनजं भयम्।।2.64.12।।
64_11.translation: After a lot of effort, with great fear controlling my thoughts and the power of speech, I related to him the calamity that had befallen his son.
64_11.word_by_word: अहम् I, चेष्टाभिः with efforts, मनसः mind's, कर्म thoughts, वाग्बलम् power of speech, अभिसंस्तभ्य  holding up firmly, तस्मै him, पुत्रव्यसनजम् the calamity arising due to the death of his son, भयम् fear, आचचक्षे related to him.

64_12.shloka: क्षत्रियोऽहं दशरथो नाहं पुत्रो महात्मनः।सज्जनावमतं दुःखमिदं प्राप्तं स्वकर्मजम्।।2.64.13।।
64_12.translation: O magnanimous sage I am a kshatriya known as Dasaratha. I am not your son. A pathetic incident has been caused by my own action, condemnable by the virtuous.
64_12.word_by_word: अहम् I, दशरथः Dasaratha, क्षत्रियः kshatriya, अहम् I, महात्मनः of the great, पुत्रः son, न not, सज्जनावमतम् condemnable by the virtuous, इदम् this, स्वकर्मजम् caused out of my ownaction, दुःखम् sorrowful, प्राप्तम् has befallen.

64_13.translation: Wishing to hunt a wild elephant coming down to the water hole for drinking, I went  to the bank of Sarayu, bow in hand, O revered sage
64_13.word_by_word: भगवन् O revered one, अहम् I, चापहस्तः bow in hand, कञ्चित् a certain, श्वापदम् wild animal, निपाने drinking at the water hole, आगतम् which has come, गजं च an elephant, जिघांसुः wishing to kill, सरयूतीरम् to the bank of river Sarayu, आगतः arrived.

64_14.shloka: ततश्श्रुतो मया शब्दो जले कुम्भस्य पूर्यतः।द्विपोऽयमिति मत्वाऽयं बाणेनाभिहतो मया।।2.64.15।।
64_14.translation: There I heard the sound of a pot being filled with water and mistaking it to be an elephant's, shot an arrow.
64_14.word_by_word: ततः thereafter, मया by me, जले in the water, पूर्यतः being filled, कुम्भस्य pot's, शब्दः sound, श्रुतः was heard, अयम् this one, द्विपः इति taking for an elephant, मत्वा having thought, अयम् he, मया by me, बाणेन with arrow, अभिहतः was killed.

64_15.shloka: गत्वा नद्यास्तत स्तीरमपश्यमिषुणा हृदि।विनिर्भिन्नं गतप्राणं शयानं भुवि तापसम्।।2.64.16।।
64_15.translation: Thereafter I reached the river bank  and beheld an ascetic with an arrow pierced in his chest. He was lying on the ground, his life ebbing away.
64_15.word_by_word: ततः then, नद्याः river's, तीरम् bank, गत्वा having gone, इषुणा with an arrow, हृदि in the chest, विनिर्भिन्नम् pierced it, गतप्राणम् with ebbing life, भुवि on the ground, शयानम् lying, तापसम् an ascetic, अपश्यम् I beheld.

64_16.shloka: भगवच्छशब्दमालक्ष्य मया गजजिघांसुना।विसृप्टोऽम्भसि नाराचस्तेन ते निहतस्सुतः।।2.64.17।।
64_16.translation: O venerable one I released an arrow towards the water aiming at the sound intending to kill an elephant but it hit your son.
64_16.word_by_word: भगवन् O venerable one, शब्दम् sound, आलक्ष्य aiming at, गजजिघांसुना intending to kill an elephant, मया by me, अम्भसि in the water, नाराचः with an arrow, विसृष्टः has been released, तेन by that, ते your, सुतः son, निहतः was struck.

64_17.shloka: ततस्तस्यैव वचनादुपेत्य परितप्यतः।स मया सहसा बाण उधृतो मर्मतस्तदा।।2.64.18।।
64_17.translation: Then I approached him. He was suffering from excruciating pain. I pulled out at his word the arrow from his chest.
64_17.word_by_word: ततः then, परितप्यतः tormented, तस्यैव by his own, वचनात् words, मया by me, तदा then, उपेत्य reaching him, सहसा at once, सः बाणः that arrow, मर्मतः from his vital part, उधृतः removed.

64_18.shloka: स चोधृतेन बाणेन तत्रैव स्वर्गमास्थितः।भवन्तौ पितरौ शोचन्नन्धाविति विलप्य च।।2.64.19।।
64_18.translation: Grieving for both of you and crying you are blind he died as soon as the arrow was pulled out.
64_18.word_by_word: सः च he also, पितरौ parents, भवन्तौ about both of you, शोचन् while grieving, अन्धौ इति   saying you are blind, विलप्य च wailing, उधृतेन extracted, तेन बाणेन by that arrow, तत्रैव there itself, स्वर्गम् heaven, आस्थितः attained.

64_19.shloka: अज्ञानाद्भवतः पुत्र स्सहसाऽभिहतो मया।शेषमेवं गते यत्स्यात्तत्प्रसीदतु मे मुनिः।।2.64.20।।
64_19.translation: Your son has been killed by me due to my ignorance. Since this has happened, may  the ascetic be pleased to command me on the next course of action.
64_19.word_by_word: अज्ञानात् by my ignorance, सहसा suddenly, भवतः पुत्रः your son, मया by me, निहतः was slain, एवं गते when this has happened, यत् whatever, शेषं स्यात् remains to be done, तत् that, मुनिः ascetic, प्रसीदतु be pleased.

64_20.shloka: स तच्च्रुत्वा वचः क्रूरं मयोक्तमघशंसिना।नाशकत्तीव्रमायासमकर्तुं भगवानृषिः।।2.64.21।।
64_20.translation: The venerable sage heard my cruel words about the sinful act and was not able to seriously react. (He was stunned).
64_20.word_by_word: भगवान् venerable, सः ऋषिः that sage, अघशंसिना conveying my sinful act, मया by me, उक्तम्  uttered, क्रूरम् cruel, तत् those, वचः words, श्रुत्वा having heard, तीव्रम् intense, आयासम्  anguish, अकर्तुम् not to do, नाशकत् was not able.

64_21.translation: The griefstricken, glorious ascetic with his face filled with tears, heaving deep sighs  broke down with grief and spoke to me as I was standing with folded palms.
64_21.word_by_word: महातेजाः brilliant, सः that ascetic, बाष्पपूर्णवदनः face filled with tears, निश्श्वसन् heaving sighs, शोककर्शितः broken with grief, कृताञ्जलिम् with folded palms, उपस्थितम् standing nearby, माम् me, उवाच said.

64_22.shloka: यद्येतदशुभं कर्म न त्वं मे कथयेस्स्वयम्।फलेन्मूर्धा स्म ते राजन् सद्य श्शतसहस्रधा।।2.64.23।।
64_22.translation: 'O king, hadn't you yourself broken this inauspicious news, your head would have split into a hundred thousand pieces right now.
64_22.word_by_word: राजन् O king, अशुभम् inauspicious, एतत् this, कर्म act, त्वम् you, मे to me, स्वयम् yourself, न कथयेः यदि not spoke, सद्य: right now, ते your, मूर्धा your head, शतसहस्रधा a hundred thousand pieces, फलेत् स्म would have been split.

64_23.shloka: क्षत्रियेण वधो राजन् वानप्रस्थे विशेषतः।ज्ञानपूर्वं कृत स्स्थानाच्च्यावयेदपि वज्रिणम्।।2.64.24।।
64_23.translation: 'If a kshatriya kills any one knowingly, particularly when in vanaprastha (third stage) this sin can displace even Indra, wielder of the thunderbolt from his position, O king.
64_23.word_by_word: राजन् king, क्षत्रियेण by a kshatriya, ज्ञानपूर्वम् with prior knowledge, कृतः done, वधः the act of killing, विशेषतः especially, वानप्रस्थे of a forestdweller, वज्रिणम् अपि even if he is wielder of thunderbolt (Indra), स्थानात् from his position, च्वावयेत् would overthrow.

64_24.shloka: सप्तधा तु फलेन्मूर्धा मुनौ तपसि तिष्ठति।ज्ञानाद्विसृजतश्शस्त्रं तादृशे ब्रह्मावादिनि।।2.64.25।।
64_24.translation: 'If any one deliberately discharges a weapon upon an ascetic observing austerities or on him who expounds the Vedas, his head will split into seven pieces.
64_24.word_by_word: तपसि  observing austerities, तिष्ठति staying, मुनौ at the ascetic, तादृशे similar, ब्रह्मवादिनि at one who propagates selfknowledge, ज्ञानात् knowingly, शस्त्रम् weapon, विसृजतः discharges, मूर्धा head, सप्तधा into seven pieces, फलेत् will break.

64_25.shloka: अज्ञानाद्धिकृतं यस्मादिदं तेनैव जवसि।अपि ह्यद्य कुलं न स्यादिक्ष्वाकूणां कुतो भवान्।।2.64.26।।
64_25.translation: 'Since you have done this unwittingly you are still alive. If it had been otherwise, your Ikshvaku race itself would have been exterminated, what to speak of you
64_25.word_by_word: इदम् this, यस्मात् for which reason, आज्ञानात् out of ignorance, कृतं हि has been done, तेनैव that is why, जीवसि you will live, इक्ष्वाकूणाम् Ikshvakus', कुलमपि race itself, अद्य now, न स्यात् हि would not have been there, भवान् you also, कुतः where are you

64_26.shloka: नय नौ नृप तं देशमिति मां चाभ्यभाषत।अद्य तं द्रष्टुमिच्छावः पुत्रं पश्चिमदर्शनम्।।2.64.27।।रुधिरेणावसिक्ताङ्गं प्रकीर्णाजिनवाससम्।शयानं भुवि निस्संज्ञं धर्म राजवशं गतम्।।2.64.28।।
64_26.translation: 'O king take us to that place. We wish to  have the last look at him, at his garment of antelope skin in disarray, his body spattered with blood, lying on the ground unconscious under the sway of the lord of death'. Thus the sage said to me.
64_26.word_by_word: नृप king, अद्य now, पश्चिमदर्शनम् for the last time to see, रुधिरेण in blood, अवसिक्ताङ्गम्   his body spattered, प्रकीर्णाजिनवाससम् with antelope skin in disarray, भुवि on the ground, शयानम् lying, निस्संज्ञम् without senses, धर्मराजवशम् under the sway of the Lord of death, गतम् gone, पुत्रम् son, द्रष्टुम् to see, इच्छावः intend, तं देशम् to that place, नौ us, नय take us, इति thus, माम् me, अभ्यभाषत च spoke.

64_27.shloka: अथाहमेकस्तं देशं नीत्वा तौ भृशदुःखितौ।अस्पर्शयमहं पुत्रं तं मुनिं सह भार्यया।।2.64.29।।
64_27.translation: Thereupon, I took both of them all by myself to that spot and made the grievingascetics touch the body of their son.
64_27.word_by_word: अथ thereupon, एकः alone, अहम् I, भृशदुःखितौ deeply grieved, तौ both of them, तं देशम् to that place, नीत्वा having taken, भार्यया सह along with his wife, तं मुनिम् to that asetic, तं पुत्रम् their son, अस्पर्शयम् made them touch.

64_28.shloka: तौ पुत्रमात्मन स्स्पृष्ट्वा तमासाद्य तपस्विनौ।निपेततुश्शरीरेऽस्य पिता चास्येदमब्रवीत्।।62.64.30।।
64_28.translation: Both the ascetics stroking their son's body and collapsed upon it. And the father said:
64_28.word_by_word: तपस्विनौ both the ascetics, तौ both, तम् their, आत्मनः own, पुत्रम् son, आसाद्य having approached, स्पृष्टवा having touched, अस्य his, शरीरे on body, निपेततुः fell, अस्य his, पिता च father, इदम् this way, अब्रवीत् spoke.

64_29.shloka: नाभिवादयसे माद्य न च माऽमभिभाषसे।किं नु शेषे तु भूमौ त्वं वत्स किं कुपितो ह्यसि।।2.64.31।।
64_29.translation: 'O child why are you not greeting us today nor speaking? Why are you lying on the ground? Are you angry with us?
64_29.word_by_word: वत्स child, अद्य today, मा me, नाभिवादयसे you are not greeting us, माम् me, न च अभिभाषसे not also speaking to us, त्वम् you, भूमौ on this ground, किं नु शेषे why are you lying, कुपितः angry, किम् असि why have you become?.

64_30.shloka: न त्वहं ते प्रियं पुत्र मातरं पश्य धार्मिक।किं नु नालिङ्गसे पुत्र सुकुमार वचो वद।।2.64.32।।
64_30.translation: 'O righteous son if I am no longer dear to you, (at least) look at your mother. O tender child, why are you not embracing me? Speak.
64_30.word_by_word: धार्मिक O righteous, पुत्र son, अहम् I, ते to you, प्रियम् dear, न तु if not so, मातरम् mother, पश्य look at, पुत्र O son, किं नु why, नालिङ्गसे are not embracing, सुकुमार O tender child, वचः words, वद tell.

64_31.shloka: कस्य वाऽपररात्रेऽहं श्रोष्यामि हृदयङ्गमम्।अधीयानस्य मधुरं शास्त्रं वान्यद्विशेषतः।।2.64.33।।
64_31.translation: 'From whom shall I hear the sweet recitation of scriptures or other texts, delightful to my heart in the last watch of the night?
64_31.word_by_word: अपररात्रे in the last watch of the night, शास्त्रम् scriptures, विशेषत: especially, अन्वद्वा any other, अधीयानस्य while reciting, कस्य वा or whose, हृदयङ्गमम् delightful to the heart, मधुरम् sweet sound, अहम् I, श्रोष्यामि shall listen?

64_32.shloka: को मां सन्द्यामुपास्यैव स्नात्वा हुतहुताशनः।श्लाघयिष्यत्युपासीनः पुत्र शोकभयार्दितम्।।2.64.34।।
64_32.translation: 'O son I am tortured with sorrow and fear. Who will serve me from now on after the ablution and the morning worship of Sandhya, followed by oblations to the sacrificial fire?
64_32.word_by_word: पुत्र O son, कः who, स्नात्वा after the ablution, सन्द्याम् morning Sandhya, उपास्यैव having worshipped, हुतहुताशनः having offered oblations to the sacrificial fire, उपासीनः seated near, शोकभयार्दितम् tormented with sorrow and fear, माम् to me, श्लाघयिष्यति serve?

64_33.translation: 'I am incapable of doing any work, I am unable to procure anything (to meet my needs. now). I have no guide (to help me walk my way). Who will feed me like a welcome guest with tubers and fruits?
64_33.word_by_word: कन्दमूलफलम् tubers and fruits, हृत्वा having brought, कः who, अकर्मण्यम् incapable of  doing any work, अप्रग्रहम् incapable of procuring anything, अनायकम् one who has no guide, माम् me, प्रियम् dear, अतिथिमिव like a guest, भोजयिष्यति will feed?

64_34.shloka: इमामन्धां च वृद्धां च मातरं ते तपस्विनीम्।कथं वत्स भरिष्यामि कृपणां पुत्रगर्धिनीम्।।2.64.36।।
64_34.translation: 'O son how can I support your wretched and pitiable mother, who is blind, old and yearning for her son?
64_34.word_by_word: वत्स O son, अन्धाम् blind, वृद्धाम् old, तपस्विनीम् miserable, कृपणाम् wretched, पुत्रगर्धिनीम्   yearning for her son, इमाम् this, ते your, मातरम् mother, कथम् how, भरिष्यामि support her?

64_35.shloka: तिष्ठ मां मागमः पुत्र यमस्य सदनं प्रति।श्वो मया सह गन्तासि जनन्या च समेधितः।।2.64.37।।
64_35.translation: 'My dear son, stay with me, do not go (now) to the abode of Yama, (lord of death). Tomorrow accompanied by me and your mother you may
64_35.word_by_word: पुत्र son, मां तिष्ठ stay with me, यमस्य of the lord of death, सदनं प्रति to the abode, मागमः do not go, मया with me, जनन्या सह च along with your mother also, समेधितः accompanied by, श्वः tomorrow, गन्तासि may go.

64_36.shloka: उभावपि च शोकार्तावनाथौ कृपणौ वने।क्षिप्रमेव गमिष्यावस्त्वया हीनौ यमक्षयम्।।2.4.38।।
64_36.translation: 'Deserted by you and without any support in the forest, afflicted with grief and feeling miserable, both of us also will assuredly go to Yama's abode, quickly.
64_36.word_by_word: त्वया by you, हीनौ having been deserted, शोकार्तौ afflicted with grief, वने in the forest, अनाथौ without support, कृपणौ wretched ones, उभावपि च both of us also, क्षिप्रमेव quickly, यमक्षयम् to the abode of Yama, गमिष्यावः will go.

64_37.shloka: ततो वैवस्वतं दृष्ट्वा तं प्रवक्ष्यामि भारतीम्।क्षमतां धर्मराजो मे बिभृयात्पितरावयम्।।2.64.39।।
64_37.translation: 'There seeing Yama, (lord of death), I shall say O Lord of Justice forgive me. Let this boy continue to maintain his parents.
64_37.word_by_word: ततः then, वैवस्वतम् lord of death, Yama, दृष्ट्वा having seen, तम् him, भारतीम् in speech, प्रवक्ष्यामि I shall say, धर्मराजः the lord of justice, मे me, क्षमताम् forgive, अयम् this man, पितरौ parents, बिभृयात् continue to maintain.

64_38.shloka: दातुमर्हति धर्मात्मा लोकपालो महायशाः।ईदृशस्य ममाक्षय्या मेकामभयदक्षिणाम्।।2.64.40।।
64_38.translation: 'That lord of justice, who is highly renowned, righteous and the guardian of the worlds will grant me one unfailing boon of protection from fear.
64_38.word_by_word: महायशाः of high renown, धर्मात्मा righteous, लोकपालः guardian of the worlds, ईदृशस्य of such, मम to me, अक्षय्याम् unfailing, एकाम् one, अभय दक्षिणाम् protection from fear, दातुम् to give, अर्हति behoves him.

64_39.shloka: अपापोऽसि यदा पुत्र निहतः पापकर्मणा।तेन सत्येन गच्छाऽऽशु ये लोकाश्शस्त्रयोधिनाम्।।2.64.41।।
64_39.translation: 'O sinless son, you are killed by a person of sinful deeds. On this truth, quickly go to those worlds which are attained by those valiant heroes.
64_39.word_by_word: पुत्र O son, पापकर्मणा by a person of sinful deeds, निहतः killed, यथा just as, अपापः असि you are sinless, तेन that, सत्येन with truth, शस्त्रयोधिनाम् those who fight with weapons, येwhichever, लोका: worlds, आशु quickly, गच्छ go.

64_40.shloka: यान्ति शूरा गतिं यां च सङ्ग्रामेष्वनिवर्तिनः।हतास्त्वभिमुखाः पुत्र गतिं तां परमां व्रज।।2.64.42।।
64_40.word_by_word: पुत्र son, सङ्ग्रामेषु in wars, अनिवर्तिनः the men who do not retreat, शूराः warriors, अभिमुखाः याम् facing the enemy, गतिम् ultimate state, यान्ति will attain, ताम् that one, परमाम् supreme, गतिम् state, व्रज attain.

64_41.shloka: यां गतिं सगरश्शैब्यो दिलीपो जनमेजयः।नहुषो दुन्दुमारश्च प्राप्तास्तां गच्छ पुत्रक।।2.64.43।।
64_41.translation: 'You will attain, my son, the same supreme state achieved by Sagara, Saibya, Dilipa, Janamejaya, Nahusha and Dundumara.
64_41.word_by_word: पुत्रक O son, सगरः Sagara, शैब्यः Saibya, दिलीपः Dilipa, जनमेजयः Janamejaya, नहुषः Nahusha, दुन्दुमारश्च Dundumara also, याम् which, गतिम् state, प्राप्ताः have attained, ताम् the same, गच्छ attain.

64_42.shloka: या गति स्सर्वसाधूनां स्वाध्यायात्तपसाच या।या भूमिदस्याहिऽताग्नेरेकपत्नी व्रतस्य च।।2.64.44।।गोसहस्रप्रदातृ़णां या या गुरुभृतामपि।देहन्यासकृतां या च तां गतिं गच्छ पुत्रक।।2.64.45।।
64_42.translation: 'You, my son, shall attain that supreme state obtained by those who are virtuous, who study the Vedas and practise asceticism.You shall attain the state merited by those bestowers of land as charity, who kindle the sacred fires, who are monoganists, who offer a thousand cows in charity, who nurture the venerable and who willingly lay down their bodies.
64_42.word_by_word: पुत्रक O son, सर्वसाधूनाम् of all virtuous people, या which, गतिः state, स्वाध्यायात् with the study of Vedas, तपसा च by asceticism, भूमिदस्य  bestowers of land as charity, आहिताग्नेः  who kindle the sacred fires, एकपत्नीव्रतस्य च of the monogamist too, गोसहस्रप्रदातृ़णाम्  who offer a thousand cows in charity, या which, गुरुभृतामपि who nurture the venerable ones, देहन्यासकताम् for those who lay down their bodies voluntarily, या च and those, तां गतिम् the same state, गच्छ you will attain.

64_43.shloka: न हि त्वस्मिन्कुले जातो गच्छत्यकुशलां गतिम्।स तु यास्यति येन त्वं निहतो मम बान्धवः।।2.64.46।।
64_43.translation: 'He who has killed you will alone attain that undesirable state, a member of our family will not.'
64_43.word_by_word: अस्मिन् in this, कुले family, जातः born, अकुशलाम् undesirable, गतिम् state, न गच्छति हि will never go, तु but, मम my, बान्धवः relation, त्वम् you, येन by whom, निहतः killed, सः he, यास्यति will attain.

64_44.shloka: एवं स कृपणं तत्र पर्यदेवयतासकृत्।ततोऽस्मै कर्तुमुदकं प्रवृत्तस्सहभार्यया।।2.64.47।।
64_44.translation: In this way the ascetic piteously wailed again and again. Thereafter, he with his wife set about to perform the funeral obsequies of their son.
64_44.word_by_word: सः he, एवम् in this way, तत्र there, असकृत् again and again, कृपणम् piteously, पर्यदेवयत  bewailed, ततः then, अस्मै to him, भार्यया सह along with his wife, उदकं कर्तुम् to perform funeral obsequies, प्रवृत्तः commenced.

64_45.shloka: स तु दिव्येन रूपेण मुनिपुत्रस्स्वकर्मभिः।स्वर्गमध्यारुहत्क्षिप्रं शक्रेण सह धर्मवित्।।2.64.48।।
64_45.translation: The virtuous son of that ascetic assumed a celestial form through the merit of his good deeds and ascended heaven at once with Indra.
64_45.word_by_word: धर्मवित् one conversant with righteousness, सः that, मुनिपुत्रः son of the sage, स्वकर्मभिः by the merit of his own deeds, शक्रेण सह with Indra, दिव्येन in a celestial, रूपेण form, क्षिप्रम् quickly, स्वर्गम् heaven, अध्यारुहत् ascended.

64_46.shloka: आबभाषे च वृद्धौ तौ सह शक्रेण तापसः।आश्वास्यच मुहूर्तं तु पितरौ वाक्यमब्रवीत्।।2.64.49।।
64_46.translation: The ascetic in the company of Indra consoling the aged couple for a brief moment said:
64_46.word_by_word: सह शक्रेण with Indra, (सः) तापसः that ascetic, तौ both, वृद्धौ to the aged ones, अबाभाषे च  spoke, पितरौ parents, मुहूर्तम् for a brief  moment, आश्वास्य consoling, वाक्यम् words, अब्रवीत् said.

64_47.shloka: स्थानमस्मि महत्प्राप्तो भवतोः परिचारणात्।भवन्तावपि च क्षिप्रं मम मूलमुपैष्यतः।।2.64.50।।
64_47.translation: 'I have attained this supreme state by virtue of the service rendered to you. You will also attain my state soon.'
64_47.word_by_word: भवतोः your, परिचारणात् by (your) service, महत् supreme, स्थानम् state, प्राप्तः अस्मि I have  attained, भवन्तौ अपि च you also, क्षिप्रम् quickly, मम my, मूलम् presence, उपैष्यतः will obtain.

64_48.shloka: एवमुक्त्वा तु दिव्येन विमानेन वपुष्मता।आरुरोह दिवं क्षिप्रं मुनिपुत्रो जितेन्द्रियः।।2.64.51।।
64_48.translation: The sage's son with his senses under control said this while ascending heaven on a beautiful, celestial, aerial chariot.
64_48.word_by_word: जितेन्द्रियः one with his senses conquered, मुनिपुत्रः sage's son, एवम् in this way, उक्त्वा having said, वपुष्मता beautiful, दिव्येन celestial, विमानेन aerial chariot, क्षिप्रम् quickly, दिवम् heaven, आरुरोह ascended.

64_49.shloka: स कृत्वा तूदकं तूर्णं तापस स्सह भार्यया।मामुवाच महातेजाः कृताञ्जलिमुपस्थितम्।।2.64.52।।
64_49.translation: The radiant ascetic along with his wife hurriedly completed the funeral libations and said to me standing with folded palms:
64_49.word_by_word: महातेजाः brilliant, सः तापसः that ascetic, भार्यया सह with his wife, तूर्णम् immediately, उदकं कृत्वा offering funeral libations, कृताञ्जलिम् with folded palms, उपस्थितम् standing nearby, माम् me, उवाच addressed.

64_50.shloka: अद्यैव जहिं मां राजन्मरणे नास्ति मे व्यथा।यच्छरेणैकपुत्रं मां त्वमकर्षीरपुत्रकम्।।2.64.53।।
64_50.translation: 'Kill me, O king with the same arrow by which you rendered me childless. Death holds no pain for me.
64_50.word_by_word: राजन् king, त्वम् you, यत् since, ऐक पुत्रम् having only one son, माम् me, शरेण with the arrow, अपुत्रकम् childless, अकार्षीः rendered, अद्यैव right now, माम् me, जहि slay, मे to me, मरणे in death, व्यथा pain, नास्ति not.

64_51.shloka: त्वया तु यदविज्ञानान्निहतो मे सुतश्शुचिः।तेन त्वामभिशप्स्यामि सुदुःखमतिदारुणम्।।2.64.54।।
64_51.translation: 'Though you have killed my purehearted son unintentionally, I will pronounce a disastrous and dreadful curse on you.
64_51.word_by_word: त्वया by you, अविज्ञानात् in ignorance, मे my, शुचिः purehearted, सुतः son, यत् since, निहतः was killed, तेन therefore, त्वाम् you, सुदुःखम् deeply sorrowful, अतिदारुणम् extremely dreadful, अभिशप्स्यामि I will curse.

64_52.shloka: पुत्रव्यसनजं दुःखं यदेतन्मम साम्प्रतम्।एवं त्वं पुत्रशोकेन राजन्कालं करिष्यसि।।2.64.55।।
64_52.translation: 'Just as I am now suffering from grief caused by my son's death, you, O king, shall die from the sorrow on account of (separation from) your son.
64_52.word_by_word: साम्प्रतम् now, यत् एतत् just as this, पुत्रव्यसनजम् caused by my son's death, दुःखम् grief, एवम् the same way, राजन् O king, त्वम् you, पुत्रशोकेन by the sorrow over your son, कालं करिष्यसि will die.

64_53.shloka: अज्ञानात्तु हतो यस्मात्क्षत्रियेण त्वया मुनिः।तस्मात्त्वां नाविशत्याशु ब्रह्महत्या नराधिप।।2.64.56।।
64_53.translation: 'Since you, O lord of men, you have killed an ascetic unaware, as kshatriya the sin of slaying a brahmin will not accrue to you immediately.
64_53.word_by_word: नराधिप O lord of men, क्षत्रियेण by being a kshatriya, त्वया by you, यस्मात् since, मुनिः sage, अज्ञानात् ignorantly, हतः killed, तस्मात् for that reason, आशु immediately, ब्रह्महत्या sin of slaying a brahmana, त्वाम् you, न आविशति will not apply.

64_54.shloka: त्वामप्येतादृशो भावः क्षिप्रमेव गमिष्यति।जीवितान्तकरो घोरो दातारमिव दक्षिणा।।2.64.57।।
64_54.translation: 'Just like the merits of alms come to the giver, you are going to face very soon a dreadful situation causing the end of your life.'
64_54.word_by_word: जीवितान्तकरः causing the end of your life, घोरः dreadful, एतादृशः such, भावः mortal condition, दक्षिणा alms, दातारम् इव like a giver, क्षिप्रमेव soon, त्वामपि you also, गमिष्यति will reach.

64_55.shloka: एवं शापं मयि न्यस्य विलप्य करुणं बहु।चितामारोप्य देहं तन्मिथुनं स्वर्गमभ्ययात्।।2.64.58।।
64_55.translation: Having thus cursed me, the couple piteously lamenting for a long time, laid themselves down on the funeral pyre  and went to heaven.
64_55.word_by_word: तत् that, मिथुनम् couple, एवम् in this way, मयि in me, शापम् curse, न्यस्य giving, करुणम्piteously, बहुविलप्य lamenting long, देहम् body, चिताम् funeral pyre, आरोप्य ascending, स्वर्गम् to heaven, अभ्ययात् went.

64_56.shloka: तदेतच्छिन्तयानेन स्मृतं पापं मया स्वयम्।तदा बाल्यात्कृतं देवि शब्दवेध्यनुशिक्षिणा।।2.64.59।।
64_56.translation: While reflecting about it now, O Devi (Kausalya) I recollect this sin committed by me unintentionally, with childish pranks while practising the art of hitting a target by its sound.
64_56.word_by_word: देवि O Devi (Kausalya), तदा then, शब्दवेध्यनुशिक्षिणा trained in discharging the arrow in the direction of sound, मया by me, बाल्यात् out of ignorance, स्वयम् myself, कृतम् committed, तत् such, एतत् this, पापम् sin, चिन्तयानेन reflecting, स्मृतम् recollected.

64_57.shloka: तस्यायं कर्मणो देवि विपाकस्समुपस्थितः।अपथ्यैस्सहम्भुक्ते व्याधिरन्नरसे यथा।।2.64.60।।
64_57.translation: Just as a man eating forbidden food and drink falls sick, so have I fallen prey to grief,because of my sin, O Devi
64_57.word_by_word: देवि O Devi, तस्य कर्मणः that act's, अयं विपाकः this consequence, अन्नरसे food and drink, अपथ्यैः सह with unhealthy food, सम्भुक्ते सति when partaking, व्याधिः यथा causing illness, समुपस्थितः has befallen.

64_58.shloka: तस्मान्मामागतं भद्रे तस्योदारस्य तद्वचः।यदहं पुत्रशोकेन सन्त्यक्ष्याम्यद्य जीवितम्।।2.64.61।।
64_58.translation: O gentle lady, the words of that noble ascetic have come true today. Hence I am now going to give up my life.
64_58.word_by_word: भद्रे O gentle lady, तस्मात् hence, अहम् I, पुत्रशोकेन due to sorrow over my son, जीवितम् life, यत् सन्त्यक्ष्यामि since I am giving up, उदारस्य of the noble, तस्य that ascetic's, तत् वचःthose words, मम for me, अद्य today, आगतम् have come true.

64_59.shloka: चक्षुभ्यां त्वां न पश्यामि कौसल्ये साधु मां स्फृश।इत्युक्त्वा स रुदंस्त्रस्तो भार्यामाह च भूमिपः।।2.64.62।।
64_59.translation: O Kausalya, I cannot see you with my eyes. Touch me gently, said the frightened Dasaratha, Lord of the earth, to his wife weeping.
64_59.word_by_word: कौशल्ये O Kausalya, चक्षुर्भ्याम् with eyes, त्वाम् you, न पश्यामि I am unable to see, मां me, साधु  properly, स्फृश touch, भूमिपः lord of the earth, इति उक्त्वा having said so, त्रस्तो frightened, रुदन् weeping, भार्याम् to his wife, आह च said also.

64_60.shloka: एतन्मे सदृशं देवि यन्मया राघवे कृतम्।सदृशं तत्तु तस्यैव यदनेन कृतं मयि।।2.64.63।।
64_60.translation: Whatever I have done to the scion of the Raghu family (Rama) is befitting me, O Devi. And whatever he has done in respect of me is also worthy of him.
64_60.word_by_word: देवि O Devi, मया by me, यत् whatever, राघवे to Rama, कृतम् done, एतत् all that, मे to me, सदृशम् befitting, अनेन by him (this Rama), मयि relating to me, यत् whatever, कृतम् done, तत्तु that one, तस्यैव his, सदृशम् is worthy of.

64_61.shloka: दुर्वृत्तमपि कः पुत्रं त्यजेद्भुवि विचक्षणः।कश्च प्रव्राज्यमानो वा नासूयेत्पितरं सुतः।।2.64.64।।
64_61.translation: Which clearsighted man in this world, will abandon his son even if he is of evil conduct? Which son will not get angry with his father when he is banished?
64_61.word_by_word: भुवि in this world, विचक्षणः clearrighted, कः who, दुर्वृत्तमपि even if illbehaved, पुत्रम् son, त्यजेत् will he abandon?, प्रव्राज्यमानो अपि even while he is being banished, कः who, सुतः son, पितरम् at his father, ना सूयेत् will not become angry?

64_62.shloka: यदि मां संस्पृशेद्रामस्सकृदद्य लभेत वा।यमक्षयमनुप्राप्ता द्रक्ष्यन्ति न हि मानवाः।।2.64.65।।
64_62.translation: Before I die, will Rama touch me once or will he come to me? After reaching the abode of Yama men cannot see their relations.
64_62.word_by_word: रामः Rama, अद्य now, सकृत् once, माम् me, सम्स्पृशेत् will touch?, लभेत वा will he come to my side, यमक्षयम् world of Yama, अनुप्राप्ताः attained, मानवाः men, न द्रक्ष्यन्ति हि cannot see any more indeed

64_63.shloka: चक्षुषा त्वां न पश्यामि स्मृतिर्मम विलुप्यते।दूता वैवस्वतस्यैते कौसल्ये त्वरयन्ति माम्।।2.64.66।।
64_63.translation: O Kausalya, I am unable to see you. My memory is failing and the messengers of Yama are hastening me.
64_63.word_by_word: कौसल्ये O Kausalya, चक्षुषा with my eyes, त्वाम् you, न पश्यामि cannot see, मम my, स्मृतिः memory, विलुप्यते is failing, वैवस्वतस्य Yama's, एते दूताः these messengers, माम् me, त्वरयन्ति are hastening up.

64_64.shloka: अतस्तु किं दुःखतरं यदहं जीवितक्षये।न हि पश्यामि धर्मज्ञं रामं सत्यपराक्रमम्।।2.64.67।।
64_64.translation: Can there be a greater sorrow than that at the last moment of my life I am unable tosee my righteous and truthful son, Rama?
64_64.word_by_word: अहम् I, जीवितक्षये at the last moment of my life, धर्मज्ञम् to the knower of righteousness, सत्यपराक्रमम्  to one possessing the strength of truth, रामम् Rama, न पश्यामि हि इति यत् the fact that I am unable to see,  अतः more than this, दुःखतरम् more sorrowful, किं नु what is there?

64_65.translation: My grief in the absence of Rama of peerless deeds is drying up my life as heat dries up small pools of water.
64_65.word_by_word: अप्रतिकर्मणः of unparalleled deeds, तस्य सुतस्य that son's, अदर्शनजः born out of nonappearance, शोकः grief, स्तोकम् small quantity, वारि water, आतपः इव like heat, मे my, प्राणान् life, उच्छोषयति is drying up.

64_66.shloka: न ते मनुष्या देवास्ते ये चारुशुभकुण्डलम्।मुखं द्रक्ष्यन्ति रामस्य वर्षे पञ्चदशे पुनः।।2.64.69।।
64_66.translation: Those who will behold Rama's countenance adorned with auspicious earrings on his return in the fifteenth year are gods not men.
64_66.word_by_word: पञ्चदशे वर्षे in the fifteenth year, ये whoever, चारु elegant, शुभकुण्डलम् with auspicious ear rings, रामस्य Rama's, मुखम् countenance, पुनः again, द्रक्ष्यन्ति will behold, ते those, देवाः gods, मनुष्याः men, न not.

64_67.shloka: पद्मपत्रेक्षणं सुभ्रु सुदंष्ट्रं चारुनासिकम्।धन्या द्रक्ष्यन्ति रामस्य ताराधिपनिभं मुखम्।।2.64.70।।
64_67.translation: Blessed are they who will behold Rama's countenance resembling the Moon, lord of the stars with eyes like lotus petals graceful eyebrows, even teeth and a nose.
64_67.word_by_word: पद्मपत्रेक्षणम् eyes like lotus petals, सुभ्रु graceful eyebrows, सुदंष्ट्रम् even teeth, चारुनासिकम् of shapely nose, ताराधिपनिभम् resembling the lord of the stars (the Moon), रामस्य Rama's, मुखम् countenance, धन्याः blessed, द्रक्ष्यन्ति will behold.

64_68.shloka: सदृशं शारदस्येन्दोः पुल्लस्य कमलस्य च।सुगन्धि मम नाथस्य धन्या द्रक्ष्यन्ति तन्मुखम्।।2.64.71।।
64_68.translation: Fortunate indeed are the men who will behold my son's fragrant countenance camparable to the autmnal Moon and the fullblown lotus.
64_68.word_by_word: शारदस्य autumnal, इन्दोः Moon, सदृशम् similar, पुल्लस्य fullblown, कमलस्य च similar to lotus, सुगन्धि fragrant, मम नाथस्य my son's, तत् that, मुखम् countenance, धन्याः blessed, द्रक्ष्यन्ति will behold.

64_69.shloka: निवृत्तवनवासं तमयोध्यां पुनरागतम्।द्रक्ष्यन्ति सुखिनो रामं शुक्रं मार्गगतं यथा।।2.64.72।।
64_69.translation: Lucky men will behold Rama return to Ayodhya after the completion of his exile, like the planet Venus moving forward on its orbit.
64_69.word_by_word: निवृत्तवनवासम् after completing the period of exile, अयोध्याम् to Ayodhya, पुनः again, आगतम् returning, रामम् Rama, मार्गगतम् moving on the highway, शुक्रं यथा like the planet Venus, सुखिनः happy persons, द्रक्ष्यन्ति will behold.

64_70.shloka: कौसल्ये चित्तमोहेन हृदयं सीदतीव मे।वेदये न च संयुक्तान् शब्दस्पर्शरसानहम्।।2.64.73।।
64_70.translation: O Kausalya, my heart, it appears is sinking and on account of delusion I am not able to feel the sense objects like sound touch and taste together.
64_70.word_by_word: कौसल्ये O Kausalya, चित्तमोहेन on account of delusion, मे हृदयम् my heart, सीदतीव as if sinking, अहम् I, संयुक्तान् united, शब्दस्पर्शरसान् the sense of sound, touch and taste, न च वेदये I am not able to know.

64_71.shloka: चित्तनाशाद्विपद्यन्ते सर्वाण्येन्द्रियाणि मे।क्षीणस्नेहस्य दीपस्य संसक्ता रश्मयो यथा।।2.64.74।।
64_71.translation: With the loss of my mental faculty, all the sense organs are giving way, like the rays of the lamp giving way together when the oil is exhausted.
64_71.word_by_word: चित्तनाशात् on account of the loss of the mental faculty, मे my, सर्वाण्येव all, इन्द्रियाणि sense organs, क्षीणस्नेहस्य with oil exhausted, दीपस्य like the lamp, संसक्ताः together, रश्मयः यथा like rays, विपद्यन्ते are giving way.

64_72.shloka: अयमात्मभवश्शोको मामनाथमचेतनम्।संसादयति वेगेन यथा कूलं नदीरयः।।2.64.75।।
64_72.translation: This selfcreated grief is rapidly destroying me like the bank of a river eroded by its swift current, leaving me helpless and insensible.
64_72.word_by_word: आत्मभवः selfcreated on account of my son, अयम् this, शोकः sorrow, अनाथम् helpless, अचेतनम् insensible, माम् me, नदीरयः current of the river, कूलं यथा like the bank, वेगेन rapidly, संसादयति eroding.

64_73.shloka: हा राघव महाबाहो हा ममाऽयासनाशन।हा पितृप्रिय मे नाथ हाऽद्य क्वासि गतस्सुत।।2.64.76।।
64_73.translation: Ah, mightyarmed Rama, destroyer of my agonies, Ah, the delight of your father, Ah, my protector, Ah, my son, where have you gone?.
64_73.word_by_word: महाबाहो O mightyarmed one, हा राघव Ah Rama, मम my, आयासनाशन destroyer of my agony, हा Ah , हा पितृप्रिय Ah delight of your father, मे नाथ my protector, हा Ah सुत son, क्वwhere, गतः असि have you gone?.

64_74.shloka: हा कौसल्ये नशिष्यामि हा सुमित्रे तपस्विनि।हा नृशंसे ममामित्रे कैकेयि कुलपांसनि।।2.64.77।।
64_74.translation: Ah, Kausalya, Ah, pitiable Sumitra, Ah, cruel Kaikeyi, my enemy and defiler of my race, I am going to die.
64_74.word_by_word: हा कौशल्ये Ah Kausalya, तपस्विनि pitiable one, हा सुमित्रे Ah Sumitra, हा Ah, नृशंसे cruel one, मम अमित्रे my enemy, कुलपांसनि defiler of my race, कैकेयि Kaikeyi, नशिष्यामि am destroyed.

64_75.shloka: इति रामस्य मातुश्च सुमित्रायाश्च सन्निधौ।राजा दशरथ श्शोचञ्जीवितान्तमुपागमत्।।2.64.78।।
64_75.translation: King Dasaratha, thus crying in distress in the presence of Rama's mother and  Sumitra reached the end of his life.
64_75.word_by_word: राजा king, दशरधः Dasaratha, इति thus, रामस्य मातुश्च Rama's mother, सुमित्रायाश्च  Sumitra's, सन्निधौ in the presence, इति thus, शोचन् crying in distress, जीवितान्तं end of his life, उपागमत् reached.

64_76.shloka: यदा तु दीनं कथयन्नराधिपः प्रियस्य पुत्त्रस्य विवासनातुरः।गतेऽर्धरात्रे भृशदुःखपीडितस्तदा जहौ प्राणमुदारदर्शनः।।2.64.79।।
64_76.translation: King Dasaratha, a man of noble vision and lord of men, anguished by the exile of his son, kept pitiably muttering till past midnight  until tormented by an intense agony he breathed his last.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे चतुष्षष्टितमस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the sixtyfourth sarga in Ayodhyakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
64_76.word_by_word: उदारदर्शनः a man of noble vision, नराधिपः king, दीनम् pitiably, कथयन् while speaking,  पुत्रस्य son's, विवासनातुरः distraught on account of his exile, अर्धरात्रे at midnight, गते having passed away, यदा when, भृशदुःखपीडितः tormented with intense sorrow, तदा then, प्राणम् life, जहौ gave up.

65_1.shloka: [Dasaratha's death -- heartbroken Kausalya and Sumitra -- palace echoes with the lamentations of Dasaratha's wives.]अथ रात्र्यां व्यतीतायां प्रातरेवापरेऽहनि।वन्दिनः पर्युपातिष्ठंस्तत्पार्थिव निवेशनम्।।2.65.1।।सूताः परमसंस्कारा मङ्गलाश्चोत्तमश्रुताः।गायका: स्तुतिशीलाश्च निगदन्तः पृथक् पृथक्।।2.65.2।।
65_1.translation: Then on the following day (unaware of Dasaratha's death) panegyrists uttering benedictions, highly accomplished bards and genealogists proficient in reciting auspicious words, singers versed in musical science reached the palace one after another eulogising the king's glory.
65_1.word_by_word: अथ thereafter, रात्र्याम्  that night, व्यतीतायाम् had passed, अपरे on the following, अहनि day, प्रातः एव in the morning, परमसंस्काराः highly accomplished men, उत्तमश्रुताः proficient in learning, मङ्गलाश्च auspicious men, सूताः genealogists, स्तुतिशीलाः those versed in praising, गायकाः singers, वन्दिनः panegyrists, पृथक् पृथक् separately one by one, निगदन्तः reciting audibly, तत् that, पार्थिवनिवेशनम् palace of the king, पर्युपातिष्ठन् reached.

65_2.shloka: अथ रात्र्यां व्यतीतायां प्रातरेवापरेऽहनि।वन्दिनः पर्युपातिष्ठंस्तत्पार्थिव निवेशनम्।।2.65.1।।सूताः परमसंस्कारा मङ्गलाश्चोत्तमश्रुताः।गायका: स्तुतिशीलाश्च निगदन्तः पृथक् पृथक्।।2.65.2।।
65_2.translation: Then on the following day (unaware of Dasaratha's death) panegyrists uttering benedictions, highly accomplished bards and genealogists proficient in reciting auspicious words, singers versed in musical science reached the palace one after another eulogising the king's glory.
65_2.word_by_word: अथ thereafter, रात्र्याम्  that night, व्यतीतायाम् had passed, अपरे on the following, अहनि day, प्रातः एव in the morning, परमसंस्काराः highly accomplished men, उत्तमश्रुताः proficient in learning, मङ्गलाश्च auspicious men, सूताः genealogists, स्तुतिशीलाः those versed in praising, गायकाः singers, वन्दिनः panegyrists, पृथक् पृथक् separately one by one, निगदन्तः reciting audibly, तत् that, पार्थिवनिवेशनम् palace of the king, पर्युपातिष्ठन् reached.

65_3.translation: The songs of those who were eulogising the king and uttering benedictions at high pitch pervaded the entire palace.
65_3.word_by_word: उदात्ताभिहिताशिषाम् uttering benedictions at high pitch, राजानम् the king, स्तुवताम् those who were praising, तेषाम् their, स्तुतिशब्दः song of praise, प्रासादाऽभोगविस्तीर्णः spread over the entire palace, अवर्तत हि pervaded.

65_4.shloka: ततस्तु स्तुवतां तेषां सूतानां पाणिवादकाः।अपदानान्युदाहृत्य पाणिवादा नवादयन्।।2.65.4।।
65_4.translation: While the bards sang the praise of the king, those who praise clapping their palms  clapped, citing the wonderful deeds of Dasaratha.
65_4.word_by_word: ततः then, तेषां सूतानाम् स्तुवताम् while the bards were singing the praise of the king, पाणिवादकाः those who praise clapping their palms, अवदानानि his wonderful deeds,  उदाहृत्य citing, पाणिवादान् claps, अवादयन् clapped.

65_5.shloka: तेन शब्देन विहगाः प्रतिबुद्धा विसस्वनुः।शाखास्थाः पञ्जरस्थाश्च ये राजकुलगोचराः।।2.65.5।।
65_5.translation: The birds perched on the branches and some in cages awoke and began to twitter all over the palace.
65_5.word_by_word: तेन by that, शब्देन sound, शाखास्थाः some perched on the branches, पञ्जरस्थाः च and some in cages, ये राजकुलगोचराः found all over the palace, विहागाः birds, प्रतिबुद्धा: awoke, विसस्वनुः began to twitter.

65_6.shloka: व्याहृताः पुण्यशब्दाश्च वीणानां चापि निस्स्वनाः।आशीर्गेयं च गाथानां पूरयामास वेश्म तत्।।2.65.6।।
65_6.translation: The sacred songs of bards and panegyrists, notes of veena, chantings of metrical hymns and benedictory verses filled the palace.
65_6.word_by_word: व्याहृताः uttered, पुण्यशब्दाश्च sacred sounds, वीणानाम् of veena, निस्स्वनाः च notes also, गाथानाम् of hymns composed to metre, आशीर्गेयं च benedictory verses, तत् that, वेश्म house, पूरमायास filled.

65_7.translation: Thereafter, as usual, men observing purificatory practices and skilled in royal service  assembled along with women and eunuchs.
65_7.word_by_word: ततः then, शुचिसमाचाराः observing purificatory practices, स्त्रीवर्ष धरभूयिष्ठाः many women  and eunuchs, पर्युपस्थानकोविदा: skilled to serve, यथापुरम् as usual, उपतस्थुः assembled.

65_8.translation: The bathattendants brought water mixed with yellow sandal paste in golden vessels at appropriate times in accordance with tradition.
65_8.word_by_word: स्नानशिक्षाज्ञाः those acquainted with bathing ceremonies, हरिचन्दन सम्पृक्तम् mixed with yellow sandal paste, उदकम् water, काञ्चनैः in golden, घटैः vessels, यथाकालम् at appropriate times, यथाविधि according to tradition, आनिन्युः brought.

65_9.translation: Also, a group of women mostly young maidens brought auspicious unguents, articles gratifying the senses and those necessary accessories for completion of bathing process.
65_9.word_by_word: तथा also, अन्याः some other, कुमारीबहुलाः with young maidens in large numbers, स्त्रियःwomen, मङ्गलालम्भनीयानि auspicious unguents, प्राशनीयाः articles gratifying to the senses, उपस्करान् articles necessary for completion of bathing ritual, उपनिन्युः brought.

65_10.translation: All the articles brought for the king (for his bath) were presentable and as per tradition. In quality they were excellent and auspicious.
65_10.word_by_word: तत् then, आभिहारिकम्  articles for the king, सर्वम् all, सर्वलक्षणसम्पन्नम् were of good quality, विधिवत् as per tradition, अर्चितम् बभूव (आभूत्) was adorable, सर्वम् everything, सुगुणलक्ष्मीवत्  excellent and auspicious

65_11.translation: All the highly enthusiastic attendants waited for the king till sunrise. Unable to see the king  they doubted about what had happened
65_11.word_by_word: ततः then, सर्वम् all (attendants with necessary preparations), परिसमुत्सुकम् highly  enthusiastic, अनुपसम्प्राप्तम् without reaching the king, किंस्वित् इति as to what had happened, उपशङ्कितम् doubting, सूर्योदयं यावत् until the sunrise, तस्थौ waited.

65_12.shloka: अथ याः कोसलेन्द्रस्य शयनं प्रत्यनन्तराः।ताः स्त्रियस्तु समागम्य भर्तारं प्रत्यबोधयन्।।2.65.12।।
65_12.translation: The women who usually attend to the bed (maids who do the bed in the morning) of Dasaratha (king of Kosala) without any restrictions, approached the king and began waking him up.
65_12.word_by_word: अथ thereafter, याः स्त्रियः those women, कोशलेन्द्रस्य of the king of Kosala (Dasaratha's), शयनं प्रति attending on the bed, अनन्तराः with unrestricted movement, ताः तु thosewomen, समागम्य on coming near, भर्तारम् that lord, प्रत्यबोधयन् and began waking him up.

65_13.shloka: तथाप्युचितवृत्ता स्ता विनयेन नयेन च।नह्यस्य शयनं स्पृष्ट्वा किञ्चिदप्युपलेभिरे।।2.65.13।।
65_13.translation: Conducting themselves agreeably with restraint and obedience,  the women touched the bed of Dasaratha but did not perceive any sign of life.
65_13.word_by_word: तथापि even then, विनयेन with restraint, नयेन obediently, उचित वृत्ताः with agreeable  conduct, ताः those women, अस्य Dasratha's, शयनम् bed, स्पृष्ट्वा having touched, किञ्चित् अपि even a little, न उपलेभिरे did not perceive.

65_14.shloka: ताः स्त्रियस्स्वप्नशीलज्ञाश्चेष्टासञ्चलनादिषुता वेपथुपरीताश्च राज्ञः प्राणेषु शङ्किताः।प्रतिस्रोतस्तृणाग्राणां सदृशं सञ्चकाशिरे।।2.65.14।।
65_14.translation: Those women knowledgeable in ascertaining the nature of sleep based on the actions, movements, etc. were apprehensive whether the king was  alive or not. Trembling severely  they seemed like the tips of reeds that  stand against the current.
65_14.word_by_word: ताः स्त्रीयः those women, चेष्टासञ्चलनादिषु in actions, movements, etc, स्वप्नशीलज्ञाः who know the nature of sleeping men, ताः those women, राज्ञः king's, प्राणेषु regarding king's life, शङ्किताः apprehensive of, वेपथुपरीताः च trembling severely, प्रतिस्रोतस्त्रृणाग्राणाम् the tips of reeds standing against the current, सदृशम् like, सञ्चकाशिरे remained.

65_15.shloka: अथ सन्देहमानानां स्त्रीणां दृष्ट्वा च पार्थिवम्।यत्तदाशङ्कितं पापं तस्य जज्ञे विनिश्चयः।।2.65.15।।
65_15.translation: Having seen the king more closely, those women who were apprehensive till then, became certain of the inevitable.
65_15.word_by_word: अथ thereafter, पार्थिवम् king, दृष्ट्वा च having seen, सन्देहमानानाम् suspicious, स्त्रीणाम्  women, यत् that, तत् this, पापम् evil, आशङ्कितम् apprehensive, तस्य its, विनिश्चय: certain, जज्ञे became.

65_16.shloka: कौसल्या च सुमत्रच पुत्रशोकपराजिते।प्रसुप्ते न प्रबुध्येते यथा कालसमन्विते।।2.65.16।।
65_16.translation: Overpowered by grief on account of separation from their sons, Sumitra and Kausalya were fast asleep and did not wake up as if they were possessed by death.
65_16.word_by_word: पुत्रशोकपराजिते overpowered by grief on account of separation from the son, प्रसुप्ते fast asleep, कौशल्या च Kausalya, सुमित्रा च and Sumitra, कालसमन्विते यथा as if possessed by death, न प्रबुध्येते did not wake up.

65_17.shloka: निष्प्रभा च विवर्णा च सन्ना शोकेन सन्नता।न व्यराजत कौसल्या तारेव तिमिरावृता।।2.65.17।।
65_17.translation: Kausalya, with her face dull and pallid, sank down, her limbs contracted. She looked lustreless like stars enveloped in darkness.
65_17.word_by_word: निष्प्रभा च dull, विवर्णा pallid, शोकेन due to sorrow, सन्ना sunk down, सन्नता with limbs shrunk, कौशल्या Kausalya, तिमिरावृता enveloped by darkness, तारेव like stars, न व्यराजत did not shine.

65_18.shloka: कौसल्याऽनन्तरं राज्ञस्सुमित्रा तदन्तनरम्।न स्म विभ्राजते देवी शोकाश्रुलुलितानना।।2.65.18।।
65_18.translation: There lay Sumitra next to Kausalya by the side of the king. Queen Kausalya's face was dull, drooping  down on account of shedding tears of sorrow.
65_18.word_by_word: राज्ञः of the king , अनन्तरम् by the side, देवी queen, कौशल्या Kausalya, तदन्तरम् next to herimmediately, सुमित्रा Sumitra, शोकाश्रुलुलितानना with her face drooping (on account of shedding tears in sorrow), न स्म विभ्राजते devoid of lustre

65_19.shloka: ते च दृष्ट्वा तथा सुप्ते शुभे देव्यौ च तं नृपम्।सुप्तमेवोद्गतप्राणमन्तःपुरमदृश्यत।।2.65.19।।
65_19.translation: Having seen the two auspicious queens asleep, the women in the inner apartment thought the king died in his sleep.
65_19.word_by_word: अन्तःपुरम् women in the inner apartment, तथा in that way, सुप्ते asleep, शुभे auspicious, ते देव्यौ the two queens, तम् that, नृपम् king, दृष्ट्वा having seen, सुप्तमेव as if asleep, उद्गत प्राणम् with lifebreath moving upward and leaving him dead, अमन्यत considered.

65_20.shloka: ततः प्रचुक्रुशुर्दीना स्सस्वरं ता वराङ्गनाः।करेणव इवारण्ये स्थानप्रच्युतयूथपाः।।2.65.20।।
65_20.translation: Then those women bewailed bitterly and loudly in distress like female elephants in the forest when their leader has fallen out of the herd.
65_20.word_by_word: ततः then, ताः वराङ्गनाः those women, अरण्ये in the forest, स्थानप्रच्युतयूथपाः the leader of the herd dislodged, करेणवः इव like the female elephants, दीनाः in distress, सस्वरम् loudly, प्रचुक्रुशुः wailed bitterly.

65_21.shloka: तासामाक्रन्दशब्देन सहसोद्धतचेतने।कौसल्या च सुमित्रा च त्यक्त निद्रे बभूवतुः।।2.65.21।।
65_21.translation: Hearing the lamentations of the women suddenly Kausalya and Sumitra woke up from sleep, their senses recovered.
65_21.word_by_word: कौशल्या च Kausalya, सुमित्रा च Sumitra too, तासाम् their, आक्रन्दशब्देन by the sound of  their cries, सहसा suddenly, उद्धतचेतने recovering senses, त्यक्तनिद्रे बभूवतुः deserted their sleep.

65_22.shloka: कौसल्या च सुमित्रा च दृष्ट्वा स्प़ृष्ट्वा च पार्थिवम्।हा नाथेति परिक्रुश्य पेततुर्धरणीतले।।2.65.22।।
65_22.translation: Kausalya and Sumitra looked at the king, touched his body, cried aloud, 'Ah, lord' and collapsed on the floor.
65_22.word_by_word: कौशल्याच Kausalya, सुमित्रा च and Sumitra, पार्थिवम् the king,  दृष्ट्वाच having seen,स्पृष्ट्वा च having touched, हा नाथ इति Ah, lord, saying so, परिक्रुश्य crying loudly, धरणीतले on the floor, पेततुः fell down.

65_23.shloka: सा कोसलेन्द्रदुहिता वेष्टमाना महीतले।न बभ्राज रजोध्वस्ता तारेव गगनाच्च्युता।।2.65.23।।
65_23.translation: Kausalya, daughter of the lord of Kosala, lay on the ground writhing in pain, coated  with dust, and devoid of brightness like a star without radiance fallen from the sky.
65_23.word_by_word: सा that, कोशलेन्द्रदुहिता daughter of the lord of Kosala, Kausalya, महीतले on the ground, वेष्टमाना rolling, रजोध्वस्ता coated with dust, गगनात् from the sky, च्युता fallen down, तारेव like a star, न बभ्राज did not shine.

65_24.shloka: नृपे शान्तगुणे जाते कौसल्यां पतितां भुवि।अपश्यंस्ताः स्त्रियः सर्वा हतां नागवधूमिव।।2.65.24।।
65_24.translation: Dasaratha with his body lying still, all the women looked at Kausalya fallen down on the floor like a slain female elephant.
65_24.word_by_word: नृपे when the king, शान्तगुणे जाते with his body lying still, सर्वाः all, ताः स्त्रीयः those women, भुवि on the earth, पतिताम् fallen, कौशल्याम्  at Kausalya, हताम् slain, नागवधूमिव like a female elephant, अपश्यन् beheld.

65_25.shloka: ततस्सर्वा नरेन्द्रस्य कैकेयीप्रमुखाः स्त्रियः।रुदन्त्य श्शोकसन्तप्ता निपेतुर्गतचेतनाः।।2.65.25।।
65_25.translation: Then all the wives of the king led by Kaikeyi,  burning with grief and weeping, lost their senses and fell down.
65_25.word_by_word: ततः then, कैकेयीप्रमुखाः led by Kaikeyi, नरेन्द्रस्य king's, स्त्रियः other wives, रुदन्त्यः weeping, शोकसन्तप्ताः burning with grief, गतचेतनाः having lost senses, निपेतुः fell down.

65_26.shloka: ताभिस्स बलवान्नादः क्रोशन्तीभिरनुद्रुतः।येन स्फीतीकृतं भूयस्तद्गृहं समनादयत् ।। 2.65.26 ।।
65_26.translation: The wailings of the women grew louder and louder until the whole palace reverberated with their lamentations.
65_26.word_by_word: क्रोशन्तीभिः by the wailing ones, ताभिः by those women, अनुद्रुतः followed, बलवान् strong, loud, सः नादः that sound, येन by which, (भूयः) स्फीतीकृतम् made louder, तत् that, गृहम् house (palaces), समनादयत् reverberated.

65_27.shloka: तत् परित्रस्तन्त्रसम्भ्रान्त पर्युत्सुकजनाकुलम्।सर्वतस्तुमुलाक्रन्दं परितापार्तबान्धवम्।।2.65.27।।सद्यो निपतितानन्दं दीनविक्लबदर्शनम्।बभूव नरदेवस्य सद्म दिष्टान्तमीयुषः।।2.65.28।।
65_27.translation: On the demise of Dasaratha, joy instantly vanished. The palace was thronged with anxious people who were exceedingly bewildered and frightened. The royal family was anguished with distress. The palace was filled all over with the tumult of cries of agony. And it looked miserable with grief.
65_27.word_by_word: दिष्टान्तम् demise, ईयुषः of him who reached, नरदेवस्य king's, तत् सद्म that palace, परित्रस्तन्त्रसम्भ्रान्त पर्युत्सुकजनाकुलम् thronged with anxious people who were exceedingly bewildered and frightened, सर्वतः all over, तुमुलाक्रन्दम् tumultuous with cries of agony, परितापार्तबान्धवम् with relatives anguished with distress, सद्यः at an instant, निपतितानन्दम् joy  vanished, दीनविक्लबदर्शनम् looked miserable with grief, बभूव became.

65_28.shloka: अतीतमाज्ञाय तु पार्थिवर्षभं यशस्विनं सम्परिवार्य पत्नयः।भृशं रुदन्त्यः करुणं सुदुःखिताः प्रगृह्य बाहू व्यलपन्ननाथवत्।।2.65.29।।
65_28.translation: Realising that the great and illustrious king, Dasaratha, had passed away, his wives gathered around him, weeping piteously and bitterly and holding one another's hands  bewailed like orphans.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे पञ्चषष्टितमस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the sixtyfifth sarga in Ayodhyakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
65_28.word_by_word: पत्नयः wives of the king, यशस्विनम् the illustrious, पार्थिवर्षभम् best of kings, अतीतम् him who has passed away, आज्ञाय realising, सम्परिवार्य surrounding him, सुदुःखिताः with intense sorrow, करुणम् piteously, भृशम् bitterly, रुदन्त्यः weeping, बाहू both their arms, प्रगृह्य holding, अनाथवत् like orphans, व्यलपन् bewailed.

66_1.shloka: [Preservation of the king's body awaiting funeral rites -- Ayodhya plunges into darkness with the demise of the king.]तमग्निमिव संशान्तमम्बुहीनमिवार्णवम्।हतप्रभमिवाऽऽदित्यं स्वर्गस्थं प्रेक्ष्य पार्थिवम्।।2.66.1।।कौसल्या बाष्पपूर्णाक्षी विविधां शोककर्शिता।उपगृह्य शिरो राज्ञः कैकेयीं प्रत्यभाषत।।2.66.2।।
66_1.translation: On seeing the king who ascended the heaven just as a blazing fire suddenly extinguishes, or like the ocean emptied of water or the Sun bereft of splendour Kausalya raised the head of the king on to her lap, her eyes filled with tears and body shrunk in sorrow, looked at Kaikeyi and said:
66_1.word_by_word: संशान्तम् pacified, अग्निमिव like blazing fire, अम्बुहीनम् without water, अर्णवमिव like the ocean, हतप्रभम् bereft of brightness, आदित्यमिव like the Sun, स्वर्गस्थम् ascended heaven, तं पार्थिवम् that king, प्रेक्ष्य on seeing, कौशल्या Kausalya, बाष्पपूर्णाक्षी with her eyes filled with tears, विविधाम् in several ways, शोककर्शिता emaciated with sorrow, राज्ञः king's, शिरः head, उपगृह्य having grasped, कैकेयीं प्रति looking at Kaikeyi, अभाषत uttered.

66_2.shloka: तमग्निमिव संशान्तमम्बुहीनमिवार्णवम्।हतप्रभमिवाऽऽदित्यं स्वर्गस्थं प्रेक्ष्य पार्थिवम्।।2.66.1।।कौसल्या बाष्पपूर्णाक्षी विविधां शोककर्शिता।उपगृह्य शिरो राज्ञः कैकेयीं प्रत्यभाषत।।2.66.2।।
66_2.translation: On seeing the king who ascended the heaven just as a blazing fire suddenly extinguishes, or like the ocean emptied of water or the Sun bereft of splendour Kausalya raised the head of the king on to her lap, her eyes filled with tears and body shrunk in sorrow, looked at Kaikeyi and said:
66_2.word_by_word: संशान्तम् pacified, अग्निमिव like blazing fire, अम्बुहीनम् without water, अर्णवमिव like the ocean, हतप्रभम् bereft of brightness, आदित्यमिव like the Sun, स्वर्गस्थम् ascended heaven, तं पार्थिवम् that king, प्रेक्ष्य on seeing, कौशल्या Kausalya, बाष्पपूर्णाक्षी with her eyes filled with tears, विविधाम् in several ways, शोककर्शिता emaciated with sorrow, राज्ञः king's, शिरः head, उपगृह्य having grasped, कैकेयीं प्रति looking at Kaikeyi, अभाषत uttered.

66_3.shloka: सकामा भव कैकेयि भुङ्क्ष्व राज्यमकण्टकम्।त्यक्त्वा राजानमेकाग्रा नृशंसे दुष्टचारिणि।।2.66.3।।
66_3.translation: O cruel one O perverse wretch, O Kaikeyi, your wishes have been fulfilled. You have forsaken the king, that was your only objective. (Now) enjoy the kingdom alone without any obstacles on your way.
66_3.word_by_word: नृशंसे O cruel one, दुष्टचारिणि O perverse wretch, कैकेयि O Kaikeyi, सकामा भव remain with your wishes fulfilled, राजानम् king, त्यक्त्वा forsaking, एकाग्रा with one objective, अकण्टकम् without any obstacle, राज्यम् kingdom, भुङ्क्ष्व enjoy.

66_4.shloka: विहाय मां गतो रामः भर्ता च स्वर्गतो मम।विपथे सार्थहीनेव नाहं जीवितुमुत्सहे।।2.66.4।।
66_4.translation: Rama has gone away leaving me. My lord has ascended the heaven, traversing the wrong road. With my wellwishers gone, I do not want to live.
66_4.word_by_word: रामः Rama, माम् me, विहाय having left, गतः has gone, मम my, भर्ता च lord also, स्वर्गतः has  ascended heaven, विपथे on a wrong path, सार्थहीनेव without wellwishers अहम् I, जीवितुम् to live, न उत्सहे do not desire.

66_5.shloka: भर्तारं तं परित्यज्य का स्त्री दैवतमात्मनः।इच्छेज्जीवितुमन्यत्र कैकेय्यास्त्यक्तधर्मणः।।2.66.5।।
66_5.translation: Which woman wishes to live, leaving her godlike husband, except Kaikeyi who has given up her sense of duty?
66_5.word_by_word: त्यक्तधर्मणः one who has abandoned righteousness, कैकेय्याः अन्यत्र other than Kaikeyi, का स्त्री which woman, आत्मनः her own, दैवतम् god, तं भर्तारम् her husband, परित्यज्य having abandoned, जीवितुम् to live, इच्छेत् desires.

66_6.shloka: न लुब्धो बुध्यते दोषान् किम्पाकमिव भक्षयन्।कुब्जानिमित्तं कैकेय्या राघवाणां कुलं हतम्।।2.66.6।।
66_6.translation: Like a greedy man who eats the (poisonous) kimpaka fruit without realising the defects of the fruit, Kaikeyi has destroyed the Raghu race on account of the hunchback (Manthara).
66_6.word_by_word: लुब्ध: a greedy man, किम्पाकम् a poisonous fruit of bad taste, भक्षयन्निव as if one has eaten, दोषान् faults, न बुध्यते does not know, कुब्जानिमित्तम् on account of the hunchback, कैकेय्या by Kaikeyi, राघवाणाम् of Raghus, कुलम् race, हतम् is destroyed.

66_7.shloka: अनियोगे नियुक्तेन राज्ञा रामं विवासितम्।सभार्यं जनकश्श्रुत्वा परितप्स्यत्यहं यथा।।2.66.7।।
66_7.translation: Hearing the unrighteous action ordered by the king in banishing Rama and his wife  king Janaka will suffer great agony like me.
66_7.word_by_word: सभार्यम् with wife, रामम् Rama, अनियोगे is an unworthy act, नियुक्तेन ordered, राज्ञा by the king, विवासितम् has been banished, श्रुत्वा having heard, जनकः Janaka, अहं यथा like me, परितप्स्यति will suffer.

66_8.shloka: स मामनाथां विधवां नाद्य जानाति धार्मिकः।रामः कमलपत्राक्षः जीवन्नाशमितो गतः।।2.66.8।।
66_8.translation: That virtuous Rama of lotuspetaleyes has left this place for good, and does not know that I am without a protector, being a widow now.
66_8.word_by_word: धार्मिकः virtuous, कमलपत्राक्षः who has lotuspetal like eyes, जीवन् even though alive, इतः from here, नाशम् destruction, गतः obtained, सः रामः that Rama, अद्य now, माम् me, अनाथाम्  without protector, विधवाम् without husband, न जानाति does not know.

66_9.shloka: विदेहराजस्य सुता तथा सीता तपस्विनी।दुःखस्यानुचिता दुःखं वने पर्युद्विजिष्यति।।2.66.9।।
66_9.translation: In the same way Sita, daughter of the king of Videha, who does not deserve hardships will be in deep agony.
66_9.word_by_word: तथा also, तपस्विनी a miserable woman, दुःखस्य of hardships, अनुचिता unworthy, विदेहराजस्य king Videha's, सुता daughter, सीता Sita, वने in the forest, दुःखम् great sorrow, पर्युद्विजिष्यति will be agitated in her mind.

66_10.shloka: नदतां भीमघोषाणां निशासु मृगपक्षिणाम्।निशम्य नूनं सन्त्रस्ता राघवं संश्रयिष्यति।।2.66.10।।
66_10.translation: Hearing the ghastly sounds of animals and birds, Sita will surely get frightened and take shelter in Rama.
66_10.word_by_word: निशाम् at night, भीमघोषाणाम् ghastly sounds, मृगपक्षिणाम् of animals and birds, नदताम् by those making sounds, निशम्य having heard, सन्त्रस्ता frightened, नूनम्  surely, राघवम् Rama, संश्रयिष्यति will take shelter.

66_11.shloka: वृद्धश्चैवाल्पपुत्रश्च वैदेहीमनुचिन्तयन्।सोऽपि शोकसमाविष्टो ननु त्यक्ष्यति जीवितम्।।2.66.11।।
66_11.translation: Old and sonless Janaka, constantly thinking of Sita and overpowered with grief will surely give up his life.
66_11.word_by_word: वृद्धश्चैव aged, अल्पपुत्रश्च not having sons, सोऽपि that Janaka too, शोकसमाविष्टः  overpowered by grief, वैदेहीम् Sita, अनुचिन्तयन् constantly thinking, जीवितम् life, त्यक्ष्यति ननु will give up indeed.

66_12.shloka: साऽहमद्यैव दिष्टान्तं गमिष्यामि पतिव्रता।इदं शरीर मालिङ्ग्य प्रवेक्ष्यामि हुताशनम्।।2.66.12।।
66_12.translation: As his faithful wife, I shall enter the fire by clasping this (Dasaratha's) body and go to  death today itself
66_12.word_by_word: पतिव्रता of faithful wife, सा अहम् such as myself, अद्यैव now itself, दिष्टान्तम् death, गमिष्यामि will go to, इदम् this, शरीरम् body, आलिङ्ग्य clasping, हुताशनम् in the fire, प्रवेक्ष्यामि I shall enter.

66_13.shloka: तां ततस्सम्परिष्वज्य विलपन्तीं तपस्विनीम्।व्यपनीय सुदुःखार्तां कौसल्यां व्यावहारिकाः।।2.66.13।।
66_13.translation: The servants led away that unfortunate Kausalya who was lamenting in great anguish  embracing the body of Dasaratha.
66_13.word_by_word: व्यावहारिकाः maidservants (those who customarily attend on the queens), सम्परिष्वज्य  having embraced, विलपन्तीम् lamenting, तपस्विनीम् unfortunate, सुदुःखार्ताम् deeply distressed, तां कौशल्याम् to that Kausaya, ततः from there, व्यपनीय removed.

66_14.translation: The counsellors, instructed (by Vasistha and others), placed the king's body in an oil tub with the understanding that the funeral rites were to be performed hereafter.
66_14.word_by_word: अथ thereafter, आदिष्टाः having been instructed, अमात्याः counsellors, जगतीपतिम् the (corpse) of the lord of the world (Dasartha), तैलद्रोण्याम् in an oil tub, संवेश्य keeping, अनन्तरम् thereafter, कर्माणि ceremonies, सर्वाणि all, चक्रुः performed.

66_15.shloka: न तु सङ्कलनं राज्ञो विना पुत्रेण मन्त्रिणः।सर्वज्ञाः कर्तुमीषुस्ते ततो रक्षन्ति भूमिपम्।।2.66.15।।
66_15.translation: The counsellors who were acquainted with all such matters (relating to the king's funeral) were unwilling to perform the obsequies in the absence of any of the king's sons. Meanwhile, they kept watch over the deadbody of the king.
66_15.word_by_word: सर्वज्ञाः conversant with all such matters (relating to the obsequies), मन्त्रिणः counsellors, विना पुत्रेण without sons, राज्ञः king's, सङ्कलनम् funeral obsequies, कर्तुम् to do, न ईषुः did not desire, ततः then, भूमिपम् king's body, रक्षन्ति they are protecting.

66_16.shloka: तैलद्रोण्यां तु सचिवैश्शायितं तं नराधिपम्।हा मृतोऽयमिति ज्ञात्वा स्त्रियस्ताः पर्यदेवयन्।।2.66.16।।
66_16.translation: On seeing the king's body laid in the oil vat by the counsellors, the women cried  Alas, the king is dead.
66_16.word_by_word: सचिवैः by counsellors, तैलद्रोण्याम् in the oil vat, शायितम् made to lay down, तं नराधिपम् that king, ज्ञात्वा on knowing (having seen), हा alas, अयम् this, मृतः is dead, इति in this way, ताः those, स्त्रियः women, पर्यदेवयन् cried.

66_17.shloka: बाहूनुद्यम्य कृपणाः नेत्रप्रस्रवणैर्मुखैः।रुदन्त्य श्शोकसन्तप्ताः कृपणं पर्यदेवयन्।।2.66.17।।
66_17.translation: With tears flowing down their faces, piteously raising their arms, groaning in their burning grief, the women lamented helplessly.
66_17.word_by_word: नेत्रप्रस्रवणैः tears flowing from their eyes, मुखैः with faces, कृपणाः piteously, बाहून् hands, उद्यम्य raising, रुदन्त्यः groaning, शोकसन्तप्ताः burning in grief, कृपणम् helplessly, पर्यदेवयन् lamented.

66_18.shloka: हा महाराज रामेण सततं प्रियवादिना।विहीनास्सत्यसन्धेन किमर्थं विजहासि नः।।2.66.18।।
66_18.translation: When we were already deprived of Rama who was always pleasing and truthful, alas, o great king, why did you leave us?
66_18.word_by_word: हा महाराज Alas, the great king, सततम् always, प्रियवादिना by a man speaking pleasing words, सत्यसन्धेन by one firm in promise, रामेण by Rama, विहीनाः deprived of, नः us, किमर्थम् why, विजहासि are you leaving us?

66_19.shloka: कैकेय्या दुष्टभावायाः राघवेण वियोजिताः।कथं पतिघ्नया वत्स्याम स्समीपे विधवा वयम्।।2.66.19।।
66_19.translation: A woman of evil intentions, Kaikeyi, at first separated us from Rama. Now she deprived us of our husband. How can we live with one who is a slayer of her husband?
66_19.word_by_word: राघवेण by Rama, वियोजिताः separated, वयम् we, विधवाः widows, दुष्टभावायाः one of evil intentions, पतिघ्नयाः slayer of husband, कैकेय्याः Kaikeyi, समीपे near, कथम् how?,वत्स्याघ्नयाम can we stay?

66_20.shloka: स हि नाथस्सदास्माकं तव च प्रभुरात्मवान्।वनं रामो गतश्श्रीमान्विहाय नृपतिश्रियम्।।2.66.20।।
66_20.translation: Rama, who was always our and your selfpossessed master and protector has gone to the forest, indeed, abandoning royal wealth.
66_20.word_by_word: अस्माकम् for us, तव च to you also, सदा always, नाथः protector, प्रभुः master, आत्मवान्  selfpossessed, श्रीमान् prosperous, सः that, रामः Rama, नृपतिश्रियम् royal wealth, विहायleaving, वनम् to the forest, गतः हि has gone indeed.

66_21.shloka: त्वया तेन च वीरेण विना व्यसनमोहिताः।कथं वयं निवत्स्यामः कैकेय्या च विदूषिताः।।2.66.21।।
66_21.translation: Without you and without the heroic Rama, how can we live overwhelmed with grief and enduring the abuses of Kaikeyi?
66_21.word_by_word: त्वया विना without you, तेन वीरेण विना without that hero, व्यसनमोहिताः overwhelmed with grief, वयम् we, कैकेय्या by Kaikeyi, विदूषिताः च having being abused, कथम् how, निवत्स्यामः can we live?

66_22.shloka: यया तु राजा रामश्च लक्ष्मणश्च महाबलः।सीतया सह सन्त्यक्ता स्साकमन्यं न हास्यति।।2.66.22।।
66_22.translation: Why will not Kaikeyi who has abandoned the king, valiant Rama and Lakshmana along with Sita cast aside others?
66_22.word_by_word: यया by such a person (Kaikeyi), राजा the king, रामश्च Rama, महाबलः valiant, लक्ष्मणश्च  also Lakshmana, सीतया सह along with Sita, सन्त्यक्ताः have been abandoned, सा that Kaikeyi, अन्यम् other, कम् whom, न हास्यति will not cast aside?

66_23.shloka: ता बाष्पेण च संवीताश्शोकेन विपुलेन च।व्यवेष्टन्त निरानन्दा राघवस्य वरस्त्रियः।।2.66.23।।
66_23.translation: The excellent wives of Dasaratha, overwhelmed with profound grief and tears, are  lying unconcious on the floor.
66_23.word_by_word: राघवस्य Dasaratha's, ताः वरस्त्रियः those excellent wives, बाष्पेण shedding tears, विपुलेन  with profound, शोकेन च grief, संवीताः overwhelmed, निरानन्दाः cheerlessly, व्यवेष्टन्त are lying unconscious on the  floor.

66_24.shloka: निशा चन्द्रविहीनेव स्त्रीव भर्तृविवर्जिता।पुरी नाराजतायोध्या हीना राज्ञा महात्मना।।2.66.24।।
66_24.translation: Like night without the Moon, like a woman forsaken by her husband, this city of Ayodhya without that magnanimous king has lost its earlier splendour.
66_24.word_by_word: महात्मना by the great, राज्ञा king, हीना deprived, अयोध्यापुरी city of Ayodhya, चन्द्रविहीना devoid of moon, निशेव night, भर्तृविवर्जिता forsaken by husband, स्त्रीव like woman, नाराजत  did not shine.

66_25.translation: With the people of Ayodhya shedding tears, the housewives crying, in anguish, 'alas alas' the courtyards houses and squares of the roads deserted, the city has lost itsearlier brilliance.
66_25.word_by_word: बाष्पपर्याकुलजना filled with people shedding tears, हाहाभूतकुलाङ्गना with the cries of anguish of housewives, शून्यचत्वरवेश्मान्ता infront of their houses and the public squares in between the houses, यथा पुरम् city with its earlier brilliance, न बभ्राज does not shine.

66_26.shloka: गते तु शोकात् त्रिदिवं नराधिपे महीतलस्थासु नृपाङ्गनासु च।निवृत्तचारस्सहसा गतो रविः प्रवृत्तचारा रजनी ह्युपस्थिता।।2.66.26।।
66_26.translation: When king Dasaratha ascended to heaven due to grief over his son and when his wives were lying on the ground, the Sun ceased his journey and the night favourable to creatures of darkness suddenly set in.
66_26.word_by_word: नराधिपे when the king, शोकात् due to grief, त्रिदिवम् towards heaven, गते तु having gone, नृपाङ्गनासु wives of the king, महीतलस्थासु च lying on the ground, रविः the Sun, सहसा instantly, निवृत्तचारः ceased his journey, गतः gone, प्रवृत्तचाराः favourable to nightrangers, रजनी night, उपस्थिता set in.

66_27.shloka: ऋते तु पुत्राद्धहनं महीपतेर्नरोचयन्ते सुहृदस्समागताः।इतीव तस्मिन् शयने न्यवेशयन् वनिचिन्त्य राजानमचिन्त्य दर्शनम्।।2.66.27।।
66_27.translation: The wellwishers who asembled, unwilling to ignite the funeral pyre of the king in the absence of any one of his sons laid the king's deadbody in that oil trough in an unexpected manner.
66_27.word_by_word: समागताः people who assembled there, सुहृदः friends, पुत्रात् ऋते in the absence of a son, महीपतेः king's, दहनम् for igniting funeral pyre, न रोचयन्ते do not agree, इतीव thus, विचिन्त्य  having thought, अचिन्त्य दर्शनम् in an unexpected form, राजानम् king, तस्मिन् शयने on that bed (in that oil trough), न्यवेशयन् laid.

66_28.shloka: गतप्रभा द्यौरिव भास्करं विना व्यपेतनक्षत्रगणेव शर्वरी।पुरी बभासे रहिता महात्मना न चास्रकण्ठाऽकुलमार्गचत्वरा।।2.66.28।।
66_28.translation: The city, bereft of illustrious Dasaratha was filled with people sobbing in the courtyards in front of their houses and in the squares in between. That city of Ayodhya bereft of brightness, appeared like the day without the Sun and the night without constellations of stars.
66_28.word_by_word: महात्मना by the great Dasaratha, रहिता bereft of, अस्रकण्ठाकुलमार्गचत्वरा courtyards in front of their houses and the squares on the roads filled with people sobbing, पुरी Ayodhya, भास्करं विना without the Sun, द्यौरिव like the sky, व्यपेतनक्षत्रगणाः with crowds of stars, शर्वरीवlike night, गतप्रभा having lost the brightness, न बभासे did not shine.

66_29.shloka: नराश्च नार्यश्च समेत्य सङ्घशः विगर्हमाणा भरतस्य मातरम्।तदा नगर्यां नरदेवसङ्क्षये बभूवुरार्ता न च शर्म लेभिरे।।2.66.29।।
66_29.translation: After the demise of the king, men and women in the city assembled in groups and denounced the mother of Bharata. Extremely distressed, they had no peace of mind.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे षट्षष्टितमस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the sixtysixth sarga in Ayodhyakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
66_29.word_by_word: तदा then, नरदेवसङ्क्षये after the demise of the king, नगर्याम् in the city, नराश्च men, नार्यश्च women, सङ्घशः in groups, समेत्य assembled, भरतस्य Bharata's, मातरम् mother, विगर्हमाणाः denounced, आर्ताः बभूवुः became extremely distressed, शर्म peace, न च लेभिरे did not have

67_1.shloka: [Ministers and brahmins speak about the miserable state of a kingdom without king -- urge Vasistha to name the heir apparent for Ayodhya.]आक्रन्दितनिरानन्दा सास्रकण्ठजनाकुला।अयोध्यायामवतता सा व्यतीयाय शर्वरी।।2.67.1।।
67_1.translation: The night stretched interminably in Ayodhya, which was filled with sobbing people  rendered cheerless by their lamentations.
67_1.word_by_word: अयोध्यायाम् in Ayodhya, आक्रन्दितनिरानन्दा rendered cheerless by the lamentations, सास्रकण्ठजनाकुला filled with sobbing people, अवतताः stretched interminably, सा शर्वरी that night, व्यतीयाय passed away.

67_2.shloka: व्यतीतायां तु शर्वर्यामादित्यस्योदये ततः।समेत्य राजकर्तारः सभामीयुर्द्विजातयः।।2.67.2।।
67_2.translation: When the night finally ended and after the sunrise next day, the brahmins who perform royal investiture having been called and reached the assembly hall.
67_2.word_by_word: ततः then, शर्वर्याम् when the night, व्यतीतायां तु passed, आदित्यस्य उदये at sunrise, राजकर्तारः those who perform royal investiture, द्विजातयः brahmins, समेत्य having been called, सभाम्assembly hall, ईयुः reached.

67_3.shloka: मार्कण्डेयोऽथ मौद्गल्यो वामदेवश्च काश्यपः।कात्यायनो गौतमश्च जाबालिश्च महायशाः।।2.67.3।।एते द्विजा स्सहामात्यैः पृथग्वा च मुदीरयन्।वसिष्ठमेवाभिमुखाः श्रेष्ठं राजपुरोहितम्।।2.67.4।।
67_3.translation: Markandeya, Maudgalya, Kasyapa, Katyayana, Gautama, Jabali of great renown   accompanied by ministers and brahmins approached Vasistha, the chief  priest of the king and expressed different opinions (on the investiture).
67_3.word_by_word: मार्कण्डेयः Markandeya, अथ and, मौद्गल्यः Maudgalya, अथ also, काश्यपः Kasyapa, कात्यायनः Katyayana, गौतमश्च Gautama also, महायशाः of great renown, जाबालिश्च Jabali too, एते  these, द्विजाः brahmins, अमात्यैः सह with ministers, श्रेष्ठम् the chief, राजपुरोहितम् king's priest, वसिष्ठमेव Vasistha himself, अभिमुखाः approached, पृथक् different, वाचम् opinions  उदीरयन् expressed.

67_4.shloka: अतीता शर्वरी दुःखं या नो वर्षशतोपमा।अस्मिन्पञ्चत्वमापन्ने पुत्रशोकेन पार्थिवे।।2.67.5।।
67_4.translation: While king Dasaratha died on account of grief over (separation from) his son and rejoined the five elements, the sorrowful night seemed like a hundred years for us. (commented the assembly of ministers).
67_4.word_by_word: अस्मिन् पार्थिवे this king, पुत्रशोकेन out of grief over (seperation from) his son, पञ्चत्वम् dissolution into the five elements (death), आपन्ने having attained, या that night, नः for us, वर्षशतोपमा like a hundred years, शर्वरी such night, दुःखम्  sorrowful, अतीता passed.

67_5.shloka: स्वर्गतश्च महाराजो रामश्चारण्यमाश्रितः।लक्ष्मणश्चापि तेजस्वी रामेणैव गतस्सह।।2.67.6।।
67_5.translation: The great king has attained heaven, Rama has taken refuge in the forest and brilliant Lakshmana has also gone with Rama.
67_5.word_by_word: महाराजः the great king, स्वर्गतश्च had attained heaven, रामश्च Rama also, अरण्यम् in the forest, आश्रितः taken refuge, तेजस्वी lustrous, लक्ष्मणश्च Lakshmana, रामेणैव सह with Rama, गतः went.

67_6.shloka: उभौ भरतशत्रुघ्नौ केकयेषु परन्तपौ।पुरे राजगृहे रम्ये मातामहनिवेशने।।2.67.7।।
67_6.translation: Bharata and Satrughna, destroyers of enemies, are at the beautiful city of Rajagriha in the Kekaya kingdom, the palace of their maternal grandfather's palace.
67_6.word_by_word: परन्तपौ destroyers of enemies, भरतशत्रुघ्नौ Bharata and Satrughna, उभौ both, केकयेषु in the Kekaya kingdom, राजगृहे at Rajagriha, पुरे city, रम्ये beautiful, मातामहनिवेशने are in maternal grandfather's palace.

67_7.shloka: इक्ष्वाकूणामिहाद्यैव कश्चिद्राजा विधीयताम्।अराजकं हि नो राष्ट्रं विनाशं समवाप्नुयात्।।2.67.8।।
67_7.translation: Therefore, let someone from the race of Ikshvakus be appointed king right now.  since without a king, the country will be destroyed.
67_7.word_by_word: इक्ष्वाकूणाम् in the race of Ikshvakus, कश्चित् anyone, इह here, अद्यैव right now, राजा as king, विधीयताम् should be made, अराजकम् without a king, नः our, राष्ट्रम् country, विनाशम्  destruction, (सम् अव) आप्नुयात् will attain.

67_8.shloka: नाराजके जनपदे विद्युन्माली महास्वनः।अभिवर्षति पर्जन्यो महीं दिव्येन वारिणा।।2.67.9।।
67_8.translation: In a country without a king, thunderous clouds garlanded by lightning would no longer water the earth with celestial showers.
