67_8.word_by_word: अराजके where there is no king, जनपदे in a country, विद्युन्माली garlanded with a row of lightning, महास्वनः thunderous, पर्जन्यः raingod, महीम् the earth, दिव्येन with celestial, वारिणा with rain, नाभिवर्षति does not shower.

67_9.shloka: नाराजके जनपदे बीजमुष्टिः प्रकीर्यते।नाराजके पितुः पुत्रो भार्या वा वर्तते वशे।।2.67.10।।
67_9.translation: Where there is no king, even a handful of seeds will not be sown (will not sprout). In a kingless kingdom, a son or a wife will not obey the father (head of the family).
67_9.word_by_word: अराजके where there is no king, जनपदे in a country, बीजमुष्टिः handfuls of seeds, न प्रकीर्यते will not be sown (sprout), अराजके where there no king, पुत्र: son, भार्या वा or wife, पितुः father's, वशे control, न वर्तते do not remain.

67_10.shloka: नाराजके धनं चास्ति नास्ति भार्या प्यराजके।इद मत्याहितं चान्यत्कुतस्सत्य मराजके।।2.67.11।।
67_10.translation: In a kingdom without a king wealth cannot be preserved, no wife would like to stay (with her husband). There is one more cause for a great peril, that is, there is no place for truth in a country (where there is no king).
67_10.word_by_word: अराजके when there is no king, धनम् wealth, नास्ति not, अराजके without a king, भार्यापि even wife, नास्ति is not, अत्याहितम् cause of great peril, अन्यत् another, इदं च this one also exists, अराजके where there no king, सत्यम् truth, कुतः where?

67_11.shloka: नाराजके जनपदे कारयन्ति सभां नराः।उद्यानानि च रम्याणि हृष्टाः पुण्यगृहाणि च।।2.67.12।।
67_11.translation: In a country where there is no king, no assemblies are convened by pleasure seeking people, nor do they build delightful gardens or sacred edifices.
67_11.word_by_word: अराजके where there is no king, जनपदे in a country, नराः people, हृष्टाः rejoiced, सभाम्  assembly, रम्याणि delightful, उद्यानानि gardens, पुण्यगृहाणि sacred edifices (like temples), न कारयन्ति are not built.

67_12.shloka: नाराजके जनपदे यज्ञशीला द्विजातयः।सत्राण्यन्वासते दान्ता ब्राह्मणा स्संशितव्रताः।।2.67.13।।
67_12.translation: In a country without a king, selfcontrolled brahmins in charge of sacrificial ceremonies, wellversed in the study of Vedas and strict followers of  austerity will not function.
67_12.word_by_word: अराजके without a king, जनपदे in a country, यज्ञशीलाः where sacrificial ceremonies are conducted, दान्ताः selfcontrolled, ब्राह्मणाः versed in the study of Vedas, संशितव्रताः of rigorous austerity, द्विजातयः brahmins, सत्राणि sacrifices, न अन्वासते do not practise.

67_13.shloka: नाराजके जनपदे महायज्ञेषु यज्वनः।ब्राह्मणा वसुसम्पन्ना विसृजन्त्याप्तदक्षिणाः।।2.67.14।।
67_13.translation: In a country without a king wealthy brahmins, who have performed great sacrifices, do not offer abundance of gifts to the officiating priests.
67_13.word_by_word: अराजके without a king, जनपदे in a country, महायज्ञेषु in great sacrifices, यज्वनः the officiating priests, वसुसम्पन्नाः wealthy, ब्राह्मणाः brahmins, आप्तदक्षिणाः abundant gifts, न विसृजन्ति do not offer.

67_14.shloka: नाराजके जनपदे प्रभूतनटनर्तकाः।उत्सवाश्च समाजाश्च वर्धन्ते राष्ट्रवर्धनाः।।2.67.15।।
67_14.translation: In a country without a king, celebrations of associations promoting the welfare of the country, actors and dancers in large numbers do not prosper.
67_14.word_by_word: अराजके where there is no king, जनपदे in a country, प्रभूतनटनर्तकाः actors and dancers in large numbers, राष्ट्रवर्धनाः promoting the welfare of the country, उत्सवाश्च celebrations, समाजाश्च assemblies, न वर्धन्ते do not prosper.

67_15.shloka: नाराजके जनपदे सिद्धार्था व्यवहारिणः।कथाभिरनुरज्यन्ते कथाशीलाः कथाप्रियैः।।2.67.16।।
67_15.translation: Where there is no king, those engaged in lawsuits will not succeed and those who are accustomed to storytelling will not entertain those who love to listen to stories.
67_15.word_by_word: अराजके where there is no king, जनपदे in a country, व्यवहारिणः those engaged inlawsuits, सिद्धार्थाः succeed, न not, कथाशीलाः those who are accustomed to storytelling, कथाप्रियैः with those who love to listen to stories, कथाभिः with stories, न अनुरज्यन्ते are not entertained.

67_16.shloka: नाराजके जनपदे उद्यानानि समागताः।सायाह्ने क्रीडितुं यान्ति कुमार्यो हेमभूषिताः।।2.67.17।।
67_16.translation: In a country without a king, young ladies adorned with golden ornaments no longer meet in the evening at the pleasure garden for sporting.
67_16.word_by_word: अराजके without a king, जनपदे in a country, हेमभूषिताः adorned with golden ornaments, कुमार्यः maidens, समागताः having met together, सायाह्ने in the evening, क्रीडितुम् for sporting, उद्यानानि in the pleasure gardens, नयान्ति will not go.

67_17.shloka: नाराजके जनपदे वाहनै शशीघ्रगामिभिः।नरा निर्यान्त्यरण्यानि नारीभिस्सह कामिनः।।2.67.18।।
67_17.translation: In a country without a king, pleasureseeking men will not drive in the woods on swiftmoving chariots with women.
67_17.word_by_word: अराजके without a king, जनपदे in a country, कामिनः pleasureseeking men, नराः men,नारीभिः with women too, शीघ्रगामिभिः by swift moving, वाहनैः chariots, अरण्यानि in the woods (for recreation), न निर्यान्ति will not go.

67_18.translation: In a country without a king, wealthy people who live on farming and raising cattle cannot sleep safely in their homes with doors wide open.
67_18.word_by_word: अराजके without a king, जनपदे in a country, कृषिगोरक्षजीविनः living by farming and  protecting cattle, धनवन्तः wealthy people, सुरक्षिताः wellprotected, विवृतद्वाराः with thedoors wide open, न शेरते do not sleep.

67_19.shloka: नाराजके जनपदे बद्धघण्टाविषाणिनः।अटन्ति राजमार्गेषु कुञ्जरा षष्टिहायनाः।।2.67.20।।
67_19.translation: In a country without a king, young elephants of sixty years of age, their tusks adorned with bells no longer wander about on the highways.
67_19.word_by_word: अराजके without a king, जनपदे in a country, षष्टिहायनाः sixty years of age, कुञ्जराः elephants, बद्धघण्टाविषाणिनः of tusks adorned with bells, राजमार्गेषु on the highways, न अटन्ति will not wander about.

67_20.translation: In a country without a king, the sounds of the ceaseless discharge of arrows and practice of weapons, the clappings of the cord on the skin shield of shooters throwing the arrows are no longer heard.
67_20.word_by_word: अराजके without a king, जनपदे in a country, इष्वस्त्राणाम् arrows and weapons, उपासने practising (the discharge of), सन्ततम् ceaselessly, शरान् arrows, अस्यताम् shooters  throwing, तलनिर्घोषः clappings of the cord on the skin shield (Tala means a protectivecovering made of hard skin worn on the left hand to prevent injury), न श्रूयते are not heard.

67_21.shloka: नाराजके जनपदे वणिजो दूरगामिनः।गच्छन्ति क्षेममध्वानं बहुपण्यसमाचिताः।।2.67.22।।
67_21.translation: In a country without a king merchants travelling long distances with several kinds of saleable goods cannot go safely on their way.
67_21.word_by_word: अराजके without a king, जनपदे in a country, दूरगामिनः travelling long distances, वणिजःmerchants, बहुपण्यसमाचिताः with several kinds of marketable goods, क्षेमम् safely, अध्वानम् on the way, न गच्छन्ति do not go.

67_22.shloka: नाराजके जनपदे चरत्येकचरो वशी।भावयन्नात्मनाऽत्मानं यत्र सायंगृहो मुनिः।।2.67.23।।
67_22.translation: In a country where there is no king, an ascetic who (normally) moves alone, selfcontrolled and contemplating on the higher self no longer wanders or rests in the inn.
67_22.word_by_word: अराजके where there is no king, जनपदे in a country, एकचरः moving alone, वशी selfcontrolled, आत्मना in mind, आत्मानाम् on the higher self, भावयन् contemplating, यत्रसायं गृहः inn, मुनिः ascetic, न चरति does not wander.

67_23.shloka: नाराजके जनपदे योगक्षेमं प्रवर्तते।नचाप्यराजके सेना शत्रून्विषहते युधि।।2.67.24।।
67_23.translation: In a country without a king, there is no security of possessions and the army cannot withstand the  enemy in a battle.
67_23.word_by_word: नाराजके without a king, जनपदे in a country, योगक्षेमम् security of possession, न प्रवर्ततेdoes not exist, अराजके without a king, सेना army, युधि in a battle, शत्रून् enemies, न विषहते not be able to oppose.

67_24.shloka: नाराजके जनपदे हृष्टैः परमवाजिभिः।नरास्संयान्ति सहसा रथैश्च परिमण्डिताः।।2.67.25।।
67_24.translation: In a country without a king, welldressed men are no longer enthusiastic to drive on excellent horses and on chariots.
67_24.word_by_word: अराजके without a king, जनपदे in the country, नराः men, परिमण्डिताः welldressed, हृष्टैः enthusiastically, परमवाजिभिः of excellent horses, रथैश्च chariots, सहसा at once, न संयान्तिwill not go.

67_25.translation: In a country with no king people proficient in scriptures do not withdraw to the forests and (recreational) gardens for debates (on scriptures).
67_25.word_by_word: अराजके with no king, जनपदे in the country, शास्त्रविशारदाः those wellversed in scriptures, नराः people, वनेषु in the forests, उपवनेषु च in the (recreational) gardens, संवदन्तः conversing, न अवतिष्ठन्ते do not stay.

67_26.translation: In a country where there is no king, people who are disciplined in spiritual practices do not offer garlands of flowers, sweetmeats and alms while worshipping gods.
67_26.word_by_word: अराजके where there is no king, जनपदे in the country, नियतैः by disciplined ones in spiritual practices, जनैः people, देवताभ्यर्चनार्थाय for worshipping the gods, माल्यमोदकदक्षिणाः garlands of flowers, sweetmeats and alms, न कल्प्यन्ते  do not arrange.

67_27.shloka: नाराजके जनपदे चन्दनागरुरूषिताः।राजपुत्रा विराजन्ते वसन्त इव शाखिनः।।2.67.28।।
67_27.translation: In a country where there is no king, the princes, anointed with sandal paste and agaru, no longer look graceful like blosoming trees in spring time.
67_27.word_by_word: अराजके where there is no king, जनपदे in the country, राजपुत्रा: princes, चन्दनागरुरूषिताः  anointed with sandal paste and agaru, वसन्ते in spring time, शाखिनः इव like trees, न राजन्ते do not look graceful.

67_28.shloka: यथा ह्यनुदका नद्यः यथा वाऽप्यतृणं वनम्।अगोपाला यथा गावस्तथा राष्ट्रमराजकम्।।2.67.29।।
67_28.translation: (The kingdom without a king) is like rivers without water, forests without vegetation and  cows without cowherds.
67_28.word_by_word: अनुदकाः without water, नद्यः rivers, यथा as, आतृणम् without vegetation, वनम् forest, यथा वा or as, आगोपालाः without cowherds, गावः cows, यथा as, अराजकम् without a king, राष्ट्रम्  country, तथा is like that.

67_29.shloka: ध्वजो रथस्य प्रज्ञानं धूमो ज्ञानं विभावसोः।तेषां यो नो ध्वजो राजा स देवत्वमितो गतः।।2.66.30।।
67_29.translation: The pennant is an identification for one's chariot. Smoke is a mark of identifying fire. All of us are recognised by the pennant (magnanimity) of the king and such a king has gone to heaven.
67_29.word_by_word: रथस्य of the chariot, ध्वजः the pennant, प्रज्ञानम् a mark of identification, विभावसोः for fire, धूमः smoke, ज्ञानम् is a mark of identification, तेषाम् for such, नः for us, यः that, ध्वजः  pennant  (with his magnanimity we are recognised), सः राजा that king, इतः from here, देवत्वम् to heaven, गतः has gone.

67_30.shloka: नाराजके जनपदे स्वकं भवति कस्यचित्।मत्स्या इव नरा नित्यं भक्षयन्ति परस्परम्।।2.67.31।।
67_30.translation: In a country where there is no king, no one can own anything and, like fish, people devour one another ceaselessly.
67_30.word_by_word: अराजके where there is no king, जनपदे in the country, कस्य चित् for any one, स्वकम् as his own, न भवति does not exist, नराः men, मत्स्याः इव like fish, नित्यम् ceaselessly, परस्परम्  one another, भक्षयन्ति devour.

67_31.shloka: ये हि सम्भिन्नमर्यादा नास्तिकाश्छिन्नसंशयाः।तेऽपि भावाय कल्पन्ते राजदण्डनिपीडिताः।।2.67.32।।
67_31.translation: Atheists, who disregard the bounds of morality and live freely dispelling doubts will tend to follow virtuous path out of fear when subjected to royal punishment.
67_31.word_by_word: सम्भिन्नमर्यादाः those disregarding the bounds of morality, छिन्नसंशयाः dispelling doubts, ये हि those, नास्तिकाः atheists, तेऽपि they also, राजदण्डनिपीडिताः when subjected to royal  punishment, भावाय for virtuous path, कल्पन्ते adopt.

67_32.shloka: यथा दृष्टि श्शरीरस्य नित्यमेव प्रवर्तते।तथा नरेन्द्रो राष्ट्रस्य प्रभवस्सत्यधर्मयोः।।2.67.33।।
67_32.translation: The king is the source for protecting the truth and morality of a country like the eyewhich perpetually watches the welfare of the body.
67_32.word_by_word: दृष्टिः eye, नित्यमेव perpetually, यथा as, शरीरस्य of the body (for its protection), प्रवर्तते is engaged, तथा similarly, नरेन्द्रः king, राष्ट्रस्य for the country's, सत्यधर्मयोः for truth and ethics, प्रभवः is the source.

67_33.shloka: राजा सत्यं च धर्मश्च राजा कुलवतां कुलम्।राजा माता पिता चैव राजा हितकरो नृणाम्।।2.67.34।।
67_33.translation: The king is the protector of truth and righteousness, of men of good families. He is father, and mother. He alone renders welfare of the people.
67_33.word_by_word: राजा king, सत्यं च truth, धर्मश्च righteousness, राजा king, कुलवताम् for men of good families, कुलम् family, राजा king alone, माता mother, पिताचैव father also, राजा king, नृणाम् for people, हितकरः one who renders welfare.

67_34.shloka: यमो वैश्रवण श्शक्रः वरुणश्च महाबलः।विशेष्यन्ते नरेन्द्रेण वृत्तेन महता ततः।।2.67.35।।
67_34.translation: Hence, the king with his excellent conduct surpasses mighty Yama, Vaisravana, Indra and Varuna.
67_34.word_by_word: ततः for that reason, यमः lord of death, Yama, वैश्रवणः Vaisravana, शक्रः Indra, महाबलः  mighty, वरुणश्च Varuna, नरेन्द्रेण by the king, महता excellent, वृत्तेन with conduct विशेष्यन्ते are surpassed.

67_35.shloka: अहो तम इवेदं स्यान्नप्रज्ञायेत किञ्चन।राजा चे न्न भवे ल्लोके विभज साध्वसाधुनी।।2.67.36।।
67_35.translation: If the king did not show the distinction between the good and evil actions, this world would have been enveloped by darkness. Nothing could have been seen. How great (is the king)?
67_35.word_by_word: अहो how great, राजा a king, साध्वसाधुनी good and evil actions, विभजन् showing the distinction, लोके in the world, न भवेद्यदि if it were not to happen, इदम् this, तमः स्यात्  would be darkness, किञ्चन even a little, न प्रज्ञायेत could not have been known.

67_36.shloka: जीवत्यपि महाराजे तवैव वचनं वयम्।नातिक्रमामहे सर्वे वेलां प्राप्येव सागरः।।2.67.37।।
67_36.translation: Even while the great king was alive, we never defied your word like the ocean which does not overstep its shore.
67_36.word_by_word: महाराजे when the great king, जीवत्यपि was alive also, वयम् we, सर्वे all, सागरः sea, वेलाम्  shore, प्राप्येव after reaching, तव your, वचनमेव words, नातिक्रमामहे never overstepped.

67_37.shloka: स न स्समीक्ष्य द्विजवर्य वृत्तं नृपं विना राज्यमरण्यभूतम्।कुमारमिक्ष्वाकुसुतं वदान्यं त्वमेव राजानमिहाभिषिञ्च।।2.67.38।।
67_37.translation: O Vasistha, the best of brahmins, considering all that has happened and knowing that a kingdom without a king is like a forest, you may consecrate a generous son from  the Ikshvaku race as our king.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे सप्तषष्टितमस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the sixtyseventh sarga in Ayodhyakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
67_37.word_by_word: द्विजवर्य O best of brahmins, सः you, वृत्तम् all that has happened, समीक्ष्य having considered, नृपं विना without a king, राज्यम् kingdom, अरण्यभूतम् like a forest, त्वमेव yourself, इह here, वदान्यम् generous, इक्ष्वाकु सुतम् born in the Ikshvaku race, कुमारम् son, नः for us, राजानम् as king, अभिषिञ्च consecrate him.

68_1.shloka: [Messengers are sent to get Bharata and Satrughna -- Messengers reach Rajagrha the maternal home of Bharata]तेषां हि वचनं श्रुत्वा वसिष्ठः प्रत्युवाच ह।मित्रामात्यगणान्सर्वान्ब्राह्मणांस्तानिदं वचः।।2.68.1।।
68_1.translation: Having listened to their (the counsellors') words, Vasistha replied to the host of friends and counsellors of the king  and to all the brahmins:
68_1.word_by_word: तेषाम् their, वचनं words, श्रुत्वा having listened, वसिष्टः Vasistha, तान् those, मित्रामात्यगणान्  host of friends and counsellors (of the king), सर्वान् all, ब्राह्मणान् brahmins, इदं वचः these words, प्रत्युवाचह said in reply.

68_2.shloka: यदसौ मातुलकुले दत्तराज्यं परं सुखी।भरतो वसति भ्रात्रा शत्रुघ्नेन समन्वितः।।2.68.2।।तच्छीघ्रं जवना दूता गच्छन्तु त्वरितैर्हयैः।आनेतुं भ्रातरौ वीरौ किं समीक्षामहे वयम्।।2.68.3।।
68_2.translation: Bharata on whom the kingdom has been conferred is living comfortably in his maternal uncle's house. Let swift messengers go quickly  on speeding horses and bring back the valiant brothers, Bharata and Satrughna. What is there to deliberate for us in this matter?
68_2.word_by_word: दत्तराज्यम् on whom the kingdom  has been conferred, असौ भरतः that Bharata, भ्रात्रा with his brother, शत्रुघ्नेन with Satrughna, समन्वितः accompanied by, यत् since, मातुलकुले in maternal uncle's house, परम् extremely, सुखी happy, वसति is living, तत् for that reason, वीरौ two valiant, भ्रातरौ brothers, आनेतुम् to bring, जवनाः swift ones, दूताः messengers, त्वरितैः by high speed, हयैः on horses, शीघ्रम् quickly, गच्छन्तु let them go, वयम् we, किम् what, समीक्षामहे shall we deliberate.

68_3.shloka: गच्छन्त्विति तत स्सर्वे वसिष्ठं वाक्यमब्रुवन्।तेषां तद्वचनं श्रूत्वा वसिष्ठो वाक्यमब्रवीत्।।2.68.4।।
68_3.translation: Let the messengers go, said all of them to Vasistha. On hearing this, Vasistha  replied again.
68_3.word_by_word: ततः after that, गच्छन्तु let them go, इति thus, सर्वे all, वसिष्ठम् addressing Vasistha, वाक्यम् words, अब्रुवन् uttered, तेषाम् their, तत् those, वचनम् words, श्रुत्वा on hearing, वसिष्ठः Vasistha, वाक्यम् words, अब्रवीत् said.

68_4.shloka: एहि सिद्धार्थ विजय जयन्ताशोक नन्दन।श्रूयतामिति कर्तव्यं सर्वानेव ब्रवीमि वः।।2.68.5।।
68_4.translation: Calling Siddhartha, Vijaya, Jayanta, Asoka and Nandana, Vasistha said, All of you  listen to what is required to be done (by you).
68_4.word_by_word: सिद्धार्थ O Siddhartha, विजय O Vijaya, जयन्त O Jayanta, अशोक O Asoka, नन्दन O Nandana, एहि come, वः us, सर्वानेव addressing all of you, (अहम् I), ब्रवीमि am telling, इतिकर्तव्यम् what is required to be done, श्रूयाताम् hear.

68_5.shloka: पुरं राजगृहं गत्वा शीघ्रं शीघ्रजवै र्हयैः।त्यक्तशोकैरिदं वाच्य श्शासनाद्भरतो मम।।2.68.6।।
68_5.translation: Go at once from here on swift horses to the city of Rajagrha and concealing signs of grief, convey these words to Bharata as my command:
68_5.word_by_word: (इतः from here), शीघ्रजवैः go swiftly, हयैः on horses, राजगृहम् to Rajagrha, पुरम् city, गत्वा  having gone, त्यक्त शोकैः concealing signs of grief, भरतः Bharata, मम my, शासनात् by command, इदम् these words, वाच्यः should be told.

68_6.shloka: पुरोहित स्त्वां कुशलं प्राह सर्वे च मन्त्रिणः।त्वरमाणश्च निर्याहि कृत्यमात्ययिकं त्वया।।2.68.7।।
68_6.translation: The family priest and all the counsellors  wish your welfare. You must return in haste. There is an urgent task required to be done by you.
68_6.word_by_word: पुरोहितः the family priest, त्वाम् your, कुशलम् welfare, प्राह has wished, सर्वे all, मन्त्रिणश्च counsellors too, त्वरमाणः च in all haste, निर्याहि return, त्वया by you, आत्ययिकम् urgent,कृत्यम् task exists.

68_7.shloka: मा चास्मै प्रोषितं रामं मा चास्मै पितरं मृतम्।भवन्त श्शंसिषुर्गत्वा राघवाणामिमं क्षयम्।।2.68.8।।
68_7.translation: All of you go there and do not communicate (to Bharata) about the exile of Rama or the demise of his father and the disaster that has befallen the Raghus.
68_7.word_by_word: भवन्तः all of you, गत्वा having gone, आस्मै to him, रामम् Rama, प्रोषितम् been exiled to the forest, मा शंसिषुः shall not be communicated, पितरम् father's, मृतम् demise, राघवाणाम् of Raghus, इमम् this, क्षयम् decline, मा शंसिषुः shall not communicate.

68_8.shloka: कौशेयानि च वस्त्राणि भूषणानि वराणि च।क्षिप्रमादय राज्ञश्च भरतस्य च गच्छत।।2.68.9।।
68_8.translation: Take with you silk garments and precious ornaments for the king of Kekaya and Bharata and depart at once.
68_8.word_by_word: राज्ञश्च the kings, भरतस्य च to Bharata, कौशेयानि वस्त्राणि silk garments, वराणि precious, भूषणानि च ornaments, आदाय taking with you, क्षिप्रम् गच्छत immediately go.

68_9.shloka: दत्तपथ्यशना दूता जग्मुस्स्वं स्वं निवेशनम्।केकयां स्ते गमिष्यन्तो हयानारुह्य संमतान्।।2.68.10।।
68_9.translation: The messengers set to depart to Kekaya kingdom, carrying with them the necessariesfor their journey went to their respective homes mounted on  excellent horses.
68_9.word_by_word: केकयान् to Kekaya kingdom, गमिष्यन्तः departing, ते दूताः those mesengers, दत्तपथ्यशनाः  necessaries for the journey, सम्मतान् excellent, हयान् horses, आरुह्य having mounted, स्वं स्वम् their respective, निवेशनम् house, जग्मुः went.

68_10.shloka: ततः प्रास्थानिकं कृत्वा कार्यशेषमनन्तरम्।वसिष्ठेनाभ्यनुज्ञाता दूता स्संत्वरिता ययुः।।2.68.11।।
68_10.translation: Having completed the rest of the arrangements for the journey and permitted by  Vasistha, the messengers left.
68_10.word_by_word: ततः then, दूताः messengers, प्रास्थानिकम् for the journey, अनन्तरम् required to be done, कार्यशेषम् rest of the arrangements, कृत्वा having done, वसिष्ठेन by Vasistha, अभ्यनुज्ञाताः  permitted, संत्वरिताः in haste, ययुः went out.

68_11.shloka: न्यन्तेनापरतालस्य प्रलम्बस्योत्तरं प्रति।निषेवमाणा स्ते जग्मुर्नदीं मध्येन मालिनीम्।।2.68.12।।
68_11.translation: The messengers proceeded in westerly direction for some distance and then crossed the southern end of the Aparatala mountain. Thereafter, they travelled northward along the bank of Malini that flows in between Aparatala and Pralamba mountains.
68_11.word_by_word: ते those messengers, अपरतालस्य Aparatala mountain, न्यन्तेन to the west of it, प्रलम्बस्य Pralamba mountain, उत्तरं प्रति to the north of, मध्येन in between, मालिनीं नदीम् river Malini, निषेवमाणाः serving, जग्मुः went.

68_12.shloka: ते हस्तिनापुरे गङ्गां तीर्त्वा प्रत्यङ्मुखा ययुः।पाञ्चालदेशमासाद्य मध्येन कुरुजाङ्गलम्।।2.68.13।।सरांसि च सुपूर्णानि नदीश्च विमलोदकाः।निरीक्षमाणा स्ते जग्मुर्दूताः कार्यवशाद्द्रुतम्।।2.68.14।।
68_12.translation: The messengers crossed Ganga at Hastinapura, and went in the westerly direction through the middle of Kurujangala and reached the country of Panchala. Beholding lakes full of water and rivers of pellucid waters there, they travelled fast with a view to fulfilling their mission.
68_12.word_by_word: ते दूताः those messengers, हस्तिनापुरे at Hastinapura, गङ्गाम् Ganga, तीर्त्वा having crossed, प्रत्यङ्मुखाः in the westerly direction, ययुः went, मध्येन कुरुजाङ्गलम् through themiddle of Kurujangala, पाञ्चालदेशम् Panchala country, आसाद्य having reached, सुपूर्णानि filled with water, सरांसि च lakes, विमलोदकाः of pellucid waters, नदीश्च rivers, निरीक्षमाणाः  beholding, कार्यवशात् with a view to fulfil their mission, द्रुतम्  fast, जग्मुः went.

68_13.shloka: ते प्रसन्नोदकां दिव्यां नानाविहगसेविताम्।उपातिजग्मुर्वेगेन शरदण्डां जनाकुलाम्।।2.68.15।।
68_13.translation: The messengers crossed the divine Saradanda of calm waters frequented by fowls of various speices and thronged with people. And proceeded speedily.
68_13.word_by_word: ते those messengers, प्रसन्नोदकाम् of calm waters, दिव्याम् divine, नानाविहगसेविताम्    frequented by fowls of various species, जनाकुलाम् thronged with people, शरदण्डाम् Saradanda river, उपातिजग्मुः crossed and went.

68_14.shloka: निकूलवृक्षमासाद्य दिव्यं सत्योपयाचनम्।अभिगम्याभिवाद्यं तं कुलिङ्गां प्राविशन्पुरीम्।।2.68.16।।
68_14.translation: They reached a divine tree (of great powers) known as Satyopayachana tree and having gone round and paid homage they entered the Kulinga city.
68_14.word_by_word: दिव्यम् divine, सत्योपयाचनम् Satyopayachana (a tree granting the wishes of those who pray for), निकूलवृक्षम् a tree on the bank, आसाद्य having reached, अभिवाद्यम् paying homage, तम् that one, अभिगम्य having reached, कुलिङ्गांपुरीम् Kulinga city, प्राविशन् entered.

68_15.shloka: आभिकालं ततः प्राप्य ते बोधिभवनाच्च्युताम्।पितृपैतामहीं पुण्यां तेरुरिक्षुमतीं नदीम्।।2.68.17।।
68_15.translation: From there they reached a village known as Abhikala and crossed the sacred Ikshumati flowing from Bodhibhavana mountain. This region was enjoyed by fathers and forefathers of Dasaratha.
68_15.word_by_word: ततः from there, ते they, अभिकालम् a village known as Abhikala, प्राप्य having reached, बोधिभवनात् from Bodhibhavana mountain, च्युताम् flowing, पितृपैतामहीम् enjoyed by fathers and forefathers, पुण्याम् sacred, इक्षुमतीम् Ikshumati river, तेरुः crossed.

68_16.shloka: अवेक्ष्याञ्जलिपानांश्च ब्राह्मणान्वेदपारगान्।ययुर्मध्येन बाह्लीकान् सुदामानं च पर्वतम्।।2.68.18।।
68_16.translation: There they saw the brahmins versed in the Vedas and drank water with cupped  palms. Then they continued their journey through the middle of Bahlika country, and  reached Sudama mountain.
68_16.word_by_word: अञ्जलिपानान् drinking water with cupped palms, वेदपारगान् versed in the Vedas, ब्राह्मणान् brahmins, अवेक्षय having seen, बाह्लीकान् मध्येन in the middle of Bahlika country, सुदामानम्  known as Sudama, पर्यतं च mountain, ययुः went.

68_17.shloka: विष्णोः पदं प्रेक्षमाणा विपाशांचापि शाल्मलीम्।नदीर्वापी स्तटाकानि पल्वलानि सरांसि च।।2.68.19।।पश्यन्तो विविधांश्चापि सिंहाव्याघ्रमृग द्विपान्।ययुः पथाऽतिमहता शासनं भर्तुरीप्सवः।।2.68.20।।
68_17.translation: Beholding the footprints of Visnu (on Sudama mountain), and seeing Vipasa, and Salmali rivers, trees, streams, deep wells, ponds, pools, large tanks, different kinds oflions, tigers and elephants, they travelled a long distance with the intention of fulfilling the command of their master.
68_17.word_by_word: विष्णोः Visnu's, पदम् footprints, प्रेक्षमाणाः beholding, विपाशांचापि Vipasa river, शाल्मलीलं चापि Salmali also, नदीः rivers, वापीः deep wells with steps to reach, तटाकानि tanks, पल्वलानिpools, सरांसि च large tanks, विविधान् different, सिंहव्याघ्रमृग द्विपान् lions, tigers and elephants, पश्यन्तः seeing, भर्तुः master's, शासनम् command, ईप्सवः wishing to fulfil,  अतिमहता very long, पथा journey, ययुः went.

68_18.shloka: ते श्रान्तवाहना दूता विकृष्णेन पथा ततः।गिरिव्रजं पुरवरं शीघ्रमासेदुरञ्जसा।।2.68.21।।
68_18.translation: After a prolonged journey the messengers with their tired horses soon reached Girivraja, the (capital city of Kekaya kingdom) best of cities.
68_18.word_by_word: विकृष्णेन by  prolonged, पथा journey, श्रान्त वाहनाः tired horses, ते दूताः those mesengers, ततः then, शीघ्रम् swiftly, अञ्जसा straight on, पुरवरम् best of cities, गिरिव्रजम् Girivrajam, आसेदुः reached.

68_19.shloka: भर्तुः प्रियार्थं कुलरक्षणार्थं भर्तुश्च वंशस्य परिग्रहार्थम्।अहेडमाना स्त्वरया स्म दूता रात्र्यान्तु ते तत्पुरमेव याताः।।2.68.22।।
68_19.translation: To please their master (sage Vasistha)  and to preserve the royal dynasty and also to protect the honour of the (race and people), the messengers soon reached their destination by night without any negligence of their duty.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे अष्टषष्टितमस्सर्गः।।Thus ends  the sixtyeighth sarga in Ayodhyakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
68_19.word_by_word: ते दूताः those messengers, भर्तुः lord's, प्रियार्थम् to please, कुलरक्षणार्थम् to preserve the royal dynasty, भर्तुः of the king's, वंशस्य the house of the Ikshvakus, परिग्रहार्थम् for the protection of (royal honour), त्वरया quickly, अहेडमानाः without negligence, रात्य्राम् in the night, तत् that, पुरमेव that city, याताः reached.

69_1.shloka: [Bharata experiences unhappiness over a distressing and frightening dream.]यामेव रात्रिं ते दूताः प्रविशन्ति स्म तां पुरीम्।भरतेनापि तां रात्रिं स्वप्नो दृष्टोऽयमप्रियः।।2.69.1।।
69_1.translation: On the very night the messengers were entering the city, Bharata had a distressing dream.
69_1.word_by_word: ते दूताः those messengers, यामेव on whichever, रात्रिम् night, तां पुरीम् that city, प्रविशन्ति स्म were entering, तां रात्रिम् that night, भरतेनापि by Bharata also, अयम् this, आप्रियः distressing, स्वप्नः dream, दृष्टः has been seen.

69_2.shloka: व्युष्टामेव तु तां रात्रिं दृष्ट्वा तं स्वप्नमप्रियम्।पुत्रो राजाधिराजस्य सुभृशं पर्यतप्यत।।2.69.2।।
69_2.translation: The son of the king of kings (Bharata) felt extremely troubled hen he had an  unpleasant dream at dawn.
69_2.word_by_word: राजाधिराजस्य (the son) of the king of kings, पुत्रः son, तां रात्रिम् that night, व्युष्टाम् एव when dawn appeared, तम् that, अप्रियम् unpleasant, स्वप्नम् dream, दृष्ट्वा having seen, सुभृशम् extremely, पर्यतप्यत felt troubled.

69_3.shloka: तप्यमानं समाज्ञाय वयस्याः प्रियवादिनः।आयासं हि विनेष्यन्त स्सभायां चक्रिरे कथाः।।2.69.3।।
69_3.translation: Observing him griefstricken his peers who always spoke pleasant words, engaged him in a variety of ways in the assembly in order to divert him.
69_3.word_by_word: प्रियवादिनः speaking pleasing words, वयस्याः peers, तप्यमानम् griefstricken, समाज्ञाय having observed, आयासम् despair, विनेष्यन्तः with a view to remove, सभायाम् in the assembly, कथाः stories, चक्रिरे made.

69_4.shloka: वादयन्ति तथा शान्तिं लास यन्त्यपि चापरे।नाटकान्यपरे प्राहुर्हास्यानि विविधानि च।।2.69.4।।
69_4.translation: In order to provide mental peace to Bharata, some played stringed instruments while some enacted dramatic scenes, some danced and cracked various kinds of jokes.
69_4.word_by_word: शान्तिम् to provide mental peace, वादयन्ति played stringed instruments, तथा similarly, अपरे some, नाटकानि dramatic scenes, लासयन्त्यपि danced, अपरे some, विविधानि various kinds of, हास्यानि jokes, प्राहुः told.

69_5.shloka: स तैर्महात्मा भरतस्सखिभिः प्रियवादिभिः।गोष्ठीहास्यानि कुर्वद्भिर्न प्राहृष्यत राघवः।।2.69.5।।
69_5.translation: The magnanimous Bharata born in the race of Raghus, was not delighted by the conversations and jokes and soothing words of his friends.
69_5.word_by_word: राघवः one born in the Raghu race, महात्मा the magnanimous, सः भरतः that Bharata, गोष्ठीहास्यानि conversations and jokes, कुर्वद्भि: while performing, प्रियवादिभिः were soothing words, सखिभिः by friends also, न प्राहृष्यत could not be delighted.

69_6.shloka: तमब्रवीत्प्रियसखो भरतं सखिभिर्वृतम्।सुहृद्भिः पर्युपासीनः किं सखे नानुमोदसे।।2.69.6।।
69_6.translation: Addressing Bharata amidst his companions some one close among them said O friend why are you dejected in spite of being in the company of friends.
69_6.word_by_word: प्रियसखः one dear friend, सखिभिः with friends, वृतम् surrounded, भरतं addressing that Bharata, अब्रवीत् said, सखे O friend, सुहृद्भिः with friends, पर्युपासीनः accompanied by, किम् why, न अनुमोदसे you are not pleased.

69_7.shloka: एवं ब्रुवाणं सुहृदं भरतः प्रत्युवाच ह।श्रुणु त्वं यन्निमित्तं मे दैन्यमेतदुपागतम्।।2.69.7।।
69_7.translation: Addressing his companion who was speaking thus, Bharata replied, saying Listen to the reason this desolation has overtaken me:
69_7.word_by_word: भरतः Bharata, एवम् in this manner, ब्रुवाणम् saying, सुहृदम् his companion, प्रत्युवाच ह replied, मे my, यन्निमित्तम् for what reason, एतत् this, दैन्यम् desolation, उपागतम् that has overtaken me, त्वम् you, श्रुणु listen.

69_8.shloka: स्वप्ने पितरमद्राक्षं मलिनं मुक्त मूर्धजम्।पतन्तमद्रिशिखरात्कलुषे गोमयह्रदे।।2.69.8।।
69_8.translation: In my dream I saw my father looking pale, with dishevelled hair, his body filled with filth falling from the peak of a mountain into a pool of cow  dung.
69_8.word_by_word: स्वप्ने in a dream, मलिनम् pale, मुक्तमूर्धजम् with dishevelled hair, अद्रिशिखरात् from the peak of a mountain, कलुषे dirty, गोमयह्रदे pool filled with cow dung, पतन्तम् falling down, पितरम् father, अद्राक्षम् saw.

69_9.shloka: प्लवमानश्च मे दृष्टस्स तस्मिन्गोमयह्रदे।पिबन्नञ्जलिना तैलं हसन्नपि मुहुर्मुहुः।।2.69.9।।
69_9.translation: I saw my father floating in that pool of cow  dung, drinking oil with cupped palms and  bursting into laughter again and again.
69_9.word_by_word: सः he, तस्मिन् that, गोमयह्रदे in the pool filled with cow dung, प्लवमानः floating, अञ्जलिना with both palms cupped, तैलम् oil, पिबन् drinking मुहुर्मुहुः again and again, हसन् laughing, मे by me, दृष्टः was seen.

69_10.translation: Thereafter I beheld him eating rice cooked with sesame seeds, his body besmeared with oil plunging again and again into it (the pool).
69_10.word_by_word: ततः thereafter, तिलौदनम् rice cooked with sesame seeds, भुक्त्वा eating, पुनः पुनः again and again, अधःशिराः plunging his head downwards, तैलेन with oil, अभ्यक्तसर्वाङ्ग: his body besmeared with oil, तैलमेव into the oil alone, अन्वगाहत entered.

69_11.shloka: स्वप्नेऽपि सागरं शुष्कं चन्द्रं च पतितं भवि।उपरुद्धां च जगतीं तमसेव समावृताम्।।2.69.11।।औपवाह्यस्य नागस्य विषाणं शकलीकृतम्।सहसाचापि संशान्तं ज्वलितं जातवेदसम्।।2.69.12।।अवतीर्णां च पृथिवीं शुष्कां श्च विविधान् द्रुमान्।अहं पश्यामि विध्वस्तान् सधूमांश्चापि पर्वतान्।।2.69.13।।
69_11.translation: In that dream I beheld the sea being dried up and the Moon fallen onto the ground. I saw the earth as though enveloped by darkness and obscured, the tusk of an  elephant worthy of a ride by the monarch broken into pieces, a blazing fire  extinguished suddenly, the earth split open, various trees dried up and mountains crumbled and covered with smoke.
69_11.word_by_word: अहम् I, स्वप्ने in the dream, सागरम् sea, शुष्कम् having dried up, चन्द्रम् Moon, भुवि on the ground, पतितम् having fallen down, जगतीम् the earth, तमस समावृताम् इव as if enveloped in  darkness, उपरुद्धाम् obscured, औपवाह्यस्य worthy of a ride, नागस्य elephant's, विषाणम् tusk,  शकलीकृतम् broken into pieces, ज्वलितम् blazing, जातवेदनम् fire, सहसा suddenly, संशान्तम् extinguished, पृथिवीम् earth, अवतीर्णां च split open, विविधान् various, द्रुमान् trees, शुष्कांश्च dried up, पर्वतान् mountains, विध्वस्तान् having been destroyed, सधूमान् with smoke, पश्यामि I see.

69_12.shloka: पीठे कार्ष्णायसे चैनं निषण्णं कृष्णवाससम्।प्रहसन्ति स्म राजानं प्रमदाः कृष्णपिङ्गलाः।।2.69.14।।
69_12.translation: In the dream, I beheld my father clad in black clothes and resting on a seat made of iron and the women in dark and brownish complexion laughing at him.
69_12.word_by_word: कार्ष्णायसे on an iron, पीठे seat, निषण्णम् resting, कृष्णवाससम्  clad in black clothes, एनं राजानं this king, कृष्णपिङ्गलाः having dark and brownish complexion, प्रमादाः women, प्रहसन्ति were laughing.

69_13.shloka: त्वरमाणश्च धर्मात्मा रक्तमाल्यानुलेपनः।रथेन खरयुक्तेन प्रयातो दक्षिणामुखः।।2.69.15।।
69_13.translation: Thereafter, I beheld that virtuous monarch bedecked with garlands made of red flowers and his body bedaubed with red sandalpaste, hurrying off southward on a chariot yoked with asses.
69_13.word_by_word: धर्मात्मा virtuous one, रक्तमाल्यानुलेपनः wearing garlands of red flowers and with his body  bedaubed with red sandal, त्वरमाणश्च hurrying off, खरयुक्तेन yoked with asses, रथेन on chariot, दक्षिणामुखः southward, प्रयातः went.

69_14.shloka: प्रहसन्तीव राजानं प्रमदा रक्तवासिनी।प्रकर्षन्ती मया दृष्टा राक्षसी विकृतानना।।2.69.16।।
69_14.translation: Finally I beheld a demoness attired in red clothes with an ugly appearance, dragging the king away as if mocking at him.
69_14.word_by_word: रक्तवासिनी clad in red coloured clothes, विकृतानना with an ugly appearance, राक्षसी प्रमदा a  demoness, प्रहसन्तीव as if mocking at him, राजानम् the king, प्रकर्षन्ती dragging, मया by me, दृष्टा was beheld.

69_15.shloka: एवमेतन्मया दृष्टमिमां रात्रिं भयावहम्।अहं रामोऽथवा राजा लक्ष्मणो वा मरिष्यति।।2.69.17।।
69_15.translation: I had such a frightful dream last night. Either I, Rama, the king or Lakshmana might  die.
69_15.word_by_word: एवम् in this manner, इमां रात्रिम् last night, भयावहम् frightening, एतत् this one, (मया)                           दृष्टम् was beheld (by me), अहम् either me, अथवा or, राजा the king, लक्ष्मणो वा or Lakshmana, मरिष्यति might die.

69_16.shloka: नरो यानेन य स्स्वप्ने स्वरयुक्तेन याति हि।अचिरात्तस्य धूमाग्रं चितायां सम्प्रदृश्यते।।2.69.18।।
69_16.translation: If one beholds in a dream a person setting out on a carriage yoked to asses, the wreath of smoke ascending from his funeral pyre will be seen soon.
69_16.word_by_word: स्वप्ने in the dream, यः any one, नरः human, रस्वयुक्तेन yoked to asses, यानेन by carriage, याति sets out, अचिरात् in a short time, चितायाम् on the funeral pyre, तस्य his, धूमाग्रम् wreath of smoke of his deadbody ascending, सम्प्रदृश्यते will be seen.

69_17.shloka: एतन्निमित्तं दीनोऽहं तन्नवः प्रतिपूजये।शुष्यतीव च मे कण्ठः न स्वस्थमिव मे मनः।।2.69.19।।
69_17.translation: So it is for this reason that I am desolate and cannot respond well to your conversation. It appears as if my throat is getting parched up and my mind is illdisposed.
69_17.word_by_word: अहम् I, एतन्निमित्तम् for this reason, दीनः am desolate, तत् therefore, वः all of you, न प्रतिपूजये not responded well, मे my, कण्ठः throat, शुष्यतीव च is as though getting parched up, मे my, मनः mind, न स्वस्थम् इव is as though uneasy.

69_18.shloka: न पश्यामि भयस्थानं भयं चैवोपधारयेभ्रष्टश्च स्वरयोगो मे छाया चोपहता मम।जुगुप्सन्निव चाऽत्मानं न पश्यमि च कारणम्।।2.69.20।।
69_18.translation: I do not see any reason for apprehension but I experience only fear. My voice has degenerated. My appearance looks haggard. Without any reason whatsoever I detest myself.
69_18.word_by_word: भयस्थानम् any reason for apprehension, नपश्यामि I do not see, भयं चैव fear alone, उपधारये am experiencing, मे my, स्वरयोगः voice, भ्रष्टः degenerated, मम my, छाया च appearance, उपहता haggard, आत्मानम् of my self, जुगुप्सन्निव as if I detest, कारणम् च reason, न पश्यामि cannot see.

69_19.shloka: इमां च दुस्स्वप्नगतिं निशाम्यतामनेकरूपामवितर्कितां पुरा।भयं महत्तद्धृदयान्नयाति मे विचिन्त्य राजानमचिन्तदर्शनम्।।2.69.21।।
69_19.translation: On observing the course of this nightmare, with all those images formerly unconceived and having thought of the king's incomprehensible presence, a great fear that has gripped my heart does not leave me.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे एकोनसप्ततितमस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the sixtyninth sarga in Ayodhyakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki
69_19.word_by_word: अनेकरूपाम् of several images, पुरा formerly, अतर्किताम् unthought of, ताम् such, इमाम् this, दुःस्वप्नगतिम् the course of this nightmare, निशाम्य having perceived, राजानम् the king, अचिन्त्यदर्शनम् as incomprehensible view, विचिन्त्य having thought of, महत् great, तत् that, भयम् fear, मे हृदयात् from my heart, न याति does not go.

70_1.shloka: [Messengers from Ayodhya arrive as Bharata was describing his nightmare to his friends -- the message of Vasistha is conveyed to Bharata to hurry back to Ayodhya -- departure of Bharata and Satrughna to Ayodhya.]भरते ब्रुवति स्वप्नं दूतास्ते क्लान्तवाहनाः।प्रविश्यासह्यपरिखं रम्यं राजगृहं पुरम्।।2.70.1।।समागम्य तु राज्ञा च राजपुत्रेण चार्चिताःराज्ञः पादौ गृहीत्वा तु तमूचुर्भरतं वचः।।2.70.2।।
70_1.translation: While Bharata was relating his dream, the mounted messengers (from Ayodhya) with their weary horses entered the lovely city of Rajagriha  surrounded by an impassable moat. There they met the king of Kekaya country and his son, Yuddhajit and were received with honour. Touching the feet of the king with reverence, they  said to Bharata:
70_1.word_by_word: भरते Bharata, स्वप्नं about the dream, ब्रुवति while relating, क्लान्तवाहना: men with their vehicles (horses) weary, दूताः messengers, असह्यपरिखम् impassable moat, रम्यम् lovely, राजगृहम् Rajagriha, पुरम् city, प्रविश्य having entered, राज्ञा च with Kekaya king, राजपुत्रेण with king's son, Yuddhajit, समागम्य having met, अर्चिताः were honoured, राज्ञः king's,पादौ feet, गृहीत्वा having touched with reverence, तं भरतम् addressing that Bharata, वचः words, ऊचुः.told.

70_2.shloka: भरते ब्रुवति स्वप्नं दूतास्ते क्लान्तवाहनाः।प्रविश्यासह्यपरिखं रम्यं राजगृहं पुरम्।।2.70.1।।समागम्य तु राज्ञा च राजपुत्रेण चार्चिताःराज्ञः पादौ गृहीत्वा तु तमूचुर्भरतं वचः।।2.70.2।।
70_2.translation: While Bharata was relating his dream, the mounted messengers (from Ayodhya) with their weary horses entered the lovely city of Rajagriha  surrounded by an impassable moat. There they met the king of Kekaya country and his son, Yuddhajit and were received with honour. Touching the feet of the king with reverence, they  said to Bharata:
70_2.word_by_word: भरते Bharata, स्वप्नं about the dream, ब्रुवति while relating, क्लान्तवाहना: men with their vehicles (horses) weary, दूताः messengers, असह्यपरिखम् impassable moat, रम्यम् lovely, राजगृहम् Rajagriha, पुरम् city, प्रविश्य having entered, राज्ञा च with Kekaya king, राजपुत्रेण with king's son, Yuddhajit, समागम्य having met, अर्चिताः were honoured, राज्ञः king's,पादौ feet, गृहीत्वा having touched with reverence, तं भरतम् addressing that Bharata, वचः words, ऊचुः.told.

70_3.shloka: पुरोहितस्त्वां कुशलं प्राह सर्वे च मन्त्रिणः।त्वरमाणश्च निर्याहि कृत्यमात्ययिकं त्वया।।2.70.3।।
70_3.translation: The family priest (Vasistha) and all the counsellors have enquired about your welfare. You must return immediately. There is an urgent matter to be attended by you.
70_3.word_by_word: पुरोहितः the family priest (Vasistha), त्वाम् about your, कुशलम् welfare, प्राह enquired, सर्वे  all, मन्त्रिणश्च counsellors also, त्वरमाणः च immediately, निर्याहि you may return, त्वया by you,  आत्ययिकम् urgent matter, कृत्यम्  to be attended.

70_4.shloka: इमानि च महार्हाणि वस्त्राण्याभरणानि च।प्रतिगृह्य विशालक्ष मातुलस्य च दापय।।2.70.4।।
70_4.translation: Oh largeeyed one (Bharata) you are asked to take these excellent raiments and precious ornaments and bestow them on your maternal uncle (said the messengers).
70_4.word_by_word: विशालाक्ष largeeyed one, (Bharata), इमानि these, महार्हाणि precious, वस्त्राणि raiments, आभरणानि च ornaments, प्रतिगृह्य having accepted, मातुलस्य to your maternal uncle, दापय give, विशालाक्ष O largeeyed one (Bharata)

70_5.shloka: अत्र विशंतिकोट्यस्तु नृपतेर्मातुलस्य ते।दशकोट्यस्तु सम्पूर्णास्तथैव च नृपात्मज।।2.70.5।।
70_5.translation: O prince these gifts worth twenty crore are intended for the king and the rest of the gifts worth ten crore for your maternal uncle.
70_5.word_by_word: नृपात्मज O prince Bharata, अत्र among this, विंशतिकोट्यः twenty crore, नृपतेः for the king, तथैव च similarly, सम्पूर्णाः complete, दशकोट्यस्तु ten crores, ते to your, मातुलस्य to be given to your maternal uncle.

70_6.shloka: प्रतिगृह्य तु तत्सर्वं स्वनुरक्त स्सुहृज्जने।दूतानुवाच भरतः कामैस्सम्प्रतिपूज्य तान्।।2.70.6।।
70_6.translation: Affectionate towards his relatives and friends, Bharata received all those gifts and in return honoured those messengers with things they liked, asking them:
70_6.word_by_word: सुहृज्जने the relatives and friends, स्वनुरक्तः who is very affectionate, भरतः Bharata, तत् that, सर्वम् all, प्रतिगृह्य having received, तान् दूतान् those messengers, कामैः what they liked, सम्प्रतिपूज्य in return honouring them, उवाच said.

70_7.shloka: कच्चित्सुकुशली राजा पिता दशरथो मम।कच्चिच्चारोगता रामे लक्ष्मणे च महात्मनि।।2.70.7।।
70_7.translation: I hope my father, Dasaratha is doing well and revered Rama and Lakshmana are in good health
70_7.word_by_word: मम पिता my father, राजा दशरथः king Dasaratha, कच्चित् I hope, सकुशली doing well, रामे Rama, महात्मनि great, लक्ष्मणे च in Lakshmana also, अरोगता good health, कच्चित् I hope.

70_8.shloka: आर्या च धर्मनिरता धर्मज्ञा धर्मदर्शिनी।अरोगा चापि कौसल्या माता रामस्य धीमतः।।2.70.8।।
70_8.translation: (I hope) Kausalya mother of the sagacious Rama the venerable lady devoted to righteousness one who knows the ways of righteousness and observes the prescribed code of conduct, is keeping sound  health.
70_8.word_by_word: आर्या च venerable lady indeed, धर्मनिरता devoted to righteousness, धर्मज्ञा adept in  righteousness, धर्मदर्शिनी observes the prescribed code of conduct, धीमतः sagacious, रामस्य Rama's, माता mother, कौशल्या Kausalya, अपि अरोगा is she keeping good health.

70_9.shloka: कच्चित्सुमित्रा धर्मज्ञा जननी लक्ष्मणस्य या।शत्रुघ्नस्य च वीरस्य साऽरोगा चापि मध्यमा।।2.70.9।।
70_9.translation: I hope my mother Sumitra (the middle one) who is familiar with the ways of righteousness, the mother of valiant Lakshmana and Satrughna, is enjoying good health.
70_9.word_by_word: या that, धर्मज्ञा knowledgeable in the ways of righteousness, लक्ष्मणस्य Lakshmana's, वीरस्य one who is full of valour, शत्रुघ्नस्य च Satrughna's, जननी mother, मध्यमा middle mother, सा सुमित्रापि that Sumitra, कच्चित् I hope, अरोगा is free from illness.

70_10.shloka: आत्मकामा सदा चण्डी क्रोधना प्राज्ञमानिनी।अरोगा चापि मे माता कैकेयी किमुवाच ह।।2.70.10।।
70_10.translation: And what about my mother Kaikeyi, ever intent on her own wellbeing, wrathful, irascible and proud of her intelligence? Is she maintaining sound health?
70_10.word_by_word: आत्मकामा ever intent on her welfare, सदा always, चण्डी irascible, क्रोधना wrathful, प्राज्ञमानिनी who is proud of her intelligence, मे माता my mother, कैकेयी Kaikeyi, अपि अरोगा is she free from illness, किम् what, उवाच ह did she say?

70_11.shloka: एवमुक्तास्तु ते दूताः भरतेन महात्मना।ऊचुस्सप्रश्रयं वाक्यमिदं तं भरतं तदा।।2.70.11।।
70_11.translation: Having listened to the words of that magnanimous Bharata, those messengers addressed him  gracefully with these words.
70_11.word_by_word: महात्मना magnanimous, भरतेन by Bharata, एवम् in this way, उक्ताः uttered, ते दूताः those messengers, तदा then, तं भरतम् addressing that Bharata, सप्रश्रयम् respectfully, इदं these  वाक्यम् (वचः) words, ऊचुः spoke.

70_12.shloka: कुशलास्ते नरव्याघ्र येषां कुशलमिच्छसि।श्रीश्च त्वां वृणुते पद्मा युज्यतां चापि ते रथः।।2.70.12।।
70_12.translation: O tiger among men (Bharata) those of whose welfare you are enquiring are all doing well. May the goddess of wealth and prosperity await you and let your chariot be yoked.
70_12.word_by_word: नरव्याघ्र tiger among men (Bharata), येषाम् whose, कुशलम् welfare, इच्छसि you are  enquiring, ते they, कुशलाः are doing well, श्रीः prosperity, पद्मा goddess of wealth, त्वाम्  you, वृणुते chosen you, ते to you, रथः chariot, युज्यतां चापि may be yoked.

70_13.shloka: भरतश्चापि तान् दूतानेवमुक्तोऽभ्यभाषत।आपृच्चेऽहं महाराजं दूतास्सन्त्वरयन्ति माम्।।2.70.13।।
70_13.translation: Having thus been addressed, Bharata said to the messengers. Let me seek the permission of the great king of Kekaya to leave and say goodbye, informing him that the messengers are hastening me up.
70_13.word_by_word: एवम् thus, उक्तः uttered, भरतश्चापि Bharata, तान् दूतान् to those messengers, अभ्यभाषत said, माम् me, दूताः messengers, सन्त्वरयन्ति are hastening me up, अहम् I, महाराजम् great king (of Kekaya), आपृच्छे shall seek permission to leave.

70_14.shloka: एवमुक्त्वा तु तान् दूतान्भरतः पार्थिवात्मजः।दूतै स्सञ्चोदितो वाक्यं मातामहमुवाच ह।।2.70.14।।
70_14.translation: Having addressed the messengers who were pressing him to leave (for Ayodhya) Bharata said to his maternal grandfather:
70_14.word_by_word: दूतैः messengers, सञ्चोदितः having been pressed, पार्थिवात्मजः king's son, भरतः Bharata,  तान् दूतान् to those messengers, एवम् in the aforesaid manner, उक्त्वा having said, मातामहम् addressing maternal grandfather, वाक्यम् these words, उवाच ह said.

70_15.shloka: राजन् पितुर्गमिष्यामि सकाशं दूतचोदितः।पुनरप्यहमेष्यामि यदा मे त्वं स्मरिष्यसि।।2.70.15।।
70_15.translation: O king, urged by these messengers I wish to go to my father. I shall come back again (from Ayodhya) whenever you  remember me.
70_15.word_by_word: राजन् O king, दूतचोदितः urged by the messengers, पितुः father's, सकाशम् for, गमिष्यामि I shall go, त्वम् you, मे for me, यदा whenever, स्मरिष्यसि remember, पुनरपि again, अहं एष्यामि I shall come.

70_16.shloka: भरतेनैवमुक्तस्तु नृपो मातामहस्तदा।तमुवाच शुभं वाक्यं शिरस्याघ्राय राघवम्।।2.70.16।।
70_16.translation: Then the  king of Kekaya, the maternal grandfather of Bharata, having heard the wordsof the scion of the Raghu dynasty (Bharata), kissed him on his forehead and spoke these auspicious words:
70_16.word_by_word: तदा then, भरतेन by Bharata, एवम् thus, उक्तः urged, मातामहः the maternal grandfather, नृपः king (of Kekaya), तम् that, राघवम् to one of Raghu dynasty (Bharata), शिरसि on his head, आघ्राय having smelt, शुभम् auspicious, वाक्यम् words, उवाच spoke.

70_17.shloka: गच्छ तातानुजाने त्वां कैकेयीसुप्रजास्त्वया।मातरं कुशलं ब्रूयाः पितरं च परन्तप।।2.70.17।।
70_17.translation: You may go, my child I permit you to leave. Kaikeyi has a worthy son in you. O slayer of enemies convey my best wishes to your mother and father.
70_17.word_by_word: तात O child, गच्छ you may go, त्वाम् you, अनुजाने I permit, त्वया by you, कैकेयी Kaikeyi, सुप्रजाः has a worthy son, परन्तप O slayer of enemies, मातरम् your mother, पितरं च and father, कुशलम् welfare, ब्रूयाः convey.

70_18.shloka: पुरोहितं च कुशलं ये चान्ये द्विजसत्तमाः।तौ च तात महेष्वासौ भ्रातरौ रामलक्ष्मणौ।।2.70.18।।
70_18.translation: My child, convey my best wishes, too, to your family priest Vasistha and other illustrious brahmins and also to those two great bowmen (Rama and Lakshmana).
70_18.word_by_word: तात O child, पुरोहितम् to the family priest (Vasistha), अन्ये and others, ये द्विजसत्तमाः those illustrious brahmins, महेष्वासौ great bowmen (Rama and Lakshmana), कुशलम् best wishes, (ब्रूहि convey).

70_19.shloka: तस्मै हस्त्युत्तमांश्चित्रान्कम्बलानजिनानि च।अभिसत्कृत्य कैकेयो भरताय धनं ददौ।।2.70.19।।
70_19.translation: The king of Kekaya felicitated Bharata, out of affection and bestowed on him wellbred elephants, manycoloured blankets, antelope skins and riches.
70_19.word_by_word: कैकेयः king of Kekaya, तस्मै भरताय to that Bharata, हस्त्युत्तमान् wellbred elephants, चित्रान्  of manycoloured, कम्बलान् blankets, अजिनानि च antelope skins, धनम् riches, अभिसत्कृत्य  having felicitated, ददौ bestowed.

70_20.shloka: रुक्मनिष्कसहस्रे द्वे षोडशाश्वशतानि च।सत्कृत्य कैकयीपुत्रं केकयो धनमादिशत्।।2.70.20।।
70_20.translation: King of Kekaya generously gave to the son of Kaikeyi (Bharata) in his honour two thousand gold coins and  sixteen hundred horses.
70_20.word_by_word: केकयः king of Kekaya, कैकयीपुत्रं son of Kaikeyi, सत्कृत्य having honoured, द्वे two, रुक्मनिष्कसहस्रे two thousand gold coins, षोडश अश्वशतानि च sixteen hundred  horses also, धनम् as wealth, आदिशत् bestowed.

70_21.translation: Similarly his maternal uncle Ashwapati quickly presented him amenable, trustworthy and virtuous counsellors as companions on his return journey.
70_21.word_by_word: तथा in the same way, अश्वपतिः Ashwapati, भरताय for Bharata, अभिप्रेतान् eamenable, विश्वास्यान् trustworthy men, गुणान्वितान् virtuous men, अमात्यान् counsellors, अनुयायिनः as companions, ददौ gave.

70_22.translation: His maternal uncle gave him the wealth of goodlooking elephants born in Iravata and Indrasira mountains and swiftmoving and welltrained asses which can be yoked easily. He gave riches too.
70_22.word_by_word: मातुलः maternal uncle, अस्मै for him (Bharata), ऐरावतान् born in Iravata mountain, ऐन्द्रशिरान्  born in Indrasira mountain, प्रियदर्शनान् beautiful to behold, नागान् elephants, शीघ्रान् swift moving, सुसंयुक्तान् welltrained, खरान् asses, धनम् riches, ददौ gave.

70_23.translation: He also gave him a gift of wellraised dogs of the inner apartment hugebodied with the strength and courage of tigers who used their fangs as weapons.
70_23.word_by_word: अन्तःपुरे in the inner apartment, अति संवृद्धान् wellraised, व्याघ्रवीर्यबलान्वितान् having the  strength and courage of tigers, दंष्ट्राऽऽयुधान् whose fangs are their weapons spears, महाकायान् of huge body, शुनश्च dogs also, उपायनम् as gift, ददौ gave.

70_24.shloka: स दत्तं केकयेन्द्रेण धनं तन्नाभ्यनन्दत।भरतः कैकयीपुत्रो गमनत्वरया तदा।।2.70.24।।
70_24.translation: All the wealth given by the king of Kekaya did not delight Bharata, son of Kaikeyi who was in a hurry to depart for Ayodhya.
70_24.word_by_word: तदा then, गमनत्वरया in a hurry to depart, सः that, कैकयीपुत्रः son of Kaikeyi, भरतः Bharata, केकयेन्द्रेण by the king of Kekaya, दत्तम् given, धनम् wealth, नाभ्यनन्दत did not delight him.

70_25.shloka: बभूव ह्यस्य हृदये चिन्ता सुमहती तदा।त्वरया चापि दूतानां स्वप्नस्यापि च दर्शनात्।।2.70.25।।
70_25.translation: Then his heart was filled with extreme anxiety due to the haste of the messengers to depart and also due to the dream he had.
70_25.word_by_word: दूतानाम् messengers', त्वरया चापि with the haste to depart, स्वप्नस्य dream's, दर्शनाच्चापि also due to beholding, तदा then, अस्य his, हृदये in the heart, सुमहती intense, चिन्ताanxiety, बभूव हि filled with.

70_26.translation: Prosperous Bharata on leaving his residence, passed through incomparable royal highway thronged with men, elephants and horses.
70_26.word_by_word: श्रीमान् prosperous, सः he (Bharata), नरनागाश्वसंवृतम् thronged with men, elephants and horses, सुमहत् great, स्ववेश्म his residence, अभ्यतिक्रम्य having passed by, अनुत्तमम् incomparable, राजमार्गम् royal highway, प्रपेदे obtained.

70_27.translation: Then the nobleminded, prosperous Bharata, on leaving the  highway, saw  the inner apartment of the king which he entered unhindered.
70_27.word_by_word: उदारधीः nobleminded, अभ्यतीत्य having crossed, ततः thereafter, अन्तःपुरम् inner apartment, अपश्यत् saw, ततः then, श्रीमान् prosperous, भरतः Bharata, अनिवारितः without any restriction, तत् in that apartment, आविवेश entered.

70_28.shloka: स मातामहमापृच्छ्य मातुलं च युधाजितम्।रथमारुह्य भरतश्शत्रुघ्नसहितो ययौ।।2.70.28।।
70_28.translation: Thus having taken leave of his maternal grandfather and uncle Yuddhajit, Bharata accompanied by Satrughna boarded the chariot and went along.
70_28.word_by_word: सः भरतः that Bharata, मतामहम् maternal grandfather, मातुलम् uncle, युधाजितम् Yaddhajit, आपृच्छ्य taking leave, शत्रुघ्नसहितः along with Satrughna, रथम् chariot, आरुह्य having ascended, ययौ went.

70_29.shloka: रथान्मण्डल चक्रांश्च योजयित्वा परश्शतम्।उष्ट्र गोऽश्वबलैर्भृत्या भरतं यान्तमन्वयुः।।2.70.29।।
70_29.translation: And the servants harnessing more than a hundred chariots of wellrounded wheels and also camels, oxen and horses followed Bharata who started off.
70_29.word_by_word: भृत्याः servants, मण्डलचक्रांश्च of wellrounded wheels, परश्शतान् more than a hundred, रथान् chariots, योजयित्वा harnessing, उष्ट्रगोश्वबलैः with camels, oxen, and horses, यान्तम् going on, भरतम् Bharata, अन्ययुः followed.

70_30.shloka: बलेन गुप्तो भरतो महात्मा सहार्यकस्याऽत्मसमैरमात्यैः।आदाय शत्रुघ्नमपेतशत्रुर्गृहाद्ययौ सिद्ध इवेन्द्रलोकात्।।2.70.30।।
70_30.translation: Under the protection of the army, the illustrious Bharata who was devoid of enemies, accompanied by ministers who were comparable to him and Satrughna, departed from his venerable grandfather's house like a siddha leaving the regions of Indra.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे सप्ततितमस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the seventieth sarga in Ayodhyakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
70_30.word_by_word: बलेन with army, गुप्तः under the protection of, महात्मा illustrious, अपेतशत्रुः devoid of enemies, भरतः Bharata, आत्मसमैः like himself, अमात्यैस्सह accompanied by ministers, शत्रुघ्नम् Satrughna, आदाय having taken, आर्यकस्य venerable grandfather's, गृहात् from house, सिद्ध: like siddha, इन्द्रलोकादिव from the regions of Indra, ययौ went.

71_1.shloka: ﻿﻿﻿﻿[Crossing many rivers, forests and territories Bharata reaches Ayodhya -- witnesses scenes of dull desolation charged with an atmosphere of apprehensions -- enters the palace dejected]स प्राङ्मुखो राजगृहादभिनिर्याय राघवः।ततस्सुदामां द्युतिमान् सन्तीर्यावेक्ष्य तां नदीम्।।2.71.1।।ह्लादिनीं दूरपारां च प्रत्यक्स्रोतस्तरङ्गिणीम्।शतद्रूमतरच्छ्रीमान्नदीमिक्ष्वाकुनन्दनः।।2.71.2।।
71_1.translation: ﻿﻿﻿﻿Glorious and prosperous prince Bharata, the delight of the Ikshvaku race, set out from Rajagriha, took the eastern direction, and observing the course of the river Sudama crossed Hladini and Satadru rivers which were very wide and flowing westwards crested with waves.
71_1.word_by_word: ﻿﻿﻿﻿द्युतिमान् the glorious, श्रीमान् the auspicious, इक्ष्वाकुकुलनन्दनः the delight of the Ikshvaku race, सः राघवः that (Bharata) of Raghu dynasty, राजगृहात् from Rajagriha, प्राङ्मुखः eastwards, अभिनिर्याय set out, ततः then, ताम् that, सुदामाम् Sudama, नदीम् river, आवेक्ष्य seen, सन्तीर्य having crossed, ह्लादिनीम् river Hladini, दूरपाराम् very wide, प्रत्यक्स्रोतस्तरङ्गिणीम् flowing westwards crested with waves, शतद्रूम् नदीम् river Satadru (Satlej), अतरत् crossed.

71_2.shloka: ﻿﻿स प्राङ्मुखो राजगृहादभिनिर्याय राघवः।ततस्सुदामां द्युतिमान् सन्तीर्यावेक्ष्य तां नदीम्।।2.71.1।।ह्लादिनीं दूरपारां च प्रत्यक्स्रोतस्तरङ्गिणीम्।शतद्रूमतरच्छ्रीमान्नदीमिक्ष्वाकुनन्दनः।।2.71.2।।
71_2.translation: ﻿﻿Glorious and prosperous prince Bharata, the delight of the Ikshvaku race, set out from Rajagriha, took the eastern direction, and observing the course of the river Sudama crossed Hladini and Satadru rivers which were very wide and flowing westwards crested with waves.
71_2.word_by_word: ﻿﻿द्युतिमान् the glorious, श्रीमान् the auspicious, इक्ष्वाकुकुलनन्दनः the delight of the Ikshvaku race, सः राघवः that (Bharata) of Raghu dynasty, राजगृहात् from Rajagriha, प्राङ्मुखः eastwards, अभिनिर्याय set out, ततः then, ताम् that, सुदामाम् Sudama, नदीम् river, आवेक्ष्य seen, सन्तीर्य having crossed, ह्लादिनीम् river Hladini, दूरपाराम् very wide, प्रत्यक्स्रोतस्तरङ्गिणीम् flowing westwards crested with waves, शतद्रूम् नदीम् river Satadru (Satlej), अतरत् crossed.

71_3.shloka: ﻿﻿ऐलाधाने नदीं तीर्त्वा प्राप्य चापरपर्पटान्।शिलामकुर्वतीं तीर्त्वा आग्नेयं शल्यकर्षणम्।।2.71.3।।सत्यसन्धश्शुचिश्श्रीमान्प्रेक्षमाण श्शिलावहाम्।अत्ययात्स महाशैलान्वनं चैत्ररथं प्रति।।2.71.4।।
71_3.translation: ﻿﻿Bharata, ever true to his word, handsome and purehearted, reached Aparaparpata region and crossed river Satadru at Eladhana, the mountain in which river Silavaha originates. Then he traversed Salyakarsna regions in the northeast, observing the course of the Silavaha and went beyond the great mountains in the direction of the forest called Chaitraratha.
71_3.word_by_word: ﻿﻿सत्यसन्ध: one who is always true to his word, शुचिः purehearted, श्रीमान् handsome, सः he (Bharata), ऐलाधाने in Eladhana, नदीम् river, तीर्त्वा crossed, अपरपर्पटान् Aparaparpata region, प्राप्य च having reached, शिलाम् hill, अकुर्वतीम् originating, तीर्त्वा having crossed, आग्नेयम् towards northeast, शल्यकर्षणम् Salyakarsna, शिलावहाम् Silavaha, प्रेक्षमाणः observing, चैत्ररथं वनं प्रति towards a forest called Chaitraratha, महाशैलान् great mountains, अत्ययात् went beyond.

71_4.shloka: ﻿सरस्वतीं च गङ्गां च युग्मेन प्रतिपद्यच।उत्तरान्वीरमत्स्यानां भारुण्डं प्राविशद्वनम्।।2.71.5।।
71_4.translation: ﻿Arriving at the confluence of Saraswati and Ganga and traversing the north of Veeramatsya region, he entered the Bharunda forest.
71_4.word_by_word: ﻿सरस्वतीं च Saraswati, गङ्गां च Ganga, युग्मेन at the confluence, प्रतिपद्य having arrived, वीरमत्स्यानाम् of Veeramatsya region, उत्तराम् to the north, भारुण्डं वनम् forest Bharunda, प्राविशत् entered.

71_5.shloka: ﻿वेगिनीं च कुलिङ्गाख्यां ह्लादिनीं पर्वताऽऽवृताम्।यमुनां प्राप्य सन्तीर्णः बलमाश्वासयत्तदा।।2.71.6।।
71_5.translation: ﻿He crossed the swiftflowing river known as Kulinga surrounded by hills and pleasing to the mind. Thereafter on crossing Yamuna he made his army rest on the otherside.
71_5.word_by_word: ﻿वेगिनीम् rapidlyflowing, पर्वतावृताम् hillbound, ह्लादिनीम् pleasing to the mind, कुलिङ्गाख्याम् known as Kulinga, यमुनाम् Yamuna, प्राप्य having arrived, सन्तीर्णः he crossed, तदा then, बलम् army, आश्वासयत् made them rest.

71_6.shloka: ﻿सशीतीकृत्य तु गात्राणि क्लान्तानाश्वास्य वाजिनः।तत्र स्नात्वा च पीत्वा च प्रायादादाय चोदकम्।।2.71.7।।
71_6.translation: ﻿The weary horses rested and cooled their bodies. And they bathed and drank. They set out again refreshed taking with them a store of water.
71_6.word_by_word: ﻿गात्राणि their limbs, शीतीकृत्य having cooled, क्लान्तान् weary, वाजिनः horses, आश्वास्य having refreshed, तत्र there, स्नात्वा having bathed, पीत्वा च and drinking, उदकम् water, आदाय took, प्रायात् set out.

71_7.translation: ﻿Then with the blessed prince (Bharata) on an excellent chariot, it (the army) moved through the vast and uninhabited forest like the god of wind passing through the sky.
71_7.word_by_word: ﻿भद्रः the blessed one, राजपुत्रः prince (Bharata), अनभीक्ष्णोपसेवितम् uninhabited, महारण्यम् vast forest, भद्रेण by an excellent, यानेन on chariot, मारुतः windgod, खमिव like sky, अत्ययात् passed through.

71_8.translation: ﻿Bharata, the descendant of Raghu, knowing that the mighty river Bhagirathi was difficult to cross at a place known as Anshudhana, quickly reached the famous city of Pragvata.
71_8.word_by_word: ﻿राघवः the descendant of Raghu (Bharata), विश्रुते in the famous, प्राग्वटे Pragvata, पुरे city, अंशुधाने at a place known as Anshudhana, दुष्प्रतराम् difficult to cross, महानदीम् mighty river, भागीरथीम् Bhagirathi, तूर्णम् quickly, उपायात् reached.

71_9.shloka: ﻿स गङ्गां प्राग्वटे तीर्त्वा समायात्कुटिकोष्ठिकाम्।सबल स्तां स तीर्त्वाऽथ समायाद्धर्मवर्धनम्।।2.71.10।।
71_9.translation: ﻿With Ganga at Pragvata city and river Kutikoshtika crossed along with his army, he reached Dharmavardhana village.
71_9.word_by_word: ﻿सः he, प्राग्वटे at Pragvata city, गङ्गाम् river Ganga, तीर्त्वा having crossed, कुटिकोष्ठिकाम् Kutikoshti river, समायात् reached, सः Bharata, सबलः with his army, ताम् that river, तीर्त्वा having crossed, अथ thereafter, धर्मवर्धनम् Dharmavardhana village, समायात् reached.

71_10.shloka: ﻿तोरणं दक्षिणार्धेन जम्भूप्रस्थमुपागमत्।वरूथं च ययौ रम्यं ग्रामं दशरथात्मजः।।2.71.11।।
71_10.translation: ﻿Having traversed the southern end of Torana, the son of Dasaratha (Bharata) reached the beautiful Varutha village via Jambuprastha.
71_10.word_by_word: ﻿दशरथात्मजः son of Dasaratha, (Bharata), तोरणम् Torana region, दक्षिणार्थेन southern direction of, जम्बूप्रस्थम् Jambuprastha village, उपागमत् arrived, वरूथम् Varutha village, रम्यं pleasant, ग्रामं च village, ययौ obtained.

71_11.shloka: ﻿तत्र रम्ये वने वासं कृत्वाऽसौ प्राङ्मुखो ययौ।उद्यानमुज्जिहानायाः प्रियका यत्र पादपाः।।2.71.12।।
71_11.translation: ﻿He (Bharata) halted in that charming forest for a while, proceeded eastwards till he reached a place known as Ujjihana garden abounding in spriyaka trees.
71_11.word_by_word: ﻿असौ he (Bharata), अत्र there, रम्ये charming, वने forest, वासम् stay, कृत्वा having made, प्राङ्मुखः eastwards, यत्र where, प्रियकाः known as priyaka, पादपाः trees, उज्जिहानायाः Ujjihana, उद्यानम् garden, ययौ reached.

71_12.shloka: ﻿सालांस्तु प्रियकान्प्राप्य शीघ्रानास्थाय वाजिनः।अनुज्ञाप्याथ भरतः वाहिनीं त्वरितो ययौ।।2.71.13।।
71_12.translation: ﻿After reaching the groves of sala and priyaka trees, Bharata harnessed the swiftrunning horses to the chariot and ordered his forces to proceed fast.
71_12.word_by_word: ﻿भरतः Bharata, सालान् sala trees, प्रियकान् priyaka trees, प्राप्य having reached, शीघ्रान् swiftrunning, वाजिनः horses, आस्थाय having harnessed, अथ thereafter, वाहिनीम् forces, अनुज्ञाप्य having commanded, त्वरितः quickly, ययौ set out.

71_13.shloka: ﻿वासं कृत्वा सर्वतीर्थे तीर्त्वा चोत्तानिकां नदीम्।अन्या नदीश्च विविधाः पार्वतीयैस्तुरङ्गमैः।।2.71.14।।हस्तिपृष्ठकमासाद्य कुटिकामत्यवर्तत।ततार च नरव्याघ्रो लौहित्ये स कपीवतीम्।।2.71.15।।
71_13.translation: ﻿That tiger among men, Bharata halted at a place known as Sarvatirtha and crossed the Uttanika and various other rivers with the help of hillborn horses. He crossed the Kutika river on an elephant the river Kapivati at a place known as Lauhitya.
71_13.word_by_word: ﻿सर्वतीर्थे in a place known as Sarvatirtha, वासम् halt, कृत्वा having made, उत्तानिकां नदीम् Uttanika river, विविधाः various, अन्याः others, नदीश्च rivers, पार्वतीयैः born in the mountains, तुरङ्गमैः on horses, तीर्त्वा having crossed, हस्तिपृष्ठकम् on an elephant, आसाद्य ascending, कुटिकाम् Kutika river, अत्यवर्तत crossed over, सः नरव्याघ्रः the tiger among men, लौहित्ये near Lauhitya, कपीवतीम् river Kapivati, ततार crossed.

71_14.shloka: ﻿एकसाले स्थाणुमतीं विनते गोमतीं नदीम्।कलिङ्गनगरे चापि प्राप्य सालवनं तदा।।2.71.16।।भरतः क्षिप्रमागच्छत्सुपरिश्रान्तवाहनः।
71_14.translation: ﻿Bharata crossed the rivers Sthanumati at Ekasala and Gomati at Vinata villages. Thereafter as his horses were extremely tired he rested for a while in the sala forest in Kalinganagara before he speedily set out (again).
71_14.word_by_word: ﻿भरतः Bharata, एकसाले at Ekasala village, स्थाणुमतीम् Sthanumati river, विनते at Vinata village, गोमतीं नदीम् Gomati river, सुपरिश्रान्तवाहनः with extremely fatigued horses, तदा then, कलिङ्गनगरे चापि at Kalinganagara, सालवनम् sala forest, प्राप्य having reached, क्षिप्रम् quickly, आगच्छत् came.

71_15.shloka: ﻿वनं च समतीत्याशुशर्वर्यामरुणोदये।।2.71.17।।अयोध्यां मनुना राज्ञा निर्मितां सन्ददर्श ह।
71_15.translation: ﻿He passed quickly through the forest at night and at sunrise beheld the city of Ayodhya built by king Manu.
71_15.word_by_word: ﻿आशु quickly, शर्वर्याम् in the night, वनं च forest also, समतीत्य having passed through, अरुणोदये at sunrise, मनुना राज्ञा by king Manu, निर्मिताम् built, अयोध्याम् Ayodhya, सन्ददर्श ह saw.

71_16.shloka: ﻿तां पुरीं पुरुषव्याघ्रस्सप्तरात्रोषितः पथि।।2.71.18।।अयोध्यामग्रतो दृष्ट्वा सारथिं वाक्यमब्रवीत्।
71_16.translation: ﻿Having spent seven nights on his way, that tiger among men (Bharata) saw Ayodhaya before him. He said to the charioteer:
71_16.word_by_word: ﻿पथि on the way, सप्तरात्रोषितः spent seven nights, पुरुषव्याघ्रः tiger among men, अग्रतः before him, ताम् अयोध्यां पुरीम् that Ayodhya city, दृष्ट्वा having seen, सारथिम् to the charioteer, वाक्यम् words, अब्रवीत् said.

71_17.shloka: ﻿एषा नातिप्रतीता मे पुण्योद्याना यशस्विनी।।2.71.19।।अयोध्या दृश्यते दूरात्सारथे पाण्डुमृत्तिका।यज्वभिर्गुणसम्पन्नैर्ब्राह्मणैर्वेदपारगैः।।2.71.20।।भूयिष्ठमृद्धैराकीर्णा राजर्षिपरिपालिता।
71_17.translation: ﻿O charioteer I am able to see Ayodhya of great renown from a distance but not so clearly that whiteclaycity of Ayodhya, with its sacred gardens ruled by several rajarsis, inhabited by numerous wealthy people, by virtuous brahmins and priests who perform sacrifices and who are wellversed in the Vedas.
71_17.word_by_word: ﻿सारथे O charioteer, पुण्योद्याना a city of sacred gardens, यशस्विनी of great renown, पाण्डुमृत्तिका with white clay, यज्वभिः those who perform sacrifices, गुणसम्पन्नैः by the virtuous, वेदपारगैः by those well versed in the vedas, भूयिष्ठम् in abundance , ऋद्धैः by the wealthy, ब्राह्मणैः by brahmins, आकीर्णा filled with, राजर्षिपरिपालिता ruled by rajarsis, एषा अयोध्या such Ayodhya, मे to me, नातिप्रतीता not so clearly, दूरात् from a distance, दृश्यते is seen.

71_18.shloka: ﻿﻿﻿एषा नातिप्रतीता मे पुण्योद्याना यशस्विनी।।2.71.19।।अयोध्या दृश्यते दूरात्सारथे पाण्डुमृत्तिका।यज्वभिर्गुणसम्पन्नैर्ब्राह्मणैर्वेदपारगैः।।2.71.20।।भूयिष्ठमृद्धैराकीर्णा राजर्षिपरिपालिता।
71_18.translation: ﻿﻿﻿O charioteer I am able to see Ayodhya of great renown from a distance but not so clearly that whiteclaycity of Ayodhya, with its sacred gardens ruled by several rajarsis, inhabited by numerous wealthy people, by virtuous brahmins and priests who perform sacrifices and who are wellversed in the Vedas.
71_18.word_by_word: ﻿﻿﻿सारथे O charioteer, पुण्योद्याना a city of sacred gardens, यशस्विनी of great renown, पाण्डुमृत्तिका with white clay, यज्वभिः those who perform sacrifices, गुणसम्पन्नैः by the virtuous, वेदपारगैः by those well versed in the vedas, भूयिष्ठम् in abundance , ऋद्धैः by the wealthy, ब्राह्मणैः by brahmins, आकीर्णा filled with, राजर्षिपरिपालिता ruled by rajarsis, एषा अयोध्या such Ayodhya, मे to me, नातिप्रतीता not so clearly, दूरात् from a distance, दृश्यते is seen.

71_19.shloka: ﻿अयोध्यायां पुरा शब्दश्श्रूयते तुमुलो महान्।।2.71.21।।समन्तान्नरनारीणां तमद्य न श्रुणोम्यहम्।
71_19.translation: ﻿I do not hear now, in Ayodhya the tumultous noise of men and women I used to hear earlier all over.
71_19.word_by_word: ﻿पुरा earlier, अयोध्यायाम् in Ayodhya, नरनारीणाम् men and women, महान् great, तुमुलः tumultous, शब्दः sound, समन्तात् all over, श्रूयते would hear, अद्य now, तम् that sound, अहम् I, न श्रुणोमि not hear.

71_20.translation: ﻿I do not see people who with passion used to stroll in the parks early in the morning. I see no cheerfulness in any one.
71_20.word_by_word: ﻿सायाह्ने early in the morning, क्रीडित्वा sporting, उपरतैः free from desire, समन्तात् all over, परिधावद्भिः strolling, नरैः people, उद्यानानि parks, मम I, अन्यथा no one, प्रकाशन्ते हि looking bright.

71_21.shloka: ﻿तान्यद्यानुरुदन्तीव परित्यक्तानि कामिभिः।।2.71.23।।अरण्यभूतेव पुरी सारथे प्रतिभाति मे।
71_21.translation: ﻿O charioteer, people full of passion have abandoned the gardens. To me, the city looks like a forest as if weeping.
71_21.word_by_word: ﻿कामिभिः people full of passion, परित्यक्तानि abandoned, तानि that, अद्य now, अनुरुदन्तीव as if weeping, सारथे O charioteer, पुरी city, अरण्यभूतेव like a forest, मे to me, प्रतिभाति it appears.

71_22.shloka: ﻿﻿न ह्यत्र यानैर्दृश्यन्ते न गजैर्न च वाजिभिः।।2.71.24।।निर्यान्तो वाऽभियान्तो वा नरमुख्या यथापुरम्।
71_22.translation: ﻿﻿Important people mounted on elephants or horses are not seen going out of the city or coming in.
71_22.word_by_word: ﻿﻿अत्र here, नरमुख्याः important people, यथापुरम् as in the past, यानैः riding, निर्यान्तो वा people going (out of city), अभियान्तो वा or coming in, न दृश्यन्ते हि not seen, गजैः elephants, न not, वाजिभिः च horses also, न not.

71_23.shloka: ﻿उद्यानानि पुरा भान्ति मत्तप्रमुदितानि च।।2.71.25।।जनानां रतिसंयोगेष्वत्यन्तगुणवन्ति च।
71_23.translation: ﻿Earlier the gardens used to reverberate with passionate songs of birds--places appropriate for lovers seeking pleasures.
71_23.word_by_word: ﻿पुरा earlier, उद्यानानि gardens, मत्तप्रमुदितानि च very melodiously singing, जनानाम् for people, रतिसंयोगेषु lovers for their pleasures, अत्यन्तगुणवन्ति च very appropriate, भान्ति would be.

71_24.translation: ﻿﻿Now the trees appear cheerless, the paths are full of dry leaves fallen all over. It appears as if the trees are crying.
71_24.word_by_word: ﻿﻿अद्य now, अनुपथम् footpath, स्रस्तपर्णैः dry leaves, विक्रोशद्भिरिव as if crying, द्रुमैः trees, तान्येतानि such (gardens), सर्वशः all over, निरानन्दानि cheerless, पश्यामि see.

71_25.shloka: ﻿﻿नाद्यापि श्रूयते शब्दः मत्तानां मृगपक्षिणाम्।।2.71.27।।संरक्तां मधुरां वाणीं कलं व्याहरतां बहु।
71_25.translation: ﻿﻿I do not hear in the red tincture of the rising Sun the melodious voices of the freely moving animals and birds.
71_25.word_by_word: ﻿﻿संरक्ताम् in the red tincture (of the rising Sun), मधुराम् melodious, वाणीम् voices, बहु many, कलम् sweet sound, व्याहरताम् freely singing and moving, मत्तानाम् proud, मृगपक्षिणाम् animals and birds, शब्दः sound, अद्यापि now, न श्रूयते not hearing.

71_26.translation: ﻿Why is it that the incomparable fragrance of sandal and incense that used to fill the nostrils, not blowing now in the prosperous city of Ayodhya?
71_26.word_by_word: ﻿चन्दनागरुसम्पृक्तः fragrance of sandal and incense, धूपसम्मूर्छितः smell wafting through the smoke, अतुलः incomparable, श्रीमान् prosperous, पवनः wind, अद्य now, यथापुरम् in the city always, किं नु why is it not, न प्रवाति not blowing?

71_27.shloka: ﻿﻿भेरीमृदङ्गवीणानां कोणसङ्घट्टितः पुनः।।2.71.29।।किमद्य शब्दो विरतस्सदा दीनगतिः पुरा।
71_27.translation: ﻿﻿Why is it that the sounds of musical instruments like mrudangas and veenas are not heard now? Why is the city filled with melancholy?
71_27.word_by_word: ﻿﻿पुरा earlier, दीनगतिः melancholy, पुनः again, कोणसङ्घट्टितः sounds of musical instruments, भेरीमृदङ्गवीणानाम् of the trumpets, mrudangas and veena, शब्दः sound, अद्य now, किम् why, विरतः not heard.

71_28.shloka: ﻿अनिष्टानि च पापानि पश्यामि विविधानि च।।2.71.30।।निमित्तान्यमनोज्ञानितेन सीदति मे मनः।
71_28.translation: ﻿Since I see many passing, inauspicious, sinful, ugly sights, my mind shrinks.
71_28.word_by_word: ﻿अनिष्टानि inauspicious symptoms, च also, पापानि sinful sights, पश्यामि see, विविधानि various निमित्तानि passing, अमनोज्ञानि ugly, तेन hence, सीदति filled with grief, मे my मनः mind.

71_29.shloka: ﻿सर्वथा कुशलं सूत दुर्लभं मम बन्दुषु।।2.71.31।।तथाह्यसति सम्मोहे हृदयं सीदतीव मे।
71_29.translation: ﻿I do not see anywhere, O charioteer the wellbeing, of my kinsmen. Hence I feel deluded and my heart is filled with grief.
71_29.word_by_word: ﻿सूत charioteer, सर्वथा all over, मम to me, बन्धुषु relations, कुशलम् welfare, दुर्लभम् not seem to be true, तथाहि therefore, सम्मोहे deluded, असति it is, मे my, हृदयम् heart, सीदतीव filled with grief.

71_30.translation: ﻿Dejected and depressed at heart, with no control over his senses and his mind full of apprehension, Bharata swiftly entered the city of Ayodhya ruled by the Ikshvakus.
71_30.word_by_word: ﻿विषण्णः dejected, श्रान्तहृदयः with depressed heart, त्रस्तः fearful man, सुलुलितेन्द्रियः losing control over his senses, भरतः Bharata, आशु quickly, इक्ष्वाकुपालिताम् ruled by the Ikshvakus, पुरीम् city of Ayodhya, प्रविवेश entered.

71_31.translation: ﻿He entered the city through the gate known as Vaijayanta with his horses exhausted. The doorkeepers stood up and amidst cries of victory followed him in.
71_31.word_by_word: ﻿श्रान्तवाहनः with his horses exhausted, वैजयन्तेन known as Vaijayanta, द्वारेण through gate of, प्राविशत् entered, द्वाःस्थैः by gate keepers, उत्थाय having stood up, विजयम् victory, पृष्टः having been uttered, तैः सहितः along with them, ययौ went.

71_32.shloka: ﻿स त्वनेकाग्रहृदयो द्वास्स्थं प्रत्यर्च्य तं जनम्।।2.71.34।।सूतमश्वपतेः क्लान्तमब्रवीत्तत्र राघवः।
71_32.translation: ﻿Bewildered, that descendant of Raghu (Bharata), reciprocated the greetings of the gatekeepers and then addressed the exhausted charioteer, Ashwapati:
71_32.word_by_word: ﻿सः राघवः तु as for the descendant of Raghus, अनेकाग्रहृदयः with a bewildered mind, द्वास्स्थम् to the gatekeepers, तम् those, जनम् people, प्रत्यर्च्य greeting in turn तत्र there, अश्वपतेः to Ashwapati, क्लान्तम् exhausted, सूतम् to the charioteer, अब्रवीत् said.

71_33.shloka: ﻿किमहं त्वरयाऽनीतः कारणेन विनानघ।।2.71.35।।अशुभाशङ्कि हृदयं शीलं च पततीव मे।
71_33.translation: ﻿O irreproachable one, why was I brought here in haste without any reason? My mind apprehends something inauspicious. I feel indisposed.
71_33.word_by_word: ﻿अनघ O irreproachable one, अहम् I am, कारणेन विना without any reason, त्वरया in haste, किम् why, आनीतः was brought, हृदयम् my heart, अशुभाशङ्कि apprehends something inauspcious, मे my, शीलं च disposition, पततीव is lost.

71_34.shloka: ﻿श्रुता नो यादृशाः पूर्वं नृपतीनां विनाशने।।2.71.36।।आकारांस्तानहं सर्वानिहपश्यामि सारथे।
71_34.translation: ﻿O charioteer I now see the very for ebodings I had heard in the past in connection with the death of kings.
71_34.word_by_word: ﻿सारथे O charioteer, नृपतीनाम् kings', विनाशने in destruction, यादृशाः such kind of, पूर्वम् in times past, नः us, श्रुताः have been heard, तान् सर्वान् all those, आकारान् signs, अहम् I, इह पश्यामि I am seeing now.

71_35.shloka: ﻿﻿सम्मार्जनविहीनानि परुषाण्युपलक्षये।।2.71.37।।असंयत कवाटानि श्रीविहीनानि सर्वशः।बलिकर्मविहीनानि धूपसम्मोदनेन च।।2.71.38।।अनाशितकुटुम्बानि प्रभाहीनजनानि च।अलक्ष्मीकानि पश्यामि कुटुम्बिभवनान्यहम्।।2.71.39।।
71_35.translation: ﻿﻿I see the unswept homes of householders standing dirty with doors not closed. There is no beauty anywhere. No one offers oblations (at the time of worship). There is no fragrance of burning incense. The families have no food to eat. The people look cheerless. I see inauspiciousness everywhere.
71_35.word_by_word: ﻿﻿अहम् I, सम्मार्जनविहीनानि unswept, कुटुंम्बिभवनानि houses of families, परुषाणि dirty, उपलक्षये discern, असंयत कवाटानि doors not closed, सर्वशः on every side, श्रीविहीनानि bereft of beauty, बलिकर्मविहीनानि devoid of offering oblations, धूपसम्मोदनेन च with fragrance of burnt incense, अनाशितकुटुम्बानि familes without food, प्रभाहीनजनानि च men devoid of brightness, अलक्ष्मीकानि inauspicious, पश्यामि I see

71_36.shloka: ﻿सम्मार्जनविहीनानि परुषाण्युपलक्षये।।2.71.37।।असंयत कवाटानि श्रीविहीनानि सर्वशः।बलिकर्मविहीनानि धूपसम्मोदनेन च।।2.71.38।।अनाशितकुटुम्बानि प्रभाहीनजनानि च।अलक्ष्मीकानि पश्यामि कुटुम्बिभवनान्यहम्।।2.71.39।।
71_36.translation: ﻿I see the unswept homes of householders standing dirty with doors not closed. There is no beauty anywhere. No one offers oblations (at the time of worship). There is no fragrance of burning incense. The families have no food to eat. The people look cheerless. I see inauspiciousness everywhere.
71_36.word_by_word: ﻿अहम् I, सम्मार्जनविहीनानि unswept, कुटुंम्बिभवनानि houses of families, परुषाणि dirty, उपलक्षये discern, असंयत कवाटानि doors not closed, सर्वशः on every side, श्रीविहीनानि bereft of beauty, बलिकर्मविहीनानि devoid of offering oblations, धूपसम्मोदनेन च with fragrance of burnt incense, अनाशितकुटुम्बानि familes without food, प्रभाहीनजनानि च men devoid of brightness, अलक्ष्मीकानि inauspicious, पश्यामि I see

71_37.shloka: ﻿अपेतमाल्यशोभानि ह्यसम्मृष्टाजिराणि च।देवागाराणि शून्यानि न चाभान्ति यथापुरम्।।2.71.40।।
71_37.translation: ﻿The temples stand devoid of the beauty of floral offerings. The floors of front yards are left unswept and unsmeared. They look deserted, devoid of brightness of the past.
71_37.word_by_word: ﻿अपेतमाल्यशोभानि deprived of the splendour of garlands, असम्मृष्टाजिराणि च floors of the front yards unsmeared, देवागाराः temples, शून्यानि empty, यथापुरम् as before, नाभान्ति च not shining.

71_38.shloka: ﻿देवतार्चाः प्रविद्धाश्च यज्ञगोष्ठ्यस्तथाविधाः।माल्यापणेषु राजन्ते नाद्य पण्यानि वा तथा।।2.71.41।।
71_38.translation: ﻿The offerings to deities have been dispensed with. There are no groups of people performing the usual holy sacrifices. The markets where garlands were sold now stand without them.
71_38.word_by_word: ﻿देवतार्चाः offerings to deities, प्रविद्धा: च have been dispensed with, यज्ञगोष्ठ्यः groups of people performing holy sacrifices, तथाविधाः as before, तथा usual, माल्यापणेषु in the markets where garlands are sold, अद्य now, पण्यानि items (garlands) for sale, न राजन्ते are not there.

71_39.translation: ﻿Even traders seem restrained by the loss of business. They are not seen as before concentrating on their trade.
71_39.word_by_word: ﻿नष्टव्यापारयन्त्रिताः restrained by the loss of business, ध्यानसंविग्नहृदयाः with distracted attention, वणिजोऽपि even traders, अद्य now, अत्र there, यथापूर्वम् as before, न दृश्यन्ते are not seen.

71_40.shloka: ﻿देवायतनचैत्येषु दीनाः पक्षिगणास्तथा।।2.71.43।।मलिनं चाश्रुपूर्णाक्षं दीनं ध्यानपरं कृशम्।सस्त्रीपुंसं च पश्यामि जनमुत्कण्ठितं पुरे।।2.71.44।।
71_40.translation: ﻿I see groups of birds frequenting the temples. The sanctuaries appear dispirited. The people in the city, both men and women look dull, emaciated, pitiable with throats choked. Their eyes are filled with tears and minds absorbed in distressing thoughts.
71_40.word_by_word: ﻿तथा as before, देवायतनचैत्येषु in temples and in sanctuaries, पक्षिगणाः multitude of birds, दीनाः dispirited, पुरे in the city, सस्त्रीपुंसम् with women and men, जनम् people, उत्कण्ठितम् with choked throats, मलिनम् dull, अश्रुपूर्णाक्षम् eyes filled with tears, दीनम् piteous, ध्यानपरम् absorbed in distressing thoughts, कृशम् emaciated, पश्यामि I see.

71_41.shloka: ﻿इत्येवमुक्त्वा भरतस्सूतं तं दीनमानसः।तान्यनिष्टान्ययोध्यायां प्रेक्ष्य राजगृहं ययौ।।2.71.45।।
71_41.translation: ﻿With these words said to the charioteer, Bharata, having seen such ominous sights in Ayodhya, proceeded to the king's palace with a depressed heart.
71_41.word_by_word: ﻿भरतः Bharata, अयोध्यायाम् in Ayodhya, तानि these, अनिष्टानि ominous sights, प्रेक्ष्य having seen, दीनमानसः with depressed heart, तं सूतम् that charioteer, इत्येवम् in this way, उक्त्वा having said, राजगृहम् king's palace, ययौ proceeded.

71_42.shloka: ﻿तां शून्यशृङ्गाटकवेश्मरथ्यां रजोऽरुणद्वारकवाटयन्त्राम्।दृष्ट्वा पुरीमिन्द्रपुरप्रकाशां दुःखेन सम्पूर्णतरो बभूव।।2.71.46।।
71_42.translation: ﻿As he (Bharata) beheld the city of Ayodhya that once had the lustre of the city of Indra, now with its crossroads, houses and highways all deserted, the fittings (nuts and bolts) on the doors red with dust, he was overwhelmed with grief.
71_42.word_by_word: ﻿शून्यशृङ्गाटकवेश्मरथ्याम् a place with crossroads, houses, and highways deserted, रजोऽरुणद्वारकवाटयन्त्राम् the fittings (nuts and bolts) on the doors red with dust, इन्द्रपुरप्रकाशाम् once having the lustre of the city of Indra, तां पुरीम् that city, दृष्ट्वा having seen, दुःखेन with grief, सम्पूर्णतरः overwhelmed, बभूव became.

71_43.shloka: ﻿बहूनि पश्यन्मनसोऽप्रियाणि यान्यन्यदा नास्य पुरे बभूवुः।अवाक्छिरा दीनमना नहृष्टः पितुर्महात्मा प्रविवेश वेश्म।।2.71.47।।
