71_43.translation: ﻿Having witnessed many unpleasant things that had never happened before, the magnanimous Bharata who was looking cheerless and dejected entered his father's palace with his head bent down.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे एकसप्ततितमस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the seventyfirst sarga in Ayodhyakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
71_43.word_by_word: ﻿अन्यदा in other times, यानि such, अस्य his, पुरे in the city, न बभूवुः did not happen, बहूनि many, मनसः to the mind, अप्रियाणि unpleasant ones, पश्यन् seeing, अवाक्छिराः with head bowed down, दीनमनाः dejected mind, नहृष्टः cheerless, महात्मा magnanimous, पितुः father's, वेश्म palace, प्रविवेश entered.

72_1.shloka: [Bharata meets Kaikeyi -- hears from Kaikeyi about the demise of king Dasaratha and Rama's exile -- Vasistha calls upon Bharata to perform obsequies and get consecrated]अपश्यंस्तु ततस्तत्र पितरं पितुरालये।जगाम भरतो द्रष्टुं मातरं मातुरालये।।2.72.1।।
72_1.translation: Not finding his father in his abode, Bharata went to see his mother in her apartment.
72_1.word_by_word: ततः thereafter, भरतः Bharata, तत्र there, पितुः father's, आलये abode, पितरम् father, अपश्यन् not seen, मातुः mother's, आलये in the abode, मातरम् mother, द्रष्टुम् to see,  जगाम went.

72_2.shloka: अनुप्राप्तं तु तं दृष्ट्वा कैकेयी प्रोषितं सुतम्।उत्पपात तदा हृष्टा त्यक्त्वा सौवर्णमासनम्।।2.72.2।।
72_2.translation: On seeing her son, who was sent away, presently arriving, the delighted Kaikeyi sprang up from her golden seat.
72_2.word_by_word: कैकेयी Kaikeyi, प्रोषितम् sent, तं सुतम् that son, अनुप्राप्तम् who had arrived, दृष्ट्वा having seen, तदा then, हृष्टा delighted, सौवर्णम् golden, आसनम् seat, त्वक्त्वा leaving, उत्पपात sprang up.

72_3.shloka: स प्रविश्यैव धर्मात्मा स्वगृहं श्रीविवर्जितम्।भरतः प्रतिजग्राह जनन्याश्चरणौ शुभौ।।2.72.3।।
72_3.translation: On entering home the righteous Bharata found it devoid of cheer and touched the auspicious feet of his mother (with reverence).
72_3.word_by_word: धर्मात्मा a man of righteous conduct, सः भरतः that Bharata, श्रीविवर्जितम् devoid of cheer, स्वगृहम् his home, प्रविश्यैव on entering, जनन्याः mother's, शुभौ auspicious, चरणौ feet, प्रतिजग्राह clasped.

72_4.shloka: सा तं मूर्धन्युपाघ्राय परिष्वज्य यशस्विनम्।अङ्के भरतमारोप्य प्रष्टुं समुपचक्रमे।।2.72.4।।
72_4.translation: Kaikeyi, gave her illustrious son Bharata a hug, kissed him on his forehead, made him rest on her lap and began her query.
72_4.word_by_word: सा she, यशस्विनम् illustrious, तं भरतम् to Bharata, मूर्धनि on his forehead, उपाघ्राय having smelt, परिष्वज्य having hugged, अङ्के on her lap, आरोप्य made him rest, प्रष्टुम् to  question, उपचक्रमे began.

72_5.shloka: अद्य ते कतिचिद्रात्र्य श्च्युतस्याऽर्यकवेश्मनः।अपि नाध्वश्रमशशीघ्रं रथेनापततस्तव।।2.72.5।।
72_5.translation: How many nights have you spent (on the way) since you left your noble grandfather's residence? Hasn't the hurried journey (over such a long distance) on the chariot left you exhausted?
72_5.word_by_word: आर्यकवेश्मनः from your noble grandfather's residence, च्युतस्य having left, ते to you, अद्य by now, कतिचित् how many, रात्र्य: nights, शीघ्रम् swiftly, रथेन on chariot, आपततः while moving, तव to you, अध्वश्रमः weary of journey, अपि न is not there?

72_6.shloka: ﻿आर्यकस्ते सुकुशली युधाजिन्मातुलस्तव।प्रवासाच्च सुखं पुत्र सर्वं मे वक्तुमर्हसि।।2.72.6।।
72_6.translation: ﻿My son are your revered grandfather and your maternal uncle Yudhajit doing well? Did you have a pleasant time during the sojourn? You should tell me all this.
72_6.word_by_word: ﻿पुत्र son, ते your, आर्यकः revered grandfather, सुकुशली is he doing well?, तव your, मातुलः maternal uncle, युधाजित् Yudhajit, प्रवासात् the sojourn, सुखम् is it pleasant?, मे to me, सर्वम् everything, वक्तुम् to tell, अर्हसि behoves you.

72_7.shloka: एवं पृष्टस्तु कैकेय्या प्रियं पार्थिवनन्दनः।आचष्ट भरत स्सर्वं मात्रे राजीवलोचनः।।2.72.7।।
72_7.translation: Thus asked lovingly by his mother Kaikeyi, the lotuseyed Bharata, the king's delight  narrated everything to her.
72_7.word_by_word: राजीवलोचनः lotuseyed, पार्थिवनन्दनः king's delight, भरतः Bharata, कैकेय्या by Kaikeyi, एवम् in this manner, प्रियम् lovingly, पृष्ट: having been asked, मात्रे to his mother, सर्वम् every thing, आचष्टे narrated.

72_8.shloka: अद्य मे सप्तमी रात्रिश्च्युतस्याऽर्यकवेश्मनः।अम्बायाः कुशली तात युधाजिन्मातुलश्च मे।।2.72.8।।
72_8.translation: This is the seventh night since I left my noble grandsire's residence. My mother's father, king of Kekaya and my maternal uncle Yudhajit are doing well.
72_8.word_by_word: आर्यकवेश्मनः from noble grandsire's residence, च्युतस्य having left, मे to me, अद्य now, सप्तमी seventh, रात्रिः night, अम्बायाः mother's, तातः father, मे my, मातुलश्च maternal uncle, युधाजित् Yudhajit, कुशली is keeping well.

72_9.shloka: यन्मे धनं च रत्नं च ददौ राजा परन्तपः।परिश्रान्तं पथ्यभवत्ततोऽहं पूर्वमागतः।।2.72.9।।
72_9.translation: The (horses carrying) the wealth including the gems which the king (of Kekaya), the subduer of enemies had bestowed on me were exhausted on the way. Therefore I have come in advance.
72_9.word_by_word: परन्तपः subduer of enemies, राजा king of Kekaya, मे to me, यत् which, धनं च wealth, रत्नं च gems, ददौ had given, that one, पथि on the way, परिश्रान्तम् अभवत् were exhausted, ततः therefore, अहम् I, पूर्वम् in advance, आगतः I came.

72_10.translation: Urged upon by the messengers carrying out the orders of the king, I have come. You, O mother, should answer the questions. I wish to ask you.
72_10.word_by_word: अहम् I, राजवाक्यहरैः by those carrying out royal orders, दूतैः messengers, त्वर्यमाणः have  hastened, आगतः came, अहम् I, यत् which one, प्रष्टुम् to ask, इच्छामि wish,  तत् all that, अम्बा mother, वक्तुम् to tell, अर्हति behoves you.

72_11.shloka: शून्योऽयं शयनीयस्ते पर्यङ्को हेमभूषितः।न चायमिक्ष्वाकुजनः प्रहृष्टः प्रतिभाति मा।।2.72.11।।
72_11.translation: Your goldbedecked couch, worthy of resting lies empty. None of the attendants of the Ikshvakus look cheerful.
72_11.word_by_word: शयनीयः a place worthy of resting, हेमभूषितः decorated with gold, अयम् this, ते your, पर्यङ्क: couch, शून्यः is empty, अयम् च and this, इक्ष्वाकुजनः  attendants of Ikshavaku, प्रहृष्टः with delight, मा to me, न प्रतिभाति does not appear.

72_12.shloka: ﻿राजा भवति भूयिष्ठमिहाम्बाया निवेशने।तमहं नाद्य पश्यामि द्रष्टुमिच्छन्निहाऽगतः।।2.72.12।।
72_12.translation: ﻿I had come here with the hope to see king Dasaratha who spends most of his time in my mother's residence. But today I do not see him .
72_12.word_by_word: ﻿राजा king, भूयिष्ठम् mostly, इह here, अम्बायाः mother's, निवेशने residence, भवति stays, अद्य today, तम him, अहम् I, न पश्यामि do not see, द्रष्टुम् to see, इच्छन् with a wish, इह here, आगतः came.

72_13.shloka: पितुर्ग्रहीष्ये चरणौ तं ममाऽख्याहि पृच्छतः।आहोस्विदम्ब ज्येष्ठायाः कौसल्याया निवेशने।।2.72.13।।
72_13.translation: I would like to pay obeisance at my father's feet. Will you answer my question, O mother, and tell me regarding his whereabouts? Or perchance could he be at the residence of my eldest mother Kausalya?
72_13.word_by_word: अम्ब O mother, पितुः father's, चरणौ both the feet, ग्रहीष्ये I shall hold, पृच्छतः thus asking, मम to me, तम् about him, आख्याहि you may tell, आहोस्वित् perchance, ज्येष्ठायाः the eldest mother's, कौशल्यायाः Kausalya's, निवेशने at her residence.

72_14.shloka: तं प्रत्युवाच कैकेयी प्रियवद्घोरमप्रियम्।अजानन्तं प्रजानन्ती राज्यलोभेन मोहिता।।2.72.14।।
72_14.translation: In spite of knowing everything, Kaikeyi actuated by greed for the kingdom, broke the unpleasant and dreadful news as if it were pleasing to Bharata, who was ignorant of what had transpired.
72_14.word_by_word: प्रजानन्ती In spite of knowing, राज्यलोभेन due to greed for kingdom, मोहिता infatuated, कैकेयी Kaikeyi, घोरम् dreadful, अप्रियम् unpleasant news, प्रियवत् as if it was pleasing, अजानन्तम् ignorant of what had transpired, तम्  him (Bharata), प्रत्युवाच conveyed to him.

72_15.shloka: ﻿या गतिस्सर्वभूतानां तां गतिं ते पिता गतः।राजा महत्मा तेजस्वी यायजूकस्सतां गतिः।।2.72.15।।
72_15.translation: ﻿Your highsouled, brilliant father ever engaged in performing sacrifices and a refuge for the virtuous people, went the inevitable way every living being must follow (attained heaven).
72_15.word_by_word: ﻿राजा king, महात्मा highsouled one, तेजस्वी brilliant one, यायजूकः ever engaged in performing sacrifices, सताम् for virtuous people, गतिः refuge, ते पिता your father, सर्वभूतानाम् for all living beings, या which, गतिः ultimate course, तां गतिम् that course, गतः attained.

72_16.shloka: तच्छ्रुत्वा भरतो वाक्यं धर्माभिजनवाञ्चुचिः।पपात सहसा भूमौ पितृशोकबलार्दितः।।2.72.16।।
72_16.translation: On hearing these words, he (Bharata), born of a righteous race and endowed with purity of character was shattered by the immense grief of his father's demise and dropped down instantaneously on the floor.
72_16.word_by_word: धर्माभिजनवान् born of the righteous race, शुचिः a man of pure nature, भरतः Bharata, तत् at that, वाक्यम् words, श्रुत्वा on hearing, पितृशोकबलार्दितः shattered by the force of grief due to his father's demise, सहसा at once, भूमौ on the ground, पपात collapsed.

72_17.shloka: हा हतोऽस्मीति कृपणां दीनां वाचमुदीरयन्।निपपात महाबाहुर्बाहू विक्षिप्य वीर्यवान्।।2.72.17।।
72_17.translation: The mightyarmed, valiant Bharata, uttering pitiable words, evoking compassion. Alas, I am finished fell down at once throwing up his arms.
72_17.word_by_word: महबाहुः mightyarmed one, वीर्यवान् valiant, हा हतः अस्मि Alas I am finished, इति thus, कृपणाम् evoking compassion, दीनाम् pitiable, वाचम् words, उदीरयन् uttering, बाहू arms, विक्षिप्य having lifted, निपपात fell down.

72_18.translation: Overwhelmed with grief, radiant Bharata reeling with delusion due to sorrow, lamented over the death of his father.
72_18.word_by_word: ततः after that, महातेजाः radiant Bharata, शोकेन by grief, संवीतः overwhelmed, पितुः father's, मरण दुःखितः sorrowing over death, भ्रान्ताकुलितचेतनः his mind afflicted with delusion, विललाप lamented.

72_19.shloka: एतत्सुरुचिरं भाति पितुर्मे शयनं पुरा।शशिनेवामलं रात्रौ गगनं तोयदात्यये।।2.72.19।।
72_19.translation: This couch of my father once used to shine like the spotless night sky irradiated by the autumnal Moon.
72_19.word_by_word: मे पितुः my father's, एतत् this, सुरुचिरम् lovely, शयनम् couch, पुरा formerly, तोयदात्यये at the end of the rainy season, रात्रौ in the night, अमलम् spotless, गगनम् sky, शशिनेव as though by the Moon, भाति स्म used to radiate.

72_20.shloka: तदिदं न विभात्यद्य विहीनं तेन धीमता।व्योमेव शशिना हीनमप्च्छुष्क इव सागरः।।2.72.20।।
72_20.translation: But today this couch without my sagacious father no longer shines like the sky without the Moon or like the sea evaporated.
72_20.word_by_word: धीमता sagacious, तेन by him, विहीनम् deprived of, तत् इदम् that this couch, अद्य today, शशिना by the Moon, हीनम् devoid of, व्योमेव like sky, अप्च्छुष्कः dried up by evaporation of water, सागरः इव like the sea, न विभाति is not shining.

72_21.shloka: ﻿﻿बाष्पमुत्सृज्य् कण्ठेन स्वात्मना परमपीडितः।आच्छाद्य वदनं श्रीमद्वस्त्रेण जयतां वरः।।2.72.21।।
72_21.translation: ﻿﻿Bharata, the foremost among the victorious, clearing his tearchoked throat and covering his auspicious countenance with raiment, wept in profound distress with tears overflowing.
72_21.word_by_word: ﻿﻿जयताम् among the victorious, वरः the foremost, कण्ठेन with throat, बाष्पम् tears, उत्सृज्य having released, वस्त्रेण with raiment, श्रीमत् auspicious, वदनम् countenance, आच्छाद्य having covered, स्वात्मना at his heart, परमपीडितः was profoundly distressed.

72_22.shloka: तमार्तं देवसङ्काशं समीक्ष्य पतितं भुवि।निकृत्तमिव सालस्य स्कन्धं परशुना वने।।2.72.22।।मत्तमातङ्गसङ्काशं चन्द्रार्कसदृशं भुवः।उत्थापयित्वा शोकार्तं वचनं चेदमब्रवीत्।।2.72.23।।
72_22.translation: Anguished and griefstricken, he who resembled the gods, fell down on the ground like a trunk of the sala tree in the forest severed by an axe. Seeing her son who was like a mighty elephant or like the Sun or the Moon, Kaikeyi lifted him up from the ground and spoke these words:
72_22.word_by_word: आर्तम् anguished, देवसङ्काशम् resembling gods, वने in the forest, परशुना by an axe, निकृत्तम् severed, सालस्य sala tree's, स्कन्धमिव like a trunk, सुतम् son, भुवि पतितम् fallen on the ground, मत्तमातङ्गसङ्काशम् like a mighty elephant, चन्द्रार्कसदृशम् similar to the Sun and the Moon, शोकार्तम् tormented by grief, तम् to him (Bharata), भुवः from the ground, उत्थापयित्वा having lifted him up, इदम् these, वचनं च words, अब्रवीत् said.

72_23.shloka: उत्तिष्ठोत्तिष्ठ किं शेषे राजपुत्र महायशः।त्वद्विधा नहि शोचन्ति सन्त स्सदसि सम्मताः।।2.72.24।।
72_23.translation: O illustrious prince arise, arise. Why are you lying down on the floor? Learned people like you, who are worthy of honour in the assembly ought not to grieve like this.
72_23.word_by_word: महायशः illustrious one, राजपुत्र prince, उत्तिष्ठ उत्तिष्ठ arise, arise, किं शेषे why are you lying down, सदसि in the assembly, सम्मताः worthy of honour, त्वद्विधाः like you, सन्तः learned people, न शोचन्ति हि ought not to grieve.

72_24.translation: ﻿O highly intelligent one, by your wisdom, virtuous conduct and scriptural knowledge you are entitled to dispense charity and perform sacrifices. You will always shine incessantly like light of the Sun.
72_24.word_by_word: ﻿बुद्धिसम्पन्न intelligent, ते your, बुद्धिः wisdom, शीलश्रुतिवचोनुगा ever following virtuous conduct and scriptures, दानयज्ञाधिकारा entitled to dispense charity and perform sacrifices, अर्कस्य Sun's, मन्दिरे in the house, प्रभेव like light, (will always shine).

72_25.shloka: स रुदित्वा चिरं कालं भूमौ विपरिवृत्य च।जननीं प्रत्युवाचेदं शोकैर्बहुभिरावृतः।।2.72.26।।
72_25.translation: Bharata engulfed in profuse sorrow wept for a long time rolling on the ground and then said these words in reply to his mother:
72_25.word_by_word: सः he (Bharata), बहुभिः in many ways, शोकैः with sorrow, आवृतः engulfed by, चिरं कालम् for a long time, रुदित्वा having wept, भूमौ on the ground, विपरिवृत्य च and rolled, जननीम्  to his mother, इदम् these words, प्रत्युवाच replied.

72_26.shloka: अभिषेक्ष्यति रामं नु राजा यज्ञं नु यक्ष्यते।इत्यहं कृतसङ्कल्पो हृष्टो यात्रामयासिषम्।।2.72.27।।
72_26.translation: Thinking that the king is about to consecrate Rama or perform some sacrifice, I undertook the journey in great delight.
72_26.word_by_word: राजा king, रामम् Rama, अभिषेक्ष्यति नु  about to consecrate, यज्ञम् sacrifice, यक्ष्यते नु or will perform indeed, इति thinking, अहम् I, कृतसङ्कल्पः with these thoughts, हृष्टः delighted, यात्राम् journey, अयासिषम् had undertaken.

72_27.shloka: तदिदं ह्यन्यथा भूतं व्यवदीर्णं मनो मम।पितरं यो न पश्यामि नित्यं प्रियहिते रतम्।।2.72.28।।
72_27.translation: Now everything has turned out to be different. My mind is shattered.I no longer behold my father who is ever intent on my welfare and happiness.
72_27.word_by_word: तत् इदम् all this, अन्यथा differently, भूतम् has happened, यः such me, नित्यम् always, प्रियहिते  my welfare and happiness, रतम् intent on, पितरम् father, न पश्यामि I do not behold, मम my, मनः mind, व्यवदीर्णम् is shattered.

72_28.shloka: अम्ब केनात्यगाद्राजा व्याघिना मय्यनागते।धन्या रामादयस्सर्वे यैः पिता संस्कृत स्स्वयम्।।2.72.29।।
72_28.translation: O mother what ailment caused the king's death before I could return? How fortunate are Rama and others by whom the last rites of my father were performed
72_28.word_by_word: अम्ब O mother, राजा king, मयि my, अनागते even before I could return, केन व्याधिना by what ailment, अत्यगात् passed away, यैः by Rama and others, पिता father, स्वयम् personally, संस्कृतः has been offered last rites, such, रामादयः Rama and others, धन्याः are fortunate.

72_29.shloka: ﻿न नूनं मां महाराजः प्राप्तं जानाति कीर्तिमान्।उपजिघ्रेद्धि मूर्ध्नि तात स्सन्नम्य सत्वरम्।।2.72.30।।
72_29.translation: ﻿Surely the illustrious maharaja is not aware of my arrival. Otherwise he would have quickly bent my head and kissed me on my forehead.
72_29.word_by_word: ﻿कीर्तिमान् illustrious, महाराजः great king, माम् me, प्राप्तम् reaching this place, न जानाति does not know, नूनम् surely, तातः father, सत्वरम् quickly, माम् me, सन्नम्य bending, मूर्ध्नि on the fore head, उपजिघ्रेत् हि would have smelt indeed( kissed).

72_30.shloka: ﻿क्व स पाणिस्सुखस्पर्शस्तातस्याक्लिष्टकर्मणः।येन मां रजसा ध्वस्तमभीक्ष्णं परिमार्जति।।2.72.31।।
72_30.translation: ﻿Where is that hand of my father of unwearied actions, the hand that would wipe away the dust from my person with a pleasant touch?
72_30.word_by_word: ﻿रजसा with dust, ध्वस्तम् covered, माम् me, येन by which (hand), अभीक्ष्णम् repeatedly, परिमार्जति used to wipe away, अक्लिष्टकर्मणः of tireless actions, तातस्य father's, सुखस्पर्शः having pleasant touch, सः पाणिः that hand, क्व where is it?

72_31.shloka: यो मे भ्राता पिता बन्धुर्यस्य दासोऽस्मि धीमतः।तस्य मां शीघ्रमाख्याहि रामस्याक्लिष्टकर्मणः।।2.72.32।।
72_31.translation: Announce at once my arrival to the wise Rama, the man of unwearied actions, my brother, father and friend whose slave I am.
72_31.word_by_word: यः who, मे to me, भ्राता brother, पिता father, बन्धुः relative, धीमतः wise, यस्य whose, दासः अस्मि I am a slave (of that wise man), तस्य such, अक्लिष्टकर्मणः of a man of unwearied actions, रामस्य to Rama, माम् about me, शीघ्रम् at once, आख्याहि announce.

72_32.shloka: ﻿﻿पिता हि भवति ज्येष्ठो धर्ममार्यस्य जानतः।तस्य पादौ ग्रहीष्यामि स हीदानीं गतिर्मम।।2.72.33।।
72_32.translation: ﻿﻿To one who knows the ways of righteousness the elder brother is (like) the father. Indeed, he (Rama) is my refuge and I shall hold his feet now.
72_32.word_by_word: ﻿﻿धर्मम् the ways of righteousness, जानतः one who knows, आर्यस्य of the noble person, ज्येष्ठः eldest brother, पिता भवति हि becomes father, तस्य his, पादौ feet, ग्रहीष्यामि shall hold, स: he, इदानीम् now, मम my, गतिः हि is a refuge indeed.

72_33.shloka: ﻿﻿﻿धर्मविद्धर्मनित्यश्च सत्यसन्धो दृढव्रतः।आर्यः किमब्रवीद्राजा पिता मे सत्यविक्रमः।।2.72.34।।
72_33.translation: ﻿﻿﻿What did my father, the noble king, conversant with righteous conduct, true, to his vows, one who always conducted himself in a righteous manner, whose truth was his prowess (at the time of his death)?
72_33.word_by_word: ﻿﻿﻿धर्मवित् conversant with virtuous conduct, धर्मनित्यश्च one who always conducts himself in a righteous manner, सत्यसन्ध: fixed upon truth, दृढव्रतः firm in vows, सत्यविक्रमः one whose strength is truth, आर्यः venerable one, राजा king, मे पिता my father, किम् what, अब्रवीत् did he say (at the time of his death)?

72_34.shloka: पश्चिमं साधु सन्देशमिच्छामि श्रोतुमात्मनः।इति पृष्टा यथातत्त्वं कैकेयी वाक्यमब्रवीत्।।2.72.35।।
72_34.translation: I want to hear the exact words of my father's last message to me. Thus questioned (by Bharata), Kaikeyi related the exact facts:
72_34.word_by_word: आत्मनः relating to me, पश्चिमम् last, सन्देशम् message, साधु exactly, श्रोतुम् to listen, इच्छामि wish, इति thus, पृष्टा questioned, कैकेयी Kaikeyi, यथा तत्त्वम् as actually happened, वाक्यम् words, अब्रवीत् said.

72_35.shloka: रामेति राजा विलपन् हा सीते लक्ष्मणेति च।स महात्मा परं लोकं गतो गतिमतां वरः।।2.72.36।।
72_35.translation: The magnanimous king, the foremost of those who attained the excellent state after, death, went to the other world, lamenting 'O Rama, O Sita, O Lakshamana'.
72_35.word_by_word: गतिमताम् among those who attained the excellent state, वरः the foremost, महात्मा magnanimous, सः that, राजा king, रामेति O Rama, हा सीते O Sita, लक्ष्मणेति च O Lakshmana also, विलपन् lamenting, परं लोकम् to the other world, गतः went.

72_36.shloka: इमां तु पश्चिमां वाचं व्याजहार पिता तव।कालधर्मपरिक्षिप्तः पाशैरिव महागजः।।2.72.37।।
72_36.translation: Your father, caught by the noose of death, like a great elephant bound by cords, uttered these last words:
72_36.word_by_word: तव your, पिता father, महागजः like a great elephant, पाशैरिव as though by cords,               कालधर्मपरिक्षिप्तः caught by the noose of fate and time, पश्चिमाम् last, इमाम् this, वाचम् words, व्याजहार uttered.

72_37.shloka: सिद्धार्थास्ते नरा राममागतं सह सीतया।लक्ष्मणं च महाबाहुं द्रक्ष्यन्ति पुनरागतम्।।2.72.38।।
72_37.translation: 'Those men who will see Rama returning home along with Sita and mightyarmed Lakshmana, will have their desires fulfilled.'
72_37.word_by_word: सीतया सह along with Sita, आगतम् returned, रामम् Rama, पुनः again, आगतम् arrived, महाबाहुम् mightyarmed, लक्ष्मणं च with Lakshmana, द्रक्ष्यन्ति see, ते नराः those men, सिद्धार्थाः will have their desires fulfilled.

72_38.shloka: तच्छ्रुत्वा विषसादैव द्वितीयाप्रियशंसनात्।विषण्णवदनो भूत्वा भूयः पप्रच्छ मातरम्।।2.72.39।।
72_38.translation: Bharata was more distraught on hearing the words that conveyed the second unpleasant tidings. With downcast countenance, he again enquired of his mother thus:
72_38.word_by_word: तत् that one, श्रूत्वा on hearing, द्वितीयाप्रियशंसनात् the account of second unpleasant tidings, विषसादैव more distressed, विषण्णवदनः भूत्वा with downcast countenance, भूयः again, मातरम् mother, पप्रच्छ enquired.

72_39.shloka: ﻿क्व चेदानीं स धर्मात्मा कौसल्यानन्दवर्धनः।लक्ष्मणेन सह भ्रात्रा सीतया च समं गतः।।2.72.40।।
72_39.translation: ﻿Where has righteous Rama who enhances the delight of Kausalya along with his brother Lakshmana and Sita gone now?
72_39.word_by_word: ﻿धर्मात्मा righteous one, सः he, कौशल्यानन्दवर्धनः one who enhances the delight of Kausalya, भ्रात्रा with his brother, लक्ष्मणेन सह with Lakshmana too, सीतया च समम् with Sita, इदानीम् at this time, क्व where, गतः has gone?

72_40.shloka: तथा पृष्टा यथातत्त्वमाख्यातुमुपचक्रमे।मातास्य सुमहद्वाक्यं विप्रियं प्रियशङ्कया।।2.72.41।।
72_40.translation: Thus questioned, his mother started relating the exact events, presuming them to be pleasant tidings (for Bharata).
72_40.word_by_word: तथा thus, पृष्टा  questioned, अस्य माता his mother, सुमहत् great, विप्रियम् grievous, वाक्यम् words, प्रियशङ्कया presuming it to be pleasant, यथातत्त्वम् exact fact, आख्यातुम् to relate, उपचक्रमे commenced.

72_41.shloka: स हि राजसुतः पुत्र चीरवासा महावनम्।दण्डकान्सह वैदेह्या लक्ष्मणानुचरो गतः।।2.72.42।।
72_41.translation: O my son, prince Rama attired in garments of bark along with Sita and followed by Lakshmana left for the great Dandaka forest.
72_41.word_by_word: पुत्र O son, राजसुतः king's son (prince), सः that Rama, चीरवासाः attired in garments of bark, लक्ष्मणानुचरः followed by Lakshmana, वैदेह्या सह with Sita, महावनम् great forest, दण्डकान् to Dandaka, गतः हि left.

72_42.shloka: तच्छ्रुत्वा भरतस्त्रस्तो भ्रातुश्चारित्रशङ्कया।स्वस्य वंशस्य महात्म्यात्प्रष्टुं समुपचक्रमे।।2.72.43।।
72_42.translation: Conscious of the glory of his race, Bharata continued to enquire if there was any unrighteous conduct on the part of his brother.
72_42.word_by_word: भरतः Bharata, तत् that word, श्रुत्वा having heard, स्वस्य वंशस्य his dynasty's, महात्म्यात् due to greatness, भ्रातुः his brother's, चरित्रशङ्कया doubting about unrighteous conduct, प्रष्टुम्  to ascertain, समुपचक्रमे again started.

72_43.shloka: कच्चिन्न ब्राह्मणधनं हृतं रामेण कस्यचित्।कच्चिन्नाढ्यो दरिद्रो वा तेनापापो विहिंसितः।।2.72.44।।
72_43.translation: I hope Rama did not seize the wealth of any brahmin nor did any harm to an innocent person, whether rich or poor.
72_43.word_by_word: रामेण by Rama, कस्यचित् of some one or the other, ब्राह्मण धनम् wealth of brahmin, न हृतं  did not seize, कच्चित् I hope not, तेन by him, आढ्यः a rich man, दरिद्रो वा or a poor one, अपापः innocent, न विहिंसितः was not tortured, कच्चित् I hope.

72_44.shloka: कच्चिन्न परदारान्वा राजपुत्रोऽभिमन्यते।कस्मात्स दण्डकारण्ये भ्रूणहेव विवासितः।।2.72.45।।
72_44.translation: I hope he did not covet another man's wife. Like a sinner who had slain a child in embryo why has he been banished to Dandaka forest?
72_44.word_by_word: राजपुत्रः the prince, परदारान् another man's wife, नाभिमन्यते वा कच्चित् did not covet, I hope, स: he, Rama, भ्रूणहा like a sinner who had slain a child in embryo, दण्डकारण्ये to Dandaka forest, कस्मात् why, विवासितः has been banished.

72_45.shloka: ﻿अथास्य चपला माता तत्स्वकर्म यथातथम्।तेनैव स्त्रीस्वभावेन व्याहर्तुमुपचक्रमे।।2.72.46।।
72_45.translation: ﻿Then the capricious mother, with the same feminine disposition which she had displayed earlier, started giving a faithful account of all her deeds.
72_45.word_by_word: ﻿अथ thereafter, चपला the capricious one, अस्य माता his mother, तेन by the same, स्त्री स्वभावेन with her earlier feminine disposition, तत् that, स्वकर्म her own deeds, यथातथम् faithfully, व्याहर्तुम् to tell, उपचक्रमे commenced.

72_46.shloka: एवमुक्ता तु कैकेयी भरतेन महात्मना।उवाच वचनं हृष्टा मूढा पण्डितमानिनी।।2.72.47।।
72_46.translation: On hearing the words of great Bharata, that foolish woman Kaikeyi thinking herself to be wise, cheerfully said:
72_46.word_by_word: महात्मना great, भरतेन by Bharata, एवम् thus, उक्ता spoken, मूढा the foolish lady, पण्डितमानिनी thinking herself to be wise, कैकेयी Kaikeyi, हृष्टा delightfully, वचनम् these words, उवाच spoke.

72_47.shloka: न ब्राह्मणधनं किञ्चिद्धृतं रामेण कस्यचित्कश्चिन्नाढ्यो दरिद्रो तेनापापो विहिंसितः।न रामः परदारांश्च चक्षुर्भ्यामपि पश्यति।।2.72.48।।
72_47.translation: Rama did not rob any brahmin of even a little wealth nor did he harm any innocent man, whether rich or poor. He never casts his eyes on another's wife.
72_47.word_by_word: रामेण by Rama, कस्यचित् some one's, ब्राह्मण धनम् wealth of brahmin, किञ्चित् even a little, न हृतम् was not seized, तेन by him, आढ्यः whether rich, दरिद्रो वा or poor अपापः innocent, कश्चित् even a little, न विहिंसितः was not harmed, रामः Rama, परदारान् wife of other man, चक्षुर्भ्याम् with the eyes, न पश्यति did not see.

72_48.shloka: मया तु पुत्र श्रुत्वैव रामस्यैवाभिषेचनम्।याचितस्ते पिता राज्यं रामस्य च विवासनम्।।2.72.49।।
72_48.translation: My son, I on hearing of Rama's consecration asked your father to confer the kingdom on you and banish Rama.
72_48.word_by_word: पुत्र O my son, मया तु by me, रामस्यैव Rama's, अभिषेचनम् consecration, श्रुत्वैव on hearing itself, पिता your father, ते for you, राज्यम् kingdom, रामस्य Rama's, विवासनं च  banishment, याचितः has been asked.

72_49.shloka: स स्ववृत्तिं समास्थाय पिता ते तत्तऽथाकरोत्।रामश्च सह सौमित्रिः प्रेषितस्सह सीतया।।2.72.50।।
72_49.translation: Your father, faithful to his word, banished Rama along with Lakshmana and Sita.
72_49.word_by_word: ते पिता your father, सः he, स्ववृत्तिम् kept up his own promise, समास्थाय having followed, तत् that one, तथा exactly, अकरोत् performed, सहसौमित्रि along with Lakshmana, रामश्च Rama also, सीतया सह along with Sita, प्रेषितः were sent.

72_50.translation: The renowned ruler of the earth (king Dasaratha), unable to behold (the sorry state of) his beloved son and stricken by filial grief, merged into the five elements (died).
72_50.word_by_word: महायशाः renowned, महीपालः ruler of this earth, तम् that, प्रियं पुत्रम् beloved son, अपश्यन् not being able to behold, पुत्रशोक परिद्यूनः stricken by filial grief, पञ्चत्वम् the state of merger in the five elements, उपपेदिवान् obtained.

72_51.shloka: त्वयात्विदानीं धर्मज्ञ राजत्वमवलम्ब्यताम्।त्वत्कृते हि मया सर्वमिदमेवं विधं कृतम्।।2.72.52।।
72_51.translation: O knower of dharma, assume kingship now. It is only for your sake that all this has been done by me.
72_51.word_by_word: धर्मज्ञ O knower of dharma, इदानीम् now, त्वया by you, राजत्वम् kingship, अवलम्ब्यताम् take possession of, मया by me, त्वत्कृते for your sake only, एवं विधम् in this manner, इदं सर्वम् all this, कृतं हि has been done.

72_52.shloka: ﻿मा शोकं मा च सन्तापं धैर्यमाश्रय पुत्रक।त्वदधीना हि नगरी राज्यं चैतदनामयम्।।2.72.53।।
72_52.translation: ﻿My son, give up sorrow and agony and take recourse to courage. This city as well as the kingdom, free from all obstacles, is under your control.
72_52.word_by_word: ﻿पुत्रक my son, शोकम् sorrow, मा आश्रय do not take recourse, सन्तापं च to remorse, मा do not take recourse, धैर्यम् courage, आश्रय take recourse, नगरी this city, त्वदधीना is under your control, अनामयम् free from obstacles, एतत् this, राज्यं च kingdom also.

72_53.shloka: तत्पुत्र शीघ्रं विधिना विधिज्ञैर्वसिष्ठमुख्यै स्सहितो द्विजेन्द्रैः।सङ्काल्य राजानमदीनसत्त्वमात्मानमुर्व्यामभिषेचयस्व।।2.72.54।।
72_53.translation: Therefore, my son, under the guidance of Vasistha and other noble brahmins, wellversed in rituals, quickly perform the funeral obsequies in accordance with tradition and without getting depressed in spirit, get yourself coronated as lord of this earth.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे द्विसप्ततितमस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the seventysecond sarga in Ayodhyakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
72_53.word_by_word: तत् hence, पुत्र O my son, विधिज्ञै: by those wellversed in rules, वसिष्ठमुख्यैः headed by Vasistha, द्विजेन्द्रैः by the best of brahmins, सहितः with, राजानम् to the king, विधिना duly, शीघ्रम् quickly, सङ्काल्य performing obsequies, अदीन सत्त्वम् without getting depressed in spirit, आत्मानम् yourself, उर्व्याम् on this earth, अभिषेचयस्व get coronated.

73_1.shloka: [Bharata grieves over his misfortune -- accuses Kaikeyi in so many words -- reveals his decision to bring back Rama to Ayodhya and serve him.]सश्रूत्वा तु पितरं वृत्तं भ्रातरौ च विवासितौ।भरतो दुःखसन्तप्त इदं वचनमब्रवीत्।।2.73.1।।
73_1.translation: On hearing about the demise of the father and his two brothers sent in exile, Bharata  overtaken by sorrow spoke thus:
73_1.word_by_word: भरतः Bharata, पितरम् father, वृत्तम् had passed away, भ्रातरौ the two brothers, विवासितौ  were in exile, श्रुत्वा तु having heard, दुःखसन्तप्तः afflicted with sorrow, इदम् these, वचनम् words, अब्रवीत् said.

73_2.shloka: किं नु कार्यं हतस्येह मम राज्येन शोचतः।विहीनस्याथ पित्रा च भ्रात्रा पितृसमेन च।।2.73.2।।
73_2.translation: Bereft of my father and my brother who was like a father to me, of what avail is this kingdom to me when I am grieving and fallen into misfortunes?
73_2.word_by_word: पित्रा च with father, अथ and, पितृसमेन like to a father to me, भ्रात्राच with brother, विहीनस्य bereft, शोचतः of a grieving one, हतस्य fallen into misfortunes, मम to me, इह now, राज्येन with the kingdom, किं नु कार्यम् of what avail?

73_3.shloka: दुःखे मे दुःखमकरोर्व्रणे क्षारमिवादधाः।राजानं प्रेतभावस्थं कृत्वा रामं च तापसम्।।2.73.3।।
73_3.translation: You have caused the death of the king and reduced Rama to an ascetic. You have piled one sorrow over sorrow on me like rubbing salt to the wound
73_3.word_by_word: राजानम् king, प्रेतभावस्थम् reducing to a corpse, रामं च also Rama, तापसम् as an ascetic, कृत्वा having made, मे to me, दुःखे in one sorrow, दुःखं another sorrow, (मे) अकरोः you have caused, व्रणे in the wound, क्षारम् salt, आदधाः इव like putting.

73_4.shloka: कुलस्य त्वमभावाय कालरात्रिरिवाऽगता।अङ्गारमुपगूह्य स्म पिता मे नावबुद्धवान्।।2.73.4।।
73_4.translation: You have come here for the destruction of this race, like a fatal night. My father did not realize that he was embracing a live charcoal.
73_4.word_by_word: त्वम् you, कुलस्य family's, अभावाय for destruction, कालरात्रिरिव like a fatal night, आगता  have arrived, मे पिता my father, अङ्गारम् a live charcoal, उपगूह्य having embraced, नावबुद्धवान् did not realize.

73_5.shloka: मृत्युमापादितो पिता त्वया मे पापदर्शिनि।सुखं परिहृतं मोहात्कुलेऽस्मिन्कुलपांसनि।।2.73.5।।
73_5.translation: O woman of sinful thoughts, you have brought about the death of my father. O obloquy of the race, by your folly you have deprived this family of its happiness.
73_5.word_by_word: पापदर्शिनि O woman of sinful thoughts, त्वया by you, मे पिता my father, मृत्युम् death, आपादितः was led to, कुलपांसनि O obloquy of the race, मोहात् out of folly, अस्मिन्  कुले in this family, सुखम् happiness, परिहृतम् has been taken away.

73_6.shloka: त्वां प्राप्य हि पिता मेऽद्य सत्यसन्धो महायशाः।तीव्रदुःखाभिसन्तप्तो वृत्तो दशरथो नृपः।।2.73.6।।
73_6.translation: My father king Dasaratha who is bound to truth and highly renowned, having come under your influence and tormented by intense grief has departed from this world.
73_6.word_by_word: मे my, पिता father, सत्यसन्धः adhering to truth, महायशाः renowned, नृपः king, दशरथः Dasaratha, अद्य now, त्वाम् you, प्राप्य having come under your influence, तीव्र दुःखाभिसन्तप्तः tormented by intense grief, वृत्तः has departed from this world.

73_7.shloka: विनाशितो महाराजः पिता मे धर्मवत्सलः।कस्मात्प्रव्राजितो रामः कस्मादेव वनं गतः।।2.73.7।।
73_7.translation: Why was my father the righteous maharaja killed? Why was Rama exiled into the forest?
73_7.word_by_word: धर्मवत्सलः righteous, महाराजः great king, मे पिता my father, कस्मात् for what reason, विनाशितः has been destroyed, रामः Rama, कस्मात् for what reason, प्रव्राजितः has been exiled, वनम् to the forest, गतः has gone.

73_8.shloka: कौसल्या च सुमित्रा च पुत्रशोकाभिपीडिते।दुष्करं यदि जीवेतां प्राप्य त्वां जननीं मम।।2.73.8।।
73_8.translation: Tormented by the grief of separation from their sons, it is difficult for Kausalya and Sumitra to survive under you, O my mother.
73_8.word_by_word: पुत्रशोकाभिपीडिते tormented by the grief on account of separation from their sons, कौशल्या च Kausalya and, सुमित्रा च Sumitra too, मम जननीम् my own mother, त्वाम् you, प्राप्य having obtained, जीवेतां यदि will survive, दुष्करम् difficult.

73_9.shloka: ननुत्वार्योऽपि धर्मात्मा त्वयि वृतिमनुत्तमाम्।वर्तते गुरुवृत्तिज्ञो यथा मातरि वर्तते।।2.73.9।।
73_9.translation: My noble and righteous brother (Rama), who is well aware of his duties to the elders conducted himself before you as he would before his own mother.
73_9.word_by_word: धर्मत्मा righteous, गुरुवृत्तिज्ञः well aware of his duties towards elders, आर्योऽपि noble, too  मातरि towards his mother, यथा as, वर्तते conducted himself, त्वयि towards you, अनुत्तमाम् very great, वृत्तिम् conduct, वर्तते ननु is abiding indeed.

73_10.shloka: तथा ज्येष्ठा हि मे माता कौसल्या दीर्घदर्शिनी।त्वयि धर्मं समास्थाय भगिन्यामिव वर्तते।।2.74.10।।
73_10.translation: In the same way my eldest mother the farsighted Kausalya, too adhered to righteousness and conducted herself towards you like a sister.
73_10.word_by_word: तथा in the same way, मे my, ज्येष्टा eldest, माता mother, दीर्घदर्शिनी a lady with farsight, कौशल्या Kausalya, धर्मम् righteousness, समास्थाय having adhered, त्वयि towards you, भगिन्यामिव as if a sister, वर्तते हि conducted

73_11.shloka: तस्याः पुत्रं कृताऽत्मानं चीरवल्कलवाससम्।प्रस्थाप्य वनवासाय कथं पापे न शोचसि।।2.73.11।।
73_11.translation: You have forced Kausalya's son, so pure in mind, to wear garments made of bark and dwell in the forest. Do you not feel remorse for it, O perverse wretch?
73_11.word_by_word: पापे O perverse wretch, कृतात्मानम् a man pure in mind, तस्याः Kauslaya's, पुत्रम् son, चीरवल्कलवाससम् made to adorn garments made of bark, वनवासाय to dwell in the forest, प्रस्थाप्य having sent, कथम् how, न शोचसि you do not feel remorseful?

73_12.shloka: अपापदर्शनं शूरं कृतात्मानं यशस्विनम्।प्रव्राज्य चीरवसनं किन्नु पश्यसि कारणम्।।2.73.12।।
73_12.translation: The glorious, valiant, selfpossessed (Rama) had never contemplated evil. What possible reason do you have for sending him, clothed in bark, into exile?
73_12.word_by_word: अपापदर्शनम् one who never contemplated evil, शूरम् valiant, कृतात्मानम् having control over his mind, यशस्विनम् the glorious, चीरवसनम् clad in bark clothes, प्रव्राज्य after being exiled, किन्नु what possible, कारणम् reason, पश्यसि do you see?

73_13.shloka: ﻿लुब्धाया विदितो मन्ये न तेऽहं राघवं प्रति।तथाह्यनर्धो राज्यार्थं त्वयाऽनीतो महानयम्।।2.73.13।।
73_13.translation: ﻿Being avaricious, you are, I think, unaware of my devotion to Rama. This great calamity has been brought about by you for (your greed for) the kingdom.
73_13.word_by_word: ﻿लुब्धायाः of avaricious, ते to you, अहम् I, राघवं प्रति to Rama, न विदितः were unaware of, मन्ये I deem, तथाहि that is proper, त्वया by you, राज्यार्थम् for the sake of kingdom, अयम् this, महान् great, अनर्थः calamity, आनीतः has been brought about.

73_14.shloka: अहं हि पुरुषव्याघ्रावपश्यन्रामलक्ष्मणौ।केन शक्तिप्रभावेन राज्यं रक्षितुमुत्सहे।।2.73.14।।
73_14.translation: When Rama and Lakshmana, the best of men stay away from me, by virtue of what mighty power am I competent to protect this kingdom?
73_14.word_by_word: अहम् I, पुरुषव्याघ्रौ two tigers among men, रामलक्ष्मणौ Rama and Lakshmana, अपश्यन् without beholding them, केन with what, शक्तिप्रभावेन by the mighty power, राज्यम् kingdom, रक्षितुम् to protect, उत्सहे will be competent?

73_15.shloka: तं हि नित्यं महाराजो बलवन्तं महाबलः।उपाश्रितोऽभूद्धर्मात्मा मेरुर्मेरुवनं यथा।।2.73.15।।
73_15.translation: The mighty and righteous maharaja used to rely upon the powerful Rama just as mount Meru depends on the forest surrounding it for its protection.
73_15.word_by_word: महाबलः  mighty, धर्मात्मा righteous one, महाराजः great king, नित्यम् always, बलवन्तम् all powerful, तम् Rama, मेरुः mount Meru, मेरुवनं यथा just as the forest surrounding Meru, उपाश्रितः अभूत् हि used to rely upon.

73_16.shloka: सोऽहं कथमिमं भारं महाधुर्यसमुद्धृतम्।दम्योधुरमिवाऽऽसाद्य वहेयं केनचौजसा।। 2.73.16।।
73_16.translation: Like a young untrained bullock that cannot carry the weight fit for a great bull, with what strength can I bear this burden?
73_16.word_by_word: सः अहम् such as me, इमं भारम् this burden, आसाद्य having taken, महाधुर्यसमुद्धृतम् carried by a great bull fit to be yoked, धुरम् the weight, दम्यः इव like an young bullock requiring training, केन by what, ओजसा strength, वहेयम् I shall bear?

73_17.shloka: अथवा मे भवेच्छक्तिर्योगैर्बुद्धिबलेन वा।सकामां न करिष्यामि त्वामहं पुत्रगर्धिनीम्।।2.73.17।।
73_17.translation: If I gather the strength (to carry the burden) either by employing the four expedients (available to a king against an enemy) or by the power of intellect, I will not allow you, covetous of your son, to fulfil your ambition.
73_17.word_by_word: अथवा or, योगैः by employing the four expedients (conciliation, bribery, sowing dissenssions and punishment), बुद्धिबलेन वा or with the strength of intellect, मे to me, शक्तिः भवेत् I might get strength, अहम् I, पुत्रगर्धिनीम् covetous of son, त्वाम् you, सकामाम्  having fulfilled your ambition, न करिष्यामि will not do.

73_18.shloka: न मे विकाङ्क्षा जायेत त्यक्तुं त्वां पापनिश्चयाम्।यदि रामस्य नावेक्षा त्वयि स्यान्मातृवत्सदा।।2.73.18।।
73_18.translation: Had Rama not treated you as his own mother I would not have the slightest hesitation to renounce you, a lady of sinful disposition.
73_18.word_by_word: त्वयि towards you, रामस्य of Rama, सदा always, मातृवत् just like his mother, अवेक्षा न स्याद्यदि if it were not so, पापनिश्चयाम् having sinful conviction, त्वाम् you, त्यक्तुम् to renounce, मे to me, विकाङ्क्षा disinclination, न जायेत will not cause.

73_19.shloka: उत्पन्नातु कथं बुद्धिस्तवेयं पापदर्शिनि।साधुचारित्रविभ्रष्टे पूर्वेषां नो विगर्हिता।।2.73.19।।
73_19.translation: O woman of sinful thoughts fallen from virtuous conduct, how did you entertain this thought reproachable to our ancestors?
73_19.word_by_word: पापदर्शिनि O sinful woman, साधुचरित्रविभ्रष्टे one fallen from virtuous conduct, नः our, पूर्वेषाम् for our ancestors, विगर्हिता reproachable, इयं बुद्धि: this thought, तव to you, कथम् how, उत्पन्ना originated.

73_20.shloka: अस्मिन्कुले हि पूर्वेषां ज्येष्ठो राज्येऽभिषिच्यते।अपरे भ्रातरस्तस्मिन्प्रवर्तन्ते समाहिताः।।2.73.20।।
73_20.translation: In our race only the eldest son is installed in the kingdom and the other brothers behave with utmost respect towards him.
73_20.word_by_word: अस्मिन् in this, कुले race, पूर्वेषाम् of our ancestors, ज्येष्ठः the eldest one, राज्ये in the kingdom, अभिषिच्यते हि is indeed installed, अपरे the rest of them, भ्रातरः brothers, तस्मिन् in the eldest, समाहिताः concentrate their attention, प्रवर्तन्ते conduct themselves.

73_21.shloka: न हि मन्ये नृशंसे त्वं राजधर्ममवेक्षसे।गतिं वा न विजानासि राजवृत्तस्य शाश्वतीम्।।2.73.21।।
73_21.translation: O cruel one I suppose neither have you any respect for the royal tradition nor are you aware of the everlasting benefit that ensues in following the royal traditon.
73_21.word_by_word: नृशंसे O cruel lady, त्वम् you, राजधर्मम् royal tradition, न अवेक्षसे are not looking at, वा  or, राजवृत्तस्य royal tradition's, शाश्वतीम् everlasting, गतिम् consequences, न विजानासि are ignorant, मन्ये I suppose.

73_22.shloka: ﻿सततं राजवृत्ते हि ज्येष्ठो राज्येऽभिषिच्यते।राज्ञामेतत्समं तत्स्यादिक्ष्वाकूणां विशेषतः।।2.73.22।।
73_22.translation: ﻿According to the established law of royalty, the eldest son is invariably crowned in the kingdom. This is true of all kings. This is a special tradition of the kings of the Ikshvaku race.
73_22.word_by_word: ﻿राजवृत्ते in royal custom, सततम् always, ज्येष्ठः the eldest son, राज्ये in the kingdom, अभिषिच्यते is consecrated, एतत् this, राज्ञाम् to all kings, समम् is the same, तत् that, इक्ष्वाकूणाम् for Ikshvakus, विशेषतः स्यात् especially it applies.

73_23.shloka: तेषां धर्मैकरक्षाणां कुलचारित्रशोभिनाम्।अद्य चारित्रशौण्डीर्यं त्वां प्राप्य विनिवर्तितम्।।2.73.23।।
73_23.translation: As for the Ikshvaku kings, righteousness is their sole protection. They follow the ancestral traditions befitting the noble race. This tradition has been topsyturvied by admitting you into the family.
73_23.word_by_word: धर्मैकरक्षाणाम् with righteousness as their sole protection, कुलचारित्रशोभिनाम् befitting the  ancestral traditions of the noble race, तेषाम् those (Ikshvaku kings)', चारित्रशौण्डीर्यम् pride about their tradition, अद्य now, त्वाम् you, प्राप्य after admitting, विनिवर्तितम् has been topsyturvied.

73_24.shloka: तवापि सुमहाभागा जनेन्द्राः कुलपूर्वगाः।बुद्धेर्मोहः कथमयं सम्भूतस्त्वयि गर्हितः।।2.73.24।।
73_24.translation: Even the kings in your ancestral family were highly distinguished men. How did this condemnable deflection originate in your mind?
73_24.word_by_word: तव your, कुलपूर्वगाः ancestors of your family, जनेन्द्राः अपि kings also, सुमहाभागाः were highly distinguished, गर्हितः censured, अयम् this, बुद्धेः mind's, मोहः delusion, त्वयि in you, कथम् how, सम्भूतः originated.

73_25.shloka: न तु कामं करिष्यामि तवाऽहं पापनिश्चये।त्वया व्यसनमारब्धं जीवितान्तकरं मम।।2.73.25।।
73_25.translation: O woman of sinful disposition, I on my part will not fulfil your cherished desire. Youhave started a distressing deed to bring an end to my existence.
73_25.word_by_word: पापनिश्चये O woman of sinful convictions, अहं तु I on my part, तव your, कामम्  cherished desire, न करिष्यामि will not fulfil, त्वया by you, मम my, जीवितान्तकरम् bringing an end to my existence, व्यसनम् distressing deed, आरब्धम् has commenced.

73_26.translation: To cause a great discomfiture for you, right now I shall bring back my faultless brother, the beloved of his people, from the forest.
73_26.word_by_word: एषः अहं तु as for me, इदानीम् now itself, तव your, अप्रियार्थम् for the sake of causing displeasure, अनघम् faultless, स्वजनप्रियम् the beloved of his people, भ्रातरम् my brother, वनात् from the forest, निवर्तयिष्यामि will make him turn back.

73_27.shloka: निवर्तयित्वा रामं च तस्याहं दीप्ततेजसः।दासभूतो भविष्यामि सुस्थिरेणान्तरात्मना।।2.73.27।।
73_27.translation: With the effulgent Rama brought back, I shall serve him with a  steadfast mind.
73_27.word_by_word: रामम् Rama, निवर्तयित्वा after bringing back, सुस्थिरेण with a steady, अन्तरात्मना and heart, दीप्ततेजसः with radiating lustre, तस्य to him, दासभूतः like a servant, भविष्यामि I shall become.

73_28.shloka: इत्येवमुक्त्वा भरतो महात्मा प्रियेतरैर्वाक्यगणैस्तुदंस्ताम्।शोकातुरश्चापि ननाद भूयः सिंहो यथा पर्वतगह्वरस्थः।।2.73.28।।
73_28.translation: Having inflicted on his mother these unpleasant words in this manner, the highsouled Bharata, overwhelmed with grief, roared again like a lion in a mountaincave.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे त्रिसप्ततितमस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the seventythird sarga in Ayodhyakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
73_28.word_by_word: महात्मा highsouled, भरतः Bharata, इत्येवम् in this manner, उक्त्वा having spoken, प्रियेतरैः unpleasant, वाक्यगणैः with words, ताम् her, तुदन् afflicting, शोकातुरः overwhelmed with grief, पर्वतगह्वरस्थः inside a mountaincave, सिंहो यथा like a lion, भूयश्चापि once again, ननादcried out loudly.

74_1.shloka: [Bharata reproaches his mother -- decides to restore the glory of Ayodhya -- vows to get back Rama]तां तथा गर्हयित्वा तु मातरं भरतस्तदा।रोषेण महताऽविष्टः पुनरेवाब्रवीद्वचः।।2.74.1।।
74_1.translation: Overtaken by great wrath, Bharata reproached his mother and then said to her again:
74_1.word_by_word: तदा then, भरतः Bharata, मातरम् mother, ताम् her, तथा in that manner, गर्हयित्वा having reproached, महता with great, रोषेण wrath, आविष्टः was overtaken, पुनरेव once again, वचः words, अब्रवीत् said.

74_2.shloka: राज्याद्भ्रंशस्व कैकेयि नृशंसे दुष्टचारिणि।परित्यक्ता च धर्मेण मा मृतं रुदती भव।।2.74.2।।
74_2.translation: O cruel Kaikeyi of wicked conduct, you may be deprived of the kingdom. Abandoned by righteousness, you shall be weeping for me after my death.
74_2.word_by_word: नृशंसे O cruel one, दुष्टचारिणि of wicked conduct, कैकेयि O Kaikeyi, राज्यात् from the  kingdom, भ्रंशस्व may be deprived, धर्मेण by righteousness, परित्यक्ता abandoned, मृतम्  having died, मा about me, रुदती भव keep weepng.

74_3.shloka: किन्नु तेऽदूषयद्राजा रामो वा भृशधार्मिकः।ययोर्मृत्युर्विवासश्च त्वत्कृते तुल्यमागतौ।।2.74.3।।
74_3.translation: Death for the king and exile for Rama, similar fate for both, have befallen on your account. What possible harm, either the king or the highly virtuous Rama has done to you?
74_3.word_by_word: ययोः to both of whom, त्वत्कृते on your account, तुल्यम् similar, मृत्युः death, विवासश्च exile, आगतौ have come, राजा the king, भृशधार्मिकः highly virtuous, रामो वा or Rama, ते to you, किन्नु what possible, अदूषयत् reviled?

74_4.shloka: भ्रूणहत्यामसि प्राप्ता कुलस्यास्य विनाशनात्।कैकेयि नरकं गच्छ मा च भर्तु स्सलोकताम्।।2.74.4।।
74_4.translation: O Kaikeyi by destroying this race you have earned the demerit of killing an embryo and shall enter hell. You shall never attain the same state of living, in the  afterworld of your husband.
74_4.word_by_word: अस्य कुलस्य of  this race, विनाशनात् by destruction, भ्रूणहत्याम् the sin of killing an unborn, प्राप्ता असि you have earned, कैकेयि Kaikeyi, नरकम् to hell, गच्छ go, भर्तुः to husband, सलोकताम् similar world, मा च not attain.

74_5.shloka: यत्त्वया हीदृशं पापं कृतं घोरेण कर्मणा।सर्वलोकप्रियं हित्वा ममाप्यापादितं भयम्।।2.74.5।।
74_5.translation: That by doing this horrible deed you have committed a great sin of renouncing Rama, the beloved of all worlds. Therefore I am overtaken by fear.
74_5.word_by_word: त्वया by you, घोरेण by a horrible, कर्मणा deed, यत् what ever reason, ईदृशम् such, पापम् sin, कृतम् has been committed, (for that reason), सर्वलोकप्रियम् beloved of all worlds, हित्वा renouncing, ममापि for me too, भयम् fear, आपादितम् has overtaken me.

74_6.shloka: त्वत्कृते मे पिता वृत्तो रामश्चारण्यमाश्रितः।अयशो जीवलोके च त्वयाऽहं प्रतिपादितः।।2.74.6।।
74_6.translation: You have caused my father's death and Rama's exile. As for me, I have obtained ignominy in this world.
74_6.word_by_word: त्वत्कृते for your sake, मे पिता my father, वृत्तः died, रामश्च Rama also, अरण्यम् to the forest, आश्रितः  taken refuge, त्वया by you, अहम् I, जीवलोके in this world of living beings, अयशः च ignominy, प्रतिपादितः obtained.

74_7.shloka: मातृरूपे ममामित्रे नृशंसे राज्यकामुके।न तेऽह मभिभाष्योऽस्मि दुर्वृत्ते पतिघातिनि।।2.74.7।।
74_7.translation: O cruel woman, O woman of vicious character you are an enemy assuming a mother's form, lustful for kingdom. You are a murderess (of your husband) and I shall never speak to you.
74_7.word_by_word: मम my, मातृरूपे mother in appearance, अमित्रे enemy, नृशंसे O cruel woman, राज्यकामुके O woman having lust for kingdom, दुर्वृत्ते of vicious character, पतिघातिनि murderess (of husband), अहम् I, ते to you, अभिभाष्यः नास्मि I shall not be speaking to you.

74_8.shloka: कौसल्या च सुमित्रा च याश्चान्या मम मातरः।दुःखेन महताऽविष्टास्त्वां प्राप्य कुलदूषिणीम्।।2.74.8।।
74_8.translation: As you have vitiated the race, my mothers Kausalya and Sumitra are overwhelmed with great sorrow.
74_8.word_by_word: कुलदूषिणीम् one who vitiated the race, त्वाम् you, प्राप्य having obtained, कौशल्या Kausalya, सुमित्रा च Sumitra  also, मम my, याः अन्याः all the other, मातरः mothers, महता great, दुःखेन sorrow, आविष्टाः are overwhelmed.

74_9.shloka: ﻿न त्वमश्वपतेः कन्या धर्मराजस्य धीमतः।राक्षसी तत्र जाताऽसि कुलप्रध्वंसिनी पितुः।।2.74.9।।यत्त्वया धार्मिको रामो नित्यं सत्यपरायणः।वनं प्रस्थापितो दुःखात्पिता च त्रिदिवं गतः।।2.74.10।।
74_9.translation: ﻿As you sent virtuous Rama, ever devoted to truth, into the forest, my father died out of grief (due to separation from his son). Therefore, you are not the true daughter of the righteous and sagacious king Aswapati but a demoness born there to destroy your father's race.
74_9.word_by_word: ﻿यत् since, त्वया by you, धार्मिकः the virtuous, नित्यम् constantly, सत्यपरायणः ever devoted to truth, रामः Rama, वनम् to the forest, प्रस्थापितः has been sent away, पिता च father, दुःखात् due to grief, त्रिदिवम् to heaven, गतः had gone, त्वम् you, धर्मराजस्य of the righteous king, धीमतः of the sagacious one, अश्वपतेः king Aswapati's, कन्या daughter, न not, तत्र in that race, जाता born, पितुः father's, कुलप्रध्वंसिनी destroying the race, राक्षसी असि you are a demoness.

74_10.shloka: यत्प्रधानाऽसि तत्पापं मयि पित्रा विनाकृते।भ्रातृभ्यां च परित्यक्ते सर्वलोकस्य चाप्रिये।।2.74.11।।
74_10.translation: The sin you have committed with a particular objective has affected me and (as a result) I am left without my father. I am abandoned by my brothers. I am hated by every one in this entire world.
74_10.word_by_word: यत्प्रधाना असि committing the sin with a sole objective, तत् that, पापम् sin, पित्रा विना separated from father, कृते made, भ्रातृभ्याम् by the brothers, परित्यक्ते abandoned, सर्वलोकस्य for the whole world, अप्रिये च not a dear one, मयि fallen on me.

74_11.shloka: कौसल्यां धर्मसंयुक्तां वियुक्तां पापनिश्चये।कृत्वा कं प्राप्स्यसे त्वद्य लोकं निरयगामिनि।।2.74.12।।
74_11.translation: O woman of sinful convictions you will go to hell. You have separated righteous Kausalya from her son. For having committed such a sin, what afterworld awaits you  (is not known)?
74_11.word_by_word: पापनिश्चये O woman of sinful convictions, निरयगामिनि O one who would attain hell, धर्मसंयुक्ताम् endowed with righteous conduct, कौशल्याम् Kausalya, वियुक्ताम् separated from her son, कृत्वा having committed, अद्य now, कं लोसकम् what afterworld, प्राप्स्यसे will attain.

74_12.shloka: किं नावबुध्यसे क्रूरे नियतं बन्धुसंश्रयम्।ज्येष्ठं पितृसमं रामं कौसल्यायाऽत्मसम्भवम्।।2.74.13।।
74_12.translation: O cruel one why do you not realise that Rama, born of Kausalya, is the eldest son and equal to my father? He is selfrestrained and a refuge to his kith and kin.
74_12.word_by_word: क्रूरे O cruel one, कौशल्यायाः Kausalya's, आत्मसम्भवम् born of her very self, रामम् Rama, नियतम् selfrestrained, बन्धुसंश्रयम् refuge for relations, ज्येष्ठम् eldest, पितृसमम् the equal of his father, किं नावबुध्यसे why do you not realise?

74_13.shloka: अङगप्रत्यङगजः पुत्रो हृदयाच्चापि जायते।तस्मात्प्रियतमो मातुः प्रिया एव तु बान्धवाः।।2.74.14।।
74_13.translation: A son born from every limb, big or small, and from the heart is the most beloved of all for his mother while the other relatives are only loving ones.
74_13.word_by_word: पुत्र: son, अङ्गप्रत्यङ्गजः born from every limb big or small, हृदयाच्चापि from the heart too, जायते is born, तस्मात् therefore, मातुः for a mother, प्रियतमः most beloved one, बान्धवाः relatives, प्रिया एव तु are loving ones only.

74_14.shloka: अन्यदा किल धर्मज्ञा सुरभि स्सुरसम्मता।वहमानौ ददर्शोर्व्यां पुत्रौ विगतचेतसौ।।2.74.15।।
74_14.translation: It is said that once upon a time Surabhi, the divine cow, highly respected by the gods and conversant with righteous ways, beheld her two sons who fainted due to fatigue while carrying the burden of the ploughs.
74_14.word_by_word: अन्यदा at some other time, धर्मज्ञा conversant with righteous ways, सुरसम्मता highly respected by the gods, सुरभिः Surabhi (the divine cow), उर्व्याम् on the earth, वहमानौ carrying the burden (drawing the plough), विगतचेतसौ  senses lost, पुत्रौ sons, ददर्श किल beheld, as they say.

74_15.shloka: तावर्धदिवसे श्रान्तौ दृष्ट्वा पुत्रौ महीतले।रुरोद पुत्रशोकेन बाष्पपर्याकुलेक्षणा।।2.74.16।।
74_15.translation: On seeing her two sons lying on earth exhausted, she wailed in distress for them with her eyes filled with tears.
74_15.word_by_word: महीतले on the earth, अर्धदिवसे at midday, श्रान्तौ tired, पुत्रौ sons, दृष्ट्वा having seen, पुत्रशोकेन by the grief for her son, बाष्पपर्याकुलेक्षणा eyes filled with tears, रुरोद wailed.

74_16.shloka: अधस्ताद्व्रजतस्तस्याः सुरराज्ञो महात्मनः।बिन्दवः पतिता गात्रे सूक्ष्मा स्सुरभिगन्धिनः।।2.74.17।।
74_16.translation: The fine drops of her fragnant tears trickled down the body of the great king of the gods (Indra).
74_16.word_by_word: तस्याः her (Kamadhenu's), सूक्ष्माः fine, सुरभिगन्धिनः fragrant, बिन्दवः tear drops, अधस्तात् down below, व्रजतः proceeding, महात्मनः great, सुरराज्ञः of the king of the gods, गात्रे on the body, पतिताः fell.

74_17.shloka: ﻿इन्द्रोऽप्यश्रुनिपातं तं स्वगात्रे पुण्यगन्धिनम्।सुरभिं मन्यते दृष्ट्वा भूयसीं तां सुरेश्वरः।।2.74.18।।
74_17.translation: ﻿When Indra, lord of the gods, saw those tears of holy fragrance fallen on his body he understood that the tears were shed by the venerated Kamadhenu.
74_17.word_by_word: ﻿सुरेश्वरः lord of the gods, इन्द्रोऽपि Indra, स्वगात्रे on his body, पुण्यगन्धिनम् of holy fragrance, तम् that, अश्रुपातम् flow of tears, दृष्ट्वा on seeing, ताम् her, भूयसीम् venerated, सुरभिम् as Kamadhenu, मन्यते thought

74_18.shloka: निरीक्षमाण श्शक्रस्तां ददर्श सुरभिं स्थिताम्।आकाशे विष्ठितां दीनां रुदन्तीं भृशदुःखिताम्।।2.74.19।।
74_18.translation: While looking around Indra beheld Kamadhenu in intense pain stationed in the sky,   looking distressed and miserable, and wailing.
74_18.word_by_word: शक्रः Indra, आकाशे in the sky, निरीक्षमाणः looking up, स्थिताम् stationed, विष्ठिताम् distressed, दीनाम् miserable, रुदन्तीम् wailing, भृशदुःखिताम् in intense pain, तां सुरभिम् to that Surabhi,  ददर्श beheld.

74_19.shloka: तां दृष्ट्वा शोकसन्तप्तां वज्रपाणिर्यशस्विनीम्।इन्द्रः प्राञ्जलिरुद्विग्न स्सुरराजोऽब्रवीद्वचः।।2.74.20।।
74_19.translation: The king of the gods, Indra, wielder of thunderbolt, saw the renowned Kamadhenu consumed with grief. Alarmed, he said to her with palms joined in reverence:
74_19.word_by_word: वज्रपाणिः wielder of thunderbolt, सुरराजः king of the gods, इन्द्रः Indra, शोकसन्तप्ताम्  consumed with grief, यशस्विनीम् renowned, ताम् that kamadhenu, दृष्ट्वा having seen, उद्विग्नः alarmed, प्राञ्जलिः with palms joined in reverence, वाक्यम् these words, अब्रवीत् said.

74_20.shloka: भयं कच्छिन्न चास्मासु कुतश्चिद्विद्यते महत्।कुतोनिमत्तश्शोकस्ते ब्रूहि सर्वहितैषिणि।।2.74.21।।
74_20.translation: 'O holy cow fear not. You wish the welfare of all, Has any great calamity befallen us from any quarter? I hope not. What is the reason for your sorrow? Tell me'.
74_20.word_by_word: सर्वहितैषिणि O wellwisher of all, अस्मासु for us, कुतश्चित् from any quarter, महत् great, भयम् fear, न विद्यते कच्छित् does not exist, ते your, शोकः sorrow, कुतोनिमित्तः for what  reason, ब्रूहि  speak.

74_21.shloka: ﻿एवमुक्ता तु सुरभि स्सुरराजेन धीमता।प्रत्युवाच ततो धीरा वाक्यं वाक्यविशारदा।।2.74.22।।
74_21.translation: ﻿On hearing the sagacious Indra, king of the gods, Kamadhenu, proficient in speech, calmly replied:
74_21.word_by_word: ﻿धीमता by the sagacious, सुरराजेन by Indra, king of the gods, एवम् this way, उक्ता having been uttered, धीरा calm, सुरभिः Surabhi, ततः then, वाक्य विशारदा proficient in speech, वाक्यम् these words, प्रत्युवाच replied.

74_22.shloka: शान्तं पापं न वः किञ्चित्कुतश्चिदमराधिपः।अहं मग्नौ तु शोचामि स्वपुत्रौ विषमे स्थितौ।।2.74.23।।एतौ दृष्ट्वा कृशौ दीनौ सूर्यरश्मिप्रतापितौ।बाध्यमानौ बलीवर्धौ कर्षकेण सुराधिप।।2.74.24।।
74_22.translation: 'God forbid, O Indra, lord of the Immortals no calamity has befallen you from any quarter. Only I am in trouble. I am weeping for these pair of bulls, my own sons who are in difficulty. When I see them scorched by the rays of the Sun, miserable, emaciated and weeping, beaten by a ploughman, I am immersed in grief'.
74_22.word_by_word: अमराधिपः O lord of the immortals (Indra), पापम् शान्तम् god forbid, वः for you, कुतश्चित् from any quarter, किञ्चित् any calamity, न not, सुराधिप O lord of the gods, अहम् I, विषमे in trouble, स्थितौ entangled, सूर्यरश्मिप्रतापितौ scorched by the rays of the Sun, कृशौ emaciated, कर्षकेण by a ploughman, बाध्यमानौ beaten, मग्नौ immersed in grief, स्वपुत्रौ my own sons, एतौ these, बलीवर्धौ pair of bulls, दृष्ट्वा having seen, दीनौ miserable, शोचामि weeping.

74_23.shloka: ममकायात्प्रसूतौ हि दुःखितौ भारपीडितौ।यौ दृष्ट्वा परितप्येऽहं नास्ति पुत्रसमः प्रियः।।2.74.25।।
74_23.translation: 'These bulls were born from my body and they are oppressed by the burden. Having seen their anguish, I am extremely grieved. There is none so dear as a son'.
74_23.word_by_word: अहम् I, भारपीडितौ oppressed by the burden, दुःखितौ anguished, यौ them both, दृष्ट्वा  having seen, परितप्ये excessively grieving, मम my, कायात् from the body, प्रसूतौ हि were born, पुत्रसमः equal to a son, प्रियः a beloved, नास्ति no one is there.

74_24.shloka: यस्याः पुत्रसहस्रैस्तु कृत्स्नं व्याप्तमिदं जगत्।तां दृष्ट्वा रुदतीं शक्रो न सुतान्मन्यते परम्।।2.74.26।।
74_24.translation: The wishfulfilling cow (Kamadhenu) had innumerable sons spread all over the world. When Indra saw that Kamadhenu too was weeping for her sons, he concluded 'there is no one greater than a son'.
74_24.word_by_word: यस्याः whose, पुत्रसहस्रैः by a thousand sons, इदं जगत् this world, व्याप्तम् are spread over, ताम् to her (Kamadhenu), रुदतीम् weeping, दृष्ट्वा having seen, शक्रः Indra, सुतात् more than a son, परम् great one, न not, मन्यते considers.

74_25.shloka: ﻿सदाऽप्रतिमवृत्तायाः लोकधारणकाम्यया।श्रीमत्या गुणनित्याया स्स्वभावपरिचेष्टया।।2.74.27।।यस्याः पुत्रसहस्राणि साऽपि शोचति कामधुक्।किं पुनर्या विना रामं कौसल्या वर्तयिष्यति।।2.74.28।।
74_25.translation: ﻿Wishing always to nourish the worlds Kamadhenu conducts herself with an unequalled character. In accordance with her nature, she has imbibed in herself eminent virtues. She is endowed with all prosperity. In spite of her thousand sons, she is weeping thus for her two bulls, what can one say of Kausalya separated from her only son Will she be her normal self again?'
74_25.word_by_word: ﻿लोकधारणकाम्यया with a desire to nourish the worlds, सदा always, अप्रतिमवृत्तायाः of unequalled conduct, श्रीमत्याः endowed with prosperity, स्वभावपरिचेष्टया in accordance with her nature, गुणनित्यायाः by her virtues, यस्याः such ones, पुत्रसहस्राणि a thousand sons, सा that, कामधुक् अपि Kamadhenu also, शोचति is weeping, या कौशल्या that Kausalya, रामं विना bereft of Rama, वर्तयिष्यति will she be her normal self again?, किं पुनः why again.

74_26.shloka: एकपुत्रा च साध्वी च विवत्सेयं त्वया कृता।तस्मात्त्वं सततं दुःखं प्रेत्य चेह च लप्स्यसे।।2.74.29।।
74_26.translation: This pious lady is blessed with only one son and (now) has been rendered childless by you. Therefore, you shall experience grief in this world and hereafter.
74_26.word_by_word: एकपुत्रा च blessed with an only son, साध्वी च pious woman, इयम् this lady, त्वया by you, विवत्सा childless, कृता has been rendered, तस्मात् therefore, त्वम् you, प्रेत्य च even after death, इह च in this world also, सततम् always, दुःखम् grief, लप्स्यसे you shall experience.

74_27.shloka: अहं ह्यपचितिं भ्रातुः पितुश्च सकलामिमाम्।वर्धनं यशसश्चापि करिष्यामि न संशयः।।2.74.30।।
74_27.translation: As for me, I shall do whatever is necessary for the atonement of the improper conduct shown towards my father and brother and for enhancement of my fame. There is no doubt  about it.
74_27.word_by_word: अहम् I, भ्रातुः for my brother, पितुश्च for father, इमाम् this, सकलाम् complete, अपचितिम्   atonement for improper conduct, यशसः of fame, वर्धनम् enhancement, करिष्यामि will do, संशयः doubt, न not.

74_28.shloka: ﻿अनाययित्वा तनयं कौसल्याया महाबलम्।स्वयमेव प्रवेक्ष्यामि वनं मुनिनिषेवितम्।।2.74.31।।
74_28.translation: ﻿If I fail to bring back the mighty son of Kausalya, I shall enter the forest frequented by ascetics.
74_28.word_by_word: ﻿महाबलम् highly powerful, कौशल्यायाः तनयम् Kausalya's son, अनाययित्वा if I do not bring back, स्वयमेव myself, मुनिनिषेवितम् frequented by the ascetics, वनम् lonely forest, प्रवेक्ष्यामि I shall enter.

74_29.shloka: न ह्यहं पापसङ्कल्पे पापे पापं त्वया कृतम्।शक्तो धारयितुं पौरैरश्रुकण्ठै र्निरीक्षितः।।2.74.32।।
74_29.translation: O vicious one, O evilintentioned one being watched by the citizens with their throats choked with tears of grief, I cannot endure the burden of the sin committed by you.
74_29.word_by_word: पापे O vicious one, पापसङ्कल्पे O evilintentioned one, अहम् I, अश्रुकण्ठैः by those whose throats are choked with tears, पौरैः by the citizens (of Ayodhya), निरीक्षितः am watched, त्वया by you, कृतम् has been committed, पापम् sin, धारयितुम् to endure, न शक्तः हि I am not capable.

74_30.shloka: सा त्वमग्निं प्रविश वा स्वयं वा दण्डकान्विश।रज्जुं बधान वा कण्ठे न हि तेऽन्यत्परायणम्।।2.74.33।।
74_30.translation: Jump into the fire or go to Dandaka forest or hang yourself. There is no other recourse for you.
74_30.word_by_word: सा त्वम् such a person like you, अग्निं वा either the fire, प्रविश enter, दण्डकान्वा or Dandaka forest, स्वयम् yourself, विश enter वा or, कण्ठे round the throat, रज्जुम् rope, बधान fasten, ते to you, अन्यत् any other, परायणम् recourse, न हि is not there.

74_31.shloka: अहमप्यवनीं प्राप्ते रामे सत्यपराक्रमे।कृतकृत्यो भविष्यामि विप्रवासितकल्मषः।।2.74.34।।
74_31.translation: When Rama who has truth as his prowess accepts the kingdom, I shall have accomplished my purpose at last and I shall be free from all blemishes.
74_31.word_by_word: सत्यपराक्रमे having truth as his prowess, रामे Rama, अवनीम् this earth (kingdom), प्राप्ते will obtain, अहमपि I also, विप्रवासितकल्मषः free from all blemishes, कृतकृत्यः shall have my desire  accomplished, भविष्यामि shall become.

74_32.shloka: इति नाग इवारण्ये तोमराङ्कुशचोदितः।पपात भुवि सङ्कृद्धो निश्श्वसन्निव पन्नगः।।2.74.35।।
74_32.translation: In this way like an elephant driven by prods and goads in the forest, highly enraged Bharata hissing like a serpent dropped down on the ground.
74_32.word_by_word: इति in this way, अरण्ये in the forest, तोमराङ्कुशचोदितः driven by prods and goads (sharp instruments), नागः इव like an elephant, सङ्कृद्धः enraged, पन्नगः इव like a serpent, निःश्वसन् hissing, भुवि on the ground, पपात fell down.

74_33.shloka: संरक्तनेत्र श्शिथिलाम्भरस्तदा विधूतसर्वाभरणः परन्तपः।बभूव भूमौ पतितो नृपात्मजश्शचीपतेः केतुरिवोत्सवक्षये।।2.74.36।।
74_33.translation: Prince Bharata, the scorcher of enemies, with bloodshot eyes, raiment in disarray, ornaments tossed about lay fallen on the ground like the banner of Indra (husband of Sachi) at the close of the festival of flaghoisting.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे चतुस्सप्ततितमस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the seventyfourth sarga in Ayodhyakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
74_33.word_by_word: तदा then, संरक्तनेत्रः with bloodshot eyes, शिथिलाम्भरः with his raiment in disarray, विधूतसर्वाभरणः with his ornaments tossed about, भूमौ on the ground, पतितः fallen, परन्तपः scorcher of enemies, नृपात्मजः king's son, उत्सवक्षये at the close of the festival, शचीपतेः of the husband of Sachi (Indra's), केतुरिव बभूव like a banner remained.

75_1.shloka: [Bharata and Satrughna meet griefstricken Kausalya -- Kausalya reproaches Bharata harshly -- Bharata appeases Kausalya and curses himself -- Kausalya gets convinced of Bharata's conviction.]दीर्घकालात्समुत्थाय संज्ञां लब्ध्वा च वीर्यवान्।नेत्राभ्यामश्रुपूर्णाभ्यां दीनामुद्वीक्ष्य मातरम्।।2.75.1।।सोऽमात्यमध्ये भरतो जननीमभ्यकुत्सयत्।
75_1.translation: On regaining his senses after a long time, the valiant Bharata looked at his unfortunate mother whose eyes were filled with tears, and condemned her amidst the counsellors.
75_1.word_by_word: वीर्यवान् valiant, सः भरतः that Bharata, दीर्घकालात् after a long time, समुत्थाय risen up, संज्ञाम् senses, लब्ध्वा च having regained, अश्रुपूर्णाभ्याम् filled with tears, नेत्राभ्याम् with eyes, दीनाम् unfortunate, मातरम् mother, उद्वीक्ष्य having looked up, अमात्यमध्ये in the midst of counsellors, जननीम् mother, अभ्यकुत्सयत् condemned.

75_2.shloka: राज्यं न कामये जातु मन्त्रये नापि मातरम्।।2.75.2।।अभिषेकं न जानामि योऽभूद्राज्ञा समीक्षितः।विप्रकृष्टेह्यहं देशे शत्रुघ्नसहितोऽवसम्।।2.75.3।।
75_2.translation: Neither did I ever desire the kingdom nor did I ever consult my mother in this regard and I am not even aware of the consecration that was planned by the king for I was away in a distant country with Satrughna.
75_2.word_by_word: जातु at any time, राज्यम् kingdom, न कामये I do not wish, मातरम् अपि even (with) mother, न मन्त्रये consulted, यः the consecration, राज्ञा by king, समीक्षितः अभूत् has been supervised, अभिषेकम् consecration, न जानामि am not aware, अहम् I, शत्रुघ्नसहितः with Satrughna, विप्रकृष्टे in a distant, देशे country, अवसम् हि stayed.

75_3.shloka: वनवासं न जानामि रामस्याहं महात्मनः।विवासनं वा सौमित्रे स्सीतायाश्च यथाऽभवत्।।2.75.4।।
75_3.translation: I knew nothing of the banishment of great Rama nor did I know how Lakshmana or Sita had gone on exile.
75_3.word_by_word: अहम् I, महात्मनः of great, रामस्य Rama's, वनवासम् banishment, न जानामि do not know, सौमित्रेः Lakshmana's, सीतायाश्च Sita's, विवासनम् exile, यथा अभवत् how it happened.

75_4.shloka: तथैव क्रोशतस्तस्य भरतस्य महात्मनः।कौसल्या शब्दमाज्ञाय सुमित्रामिदमब्रवीत्।।2.75.5।।
75_4.translation: As magnanimous Bharata was wailing, Kausalya recognised his voice and said to Sumitra:
75_4.word_by_word: तथैव in that way, क्रोशतः wailing, महात्मनः of the magnanimous, भरतस्य Bharata's, शब्दम् sound, आज्ञाय having recognised, कौशल्या Kausalya, सुमित्राम् addressing Sumitra, इदम् these words, अब्रवीत् spoke.

75_5.shloka: आगतः क्रूरकार्यायाः कैकेय्या भरतस्सुतः।तमहं द्रष्टुमिच्छामि भरतं दीर्घदर्शिनम्।।2.75.6।।
75_5.translation: Bharata, the farsighted son of Kaikeyi of cruel deeds has come and I wish to see him.
75_5.word_by_word: क्रूरकार्यायाः of a woman of cruel deeds, कैकेय्याः Kaikeyi's, सुतः son, भरतः Bharata, आगतः has come, दीर्घदर्शिनम् farsighted, तं भरतम् that Bharata, अहम् I, द्रष्टुम् to see, इच्छामि I am wishing

75_6.shloka: एवमुक्त्वा सुमित्रां सा विवर्णा मलिना कृशा।प्रतस्थे भरतो यत्र वेपमाना विचेतना।।2.75.7।।
75_6.translation: Having said so to Sumitra, Kausalya trembling and almost lifeless, emaciated, sullied and turned pallid set out for the place where Bharat was.
75_6.word_by_word: विवर्णा turned pallid, मलिना sullied, कृशा emaciated, सा that Kausalya, सुमित्राम् to Sumitra,एवम् thus, उक्त्वा having uttered, वेपमाना trembling, विचेतना almost lifeless, भरतः Bharata, यत्र wherever, प्रतस्थे set out.

75_7.shloka: स तु रामानुजश्चापि शत्रुघ्नसहितस्तदा।प्रतस्थे भरतो यत्र कौसल्याया निवेशनम्।।2.75.8।।
75_7.translation: But at the same time Bharata, the younger brother of Rama accompanied by Satrughna  proceeded to the place where Kausalya resided.
75_7.word_by_word: तदा then, रामानुजः younger brother of Rama, सः भरतः तु Bharata on his part, शत्रुघ्नसहितः accompanied by Satrughna, कौशल्यायाः to Kausalya's, निवेशनम् residence, यत्र wherever, प्रतस्थे proceeded.

75_8.shloka: तत श्शत्रुघ्नभरतौ कौसल्यां प्रेक्ष्य दुःखितौ।पर्यष्वजेतां दुःखार्तां पतितां नष्टचेतसाम्।।2.75.9।।रुदन्तौ रुदतीं दुःखात्समेत्यार्यां मनस्स्विनीम्।
75_8.translation: Then agonised Bharata and Satrughna, beholding that venerable, noblehearted, griefstricken, weeping Kausalya who was  almost semiconscious overcome with grief, approached her with great sorrow and hugged her.
75_8.word_by_word: ततः then, शत्रुघ्नभरतौ Satrughna and Bharata, दुःखार्ताम् griefstricken, नष्टचेतसाम् semi conscious, रुदतीम् weeping, आर्याम् venerable, मनस्स्विनीम् noblehearted, कौशल्याम् Kausalya, प्रेक्ष्य having seen, दुःखितौ overcome with sorrow, रुदन्तौ agonised, दुःखात् with great sorrow, समेत्य having approached, पर्यष्वजेताम् hugged.

75_9.shloka: भरतं प्रत्युवाचेदं कौसल्या भृशदुःखिता।।2.75.10।।इदं ते राज्यकामस्य राज्यं प्राप्तमकण्टकम्।संप्राप्तं बत कैकेय्या शशीघ्रं क्रूरेण कर्मणा।।2.75.11।।
75_9.translation: Looking at Bharata, the deeply afflicted Kausalya said, The kingdom which you had desired has been acquired without any obstacle. Alas Kaikeyi had quickly secured it for you  through her crooked act.
75_9.word_by_word: भृशदुःखिता deeply afflicted, कौशल्या Kausalya, भरतं प्रति looking at Bharata, इदम् these words, उवाच said, राज्यकामस्य of one desirous of the kingdom, ते to you, इदम् this, अकण्टकम् without obstacles, राज्यम् kingdom, प्राप्तम् has been acquired, कैकेय्याः Kaikeyi's, क्रूरेण by crooked, कर्मणा with act, शीघ्रम् quickly, सम्प्राप्तम् secured, बत alas.

75_10.shloka: प्रस्थाप्य चीरवसनं पुत्रं मे वनवासिनम्।कैकेयी कं गुणं तत्र पश्यति क्रूरदर्शिनी।।2.75.12।।
75_10.translation: What advantage did cruel Kaikeyi visualize in sending away my son to dwell in the forest  wearing robes of bark?
75_10.word_by_word: क्रूरदर्शिनी one of cruel thoughts, कैकेयी Kaikeyi, मे my, पुत्रम् son, चीरवसनम् clad in bark robes, वनवासिनम् a forestdweller, प्रस्थाप्य having sent, तत्र there, कम् what, गुणम्  advantage, पश्यति sees?

75_11.shloka: क्षिप्रं मामपि कैकेयी प्रस्थापयितुमर्हति।हिरण्यनाभो यत्रास्ते सुतो मे सुमहायशाः।।2.75.13।।
75_11.translation: Kaikeyi should send me also without any delay to that place where my illustriousRama with golden navel dwells.
75_11.word_by_word: सुमहायशाः illustrious, हिरण्यनाभः goldennavalled one, मे सुतः my son, यत्र whereever, आस्ते stays, मामपि me also, कैकेयी Kaikeyi, क्षिप्रम् without delay, प्रस्थापयितुम् to send me, अर्हति behoves her.

75_12.shloka: अथवा स्वयमेवाहं सुमित्रानुचरा सुखम्।अग्निहोत्रं पुरस्कृत्य प्रस्थास्ये यत्र राघवः।।2.75.14।।
75_12.translation: Or else I, accompanied by Sumitra, shall go happily on my own holding the sacred fire in front to that place where Rama dwells.
75_12.word_by_word: अथवा or else, अहम् I, स्वयमेव on my own, सुमित्रानुचरा with Sumitra as companion,  अग्निहोत्रम् with sacred fire, पुरस्कृत्य holding in front of me, राघवः Rama, यत्र where, सुखम् happily, प्रस्थास्ये shall set out.

75_13.shloka: कामं वा स्वयमेवाद्य तत्र मां नेतुमर्हसि।यत्रासौ पुरुषव्याघ्रः पुत्रो मे तप्यते तपः।।2.75.15।।
75_13.translation: Or, you should now take me personally to that place where, my son Rama, the best among men, is performing austerities.
75_13.word_by_word: वा or, पुरुषव्याघ्रः tiger among men, मे पुत्रो my son, असौ this Rama, यत्र where, तपः the austerities, तप्यते performing, तत्र there, स्वयमेव yourself, अद्य now, माम् me, कामम् certainly indeed, नेतुम् to take, अर्हसि behoves you.

75_14.shloka: इदं हि तव विस्तीर्णं धनधान्यसमाचितम्।हस्त्वश्वरथसम्पूर्णं राज्यं निर्यातितं तया।।2.75.16।।
75_14.translation: This vast kingdom, with all its abundance of wealth and grain, elephants, horses and chariots has been delivered to you by her.
75_14.word_by_word: हस्त्यश्वरथसम्पूर्णम् abounding in elephants, horses and chariots, धनधान्यसमाचितम् with abundace of wealth and grain, विस्तीर्णम् vast, इदं राज्यम् this kingdom, तया by her, तव to you, निर्यातितं हि has been delivered.

75_15.shloka: इत्यादिबहुभिर्वाक्यैः क्रूरैः सम्भर्त्सितोऽनघः।विव्यथे भरतस्तीव्रं व्रणे तुद्येव सूचिना।।2.75.17।।
75_15.translation: Thus reproached by many a harsh word, like needle pricking a wound, the sinless Bharata was intensely pained.
75_15.word_by_word: इत्यादि like this, बहुभिः by many, क्रूरैः harsh, वाक्यैः with words, सूचिना with needle, व्रणे in the wound, तुद्येव as if by piercing, सम्भर्त्सितः reproached, अनघः sinless, भरतः Bharata, तीव्रम् intensely, विव्यथे was afflicted.

75_16.shloka: पपात चरणौ तस्यास्तदा सम्भ्रान्तचेतनः।विलप्य बहुधाऽसंज्ञो लब्धसंज्ञस्ततः स्थितः।।2.75.18।।
75_16.translation: (Having heard these words), his senses reeling, he became unconscious, lamented profusaly and fell at her feet. And on regaining his senses, he stood motionless.
75_16.word_by_word: तदा then, सम्भ्रान्तचेतनः with senses reeling, तस्याः her, चरणौ feet, पपात fell, बहुधा repeatedly, विलप्य lamenting, असंज्ञः unconscious, ततः then, लब्धसंज्ञः on regaining the senses, स्थितः stood.

75_17.shloka: एवं विलपमानां तां भरतः प्राञ्जलिस्तदा।कौसल्यां प्रत्युवाचेदं शोकैर्बहुभिरावृताम्।।2.75.19।।
75_17.translation: As Kausalya was lamenting in this manner, overwhelmed with deep grief, Bharata, his palms joined in reverence, replied her in these words:
75_17.word_by_word: तदा then, भरतः Bharata, प्राञ्जलिः his palms joined in reverence, एवम् in that manner, विलपमानाम् lamenting, बहुभिः intense, शोकैः with sorrow, आवृताम् overwhelmed with, तां कौशल्याम् that Kausalya, इदम् these words, प्रत्युवाच replied.

75_18.shloka: आर्ये कस्मादजानन्तं गर्हसे मामकिल्बिषम्।विपुलां च मम प्रीतिं स्थिरां जानासि राघवे।।2.75.20।।
75_18.translation: O noble lady unaware (of what had happened), I am guiltless. Why do you upbraid me? You know well my profound, steadfast affection for Raghava (Rama).
75_18.word_by_word: आर्ये O noble lady, आजानन्तम् unaware, अकिल्बिषम् guiltless, माम् me, कस्मात् for whatreason, गर्हसे upbraiding, राघवे in Rama, मम my, विपुलाम् profound, स्थिराम् steadfast, प्रीतिम् affection, जानासि you know.

75_19.shloka: कृता शास्त्रानुगा बुद्धिर्माभूत्तस्य कदाचन।सत्यसन्ध स्सतां श्रेष्ठो यस्याऽर्योऽनुमते गतः।।2.75.21।।
75_19.translation: Did not the one who counselled the banishment of my noble brother who is steadfast and bound by truth and virtue, ever adhered to scriptures?(or)My noble brother (Rama), the best among the virtuous, bound to truth, is banished. Let not such thought occur at any time to one who steadfastly adheres to scriptures
75_19.word_by_word: सत्यसन्धः bound to truth, सताम् श्रेष्ठः best among virtuous men, आर्यः noble (Rama), यस्य whose अनुमते with sanction, गतः banished, तस्य his, बुद्धिः thought, कदाचन at any time, शास्त्रानुगा adhered to the scriptures, कृता steadfast, मा भूत् let it not happen.

75_20.shloka: प्रेष्यं पापीयसां यातु सूर्यञ्च प्रतिमेहतु।हन्तु पादेन गां सुप्तां यस्याऽर्योऽनुमते गतः।।2.75.22।।
75_20.translation: May the one who counselled the exile of my esteemed brother, Rama be cursed with the sin of undergoing servitude in the hands of most sinful of men, the sin of passing urine facing the Sun and of kicking a sleeping cow.
75_20.word_by_word: आर्यः noble one (Rama), यस्य whose, अनुमते with sanction, गतः exiled, पापीयसाम् the most sinful of men, प्रेष्यम् servitude, यातु shall obtain, सूर्यं च प्रति facing the Sun, मेहतु pass urine, सुप्ताम् sleeping, गाम् cow, पादेन by foot, हन्तु kick.

75_21.shloka: कारयित्वा महत्कर्म भर्ता भृत्यमनर्थकम्।अधर्मो योऽस्य सोऽस्यास्तु यस्याऽर्योऽनुमतेगतः।।2.75.23।।
75_21.translation: May the one who counselled the exile of my esteemed brother acquire the demerit of unrighteousness in the same way as a master who gets a difficult work done by a servant without remuneration.
75_21.word_by_word: आर्यः noble one, यस्य whose, अनुमते counsel, गतः was exiled, अस्य that man, यः भर्ता the master, भृत्यम् his servant, अनर्थकम् without remuneration, महत् difficult, कर्म work, कारयित्वा having got done, अस्य to that man, यः अधर्मः acquire the unrighteousness, सः that must, अस्तु be it in that way.

75_22.shloka: परिपालयमानस्य राज्ञो भूतानि पुयत्रवत्।ततस्नु दुह्यतां पापं यस्याऽर्योऽनुमते गतः।।2.75.24।।
75_22.translation: May the one who counselled the exile of my esteemed brother acquire the sin in the same way as a man  acting treacherously against a king who rules like a father and protects his subjects like his own children, acquires.
75_22.word_by_word: आर्यः esteemed one, यस्य whose, अनुमते with sanction, गतः was exiled, for him राज्ञः by the king, भूतानि his subjects, पुत्रवत् like his own children, परिपालयमानस्य is ruling, ततः father indeed, द्रुह्यताम् who are treacherously acting, पापम् sin, तत् shall happen.

75_23.shloka: बलिषड्भागमुद्धृत्य नृपस्यारक्षतः प्रजाः।अधर्मो योऽस्य सोऽस्यास्तु यस्यार्थोऽनुमते गतः।।2.75.25।।
75_23.translation: May the one who counselled the exile of my esteemed brother acquireunrighteousness in the same way as a king who, having received one sixth of the income as tax from people does not protect them
75_23.word_by_word: आर्यः esteemed one, यस्य whose, अनुमते with sanction, गतः exiled, अस्य for him, बलिषड्भागम् sixth portion of their revenue as tax, उद्धृत्य having received, नृपस्य of the king, प्रजाः the people, अरक्षतः while not protecting, अस्य for him, अधर्मः that unrighteousness, स: that one, अस्तु so be it.

75_24.shloka: संश्रुत्य च तपस्विभ्यस्सत्रे वै यज्ञदक्षिणाम्।तां विप्रलपतां पापं यस्यार्योऽनुमते गतः।।2.75.26।।
75_24.translation: May the one who counselled the exile of my esteemed brother acquire the sin in the same way as a person acquires for having promised the ascetics the required offering at a sacrifice and later denies them
75_24.word_by_word: आर्यः esteemed one, यस्य whose, अनुमते with sanction, गतः exiled, तपस्विभ्यः for ascetics, सत्रे at sacrifice, यज्ञदक्षिणाम् the offerings at a sacrifice, संश्रुत्य having promised, ताम् that one, विप्रलवताम् those who deny them later, पापम् acquire sin.

75_25.shloka: हस्त्यश्वरथसम्बाधे युद्धे शस्त्रसमाकुले।मा स्म कार्षीत्सतां धर्मं यस्यार्योऽनुमते गतः।।2.75.27।।
75_25.translation: May the one who counselled the exile of my esteemed brother acquire the demerit in the same way as a person, who having gone to the battleground abundantly provided with elephants, horses, chariots and weapons fails to discharge the duty (of a fighter)
75_25.word_by_word: आर्यः esteemed one, यस्य whose, अनुमते with sanction, गतः exiled, हस्त्यश्वरथसम्बाधे abundantly provided with elephants, horses and chariots, शस्त्रसमाकुले filled with weapons, युद्धे in a battle, सताम् virtuous men's, धर्मम् righteous, मा स्म कार्षीत्shall not do.

75_26.shloka: उपदिष्टं सुसूक्ष्मार्थं शास्त्रं यत्नेन धीमता।स नाशयतु दुष्टात्मा यस्याऽर्योऽनुमते गतः।।2.75.28।।
75_26.translation: May the one who counselled the exile of my esteemed brother acquire demerit in the same way as an evilhearted person who forever destroys the subtle meaning of the scriptures imparted carefully by a sagacious preceptor
75_26.word_by_word: आर्यः esteemed one (Rama), यस्य whose, अनुमते with sanction, गतः exiled, सः that man, दुष्टात्मा evilhearted one, धीमता by a sagacious preceptor, यत्नेन carefully, उपदिष्टम् imparted, सुसूक्ष्मार्थम् having  subtle meaning, शास्त्रम् scriptures, नाशयत may destroy.

75_27.translation: May the one who counselled the exile of my esteemed brother be highly unfortunate like me in not being able to behold that longarmed and broadshoulderd one seated on the throne and resembling both the Sun and the Moon in radiance
75_27.word_by_word: आर्यः esteemed one (Rama), यस्य whose, अनुमते with sanction, गतः exiled, व्यूढबाह्वंसम्  longarmed and broadshoulderd one, चन्द्रार्कसमतेजसम् resembling Sun and Moon in radiance, राज्यस्थम् on the throne, आसीनम् seated, तम् that Rama, मा च द्राक्षीत् never behold him.

75_28.shloka: पायसं कृसरं छागं वृथा सोऽश्नातु निर्घृणः।गुरूंश्चाप्यवजानातु यस्याऽर्योऽनुमते गतः।।2.75.30।।
75_28.translation: May the one who counselled the exile of my esteemed brother acquire the demerit in the same way as a person, who partakes the sweet milkrice, sesamerice and goat's flesh without purpose (without invoking and offering it to the gods) and disrespects the teachers
75_28.word_by_word: आर्यः esteemed one, यस्य whose, अनुमते with sanction, गतः was exiled, निर्घृणः pitiless, सः that person, पायसम् sweet milkrice, कृसरम् sesamerice, छागम् goat's flesh, वृथा without purpose (without offering to the gods), अश्नातु may partake, गुरून् preceptors, अवजानातु च may be disrespected.

75_29.shloka: गाश्च स्पृशतु पादेन गुरून्परिवदेत्स्वयम्।मित्रे द्रुह्येत सोऽत्यन्तं यस्याऽर्योऽनुमते गतः।।2.75.31।।
75_29.translation: May the one who counselled the exile of my esteemed brother acquire the sin in the same way a person who kicks the cows abuses elders and causes great offence to his friends
