75_29.word_by_word: आर्यः esteemed one, यस्य whose, अनुमते with sanction, गतः was exiled, सः that  person, पादेन with foot, गाः cows, स्पृशतु may touch (kick), स्वयम् himself, गुरून् elders, परिवदेत्  may be abused, मित्रे friend, अत्यन्तम् greately, द्रुह्येत causes offence.

75_30.shloka: विश्वासात्कथितं किञ्चित्परिवादं मिथः क्वचित्।विवृणोतु स दुष्टात्मा यस्याऽर्योऽमते गतः।।2.75.32।।
75_30.translation: May the one who counselled the exile of my esteemed brother, acquire the sin in the same way as a wickedminded person, who divulges the words of abuse secretly confided in him by his friends.
75_30.word_by_word: आर्यः esteemed one, यस्य whose, अनुमते with sanction, गतः exiled, सः दुष्टात्मा that wickedminded man, क्वचित् at some place, मिथः secretly, विश्वासात् in confidence, कथितम् told, किञ्चित् little, परिवादम् words of abuse, विवृणोतु may divulge.

75_31.shloka: अकर्ता ह्यकृतज्ञश्च त्यक्ताचाऽत्मा निरपत्रपः।लोके भवतु विद्विष्टो यस्यार्योऽनुमते गतः।।2.75.33।।
75_31.translation: May the one who counselled the exile of my esteemed brother be hated universally as one who never helps any one, who is ungrateful, shameless and as one who has committed the sin of suicide
75_31.word_by_word: आर्यः esteemed one, यस्य whose, अनुमते with sanction, गतः was exiled, अकर्ता one who never helps, अकृतज्ञः च an ungrateful one, त्यक्तात्मा one who deserted his life, निरपत्रप: shameless one, लोके in this world, विद्विष्टो भवतु worthy to be hated.

75_32.shloka: पुत्रैर्दारैश्च भृत्यैश्च स्वगृहे परिवारितः।स एको मृष्टमश्नातु यस्यार्योऽनुमते गतः।।2.75.34।।
75_32.translation: May the one who counselled the exile of my esteemed brother  acquire the sin in the same way as one who, although surrounded by wife, children and servants, eats the delicacies all alone without sharing acquires.
75_32.word_by_word: आर्यः esteemed one, यस्य whose, अनुमते with sanction, गतः exiled, that man, स्वगृहे in his own house, पुत्रैर्दारैश्च by wife and children, भृत्यैश्च by servants, परिवारितः surrounded, एकः alone, मृष्टम् delicacies, अश्नातु will partake.

75_33.shloka: अप्राप्य सदृशान् दाराननपत्यः प्रमीयताम्।अनवाप्य क्रियां धर्म्यां यस्याऽर्योऽनुमते गतः।।2.75.35।।
75_33.translation: May the one who counselled the exile of my esteemed brother die without winning a worthy wife and without begetting offspring and without performing religious deeds
75_33.word_by_word: आर्यः esteemed one, यस्य whose, अनुमते with sanction, गतः exiled, that man, सदृशान् worthy, दारान् wife, अप्राप्य without getting, अनपत्यः without begetting offspring, धर्म्याम् religious, क्रियाम् deeds, अनवाप्य without performing, प्रमीयताम् let him die.

75_34.shloka: माऽत्मनस्सन्ततिं द्राक्षीत्स्वेषु दारेषु दुःखितः।आयुस्समग्रमप्राप्य यऽस्यार्योऽनुमते गतः।।2.75.36।।
75_34.translation: May the one who counselled the exile of my esteemed brother live an entire life of anguish without begetting children through his wife or without seeing his own children
75_34.word_by_word: आर्यः esteemed one, यस्य whose, अनुमते with sanction, गतः exiled, that man,  समग्रम् entire, आयुः life, अप्राप्य begetting, दुःखितः anguished, स्वेषु relating to him, दारेषु in wife, आत्मनः his own, सन्ततिम् children, मा द्राक्षीत् will not see.

75_35.shloka: राजस्त्रीबालवृद्धानां वधे यत्पापमुच्यते।भृत्यत्यागे च यत्पापं तत्पापं प्रतिपद्यताम्।।2.75.37।।
75_35.translation: May the one who counselled the exile of my esteemed brother acquire the same sin as one acquires for murdering a king, a woman, children and the aged and deserting dependents
75_35.word_by_word: राजस्त्रीबालवृद्धानाम् of the king, woman, children and the aged, वधे kills, यत् पापम् whatever sin, उच्यते is mentioned in scriptures, भृत्यत्यागे च desertion of the dependents as well, यत् पापम् whatever sin, तत् (पापं) such (sin), प्रतिपद्यताम् be obtained.

75_36.shloka: लाक्षया मधुमांसेन लोहेन च विषेण च।सदैव बिभृयाद्भृत्यान्यस्यार्योऽनुमते गतः।।2.75.38।।
75_36.translation: May the one who counselled the exile of my esteemed brother acquire the same sin as one who supports his wife and children by trafficking in lac, wine, meat and metal and poison acquires
75_36.word_by_word: आर्यः esteemed one, यस्य whose, अनुमते with sanction, गतः exiled, that man, सदैव always, भृत्यान् dependant wife and children, लाक्षया in lac, मधु मांसेन in wine and meat, लोहेन in metal, विषेण च and in poison, बिभृयात् supports.

75_37.shloka: सङ्ग्रमे समुपोढे स्म शत्रुपक्षभयङ्करे।पलायामानो वध्येत यस्यार्योऽनुमते गतः।।2.75.39।।
75_37.translation: May the one who counselled the exile of my esteemed brother acquire the same sin like a warrior, dreadful to the enemy side who will be slain while fleeing from the war at its peak
75_37.word_by_word: आर्यः esteemed one, यस्य whose, अनुमते with sanction, गतः exiled, सः that man, शत्रुपक्षभयङ्करे सङ्ग्रमे in war, समुपोढे when at its peak, पलायमानः feeling, वध्येत be slain.

75_38.shloka: कपालपाणिः पृथिवीमटतां चीरसंवृतः।भिक्षमाणो यथोन्मत्तो यस्यार्योऽनुमते गतः।।2.75.40।।
75_38.translation: May the one who counselled the exile of my esteemed brother, wander this earth, begging alms, holding a human skull like an insane man dressed in rags
75_38.word_by_word: आर्यः esteemed one, यस्य whose, अनुमते with sanction, गतः exiled, सः that man, कपालपाणिः with a human skull in hand, चीरसंवृतः covered by rags, भिक्षमाणः begging for alms, उन्मत्तो यथा like a insane man, पृथिवीम् on this earth, अटताम् may wander.

75_39.shloka: मद्ये प्रसक्तो भवतु स्त्रीष्वक्षेषु च नित्यशः।कामक्रोधाभिभूतस्तु यस्यार्योऽनुमते गतः।।2.75.41।।
75_39.translation: May the one who counselled the exile of my esteemed brother be always addicted to wine, women and gambling and be swayed by desire and anger
75_39.word_by_word: आर्यः esteemed one, यस्य whose, अनुमते with sanction, गतः exiled, that man, नित्यशः always, मद्ये in wine, स्त्रीषु in women, अक्षेषु च in dice for gambling, प्रसक्तः addicted, कामक्रोधाभिभूतः भवतु shall be prevailed over by passion and anger.

75_40.shloka: मास्म धर्मे मनो भूयादधर्मं स निषेवताम्।अपात्रवर्षी भवतु यस्यार्योऽनुमते गतः।।2.75.42।।
75_40.translation: May the mind of that man who counselled the exile of my esteemed brother not be established in virtue May he practise unrighteousness and confer charity on the unworthy
75_40.word_by_word: आर्यः esteemed one, यस्य whose, अनुमते with sanction, गतः exiled, अस्य his, मनः mind, धर्मे in virtue, मा भूयात् shall not stay, सः he, अधर्मे in unrighteousness, निषेवताम् will practise, अपात्रवर्षी भवतु shall confer charity on the unworthy.

75_41.shloka: सञ्चितान्यस्य वित्तनि विविधानि सहस्रशः।दस्युभिर्विप्रलुप्यन्तां यस्यार्योऽनुमते गतः।।2.75.43।।
75_41.translation: May that man's accumulated extensive posssessions of various kinds of wealth be  snatched away by thieves in thousands of ways if he had counselled the exile of my esteemed brother
75_41.word_by_word: आर्यः esteemed one, यस्य whose, अनुमते with sanction, गतः exiled, अस्य for that man's, सहस्रशः in thousands, सञ्चितानि accumulated, विविधानि वित्तानि various, possessions of wealth, दस्युभिः by thieves, विप्रलुप्यन्ताम् be snatched away.

75_42.shloka: उभे सन्ध्ये शयानस्य यत्पापं परिकल्प्यते।तच्चपापं भवेत्तस्य यस्यार्योऽनुमते गतः।।2.75.44।।
75_42.translation: May the one who counselled the exile of my esteemed brother acquire the extent of demerit fixed for a person, who sleeps at the hour of twilight of dawn and dusk
75_42.word_by_word: आर्यः esteemed one, यस्य whose, अनुमते with sanction, गतः exiled, तस्य  for that man, उभे सन्ध्ये at the twilight hour of dawn and dusk, शयानस्य sleeping, यत् पापम् the extent of sin, परिकल्प्यते is fixed, तत् पापम् that sin, भवेत् shall be.

75_43.shloka: यदग्निदायके पापं यत्पापं गुरतल्पगे।मित्रद्रोहे च यत्पापं तत्पापं प्रतिपद्यताम्।।2.75.45।।
75_43.translation: May that one who counselled the exile of my esteemed brother acquire the sin in the same way as a person who sets fire to human settlements, violates the preceptors's bed and betrays his friend
75_43.word_by_word: अग्निदायके one who sets fire to human settlements, यत् पापम् sin of such act, गुरुतल्पगे violation of the preceptor's bed, यत् पापम् sin of such act, मित्रद्रोहे betraying a friend, यत् पापम् sin of such act, तत् पापम् sin of that act, प्रतिपद्यताम् be obtained.

75_44.shloka: देवतानां पित्रूणां च मातापित्रोस्तथैव च।मा स्म कार्षीत्स शुश्रूषां यस्यार्योऽनुमते गतः।।2.75.46।।
75_44.translation: May the one who counselled the exile of my esteemed brother, acquire the sin in the same way as a person who fails to show obedience to the gods and the ancestors and to serve his parents
75_44.word_by_word: आर्यः esteemed one, यस्य whose, अनुमते with sanction, गतः exiled, सः that man, देवतानाम् for gods, पित्रूणाम् to ancestors, तथा च in the same way, मातापित्रोः for parents, शुश्रूषाम् serve, मा स्म कार्षीत् shall not do.

75_45.shloka: सतां लोकात्सतां कीर्त्या स्सञ्जुष्टात्कर्मणस्तथा।भ्रश्यतु क्षिप्रमद्यैव यस्यार्योऽनुमते गतः।।2.75.47।।
75_45.translation: May the one who counselled the exile of my esteemed brother be expelled  this very moment from the world approved by virtuous men, from their renown and from their (noble) actions
75_45.word_by_word: आर्यः esteemed one, यस्य whose, अनुमते with sanction, गतः exiled, that person,  अद्यैव now, क्षिप्रम् this very moment, सताम् virtuous men's, लोकात् from the world, सताम्  virtuous men's, कीर्त्याः from renown, तथा and, सञ्जुष्टात् approved by virtuous men, कर्मणः from actions, भ्रश्यतु be expelled.

75_46.translation: The one who counselled the exile of my noble, longarmed and broadchested brother be banished like the one who commited the sin of leaving the ministration to his mother and engaging himself in purposeless acts
75_46.word_by_word: दीर्घबाहुः longarmed, महावक्षाः broadchested, आर्यः esteemed one, यस्य whose, अनुमते with sanction, गतः exiled, सः that person, मातृशुश्रूषाम् ministration to mother, अपास्य abdicating, अनर्थे without purpose, अवतिष्ठताम् shall remain.

75_47.shloka: बहुपुत्रो दरिद्रश्च ज्वररोगसमन्वितः।स भूयात्सतत क्लेशी यस्यार्योऽनुमते गतः।।2.75.49।।
75_47.translation: May the one who counselled the exile of my esteemed brother be always miserable with many sons, poverty and fever and disease
75_47.word_by_word: आर्यः esteemed one, यस्य whose, अनुमते with sanction, गतः exiled, सः that person, बहुपुत्रः possessing many sons, दरिद्रः impoverished, ज्वररोगसमन्वितः suffering  from fever anddisease, सततं क्लेशी भूयात् be always miserble.

75_48.translation: May the one who counselled the exile of my esteemed brother acquire the sin in the same way a person disappoints who miserable mendicants seeking alms and looking up to him for help
75_48.word_by_word: आर्यः esteemed one, यस्य whose, अनुमते with sanction, गतः was exiled, that person, आशंसमानानाम् seeking, दीनानाम् pitiable ones, ऊर्ध्वचक्षुसाम् of those raising their eyes in hope towards donors, अर्थिनाम् mendicants', आशाम् hope, वितथाम् futile, कुर्यात् may make.

75_49.shloka: मायया रमतां नित्यं परुषः पिशुनोऽशुचिः।राज्ञो भीतस्त्वधर्मात्मा यस्यार्योऽनुमते गतः।।2.75.51।।
75_49.translation: May the one who counselled the exile of my esteemed brother acquire the sin in the same way as a person, who is abusive, niggardly, impure, unrighteous and always afraid of being caught by the king, and lives by cheating others, acquires
75_49.word_by_word: आर्यः esteemed one, यस्य whose, अनुमते with sanction, गतः exiled, that person, परुषः abusive, पिशुनः niggardly, अशुचिः impure, अधर्मात्मा unrighteous, नित्यम् always, राज्ञः  from the king, भीतः afraid of, मायया by deceit, रमताम् will entertain his life.

75_50.shloka: ऋतुस्नातां सतीं भार्यामृतुकालानुरोधिनीम्।अतिवर्तेत दुष्टात्मा यस्यार्योऽनुमते गतः।।2.75.52।।
75_50.translation: May the one who counselled the exile of my esteemed brother acquire the sin in the same way as a wickedminded person who neglects his chaste wife observing the menstrual period unfavourable for conception and had bathed after menstruation  acquires
75_50.word_by_word: आर्यः esteemed one, यस्य whose, अनुमते with sanction, गतः exiled, that person, दुष्टात्मा wickedminded, ऋतुकालानुरोधिनीम् observing the menstrual period unfavourable forconception, ऋतुस्नाताम् a woman who bathed after menstruation,सतीम् chaste woman, भार्याम् wife, अतिवर्तेत may neglect.

75_51.translation: May the one who counselled the exile of my esteemed brother acquire the sin in the same way a foolish person who abandons righteous conduct and  forsakes his rightfully married wife and resorts to other man's wife acquires
75_51.word_by_word: आर्यः esteemed one, यस्य whose, अनुमते with sanction, गतः exiled, that person मूढः foolish one, त्यक्तधर्मरतिः abandoned righteous conduct, धर्मदारान् rightfully married wife, परित्यज्य having forsaken, परदारान् other's wife, निषेवताम् may resort.

75_52.shloka: विप्रलुप्तप्रजातस्य दुष्कृतं ब्राह्मणस्य यत्।तदेव प्रतिपद्येत यस्यार्योऽनुमते गतः।।2.75.54।।
75_52.translation: May the one who counselled the exile of my esteemed brother acquire the same sin like that of a lowbred brahmin who commits an irreversible sin acquires
75_52.word_by_word: आर्यः esteemed one, यस्य whose, अनुमते with sanction, गतः exiled,  विप्रलुप्तप्रजातस्य lacking in children, ब्राह्मणस्य to brahmin, यत् दुष्कृतम् that demerit, तदेव   the same, प्रतिपद्यताम् shall obtain.

75_53.shloka: पानीयदूषके पापं तथैव विषदायके।यत्तदेकस्स लभतां यस्यार्योऽनुमते गतः।।2.75.55।।
75_53.translation: May the sin of polluting drinking water and administering poison to others be put together and be incurred by the man who counselled the exile of my esteemed brother
75_53.word_by_word: आर्यः esteemed one, यस्य whose, अनुमते with sanction, गतः exiled, सः that person, एकः only alone, पानीयदूषके in the case of a man who pollutes drinking water, तथैव similarly, विषदायके administers poison to others, यत् पापम् such sin, लभताम् will obtain.

75_54.shloka: ब्राह्मणायोद्यतां पूजां विहन्तु कलुषेन्द्रियः।बालवत्सां च गां दोग्धु यस्यार्यो ऽनुमते गतः।।2.75.56।।
75_54.translation: May the one who counselled the exile of my esteemed brother acquire the sin in the same way a person with befouled senses disturbs the offerings of worship kept ready for a brahmin and milks the cow having a young calf acquires.
75_54.word_by_word: आर्यः esteemed one, यस्य whose, अनुमते with sanction, गतः exiled, (सः that person), कलुषेन्द्रियः with befouled senses, ब्राह्मणाय to a brahmin, उद्यताम् kept ready, पूजाम्  offerings of worship, विहन्तु may disturb, बालवत्साम् having a young calf, गाम् cow, दोग्धु may milk.

75_55.shloka: तुर्ष्णार्तं सति पानीये विप्रलम्भेन योजयेत्।लभेत तस्य यत्पापं यस्यार्योऽनुमते गतः।।2.75.57।।
75_55.translation: May the one who counselled the exile of my esteemed brother acquire the sin in the same way a person who in possession of water does not give it to one suffering fromthirst acquires it
75_55.word_by_word: आर्यः esteemed one, यस्य whose, अनुमते with sanction, गतः exiled, (सः that person), पानीये water, सति existing, तृष्णार्तम् thirsty one, विप्रलम्भेन by deceipt, योजयेत् arranges, तस्य to him, यत् पापम् whatever sin, लभेत will result.

75_56.shloka: भक्त्या विवदमानेषु मार्गमाश्रित्य पश्यतः।तस्य पापेन युज्येत यस्यार्योऽनुमते गतः।।2.75.58।।
75_56.translation: May that one who counselled the exile of my esteemed brother acquire the sin in the same way a person acquires while giving onesided judgement between divided religious disputants
75_56.word_by_word: आर्यः esteemed one, यस्य whose, अनुमते with sanction, गतः exiled, भक्त्या by loyalty (to two religious factions), विवदमानेषु while disputing, मार्गम् one line of argument, आश्रित्य taking shelter, पश्यतः seeing, तस्य to him, पापेन by such sin, युज्येत will apply.

75_57.shloka: विहीनां पतिपुत्राभ्यां कौसल्यां पार्थिवात्मजः।एवमाश्वासयन्नेव दुःखार्तो निपपात ह।।2.75.59।।
75_57.translation: While thus appeasing Kausalya deprived of her husband and son, Bharata, filled with grief, fell down at her feet.
75_57.word_by_word: पार्थिवात्मजः king's son, Bharata, पतिपुत्राभ्याम् of husband and son, विहीनाम् deprived of, कौशल्याम् Kausalya, एवम् in this way, आश्वासयन्नेव while appeasing, दुःखार्तः filled with grief, निपपात ह fell down at her feet.

75_58.shloka: तथा तु शपथैः कष्टै श्शपमानमचेतनम्।भरतं शोकसन्तप्तं कौसल्या वाक्यमब्रवीत्।।2.75.60।।
75_58.translation: Kausalya said these words to Bharata who fell unconscious, consumed with grief, while swearing on painful oaths.
75_58.word_by_word: तथा in this manner, कष्टैः by painful, शपथैः on oaths, शपमानम् swearing, अचेतनम् lying unconscious, शोकसन्तप्तम् consumed with grief, भरतम् Bharata, कौशल्या Kausalya, वाक्यम् these words, अब्रवीत् said.

75_59.shloka: मम दुःखमिदं पुत्र भूयस्समुपजायते।शपथै श्शपमानो हि प्राणानुपरुणत्सि मे।।2.75.61।।
75_59.translation: O son by swearing on oaths, you are choking the very breath of my life and my suffering has grown still more.
75_59.word_by_word: पुत्र son, मम to me, इदं दुःखम् this suffering, भूयः still more, समुपजायते is growing, शपथैः by oaths, शपमानः swearing, मे my, प्राणान् life, उपरुणत्सि हि you are obstructing (choking).

75_60.shloka: दिष्ट्या न चलितो धर्मादात्मा ते सहलक्ष्मणः।वत्स सत्यप्रतिज्ञो ते सतां लोकमवाप्स्यसि।।2.75.62।।
75_60.translation: O dear child, fortunately your mind is unswerved from righteousness. You being truthful to your promise shall attain the world of virtuous men along with Lakshmana.
75_60.word_by_word: वत्स O dear child, दिष्ट्या fortunately, ते your, आत्मा mind, धर्मात् form righteousness, न चलितः unswerved, सत्यप्रतिज्ञः truthful to promise, सहलक्ष्मणः with Lakshmana, सताम् virtuous men's, लोकम् world, अवाप्स्यसि you shall attain.

75_61.shloka: इत्युक्त्वा चाङ्कमानीय भरतं भ्रातृवत्सलम्।परिष्वज्य महाबाहुं रुरोद भृशदुःखिता।।2.75.63।।
75_61.translation: After having addressed Bharata, who was affectionate towards his brother that way, Kausalya  drew the mightyarmed one onto her lap and hugged him and cried out with extreme grief.
75_61.word_by_word: भ्रातृवत्सलम् a man affectionate towards his brothr, भरतम् addressing Bharata, इति thus , उक्त्वा having said, अङ्कम् on her lap, आनीय drawing into, महाबाहुम् mightyarmed one, परिष्वज्य  hugged, भृशदुःखिता with extreme grief, रुरोद cried out.

75_62.shloka: एवं विलपमानस्य दुःखार्तस्य महात्मनः।मोहाच्च शोकसम्रोधाद्बभूव लुलितं मनः।।2.75.64।।
75_62.translation: Afflicted by sorrow and lamenting thus, great Bharata's mind became unsteady owing to swooning and  besieged by grief.
75_62.word_by_word: एवम् in this way, विलपमानस्य while lamenting, दुःखार्तस्य afflicted by sorrow, महात्मनः greatBharata's, मनः mind, मोहाच्च due to swooning, शोकसम्रोधात् due to being besieged by grief, लुलितम् बभूव became unsteady.

75_63.shloka: लालप्यमानस्य विचेतनस्य प्रणष्टबुद्धे: पतितस्य भूमौ।मुहुर्मुहुर्निश्श्वसतश्च घर्मं सा तस्य शोकेन जगाम रात्रिः।।2.75.65।।
75_63.translation: That night passed off in grief for Bharata, who fell on the ground with his mind clouded and his senses lost. He lamented again and again, heaving deep, warm sighs.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे पञ्चसप्ततितमस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the seventyfifth sarga in Ayodhyakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
75_63.word_by_word: लालप्यमानस्य lamenting, विचेतनस्य having lost the senses, प्रणष्टबुद्धे: with obscured mind, भूमौ on the ground, पतितस्य one having fallen down, मुहुर्मुहुः again and again, घर्मम्  warm, निःश्वसतः heaving deep sighs, तस्य to that Bharata, रात्रिः that night, शोकेन in grief, जगाम passed off.

76_1.shloka: [Bharata performs funeral rites of king Dasaratha on the bank of Sarayu.]तमेवं शोकसन्तप्तं भरतं कैकयी सुतम्।उवाच वदतां श्रेष्ठो वसिष्ठ श्श्रेष्ठवागृषिः।।2.76.1।।
76_1.translation: Vasistha, the most eloquent and the best of ascetics said to Bharata, the son of Kaikeyi who was tormented with grief:
76_1.word_by_word: एवम् in this way, शोकसन्तप्तम् tormented with grief, कैकयीसुतम् son of Kaikeyi, तं भरतम् to that Bharata, वदताम् among the eloquent, श्रेष्ठः best, श्रेष्ठवाक् a man of excellent speech, वसिष्ठः ऋषिः sage Vasistha, उवाच said.

76_2.shloka: अलं शोकेन भद्रं ते राजपुत्र महायशः।प्राप्तकालं नरपतेः कुरु संयानमुत्तमम्।।2.76.2।।
76_2.translation: O prince of great renown, may God bless you It is not proper on your part to grieve. It is time to perform the funeral rites of the king in the best way possible.
76_2.word_by_word: महायशः of great renown, राजपुत्रः king's son, ते भद्रं bless you, शोकेन by grief, अलम् enough, नरपतेः king's, प्राप्तकालम् time has come, उत्तमम् best, संयानम् funeral rites, कुरु perform.

76_3.shloka: वसिष्ठस्य वच श्शृत्वा भरतो धारणां गतः।प्रेतकार्याणि सर्वाणि कारयामास धर्मवित्।।2.76.3।।
76_3.translation: On hearing the words of Vasistha, dutiful Bharata regained his steadiness and engaged in the performance of the funeral rites.
76_3.word_by_word: धर्मवित् knower of his duty, भरतः Bharata, वसिष्ठस्य Vasistha's, वचः words, श्रूत्वा on hearing, धारणाम् steadiness, गतः regained, सर्वाणि all, प्रेतकार्यणि funeral rites, कारयामास began the performance.

76_4.shloka: उद्धृतं तैलसंरोधात्सतु भूमौ निवेशितम्।आपीतवर्णवदनं प्रसुप्तमिव भूमिपम्।।2.76.4।।संवेश्य शयने चाग्य्रे नानारत्नपरिष्कृते।ततो दशरथं पुत्रो विललाप सुदुःखितः।।2.76.5।।
76_4.translation: The mortal remains of king Dasaratha, protector of the earth, was taken out of the oil container and placed on the floor. His pale, yellow face appeared as if he was asleep. Thereafter it was laid upon a magnificent couch adorned with every kind of gem. On seeing Dasaratha in that state  Bharata lamented in extreme distress.
76_4.word_by_word: सः पुत्रः that son Bharata, तैलसंरोधात् from the oil container, उद्धृतम् raised, भूमौ on thefloor, निवेशितम् placed, आपीतवर्णवदनम् with a pale yellowcoloured face, प्रसुप्तमिव as if sleeping, भूमिपम् protector of the earth, दशरथम् Dasaratha, नानारत्न परिष्कृते adorned with every kind of gem, अग्य्रे on a magnificient, शयने on the couch, संवेश्य ततः having placed then, सुदुःखितः  in extreme distress, विललाप lamented.

76_5.shloka: किं ते व्यवसितं राजन् प्रोषिते मय्यनागते।विवास्य रामं धर्मज्ञं लक्ष्मणं च महाबलम्।।2.76.6।।
76_5.translation: What have you done, O king, between my absence and my arrival? You have banished the righteous Rama and the valiant Lakshmana.
76_5.word_by_word: राजन् O king, प्रोषिते when I was away from home, मयि अनागते before I could return, धर्मज्ञम्   righteous one, रामम् Rama, महाबलम् valiant, लक्ष्मणं च Lakshmana, विवास्य banished, ते  you, किम् what, व्यवसितम् was resolved?

76_6.shloka: क्व यास्यसि महाराज हित्वेमं दुःखितं जनम्।हीनं पुरुषसिंहेन रामेणाक्लिष्टकर्मणा।।2.76.7।।
76_6.translation: O great king Where will you go leaving me who is bewailing for having been left by Rama, the lion among men and a man of pious deeds?
76_6.word_by_word: महाराज O great king, अक्लिष्टकर्मणा by a man of pious acts, पुरुषसिंहेन by a lion among men, रामेण by Rama, हीनम् left, दुःखितम् bewailing, इमं जनम् this person, हित्वा leaving, क्व where, यास्यसि will you go?

76_7.shloka: योगक्षेमं तु ते राजन् कोऽस्मिन्कल्पयिता पुरेत्वयि प्रयाते स्वस्तात रामे च वनमाश्रिते।।2.76.8।।
76_7.translation: O king O father you have gone to heaven and Rama has taken shelter in the forest now. Who will take care of the welfare and security of your city?
76_7.word_by_word: राजन् O king, तात O father, त्वयि when you, स्वः to heaven, प्रयाते having gone, रामे च  Rama, वनम् forest, आश्रिते having taken refuge, अस्मिन् this, पुरे in your city, योगक्षेमम्  welfare and security, कल्पयिता who will arrange.

76_8.shloka: विधवा पृथिवी राजन् स्त्वया हीना न राजते।हीनचन्द्रेव रजनी नगरी प्रतिभाति मा।।2.76.9।।
76_8.translation: O king bereft of you, the earth (kingdom) is widowed and has lost its radiance. The city appears to me like a moonless night.
76_8.word_by_word: राजन् O king, त्वया by you, हीना bereft of, पृथिवी the earth, विधवा is a widow, न राजते does not shine, नगरी city, हीनचन्द्रा without Moon, रजनीव like the night, मा to me, प्रतिभाति  appears.

76_9.shloka: एवं विलपमानं तं भरतं दीनमानसम्।अब्रवीद्वचनं भूयो वसिष्ठस्तु महामुनिः।।2.76.10।।
76_9.translation: To Bharata who was thus lamenting with a dejected mind, the great ascetic Vasistha once again said:
76_9.word_by_word: एवम् in this way, विलपमानम् lamenting, दीनमानसम् dejected mind, तं भरतम् to that Bharata, महामुनिः great ascetic, वसिष्ठः Vasistha, भूयः again, वचनम् words, अब्रवीत् said.

76_10.shloka: प्रेतकार्याणि यान्यस्य कर्तव्यानि विशां पतेः।तान्यव्यग्रं महाबाहो क्रियान्तामविचारितम्।।2.76.11।।
76_10.translation: O mightyarmed prince, the funeral rites that are required to be performed for the departed king ought to be done carefully without any shortcomings.
76_10.word_by_word: महाबाहो O mightyarmed one, अस्य विशांपतेः for this king, यानि those, प्रेतकार्याणि funeral rites, कर्तव्यानि are required to be done, तानि them, अविचारितम् without hesitation, अव्यग्रम्attentively, क्रियान्ताम् may be performed.

76_11.shloka: तथेति भरतो वाक्यं वसिष्ठस्याभिपूज्य तत्।ऋत्विक्पुरोहिताचार्यान् स्त्वरयामास सर्वशः।।2.76.12।।
76_11.translation: Bharata said, 'Be it so' in obedience to Vasistha, who hastened up the learned Vedic scholars, family priests and preceptors to perform various rites.
76_11.word_by_word: भरतः Bharata, तथेति 'Be it so', वरिष्ठस्य Vasistha's, तत् वाक्यम् those words, अभिपूज्य  honouring, सर्वशः every way, ऋत्विक्पुरोहिताचार्यान् learned Vedic scholars, family priests and spiritual preceptors, त्वरयामास hastened them up.

76_12.shloka: ये त्वग्नयो नरेन्द्रेस्य चाग्न्यगाराद्बहिष्कृताः।ऋत्विग्भिर्याजकैश्चैव ते आह्रियन्त यथाविधि।।2.76.13।।
76_12.translation: The sacrificial fire of the king has been put outside the firesanctuary in accordance with the ritual precepts and were withdrawn by the attendants and priests wellversed in Vedic lore.
76_12.word_by_word: नरेन्द्रस्य king's, ये अग्नयः the fire, अग्न्यगारात् from firesanctuary, बहिष्कृताः have been put outside, ते they, यथाविधि in accordance with the ritual precepts, ऋत्विग्भि: by Vedic priests, याजकैश्चैव by sacrificial attendants, आह्रियन्त were withdrawn.

76_13.translation: Thereafter the attendants raised the mortal remains of the deceased king onto a litter, with dejected minds, throats choked with tears and carried him away.
76_13.word_by_word: अथ thereafter, परिचारकाः the attendants, गतचेतसम् deceased, राजानम् king, शिबिकायाम् on a litter, आरोप्य placing, बाष्पकण्ठाः with their throats choked with tears, विमनसः with dejected mind, तम् him, ऊहुः carried him away.

76_14.shloka: हिरण्यं च सुवर्णं च वासांसि विविधानि च।प्रकिरन्तो जना मार्गं नृपतेरग्रतो ययुः।।2.76.15।।
76_14.translation: The people went ahead of the king's body strewing on the way gold of brilliant colour and different kinds of garments.
76_14.word_by_word: जनाः people, नृपतेः king's, अग्रतः ahead, हिरण्यम् gold, सुवर्णं च with bright colour, विविधानि differents kinds, वासांसि च garments, प्रकिरन्तः strewing, मार्गम् on the way, ययुः went.

76_15.shloka: चन्दनागरुनिर्यासान् सरलं पद्मकं तथा।देवदारूणि चाहृत्य क्षेपयन्ति तथापरे।।2.76.16।।गन्धानुच्चावचांश्चान्यां स्तत्र गत्वाथ भूमिपम्।तत्र संवेशयामासुश्चितामध्ये तमृत्विजः।।2.76.17।।
76_15.translation: In this way others brought sandal, agaru and fragrant gum gugul, the resin of balsa tree and woods of sarala, padmaka and devadaru and built a pyre and strew many kinds of fragrant substances on it. Thereafter the priests laid the mortal remains of the king in the centre of the pyre.
76_15.word_by_word: तथा like that, अपरे others, चन्दनागरूनिर्यासान् sandal, agaru and fragrant gum gugul, theresin of Balsa tree, सरलम् sarala tree, पद्मकम् padmaka tree, देवदारूणि च devadaru tree, अन्यान् other, उच्चावचान् of many kinds, गन्धान् fragrant substances, आहृत्य having brought, तत्र there, गत्वा having gone, क्षेपयन्ति were strewn, अथ there, ऋत्विजः priests, भूमिपम् the body of the king, तत्र there, चितामध्ये in the centre of fire, संवेशयामासुः laid it down.

76_16.shloka: तदा हुताशनं हुत्वा जेपुस्तस्य तदृत्विजः।जगुश्च ते यथाशास्त्र तत्र सामानि सामगाः।।2.76.18।।
76_16.translation: Then the priests offering oblations to the king's fire, intoned prayers. The reciters of Sama Veda sang the hymns in accordance with the sacred scriptures.
76_16.word_by_word: तदा then, तदृत्विजः his priests, तस्य that king's, हुताशनम् fire, हुत्वा offering oblations, जेपुः intoned prayers, तत्र there, ते those, सामगाः those who chant Sama Veda, यथाशास्त्रम् in accordance with sacred scriptures, सामानि hymns, जगुश्च sang.

76_17.shloka: शिबिकाभिश्च यानैश्च यथार्हं तस्य योषितः।नगरा न्निर्ययुस्तत्र वृद्धैः परिवृता स्तदा।।2.76.19।।
76_17.translation: Then in accordance with their rank and surrounded by aged guards, the wives of  king Dasaratha departed for that place from the city in palanquins and other carriages.
76_17.word_by_word: तदा then, तस्य his (the king's), योषितः wives, वृद्धैः with aged guards, परिवृताः surrounded by, यथार्हम्  according to their rank, शिबिकाभिश्च in palanquins, यानैश्च in other carriages, नगरात् from the city, तत्र to that place, निर्ययुः departed.

76_18.shloka: प्रसव्यं चापि तं चकुः ऋत्विजोऽग्निचितं नृपम्।स्त्रियश्च शोकसन्तप्ताः कौसल्याप्रमुखास्तदा।।2.76.20।।
76_18.translation: Then the priests and other women led by Kausalya who was consumed with grief circumambulated the pyre in the reverse direction as the king's body was engulfed by flames.
76_18.word_by_word: तदा then, ऋत्विजः priests, शाकेसन्तप्ताः consumed with grief, कौशल्याप्रमुखाः led by Kausalya, स्त्रियश्च women also, अग्निचितम् engulfed by flames, तं नृपम् that king, प्रसव्यं चापि चक्रुः circumambulated in the reverse direction.

76_19.shloka: क्रौञ्चीनामिव नारीणां निनादस्तत्र शुश्रुवे।आर्तानां करुणं काले क्रोशन्तीनां सहस्रशः।।2.76.21।।
76_19.translation: At that time, piteous cries of distressed women in their thousands like the piercing cries of female kraunchas (birds) were heard.
76_19.word_by_word: तत्र काले at that time, आर्तानाम् of the distressed persons, करुणम् piteously, क्रोशन्तीनाम् of those women crying, सहस्रशः in thousands, नारीणाम् women's, निनादः sound, क्रौञ्चीनामिव like the sound of the kraunchas (birds), शुश्रुवे was heard.

76_20.translation: Thereafter, the courtesans weeping uncontrollably and, lamenting again and again, alighted from carriages on the bank of the river Sarayu.
76_20.word_by_word: ततः then, रुदन्त्यो weeping, विवशाः uncontrolled, वराङ्गनाः courtesans, पुनः पुनः again and again, विलप्य lamenting, सरयूतीरम् on the bank of the river Sarayu, यानेभ्यः from the carriages, अवतेरुः alighted.

76_21.shloka: कृत्वोदकं ते भरतेन सार्धं नृपाङ्गना मन्त्रिपुरोहिता श्च।पुरंप्रविश्याश्रुपरीतनेत्राः भूमौ दशाहं व्यनयन्त दुःखम्।।2.76.23।।
76_21.translation: The wives of the king, counsellors and priests along with Bharata offered waterlibation and entered the city with tearful eyes. They spent the tenday  mourning period sleeping on the ground (floor) in great grief.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे षटसप्ततितमस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the seventysixth sarga in Ayodhyakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
76_21.word_by_word: नृपाङ्गनाः wives of the king, ते they, मन्त्रिपुरोहिताश्च counsellors and priests, भरतेन सार्धम् along with Bharata, उदकम् waterlibations, कृत्वा having offered, अश्रुपरीतनेत्राः with their eyes filled with tears, पुरम् the city, प्रविश्य having reentered, दशाहम् ten days, भूमौ on the floor, दु:खम् their mourning period, व्यनयन्त spent.

77_1.shloka: [On the thirteenth day Bharata drops down in agony while picking up the bones of his deceased father -- Bharata and Satrughna once again plunge in grief -- Vasistha and Sumanthra console them]ततो दशाहेऽतिगते कृतशौचो नृपात्मजः।द्वादशेऽहनि सम्प्राप्ते श्राद्धकर्माण्यकारयत्।।2.77.1।।
77_1.translation: Having observed the tenday mourning period, Bharata purified himself on the twelfth day and got the shraddha rites (obsequies) performed.
77_1.word_by_word: ततः then, दशाहे the tenth day, अतिगते  having passed, कृतशौचः purified himself, नृपात्मजः king's son, Bharata, द्वादशे on the twelfth, अहनि day, सम्प्राप्ते had arrived, श्राद्धकर्माणि  shraddha rites, अकारयत् got them performed.

77_2.shloka: ब्राह्मणेभ्यो ददौ रत्नं धनमन्नं च पुष्कलम्।वासांसि च महार्हाणि रत्नानि विविधानि च।।2.77.2।।
77_2.translation: During the shraddha ceremony (obsequies) Bharata bestowed on brahmins precious stones, wealth, large quantities of rice, highly valuable garments and various gems.
77_2.word_by_word: ब्राह्मणेभ्यः to brahmins, रत्नम् precious stones, धनम् wealth, पुष्कलम् in abundance, अन्नम् rice, महार्हाणि highly valuable, वासांसि garments, विविधानि of various kinds, रत्नानि gems, ददौ gave.

77_3.shloka: बास्तिकं बहु शुक्लं च गाश्चापि शतशस्तथा।दासीदासं च यानं च वेश्मानि सुमहान्ति च।।2.77.3।।ब्राह्मणेभ्यो ददौ पुत्रो राज्ञस्तस्यौर्ध्वदैहिकम्।
77_3.translation: At the time of performing the rites pertaining to the other world, Bharata bestowed on brahmins herds of white goats, cows in hundreds, male and female servants and spacious houses and carriages.
77_3.word_by_word: पुत्रः son of Dasaratha, तस्य that, राज्ञः king's, और्ध्वदैहिकम् rites pertaining to the other world, ब्राह्मणेभ्यः to brahmins, बहु many, शुक्लम् white in colour, बास्तिकम् of goats, तथा also, शतशः in hundreds, गाश्चापि even cows, दासी दासं च male and female servants, यानं च carriages, सुमहान्ति spacious, वेश्मानि च houses, ददौ gave.

77_4.shloka: ततः प्रभातसमये दिवसेऽथ त्रयोदशे।।2.77.4।।विललाप महाबाहुर्भरत श्शोकमूर्छितः।शब्दापिहितकण्ठस्तु शोधनार्थमुपागतः।।2.77.5।।चितामूले पितुर्वाक्यमिदमाह सुदुःखितः।
77_4.translation: Thereafter at the hour of dawn on the thirteenth day mightyarmed Bharata visited the cemetery to perform the purificatory ceremony. Approaching the place of the funeral pyre of his father, he lamented in the intensity of grief:
77_4.word_by_word: ततः then, त्रयोदशे on the thiteenth, दिवसे day, प्रभातसमये at dawn, अथ thereafter, शोधनार्थम् for purification, उपागतः having arrived (at the cemetery), महाबाहुः mightyarmed, भरतः Bharata, शोकमूर्छितः rendered unconscious by grief, शब्दापिहितकण्ठः loudly, विललाप lamented, पितुः father's, चितामूले at the foot of the pyre, सुदुःखितः intensely grieved, इदं वाक्यम् these words, आह spoke.

77_5.shloka: तात यस्मिन्निसृष्टोऽहं त्वया भ्रातरि राघवे।।2.77.6।।तस्मिन्वनं प्रव्रजिते शून्ये त्यक्तोऽस्म्यहं त्वया।
77_5.translation: O dear father, my brother Rama to whom you have entrusted me has been sent tothe forest now and I am  left in a vacuum.
77_5.word_by_word: तात O father, यस्मिन् भ्रातरि to that brother, राघवे in Rama, अहम् I, त्वया by you,निसृष्टः  entrusted, तस्मिन् that Rama, वनम् to forest, प्रव्रजिते has been sent, अहम् I, त्वया by you,शून्ये in a vacuum, त्यक्तः अस्मि I have been left.

77_6.shloka: यस्या गतिरनाथायाः पुत्रः प्रवाजितो वनम्।तामम्बां तात कौसल्यां त्यक्त्वा त्वं क्व गतो नृप।।2.77.7।।
77_6.translation: Where have you gone, my king my father, forsaking mother Kausalya who is without a protector and whose only support Rama, her son has been sent away to the forest?
77_6.word_by_word: नृप king, तात father, आनाथायाः of the orphaned lady, यस्याः गतिः whose support, पुत्रः son (Rama), वनम् to forest, प्रव्राजितः has been sent, ताम् that, अम्बम् mother, कौशल्याम् Kausalya, त्यक्त्वा forsaking, क्व where, (त्वं) गतः have you gone?

77_7.shloka: दृष्ट्वा भस्मारुणं तच्च दग्धास्थि स्थानमण्डलम्।।2.77.8।।पितु श्शरीरनिर्वाणं निष्टनन्विषसाद सः।
77_7.translation: Having seen the circular place, looking reddishbrown with burnt bones and ashes, where his father's body was consumed by fire, Bharata started crying aloud in deep despondency.
77_7.word_by_word: सः he, भस्मारुणम् reddish brown with ashes, दग्धास्थि with burnt bones, पितुः father's, शरीरनिर्वाणम् where the body was made extinct, तत् that, स्थानमण्डलम् circular place, दृष्ट्वा having seen, निष्टनन् crying aloud, विषसाद indulged in sorrow.

77_8.shloka: स तु दृष्ट्वा रुदन् दीनः पपात धरणीतले।।2.77.9।।उत्थाप्यमानश्शक्रस्य यन्त्रध्वज इव च्युतः।
77_8.translation: On seeing the cremation ground desolate Bharata collapsed sobbing on the ground like a fastened flag staff of Indra, which fell as it was being raised.
77_8.word_by_word: सः तु as regards Bharata, दृष्ट्वा having seen, दीनः desolate, रुदन् sobbing, उत्थाप्यमानः as it was being raised, च्युतः fallen down, शक्रस्य Indra's, यन्त्रध्वजः इव like fastened flag staff, धरणीतलौ on the ground, पपात fell.

77_9.translation: Immediately all his counsellors ran towards him like the ascetics who raised Yayati, a man of pious vows, when he fell down at the final hour.
77_9.word_by_word: ततः thereafter, सर्वे all, तस्य अमात्याः his counsellors, शुचिव्रतम् a man of pious vows, अन्तकाले at the final hour, निपतितम् fallen down, ययातिम् Yayati, ऋषयो यथा like the ascetics, अभिपेतुः ran towards him.

77_10.shloka: शत्रुघ्न श्चापि भरतं दृष्ट्वा शोकम् परिप्लुतः।।2.77.11।।विसंज्ञो न्यपतद्भूमौ भूमिपालमनुस्मरन्।
77_10.translation: Beholding Bharata, Satrughna also plunged in grief remembering the king, and fell unconscious on the ground.
77_10.word_by_word: शत्रुघ्नश्चापि Satrughna too, भरतम् Bharata, दृष्ट्वा beholding, शोकपरिप्लुतः plunged in grief, भूमिपालम् the king, अनुस्मरन् remembering, विसंज्ञः unconscious, भूमौ on the ground, न्यपतत् fell down.

77_11.shloka: उन्मत्त इव निश्चेता विललाप सुदुःखितः।।2.77.12।।स्मृत्वा पितुर्गुणाङ्गानि तानि तानि तथा तथा।
77_11.translation: Recollecting the many virtues of his father again and again, like a madman, Satrughna,mentally unsteady, lamented in profound sorrow.
77_11.word_by_word: पितुः father's, तानि तानि those respective ones, गुणाङ्गानि virtues resulting one from the other, तथा तथा again and again, स्मृत्वा recollecting, उन्मत्तः इव like a mad person, निश्चेताः becoming mentally unsteady, सुदुःखितः in profound sorrow, विललाप lamented.

77_12.translation: With Manthara as the source, Kaikeyi as a crocodile, this terrible sea of sorrow which has submerged all of us lies unruffled.
77_12.word_by_word: मन्थराप्रभवः with Manthara as the source, कैकेयी ग्राहसङ्कुलः Kaikeyi as a crocodile, अक्षोभ्यः  undisturbed, तीव्रः terrible, वरदानमयः in the form of irrevocable boons, शोकसागरः sea of sorrow, अमञ्जयत् drowned.

77_13.shloka: सुकुमारं च बालं च सततं लालितं त्वया।।2.77.14।।क्व तात भरतं हित्वा विलपन्तं गतो भवान्।
77_13.translation: Where have you gone dear father, leaving the lamenting Bharata, so young and tender, who was always your darling?
77_13.word_by_word: तात father, सुकुमारम् tender, बालं च young, त्वया by you, सततम् always, लालितम् fondled, विलपन्तम् lamenting, भरतम् Bharata, हित्वा leaving, भवान् you, क्व where, गतः have you gone?

77_14.shloka: ननु भोज्येषु पानेषु वस्त्रेष्वाभरणेषु च।।2.77.15।।प्रवारयसि नस्सर्वान् तन्नः कोऽन्यः करिष्यति।
77_14.translation: You used to make all of us choose delicious food, drinks, garments and ornaments. Who else will do that now?
77_14.word_by_word: भोज्येषु in delicious food, पानेषु in drinks, वस्त्रेषु in garments, आभरणेषु च in ornaments, सः सर्वान् all of us, प्रवारयसि ननु used to make us choose, तत् that, नः for us, अन्यः some other, कः who, करिष्यति will do?

77_15.shloka: अवदारणकाले तु पृथिवी नावदीर्यते।।2.77.16।।या विहीना त्वया राज्ञा धर्मज्ञेन महात्मना।
77_15.translation: You are a righteous and mighty king and without you, this earth would have been broken into pieces. But it does not.
77_15.word_by_word: धर्मज्ञेन aware of righteous ways, महात्मना mighty, राज्ञा by the king, त्वया by you, या the earth, विहीना devoid of, पृथिवी that earth, अवदारणकाले at the time of breaking into pieces, नावदीर्यते does not break.

77_16.shloka: पितरि स्वर्गमापन्ने रामे चारण्यमाश्रिते।।2.77.17।।किं मे जीवितसामर्थ्यं प्रवेक्ष्यामि हुताशनम्।
77_16.translation: With my father ascended to heaven and Rama gone to the forest, where is the strength in me to live? I shall enter the blazing fire.
77_16.word_by_word: पितरि when father, स्वर्गम् heaven, आपन्ने had ascended, रामे च when Rama, अरण्यम् the forest, आश्रिते had taken refuge, मे to me, जीवितसामर्थ्यम् strength to live, किम् what is there, हुताशनम् blazing fire, प्रवेक्ष्यामि I will enter.

77_17.shloka: हीनो भ्रात्रा च पित्रा च शून्यामिक्ष्वाकुपालिताम्।।2.77.18।।अयोध्यां न प्रवेक्ष्यामि प्रवेक्ष्यामि तपोवनम्।
77_17.translation: Devoid of my father and brother, I will not return to empty Ayodhya that was once ruled by the Ikshvakus. I will enter the grove of asceticism .
77_17.word_by_word: भ्रात्रा with brother, पित्रा च with father, हीनः devoid of, शून्याम् empty, इक्ष्वाकुपालिताम् ruled by Ikshvakus, अयोध्याम् Ayodhya, न प्रवेक्ष्यामि I will not enter, तपोवनम् penance grove, प्रवेक्ष्यामि I shall enter.

77_18.shloka: तयोर्विलपितं श्रुत्वा व्यसनं चान्ववेक्ष्य तत्।।2.77.19।।भृशमार्ततरा भूयस्सर्वएवानुगामिनः।
77_18.translation: Having heard the lamentataions of both the brothers and reflecting the calamity befallen on them, the attendants felt extremely afflicted once again.
77_18.word_by_word: तयोः of both of them, विलपितम् lamentations, श्रुत्वा having heard, तत् that, व्यसनम् of calamity, अन्ववेक्ष्य reflecting, सर्वे all, अनुगामिनः attendants, भूयः again, भृशम् extremely, आर्ततराः become more afflicted.

77_19.shloka: ततो विषण्णौ श्रान्तौ च शत्रुघ्नभरतावुभौ।।2.77.20।।धरण्यां संव्यवेष्टेतां भग्नशृङ्गाविवर्षभौ।
77_19.translation: Thereafter, both Satrughna and Bharata, dejected and exhausted, lay writhing on the  floor like two bulls with their horns broken.
77_19.word_by_word: ततः thereafter, विषण्णौ dejected, श्रान्तौ च exhausted, उभौ both, शत्रुघ्नभरतौ Satrughna and Bharata, भग्नशृङ्गौ with the horns broken, ऋषभौ इव like bulls, धरण्याम् on the floor, संव्यवेष्टेताम् lay writhing.

77_20.shloka: ततः प्रकृतिमान्वैद्यः पितुरेषां पुरोहितः।।2.77.21।।वसिष्ठो भरतं वाक्यमुत्थाप्य तमुवाच ह।
77_20.translation: Then his father's family priest Vasistha of composed mind and versed in the Vedas  raised Bharata and said to him:
77_20.word_by_word: ततः then, प्रकृतिमान् of composed character, वैद्यः learned, एषाम् their, पितुः father's, पुरोहितः priest, वसिष्ठः Vasistha, तम् भरतम् that Bharata, उत्थाप्य having raised, वाक्यम् these words, उवाच said.

77_21.shloka: त्रयोदशोऽयं दिवसः पितुर्वृत्तस्य ते विभो।।2.77.22।।सावशेषास्थिनिचये किमिह त्वं विलम्भसे।
77_21.translation: O lord, this is the thirteenth day since the death of your father. The heap of bones and ashes still remain on the pyre. Why this delay on your part?
77_21.word_by_word: विभो O lord, अयम् it is, वृत्तस्य of the dead, ते पितुः your father's, त्रयोदशः the thirteenth, दिवसः day, सावशेषास्थिनिचये when the heap of bones and ashes still remain, त्वम् you, इहhere, किम् why, विलम्बसे are you delaying?

77_22.shloka: त्रीणि द्वन्द्वानि भूतेषु प्रवृत्तान्यविशेषतः।।2.77.23।।तेषु चापरिहार्येषु नैवं भवितुमर्हसि।
77_22.translation: There are three dualities  (hunger and thirst, pain and pleasure, birth and death), which are applicable to all living beings without any exception and cannot be eschewed. Therefore, it does not behove you to act in this way.
77_22.word_by_word: त्रीणि three, द्वन्द्वानि dualities, भूतेषु in living beings, अविशेषतः without exception, प्रवृत्तानि  are applicable, तेषु they, अपरिहार्येषु cannot be eschewed, एवम् भवितुम् to become sorrowful, नार्हसि it does not behove you.

77_23.translation: The knower of reality Sumantra helped Satrughna to rise, after having consoled him, imparted him the truth about the inevitability of birth and death.
77_23.word_by_word: तत्त्वज्ञः knower of truth (nature of the Brahman), सुमन्त्रश्चापि Sumantra also, शत्रुघ्नम् Satrughna, उत्थाप्य have raised, अभिप्रसाद्य च having consoled him, सर्वभूतभवाभवम् about birth and death, श्रावयामास made him to listen.

77_24.shloka: उत्थितौ च नरव्याघ्रौ प्रकाशेते यशस्विनौ।।2.77.25।।वर्षातपपरिक्लिनौ पृथगिन्द्रध्वजाविव।
77_24.translation: Having risen from the earth both the illustrious tigers among men, Bharata and Satrughna looked  faded and weather beaten like the banners of Indra that had faded under the Sun and rain.
77_24.word_by_word: उत्थितौ the two risen, यशस्विनौ illustrious, नरव्याघ्रौ tigers among men, पृथक् separately, वर्षातपपरिक्लिनौ faded due to the heat of Sun and rain, इन्द्रध्वजाविव like the banners of Indra, प्रकाशेते shone.

77_25.shloka: अश्रूणि परिमृद्नन्तौ रक्ताक्षौ दीनभाषिणौ।अमात्यास्त्वरयन्ति स्म तनयौ चापराः क्रियाः।।2.77.26।।
77_25.translation: The counsellors hastened up both the sons, who were wiping away the tears and speaking with blodshot eyes, to complete the remaining part of  the funeral rites.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे सप्तसप्ततितमस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the seventyseventh sarga in Ayodhyakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
77_25.word_by_word: अश्रूणि tears, परिमृद्नन्तौ wiping  away, रक्ताक्षौ with blodshot eyes, दीनभाषिणौ speaking in desolation, तनयौ both sons, अमात्याः counsellors, अपराः the remaining क्रियाः funeral rites, त्वरयन्ति स्म hastened up.

78_1.shloka: [While Bharata looks at Manthara furiously, Satrughna drags her and throws her down -- Kaikeyi pleads for mercy and pacifies Manthara.]अथ यात्रां समीहन्तं शत्रुघ्नो लक्ष्मणानुजः।भरतं शोकसन्तप्तमिदं वचनमब्रवीत्।।2.78.1।।
78_1.translation: As the griefstricken Bharata was intending to proceed to Rama, Lakshmana's younger brother Satrughna said to him:
78_1.word_by_word: अथ now, यात्राम् journey (to Rama), समीहन्तम् wishing, शोकसन्तप्तम् griefstriken, भरतम्Bharata, लक्ष्मणानुजः Lakshmana's younger brother, शत्रुघ्नः Satrughna, इदम् these, वचनम् words, अब्रवीत् said.

78_2.shloka: गतिर्य स्सर्वभूतानां दुःखे किं पुनरात्मनः।स राम स्सत्त्वसम्पन्नः स्त्रिया प्रव्राजितो वनम्।।2.78.2।।
78_2.translation: Couldn't the mighty Rama who is the ultimate refuge of all beings protect himself in his own distress? That Rama has been exiled to the forest by a woman.
78_2.word_by_word: यः who, सर्वभूतानाम् for all beings, गतिः ultimate refuge, आत्मनः in his own, दुःखे distress, किं पुनः why again say, सः he, सत्त्वसम्पन्नः endowed with strength, रामः Rama, स्त्रिया by a woman, वनम् to forest, प्रव्राजितः has been exiled.

78_3.shloka: बलवान्वीर्यसम्पन्नो लक्ष्मणो नाम योऽप्यसौ।किं न मोचयते रामं कृत्वा स्म पितृनिग्रहम्।।2.78.3।।
78_3.translation: And why did not Lakshmana who is strong and powerful release Rama from exile by restraining our father?
78_3.word_by_word: बलवान् strong, वीर्यसम्पन्नः endowed with prowess, लक्ष्मणो नाम Lakshmana by name, यः whoever, असौ अपि even himself, पितृनिग्रहम् restraint of father, कृत्वा having made, रामम् Rama, किम् why, न मोचयते स्म did not release?.

78_4.shloka: पूर्वमेव तु निग्राह्य स्समवेक्ष्य नयानयौ।उत्पथं यस्समारूढो राजा नार्या वशं गतः।।2.78.4।।
78_4.translation: In the first place, the king could have restrained himself by reflecting on whether the course of action adopted by him under the influence of a woman was just or unjust.
78_4.word_by_word: यः who, नार्याः woman's, वशम् the influence, गतः having come under, उत्पथम् upward course, समारूढः had climbed, राजा king, नयानयौ what was just or unjust, समवेक्ष्य having considered, पूर्वमेव in the first place, निग्राह्यः could have restrained.

78_5.shloka: इति सम्भाषमाणे तु शत्रुघ्ने लक्ष्मणानुजे।प्राग्द्वारेऽभूत्तदा कुब्जा सर्वाभरणभूषिता।।2.78.5।।
78_5.translation: While Satrughna, brother of Lakshmana was conversing thus, the hunchback Manthara decorated with all kinds of ornaments arrived at the entrance.
78_5.word_by_word: लक्ष्मणानुजे while the brother of Lakshmana, शत्रुघ्ने Satrughna, इति thus, सम्भाषमाणे was conversing, तदा then, कुब्जा hunchback Manthara, सर्वाभरणभूषिता wearing every kind of ornament, प्राग्द्वारे अभूत् arrived at the entrance.

78_6.shloka: लिप्ता चन्दनसारेण राजवस्त्राणि बिभ्रती।विविधं विविधै स्तैस्तैर्भूषणैश्च विभूषिता।।2.78.6।।
78_6.translation: She had besmeared herself with the essence of sandal, had put on royal garments andadorned herself in many ways with every kind of ornament.
78_6.word_by_word: चन्दनसारेण with essence of sandal, लिप्ता besmeared, राजवस्त्राणि royal garments, बिभ्रती wearing, विविधैः by various kinds of, तैस्तैः those particular, भूषणैश्च ornaments, विविधम् in many ways, विभूषिता was adorned.

78_7.translation: Tied with colourful girdle strings and wearing many other auspicious ornaments, shelooked like a female monkey tied with a rope.
78_7.word_by_word: चित्रैः of different colours, मेखलादामभिः with girdle strings, अन्यैः by other, बहुभिः many, शुभभूषणैश्च with auspicious ornaments, बद्धा tied around, रज्जुबद्धा tied with cords, वानरीव like a female monkey, बभासे shone.

78_8.shloka: तां समीक्ष्य तदा द्वास्स्थास्सुभृशं पापकारिणीम्।गृहीत्वाऽकरुणां कुब्जां शत्रुघ्नाय न्यवेदयन्।।2.78.8।।
78_8.translation: Seeing the hunchback, doer of many sinful deeds, the gatekeepers caught hold of her and informed Satrughna.
78_8.word_by_word: तदा then, द्वास्स्थाः the gatekeepers, सुभृशम् many, पापकारिणीम् doer of sinful deeds, अकरुणाम् without compassion, तां कुब्जाम् that hunchback, समीक्ष्य seeing, गृहीत्वा seizng, शत्रुघ्नाय to Satrughna, न्यवेदयन् informed.

78_9.shloka: यस्याः कृते वने रामो न्यस्तदेहश्च वः पिता।सेयं पापा नृशंसा च तस्याः कुरु यथामति।।2.78.9।।
78_9.translation: Here is that sinful, cruel woman on whose account Rama is in the forest and your father has forsaken his body. Do with her as it pleases you.
78_9.word_by_word: यस्याः कृते on whose acount, रामः Rama, वने in the forest, वः पिता your father, न्यस्तदेहश्च  forsook his body, सा that, पापा sinful woman, नृशंसा च cruel also, इयम् this (Manthara), तस्याः to her, यथामति as you please, कुरु do.

78_10.shloka: शत्रुघ्नश्च तदाज्ञाय वचनं भृशदुःखितः।अन्तःपुरचरान्सर्वानित्युवाच धृत व्रतः।।2.78.10।।
78_10.translation: Intensely grieved to hear those words, Satrughna who was steadfast in his vows said to the inmates of the inner apartment:
78_10.word_by_word: भृशदुःखितः deeply grieved, धृत व्रत: stern and steadfast in his vows, शत्रुघ्नश्च Satrughna also, तत् those, वचनम् words, आज्ञाय having known (heard), सर्वान् all, अन्तःपुरचरान् those moving in the inner apartment, इति thus, उवाच said.

78_11.shloka: तीव्रमुत्पादितं दुःखं भ्रात्रूणां मे तथा पितुः।यया सेयं नृशंसस्य कर्मणः फलमश्नुताम्।।2.78.11।।
78_11.translation: Let this woman, who caused deep sorrow to our brothers and father, reap the fruit of her malicious actions.
78_11.word_by_word: यया by whom, भ्रात्रूणाम् of our brothers, मे my, पितुः of father, तीव्रम् intense, दुःखम् sorrow, उत्पादितम् has been caused, सा इयम् that she, नृशंसस्य of a malicious, कर्मणः actions, फलम्  fruits, अश्नुताम् let her reap.

78_12.shloka: एवमुक्त्वा तु तेनाशु सखीजनसमावृता।गृहीता बलवत्कुब्जा सा तद्गृहमनादयत्।।2.78.12।।
78_12.translation: Saying thus, he forcibly caught hold of the hunchback amidst her companions when she filled the house with her cries.
78_12.word_by_word: एवम् in this way, उक्त्वा having said, आशु quickly, तेन by him, बलवत् forcibly, गृहीता  caught hold of, सखीजन समावृता surrounded by her companions, सा कुब्जा that hunchback, तत् गृहम् that house, अनादयत् reverberated with her cries.

78_13.shloka: तत स्सुभृशसन्तप्तस्तस्या स्सर्व स्सखीजनः।क्रुद्धमाज्ञाय शत्रुघ्नं विपलायत सर्वशः।।2.78.13।।
78_13.translation: Perceiving the enraged Satrughna all her companions shook in terror and fled in different directions.
78_13.word_by_word: ततः then, तस्याः her, सर्वः all, सखीजनः comapnions, शत्रुघ्नम् of Satrughna, क्रुद्धम् as enraged one, आज्ञाय having known, सुभृश सन्तप्तः extremely pained, सर्वशः in all directions, विपलायत ran fled.

78_14.shloka: आमन्त्रयत कृत्स्न श्च तस्या स्सर्व स्सखीजनः।यथाऽयं समुपक्रान्तो निश्शेषां नः करिष्यति।।2.78.14।।
78_14.translation: All her companions conversed among themselves. The way he began, it looks he will finish all of us.
78_14.word_by_word: तस्याः her, सर्वः all, सखीजनः companions, अयम् this man, यथा in this way, समुपक्रान्तः began,  नः us, निःशेषाम् leaving none, करिष्यति will do, आमन्त्रयत conversed with each other.

78_15.shloka: सानुक्रोशां वदान्यां च धर्मज्ञां च यशस्विनीम्।कौसल्यां शरणं याम सा हि नोऽस्तु ध्रुवा गतिः।।2.78.15।।
78_15.translation: Let us seek refuge under the illustrious Kausalya, who is compassionate, generous,  and knower of righteousness. She is our sure saviour.
78_15.word_by_word: सानुक्रोशाम् compassionate, वदान्यां च generous, धर्मज्ञाम् knower of righteousness, यशस्विनीम् illustrious, कौशल्याम् Kausalya, शरणं याम we seek refuge, सा that, नः for us, ध्रुवा surely, गतिः अस्तु is only saviour.

78_16.shloka: स च रोषेण ताम्राक्ष श्शत्रुघ्न श्शत्रुतापनः।विचकर्ष तदा कुब्जां क्रोशन्तीं धरणीतले।।2.78.16।।
78_16.translation: With bloodshot eyes Satrughna, the scorcher of enemies, dragged the shrieking hunchback down the ground in fury.
78_16.word_by_word: रोषेण in fury, ताम्राक्षः a man with blodshot eyes, शत्रुतापनः scorcher of enemies, सः शत्रुघ्नः that Satrughna, तदा then, क्रोशन्तीम् shrieking, कुब्जाम् hunchback, धरणीतले on the ground, विचकर्ष dragged.

78_17.shloka: तस्या ह्याकृष्यमाणाया मन्थराया स्ततस्ततः।चित्रं बहुविधं भाण्डं पृथिव्यां तद्व्यशीर्यत।।2.78.17।।
78_17.translation: While Manthara was being dragged by Satrughna, the collection of ornaments of many colours and of various kinds worn by her were broken and  scattered here and there all over the ground.
78_17.word_by_word: तस्याः that, मन्थरायाः Manthara, आकृष्यमाणायाः while being dragged, चित्रम् of various colours, बहुविधम् of many kinds, तत् that, भाण्डम् collection of ornaments, ततस्ततः here and there, व्यशीर्यत were scattered.

78_18.shloka: तेन भाण्डेन संस्तीर्णं श्रीमद्राजनिवेशनम्।अशोभत तदा भूयः शारदं गगनं यथा।।2.78.18।।
78_18.translation: The resplendent royal palace, strewn all over with several ornaments on the ground  shone like the autumnal sky (studded with innumerable stars).
78_18.word_by_word: तेन by that, भाण्डेन with the collection of ornaments, संस्तीर्णम् strewn on the ground, श्रीमद्राजनिवेशनम् the resplendent royal palace, तदा then, शारदम् autumnal, गगनं यथा like the sky, भूयः greatly, अशोभत shone.

78_19.shloka: स बली बलवत्क्रोधाद्गृहीत्वा पुरुषर्षभः।कैकेयीमभिनिर्भर्त्स्य बभाषे परुषं वचः।।2.78.19।।
78_19.translation: The mighty and the best of men Satrughna seized with fury, forcibly caught hold of that hunchback and censured Kaikeyi with harsh words.
78_19.word_by_word: बली mighty, सः पुरुषर्षभः that best of men, क्रोधात् out of fury, बलवत् forcibly, गृहीत्वाseizing, कैकेयीम् Kaikeyi, अभिनिर्भर्त्स्य threatening, परुषम् harsh, वचः words, बभाषे spoke.

78_20.shloka: तैर्वाक्यैः परुषैर्दुःखैः कैकेयी भृशदुःखिता।शत्रुघ्नभयसन्त्रस्ता पुत्रं शरणमागता।।2.78.20।।
78_20.translation: Kaikeyi, deeply distressed at those harsh and grievous words was afraid of Satrughna and sought the protection of her son Bharata.
78_20.word_by_word: कैकेयी Kaikeyi, परुषैः by harsh, दुःखैः by grievous, तैः वाक्यैः with those words, भृशदुःखिता extremely distressed, शत्रुघ्नभयसंत्रस्ता afraid of calamity from Satrughna, पुत्रम् sonBharata, शरणम् for protection, आगता reached.

78_21.shloka: तं प्रेक्ष्य भरतः क्रुद्धं शत्रुघ्नमिदमब्रवीत्।अवध्या स्सर्वभूतानां प्रमदाः क्षम्यतामिति।।2.78.21।।
78_21.translation: Bharata, addressing the enraged Satrughna said Of all beings a lady is not to be killed.  Pardon her.
78_21.word_by_word: भरतः Bharata, क्रुद्धम् enraged one, तम् शत्रुघ्नम् addressing that Satrugna, इदम् these words, अब्रवीत् said, प्रमदाः women, सर्वभूतानाम् in all beings, अवध्याः should not to be killed, क्षम्यताम् may be pardoned.

78_22.shloka: हन्यामहमिमां पापां कैकेयीं दुष्टचारिणीम्।यदि मां धार्मिको रामो नासूयेन्मातृघातकम्।।2.78.22।।
78_22.translation: If righteous Rama were not to accuse me of slaying a mother, I would have killed the sinful Kaikeyi of wicked deeds myself.
78_22.word_by_word: धार्मिकः righteous, रामः Rama, मातृघातकम् slayer of mother, माम् me, न असूयेद्यदि if he were not to accuse me, दुष्टचारिणीम् a woman of wicked deeds, पापाम् sinful, इमां कैकेयीम् this Kaikeyi, अहम् I, हन्याम् would have killed.

78_23.shloka: इमामपि हतां कुब्जां यदि जानाति राघवः।त्वां च मां च हि धर्मात्मा नाभिभाषिष्यते ध्रुवम्।।2.78.23।।
78_23.translation: If righteous Rama comes to know that this hunchback has been slain by us, he will certainly never talk to you or me.
78_23.word_by_word: धर्मात्मा righteous, राघवः Rama, इमाम् this, कुब्जाम् अपि hunchback also, हताम् as slain, जानाति यदि if he comes to know, ध्रुवम् surely, त्वां च you, मां च हि me also, नाभिभाषिष्यते will never talk (to us).

78_24.shloka: भरतस्य वचश्श्रुत्वा शत्रुघ्नो लक्ष्मणानुजः।न्यवर्तत ततो रोषात्तां मुमोच च मन्थराम्।।2.78.24।।
78_24.translation: Hearing the words of Bharata, Satrughna, the younger brother of Lakshmana restrained his fury and also released Manthara.
78_24.word_by_word: लक्ष्मणानुजः Lakshmana's younger brother, शत्रुघ्नः Satrughna, भरतस्य Bharata's, वचः words, श्रुत्वा after hearing, ततः then, रोषात् from fury, न्यवर्तत restrained, ताम् that, मन्थराम् Manthara, मुमोच च also released.

78_25.shloka: सा पादमूले कैकेय्या मन्थरा निपपात ह।निश्श्वसन्ती सुदुःखार्ता कृपणं विललाप च।।2.78.25।।
78_25.translation: Manthara, tormented with grief, fell at the feet of Kaikeyi and began heaving deep sighs.
78_25.word_by_word: सा मन्थरा that Manthara, कैकेय्याः Kaikeyi's, पादमूले at her feet, निपपात ह fell down, सुदुःखार्ता tormented with grief, निःश्वसन्ती heaving deep sighs, कृपणम् wretchedly, विललाप च  lamented.

78_26.shloka: शत्रुघ्नविक्षेपविमूढसंज्ञां समीक्ष्य कुब्जां भरतस्य माता।शनैस्समाश्वासयदार्तरूपां क्रौञ्चीं विलग्नामिव वीक्षमाणाम्।।2.78.26।।
78_26.translation: .Seeing the hunchback thrown down by Satrughna and lying senseless and anguishedlike a female krauncha bird caught in a net looking in different directions, Kaikeyi gently soothed her.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे अष्टसप्ततितमस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the seventyeighth sarga in Ayodhyakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
78_26.word_by_word: भरतस्य Bharata's, माता mother, शत्रुघ्नविक्षेपविमूढसंज्ञाम् thrown down by Satrughna and lay sensesless, आर्तरूपाम् anguished, विलग्नाम् caught in a net, क्रौञ्चीमिव like a female krauncha bird, वीक्षमाणाम् looking in different directions, कुब्जाम् hunchback, समीक्ष्य  having seen, शनैः gently, समाश्वासयत् consoled.

79_1.shloka: [Bharata is asked to accept the throne -- orders construction of road into the forest -- gets ready to bring back Rama.]ततः प्रभातसमये दिवसेऽथ चतुर्दशे।समेत्य राजकर्तारो भरतं वाक्यमब्रुवन्।।2.79.1।।
79_1.translation: Then, at the hour of dawn on the fourteenth day, all those who were empowered to proclaim the king,  assembled and addressed Bharata:
79_1.word_by_word: ततः then, चतुर्दशे on the fourteenth, दिवसे day, अथ afterwards, प्रभातसमये at the hour of dawn, राजकर्तारः those who are empowered to proclaim a king, समेत्य having come, भरतम् to Bharata, वाक्यम् these words, अब्रुवन् said.

79_2.shloka: गतो दशरथस्स्वर्गं यो नो गुरुतरो गुरुः।रामं प्रव्राज्य वै ज्येष्ठं लक्ष्मणं च महाबलम्।।2.79.2।।
79_2.translation: Dasaratha, who was our most revered master and preceptor, having exiled his eldest son Rama and mighty Lakshmana, ascended heaven.
79_2.word_by_word: यः who, नः for us, गुरुतरः superior, गुरुः preceptor, दशरथः Dasaratha, ज्येष्ठम् eldest son, रामम् to Rama, महाबलं च mighty, लक्ष्मणं च to Lakshmana also, प्रव्राज्य having exiled, स्वर्गम् heaven, गतः gone.

79_3.shloka: त्वमद्य भव नो राजा राजपुत्र महायशः।सङ्गत्या नापराध्नोति राज्यमेतदनायकम्।।2.79.3।।
79_3.translation: O illutrious prince do assume kingship now. Incidentally, there has been yet no attack on this leaderless kingdom.
79_3.word_by_word: महायशः O  illustrious one, राजपुत्र O king's son (prince), अद्य now, त्वम् you, नः for us, राजा  भव be king, अनायकम् without a leader, एतत् राज्यम् this kingdom, सङ्गत्या by association, नापराध्नोति has not comitted any offence.

79_4.shloka: अभिषेचनिकं सर्वमिदमादाय राघव।प्रतीक्षते त्वां स्वजनश्श्रेणयश्च नृपात्मज।।2.79.4।।
79_4.translation: O prince of the Raghu race (Bharata), your subjects and guilds of traders, artisans, etc, have procured necessary materials for your consecration, and  await you.
79_4.word_by_word: नृपात्मज son of the king, राघव Bharata (of Raghus race), स्वजनः your subjects, श्रेणयश्च guilds of traders, artisans, etc, सर्वम् all, इदम् this, अभिषेचनिकम् necessary materials for consecration, आदाय  having brought, त्वाम् you, प्रतीक्षते waiting.

79_5.shloka: राज्यं गृहाण भरत पितृपैतामहं ध्रुवम्।अभिषेचय चात्मानं पाहि चास्मान्नरर्षभ।।2.79.5।।
79_5.translation: O best among men, inherit this stable kingdom of your ancestors, get yourself consecrated and save us.
79_5.word_by_word: भरत O Bharata, पितृपैतामहम् ancestral, ध्रुवम् stable, राज्यम् kingdom, गृहाण you may receive, नरर्षभ bull (best) among men, आत्मानम् yourself , अभिषेचय get consecrated, अस्मान् us, पाहि च save.

79_6.shloka: अभिषेचनिकं भाण्डं कृत्वा सर्वं प्रदक्षिणम्।भरतस्तं जनं सर्वं प्रत्युवाच धृतव्रतः।।2.79.6।।
79_6.translation: Bharata, firm in vows, circumambulated all the articles procured in connection withconsecration, and replied them as follows:
79_6.word_by_word: धृतव्रतः a man of firm vows, भरतः Bharata, अभिषेचनिकम् relating to consecration, सर्वम् all, भाण्डम् the articles procured, प्रदक्षिणं कृत्वा having circumambulated, सर्वम् all, तं जनम् to those people, प्रत्युवाच replied.

79_7.shloka: ज्येष्ठस्य राजता नित्यमुचिता हि कुलस्य नः।नैवं भवन्तो मां वक्तुमर्हन्ति कुशला जनाः।।2.79.7।।
79_7.translation: It has been the tradition in our race that the eldest son alone should always inherit the kingdom. It does not behove intelligent people like you to tell me like this.
79_7.word_by_word: नित्यम् always, नः our, कुलस्य race, ज्येष्ठस्य the eldest one, राजता kingship, उचिता हि is befitting (tradition) indeed, कुशलाः intelligent, जनाः people, भवन्तः all of you, माम् me, एवम् in this way, वक्तुम् to tell, न अर्हन्ति does not behove.

79_8.shloka: रामः पूर्वो हि नो भ्राता भविष्यति महीपतिः।अहं त्वरण्ये वत्स्यामि वर्षाणि नव पञ्च च।।2.79.8।।
79_8.translation: Our eldest brother, Rama shall become king. As for me, I shall dwell in the forest for fourteen years.
79_8.word_by_word: नः our, पूर्वः eldest, भ्राता brother, रामः Rama, महीपतिः भविष्यति shall become king, अहं तु as for me, नव पञ्च च nine and four (fourteen), वर्षाणि years, अरण्ये in the forest, वत्स्यामि I shall dwell.

79_9.shloka: युज्यतां महती सेना चतुरङ्गमहाबला।आनयिष्याम्यहं ज्येष्ठं भ्रातरं राघवं वनात्।।2.79.9।।
79_9.translation: Let the great and powerful army of four divisions be marshalled. I will bring back my eldest brother Rama from the forest.
79_9.word_by_word: चतुरङ्गमहाबला powerful army of four divisions, महती great, सेना army, युज्यताम् be  marshalled, अहम् I, ज्येष्ठम् eldest, भ्रातरम् brother, राघवम् Rama, वनात् from the forest, आनयिष्यामि I will bring back.

79_10.shloka: अभिषेचनिकं चैव सर्वमेतदुपस्कृतम्।पुरस्कृत्य गमिष्यामि रामहेतोर्वनं प्रति।।2.79.10।।
79_10.translation: I shall go to the forest to (bring back) Rama, with all these articles, procured for coronation kept in front.
79_10.word_by_word: एतत् उपस्कृतम् these collected, सर्वम् all, आभिषेचनिकम् all these articles for coronation, पुरस्कृत्य kept in front, रामहेतोः for Rama, वनं प्रति to the forest, गमिष्यामि I shall go.

79_11.shloka: तत्रैवं तं नरव्याघ्रमभिषिच्य पुरस्कृतम्।आनेष्यामि तु वै रामं हव्यवाहमिवाध्वरात्।।2.79.11।
79_11.translation: After coronating Rama, the best of men, there itself, I will definitely bring him back, letting him go ahead of me, like the sacred fire carried from the place of sacrifice.
79_11.word_by_word: नरव्याघ्रम् tiger among men, तम् him, तत्रैव there itself, अभिषिच्य having crowned, पुरस्कृतम् going ahead of me, रामम् to Rama, अध्वरात् from the place of sacrifice, हव्यवाहमिव like the fire, आनेष्यामि तु वै will definitely bring back.

79_12.shloka: न सकामां करिष्यामि स्वामिमां मातृगन्धिनीम्।वने वत्स्याम्यहं दुर्गे रामो राजा भविष्यति।।2.79.12।।
79_12.translation: I shall never fulfil the wishes of that woman called my mother. I shall dwell in the inaccessible forest and Rama shall become king.
79_12.word_by_word: स्वाम् my own, मातृगन्धिनीम् called mother, इमाम् this, सकामाम् fulfil her desire, न करिष्यामिshall never do, अहम् I, दुर्गे in the inaccessible, वने in the forest, वत्स्यामि shall dwell, रामः Rama, राजा भविष्यति shall become king.

79_13.shloka: क्रियतां शिल्पिभिः पन्था स्समानि विषमाणि च।रक्षिणश्चानुसम्यान्तु पथि दुर्गविचारकाः।।2.79.13।।
79_13.translation: Let the road be aligned by artisans and uneven ground be levelled. The guards who judge the inaccessible terrains should follow them on their way.
79_13.word_by_word: शिल्पिभि: by the artisans, पन्थाः road, क्रियताम् let it be laid, विषमाणि uneven ground, समानि  be levelled, दुर्गविचारकाः judging the inaccessible terrains, रक्षिणश्च guards, पथि on the way, अनुसम्यान्तु be followed.

79_14.shloka: एवं सम्भाषमाणं तं रामहेतोर्नृपात्मजम्।प्रत्युवाच जनस्सर्व श्श्रीमद्वाक्यमनुत्तमम्।।2.79.14।।
79_14.translation: When prince Bharata was thus speaking in favour of Rama, all the people responded with these excellent, propitious words:
79_14.word_by_word: रामहेतोः on behalf of Rama, एवम् in this way, सम्भाषमाणम् speaking, तं नृपात्मजम् to the son of the king, Bharata, सर्वः all, जनः the people, श्रीमत् with auspiciousness, अनुत्तमम् excellent, वाक्यम् words, प्रत्युवाच replied.

79_15.shloka: एवं ते भाषमाणस्य पद्मा श्रीरुपतिष्ठतात्।यस्त्वं ज्येष्ठे नृपसुते पृथिवीं दातुमिच्छसि।।2.79.15।।
79_15.translation: May Lakshmi, goddess of prosperity, abide in you for having expressed your desire to bestow the kingdom upon the king's eldest son.
79_15.word_by_word: यः त्वम् such as you are, ज्येष्ठे in the eldest, नृप सुते in king's son, पृथिवीम् kingdom, दातुम् to bestow, इच्छसि are desiring, एवम् in this way, भाषमाणस्य talking, ते to you, श्रीः goddess of prosperity, पद्मा Lakshmi, उपतिष्ठताम् may grace you.

79_16.shloka: अनुत्तमं तद्वचनं नृपात्मजप्रभाषितं संश्रवणे निशम्य च।प्रहर्षजास्तं प्रति बाष्पबिन्दवो निपेतुरार्यानननेत्रसम्भवाः।।2.79.16।।
79_16.translation: With such graceful words spoken by the prince within their hearing, tears of joy filled the eyes of the noble people and fell drop by drop down their faces.
79_16.word_by_word: संश्रवणे within hearing range, नृपात्मजप्रभाषितम् spoken by the king's son, अनुत्तमम् graceful, तत् वचनम् that speech, निशम्य च having heard, तं प्रति to him, प्रहर्षजाः born of joy, आर्यानननेत्रसम्भवाः arising from the eyes and countenances of noble ones, बाष्पबिन्दवः  drops of tears, निपेतुः trickled down.

79_17.shloka: ऊचुस्ते वचनमिदं निशम्य हृष्टा स्सामात्या स्सपरिषदो वियातशोकाः।पन्थानं नरवर भक्तिमान् जनश्च व्यादिष्टस्तव वचनाच्च शिल्पिवर्गः।।2.79.17।
79_17.translation: All the ministers and members of the council, relieved of their distress, were delighted to hear these words and said O best among men, on your orders devoted people and groups of artisans have been instructed to lay the road.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे एकोनाशीतितमस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the seventyninth sarga in Ayodhyakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
79_17.word_by_word: इदम् this, वचनम् word, निशम्य having heard, हृष्टाः delighted, सामात्याः with ministers, सपरिषदः with council of members, ते they, वियातशोकाः relieved of their distress, इदं वचनम् these words, ऊचुः uttered, नरवर O best among men, भक्तिमान् devoted man, जनश्च people, शिल्पि वर्गः groups of artisans, तव your, वचनात् from orders, पन्थानम् to prepare the way, व्यादिष्टः have been instructed.

80_1.shloka: [ Arrangements made for the journey to the forest.]अथ भूमिप्रदेशज्ञास्सूत्रकर्मविशारदाः।स्वकर्माभिरताश्शूराः खनका यन्त्रकास्तथा।।2.80.1।।कर्मान्तिकाः स्थपतयः पुरुष यन्त्रकोविदाः।तथा वार्धकयश्चैव मार्गिणो वृक्षतक्षकाः।।2.80.2।।कूपकारास्सुधाकारार्वंशकर्मकृतस्तथा।समर्था ये च द्रष्टारः पुरतस्ते प्रतस्थिरे।।2.80.3।।
80_1.translation: Then surveyors, experts in measurment, energetic and zealous labourers, excavators, engineers, skilled workers, architects, craftsmen, carpenters, roadlevellers, woodcutters, welldiggers, whitewashers, basketmakers, competent supervisors were sent in advance.
80_1.word_by_word: अथ thereafter, भूमिप्रदेशज्ञाः land surveyors, सूत्रकर्मविशारदा: experts in measurement, स्वकर्माभिरताः zealous workers, शूराः energetic, खनकाः excavators, तथा also, यन्त्रकाः engineers, कर्मान्तिकाः skilled workers, स्थपतयः architects, यन्त्रकोविदाः expert mechanics, पुरुषाः men, तथा similarly, वार्धकयः carpenters, मार्गिण road workers, वृक्षतक्षकाः woodcutters, कूपकाराः welldrillers, सुधाकाराः whitewashers, तथा also, वंशकर्मकृतः bambooworkers (basketmakers), समर्थाः competent, ये those, द्रष्टारः supervisors, ते they, पुरतः in advance, प्रतस्थिरे set out.

80_2.shloka: अथ भूमिप्रदेशज्ञास्सूत्रकर्मविशारदाः।स्वकर्माभिरताश्शूराः खनका यन्त्रकास्तथा।।2.80.1।।कर्मान्तिकाः स्थपतयः पुरुष यन्त्रकोविदाः।तथा वार्धकयश्चैव मार्गिणो वृक्षतक्षकाः।।2.80.2।।कूपकारास्सुधाकारार्वंशकर्मकृतस्तथा।समर्था ये च द्रष्टारः पुरतस्ते प्रतस्थिरे।।2.80.3।।
80_2.translation: Then surveyors, experts in measurment, energetic and zealous labourers, excavators, engineers, skilled workers, architects, craftsmen, carpenters, roadlevellers, woodcutters, welldiggers, whitewashers, basketmakers, competent supervisors were sent in advance.
80_2.word_by_word: अथ thereafter, भूमिप्रदेशज्ञाः land surveyors, सूत्रकर्मविशारदा: experts in measurement, स्वकर्माभिरताः zealous workers, शूराः energetic, खनकाः excavators, तथा also, यन्त्रकाः engineers, कर्मान्तिकाः skilled workers, स्थपतयः architects, यन्त्रकोविदाः expert mechanics, पुरुषाः men, तथा similarly, वार्धकयः carpenters, मार्गिण road workers, वृक्षतक्षकाः woodcutters, कूपकाराः welldrillers, सुधाकाराः whitewashers, तथा also, वंशकर्मकृतः bambooworkers (basketmakers), समर्थाः competent, ये those, द्रष्टारः supervisors, ते they, पुरतः in advance, प्रतस्थिरे set out.

80_3.shloka: स तु हर्षात्तमुद्देशं जनौघो विपुलः प्रयान्।अशोभत महावेगस्समुद्र इव पर्वणि।।2.80.4।।
80_3.translation: Like a swollen ocean on a fullmoon day the multitude of people proceeded joyfully with great speed to the appointed place.
80_3.word_by_word: हर्षात् with joy, तम् उद्देशम् to the appointed region, प्रयान् proceeding, सः that, विपुलः  multitude, जनौघः people, पर्वणि on fullmoon day, महावेगः with great speed, समुद्रः इव  likean ocean, अशोभत shone.

80_4.shloka: ते स्ववारं समास्थाय वर्त्मकर्मणि कोविदाः।करणैर्विविधोपेतैः पुरस्तात्सम्प्रतस्थिरे।।2.80.5।।
80_4.translation: Those groups who were skilled in the construction of roads took up their places with every kind of tool and departed ahead of others.
80_4.word_by_word: वर्त्मकर्मणि in the construction of roads, कोविदाः skilled, ते those, विविधोपेतैः with different kinds of, करणैः tools, स्ववारम् their own group, समास्थाय taking up the place, पुरस्तात् ahead, सम्प्रतस्थिरे departed.

80_5.shloka: लतावल्ली श्च गुल्मांश्च स्थाणूनश्मन एव च।जनायांचक्रिरे मार्गं छिन्दन्तो विविधान्द्रुमान्।।2.80.6।।
80_5.translation: Clearing and cutting branches of various trees and creepers, shrubs, plants branchless trees and hewing boulders, the road was paved by the king's men.
80_5.word_by_word: लतावल्लीः च creepers, गुल्मांश्च shrubs, स्थाणून् branchless trees, अश्मन एव च boulders, विविधान् various, द्रुमान् trees, छिन्दन्त hewing off, मार्गम् way, जनायांचक्रिरे paved by the (king's) men.

80_6.translation: Some of them, planted saplings in places where there were none, while some others severed trees here and there with axes, hatchets and sickles.
80_6.word_by_word: केचित् some of them, अवृक्षेषु where there were no trees, देशेषु in places, वृक्षान् saplings, अरोपयन् planted, केचित् some, क्वचित् क्वचित् here and there, कुठारैः with axes, टङ्कैश्च with hatchets, दात्रैः च with sickles, छिन्दन् severing.

80_7.shloka: अपरे वीरणस्तम्भान्बलिनो बलवत्तराः।विधमन्ति स्म दुर्गाणि स्थलानि च ततस्ततः।।2.80.8।।
80_7.translation: Some other stronger men, plucked the strongrooted tufts of fragrant grass. Here and there they made impassable terrains even.
80_7.word_by_word: बलवत्तराः stronger men, अपरे some others, बलिनः strongrooted, वीरणस्तम्भान् tufts of fragrant grass, विधमन्ति स्म removed, ततस्ततः here and there, दुर्गाणि impassable terrains, स्थलानि were made even.

80_8.translation: Some filled wells and chasms with loose soil, while others made low level grounds plain and wide on all sides.
80_8.word_by_word: अपरे some others, कूपान् wells, आयतम् wide, श्वभ्रम् chasm, पांसुभिः with loose soil, अपूरयन् filled, ततः thereafter, केचित् some, निम्नभागान् low level grounds, समन्ततः on all sides, समान् evenly, चक्रुः made.

80_9.translation: People threw bridges at places that needed to be bridged. They pulverised stones that obstructed the path and split open big stones to drain out water.
80_9.word_by_word: तदा then, नराः people, बन्धनीयान् required to be bridged, तांस्तान् at such, देशान् places, बबन्धु: bridged, क्षोद्यान् required crushing, सञ्चुक्षुदुः pulverised, भेदनीयान् च required to be split open, बिभिदुः broke them.

80_10.translation: In a short time they constructed many water reservoirs of different shapes capable of holding large volumes of water like the sea.
80_10.word_by_word: अचिरेणकालेनैव in a short time, बहूदकान् having large volumes of water, बहुविधाकारान् of different shapes, सागरप्रतिमान् like the sea, बहून् many, परिवाहान् water courses, चक्रुः constructed.

80_11.translation: In arid places, various good drinkingwaterwells surrounded by dykes were dug.
80_11.word_by_word: निर्जलेषु where there was no water, देशेषु in places, उत्तमान् best, बहुविधान् various, वेदिकापरिमण्डितान् surrounded by circular dykes, उदपानान् drinking water wells, खानयामासुः  were dug.

80_12.shloka: ससुधाकुट्टिमतलः प्रपुष्पितमहीरुहः।मत्तोद्घुष्ट द्विजगणः पताकाभिरलङ्कृतः।।2.80.13।।चन्दनोदकसंसिक्तो नानाकुसुमभूषितः।बह्वशोभत सेनायाः पन्था स्सुरपथोपमः।।2.80.14।।
80_12.translation: The highway for the army was paved smooth, with its surface decorated with mosaic.  It was lined with blossoming trees with flocks of birds intoxicated with singing. It was decked with banners and sprinkled with sandal water and a strewn with flowers of every kind. Like the path of gods, the highway shone with brilliance.
80_12.word_by_word: ससुधाकुट्टिमतलः surface decorated with mosaic, प्रपुष्पितमहीरुहः avenue lined with blossoming trees, मत्तोद्घुष्ट द्विजगणः with flocks of birds intoxicated with singing, पताकाभिः with banners, अलङ्कृतः decorated, चन्दनोदकसंसिक्तः sprinkled with sandal water, नानाकुसुमभूषितः embellished with various kinds of flowers, सेनायाः army's सुरपथोपमः like the path of the gods, (सः) पन्थाः that highway, बहु brilliantly, अशोभत shone.

80_13.shloka: आज्ञाप्याथ यथाऽज्ञप्ति युक्तास्तेऽधिकृता नराः।रमणीयेषु देशेषु बहुस्वादुफलेषु च।।2.80.15।।यो निवेशस्त्वभिप्रेतो भरतस्य महात्मनः।भूयस्तं शोभयामासुर्भूषाभिर्भूषणोपमम्।।2.80.16।।
80_13.translation: Those authorised ordered the artisans to perform their respective tasks. Thereafter, they selected lovely tracts of land filled with trees bearing varieties of sweet fruits as restingplace for great Bharata and decorated them so splendidly, that they looked like ornaments themseleves.
80_13.word_by_word: अधिकृता authorised, ते नराः those persons, यथाज्ञप्ति in accordance with the orders (of Bharata), युक्ताः performing their work, आज्ञप्य issued orders (to the artisans), अथ thereafter, बहुस्वादुफलेषु with varieties of sweet fruits, रमणीयेषु lovely, देशेषु places, महात्मनः  of great, भरतस्य Bharata, यः निवेशः restingplace, अभिप्रेतः selected, तम् that place, भूषाभिः with ornaments, भूषणोपमम् like ornaments , भूयः well, शोभयामासुः shone.

80_14.shloka: नक्षत्रेषु प्रशस्तेषु मुहूर्तेषु च तद्विदः।निवेशान् स्थापयामासुर्भरतस्य महात्मनः।।2.80.17।।
80_14.translation: Men wellversed in the study of planetary positions relating to auspicious constellations and auspicious times arranged different restingplaces at different timesduring the sojourn of great Bharata.
80_14.word_by_word: तद्विदः men well versed in the study of planetary positions relating to auspicious constellations and auspicious time (astrologers), प्रशस्तेषु at auspicious, नक्षत्रेषु in the constellation, मुहूर्तेषु at auspicious time, महात्मनः highsouled, भरतस्य for Bharata, निवेशान् restplace, स्थापयामासुः  established.

80_15.translation: They heaped sand and dug moats around the restingplace. It was adorned with wellbuilt highways and broad thoroughfares, lined with mansions surrounded by walls as high as mount Indrakeela. The peaks of those tall residences decorated with flags which looked as if spreading into the sky. (Thus the restingplace) shone like the abode of Indra.
80_15.word_by_word: तत्र there, बहुपांसुचयाश्चपि heaps of sand, परिखापरिवारिताः encircled by moats, इन्द्रकीलप्रतिमाः comparable to mount Indrakeela, प्रतोलीवरशोभिताः adorned with broad highways, प्रासादमालावितताः lined with mansions, सौधप्राकारसंवृताः surrounded by walls, पताकाशोभिताः decorated with flags, सुनिर्मित महापथाः with wellbuilt, broad thoroughfares, ते निवेशाः those residences, आकाशे in the sky, विसर्पद्भिरिव like one spreading, समुच्छ्रितैः tall, विटङ्काग्रविमानकैः with the peaks of mansions, शक्रपुरोपमाः like the abode of Indra, बभुः shone.

80_16.translation: The reached Ganga with its cool and limpid waters abounding in large fishes, its bank lined with groves of various trees.
80_16.word_by_word: विविधद्रुमकाननाम् with groves of various trees, शीतलामलपानीयाम् with cool and limpid  waters, महामीनसमाकुलाम् abounding in large fishes, जाह्नवीम् the river Ganga, समासाद्य having reached.

80_17.shloka: सचन्द्रतारागणमण्डितं यथा नभः क्षपायाममलं विराजते।नरेन्द्रमार्गस्स तथा व्यराजत क्रमेण रम्यः शुभशिल्पिनिर्मितः।।2.80.22।।
80_17.translation: The lovely royal road constructed in an orderly fashion by eminent craftsmen looked splendid like the clear sky decorated with by the Moon and clusters of stars.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे अशीतितमस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the eightieth sarga in Ayodhyakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
80_17.word_by_word: सचन्द्रतारागणमण्डितम् decorated with the Moon and stars, अमलम् clear, नभः sky, क्षपायाम् in the night, याथा how, विराजते shines, क्रमेण orderly manner, शुभशिल्पिनिर्मितः constructed by eminent craftsmen, रम्यः lovely, सः that, नरेन्द्रमार्गः royal road, तथा that way, व्यराजत shone.

81_1.shloka: [ Assembly of Vasistha, ministers, commanders of army and people of Ayodhya -- Bharata is invited to the assembly with the usual welcoming music etc.]ततो नान्दीमुखीं रात्रिं भरतं सूतमागधाः।तुष्टुवुर्वाग्विशेषज्ञास्स्तवैर्मङ्गलसंहितैः।।2.81.1।।
81_1.translation: Thereafter bards and panegyrists adept in conversation with an auspicious startpleased Bharata with eulogy in the last part of the night.
81_1.word_by_word: ततः thereafter, वाग्विशेषज्ञाः experts in conversation, सूतमागधाः bards and panegyrists, नान्दीमुखीम् with an auspicious start, रात्रिम् the night, मङ्गलसंहितैः filled with an auspicious notes, स्तवैः praises, भरतम् Bharata, तुष्टुवुः pleased.

81_2.translation: The drums of the night watch were beaten by golden sticks. Conches in hundreds were blown and sounds of various modulations were created.
81_2.word_by_word: सुवर्णकोणाभिहतः beaten by golden sticks, यामदुन्दुभिः the drums of the nightwatch (to indicate watchers of the night), प्राणदत् was struck, शङ्खांश्च conches, उच्चावचस्वरान् of various modulations, नादांश्च sounds, शतशः in hundreds, दध्मुः people blew.

81_3.translation: The shrill trempets which seemed to fill the heavens caused much more distress to the already griefstricken Bharata.
81_3.word_by_word: सुमहान् shrill, सः that, तूर्यघोषः sound of trumpets, दिवम् the heaven, आपूरयन्निव as if filling, शोकसंतप्तम् griefstricken, भरतम् Bharata, भूयः still more, शोकैः with sorrows, अरन्ध्रयत् filled.

81_4.shloka: ततः प्रबुद्धो भरतस्तं घोषं सन्निवर्त्य च।नाहं राजेति चाप्युक्त्वा शत्रुघ्नमिदमब्रवीत्।।2.81.4।।
81_4.translation: Then Bharata waking up, exclaimed, I am not the king, ordered the pipers to stop and said to Satrughna:
81_4.word_by_word: ततः then, प्रबुद्ध: awakened, भरतः Bharata, अहम् I, राजा king, न not, इति thus, उक्त्वा having said, तम् घोषम् that sound, सन्निवर्त्य च having stopped, शत्रुघ्नम् to Satrughna, इदम् these words, अब्रवीत् said.

81_5.shloka: पश्य शत्रुघ्न कैकेय्या लोकस्यापकृतं महत्।विसृज्य मयि दुःखानि राजा दशरथो गतः।।2.81.5।।
81_5.translation: O Satrughna see what great harm has been done to these people at the instance of Kaikeyi. King Dasaratha has gone, leaving me to suffer.
