81_5.word_by_word: शत्रुघ्न O Satrughna, पश्य see, कैकेय्या by Kaikeyi, लोकस्य to the people, महत् great, अपकृतम् harm has been done, राजा king, दशरथः Dasaratha, दुःखानि all sufferings, मयि in me, विसृज्य having left, गतः went.

81_6.shloka: तस्यैषा धर्मराजस्य धर्ममूला महात्मनः।परिभ्रमति राज्य श्रीर्नौरिवाकर्णिका जले।।2.81.6।।
81_6.translation: This kingdom, rooted in the righteousness of that noble king, is now whirling like aboat in a whirlpool without a helmsman.
81_6.word_by_word: धर्मराजस्य of righteous king, तस्य his, महात्मनः noble one's, धर्ममूला rooted in  righteousness, एषा such, राज्यश्रीः the goddess of kingdom, जले in water, आकर्णिका without helmsman, नौः इव like a boat, परिभ्रमति is revolving.

81_7.shloka: यो हि न स्सुमहान्नाथस्सोऽपि प्रव्राजितो वनम्।अनया धर्ममुत्सृज्य मात्रा मे राघवस्स्वयम्।।2.81.7।।
81_7.translation: Even Rama, a great protector for all of us, has been banished to the forest by my mother bereft of virtuous conduct.
81_7.word_by_word: यः whoever, नः for us, सुमहान् great, नाथः protector, सः (राघवः) अपि that Rama also, अनया this, मे मात्रा by my mother, धर्मम् virtuous conduct, उत्सृज्य having abandoned, स्वयम् herself, वनम् forest, प्रव्राजितः has been banished.

81_8.shloka: इत्येवं भरतं प्रेक्ष्य विलपन्तं विचेतनम्।कृपणं रुरुदुस्सर्वास्सस्वरं योषित स्तदा।। 2.81.8।।
81_8.translation: Thus lamenting, Bharata fainted. Seeing him (in this state) all the women (of the inner apartment) at once cried aloud piteously.
81_8.word_by_word: तदा then, इत्येवम् in this way, विलपन्तम् lamenting, विचेतनम् lying unconscious, भरतम् Bharata, प्रेक्ष्य having seen, सर्वाः all, योषितः women, सस्वरम् in one voice, कृपणम् piteously, रुरुदुः cried loudly.

81_9.shloka: तथा तस्मिन्विलपति वसिष्ठो राजधर्मवित्।सभामिक्ष्वाकुनाथस्य प्रविवेश महायशाः।।2.81.9।।
81_9.translation: While Bharata was weeping, illustrious Vasistha, conversant with royal traditions, entered the assembly hall of the lord of the Iksvakus (king Dasaratha).
81_9.word_by_word: तस्मिन् that Bharata, तथा in that way, विलपति lamenting, राजधर्मवित् conversant with royal traditions, महायशाः illustrious man, वसिष्ठः Vasistha, इक्ष्वाकुनाथस्य of the lord of Iksvakus (king Dasaratha's), सभाम् assembly hall, प्रविवेश entered.

81_10.shloka: शातकुम्भमयीं रम्यां मणिरत्नसमाकुलाम्।सुधर्मामिव धर्मात्मा सगणः प्रत्यपद्यत।।2.81.10।।
81_10.translation: Righteous Vasistha along with his disciples reached the lovely golden assembly hall  inlaid with gems and precious stones, which resembled Sudharma, (the assembly hall of Indra).
81_10.word_by_word: धर्मात्मा righteous, सगणः along with his disciples, शातकुम्भमयीम् with gold finishing, रम्याम् lovely, मणिरत्नसमाकुलाम् inlaid with gems and precious stones, सुधर्मामिव like Sudharma, (the assembly hall of Indra), प्रत्यपद्यत reached.

81_11.shloka: स काञ्चनमयं पीठं सुखास्तरणसंवृतम्।अध्यास्त सर्ववेदज्ञो दूताननुशशास च।।2.81.11।।
81_11.translation: Vasistha, wellversed in all the Vedas, sat on a golden seat with a comfortable cover and ordered the messengers:
81_11.word_by_word: सर्ववेदज्ञः wellversed in all the Vedas, सः Vasistha, सुखास्तरणसंवृतम् covered with comfortable spread, काञ्चनमयम् made of gold, पीठम् seat, अध्यास्त sat, दूतान् messengers, अनुशशास च ordered too.

81_12.translation: Fetch quietly brahmins, kshatriyas, vaisyas, ministers and army commanders at once. A matter of great urgency awaits us.
81_12.word_by_word: अव्यग्राः with a steady mind, ब्राह्मणान् brahmins, क्षत्रियान् kshatriyas, वैश्यान् Vaisyas, अमात्यान् ministers, गणवल्लभान् army commanders, क्षिप्रम् at once, आनयत fetch, नः for us,  आत्ययिकम् of great urgency, कृत्यं हि work to be done.

81_13.shloka: सराजभृत्यं शत्रुघ्नं भरतं च यशस्विनम्।युधाजितं सुमन्त्रं च ये च तत्र हिता जनाः।।2.81.13।।
81_13.translation: Bring all the royal attendants, Satrughna, the illustrious Bharata, Yudhajit, Sumantra and all those wellwishers of the king.
81_13.word_by_word: सराजभृत्यम् along with royal attendants, शत्रुघ्नम् Satrughna, यशस्विनम् the illustious one, भरतं च Bharata too, युधाजितम् Yudhajit, सुमन्त्रं च Sumantra also, तत्र there, हिताः well wishers of the king, ये जनाः all those people.

81_14.translation: As they (invitees) began arriving on chariots, horses and elephants, there arose a great tumult.
81_14.word_by_word: ततः then, रथैः with chariots, अश्वैः on horses, गजैश्चापि on elephants, उपगच्छताम् of those arriving, जनानाम् people's, सुमहान् great, हलहला शब्दः tumultuous sound, समपद्यत arose.

81_15.shloka: ततो भरतमायान्तं शतक्रतुमिवामराः।प्रत्यनन्दन्प्रकृतयो यथा दशरथं तथा।।2.81.15।।
81_15.translation: Then as Bharata apprroached,  ministers and subjects greeted him as they used to greet Dasaratha, just as gods greet Indra, the performer of a hundred sacrifices.
81_15.word_by_word: ततः then, आयान्तम् approaching, भरतम् Bharata, प्रकृतयः ministers and other subjects, दशरथम् Dasaratha, यथा like, तथा like, अमराः gods, शतक्रतुमिव like Indra, the performer of hundred sacrifices, प्रत्यनन्दन् greeted.

81_16.shloka: ह्रद इव तिमिनागसंवृतः स्तिमितजलो मणिशङ्खशर्करः।दशरथसुतशोभिता सभा सदशरथेव बभौ यथा पुरा।।2.81.16।।
81_16.translation: The assembly hall looked splendid like a lake of tranquil waters with gems, shells  pebbles, grains of sand and teeming with whales and serpents in the presence of the son of king Dasaratha. It appeared as though Dasaratha himself was present.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे एकाशीतितमस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the eightyfirst sarga in Ayodhyakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
81_16.word_by_word: दशरथसुतशोभिता graced by the son of Dasaratha, सभा assembly hall, सदशरथा इव as if Dasaratha was present, तिमिनाग संवृतः filled with whales and serpents, मणिसङ्खशर्करः with gems, shells, pebbles and grains of sand, स्तिमितजलः with placid water, ह्रद इव like a lake, यथापुरा as of yore, बभौ shone.

82_1.shloka: [Bharata addresses the assembly -- declines Vasistha's plea to accept the throne -- gets ready to depart for the forest with the citizens of Ayodhya.]तामार्यगणसम्पूर्णां भरतः प्रग्रहां सभाम्।ददर्श बुद्धिसम्पन्नः पूर्णचन्द्रो निशामिव।।2.82.1।।
82_1.translation: Sagacious Bharata beheld that assembly hall filled with honourable members, like the fullmoon beholds the night stretching forth (with stars).
82_1.word_by_word: बुद्धिसम्पन्नः sagacious, भरतः Bharata, आर्यगणसम्पूर्णाम् full of honourable members, तां सभाम् that assembly hall, पूर्णचन्द्रः fullmoon, प्रग्रहाम् stretching forth, निशामिव like night, ददर्श beheld.

82_2.shloka: आसनानि यथान्यायमार्याणां विशतां तदा।वस्त्राङ्गरागप्रभया द्योतिता सा सभोत्तमा।।2.82.2।।
82_2.translation: When the seats were occupied by the honourable members according to their rank, that august assembly looked splendid with the brilliance of their apparels and fragrance of unguents.
82_2.word_by_word: तदा then, उत्तमा august, सा सभा that assembly, यथान्यायम् according to their rank,  आसनानि seats, विशताम् entered, आर्याणाम् honourable members', वस्त्राङ्गरागप्रभया with the brilliance of their apparels and fragrance of unguents, द्योतिता looked splendid.

82_3.shloka: सा विद्वज्जनसम्पूर्णा सभा सुरुचिरा तदा।अदृश्यत घनापाये पूर्णचन्द्रेव शर्वरी।।2.82.3।।
82_3.translation: The most splendid assembly filled with learned people looked brilliant like the night with the autumnal fullmoon.
82_3.word_by_word: तदा then, विद्वज्जनसम्पूर्णा filled with learned people, सुरुचिरा  most splendid, सा सभा that assembly, घनापाये after the departure of rains, पूर्णचन्द्रा with fullmoon, शर्वरीव like thenight, अदृश्यत looked.

82_4.shloka: राज्ञस्तु प्रकृती स्सर्वा स्समग्राः प्रेक्ष्य धर्मवित्।इदं पुरोहितो वाक्यं भरतं मृदु चाब्रवीत्।।2.82.4।।
82_4.translation: The chief priest Vasistha, knower of righteousness, looked at all the ministers present and addressed Bharata in a gentle voice.
82_4.word_by_word: धर्मवित् knower of righteousness, पुरोहितः the chief priest, समग्राः complete, सर्वाः all, राज्ञः king's, प्रकृतीः ministers, प्रेक्ष्य having seen, भरतम् Bharata, मृदु in a gentle way, इदम् these, वाक्यम् words, अब्रवीत् spoke.

82_5.shloka: तात राजा दशरथ स्स्वर्गतो धर्ममाचरन्।धनधान्यवतीं स्फीतां प्रदाय पृथिवीं तव।।2.82.5।।
82_5.translation: O dear child following the righteous path king Dasaratha conferred on you this vast kingdom abounding in wealth and grains before attaining heaven.
82_5.word_by_word: तात dear child, राजा king, दशरथः Dasaratha, धर्मम् righteousness, आचरन् while following, धनधान्यवतीम् abounding in wealth and grains, स्फीताम् vast, पृथिवीम् kingdom, तव to you, प्रदाय having given, स्वर्गतः attained heaven.

82_6.translation: Abiding in truth, remembering the righteous ways of virtuous men just as the rising Moon does not leave its beams, Rama too did not move away from his father's command.
82_6.word_by_word: तथा and, सत्यधृतिः abiding in truth, रामः Rama, सताम् of the virtuous, धर्मम् righteousness, अनुस्मरन् remembering, उदितः rising, शशी moon, ज्योत्स्नामिव like moon light, पितुः father's, आदेशम् command, नाजहात् did not abandon.

82_7.shloka: पित्रा भ्रात्रा च ते दत्तं राज्यं निहतकण्टकम्।तद्भुङ्क्ष्व मुदितामात्यः क्षिप्रमेवाभिषेचय।।2.82.7।।
82_7.translation: The kingdom free from obstacles has been passed on to you by your father and brother. Get yourself coronated quickly and enjoy it along with your cheerful ministers.
82_7.word_by_word: पित्रा by your father, भ्रात्रा च by your brother also, निहतकण्टकम् all thorns removed, राज्यम् kingdom, ते to you, दत्तम् has been given, मुदितामात्यः with ministers pleased, तत् that king dom, भुङ्क्ष्व enjoy, क्षिप्रमेव quickly, अभिषेचय be consecrated.

82_8.translation: Let kings from the north, the west, the south, the bordering kingdoms, and the seatraders offer you crores of gems as gifts.
82_8.word_by_word: उदीच्याः kings from the north, प्रतीच्या श्च from the west, दाक्षिणात्याश्च from the south, केवलाः solely, अपरान्ताः kings of the bordering kingdoms, सामुद्राः seatraders, ते they, कोट्या crores in number, रत्नानि gems, अभिहरन्तु may offer to you as gift.

82_9.shloka: तच्छ्रुत्वा भरतो वाक्यं शोकेनाभिपरिप्लुतः।जगाम मनसा रामं धर्मज्ञो धर्मकाङ्क्षया।।2.82.9।।
82_9.translation: On hearing those words, Bharata who knew his duty was overwhelmed with distressand, resolved to abide by righteousness, reached Rama through his mind (thought of Rama).
82_9.word_by_word: धर्मज्ञः knower of duty, भरतः Bharata, तत् that, वाक्यम् words, श्रुत्वा having heard, शोकेन with distress, अभिपरिप्लुतः overwhelmed, धर्मकाङ्क्षया wishing to abide by  righteousness, रामम् Rama, मनसा with mind, जगाम reached.

82_10.shloka: सबाष्पकलया वाचा कलहंसस्वरो युवा।विललाप सभामध्ये जगर्हे च पुरोहितम्।।2.82.10।।
82_10.translation: Young Bharata with the melodious voice of a swan, choked with tears, lamenting in the assembly, reproached the family priest Vasistha, saying:
82_10.word_by_word: कलहंसस्वरः voice resembling the melodious cackle of a swan, युवा the young man, सबाष्पकलया voice choked with sobs, वाचा words, सभामध्ये in the midst of the assembly, विललाप lamented, पुरोहितम् to the family priest Vasistha, जगर्हे च reproached.

82_11.shloka: चरितब्रह्मचर्यस्य विद्यास्नातस्य धीमतः।धर्मे प्रयतमानस्य को राज्यं मद्विधो हरेत्।।2.82.11।।
82_11.translation: Would any man seize this kingdom which rightfully belongs to sagacious Rama, who practises brahmacharya, who is wellversed in all branches of learning and who endeavours to protect righteousness?
82_11.word_by_word: चरितब्रह्मचर्यस्य one who practised brahmacharaya, विद्यास्नातस्य who is wellversed in all branches of learning, धीमतः of the sagacious, धर्मे in righteousness, प्रयतमानस्य endeavouring, राज्यम् kingdom, मद्विधः a man like me, कः who, हरेत् will seize?

82_12.shloka: कथं दशरथाज्जातो भवेद्राज्यापहारकः।राज्यं चाहं च रामस्य धर्मं वक्तुमिहार्हसि।।2.82.12।।
82_12.translation: How can any usurper of the kingdom be born of Dasaratha? Or, how would anyprogeny of Dasaratha become the usurper of the kingdom? I and the kingdom, both belong to Rama. You should tell the truth about this.
82_12.word_by_word: दशरथात् from Dasaratha, जातः born, राज्यापहारकः usurper of the kingdom, कथम् भवेत् how will he become?, राज्यं च kingdom, अहं च I also, रामस्य belong to Rama, इह in this matter, धर्मम् truth, वक्तुम् to tell, अर्हसि it behoves you.

82_13.shloka: ज्येष्ठ श्श्रेष्ठश्च धर्मात्मा दिलीपनहुषोपमः।लब्धुमर्हति काकुत्स्थो राज्यं दशरथो यथा।।2.82.13।।
82_13.translation: The eldest, eminent and righteous Rama, the scion of the Kakutstha dynasty, who is comparable to Dilipa and Nahusha deserves to inherit this kingdom just as Dasaratha did.
82_13.word_by_word: ज्येष्ठः eldest, श्रेष्ठः च and also eminent, धर्मात्मा righteous one, दिलीपनहुषोपमः comparable to Dilipa and Nahusha, काकुत्स्थ Rama of Kakutstha dynasty, दशरथो यथा like Dasaratha, राज्यम् kingdom, लब्धुम् to inherit, अर्हति deserves.

82_14.shloka: अनार्यजुष्टमस्वर्ग्यं कुर्यां पापमहं यदि।इक्ष्वाकूणामहं लोके भवेयं कुलपांसनः।।2.82.14।।
82_14.translation: If I commit this evil act followed by wretched people which would not lead any one to  heaven, I shall only be bringing disgrace to the kings of the Ikshvaku dynasty.
82_14.word_by_word: अहम् I, अनार्यजुष्टम् followed by wretched ones, अस्वर्ग्यम् not leading to heaven, पापम् sin, कुर्यां यदि if I do, लोके in this world, इक्ष्वाकूणाम् to the Ikshvaku kings, कुलपांसनः one who is a disgrace to the family, भवेयम् I shall become.

82_15.shloka: यद्धि मात्रा कृतं पापं नाहं तदपि रोचये।इहस्थो वनदुर्गस्थं नमस्यामि कृताञ्जलिः।।2.82.15।।
82_15.translation: I will never accept the evil deed committed by my mother. From here itself I shall payobeisance with folded palms to my brother who dwells in the impenetrable forest.
82_15.word_by_word: मात्रा by my mother, यत् which, पापम् sin, कृतम् was committed, तत् अपि that one also, अहम् I, न रोचये हि do not accept, इहस्थः from here, वनदुर्गस्थम् one staying in impenetrable forest, कृताञ्जलिः with folded palms, नमस्यामि pay obeisance.

82_16.shloka: राममेवानुगच्छामि राजा स द्विपदां वरः।त्रयाणामपि लोकानां राज्यमर्हति राघवः।।2.82.16।।
82_16.translation: I shall follow Rama the best among men. He alone and no one else deserves to rule over the kingdom of the three worlds.
82_16.word_by_word: राममेव Rama alone, अनुगच्छामि I will follow, द्विपदां वरः best among men, सः he alone, राजा is the king, राघवः Rama, त्रयाणां लोकानाम् of the three worlds', राज्यमपि kingdom, अर्हति deserves.

82_17.shloka: तद्वाक्यं धर्मसंयुक्तं श्रुत्वा सर्वे सभासदः।हर्षान्मुमुचुरश्रूणि रामे निहितचेतसः।।2.82.17।।
82_17.translation: Hearing the words of Bharata full of righteousness, all the men assembled there   shed tears of joy, thinking of Rama.
82_17.word_by_word: सर्वे all, सभासदः members of the assembly, धर्मसंयुक्तम् bound by righteousness, तद्वाक्यम् those words, श्रुत्वा having heard, रामे on Rama, निहितचेतसः fixing their thoughts, हर्षात् out of joy, अश्रूणि tears, मुमुचुः shed.

82_18.shloka: यदि त्वार्यं न शक्ष्यामि विनिवर्तयितुं वनात्।वने तत्रैव वत्स्यामि यथाऽर्यो लक्ष्मणस्तथा।।2.82.18।।
82_18.translation: If I am not able to bring back my noble brother (Rama) from the forest, I shall also dwell there like my noble brother Lakshmana.
82_18.word_by_word: आर्यम् my noble brother, वनात् from the forest, विनिवर्तयितुम् to bring back, न शक्ष्यामि यदि if I am not able, आर्यः noble brother, लक्ष्मणः Lakshmana, यथा as, तथा so, तत्र there, वने एव in the forest itself, वत्स्यामि I shall dwell.

82_19.shloka: सर्वोपायं तु वर्तिष्ये विनिवर्तयितुं बलात्।समक्षमार्यमिश्राणां साधूनां गुणवर्तिनाम्।।2.82.19।।
82_19.translation: I shall employ all possible means to bring him back and join you who are respectable, virtuous and pious.
82_19.word_by_word: गुणवर्तिनाम् of the virtuous, साधूनाम् of the pious, आर्यमिश्राणाम् noble ones, समक्षम् in the  presence, बलात् with all force, विनिवर्तयितुम् to bring back, सर्वोपायम् by all means, वर्तिष्ये I shall attempt.

82_20.shloka: विष्टिकर्मान्तिका स्सर्वे मार्गशोधकरक्षकाः।प्रस्थापिता मया पूर्वं यत्रापि मम रोचते।।2.82.20।।
82_20.translation: I have already despatched the explorers and protectors of roads who work for wages and without wages as well. It also pleases me to undertake this journey.
82_20.word_by_word: मार्गशोधकरक्षकाः explorers and protectors of the paths, सर्वे all, विष्टिकर्मान्तिकाः who work for wages and no wages, मया by me, पूर्वम् previously, प्रस्थापिताः have been despatched, मम for me, यात्रापि this journey, रोचते pleases.

82_21.shloka: एवमुक्त्वा तु धर्मात्मा भरतो भ्रातृवत्सलः।समीपस्थमुवाचेदं सुमन्त्रं मन्त्रकोविदम्।।2.82.21।।
82_21.translation: Righteous Bharata who was full of devotion towards his brother having uttered thus, addressed  the skilful counsellor Sumantra standing nearby:
82_21.word_by_word: धर्मात्मा righteous one, भ्रातृवत्सलः a devoted brother, भरतः Bharata, एवम् in this way, उक्त्वा तु having uttered, समीपस्थम् standing nearby, मन्त्रकोविदम् skilled  in counselling, सुमन्त्रम् to Sumantra, इदम् these words, उवाच said.

82_22.shloka: तूर्णमुत्थाय गच्छ त्वं सुमन्त्र मम शासनात्।यात्रामाज्ञापय क्षिप्रं बलं चैव समानय।।2.82.22।।
82_22.translation: O Sumantra quickly rise and go. On my authority, order the expedition and let the army be marshalled at once.
82_22.word_by_word: सुमन्त्र Sumantra, मम my, शासनात् on command, तूर्णम् quickly, उत्थाय after rising, गच्छ त्वं go, क्षिप्रम् speedily, यात्राम् expedition, आज्ञापय order, बलं चैव army also, समानय bring.

82_23.translation: On hearing the words of the magnanimous Bharata, Sumantra was delighted and as  instructed, ordered everything as if he was anxious to do it himself.
82_23.word_by_word: महात्मना magnanimous, भरतेन by Bharata, एवम् in that way, उक्तः having been instructed, सुमन्त्रः Sumantra, हृष्टः in delight, तत् then, सर्वम् entirely, यथासन्दिष्टम् as has been commanded, इष्टवत् as if he longed, आदिशत् ordered.

82_24.shloka: ताः प्रहृष्टाः प्रकृतयो बलाध्यक्षा बलस्य च।श्रुत्वा यात्रां समाज्ञप्तां राघवस्य निवर्तने।।2.82.24।।
82_24.translation: Having come to know that orders were issued to send the army on an expedition to bring back Rama, the subjects and the army chiefs were delighted.
82_24.word_by_word: राघवस्य Rama's, निवर्तने return, समाज्ञप्ताम् ordered, बलस्य च army's, यात्राम् the expedition, श्रुत्वा having heard, ताः those, प्रकृतयः subjects, बलाध्यक्षाः chiefs of army, प्रहृष्टाः were delighted.

82_25.shloka: ततो योधाङ्गना स्सर्वा भर्त्रून्सर्वान्गृहेगृहे।यात्रागमनमाज्ञाय त्वरयन्ति स्म हर्षिताः।।2.82.25।।
82_25.translation: Then, the wives of the soldiers having come to know of the expedition were all delighted and in every household hastened up their husbands.
82_25.word_by_word: ततः thereafter, गृहेगृहे in every house, सर्वाः all, योधाङ्गनाः wives of soldiers, यात्रागमनम् for expedition, आज्ञाय having come to know, हर्षिताः gladly, सर्वान् all, भर्त्रून् their husbands, त्वरयन्ति स्म hastened   them up.

82_26.shloka: ते हयैर्गोरथैश्शीघ्रैस्स्यन्दनैश्च महाजवैःसह योधैर्बलाध्यक्षा बलं सर्वमचोदयन्।।2.82.26।।
82_26.translation: Those chiefs of the army urged the soldiers, horses, fastmoving bullockcarts and swift chariots (to move on).
82_26.word_by_word: ते those, बलाध्यक्षाः chiefs of army, हयैः horses, शीघ्रैः fastmoving, गोरथैः bullock carts, महाजवैः of swift, स्यन्दनैश्च by chariots, योधैश्च सह with soldiers, सर्वम् all, बलम् army, अचोदयन् urged.

82_27.shloka: सज्जं तु तद्बलं दृष्ट्वा भरतो गुरुसन्निधौ।रथं मे त्वरयस्वेति सुमन्त्रं पार्श्वतोऽब्रवीत्।।2.82.27।।
82_27.translation: When Bharata saw that the army was ready, he instructed Sumantra who was standing by the side of the preceptor to quickly prepare his chariot.
82_27.word_by_word: भरतः Bharata, सज्जम् ready, तत् बलम् that army, दृष्ट्वा having seen, गुरुसन्निधौ in the presence of  the preceptor (Vasistha), पार्श्वतः on his side, सुमन्त्रम् to Sumantra, मे my, रथम् chariot, त्वरयस्व quickly prepare, इति like this, अब्रवीत् said.

82_28.shloka: भरतस्य तु तस्याज्ञां प्रतिगृह्य च हर्षितः।रथं गृहीत्वा प्रययौ युक्तं परमवाजिभिः।।2.82.28।।
82_28.translation: He (Sumantra) received the command of Bharata in great delight and set out with a chariot harnessed with excellent horses.
82_28.word_by_word: तस्य भरतस्य that Bharata's, आज्ञाम् command, प्रतिगृह्य having received, हर्षितः delighted, परमवाजिभिः with excellent horses, युक्तम् harnessed, रथम् chariot, गृहीत्वा grasping, प्रययौwent.

82_29.shloka: स राघव स्सत्यधृतिः प्रतापवान् ब्रुवन् सुयुक्तं दृढसत्यविक्रमः।गुरुं महारण्यगतं यशस्विनं प्रसादयिष्यन्भरतोऽब्रवीत्तदा।।2.82.29।।
82_29.translation: Bharata, a descendant of the Raghu race, firm in truth, one whose valour comes out of unswerving truth, speaking judiciously said this to propitiate his esteemed brother who was in the dense forest:
82_29.word_by_word: तदा then, राघवः Bharata, सत्यधृतिः firm in truth, प्रतापवान् valiant, दृढसत्यविक्रमः whose valour comes out of unshakable truth, सुयुक्तम् judiciously, ब्रुवन् speaking, भरतः Bharata, महारण्यगतम् gone to the great forest, यशस्विनम् illustrious, गुरुम् esteemed brother, प्रसादयिष्यन् to propitiate, अब्रवीत् said.

82_30.shloka: तूर्णं समुत्थाय सुमन्त्र गच्छ बलस्य योगाय बलप्रधानान्।आनेतुमिच्छामि हि तं वनस्थं प्रसाद्य रामं जगतो हिताय।।2.82.30।।
82_30.translation: O Sumantra, arise, go at once to the leaders of the army and ask them to assemble the troops. I shall propifiate Rama who is in the deep forest and bring him back for the welfare of the world.
82_30.word_by_word: सुमन्त्र Sumantra, समुत्थाय arise, बलस्य the army's, योगाय to assemble, बलप्रधानान् to  leaders of the army, तूर्णम् quickly, गच्छ go, वनस्थम् who is in the forest, तम् रामम् that Rama, प्रसाद्य having appeased, जगतः world's, हिताय welfare, आनेतुम् to bring, इच्छामि हि am wishing.

82_31.shloka: ससूतपुत्रो भरतेन सम्यगाज्ञापितस्सम्परिपूर्णकामः।शशास सर्वान्प्रकृतिप्रधानान्बलस्य मुख्यांश्च सुहृज्जनं च।।2.82.31।।
82_31.translation: The charioteer categorically commanded by Bharata, his desire fulfilled, communicated the royal mandate to all important subjects, chiefs of army and friends.
82_31.word_by_word: भरतेन by Bharata, सम्यक् distinctly, आज्ञापितः having been ordered, सम्परिपूर्णकामः with his desire fulfilled, सः that, सूतपुत्रः charioteer, सर्वान् all, प्रकृतिप्रधानान् to important subjects, बलस्य army's, मुख्यांश्च chiefs, सुहृज्जनं च to friends, शशास ordered.

82_32.shloka: तत स्समुत्थाय कुले कुले ते राजन्यवैश्या वृषलाश्च विप्राः।अयूयुजन्नुष्ट्रखरान्रथांश्च नागान्हयांश्चैव कुलप्रसूतान्।।2.82.32।।
82_32.translation: Thereafter, men from every household, kshatriyas, vaisyas, sudras and brahmins came out and harnessed their chariots to the camels and asses, elephants and horses of high pedigree.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे द्व्यशीतितमस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the eightysecond sarga in Ayodhyakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
82_32.word_by_word: ततः there after, कुले कुले in every household, ते those, राजन्यवैश्याः kshatriyas, vaisyas वृषलाश्च sudras, विप्राः brahmins, समुत्थाय after rising up, उष्ट्रखरान् camels and asses, रथांश्च chariots, कुलप्रसूतान् born in a good race, नागान् elephants, हयांश्चैव horses as well, अयूयुजन् harnessed.

83_1.shloka: [Bharata's journey with queens, ministers and all others.]तत स्समुत्थितः काल्यमास्थाय स्यन्दनोत्तमम्।प्रययौ भरतश्शीघ्रं रामदर्शनकाङ्क्षया।।2.83.1।।
83_1.translation: Getting up at dawn, Bharata boarded his excellent chariot and set forth swiftly, longing to see Rama.
83_1.word_by_word: ततः then, भरतः Bharata, काल्यम् at dawn, समुत्थितः risen, स्यन्दनोत्तमम् best chariot, आस्थायhaving boarded, रामदर्शनकाङ्क्षया longing to see Rama, शीघ्रम् swiftly, प्रययौ set forth.

83_2.translation: All the ministers and priests went ahead of Bharata mounting their chariots,  harnessed with horses and resembling the chariot of the Sun god.
83_2.word_by_word: सर्वे all, मन्त्रिपुरोधस: ministers and priests, हयैः horses, युक्तान् harnessed, सूर्यरथोपमान्  resembling the chariot of the Sun, रथान् chariots, अधिरुह्य having mounted, तस्य his, अग्रतः in front of, प्रययुः went.

83_3.translation: As per tradition, nine thousand elephants were arranged to follow Bharata, delight ofthe race of the Ikshvakus as he set out.
83_3.word_by_word: यथाविधि as per tradition, कल्पितानि arranged, नवनागसहस्राणि nine thousand elephants, यान्तम् while going, इक्ष्वाकुकुलनन्दनम् the delight of the house of Ikshvakus, भरतम् Bharata, अन्वयुः followed.

83_4.shloka: षष्टी रथसहस्राणि धन्विनो विविधायुधाः।अन्वयुर्भरतं यान्तं राजपुत्रं यशस्विनम्।।2.83.4।।
83_4.translation: Sixty thousands chariots and many archers holding weapons of every kind followed the illustrious prince Bharata as he went.
83_4.word_by_word: षष्टि: sixty, रथसहस्राणि thousands of chariots, विविधायुधा: men with weapons of every kind, धन्विनः archers, यान्तम् while going, यशस्विनम् illustrious, राजपुत्रम् king's son, भरतम् Bharata, अन्वयुः followed.

83_5.shloka: शतं सहस्राण्यश्वानां समारूढानि राघवम्।अन्वयुर्भरतं यान्तं सत्यसन्धं जितेन्द्रियम्।।2.83.5।।
83_5.translation: One hundred thousand horses each mounted by a rider followed Bharata, one who had conquered  his passion and adhered to truth.
83_5.word_by_word: राघवम् born in the Raghu race (Bharata), सत्यसन्धम् adhering to truth, जितेन्द्रियम् one who conquered passions, यान्तम् while going, भरतम् Bharata, समारूढानि mounted by riders, अश्वानाम् of horses, शतम् hundred, सहस्राणि thousand, अन्वयुः followed.

83_6.shloka: कैकेयी च सुमित्रा च कौसल्या च यशस्विनी।रामानयनसंहृष्टा ययुर्यानेन भास्वता।।2.83.6।।
83_6.translation: Kaikeyi, Sumitra as well as the illustrious Kausalya travelled by a resplendent chariot, delighted with the thought of bringing Rama back.
83_6.word_by_word: कैकेयी च Kaikeyi as well as, सुमित्रा च Sumitra also, यशस्विनी illustrious, कौसल्या च Kausalya also, रामानयनसंहृष्टाः delighted at the thought of bringing Rama back, भास्वता by a resplendent, यानेन by the chariot, ययुः went.

83_7.shloka: प्रयाताश्चार्यसङ्घाता रामं द्रष्टुं सलक्ष्मणम्।तस्यैव च कथाश्चित्राः कुर्वाणा हृष्टमानसाः।।2.83.7।।
83_7.translation: Venerable people in groups, narrating various accomplishments of Rama and eager to see him with Lakshmana, proceeded in a delightful mood.
83_7.word_by_word: आर्यसङ्घाताश्च venerable groups of people, हृष्टमानसाः delighted in their hearts, चित्राः  various, तस्यैव Rama's only, कथाः accomplishments, कुर्वाणाः doing, सलक्ष्मणम् with Lakshmana, रामम् Rama, द्रष्टुम् to see, प्रयाताः went forth.

83_8.shloka: मेघश्यामं महाबाहुं स्थिरसत्त्वं दृढव्रतम्।कदा द्रक्ष्यामहे रामं जगत श्शोकनाशनम्।।2.83.8।।
83_8.translation: When shall we see that mightyarmed Rama of darkblue complexion like the raincloud, firm in strength and steadfast in vows and the destroyer of the sorrows of  this world?
83_8.word_by_word: मेघश्यामम् darkblue like raincloud, महाबाहुम् the mightyarmed, स्थिरसत्त्वम् firm in strength, दृढव्रतम् steadfast in vows, जगतः of this world, शोकनाशनम् destroyer of sorrow, रामम् Rama, कदा when, द्रक्ष्यामहे shall see?

83_9.shloka: दृष्ट एव हि न श्शोकमपनेष्यति राघवः।तम स्सर्वस्य लोकस्य समुद्यन्निव भास्करः।।2.83.9।।
83_9.translation: At his sight alone our sorrows will be dispelled, the way the darkness of the entire world is dispelled by the rising Sun.
83_9.word_by_word: समुद्यन् rising, भास्करः Sun, सर्वस्य of the entire, लोकस्य world's, तमः इव like darkness, राघवः Rama, दृष्ट एव at his sight alone, नः our, शोकम् sorrow, अपनेष्यति will dispel.

83_10.shloka: इत्येवं कथयन्तस्ते सम्प्रहृष्टाः कथा श्शुभाः।परिष्वजानाश्चान्योन्यं ययुर्नागरिका जनाः।।2.83.10।।
83_10.translation: The inhabitants of the town proceeded joyfully, narrating Rama's delightful achievements on their way by embracing one another.
83_10.word_by_word: ते they, नागरिकाः जनाः inhabitants of the city, इत्येवम् in this way, शुभाः delightful, कथाः achievements, कथयन्तः narrating, सम्प्रहृष्टाः joyfully, अन्योन्यम् mutually, परिष्वजानाश्च embracing also, ययुः proceeded.

83_11.shloka: ये च तत्रापरे सर्वे सम्मता ये च नैगमाः।रामं प्रति ययुर्हृष्टा स्सर्वाः प्रकृतयस्तथा।।2.83.11।।
83_11.translation: Respectable city folks, like traders and other subjects went along in great delight towards Rama.
83_11.word_by_word: तत्र there, ये च अपरे all the others, सम्मताः respectable, ये च नैगमाः those merchants, तथा similarly, सर्वाः all, प्रकृतयः subjects, हृष्टाः delighted, रामम् प्रति to Rama, ययुः went along.

83_12.shloka: मणिकाराश्च ये केचित्कुम्भकाराश्च शोभनाः।सूत्रकर्मकृतश्चैव ये च शस्त्रोपजीविनः।2.83.12।।मयूरकाः क्राकचिका रोचका वेधकास्तथा।दन्तकारा स्सुधाकारा स्तथा गन्धोपजीविनः।।2.83.13।।सुवर्णकाराः प्रख्यातास्तथा कम्बलधावकाः।स्नापकोष्णोदका वैद्याधूपकाश्शौण्डिकास्तथा।।2.83.14।।रजकास्तुन्नवायाश्च ग्रामघोषमहत्तराः।शैलूषाश्च सह स्त्रीभिर्ययुः कैवर्तकास्तथा।।2.83.15।।
83_12.translation: Gempolishers, potters, weaponsmiths, weavers, makers of adornments with peacock feathers, sawyers, makers of artificial ornaments, perforators of shells and ornaments, ivoryworkers, whitewashers, purveyors of fragrant essences, renowned goldsmiths, blanketcleaners, hotbath attendants, physicians, vintners, incense merchants, washermen, tailors, headmen of villages and hamlets, actors along with their wives, fishermen -- all followed Bharata.
83_12.word_by_word: ये those, केचित् some others, मणिकाराः gempolishers, शोभनाः richly decorated, कुम्भकाराश्च  potters, ये शस्त्रोपजीविनः those who live on making weapons (weaponsmiths), सूत्रकर्मकृतश्चैव those who work with thread (weavers), मयूरकाः makers of adornments with peacock feathers, क्राकचिकाः those who work with saws (sawyers), रोचकाः makers of artificial ornaments, वेधकाः perforators (of shells and ornaments), तथा also, दन्तकाराः  artists who work with ivory, सुधाकाराः those engaged in whitewashing, तथा also, गन्धोपजीविनः subsisting on selling fragrant essences (perfumers), प्रख्याताः renowned, सुवर्णकाराः goldsmiths, तथा also, कम्भलधावकाः blanketcleaners, स्नापकोष्णोदकाः hot bath attendants, वैद्याः physicians, शौण्डिकाः distillers and sellers  of spiritual liquor (vintners), धूपकाः incense merchants, रजकाः washermen, तुन्नवायाश्च those who do sewing work(tailors), ग्रामघोषमहत्तराः important people in villages and hamlets where cowherds reside, स्त्रीभिः सह along with women, शैलूषाः actors, तथा similarly, कैवर्तकाः fishermen, ययुः went.

83_13.shloka: समाहिता वेदविदो ब्राह्मणा वृत्तसम्मताः।गोरथैर्भरतं यान्तमनुजग्मु स्सहस्रशः।।2.83.16।।
83_13.translation: Brahmins learned in the Vedas and renowned for their virtuous conduct followed Bharta in their thousands on bullock carts with composed minds.
83_13.word_by_word: समाहिताः with composed mind, वृत्तसम्मताः renowned for their virtuous conduct, वेदविदः learned in the Vedas, सहस्रशः in thousands, ब्राह्मणाः brahmins, यान्तम् departing, भरतम् Bharata, गोरथैः on bullock carts, अनुजग्मुः followed.

83_14.translation: Dressed well in clean clothes and anointed with pure red sandalpaste, they all slowly followed Bharata, mounting on various vehicles.
83_14.word_by_word: सुवेषाः welldressed, शुद्धवसनाः in clean clothing, ताम्रमृष्टानुलेपनाः anointed with pure redsandalpaste, ते सर्वे all those, विविधैः various, यानैः on vehicles, शनैः slowly, भरतम् Bharata, अन्वयुः followed.

83_15.shloka: प्रहृष्टमुदिता सेना साऽन्वयात्कैकयीसुतम्।भ्रातुरानयने यान्तं भरतं भ्रातृवत्सलम्।।2.83.18।।
83_15.translation: The army, overwhelmed with joy and cheer followed the devoted brother Bharata who had set out to bring back Rama.
83_15.word_by_word: प्रहृष्टमुदिता overwhelmed with joy and cheer, सा सेना that army, भ्रातुः brother's, आनयने to bring back, यान्तम् set out, कैकयीसुतम् Kaikeyi's son (Bharata), भ्रातृवत्सलम् to his brother, Rama, भरतम् Bharata, अन्वयात् followed.

83_16.shloka: ते गत्वा दूरमध्वानं रथयानाश्वकुञ्जरैः।समासेदुस्ततो गङ्गां शृङ्गीबेरपुरं प्रति।।2.83.19।।यत्र रामसखो वीरो गुहो ज्ञातिगणैर्वृतः।निवसत्यप्रमादेन देशं तं परिपालयन्।।2.83.20।।
83_16.translation: After travelling a long distance on chariots, carriages, horses and elephants, they reached the river Ganga close to Srngiberapura, a country ruled vigilantly by Rama's friend, the valiant Guha who lived there along with his relatives.
83_16.word_by_word: ते they, रथयानाश्वकुञ्जरैः on chariots, carriages, horses and elephants, दूरम् a great distance, अध्वानम् the path, गत्वा having travelled, ततः thereafter, रामसखः Rama's friend, वीरः valiant, गुहः Guha, ज्ञातिगणैः with relatives, वृतः surrounded by, तम् that, देशम् country, अप्रमादेन vigilantly, परिपालयन् ruling, यत्र where, निवसति living, शृङ्गीबेरपुरं प्रति near Srngiberapura, गङ्गाम् Ganges, समासेदुः reached.

83_17.shloka: उपेत्य तीरं गङ्गायाश्चक्रवाकैरलङ्कृतम्।व्यवातिष्ठत सा सेना भरतस्यानुयायिनी।।2.83.21।।
83_17.translation: The army following Bharata reached the bank of the river Ganga, graced by chakravakas (ruddy geese) and halted there.
83_17.word_by_word: भरतस्य अनुयायिनी following Bharata, सा सेना that army, चक्रवाकैः with chakravakas (the ruddy geese), अलङ्कृतम् graced, गङ्गायाः river Ganga's, तीरम् bank, उपेत्य having reached, व्यवातिष्ठत halted there.

83_18.translation: As he beheld the army following him and the river Ganga of sacred waters in front of him, Bharata who was proficient in speech said to his ministers:
83_18.word_by_word: अनुगताम् following, सेनाम् army, शिवोदकाम् having sacred waters, तां गङ्गां च that river Ganga, निरीक्षय having gazed at, वाक्यकोविदः proficient in speech, भरतः Bharata, सर्वान् all, सचिवान् to ministers, अब्रवीत् said.

83_19.shloka: निवेशयत मे सैन्यमभिप्रायेण सर्वतः।विश्रान्ताः प्रतरिष्यामश्श्व इदानीमिमां नदीम्।।2.83.23।।
83_19.translation: You may, according to your convenience, halt the army anywhere here and, after taking rest (for the night), we shall cross the river Ganga tomorrow.
83_19.word_by_word: मे सैन्यम् my army, अभिप्रायेण according to their desires, सर्वतः all over, निवेशयत you may halt, इदानीम् now, विश्रान्ताः having taken rest, नदीम् river, श्वः tomorrow, प्रतरिष्यामः will cross.

83_20.shloka: दातुं च तावदिच्छामि स्वर्गतस्य महीपतेः।और्ध्वदेहनिमित्तार्थमवतीर्योदकं नदीम्।।2.83.24।।
83_20.translation: Meanwhile, I shall get into this river and offer libations with water to the departed king for the good of his life in the other world.
83_20.word_by_word: नदीम् river, अवतीर्य descending, स्वर्गतस्य to the departed, महीपतेः king's, और्ध्वदेहनिमित्तार्थम् for the good of his life in the other world, उदकम् libations with water, दातुम् च to offer, इच्छामि तावत् I wish.

83_21.shloka: तस्यैवं ब्रुवतोऽमात्यास्तथेत्युक्त्वा समाहिताः।न्यवेशयंस्तां छन्देन स्वेन स्वेन पृथक्पृथक्।।2.83.25।।
83_21.translation: While he (Bharata's) was speaking this way, all the ministers assented by saying 'Be it so' and made arrangement for their troops to rest separately according to their pleasure.
83_21.word_by_word: तस्य his (Bharata's), एवम् in this way, ब्रुवतः while saying, अमात्याः ministers, तथेति 'be it so', उक्त्वा  saying, समाहिताः with composed minds, ताम् they, स्वेन स्वेन each of their, छन्देन with pleasure, पृथक् पृथक् separately न्यवेशयन् rested.

83_22.shloka: निवेश्य गङ्गामनु तां महानदीं चमूं विधानैः परिबर्हशोभिनीम्।उवास रामस्य तदा महात्मनो विचिन्तयानो भरतो निवर्तनम्।।2.83.26।।
83_22.translation: The army encamped by Bharata looked splendid with royal insigaia. After making necessary arrangements for the army on the bank of the mighty river Ganga and pondering over the means of bringing back the magnanimous Rama, Bharata stayed.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे त्र्यशीतितमस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the eightythird sarga in Ayodhyakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
83_22.word_by_word: भरतः Bharata, परिबर्हशोभिनीम् looking splendid with their royal insignia, चमूम् army, ताम् that, महानदीम् mighty river, गङ्गाम् अनु following Ganga, विधानैः with adequate arrangements, निवेश्य encamping, तदा then, महात्मनः magnanimous, रामस्य Rama's, निवर्तनम् to bring back, विचिन्तयानः pondering, उवास stayed.

84_1.shloka: [Guha spots from a distance Bharata's army approaching -- wants to know the intentions of Bharata -- convinced of Bharata's loyalty, he extends warn hospitality.]ततो निविष्टां ध्वजिनीं गङ्गामन्वाश्रितां नदीम्।निषादराजो दृष्ट्वैव ज्ञातीन्सन्त्वरितोऽऽब्रवीत्।।2.84.1।।
84_1.translation: Guha, king of the nishadas, observed the bannered army encamped all along the bank of the river Ganga, hurried off and said to his kinsmen:
84_1.word_by_word: ततः then, निषादराजः king of the nishadas (Guha), गङ्गां नदीम् river Ganga, अन्वाश्रिताम् all along the bank, निविष्टाम् encamped, ध्वजिनीम् the bannered army, दृष्ट्वैव on seeing, सन्त्वरितः hurriedly, ज्ञातीन् to relatives, अब्रवीत् said.

84_2.translation: Here is an army as vast as the ocean, and I am unable to comprehend its magnitude even mentally.
84_2.word_by_word: इतः this side, सागराभा looking like an ocean, इयम् this, महती vast, सेना army, प्रदृश्यते appearing, मनसा in my mind, विचिन्तयन्नपि even by thinking, अस्याः this army's, अन्तम्  end, नाधिगच्छामि I am not able to reach.

84_3.shloka: यथा तु खलु दुर्बुद्धिर्भरत स्स्वयमागतः।स एष हि महाकायः कोविदारध्वजो रथे।।2.84.3।।
84_3.translation: It appears that the evilminded Bharata himself has come here. The emblem of a huge kovidara (pomegranate) tree is seen on his chariot.
84_3.word_by_word: दुर्बुद्धि: evilminded, भरतः Bharata, स्वयम् himself, यथा तु आगतः खलु has come it appears,  सः that, महाकायः of huge size, कोविदारध्वजः having the emblem of kovidara                          (promegranate) tree, एषः this one, रथे हि on the chariot.

84_4.shloka: बन्धयिष्यति वा दाशानथवाऽस्मान्वधिष्यति।अथ दाशरथिं रामं पित्रा राज्याद्विवासितम्।।2.84.4।।सम्पन्नां श्रियमन्विच्छन्स्तस्य राज्ञ स्सुदुर्लभाम्।भरतः कैकयीपुत्रो हन्तुं समधिगच्छति।।2.84.5।।
84_4.translation: Could it be that Bharata, son of Kaikeyi, has come here to bind us with the cords or to slay us? Or is he marching forward with the intention of taking possession of a prosperous, rare kingdom by slaying Rama who has been banished by his father:
84_4.word_by_word: कैकयीपुत्रः Kaikeyi's son, भरतः Bharata, दाशान् fishermen, बन्धयिष्यति is going to bind us  with cords?, अथवा or, अस्मान् us, वधिष्यति will slay?, अथ or, तस्य राज्ञः that king's, सम्पन्नाम्  prosperous, सुदुर्लभाम् not easily obtainable, श्रियम् wealth, अन्विच्छन् wishing, पित्रा by father, राज्यात् from kingdom, विवासितम् banished, दाशरथिम् son of Dasaratha, रामम् to Rama, हन्तुम् to slay, समधिगच्छति is he marching forward?

84_5.shloka: भर्ताचैव सखाचैव रामो दाशरथिर्मम।तस्यार्थकामास्सन्नद्धा गङ्गाऽनूपे प्रतिष्ठत।।2.84.6।।
84_5.translation: Rama, son of Dasaratha, is not only my master but also my friend. Therefore, to safeguard his interests remain stationed here on the bank of the river Ganga.
84_5.word_by_word: दाशरथिः son of Dasaratha, रामः Rama, मम to me, भर्ता चैव is my master, सखाचैव friend too, तस्य his, अर्थकामाः wealth and desires, गङ्गाऽनूपे on the bank of river Ganga, प्रतिष्ठत   remain stationed.

84_6.shloka: तिष्ठन्तु सर्वे दाशाश्च गङ्गामन्वाश्रिता नदीम्।बलयुक्ता नदीरक्षा मांसमूलफलाशनाः।।2.84.7।।
84_6.translation: Let all the fishermen, who live on meat, roots and fruits and protect the river, stay here with the troops by taking up positions along the banks of the river Ganga.
84_6.word_by_word: मांसमूलफलाशनाः living on meat, roots and fruits, नदीरक्षाः protectors of the river, सर्वे all, दाशाश्च fishermen, बलयुक्ताः with your troops, गङ्गां नदीम् river Ganga, अन्वाश्रिताः following  and taking up your positions, तिष्ठन्तु stay here.

84_7.shloka: नावां शतानां पञ्चानां कैवर्तानां शतं शतम्।सन्नद्धानां तथा यूनां तिष्ठन्त्वित्यभ्यचोदयत्।।2.84.8।।
84_7.translation: Let five hundred boats, each manned by a hundred young fishermen fully equipped, be in readiness he exhorted them.
84_7.word_by_word: पञ्चानाम् five, शतानाम् hundred, नावाम् boats, सन्नद्धानाम् fully equipped, तथा also, यूनाम् youths, कैवर्तानाम् fishermen, शतं शतम् one hundred in each, तिष्ठन्तु stand, इति like that, अभ्यचोदयत् exhorted.

84_8.shloka: यदाऽऽदुष्टस्तु भरतो रामस्येह भविष्यति।सेयं स्वस्तिमती सेना गङ्गामद्य तरिष्यति।।2.84.9।।
84_8.translation: Should it happen that Bharata is not illdisposed toward Rama, the army will safe cross the river Ganga today itself.
84_8.word_by_word: भरतः Bharata, इह here, रामस्य toward Rama, अदुष्टः not illdisposed, यदा तु भविष्यति  when it be proved, सा इयम् that this, सेना army, अद्य today, स्वस्तिमती in safety, गङ्गाम् Ganga, तरिष्यति will cross over.

84_9.shloka: इत्युक्त्वोपायनं गृह्य मत्स्यमांसमधूनि च।अभिचक्राम भरतं निषादाधिपतिर्गुहः।।2.84.10।।
84_9.translation: Having spoken thus, Guha, lord of the nishadas, approached Bharata, taking with him fish, meat and wine as offerings.
84_9.word_by_word: निषादाधिपतिः गुहः overlord of the nishadas, Guha, इति thus, उक्त्वा having spoken, मत्स्यमांसमधूनि fish, meat and wine, उपायनम् as gifts, गृह्य holding, भरतम् to Bharata, अभिचक्राम approached.

84_10.shloka: तमायान्तं तु सम्प्रेक्ष्य सूतपुत्रः प्रतापवान्।भरतायाऽचचक्षेऽथ विनयज्ञो विनीतवत्।।2.84.11।।
84_10.translation: The valiant Sumantra, conversant with ways of modesty, observed Guha approaching them and humbly informed Bharata.
84_10.word_by_word: अथ thereafter, प्रतापवान् valiant, विनयज्ञः conversant with modesty, सूतपुत्रः son of charioteer, Sumantra, आयान्तम् approaching, तम् him, सम्प्रेक्ष्य having seen, विनीतवत्   humbly, भरताय to Bharata, आचचक्षे informed.

84_11.shloka: एष ज्ञातिसहस्रेण स्थपतिः परिवारितः।कुशलो दण्डकारण्ये वृद्धो भ्रातुश्च ते सखा।।2.84.12।।
84_11.translation: Guha who has come here surrounded by too many thousands of his relations is fully acquainted with the Dandaka forest. He is an aged man and a friend of your brother said Sumatra.
84_11.word_by_word: ज्ञातिसहस्रेण with thousands of relations, परिवारितः surrounded by, एषः स्थपतिः this lord,  दण्डकारण्ये in the Dandaka forest, कुशलः skilled, वृद्धः aged one, ते your, भ्रातुः brother's, सखा च friend also.

84_12.shloka: तस्मात्पश्यतु काकुत्स्थ त्वां निषादाधिपो गुहः।असंशयं विजानीते यत्र तौ रामलक्ष्मणौ।।2.84.13।।
84_12.translation: O scion of the Kakusthas (Bharata) therefore, give audience to the overlord of the nishadas, Guha, who undoubtedly knows the whereabouts of Rama and Lakshmana.
84_12.word_by_word: काकुत्स्थ O Kakutstha, तस्मात् therefore, निषादाधिपः overlord of Nishadas, गुहः Guha, त्वाम्you, पश्यतु let him see, तौ रामलक्ष्मणौ both Rama and Lakshmana, यत्र where, असंशयम्   undoubtedly, विजानीते he will know.

84_13.shloka: एतत्तु वचनं श्रुत्वा सुमन्त्राद्भरत श्शुभम्।उवाच वचनं शीघ्रं गुहः पश्यतु मामिति।।2.84.14।।
84_13.translation: On hearing these auspicious words of Sumantra, Bharata said Let Guha see me at once.
84_13.word_by_word: भरतः Bharata, सुमन्त्रात् from Sumantra, एतत् शुभम् these auspicious, वचनम् word, श्रुत्वा having heard, गुहः Guha, शीघ्रम् at once, माम् me, पश्यतु let him see, इति these, वचनम् word, उवाच said.

84_14.shloka: लब्ध्वाऽभ्यनुज्ञां संहृष्टो ज्ञातिभिः परिवारितः।आगम्य भरतं प्रह्वो गुहो वचनमब्रवीत्।।2.84.15।।
84_14.translation: Having obtaind the permission, a delighted Guha, escorted by his relatives,  approached Bharata and humbly said:
84_14.word_by_word: गुहः Guha, अभ्यनुज्ञाम् permission, लब्ध्वा having obtained, संहृष्टः delighted, ज्ञातिभिः relatives, परिवारितः escorted by, आगम्य having approached, प्रह्वः bowing humbly, भरतम् to Bharata, वचनम् words, अब्रवीत् said.

84_15.shloka: निष्कुटश्चैव देशोऽयं वञ्चिताश्चापि ते वयम्।निवेदयामस्ते सर्वे स्वके दासकुले वस।।2.84.16।।
84_15.translation: This country is like a pleasuregarden at the backyard of your palace. All of us are  subordinate to you and we solicit you to stay in the house of  this servant of yours.
84_15.word_by_word: अयम् this, देशः country, ते your, निष्कुटः is like a pleasuregarden behind your house, वयम् we, वञ्चिताश्चापि are subordinate, ते सर्वे all of us, निवेदयामः soliciting, दासकुले in the house of this servant, वस stay.

84_16.shloka: अस्ति मूलं फलञ्चैव निषादैस्समुपाहृतम्।आर्द्रं च मांसं शुष्कं च वन्यं चोच्चावचं महत्।।2.84.17।।
84_16.translation: Here are roots, fruits and a great variety of forest produce, fresh and dried meat brought by the nishadas.
84_16.word_by_word: निषादैः by nishadas, समुपाहृतम् have been brought, मूलम् root, फलं चैव fruits also, वन्यम्  the forest produce, आर्द्रम् fresh, शुष्कं च dried, उच्चावचम् of great variety, महत् best, मांसं च  अस्ति meat are here.

84_17.shloka: आशंसे स्वाशिता सेना वत्स्यतीमां विभावरीम्।अर्चितो विविधैः कामै श्श्व स्ससैन्यो गमिष्यसि।।2.84.18।।
84_17.translation: We hope your army having  refreshed themselves will spend the night here. With our hospitality extended, you can proceed tomorrow.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे चतुरशीतितमस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the eightyfourth sarga in Ayodhyakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
84_17.word_by_word: सेना army, स्वाशिता refreshed, इमाम् विभावरीम् this night, वत्स्यति will spend, आशंसे I hope, विविधैः by various, कामैः by our hospitality, अर्चितः treated, श्वः tomorrow, ससैन्यः with army, गमिष्यसि will go.

85_1.shloka: [Bharata expresses his desire to bring back Rama -- enquires the way to Bharadwaja's hermitage.]एवमुक्तस्तु भरतो निषादाधिपतिं गुहम्।प्रत्युवाच महाप्राज्ञो वाक्यं हेत्वर्थसंहितम्।।2.85.1।।
85_1.translation: When thus spoken to, Bharata, a great intellectual, replied to Guha with these well thought out and meaningful words.
85_1.word_by_word: एवम् thus, उक्तः having spoken, महाप्राज्ञः  great intellectual, भरतः Bharata, निषादाधिपतिम् the overlord of the nishadas, गुहम् Guha, हेत्वर्थसंहितम् in well thought out and significant, वाक्यम् words, प्रत्युवाच replied.

85_2.shloka: ऊर्जितः खलु ते कामः कृतो मम गुरोस्सखे।यो मे त्वमीदृशीं सेनामेकोऽभ्यर्चितुमिच्छसि।।2.85.2।।
85_2.translation: O dear friend of my elder brother, your desire to extend hospitality to this large army all alone is indeed noble.
85_2.word_by_word: मम my, गुरोः elder brother's, सखे friend, यः त्वम् you, एकः alone, ईदृशीम् this large, सेनाम् army, अभ्यर्चितुम् to extend hospitality, इच्छसि want, ते your, कृतः done, कामः desire, ऊर्जितः खलु is indeed great.

85_3.shloka: इत्युक्त्वा तु महातेजा गुहं वचनमुत्तमम्।अब्रवीद्भरत श्श्रीमाननिषादाधिपतिं पुनः।।2.85.3।।
85_3.translation: Having spoken to Guha courteously, the majestic, radiant Bharata continued:
85_3.word_by_word: महातेजाः of great radiance, श्रीमान् the majestic one, भरतः Bharata, गुहम् to Guha, उत्तमम् courteous, वचनम् word, उक्त्वा तु having said, पुनः again, निषादाधिपतिम्  addressing king of the nishadas, अब्रवीत् said.

85_4.shloka: कतरेण गमिष्यामि भरद्वाजाश्रमं गुह।गहनोऽयं भृशं देशो गङ्गाऽनूपो दुरत्ययः।।2.85.4।।
85_4.translation: O Guha this region of Ganga with its dense forest is very difficult to cross. How can I reach the hermitage of Bharadwaja?
85_4.word_by_word: गुह Guha, कतरेण by which path, भरद्वाजाश्रमम् to the hermitage of Bharadwaja, गमिष्यामि can I go, गङ्गनूपः marshy banks of Ganga, अयम् this, देशः region, भृशम् highly, गहनः isdense, दुरत्ययः very difficult to traverse.

85_5.shloka: तस्य तद्वचनं श्रुत्वा राजपुत्रस्य धीमतः।अब्रवीत्प्राञ्जलिर्वाक्यं गुहो गहनगोचरः।।2.85.5।।
85_5.translation: When he heard those words of the sagacious Bharata, Guha the forest ranger answered him reverentially with folded palms.
85_5.word_by_word: धीमतः of the sagacious, तस्य राजपुत्रस्य of that king's son, तत् वचनम् those words, श्रुत्वा having heard, गहनगोचरः one who ranges in the dense forest, गुहः Guha, प्राञ्जलिः with folded palms (in reverence), वाक्यम् these words, अब्रवीत् spoke.

85_6.translation: O prince of great renown I shall follow you, wellprepared with these fishermen, armed with bows.
85_6.word_by_word: महायशः a man of great renown, राजपुत्रः king's son, धन्विनः armed with bows, दाशाः fishermen, सुसमाहिताः wellprepared, त्वा you, अनुगमिष्यन्ति shall follow, अहम् I, त्वा you, अनुगमिष्यामि shall follow.

85_7.shloka: कच्छिन्नदुष्टो व्रजसि रामस्याक्लिष्टकर्मणः।इयं ते महती सेना शङ्कां जनयतीव मे।।2.85.7।।
85_7.translation: Are you not going to that place with the evil intention of causing harm to Rama of unwearied actions? This large army of yours arouses doubts in me.
85_7.word_by_word: अक्लिष्टकर्मणः of unwearied actions, रामस्य towards Rama, दुष्टः bearing illwill, न व्रजसि कच्छित् are you not going to that place?, महती large, ते your, इयं सेना this army, मे to me, शङ्काम् doubt, जनयतीव as though arouses.

85_8.shloka: तमेवमभिभाषन्तमाकाश इव निर्मलः।भरतश्श्लक्ष्णया वाचा गुहं वचनमब्रवीत्।।2.85.8।।
85_8.translation: When he heard Guha thus speaking, Bharata who was as tranquil as the sky, said to him in a gentle voice.
85_8.word_by_word: आकाशः इव like the sky, निर्मलः tranquil, भरतः Bharata, एवम् thus, अभिभाषन्तम् talking, तं गुहम् addressing Guha, श्लक्ष्णया in gentle, वाचा voice, वचनम् words, अब्रवीत् said.

85_9.shloka: माभूत्स कालो यत्कष्टं न मां शङ्कितुमर्हसि।राघव स्सहि मे भ्राता ज्येष्ठः पितुसमो मतः।।2.85.9।।
85_9.translation: That calmitous time will never come (again). You should not suspect me. I look upon Rama, my eldest brother, as my father.
85_9.word_by_word: यत् which, कष्टम् calamity, सः कालः that time, मा भूत् shall not come, माम् to me, शङ्कितुम् to suspect, नार्हसि you should not, मे my, ज्येष्ठः eldest, भ्राता brother, सः राघवः that Rama, पितृसमः is equal to my father, मतः हि he has been held in high esteem.

85_10.shloka: तं निवर्तयितुं यामि काकुत्स्थं वनवासिनम्।बुद्धिरन्या न ते कार्या गुह सत्यं ब्रवीमि ते।।2.85.10।।
85_10.translation: I am going to bring back that scion of the kakutsthas (Rama) who resides in the forest. O Guha, do not entertain any other thought. I am tellng you the truth.
85_10.word_by_word: वनवासिनम् residing in the forest, तम् काकुत्स्थम् to that scion of the Kakutsthas, निवर्तयितुम् to bring back, यामि I am going, गुह O Guha, ते to you, अन्या other, बुद्धि: thought, न कार्या not to be entertained, ते to you, सत्यम् truth, ब्रवीमि I am telling.

85_11.shloka: स तु संहृष्टवदन श्श्रुत्वा भरतभाषितम्।पुनरेवाब्रवीद्वाक्यं भरतं प्रति हर्षितः।।2.85.11।।
85_11.translation: When he heard those words of Bharata, Guha was delighted and his face beamed with joy as he said to Bharata:
85_11.word_by_word: भरतभाषितम् Bharata's words, श्रुत्वा on hearing, संहृष्टवदनः one whose is face beaming with joy, सः तु that Guha, हर्षितः delighted, भरतं प्रति looking at Bharata, पुनरेव once  again, वाक्यम् these words, अब्रवीत् said.

85_12.shloka: धन्यस्त्वं न त्वया तुल्यं पश्यामि जगतीतले।अयत्नादागतं राज्यं यस्त्वं त्यक्तुमिहेच्छसि।।2.85.12।।
85_12.translation: Blessed indeed you are as you desire to renounce the kingdom that has come to you effortlessly. I see none equal to you on this earth.
85_12.word_by_word: यः त्वम् such a man as you are, इह now, अयत्नात् effortlessly, आगतम् arrived, राज्यम् kingdom, त्यक्तुम् to renounce, इच्छसि wish, त्वम् you, धन्यः are blessed, त्वया your, तुल्यम् equal, जगतीतले on this earth, न पश्यामि I do not see.

85_13.shloka: शाश्वती खलु ते कीर्तिर्लोकाननुचरिष्यति।यस्त्वं कृच्छ्रगतं रामं प्रत्यानयितुमिच्छसि।।2.85.13।।
85_13.translation: You desire to bring back Rama who is in great difficulty. This everlasting fame of yours will spread all over the world.
85_13.word_by_word: यः त्वम् you, कृच्छ्रगतम् who is in great difficulty, रामम् Rama, प्रत्यानयितुम् to bring back, इच्छसि desire, ते your, शाश्वती everlasting, कीर्तिः fame, लोकान् in this world, अनुचरिष्यति will spread.

85_14.shloka: एवं सम्भाषमाणस्य गुहस्य भरतं तदा।बभौ नष्टप्रभस्सूर्यो रजनी चाभ्यवर्तत।।2.85.14।।
85_14.translation: As Guha was thus conversing with Bharata, the rays of the Sun diminished and the night set in.
85_14.word_by_word: तदा then, गुहस्य Guha's, एवं thus, भरतं to Bharata, सम्भाषमाणस्य while conversing, सूर्यः sun, नष्टप्रभः diminished light, बभौ shone, रजनी च night, अभ्यवर्तत set in.

85_15.shloka: सन्निवेश्य स तां सेनां गुहेन परितोषितः।शत्रुघ्नेन सह श्रीमाञ्छयनं समुपागमत्।।2.85.15।।
85_15.translation: Fortunate Bharata gratified by Guha encamped his army and retired to bed along with Satrughna.
85_15.word_by_word: श्रीमान् fortunate Bharata, सः he, तां सेनां that army, सन्निवेश्य having encamped, गुहेन with Guha, परितोषितः gratified, शत्रुघ्नेन सह along with Satrughna, शयनं sleep, समुपागमत्  obtained.

85_16.shloka: रामचिन्तामय श्शोको भरतस्य महात्मनः।उपस्थितो ह्यनर्हस्य धर्मप्रेक्षस्य तादृशः।।2.85.16।।
85_16.translation: But the thought of Rama caused grief to the magnanimous Bharata, a man of righteous outlook who did not deserve such grief.
85_16.word_by_word: महात्मनः of the magnanimous, धर्मप्रेक्षस्य of a man of righteous outlook, अनर्हस्य of him who  does not deserve (grief), भरतस्य Bharata's, तादृशः such, रामचिन्तामयः filled with thethought of Rama, शोकः grief, उपस्थितः हि had befallen.

85_17.translation: Just like a concealed forestfire scorching the dried up forest, the fire of sorrow kindled in his mind scorched Bharata.
85_17.word_by_word: वनदाहाभिसन्तप्तं dried by forest fire, पादपं tree, गूढः hidden, अग्निरिव like a fire, राघवम्  Bharata, दहनः grief, अन्तर्दाहेन burning within himself, सन्तापयति scorching.

85_18.translation: Like the ice melted by the heat of the Sun's rays flows down the Himalayas, sweat poured from all parts of his body caused by the fire of grief.
85_18.word_by_word: सूर्यांशुसन्तप्तः heated by the Sun's rays, हिमवान् Himalayas, यथा just as, हिमं ice, प्रसृतः melted, सर्वगात्रेभ्यः from all limbs, शोकाग्निसम्भवम् caused by the fire of grief, स्वेदम् sweat, प्रसृतः poured out.

85_19.shloka: ध्याननिर्धरशैलेन विनिश्श्वसितधातुना।दैन्यपादपसंघेन शोकायासाधिशृङ्गिणा।।2.85.19।।प्रमोहानन्तसत्त्वेन सन्तापौषधिवेणुना।आक्रान्तो दुःखशैलेन महता कैकयीसुतः।।2.85.20।।
85_19.translation: Bharata, son of Kaikeyi was stricken by a lofty mountain of grief. The cavityless rocks of that mountain were his contemplation, the minerals were his sighs, the multitude of trees were his desolation, peaks were his fatigue and mental distress, the unlimited number of animals were his stupor, the bamboo tree was his sorrow.
85_19.word_by_word: कैकयीसुतः Kaikeyi's son, ध्याननिर्धरशैलेन by the cavityless rocks of that mountain ofcontemplation, विनिःश्वसितधातुना by the minerals of heaving sighs, दैन्यपादपसंघेन by the multitude of trees in the form of dejection, शोकायासाधिशृङ्गिणा by the peaks of  sorrow fatigue and mental distress, प्रमोहानन्तसत्त्वेन by the countless creatures of stupor, सन्तापौषधिवेणुना by the bamboo tree of sorrow, महता great, दुःखशैलेन by the mountains of grief, आक्रान्तः was invaded.

85_20.shloka: विनिश्श्वसन्वै भृशदुर्मनास्ततः प्रमूढसंज्ञः परमापदं गतः।शमं न लेभे हृदयज्वरार्दितो नरर्षभो यूथहतो यथर्षभः।।2.85.21।।
85_20.translation: Then best of men, Bharata, with highly distraught mind and heaving sighs, with senses bewildered and oppressed by the fever raging in his heart and caught in a great calamity, like a bull separated from the herd enjoyed no peace of mind.
85_20.word_by_word: ततः then, नरर्षभः best among men (Bharata), विनिश्श्वसन् heaving sighs, भृशदुर्मनाः with greatly distraught mind, प्रमूढसंज्ञः with bewildered senses, परमापदं a great calamity, गतः caught, हृदयज्वरार्दितः oppressed by the fever raging his heart, यूथहतः separated from the herd, ऋषभः यथा like a bull, शमं peace of mind, न लेभे  did not get.

85_21.shloka: गुहेन सार्धं भरतस्समागतो महानुभावस्सजनस्समाहितः।सुदुर्मनास्तं भरतं तदा पुनर्गुह स्समाश्वासयदग्रजं प्रति।।2.85.22।।
85_21.translation: Bharata, a man of great magnanimity, joined Guha together with his people with composed mind. Then Guha, greatly distraught, again consoled  Bharata  regarding his elder brother Rama.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे पञ्चाशीतितमस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the eightyfifth sarga in Ayodhyakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
85_21.word_by_word: महानुभावः magnanimous, सजनः along with his people, भरतः Bharata, समाहितः with a composed mind, गुहेन सार्धं with Guha, समागतः joined, तदा then, सुदुर्मनाः with greatly distraught mind, गुहः Guha, तं भरतम् that Bharata, पुनः again, अग्रजं प्रति about elder brother Rama, आश्वासयत् consoled.

86_1.shloka: [Guha's reminiseesces.]आचचक्षेऽथ सद्भावं लक्ष्मणस्य महात्मनः।भरतायाप्रमेयाय गुहो गहनगोचरः।।2.86.1।।
86_1.translation: Then Guha, the forest ranger, described to Bharata the countless qualities of the goodnatured, magnanimous Lakshmana:
86_1.word_by_word: अथ then, गहनगोचरः forest ranger, गुहः Guha, अप्रमेयाय to a man of immeasurable (virtues), भरताय to Bharata, महात्मनः of the magnanimous, लक्ष्मणस्य Lakshmana's, सद्भावम् good nature, आचचक्षे explained.

86_2.translation: I spoke to the virtuous Lakshmana, who was holding arrows, bow and sword in his hand and keeping awake completely for the protection of his brother.
86_2.word_by_word: अहम् I, भ्रातृगुप्त्यर्थम् for the sake of protecting his brother, अत्यन्तम् completely, जाग्रतम् keeping awake, शरचापासिधारिणम् holding arrows, bow and sword, गुणैः with virtues, युक्तम् endowed with, तं लक्ष्मणम् that Lakshmana, अबृवम् I said.

86_3.shloka: इयं तात सुखा शय्या त्वदर्थमुपकल्पिता।प्रत्याश्वसिहि शेष्वास्यां सुखं राघवनन्दन।।2.86.3।।
86_3.translation: My friend, Lakshmana, the delight of the Raghavas this comfortable couch has been arranged for you. Lie down peacefully without any anxiety.
86_3.word_by_word: राघवनन्दन delight of the race of Raghu, तात my friend, (लक्ष्मण Lakshmana), सुखा comfortable, इयम् this, शय्या couch, त्वदर्थम् for your sake, उपकल्पिता has been arranged, प्रत्याश्वसिहि be assured, अस्याम् upon it, सुखम् peacefully, शेष्व lie down.

86_4.shloka: उचितोऽयं जनस्सर्वो दुःखानां त्वं सुखोचितः।धर्मात्मंस्तस्य गुप्त्यर्थं जागरिष्यामहे वयम्।।2.86.4।।
86_4.translation: O righteous one you are used to conforts where as all of our people are accustomed to hardships. So we will stay awake and protect Rama.
86_4.word_by_word: धर्मात्मन् O righteous one, अयम् this, सर्वः all, जनः people, दुःखानाम् for hardships, उचितः  are accustomed, त्वम् you, सुखोचितः are used to comfort, तस्य for Rama's, गुप्त्यर्थम् for the sake of protection, वयम् we, जागरिष्यामहे will stay awake.

86_5.shloka: नहि रामात्प्रियतरो ममास्ति भुवि कश्चन।मोत्सुकोऽभूर्ब्रवीम्येतदप्यसत्यं तवाग्रतः।।2.86.5।।
86_5.translation: To me, there is none on earth dearer than Rama. Do not have any anxiety. I am telling you the truth.
86_5.word_by_word: मम for me, भुवि on earth, रामात् more than Rama, प्रियतरः dearer, कश्चन none, नास्ति हि does not exist, अथ and, उत्सुकः anxious, मा भूः do not have, तव your, अग्रतः in presence, एतत् this, सत्यम् truthful, वाक्यम् words, ब्रवीमि I am telling.

86_6.shloka: अस्य प्रसादादाशंसे लोकेऽस्मिन् सुमहद्यशः।धर्मावाप्तिं च विपुलामर्थकामौ च केवलम्।।2.86.6।।
86_6.translation: By the grace of Rama, I want to acquire in this world great renown, abundance of righteousness, absolute artha (prosperity) and kama (pleasure).
86_6.word_by_word: अस्य this Rama's, प्रसादात् grace, अस्मिन् in this लोके world, सुमहत् great, यशः renown, विपुलाम् abundance of, धर्मावाप्तिं च advantage of righteousness, केवलम् solely, अर्थकामौ च  artha (prosperity) and kama (pleasure), आशंसे I desire.

86_7.shloka: सोऽहं प्रियसखं रामं शयानं सह सीतया।रक्षिष्यामि धनुष्पाणि स्सर्वै स्स्वैर्ज्ञातिभिस्सह।।2.86.7।।
86_7.translation: As for me, bow in hand and all my kinsmen with me, I shall protect my dear friend Rama who is resting with Sita.
86_7.word_by_word: सः अहं as for me, सर्वैः with all, स्वैः own, ज्ञातिभिः सह with relatives, सीतया सह along with Sita, शयानम् asleep, प्रियसखम् dear friend, रामम् to Rama, धनुष्पाणिः bow in hand, रक्षिष्यामि I will protect.

86_8.shloka: न हि मेऽविदितं किञ्चिद्वनेऽस्मिंश्चरत स्सदा।चतुरङ्गं ह्यपि बलं प्रसहेम वयं युधि।।2.86.8।।
86_8.translation: Nothing is unknown to me in this forest in which I range about continually. We can withstand an army of four divisions in a battle.
86_8.word_by_word: अस्मिन् वने in this forest, सदा always, चरतः ranging, मे to me, अविदितम् unknown, किञ्चित् nothing, न हि not, वयम् we, युधि in the battle, चतुरङ्गं बलम् अपि four divisions of the army also, प्रसहेम हि will withstand.

86_9.shloka: एवमस्माभिरुक्तेन लक्ष्मणेन महात्मना।अनुनीता वयं सर्वे धर्ममेवानुपश्यता।। 2.86.9।।
86_9.translation: The magnanimous Lakshmana, established in dharma, replied:
86_9.word_by_word: एवं thus, अस्माभिः by us, उक्तेन having been uttered, महात्मना by the  magnanimous, धर्ममेव virtuousness alone, अनुपश्यता seeing, लक्ष्मणेन by Lakshmana, वयम् we, सर्वे all, अनुनीताः  have been entreated.

86_10.shloka: कथं दाशरथौ भूमौ शयाने सह सीतया।शक्या निद्रा मया लब्धुं जीवितं वा सुखानि वा।।2.86.10।।
86_10.translation: While Rama sleep on the ground with Sita, how can I find sleep or joy or comfort?
86_10.word_by_word: दाशरथौ Rama, सीतया सह with Sita, भूमौ on the ground, शयाने while sleeping, मया by me,  निद्रा sleep, लब्धुम् to obtain, कथम् how, शक्या is it possible, जीवितं वा either life, सुखानि वा  or comforts.

86_11.shloka: यो न देवासुरैस्सर्वैश्शक्यः प्रसहितुं युधि।तं पश्य गुह संविष्टं तृणेषु सह सीतया।।2.86.11।।
86_11.translation: O Guha behold Rama, whom gods and demons combined cannot withstand in a battle now lying on a bed of grass with Sita.
86_11.word_by_word: गुह O Guha, यः that Rama, सर्वैः by all, देवासुरैः by gods and demons, युधि in battle, प्रसहितुं  to withstand, न शक्यः not possible, तम् him, सीतया सह with Sita, तृणेषु on the grass, संविष्टम् lying down, पश्य behold.

86_12.shloka: महता तपसा लब्धो विविधैश्च परिश्रमैः।एको दशरथस्यैष पुत्रस्सदृशलक्षणः।।2.86.12।।
86_12.translation: Rama is the only one among the sons who resembles his father in various virtues. Dasaratha obtained him after a great deal of austerities and efforts as well.
86_12.word_by_word: एषः this Rama, महता by great, तपसा with austerities, विविधैः by various, परिश्रमैश्च with   efforts as well, लब्धः was obtained, दशरथस्य Dasaratha's, एकः one, सदृशलक्षणः one with very similar virtues, पुत्रः is the son.

86_13.shloka: अस्मिन्प्रव्राजिते राजा न चिरं वर्तयिष्यति।विधवा मेदिनी नूनं क्षिप्रमेव भविष्यति।।2.86.13।।
86_13.translation: After Rama is exiled, king Dasaratha will not survive for long and surely the earth will soon be widowed.
86_13.word_by_word: अस्मिन् when he, प्रव्राजिते is exiled, राजा king Dasaratha, चिरम् for a long time, न वर्तयिष्यति will not survive, नूनम् surely, मेदिनी earth, क्षिप्रमेव soon, विधवा widow, भविष्यति will become.

86_14.shloka: विनद्य सुमहानादं श्रमेणोपरताः स्त्रियः।निर्घोषो विरतो नूनमध्य राजनिवेशने।।2.86.14।।
86_14.translation: The women of the inner apartment who lamented loudly, must have stopped weeping out of weariness. By now, the clamour in the king's palace would have surely subsided.
86_14.word_by_word: स्त्रियः women, सुमहानादम् loud sounds, विनद्य having cried, श्रमेण with exhaustion, उपरताः  have ceased, अद्य now, राजनिवेशने in the king's palace, निर्घोषः clamour, नूनम् surely, विरतः   has subsided.

86_15.shloka: कौसल्या चैव राजा च तथैव जननी मम।नाशंसे यदि जीवेयुस्सर्वे ते शर्वरीमिमाम्।।2.86.15।।
86_15.translation: I doubt whether the king, Kausalya and my mother Sumitra and the rest of them will outlive this night.
86_15.word_by_word: कौसल्या चैव even Kausalya, राजा च king also, तथैव in the same way, मम जननी my mother, ते सर्वे all of them, इमाम् this, रजनीम् night, यदि जीवेयुः if they are alive, नाशंसे I do not think.

86_16.shloka: जीवेदपि च मे माता शत्रुघ्नस्यान्ववेक्षया।दुःखिता या तु कौसल्या वीरसूर्विनशिष्यति।।2.86.16।।
86_16.translation: My mother might live, looking at Satrughna. But Kausalya, who is the mother of a hero, will die from extreme grief.
86_16.word_by_word: मे माता my mother, शत्रुघ्नस्य Satrughna's, अन्ववेक्षया looking at, जीवेदपि च might be alive, वीरसूः mother of a warrior, या कौसल्या that Kausalya, सा तु as for her, दुःखिता with extreme grief, विनशिष्यति will die.

86_17.shloka: अतिक्रान्तमतिक्रान्तमनवाप्य मनोरथम्।राज्ये राममनिक्षिप्य पिता मे विनशिष्यति।।2.86.17।।
86_17.translation: My father, king Dasaratha, failing to fulfil his cherished desires one after another and unable to place Rama on the throne, will pass away.
86_17.word_by_word: मे पिता my father, अतिक्रान्तम् अतिक्रान्तम् gone by one after another, मनोरथम् cherished desire, अनवाप्य without fulfilling, राज्ये in the kingdom, रामम् Rama, अनिक्षिप्य without placing, विनशिष्यति will pass away.

86_18.shloka: सिद्धार्थाः पितरं वृत्तं तस्मिन्काले ह्युपस्थिते।प्रेतकार्येषु सर्वेषु संस्करिष्यन्ति भूमिपम्।।2.86.18।।
86_18.translation: When the moment of death arrives for my father, those who perform the funeral rites for him would have fulfilled their desire.
86_18.word_by_word: तस्मिन्काले when that moment, उपस्थिते had arrived, वृत्तम् being in that state, पितरम् my father, भूमिपम् for the lord of the earth, सर्वेषु all, प्रेतकार्येषु in funeral rites, संस्करिष्यन्ति will perform, सिद्धार्थाः men who attained their purpose.

86_19.shloka: रम्यचत्वरसंस्थानां सुविभक्तमहापथाम्।हर्म्यप्रासादम्पन्नां सर्वरत्नविभूषिताम्।।2.86.19।।गजाश्वरथसंबाधां तूर्यनादविनादिताम्।सर्वकल्याणसंपूर्णां हृष्टपुष्टजनाकुलाम्।।2.86.20।।आरामोद्यानसंपूर्णां समाजोत्सवशालिनीम्।सुखिता विचरिष्यन्ति राजधानीं पितुर्मम।।2.86.21।।
86_19.translation: There in the capital of my father with its lovely crossroads and squares, welllaid  highways, full of mansions and palaces encrusted with all kinds of precious stones, teeming with elephants, horses and chariots, resounding with trumpets, and with wellbeing everywhere, and plenty of pleasuregardens, and parks and community festivals, people sound in health would be moving about in great comfort.
86_19.word_by_word: रम्यचत्वरसस्थानाम् with lovely crossroads and squares, सुविभक्तमहापथाम् welllaid  highways, हर्म्यप्रासादसंपन्नाम् full of mansions and palaces, सर्वरत्नविभूषिताम् encrusted with every kind of precious stone, गजाश्वरथसंबाधाम् full of elephants, horses and chariots, तूर्यनादविनादिताम् resounding with trumpets, सर्वकल्याणसंपूर्णाम् with universal wellbeing, हृष्टपुष्टजनाकुलाम् crowded with healthy people, आरामोद्यानसंपूर्णाम् with plenty of pleasuregardens and parks, समाजोत्सवशालिनीम् shining with community festivities, मम पितुः my father's, राजधानीम् capital (Ayodhya), सुखिताः with all comforts, विचरिष्यन्ति will move  about.

86_20.shloka: अपिसत्यप्रतिज्ञेन सार्धं कुशलिना वयं।निवृत्ते समये ह्यस्मिन् सुखिताः प्रविशेमहि।।2.86.22।।
86_20.translation: Can we ever reenter Ayodhya happily after safely fulfilling the vow and completing the term of exile?
86_20.word_by_word: वयं we, आस्मिन् in this, समये the time, निवृत्ते returning, सत्यप्रतिज्ञेन who fulfilled his vow, कुशलिना सार्धं along with him in safe condition, सुखिताः with happiness, अपि प्रविशेमहि will we enter Ayodhya?

86_21.shloka: परिदेवयमानस्य तस्यैवं सुमहात्मनः।तिष्ठतो राजपुत्रस्य शर्वरी साऽत्यवर्तत।।2.86.23।।
86_21.translation: While the highminded prince was lamenting this way and was waiting, the night passed off.
86_21.word_by_word: सुमहात्मनः of the highminded, एवं in this way, परिदेवयमानस्य lamenting so, तस्य राजपुत्रस्य that prince, तिष्ठतः while waiting, सा शर्वरी that night, अत्यवर्तत elapsed.

86_22.shloka: प्रभाते विमले सूर्ये कारयित्वा जटा उभौ।अस्मिन् भागीरथीतीरे सुखं सन्तारितौ मया।।2.86.24।।
86_22.translation: The next morning when the Sun shone bright, both of them matted their hair on the bank of the river Bhagirathi (Ganga) and I ferried them across comfortably.
86_22.word_by_word: विमले when bright, सूर्ये Sun, प्रभाते at dawn, उभौ both, आस्मिन् in this, भागीरथीतीरे on the bank of Bhagirathi, जटाः matting their hair, कारयित्वा made, मया by me, सुखम् comfortably, सन्तारितौ were ferried.

86_23.shloka: जटाधरौ तौ द्रुमचीरवाससौ महाबलौ कुञ्जरयूथपोपमौ।वरेषुचापासिधरौ परन्तपौ व्यपेक्षमाणौ सह सीतया गतौ।।2.86.25।।
86_23.translation: Rama and Lakshmana, slayers of enemies, who are as strong as bull elephants, with their hair matted, wearing robes made of bark, armed with excellent bows, arrows and swords went along with Sita looking around (vigilantly).इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे षडशीतितमस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the eightysixth sarga in Ayodhyakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
86_23.word_by_word: जटाधरौ wearing matted hair, द्रुमचीरवाससौ those two dressed in bark robes, महाबलौ of great strength, कुञ्जरयूथपोपमौ comparable to elephants, वरेषुचापासिधरौ armed with excellent bows, arrows and swords, तौ both, परन्तपौ slayers of enemies, व्यपेक्षमाणौ looking back alertly, सीतया सह along with Sita, गतौ went.

87_1.shloka: [Bharata enquires about Rama, Sita and Lakshmana -- Guha narrates to Kausalya how Rama, Sita and Lakshmana spent their time, matted their hair and slept on grass.]गुहस्य वचनं श्रुत्वा भरतो भृशमप्रियम्।ध्यानं जगाम तत्रैव यत्र तच्छ्रुतमप्रियम्।।2.87.1।।
87_1.translation: Extremely unhappy over what he heard from Guha, Bharata was immersed in thought then and there.
87_1.word_by_word: भरतः Bharata, भृशम् highly, अप्रियम् unpleasant, गुहस्य from Guha, वचनम् words, श्रुत्वा having heard, तत् अप्रियम् that unpleasant, यत्र wherever, श्रुतम् was heard, तत्रैव there only, ध्यानम्  thought, जगाम obtained.

87_2.shloka: सुकुमारो महासत्त्वस्सिंहस्कन्धो महाभुजः।पुण्डरीकविशालाक्ष स्तरुणः प्रियदर्शनः।।2.87.2।।प्रत्याश्वस्य मुहूर्तं तु कालं परमदुर्मनाः।पपात सहसा तोत्रैर्ह्यतिविद्ध इव द्विपः।।2.87.3।।
87_2.translation: The delicate, youthful, highly energetic and mightyarmed Bharata of graceful appearance, with shoulders like that of a lion and wideeyed like lotus petals, recovered for a moment and with a mind deeply distressed fell down at once like an elephant smitten by a goad.
87_2.word_by_word: सुकुमारः delicate, महासत्त्वः highly energetic, सिंहस्कन्धः with shoulders like that of a lion, महाभुजः mightyarmed, पुण्डरीकविशालाक्षः wideeyed like lotus petals, तरुणः youthful, प्रियदर्शनः of graceful appearance, मुहूर्तं कालं तु for a moment, प्रत्याश्वस्य having revived, परमदुर्मनाः with deeply distressed mind, तोत्रैः by whips, अतिविद्धः smitten, द्विपः इव like an elephant, सहसा at once, पपात fell down.

87_3.translation: Seeing Bharata in that state, Satrughna who was standing close by, smitten with grief clasped him, cried loudly and fell senseless.
87_3.word_by_word: अनन्तरस्थितः standing close by, शत्रुघ्नः Satrughna, तदवस्थम् in this state, भरतम् Bharata, परिष्यज्य having embraced, शोककर्शितः smitten with grief, विसंज्ञः having lost his senses,  उच्चैः loudly, रुरोद cried.

87_4.translation: Then Bharata's mothers, who were emaciated due to fasting and afflicted by the calamity of the death of their husband were desolate, rushed towards him.
87_4.word_by_word: ततः thereafter, उपवासकृशाः emaciated due to fasting, दीनाः desolate, भर्तृव्यसनकर्शिताः afflicted by the calamity of their husband's death, सर्वाः all, भरतस्य Bharata's, ताः मातरः  mothers, समापेतुः rushed towards him.

87_5.shloka: ताश्च तं पतितं भूमौ रुदन्त्यः पर्यवारयन्।कौसल्या त्वनुसृत्यैनं दुर्मनाः परिषस्वजे।।2.87.6।।
87_5.translation: Sobbing, they gathered around Bharata who had fallen on the ground, while Kausalya approached him in a depressed state and took him into her arms.
87_5.word_by_word: ताश्च all of them, रुदन्त्य: sobbing, भूमौ on the ground, पतितम् fallen, तम् him, पर्यवारयन् surrounded, कौसल्या तु as for Kausalya, दुर्मनाः in a depressed mind, अनुसृत्य approaching, एनम् that Bharata, परिषस्वजे took him into her arms.

87_6.shloka: वत्सला स्वं यथा वत्समुपगूह्य तपस्विनी।परिपप्रच्छ भरतं रुदन्ती शोकलालसा।।2.87.7।।
87_6.translation: Desolate Kausalya, in deep distress, clasped Bharata out of filial love as if he were her own child, wept and enquired of him:
87_6.word_by_word: शोकलालसा distressed in grief, तपस्विनी desolate, वत्सला with filial love, रुदन्ती weeping, स्वम् her own, वत्सं यथा like child, उपगूह्य clasping, भरतम् Bharata, परिपप्रच्छ enquired.

87_7.shloka: पुत्र व्याधिर्न ते कच्चिच्छरीरं परिबाधते।अद्य राजकुलस्यास्य त्वदधीनं हि जीवितम्।।2.87.8।।
87_7.translation: O son I hope you are not affected by illness. Now the existence of this royal house devolves on you.
87_7.word_by_word: पुत्र O son, व्याधिः illness, ते शरीरम् your body, कच्चित् न परिबाधते is not troubling, I hope, अद्य now, अस्य राजकुलस्य of this royal house, जीवितम् life, त्वदधीनं हि is dependent on you.

87_8.shloka: त्वां दृष्ट्वा पुत्र जीवामि रामे सभ्रातृकेगते।वृत्ते दशरथे राज्ञि नाथ एकस्त्वमद्य नः।।2.87.9।।
87_8.translation: O my son, with Rama gone to the forest along with your brother Lakshmana and with king Dasaratha departed from this world, I continue to live seeing you. From now on you alone are our sole protector.
87_8.word_by_word: पुत्र O son, सभ्रातृके along with your brother, Lakshmana, रामे Rama, गते having  gone, राज्ञि king, दशरथे Dasaratha, वृत्ते had departed, त्वाम् you, दृष्ट्वा seeing, जीवामि I am living, अद्य now, त्वम् you, एकः alone, नः for us, नाथः are protector.

87_9.shloka: कच्चिन्न लक्ष्मणे पुत्र श्रुतं ते किंचदप्रियम्।पुत्रे वाऽप्येकपुत्राया स्सहभार्ये वनं गते।।2.87.10।।
87_9.translation: O my son, I hope you have not heard any unpleasant news about Lakshmana orabout my only son Rama who has gone to the forest along with his wife.
87_9.word_by_word: पुत्र O son, लक्ष्मणे relating to Lakshmana, सहभार्ये with his wife, वनम् to the forest, गते had gone, एकपुत्रायाः of me having only one son, पुत्रे वा or relating to Rama, किंचित् even  little, अप्रियम् unpleasant news, ते to you, कच्चित् न श्रुतम् is not heard, I hope not.

87_10.shloka: स मुहूर्तं समाश्वस्य रुदन्नेव महायशाः।कौसल्यां परिसान्त्वेद्यं गुहं वचनमब्रवीत्।।2.87.11।।
87_10.translation: Highly renowned Bharata, composing himself for a moment and still weeping, reassured Kauslaya, and then said this to Guha:
87_10.word_by_word: महायशाः of great renown, सः that Bharata, मुहूर्तम् for a moment, समाश्वस्य composing himself, कौसल्याम् Kausalya, परिसान्त्वेद्यं reassuring, रुदन्नेव still weeping, गुहम् to Guha, वचनम् these words, अब्रवीत् said.

87_11.shloka: भ्राता मे क्वावसद्रात्रौ क्व सीता क्व च लक्ष्मणः।अस्वपच्छयने कस्मिन् किं भुक्त्वा गुह शंस मे।।2.87.12।।
87_11.translation: O Guha where did my brother Rama, Sita and Lakshmana spend that night? What did they eat? On what couch did they sleep? Tell me all that.
87_11.word_by_word: गुह O Guha, मे भ्राता my brother, रात्रौ in the night, क्व where, अवसत् did he dwell, सीता Sita, क्व where did she stay, लक्ष्मणः Lakshmana, क्व where did he stay, किम् what, भुक्त्वा  having eaten, कस्मिन् in which, शयने couch, अस्वपत् did he sleep, मे to me, शंस tell me.

87_12.shloka: सोऽब्रवीद्भरतं हृष्टो निषादाधिपतिर्गुहः।यद्विधं प्रतिपेदे च रामे प्रियहितेऽतिथौ।।2.87.13।।
87_12.translation: Thereupon delighted Guha, overlord of the nishadas, told Bharata all that he had provided to Rama, his beloved friend and guest:
87_12.word_by_word: निषादाधिपतिः overlord of the nishadas, सः गुहः that Guha, हृष्टः delighted, प्रियहिते belovedfriend, अतिथौ guest, रामे relating to Rama, यद्विधम् in whatever way, प्रतिपेदे all that he had  provided, भरतम् to Bharata, अब्रवीत् said.

87_13.shloka: अन्नमुच्चावचं भक्षाः फलानि विविधानि च।रामायाभ्यवहारार्थं बहुचोपहृतं मया।।2.87.14।।
87_13.translation: I offered Rama rice including a variety of eatables like fruits in great quantity for his food.
87_13.word_by_word: मया by me, रामाय to Rama, अभ्यवहारार्थम् for the purpose of meal, उच्चावचम् of various kinds, अन्नम् rice, भक्षाः eatables, विविधानि of several kinds, फलानि च fruits also, बहु in great quantity, उपहृतम् was brought.

87_14.shloka: तत्सर्वं प्रत्यनुज्ञासीद्राम स्सत्यपराक्रमः।न तु तत्प्रत्यगृह्णात्स क्षत्रधर्ममनुस्मरन्।।2.87.15।।
87_14.translation: Rama whose prowess is his truth, acknowledged all that but remembering the duty enjoined on a kshatriya did not accept them.
87_14.word_by_word: सत्यपराक्रमः a man with truth as prowess, रामः Rama, तत्सर्वम् all that, प्रत्यनुज्ञासीत् acknowledged ordered, सः he, क्षत्रधर्मम् the duty of a kshatriya, अनुस्मरन् remembering, तत् all that, न तु प्रत्यगृह्णात् did not accept it.

87_15.shloka: न ह्यस्माभिः प्रतिग्राह्यं सखे देयं तु सर्वदा।इति तेन वयं राजन्ननुनीता महात्मना।।2.87.16।।
87_15.translation: O king that great Rama entreated us in a friendly manner by saying 'O friend we should always give to others but should never accept anything from others'.
87_15.word_by_word: राजन् O king, सखे O friend, आस्माभिः by us, न प्रतिग्राह्यम् should not be received, सर्वदा always, देयम् should be given, इति thus, महात्मना by the great, तेन by him, वयम् we, अनुनीताः were entreated.

87_16.shloka: लक्ष्मणेन समानीतं पीत्वा वारि महायशाः।औपवास्यं तदाऽकार्षीद्राघवस्सह सीतया।।2.87.17।।
87_16.translation: Illustrious Rama along with Sita only drank the water brought by Lakshamana and  undertook fasting.
87_16.word_by_word: महायशाः the illustrious one, राघवः Rama, तदा then, लक्ष्मणेन by Lakshmana, समानीतम् brought by, वारि water, सीतया सह with Sita, पीत्वा after drinking, औपवास्यम् fasting, अकार्षीत्  undertook.

87_17.shloka: ततस्तु जलशेषेण लक्ष्मणोऽप्यकरोत्तदा।वाग्यतास्ते त्रय स्सन्ध्यां समुपासत संहिताः।।2.87.18।।
87_17.translation: Thereafter Lakshmana also drank the remainder of water. Then all the three observing silence intently performed the evening worship.
87_17.word_by_word: ततः तु thereafter, तदा then, लक्ष्मणोऽपि Lakshmana also, जलशेषेण with the remainder of the water, अकरोत् satisfied his hunger, ते त्रयः those three, वाग्यताः observing silence, संहिताः intently, सन्ध्याम् evening worship, समुपासत performed.

87_18.shloka: सौमित्रिस्तु ततः पश्चादकरोत्स्वास्तरं शुभम्।स्वयमानीय बर्हींषि क्षिप्रं राघवकारणात्।।2.87.19।।
87_18.translation: Therafter, the son of Sumitra (Lakshmana) himself fetched darbha grass and quicklyprepared an auspicious and comfortable bed for Rama.
87_18.word_by_word: ततः पश्चात् thereafter, सौमित्रिस्तु son of Sumitra on his part, स्वयम् himself, बर्हींषि darbha grass, आनीय having brought, राघवकारणात् for the sake of Rama, क्षिप्रम् quickly, शुभम् auspicious, स्वास्तरम् comfortable bed, अकरोत् prepared.

87_19.shloka: तस्मिन्समाविशद्राम स्स्वास्तरे सह सीतया।प्रक्षाल्य च तयोः पादावपचक्राम लक्ष्मणः।।2.87.20।।
87_19.translation: Rama lay down upon the bed along with Sita. Thereafter Lakshmana, having washed their feet, moved to a distant place.
87_19.word_by_word: रामः Rama, तस्मिन् on that, स्वास्तरे bed, सीतया सह with Sita, समाविशत् lay down, लक्ष्मणः Lakshmana,  तयोः their, पादौ feet, प्रक्षाल्य having washed, अपचक्राम left for a distant place.

87_20.shloka: एतत्तदिङ्गुदीमूलमिदमेव च तत्तृणम्।यस्मिन्रामश्च सीता च रात्रिं तां शयितावुभौ।।2.87.21।।
87_20.translation: Here at the foot of the ingudi tree and upon that bed of grass both Rama and Sita rested that night.
87_20.word_by_word: रामश्च Rama as well as, सीता Sita, उभौ both, तां रात्रिम् that night, यस्मिन् where, शयितौ slept, तत् that, इंगुदीमूलम् foot of the ingudi tree, एतत् this only, तत् that, तृणं च grass bed, इदमेव this one only.

87_21.shloka: नियम्य पृष्ठे तु तलाङ्गुलित्रवान् शरैस्सुपूर्णाविषुधी परन्तपः।महाद्धनु स्सज्यमुपोह्य लक्ष्मणो निशामतिष्ठत्परितोऽस्य केवलम्।।2.87.22।।
87_21.translation: Lakshmana, the scorcher of enemies, wearing protective covering for his palms and fingers (made of gohaskin), strapping on his back two quivers filled with arrows,holding a great bow, strung ready, stood sentinel throughout the night guarding the surrounding.
87_21.word_by_word: परन्तपः scorcher of enemies, लक्ष्मणः Lakshmana, तलाङ्गुलित्रवान् wearing protective covering for his palms and fingers (made of gohaskin), शरैः arrows, सुपूर्णौ filled with,  इषुधी two quivers, पृष्ठे on his back, नियम्य strapping, सज्यम् furnished with string, महत् great, धनुः bow, उपोह्य holding, निशाम् during that night, अस्य Rama's, परितः  surrounding, अतिष्ठत् केवलम् stood throughout.

87_22.shloka: तत स्त्वहंचोत्तमबाणचापधृत् स्थितोऽभवं तत्र स यत्र लक्ष्मणः।अतन्द्रितैर्ज्ञातिभिरात्तकार्मुकैर्महेन्द्रकल्पं परिपालयंस्तदा।।2.87.23।।
87_22.translation: Then, holding the best of arrows and bow along with my indefatigable kinsmen similarly armed with bows, I stood by the side of Lakshmana guarding Rama who is comparable to Indra.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे सप्ताशीतितमस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the eightyseventh sarga in Ayodhyakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
87_22.word_by_word: ततः thereafter, अहं तु as for me, तदा then, उत्तमबाणचापधृत् holding the best of arrows and bow, अतन्द्रितैः with the indefatigable, आत्तकार्मुकैः armed with bows, ज्ञातिभिः with my kinsmen, महेन्द्रकल्पम् comparable to Indra, परिपालयन् while protecting, लक्ष्मणः Lakshmana, यत्र wherever, तत्र there, स्थितः अभवम् remained standing.
