88_1.shloka: [Guha relates to Bharata about Rama's life in the forest contrary to the life in Ayodhya.]तच्छ्रुत्वा निपुणं सर्वं भरत स्सह मन्त्रिभिः।इङ्गुदीमूलमागम्य रामशय्यामवेक्ष्य ताम्।।2.88.1।।अब्रवीज्जननी स्सर्वा इह तेन महात्मना।शर्वरी शयिता भूमाविदमस्य विमर्दितम्।।2.88.2।।
88_1.translation: After listening to all that Guha had said, Bharatha reached the foot of the ingudi tree accompanied by his ministers and gazing at Rama's bed, said to all his mothers the magnanimous Rama rested that night here on this ground in that crushed bed.
88_1.word_by_word: भरतः Bharata, तत् सर्वम् all that, निपुणम् attentively, श्रुत्वा having listened, मन्त्रिभिस्सह along with ministers, इङ्गुदीमूलम् to the foot of the ingudi tree, आगम्य having reached, ताम्  रामशय्याम् that Rama's bed, अवेक्ष gazing, सर्वाः all, जननीः mothers, अब्रवीत् said, तेन महात्मना by that magnanimous, Rama, इह here, भूमौ on the ground, शर्वरी night, शयिता has been slept, अस्य his, विमर्दितम् crushed bed, इदम् this one.

88_2.shloka: तच्छ्रुत्वा निपुणं सर्वं भरत स्सह मन्त्रिभिः।इङ्गुदीमूलमागम्य रामशय्यामवेक्ष्य ताम्।।2.88.1।।अब्रवीज्जननी स्सर्वा इह तेन महात्मना।शर्वरी शयिता भूमाविदमस्य विमर्दितम्।।2.88.2।।
88_2.translation: After listening to all that Guha had said, Bharatha reached the foot of the ingudi tree accompanied by his ministers and gazing at Rama's bed, said to all his mothers the magnanimous Rama rested that night here on this ground in that crushed bed.
88_2.word_by_word: भरतः Bharata, तत् सर्वम् all that, निपुणम् attentively, श्रुत्वा having listened, मन्त्रिभिस्सह along with ministers, इङ्गुदीमूलम् to the foot of the ingudi tree, आगम्य having reached, ताम्  रामशय्याम् that Rama's bed, अवेक्ष gazing, सर्वाः all, जननीः mothers, अब्रवीत् said, तेन महात्मना by that magnanimous, Rama, इह here, भूमौ on the ground, शर्वरी night, शयिता has been slept, अस्य his, विमर्दितम् crushed bed, इदम् this one.

88_3.shloka: महाभागकुलीनेन महाभागेन धीमता।जातो दशरथेनोर्व्यां न रामस्स्वप्तु मर्हति।।2.88.3।।
88_3.translation: Rama, son of highly fortunate and sagacious Dasaratha, born of a noble lineage does not deserve to rest on this naked earth.
88_3.word_by_word: महाभागकुलीनेन by the highborn, महाभागेन by a highly fortunate man, धीमता by the sagacious, दशरथेन by Dasaratha, जातः born, रामः Rama, उर्व्याम् on the naked earth, स्वप्तुम् to sleep, न अर्हति does not deserve.

88_4.shloka: अजिनोत्तरसंस्तीर्णे वरास्तरणसंचये।शयित्वा पुरुषव्याघ्रः कथं शेते महीतले।।2.88.4।।
88_4.translation: How could Rama, the best among men used to a bed made of a pile of excellent spreads and overspread with deer skin, sleep on the bare ground?
88_4.word_by_word: पुरुषव्याघ्रः best among men, Rama, अजिनोत्तरसंस्तीर्णे on over spreads of deer skin,          वरास्तरणसंचये on bed made of a pile of excellent spreads, शयित्वा used to sleep, महीतले on the ground, कथम् how, शेते can sleep?

88_5.shloka: प्रासादाग्रविमानेषु वलभीषु च सर्वदा।हैमराजतभौमेषु वरास्तरणशालिषु।।2.88.5।।पुष्पसञ्चयचित्रेषु चन्दनागरुगन्धिषु।पाण्डुराभ्रप्रकाशेषु शुकसङ्घरूतेषुच।।2.88.6।।प्रासादवरवर्येषु शीतवत्सु सुगन्धिषु।उषित्वामेरुकल्पेषु कृतकाञ्चन भित्तिषु।।2.88.7।।गीतवादित्रनिर्घोषैर्वराभरणनिस्स्वनैः।मृदङ्गवरशब्दैश्च सततं प्रतिबोधितः।।2.88.8।।वन्दिभिर्वन्दितः काले बहुभि स्सूतमागधैः।गाथाभिरनुरूपाभि स्स्तुतिभिश्च परन्तपः।।2.88.9।।
88_5.translation: Rama, scorcher of enemies, one who was accostomed to dwell in the attic of sevenstoreyed mansions with floors paved with gold, and silver, spread with excellent carpets, decked with bouquets of flowers and perfumed with sandal and agaru. The peaks of those palaces were bright like towering white clouds and echoed with cries of  parrots. They were cool and fragrant with perfumes. The marvellous palaces made of golden walls are comparable to mount Meru. He used to wake up to the sounds of songs and musical instruments, the tinkling of finest ornaments and the splendid sounds of the drums. Many bards, genealogists and panegyrists singing befitting ballads and extolling his virtues at appropriate time used to salute him in reverence (Bharata lamented).
88_5.word_by_word: परन्तपः scorcher of enemies, (सः that Rama), सर्वदा always, प्रासादाग्रविमानेषु वलभीषु च in the attic of the sevenstoreyed mansion, हैमराजतभौमेषु the floors paved with gold and silver, वरास्तरणशालिषु spread with excellent carpets, पुष्पसंचयचित्रेषु decked with bouquets of flowers, चन्दनागरुगन्धिषु perfumed with sandal and agaru, पाण्डुराभ्रप्रकाशेषु brightness like white clouds, शुकसङ्घरुतेषु च echoed with cries of flocks of parrots, शीतवत्सु cool,सुगन्धिषु in places fragrant with perfumes, कृतकाञ्चनभित्तिषु surrounded by goldplated walls, मेरुकल्पेषु like mount Meru, प्रासादवरवर्येषु in the best of mansions, उषित्वा having dwelt, गीतवादित्रनिर्घोषैः with the sounds of songs and musical instruments, वराभरणनिस्वनैः with the tinkling of ornaments, मृदङ्गवरशब्दैश्च and with excellent sounds of drums, (तत्र there), प्रतिबोधितः awakened, बहुभिः by many, सूतमागधैः bards and genealogists, वन्दिभिः by the panegyrists  गाथाभिः with ballads, अनुरूपाभिः by worthy, स्तुतिभिश्च by songs of praise, काले at appointed time, वन्दितः saluted in reverence.

88_6.shloka: अश्रद्धेयमिदं लोके न सत्यं प्रतिभाति मा।मुह्यते खलु मे भाव स्स्वप्नोऽयमिति मे मतिः।।2.88.10।।
88_6.translation: It is unbelievable that such a thing has happened to Rama in this world. It does not seem real to me and looks appears like a dream and my mind is bewildered.
88_6.word_by_word: लोके in the world, इदम् this, अश्रद्धेयम् can not be believed, सत्यम् truly, मा to me, न प्रतिभाति does not appear, मे my, भावः thought (mind), मुह्यते खलु is bewildered, अयम् this, स्वप्नः इति like a dream, मे my, मतिः thinking.

88_7.shloka: न नूनं दैवतं किंचित्कालेन बलवत्तरम्।यत्र दाशरथी रामो भूमावेव शयीत सः।।2.88.11।।
88_7.translation: Dasaratha's son, Rama had to rest on the ground would admittedly mean that no divine power is mightier than Time (Destiny).
88_7.word_by_word: दैवतम् divine power, कालेन in course of time, किंचित् even a little, बलवत्तरम् more strong, न not, नूनम् surely, यत्र where, सः दाशरथि: that Dasaratha's son, रामः Rama, भूमावेव on the ground itself, शयीत had to sleep.

88_8.shloka: विदेहराजस्य सुता सीता च प्रियदर्शना।दयिता शयिता भूमौ स्नुषा दशरथस्य च।।2.88.12।।
88_8.translation: Sita, daughter of Janaka, king of Videha, and beloved daughterinlaw of Dasaratha who caused delight to the beholder, too had to rest on the bare ground.
88_8.word_by_word: विदेहराजस्य king of Videha, सुता daughter, प्रियदर्शना one who causes delight to the beholder, दशरथस्य Dasaratha's, दयिता beloved, स्नुषा च daughterinlaw also, सीता च Sita too, भूमौ on the ground, शयिता rested.

88_9.shloka: इयं शय्या मम भ्रातुरिदं हि परिवर्तितम्।स्थण्डिले कठिने सर्वं गात्रै र्विमृदितं तृणम्।।2.88.13।।
88_9.translation: This is my brother's couch and it is here where he had tossed about. The grass spread on this hard surface is crushed by his limbs.
88_9.word_by_word: इयम् this, मम भ्रातुः my brother's, शय्या couch, इदम् here, परिवर्तितं हि tossed about, कठिने on a hard, स्थण्डिले earth, सर्वम् entire, तृणम् grass, गात्रैः by his limbs, विमृदितम् is crushed.

88_10.shloka: मन्ये साभरणा सुप्ता सीताऽस्मिञ्छयनोत्तमे।तत्र तत्र हि दृश्यन्ते सक्ताः कनकबिन्दवः।।2.88.14।।
88_10.translation: Some particles of gold dust are seen stuck to this bed here and there. I think Sita might have rested on this excellent bed with all her jewellery.
88_10.word_by_word: सीता Sita, अस्मिन् this, शयनोत्तमे on excellent bed, साभरणा with her jewellery, सुप्ता must have slept, मन्ये I think, तत्र तत्र here and there, सक्ताः stuck to, कनकबिन्दवः particles of gold dust, दृश्यन्ते are seen.

88_11.shloka: उत्तरीयमिहाऽसक्तं सुव्यक्तं सीतया तदा।तथा ह्येते प्रकाशन्ते सक्ताः कौशेयतन्तवः।।2.88.15।।
88_11.translation: That the upper garment of Sita might have been caught here is well evident from the shining silken threads stuck.
88_11.word_by_word: तदा then, सीतया by Sita, उत्तरीयम् upper garment, इह here, आसक्तम् had been, सुव्यक्तम् is  is well evident, तथाहि as for instance, सक्ताः stuck, एते कौशेयतन्तवः these silken threads, प्रकाशन्ते are shining.

88_12.shloka: मन्ये भर्तु स्सुखा शय्या येन बाला तपस्विनी।सुकुमारी सती दुःखं न हि विजानाति मैथिली।।2.88.16।।
88_12.translation: Hapless Sita is young and delicate. Being a chaste lady, she, even in these (adverse) circumstances, does not feel the brunt. Hence, maybe she thinks her husbands' (hard) bed comfortable to her.
88_12.word_by_word: येन for what reason, बाला the young lady, तपस्विनी unfortunate, सुकुमारी delicate lady, सती chaste lady, मैथिली Sita, दुःखम् suffering, न हि (वि)जानाति does not know, for that reason,भर्तुः husband's, शय्या bed, सुखा comfortable, मन्ये I think.

88_13.shloka: हा हन्ताऽस्मि नृशंसोऽहं यत्सभार्यः कृते मम।ईदृशीं राघवश्शय्यामधिशेते ह्यनाथवत्।।2.88.17।।
88_13.translation: Alas, what suffering Because of a cruel man like me Rama along with his spouse was condemned to recline upon such bed like an orphan.
88_13.word_by_word: हा हन्त Alas, what a difficulty, अहम् I, नृशंसः अस्मि I have been cruel, यत् since, मम कृते  because of me, राघवः Rama, सभार्यः with his spouse, अनाथवत् like an orphan, ईदृशीम् such, शय्याम् bed, अधिशेते is reclining upon.

88_14.shloka: सार्वभौमकुले जात स्सर्वलोकस्य सम्मतः।सर्वलोकप्रियस्त्यक्त्वा राज्यं सुखमनुत्तम्।।2.88.18।।कथमिन्दीवरश्यामो रक्ताक्षः प्रियदर्शनः।सुखभागी न दुःखार्ह श्शयितो भुवि राघवः।।2.88.19।।
88_14.translation: How could such Rama sleep on the ground? He was born in the house of emperors, worthy of reverence by the entire world and beloved of all the worlds, with the complexion of a blue lotus, with red eyes, and pleasing looks, one who deserves to be happy and not to suffer by renouncing the kingdom and excellent comforts.
88_14.word_by_word: सार्वभौमकुले in the house of emperors, जातः was born, सर्वलोकस्य of the entire world, सम्मतः worthy of reverence, सर्वलोकप्रियः beloved of all the worlds, इन्दीवरश्यामः with the complexion of a blue lotus, रक्ताक्षः of reddened eyes, प्रियदर्शनः pleasing to look, सुखभागी worthy of happiness, न दुःखार्हः does not deserve suffering, राघवः Rama, राज्यम् kingdom, अनुत्तमम् excellent, सुखम् comforts, त्यक्त्वा having given up, भुवि on this ground, कथम् how, शयितः did he sleep?

88_15.shloka: धन्यः खलु महाभागो लक्ष्मण श्शुभलक्षणः।भ्रातरं विषमे काले यो राममनुवर्तते।।2.88.20।।
88_15.translation: Surely Lakshmana of great merit and auspicious virtues is fortunate since he is accompanying his brother Rama in times of adversity.
88_15.word_by_word: यः that, विषमे in adverse, काले times, भ्रातरम् brother, रामम् Rama, अनुवर्तते is accompanying, शुभलक्षणः a man of auspicious virtues, महाभागः a great man, लक्ष्मणः Lakshmana, धन्यः खलु is indeed fortunate.

88_16.shloka: सिद्धार्था खलु वैदेही पतिं याऽनुगता वनम्।वयं संशयिता स्सर्वे हीनास्तेन महात्मना।।2.88.21।।
88_16.translation: Sita has, indeed, accomplished her object by accompanying her husband (to the forest). Bereft of that magnanimous Rama, all of us are in doubt (if he will accept our services).
88_16.word_by_word: या that Sita, वनम् to the forest, पतिम् husband, अनुगता had followed, वैदेही Sita, सिद्धार्था खलु has surely acomplished her object, महात्मना by the magnanimous, तेन by that Rama, हीनाः bereft of, वयम् we, सर्वे all, संशयिताः are full of doubts.

88_17.shloka: आकर्णधारा पृथिवी नौः इव प्रतिभाति मा।गते दशरथे स्वर्गं रामे चारण्यमाश्रिते।।2.88.22।।
88_17.translation: King Dasaratha having ascended to heaven and Rama taken shelter in the forest, this kingdom appears to me like a ship without a helmsman.
88_17.word_by_word: दशरथे Dasaratha, स्वर्गम् to heaven, गते having ascended, रामे च when Rama too, अरण्यम् forest, आश्रिते having taken shelter, पृथिवी earth, आकर्णधारा without helmsman, नौः इव like a ship, मा to me, प्रतिभाति appears.

88_18.shloka: न च प्रार्थयते कच्चिन्मनसापि वसुन्धराम्।वनेऽपि वसतस्तस्य बाहुवीर्याभिरक्षिताम्।।2.88.23।।
88_18.translation: No one, even in thought, would ever desire this kingdom, protected by the strength of his arms even while residing in the forest.
88_18.word_by_word: वने in the forest, वसतः अपि though residing, तस्य his, बाहुवीर्याभिरक्षिताम् protected by the might of his arms, वसुन्धराम् this earth, कश्चित् none, मनसापि even in thought, न च प्रार्थयते does not desire.

88_19.translation: Now the gates of our capital city (Ayodhya) are wide open. The city is unprotected and endangered. There are no guards to keep vigil over the ramparts. The horses and elephants are not in control (hence unprepared for battle). The army is unhappy and demoralised. At this state even the enemies will not like to seize the city, they will shun it like food mixed with poison.
88_19.word_by_word: शून्यसंवरणारक्षां without guards to keep vigil over the ramparts, अयन्त्रितहयद्विपाम् with horses and elephants are not in control, अपावृतपुरद्वाराम् with the city gates kept wide open, अरक्षिताम् unprotected, अप्रहृष्टबलाम् unhappy army, शून्याम् empty (demoralised), विषमस्थाम् in dire difficulties, अनावृताम् wide open, राजधानीम् the capital city (Ayodhya), शत्रवः enemies, विषकृतान् mixed with poison, भक्षानिव like food, नाभिमन्यन्ते will not think of.

88_20.shloka: अद्यप्रभृति भूमौ तु शयिष्येऽहं तृणेषु वा।फलमूलाशनो नित्यं जटाचीराणि धारयन्।।2.88.26।।
88_20.translation: From today onwards, wearing matted hair and clad in robes made of bark and living on fruits and roots, I too shall sleep on the naked ground or on grass.
88_20.word_by_word: अद्य प्रभृति from today, अहम् I, जटाचीराणि matted hair and robes made of bark, धारयन् wearing, नित्यम् always, फलमूलाशनः eating fruits and roots, भूमौ तु on the ground itself, तृणेषु वा or on the grass, शयिष्ये I will sleep.

88_21.shloka: तस्यार्थमुत्तरं कालं निवत्स्यामि सुखं वने।तं प्रतिश्रवमामुच्य नास्य मिथ्या भविष्यति।।2.88.27।।
88_21.translation: Taking upon myself the vow of Rama, I too shall live in the forest cheerfully for the rest of the term on behalf of him so that his vow shall not prove untrue.
88_21.word_by_word: तम् Rama's, प्रतिश्रवम् vow, आमुच्य casting on me, उत्तरं कालम् the rest of his term (of exile), तस्य अर्थम् on account of him, वने in the forest, सुखम् cheerfully, निवत्स्यामि shall dwell, अस्य his vow, मिथ्या untrue, न भविष्यति shall not become.

88_22.shloka: वसन्तं भ्रातुरर्थाय शत्रुघ्नो माऽनुवत्स्यति।लक्ष्मणेन सहत्वार्यो ह्ययोध्यां पालयिष्यति।।2.88.28।।
88_22.translation: As I live in the forest on behalf of my brother Rama, Satrughna will live with me. My esteemed brother Rama will rule Ayodhya along with Lakshmana.
88_22.word_by_word: शत्रुघ्नः Satrughna, भ्रातुः अर्थाय on behalf of my  brother Rama, वसन्तम् living (in the forest), मा me, अनुवत्स्यति will live by following me, आर्यः esteemed brother, लक्ष्मणेन सह along with Lakshmana, अयोध्याम् Ayodhya, पालयिष्यति हि will rule.

88_23.shloka: अभिषेक्ष्यन्ति काकुत्स्थमयोध्यायां द्विजातयः।अपि मे देवताः कुर्युरिमं सत्यं मनोरथम्।।2.88.29।।
88_23.translation: In Ayodhya the brahmins shall coronate Rama. Will the gods make this desire of mine true?
88_23.word_by_word: द्विजातयः brahmins, काकुत्स्थम् to Rama, अयोध्यायाम् in Ayodhya, अभिषेक्ष्यन्ति will crown him, देवताः gods, इमम् this, मे my, मनोरथम् desire, सत्यम् as true, अपि कुर्युः will they make it?

88_24.shloka: प्रसाद्यमान श्शिरसा मया स्वयं बहुप्रकारं यदि नाभिपत्स्यते।ततोऽनुवत्स्यामि चिराय राघवम् वनेचरन्नार्हति मामुपेक्षितुम्।।2.88.30।।
88_24.translation: I will seek his grace in many ways by bowing down my head. Even then if Rama does not grant my wish, I shall also live with him as long as it takes. He will not be able to ignore a forester like me.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे अष्टाशीतितमस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the eightyeigth sarga in Ayodhyakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
88_24.word_by_word: मया by me, स्वयम् personally, बहुप्रकारम् in many ways, शिरसा bowing down my head, प्रसाद्यमानः seeking his grace, न प्रपत्स्यते यदि if it is not granted, ततः then, वने चरन् living in the forest, राघवम् Rama, चिराय for a long time, अनुवत्स्यामि will live along him, माम् me, उपेक्षितुम् to ignore, नार्हति he cannot.

89_1.shloka: [Guha ferries Bharata, Satrughna and all others across Ganga -- Bharata sets out to meet sage Bharadwaja.]उष्य रात्रिं तु तत्रैव गङ्गाकूले स राघवः।भरतः काल्यमुत्थाय शत्रुघ्नमिदमब्रवीत्।।2.89.1।।
89_1.translation: Bharata got up at daybreak after spending the night on the bank of the Ganga at that very place where Rama, the descendent of Raghu, had stayed. And said these words to Satrughna:
89_1.word_by_word: राघवः born in the race of Raghu, सः भरतः that Bharata, तत्र there, गङ्गाकूले एव on the bank of the river Ganga only, रात्रिम् night, उष्य having stayed, काल्यम् at daybreak, उत्थाय rising, शत्रुघ्नम् Satrughna, इदम् these words, अब्रवीत् spoke.

89_2.shloka: शत्रुघ्नोत्तिष्ठ किं शेषे निषादाधिपतिं गुहम्।शीघ्रमानय भद्रं ते तारयिष्यति वाहिनीम्।।2.89.2।।
89_2.translation: O Satrughna, blessings to you Why are you still alseep? Arise fetch Guha the king of the nishadas quickly. He will ferry the army across the river.
89_2.word_by_word: शत्रुघ्न Satrughna, उत्तिष्ठ arise, किम् why, शेषे are you asleep, ते for you, भद्रम् blessings to you, निषादाधिपतिम् overlord of Nishada, गुहम् Guha, शीघ्रम् quickly, आनय fetch, वाहिनीम् the army, तारयिष्यति he will help us in ferrying across.

89_3.shloka: जागर्मि नाहं स्वपिमि तमेवाऽर्यं विचिन्तयन्।इत्येवमब्रवीद्भ्रात्ता शत्रुघ्नोऽपि प्रचोदितः।।2.89.3।।
89_3.translation: Urged by his brother Bharata, Satrughna replied 'I am not asleep. I am awake. I am deeply thinking of our esteemed brother, Rama'
89_3.word_by_word: भ्राता the brother, शत्रुघ्नोऽपि Satrughna also, प्रचोदितः having been urged upon, अहम् I, तम् that, आर्यम् एव about esteemed brother Rama only, विचिन्तयन् thinking about, जागर्मि I amawake, न स्वपिमि not sleeping, इत्येवम् in this way, अब्रवीत् said.

89_4.shloka: इति संवदतोरेवमन्योन्यं नरसिंहयोः।आगम्य प्राञ्जलिः काले गुहो भरतमब्रवीत्।।2.89.4।।
89_4.translation: While the two lions among men, Bharata and Satrughna were thus conversing with each other, Guha came in the appropriate time and said to Bharata with folded palms:
89_4.word_by_word: नरसिंहयोः lions among men, Bharata and Satrughna, इत्येवम् in this way, अन्योन्यम् with one another, संवदतोः while both of them were conversing, गुहः Guha, काले at appropriate time, आगम्य having arrived, प्राञ्जलिः with folded palms, भरतम् to Bharata, अब्रवीत् said.

89_5.shloka: कच्चित्सुखं नदीतीरेऽवात्सीः काकुत्स्थ शर्वरीम्।कच्चित्ते सह सैन्यस्य तावत्सर्वमनामयम्।।2.89.5।।
89_5.translation: O scion of the Kakutstha race (Bharata) I trust, you and your army passed the night on the river bank comfortably without any inconvenience.
89_5.word_by_word: काकुत्थ्स O scion of the Kakutstha race (Bharata), शर्वरीम् night, नदीतीरे on the bank of the river, सुखम् comfortably, कच्चित् वात्सीः you had passed, I hope, सह सैन्यस्य along with the army, ते to you, सर्वम् all, अनामयं तावत् कच्चित् there was no inconvenience, I trust.

89_6.shloka: गुहस्य वचनं श्रुत्वा तत्तु स्नेहादुदीरितम्।रामस्यानुवशो वाक्यं भरतोऽपीदमब्रवीत्।।2.89.6।।
89_6.translation: On hearing Guha's affectionate words Bharata, ever obedient to Rama, replied:
89_6.word_by_word: रामस्य of Rama, अनुवशः obedient, भरतोऽपि Bharata too, स्नेहात् out of affection, उदीरितम् uttered, तत् that, गुहस्य Guha's, वचनम् words, श्रुत्वा on hearing, इदं वाक्यम् these words, अब्रवीत् said.

89_7.shloka: सुखा न श्शर्वरी राजन् पूजिताश्चापि ते वयम्।गङ्गां तु नौभिर्बह्वीभिर्दाशास्सन्तारयन्तु नः।।2.89.7।।
89_7.translation: O king (Guha) the night passed comfortably for us. We have been honoured by you in many ways. Let your fishermen be ordered to ferry us across the Ganga in their boats.
89_7.word_by_word: राजन् O king, नः for us, शर्वरी the night, सुखा comfortable, वयम् we, ते to (by) you, पूजिताश्चापि have been honoured, दाशाः fishermen, बह्वीभिः by many, नौभिः boats, नः us, गङ्गाम् the river Ganga, सन्तारयन्तु please, ferry us across.

89_8.shloka: ततो गुह स्सन्त्वरितं श्रुत्वा भरतशासनम्।प्रति प्रविश्य नगरं तं ज्ञातिजनमब्रवीत्।।2.89.8।।
89_8.translation: Then at Bharata's command Guha returned to his habitation quickly and said to his relations:
89_8.word_by_word: ततः then, गुहः Guha, सन्त्वरितम् quickly, भरतशासनम् at Bharata's command, श्रुत्वा having heard, नगरम् his establishment, प्रति प्रविश्य having entered, तम् that, ज्ञातिजनम् to his relations, अब्रवीत् said.

89_9.shloka: उत्तिष्ठत प्रबुध्यध्वं भद्रमस्तु च वस्सदा।नाव स्समनुकर्षध्वं तारयिष्याम वाहिनीम्।।2.89.9।।
89_9.translation: Arise and awake. May you be ever blessed. Haul down the boats into the river. We have to ferry the army (across the river).
89_9.word_by_word: उत्तिष्ठत arise, प्रबुध्यध्वम् awake, सदा always, वः भद्रम् अस्तु be blessed, नावः the boats, समनुकर्षध्वम् haul down, वाहिनीम् the army, तारयिष्याम we shall ferry them across.

89_10.shloka: ते तथोक्ता स्समुत्थाय त्वरिता राजशासनात्।पञ्चनावां शतान्याशु समानिन्युस्समन्ततः।।2.89.10।।
89_10.translation: On hearing these words, they arose in haste and immediately brought five hundred boats from every direction in accordance with the command of their king (Guha).
89_10.word_by_word: तथा thus, उक्ताः addressed, ते they, राजशासनात् by the king's command, त्वरिताः in haste, आशु immediately, समन्ततः from every direction, नावाम् of the boats, पञ्चशतानि five hundreds, समानिन्युः brought.

89_11.translation: They brought excellent boats known as Swastika, solidly built, they lookd magnificent, filled with large bells, sails and flags.
89_11.word_by_word: महाघंटाधराः fitted with large bells, वराः excellent, पताकाभिः with flags, शोभमानाः looking  magnificent, युक्तवाताः filled with sails, सुसंहताः built solidly, स्वस्तिकविज्ञेयाः known as Swastika, अन्याः also some other boats (brought).

89_12.shloka: तत स्स्वस्तिकविज्ञेयां पाण्डुकम्बलसंवृताम्।सनन्दिघोषां कल्याणीं गुहो नावमुपाहरत्।।2.89.12।।
89_12.translation: Then Guha personally brought an auspicious boat known as Swastika covered with white canvas and generating captivating sounds.
89_12.word_by_word: ततः then, गुहः Guha, पाण्डुकम्बलसंवृताम् covered with white canvas, सनन्दिघोषाम् generating aptivating sounds, कल्याणीं auspicious, स्वस्तिकविज्ञेयाम् known as Swastika, नावम् boat, उपाहरत् brought.

89_13.shloka: तामारुरोह भरतश्शत्रुघ्नश्च महाबलः।कौसल्या च सुमित्रा च याश्चान्या राजयोषितः।।2.89.13।।पुरोहितश्च तत्पूर्वं गुरवो ब्राह्मणाश्च ये।अनन्तरं राजदारास्तदैव शकटापणाः।।2.89.14।।
89_13.translation: The family priest (Vasistha) and other brahmins were the first to board. Next mightyBharata and Satrughna, Kausalya, Sumitra, women of the palace including the other wives of the king and wagons and supplies followed.
89_13.word_by_word: भरतः Bharata, ताम् आरुरोह boarded it, महाबलः of great strength, शत्रुघ्नश्च Satrughna also, कौसल्या च Kausalya, सुमित्रा च Sumitra, अन्याः other, याः राजयोषितः other royal women, तत्पूर्वम् before them, पुरोहितश्च family priest (Vasistha), गुरवः preceptors, ये ब्राह्मणाश्च such  brahmins, अनन्तरम् thereafter, राजदाराः king's wives, तथैव also, शकटापणाः wagons and supplies.

89_14.translation: The clamour of the people setting fire to the temporary shelters in that camp, descending down the river and transporting the supplies into the boats reached the heaven.
89_14.word_by_word: आवासम् the shelters in that camp, आदीपयताम् those who are burning, तीर्थं चापि through the descent of the river, अवगाहताम् those who are going down, भाण्डानि supplies, आददानानाम् of transporting, घोषः clamour, त्रिदिवम् the heaven, अस्पृशत् not touching.

89_15.shloka: पताकिन्यस्तु ता नावस्स्वयं दाशैरधिष्ठिताः।वहन्त्यो जनमारूढं तदा सम्पेतुराशुगाः।।2.89.16।।
89_15.translation: Those boats adorned with flags were propelled by the fishermen occupying them. They sailed with men rowing on board fast.
89_15.word_by_word: पताकिन्यः (adorned) with flags, दाशैः by the fishermen, स्वयम् themselves, अधिष्ठिताः  occupied, ताः नावः those boats, तदा then, आरूढम् boarded, जनम् men, वह्नत्यः carrying, आशुगाः swiftly rowing men, सम्पेतुः moved.

89_16.shloka: नारीणामभिपूर्णा स्तु काश्चित् काश्चिच्च वाजिनाम्।काश्चिदत्र वहन्ति स्म यानयुग्यं महाधनम्।।2.89.17।।
89_16.translation: Some boats were filled with women, some others with horses. while still otherstransported draught animals for drawing carriages and the great treasures.
89_16.word_by_word: अत्र there, काश्चित् some boats, नारीणाम् with women, अभिपूर्णाः were filled with, काश्चित् some others, वाजिनाम् with horses, काश्चित् while still others, यानयुग्यम् the draught animals for drawing carriages, महाधनम् great treasures, वहन्ति स्म were transporting.

89_17.shloka: ता स्स्म गत्वा परं तीरमवरोप्य च तं जनम्।निवृत्ताः काण्डचित्राणि क्रियन्ते दाशबन्धुभिः।।2.89.18।।
89_17.translation: Having reached the other bank, the men disembarked. While returning, the fisherfolk exhibited their craft of lovely formations.
89_17.word_by_word: ताः those, परं तीरम् the other bank, गत्वा having reached, तं जनम् the men, अवरोप्य disembarked, निवृत्ताः स्म returned, दाशबन्धुभिः the fisherfolk, काण्डचित्राणि lovely formations with their craft, क्रियन्ते स्म exhibited.

89_18.shloka: सवैजयन्तास्तु गजा गजारोहप्रचोदिताः।तरन्त स्स्म प्रकाशन्ते सध्वजा इव पर्वताः।।2.89.19।।
89_18.translation: The elephants, embellished with banners and goaded by their mahouts lookedsplendid like mountains with banners while crossing in the water.
89_18.word_by_word: सवैजयन्ताः embellished with banners, गजारोहप्रचोदिताः goaded by their mahouts, गजाः the elephants, तरन्तः while crossing the water, सध्वजाः with flags, पर्वताः इव like mountains, प्रकाशन्ते स्म were shining.

89_19.translation: Only some of the people were able to board the boats. Some others crossed on rafts and on large pots. Still others swam with their arms.
89_19.word_by_word: अन्ये other, नावः boats, आरुरुहुश्च boarded, अपरे others, तथा like that, प्लवैः on rafts, तेरुः crossed, अन्ये others, कुम्भघटैः with large pots, तेरुः crossed, अन्ये others, बाहुभिः with their arms, तेरुः च crossed.

89_20.shloka: सा पुण्या ध्वजिनी गङ्गां दाशैस्सन्तारिता स्वयम्।मैत्रे मुहूर्ते प्रययौ प्रयागवनमुत्तमम्।।2.89.21।।
89_20.translation: The auspicious army, ferried across the river Ganga by the fishermen, reached the great forest of Prayaga at the auspicious hour of Maitra.
89_20.word_by_word: दाशैः by the fishermen, स्वयम् themselves, गङ्गाम् the river Ganga, सन्तारिता ferried over, पुण्या auspicious, सा ध्वजिनी army, मैत्रे मुहूर्ते at the auspicious hour of Maitra, उत्तमम् great, प्रयागवनम् forest of Prayaga, प्रययौ reached.

89_21.shloka: आश्वासयित्वा च चमूं महात्मा निवेशयित्वा च यथोपजोषम्।द्रष्टुं भरद्वाजमृषिप्रवर्य मृत्विग्वृतस्सन्भरतः प्रतस्थे।।2.89.22।।
89_21.translation: The noble Bharata, got his army encamped according to their pleasure and set out, accompanied by his priests, to see the distinguished sage Bharadwaja.
89_21.word_by_word: महात्मा the noble one, भरतः Bharata, चमूम् the army, आश्वासयित्वा having rested, यथोपजोषम्  according to their pleasure, निवेशयित्वा having encamped, ऋषिप्रवर्यम् the distinguished rishi, भरद्वाजम् Bharadwaja, द्रष्टुम् to see, ऋत्विग्वृतस्सन् surrounded by his priests, प्रतस्थे  set out.

89_22.shloka: स ब्राह्मणस्याऽश्रममभ्युपेत्य महात्मनो देवपुरोहितस्य।ददर्श रम्योटजवृक्षषण्डं महद्वनं विप्रवरस्य रम्यम्।।2.89.23।।
89_22.translation: Approaching the hermitage of Bharadwaja, the eminent brahmin and official priest of the gods, Bharata saw the delightful huts and trees of the charming great forest.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे एकोननवतितमस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the eightyninth sarga in Ayodhyakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
89_22.word_by_word: सः Bharata, देवपुरोहितस्य official priest of the gods, महात्मनः of the eminent, ब्राह्मणस्य  brahmin's, आश्रमम् hermitage, अभ्युपेत्य having approached, रम्योटजवृक्षषण्डम् delightful  huts and multitude of trees, विप्रवरस्य of the best brahmins, रम्यम् charming, महत् वनम् great forest, ददर्श saw.

90_1.shloka: [Bharadwaja welcomes Bharata and Vasistha -- Bharata discloses his intention to get back Rama.]भरद्वाजाश्रमं दृष्ट्वा क्रोशादेव नरर्षभः।बलं सर्वमवस्थाप्य जगाम सह मन्त्रिभिः।।2.90.1।।पद्भ्यामेव हि धर्मज्ञो न्यस्तशस्त्रपरिच्छदः।वसानो वाससी क्षौमे पुरोधाय पुरोधसम्।।2.90.2।।
90_1.translation: Bharata, the knower of righteous ways and the best among men, saw the hermitage of Bharadwaja from a distance of one krosa and brought his entire army to a halt. He laid aside all his royal robes and weapons. Clad in silk garments, he went on foot along with his ministers, with the family priest Vasistha ahead of him.
90_1.word_by_word: धर्मज्ञः knower of righteous ways, नरर्षभः the best among men, क्रोशादेव from a distance of one krosa, भरद्वाजाश्रमम् Bharadwaja's hermitage, दृष्ट्वा having seen, सर्वम् entire, बलम् army, अवस्थाप्य  brought to a halt, न्यस्तशस्त्रपरिच्छदः lay aside the royal robes and weapons, क्षौमे वाससी silk garments, वसानः wearing, पुरोधसम् with family priest, Vasistha, पुरोधाय placing ahead of him, मन्त्रिभिस्सह along with ministers, पद्भ्याम् एव on foot, जगाम went.

90_2.shloka: भरद्वाजाश्रमं दृष्ट्वा क्रोशादेव नरर्षभः।बलं सर्वमवस्थाप्य जगाम सह मन्त्रिभिः।।2.90.1।।पद्भ्यामेव हि धर्मज्ञो न्यस्तशस्त्रपरिच्छदः।वसानो वाससी क्षौमे पुरोधाय पुरोधसम्।।2.90.2।।
90_2.translation: Bharata, the knower of righteous ways and the best among men, saw the hermitage of Bharadwaja from a distance of one krosa and brought his entire army to a halt. He laid aside all his royal robes and weapons. Clad in silk garments, he went on foot along with his ministers, with the family priest Vasistha ahead of him.
90_2.word_by_word: धर्मज्ञः knower of righteous ways, नरर्षभः the best among men, क्रोशादेव from a distance of one krosa, भरद्वाजाश्रमम् Bharadwaja's hermitage, दृष्ट्वा having seen, सर्वम् entire, बलम् army, अवस्थाप्य  brought to a halt, न्यस्तशस्त्रपरिच्छदः lay aside the royal robes and weapons, क्षौमे वाससी silk garments, वसानः wearing, पुरोधसम् with family priest, Vasistha, पुरोधाय placing ahead of him, मन्त्रिभिस्सह along with ministers, पद्भ्याम् एव on foot, जगाम went.

90_3.shloka: तत स्सन्दर्शने तस्य भरद्वाजस्य राघवः।मन्त्रिणस्तानवस्थाप्य जगामानुपुरोहितम्।।2.90.3।।
90_3.translation: Then the scion of the Raghu race (Bharata) halted his ministers within sight of Bharadwaja's (hermitage) and went along following his priest Vasistha.
90_3.word_by_word: ततः then, राघवः scion of the Raghu race (Bharata), तान् मन्त्रिणः those ministers, तस्य भरद्वाजस्य that Bharadwaja's, संदर्शने within sight, अवस्थाप्य halted, अनुपुरोहितम् following his priest जगाम went.

90_4.shloka: वसिष्ठमथ दृष्ट्वैव भरद्वाजो महातपाः।सञ्चचाऽलासनात्तूर्णं शिष्यानर्घ्यमिति ब्रुवन्।।2.90.4।।
90_4.translation: On seeing Vasistha, the great ascetic Bharadwaja immediately left his seat and said to his disciples, Bring offerings of water.
90_4.word_by_word: अथ thereafter, महातपाः the great ascetic, भरद्वाजः Bharadwaja, वसिष्ठम् Vasistha, दृष्ट्वैव on seeing, अर्घ्यम् इति bring offerings of water, शिष्यान् to disciples, ब्रुवन् saying, तूर्णम् soon, आसनात् from seat, सञ्चचाल moved.

90_5.shloka: समागम्य वसिष्ठेन भरतेनाभिवादितः।अबुद्ध्यत महातेजास्सुतं दशरथस्य तम्।।2.90.5।।
90_5.translation: After meeting Vasistha and greeted by Bharata, the radiant Bharadwaja could recognize he was the son of Dasaratha.
90_5.word_by_word: महातेजाः radiant Bharadwaja, वसिष्ठेन with Vasistha, समागम्य having met, भरतेन by Bharata, अभिवादितः greeted, तम् him, दशरथस्य Dasaratha's, सुतम् as son,  अबुद्ध्यत knew of.

90_6.shloka: ताभ्यामर्घ्यं च पाद्यं च दत्वा पश्चात्फलानि च।आनुपूर्व्याच्छ धर्मज्ञः पप्रच्छ कुशलं कुले।।2.90.6।।
90_6.translation: Offering them both in order arghya (welcomeoffering), water to wash their feet and fruits in accordance with the practice, he enquired Bharata about the welfare of the family.
90_6.word_by_word: धर्मज्ञः knower of righteous ways (Bharadwaja), आनुपूर्व्यात् in order, ताभ्याम् to both of them, अर्घ्यं च welcomeoffering, पाद्यं च water for washing feet, पश्चात् thereafter, फलानिच fruits, दत्वा having given, कुले in the family, कुशलम् welfare, पप्रच्छ enquired.

90_7.shloka: अयोध्यायां बले कोशे मित्रेष्वपि च मन्त्रिषु।जानन् दशरथं वृत्तं न राजानमुदाहरत्।।2.90.7।।
90_7.translation: He enquired about the welfare of Ayodhya, of the army, treasury, friends and the ministers. But knowingly did not mention about Dasaratha's wellbeing (the knew Dasaratha was dead).
90_7.word_by_word: अयोध्यायाम् in Ayodhya, बले in the army, कोशे in the treasury, मित्रेष्वपि च of the friends also, मन्त्रिषु of the ministers, वृत्तम् wellbeing, जानन् knowingly, राजानम् king, दशरथम् Dasaratha, नोदाहरत् did not mention.

90_8.shloka: वसिष्ठो भरतश्चैनं पप्रच्छतुरनामयम्।शरीरेऽग्निषु वृक्षेषु शिष्येषु मृगपक्षिषु।।2.90.8।।
90_8.translation: Vasistha and Bharata also enquired about his health and welfare of his sacred fires, his disciples, animals and birds and trees of the hermitage.
90_8.word_by_word: वसिष्ठः Vasistha, भरतश्च also Bharata, एनम् him, शरीरे about his health, अग्निषु his sacred fires, वृक्षेषु his trees, शिष्येषु his disciples, मृगपक्षिषु about animals and birds, अनामयम् well being, पप्रच्छतुः enquired.

90_9.shloka: तथेति तत्प्रतिज्ञाय भरद्वाजो महातपाः।भरतं प्रत्युवाचेदं राघवस्नेहबन्धनात्।।2.90.9।।
90_9.translation: Saying, all is well, the great ascetic Bharadwaja, out of his affection for Rama, said to Bharata:
90_9.word_by_word: महातपाः the great ascetic, भरद्वाजः Bharadwaja, तथेति saying so, so, तत् that welfare, प्रतिज्ञाय informing, राघवस्नेहबन्धनात् out of affection for Rama, भरतं प्रति addressingBharata, इदम् these words, उवाच said.

90_10.shloka: किमिहाऽगमने कार्यं तव राज्यं प्रशासतः।एतदाचक्ष्व मे सर्वं न हि मे शुद्ध्यते मनः।।2.90.10।।
90_10.translation: Why have you come here when you ought to be ruling the kingdom? Tell me everything about this. My mind is not clear in this matter.
90_10.word_by_word: राज्यम् kingdom, प्रशासतः while ruling over, तव for you, इह here, आगमने in the arrival, कार्यम् reason, किम् what, एतत् all this, सर्वम् completely, मे to me, आचक्ष्व tell, मे to me, मनः my mind, न हि शुद्ध्यते is not clear about it.

90_11.shloka: सुषुवे यममित्रघ्नं कौसल्यानऽन्दवर्धनम्।भ्रात्रा सह सभार्यो यश्चिरं प्रव्राजितो वनम्।।2.90.11।।नियुक्तः स्त्रीनियुक्तेन पित्रा योऽसौ महायशाः।वनवासी भवेतीह समाः किल चतुर्दश।।2.90.12।।कच्छिन्न तस्यापापस्य पापं कर्तुमिहेच्छसि।अकण्टकं भोक्तुमना राज्यं तस्यानुजस्य च।।2.90.13।।
90_11.translation: Rama, destroyer of enemies and enhancer of the delight of his mother Kausalya, has been banished to the forest for a long time along with his wife and brother. That illustrious one has been ordered by his father to live in the forest for fourteen years through the pursuasion of a woman. To enjoy the kingdom without obstacles do you intend to cause any harm to that irreproachable Rama and his brother?
90_11.word_by_word: अमित्रघ्नम् destroyer of enemies, आनन्दवर्धनम् enhances the delight of, यं that Rama, कौसल्या Kausalya, सुषुवे gave birth, यः that, सभार्यः with his wife, भ्रात्रा सह along with his brother, चिरम् for a long time, वनम् to the forest, प्रव्राजितः has been banished, महायशाः  illustrious, यः असौ that Rama, स्त्री नियुक्तेन urged by a woman, पित्रा by his father, चतुर्दश fourteen, समाः years, वनवासी living in the forest, भव shall become, इति thus, इह here, नियुक्तः has been ordered, तस्य his, अपापस्य sinless, तस्य his, अनुजस्य च brother, पापम्  harm, कर्तुम् to do, अकण्टकम् without obstacles, राज्यम् kingdom, भोक्तुमनाः to enjoy, इह here, न इच्छसि not intending to do so?

90_12.shloka: एवमुक्तो भरद्वाजं भरतः प्रत्युवाच ह।पर्यश्रुनयनो दुःखाद्वाचा संसज्जमानया।।2.90.14।।
90_12.translation: At these words, Bharata, eyes filled with tears of grief, replied to Bharadwaja in a   stumbling voice:
90_12.word_by_word: एवम् thus, उक्तः addressed, भरतः Bharata, दुःखात् with grief, पर्यश्रुनयनः with tears in his eyes, संसज्जमानया with stumbling, वाचा words, भरद्वाजम् to Bharadwaja, प्रत्युवाच ह said in reply.

90_13.shloka: हतोऽस्मि यदि मामेवं भगवानपि मन्यते।मत्तो न दोषमाशङ्के नैवं मामनुशास्तु हि।2.90.15।।
90_13.translation: When one so venerable like you too misunderstands me, I am gone. There is no danger for him from me. Do not rebuke me this way.
90_13.word_by_word: भगवानपि even one venerable like you, माम् about me, एवम् in this way, मन्यते यदि if you think, हतः अस्मि I am done with, मत्तः from me, दोषम् evil, न आशङ्के do not suspect, माम् me, एवम् in this way, न अनुशास्तु हि not rebuke.

90_14.shloka: न चैतदिष्टं माता मे यदवोचन्मदन्तरे।नाहमेतेन तुष्टश्च न तद्वचनमाददे।।2.90.16।।
90_14.translation: I do not approve of whatever my mother said in my absence. I am not happy with those words and I do not accept them.
90_14.word_by_word: मे माता my mother, मदन्तरे in my absence, यत् whatever, अवोचत् said, एतत् that one, इष्टम् to my liking, न च not, एतेन by this, अहम् I, तुष्टश्च pleased, न not, तद्वचनं those words, नआददे I do not accept.

90_15.shloka: अहं तु तं नरव्याघ्रमुपयातः प्रसादकः।प्रतिनेतुमयोध्यां च पादौ तस्याभिवन्दितुम्।।2.90.17।।
90_15.translation: I have come to worship the feet of Rama, the best of men and persuade him to return to Ayodhya.
90_15.word_by_word: अहं तु as for me, नरव्याघ्रम् the best among men, Rama, तम् him, प्रसादकः after persuading, अयोध्याम् to Ayodhya, प्रतिनेतुम् to take him back, तस्य his, पादौ feet, अभिवन्दितुम् च to worship, उपयातः I have come.

90_16.shloka: त्वं मामेवंगतं मत्वा प्रसादं कर्तुमर्हसि।शंस मे भगवन्रामः क्व सम्प्रति महीपतिः।।2.90.18।।
90_16.translation: O venerable one in consideration of the circumstances I am in, be kind to me and tell me the whereabouts of Rama, lord of the earth.
90_16.word_by_word: भगवन् O Lord, त्वम् you, माम् me, एवंगतम् in these circumstances, मत्वा having considered, प्रसादम् kindness, कर्तुम् to do, अर्हसि be pleased, महीपतिः lord of the earth, रामः Rama, सम्प्रति now, क्व where, मे to me, शंस tell.

90_17.shloka: वशिष्ठादिभिः ऋत्विग्भिर्याचितो भगवांस्ततः।उवाच तं भरद्वाजः प्रसादाद्भरतं वचः।2.90.19।।
90_17.translation: Likewise besought by Vasistha and other priests, the venerable Bharadwaja was pleased to tell Bharata:
90_17.word_by_word: ततः then, वशिष्ठादिभिः by Vasistha and others, ऋत्विग्भिः by the priests, याचितः besought, भगवान् the venerable one, भरद्वाजः Bharadwaja, प्रसादात् with pleasure, तं भरतम् to Bharata, वचः these words, उवाच said.

90_18.translation: O best of men (Bharata) your conduct towards the preceptors, your selfrestraint and devotion to the virtuous are all in keeping with those born in the race of Raghu.
90_18.word_by_word: पुरुषव्याघ्रः O best of men, गुरुवृत्ति: conduct towards spiritual preceptors, दमश्चैव control over senses, साधूनाम् of virtuous people, अनुयायिता following, एतत् all this, राघववंशजे born in the Raghu race, त्वयि in you, युक्तम् is appropriate.

90_19.shloka: जाने चैतन्मनस्थं ते दृढीकरणमस्त्विति।अपृच्छं त्वां तथाऽत्यर्थं कीर्तिं समभिवर्धयन्।।2.90.21।।
90_19.translation: I am aware of the feelings in your heart. Even then I enquired in order to confirm it  and to further your fame.
90_19.word_by_word: ते your, मनस्थम् feelings of your heart, एतत् this, जाने च I am aware, दृढीकरणम् अस्तु let it be confirmed, इति in this manner, (तव your), कीर्तिम् fame, अत्यर्थम् greatly, समभिवर्धयन् to increase it, त्वाम् you, अपृच्छम् I asked.

90_20.shloka: जाने च रामं धर्मज्ञं ससीतं सहलक्ष्मणम्।असौ वसति ते भ्राता चित्रकूटे महागिरौ।।2.90.22।।
90_20.translation: I know your brother who is conversant with righteousness is living on Chitrakuta mountain with Sita and Lakshmana.
90_20.word_by_word: धर्मज्ञम् knower of righteousness (Rama), ससीतम् with Sita, सहलक्ष्मणम् with Lakshmana, रामम् Rama, जाने च I know, असौ ते भ्राता this your brother, चित्रकूटे in Chitrakuta, महागिरौ mountain, वसति is living.

90_21.shloka: श्वस्तु गन्तासि तं देशं वसाद्य सह मन्त्रिभिः।एतन्मे कुरु सुप्राज्ञ कामं कामार्थकोविद।।2.90.23।।
90_21.translation: O supremely sagacious prince gifted with the knowledge of kama (desire) and artha (wealth), tomorrow you go, but to night stay here with your ministers and fulfil my desire.
90_21.word_by_word: तं देशम् to that place, श्वः tomorow, गन्तासि shall go, अद्य today, मन्त्रिभिस्सह along with  ministers, वस you may stay, सुप्राज्ञ O supremely sagacious prince, कामार्थकोविद who is aware of kama (desire) and artha (prosperity), मे my, एतम् this, कामं desire, कुरु fulfil.

90_22.shloka: ततस्तथेत्येवमुदारदर्शनः प्रतीतरूपो भरतोऽब्रवीद्वचः।चकार बुद्धिं च तदा तदाश्रमे निशानिवासाय नराधिपाऽत्मजः।।2.90.24।।
90_22.translation: A man of liberal disposition, Bharata expressed his intention, saying, 'Be it so'. Then the prince made up him mind to spend the might in that hermitage.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे नवतितमस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the ninetieth sarga in Ayodhyakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
90_22.word_by_word: उदारदर्शनः a man of liberal outlook, भरतः Bharata, प्रतीतरूपः expressing his intention, ततः then, तथा be it so, इत्येवम् saying, वचः words, अब्रवीत् said, तदा then, नराधिपात्मजः son of the king, तदाश्रमे in that hermitage, निशानिवासाय to spend the night, बुद्धिम् decision, चकार made.

91_1.shloka: [Bharadwaja extends elaborate hospitality to Bharata and his entourage -- Invokes Visvakarma to make necessary arrangements.]कृतबुद्धिं निवासाय तत्रैव स मुनिस्तदा।भरतं कैकयीपुत्रमातिथ्येनन्यमन्त्रयत्।।2.91.1।।
91_1.translation: With the decision of Bharata, son of Kaikeyi, to stay there for the night, sage Bharadwaja extended to him all hospitality.
91_1.word_by_word: सः that, मुनिः sage (Bharadwaja), तदा then, तत्रैव there itself, निवासाय to stay, कृतबुद्धिम् having resolved, कैकयीपुत्रम् Kaikeyi's son, भरतम् Bharata, आतिथ्येन with hospitality, न्यमन्त्रयत् invited.

91_2.shloka: अब्रवीद्भरतस्त्वेनं नन्विदं भवता कृतम्।पाद्यमर्घ्यं तथाऽतिथ्यं वने यदुपपद्यते।।2.91.2।।
91_2.translation: Bharata said to Bharadwaja, You have already extended the hospitality in offering water for washing the feet with and of arghya befitting a guest as available in the forest.
91_2.word_by_word: भरतस्तु as for Bharata, एनम् to him, अब्रवीत् said, भवता by you, पाद्यम् water for washing the feet with, अर्घ्यम् welcome offering, तथा also, वने in the forest, यत् whichever, उपपद्यते is available, इदम् this, आतिथ्यम् hospitality, कृतं ननु has been made.

91_3.shloka: अथोवाच भरद्वाजो भरतं प्रहसन्निव।जाने त्वां प्रीतिसंयुक्तं तुष्येस्त्वं येन केनचित्।।2.91.3।।
91_3.translation: Bharadwaja then said to Bharata with a gentle smile, I know you are full of love and content with whatever is offered you.
91_3.word_by_word: अथ then, भरद्वाजः Bharadwaja, प्रहसन्निव with a gentle smile, भरतम् to Bharata, उवाच said, त्वाम् you, प्रीतिसंयुक्तम् are full of love, जाने I know, त्वाम् you, येन केन चित् with whateveroffered, तुष्येः are contented.

91_4.shloka: सेनायास्तु तवैतस्याः कर्तुमिच्छामि भोजनम्।मम प्रीतिर्यथारूपा तथार्हो मनुजर्षभ।।2.91.4।।
91_4.translation: O Bharata, the best of men, I want to treat your army with food. This will please me and I hope you will act accordingly.
91_4.word_by_word: मनुजर्षभ best among mortals, तव your, एतस्याः for all the, सेनायाः the army men, भोजनम् food, कर्तुम् I am to offer, इच्छामि wish, मम my, प्रीतिः pleasure, यथा रूपा in whatever way, तथा accordingly, अर्हः worthy of.

91_5.shloka: किमर्थं चापि निक्षिप्य दूरे बलमिहागतः।कस्मान्नेहोपयातोऽसि सबलः पुरुषर्षभः।।2.91.5।।
91_5.translation: Why did you, O Bharata, the best of men, station your army at a distance before coming here? Could you not approach me along with your army?
91_5.word_by_word: पुरुषर्षभः best of men, किमर्थम् for what reason, बलम् army, दूरे at a distance, निक्षिप्य having stationed, इह here, आगतः you have come, इह here, सबलः with your army, कस्मात् why, न उपयातः असि not come with.

91_6.shloka: भरतः प्रत्युवाचेदं प्राञ्जलिस्तं तपोधनम्।ससैन्यो नोपयातोऽस्मि भगवन्भगवद्भयात्।।2.91.6।।
91_6.translation: With folded palms (in reverence), Bharata said to sage Bharadwaja whose penance was his wealth: I did not approach you with the army for fear of you, O venerable one.
91_6.word_by_word: भरतः Bharata, प्राञ्जलिः with folded palms (in reverence), तपोधनम् who has benance as his wealth (sage), तम् him, इदम् this, प्रत्युवाच replied, भगवन् O venerable one, भगवद्भयात् for fear of you, ससैन्यः with army, नोपयातोऽस्मि did not approach.

91_7.shloka: राज्ञा च भगवन्नित्यं राजपुत्रेण वा सदा।यत्नतः परिहर्तव्या विषयेषु तपस्विनः।।2.91.7।।
91_7.translation: O venerable one a king or a prince ought to intentionally avoid those places occupied by ascetics.
91_7.word_by_word: भगवन् O venerable one, राज्ञा by the king, राजपुत्रेण वा or by a king's son, विषयेषु in places, सदा always, तपस्विनः of ascetics, यत्नतः intentionally, परिहर्तव्याः should be avoided.

91_8.shloka: वाजिमुख्या मनुष्याश्च मत्ताश्च वरवारणाः।प्रच्छाद्य भगवन्भूमिं महतीमनुयान्ति माम्।।2.91.8।।
91_8.translation: O venerable sage spirited horses, men and mighty rutting elephants follow me covering a wide expanse of land.
91_8.word_by_word: भगवन् O Lord, वाजिमुख्याः spirited horses, मनुष्याश्च men also, मत्ताः rutting, वरवारणाश्च mighty elephants, महतीम् wide, भूमिम् earth, प्रच्छाद्य spread over, माम् me, अनुयान्ति are following.

91_9.shloka: ते वृक्षानुदकं भूमिमाश्रमेषूटजां स्तथा।न हिंस्युरिति तेनाऽहमेक एव समागतः।।2.91.9।।
91_9.translation: Lest the army should damage the huts, trees, land, and defile the water in the ashram, I came here alone.
91_9.word_by_word: ते they, आश्रमेषु in ashrams, वृक्षान् trees, उदकम् water, भूमिम् land, तथा also, उटजान् huts, न हिंस्युः shall not damage, इति so, तेन therefore, अहम् I, एक एव alone, समागतः came here.

91_10.translation: Thus commanded the great ascetic, 'Let the army be brought here'. Accordingly, Bharata ordered the army to come.
91_10.word_by_word: ततस्तु all, सेना army, इतः here, अनीयताम् be brought, इति thus, परमर्षिणा great sage, आज्ञप्तः having been commanded, भरतः Bharata, सेनायाः the army's, समुपागमम् to get, चक्रे made.

91_11.translation: Then Bharadwaja entered the fire sanctuary, sipped water and washed his hands with water and invoked Visvakarma to provide hospitality.
91_11.word_by_word: अथ then, अग्निशालाम् fire sanctuary, प्रविश्य entered, आपः water, पीत्वा sipped, परिमृज्य च washing his hands, आतिथ्यस्य for the hospitality, क्रियाहेतोः to provide, विश्वकर्माणम् to Visvakarma, आह्वयत् invoked.

91_12.shloka: आह्वये विश्वकर्माणमहं त्वष्टारमेव च।आतिथ्यं कर्तुमिच्छामि तत्र मे संविधीयताम्।।2.91.12।।
91_12.translation: I intend to provide hospitality for which I am invoking Visvakarma and Tvastara who builds houses. Let adequate arrangements be made.
91_12.word_by_word: अहम् I, आतिथ्यम् hospitality, कर्तुम् to perform, इच्छामि am intending, त्वष्टारम् एव च even Tvastara who builds homes, विश्वकर्माणम् Visvakarma, आह्वये I am invoking, तत्र in this matter, मे to me, संविधीयताम् things may be arranged.

91_13.shloka: आह्वये लोकपालांस्त्रीन् देवान् शक्रमुखांस्तथा।आतिथ्यं कर्तुमिच्छामि तत्र मे संविधीयताम्।।2.91.13।।
91_13.translation: I invoke the three deities, guardians of the four quarters headed by Indra to extend hospitality (to Bharata). Let them make adequate arrangements in this regard.
91_13.word_by_word: तथा like that, शक्रमुखान् Indra in the forefront, लोकपालान् guardians of the (four) quarters, त्रीन् देवान् three deities, आह्वये I am invoking, आतिथ्यम् hospitality, कर्तुम् to provide, इच्छामि desiring तत्र in this matter, मे to me, संविधीयताम् arrangements be made.

91_14.shloka: प्राक्स्रोतसश्च या नद्यः प्रत्यक्स्रोतस एव च।पृथिव्यामन्तरिक्षे च समायान्त्वद्य सर्वशः।।2.91.14।।
91_14.translation: Let the rivers flowing towards the east, and the west, flowing on the earth and in the sky, flowing everywhere reach here and now.
91_14.word_by_word: या नद्यः those revers, पृथिव्याम् on the earth, अन्तरिक्षे in the sky, प्राक्स्रोतसः flowing towards the east, प्रत्यक्स्रोतसः towards the west, सर्वशः from everywhere, अद्य now, समायान्तु may come.

91_15.shloka: अन्या स्रवन्तु मैरेयं सुरामन्यास्सुविष्ठिताम्।अपरा श्चोदकं शीतमिक्षुकाण्डरसोपमम्।।2.91.15।।
91_15.translation: Let some rivers flow with liquor made of datepalms, some with wellprepared wine and some with cool water which tastes like sugarcane juice.
91_15.word_by_word: अन्याः other rivers, मैरेयम् intoxicating liquour (made of datepalms), स्रवन्तु let them flow, अन्याः other rivers, सुविष्ठिताम् wellprepared, सुराम् wine, अपराश्च still others, इक्षुकाण्डरसोपमम् tasting like sugar cane juice, शीतम् cool, उदकम् water, स्रवन्तु let them flow.

91_16.translation: I invoke the gandharvas, Visvavasu, Ha Ha and Hu Hu, and also goddesses like gandharvas (heavenly musicians) and apsaras (nymphs) from all regions.
91_16.word_by_word: देवगन्धर्वान् the gandharvas of deities, विश्वावसु Visvavasu, हहाहुहून् Ha Ha and Hu Hu, तथैव also, देवीः goddesses, गन्धर्वीश्चापि female gandharvas (heavenly musicians), अप्सरसः apsaras (nymphs), सर्वशः from all regions, आह्वये invoke.

91_17.shloka: घृताचीमथ विश्वाचीं मिश्रकेशीमलंबुसाम्।नागदन्तां च हेमां च हिमामद्रिकृतस्थलाम्।।2.91.17।।
91_17.translation: I summon also Grutachi, Visvachi, Misrakesi, Alambusa, Nagadantha, Hema and Hima whose abode is on the mountain.
91_17.word_by_word: अथ also, घृताचीम् Grutachi, विश्वाचीम् Visvachi, मिश्रकेशीम् Misrakesi, अलंबुसाम् Alambusa, नागदन्तां च Nagadanta, हेमां च Hema, अद्रिकृतस्थलाम् whose abode is on the mountain, हिमाम्  Hima I am summoning.

91_18.shloka: शक्रं याश्चोपतिष्ठन्ति ब्रह्माणं याश्च योषितः।सर्वास्तुम्बुरुणा सार्धमाह्वये सपरिच्छदाः।।2.91.18।।
91_18.translation: I invoke all the women who attend on Indra and Bramha along with tumbur with all their (musical) instruments.
91_18.word_by_word: याश्च those, योषितः women, शक्रम् Indra, उपतिष्ठन्ति are serving, याश्च those, ब्रह्माणम् attending on Bramha, सपरिच्छदाः with all their musical instruments, सर्वाः all, तुम्बुरुणा सार्धम् with their tumbur, आह्वये I am invoking.

91_19.shloka: वनं कुरुषु यद्दिव्यं वासोभूषणपत्रवत्।दिव्यनारीफलं शश्वत्तत्कौबेरमिहैतु च।।2.91.19।।
91_19.translation: Let Kubera's divine forest situated in the land of Kurus, where leaves serve as raiment and ornaments and celestial women as its fruits come here.
91_19.word_by_word: कुरुषु in the land of Kurus, शश्वत् always, वासोभूषणपत्रवत् leaves serving as raiment andornaments, दिव्यनारीफलम् celestial women as fruits, कौबेरम् relating to Kubera, यत् which, दिव्यं वनम् divine forest, तत् that, इह here, एतु let it come over.

91_20.shloka: इह मे भगवान् सोमो विधत्तामन्नमुत्तमम्।भक्ष्यंभोज्यं च चोष्यं च लेह्यं च विविधं बहु।।2.91.20।।
91_20.translation: Let the blessed Moon furnish me with excellent food of every kind -- solid, liquid, soft and those which are to be sucked and licked in great variety and quantity.
91_20.word_by_word: भगवान् the lord, सोमः Moon, मे for me, इह here, उत्तमम् excellent, अन्नम् food, विविधम् many kinds, बहु many varieties, भक्ष्यम् eatables, भोज्यम् chewable food, चोष्यम् food eaten by sucking, लेह्यं च that which is licked, विधत्ताम् be provided.

91_21.shloka: विचित्राणि च माल्यानि पादपप्रच्युतानि च।सुरादीनि च पेयानि मांसानि विविधानि च।।2.91.21।।
91_21.translation: Let her furnish me with manycoloured garlands of fresh flowers from trees, wines and other drinks and meat of different kinds.
91_21.word_by_word: पादपप्रच्युतानि those dropped from trees, विचित्राणि manycoloured, माल्यानि च flower garlands, सुरादीनि wines and others, पेयानि drinks, विविधानि of different kinds, मांसानि च meat be furnished.

91_22.shloka: एवं समाधिना युक्तस्तेजसाऽप्रतिमेन च।शीक्षास्वरसमायुक्तं तपसा चाब्रवीन्मुनिः।।2.91.22।।
91_22.translation: The valiant ascetic of incomparable lustre and power of penance in profound meditation said this in an accent in conformity with Vedic instruction.
91_22.word_by_word: समाधिना in profound meditation, अप्रतिमेन incomparable, तेजसा च with radiance, तपसा च with the power of penance, युक्तं filled with, मुनिः ascetic, शीक्षास्वरसमायुक्तम् with accent in conformity with Vedic instruction, एवम् in this way, अब्रवीत् said.

91_23.shloka: मनसा ध्यायतस्तस्य प्राङ्मुखस्य कृताञ्जलेः।आजग्मुस्तानि सर्वाणि दैवतानि पृथक्पृथक्।।2.91.23।।
91_23.translation: As Bharadwaja with folded palms was thus meditating with his face turned eastward, all the deities appeared there one by one.
91_23.word_by_word: तस्य his, प्राङ्मुखस्य facing east, कृताञ्जलेः with folded palms, मनसा in mind, ध्यायतः while meditating, सर्वाणि all, तानि दैवतानि those deities, पृथक्पृथक् one by one, आजग्मुः arrived.

91_24.shloka: मलयं दर्दुरं चैव ततस्स्वेदनुदोऽनिलः।उपस्पृश्य ववौ युक्त्या सुप्रियात्मा सुखश्शिवः।।2.91.24।।
91_24.translation: Meanwhile, soft auspicious and pleasant breeze passing over Malaya and Dardura mountains, comforting and cooling the sweat, began to blow.
91_24.word_by_word: ततः then, अनिलः wind, मलयम् Malaya hill, दर्दुरं चैव mount Dardura, उपस्पृश्य having touched, युक्त्या by virtue of contact, सुप्रियात्मा most pleasant, सुखः comforting, शिवः auspicious, स्वेदनुदः cooling the sweat, ववौ blew.

91_25.shloka: ततोऽभ्यवर्षन्त घना दिव्याः कुसुमवृष्टयः।दिव्यदुन्दुभिघोषश्च दिक्षु सर्वासु शुश्रुवे।।2.91.25।।
91_25.translation: Then divine clouds rolled in and showered celestial flowers. The sounds of heavenly gongs could be heard in every direction.
91_25.word_by_word: ततः then, दिव्याः celestial, कुसुमवृष्टयः rain of flowers, घनाः clouds, अभ्यवर्षन्त showered, सर्वासु in all, दिक्षु directions, दिव्यदुन्दुभिघोषश्च sounds of divine musical gongs, शुश्रुवे could be heard.

91_26.shloka: प्रववुश्चोत्तमा वाता ननृतुश्चाप्सरोगणाः।जगुश्च देवगन्धर्वा वीणाः प्रमुमुचुस्स्वरान्।।2.91.26।।
91_26.translation: Gentle breeze began to blow. Troops of apsaras danced. Gandharvas and gods sang and the lyres rang.
91_26.word_by_word: उत्तमाः gentle, वाताश्च winds, प्रववु blew, अप्सरोगणाः troops of apsaras, ननृतुश्च also danced, देवगन्धर्वाः divine gandharvas, जगुश्च sang, वीणाः lyres, स्वरान् notes, प्रमुमुचुः issued forth.

91_27.shloka: स शब्दो द्यां च भूमिं च प्राणिनां श्रवणानि च।विवेशोच्चरितश्श्लक्ष्णस्समो लयसमन्वितः।।2.91.27।।
91_27.translation: That soft, melodious, rhythmic and wellmodulated sound entered the heaven and earth as well as the ears of all living beings.
91_27.word_by_word: उच्चरितः uttered, श्लक्षणः soft melody, लयसमन्वितः rhythmic, समः modulation, सः शब्दः those sounds, द्यां च the sky, भूमिं च the earth, प्राणिनाम् of all living beings, श्रवणानि च in the ears, विवेश entered.

91_28.shloka: तस्मिन्नुपरते शब्दे दिव्ये श्रोत्र सुखे नृणाम्।ददर्श भारतं सैन्यं विधानं विश्वकर्मणः।।2.91.28।।
91_28.translation: When the celestial sounds pleasing to the ears of men had subsided, the army of Bharata beheld the wonderful creations of Visvakarma.
91_28.word_by_word: नृणाम् for men, शोत्रसुखे pleasing to the ears, तस्मिन् when that, दिव्ये celestial, शब्दे sound, उपरते had subsided, भारतम् relating to Bharata, सैन्यम् army, विश्वकर्मणः Visvakarma's, विधानम् the creations, ददर्श he beheld.

91_29.translation: The ground was levelled on every side for five yojanas and covered with several grass lawns resembling lapis lazuli (blue sapphire) and cat's eye.
91_29.word_by_word: समन्तात् on every side, पञ्चयोजना five yojanas (forty miles), भूमिः the ground, समा has been levelled, नीलवैढूर्यसन्निभैः with sapphires or gems called cat'seye (beryl) spread,बहुभिः by many, शाद्वलैः grass lawns, छन्ना covered with, बभूव हि became৷৷

91_30.shloka: तस्मिन्बिल्वाः कपित्थाश्च पनसा बीजपूरकाः।आमलक्यो बभूवुश्च चूताश्च फलभूषणाः।।2.91.30।।
91_30.translation: There the best of fruitbearing trees like bilva trees, woodapple trees, citrons, emblic myrobalan trees and mango trees laden with fruits sprang up.
91_30.word_by_word: तस्मिन् there, फलभूषणाः fruits as adorenments, बिल्वाः Bilva, कपित्थाश्च woodapple trees, पनसाः jackfruit trees, बीजपूरकाः citron trees, आमलक्यः emblic myrobalan trees, चूताश्च mangotrees, बभूवुः sprang up.

91_31.shloka: उत्तरेभ्यः कुरुभ्यश्च वनं दिव्योपभोगवत्।आजगाम नदी दिव्या तीरजैर्भहुभिर्वृता।।2.91.31।।
91_31.translation: From the forests of the northern Kuru kingdom, with all delights of heaven, a divine river with innumerable trees that grow on river banks came into existence.
91_31.word_by_word: उत्तरेभ्यः कुरुभ्यः from the kingdom of northern Kurus, दिव्योपभोगवत् with all heavenly delights, वनम् forest, बहुभिः by innumerable, तीरजैः trees growing on the banks, कृता surrounded, दिव्या divine, नदी river, आजगाम came into existence.

91_32.shloka: चतुश्शालानि शुभ्राणि शालाश्च गजवाजिनाम्।हर्म्यप्रासादसम्बाधास्तोरणानि शुभानि च।।2.91.32।।
91_32.translation: Bright quadrangles, stables for elephants and horses, auspicious arch ways for palaces and mansions sprang up.
91_32.word_by_word: शुभ्राणि bright, चतुश्शालानि quadrangles, गजवाजिनाम् for horses and elephants, शालाश्च stables, शुभानि auspicious, हर्म्यप्रासादसम्बाधास्तोरणानि consisting of archways for palaces and mansions sprang up.

91_33.shloka: सितमेघनिभं चापि राजवेश्म सुतोरणम्।दिव्यमाल्यकृताकारं दिव्यगन्धसमुक्षितम्।।2.91.33।।चतुरश्रमसंबाधं शयनासनयानवत्।दिव्यैस्सर्वरसैर्युक्तं दिव्यभोजनवस्त्रवत्।।2.91.34।।उपकल्पितसर्वान्नं धौतनिर्मलभाजनम्।क्लुप्तसर्वासनं श्रीमत्स्वास्तीर्णशयनोत्तमम्।।2.91.35।।
91_33.translation: An auspicious royal palace with splendid archs resembling white clouds sprang up. It was sprinkled with celestial perfumes and adorned with beautiful garlands. That royal palace forming a quadrangle was furnished with couches, seats and carriages and furnished with celestial drinks of every kind, delicious food and splendid garments. It was stocked with food of every variety in clean and spotless vessels. Seats for every one and magnificent couches covered with excellent bedstead were arranged.
91_33.word_by_word: सितमेघनिभम् like white clouds, सुतोरणम् with beautiful archs, दिव्यमाल्यकृताकारम् adorned with fine garlands, दिव्यगन्धसमुक्षितं sprinkled with celestial perfumes, चतुरश्रम् forming a quadrangle, असंबाधम् very spacious, शयनासनयानवत् furnished with couches, seats and carriages, दिव्यैः by the celestial, सर्वरसैः with all kinds of drinks, युक्तम् arranged with, दिव्यभोजनवस्त्रवत् with heavenly food and dress, उपकल्पितसर्वान्नं stocked with food of every variety, धौतनिर्मलभाजनम् clean washed pots, क्लुप्तसर्वासनम् with seats arranged for every one, स्वास्तीर्णशयनोत्तमम् with magnificent couches covered with excellent bedstead, श्रीमत् auspicious, राजवेश्मचापि a royal palace also sprang up.

91_34.shloka: प्रविवेश महाबाहुरनुज्ञातो महर्षिणा।वेश्म तद्रत्नसम्पूर्णं भरतः कैकयीसुतः।।2.91.36।।
91_34.translation: Longarmed Bharata, son of Kaikeyi entered that palace full of jewels with the permission of the great sage.
91_34.word_by_word: महाबाहुः longarmed, कैकयीसुतः son of Kaikeyi, भरतः Bharata, महर्षिणा by the great sage,अनुज्ञातः having been permitted, रत्नसम्पूर्णम् full of jewels, तत् that, वेश्म house, प्रविवेश entered.

91_35.shloka: अनुजग्मुश्च तं सर्वे मन्त्रिणस्सपुरोहिताः।बभूवुश्च मुदा युक्ता दृष्ट्वा तं वेश्मसंविधिम्।।2.91.37।।
91_35.translation: All the ministers, priests followed him and were glad to see the arrangement in that mansion.
91_35.word_by_word: सपुरोहिताः along with priests, सर्वे all, मन्त्रिणः ministers, तम् that Bharata, अनुजग्मुश्च followed, तम् संविधिम् that arrangement, दृष्ट्वा having seen all over, मुदा full of joy, युक्ताः filled with  बभूवुश्च became.

91_36.shloka: तत्र राजासनं दिव्यं व्यजनं छत्रमेव च।भरतो मन्त्रिभिस्सार्धमभ्यवर्तत राजवत्।।2.91.38।।
91_36.translation: There where stood an exquisite throne, a fan and a parasol Bharata stayed in the company of ministers.
91_36.word_by_word: भरतः Bharata, मन्त्रिभिः सार्धं in the company of ministers, तत्र there, दिव्यम् exquisite, राजासनम् throne, व्यजनम् a fan (of yak's tail), छत्रमेव च parasol, राजवत् like a king, अभ्यवर्तत stayed.

91_37.translation: He bowed in reverence and worshipped the throne (as though Rama were seated there). Taking hold of a fan made of yak's tail he sat in a minister's seat.
91_37.word_by_word: रामाय to Rama, अभिप्रणम्य च having bowed in reverence, आसनम् that throne, पूजयामास worshipped, वालव्यजनम् fan made of yak's tail, आदाय taking hold of,  सचिवासने in a minister's seat, न्यषीदत् sat down

91_38.translation: First the ministers and priests took their respective seats in accordance with their rank, and then the army chief and finally the supervisor of the camp.
91_38.word_by_word: सर्वे all, मन्त्रिपुरोहिताः ministers and priests, आनुपूर्व्यात् in order, निषेदुः sat, ततः सेनापति after that the army chief, पश्चात् later, प्रशास्ता च and the supervisor of the camp, निषेदतुः sat.

91_39.shloka: तत स्तत्र मुहूर्तेन नद्यः पायसकर्दमाः।उपातिष्ठन्त भरतं भरद्वाजस्य शासनात्।।2.91.41।।
91_39.translation: Rivers filled with payasam (rice cooked in milk and sugar) in the shape of mud flowed towards Bharata at the command of Bharadwaja.
91_39.word_by_word: ततः then, भरद्वाजस्य by Bharadwaja, शासनात् order, मुहूर्तेन instantly, तत्र there, पायसकर्दमाः payasam (rice cooked in milk with sugar) as mud, नद्यः rivers, भरतम् Bharata, उपातिष्ठन्त approached.

91_40.shloka: तासामुभयतः कूलं पाण्डुमृत्तिकलेपनाः।रम्याश्चावसधा दिव्या ब्रह्मणस्तु प्रसादजा:।।2.91.42।।
91_40.translation: On both the banks of those rivers, charming, celestial houses plastered with white clay appeared by the grace of Brahma.
91_40.word_by_word: तासाम् those rivers, उभयतः कूलम् on both the banks, पाण्डुमृत्तिलेपनाः plastered with whiteclay, ब्रह्मणः Brahma, प्रसादजाः produced by the grace, दिव्याः celestial, रम्याः charming, आवसधाश्च houses appeared.

91_41.shloka: तेनैव च मूहूर्तेन दिव्याऽभरणभूषिताः।आगुर्विंशतिसाहस्राः ब्रह्मणा प्रहिताः स्त्रियः।।2.91.43।।
91_41.translation: At that very moment twenty thousand women adorned with beautiful ornaments sent by Brahma presented themselves.
91_41.word_by_word: तेन at that, मुहूर्तेन च moment, दिव्याभरणभूषिताः adorned with beautiful ornaments, ब्रह्मणा by Brahma, प्रहिताः sent, विंशतिसाहस्राः twenty thousand, स्त्रियः women, आगुः came.

91_42.shloka: सुवर्णमणिमुक्तेन प्रवालेन च शोभिताः।आगुर्विंशतिसाहास्राः कुबेरप्रहिताः स्त्रियः।।2.91.44।।
91_42.translation: Twenty thousand women adorned with gold, gems and corals sent by Kubera came.
91_42.word_by_word: सुवर्णमणिमुक्तेन wearing golden ornaments and gems, प्रवालेन with corals, शोभिता shining, कुबेरप्रहिताः sent by Kubera, विंशतिसाहस्राः twenty thousand, स्त्रियः आगुः women came.

91_43.translation: Troops of twenty thousand apsaras by whom any man when taken hold of in their arms could be intoxicated with intense passion, came from Nandana gardens.
91_43.word_by_word: याभिः by whom, गृहीतः when taken hold of (in their arms), पुरुषः man, सोन्माद इव filled with intense passion, लक्ष्यते is observed, such, विंशतिसाहस्राः twenty thousand, अप्सरोगणाः troops of apsaras, नन्दनात् from Nandana, आगुः came.

91_44.translation: There along with Narada, Tumburu and Gopa, distinguished kings of the gandharvas, looking bright like the Sun, began to sing in the presence of Bharata.
91_44.word_by_word: नारदः Narada, तुम्भुरुः Tumburu, गोपः Gopa, प्रवराः distinguished ones, सूर्यवर्चसः resembling the brightness of the Sun, एते these, गन्धर्वराजानः kings among gandharvas, भरतस्य  Bharata's, अग्रतः presence, जगुः began to sing.

91_45.shloka: अलम्बुसा मिश्रकेशी पुण्डरीकाऽथ वामना।उपानृत्यंस्तु भरतं भरद्वाजस्य शासनात्।।2.91.47।।
91_45.translation: Thereafter, the apsaras, Alambusa, Misrakesi, Pundarika and Vamana danced near Bharata at the command of Bharadwaja.
91_45.word_by_word: अथ thereafter, भरद्वाजस्य Bharadwaja's, शासनात् command, अलम्बुसा Alambusa, मिश्रकेशी Misrakese, पुण्डरीका Pundarika, वामना Vamana, भरतम् Bharata, उपानृत्यन् तु danced near.

91_46.shloka: यानि माल्यानि देवेषु यानि चैत्ररथे वने।प्रयागे तान्यदृश्यन्त भरद्वाजस्य शासनात्।।2.91.48।।
91_46.translation: The garlands of the gods available in Chitraratha's (Kubera's) garden could not match those obtained under the orders of Bharadwaja.
91_46.word_by_word: यानि those, माल्यानि garlands, देवेषु among the gods, यानि those garlands, चैत्ररथे of Chaitraratha, वने in the garden, तानि all those, भरद्वाजस्य Bharadwaja's, शासनात् at the command, प्रयागे Prayaga, अदृश्यन्त were found.

91_47.shloka: बिल्वा मार्दङ्गिका आसन् शम्याग्राहा विभीतकाः।अश्वत्था नर्तकाश्चासन्भरद्वाजस्य शासनात्।।2.91.49।।
91_47.translation: At the command of Bharadwaja, bilva trees acted as drummers, vibhitaka trees as cymbalists and the pipal trees as dancers.
91_47.word_by_word: भरद्वाजस्य at Bharadwaja's, शासनात् command, बिल्वाः bilva trees, मार्दङ्गिकाः as drummers,  आसन् became, विभीतकाः vibhitaka (palm) trees, शम्याग्राहा as cymbalists, अश्वत्था pipaltrees, नर्तकाश्च as dancers, आसन् became.

91_48.shloka: ततस्सरलतालाश्च तिलका नक्तमालकाः।प्रहृष्टास्तत्र सम्पेतुः कुब्जा भूत्वाऽथ वामनाः।।2.91.50।।
91_48.translation: Thereafter pine, palmyra, tilaka, and naktamala trees were transformed into hunchbacks and dwarfs and moved about in great delight.
91_48.word_by_word: ततः then, सरलतालाश्च pine and palmyra trees, तिलकाः tilaka trees, नक्तमालकाः naktamala (that bear flowers at night), प्रहृष्टाः out of great joy, कुब्जाः hunchbacked, अथ also, वामनाः dwarfs, भूत्वा तत्र सम्पेतुः taking the form moved about there.

91_49.shloka: शिंशुपामलकीजम्ब्वो याश्चान्याः काननेषु ताःमालती मल्लिका जातिर्याश्चान्याः कानने लताः।प्रमदाविग्रहं कृत्वा भरद्वाजाश्रमेऽवदन्।।2.91.51।।
91_49.translation: Asohka, emblic myrobalan and all other trees found in the forest malati, mallika and jati creepers assumed the form of women, came over to the hermitage of Bharadwaja and said:
91_49.word_by_word: शिंशुपामलकीजम्ब्वः ashoka and emblic myrobalan trees, काननेषु in the forest, अन्याः and other, याः those, ताः they, मालती jasmine creeper, मल्लिका mallika creeper, जातिः jati creeper, कानने in the forest, अन्याः other, याः लताः all those creepers, प्रमदाविग्रहम् taking the form of women, कृत्वा having made, भरद्वाजाश्रमे in the hermitage of Bharadwaja, अवदन् said.

91_50.shloka: सुरास्सुरापाः पिबत पायसं च बुभुक्षिताः।।2.91.52।।मांसानि च सुमेध्यानि भक्ष्यन्तां यावदिच्छथ।।2.91.53।।
91_50.translation: 'O wine drinkers, drink as much as you can those who are hungry partake payasam and sacred meat'.
91_50.word_by_word: सुरापाः O those of you who drink liquor, यावत् until, इच्छथ you desire, सुराः liquor, पिबत drink, बुभुक्षिताः those who are hungry to eat, पायसं च payasam (made of milk and rice), सुमेध्यानि sacred, मांसानि च meat, भक्ष्यन्ताम् let them eat.

91_51.shloka: उच्छाद्य स्नापयन्ति स्म नदीतीरेष वल्गुषु।अप्येकमेकं पुरषं प्रमदास्सप्त चाष्ट च।।2.91.54।।
91_51.translation: Every single warrior was attended by seven or eight women who applied oil and massaged his body and bathed him on the lovely banks of the river.
91_51.word_by_word: सप्त च seven or, अष्ट च eight, प्रमदाः women, एकम् one by one, पुरुषम् man, उच्छाद्य applied  oil and massaged the body, वल्गुषु in the lovely, नदीतीरेषु on the banks of the river, स्नापयन्ति bathed them, स्म अपि also.

91_52.translation: Some women with beautiful eyes quickly approached them for massaging. The  best of ladies wiped their bodies dry and gave each other wine to drink.
91_52.word_by_word: रुचिरलोचनाः with beautiful eyes, नार्यः women, संवाहन्त्यः massaging, समापेतुः quickly approached, वराङ्गनाः best of ladies, तथा like that, परिमृज्य wiped the water, अन्योन्यम् to each other, पाययन्ति made them drink.

91_53.shloka: हयान् गजान् खारानुष्ट्रान्तथैव सुरभेस्सुतान्।अभोजयन्वाहनपास्तेषां भोज्यं यथाविधि।।2.91.56।।
91_53.translation: The attendants of draughtanimals fed the horses, elephants, donkeys, camels and oxen their appropriate food.
91_53.word_by_word: वाहनपाः attendants of draughtanimals, हयान् horses, गजान् elephants, खरान् donkeys,उष्ट्रान् camels, तथैव similarly, सुरभेः the Surabhi's, सुतान offsprings, यथाविधि duly, तेषाम् for them, भोज्यम् food, अभोजयन् fed.

91_54.shloka: इक्षूंश्च मधुलाजांश्च भोजयन्ति स्म वाहनान्।इक्ष्वाकुवरयोधानां चोदयन्तो महाबला:।।2.91.57।।
91_54.translation: The draughtaimals of the illustrious warriors of Ikshvaku kings were urged by the highly energetic attendants to eat more and more of parched grain mixed with sugarcane and honey.
91_54.word_by_word: महाबलाः of highly energetic attendants, इक्ष्वाकुवरयोधानाम् of the illustrious warriors of Ikshvaku race, वाहनान् the draughtanimals, चोदयन्तः provoking them to eat, इक्षूंश्च sugarcane, मधुलाजांश्च honey and parched grain, भोजयन्ति स्म were fed.

91_55.shloka: नाश्वबन्धोऽश्वमाजानान्नगजं कुञ्जरग्रहः।मत्तप्रमत्तमुदिता चमूः सा तत्र संबभौ।।2.91.58।।
91_55.translation: The horserider no longer recognised the horse or the mahout the elephant and the whole army was inebriated with drinking and pleasure.
91_55.word_by_word: अश्वबन्धः horserider, अश्वम् horse, न अजानात् no longer recognised, कुञ्जरग्रहः mahout, गजम् elephant, न not recognised, तत्र there, सा that, चमूः whole army, मत्तप्रमत्तमुदिता fully drunk had forgotten in their joy, सम्बभौ shone.

91_56.translation: All the armymen with their desires gratified and anointing their bodies with red sandal paste surrounded by apsaras exclaimed.
91_56.word_by_word: सर्वकामैः by all horseriders, तर्पिताः gratified, रक्तचन्दनरूषिताः smeared with red sandal paste, अप्सरोगणसम्युक्ताः surrounded by apsaras, ते सैन्याः those soldiers, वाचम् thesewords, उदैरयन् exclaimed.

91_57.shloka: नैवायोध्यां गमिष्यामो नगमिष्याम दण्डकान्।कुशलं भरतस्यास्तु रामस्यास्तु तथा सुखम्।।2.91.60।।
91_57.translation: We will neither return to Ayodhya, nor enter Dandaka (forest). May Bharata and Rama be happy.
91_57.word_by_word: अयोध्याम् to Ayodhya, न गमिष्यामः will not return, दण्डकान् to Danadaka forest, न गमिष्यामः will not go, भरतस्य to Bharata, कुशलम् welfare, अस्तु तथा be like this, रामस्य Rama, सुखम् happy, अस्तु will be.

91_58.shloka: इति पादातयोधाश्च हस्त्यश्वारोहबन्धकाः।अनाथास्तं विधिं लब्ध्वा वाचमेतामुदीरयन्।।2.91.61।।
91_58.translation: Having enjoyed the hospitality of Bharadwaja the foot soldiers, horse and elephant riders made utterances ignoring their leaders.
91_58.word_by_word: पादातयोधाश्च foot soldiers, हस्त्यश्वरोहबन्धकाः horse and elephant riders, तम् विधिम् that hospitality, लब्धवा having received, अनाथाः इति no longer recognising their leaders, एताम् such, वाचम् utterances, उदीरयन् made.

91_59.translation: The exceedingly delighted soldiers of Bharata's retinue in their thousands cried out with excitement This is the very heaven.
91_59.word_by_word: भरतस्य Bharata's, अनुयातारः followers, ते नराः those men, तत्र there, सहस्रशः in their thousands, सम्प्रहृष्टाः highly exited with delight, विनेदुः shouted, अयम् this is, स्वर्गः heaven, इति thus, अब्रुवन् च started uttering.

91_60.shloka: नृत्यन्ति स्म हसन्ति स्म गायन्ति स्म च सैनिकाःसमन्तात्परिधावन्ति माल्योपेतास्सहस्रशः।।2.91.63।।
91_60.translation: Those thousands of soldiers wearing flower garlands ran about dancing, singing, and laughing.
91_60.word_by_word: सहस्रशः in thousands, सैनिकाः soldiers, माल्योपेताः wearing flower garlands, नृत्यन्ति स्म danced, हसन्ति स्म laughed, गायन्ति स्म sang, समन्तात् all over, परिधावन्ति ran about.

91_61.shloka: ततो भुक्तवतां तेषां तदन्नममृतोपमम्।दिव्यानुद्वीक्ष्य भक्ष्यां स्तानभवद्भक्षणे मतिः।।2.91.64।।
91_61.translation: Glancing at the ambrosial food, a desire arose in the minds of those soldiers to eat once again although they had already partaken it.
91_61.word_by_word: ततः then, अमृतोपमम् like nectar, तत् अन्नम् that food, भुक्तवताम् of those who had partaken, तेषाम् for them, दिव्यान् heavenly, तान् भक्ष्यान् those eatables, उद्वीक्षय glancing, भक्षणे to partake, मतिः in their minds, अभवत् desire arose.

91_62.shloka: प्रेष्याश्चेट्यश्च वध्वश्च बलस्थाश्च सहस्रशः।बभूवुस्ते भृशं दृप्तास्सर्वे चाहतवाससः।।2.91.65।।
91_62.translation: Messengers, maidservants, female attendants, and soldiers -- all of them in their thousands dressed in fresh garments felt exceedingly proud of themselves.
91_62.word_by_word: सहश्रसः in their thousands, प्रेष्याः messengers, चेट्यश्च maidservants, वध्वश्च female attendants, बलस्थाः army attendants, ते they, सर्वे च all of them, अहतवाससः dressed inunworn (new) garments, भृशम् exceedingly, दृप्ताः बभूवुः felt proud of themselves.

91_63.shloka: कुञ्जराश्च खरोष्ट्राश्च गोऽश्वाश्च मृगपक्षिणः।बभूवुस्सुभृतास्तत्र नान्यो ह्यन्यमकल्पयत्।।2.91.66।।
91_63.translation: There the elephants, donkeys and camels, cows and horses and also beasts and birds were wellnourished. No one troubled the other.
91_63.word_by_word: तत्र there, कुञ्जराश्च elephants, खरोष्ट्राश्च donkeys and camels, गोऽश्वाश्च cows and horses, मृगपक्षिणः beasts and birds, सुभृताः बभूवु were wellnourished, अन्यः अन्यम् one to the other, न अकल्पयत् हि did not trouble.

91_64.shloka: नाऽशुक्लवासा स्तत्राऽसीत्क्षुधितो मलिनोऽपि वा।रजसा ध्वस्तकेशो वा नरः कश्चिददृश्यत।।2.91.67।।
91_64.translation: In that army there was none who could be seen without wearing garments of sparkling white, who was hungry or dirty or with decayed hair.
91_64.word_by_word: तत्र there, अशुक्लवासाः wearing nonwhite (dirty) dress, क्षुधितः hungry, मलिनोऽपि dirty, न आसीत् none was there, कश्चित् नरः anybody, रजसा with dust, ध्वस्तकेशो वा with decayed hair, नादृश्यत could not be seen.

91_65.shloka: आजैश्चापि च वाराहैर्निष्ठानवरस़ञ्चयैः।फलनिर्यूह संसिद्दैस्सूपैर्गन्ध रसान्वितैः।।2.91.68।।पुष्पध्वजवतीः पूर्णाश्शुक्लस्यान्नस्य चाभितः।ददृशुर्विस्मितास्तत्रनरा लौहीस्सहस्रशः।।2.91.69।।
91_65.translation: There the soldiers beheld in amazement thousands of iron containers decked with flags and flowers and filled with white rice, mutton, pork, choicest condiments, fruit juice, fragrant and tasty soup.
91_65.word_by_word: तत्र there, नराः men, आजैश्चापि with mutton, वाराहैश्च pork, निष्ठानवरसञ्चयैः with choicest condiments, फलनिर्यूह संसिद्दैः with various fruit juices, गन्धरसान्वितैः with fragrant and tasteful, सूपैः with soups, पूर्णाः filled with, शुक्लस्य white, अन्नस्य rice, लौहीः best of iron containers, अभितः on all sides, विस्मिताः were amazed, ददृशुः beheld.

91_66.translation: Along the edge of the forest, wells were filled with thick payasam. There were wishfulfilling cows and honeydripping trees.
91_66.word_by_word: वनपार्श्वेषु along the edge of the forest, पायसकर्दमाः drink of milk and rice, कूपाः wells, बभूवुः were formed, गाव: cows, ताः those, कामदुघाः wishfulfilling, द्रुमाश्च trees, मधुश्च्युतः dripping honey, आसन् became.

91_67.translation: The wells were found filled with datepalm liquor and surrounded by pots of well cooked meat of peacocks, chicken and other animals.
91_67.word_by_word: वाप्यः wells, मैरेयपूर्णाश्च filled with datepalm liquor, प्रतप्तपिठरैः with hot pots (filled with cooked meat), मार्गमायूरकौक्कुटैः meat of peacock, chicken and deer, मृष्णमांसचयैः meat of other animals, वृताः surrounded by.

91_68.shloka: पात्रीणां च सहस्राणि स्थालीनां नियुतानि च।न्यर्बुधानि च पात्राणि शातकुम्भमयानि च।।2.91.72।।स्थाल्यः कुम्भ्य करम्भ्य श्च दधिपूर्णास्सुसंस्कृताः।यौवनस्थस्य गौरस्य कपित्थस्य सुगन्धिनः।।2.91.73।।ह्रदाः पूर्णा रसालस्य दध्नश्श्वेतस्य चापरे।बभूवुः पायसस्यान्ये शर्करायावसञ्चयाः।।2.91.74।।
91_68.translation: There were thousands of pots, lakhs of plates, crores of vessels -- all made of gold and filled with wellgarnished food. Curd was kept in earthern pots like jugs and jars and pots with a wide mouth. Tanks were formed, some filled with white curd of good flavour and of the colour of woodapple, some with white curd blended with spices and some with payasam and heaps of barely powder mixed with sugar.
91_68.word_by_word: पात्रीणाम् vessels, सहस्राणि in thousands, स्थालीनाम् plates, नियुतानि in lakhs, शातकुम्भमयानि made of gold, पात्राणि pots (cups), सुसंस्कृताः wellcleansed, स्थाल्यः earthern jugs, कुम्भ्यः jars, करम्भ्यश्च pots with a wide mouth, यौवनस्थस्य not very ripe, गौरस्य white, सुगन्धिनः of good flavour, कपित्थस्य curds of the colour of wood apple, पूर्णाः filled with, ह्रदाः tanks, रसालस्य blended with spices, श्वेतस्य white, दध्नः curds, अपरे च some more tanks, पायसस्य sweets made from milk and rice cooked together (payasam), अन्ये some other tanks, शर्करायावसञ्चयाः food prepared from barley mixed with sugar, बभूवुः were formed.

91_69.shloka: कल्कान्चूर्णकषायांश्च स्नानानि विविधानि च।ददृशुर्भाजनस्थानि तीर्थेषु सरतां नराः।।2.91.75।।
91_69.translation: The soldiers saw on the river banks at landing places levigated powder, fragrant powder and extracts and other bathing requisites of different kinds stored in receptacles.
91_69.word_by_word: नराः men (soldiers), सरिताम् rivers, तीर्थेषु landing places, कल्कान् levigated powder, चूर्णकषायांश्च powder and extract, भाजनस्थानि in receptacles, विविधानि of different kinds,  स्नानानि च bathing requisites, ददृशुः were seen.

91_70.shloka: शुक्लानंशुमतश्चापि दन्तधावनसञ्चयान्।शुक्लांश्चन्दनकल्कांश्च समुद्गेष्ववतिष्ठतः।।2.91.76।।दर्पणापरिमृष्टांश्च वाससां चापि सञ्चयान्।पादुकोपानहां चैव युग्मानिच सहस्रशः।।2.91.77।।आञ्जनीः कङ्कतान्कूर्चान् शस्त्राणि च धनूंषि च।मर्मत्राणानि चित्राणि शयनान्यासनानि च।।2.91.78।।प्रतिपानह्रदान्पूर्णन्खरोष्ट्रगजवाजिनाम्।अवगाह्यसुतीर्थांश्चह्रदान् सोत्पलपुष्करान्।2.91.79।।आकाश वर्णप्रतिमान् स्वच्छतोयान्सुखप्लवान्।नीपवैडूर्यवर्णांश्च मृदून्यवससञ्चयान्।निर्वापार्थान् पशूनां ते ददृशुस्तत्र सर्वशः।।2.91.80।।
91_70.translation: There the soldiers beheld on every side stacks of toothbrushing sticks, white and bristled, white lumps of sandal paste placed in dishes made of leaves, well cleaned mirrors, collection of clothes, several pairs of footwear, collyrium boxes, combs,brushes for cleaning moustaches, weapons, parasoles, bows and shining armour, different kinds of couches, and seats. There were pools of drinking water for donkeys, camels, elephants and horses and excellent landing places filled with flowering lotuses and water lilies. The lakes were of transparent waters resembling the hue of the sky easy and comfortable for swimming. There they saw heaps of soft grass as green assapphire and kadamva trees for animals to refresh themselves under.
91_70.word_by_word: ते they (soldiers), तत्र there, सर्वशः on every side, शुक्लान् pure white, अंशुमतश्चापि bristled, दन्तधावनसञ्चयान् stacks of toothbrushing sticks, समुद्गेषु in dishes made of leaves, अतिष्ठतः placed, शुक्लान् pure white, चन्दनकल्कांश्च lumps of  sandal paste, परिमृष्टान् very wellcleaned, दर्पणान् च mirrors, वाससाम् clothes, सञ्चयान् चापि collection,  पादुकोपानहाम् foot wear for the feet, सहस्रशः in thousands, युग्मानि च of pairs, आञ्जनीः collyrium boxes, कङ्कतान् combs, कूर्चान् brushes for cleaning moustaches, शस्त्राणि च weapons, धनूंषि च bows, मर्मत्राणानि shields, चित्राणि armours for protecting vital parts, शयनानि couches, आसनानि च seats, खरोष्ट्रगजवाजिनाम् for donkeys, camels, elephants and horses, प्रतिपानह्रदान् pools of drinking water, अवगाह्यसुतीर्थान् excellent bathing places, सोतपलपुष्करान् filled with flowering lotuses and lilies, आकाशवर्णप्रतिमान् resembling the hue of the sky (blue), स्वच्छतोयान् pure and tranparent waters, सुखप्लवान् good and comfortable tanks for swimming in, ह्रदान् lakes, पशूनाम् for animals, निर्वापार्थान् for refreshing, नीपवैडूर्यवर्णांश्च like kadamva trees as green as the sapphire, मृदून् soft, यवसञ्चयान् heaps of grass collected together, ददृशुः beheld.

91_71.shloka: व्यस्मयन्त मनुष्यास्ते स्वप्नकल्पं तदद्भुतम्।दृष्ट्वाऽतिथ्यं कृतं तादृग्भरतस्य महर्षिणा।।2.91.81।।
91_71.translation: The men were amazed when they beheld the wonderful hospitality extended by maharshi Bharadwaja to Bharata, as if all this happened in a dream world.
91_71.word_by_word: ते मनुष्याः those men, महर्षिणा by the sage, भरतस्य to Bharata, कृतम् provided, तादृक् such, स्वप्नकल्पम् like a dream, अद्भुतम् wonderful, तत् that, आतिथ्यम् hospitality, दृष्ट्वा beholding, व्यस्मयन्त were amazed.

91_72.shloka: इत्येवं रममाणानां देवानामिव नन्दने।भरद्वाजाश्रमे रम्ये सा रात्रिर्व्यत्यवर्तत।।2.91.82।।
91_72.translation: As they were enjoying themselves in Bharadwaja's hermitage like the gods in the garden of Indra the night wore off.
91_72.word_by_word: इत्येवम् like this, नन्दने in the garden of Indra, देवानामिव as for gods, रम्ये in the lovely, भरद्वाजाश्रमे in Bharadwaja's hermitage, रममाणानाम् enjoying so, सा रात्रिः that night, व्यत्यवर्तत passed off.

91_73.shloka: प्रतिजग्मुश्च ता नद्यो गन्धर्वाश्च यथागतम्।भरद्वाजमनुज्ञाप्य ताश्च सर्वा वराङ्गनाः।।2.91.83।।
91_73.translation: Those rivers, the gandharvas and all those lovely women took leave of sage Bharadwaja and returned to where they had come from.
