91_73.word_by_word: ताः नद्यः those rivers, गन्धर्वाश्च and the gandharvas, सर्वाः all, ताः of them, वराङ्गनाश्च lovely women too, भरद्वाजम् Bharadwaja's, अनुज्ञाप्य obtaining permission, यथागतम् fromwhereever they had come, प्रतिजग्मुश्च returned.

91_74.shloka: तथैव मत्ता मदिरोत्कटा नरास्तथैव दिव्यागरुचन्दनोक्षिताः।तथैव दिव्या विविधास्स्रगुत्तमाः पृथक्प्रकीर्णा मनुजैः प्रमर्दिताः।।2.91.84।।
91_74.translation: Even after the departure of the gandharvas the soldiers who had consumed limitless liquor were still inebriated. The divine agaru and sandalwood smeared on their bodies still remained. Several splendid garlands crushed by them were strewn all over.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्य अयोध्याकाण्डे एकनवतितमस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the ninetyfirst sarga in Ayodhyakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
91_74.word_by_word: नराः men, मदिरोत्कटाः having consumed limitless drink, तथैव still, मत्ताः inebriated, तथैव still, दिव्यागरु smeared with divine agaru, चंदनोक्षिताः sandal fragrance, मनुजैः by people, प्रमर्दिताः wellcrushed, पृथक् helter skelter, प्रकीर्णाः strewn, दिव्याः divine, विविधाः several, स्रगुत्तमाः splendid garlands, तथैव remained so.

92_1.shloka: [Bharata takes leave of Bharadwaja -- departs for mount Chitrakuta.]ततस्तां रजनीमुष्य भरतस्सपरिच्छदः।कृतातिथ्यो भरद्वाजं कामादभिजगाम ह।।2.92.1।।
92_1.translation: Bharata with his retinue received the hospitality and spent the night at Bharadwaja's ashram. Then he approached Bharadwaja on his own.
92_1.word_by_word: ततः thereafter, कृतातिथ्यः having received the hospitality, सपरिच्छदः with his retinue, भरतः Bharata, तां रजनीम् that night, उष्य having spent, कामात् intention of, भरद्वाजम् Bharadwaja, अभिजगाम ह approached.

92_2.shloka: तं ऋषिः पुरुषव्याघ्रं प्राञ्जलिं प्रेक्ष्य चाऽगतम्।हुताग्निहोत्रो भरतं भरद्वाजोऽभ्यभाषत।।2.92.2।।
92_2.translation: Seeing Bharata, the best among men, who stood with folded palms, sage Bharadwaja, who had just completed his firesacrifice, said to him:
92_2.word_by_word: हुताग्निहोत्रः who had completed his firesacrifice, भरद्वाजः ऋषिः sage Bharadwaja, पुरुषव्याघ्रम् tiger among men, प्राञ्जलिम् with folded palms, आगतम् arrived, तं भरतम् to Bharata, प्रेक्ष्य having seen, अभ्यभाषत spoke.

92_3.shloka: कच्चिदत्र सुखा रात्रिस्तवास्मद्विषये गता।समग्रस्ते जनः कच्चिदातिथ्ये शंस मेऽनघ।।2.92.3।।
92_3.translation: O sinless one hope, you spent the night at our hermitage well? Tell me whether all your people enjoyed the hospitality?
92_3.word_by_word: अत्र here, अस्मद्विषये at our place, तव to you, रात्रिः night, सुखम् happily, गता कच्चित् hope you spent, हे अनघ O sinless one, आतिथ्ये in the matter of hospitality, ते जनः your people, समग्रः कच्चित् all well, मे शंस tell me.

92_4.translation: Bharata saluted with folded palms the sage of great powers. And emerging from the hermitage, replied:
92_4.word_by_word: भरतः Bharata, आश्रमात् from the hermitage, अभिनिष्क्रान्तम् emerging, उत्तमतेजसम् great power, तम् ऋषिम् that sage, अञ्जलिं कृत्वा with palms joined together, अभिप्रणम्य च and saluting him, उवाच said:

92_5.translation: O holy one, I with my ministers and the entire army of men and animals passed the night happily. All our desires have been gratified by you.
92_5.word_by_word: भगवन् O holy one, सामात्यः with my ministers, समग्रबलवाहनः with the entire army and animals, त्वया by you, बलवत् exceedingly, सर्वकामैः with all desires, तर्पितः gratified, सुखोषितः अस्मि passed pleasantly.

92_6.shloka: अपेतक्लमसन्तापा स्सुभिक्षास्सुप्रतिश्रयाः।अपि प्रेष्यानुपादाय सर्वे स्म सुसुखोषिताः।।2.92.6।।
92_6.translation: All of us including the messengers were released from fatigue and heat. We were wellfed and wellhoused and the night was wellspent.
92_6.word_by_word: प्रेष्यान् अपि even the messengers, उपादाय including, सर्वे all of us, अपेतक्लमसन्तापाः freed from fatigue and heat, सुभिक्षाः wellnourished, सुप्रतिश्रयाः wellhoused, सुसुखोषिताः स्मः we passed (the night) happily

92_7.shloka: आमन्त्रयेऽहं भगवन् कामं त्वामृषिसत्तमः।समीपं प्रस्थितं भ्रातुर्मैत्रेणेक्षस्व चक्षुषा।।2.92.7।।
92_7.translation: O venerable one O excellent of the ascetics I seek your leave. As I am proceeding to see my brother, bless me with a kindly look.
92_7.word_by_word: भगवन् O venerable one, ऋषिसत्तमः O excellent of the ascetics, अहम् I, त्वाम् you, कामम् greatly, आमन्त्रये I take leave of you, भ्रातुः brother's, समीपम् to, प्रस्थितम् set out, मैत्रेण friendly, चक्षुषा with eye, ईक्षस्व you may consider.

92_8.shloka: आश्रमं तस्य धर्मज्ञ धार्मिकस्य महात्मनः।आचक्ष्व कतमो मार्गः कियानिति च शंस मे।।2.92.8।।
92_8.translation: O knower of righteousness Tell me which path leads to the hermitage of that righteous and magnanimous one (Rama)? And how far is it (from here)?
92_8.word_by_word: धर्मज्ञ O knower of righteous ways, धार्मिकस्य of the righteous, तस्य महात्मनः of that magnanimous one, आश्रमम् hermitage, आचक्ष्व tell me, कतमः which, मार्गः is the path  कियान् how far, इति च that one also, मे to me, शंस tell.

92_9.shloka: इति पृष्टस्तु भरतं भ्रातृदर्शनलालसम्।प्रत्युवाच महातेजा भरद्वाजो महातपाः।।2.92.9।।
92_9.translation: Thus questioned, the great sage, brilliant Bharadwaja replied to Bharata who was yearning to see his brother:
92_9.word_by_word: महातेजाः brilliant, महातपाः a great sage, भरद्वाजः Bharadwaja, इति thus, पृष्टः questioned, भ्रातृदर्शनलालसम् yearning to see his brother, भरतम् to Bharata, प्रत्युवाच replied.

92_10.translation: O Bharata, three and a half yojanas from here in the lonely forest stands mount Chitrakuta, with its charming streams and woodlands
92_10.word_by_word: भरत O Bharata, अर्धतृतीयेषु three and a half, योजनेषु yojanas (one yojana is equivalent to eight miles), तत्र there, अजने lonely, वने forest, रम्यनिर्झरकाननः with charming streams and woodlands, चित्रकूटः Chitrakuta, गिरिः mountain (is there).

92_11.shloka: उत्तरं पार्श्वमासाद्य तस्य मन्दाकिनी नदी।पुष्पितद्रुमसञ्छन्ना रम्यपुष्पितकानना।।2.92.11।।
92_11.translation: On its northern side flows the river Mandakini which is densely covered with flowering trees and lovely blossoming woods (on its banks).
92_11.word_by_word: तस्य its, उत्तरं पार्श्वम् northern side, आसाद्य having reached, पुष्पितद्रुमसञ्चन्ना covered with flowering trees, रम्यपुष्पितकानना with lovely, blossoming woods, मन्दाकिनी नदी there is river Mandakini.

92_12.shloka: अनन्तरं तत्सरितश्चित्रकूटश्च पर्वतः।तयोः पर्णकुटी तात तत्र तौ वसतो ध्रुवम्।।2.92.12।।
92_12.translation: O dear child, beyond that river lies mount Chitrakuta on which there is a hut made of leaves where, for sure, they both dwell.
92_12.word_by_word: तत्सरितः that river, अनन्तरम् beyond, चित्रकूटः Chitrkuta, पर्वतः mountain, तयोः their, पर्णकुटी leafy hut, तात O dear child, तौ both of them, तत्र there, वसतः are living, ध्रुवम् this is certain.

92_13.shloka: दक्षिणेनैव मार्गेण सव्यदक्षिणमेव वा।गजवाजिरथाकीर्णां वाहिनीं वाहिनीपते।।2.92.13।।वाहयस्व महाभाग ततो द्रक्ष्यसि राघवम्।
92_13.translation: O distinguished lord of the army, if you lead your army full of elephants, horses and chariots through the southern path or towards the southwest, you will come across Rama there.
92_13.word_by_word: वाहिनीपते lord of the army, महाभाग O distinguished one, गजवाजिरथाकीर्णाम् consisting of elephants, horses and chariots, वाहिनीम् army, दक्षिणेनैव to its south, मार्गेण through the  path, सव्यदक्षिणमेव वा or towards southwest, वाहयस्व lead, ततः thereafter, राघवम् Rama, द्रक्षयसि you will see.

92_14.shloka: प्रयाणमिति तच्छ्रुत्वा रजराजस्य योषितः।हित्वा यानानि यानार्हाः ब्राह्मणं पर्यवारयन्।।2.92.14।।
92_14.translation: When they heard about the journey, the wives of Dasaratha descended from their chariots worthy of them and stood around the brahmin, Bharadwaja.
92_14.word_by_word: इति thus, प्रयाणम् about journey, श्रुत्वा having heard, यानार्हाः chariots worthy of them,राजराजस्य king of kings, Dasaratha's, योषितः wives, यानानि carriages, हित्वा leaving, ब्राह्मणम् that brahmin, पर्यवारयन् stood around.

92_15.shloka: वेपमाना कृशा दीना सह देव्या सुमित्रया।कौसल्या तत्र जग्राह कराभ्यां चरणौ मुनेः।।2.92.15।।
92_15.translation: Among them was Kausalya, trembling, emaciated and desolate, along with Sumitra.  They grasped the feet of sage Bharadwaja with their hands.
92_15.word_by_word: तत्र among them, कृशा emaciated, दीना desolate, कौसल्या Kausalya, वेपमाना trembling, मुनेः sage's, चरणौ feet, सुमित्रया देव्या सह along with Sumitra, जग्राह grasped.

92_16.shloka: असमृद्धेन कामेन सर्वलोकस्य गर्हिता।कैकेयी तस्य जग्राह चरणौ सव्यपत्रपा।।2.92.16।।
92_16.translation: Kaikeyi with her unfulfilled desire and despised in all the worlds overcome with shame, also grasped his feet.
92_16.word_by_word: असमृद्धेन with unfulfilled, कामेन with desire, सर्वलोकस्य for all the worlds, गर्हिता despised, कैकेयी Kaikeyi, सव्यपत्रपा overcome with shame, तस्य his, चरणौ feet, जग्राह grasped.

92_17.shloka: तं प्रदक्षिणमागम्य भगवन्तं महामुनिम्।अदूरार्भरतस्यैव तस्थौ दीनमनास्तदा।।2.92.17।।
92_17.translation: She reverently circumambulated that great and divine ascetic and stood not far awayfrom Bharata with a sad heart.
92_17.word_by_word: तदा then, भगवन्तम् divine, तं महामुनिम् that great ascetic, प्रदक्षिणं आगम्य reverently circumambulated, दीनमनाः with a sad heart, भरतस्य from Bharata, अदूरादेव not far away, तस्थौ stood.

92_18.shloka: ततः पप्रच्छ भरतं भरद्वाजो दृढव्रतः।विशेषं ज्ञातुमिच्छामि मात्रूणां तव राघव।।2.92.18।।
92_18.translation: Then Bharadwaja, firm in his vows, said to Bharata, I want to know about your mothers individually.
92_18.word_by_word: ततः thereafter, दृढव्रतः firm in vows, भरद्वाजः Bharadwaja, भरतम् Bharata, पप्रच्छ enquired, राघव O Bharata, तव your, मात्रूणाम् mothers, विशेषम् individually, ज्ञातुम् to know, इच्छामि want desiring.

92_19.shloka: एवमुक्तस्तु भरतो भरद्वाजेन धीमता।उवाच प्राञ्जलिर्भूत्वा वाक्यं वचनकोविदः।।2.92.19।।
92_19.translation: Thus asked by the sagacious Bharadwaja, Bharata, proficient in speech, replied with palms folded in reverence:
92_19.word_by_word: धीमता by the sagacious, भरद्वाजेन by Bharadwaja, एवम् thus, उक्तः asked, वचनकोविदःproficient in speech, भरतः Bharata, प्राञ्जलि: भूत्वा with palms joined together in reverence, वाक्यम् words, उवाच said.

92_20.shloka: यामिमां भगवन् दीनां शोकानशनकर्शिताम्।पितुर्हि महिषीं देवीं देवतामिव पश्यसि।।2.92.20।।एषा तं पुरषव्याघ्रं सिंहविक्रान्तगामिनम्।कौसल्या सुषुवे रामं धातारमदितिर्यथा।।2.92.21।।
92_20.translation: O venerable sage, this queen you are looking at, forlorn and emaciated due to grief and fasting, and who resembles a goddess is Kausalya, the principal queen of my father. As Aditi bore Dhata, she bore Rama, the best among men who walks with the powerful stride of a lion.
92_20.word_by_word: भगवन् O venerable one, दीनाम् desolate, शोकानशनकर्शिताम् emaciated due to grief and fasting, पितुः father's, महिषीम् principal queen, देवतामिव resembling a goddess, याम् इमाम्   देवीम् that this queen, पश्यसि you are seeing, एषा she, कौसल्या is Kausalya, अदितिः Aditi,धातारं यथा like Dhata, सिंहविक्रान्तगामिनम् walking with the powerful stride of a lion, पुरुषव्याघ्रम् tiger among men, तं रामम् that Rama, सुषुवे gave birth.

92_21.shloka: अस्या वामभुजं श्लिष्टा यैषा तिष्ठति दुर्मनाः।कर्णिकारस्य शाखेव शीर्णपुष्पा वनान्तरे।।2.92.22।।एतस्यास्तु सुतौ देव्याः कुमारौ देववर्णिनौ।उभौ लक्ष्मणशत्रुघ्नौ वीरौ सत्यपराक्रमौ।।2.92.23।।
92_21.translation: This lady plunged in grief, resembling the branch of a karnikara tree in the midst of the forest with blossoms withered and leaning on the left arm of Kausalya, is queen Sumitra, mother of two heroes, comparable to gods in beauty and possessing true prowess -- Lakshmana and Satrughna.
92_21.word_by_word: या एषा this woman, दुर्मनाः plunged in grief, वनान्तरे in the midst of the forest, शीर्णपुष्पा with blossoms withered, कर्णिकारस्य of the karnikara tree, शाखेव like a branch, अस्याः this Kausalya's, वामभुजम् left arm, श्लिष्टा leaning, तिष्ठति standing, कुमारौ two princes, देववर्णिनौequal to gods in beauty, वीरौ heroes, सत्यपराक्रमौ possessing no vain prowess, लक्षणशत्रुघ्नौ  Lakshmana and Satrughna, उभौ both, एतस्या देव्या: this queen's, सुतौ sons.

92_22.shloka: यस्याः कृते नरव्याघ्रौ जीवनाशमितो गतौ।राजपुत्रविहीनश्च स्वर्गं दशरथो गतः।।2.92.24।।क्रोधनामकृतप्रज्ञां दृप्तां सुभगमानिनीम्।ऐश्वर्यकामां कैकेयीमनार्यामार्यारूपिणीम्।।2.92.25।।ममैतां मातरं विद्धि नृशंसां पापनिश्चयाम्।यतोमूलं हि पश्यामि व्यसनं महदात्मनः।।2.92.26।।
92_22.translation: She is my mother Kaikeyi who is irascible, lacks the power of discrimination, proud, boastful of her beauty, ambitious of wealth, ignoble in the guise of a noble woman, wicked and intent on sinful acts. Behold her. You may know that because of her,  Rama and Lakshmana the best of men entered the forest which may cause their destruction and king Dasaratha attained heaven. She alone is the root of this great calamity that I am presently confronting.
92_22.word_by_word: यस्याः कृते on whose account, नरव्याघ्रौ best of men (Rama and Lakshmana), इतः from here, जीवनाशम् destruction of life, गतौ obtained, राजा दशरथः king Dasaratha, पुत्रविहीनश्च deprived of his son, स्वर्गम् heaven, गतः attained, आत्मन: mine, महत् great, व्यसनम्  calamity, यतोमूलम् the root cause of, पश्यामि I see, क्रोधानाम् irascible, अकृतप्रज्ञाम् is not discerning, दृप्ताम् proud, सुभगमानिनीम् considers herself beautiful, ऐश्वर्यकामाम् ambitious of wealth, अनार्याम् ignoble, आर्यरूपिणीम् in the guise of a noble woman, एताम् she, नृशंसाम् wicked, पापनिश्चयाम् intent on sinful acts, मम my, मातरम् mother, कैकेयीम् Kaikeyi, विद्धि you may know.

92_23.shloka: इत्युक्त्वा नरशार्दूलो बाष्पगद्गदया गिरा।स निश्स्वास ताम्राक्षो नागः कृद्ध इव श्वसन्।।2.92.27।।
92_23.translation: Thus spoke Bharata, the best of men, with his eyes reddened and voice choked with sobs and  hissing like a king cobra.
92_23.word_by_word: ताम्राक्षः with reddened eyes, नरशार्दूलः tiger among men, सः that Bharata, बाष्पगद्गदया in a voice choked with tears, गिरा with words, इति thus,उक्त्वा having said, कृद्धः angry, श्वसन् sighing, नागः इव like a king cobra, निश्स्वास heaved sighs.

92_24.shloka: भरद्वाजो महर्षिस्तं ब्रुवन्तं भरतं तथा।प्रत्युवाच महाबुद्धिरिदं वचनमर्थवत्।।2.92.28।।
92_24.translation: Hearing the words of Bharata, the great sage, wise Bharadwaja replied with meaningful words:
92_24.word_by_word: महाबुद्धि: wise, महर्षिः great sage Maharshi, भरद्वाजः Bharadwaja, तथा thus, ब्रुवन्तम्      speaking, तं भरतम् to that Bharata, अर्थवत् significant, इदं वचनम् these words, प्रत्युवाचreplied.

92_25.shloka: न दोषेणावगन्तव्या कैकेयी भरत त्वया।रामप्रव्राजनं ह्येतत्सुखोदर्कं भविष्यति।।2.92.29।।
92_25.translation: O Bharata, you should not find fault with Kaikeyi. Rama's banishment will prove a great source of happiness in future (for mankind).
92_25.word_by_word: भरत O Bharata, कैकेयी Kaikeyi, त्वया by you, दोषेण with any fault, न अवगन्तव्या should not be imputed, एतत् this, रामप्रव्राजनम् banishment of Rama, सुखोदर्कम् of great felicity, भविष्यति हि will become.

92_26.shloka: देवानां दानवानां च ऋषीणां भावितात्मनाम्।हितमेव भविष्यद्धि रामप्रव्राजनादिह।।2.92.30।।
92_26.translation: Banishment of Rama will bring about the welfare of the gods, the demons, and the sages of purified souls.
92_26.word_by_word: इह now, रामप्रव्राजनात् by banishing Rama, देवानाम् of gods, दानवानां च of demous, भावितात्मनाम् of purified souls, ऋषीणां rishis', हितमेव also welfare, भविष्यद्धि shall become.

92_27.shloka: अभिवाद्य तु संसिद्धः कृत्वा चैनं प्रदक्षिणम्।आमन्त्र्य भरत स्सैन्यं युज्यतामित्यचोदयत्।।2.92.31।।
92_27.translation: Having paid obeisance, the accomplished Bharata circumambulated sage Bharadwaja,look leave of him, and ordered his army to get ready.
92_27.word_by_word: भरतः Bharata, एनम् him, अभिवाद्य having paid obeisance, संसिद्धः getting ready for the journey, प्रदक्षिणं च कृत्वा having circumambulated, आमन्त्र्य having taken leave of him, युज्यताम् इति Be harnessed, सैन्यम् the army, अचोदयत् urged.

92_28.translation: Different groups of people intending to depart harnessed excellent horsechariots decorated with gold.
92_28.word_by_word: ततः then, बहुविधः different types, जनः people, प्रयाणार्थी wishing to proceed, दिव्यान् excellent, हेमपरिष्कृतान् decorated with gold, युक्तान् harnessed, वाजिरथान् horsechariots, अध्यारोहत् mounted.

92_29.shloka: गजकन्या गजाश्चैव हेमकक्ष्याः पताकिनः।जीमूता इव घर्मान्ते सघोषास्सम्प्रतस्थिरे।।2.92.33।।
92_29.translation: The male and female elephants wearing golden girths and decorated with pennants,  set forth with their bells sounding like thunderclouds at the end of summer.
92_29.word_by_word: हेमकक्ष्याः with golden girths, पताकिनः with pennants, गजकन्याः female elephants, गजाश्चैवalso male elephants, घर्मान्ते at the close of summer, जीमूताः इव like thunderclouds, सघोषाः with sounds, सम्प्रतस्थिरे set forth.

92_30.shloka: विविधान्यपि यानानि महन्ति च लघूनि च।प्रययु स्सुमहार्हाणि पादै रेव पदातयः।।2.92.34।।
92_30.translation: Various types of costly carriages, large and small, set forth, while the infantry marched on.
92_30.word_by_word: महन्ति च large ones, लघूनि च small ones, विविधानि of various kinds, सुमहार्हाणि costly, यानानि had carriages, प्रययुः set forth, पदातयः footsoldiers, पादैरेव set out on foot it self.

92_31.translation: The women headed by Kausalya, eager to see Rama, proceeded delightfully in distinguished carriages.
92_31.word_by_word: अथ thereafter, कौसल्याप्रमुखाः headed by Kausalya, स्त्रियः women, रामदर्शनकाङ्क्षिण्यः eager to see Rama, मुदिताः delightfully, तदा then, यानप्रवेकैः in distinguished carriages, प्रययुः went.

92_32.shloka: चन्द्रार्कतरुणाभासां निर्युक्तां शिबिकां शुभाम्।आस्थाय प्रययौ श्रीमान्भरत स्सपरिच्छदः।।2.92.36।।
92_32.translation: Magnanimous Bharata got into an auspicious palanquin of the splendour of the Sun and the Moon kept ready and proceeded amidst escorts.
92_32.word_by_word: श्रीमान् majestic, भरतः Bharata, चन्द्रार्कतरुणाभासाम् with the splendour of the Sun and the Moon, निर्युक्ताम् kept ready, शुभाम् auspicious, शिबिकाम् palanquin, आस्थाय having got in, सपरिच्छदः with retinue, प्रययौ proceeded.

92_33.shloka: सा प्रयाता महासेना गजवाजिरथाकुला।दक्षिणां दिशमावृत्य महामेघ इवोत्थितः।।2.92.37।।वनानि तु व्यतिक्रम्य जुष्टानि मृगपक्षिभिः।गङ्गायाः परवेलायां गिरिष्वपि नदीषु च।।2.92.38।।
92_33.translation: That vast army teeming with elephants, horses and chariots proceeded southward spreading like a lofty cloud that had risen in the sky, traversing through the forests full of birds and beasts, passing through the mountains and streams on the other side of the river Ganga.
92_33.word_by_word: गजवाजिरथाकुला teeming with elephants, horses and chariots, सा महासेना that vast army, उत्थितः that has arisen, महामेघ इव like a lofty cloud, दक्षिणां दिशम् southward, आवृत्य  having spread, मृगपक्षिभिः with birds and beasts, जुष्टानि visited, वनानि forests, व्यतिक्रम्य traversing, गङ्गाया: river Ganga's, परवेलायाम् on the other side, गिरिष्वपि through mountains also, नदीषु च and streams, प्रयाता proceeded.

92_34.shloka: सा सम्प्रहृष्टद्विपवाजियोधा वित्रासयन्ती मृगपक्षिसङ्घान्।महद्वनं तत्प्रतिगाहमाना रराज सेना भरतस्य तत्र।।2.92.39।।
92_34.translation: Bharata's army of soldiers, elephants and horses, all in high spirits, looked splendid while entering the forest full of frightening flocks of birds and beasts.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे द्विनवतितमस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the ninetysecond sarga in Ayodhyakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
92_34.word_by_word: सम्प्रहृष्टद्विपवाजियोधा with soldiers, elephants and horses in high spirits, मृगपक्षिसङ्घान् flocks of birds and beasts, वित्रासयन्ती frightening, भरतस्य Bharata's, सा सेना that army, तत्र there, तत् that, महत् great, वनम् forest, प्रतिगाहमाना while entering, रराज looked splendid.

93_1.shloka: [Bharata's Journey to Chitrakuta -- Bharata observes signs of smoke and presumes it to be the hermitage of Rama -- Bharata, Vasistha and Satrughna move forward towards the hermitage.]तया महत्या यायिन्या ध्वजिन्या वनवासिनः।अर्दिता यूथपा मत्ताः सयूथास्सम्प्रदुद्रुवुः।।2.93.1।।
93_1.translation: On seeing the great army marching, the exited leaders of herds of elephants inhabiting the forest were frightened and ran off with their herds.
93_1.word_by_word: यायिन्या while on the march, महत्या by the great, तया that, ध्वजिन्या by the army, वनवासिनः  foresters, मत्ताः exited, यूथपाः the leaders of herds, अर्दिताः were frightened, सयूथाः withherds, सम्प्रदुद्रुवुः ran off.

93_2.shloka: ऋक्षाः पृषतसङ्घाश्च रुरवश्च समन्ततः।दृश्यन्ते वनराजीषु गिरिष्वपि नदीषु च।।2.93.2।।
93_2.translation: Bears, herds of dappled gazelle and antelopes could be seen everywhere in the stretches of the forest, also on the mountains and on the river banks.
93_2.word_by_word: वनराजीषु in the stretches of the forest, गिरिष्वपि also on the mountains, नदीषु च at the river banks, समन्ततः on all sides, ऋक्षाः bears, पृषतसङ्घाश्च herds of dappled gazelle, रुरवश्च antelopes, दृश्यन्ते could be seen

93_3.shloka: स सम्प्रतस्थे धर्मात्मा प्रीतो दशरथात्मजः।वृतो महत्या नादिन्या सेनया चतुरङ्गया।।2.93.3।।
93_3.translation: Bharata the righteous son of Dasaratha, proceeded with great delight in the company of the clamouring army of four divisions.
93_3.word_by_word: धर्मत्मा the righteous, सः दशरथात्मजः that son of Dasaratha (Bharata), प्रीतः was delighted,  नादिन्या clamouring, महत्या great, चतुरङ्गया of four divisions, सेनया with army, वृतःsurrounded by, सम्प्रतस्थे proceeded.

93_4.shloka: सागरौघनिभा सेना भरतस्य महात्मनः।महीं सञ्छादयामास प्रावृषि द्यामिवाम्बुदः।।2.93.4।।
93_4.translation: The army of the magnanimous Bharata, resembling the waves of the ocean, covered the earth as the clouds cover the sky during the rainy season.
93_4.word_by_word: महात्मनः of the magnanimous one, भरतस्य Bharata's, सागरौघनिभा resembling the waves of ocean, सेना the army, प्रावृषि during the rainy season, अम्बुदः cloud, द्यामिव like the sky, महीम् the earth, सञ्छादयामास covered.

93_5.shloka: तुरङ्गौघैरवतता वारणैश्च महाजवैः।अनालक्ष्या चिरं कालं तस्मिन्काले बभूव भूः।।2.93.5।।
93_5.translation: At that moment, a multiutde of swift horses and elephants spread out with great speed and the surface of the earth became invisible for a long time.
93_5.word_by_word: तस्मिन्काले at that moment, महाजवैः with great speed, तुरङ्गौघैः with multitude of horses, वारणैश्च with elephants, अवतता overspread, भूः the earth, चिरकालम् for a long time, अनालक्ष्या  बभूव became invisible.

93_6.shloka: स यात्वा दूरमध्वानं सुपरिश्रान्तवाहनः।उवाच भरत श्श्रीमान् वसिष्ठं मन्त्रिणां वरम्।।2.93.6।।
93_6.translation: With his draught animals extremely wearied by covering a great distance, the majestic Bharata said to Vasistha, the best of counsellors:
93_6.word_by_word: श्रीमान् the majestic one, सः भरतः that Bharata, दूरम् great, अध्वानम् distance, यात्वा having travelled, सुपरिश्रान्तवाहनः with draught animals extremely wearied, मन्त्रिणाम् among counsellors, वरम् the best, वसिष्ठम् addressing Vasistha, उवाच said.

93_7.shloka: यादृशं लक्ष्यते रूपं यथा चैव श्रुतं मया।व्यक्तं प्राप्ताः स्म तं देशं भरद्वाजो यमब्रवीत्।।2.93.7।।
93_7.translation: Looking at these surroundings and from what I had heard, it is clear that we have reached the region indicated by Bharadwaja.
93_7.word_by_word: यादृशम् whichever, रूपम् the appearance, लक्ष्यते is being observed, मया by me, यथा as, श्रुतं चैव has been heard, यम् about which region, भरद्वाजः Bharadwaja, अब्रवीत् spoke, तं देशम् that region, प्राप्ताः स्म we have reached, व्यक्तम् this is clear.

93_8.shloka: अयं गिरिश्चित्रकूट इयं मन्दाकिनी नदी।एतत्प्रकाशते दूरान्नीलमेघनिभं वनम्।।2.93.8।।
93_8.translation: This mountain is Chitrakuta and this river, Mandakini. The forest shines from a distance like a blue cloud.
93_8.word_by_word: अयम् गिरिः this is the mountain, चित्रकूटः is Chitrakuta, इयं नदी this is the river, मन्दाकिनी Mandakini, दूरात् from a distance, एतत् this, नीलमेघनिभम् like a blue cloud, वनम् forest, प्रकाशते is shining.

93_9.shloka: गिरे स्सानूनि रम्याणि चित्रकूटस्य सम्प्रति।वारणैरवमृद्यन्ते मामकै पर्वतोपमैः।।2.93.9।।
93_9.translation: The enchanting ridges of mount Chitrakuta are now trampled by my mountainlike elephants.
93_9.word_by_word: सम्प्रति now, मामकैः relating to me, पर्वतोपमैः resembling mountains, वारणैः with elephants, चित्रकूटस्य गिरेः Chitrkuta mountain's, रम्याणि enchanting, सानूनि ridges, अवमृद्यन्ते are being trampled.

93_10.shloka: मुञ्चन्ति कुसुमान्येते नगाः पर्वतसानुषु।नीला इवातपापाये तोयं तोयधरा घनाः।।2.93.10।।
93_10.translation: The trees on the mountain ridges are shedding flowers, like dense blue rainclouds showering water at the end of summer.
93_10.word_by_word: पर्वतसानुषु on the mountain ridges, एते नगाः these trees, आतपापाये at the end of summer, नीलाः blue, घनाः dense, तोयधराः rainclouds, तोयम् इव like showers, कुसुमानि flowers, मुञ्चन्ति are shedding.

93_11.shloka: किन्नराचरितं देशं पश्य शत्रुघ्न पर्वतम्।मृगैस्समन्तादाकीर्णं मकरैरिव सागरम्।।2.93.11।।
93_11.translation: O Satrughna, behold this mountain frequented by kinneras and abounding in animals like great crocodiles in the ocean.
93_11.word_by_word: शत्रुघ्न O Satrughna, मकरैः with great crocodiles, सागरम् इव like ocean, समन्तात् everywhere, मृगैः with animals, आकीर्णम् abounding, किन्नराचरितम् frequented by kinneras, देशम् region, पर्वतम् mountain, पश्य behold.

93_12.shloka: एते मृगगणा भान्ति शीघ्रवेगाः प्रचोदिताः।वायुप्रविद्धा श्शरदि मेघराजिरिवाम्बरे।।2.93.12।।
93_12.translation: Incited by the clamour of the army, these swiftrunning herds of deer expelled from their retreats resemble mass of clouds in the autumnal sky shattered by the wind.
93_12.word_by_word: प्रचोदिताः incited, शीघ्रवेगाः swiftfooted, एते these, मृगगणाः herds of deer, शरदि autumnal, अम्बरे sky, वायुप्रविद्धा expelled, मेघराजिरिव like mass of clouds, भान्ति are appearing.

93_13.shloka: कुर्वन्ति कुसुमापीडान् शिरस्सु सुरभीनमी।मेघप्रकाशैः फलकैर्दाक्षिणात्या यथा नराः।।2.93.13।।
93_13.translation: Like the people of the south, the trees on the mountain ridges with branches, brilliant like clouds, are crowned with fragrant flowers as adornments.
93_13.word_by_word: अमी these mountain ridges, मेघप्रकाशैः looking brilliant like clouds, फलकैः shields, दाक्षिणात्याः belonging to southern region, नराः यथा like people, शिरस्सु on their heads, सुरभीन् fragrant, कुसुमापीडान् flower adornments, कुर्वन्ति are making.

93_14.shloka: निष्कूजमिव भूत्वेदं वनं घोरप्रदर्शनम्।अयोध्येव जनाकीर्णा सम्प्रति प्रतिभाति मा।।2.93.14।।
93_14.translation: This forest, dreadful in appearance was devoid of twittering of birds. But now it appears to me like Ayodhya thronged with people.
93_14.word_by_word: घोरप्रदर्शनम् dreadful in appearance, इदं वनम् this forest, निष्कूजमिव भूत्वा devoid of any twittering of birds, सम्प्रति now, जनाकीर्णा thronged with people, अयोध्येव like Ayodhya, मा to me, प्रतिभाति it appears.

93_15.shloka: खुरैरुदीरितो रेणुर्दावं प्रच्छाद्य तिष्ठति।तं वहत्यनिल श्श्रीघ्रं कुर्वन्निव मम प्रियम्।।2.93.15।।
93_15.translation: While the dust kicked by the hooves of the horses enveloped the forest, the wind, as if to please me, is quickly blowing them away.
93_15.word_by_word: खुरैः by the hooves, उदीरितः kicked, रेणुः dust, दावम् the forest, प्रच्छाद्य having enveloped, तिष्ठति is set, अनिलः wind, मम to me, प्रियम् pleasure, कुर्वन् इव as if to give, शीघ्रम् quickly, तम् that dust, वहति transporting it.

93_16.translation: Behold, O Satrughna, these chariots, commanded by excellent charioteers,  harnessed with horses are flying through the forest.
93_16.word_by_word: शत्रुघ्न O Satrughna, कानने in the forest, शीघ्रम् quickly, सम्पततः flying, सूतमुख्यैः by excellent charioteers, अधिष्ठितान् commanded by, तुरगोपेतान् drawn by horses, एतान् these, स्यन्दनान् chariots, पश्य behold.

93_17.translation: Behold, these lovely frightened peacocks and other birds hurriedly entering their nests.
93_17.word_by_word: प्रियदर्शनान् pleasant to look, वित्रासितान् frightened, एतम् अधिवासम् their nests, शीघ्रम्hurriedly, आविशतः entering, एतान् these, बर्हिणः peacocks, पतत्रिणः birds, पश्य behold.

93_18.shloka: अतिमात्रमयं देशो मनोज्ञः प्रतिभाति मे।तापसानां निवासोऽयं व्यक्तं स्वर्गपथो यथा।।2.93.18।।
93_18.translation: Being the abode of ascetics, this region looks very charming like the pathway to heaven.
93_18.word_by_word: अयं देशः this region, अतिमात्रम् very, मनोज्ञः charming, मे to me, प्रतिभाति appears, स्वर्गपथो यथा like pathway to heaven, अयम् this one, व्यक्तम् clearly, तापसानाम् ascetics', निवासः abode.

93_19.shloka: मृगा मृगीभिः सहिता बहवः पृषता वने।मनोज्ञरूपा दृश्यन्ते कुसुमैरिव चित्रिताः।।2.93.19।।
93_19.translation: In this forest many a dappled deer with their mates looking as if painted with flowers are seen wandering about with a charming appearance.
93_19.word_by_word: वने in this forest, बहवः many, पृषताः मृगाः spotted deer, कुसुमैः with flowers, चित्रिता इव as if painted, मनोज्ञरूपाः of charming appearance, मृगीभिः does, सहिताः in the company of,दृश्यन्ते are seen.

93_20.shloka: साधु सैन्याः प्रतिष्ठन्तां विचिन्वन्तु च कानने।यथा तौ पुरुषव्याघ्रौ दृश्येते रामलक्ष्मणौ।।2.93.20।।
93_20.translation: Let the soldiers set out and properly search the forest till such time the best of men, Rama and Lakshmana, are found.
93_20.word_by_word: पुरुषव्याघ्रौ best of men, तौ रामलक्ष्मणौ those Rama and Lakshmana, यथा how, दृश्येते they could be seen, सैन्याः soldiers, साधु properly, प्रतिष्ठन्ताम् let them proceed, कानने in the forest, विचिन्वन्तु च be searched.

93_21.shloka: भरतस्य वचश्श्रुत्वा पुरुषाश्शस्त्रपाणयः।विविशु स्तद्वनं शूरा धूमं च ददृशु स्ततः।।2.93.21।।
93_21.translation: Hearing the words of Bharata, those valiant warriors with weapons in their hands entered the forest. Therafter, they observed a spiral of smoke rising.
93_21.word_by_word: भरतस्य Bharata's, वचः words, श्रुत्वा having heard, शस्त्रपाणयः with weapons in their hands, शूराः valiant, पुरुषाः men, तत् that, वनम् forest, विविशुः entered, ततः then, धूमम् smoke, ददृशुश्च observed.

93_22.shloka: ते समालोक्य धूमाग्रमूचुर्भरतमागताः।नामनुष्ये भवत्यग्नि र्व्यक्तमत्रैव राघवौ।।2.93.22।।
93_22.translation: Having seen the column of smoke, they returned and informed Bharata, saying, 'In a place bereft of men, fire cannot exist. Clearly Rama and Lakshmana must be here only.'
93_22.word_by_word: ते they, धूमाग्रम् column of smoke, समालोक्य having seen, भरतम् to Bharata, आगताः returned, ऊचुः communicated, अमनुष्ये in a place bereft of men, अग्नि: fire, न भवति  cannot exist, व्यक्तम् clearly, राघवौ Rama and Lakshmana, अत्रैव are here only.

93_23.shloka: अथ नाऽत्र नरव्याघ्रौ राजपुत्रौ परन्तपौ।अन्ये रामोपमा स्सन्ति व्यक्तमत्र तपस्विनः।।2.93.23।।
93_23.translation: In case the two princes, Rama and Lakshmana, the best of men, and subduers ofenemies are not residing here then evidently it must be some other ascetics like Rama.
93_23.word_by_word: अथ otherwise, नरव्याघ्रौ tigers among men, परन्तपौ subduers of enemies, राजपुत्रौ princes, अत्र न if they are not here, अत्र here, रामोपमाः resembling Rama, अन्ये other, तपस्विनः सन्ति ascetics are there, व्यक्तम् evident.

93_24.translation: Having heard these words acceptable to the pious, Bharata, the crusher of enemy forces, addressed the entire army:
93_24.word_by_word: अमित्रबलमर्दनः who crushes the hostile armies, भरतः Bharata, तेषाम् their, साधुसम्मतम् acceptable to the pious, तत् वचनम् those words, श्रुत्वा having heard, सर्वान् entire, तान् सैन्यान् to that entire army, उवाच said.

93_25.shloka: यत्ता भवन्तस्तिष्ठन्तु नेतो गन्तव्यमग्रतः।अहमेव गमिष्यामि सुमन्त्रो गुरुरेव च।।2.93.25।।
93_25.translation: All of you carefully watch here. Do not proceed any further. Sumantra, the preceptor and myself shall go forward.
93_25.word_by_word: भवन्तः all of you, यत्ताः alertly, तिष्ठन्तु stay, इतः from here, अग्रतः forward, न गन्तव्यम् you should not proceed, अहमेव myself alone, गमिष्यामि I shall go, सुमन्त्रः Sumantra, गुरुरेव च  preceptor Vasistha also.

93_26.shloka: एवमुक्ता स्ततस्सर्वे तत्र तस्थुः समन्तः।भरतो यत्र धूमाग्रं तत्र दृष्टिं समादधात्।।2.93.26।।
93_26.translation: At this command, all of them halted. Then Bharata fixed his gaze on the source of the smoke.
93_26.word_by_word: ततः thereafter, एवम् thus, उक्ताः spoken, सर्वे all of them, समन्ततः everyside, तत्र there, तस्थुः  halted, भरतः Bharata, धूमाग्रम् column of smoke, यत्र where it is seen, तत्र there, दृष्टिम् gaze, समादधात् fixed.

93_27.shloka: व्यवस्थिता या भरतेन सा चमूर्निरीक्षमाणाऽपि च भूमिमग्रतः।बभूव हृष्टा न चिरेण जानती प्रियस्य रामस्य समागमं तदा।।2.93.27।।
93_27.translation: The army thus halted by Bharata, gazing at the space before them rejoiced at the thought that not long before they would rejoin their beloved Rama.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे त्रिनवतितमस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the ninetythird sarga in Ayodhyakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
93_27.word_by_word: या the army, भरतेन by Bharata, व्यवस्थिता has been halted, चमूः army, अग्रतः in the forefront, भूमिम् the space, निरीक्षमाणाऽपि च even though gazing at, न चिरेण not long before, तदा then, प्रियस्य of the beloved, रामस्य Rama's, समागमम् union, जानती knowing, हृष्टा बभूव rejoiced.

94_1.shloka: [Rama shares with Sita his delight of the beautiful nature around Chitrakuta mountain.]दीर्घकालोषित स्तस्मिन्गिरौ गिरिवनप्रियः।वैदेह्याः प्रियमाकाङ्क्षन्स्वं च चित्तं विलोभयन्।।2.94.1।।अथ दाशरथिश्चित्रं चित्रकूटमदर्शयत्।भार्याममरसङ्काश श्शचीमिव पुरन्दरः।।2.94.2।।
94_1.translation: Rama, resembling the gods, who had been living there for long developed a liking for the mountains and forests. With a desire to please Sita and his own mind, he showed her the wonderful Chitrakuta mountain as Indra did to his wife Sachi.
94_1.word_by_word: अथ thereafter, अमरसङ्काशः one who resembles the gods, गिरिवनप्रियः one fond of mountains and forests, तस्मिन् in that, गिरौ on the mountain, दीर्घकालोषितः who had been living for a long time, दाशरथिः Rama, वैदेह्याः Sita's, प्रियम् pleasure, आकाङ्क्षन् desiring, स्वम्own, चित्तम् mind, विलोभयन् to please, चित्रम् wonderful, चित्रकूटम् Chitrakuta mountain, भार्याम् to his consort, पुरन्दरः Indra (breaker of fortresses), शचीमिव like Sachi, अदर्शयत् showed.

94_2.shloka: दीर्घकालोषित स्तस्मिन्गिरौ गिरिवनप्रियः।वैदेह्याः प्रियमाकाङ्क्षन्स्वं च चित्तं विलोभयन्।।2.94.1।।अथ दाशरथिश्चित्रं चित्रकूटमदर्शयत्।भार्याममरसङ्काश श्शचीमिव पुरन्दरः।।2.94.2।।
94_2.translation: Rama, resembling the gods, who had been living there for long developed a liking for the mountains and forests. With a desire to please Sita and his own mind, he showed her the wonderful Chitrakuta mountain as Indra did to his wife Sachi.
94_2.word_by_word: अथ thereafter, अमरसङ्काशः one who resembles the gods, गिरिवनप्रियः one fond of mountains and forests, तस्मिन् in that, गिरौ on the mountain, दीर्घकालोषितः who had been living for a long time, दाशरथिः Rama, वैदेह्याः Sita's, प्रियम् pleasure, आकाङ्क्षन् desiring, स्वम्own, चित्तम् mind, विलोभयन् to please, चित्रम् wonderful, चित्रकूटम् Chitrakuta mountain, भार्याम् to his consort, पुरन्दरः Indra (breaker of fortresses), शचीमिव like Sachi, अदर्शयत् showed.

94_3.shloka: न राज्याद्भ्रंशनं भद्रे न सुहृद्भिर्विनाभवः।मनो मे बाधते दृष्ट्वा रमणीयमिमं गिरिम्।।2.94.3।।
94_3.translation: O gentle one, when I behold this lovely mountain, neither the expulsion from the kingdom nor being away from friends pains my mind.
94_3.word_by_word: हे भद्रे O gentle one, इमम् this, रमणीयम् lovely, गिरिम् mountain, दृष्ट्वा beholding, राज्यात् from the kingdom, भ्रंशनम् expulsion, मे मनः my mind, न बाधते does not pain, सुहृद्भिर्विनाभवः separation from friends, न does not pain.

94_4.translation: O auspicious one, you may behold this mountin abounding in flocks of birds of every kind and its peaks adorned wtih minerals and as if piercing the sky.
94_4.word_by_word: भद्रे O auspicious one, नानाद्विजगणायुतम् abounding in flocks of birds of every kind, खम् the sky, उद्विद्धैरिव as if piercing, धातुमद्भि: with minerals, शिखरैः peaks, विभूषितम् adorned, इमम् this, अचलम् mountain, पश्य you may see.

94_5.translation: This mountain with its peaks is adorned with various minerals. Some of the regions have the radiance of silver and bronze, some look bloodred or maddercrimson, some sparkle like the rarest of gems while others shine like topaz or crystal or a flower of ketaka plant or shimmer like stars and quicksilver.
94_5.word_by_word: धातुविभूषिताः adorned with minerals, अचलेन्द्रस्य of this lord of the mountains, केचित् some, देशाः regions, रजतसङ्काशाः similar to (the radiance of) silver, केचित् some regions, क्षतजसंनिभाः are having bloodred colour, पीतमाञ्जिष्टवर्णाश्च (some) colour of maddercrimson, केचित् some, मणिवरप्रभाः sparkle like the best of gems, पुष्यार्ककेतकाभाश्च shining like topaz, or crystal or a flower of ketaka plant, केचित् some, ज्योतीरसप्रभाः shimmering like stars or quicksilver, विराजन्ते shining.

94_6.translation: This mount Chitrakuta is swarmed by flocks of birds and herds of several kinds of animals like tigers, panthers and bears of every kind giving up their cruel nature.
94_6.word_by_word: अयं शैलः this mountain, अदुष्टैः without being cruel, नानामृगगणद्वीपितरर्क्ष्वृक्षगणैः with herds of several kinds of animals like tigers, panthers and bears, वृतः surrounded by, बहुपक्षिसमायुतः united with flocks of birds, भाति is shining.

94_7.translation: This mountain is spread over with various kinds of flowering trees and trees laden with fruits, shady and enchanting, mango, roseapples, asanas, lodhras, priyalas, jackfruit trees, dhavas, ankolas, lovely tinisas, bilva trees, tinduka and bamboo, kashmaya, arishta and varuna, madhukas, tilaka trees, badari and myrobalan trees, nipa trees, cane, danvas, and promegranate trees, the mountain looks splendid.
94_7.word_by_word: अयं गिरिः this mountain, पुष्पवद्भिः covered with flowers, फलोपेतैः laden with fruits, छायावद्भिः shady, मनोरमैः enchanting, आम्रजम्ब्वसनैः mango, roseapples, asana trees, लोध्रैः lodhra trees, प्रियालैः priyala trees, पनसैः jackfruit trees, धवैः dhava trees, अङ्कोलैः ankola trees, भव्यतिनिशैः lovely tinisa trees, बिल्वतिन्दुकवेणुभिः bilva trees, tinduka and bamboo, काश्मर्यारिष्टवरुणैः kashmaya, arishta and varuna तथा similarly,मधूकैः madhuka trees, तिलकैः tilaka trees, बदर्यामलकै: badari and myrobalan trees, नीपैः kodamva trees, वेत्रधन्वनबीजकैः cane, danvas, and promegranates, एवमादिभि: with these kinds of trees, आकीर्णः spread over, श्रियम् splendour, पुष्यति enhancing.

94_8.shloka: शैलप्रस्थेषु रम्येषु पश्येमान् रोमहर्षणान्।किन्नरान् द्वन्द्वशो भद्रे रममाणान्मनस्विनः।।2.94.11।।
94_8.translation: O auspiciouslooking one, behold these highspirited kinneras in pairs who are sporting on the picturesque hill plateaus causing thrills.
94_8.word_by_word: भद्रे O auspicious one, रम्येषु in the beautiful, शैलप्रस्थेषु on the plateau, द्वन्द्वशः in pair, रममाणान् sporting, रोमहर्षणान् thrilling, मनस्विनः highspirited, इमान् these, किन्नरान् kinneras, पश्य behold.

94_9.shloka: शाखावसक्तान् खड्गांश्च प्रवराण्यम्बराणि च।पश्य विद्याधरस्त्रीणां क्रीडोद्धेशान्मनोरमान्।।2.94.12।।
94_9.translation: Behold the captivating sporting retreats of Vidyadharis, with their swords and best garments hung on the branches of the trees.
94_9.word_by_word: विद्याधरस्त्रीणाम् by Vidyadhara women, शाखावसक्तान् hanging from the branches, खड्गांश्च  swords, प्रवराणि best, अम्बराणि च garments, मनोरमान् captivating, क्रीडोद्धेशान् sporting retreats, पश्य behold.

94_10.shloka: जलप्रपातैरुद्भेदैर्निष्यन्दैश्च क्वचित्क्वचित्।स्रवद्भिर्भात्ययं शैल स्स्रवन्मद इव द्विपः।।2.94.13।।
94_10.translation: Behold a waterfall here and a fountain there gushing from the earth and in other places, the mountain looks like an elephant rutting ichor.
94_10.word_by_word: अयम् this, शैलः mountain, क्वचित् क्वचित् here and there, स्रवद्भिः by the flowing, जलप्रपातैः  waterfalls, उद्भेदैः sprouting from the earth, निष्यन्दैश्च fountains, स्रवन्मदः emitting the ichor, द्विपः इव like the elephant, भाति shining.

94_11.translation: The breeze from the caves carrying the fragrance of many flowers is satisfying the sense of smell. Who will not find it delightful?
94_11.word_by_word: नानापुष्पभवान् produced from many flowers, गन्धान् fragrance, वहन् carrying, गुहासमीरणः breeze from the caves, घ्राणतर्पणम् satisfying the sense of smell, अभ्येत्य going towards, कं नरम् which man, न प्रहर्षयेत् would not delight?

94_12.shloka: यदीह शरदोऽनेकास्त्वया सार्धमनिन्दिते।लक्ष्मणेन च वत्स्यामि न मां शोकः प्रधक्ष्यति।।2.94.15।।
94_12.translation: O flawless one, if I am to live here for many years to come with you and Lakshmana,no grief will consume me.
94_12.word_by_word: अनिन्दिते O flawless one, त्वया with you, लक्ष्मणेन च सार्धम् and in the company Lakshmana, इह here, अनेकाः many, शरदः autumns, वत्स्यामि यदि if I am to live, माम् me, शोकः grief, न प्रधक्ष्यति will not consume.

94_13.translation: O lovely Sita, I am enamoured of this delightful mountain with its enchanting peaks laden with abundance of flowers and fruits and flocked by different kinds of birds.
94_13.word_by_word: भामिनि O lovely Sita, बहुपुष्पफले laden with abundance of flowers and fruits, नानाद्विजगणायुते flocked by different kinds of birds, विचित्रशिखरे on enchanting mountain peaks, रम्ये delightful, अस्मिन् on this mountain, रतवान् अस्मि हि I am fond of.

94_14.shloka: अनेन वनवासेन मया प्राप्तं फलद्वयम्।पितुश्चानृणता धर्मे भरतस्य प्रियं तथा।।2.94.17।।
94_14.translation: By living in the forest I have achieved a twofold benefitdischarge of debt of my father with regard to righteousness and causing happiness to Bharata.
94_14.word_by_word: अनेन by this, वनवासेन staying in the forest, धर्मे with regard to righteousness, पितुः to father, अनृणता discharge of debt, तथा also, भरतस्य Bharata's, प्रियम् pleasure, फलद्वयम्twofold benefit, मया by me, प्राप्तम् have been obtained.

94_15.translation: O Sita, are you enjoying by being with me here on this Chitrakuta and observing various objects gratifying to the body, mind and speech?
94_15.word_by_word: हे वैदेहि O Sita, मनोवाक्कायसम्मतान् gratifying to body, speech and mind, विविधान् various, भावान् objects, पश्यन्ती observing, चित्रकूटे on Chitrakuta, मया सह along with me, रमसे कच्चित् are you enjoying?

94_16.shloka: इदमेवामृतं प्राहू राज्ञि राजर्षयः परे।वनवासं भवार्थाय प्रेत्य मे प्रपितामहाः।।2.94.19।।
94_16.translation: My greatgrandfathers and ancient royal sages used to say that living in the forest is like enjoying nectar for a king for the best existence after death.
94_16.word_by_word: मे my, प्रपितामहाः greatgrandfathers, परे ancestors, राजर्षयः royal sages, प्रेत्य after death, भवार्थाय for best existence, इदम् this, वनवासमेव living in the forest, राज्ञि for the king, अमृतम्  like nectar, प्राहुः said.

94_17.shloka: शिला श्शैलस्य शोभन्ते विशाला श्शतशोऽभितः।बहुला बहुलैर्वर्णैर्नीलपीतसितारुणैः।।2.94.20।।
94_17.translation: Several hundreds of massive rocks of the mountain look splendid all around, in  blueblack, yellow, white and red colours.
94_17.word_by_word: बहुलैः several, नीलपीतसितारुणैः blueblack, yellow, white and red, वर्णैः colours, बहुलाः many, विशालाः massive, शैलस्य mountain's, शिलाः rocks, शतशः in hundreds, अभितः on all sides, शोभन्ते are looking splendid.

94_18.shloka: निशिभान्त्यचलेन्द्रस्य हुताशनशिखा इव।ओषध्यः स्वप्रभालक्ष्म्या भ्राजमाना स्सहस्रशः।।2.94.21।।
94_18.translation: Herbs in thousands on this king of the hills shine in the night with the splendour of  their own lustre, like flames of fire.
94_18.word_by_word: स्वप्रभालक्ष्म्या with the splendour of their own lustre, भ्राजमानाः illuminating, सहस्रशः in thousands, अचलेन्द्रस्य of this lord of the hills (Chitrakuta's), ओषध्यः herbs, निशि in the night, हुताशनशिखा इव like flames of fire, भान्ति shine.

94_19.shloka: केचित् क्षयनिभा देशाः केचिदुद्यानसन्निभाः।केचिदेकशिला भान्ति पर्वतस्यास्य भामिनि।।2.94.22।।
94_19.translation: O lovely Sita Some regions of the mountain look like dwellingplaces, some others are like flowergardens and some are shining like a single rock.
94_19.word_by_word: भामिनि O lovely Sita, अस्य this, पर्वतस्य mountain's, केचित् some, देशाः regions, क्षयनिभाः like dwellings, केचित् some, उद्यानसन्निभाः like flower gardens, केचित् some, एकशिलाः in the  form of a single rock, भान्ति are shining.

94_20.shloka: भित्त्वेव वसुधां भाति चित्रकूटस्समुत्थितः।चित्रकूटस्य कूटोऽसौ दृश्यते सर्वत श्शुभः।।2.94.23।।
94_20.translation: This Chitrakuta mountain stands erect as if it has arisen by splitting open the earth and its peak looks graceful from every side.
94_20.word_by_word: चित्रकूटः Chitrakuta mountain, वसुधाम् this earth, भित्त्वा splitting open, समुत्थितः इव as if rising from, भाति shining, चित्रकूटस्य Chitrakuta's, असौ this, कूटः peak, सर्वतः on every side, शुभः gracious, दृश्यते is seen.

94_21.translation: Behold those excellent couches of lovers spread with leaves of kustha, sthagara, punnaga and bhurja and covered with lotus petals.
94_21.word_by_word: कुष्ठस्थगरपुन्नाग भूर्जपत्रोत्तरच्छदान् covered with leaves of kustha, sthagara, punnaga and bhurja, कुशेशयदलायुतान् covered with lotus petals, कामिनाम् lovers, स्वास्तरान् excellent couches, पश्य behold.

94_22.shloka: मृदिताश्चापविद्धाश्च दृश्यन्ते कमलस्रजः।कामिभिर्वनिते पश्य फलानि विविधानि च।।2.94.25।।
94_22.translation: O Lady, behold those lotus garlands crushed and cast aside by lovers and also many fruits (tasted by them and) lying there.
94_22.word_by_word: वनिते O lady, कामिभिः by lovers, मृदिताश्च crushed, अपविद्धाश्च cast aside, कमलस्रजः lotus garlands, विविधानि many, फलानि च fruits, दृश्यन्ते can be seen, पश्य behold.

94_23.translation: This Chitrakuta mountain, with abundance of roots, fruits and water surpasses in beauty Vasvaukasara, the capital city of Kubera or Nalini, his celestial garden or the land of Uttarakuru.
94_23.word_by_word: बहुमूलफलोदकः with abundance of roots, fruits and water, असौ this, चित्रकूट: पर्वत: Chitrakuta mountain, वस्वौकसाराम् Vasvaukasara, the capital city of Kubera, नलिनीम्  Nalini, the celestial lake of Kubera, उत्तरान् कुरून् the land of Uttarakuru, अत्येतीव surpasses.

94_24.shloka: इमं तु कालं वनिते विजह्रिवांस्त्वया च सीते सह लक्ष्मणेन च।रतिं प्रपत्स्ये कुलधर्मवर्धनीं सतां पथि स्वैर्नियमैः परैः स्थितः।।2.94.27।।
94_24.translation: O my beloved Sita, by spending time with you and Lakshmana following the path of the virtuous with utmost restraint and by enhancing the righteousness of my race, I shall obtain great felicity.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे चतुर्नवतितमस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the ninetyfourth sarga in Ayodhyakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
94_24.word_by_word: वनिते सीते O my beloved Sita, इमं कालम् this time, त्वया च with you, लक्ष्मणेन सह and also with Lakshmana, विजह्रिवान् wandering about, स्वैः by my own, परैः utmost, नियमैः  restraint, सताम् virtuous men's, पथि path, स्थितः following, कुलधर्मवर्धनीम् as enhancing the righteousness of my race, रतिम् felicity, प्रपत्स्ये I shall obtain.

95_1.shloka: [Rama describes to Sita the beauty of mountains, rivers, birds and animals at Chitrakuta.]अथ शैलाद्विनिष्क्रम्य मैथिलीं कोसलेश्वरः।अदर्शयच्छुभजलां रम्यां मन्दाकिनीं नदीम्।।2.95.1।।
95_1.translation: Then Rama, the lord of Kosala, descended from the mountain and showed Sita the charming river Mandakini of sacred waters.
95_1.word_by_word: अथ then, कोसलेश्वरः lord of Kosala (Rama), शैलात् from the mountain, विनिष्क्रम्य having descended, शुभजलाम् of sacred water, रम्याम् charming, मन्दाकिनीं नदीम् river Mandakini, मैथिलीम् to Sita, अदर्शयत् showed.

95_2.shloka: अब्रवीच्च वरारोहां चारुचन्द्रनिभाननाम्।विदेहराजस्य सुतां रामो राजीवलोचनः।।2.95.2।।
95_2.translation: Lotus-eyed Rama said to the heavy-hipped daughter of the king of Videha, whose face resembled the beautiful Moon.
95_2.word_by_word: राजीवलोचनः lotus-eyed, रामः Rama, वरारोहाम् to the heavy-hipped, चारुचन्द्रनिभाननाम् to her whose face resembled the beautiful Moon, विदेहराजस्य of the king of Videha, सुताम् daughter, अब्रवीच्च said.

95_3.shloka: विचित्रपुलिनां रम्यां हंससारससेविताम्।कमलैरुपसम्पन्नां पश्य मन्दाकिनीं नदीम्।।2.95.3।।
95_3.translation: Look at this enchanting river Mandakini with its variegated sandbanks frequented by geese and swans and adorned with lotuses.
95_3.word_by_word: विचित्रपुलिनाम् of variagated sandbanks, रम्याम् enchanting, हंससारससेविताम् frequented by geese and swans, कमलैः with lotus, उपसम्पन्नाम् adorned with, मन्दाकिनीं नदीम् river Mandakini, पश्य look.

95_4.shloka: नानाविधैस्तीररुहै र्वृतां पुष्पफलद्रुमैः।राजन्तीं राजराजस्य नलिनीमिव सर्वतः।।2.95.4।।
95_4.translation: See this river sparkling with trees of every kind laden with fruits and flowers growing on its banks. Everywhere it resembles the lake Nalini of Kubera.
95_4.word_by_word: सर्वतः everywhere, नानाविधैः of various kinds, तीररुहैः growing on its banks, पुष्पफलद्रुमैः  trees, laden with fruits and flowers, वृताम् surrounded by, राजराजस्य Kubera's, नलिनीम् इव like fragrant lake Nalini, राजन्तीम् sparkling.

95_5.shloka: मृगयूथनिपीतानि कलुषाम्भांसि साम्प्रतम्।तीर्थानि रमणीयानि रतिं सञ्जनयन्ति मे।।2.95.5।।
95_5.translation: The herds of deer have just drunk water by descending down the landing places and the waters are still turbid. This sight produces great pleasure in me.
95_5.word_by_word: साम्प्रतम् just now, मृगयूथनिपीतानि drunk by herds of deer, कलुषाम्भांसि of turbid waters, रमणीयानि lovely, तीर्थानि landing places, मे to me, रतिम् pleasure, सञ्जनयन्ति is producing.

95_6.shloka: जटाजिनधराः काले वल्कलोत्तरवाससः।ऋषय स्त्ववगाहन्ते नदीं मन्दाकिनीं प्रिये।।2.95.6।।
95_6.translation: O my beloved rishis with matted locks and wearing deer skins and bark of trees as upper cloth bathe in the river Mandakini for performing morning ablutions in time.
95_6.word_by_word: प्रिये O my beloved, जटाजिनधराः with matted locks and wearing deer skins, वल्कलोत्तरवाससः bark as upper cloth, ऋषयः rishis, काले at the appointed hour, मन्दाकिनीं नदीम् the river Mandakini, अवगाहन्ते are immersing.

95_7.shloka: आदित्यमुपतिष्ठन्ते नियमादूर्ध्वबाहवः।एते परे विशालाक्षि मुनय स्संशितव्रताः।।2.95.7।।
95_7.translation: O largeeyed Sita, some other ascetics of rigid austerities worship the sungod according to tradition, lifting up their arms and invoking the Sun.
95_7.word_by_word: विशालाक्षि O largeeyed Sita, संशितव्रताः of rigid austerities, एते परे some other, मुनयः ascetics, नियमात् according to tradition, ऊर्ध्वबाहवः lifting up their arms, आदित्यम्  Sungod, उपतिष्ठन्ते are worhipping.

95_8.shloka: मारुतोद्धूतशिखरैः प्रनृत्त इव पर्वतः।पादपैः पत्रपुष्पाणि सृजद्भिरभितो नदीम्।।2.95.8।।
95_8.translation: With the trees whose tops are swayed by the wind, the mountain was as if dancing, shedding leaves and flowers all around the river.
95_8.word_by_word: मारुतोद्धूतशिखरैः tree tops swayed by the wind, नदीमभितः around the river, पत्रपुष्पाणि leaves and flowers, सृजद्भिः shedding, पादपैः with trees, पर्वतः mountain, प्रनृत्त इव seems dancing.

95_9.translation: Behold this river Mandakini whose waters here are transparent like crystals, there sparkling with sand dunes and elsewhere crowded with siddhas.
95_9.word_by_word: क्वचित् at some places, मणिनिकाशोदाम् with water transparent as crystals, क्वचित् at some other places, पुलिनशालिनीम् sparkling with sand dunes, क्वचित् at some places, सिद्धजनाकीर्णाम् filled with siddhas (those acomplished in spiritual pursuits), मन्दाकिनीं नदीम् river Mandakini, पश्य see.

95_10.translation: Look at the scattered heaps of flowers shaken off by the wind and large quantities of flowers floating on the waters.
95_10.word_by_word: वायुना by the wind, निर्धूतान् shaken off, विततान् scattered, पुष्पसञ्चयान् heaps of flowers, पश्य see, जलमध्यगान् in the midst of waters, पोप्लूयमानान् floating, अपरान् other masses of flowers, त्वम् you, पश्य see.

95_11.shloka: तांश्चातिवल्गुवचसो रथाङ्गाह्वयना द्विजाः।अधिरोहन्ति कल्याणि निष्कूजन्त श्शुभा गिरः।।2.95.11।।
95_11.translation: O my auspicious Sita, sweetvoiced Chakravaka birds singing in most pleasant tones are alighting on those heaps of flowers.
95_11.word_by_word: कल्याणि O my auspicious Sita, वल्गुवचसः of sweetvoiced, रथाङ्गाह्वयनाः birds named Chakravaka, द्विजाः birds, शुभाः most pleasant, गिरः tones, निष्कूजन्तः uttering, तान् on those (heaps of flowers), अधिरोहन्ति alighting.

95_12.shloka: दर्शनं चित्रकूटस्य मन्दाकिन्याश्च शोभने।अधिकं पुरवासाच्च मन्ये तव च दर्शनात्।।2.95.12।।
95_12.translation: My lovely Sita, I consider watching this mount Chitrakuta and river Mandakini in your presence more delightful than living in Ayodhya.
95_12.word_by_word: शोभने my lovely Sita, तव your, दर्शनात् in presence, चित्रकूटस्य Chitrakuta's, मन्दाकिन्याश्च  Mandakini's, दर्शनम् viewing, पुरवासाच्छ compared to living in Ayodhya, अधिकम् is  greater, मन्ये I consider.

95_13.translation: The waters of river Mandakini is perpetually agitated by siddhas who are endowed with asceticism, selfrestraint and tranquillity and who are cleansed of sins by taking bath in the river. Plunge with me into this river.
95_13.word_by_word: विधूतकलुषैः cleansed of sins, तपोदमशमान्वितैः endowed with asceticism, selfrestraint and  tranquillity, सिद्धैः with siddhas, नित्यविक्षोभितजलाम् with perpetually agitated waters, मया सह with me, विगाहस्व enter.

95_14.shloka: सखीवच्च विगाहस्व सीते मन्दाकिनीं नदीम्।कमलान्यवमज्जन्ती पुष्कराणि च भामिनि।।2.95.14।।
95_14.translation: O lovely Sita, like a companion plunge into this river Mandakini, submerging the red and white lotuses, and enjoy sporting.
95_14.word_by_word: भामिनि O lovely, सीते Sita, कमलानि red lotuses, पुष्कराणि च white lotuses, अवमज्जन्ती  submerging, सखीवत् like a friend, मन्दाकिनीं नदीम् Mandakini river, विगाहस्व you may enter.

95_15.shloka: त्वं पौरजनवद्व्यालानयोध्यामिव पर्वतम्।मन्यस्व वनिते नित्यं सरयूवदिमां नदीम्।।2.95.15।।
95_15.translation: O my lovely lady Always think this river Mandakini as Sarayu and this mount Chitrakuta as Ayodhya and these wild animals as its inhabitants.
95_15.word_by_word: वनिते O my lovely lady, त्वम् you, व्यालान् wild animals, पौरजनवत् as inhabitants of Ayodhya, पर्वतम् mountain, अयोध्यामिव as Ayodhya, इमाम् this, नदीम् river, सरयूवत् as Sarayu, नित्यम् always, मन्यस्व think of.

95_16.shloka: लक्ष्मणश्चापि धर्मात्मा मन्निदेशे व्यवस्थितः।त्वं चानुकूला वैदेहि प्रीतिं जनयथो मम।।2.95.16।।
95_16.translation: With righteous Lakshmana obedient and you, O Sita, agreeable to me, you both bring me great pleasure.
95_16.word_by_word: वैदेहि O Sita, धर्मात्मा righteous, लक्ष्मणश्चापि Lakshmana also, मन्निदेशे at my command, व्यवस्थितः obedient, त्वं च you also, अनुकूला agreeable, मम to me, प्रीतिम् pleasure, जनयथः are causing.

95_17.shloka: उपस्पृशंस्त्रिषवणं मधुमूलफलाशनः।नायोध्यायैन राज्याय स्पृहयेऽद्य त्वया सह।।2.95.17।।
95_17.translation: Bathing thrice in your company at the time of prayers and partaking honey, roots and fruits, I do not yearn either for Ayodhya or for the kingdom.
95_17.word_by_word: त्रिषवणम् thrice at the time of prayers, उपस्पृशन् bathing, मधुमूलफलाशनः honey, roots and fruits, त्वया सह in your company, अद्य now, अयोध्यायै for Ayodhya, न स्पृहये I do not yearn for, राज्याय न nor even the kingdom.

95_18.shloka: इमांहि रम्यां मृगयूथशालिनीं निपीततोयां गजसिंहवानरैः।सुपुष्पितां पुष्पभरैरलङ्कृतां नसोऽस्ति य स्स्यान्न गतक्लम स्सुखी।।2.95.18।।
95_18.translation: With this enchanting Mandakini teeming with herds of deer, whose waters are drunk by elephants, lions and monkeys, decorated with heaps of flowers fallen from the trees in full bloom, who will not feel happy and free from fatigue.
95_18.word_by_word: रम्याम् enchanting, मृगयूथशालिनीम् teeming with herds of deer, गजसिंहवानरैः with elephants, lions and monkeys, निपीततोयाम् its waters being drunk by, सुपुष्पिताम् in full  bloom, पुष्पभरैः with multitude of flowers, अलङ्कृताम् decorated, इमाम् this (river Mandakini), यः who, गतक्लमः with fatigue gone, सुखी happy, न स्यात् will not find himself, सः that one, नास्ति does not exist.

95_19.shloka: इतीव रामो बहुसङ्गतं वचः प्रियासहाय स्सरितं प्रति ब्रुवन्।चचार रम्यं नयनाञ्जनप्रभं स चित्रकूटं रघुवंशवर्धनः।।2.95.19।।
95_19.translation: Rama, the perpetuator of the Raghu dynasty, describing the river Mandakini at length appropriately in this manner, wandered in the company of his beloved consort on mount Chitrakuta looking black like collyrium.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे पञ्चनवतितमस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the ninetyfifth sarga in Ayodhyakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
95_19.word_by_word: रघुवंशवर्धनः perpetuator of Raghu dynasty, सः रामः that Rama, इतीव in this manner, सरितं प्रति about Mandakini river, बहु at length, सङ्गतम् appropriate, वचः words, ब्रुवन् speaking,  प्रियासहायः in the company of his beloved, नयनाञ्जनप्रभम् resembling collyrium in hue, रम्यम् delightful, चित्रकूटम् Chitrakuta, चचार wandered about.

96_1.shloka: [Rama hears the sounds of the army approaching the hermitage -- alerts Lakshmana to make sure -- recognition of the army as that of Bharata's -- Lakshmana mistakes Bharata's intentions.]तां तथा दर्शयित्वा तु मैथिलीं गिरिनिम्नगाम्।निषसाद गिरिप्रस्थे सीतां मांसेन छन्दयन्।।2.96.1।।
96_1.translation: Rama showed Sita, the princess of Mithila the river Mandakini flowing in the mountain, gratified her by offering meat (to eat) and sat on the mountain slope.
96_1.word_by_word: मैथिलीम् princess of Mithila, तां सीताम् to Sita, तथा in that way, गिरिनिम्नगाम्  mountainriver, दर्शयित्वा having shown, मांसेन with meat, छन्दयन् gratifying, गिरिप्रस्थे on the mountainslope, निषसाद sat.

96_2.shloka: इदं मेध्यमिदं स्वादु निष्टप्तमिदमग्निना।एवमास्ते स धर्मात्मा सीतया सह राघवः।।2.96.2।।
96_2.translation: Offering Sita several kinds of preparations to eat, righteous Rama, seated in her company remarked, This meat is savoury, this meat roasted on fire is sacred.
96_2.word_by_word: धर्मात्मा righteous, स राघवः that Rama, इदम् this, मेध्यम् sacred meat, इदम् this, स्वादु is savoury, इदम् this one, अग्निना with fire, निष्टप्तम् roasted, एवम् uttering this way, सीतया सह in the company of Sita, आस्ते was seated.

96_3.shloka: तथा तत्राऽसतस्तस्य भरतस्यौपयायिनः।सैन्यरेणुश्च शब्दश्च प्रादुरास्तां नभस्पृशौ।।2.96.3।।
96_3.translation: Now as Rama was sitting there, the tumult and the dust raised by the approaching army of Bharata reached the sky.
96_3.word_by_word: तथा thus, तस्य that Rama, तत्र there, आसतः while sitting, उपयायिनः approaching, भरतस्य Bharata's, सैन्यरेणुश्च dust raised by the army, शब्दश्च and tumult, नभस्पृशौ both reachingthe sky, प्रादुरास्ताम् was generated.

96_4.shloka: एतस्मिन्नन्तरे त्रस्ता श्शब्देन महता ततः।अर्दिता यूथपा मत्ता स्सयूथा दुद्रुवुर्दिशः।।2.96.4।।
96_4.translation: Meanwhile, the mighty leaders of the elephantherds were agitated, and frightened by the loud noise, fled away from there in different directions.
96_4.word_by_word: एकस्मिन् अन्तरे meanwhile, मत्ताः mighty, यूथपाः leaders of elephantherds, महता with a loud, शब्देन noise, त्रस्ताः were frightened, अर्दिताः agitated सयूथाः with herds, ततः from there, दिशः in different directions, दुद्रुवुः fled away.

96_5.shloka: स तं सैन्यसमुद्धूतं शब्दं शुश्राव राघवः।तां श्च विप्रद्रुतान्सर्वान्यूथपानन्ववैक्षत।।2.96.5।।
96_5.translation: Rama heard the sound generated by the army and saw those leaders of herds fleeing away.
96_5.word_by_word: सः राघवः that Rama, सैन्यसमुद्बूतम् generated by the army, तं शब्दम् that sound, शुश्राव heard, विप्रद्रुतान् fleeing, तान् those, सर्वान् all, यूथपान् च leaders of herds, अन्ववैक्षत saw.

96_6.shloka: तांश्च विद्रुवतो दृष्ट्वा तं च श्रुत्वा च निस्वनम्।उवाच राम स्सौमित्रिं लक्ष्मणं दीप्ततेजसम्।।2.96.6।।
96_6.translation: Seeing those animals fleeing and hearing the clamour, Rama addressed Lakshmana,son of Sumitra, who was blazing with energy.
96_6.word_by_word: रामः Rama, विद्रुवतः running, तान् them, दृष्ट्वा having seen, तम् them, निस्वनं also sound, श्रुत्वा having heard, दीप्ततेजसम् blazing with energy, सौमित्रिम् son of Sumitra, लक्ष्मणम् addressing Lakshmana, उवाच said.

96_7.translation: O Lakshmana, the worthy son of Sumitra, fearful and tumultuous clamour like rumbling sound of clouds is heard. What a wonder Go and see.
96_7.word_by_word: हन्त Oh what a wonder, लक्ष्मण Lakshmana, सुमित्रा Sumitra, त्वया by you, सुप्रजाः has a worthy son, इह here, भीमस्तनितगम्भीरः fearful rumbling of clouds, तुमुलः tumultous, स्वनः sound, इह here, श्रूयते is being heard, पश्य see.

96_8.shloka: गजयूथानि वाऽरण्ये महिषा वा महावने।वित्रासिता मृगा स्सिंहै स्सहसा प्रद्रुता दिशः।।2.96.8।।
96_8.translation: Herds of elephants and buffaloes in the great woods and wild beasts frightened by lions are running in different directions.
96_8.word_by_word: अरण्ये in the forest, गजयूथानि herds of elephants, महावने in the great woods, महिषाः वा buffaloes, मृगाः wild beasts, वित्रासिताः frightened, सिंहैः by lions, सहसा quickly, दिशः in directions, प्रद्रुताः running.

96_9.shloka: राजा वा राजपुत्रो वा मृगयामटते वने।अन्यद्वा श्वापदं किञ्चित्सौमित्रे ज्ञातुमर्हसि।।2.96.9।।
96_9.translation: O Lakshmana, do ascertain if any king or prince has come for hunting or whether any ferocious animal has entered this forest, shouldn't you?
96_9.word_by_word: सौमित्रे O Lakshmana, राजा वा king or, राजपुत्रो वा or prince, वने in the forest, मृगयाम् अटते  is hunting, वा or, किञ्चित् any, अन्यत् other, श्वापदम् ferocious animal, ज्ञातुम् to know, अर्हसि ought to

96_10.translation: O Lakshmana, this mountain is highly inaccessible even to birds. Find out exactly and quickly what this is all about.
96_10.word_by_word: लक्ष्मण O Lakshmana, अयम् this, गिरिः mountain, पक्षिणामपि even to birds, सुदुश्चरः is highly inaccessible, एतत् सर्वम् all this, यथातत्त्वम् exactly, अचिरात् quickly, ज्ञातुम् to know, अर्हसि ought to.

96_11.shloka: स लक्ष्मण स्सन्त्वरित स्सालमारुह्य पुष्पितम्।प्रेक्षमाणो दिश स्सर्वाः पूर्वां दिशमुदैक्षत।।2.96.11।।
96_11.translation: Lakshmana hurriedly climbed a flowering sala tree, surveyed in all directions and fixed his gaze on the east.
96_11.word_by_word: सः लक्ष्मणः that Lakshmana, सन्त्वरितः hurriedly, पुष्पितम् flowering, सालम् Sala tree, आरुह्यclimbing, सर्वाः all, दिशः directions, प्रेक्षमाणः seeing, पूर्वं दिशम् the eastern direction, उदैक्षत looked.

96_12.shloka: उदङ्मुखः प्रेक्षमाणो ददर्श महतीं चमूम्।रथाश्वगजसम्बाधां यत्तैर्युक्तां पदातिभिः।।2.96.12।।
96_12.translation: Turning his face to the north, he beheld a vast army consisting of chariots, elephants and horses and a wellequipped infantry.
96_12.word_by_word: उदङ्मुखः facing the north, प्रेक्षमाणः seeing, रथाश्वगजसम्बाधाम् with chariots, elephants and horses, यत्तै: wellequipped, पदातिभिः with infantry, युक्ताम् consisting of, महतीम् vast, चमूम् army, ददर्श beheld.

96_13.shloka: तामश्वगजसम्पूर्णां रथध्वजविभूषिताम्।शशंस सेनां रामाय वचनं चेदमब्रवीत्।।2.96.13।।
96_13.translation: He (Lakshmana) informed Rama about the army full of horses and elephants and decorated with chariotbanners and said these words:
96_13.word_by_word: अश्वगजसम्पूर्णाम् full of horses and elephants, रथध्वजविभूषिताम् decorated with chariotbannars, तां सेनाम् of the army, रामाय to Rama, शशंस informed, इदम् these, वचनं च words also, अब्रवीत् said.

96_14.shloka: अग्निं संशमयत्वार्य स्सीता च भजतां गुहाम्।सज्यं कुरुष्व चापं च शरांश्च कवचं तथा।।2.96.14।।
96_14.translation: O noble one, put out the sacred fire (Agnihotra) and let Sita take refuge in the cave. String your bow and keep the arrows ready. Put on your armour.
96_14.word_by_word: आर्यः O noble one, अग्निम् sacredfires (Agnihotra), संशमयतु put off, सीता च Sita also, गुहाम् cave, भजताम् let take refuge, चापम् bow, सज्यम् with string, कुरुष्व make ready, तथा so also, शरांश्च arrows also, कवचम् armour (put on).

96_15.shloka: तं रामः पुरुषव्याघ्रो लक्ष्मणं प्रत्युवाच ह।अङ्गावेक्षस्व सौमित्रे कस्येमां मन्यसे चमूम्।।2.96.15।।
96_15.translation: Rama the best among men replied to Lakshamana, Oh, Lakshmana, look properly and tell me to whom do you think this army might belong
96_15.word_by_word: पुरुषव्याघ्रः best among men, रामः Rama, तं लक्ष्मणम् to Lakshmana, प्रत्युवाच ह replied so, अङ्ग Oh, सौमित्रे Lakshmana, अवेक्षस्व look, इमाम् this, चमूम् army, कस्य of whom, मन्यसे do you think.

96_16.shloka: एवमुक्तस्तु रामेण लक्ष्मणो वाक्यमब्रवीत्।दिधक्षन्निव तां सेनां रुषितः पावको यथा।।2.96.16।।
96_16.translation: Hearing the words of Rama, enraged Lakshmana, like a flaming fire as if he would reduce the army to ashes, replied:
96_16.word_by_word: रामेण by Rama, एवं in that manner, उक्तः having been said, लक्ष्मणः Lakshmana, पावको यथा like a fire, रुषितः was wrathful, तां सेनाम् that army, दिधक्षन्निव as if he wanted to burn down, वाक्यम् these words, अब्रवीत् said.

96_17.shloka: सम्पन्नं राज्यमिच्छंस्तु व्यक्तं प्राप्याभिषेचनम्।आवां हन्तुं समभ्येति कैकेय्या भरतस्सुतः।।2.96.17।।
96_17.translation: It is evident that Kaikeyi's son Bharata, who has been consecrated, is coming to slayboth of us desiring the prosperous kingdom (to be without obstacles).
96_17.word_by_word: कैकेय्याः Kaikeyi's, सुतः son, भरतः Bharata, अभिषेचनम् प्राप्य having been consecrated, राज्यम् kingdom, सम्पन्नम् endowed with prosperity (without obstacles), इच्छन् desiring, आवाम् both of us, हन्तुम् to slay, समभ्येति is coming, व्यक्तम् this is evident.

96_18.shloka: एष वै सुमहाञ्छ्रीमान्विटपी सम्प्रकाशते।विराजत्युद्गतस्कन्धं कोविदारध्वजो रथे।।2.96.18।।
96_18.translation: There on that chariot, is a banner shining brilliantly with the emblem of a lofty majestic Kovidara tree with a large trunk.
96_18.word_by_word: एषः this, सुमहान् lofty, श्रीमान् majestic, उद्गतस्कन्धः atop with large trunk, विटपी tree, सम्प्रकाशते रथे on chariot, कोविदारध्वजः with his standard bearing the emblem of Kovidara tree, विराजति shining brilliantly.

96_19.shloka: असौ हि सुमहास्कन्धो विटपी च महाद्रुमः।विराजते महासैन्ये कोविदारध्वजो रथे।।2.96.19।।
96_19.translation: There the emblem of the great Kovidara tree of very large trunk spread with many branches shines brilliantly atop the chariot.
96_19.word_by_word: सुमहास्कन्धः of very large trunk, विटपी च spread with many branches, असौ this, महाद्रुमःlarge tree, कोविदारध्वजः standard of Kovidara, रथे on chariot, महासैन्ये in large army, विराजते is shining brilliantly.

96_20.shloka: भजन्त्येते यथाकाममश्वानारुह्य शीघ्रगान्।एते भ्राजन्ति संहृष्टा गजानारुह्य सादिनः।।2.96.20।।
96_20.translation: These men mounted on swiftlymoving horses are following the post. The riders of elephants  mounted on the elephants look cheerful.
96_20.word_by_word: एते these, यथाकामम् at their will, शीघ्रगान् swiftlymoving, अश्वान् horses, आरुह्य having mounted, भजन्ति are following, एते these, सादिनः riders of elephants, गजान् elephants, आरुह्य having mounted, संहृष्टाः cheerfully, भ्राजन्ति are shining.

96_21.shloka: गृहीतधनुषौ चावां गिरिं वीर श्रयावहै।अथवेहैव तिष्ठाव स्सन्नद्धावुद्यतायुधौ।।2.96.21।।
96_21.translation: O mighty warrior, let both of us take up the bows and station ourselves on this mountain or we shall stay here itself armed with weapons fully prepared for the battle.
96_21.word_by_word: वीर O mighty warrior, आवाम् both of us, गृहीतधनुषौ by taking up the bows, गिरिम् on this  mountain, श्रयावहै take refuge, अथवा or, सन्नद्धौ fully prepared (for battle), उद्यतायुधौ with weapons in readiness, इहैव here itself, तिष्ठावः stay here.

96_22.shloka: अपि नौ वशमागच्छेत्कोविदारध्वजो रणे।अपि द्रक्ष्यामि भरतं यत्कृते व्यसनं महत्।।2.96.22।।त्वया राघव सम्प्राप्तं सीतया च मया तथा।
96_22.translation: O Rama, will this Kovidara emblem come into our possession in the battle? Can I see Bharata, the cause of the calamity that has befallen you, Sita and me?
96_22.word_by_word: राघव O Rama, रणे in battle, कोविदारध्वजः Kovidara banner, नौ our, वशम् possession,अप्यागच्छेत् will it come, यत्कृते on whose account, त्वया by you, सीतया by Sita, तथा also, मया च by me, महत् great, व्यसनम् calamity, सम्प्राप्तम् has befallen, such, भरतम् Bharata, अपि द्रक्ष्यामि can I see.

96_23.shloka: यन्निमित्तं भवान्राज्याच्छ्युतो राघव शाश्वतात्।।2.96.23।।सम्प्राप्तोऽयमरिर्वीर भरतो वध्य एव मे।
96_23.translation: O that mighty warrior Bharata, on whose account you have been banished from the perpetual kingdom, comes here as a foe and as for me, he deserves to be slain.
96_23.word_by_word: हे वीर O mighty warrior, राघव Rama, भवान् you, यन्निमित्तम् on whose account, शाश्वतात्   from the perpetual, राज्यात् from kingdom, च्युतः deprived, अयम् such, सम्प्राप्तः has come here, अरिः foe, भरतः Bharata, मे to me, वध्य एव deserves to be slain.

96_24.shloka: भरतस्य वधे दोषं नाहं पश्यामि राघव।पूर्वापकारिणं हत्वा न ह्यधर्मेण युज्यते।।2.96.24।।
96_24.translation: O Rama, I do not see anything  wrong in slaying Bharata. In killing one who had done harm is not an act of unrighteousness.
96_24.word_by_word: राघव O Rama, भरतस्य Bharta's, वधे in slaying, अहम् I, दोषम्  wrong, न पश्यामि do not see, पूर्वापकारिणम् one who has done harmful act earlier, हत्वा in slaying, अधर्मेण with unrighteousness, न युज्यते is not attached.

96_25.translation: O Rama, Bharata has abandoned righteousness and has harmed you. When he is slain, you shall rule over the whole earth.
96_25.word_by_word: राघव O Rama, भरतः Bharata, पूर्वापकारी had done harm earlier, त्यक्तधर्मश्च abandoned righteousness, एतस्मिन् when such a person, निहते after having been slain कृत्स्नाम् thewhole, वसुन्धराम् earth, अनुशाधि you shall rule.

96_26.shloka: अद्य पुत्रं हतं संख्ये कैकेयी राज्यकामुका।मया पश्येत्सुदुःखार्ता हस्तिभग्नमिव द्रुमम्।।2.96.26।।
96_26.translation: Let that Kaikeyi, greedy for the kingdom, see in great anguish her son who shall be slain by me today in a battle like a tree felled by an elephant.
96_26.word_by_word: राज्यकामुका greedy for the kingdom, कैकेयी Kaikeyi, अद्य today, संख्ये in a battle, मया by me, हतम् slain, पुत्रम् son, हस्तिभग्नम् felled by an elephant, द्रुमम् इव like a tree, सुदुःखार्ता extremely afflicted, पश्येत् let her see.

96_27.shloka: कैकेयीं च वधिष्यामि सानुबन्धां सबान्धवाम्।कलुषेणाद्य महता मेदिनी परिमुच्यताम्।।2.96.27।।
96_27.translation: I shall also slay Kaikeyi with her attendants and relations. Let the earth be cleansed of the great sin today.
96_27.word_by_word: सानुबन्धाम् with her attendants, सबान्धवाम् with her relations, कैकेयीं च also Kaikeyi, वधिष्यामि will slay, अद्य today, मेदिनी the earth, महता by a great, कलुषेण of the sin, परिमुच्यताम् let it  be cleansed.

96_28.shloka: अद्येमं संयतं क्रोधमसत्कारं च मानद।मोक्ष्यामि शत्रुसैन्येषु कक्षेष्विव हुताशनम्।।2.96.28।।
96_28.translation: O protector of honour, today I shall vent my suppressed anger and dishonour on the enemy's army like a fire on the thicket.
96_28.word_by_word: मानद O protector of honour (Rama), संयतम् suppressed, इमम् this, क्रोधम् anger, असत्कारं च dishonour, हुताशनम् fire, कक्षेष्विव like a thicket, अद्य today, शत्रुसैन्येषु in the army of enemies, मोक्ष्यामि I shall release.

96_29.shloka: अद्यैतच्छित्रकूटस्य काननं निशितै श्शरैः।छिन्दञ्चत्रुशरीराणि करिष्ये शोणितोक्षितम्।।2.96.29।।
96_29.translation: Today I shall rend the bodies of enemies with my sharpened arrows and spatter the forest of Chitrakuta mountain with their blood.
96_29.word_by_word: अद्य today, निशितैः by the sharpened, शरैः with arrows, शत्रुशरीराणि bodies of enemies, छिन्दन् rending, चित्रकूटस्य Chitrakuta's, एतत् काननम् this forest, शोणितोक्षितम् spattered with blood, करिष्ये I shall do.

96_30.translation: Let the wild beasts drag away the elephants, horses and men to be killed by me with their hearts transfixed with my arrows.
96_30.word_by_word: शरैः with arrows, निर्भिन्नहृदयान् with hearts transfixed, कुञ्जरान् elephants, तथा and, तुरगान् horses, मया by me, निहतान् killed, नरांश्च also men, श्वापदाः also wild beasts, परिकर्षन्तु let them drag off.

96_31.shloka: शराणां धनुषश्चाहमनृणोऽस्मिन्महावने।ससैन्यं भरतं हत्वा भविष्यामि न संशयः।।2.96.31।।
96_31.translation: Having slain Bharata and his army in this great forest, I shall doubtless discharge my debt to my arrows and bow.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे षण्णवतितमस्सर्गः।Thus ends the ninetysixth sarga in Ayodhyakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
96_31.word_by_word: अस्मिन् in this, महावने great forest, अहम् I, ससैन्यम् with army, भरतम् Bharata, हत्वा having slain, शराणाम् of the arrows, धनुषश्च of the bow, अनृणः discharging my debt, भविष्यामि shall become, संशंयः doubt, न not.

97_1.shloka: [Rama's correction of Lakshmana's judgement -- Bharata's army encamped round Chitrakuta.]सुसंरब्धं तु सौमित्रिं लक्ष्मणं क्रोधमूर्छितम्।रामस्तु परिसान्त्व्याथ वचनं चेदमब्रवीत्।।2.97.1।।
97_1.translation: Thereafter, Rama pacified Lakshmana, son of Sumitra who was violently agitated. He said to him who had swooned with rage:
97_1.word_by_word: अथ thereafter, रामस्तु as for Rama, सुसंरब्धम् violently agitated, क्रोधमूर्छितम् swooned with rage, सौमित्रिम् to Sumitra's son, लक्ष्मणम् to Lakshmana, परिसान्त्व्य having pacified, इदम् this, वचनं च word, अब्रवीत् said.

97_2.shloka: किमत्र धनुषा कार्यमसिना वा सचर्मणा।महेष्वासे महाप्राज्ञे भरते स्वयमागते।।2.97.2।।
97_2.translation: When sagacious Bharata of great strength has come here, where is the need for a bow or a sword or a shield.
97_2.word_by_word: महेष्वासे of great strength, महाप्राज्ञे sagacious, भरते Bharata, स्वयम् himself, अत्र here, आगते has come, धनुषा with bow, सचर्मणा with shield, असिना वा or with sword, किं कार्यम् where is the need?

97_3.shloka: पितुस्सत्यं प्रतिश्रुत्य हत्वा भरतमागतम्।किं करिष्यामि राज्येन सापवादेन लक्ष्मण।।2.97.3।।
97_3.translation: O Lakshmana, having sworn that I would make father's word true, what shall I do with the kingdom earned slanderously by slaying Bharata who has come (to see me)?
97_3.word_by_word: लक्ष्मण O Lakshmana, पितुः father's, सत्यम् truth, प्रतिश्रुत्य having sworn, आगतम् one who has come here, भरतम् Bharata, हत्वा having slain, सापवादेन with slander, राज्येन with a kingdom, किं करिष्यामि what shall I do?

97_4.shloka: यद्द्रव्यं बान्धवानां वा मित्राणां वा क्षये भवेत्।नाहं तत्प्रतिगृह्णीयां भक्षान्विषकृतानिव।।2.97.4।।
97_4.translation: I shall never accept any wealth obtained by destroying kith and kin or friends which is akin to taking food prepared with poison.
97_4.word_by_word: यत् द्रव्यम् the wealth, बान्धवानां वा of kith and kin, मित्राणां वा or friends', क्षये भवेत् is obtaind through destruction, तत् that one, अहम् I, विषकृतान् prepared with poison, भक्षान् इव likeeatables, न प्रतिगृह्णीयाम् I shall not accept.

97_5.shloka: धर्ममर्थं च कामं च पृथिवीं चापि लक्ष्मण।इच्छामि भवतामर्थे एतत् प्रतिशृणोमि ते।।2.97.5।।
97_5.translation: O Lakshmana, on the oath of righteousness, I wish wealth and pleasure as well as this kingdom for the sake of you all.
97_5.word_by_word: लक्ष्मण O Lakshmana, धर्मम् righteousness, अर्थं च prosperity (wealth) also, कामं च desire, पृथिवीं चापि earth (kingdom) also, भवताम् अर्थे for your sake, इच्छामि I want, एतत् all this, ते to you, प्रतिशृणोमि I swear.

97_6.shloka: भ्रात्रूणां संग्रहार्थं च सुखार्थं चापि लक्ष्मण।राज्यमप्यहमिच्छामि सत्येनाऽयुधमालभे।।2.97.6।।
97_6.translation: O Lakshmana, I desire this kingdom only for the unity and happiness of my brothers. Iswear on the weapon I hold.
97_6.word_by_word: लक्ष्मण O Lakshmana, भ्रात्रूणाम् brothers', संग्रहार्थम् remain united, सुखार्थं चापि and also for happiness, अहम् I, राज्यमपि even kingdom, इच्छामि I desire, सत्येन truly, आयुधम् weapons, अलभे I hold.

97_7.shloka: नेयं मम मही सौम्य दुर्लभा सागराम्बरा।न हीच्छेयमधर्मेण शक्रत्वमपि लक्ष्मण।।2.97.7।।
97_7.translation: O gentle Lakshmana, lordship of this earth with the sea as its garment is not difficult to obtain (for me). But I do not desire even Indrahood by unrighteous means.
97_7.word_by_word: सौम्य O gentle, लक्ष्मण Lakshmana, सागराम्बरा with the sea as garment, इयम् this, मही earth, मम to me, दुर्लभा difficult, न not, अधर्मेण unrighteously, शक्रत्वमपि even Indrahood, न इच्छेयं हि I do not desire.

97_8.shloka: यद्विना भरतं त्वां च शत्रुघ्नं चापि मानद।भवेन्मम सुखं किञ्चिद्भस्म तत्कुरुतां शिखी।।2.97.8।।
97_8.translation: O protector of honour even if there were to be some happiness which I could enjoy without you, Bharata, and Satrughna, let it be reduced to ashes by fire.
97_8.word_by_word: मानद O bestower of honour (Lakshmana), यत् any happiness, भरतम् Bharata, त्वां च you also, शतृघ्नं चापि Satrughna too, विना without leaving, मम to me, भवेत् happens, तत् that, किञ्चित् सुखम् some happines, शिखी fire, भस्म as ashes, कुरुताम् let it be reduced.

97_9.shloka: मन्येऽहमागतोऽयोध्यां भरतो भ्रातृवत्सलः।मम प्राणात्प्रियतरः कुलधर्ममनुस्मरन्।।2.97.9।।श्रुत्वा प्रव्राजितं मां हि जटावल्कलधारिणम्।जानक्यासहितं वीर त्वया च पुरुषर्षभ।।2.97.10।।स्नेहेनाऽक्रान्तहृदय श्शोकेनाकुलितेन्द्रियः।द्रष्टुमभ्यागतो ह्येष भरतो नान्यथाऽगतः।।2.97.11।।
97_9.translation: O best among men, O valiant one I think Bharata who is affectionate towards hisbrothers and who is dearer to me than my life, must have returned to Ayodhya and has heard that I had been exiled along with you and Janaki, wearing barks and matted locks. Remembering the duties of the race with an afflicted mind and with agitated senses he has come here to see me. He has not come with any other intention.
97_9.word_by_word: वीर O valiant one, पुरुषर्षभ best among men, भ्रातृवत्सलः affectionate towards brothers, मम to me, प्राणात् more than life, प्रियतरः dearer, भरतः Bharata, अयोध्याम् to Ayodhya, आगतः  had returned, माम् me, जानक्या with Janaki, त्वया च with you, सहितम् in the company of, जटावल्कलधारिणम् wearing barks and matted locks, प्रव्राजितम् having been exiled, श्रुत्वा hearing, कुलधर्मम् duties of race, अनुस्मरन् remembering, स्नेहेन with devotion, आक्रान्तहृदय: mind possessed by, शोकेन with distress, आकुलितेन्द्रियः with agitated senses, द्रष्टुम् to see, अभ्यागतः has arrived, अहम् I, मन्ये consider, एषः भरतः this Bharata, अन्यथा for  any other reason, न आगतः has not come.

97_10.shloka: अम्बां च कैकयीं रुष्य परुषं चाप्रियं वदन्।प्रसाद्य पितरं श्रीमार्नाज्यं मे दातुमागतः।।2.97.12।।
97_10.translation: Auspicious Bharata, angry with Kaikeyi and having spoken to her unpleasant, bitter words and having propitiated our father, has come here to offer me the kingdom.
97_10.word_by_word: श्रीमान् auspicious Bharata, अम्बाम् mother, कैकयीम् at Kaikeyi, रुष्य angered, परुषम् harshly, अप्रियं च bitterly, वदन् speaking, पितरम् father, प्रसाद्य having propitiated, मे to me, राज्यम् kingdom, दातुम् to offer, आगतः has come.

97_11.shloka: प्राप्तकालं यदेषोऽस्मान्भरतो द्रष्टुमिच्छति।अस्मासु मनसाऽप्येष नाप्रियं किञ्चिदाचरेत्।।2.97.13।।
97_11.translation: Finding the time appropriate, Bharata has come to see us. Even in his mind he would have never thought of causing any harm to us in any way.
97_11.word_by_word: एषः भरतः this Bharata, अस्मान् us, यत् द्रष्टुम् इच्छति should he desire to see, प्राप्तकालम् this is appropriate time, एषः he, अस्मासु in us, मनसा अपि even by thought, किंचित् even a little, अप्रियम् harm, नाचरेत् will not do.

97_12.shloka: विप्रियं कृतपूर्वं ते भरतेन कदा नु किम्।ईदृशं वा भयं तेऽद्य भरतं योऽत्र शङ्कसे।।2.97.14।।
97_12.translation: Why are you suspicious of Bharata? Has he done anything disagreeable to you any time in the past?
97_12.word_by_word: अत्र here, यः such you, अद्य now, भरतम् about Bharata, शङ्कसे you suspect, ते to you, भरतेन by Bharata, कदा नु at any time anything, किम् विप्रियम् anything disagreeable, ईदृशम् such, भयं वा or fear, कृतपूर्वम् has been done in the past.

97_13.shloka: न हि ते निष्ठुरं वाच्यो भरतो नाप्रियं वचः।अहं ह्यप्रियमुक्त स्स्यां भरतस्याप्रिये कृते।।2.97.15।।
97_13.translation: You must not speak any harsh or unpleasant words against Bharata. If you do, they will be deemed to be directed against me.
97_13.word_by_word: भरतः Bharata, ते to you, निष्ठुरम् harsh word, न वाच्यः must not speak, अप्रियम् harsh, वचः words, न not, भरतस्य to Bharata, अप्रिये unpleasant act, कृते if it has been done, अहम् I, अप्रियम् harsh words, उक्तः स्यां हि has been told.

97_14.shloka: कथं नु पुत्राः पितरं हन्युः कस्यां चिदापदि।भ्राता वा भ्रातरं हन्यात्सौमित्रे प्राणमात्मनः।।2.97.16।।
97_14.translation: Whatever be the calamity, O Lakshmana, how will sons slay their father, or a brother kill his own brother who is as dear to him as his own life?
