100_65.translation: I trust, you walk the auspicious path of truth (virtue) followed by our father and forefathers.
100_65.word_by_word: तातः our father, याम् वृत्तिम् whichever course, वर्तते is following, याम् which course, नः our, प्रपितामहाः followed by ancestors, या च सत्पथगा which one walks the path of truth, शुभा auspicious, ताम् that, वृत्तिम् course, वर्तसे कच्चित् I trust, you follow.

100_66.shloka: कच्चित्स्वादु कृतं भोज्यमेको नाश्नासि राघव।कच्चिदाशंसमानेभ्यो मित्रेभ्य स्सम्प्रयच्छसि।।2.100.75।।
100_66.translation: O Bharata, I trust you do not partake delicious food all by yourself, and you share it with your friends when they want it.
100_66.word_by_word: राघव Bharata, स्वादुकृतम् prepared deliciously, भोज्यम् food, एकः alone, नाश्नासि कच्चित् I  trust you are not partaking, अशंसमानेभ्यः to those who desire them, मित्रेभ्यः to friends, सम्प्रयच्छसि कच्चित् I trust you are giving it.

100_67.shloka: राजा तु धर्मेण हि पालयित्वा महामतिर्दण्डधरः प्रजानाम्।अवाप्य कृत्स्नां वसुधां यथावदितश्च्युत स्स्वर्गमुपैति विद्वान्।।2.100.76।।
100_67.translation: The highly sagacious and learned king, having acquired the entire earth and punishing the people in accordance with tradition and righteously ruling the kingdom, will ascend the his release (from this world).इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे शततमस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the hundredth sarga in Ayodhyakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
100_67.word_by_word: महामति: one who has great wisdom, विद्वान् learned man, राजा तु as for the king, कृत्स्नां entire, वसुधाम् earth, अवाप्य having acquired, प्रजानाम् for people, दण्डधरः holding Danda in hand, यथावत् in accordance with tradition, धर्मेण righteously, पालयित्वा having ruled, इतः  from here, च्युतः having been released, स्वर्गम् heaven, उपैति हि will ascend.

101_1.shloka: [Bharata pleads with Rama to return -- informs passing away of king Dasaratha.]रामस्य वचनं श्रुत्वा भरतः प्रत्युवाच ह।किं मे धर्माद्विहीनस्य राजधर्मः करिष्यति।।2.101.1।।
101_1.translation: On listening to Rama, Bharata replied Of what use shall be these royal duties to me, when I have fallen from righteousness?
101_1.word_by_word: रामस्य Rama's, वचनम् words, श्रुत्वा on listening, भरतः Bharata, प्रत्युवाच ह replied, धर्मात् from righteousness, विहीनस्य devoid of, मे to me, राजधर्मः royal duties, किं करिष्यति of what use  to me.

101_2.shloka: शाश्वतोऽयं सदा धर्मः स्थितोऽस्मासु नरर्षभ।ज्येष्ठेे पुत्रे स्थिते राजा न कनीयान् भवेन्नृपः।।2.101.2।।
101_2.translation: O best of men there is an ancient tradition in our race that the younger son cannot become king when the eldest is there.
101_2.word_by_word: नरर्षभ best of men, अयम् this one, शाश्वतः ancient, धर्मः righteousness, अस्मासु in our race, सदा always, स्थितः exists, राजन् O king, ज्येष्ठपुत्रे the eldest son, स्थिते is there, कनीयान् younger one, नृपः king, न भवेत् can never become.

101_3.shloka: स समृद्धां मया सार्धमयोध्यां गच्छ राघव।अभिषेचयचात्मानं कुलस्यास्य भवाय नः।।2.101.3।।
101_3.translation: Therefore, O scion of the Raghu race, return along with me to prosperous Ayodhya and for the good of our race get your self coronated.
101_3.word_by_word: राघव Rama, सः he, मया सार्धम् with me, समृद्धाम् prosperous, अयोध्याम् to Ayodhya, गच्छ return, नः for us, अस्य कुलस्य for this race, भवाय for the good of, आत्मानम् yourself, अभिषेचय  coronated.

101_4.shloka: राजानं मानुषं प्राहु र्देवत्वे सम्मतो मम।यस्य धर्मार्थसहितं वृत्तमाहुरमानुषम्।।2.101.4।।
101_4.translation: Other think the king to be a human, but to me, he is divine since his conduct and the statecraft are superhuman as they are in conformity with righteousness.
101_4.word_by_word: राजानम् king, मानुषम् to be a man, प्राहुः is said (by the wise), यस्य whose, धर्मार्धसहितम् in conformity with righteousness and state craft, वृत्तम् conduct, अमानुषम् beyond human capacity, आहुः they say, मम my, देवत्वे godly, सम्मतः has been claimed.

101_5.shloka: केकयस्थे च मयि तु त्वयि चारण्य माश्रिते।दिवमार्यो गतो राजा यायजूक: सतां मतः।।2.101.5।।
101_5.translation: While I was in Kekaya and you took refuge in the forest, venerable king (Dasaratha), who was always engaged in sacrifices and was held in high esteem by the virtuous, ascended to heaven.
101_5.word_by_word: मयि me, केकयस्थे while I was in Kekaya, त्वयि च when you, अरण्यम् to the forest, आश्रिते having taken refuge, आर्यः revered, यायजूकः ever performing sacrifices, सताम् by the virtuous, मतः esteemed, राजा king, दिवम् to heaven, गतः went.

101_6.shloka: निष्क्रान्तमात्रे भवति ससीते सहलक्ष्मणे।दुःखशोकाभिभूतस्तु राजा त्रिदिवमभ्यगात्।।2.101.6।।
101_6.translation: As soon as you set out for the forest along with Sita and Lakshmana, the king, overwhelmed with grief, attained heaven.
101_6.word_by_word: ससीते along with Sita, सहलक्ष्मणे with Lakshmana, भवति when you, निष्क्रान्तमात्रे had just set out, राजा king, दुःखशोकाभिभूतः griefstricken, त्रिदिवम् to heaven, अभ्यगात् went.

101_7.shloka: उत्तिष्ठ पुरुषव्याघ्र क्रियतामुदकं पितुः।अहं चायं च शत्रुघ्नः पूर्वमेव कृतोदकौ।।2.101.7।।
101_7.translation: Arise, O best of men and offer libations to our father. I and Satrughna have already done so.
101_7.word_by_word: पुरुषव्याघ्रः O best of men, उत्तिष्ठ arise, पितुः to father, उदकम् traditional libation of water, क्रियताम् offer, अहं च I also, अयम् this, शत्रुघ्नश्च Satrughna also, पूर्वमेव already, कृतोदकौ  offered libations of water.

101_8.shloka: प्रियेण किल दत्तं हि पितृलोकेषु राघव।अक्षय्यं भवतीत्याहुर्भवांश्चैव पितुः प्रियः।।2.101.8।।
101_8.translation: O son of Raghu's race, it is said that whatever is offered by a dear son becomes eternal in the world of manes. You alone are the beloved son of our father.
101_8.word_by_word: राघव O Rama, प्रियेण by a dear one, दत्तम् offered, पितृलोकेषु in the world of manes, अक्षय्यम् भवति becomes eternal, इति thus, आहुः खलु people say indeed, भवांश्चैव you alone, पितुः to father, प्रियः is beloved.

101_9.shloka: त्वामेव शोचंस्तव दर्शनेप्सुस्त्वय्येव सक्तामनिवर्त्य बुद्धिम्।त्वया विहीन स्तव शोकमग्नस्त्वां संस्मरन्नस्तमितः पिता ते।।2.101.9।।
101_9.translation: Your father, deprived of you, brooding over you, wishing to behold you, unable to divert his mind fixed on you, remembering you alone and immersed in sorrow departed (from this world).इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे एकोत्तर शततम स्सर्गः।।Thus ends the hundredone sarga in Ayodhyakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
101_9.word_by_word: ते your, पिता father, त्वया by you, विहीनः separated, त्वामेव about you, शोचन् grieving, तव your, दर्शनेप्सुः wishing to see, त्वय्येव in you alone, सक्ताम् fixing, बुद्धिम् mind, अनिवर्त्य without diverting, तव your, शोकमग्नः immersed in sorrow, त्वाम् you, संस्मरन् remembering, अस्तमितः departed.

102_1.shloka: [Rama, Sita and Lakshmana's grief over king Dasaratha's death -- Rama and Lakshmana offer libations of water in Mandakini river]तां श्रुत्वा करुणां वाचं पितुर्मरणसंहिताम्।राघवो भरते नोक्तां बभूव गतचेतनः।।2.102.1।।
102_1.translation: Having heard the words of Bharata regarding the death of his father, Rama became unconscious.
102_1.word_by_word: राघवः one born in the race of the Raghus (Rama), भरतेन by Bharata, उक्ताम् uttered, पितुः father's, मरणसंहिताम्  union with death, करुणाम् pitiable, तां those, वाचम् words, श्रुत्वा on hearing, गत चेतनः unconscious, बभूव became.

102_2.shloka: तं तु वज्रमिवोत्सृष्टमाहवे दानवारिणावाग्वज्रंभरते नोक्त ममनोज्ञं परन्तपः।।2.102.2।।प्रगृह्य रामो बाहू वैपुष्पिताग्रो यथा द्रुमः।वने परशुना कृत्तस्तथा भुवि पपात ह।।2.102.3।।
102_2.translation: On hearing the thunderlike words spoken by Bharata afflicting the mind, like thethunderbolt hurled by Indra (enemy of demons) in a battle, Rama, the scorcher of enemies, stretching forth both his arms, fell down on the ground like a tree with flowering tops severed by an axe in the forest.
102_2.word_by_word: परन्तपः destroyer of enemies, रामः Rama, आहवे in the battle, दानवारिणा by the enemy of demons (Indra), उत्सृष्टम् hurled, वज्रमिव like thunderbolt, अमनोज्ञम् unpleasant, भरतेन by Bharata, उक्तम् spoken, तम् that, वाग्वज्रम् thunderlike words, बाहू both arms, प्रगृह्य stretching forth, वने in the forest, परशुना by an axe, कृत्तः severed, पुष्पिताग्रः with flowering tops, द्रुमः tree, यथा as, तथा like that, भुवि on the ground, पपात ह fell down.

102_3.shloka: तथा हि पतितं रामं जगत्यां जगतीपतिम्।कूलघातपरिश्रान्तं प्रसुप्तमिव कुञ्जरम्।।2.102. 4।।भ्रातरस्ते महेष्वासं सर्वतश्शोककर्शितम्।रुदन्तस्सह वैदेह्या सिषिचुस्सलिलेन वै।।2.102.5।।
102_3.translation: Those brothers on all sides, with Sita lamenting, sprinkled water on Rama, the great archer and lord of the earth who, afflicted with grief, had fallen down on the ground, and was lying like an elephant exhausted from repeatedly striking a river bank.
102_3.word_by_word: तथा that way, जगत्याम् on the earth, निपतितम् fallen, जगतीपतिम् lord of the world, कूलघातपरिश्रान्तम् exhausted from striking a river bank, प्रसुप्तम् asleep, कुञ्जरम् इव like an elephant, महेष्वासम् a great archer, शोककर्शितम् afflicted with grief, रामम् Rama, सर्वतः on all sides, वैदेह्या सह along with Sita, ते those, भ्रातरः brothers, रुदन्तः lamenting, सलिलेन with waters, सिषिचुः वै sprinkled.

102_4.shloka: स तु संज्ञां पुनर्लब्ध्वा नेत्राभ्यामस्रमुत्सृजन्।उपाक्रामत काकुत्स्थ कृपणं बहु भाषितुम्।।2.102.6।।
102_4.translation: On regaining consciousness, shedding tears profusely, Rama again started speaking piteously.
102_4.word_by_word: सः काकुत्स्थ that Rama, पुनः again, संज्ञाम् consciousness, लब्ध्वा regaining, नेत्राभ्याम् from eyes, अस्रम् tears, उत्सृजन् shedding, कृपणम् piteously, बहु excessively, भाषितुम् to speak, उपाक्रामत started.

102_5.shloka: स रामस्स्वर्गतं श्रुत्वा पितरं पृथिवीपतिम्।उवाच भरतं वाक्यं धर्मात्मा धर्मसंहितम्।।2.102.7।।
102_5.translation: On hearing that his father, king Dasaratha, the lord of the world had attained heaven, righteous Rama said to Bharata in conformty with his rightful conduct.
102_5.word_by_word: धर्मात्मा righteous, सः रामः that Rama, पृथिवीपतिम् lord of the world, पितरम् father, स्वर्गतम्  had attained heaven, श्रुत्वा on hearing, भरतम् to Bharata, धर्मसंहितम् that which was inconformity with his rightful conduct, वाक्यम् words, उवाच said.

102_6.shloka: किं करिष्याम्ययोध्यायां ताते दिष्टां गतिं गते।कस्तां राजवराध्दीनामयोध्यां पालयिष्यति।।2.102.8।।
102_6.translation: What shall I do in Ayodhya now that my father has followed the path ordained by the gods? Who will rule that Ayodhya deprived of that best of kings?
102_6.word_by_word: ताते father, दिष्टां गतिम् the path ordained by the gods, अयोध्यायाम् in Ayodhya, किं करिष्यामि what shall I do, राजवरात् by the best of kings, हीनाम् deprived, ताम् अयोध्याम् that Ayodhya, कः who, पालयिष्यति will rule.

102_7.shloka: किं नु तस्य मया कार्यं दुर्जातेन महात्मनः।यो मृतो मम शोकेन मया चापि न संस्कृतः।।2.102.9।।
102_7.translation: I could not even perform the last rites of that magnanimous one who died of grief on account of me. What use is my life with an unlucky birth?
102_7.word_by_word: यः that king Dasaratha, मम शोकेन of grief on account of me, मृतः died, मया by me, न संस्कृतश्चापि the last rites could not be performed, तस्य for him, महात्मनः for that  magnanimous one, दूर्जातेन of unlucky birth, मया by me, किं नु कार्यम् of what use?

102_8.shloka: अहो भरत सिद्धार्थो येन राजा त्वयाऽनघ।शत्रुघ्नेन च सर्वेषु प्रेतकृत्येषु सत्कृतः।।2.102.10।।
102_8.translation: O irreproachable Bharata, it is gratifying that you and Satrughna are indeed fortunate to have fulfilled your cherished desire since the king was wellhonoured by you with all the obsequial rites.
102_8.word_by_word: अनघ O irreproachable one, भरत Bharata, येन त्वया by you, शत्रुघ्नेन by Satrughna, राजा king, सर्वेषु in all, प्रेतकृत्येषु in last rites, सत्कृतः wellhonoured, सिद्धार्थः you have fulfilled  your duty, अहो fortunate indeed.

102_9.shloka: निष्प्रधानामनेकाग्रां नरेन्द्रेण विनाकृताम्।निवृत्तवनवासोऽपि नायोध्यां गन्तु मुत्सहे।।2.102.11।।
102_9.translation: Even after the completion of my exile I do not wish to return to Ayodhya which is directionless, bereft of its chief, the king.
102_9.word_by_word: निवृत्तवनवासोऽपि even after completion of the exile, निष्प्रधानाम् bereft of chief, अनेकाग्रम् directionless, नरेन्द्रेण by the king, विनाकृताम् deprived, अयोध्याम् Ayodhya, गन्तुम् to return, न उत्सहे I do not desire.

102_10.shloka: समाप्तवनवासं मामयोध्यायां परन्तप।कोऽनु शासिष्यति पुनस्ताते लोकान्तरं गते।।2.102.12।।
102_10.translation: O subduer of enemies, when father has gone to the other world, who will guide me in Ayodhya after I complete my term of exile?
102_10.word_by_word: परन्तप O subduer of enemies, Bharata, ताते with father, लोकान्तरम् to the other world, गते having gone to, समाप्तवनवासम् on completion the exile, माम् me, पुनः again, अयोध्याम् in Ayodhya, कः who, अनुशासिष्यति guide.

102_11.shloka: पुरा प्रेक्ष्य सुवृत्तं मां पिता यान्याह सान्त्वयन्।वाक्यानि तानि श्रोष्यामि कुतश्श्रोत्रसुखान्यहम्।।2.102.13।।
102_11.translation: On seeing my good conduct our father used to say comforting words to me. Nowfrom whom can I hear such words pleasing to the ears?
102_11.word_by_word: पुरा in the past, पिता father, माम् me, सुवृत्तम् good conduct, प्रेक्ष्य on seeing, सान्त्वयन्comforting, यानि वाक्यानि such words, आह used to say, श्रोत्र सुखा pleasant to the ears, तानि those words, कुतः from whom, श्रोष्यामि I can hear.

102_12.shloka: एवमुक्त्वा स भरतं भार्यामभ्येत्य राघवः।उवाच शोकसन्तप्तः पूर्णचन्द्रनिभाननाम्।।2.102.14।।
102_12.translation: Having thus spoken to Bharata, Rama, overwhelmed with grief, approached his wife Sita whose face looked like the full Moon, and said to her.
102_12.word_by_word: सः राघवः that Rama, भरतम् to Bharata, एवम् in this way, उक्त्वा having said, पूर्णचन्द्रनिभाननाम् her face looking like the full Moon, भार्याम् wife, अभ्येत्य having approached, शोकसन्तप्तः  overhelmed with grief, उवाच said.

102_13.shloka: सीते मृतस्ते श्वशुरः पित्रा हीनोऽसि लक्ष्मण।भरतो दुःखमाचष्टे स्वर्गतं पृथिवीपतिम्।।2.102.15।।
102_13.translation: O Sita, your fatherinlaw is dead. O Lakshmana, you are deprived of your father. Bharata is relating to me the sad news that king Dasaratha has attained his heavenly abode.
102_13.word_by_word: सीते O Sita, ते श्वशुरः your fatherinlaw, मृतः is dead, लक्ष्मण O Lakshmana, पित्रा father, हीनः असि are deprived of, भरतः Bharata, पृथिवीपतिम् lord of the world, king Dasaratha, स्वर्गतम् as having gone to heaven, दुःखम् sad news, आचष्टे is relating.

102_14.shloka: ततो बहुगुणं तेषां बाष्पं नेत्रेष्वजायत।तथा ब्रुवति काकुत्स्थे कुमाराणां यशस्विनाम्।।2.102.16।।
102_14.translation: While the scion of the Kakutsthas was saying thus, copious tears welled up from the eyes of all those illustrious sons of Dasaratha.
102_14.word_by_word: काकुत्स्थे when Rama, तथा thus, ब्रुवति while saying, ततः thereafter, यशस्विनाम् of the illustrious, तेषाम् those, कुमाराणाम् of the sons of Dasaratha, नेत्रेषु in their eyes, बहुगुणम्copious, बाष्पः tears, अजायत welled up.

102_15.shloka: ततस्ते भ्रातर  स्रव्रॆ भृशमाश्वास्य दु:खितम्।अब्रुवन् जगतीभर्तुः क्रियतामुदकं पितुः।।2.102.17।।
102_15.translation: All the brothers, having consoled Rama as best they could, told him, Let the libations be offered to our father, the protector of the world.
102_15.word_by_word: ततः then, सर्वे all, ते भ्रातरः his brothers, राघवम् Rama, भृशम् greatly, आश्वास्य having consoled, जगतीभर्तुः to the protector of the world, Dasaratha, पितुः to father, उदकम् libations of water, क्रियताम् may be offered, अब्रुवन् they told.

102_16.shloka: सा सीता स्वर्गतं श्रुत्वा श्वशुरं  तं महानृपम्।नेत्राभ्यामश्रुपूर्णाभ्या शशाकेक्षितुं प्रियम्।।2.102.18।।
102_16.translation: On hearing that her fatherinlaw, king Dasaratha, had attained heaven, Sita, her eyes filled with tears could not look at her husband in the face.
102_16.word_by_word: सा सीता that Sita, श्वशुरम् fatherinlaw, नृपम् king Dasaratha, स्वर्गलोकगतम् as having attained heaven, श्रुत्वा having heard, अश्रुपूर्णाभ्याम् filled with tears, नेत्राभ्याम् with eyes, पतिम् husband, ईक्षितुम् to see, नाशकत् was not able.

102_17.shloka: सान्त्वयित्वा तु तां रामो रुदन्तीं जनकात्मजाम्।उवाच लक्ष्मणं तत्र दुःखितो दुःखितं वचः।।2.102.19।।
102_17.translation: Having consoled Sita, daughter of Janaka, griefstricken Rama said to Lakshmana who was also distressed with grief.
102_17.word_by_word: रामः Rama, रुदन्तीम् weeping, तां जनकात्मजाम् that Sita, सान्त्वयित्वा having consoled, दुःखितः  overcome with grief, दुःखितम् distressed, लक्ष्मणम् Lakshmana, तत्र then, वचः words, उवाच said.

102_18.shloka: आनयेङ्गुदिपिण्याकं चीरमाहर चोत्तरम्।जलक्रियार्थं तातस्य गमिष्यामि महात्मनः।।2.102.20।।
102_18.translation: I shall go and offer libations to my magnanimous father. Go and fetch the dried pulp of ingudi fruit and an upper garment made of bark.
102_18.word_by_word: इङ्गुदिपिण्याकम् oil cake of Ingudi fruit, आनय bring, उत्तरम् upper, चीरं च bark garment, आहर fetch, महात्मनः of the magnanimous, तातस्य father's, जलक्रियार्थम् to offer libations of water, गमिष्यामि I shall go.

102_19.shloka: सीता पुरस्ताद्व्रजतु त्वमेनामभितो व्रज।अहं पश्चाद्गमिष्यामि गतिर्ह्येषा सुदारुणा।।2.102.21।।
102_19.translation: Let us proceed in this order -- you first, Sita second and I last. This procession  in mourning is terrible indeed.
102_19.word_by_word: सीता Sita, पुरस्तात् in front, व्रजतु let her proceed, एनाम् अभितः ahead of her, त्वम् you, व्रज go, अहम् I, पश्चात् behind, गमिष्यामि shall go, एषा this, गतिः procession in mourning, सुदारुणा हि is terrible indeed.

102_20.shloka: ततो नित्यानुगस्तेषां विदितात्मा महामतिः।मृदुर्दान्तश्च कान्तश्च रामे च दृढभक्तिमान्।।2.102.22।।सुमन्त्र स्तैर्नृपसुतैस्सार्धमाश्वस्य राघवम्।अवातारयदालम्ब्य नदीं मन्दाकिनीं शिवाम्।।2.102.23।।
102_20.translation: Thereafter, their constant follower Sumantra who was conversant in spiritual knowledge, a highminded person, softnatured, selfcontrolled, tranquilminded and staunchly devoted to Rama consoled him. Holding the hands of the princes, Sumantra helped their descent into the auspicious river Mandakini for taking bath.
102_20.word_by_word: ततः thereafter, तेषाम् them, नित्यानुगः constant follower, विदितात्मा knowledgeable in spiritual sciences, महामतिः endowed with great intelligence, मृदुः softnatured, दान्तश्चselfcontrolled, शान्तश्च tranquilminded, रामे च in Rama, दृढभक्तिमान् staunchly devoted, सुमन्त्रः Sumantra, तैः नृपसुतैः सार्धम् along with those princes, राघवम् Rama, आश्वास्य having consoled him, आलम्ब्य taking hold of his hand, शिवाम् auspicious, मन्दाकिनीं नदीम् (into) the river Mandakini, अवातारयत् helped their descent.

102_21.shloka: ततो नित्यानुगस्तेषां विदितात्मा महामतिः।मृदुर्दान्तश्च शान्तश्च रामे च दृढभक्तिमान्।।2.102.22।।सुमन्त्रस्तैर्नृपसुतैः सार्धमाश्वास्य राघवम्।अवातारयदालम्ब्य नदीं मन्दाकिनीं शिवाम्।।2.102.23।।
102_21.translation: Thereafter, their constant follower Sumantra who was conversant in spiritual knowledge, a highminded person, softnatured, selfcontrolled, tranquilminded and staunchly devoted to Rama consoled him. Holding the hands of the princes, Sumantra helped their descent into the auspicious river Mandakini for taking bath.
102_21.word_by_word: ततः thereafter, तेषाम् them, नित्यानुगः constant follower, विदितात्मा knowledgeable in spiritual sciences, महामतिः endowed with great intelligence, मृदुः softnatured, दान्तश्चselfcontrolled, शान्तश्च tranquilminded, रामे च in Rama, दृढभक्तिमान् staunchly devoted,  सुमन्त्रः Sumantra, तैः नृपसुतैः सार्धम् along with those princes, राघवम् Rama, आश्वास्य having consoled him, आलम्ब्य taking hold of his hand, शिवाम् auspicious, मन्दाकिनीं नदीम् (into) the river Mandakini, अवातारयत् helped their descent.

102_22.shloka: ते सुतीर्थां ततः कृच्छ्रादुपागम्य यशस्विनः।नदीं मन्दाकिनीं रम्यां सदा पुष्पितकाननाम्।।2.102.24।।शीघ्रस्रोतसमासाद्य तीर्थं शिवमकर्दमम्।सिषिचु स्तूदकं राज्ञे तत एतद् भवत्विति।।2.102.25।।
102_22.translation: The illustrious brothers approached with great difficulty the swiftflowing and enchanting river Mandakini which had convenient descent and endowed with forests always in bloom. They descended at an auspicious place that was not slushy and offered libations of water saying 'O father, let these offerings be yours'.
102_22.word_by_word: ततः then, यशस्विनः illustrious, ते they, सुतीर्थां of convenient descent, रम्याम् enchanting, सदापुष्पितकाननाम् with forests always in blossom, शीघ्रस्रोतसम् swiftly flowing, मन्दाकिनीं नदीम् river Mandakini, कृच्छ्रात् with great difficulty, उपागम्य having approached, अकर्दमम् at a place that is not slushy, शिवम् auspicious, तीर्थम् descent, आसाद्य having reached, तात O father, एतत् these, ते to you, भवतु let this be, इति thus, राज्ञे for the king, उदकम् waters, सिषिचुः sprinkled. (offered libation).

102_23.shloka: ते सुतीर्थां ततः कृच्छ्रादुपागम्य यशस्विनः।नदीं मन्दाकिनीं रम्यां सदा पुष्पितकाननाम्।।2.102.24।।शीघ्रस्रोतसमासाद्य तीर्थं शिवमकर्दमम्।सिषिचु स्तूदकं राज्ञे तातैतत्ते भवत्विति।।2.102.25।।
102_23.translation: The illustrious brothers approached with great difficulty the swiftflowing and enchanting river Mandakini which had convenient descent and endowed with forests always in bloom. They descended at an auspicious place that was not slushy and offered libations of water saying 'O father, let these offerings be yours'.
102_23.word_by_word: ततः then, यशस्विनः illustrious, ते they, सुतीर्थां of convenient descent, रम्याम् enchanting, सदापुष्पितकाननाम् with forests always in blossom, शीघ्रस्रोतसम् swiftly flowing, मन्दाकिनीं नदीम् river Mandakini, कृच्छ्रात् with great difficulty, उपागम्य having approached, अकर्दमम् at a place that is not slushy, शिवम् auspicious, तीर्थम् descent, आसाद्य having reached, तात O father, एतत् these, ते to you, भवतु let this be, इति thus, राज्ञे for the king, उदकम् waters, सिषिचुः sprinkled. (offered libation).

102_24.shloka: प्रगृह्य च महीपालो जलपूरितमञ्जलिम्।दिशं याम्यामभिमुखो रुदन्वचनमब्रवीत्।।2.102.26।।
102_24.translation: Rama, the ruler of the earth, held water with both palms cupped and, facing the south, the direction of Yama (the god of death) said these words, sobbing:
102_24.word_by_word: महीपालः ruler of the earth, जलपूरितम् filled with water, अञ्जलिम् both palms cupped, प्रगृह्य holding, याम्यां दिशम् relating to direction of Yama, the southern direction, अभिमुखःfacing, रुदन् with sobs, वचनम् words, अब्रवीत् said.

102_25.shloka: एतत्ते राजशार्दूल विमलं तोयमक्षयम्।पितृलोकगत स्याद्य मद्दत्तमुपतिष्ठतु।।2.102.27।।
102_25.translation: 'O best of kings, you are gone to the world of the manes, and let this inexhaustible libation of pure water reach you'.
102_25.word_by_word: राजशार्दूल O best of kings, पितृलोकगतस्य one who has attained the world of the ancestors, ते to you, अद्य now, मद्दत्तम् offered by me, एतत् this, विमलम् pure, तोयम् water, अक्षयम्  inexhaustible, उपतिष्ठतु let it reach you.

102_26.shloka: ततो मन्दाकिनीतीरात्प्रत्युत्तीर्य स राघवः।पितुश्चकार तेजस्वी निर्वापं भ्रातृभि सह।।2.102.28।।
102_26.translation: Then, the powerful scion of the Raghu race reached bank, from the bathing spot of the river Mandakini along with his brothers and offered pinda (an offering of rice flour to the departed) to his late lamented father.
102_26.word_by_word: ततः then, तेजस्वी powerful, राघवः scion of the Raghu race (Rama), मन्दाकिनीतीरात् from the bank the river Mandakini, प्रत्युत्तीर्य climbing up, भ्रातृभि: सह with his brothers, पितुः for the departed father, निवापम् offerings of pinda ( balls of rice or flour), चकार made.

102_27.shloka: ऐङ्गुदं बदरीमिश्रं पिण्याकं दर्भसंस्तरे।न्यस्य रामस्सदुःखार्तो रुदन्वचनमब्रवीत्।।2.102.29।।
102_27.translation: Placing the balls of ingudi pulp mixed with badari fruit on a spread of darbha grass, Rama, was overcome with grief and weeping, said:
102_27.word_by_word: सः रामः that Rama, बदरीमिश्रम् mixed with badari fruits, ऐङ्गुदम् pertaining to the ingudi tree, पिण्याकम् pulp made into balls, दर्भसंस्तरे on a spread of darbha grass, न्यस्य after placing, दुःखार्तः overcome with distress, रुदन् weeping, वचनम् these words, अब्रवीत् said.

102_28.shloka: इदं भुङ्क्ष्वमहाराज प्रीतो यदशना वयम्।यदन्नः पुरुषो भवति तदन्ना स्तस्य देवताः।।2.102.30।।
102_28.translation: O great king, we offer you such food as we partake now. Be pleased to accept it. For,  his gods are offered the food a man takes.
102_28.word_by_word: महाराज O great king, वयम् we, यदशनाः whatever is food, इदम् such food, प्रीतः wellpleased, भुङ्क्ष्व  partake, पुरुषः man, यदन्नः whichever food, भवति takes, तस्य देवताः his gods, तदन्नाः have the same food.

102_29.shloka: तत स्तेनैव मार्गेण प्रत्युत्तीर्य सरित्तटात्।आरुरोह नरव्याघ्रो रम्यसानुं महीधरम्।।2.102.31।।
102_29.translation: Rama, the tiger among men, ascending the riverbank and proceeding on the same path (he had come), climbed the (Chitrakuta) mountain of charming slopes.
102_29.word_by_word: ततः thereafter, नरव्याघ्रः best among men (Rama), तेन that, मार्गेणैव by the same path itself, नदीतटात् from the river bank, प्रत्युत्तीर्य having ascended, रम्यसानुम् having charming slopes, महीधरम् mountain, आरुरोह climbed.

102_30.translation: Rama, lord of the earth, reached the door of the leafhut and took Bharata andLakshmana in his arms.
102_30.word_by_word: ततः then, जगतीपतिः lord of the earth (Rama), पर्णकुटीद्वारम् the door of leafhut, आसाद्य  having reached, बाहुभ्याम् with his arms, भरतलक्ष्मणौ Bharata and Lakshmana, उभौ both, परिजग्राह took hold of.

102_31.shloka: तेषां तु रुदतां शब्दात् प्रतिशब्दोऽभवद् गिरौ।भ्रातॄणां सह वैदेह्या सिंहानां नर्दतामिव।।2.102.33।।
102_31.translation: The mountain echoed with the sound of lamentations of all the brothers along with Sita which resembled the roar of lions.
102_31.word_by_word: वैदेह्या सह with Sita, रुदताम् of those lamenting people, तेषां भ्रात्रूणाम् all the brothers', शब्दात् with the sound, नर्दताम् roaring, सिंहानामिव like the lions, शब्दात् with sound, गिरौ in the mountain, प्रतिशब्दः अभवत् was echoed.

102_32.shloka: महाबलानां रुदतां कुर्वतामुदकं पितुः।विज्ञाय तुमुलं शब्दं त्रस्ता भरत सैनिकाः।।2.102.34।
102_32.translation: The soldiers of Bharata were alarmed on hearing the tumultuous sounds raised by those mighty brothers offering libations of water and lamenting.
102_32.word_by_word: महाबलानाम् of mighty ones, पितुः to father, उदकम् libations of water, कुर्वताम् of those offering, रुदताम् lamenting brothers', तुमुलम् tumultous, शब्दम् sound, विज्ञाय having come to know, भरतसैनिकाः soldiers of Bharata, त्रस्ताः were alarmed.

102_33.shloka: अब्रुवंश्चापि रामेण भरत संगतो ध्रुवम्।तेषामेव महान् श‌ब्द: शोचतां पितरं मृतम्।।2.102.35।।
102_33.translation: They said, 'Bharata must have joined Rama. That loud noise must be their wailing over their deceased father'.
102_33.word_by_word: भरतः Bharata, रामेण with Rama, सङ्गतः joined, घृवम् this is certain, मृतम् deceased, पितरम् about father, शोचताम् lamenting, तेषामेव their only, महान् loud, शब्दः noise, अब्रुवन् च अपि they said.

102_34.shloka: अथ वासान्परित्यज्य तं सर्वेऽभिमुखास्स्वनम्।अप्येकमनसो जग्मुर्यथास्थानं प्रधाविताः।।2.102.36।।
102_34.translation: Then all of them left their camps with one single thought (of seeing Rama) in their minds and ran in the direction from where that sound emanated.
102_34.word_by_word: सर्वे all of them, अथ thereafter, वासान् their camps, परित्यज्य leaving, तं स्वनम् that sound, अभिमुखाः towards, एकमनसः अपि with only one thought in their minds, यथास्थानम् from their respective places, प्रधाविताः ran, जग्मुः went.

102_35.shloka: हयैरन्ये गजैरन्ये रथैरन्ये स्वलङ्कृतैः।सुकुमारा स्तथैवान्ये पद्भिरेव नरा ययुः।।2.102.37।।
102_35.translation: Some rode horses, some, elephants, while others mounted welldecorated chariots, while the young went on foot.
102_35.word_by_word: अन्ये some, हयैः on horses, अन्ये गजैः some on elephants, सुकुमाराः delicate men, अन्ये others, स्वलङ्कृतैः welldecorated, रथैः on chariots, तथैव similarly, अन्ये other, नराः men, पद्भिरेव on foot, ययुः went.

102_36.shloka: अचिरप्रोषितं रामं चिरविप्रोषितं यथा।द्रष्टुकामो जनः सर्वो जगाम सहसाऽऽश्रमम्।।2.102.38।।
102_36.translation: The whole multitude of people at once rushed towards the hermitage wishing to see Rama as if he had left long ago though he had gone on exile very recently.
102_36.word_by_word: सर्वः all, जनः people, अचिरप्रोषितम् exiled recently, रामम् Rama, चिरविप्रोषितं यथा as if he had left long ago, द्रष्टुकामः with a desire to see him, सहसा quickly, आश्रमम् towards the hermitage, जगाम went.

102_37.shloka: भ्रातृ़णां त्वरितास्ते तु द्रष्टुकामा स‌मागमम्।ययुर्बहुविधैर्यानै: खुरनेमिस्वनाकुलैः।।2.102.39।।
102_37.translation: Eager to see the union of brothers, all those people went by every sort of vehicle filled with the sounds of hooves and wheels.
102_37.word_by_word: तत्र there, भ्रातृ़णाम् of brothers, समागमम् union of, द्रष्टुकामाः people wishing to see, त्वरिताःhastily, खुरनेमिस्वनाकुलैः filled with the sounds of the hooves and wheels, बहुविधैः by every sort of, यानै: on vehicle, ययुः went.

102_38.shloka: सा भूमिर्बहुभिर्यानैः रथ‌नेमिसमाहता।मुमोच तुमुलं शब्दं द्यौरिवाभ्रसमागमे।।2.102.40।।
102_38.translation: The earth crushed by several vehicles, hooves (of horses) and wheels (of chariots) emitted tumultuous sounds like the sky in the gathering stormclouds.
102_38.word_by_word: बहुभि: by several, यानैः by vehicles, खुरनेमि समाहता crushed with hooves and wheels, सा भूमिः the earth, अभ्रसमागमे at the gathering of stormclouds, द्यौरिव like the sky, तुमुलम् tumultous, शब्दम् sound, मुमोच emitted.

102_39.shloka: तेन वित्रासिता नागाः करेणुपरिवारिताः।आवासयन्तो गन्धेन जग्मुरन्यद्वनं ततः।।2.102.41।।
102_39.translation: Frightened by the sound, the elephants followed by their females, spreading all the way the odour of the ichor, moved to other forests.
102_39.word_by_word: तेन by that (sound), वित्रासिताः frightened, करेणुपरिवारिताः followed by the female elephants, नागाः elephants, गन्धेन with the odour of ichor, आवासयन्तः odorising, ततः from there, अन्यत् वनम् to another forest, जग्मुः went.

102_40.shloka: वराह वृकसङ्घाश्च महिषा: सृमरास्तथा ।व्याघ्रगोकर्णगवया वित्रेसुः पृषतै स‌ह।।2.102.42।।
102_40.translation: Hearing that sound, hosts of boars and deer, buffaloes, serpents and apes, tigers, antelopes with ears like the cows', gavayas as well as dappled antelopes were all frightened.
102_40.word_by_word: वराहवृकसङ्घाश्च with host of boars and wolves, महिषाः buffaloes, सर्पवानराः serpents and apes, व्याघ्रगोकर्णगवयाः tigers, antelopes with ears like cows', gavayas, पृषतैः सह along with spotted deer, वित्रेसुः were frightened.

102_41.shloka: रथाङ्गसाह्वा नत्यूहा हंसाः कारण्डवाः परे।तथा पुंस्कोकिलाः क्रौञ्चा विसंज्ञा भेजिरे दिशः।।2.102.43।।
102_41.translation: Ducks, watercranes, geese, karandavas, cranes, male cuckoos and kraunchas fled senselessly in different directions.
102_41.word_by_word: रथाङ्गसाह्वाः ducks, नत्यूहा watercranes, हंसाः geese, कारण्डवाः karandavas, प्लवाः cranes, तथा similarly, पुंस्कोकिलाः male cuckoos, क्रौञ्चाः kraunchas, विसंज्ञाः senselessly, दिशः diffrent directions, भेजिरे fled.

102_42.shloka: तेन शब्देन वित्रस्तैराकाशं पक्षिभिर्वृतम्।मनुष्यैरावृता भूमिरुभयं प्रबभौ तदा।।2.102.44।।
102_42.translation: The sky was filled with birds frightened by the sound and the earth covered with people. Both looked extremely beautiful.
102_42.word_by_word: तेन शब्देन by that sound, वित्रस्तैः frightened, पक्षिभिः by birds also, वृतम् filled with, आकाशम् the sky, मनुष्यैः by people, आवृता covered, भूमिः the earth, उभयम् both, तदा प्रबभौ greatly shone.

102_43.shloka: ततस्तं पुरषव्याघ्रं यशस्विनमकल्पषम्।आसीनं स्थण्डिले रामं ददर्श सहसा जनः।।2.102.45।।
102_43.translation: All at once the people saw the illustrious Rama, the best of men, and the subduer of enemies squatting on the bare earth.
102_43.word_by_word: ततः thereafter, जनः people, पुरुषव्याघ्रं best of men, यशस्विनम् illustrious, अरिन्दमम् one who is destroyer of enemies, स्थण्डिले on the bare earth, आसीनम् squatted, तम् that, रामम् Rama, सहसा at once, ददर्श beheld.

102_44.shloka: विगर्हमाणः कैकेयीं मन्थरासहितामपि।अभिगम्य जनो रामं बाष्पपूर्णमुखोऽभवत्।।2.102.46।।
102_44.translation: All those men with faces full of tears, reproaching Kaikeyi and Manthara (all the way), approached Rama.
102_44.word_by_word: जनः all men, मन्थरासहिताम् including Manthara, कैकेयीम् Kaikeyi, विगर्हमाणः censuring, रामम्  to Rama, अभिगम्य having reached, बाष्पपूर्णमुखः with face filled with tears, अभवत् became.

102_45.translation: Thereafter, beholding those people deeply afflicted, their eyes full of tears, Rama embraced them as if they were his own father and mother.
102_45.word_by_word: धर्मज्ञः knower of righteousness, सः that Rama, अथ thereafter, बाष्पपूर्णाक्षान् eyes filled with tears, सुदुःखितान् deeply afflicted, तान्नरान् those people, समीक्ष्य having seen, पितृवत् like a father, मातृवच्च like a mother, पर्यष्वजत embraced.

102_46.shloka: स तत्र कांश्चित्परिषस्वजे नरान्नरास्तु केचित्तु तमभ्यवादयन्।चकार सर्वान्सवयस्यबान्धवान्यथार्ह मासाद्य तदा नृपात्मजः।।2.102.48।।
102_46.translation: Rama embraced some, while others paid him obeisance. Therafter, he honoured his erstwhile companions and relations in accordance with their status.
102_46.word_by_word: सः Rama, तत्र there, कांश्चित् some, नरान् men, परिषस्वजे embraced, केचित्तु as for some, नराश्च men, तम् that Rama, अभ्यवादयन् paid obeisance, तदा then, सः that, नृपात्मजः king's son, सर्वान् all of them, आसाद्य having reached, वयस्यबान्धवान् friends and relations, यथार्हम्as deserved, चकार made.

102_47.shloka: स तत्र तेषां रुदतां महात्मनां भुवं च खं चानुनिनादयन्स्वनः।गुहा गिरीणां च दिशश्च सन्ततं मृदङ्गघोषप्रतिमः प्रशुश्रुवे।।2.102.49।।
102_47.translation: The weeping and the tumult of those magnanimous people made the earth, sky, mountaincaves and all quarters reverberate incessantly like the beating of drums.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे द्व्युत्तरशततमस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the hundred and second sarga in Ayodhyakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
102_47.word_by_word: तत्र there, रुदताम् weeping, तेषां महात्मनाम् those magnanimous persons, स्वनः that tumult,  भुवं च the earth, खं च the sky, गिरीणाम् of mountains, गुहाश्च caves, दिशश्च the directions, अनुनिनादयन् reverberating, मृदङ्गघोषप्रतिमः like beating of drums, सन्ततम् incessantly, प्रशुश्रुवे was heard.

103_1.shloka: [Wailing of all mothers on seeing Rama offering libations to his father in Mandakini.]वसिष्ठः पुरतः कृत्वा दारान्दशरथस्य च।अभिचक्राम तं देशं रामदर्शनतर्षितः।।2.103.1।।
103_1.translation: Longing to see Rama, Vasistha, headed by the wives of Dasaratha, set out on foot(where Rama was offering libations).
103_1.word_by_word: वसिष्ठः Vasistha, दशरथस्य Dasaratha's, दारान् wives, पुरतः in front of, कृत्वा having placed,  रामदर्शनतर्षितः longing to see Rama, तं देशम् that place, अभिचक्राम set out on foot.

103_2.shloka: राजपत्न्यश्च गच्छन्त्यो मन्दं मन्दाकिनीं प्रति।ददृशु स्तत्र तत् तीर्थं रामलक्ष्मणसेवितम्।।2.103.2।।
103_2.translation: The wives of the king while proceeding slowly towards the river Mandakini beheld the bathing place frequented by Rama and Lakshmana.
103_2.word_by_word: राजपत्न्यश्च king's wives also, मन्दाकिनीं प्रति towards the river Mandakini, मन्दम् slowly, गच्छन्त्यः while proceeding, तत्र there, रामलक्ष्मणसेवितम् frequented by Rama and  Lakshmana, तत् तीर्थम् that bathing place, ददृशुः beheld.

103_3.shloka: कौसल्या बाष्पपूर्णेन मुखेन परिशुष्यता।सुमित्रामब्रवीद्दीना याश्चान्या राजयोषितः।।2.103.3।।
103_3.translation: Kausalya, with eyes filled with tears and her face emaciated, addressing Sumitra andthe other wives of the king sadly said:
103_3.word_by_word: कौसल्या Kausalya, बाष्पपूर्णेन filled with tears, परिशुष्यता emaciated, मुखेन with her countenance, दीना in desolation, सुमित्राम् to Sumitra, याः अन्याः the other, राजयोषितः to wives of the king, अब्रवीत् said.

103_4.shloka: इदं तेषामनाथानां क्लिष्टमक्लिष्टकर्मणाम्।वने प्राक्कलनं तीर्थं ये ते निर्विषयीकृताः।।2.103.4।।
103_4.translation: This is a sacred place to the east of the forest used by the unfortunate Rama, and Lakshmana of untiring energy and Sita expelled from the country and undergoing suffering.
103_4.word_by_word: इदम् this one, ये ते those, निर्विषयीकृताः expelled from the country, तेषाम् their, आक्लिष्टकर्मणाम् men performing deeds with untiring energy, अनाथानाम् unfortunate ones, क्लिष्टम् sufferings, प्राक्कलनम् to the east of, वने in the forest, तीर्थम् sacred place.

103_5.shloka: इत स्सुमित्रे पुत्रस्ते सदा जलमतन्द्रितः।स्वयं हरति सौमित्रिर्मम पुत्रस्य कारणात्।।2.103.5।।
103_5.translation: O Sumitra, your son Lakshmana, free from laziness, always carries water from here for the sake of my son.
103_5.word_by_word: सुमित्रे O Sumitra, ते पुत्रः your son, सौमित्रिः Lakshmana, मम पुत्रस्य my son's, कारणात् on account, सदा always, अतन्द्रितः without indolence, इतः from  this place, जलम् water, स्वयम् himself, हरति carries.

103_6.shloka: जघन्यमपि ते पुत्रः कृतवान् न तु गर्हितः।भ्रातुर्यदर्थरहितं सर्वं तद् गर्हितंं गुणैः।।2.103.6।।
103_6.translation: Your son, though engaged in servile tasks (like bringing water), is not to be held contemptible because all the services intended for the benefit of his brother areprompted by virtue.
103_6.word_by_word: ते पुत्रः your son, जघन्यम् servile task, अपि although, कृतवान् has done, गर्हितः तु is indeed contemptible, न not, यत् the service, भ्रातुः to brother, अर्थसहितम् for the benefit of, तत् सर्वम् all that, गुणैः with virtues, विहितम् is endowed with.

103_7.shloka: अद्यायमपि ते पुत्रः क्लेशानामतथोचितः।नीचानर्थ समाचारं सज्जं कर्म प्रमुञ्चतु।।2.103.7।।
103_7.translation: This your son unaccustomed to, and undeserving of, any suffering may now give up this mean and distressing duty entrusted to him.
103_7.word_by_word: क्लेशानाम् of suffering, अतथोचितः unaccustomed, अयम् this, ते पुत्रः अपि your son also, अद्य now, नीचानर्थसमाचारम् mean and distressing, सज्जम् commenced, कर्म work, this service, प्रमुञ्चतु cease to perform.

103_8.shloka: दक्षिणाग्रेषु दर्भेषु सा ददर्श महीतले।पितुरिङ्गुदिपिण्याकं न्यस्तमायतलोचना।।2.103.8।।
103_8.translation: That largeeyed Kausalya beheld the cakes of ingudi pulp placed by Rama for his father on a spread of darbha grass whose blades pointed toward the south.
103_8.word_by_word: आयतलोचना largeeyed, सा that Kausalya, दक्षिणाग्रेषु pointed towards south, दर्भेषु blades of darbha grass, महीतले on the ground, पितुः father's, न्यस्तम् placed, इङ्गुदिपिण्याकम् cakes of ingudi pulp, ददर्श beheld.

103_9.shloka: तं भूमौ पितुरार्तेन न्यस्तं रामेण वीक्ष्य सा।उवाच देवी कौसल्या सर्वा दशरथस्त्रियः।।2.103.9।।
103_9.translation: Seeing the pinda (edible offering made to the departed soul) placed on the ground for his father by the distressed Rama, queen Kausalya, addressing all the wives of Dasaratha, said:
103_9.word_by_word: देवी queen, सा कौसल्या that Kausalya, आर्तेन distressed, रामेण by Rama, पितुः to father, न्यस्तम् placed, तम् that pinda (pindaofferings made to the departed soul), भूमौ on the ground, वीक्ष्य seeing, सर्वाः all, दशरथस्त्रियः to wives of Dasaratha, उवाच said.

103_10.translation: Have darsan of this pinda offered by Rama according to tradition to his magnanimous father, Dasaratha, lord of the Ikshvaku race.
103_10.word_by_word: राघवेण by Rama, इक्ष्वाकुनाथस्य for the sake of lord of the Ikshvaku race, महात्मनः of the magnanimous, पितुः father, राघवस्य for Dasaratha, यथाविधि according to tradition, दत्तम् given, इदम् this pinda, पश्यत look at.

103_11.shloka: तस्य देवसमानस्य पार्थिवस्य महात्मनः।नैतदौपयिकं मन्ये भुक्तभोगस्य भोजनम्।।2.103.11।।
103_11.translation: I do not think that this is an appropriate food for that godlike and great lord of the earth who enjoyed all luxury.
103_11.word_by_word: देवसमानस्य of a man equal to god, भुक्तभोगस्य of one who enjoyed every luxury, महात्मनः of the magnaniouous, तस्य पार्थिवस्य of that lord of the earth, एतत् this, भोजनम् food, औपयिकम् is appropriate, न मन्ये I don't think.

103_12.shloka: चतुरन्तां महीं भुक्त्वा महेन्द्रसदृशो विभुः।कथमिङ्गुदिपिण्याकं स भुक्ते वसुधाधिपः।।2.103.12।।
103_12.translation: How can Indralike Dasaratha, having ruled the earth bounded by four oceans, eat a cake of ingudi pulp?
103_12.word_by_word: महेन्द्रसदृशः resembling Indra, विभुः king, सः वसुधाधिपः that lord of the earth, चतुरन्ताम् with four corners, महीम् the earth, भुक्त्वा having enjoyed, इङ्गुदिपिण्याकम् the cake of pulp of ingudi, कथम् how, भुक्ते can he eat?

103_13.shloka: अतो दुःखतरं लोके न किञ्चित्प्रतिभाति मा।यत्र रामः पितुर्दद्यादिङ्गुदिक्षोदमृद्धिमान्।।2.103.13।।
103_13.translation: Rama (who was once) highly prosperous, had to offer the cake of ingudi pulp to his father. Nothing appears more painful to me than this in this world.
103_13.word_by_word: यत्र at a point, ऋद्धिमान् (formerly) prosperous, रामः Rama, पितुः to father, इङ्गुदिक्षोदम् cake of ingudi nuts, दद्यात् may offer, अतः more than this, लोके in this world, दुःखतरम् more painful, किञ्चित् anything, मा to me, न प्रतिभाति does not appear.

103_14.shloka: रामेणेङ्गुदिपिण्याकं पितुर्दत्तं समीक्ष्य मे।कथं दुःखेन हृदयं न स्फोटति सहस्रधा।।2.103.14।।
103_14.translation: Seeing the offering of cake of ingudi pulp by Rama to his father, how is it that my heart does not break into a thousand pieces in sorrow?
103_14.word_by_word: रामेण by Rama, पितुः to father, दत्तम् offered, इङ्गुदिपिण्याकम् cake of ingudi pulp, समीक्ष्य  on seeing, मे हृदयम् my heart, दुःखेन out of sorrow, सहस्रधा into a thousand pieces, कथम्how, न स्फोटति not breaking?

103_15.shloka: श्रुतिस्तु खल्वियं सत्या लौकिकी प्रतिभाति मा।यदन्नः पुरुषो भवति तदन्नास्तस्य देवताः।।2.103.15।।
103_15.translation: The wellknown saying in this world is that 'whatever food a man partakes, his gods also partake the same'. This dictum appears true (now).
103_15.word_by_word: पुरुषः man, यदन्नः भवति whatever is his food, तस्य his, देवताः gods, तदन्नाः they have the same food, इयम् this, लौकिकी wellknown in the world, श्रुतिस्तु saying, सत्या as truthful, मा about (to) me, प्रतिभाति खलु occurs to me.

103_16.shloka: एवमार्तां सपत्न्यस्ता जग्मुराश्वास्य तां तदा।ददृशुश्चाश्रमे रामं स्वर्गच्युतमिवामरम्।।2.103.16।।
103_16.translation: The cowives, having thus consoled the distressed Kausalya, went to the hermitage. There they beheld Rama who looked like a god dislodged from heaven.
103_16.word_by_word: तदा then, ताः those, सपत्न्यः cowives, एवम् in this way, आर्ताम् distressed, ताम् her, आश्वास्य having consoled, जग्मुः went, आश्रमे in the hermitage, स्वर्गच्युतम् fallen from heaven, अमरमिव like a god, रामम् Rama, ददृशुश्च beheld.

103_17.shloka: सर्वभोगैः परित्यक्तं रामं सम्प्रेक्ष्य मातरः।आर्ता मुमुचुरश्रूणि सस्वरं शोककर्शिताः।।2.103.17।।
103_17.translation: Beholding Rama devoid of all luxury, his mothers afflicted with grief, and overcome with sorrow, cried aloud, tears streaming down.
103_17.word_by_word: शोककर्शिताः emaciated due to  grief, मातरः mothers, सर्वभोगैः with all luxuries, परित्यक्तम्  devoid of, रामम् Rama, सम्प्रेक्ष्य having seen, आर्ताः overcome with sorrow, सस्वरम् in loud voice, अश्रूणि tears, मुमुचुः shed.

103_18.shloka: तासां रामस्समुत्थाय जग्राह चरणान् शुभान्।मात्रूणां मनुजव्याघ्रस्सर्वासां सत्यसङ्गरः।।2.103.18।।
103_18.translation: Rama, the best among men and true to his promise, rose and touched the auspicious feet of all his mothers (in reverence).
103_18.word_by_word: मनुजव्याघ्रः best among men, सत्यसङ्गरः true to his promise, रामः Rama, समुत्थाय having risen, सर्वासाम् to all, तासां मात्रूणाम् of those mothers, शुभान् auspicious, चरणान् feet, जग्राह clasped.

103_19.shloka: ताः पाणिभि स्सुखस्पर्शैर्मृद्वङ्गुलितलै श्शुभैः।प्रममार्जू रजः पृष्ठाद्रामस्यायतलोचनाः।।2.103.19।।
103_19.translation: Those largeeyed queens, their palms with delicate fingers and with auspicious hands with a pleasant touch, wiped the dust from the back of his body.
103_19.word_by_word: आयतलोचनाः largeeyed ones, ताः they, सुखस्पर्शैः with pleasant touch, मृद्वङ्गुलितलैः with palms having delicate fingers, शुभैः by auspicious, पाणिभिः with hands, रामस्य Rama's, पृष्ठात् from the back of the body, रजः the dust, प्रममार्जुः wiped.

103_20.shloka: सौमित्रिरपि ता स्सर्वा मातृ़स्सम्प्रेक्ष्य दुःखितः।अभ्यवादयतासक्तं शनै रामादनन्तरम्।।2.103.20।।
103_20.translation: On seeing his mothers, Lakshmana, too, was overcome with grief and with devotion followed Rama and slowly bowed to them with reverence.
103_20.word_by_word: सौमित्रिरपि Lakshmana also, सर्वाः all, ताः मात्रृ़ः those mothers, सम्प्रेक्ष्य after seeing, दुःखितः  overcome with grief, रामात् अनन्तरम् following Rama, शनैः slowly, आसक्तम् with devotion,अभ्यवादयत् bowed with reverence.

103_21.shloka: यथा रामे तथा तस्मिन्सर्वा ववृतिरे स्त्रियः।वृत्तिं दशरथाज्जाते लक्ष्मणे शुभलक्षणे।।2.103.21।।
103_21.translation: All the queens treated Lakshmana, born of Dasaratha and endowed with auspicious qualities, with the same love as they did to Rama.
103_21.word_by_word: सर्वाः all, स्त्रियः wives, दशरथात् of Dasaratha, जाते born, शुभलक्षणे possessing auspicious qualities, तस्मिन् लक्ष्मणे in the matter of Lakshmana, रामे यथा just as in the case of Rama, तथा similarly, वृत्तिम् conduct, ववृतिरे treated.

103_22.shloka: सीताऽपि चरणांस्तासामुपसङ्गृह्य दुःखिता।श्वश्रूणामश्रुपूर्णाक्षी सा बभूवाग्रतः स्थिता।।2.103.22।।
103_22.translation: Sita, too, overcome with grief, grasped the feet of her mothersinlaw and stood before them, her eyes full of tears.
103_22.word_by_word: सा सीतापि that Sita too, दुःखिता overcome with sorrow, तासाम् by those, श्वश्रूणाम् of mothersinlaw, चरणान् feet, उपसङ्गृह्य grasping, अश्रुपूर्णाक्षी eyes suffused with tears,अग्रतः before them, स्थिता बभूव stood.

103_23.shloka: तां परिष्वज्य दुःखार्तां माता दुहितरं यथा।वनवासकृशां दीनां कौसल्या वाक्यमब्रवीत्।।2.103.23।।
103_23.translation: Like a mother to her daughter, Kausalya embraced the wretched Sita, who was afflicted with sorrow, and emaciated due to her stay in the forest, and said to her:
103_23.word_by_word: कौसल्या Kausalya, दुःखार्ताम् anguished, वनवासकृशाम् emaciated due to her stay in the forest, दीनाम् poor, ताम् her, माता mother, दुहितरं यथा like a daughter, परिष्वज्य having embraced, वाक्यम् words, अब्रवीत् said.

103_24.shloka: विदेहराजस्य सुता स्नुषा दशरथस्य च।रामपत्नी कथं दुःखं सम्प्राप्ता निर्जने वने।।2.103.24।।
103_24.translation: How is it that Sita, daughter of Janaka, king of Videha, daughterinlaw of Dasaratha and wife of Rama, has to undergo such hardships in the lonely forest.
103_24.word_by_word: विदेहराजस्य of the king of Videha, सुता daughter, दशरथस्य Dasaratha's, स्नुषा daughterinlaw, रामपत्नी Rama's wife, निर्जने in desolation, वने  in the forest, कथम् how, दुःखम्  grief, सम्प्राप्ता had undergone.

103_25.shloka: पद्ममातपसन्तप्तं परिक्लिष्टमिवोत्पलम्।काञ्चनं रजसा ध्वस्तं क्लिष्टं चन्द्रमिवाम्बुदैः।।2.103.25।।मुखं ते प्रेक्ष्य मां शोको दहत्यग्निरिवाऽश्रयम्।भृशं मनसि वैदेहि व्यसनारणिसम्भवः।।2.103.26।।
103_25.translation: O Sita, after looking at your countenance, which is like a lotus, scorched by the sunshine, or like a withered waterlily or gold defiled by dust or the Moon obscured by the clouds, the fire of sorrow is burning my mind. The grief in my mind is like fire kindled from the arani (sacrificial faggots) that consumes its own souree. (On a circular wood piece, a wooden stick is placed and churned to produce fire specially in sacrifices is called arani.)
103_25.word_by_word: वैदेहि O Sita, आतपसन्तप्तम् scorched by sunshine, पद्मम् इव like lotus, परिक्लिष्टम् withered, उत्पलमिव like waterlily, रजसा by dust, ध्वस्तम् defiled, काञ्चनम् इव like gold, अम्बुदैः with clouds, क्लिष्टम् obscured, चन्द्रम् इव like the Moon, ते मुखम् your countenance, प्रेक्ष्य on seeing, व्यसनारणिसम्भवः kindled from the faggots of calamities, शोकः grief, अग्निः fire, आश्रयमिव like the stick, its refuge, माम् me, मनसि in the mind, भृशम् greatly, दहति burning.

103_26.shloka: ब्रुवन्त्यामेवमार्तायां जनन्यां भरताग्रजः।पादावासाद्य जग्राह वसिष्ठस्य च राघवः।।2.103.27।।
103_26.translation: While Rama's mother was uttering such words in anguish, Rama reached Vasistha and clasped his feet with reverence.
103_26.word_by_word: आर्तायां while in anguish, जनन्याम् mother, एवम् in this way, ब्रुवन्त्याम् while speaking, भरताग्रजः Bharata's elder brother, राघवः Rama, आसाद्य having approached, वसिष्ठस्य Vasistha, पादौ feet, जग्राह clasped.

103_27.shloka: पुरोहितस्याग्निसमस्य वै तदा बृहस्पतेरिन्द्रमिवामराधिपः।प्रगृह्य पादौ सुसमृद्धतेजसस्सहैव तेनोपविवेश राघवः।।2.103.28।।
103_27.translation: Rama touched the feet of the family priest Vasistha, a man equivalent to effulgent fire like Indra, the lord of the gods, does to Brihaspati and sat down along with him.
103_27.word_by_word: तदा then, राघवः Rama, अग्निसमस्य of a man equivalent to fire, सुसमृद्ध तेजसः of exceeding brilliance, पुरोहितस्य family priest's, पादौ feet, अमराधिपः king of the gods, इन्द्रः Indra, बृहस्पतेरिव like Brihaspati's feet, प्रगृह्य clasping, तेन सहैव with him, उपविवेश sat down.

103_28.shloka: ततो जघन्यं सहितै स्समन्त्रिभिः पुरप्रधानैश्च सहैव सैनिकैः।जनेन धर्मज्ञतमेन धर्मवानुपोपविष्टो भरत स्तदाऽग्रजम्।।2.103.29।।
103_28.translation: After Vasistha and Rama sat down, righteous Bharata sat close to his elder brother. Behind him sat his companions, leading citizens, soldiers and righteous men.
103_28.word_by_word: तदा then, ततः जघन्यम् then behind them, धर्मवान् righteous, सः भरतः सहितैः along with Bharata, मन्त्रिभिः with counsellors पुरप्रधानैश्च with leading citizens, सैनिकैस्सहैव along with soldiers as well, धर्मज्ञतमेन most knowledgeble one in the ways of righteousness, जनेन by men, अग्रजम् elder brother, Rama, उपोपविष्टः sat down near him.

103_29.shloka: उपोपविष्ट स्तु तदा स वीर्यवांस्तपस्विवेषेण समीक्ष्य राघवम्।श्रिया ज्वलन्तं भरतः कृताञ्जलिर्यथा महेन्द्रः प्रयतः प्रजापतिम्।।2.103.30।।
103_29.translation: Beholding Rama attired like an ascetic but radiant with a majestic glow, the extremely valiant Bharata sat near him with folded palms like the great Indra purified by religious austerities sits near Brahma, the creator.
103_29.word_by_word: वीर्यवान् extremely powerful, सः that, भरतः Bharata, तपस्विवेषेण dressed as an ascetic, श्रिया with majesty, ज्वलन्तम् radiating, राघवम् Rama, प्रयतः purified by religious austerities, महेन्द्रः great Indra, प्रजापतिं यथा like Brahma, the creator, समीक्ष्य having looked at, कृताञ्जलिः with folded palms, तदा then, उपोपविष्टः तु sat next to him.

103_30.shloka: किमेष वाक्यं भरतोऽद्य राघवं प्रणम्य सत्कृत्य च साधु वक्ष्यति।इतीव तस्यार्यजनस्य तत्त्वतो बभूव कौतूहलमुत्तमं तदा।।2.103.31।।
103_30.translation: All noble people were truly filled with great curiosity as to what Bharata was going to speak, after paying his homage and honouring Rama.
103_30.word_by_word: एषः this, भरतः Bharata, अद्य now, राघवम् to Rama, प्रणम्य having paid his homage, सत्कृत्य च also honouring him, साधु of good, किं वाक्यम् what words, वक्ष्यति will speak, इतीव thus as if, तदा of that, तस्य those, आर्यजनस्य of nobility, तत्त्वतः truly, उत्तमम् great, कौतूहलम्   curiosity, बभूव arose.

103_31.shloka: स राघव स्सत्यधृति श्च लक्ष्मणो महानुभावो भरत श्च धार्मिकः।वृताः सुहृद्भि श्च विरेजुरध्वरे यथा सदस्यै स्सहितास्त्रयोऽग्नयः।।2.103.32।।
103_31.translation: Rama who was steadfast in truth, Lakshmana of great dignity and righteous Bharata surrounded by their friends were as resplendent as three sacrificial fires encircled by officiating priests.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे त्य्रुत्तरशततमस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the one hundredthird sarga in Ayodhyakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
103_31.word_by_word: सत्यधृतिः steadfast in truth, सः राघवश्च that Rama, महानुभावः a man of great dignity, लक्ष्मणः Lakshmana, धार्मिकः practising righteouness, भरतश्च Bharata as well, सुहृद्भिः by their friends, वृताः surrounded by, अध्वरे in the sacrifice, सदस्यैः with the officiating priests  सहिताः along with, त्रयः the three, अग्नयः यथा like fires, विरेजुः were resplendent.

104_1.shloka: [Bharata beseeches Rama repeatedly -- Rama justifies his obedience to his father's command.]तं तु राम स्समाश्वास्य भ्रातरं गुरवत्सलम्।लक्ष्मणेन सह भ्रात्रा प्रष्टुं समुपचक्रमे।।2.104.1।।
104_1.translation: Rama with his brother Lakshmana having consoled Bharata who is ever devoted to elders began to question:
104_1.word_by_word: भ्रात्रा brother, लक्ष्मणेन सह along with Lakshmana, रामः Rama, गुरुवत्सलम् to one devoted to elders, भ्रातरम् to brother, तम् that Bharata, समाश्वास्य having consoled, प्रष्टुम् to question,  समुपचक्रमे commenced.

104_2.shloka: किमेतदिच्छेयमहं श्रोतुं प्रव्याहृतं त्वया।यस्मात्त्वमागतो देशमिमं चीरजटाजिनः।।2.104.2।।
104_2.translation: I want to hear what brought you to this region with your barkrobes, matted locks and antelope skin.
104_2.word_by_word: त्वम् you, चीरजटाजिन: wearing barkrobes, matted locks and antelope skin, यस्मात् for what reason, इमं देशम् to this region, आगतः have come, एतत् किम् what is it, त्वया by you, प्रव्याहृतम् being related, अहम् I, श्रोतुम् to hear, इच्छेयम् I desire.

104_3.shloka: यन्निमित्तमिमं देशं कृष्णाजिनजटाधरः।हित्वा राज्यं प्रविष्टस्त्वं तत्सर्वं वक्तुमर्हसि।।2.104.3।।
104_3.translation: What made you come to this region, leaving the kingdom and wearing deer skin and matted hair? You should tell me everything.
104_3.word_by_word: त्वम् you, राज्यम् kingdom, हित्वा leaving, कृष्णाजिनजटाधरः wearing deer skin and matted hair, किन्निमित्तम् for what reason, इमं देशम् this region, प्रविष्टः have entered, तत् that, सर्वम् everything, वक्तुम् to tell, अर्हसि behoves you.

104_4.shloka: इत्युक्तः कैकयीपुत्रः काकुत्स्थेन महात्मना।प्रगृह्य बलवद्भूयः प्राञ्जलिर्वाक्यमब्रवीत्।।2.104.4।।
104_4.translation: Thus enquired by the magnanimous Rama, Bharata, joining his palms tightly, replied:
104_4.word_by_word: महात्मना by the magnanimous, काकुत्स्थेन by Rama, इति thus, उक्तः uttered, कैकयीपुत्रः son of Kaikeyi, Bharata, प्राञ्जलिः joining the palms in reverence, भूयः again, बलवत् strongly, प्रगृह्य holding, वाक्यम् this statement, अब्रवीत् said.

104_5.shloka: आर्यं तातः परित्यज्य कृत्वा कर्म सुदुष्करम्।गत: स्वर्ग महाबाहुः पुत्रशोकाभिपीडितः।।2.104.5।।
104_5.translation: O my revered sire our mighty father, having performed an impossible task of banishing you to the forest, and tortured by grief due to separation from his son, went to heaven.
104_5.word_by_word: महाबाहुः mightyarmed, तातः father, आर्यं my esteemed brother, परित्यज्य having abandoned, सुदुष्करम् impossible to perform, कर्म task, कृत्वा having done, पुत्रशोकाभिपीडितः tortured by the grief due to separation from his son, स्वर्गम् heaven, गतः went.

104_6.shloka: स्त्रिया नियुक्तः कैकेय्या मम मात्रा परन्तप।चकार सा महत्पापमिदमात्मयशोहरम्।।2.104.6।।
104_6.translation: O Rama, tormentor of enemies having been instigated by a woman, my motherKaikeyi, committed this great sin of destroying his (Dasaratha's) reputation.
104_6.word_by_word: परन्तप O tormentor of enemies, Rama, मम my, मात्रा mother, स्त्रिया woman, कैकेय्या byKaikeyi, नियुक्तः instigated, आत्मयशोहरम् destroying his reputation, सुमहत् great, इदं पापम् this sin, चकार commited.

104_7.shloka: सा राज्यफलमप्राप्य विधवा शोककर्शिता।पतिष्यति महाघोरे निरये जननी मम।।2.104.7।।
104_7.translation: My mother, formented with grief and with the fruit of the kingdom forfeited, and cursed with widowhood, will fall into the dreadful hell.
104_7.word_by_word: मम my, जननी mother, सा that lady, राज्यफलम् fruit of kingodm, अप्राप्य without acquiring, विधवा widow, शोककर्शिता formented with grief, महाघोरे dreadful, निरये hell, पतिष्यति will fall.

104_8.shloka: तस्य मे दासभूतस्य प्रसादं कर्तुमर्हसि।अभिषिञ्चस्व चाद्येव राज्येन मघवानिव।।2.104.8।।
104_8.translation: It behoves you to grant  me a favour. I am like your servant. Now get yourself coronated in the kingdom like Indra.
104_8.word_by_word: तस्य such, दासभूतस्य servant I am, मे to me, प्रसादम् favour, कर्तुम् to do, अर्हसि behoves you, अद्येव now itself, मघवानिव like Indra, राज्येन in the kingdom, अभिषिञ्चस्व be coronated.

104_9.shloka: इमाः प्रकृतय स्सर्वा विधवा मातरश्च याः।त्वत्सकाशमनुप्राप्ता प्रसादं कर्तुमर्हसि।।2.104.9।।
104_9.translation: All these subjects and your widowed mothers have come to you. It behoves you to grant them this favour.
104_9.word_by_word: इमाः these, सर्वाः all, प्रकृतयः subjects, विधवाः widows, मातरश्च those mothers, त्वत्सकाशम्to your proximity, अनुप्राप्ताः have reached, प्रसादम् favour, कर्तुम् to do, अर्हसि behoves you.

104_10.shloka: तदानुपूर्व्या युक्तं च युक्तं चात्मनि मानद।राज्यं प्राप्नुहि धर्मेण सकामान्सुहृदः कुरु।।2.104.10।।
104_10.translation: O bestower of honour by the law of primogeniture and as a worthy successor it is appropriate that you should accept the kingdom righteously and fulfil the desire of your friends.
104_10.word_by_word: मानद O bestower of honour, तत् for that reason, आनुपूर्व्या by succession, युक्तम् appropriate, आत्मनि in you, युक्तं च is appropriate, राज्यम् kingdom, धर्मेण righteously, प्राप्नुहि you may obtain, सुहृदः friends, सकामान् having fulfilled their desire, कुरु make them.

104_11.shloka: भवत्वविधवा भूमि स्समग्रा पतिना त्वया।शशिना विमलेनेव शारदी रजनी यथा।।2.104.11।।
104_11.translation: Like an autumnal night with the immaculate Moon, let this entire earth cease to be a widow by securing you as her lord.
104_11.word_by_word: समग्रा this entire, भूमिः earth, शारदी relating to autumn, रजनी यथा like night, पतिना as lord, त्वया by you, विमलेन by the immaculate, शशिना इव like the Moon, अविधवा भवतु let it be a widow no more.

104_12.shloka: एभिश्च सचिवैस्सार्धं शिरसा याचितो मया।भ्रातु  शिष्यस्य दासस्य प्रसादं कर्तुमर्हसि।।2.104.12।।
104_12.translation: With my head bowed down, I beseech you along with all these ministers to show favour to me who is your brother, disciple and slave.
104_12.word_by_word: एभिः by these, सचिवैः सार्धम् with ministers, मया by me, शिरसा with head bowed down, याचितः has been besought, भ्रातुः of a brother, शिष्यस्य of a disciple, दासस्य of a slave, प्रसादम् favour, कर्तुम् to do, अर्हसि it behoves you.

104_13.shloka: तदिदं शाश्वतं पित्र्यं सर्वं प्रकृतिमण्डलम्।पूजितं पुरुषव्याघ्र नातिक्रमितुमर्हसि।।2.104.13।।
104_13.translation: O best among men, it does not behove you to transgress the prayers of the whole order of subjects and ministers to assume this hereditary and perpetual order.
104_13.word_by_word: पुरुषव्याघ्रः O best among men, तत् for that reason, शाश्वतम् eternal, पित्र्यम् hereditary, पूजितम् venerable, सर्वम् entire, इदम् this order, प्रकृतिमण्डलम् the whole order of subjects, अतिक्रमितुम् to transgress, न अर्हति it does not behove you.

104_14.shloka: एवमुक्त्वा महाबाहु स्सबाष्पः कैकयीसुतः।रामस्य शिरसा पादौ जग्राह भरत: पुन:।।2.104.14।।
104_14.translation: Having said thus, the mightyarmed Bharata, in accordance with tradition, grasped with tearful eyes the feet of Rama again with his head.
104_14.word_by_word: महाबाहुः mightyarmed, कैकयीसुतः Kaikeyi's son, Bharata, एवम् in this way, उक्त्वा having said, सबाष्पः with tearful eyes, रामस्य Rama's, पादौ feet, पुनः again, विधिवत् in accordance with tradition, शिरसा with his head, जग्राह grasped.

104_15.shloka: तं मत्तमिव मातङ्गं निःश्वसन्तं पुन पुनः।भ्रातरं भरतं रामः परिष्वज्येदमब्रवीत्।।2.104.15।।
104_15.translation: Rama embraced his brother Bharata who repeatedly heaved sighs and resembled anelephant in rut, and said:
104_15.word_by_word: रामः Rama, पुनः पुनः repeatedly, निःश्वसन्तम् heaving sighs, मत्तम् in rut, मातङ्गम् इव  resembling an elephant, भ्रातरम् brother, तं भरतम् that Bharata, परिष्वज्य embracing, इदम् this word, अब्रवीत् said.

104_16.translation: How can a man like you, born of a noble race, endowed with energy, powerful and adherent to vows, commit a sin for the sake of a kingdom?
104_16.word_by_word: कुलीनः a man of noble birth, सत्वसम्पन्नः endowed with energy, तेजस्वी powerful, चरितव्रतःadherent to one's vows, त्वद्विधः like you, जनः a man, राज्यहेतोः for the sake of kingdom, पापम् sin, कथम् how, आचरेत् will commit?

104_17.shloka: न दोषं त्वयि पश्यामि सूक्ष्ममप्यरिसूदन।न चापि जननीं बाल्यात्त्वं विगर्हितुमर्हसि।।2.104.17।।
104_17.translation: O destroyer of enemies, I do not find even slightest fault with you. Like a child, it does not behove you to reproach your mother.
104_17.word_by_word: अरिसूदन O destroyer of enemies, त्वयि in you, सूक्ष्ममपि slightest, दोषम् fault, न पश्यामि I do not find, त्वम् you, बाल्यात् out of childishness, जननीं your mother, विगर्हितुम् to reproach, नार्हसि चापि does not behove you.

104_18.shloka: कामकारो महाप्राज्ञ गुरूणां सर्वदाऽनघ।उपपन्नेषु दारेषु पुत्रेषु च विधीयते।।2.104.18।।
104_18.translation: O sagacious and sinless one, it is laid down (in sastras) that elders when married can always act at their free will towards their wives and sons.
104_18.word_by_word: महाप्राज्ञ sagacious, अनघ sinless, गुरूणाम् of elders, उपपन्नेषु when married, दारेषु in relation to their wives, पुत्रेषु च also sons, सर्वदा always, कामकारः acting at will, विधीयते is laid down.

104_19.shloka: वयमस्य यथा लोके सङ्ख्याता: सौम्य साधुभिः।भार्याः पुत्राश्च शिष्याश्च त्वमनुज्ञातुमर्हसि।।2.104.19।।
104_19.translation: O handsome one, you should treat us the way the virtuous treat their wives, sons and disciples in this world.
104_19.word_by_word: सौम्य O handsome one, लोके in this world, भार्याः wives, पुत्राश्च sons, शिष्याश्च disciples, साधुभिः by virtuous men, यथा as, संख्याताः have been treated, वयम् we, अस्य for this (king Dasaratha, etc), त्वं you, अनुज्ञातुं to permit, अर्हसि it behoves you.

104_20.shloka: वने वा चीरवसनं सौम्य कृष्णाजिनाम्बरम्।राज्ये वाऽपि महाराजो मां वासयितुमीश्वरः।।2.104.20।।
104_20.translation: O handsome one, king Dasaratha is alone competent to accommodate me in the forest wearing bark robes and antelope skin as garment or install me in the kingdom.
104_20.word_by_word: सौम्य O handsome one, चीरवसनम् dressed in bark robes, कृष्णाजिनाम्बरम् with antelope skin as garment, माम् me, महाराजः the maharaja (Dasaratha), वने वा either in the forest, राज्ये वापि or in the kingdom, वासयितुम् to accommodate me,  ईश्वरः is competent.

104_21.shloka: यावत पितरि धर्मज्ञे गौरवं लोकसत्कृतम्।तावद्धर्मभृतां श्रेष्ठ जनन्यामपि गौरवम्।।2.104.21।।
104_21.translation: O best among the protectors of righteousness the honour shown to our father who is conversant with the ways of righteousness and much revered by the world ought to be shown towards our mother also.
104_21.word_by_word: धर्मभृताम् among the protectors of righteousness, श्रेष्ठ best, धर्मज्ञे conversant with the ways of righteousness, पितरि in father, लोकसत्कृतम् revered by the world, यावत् how much, गौरवम् honour, जनन्यामपि even for mother, तावत् that much, गौरवम् honour, should be shown.

104_22.shloka: एताभ्यां धर्मशीलाभ्यां वनं गच्छेति राघव।मातापितृभ्यामुक्तोऽहं कथमन्यत्समाचरे।।2.104.22।।
104_22.translation: O Bharata, I have been commanded by our righteous father and mother to go to the forest. How can any one act otherwise?
104_22.word_by_word: राघव O Bharata, धर्मशीलाभ्याम् of righteous conduct, एताभ्याम् by these two, मातापितृभ्याम् by the father and mother, वनम् to forest, गच्छ go, इति thus, उक्तः having been told, अहम् I, अन्यत् other than this, कथम् how, समाचरेत् can act?

104_23.shloka: त्वया राज्यमयोध्यायां प्राप्तव्यं लोकसत्कृतम्।वस्तव्यं दण्डकारण्ये मया वल्कलवाससा।।2.104.23।।
104_23.translation: You shall rule the kingdom wellhonoured by the people in Ayodhya and I shall live in Dandaka forest wearing bark as garments.
104_23.word_by_word: त्वया by you, अयोध्यायाम् in Ayodhya, लोकसत्कृतम् honoured by the the world, राज्यम् kingdom, प्राप्तव्यम् is to be obtained, मया by me, वल्कलवाससा with barkrobes as garments, दण्डकारण्ये in Dandaka forest, वस्तव्यम् I must live.

104_24.shloka: एवं कृत्वा महाराजो विभागं लोकसन्निधौ।व्यादिश्य च महातेजा दिवं दशरथो गतः।।2.104.24।।
104_24.translation: The maharja of great radiance made this division in the presence of people and after commanding thus, ascended heaven.
104_24.word_by_word: महाराजः great king, महातेजाः of great splendour, दशरथः Dasaratha, लोकसन्निधौ in the presence of people, एवम् in this way, विभागम् apportionment, कृत्वा having  made, व्यादिश्य च having commanded, दिवम् to heaven, गतः went.

104_25.shloka: स च प्रमाणं धर्मात्मा राजा लोकगुरुस्तव।पित्रा दत्तं यथाभागमुपभोक्तुं त्वमर्हसि।।2.104.25।।
104_25.translation: The proclamation of that righteous king revered by the world shall be your guide. Youshould enjoy that portion bestowed by father.
104_25.word_by_word: धर्मात्मा righteous, लोकगुरुः revered by the world, सः राजा that king, तव your, प्रमाणम्proclamation, त्वम् you, पित्रा by father, दत्तम् bestowed, यथाभागम् that portion, उपभोक्तुम् to enjoy, अर्हसि behoves you.

104_26.shloka: चतुर्दश समास्सौम्य दण्डकारण्यमाश्रितः।उपभोक्ष्ये त्वहं दत्तं भागं पित्रा महात्मना।।2.104.26।।
104_26.translation: O handsome one, as for myself, I shall enjoy the portion bestowed on me by my magnanimous father and shall take refuge in the Dandaka forest for fourteen years.
104_26.word_by_word: सौम्य O handsome one, अहं तु as for myself, चतुर्दश fourteen, समाः years, दण्डकारण्यम् Dandaka forest, आश्रितः taking refuge, महात्मना magnanimous, पित्रा by father, दत्तम् bestowed, भागम् portion, उपभोक्ष्ये I will enjoy.

104_27.shloka: यदब्रवीन्मां नरलोकसत्कृतः पिता महात्मा विबुधाधिपोपमः।तदेव मन्ये परमात्मनो हितं न सर्वलोकेश्वर भावमप्ययम्।।2.104.27।।
104_27.translation: I think what my great father, who is honoured by all men, and an equal to Indra, ordered is for my highest welfare. The will of the overlord of the world should not be done away with.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे चतुरुत्तरशततमस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the one hundredfourth sarga in Ayodhyakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
104_27.word_by_word: नरलोकसत्कृतः honoured by the men of the world, पिता father, महात्मा highsouled, विबुधाधिपोपमः equal to the king of the gods, यत् whatever, अब्रवीत् said, माम् to me, तदेव that only, परमात्मन: the ulitimate, हितं good, मन्ये I regard it, सर्वलोकेश्वर: the will of the lord of all the worlds, भावमप्ययम् न should not be allowed to vanish.

105_1.shloka: [Bharata's lamentation and Rama's consolation.]ततः पुरुषसिंहानां वृतानां तै स्सुहृद्गणैः।शोचतामेव रजनी दुःखेन व्यत्यवर्तत।।2.105.1।।
105_1.translation: That night passed off painfully for the four lion like brothers as they lamented, surrounded by their hosts of friends.
105_1.word_by_word: ततः then, तैः by them, सुहृद्गणैः with hosts of friends, वृतानाम् surrounded by, पुरुषसिंहानाम्  lions of men (best of men), शोचतामेव while they were lamenting, रजनी night, दुःखेन painfully, व्यत्यवर्तत passed off.

105_2.shloka: रजन्यां सुप्रभातायां भ्रातरस्ते सुहृद्वृताः।मन्दाकिन्यां हुतं जप्यं कृत्वा राममुपागमन्।।2.105.2।।
105_2.translation: When the night dawned, those brothers surrounded by their friends made (morning) ablutions and, after the prayers, returned to Rama.
105_2.word_by_word: रजन्याम् that night, सुप्रभातायाम् had dawned, ते भ्रातरः those brothers, सुहृद्वृताः surrounded by friends, मन्दाकिन्याम् on the bank of Mandakini river, हुतम् morning oblations, जप्यम् prayers, कृत्वा having performed, रामम् to Rama, उपागमन् returned.

105_3.shloka: तूष्णीं ते समुपासीना न कश्चित्किञ्चिदब्रवीत्।भरतस्तु सुहृन्मध्ये रामं वचनमब्रवीत्।।2.105.3।।
105_3.translation: All of them sat together silently and no one uttered a word. Bharata alone from among  them addressed Rama saying:
105_3.word_by_word: ते they, तूष्णीम् silently, समुपासीनाः sat togethr, कश्चित् any one, किञ्चित् a little, न अब्रवीत्  did not speak, भरतस्तु Bharata on his part, सुहृन्मध्ये from among the friends, रामम् addressing Rama, वचनम् these words, अब्रवीत् said.

105_4.shloka: सान्त्विता मामिका माता दत्तं राज्यमिदं मम।तद्ददामि तवैवाहं भुङ्क्ष्व राज्यमकण्टकम्।।2.105.4।।
105_4.translation: This kingdom was given to me for the satisfaction of my mother. I am bestowing it back on you. Enjoy it without any obstacles.
105_4.word_by_word: मामिका my own, माता mother, सान्त्विता has been pacified, इदम् this, राज्यम् kingdom, मम to me, दत्तम् was given, तत् that kingdom, अहम् I, तवैव to you alone, ददामि am giving, अकण्टकम् without obstacles, राज्यम् kingdom, भुङ्क्ष्व enjoy.

105_5.translation: Like a dyke bursts under pressure by the great surge of waters during the rainy season, this vast kingdom cannot be sustained by any one except yourself.
105_5.word_by_word: जलागमे during the rainy season, महता great, अम्बुवेगेन by the surge of waters, भिन्नः burst  सेतुः इव like a dyke, इदम् this, महत् vast, राज्यखण्डम् kingdom, त्वदन्येन other than yourself, दुरावारम्  insupportable.

105_6.shloka: गतिं खर इवाश्वस्य तार्क्ष्यस्येव पतत्रिणः।अनुगन्तुं न शक्तिर्मे गतिं तव महीपते।।2.105.6।।
105_6.translation: O lord of the earth as an ass cannot follow the pace of a horse or a bird, the pace of Tarkshya (Garuda), I do not have the capability to follow you.
105_6.word_by_word: महीपते O lord of the earth, Rama, अश्वस्य horse's, गतिम् pace, खर इव like an ass, तार्क्ष्यस्य  Tarkshya's (the holy eagle, Garuda) pace, पतत्रिणः इव like a bird, तव गतिम् your pace,अनुगन्तुम् to follow, मे to me, शक्तिः power, न do not have.

105_7.shloka: सुजीवं नित्यशस्तस्य यः परैरुपजीव्यते।राम तेन तु दुर्जीवं यः परानुपजीवति।।2.105.7।।
105_7.translation: O Rama, the life of a man on whom others depend for their sustenance is a happy life and the life of one who depends on others for his own mintenance is miserable.
105_7.word_by_word: राम Rama, यः who, परैः by others, नित्यशः always, उपजीव्यते depends for sustenance, तस्य his, सुजीवम् happy life, यः who, परान् on others, उपजीवति depends for sustenance, तेन तु as for him, दुर्जीवम् is a hard life.

105_8.shloka: यथा तु रोपितो वृक्षः पुरुषेण विवर्धितः।ह्रस्वकेण दुरारोहो रूढस्कन्धो महाद्रुमः।।2.105.8।।स यदा पुष्पितो भूत्वा फलानि न विदर्शयेत्।स तां नानुभवेत्प्रीतिं यस्य हेतोः प्ररोपितः।।2.105.9।।एषोपमा महाबाहो तमर्थं वेत्तु मर्हसि।यदि त्वमस्मान्वृषभो भर्ता भृत्यान्न शाधि हि।।2.105.10।।
105_8.translation: O mightyarmed Rama, a man plants a tree, rears it till it grows into such a large tree with a big trunk that it becomes difficult for a dwarf to climb. When the tree flowers but does not bear fruit, the man who planted it gets no pleasure out of the purpose for which the tree was planted. Being a mighty protector, do not chastise us who are yourservants. This is a simile. You may better comprehend its implications.(The meaning of the simile is that if you do not assume the throne, the desire of our father, who nurtured you right from your childhood and hoped that one day you will become king and rule the people, will be in vain.)
105_8.word_by_word: महाबाहो O mightyarmed one, वृषभः mighty, भर्ता protector, त्वम् you, भृत्यान् servants, अस्मान् us, न शाधि हि if you do not rule, पुरुषेण by a man, रोपितः planted, विवर्धितः reared, ह्रस्वकेण  by a dwarf  दुरारोहः difficult to climb, रूढस्कन्दः with a big trunk, महाद्रुमः large tree, वृक्षः tree, यदा when, पुष्पितः भूत्वा it having blossomed, फलानि fruit, यथा as, न विदर्शयेत् does not bear, यस्य हेतोः for such purpose, प्ररोपितः it has been planted, सः he, तां प्रीतिम् that pleasure, नानुभवेत् does not feel, एषा this one, उपमा simile, तम् अर्थम् its meaning, वेत्तुम् know, अर्हसि behoves you.

105_9.shloka: श्रेणयस्त्वां महाराज पश्यन्त्वग्य्राश्च सर्वशः।प्रतपन्तमिवादित्यं राज्ये स्थित मरिन्दमम्।।2.105.11।।
105_9.translation: O great king and subduer of enemies, may all the leading guilds of traders and other subjects behold you all over installed in the kingdom like the resplendent Sun.
105_9.word_by_word: महाराज O great king, राज्ये in the kingdom, स्थितम् installed, अरिन्दमम् subduer of enemies, त्वाम् you, अग्य्राः leading, श्रेणयः guilds of traders, etc, सर्वशः all over, प्रतपन्तम्  with resplendence, आदित्यम् इव like Sun, पश्यन्तु let them see.

105_10.shloka: तवानुयाने काकुत्स्थ मत्ता नर्दन्तु कुञ्जराः।अन्तःपुरगता नार्यो नन्दन्तु सुसमाहिताः।।2.105.12।।
105_10.translation: O Rama, let the elephants following you, intoxicated with ichor, be heard trumpeting. Let the women of the inner apartment rejoice with composed minds (when they hear of your return).
105_10.word_by_word: काकुत्स्थ O Kakutstha (Rama), तव your, अनुयाने following you, मत्ताः intoxicated with ichor, कुञ्जराः elephants, नर्दन्तु may trumpet, अन्तःपुरगताः of the inner apartment, नार्यः women, सुसमाहिताः with composed minds, नन्दन्तु may rejoice.

105_11.shloka: तस्य साध्वित्यमन्यन्त नागरा विविधा जनाः।भरतस्य वच श्श्रुत्वा रामं प्रत्यनुयाचतः।।2.105.13।।
105_11.translation: Hearing the words of Bharata beseeching Rama to return, various classes of people of the city of Ayodhya, in approbation exclaimed well said.
105_11.word_by_word: रामं प्रति about Rama, अनुयाचतः while beseeching, तस्य भरतस्य that Bharata's, वचः words, श्रुत्वा hearing, नागराः pertaining to the city, विविधाः various classes, जनाः people, साधु इतिas well said, अमन्यन्त exclaimed.

105_12.shloka: तमेवं दुःखितं प्रेक्ष्य विलपन्तं यशस्विनम्।रामः कृतात्मा भरतं समाश्वासयदात्मवान्।।2.105.14।।
105_12.translation: Having seen the illustrious Bharata lamenting that way, Rama, a man of firm determination and selfpossession, consoled him thus:
105_12.word_by_word: कृतात्मा man of firm determination, आत्मवान् selfpossessed, रामः Rama, एवम् in this way, विलपन्तम् lamenting, यशस्विनम् illustrious, दुःखितम् depressed, तं भरतम् that Bharata, प्रेक्ष्य seeing, समाश्वासयत् consoled him.

105_13.translation: A man is neither independent nor competent to do any act on his free will. Fate pulls him this way or the other.
105_13.word_by_word: आत्मनः by oneself, कामकारः to do at free will, नास्ति is not there, अयम् this, पुरुषः man, अनीश्वरः is not independent, कृतान्तः fate, एनम् him, इतश्च from this way, इतरतश्च or the  other way, परिकर्षति is pulled.

105_14.shloka: सर्वे क्षयान्ताः निचयाः पतनान्ता समुच्छ्रयाः।संयोगा विप्रयोगान्ता मरणान्तं च जीवितम्।।2.105.16।।
105_14.translation: All accumulations of wealth deplete at the end. Every man who attains elevated positions falls at the end. Every union culminates in separation. Every life ends in death.
105_14.word_by_word: सर्वे all, निचयाः accumulations of wealth, क्षयान्ताः deplete at the end, समुच्छ्रयाः elevated positions, पतनान्ताः degrade at the end, संयोगाः union, विप्रयोगान्ताः end in separation, जीवितम् life, मरणान्तम् has death at the end.

105_15.shloka: यथा फलानां पक्वानां नान्यत्र पतनाद्भयम्।एवं नरस्य जातस्य नान्यत्र मरणाद्भयम्।।2.105.17।।
105_15.translation: The only fear of a ripened fruit is the fear of falling down (from the tree). In the same way every man who is born has no other fear except the fear of death.
105_15.word_by_word: पक्वानाम् ripened, फलानाम् fruits, पतनात् from falling down, अन्यत्र no other, भयम् fear, यथा as how, न not, एवम् in the same way, जातस्य of one who is born, नरस्य for a man, मरणात्  more than death, अन्यत्र from any other source, भयम् fear, न not.

105_16.shloka: यथाऽगारं दृढस्थूणं जीर्णं भूत्वाऽवसीदति।तथैव सीदन्ति नरा जरामृत्युवशं गताः।।2.105.18।।
105_16.translation: Even a house constructed with sturdy pillars gets dilapidated and ultimately decays. In the same way people under the sway of old age and death are destroyed (at last).
105_16.word_by_word: दृढस्थूणम् with sturdy pillars, आगारम् house, यथा as, जीर्णं भूत्वा after getting dilapidated, अवसीदति decays, तथैव in the same way, नराः people, जरामृत्युवशंगताः under the sway of  old age and death, सीदन्ति are destroyed.

105_17.shloka: अत्येति रजनी या तु सा न प्रतिनिवर्तते।यात्येव यमुना पूर्णा समुद्रमुदकाकुलम्।।2.105.19।।
105_17.translation: A night that once passe off does not return like the waters of river Yamuna that flowinto the ocean filled with water (the water do not flow back into Yamuna).
105_17.word_by_word: या such, रजनी night, अत्येति passes off, सा that one, न प्रतिनिवर्तते does not return, पूर्णाfilled with waters, यमुना river Yamuna, उदकाकुलम् waterfilled, समुद्रम् to the ocean, यात्येव flows forever.

105_18.shloka: अहोरात्राणि गच्छन्ति सर्वेषां प्राणिनामिह।अायूंषि क्षपयन्त्याशु ग्रीष्मे जलमिवांशवः।।2.105.20।।
105_18.translation: The passing days and nights quickly decrease the life span of all living beings in this world, like sunrays drying up the water in summer.
105_18.word_by_word: इह in this world, गच्छन्ति are passing, अहोरात्राणि days and nights, ग्रीष्मे in summer, अंशवः rays of the sun, जलमिव like the water, सर्वेषाम् all, प्राणिनाम् living things', आयूंषि life span, आशु are quickly, क्षपयन्ति are decaying.

105_19.shloka: आत्मानमनुशोच त्वं किमन्यमनुशोचसि।आयुस्ते हीयते यस्य स्थितस्य च गतस्य च।।2.105.21।।
105_19.translation: Whether you are static or moving, your lifespan decreases. Therefore, you should only grieve about yourself and not for any one else.
105_19.word_by_word: स्थितस्य च whether you stand, गतस्य च or moving, यस्य whosoever, आयुः life span, हीयते decreases, आत्मानम् about you, त्वम् you, अनुशोच grieve, अन्यम् about others, किम् why, अनुशोचसि are you grieving?

105_20.translation: Death follows a man wherever he goes. When he sits, death sits with him. Even after travelling a very long distance, the man returns along with death.
105_20.word_by_word: मृत्युः death, सहैव along with you, व्रजति is moving, सह मृत्युः along with death, निषीदति a man sits, सुदीर्घम् very long, अध्वानम् way, गत्वा having gone, सहमृत्युः with death, निवर्तते is returning.

105_21.shloka: गात्रेषु वलयः प्राप्ता श्श्वेताश्चैव शिरोरुहाः।जरया पुरुषो जीर्णः किं हि कृत्वा प्रभावयेत्।।2.105.23।।
105_21.translation: Wrinkels form on the body and hair turns grey in old age. In this way, decayed with age, what can a man do to have control over death.
105_21.word_by_word: गात्रेषु in man's limbs, वलय: wrinkles, प्राप्ताः are formed, शिरोरुहाश्चैव hair also, श्वेताः becomes grey, जरया with old age, जीर्णः one decays, पुरुषः a man, किं हि what, कृत्वा having done, प्रभावयेत् can influence.

105_22.shloka: नन्दन्त्युदित आदित्ये नन्दन्त्यस्तमितेऽहनि।आत्मनो नावबुध्यन्ते मनुष्या जीवितक्षयम्।।2.105.24।।
105_22.translation: People rejoice when the Sun rises and rejoice when the Sun sets. But they are unaware of the decline of the life span of their own.
105_22.word_by_word: मनुष्याः people, आदित्ये the Sun, उदिते rises, नन्दन्ति rejoice, रवौ when the Sun, आस्तमिते sets, नन्दन्ति rejoice, आत्मनः their own, जीवितक्षयम् decline of life span, नावबुद्ध्यन्ते are not aware of.

105_23.shloka: हृष्यन्त्यृतुमुखं दृष्ट्वा नवं नवमिहागतम्।ऋतूनां परिवर्तेन प्राणिनां प्राणसङ्क्षयः।।2.105.25।।
105_23.translation: At the advent of each new season men feel delighted to see the newly blossomedflowers and fruits. But with the change of the scasons the life span also diminishes.
105_23.word_by_word: ऋतुमुखम् setting of a season, दृष्ट्वा having seen, इह now, नवं नवम् something new             (flowers and fruits), आगतम् have arrived, हृष्यन्ति feel delighted, ऋतूनाम् of seasons, परिवर्तेन by changes, प्राणिनाम् of living beings', प्राणसङ्क्षयः life span decreases.

105_24.shloka: यथा काष्ठं च काष्ठं च समेयातां महार्णवे।समेत्य च व्यपेयातां कालमासाद्य कञ्चन।।2.105.26।।एवं भार्याश्चपुत्राश्च ज्ञातयश्च धनानि च।समेत्य व्यवधावन्ति ध्रुवो ह्येषां विनाभवः।।2.105.27।।
105_24.translation: In a mighty ocean, two pieces of logs meet one another, float together and in due course get separated. In the same way wives, sons, relatives and riches remain together for some time and thereafter get separated. Their separation is certain.
105_24.word_by_word: यथा as, महार्णवे in a mighty ocean, काष्ठं च a piece of wood, काष्ठं च another piece of wood, समेयाताम् might meet, समेत्य having met, कञ्चन कालम् for a short span, आसाद्य remaining together, व्यपेयातां च get separated, एवम् in the same way, भार्याश्च wives, पुत्राश्च sons, ज्ञातयश्च relatives, धनानि च riches, समेत्य after coming together, व्यवधावन्ति get separated, एषाम् their, विनाभवः separation, ध्रुवो हि is certain.

105_25.shloka: यथा काष्ठं च काष्ठं च समेयातां महार्णवे।समेत्य च व्यपेयातां कालमासाद्य कञ्चन।।2.105.26।।एवं भार्याश्चपुत्राश्च ज्ञातयश्च धनानि च।समेत्य व्यवधावन्ति ध्रुवो ह्येषां विनाभवः।।2.105.27।।
105_25.translation: In a mighty ocean, two pieces of logs meet one another, float together and in due course get separated. In the same way wives, sons, relatives and riches remain together for some time and thereafter get separated. Their separation is certain.
