110_11.shloka: अनरण्यान्महाबाहुः पृथु राजा बभूव ह।तस्मात्पृथोमेहाराजस्त्रिशङ्कुरुदपद्यत।।2.110.11।।स सत्यवचनाद् वीर: स‌शरीरो दिवं गतः।
110_11.translation: Mightyarmed king Prithu was the son of Anaranya and Prithu was father of the great king Trishanku. That heroic Trishanku, on account of his truthfulness ascended the heaven with his physical body.
110_11.word_by_word: अनरण्यात् of Anaranya, महाबाहुः mightyarmed, पृथुः Prithu, राजा king, बभूव ह was born, तस्मात् पृथोः from that Prithu, त्रिशङ्कुः Trishanku, महाराजः great king, उदपद्यत was born, सःवीरः that heroic man, सत्यवचनात् on account of his truthfulness, सशरीरः with his physical body, दिवम् heaven, गतः ascended.

110_12.translation: Trishanku's son was illustrious Dundhumara, father of the exceedingly powerful Yuvanaswa.
110_12.word_by_word: त्रिशङ्कोः to Trishanku, महायशाः of illustrious, दुन्धुमारः Dundhumara, सूनुः as son, अभवत् became, दुन्धुमारात् from Dundhumara, महातेजाः exceedingly powerful, युवनाश्वः Yuvanaswa, व्यजायत was born.

110_13.shloka: युवनाश्वसुत श्श्रीमान्मान्धाता समपद्यत।।2.110.13।।मान्धातुस्त महातेजा: सुसन्धिरुदपद्यत।सुसन्धेरपि पुत्रौ द्वौ ध्रुवसन्धिः प्रसेनजित्।।2.110.14।।यशस्वी ध्रुवसन्धेस्तु भरतो रिपुसूदनः।
110_13.translation: Majestic Mandhata was Yuvanasva's son and father of mighty Susandhi. Sudsandhi had two sons Dhruvasandhi and Prasenjit. Renowned Bharata, slayer of enemies, was the son of Dhruvasandhi.
110_13.word_by_word: श्रीमान् majestic, मान्धाता Mandhata, युवनाश्वसुतः as Yuvanasva's son, समपद्यत was born, मन्धातुः to Mandhat, महातेजाः mighty, सुसन्धि Susandhi, उदपध्यत was born, सुसंधेरपि and to Susandhi, ध्रुवसंधिः Dhruvasandhi, प्रसेनजित् Prasenjit, द्वौ two, पुत्रौ sons, यशस्वी renowned, रिपुसूदनः slayer of enemies, भरतः Bharata ध्रुवसन्धेः born to Dhruvasandhi.

110_14.shloka: युवनाश्वसुत श्श्रीमान्मान्धाता समपद्यत।।2.110.13।।मान्धातुस्त महातेजा स्सुसन्धिरुदपद्यत।सुसन्धेरपि पुत्रौ द्वौ ध्रुवसन्धिः प्रसेनजित्।।2.110.14।।यशस्वी ध्रुवसन्धेस्तु भरतो रिपुसूदनः।
110_14.translation: Majestic Mandhata was Yuvanasva's son and father of mighty Susandhi. Sudsandhi had two sons Dhruvasandhi and Prasenjit. Renowned Bharata, slayer of enemies, was the son of Dhruvasandhi.
110_14.word_by_word: श्रीमान् majestic, मान्धाता Mandhata, युवनाश्वसुतः as Yuvanasva's son, समपद्यत was born, मन्धातुः to Mandhat, महातेजाः mighty, सुसन्धि Susandhi, उदपध्यत was born, सुसंधेरपि and to Susandhi, ध्रुवसंधिः Dhruvasandhi, प्रसेनजित् Prasenjit, द्वौ two, पुत्रौ sons, यशस्वी  renowned, रिपुसूदनः slayer of enemies, भरतः Bharata  ध्रुवसन्धेः born to Dhruvasandhi.

110_15.shloka: भरतात्तु महाबाहोरसितो नाम जायत।।2.110.15।।यस्यैते प्रतिराजान उदपद्यन्त शत्रवः।हैहयास्तालजङ्घाश्च शूराश्च शशिबिन्दवः।।2.110.16।।
110_15.translation: Mightyarmed Bharata had a son named Asita against whom the Haihayas, Talajanghas and the indomitable Sasibindus, the rival kings rose as enenmies.
110_15.word_by_word: महाबाहोः of the mightyarmed, भरतात् Bharata, असितो नाम named Asita, (अ)जायत was born, यस्य to him, हैहयाः Haihayas, तालजङ्घाश्च Talajanghas, शूराः indomitable, शशिबिन्दवश्च Sasibindus also, प्रतिराजानः rival kings, शत्रवः as enemies, उदपद्यन्त rose up.

110_16.shloka: तांस्तु सर्वान्प्रतिव्यूह्य युद्धे राजा प्रवासितः।स च शैलवरे रम्ये बभूवाभिरतो मुनिः।।2.110.17।।
110_16.translation: Although king Asita engaged all of them in a battle, he was (defeated and) driven into exile. He retired to a delightful, tall mountain and lived a life of contentment of a sage.
110_16.word_by_word: राजा the king, युद्धे in battle, तान् सर्वान् all of them, प्रतिव्यूह्य having engaged, प्रवासितः driveninto exile, सः he, रम्ये in a delightful, शैलवरे on a tall mountain, अभिरतः contented, मुनिः sage, बभूव became.

110_17.shloka: द्वे चास्य भार्ये गर्भिण्यौ बभूवतुरिति श्रुतिः।एका गर्भविनाशाय सपत्न्यै गरलं ददौ।।2.110.18।।
110_17.translation: Both his wives became pregnant. It is said that one of them gave the other poison (with the motive) to destroy the embryo.
110_17.word_by_word: अस्य his, द्वे भार्ये two wives, गर्भिण्यौ बभूवतुः became pregnant, इति like this, श्रुतिः it is said, एका one, गर्भविनाशाय to destroy the embryo, सपत्नयै to her cowife, गरलम् poison, ददौ gave.

110_18.shloka: भार्गवश्च्यवनो नाम हिमवन्तमुपाश्रितः।तमृषिं समुपागम्य कालिन्दी त्वभ्यवादयत्।।2.110.19।।स तामभ्यवदद्विप्रो वरेप्सुं पुत्रजन्मनि।
110_18.word_by_word: भार्गवः descendant of Bhrigu, च्यवनो नाम Chyavana by name, हिमवन्तम् Himavat mountain, उपाश्रितः had taken shelter, कालिन्दी Kalindi, तं ऋषिम् that rishi, समुपागम्य having approached, अभ्यवादयत् paid obeisance, सः विप्रः that brahmin, पुत्रजन्मनि for the birth of a son, वरेप्सुम् craving for a boon, ताम्  to her, अभ्यवदत् said.

110_19.shloka: पुत्रस्ते भविता देवि महात्मा लोकविश्रुतः।।2.110.20।।धार्मिकश्च सुशीलश्च वंशकर्ताऽरिसूदनः।
110_19.translation: O queen, you will beget a son who will be magnanimous, virtuous, renowned in the world. He will be the perpetuator of the race and destroyer of enemies.
110_19.word_by_word: देवि O queen, ते to you, महात्मा magnanimous, लोक विश्रुतः renowned in the world, धार्मिकश्च virtuous, सुशीलश्च of good conduct, वंशकर्ता perpetuator of the race, अरिसूदनः destroyer of enemies, पुत्र a son, भविता will be born.

110_20.shloka: कृत्वा प्रदक्षिणं हृष्टा मुनिंतमनुमान्य च।।2.110.21।।पद्मपत्रसमानाक्षं पद्मगर्भसमप्रभम्।तत: सा गृहमागम्य देवी पुत्रं व्यजायत।।2.110.22।।
110_20.translation: The queen was happy. She circumambulated the sage, took leave of him and came back home. Thereafter, she gave birth to a son who had eyes like lotus petals and wholooked resplendent like Brahma.
110_20.word_by_word: सा देवी that queen, हृष्टा delighted, तं मुनिम् to that sage, प्रदक्षिणं circumambulation, कृत्वा having made, अनुमान्य च taking leave of him, ततः then, गृहम् to home, आगम्य having returned, पद्मपत्रसमानाक्षम् with eyes like lotus petals, पद्मगर्भसमप्रभम् resplendent like Brahma, पुत्रम् son, व्यजायत gave birth.

110_21.shloka: सपत्न्या तु गरस्तस्यै दत्तो गर्भजिघांसया।गरेण सह तेनैव जात स्स सगरोऽभवत्।।2.110.23।।
110_21.translation: With a motive to destroy the embryo her cowife had poisoned her. That child was born with gara or poison for which he was called  Sagara.
110_21.word_by_word: सपत्नया by her cowife, गर्भजिघांसया with a motive to destroy the embryo, तस्यै to her, गरः poison, दत्तः given, तेन for that reason, गरेण सहैव with poison, जातः born, सः he, सगरः Sagara, अभवत् became.

110_22.shloka: स राजा सगरो नाम य: स‌मुद्रमखानयत्।इष्ट्वा पर्वणि वेगेन त्रासयन इमाः प्रजाः।।2.110.24।
110_22.translation: The king Sagara performed a sacrifice on the fullmoon day. And swiftly dug the ocean that frightened the people.
110_22.word_by_word: सः he, सगरो नाम राजा a king, Sagara by name, यः who, इष्ट्वा having performed a sacrifice, पर्वणि on a fullmoon day, वेगेन swiftly, इमाः प्रजाः these men, त्रासयन्तम् frightening, समुद्रम् the ocean, अखानयत् excavated.

110_23.shloka: असमञ्जस्तु पुत्रोऽभूत्सगरस्येति न श्श्रुतम्।जीवन्नेव स पित्रा तु निरस्तः पापकर्मकृत्।।2.110.25।।
110_23.translation: We have heard that a son, Asamanja by name, was born to Sagara. For his sinful deeds he was banished by his father while he was still alive.
110_23.word_by_word: असमञ्जः Asamanja, सगरस्य Sagara's, पुत्रः son, अभूत् became, इति thus, नः for us, श्रुतम् heard, पापकर्मकृत् one who indulged in sinful deeds, सः he, जीवन्नेव while he was living in the kingdom, पित्रा by father, निरस्तः banished.

110_24.shloka: अंशुमानिति पुत्रोऽभूदसमञ्जस्य वीर्यवान्।दिलीपोंशुमतः पुत्रो दिलीपस्य भगीरथः।।2.110.26।।
110_24.translation: Valiant Anshuman was the son of Asamanja and the father of Dilipa. Dilipa's son was Bhagiratha.
110_24.word_by_word: असमञ्जस्य Asamanja's, वीर्यवान् valiant, अंशुमानिति Anshuman by name, पुत्रः son, अभूत् was born, दिलीपः Dilipa, अंशुमतः Ansuman's, पुत्रः son, भगीरथः Bhagiratha, दिलीपस्य was son of Dilipa.

110_25.shloka: भगीरथात्ककुत्स्थस्तु काकुत्स्था येन विश्रुताः।ककुत्स्थस्य च पुत्रोऽभूद्रघुर्येन च राघवाः।।2.110.27।।
110_25.translation: To Bhagiratha was born Kakutstha, by whom your race is wellknown. A son Raghu was born to Kakutstha and hence all of you are known as Raghavas.
110_25.word_by_word: भगीरथात् from Bhagiratha, ककुत्स्थ: Kakutstha, येन by whom, काकुत्स्थाः as Kakutsthas, विश्रुताः are celebrated, ककुत्स्थस्य च to Kakutstha, रघुः Raghu, पुत्रः son, अभूत् was born, येन  by whom, राघवाः Raghavas

110_26.shloka: रघोस्तु पुत्रस्तेजस्वी प्रवृद्धः पुरुषादकः।कल्माषपाद स्सौदास इत्येवं प्रथितो भुवि।।2.110.28।।
110_26.translation: The illustrious son of Raghu became famous in the world under the names of  Kalmasapada and Sowdasa. The curse of a sage turned him a devourer of men forsome years.
110_26.word_by_word: रघोः Raghu, तेजस्वी illustrious, पुत्रः son, प्रवृद्धः has grown, पुरुषादकः Purushadaka, कल्माषपादः Kalmasapada, सौदासः Sowdasa, इत्येवम् like these, भुवि in this world, प्रथितः became famous.

110_27.translation: Shankhana was the famous son of Kalmashapada. Whoever challenged his prowess was routed  with his entire army.
110_27.word_by_word: शङ्खणः Shankhana, इति thus, विश्रुतः is famous, कल्माषपादपुत्रः as son of Kalmashapada, अभूत् became, यः whoever, तद्वीर्यम् with that prowess, आसाद्य having been target acquired, सहसैन्यः with his army, व्यनीनशत् was destroyed.

110_28.shloka: शङ्खणस्य च पुत्रोऽभूच्छूर श्रीमान्सुदर्शनः।सुदर्शनस्याग्निवर्णः अग्निवर्णस्य शीघ्रगः।।2.110.30।।शीघ्रगस्य मरुः पुत्रो मरोः पुत्रः प्रशुश्रुवः।प्रशुश्रुवस्य पुत्रोभूदम्बरीषो महाद्युतिः।।2.110.31।।अम्बरीषस्य पुत्रोभून्नहुषः सत्यविक्रमः।नहुषस्य च नाभागः पुत्रः परमधार्मिकः।।2.110.32।।अजश्च सुव्रतश्चैव नाभागस्य सुतावुभौ।अजस्यैव च धर्मात्मा राजा दशरथस्सुतः।।2.110.33।।
110_28.translation: The son of Shankhana was the glorious Sudarshana, father of Agnivarna. Shighraga was the son of Agnivarna whose son was Maru. Maru's son was Prashushruva and to Prashushruva was born splendid Ambarisha. Nahusha of indisputable prowess was the son of Ambarisha whose son was the supremely righteous Nabhaga. Nabhaga had two sons, Aja and Suvrata and Aja's son was the righteous king Dasaratha.
110_28.word_by_word: शङ्खणस्य to Shankhana, श्रीमान् glorious, सुदर्शनः Sudarshana, पुत्रः was his son, सुदर्शनस्य to Sudarshana, अग्निवर्णः Agnivarna, अग्निवर्णस्य to Agnivarna, शीघ्रगः Shighraga, शीघ्रगस्य to Shighraga, पुत्रः son, मरुः Maru, मरोः to Maru, पुत्रः son, प्रशुश्रुवः Prashushruva, प्रशुश्रुवस्य to Prashushruva, महाद्युतिः splendid, अम्बरीषः Ambarisha पुत्रः son, अभूत् was born, अम्बरीषस्य to Ambarisha, सत्यविक्रम: a man of real prowess, नहुषः Nahusha, पुत्रः son, अभूत् was born, नहुषस्य to Nahusha, परमधार्मिकः supremely righteous, नाभागः Nabhaga, पुत्रः son,नाभागस्य to Nabhaga, अजश्च Aja, सुव्रतश्चैव and Suvrata, उभौ two, सुतौ sons, धर्मात्मा rigtheous, राजा दशरथः king Dasaratha, अजस्यैव to Aja, सुतः son.

110_29.shloka: तस्य ज्येष्ठोऽसि दायादो राम इत्यभिविश्रुतः।तद्गृहाण स्वकं राज्यमवेक्षस्व जनं नृप।।2.110.34।।
110_29.translation: Being the eldest son of king Dasaratha and widely  known as Rama you happen to be the  heir apparent. Hence, O king, accept the kingdom and look after the people.
110_29.word_by_word: राम इति as Rama, अभिविश्रुतः known far and wide, तस्य that king's, दायादः an heir, ज्येष्ठः असि are the eldest son, नृपः O king, तत् for that reason, स्वकम् is your own, राज्यम् kingdom, गृहाण accept, जनम् the people, अवेक्षस्व look after.

110_30.shloka: इक्ष्वाकूणां हि सर्वेषां राजा भवति पूर्वजः।पूर्वजे नापरः पुत्रो ज्येष्ठो राज्येऽभिषिच्यते।।2.110.35।।
110_30.translation: In the line of the Ikshvakus, only the eldest son becomes king. When the eldest is living, a youger son cannot become the king. The eldest son alone is consecrated in the kingdom.
110_30.word_by_word: सर्वेषाम् for every one, इक्ष्वाकूणाम् among the Ikshvakus, पूर्वजः eldest son, राजा as king, भवति becomes, पूर्वजे when the eldest is there, अपरः younger one, न not, ज्येष्ठः पुत्रः the eldest son, राज्ये in the kingdom, अभिषिच्यते is consecrated.

110_31.shloka: स राघवाणां कुलधर्ममात्मनः  सनातनं नाद्य विहन्तुमर्हसि।प्रभूतरत्नामनुशाधि मेदिनीं प्रभूतराष्ट्रां पितृवन्महायशः।।2.110.36।।
110_31.translation: O illustrious Rama, now it does not behove you to abandon the ancient family tradition of the  Raghus. Like your father rule this vast kingdom with abundance of treasures.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे दशोत्तरशततमस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the hundredtenth sarga in Ayodhyakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
110_31.word_by_word: महायशः O illustrious Rama, सः that you, आत्मनः your, राघवाणाम् in house of Raghus, सनातनम् eternal, कुलधर्मम् family tradition, अद्य today, विहन्तुम् to abandon, नार्हसि does notbehove you, प्रभूतरत्नाम् with abundance of treasures, प्रभूतराष्ट्राम् vast kingdom, मेदिनीम्  the earth, पितृवत् like your father, अनुशाधि rule.

111_1.shloka: [Vasistha explains the value of conforming to righteousness -- pleads with Rama to grant the wishes of Bharata and respect  his request -- Rama declines.]वसिष्ठस्तु तदा राममुक्त्वा राजपुरोहितः।अब्रवीद्धर्मसंयुक्तं पुनरेवापरं वचः।।2.111.1।।
111_1.translation: Vasistha, the family priest, continued to speak to Rama on righteousness.
111_1.word_by_word: राजपुरोहितः  royal priest, वसिष्टस्तु Vasistha on his part, तदा then, रामम् to Rama, उक्त्वा  spoke further, पुनरेव again, धर्मसंयुक्तम् on righteousness, अपरं वचः some otherword, अब्रवीत् said.

111_2.shloka: पुरुषस्येह जातस्य भवन्ति गुरवस्त्रयः।आचार्यश्चैव काकुत्स्थ पिता माता च राघव।।2.111.2।।
111_2.translation: Every man born has three preceptors. They are his teacher, father and mother.
111_2.word_by_word: काकुत्स्थ O Kakutstha, राघव Rama, जातस्य of one who is born, पुरुषस्य for a person, आचार्यश्चैव the preceptor, पिता the father, माता च the mother, त्रयः three, गुरवः भवन्ति   become gurus.

111_3.shloka: पिता ह्येवं जनयति पुरुषं पुरुषर्षभ।प्रज्ञां ददाति चाचार्यस्तस्मात्स गुरुरुच्यते।।2.111.3।।
111_3.translation: O best of men, the father brings forth a son. The teacher imparts him wisdom.Therefore, the teacher is considered superior.
111_3.word_by_word: पुरुषर्षभ O best of men, एवं पुरुषम् in such a way a man, पिता father, जनयति हि begets, आचार्यः teacher, प्रज्ञाम् wisdom, ददाति gives, तस्मात् therefore, सः that (teacher), गुरुः     become guru, उच्यते is called.

111_4.shloka: सोऽहं ते पितुराचार्यस्तव चैव परन्तप।मम त्वं वचनं कुर्वन्नातिवर्तेस्सतां गतिम्।।2.111.4।।
111_4.translation: I was preceptor to your father and also to you. O destroyer of foes, by following my words, you will not transgress the path of the virtuous.
111_4.word_by_word: सः अहम् that I, ते पितुः of your father, तव चैव and also your, आचार्यः preceptor, परन्तप O destroyer of foes, त्वम् you, मम my, वचनम् order, कुर्वन् carrying out, सताम् of virtuous men's, गतिम् path, नातिवर्तेः you will not transgress.

111_5.shloka: इमा हि ते परिषद श्श्रेणयश्च द्विजास्तथा।एषु तात चरन्धर्मं नातिवर्ते: स‌तां गतिम्।।2.111.5।।
111_5.translation: All these learned men, guilds of merchants and the twiceborn (brahmins) of this assembly are your men. By fulfilling your duty towards them, you will never swervefrom the path of the virtuous.
111_5.word_by_word: तात my child, इमाः these, परिषदः assembly of men, श्रेणयश्च guilds of merchants and others, तथा also, द्विजाः the twiceborn, ते हि are yours, एषु towards them, धर्मम् duty, चरन् while practising, सताम् of the virtuous, गतिम् path, नातिवर्तेः you will never swerve.

111_6.shloka: वृद्धाया धर्मशीलाया मातुर्नार्हस्यवर्तितुम्।अस्या हि वचनं कुर्वन्नातिवर्तेस्सतां गतिम्।।2.111.6।।
111_6.translation: Here is your aged and righteous mother. It does not behove you to deny your service to her. By obeying her, you will never deviate from the path of the virtuous.
111_6.word_by_word: वृद्धायाः of an aged woman, धर्मशीलायाः of a righteousminded woman, मातुः of the mother, अवर्तितुम् not to attend her, नार्हसि is not proper, अस्याः her, वचनम् words, कुर्वन् obeying, सताम् of the virtuous, गतिम् path, नातिवर्तेः you will not deviate.

111_7.shloka: भरतस्य वचः कुर्वन्याचमानस्य राघव।आत्मानं नातिवर्तेस्त्वं सत्यधर्मपराक्रम।।2.111.7।।
111_7.translation: O scion of the Raghus whose strength springs from truth and righteousness, if you accede to the prayers of Bharata, you will not ignore the call of your soul.
111_7.word_by_word: सत्यधर्मपराक्रम one whose strength comes from truth and righteousness, राघव Rama, त्वम् you, याचमानस्य of the supplicant, भरतस्य Bharata's, वचः words, कुर्वन् by following, आत्मानम् call of your soul, नातिवर्तेः will not ignore.

111_8.shloka: एवं मधुरमुक्तस्सन् गुरुणा राघवस्स्वयम्।प्रत्युवाच समासीनं वसिष्ठं पुरुषर्षभः।।2.111.8।।
111_8.translation: When Rama, the best of men, was advised personally by Vasistha, the preceptor, with sweet words, he replied to him who was sitting beside him:
111_8.word_by_word: पुरुषर्षभः the best of men, राघवः Rama, गुरुणा by the preceptor, स्वयम् personally, एवम् in that way, मधुरम् with sweet words, उक्तस्सन् by having been addressed, समासीनम् who was sitting beside, वसिष्ठम्  to Vasistha, प्रत्युवाच replied.

111_9.shloka: यन्मातापितरौ वृत्तं तनये कुरुत: स‌दा।न सुप्रतिकरं तत् तु मात्रा पित्रा च यत्कृतम्।।2.111.9।।यथाशक्ति प्रदानेन स्वापनोच्छादनेन च।नित्यं च प्रियवादेन तथा संवर्धनेन च।।2.111.10।।
111_9.translation: The course of action the parents always adopt in respect of their son, the benefits they confer on him according to their resources, the way they lull him to sleep and clothe him, the affectionate words they always speak to him and the way they bring him up all these cannot be repaid.
111_9.word_by_word: मातापितरौ parents, तनये in relation to son, सदा always, यत् what, वृत्तम् course of action, कुरुतः perform, यथाशक्तिप्रदानेन by conferring benefits according to their resources, स्वापनोच्छादनेन च by lulling him to sleep, clothing him, नित्यं च always, प्रियवादेन with affectionate words, तथा similarly, संवर्धनेन च bringing him up, मात्रा by mother, पित्रा च andby father, यत् what, कृतम् was done, तत्तु all that, न सुप्रतिकरम् cannot easily be repaid.

111_10.shloka: यन्मातापितरौ वृत्तं तनये कुरुतस्सदा।न सुप्रतिकरं तत्तु मात्रा पित्रा च यत्कृतम्।।2.111.9।।यथाशक्तिप्रदानेन स्वापनोच्छादनेन च।नित्यं च प्रियवादेन तथा संवर्धनेन च।।2.111.10।।
111_10.translation: The course of action the parents always adopt in respect of their son, the benefits they confer on him according to their resources, the way they lull him to sleep and clothe him, the affectionate words they always speak to him and the way they bring him up all these cannot be repaid.
111_10.word_by_word: मातापितरौ parents, तनये in relation to son, सदा always, यत् what, वृत्तम् course of action, कुरुतः perform, यथाशक्तिप्रदानेन by conferring benefits according to their resources, स्वापनोच्छादनेन च by lulling him to sleep, clothing him, नित्यं च always, प्रियवादेन with affectionate words, तथा similarly, संवर्धनेन च bringing him up, मात्रा by mother, पित्रा च andby father, यत् what, कृतम् was done, तत्तु all that, न सुप्रतिकरम् cannot easily be repaid.

111_11.shloka: स हि राजा जनयिता पिता दशरथो मम।आज्ञातं यन्मया तस्य न तन्मिथ्या भविष्यति।।2.111.11।।
111_11.translation: King Dasaratha is my father who begot me. The promise I made him shall not prove false.
111_11.word_by_word: मम my, पिता father, सः that, राजा दशरथः king Dasaratha, जनयिता हि he begot me, मया by me, तस्य to him, यत् whatever, आज्ञातं was promised, तत् that one, मिथ्या false, न भविष्यति shall not become.

111_12.shloka: एवमुक्तस्तु रामेण भरतः प्रत्यनन्तरम्।उवाच परमोदारस्सूतं परमदुर्मनाः।।2.111.12।।
111_12.translation: Having been addressed by Rama in this way, Bharata of great generosity, in extreme distress, addressing the charioteer who was standing nearby said:
111_12.word_by_word: परमोदारः a man of great generosity, भरतः Bharata, रामेण by Rama, एवम् in this way, उक्तःhaving been addressed, परमदुर्मनाः with extremely distressed mind, प्रत्यनन्तरं who was  nearby, सूतम् to the charioteer, उवाच said.

111_13.shloka: इह मे स्थण्डिले शीघ्रं कुशानास्तर सारथे।आर्यं प्रत्युपवेक्ष्यामि यावन्मे न प्रसीदति।।2.111.13।।
111_13.translation: O charioteer, quickly spread kusa grass on the bare ground. Until my esteemed brother shows his grace, I shall lie down here -- waiting.
111_13.word_by_word: सारथे O charioteer, मे to me, इह here, स्थण्डिले on the bare ground, शीघ्रम् quickly, कुशान् kusa grass, आस्तर spread, यावत् till such time, मे to me, न प्रसीदति does not show hisgrace, आर्यम् esteemed brother Rama, प्रत्युपवेक्ष्यामि shall lie down here waiting for him.

111_14.shloka: अनाहारो निरालोको धनहीनो यथा द्विजः।शेष्ये पुरस्ताच्छालाया यावन्न प्रतियास्यति।।2.111.14।।
111_14.translation: Like a poor brahmin, starving, my face muffled, I shall lie down in front of the hut until he agrees to return.
111_14.word_by_word: धनहीन: poor, द्विजः यथा like a brahmin, अनाहारः starve, निरालोकः  without seeing the light (of the day), शालायाः of the hut, पुरस्तात् in front of, यावत् till such time, न प्रतियास्यति does not return, शेष्ये I shall lie down.

111_15.shloka: स तु राममवेक्षन्तं सुमन्त्रं पेक्ष्य दुर्मनाः।कुशोत्तरमुपस्थाप्य भूमावेवाऽस्तरत्स्वयम्।।2.111.15।।
111_15.translation: Bharata was mentally disturbed saw Sumantra waiting for Rama's order. Then he himself brought a heap of kusa grass and spread it on the ground.
111_15.word_by_word: दुर्मनाः of troubled mind, स तु that Bharata, रामम् at Rama, अवेक्षन्तम् glancing at, सुमन्त्रम् Sumantra, प्रेक्ष्य seeing, स्वयमेव himself, कुशोत्तरम् of kusa grass, उपस्थाप्य having brought, भूमौ on the ground, आस्तरत् spread.

111_16.shloka: तमुवाच महातेजा रामो राजर्षिसत्तमः।किं मां भरत कुर्वाणं तात प्रत्युपवेक्ष्यसि।।2.111.16।।
111_16.translation: Rama, the foremost of royal sages and highly powerful said, 'Dear Bharata, what wrong have I done that you should prevent me by lying down in front of me?'
111_16.word_by_word: महातेजाः highly powerful, राजर्षिसत्तमः the foremost of royal sages, रामः Rama, तम् to him (Bharata), उवाच said, तातः O dear one, भरत Bharata, किं कुर्वाणम् what have I done, माम्  before me, प्रत्युपवेक्ष्यसि preventing me by lying down?

111_17.shloka: ब्राह्मणो ह्येकपार्श्वेन नरान्रोद्धुमिहार्हति।न तु मूर्धाभिषिक्तानां विधिः प्रत्युपवेशने।।2.111.17।।
111_17.translation: A brahmin alone is competent in this world to prevent a person by lying down on one side (in front of him). One who is anointed king is not permitted by (scriptural) tradition to squat in protest.
111_17.word_by_word: ब्राह्मणः brahmin, एकपार्श्वेन (lying down) on one side, नरान् to men, इह in this world, रोद्धुम् to prevent, अर्हति हि is competent, मूर्धाभिषिक्तानां तु for one who is anointed king, प्रत्युपवेशने  to sit in protest, विधिः न there is no tradition.

111_18.shloka: उत्तिष्ठ नरशार्दूल हित्वैतद्दारुणं व्रतम्।पुरवर्यामितः क्षिप्रमयोध्यां याहि राघव।।2.111.18।।
111_18.translation: O Bharata, O tiger among men, O scion of the Raghu race give up this formidable vow. Arise and quickly return to Ayodhya, the best of cities.
111_18.word_by_word: नरशार्दूल O best of men, राघव Bharata, एतत् all this, दारुणम् formidable, व्रतम् resolve, हित्वाgive up, उत्तिष्ठ arise, इतः from here, क्षिप्रम् quickly, पुरवर्याम् to the best of cities, अयोध्याम् Ayodhya, याहि you may return.

111_19.shloka: आसीनस्त्वेव भरतः पौरजानपदं जनम्।उवाच सर्वतः प्रेक्ष्य किमार्यं नानुशासथ।।2.111.19।।
111_19.translation: While remaining seated, Bharata looking all around at the inhabitants from towns andvillages, questioned them 'why don't you all persuade my esteemed brother to return'.
111_19.word_by_word: भरतः Bharata, आसीनस्त्वेव while remaining seated, पौरजानपदम् men inhabiting towns and villages, जनम् men, सर्वतः on all sides, प्रेक्ष्य looking, आर्यम् esteemed brother, किम् why, नानुशासथ don't you all persuade, उवाच said.

111_20.shloka: ते तदोचुर्महात्मानं पौरजानपदा जनाः।काकुत्स्थमभिजानीमः सम्यग् वदति राघवः।।2.111.20।।
111_20.translation: Those inhabitants from towns and villages replied to the magnanimous Bharata 'we  know the scion of the Kakutha dynasty, Rama, very well. What he has said is proper'.
111_20.word_by_word: पौरजानपदाः inhabiting in towns and villages, ते जनाः those people, महात्मानम्  magnanimous, तम् to Bharata, ऊचुः uttered, काकुत्स्थम् about Kakustha (Rama), अभिजानीयः we know very well, राघवः Rama, सम्यक् properly, वदति  says.

111_21.shloka: एषोऽपि हि महाभागः पितुर्वचसि तिष्ठति।अत एव न शक्ताः स्मो व्यावर्तयितुमञ्जसा।।2.111.21।।
111_21.translation: Highly distinguished Rama is firmly fixed on the command of his father. That is why we are incapable of making him return quickly.
111_21.word_by_word: एषः this, महाभागः highly distinguished Rama, पितुः father's, वचसि word, तिष्ठति हि is fixed, अत एव that is why, अञ्जसा quickly, व्यावर्तयितुम् to make him return, शक्ताः capable, न स्मः not.

111_22.shloka: तेषामाज्ञाय वचनं रामो वचनमब्रवीत्।एवं निबोध वचनं सुहृदां धर्मचक्षुषाम्।।2.111.22।।
111_22.translation: Having understood their words, Rama said to him, 'Listen to the words of our friends who have a righteous vision.'
111_22.word_by_word: रामः Rama, तेषाम् their, वचनम् words, आज्ञाय having understood, वचनम् words, अब्रवीत् said, धर्मचक्षुषाम् through righteous vision, सुहृदाम् friends, एवम् in this way, वचनम् words, निबोध  understand.

111_23.shloka: एतच्चैवोभयं श्रुत्वा सम्यक्सम्पश्य राघव।उत्तिष्ठ त्वं महाबाहो मां च स्पृश तथोदकम्।।2.111.23।।
111_23.translation: O mightyarmed son of the Raghus, you have heard both (them and me). Carefully think over. Arise. Touch me and sip water.
111_23.word_by_word: महाबाहो O mightyarmed one, राघव Bharata, एतत् all this, उभयं चैव both, श्रुत्वा having heard, सम्यक् carefully, सम्पश्य having thought over, त्वम् you, उत्तिष्ठ arise, मां च me, तथा as also, उदकम् water, स्पृश touch.

111_24.shloka: अथोत्थाय जलंस्पृष्ट्वा भरतो वाक्यमब्रवीत्।श्रुण्वन्तु मे परिषदो मन्त्रिण श्श्रेणयस्तथा।।2.111.24।।
111_24.translation: Then Bharata stood up and performed achamana (sipping of water) and said 'let theassembly of  learned men, counsellors and guildsmen hear me'.
111_24.word_by_word: अथ then, भरतः Bharata, उत्थाय having stood up, जलम् water, स्पृष्ट्वा having touched, वाक्यम् these words, अब्रवीत् said, परिषदः O men of the assembly, मन्त्रिणः O counsellors, तथा also, श्रेणयः O guildsmen, मे me, श्रुण्वन्तु listen.

111_25.shloka: न याचे पितरं राज्यं नानुशासामि मातरम्।आर्यं परमधर्मज्ञं नानुजानामि राघवम्।।2.111.25।।
111_25.translation: I never asked my father to confer the kingdom on me. I never urged my mother to seek the kingdom for me. I never supported the exile of my esteemed brother Rama, who is supreme in the knowleldge of righteousness.
111_25.word_by_word: पितरम् my father, राज्यम् kingdom, न याचे did not ask, मातरम् mother, नानुशासामि did not urge, परमधर्मज्ञम् supremely knowleldgeable in ways of righteousness, आर्यम् esteemed, राघवम् Rama, नानुजानामि I did not consent.

111_26.shloka: यदित्ववश्यं वस्तव्यं कर्तव्यं च पितुर्वचः।अहमेव निवत्स्यामि चतुर्दश समा वने।।2.111.26।।
111_26.translation: If it is absolutely essential to live in the forest in accordance with the command of my father, I myself  shall also dwell in the forest for fourteen years.
111_26.word_by_word: अवश्यम् absolutely, वस्तव्यं यदि if it is essential to live in the forest, पितुः father's, वचः words, कर्तव्यं च must be done, अहमेव I myself, चतुर्दश समाः fourteen years, वने in the forest, निवत्स्यामि I will reside.

111_27.shloka: धर्मात्मा तस्य तथ्येन भ्रातुर्वाक्येन विस्मितः।उवाच राम स्सम्प्रेक्ष्य पौरजानपदं जनम्।।2.111.27।।
111_27.translation: On hearing the genuine sentiments of his brother, righteous Rama was astonished. He said to the inhabitants from towns and villages:
111_27.word_by_word: धर्मात्मा righteous, रामः Rama, तस्य his, भ्रातुः brother's, तथ्येन genuine, वाक्येन with words, विस्मितः was astonished, पौरजानपदम् inhabiting the towns and villages, जनम् people, सम्प्रेक्ष seeing, उवाच said.

111_28.shloka: विक्रीतमाहितं क्रीतं यत्पित्रा जीवता मम।न तल्लोपयितुं शक्यं मया वा भरतेन वा।।2.111.28।।
111_28.translation: Neither Bharata nor I can in any way annul anything which was sold, pledged or bought by my father during his lifetime.
111_28.word_by_word: मम my, जीवता while living, पित्रा by father, यत् what, विक्रीतम् was sold, आहितम् pledged, क्रीतम् bought, तत् that, लोपयितुं to annul, मया वा by me or, भरतेन वा or Bharata, न शक्यम् not possible.

111_29.shloka: उपधिर्न मया कार्यो वनवासे जुगुप्सितः।युक्तमुक्तं च कैकेय्या पित्रा मे सुकृतं कृतम्।।2.111.29।।
111_29.translation: As far as living in the forest is concerned it is reprehensible to keep a subsitute for me and it shall not be done. Kaikeyi has acted rightfully and my father has taken the proper decision.
111_29.word_by_word: मया by me, वनवासे in the matter of living in the forest, जुगुप्सितः reprehensible, उपधिः placing a substitute, न कार्यः shall not be done, कैकेय्या by Kaikeyi, युक्तम् rightly, उक्तम् spoken, मे पित्रा by my father, सुकृतम् good deed, कृतम् has been done.

111_30.shloka: जानामि भरतं क्षान्तं गुरुसत्कारकारिणम्।सर्वमेवात्र कल्याणं सत्यसन्धे महात्मनि।।2.111.30।।
111_30.translation: I know Bharata as a man of forbearance and one who honours elders. Everything will turn out well for this great soul wedded to truth.
111_30.word_by_word: भरतम् Bharata, क्षान्तम् a man of forbearance, गुरुसत्कारकारिणम् honours elders, जानामि I know, सत्यसन्धे true to his word, महात्मनि great, अत्र for him, सर्वमेव everything, कल्याणम् will be auspicious.

111_31.shloka: अनेन धर्मशीलेन वनात्प्रत्यागतः पुनः।भ्रात्रा सह भविष्यामि पृथिव्याः पतिरुत्तमः।।2.111.31।।
111_31.translation: On returning from the forest, I shall become the supreme lord of this earth along with this virtuous brother.
111_31.word_by_word: वनात् from the forest, पुनः again, प्रत्यागतः when returned, धर्मशीलेन of virtuous conduct, अनेन भ्रात्रा सह along with this brother, पृथिव्याः of the earth, उत्तमः supreme, पतिः lord, भविष्यामि I shall become.

111_32.shloka: वृतो हि राजा कैकेय्या मया तद्वचनं कृतम्।अनृतान्मोचयानेन पितरं तं महीपतिम्।।2.111.32।।
111_32.translation: The king (Dasaratha) was solicited by Kaikeyi and I shall abide. Therefore, you also release the lord of the earth, our father from the charge of falsehood.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे एकादशोत्तरशततमस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the hundredeleventh sarga in Ayodhyakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
111_32.word_by_word: राजा the king (Dasaratha), कैकेय्या by Kaikeyi, वृतो हि has been solicited, मया by me, तद्वचनं those words, कृतम् are followed, अनेन for that reason, महीपतिम् the lord of the earth, तं पितरम् that father, अनृतात् from falsehood, मोचय you may release.

112_1.shloka: [Sages praise Rama and Bharata for their virtues -- Bharata proclaims to stay outside Ayodhya and rule under the security of Rama's sandals.]तमप्रतिमतेजोभ्यां भ्रातृभ्यां रोमहर्षणम्।विस्मिता: स‌ङ्गमं प्रेक्ष्य समवेता महर्षयः।।2.112.1।।
112_1.translation: The great sages assembled there were amazed at witnessing the meeting of the two brothers (Rama and Bharata) of umparalleled briliance.
112_1.word_by_word: समवेताः those who had assembled, महर्षयः the great sages, अप्रतिमतेजोभ्यां of both men of unparalleled brilliance, भ्रातृभ्याम् of brothers (Rama and Bharata), तम् that, रोमहर्षणम् thrilled, सङ्गमम् their meeting, प्रेक्ष्य witnessing, विस्मिताः were amazed.

112_2.shloka: अन्तर्हिता मुनिगणास्सिद्धाश्च परमर्षयः।तौ भ्रातरौ महात्मानौ काकुत्स्थौ प्रशशंसिरे।।2.112.2।।
112_2.translation: The hosts of sages, siddhas and devarshis watching invisible the two Kakutstha  brothers extoled them.
112_2.word_by_word: अन्तर्हिताः remaining invisible, मुनिगणाः hosts of sages, सिद्धाश्च siddhas, परमर्षय: devarshis,  महात्मानौ magnanimous, भ्रातरौ brothers, तौ those two, काकुत्स्थौ Kakutsthas, प्रशशंसिरे lauded.

112_3.shloka: स धन्यो यस्य पुत्रौ द्वौ धर्मज्ञौ धर्मविक्रमौ।श्रुत्वा वयं हि सम्भाषामुभयोस्स्पृहयामहे।।2.112.3।।
112_3.translation: On hearing their dialogue we are deeply drawn towards them, these two sons of king Dasaratha who was fortunate to have these practioners of righteousness and whose strength is dharma.
112_3.word_by_word: धर्मज्ञौ practioners of righteousness, धर्मविक्रमौ whose strength is righteousness, द्वौ both, यस्य whose, पुत्रौ two sons, सः he (Dasaratha), धन्यः is fortunate, वयम् we, संभाषाम् their conversation, श्रुत्वा having heard, उभयोः in respect of both of them, स्पृहयामहे हि we areattached.

112_4.shloka: ततस्त्वृषिगणाः क्षिप्रं दशग्रीववधैषिणः।भरतं राजशार्दूलमित्यूचु: स‌ङ्गता वचः।।2.112.4।।
112_4.translation: Thereafter hosts of rishis desiring the speedy destruction of tenheaded Ravana said these words to Bharata, the best of kings.
112_4.word_by_word: ततः thereafter, क्षिप्रम् quickly, दशग्रीववधैषिणः men desiring the destruction of tenheaded Ravana, ऋषिगणाः hosts of rishis, राजशार्दूलम् best of kings, भरतम् Bharata, इति thus, वचः words, ऊचुः uttered.

112_5.shloka: कुले जात महाप्राज्ञ महावृत्त महायशः।ग्राह्यं रामस्य वाक्यं ते पितरं यद्यवेक्षसे।।2.112.5।।
112_5.translation: O Bharata, born in an illustrious race, highly sagacious and a man of virtuous conduct and great renown, accept Rama's proposal if you have any regard for your father.
112_5.word_by_word: कुले जात O born in an illustrious race, महाप्राज्ञ O highly sagacious one, महावृत्त of virtuous conduct, महायशः O man of great renown, ते your, पितरम् father, अवेक्षसे यदि if you look at your father, रामस्य Rama's, वाक्यम् words, ग्राह्यम् have to be accepted.

112_6.shloka: सदाऽनृणमिमं रामं वयमिच्छामहे पितुः।आनृणत्वाच्च कैकेय्या: स्वर्गम् दशरथो गतः।।2.112.6।।
112_6.translation: We always desire that Rama should discharge his debt to his father. Dasaratha, who by redeeming himself of his obligation to Kaikeyi, had ascended heaven.
112_6.word_by_word: वयम् we, इमं रामम् this Rama, सदा always, पितुः as regards his father, अनृणम् free from debt, इच्छामहे we desire, दशरथः Dasaratha, कैकेय्याः to Kaikeyi, अनृणत्वाच्च by discharginghis obligation, स्वर्गम् heaven, गतः ascended.

112_7.shloka: एतावदुक्त्वा वचनं गन्धर्वा: स‌महर्षयः।राजर्षयश्चैव तदा सर्वे स्वां स्वां गतिं गताः।।2.112.7।।
112_7.translation: Then the great rishis, gandharvas and royal sages having said this, returned to their respective abodes.
112_7.word_by_word: तदा then, समहर्षयः with great rishis, गन्धर्वाः gandharvas, राजर्षयश्चैव and royal sages, एतावत्upto this extent, वचनम् word, उक्त्वा having spoken, सर्वे all, स्वां स्वाम् to their respective, गतिम् abode, गताः went.

112_8.translation: Of pleasing appearance, Rama, gladdened by the auspicious statements (of the sages),  paid them homage with a cheerful countenance.
112_8.word_by_word: शुभदर्शनः of auspicious appearance, रामः Rama, शुभेन by the auspicious, तेन वाक्येन by that statement, ह्लादितः was gladdened, संहृष्टवदनः with delightful countenance, तान् ऋषीन् those rishis, अभ्यपूजयत् paid homage.

112_9.shloka: त्रस्तगात्रस्तु भरतस्स वाचा सज्जमानया।कृताञ्जलिरिदं वाक्यं राघवं पुनरब्रवीत्।।2.112.9।।
112_9.translation: Before Bharata, with his limbs trembling and with palms folded (in reverence) was   ready to depart, he said to Rama:
112_9.word_by_word: सः भरतत्तु as for Bharata, त्रस्तगात्रः limbs trembling, कृताञ्जलिः with palms folded (in reverence), सज्जमानया got ready, वाचा words, पुनः again, राघवम् to Rama, इदं वाक्यम् these word, अब्रवीत् said.

112_10.shloka: राजधर्ममनुप्रेक्ष्य कुलधर्मानुसन्ततिम्।कर्तुमर्हसि काकुत्स्थ मम मातुश्च याचनाम्।।2.112.10।।
112_10.translation: O Rama, keeping in view the code of kings and tradition of our family, it behoves you to consider my supplication and that of my mother.
112_10.word_by_word: काकुत्स्थ O Kakutstha, राजधर्मम् code of kings, कुलधर्मानुसन्ततिम् to abide by the traditional code of our family, अनुप्रेक्ष्य having considered, मम my, मातुश्च also mother's, याचनाम् supplication, कर्तुम् to do, अर्हसि behoves you.

112_11.translation: I do not venture to protect this kingdom all by myself and keep the inhabitants of the towns and villages who are loyal to you pleased.
112_11.word_by_word: अहम् I, एकस्तु am alone, सुमहत् this vast, राज्यम् kingdom, रक्षितुम् to protect, रक्तान् loyal पौरजानपदान् inhabitants of the town and villages, रञ्जयितुम् to please, नोत्सहे I do not venture.

112_12.shloka: ज्ञातयश्च हि योधाश्च मित्राणि सुहृदश्च नः।त्वामेव प्रतिवीक्षन्ते पर्जन्यमिव कर्षकाः।।2.112.12।।
112_12.translation: All our relatives, warriors, friends and wellwishers long to see you like farmers yearn for the raincloud.
112_12.word_by_word: नः our, ज्ञातयश्च relatives, योधाश्च warriors, मित्राणि friends, सुहृदश्च wellwishers, त्वामेव you alone, कर्षकाः farmers, पर्जन्यमिव like rainbearing cloud, प्रतिवीक्षन्ते are longing.

112_13.shloka: इदं राज्यं महाप्राज्ञ स्थापय प्रतिपद्य हि।शक्तिमानसि काकुत्स्थ लोकस्य परिपालने।।2.112.13।।
112_13.translation: O sagacious Rama, accept this kingdom and ensure its stability. You are powerful enough to govern this world. So accept this kingdom and restore its stability.
112_13.word_by_word: महाप्राज्ञ O sagacious one, इदं राज्यम् this kingdom, प्रतिपद्य after accepting, स्थापय establish, काकुत्स्थ Kakutstha, लोकस्य this world's, परिपालने in governance, शक्तिमान् असि  you are powerful.

112_14.shloka: इत्युक्त्वा न्यपतद्भ्रातुः पादयोर्भरतस्तदा।भृशं सम्प्रार्थयामास राममेव प्रियंवदः।।2.112.14।।
112_14.translation: Having said this, Bharata, fell at the feet of his brother, and speaking sweetly, he profusely  entreated  Rama.
112_14.word_by_word: भरतः Bharata, तदा then, इति thus, उक्त्वा having said, भ्रातुः brother's, पादयोः at the feet, न्यपतत् fell, प्रियंवदः one who speaks sweetly, Bharata, रामम् एव Rama alone, भृशम्  profusely, सम्प्रार्थयामास entreated him.

112_15.shloka: तमङ्के भरतं कृत्वा रामो वचनमब्रवीत्।श्यामं नलिनपत्राक्षं मत्तहंसस्वरं स्वयम्।।2.112.15।।
112_15.translation: Rama took his in his arms Bharata who had a darkblue complexion, whose eyes were like petals of lotus and whose voice was the voice of an amorous swan.
112_15.word_by_word: रामः Rama, श्यामम् dark complexioned, नलिनपत्राक्षम् man with eyes like lotus petals, मत्तहंस स्वरम् voice of  an amorous swan, तं भरतम् to that Bharata, स्वयम् personally, अङ्के into his lap, कृत्वा drawing, वचनम् these words, अब्रवीत् said.

112_16.shloka: आगता त्वामियं बुद्धिस्स्वजा वैनयिकी च या।भृशमुत्सहसे तात रक्षितुं पृथिवीमपि।।2.112.16।।
112_16.translation: O child, this wisdom of yours is both inborn and imbibed through training. With this,you are perfectly capable of protecting the earth.
112_16.word_by_word: तातः O child, स्वजा innate, वैनयिकी च though training (received from a preceptor), या बुद्धि: such wisdom, त्वाम् you, आगता reached, पृथिवीम् to the earth, रक्षितुम् अपि even to protect, भृशम् perfectly, उत्सहसे you are capable.

112_17.shloka: अमात्यैश्च सुहृद्भिश्च बुद्धिमद्भिश्च मन्त्रिभिः।सर्वकार्याणि सम्मन्त्र्य सुमहन्त्यपि कारय।।2.112.17।।
112_17.translation: After due consultation with ministers, friends, counsellors and prudent persons,   accomplish all tasks, however formidable they may appear.
112_17.word_by_word: अमात्यैश्च with ministers, सुहृद्भिश्च with friends, बुद्धिमद्भि: with the prudent, मन्त्रिभिश्च   with the counsellors, सम्मन्त्र्य consulting, सुमहन्त्यपि however great they might appear, सर्वकार्याणि all endeavours, कारय you may get them done.

112_18.shloka: लक्ष्मीश्चन्द्रादपेयाद्वा हिमवान्वा हिमं त्यजेत्।अतीयात्सागरो वेलां न प्रतिज्ञामहं पितुः।।2.112.18।।
112_18.translation: The Moon might lose its splendour, snow might abandon the Himavat mountain, the ocean might overstep its shores, but I shall not forsake the promise made to my father.
112_18.word_by_word: चन्द्रात् from the Moon, लक्ष्मीः splendour, अपेयाद्वा might withdraw, हिमवान् Himavat mountain, हिमम् snow, त्यजेद्वा might abandon, सागरः ocean, वेलाम् its shores, अतीयात् might overstep, अहम् I, पितुः to father, प्रतिज्ञाम् promise, न shall not forsake.

112_19.shloka: कामाद्वा तात लोभाद्वा मात्रातुभ्यमिदं कृतम्।न तन्मनसि कर्तव्यं वर्तितव्यं च मातृवत्।।2.112.19।।
112_19.translation: Dear brother, whether out of affection or greed, your mother has done this for yoursake. It should not agitate your mind. You should conduct yourself as one should towards one's mother.
112_19.word_by_word: तात child, कामाद्वा either out of affection, लोभाद्वा or out of covetousness, मात्रा by your  mother, तुभ्यम् for your sake, इदम् this, कृतम् was done, तत् that, मनसि in your mind, न कर्तव्यम् should not be taken seriously, मातृवत् as to one's own mother, वर्तिव्यम् you should conduct.

112_20.translation: On hearing this, Bharata replied to the son of  Kausalya who looked like the Sun or the new Moon in brilliance:
112_20.word_by_word: भरतः Bharata, एवम् in this way, ब्रुवाणम् speaking, तेजसा in brilliance, आदित्यसङ्काशम्  resembling  the Sun, प्रतिपच्चन्द्रदर्शनम् appearance like the new Moon, कौसल्यासुतम् to the son of Kausalya, अब्रवीत् said.

112_21.shloka: आधिरोहाऽर्य पादाभ्यां पादुके हेमभूषिते।एतेहि सर्वलोकस्य योगक्षेमं विधास्यतः।।2.112.21।।
112_21.translation: O noble one, place your feet on these sandals decorated with gold. They will secure the prosperity and safety of the entire world.
112_21.word_by_word: आर्य O noble one, हेमभूषिते decorated with gold, पादुके sandals, पादाभ्याम् from your feet, अधिरोह get into, एते these, सर्वलोकस्य of the entire world, योगक्षेमम् safety, विधास्यतः हि are going to secure.

112_22.shloka: सोऽधिरुह्य नरव्याघ्रः पादुके ह्यवरुह्य च।प्रायच्छत्सुमहातेजा भरताय महात्मने।।2.112.22।।
112_22.translation: Rama, the best of men, one with great brilliance, put on and then put off the sandals  and presented them to the magnanimous Bharata.
112_22.word_by_word: नरव्याघ्रः the best of men, सुमहातेजाः of great brilliance, सः that Rama, पादुके sandals, अधिरुह्य putting on, अवरुह्य च putting off, महात्मने to the magnanimous, भरताय to Bharata, प्रायच्छत् gave.

112_23.shloka: स पादुके सम्प्रणम्य रामं वचनमब्रवीत्चतुर्दश हि वर्षाणि जटाचीरधरो ह्याहम्।।2.112.23।।फलमूलाशनो वीर भवेयं रघुनन्दन।तवाऽगमनमाकाङ्क्षान्वसन्वै नगराद्बहिः।।2.112.24।।तव पादुकयोर्न्यस्तराज्यतन्त्रः परन्तप।
112_23.translation: Bharata bowed before the sandals and said to Rama, 'O tormentorr of enemies, O hero, wearing matted locks and bark garments, living on fruits and roots, placing the responsibility of ruling the kingdom on your sandals and looking forward to your arrival, I shall reside outside the city for fourteen years.'
112_23.word_by_word: सः that Bharata, पादुके to the sandals, सम्प्रणम्य bowing down, रामम् to Rama, वचनम् words, अब्रवीत् said, परन्तप O tormentor of enemies, वीर O hero, रघुनन्दन Rama, अहम् I, चतुर्दश वर्षाणि fourteen years, जटाचीरधरः wearing matted locks and bark garments, फलमूलाशनः living on fruits and roots, तव your, पादुकयोः on your sandals, न्यस्तराज्यतन्त्रः placing the responsibility of ruling this kingdom, तव your, आगमनम् arrival, आकाङ्क्षन् looking forward, नगरात् from the city, बहिः outside, वसन् residing, भवेयम् I  shall remain.

112_24.shloka: चतुर्दशे तु संपूर्णे वर्षेऽहनि रघूत्तम।।2.112.25।।न द्रक्ष्यामि यदि त्वां तु प्रवेक्ष्यामि हुताशनम्।
112_24.translation: O best of the Raghus, if I do not behold you on the day after completion of fourteen years I shall enter the blazing fire.
112_24.word_by_word: रघूत्तम O best of the Raghus, चतुर्दशे when fourteen, वर्षे years, संपूर्णे have passed, अहनिon that day, त्वाम् you, न द्रक्ष्यामि यदि if I do not behold, हुताशनम् blazing fire, प्रवेक्ष्यामि I shall enter.

112_25.shloka: तथेति च प्रतिज्ञाय तं परिष्वज्य सादरम्।।2.112.26।।शत्रुघ्नं च परिष्वज्य भरतं चेदमब्रवीत्।
112_25.translation: 'Be it so', assured Rama and then affectionately embracing both Bharata and Satrughna, said to Bharata:
112_25.word_by_word: तथेति be it so, प्रतिज्ञाय having promised, तम् to that Bharata, सादरम् affectionately, परिष्वज्य having embraced, शत्रुघ्नम् Satrughna, परिष्वज्य having embraced, भरतं च also Bharata, इदम् these words, अब्रवीत् spoke.

112_26.shloka: मातरं रक्ष कैकेयीं मा रोषं कुरु तां प्रति।।2.112.27।।मया च सीतया चैव शप्तोऽसि रघुसत्तम।इत्युक्त्वाऽश्रुपरीताक्षो भ्रातरं विससर्ज ह।।2.112.28।।
112_26.translation: Look after your mother, O chief of the Raghus Do not be angry with her. Swear in my name and in the name of Sita. So saying, eyes filled with tears, Rama took leave of his brother.
112_26.word_by_word: रघुसत्तम O chief of the Raghus,  मातरम् mother, कैकेयीम् Kaikeyi, रक्ष protect, तां प्रति to her, रोषम् anger, मा कुरु do not show, मया च by me, सीतया चैव on Sita, शप्तः असि are being sworn, इति like this, उक्त्वा having said, अश्रुपरीताक्षः with the eyes filled with tears, भ्रातरम् brother, विससर्ज ह took leave of.

112_27.shloka: स पादुके ते भरतः प्रतापवान् स्वलङ्कृते सम्परिपूज्य धर्मवित्।प्रदक्षिणं चैव चकार राघवम् चकार ते चोत्तमनागमूर्धनि।।2.112.29।।
112_27.translation: The valiant and righteous Bharata, worshipped the welldecorated sandals and after circumambulating Rama reverentially placed them atop the best of elephants.
112_27.word_by_word: प्रतापवान् the valiant, धर्मवित् knower of righteousness, सः भरतः that Bharata, स्वलङ्कृते welldecorated, ते those, पादुके sandals, सम्परिपूज्य having worshipped, राघवम् to Rama, प्रदक्षिणम् circumambulation, चकार performed, ते those sandals, उत्तमनागमूर्धनि atop the best of elephants, चकार made.

112_28.shloka: अथाऽनुपूर्व्यात्प्रतिनन्द्य तं जनं गुरूंश्च मन्त्रिप्रकृतीस्तथाऽनुजौ।व्यसर्जयद्राघववंशवर्धनस्थिरः स्वधर्मे हिमवानिवाचलः।।2.112.30।।
112_28.translation: Inflexibly fixed in his own code of righteouness, like the Himavat mountain, Rama, the enhancer of the progeny of the Raghu dynasty, paid respect due to the preceptors, ministers and subjects in accordance with their rank, blessed his younger brothers, Bharata and Satrughna and sent them forth.
112_28.word_by_word: अथ thereafter, राघववंशवर्धनः one who enhances the progeny of the Raghu dynasty, स्वधर्मे in his code of righteousness, हिमवान् Himavat, अचलः इव like the unshakable mountain, स्थिरः firm, तं जनम् those people, अनुपूर्व्या in accordance with their rank, प्रतिनन्द्य having greeted, गुरूंश्च to preceptors, मन्त्रिप्रकृतीः ministers and subjects, तथा like that, अनुजौ wishing his younger brothers Bharata and Satrughna, व्यसर्जयत् sent them forth.

112_29.shloka: तं मातरो बाष्पगृहीतकण्ठ्यो दुःखेन नामन्त्रयितुं हि शेकुः।स त्वेव मात्रृ़रभिवाद्य सर्वारुदन्कुटीं स्वां प्रविवेश राघवः।।2.112.31।।
112_29.translation: His mothers were unable to bid him farewell their throats were choked with tears of sorrow but Rama himself paid obeisance to them and entered his hut in tears.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे द्वादशोत्तरशततमस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the hundredtwelfth sarga in Ayodhyakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
112_29.word_by_word: दुःखेन in their grief, बाष्पगृहीतकण्ठ्य throats choked with sobs, मातरः mothers, तम् to him, अमन्त्रयितुं to bid farewell, न शेकुर्हि were not able, सः that, राघवः एव Rama himself, सर्वाः all, मात़ृ़: mothers, अभिवाद्य paying obeisance, रुदन् weeping, स्वाम् his, कुटीं hut, प्रविवेश entered.

113_1.shloka: [Return of Bharata and Satrughna with Rama's sandals as the representative of Rama.]तत श्शिरसि कृत्वा तु पादुके भरतस्तदा।आरुरोह रथं हृष्टः शत्रुघ्नेन समन्वितः।।2.113.1।।
113_1.translation: Then Bharata accompanied by Satrughna, placing the sandals on his head in delight, boarded the chariot.
113_1.word_by_word: ततः thereafter, तदा then, भरतः Bharata, पादुके sandals, शिरसि upon his head, कृत्वा having placed, हृष्टः in delight, शत्रुघ्नेन with Satrughna, समन्वितः accompanied by, रथम् chariot, आरुरोह boarded.

113_2.shloka: वसिष्ठो वामदेवश्च जाबालिश्च दृढव्रतः।अग्रतः प्रययु स्सर्वे मन्त्रिणो मन्त्रपूजिताः।।2.113.2।।
113_2.translation: Vasishta, Vamadeva, Jabali of rigorous penance and all the ministers honoured for their counsel proceeded ahead.
113_2.word_by_word: वसिष्ठः Vasistha, वामदेवश्च Vamadeva, दृढव्रतः of rigid penance, जाबालिश्च Jabali, मन्त्रपूजिताः honoured for their counselling, सर्वे मन्त्रिणः all the ministers, अग्रतः in the forefront, प्रययुः proceeded.

113_3.shloka: मन्दाकिनीं नदीं रम्यां प्राङ्मुखास्ते ययुस्तदा।प्रदक्षिणं च कुर्वाणाश्चित्रकूटं महागिरिम्।।2.113.3।।
113_3.translation: All of them circumambulated the mighty mountain Chitrakuta and proceeded easttowards the charming river Mandakini.
113_3.word_by_word: तदा then, ते they, चित्रकूटं महागिरिम् mighty mountain, Chitrakuta, प्रदक्षिणम् circumambulation, कुर्वाणाः doings, प्राङ्मुखाः facing eastward, मन्दाकिनीम् river  Mandakini, रम्याम् charming, नदीम् to river, ययुः proceeded.

113_4.shloka: पश्यन्धातुसहस्राणि रम्याणि विविधानि च।प्रययौ तस्य पार्श्वेन ससैन्यो भरतस्तदा।।2.113.4।।
113_4.translation: Beholding a thousand varieties of beautiful minerals, Bharata with his army proceeded  alongside the mountain.
113_4.word_by_word: तदा then, भरतः Bharata, रम्याणि beautiful, विविधानि various, धातुसहस्राणि a thousand  varieties of minerals, पश्यन् beholding, ससैन्यः with army, तस्य that mountain's, पार्श्वे alongside, प्रययौ went.

113_5.shloka: अदूराच्चित्रकूटस्य ददर्श भरतस्तदा।आश्रमं यत्र स मुनिर्भरद्वाजः कृतालयः।।2.113.5।।
113_5.translation: Not far from Chitrakuta mountain, Bharata beheld a hermitage where sage Bharadwaja resided.
113_5.word_by_word: तदा then, भरतः Bharata, चित्रकूटस्य of Chitrakuta, अदूरात् not far from there, यत्र where, मुनिः sage, सः भरद्वाजः that Bharadwaja, कृतालयः made his residence, आश्रमम् hermitage, ददर्श beheld.

113_6.shloka: स तमाश्रममागम्य भरद्वाजस्य बुद्धिमान्।अवतीर्य रथात्पादौ ववन्दे भरतस्तदा।।2.113.6।।
113_6.translation: On approaching the hermitage of sage Bharadwaja, Bharata  alighted from the chariot,and prostrated at his feet.
113_6.word_by_word: तदा then, बुद्धिमान्  sagacious, सः भरतः that Bharata, भरद्वाजस्य Bharadwaja's, तम् आश्रमम् that hermitage, आगम्य having reached, रथात् from the chariot, अवितीर्य alighting, पादौ at his feet, ववन्दे prostrated.

113_7.shloka: ततो हृष्टो भरद्वाजो भरतं वाक्यमब्रवीत्।अपि कृत्यं कृतं तात रामेण च समागतम्।।2.113.7।।
113_7.translation: Then Bhardwaja asked Bharata in delight, My son, have you accomplished your task?  Did you meet  Rama?
113_7.word_by_word: ततः then, हृष्टः delighted, भरद्वाजः Bharadwaja, भरतम् to Bharata, वाक्यम् these words, अब्रवीत् said, तात O child, कृत्यम् the task, अपि कृतम् has it been accomplished?, रामेण च with Rama, अपि समागतम् have you met?

113_8.shloka: एवमुक्त स्स तु ततो भरद्वाजेन धीमता।प्रत्युवाच भरद्वाजं भरतो धर्मवत्सलः।।2.113.8।।
113_8.translation: Having been thus addressed by wise Bharadwaja, Bharata, devoted to righteousness, replied:
113_8.word_by_word: ततः thereafter, धीमता by the wise, भरद्वाजेन by Bharadwaja, एवम् in this way, उक्तः having been addressed, धर्मवत्सलः devoted to righteousness, भरतः Bharata, भरद्वाजम् to Bharadwaja, प्रत्युवाच replied.

113_9.shloka: स याच्यमानो गुरुणा मया च दृढविक्रमः।राघवः परमप्रीतो वसिष्ठं वाक्यमब्रवीत्।।2.113.9।।
113_9.translation: Entreated by me and by preceptor (Vasistha), the highly pleased Rama with his  firmness of mind replied  to Vasistha:
113_9.word_by_word: गुरुणा by the preceptor (Vasistha), मया by me, याच्यमानः entreated, दृढविक्रमः of firmness of mind, राघवः Rama, परमप्रीतः highly pleased, वसिष्ठम् to Vasistha, वाक्यम् these words, अब्रवीत् said.

113_10.shloka: पितुः प्रतिज्ञां तामेव पालयिष्यामि तत्त्वतः।चतुर्दश हि वर्षाणि या प्रतिज्ञा पितुर्मम।।2.113.10।।
113_10.translation: In sooth, I shall honour the words of promise given by my father and live in the forest for fourteen years, as promised.
113_10.word_by_word: चतुर्दश वर्षाणि हि fourteen years indeed, मम पितुः to my father, या प्रतिज्ञा that promise, पितुः of my father, तां प्रतिज्ञाम् एव that promise only, तत्त्वतः truly, पालयिष्यामि shall honour.

113_11.shloka: एवमुक्तो महाप्राज्ञो वसिष्ठः प्रत्युवाच ह।वाक्यज्ञो वाक्यकुशलं राघवं वचनं महत्।।2.113.11।।
113_11.translation: On hearing him, Vasistha a great intellectual and highly eloquent one replied to Rama, skilled in words of deep significance.
113_11.word_by_word: एवम् in this way, उक्तः spoken, महाप्राज्ञः great intellectual, वाक्यज्ञः eloquent, वसिष्ठः Vasistha, वाक्यकुशलम् skilled in words, राघवम् Rama, महत् of deep significance, वचनम् words, प्रत्युवाच ह replied.

113_12.shloka: एते प्रयच्छ संहृष्टः पादुके हेमभूषिते।अयोध्यायां महाप्राज्ञ योगक्षेमकरे तव।।2.113.12।।
113_12.translation: O extremely sagacious one, bestow with pleasure your sandals decked with gold for security and safety of Ayodhya.
113_12.word_by_word: महाप्राज्ञ O extemely sagacious one, संहृष्टः with pleasure, अयोध्यायाम् of Ayodhya, योगक्षेमकरे securing safety and security, एते these two, हेमभूषिते decorated with gold, तव पादुके your pair of sandals, प्रयच्छ bestow.

113_13.shloka: एवमुक्तो वसिष्ठेन राघवः प्राङ्मुखः स्थितः।पादुके ह्यधिरुह्यैते मम राज्याय वै ददौ।।2.113.13।।
113_13.translation: Thus addressed by Vasistha, Rama stood facing eastward wearing these sandals. and bestowed them on me for the sake of ruling the kingdom.
113_13.word_by_word: वसिष्ठेन by Vasistha, एवम् in this way, उक्तः having  spoken, राघवः Rama, प्राङ्मुखः स्थितः standing eastward, एते these, पादुके sandals, अधिरुह्य wearing, मम to me, राज्याय for thesake of ruling the kingdom, ददौ bestowed.

113_14.shloka: निवृत्तोऽहमनुज्ञातो रामेण सुमहात्मना।अयोध्यामेव गच्छामि गृहीत्वा पादुके शुभे।।2.113.14।।
113_14.translation: I am now returning to Ayodhya with these auspicious sandals permitted by the  magnanimous Rama.
113_14.word_by_word: सुमहात्मना by the highly magnanimous, रामेण by Rama, अनुज्ञातः having been permitted, अहम् I, निवृत्तः am returning, शुभे auspicious, पादुके sandals, गृहीत्वा taking, अयोध्यामेव to Ayodhya only, गच्छामि am going.

113_15.shloka: एतच्छ्रुत्वा शुभं वाक्यं भरतस्य महात्मनः।भरद्वाजश्शुभतरं मुनिर्वाक्यमुवाच तम्।।2.113.15।।
113_15.translation: Hearing the auspicious words of  the magnanimous Bharata, sage Bharadwaja said to  him in words still more  auspicious.
113_15.word_by_word: महात्मनः of the magnanimous, भरतस्य Bharata's, शुभम् auspicious, एतत् all these, वाक्यम्  words, श्रुत्वा having heard, भरद्वाज: Bharadwaja, मुनिः sage, शुभतरम् the more auspicious, वाक्यम् words, तम् addressing Bharata, उवाच said.

113_16.shloka: नैतच्चित्रं नरव्याघ्र शीलवृत्तवतां वर।यदार्यं त्वयि तिष्ठेत्तु निम्ने सृष्टमिवोदकम्।।2.113.16।।
113_16.translation: O best of men, foremost among men of excellent character and dispositon, it is not surprising that all noble qualities come to reside in you naturally like water poured flowing downward.
113_16.word_by_word: नरव्याघ्र O best of men, शीलवृत्तवताम् among men of excellent character and dispositon, वर foremost, सृष्टम् poured out, उदकम् water, निम्ने इव like downward, आर्यम् noble, त्वयिin you, यत् तिष्ठेत् reside, एतत् that one, चित्रम् surprising, न not.

113_17.shloka: अमृत स्समहाबाहुः पिता दशरथस्तव।यस्य त्वमीदृश: पुत्रो धर्मज्ञो धर्मवत्सलः।।2.113.17।।
113_17.translation: With you as his son, endowed with qualities of righteousness and devotion to duty, your mightyarmed father Dasaratha is not dead. (He lives through you).
113_17.word_by_word: यस्य of whom, धर्मज्ञः knower of righteousness, धर्मवत्सलः one who is devoted to duty, ईदृशः endowed with such qualties, त्वम् you, पुत्रः as son, सः such, महाबाहुः mightyarmed man, तव your, पिता father, दशरथः Dasaratha, अमृतः is not dead.

113_18.shloka: तमृषिं तु महात्मानमुक्तवाक्यं कृताञ्जलिः।आमन्त्रयितुमारेभे चरणावुपगृह्य च।।2.113.18।।
113_18.translation: Hearing the words of the magnanimous Bharadwaja, Bharata paid his respect, folding his palms,  and clasping the feet of the sage and sought his permission to leave.
113_18.word_by_word: कृताञ्जलिः with folded palms, उक्तवाक्यम् having spoken thus, महात्मानम् magnanimous one, तं ऋषिम् that sage, चरणौ feet, उपगृह्य clasping, आमन्त्रयितुम् to take  leave of, आरेभे he commenced.

113_19.shloka: ततः प्रदक्षिणं कृत्वा भरद्वाजं पुनः पुनः।भरतस्तु ययौ श्रीमानयोध्यां सह मन्त्रिभिः।।2.113.19।।
113_19.translation: Then illustrious Bharata circumambulated the sage several times in homage  before heset out for Ayodhya with his counsellors.
113_19.word_by_word: ततः then, श्रीमान् the illustrious, भरतः Bharata, पुन पुनः again and again, भरद्वाजम् toBharadwaja, प्रदक्षिणम् circumambulation, कृत्वा having done, मन्त्रिभिस्सह along with the counsellors, अयोध्याम् to Ayodhya, ययौ set out.

113_20.shloka: यानैश्च शकटैश्चैव हयैर्नागैश्च सा चमूः।पुनर्निवृत्ता विस्तीर्णा भरतस्यानुयायिनी।।2.113.20 ।।
113_20.translation: The vast army of Bharata with all its carriages, carts, horses and elephants following   him again turned  back towards Ayodhya.
113_20.word_by_word: भरतस्य Bharata's, विस्तीर्णा vast, सा चमूः that army, अनुयायिनी following, यानैश्च with carriages, शकटैश्चैव with carts, हयैः with horses, नागैश्च with elephants, पुनः again, निवृत्ता turned back towards Ayodhya.

113_21.shloka: ततस्ते यमुनां दिव्यां नदीं तीर्त्वोर्मिमालिनीम्।ददृशुस्तां पुन स्सर्वे गङ्गां शुभजलां नदीम्।।2.113.21।।
113_21.translation: Thereafter, all of them crossed  the divine river Yamuna wreathed in waves and, beheld  the Ganga of sacred waters once again.
113_21.word_by_word: ततः thereafter, ते सर्वे all of them, दिव्याम् divine, ऊर्मिमालिनीम् wreathed with waves, यमुनां नदीम् river Yamuna, तीर्त्वा having crossed, शुभजलाम् of auspicious waters of, तां गङ्गां that Ganga, नदीम् river, पुनः again, ददृशुः beheld.

113_22.shloka: तां रम्यजलसंपूर्णां सन्तीर्य सहबान्धवःशृङ्गिबेरपुरं रम्यं प्रविवेश ससैनिकः।शृङ्गिबेरपुराद्भूय स्त्वयोध्यां सन्ददर्श ह।।2.113.22।।
113_22.translation: Bharata along with his kins and his army crossed the Ganga with its overflowing,  wonderful waters and entered the beautiful city of Sringiberapura and from there he proceeded until he beheld the city of Ayodhya.
113_22.word_by_word: रम्यजलसंपूर्णाम् overflowing with wonderful waters, ताम् to Ganga , सहबान्धवः with relations,सन्तीर्य having crossed, ससैनिकः with army, रम्यम् beautiful, शृङ्गिबेरपुरम् Sringiberapura, प्रविवेश entered, शृङ्गिबेरपुरात् from Sringiberapura, भूयः again, अयोध्याम् Ayodhya, सन्ददर्श हbeheld.

113_23.shloka: अयोध्यां च ततो दृष्ट्वा पित्रा भ्रात्रा विवर्जिताम्।भरतो दुःख सन्तप्त स्सारथिं चेदमब्रवीत्।।2.113.23।।
113_23.translation: On seeing the city of Ayodhya bereft of his father and brothers, Bharata, consumed with grief, said to the charioteer:
113_23.word_by_word: ततः then, भरतः Bharata, पित्रा by father, भ्रात्रा by brothers, विवर्जिताम् deserted, अयोध्याम् Ayodhya, दृष्ट्वा after seeing, दुःख सन्तप्तः consumed with grief, सारथिम् to the charioteer, इदम् these words, अब्रवीत् said.

113_24.shloka: सारथे पश्य विध्वस्ता साऽयोध्या न प्रकाशते।निराकारा निरानन्दा दीना प्रतिहतस्वरा।।2.113.24।।
113_24.translation: O charioteer, look, Ayodhya is in shapeless shambles. It is silent and cheerless. It is dull and desolate. It shines no more.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे त्रयोदशोरशततमस्सर्गः।Thus ends the hundredthirteenth sarga in Ayodhyakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
113_24.word_by_word: सारथे O charioteer, विध्वस्ता ruined, सा आयोध्या that Ayodhya, निराकारा formless, निरानन्दा cheerless, दीना desolate, प्रतिहतस्वरा silent, न प्रकाशते does not shine, पश्य see.

114_1.shloka: [Gloom at Ayodhya after the exile of Rama.]स्निग्धगम्भीरघोषेण स्यन्दनेनोपयान्प्रभुः।अयोध्यां भरतः क्षिप्रं प्रविवेश महायशाः।।2.114.1।।
114_1.translation: Bharata, the renowned lord (of Ayodhya) travelled on the chariot that produced a deep, soothing, sound. And entered Ayodhya soon.
114_1.word_by_word: महायशः renowned, प्रभुः lord, भरतः Bharata, स्निग्धगम्भीरघोषेण with its deep, soothing sound, स्यन्दनेन by the chariot, उपयान् while travelling, क्षिप्रम् soon, अयोध्याम् Ayodhya, प्रविवेश entered.

114_2.word_by_word: बिडालोलूकचरिताम् ranged by cats and owls, आलीननरवारणाम् where people and elephants were out of sight, तिमीराभ्याहताम् enveloped in darkness, अप्रकाशाम् without light, कालीम्  black, निशामिव like night.

114_3.shloka: राहुशत्रोः प्रियां पत्नीं श्रिया प्रज्वलितप्रभाम्।ग्रहेणाभ्युत्थितेनैकां रोहिणीमिव पीडिताम्।।2.114.3।।
114_3.translation: (The city looked) like Rohini, the beloved consort of the Moon, the star which wasmajesticlly radiating flaming brilliance and now, tormented by the exalted Rahu which has eclipsed the Moon, shines alone.
114_3.word_by_word: श्रिया with majesty, प्रज्वलितप्रभाम् radiating with lustre, अभ्युत्थितेन exalted, ग्रहेन by cruel planet, पीडिताम् tormented, राहुशत्रोः enemy of Rahu, (the Moon's), प्रियाम् beloved, पत्नीम् to wife, एकाम् alone, रोहिणीमिव like the star Rohini.

114_4.translation: (It appeared) like a lean mountainstream with scant, hot and turbid waters, with scorched aquatic birds and with small and large fishes and crocodiles dead due to the heat of the Sun.
114_4.word_by_word: अल्पोष्णक्षुब्धसलिलां with scant, hot and turbid waters, घर्मोत्तप्तविहङ्गमाम् the aquatic birds scorched by the Sun's heat, लीनमीनझषग्राहाम् small fish, large fish and crocodiles perished, कृशाम् dried up, गिरिनदीमिव like a mountainstream.

114_5.shloka: विधूमामिव हेमाभामध्वराग्ने स्समुत्थिताम्।हविरभ्युक्षितां पश्चाच्छिखां विप्रलयं गताम्।।2.114.5।।
114_5.word_by_word: विधूमाम् smokeless, हेमाभाम् with the splendour of gold, समुत्थिताम् rising, पश्चात् later on, हविरभ्युक्षिताम् sprinkled with sacrificial offering of clarified butter, विप्रलयम् extinction, गताम्  obtained, अध्वराग्नेः sacrificial fire's, शिखामिव like flames.

114_6.translation: warriors slain in the great battle (the city appeared desolate).
114_6.word_by_word: महाहवे in a great battle, विध्वस्तकवचाम् armours scattered, रुग्णगजवाजिरथध्वजाम् injured elephants, horses and shattered chariots and banners standards, हतप्रवीराम् with heroicwarriors slain, आपन्नाम् in great distress, चमूमिव like the army.

114_7.shloka: सफेनां सस्वनां भूत्वा सागरस्य समुत्थिताम्।प्रशान्तमारुतोद्धूतां जलोर्मिमिव निस्स्वनाम्।।2.114.7।।
114_7.word_by_word: सफेनाम् filled with foam, सस्वनाम् भूत्वा with roaring sounds, समुत्थिताम् risen, प्रशान्तमारुतोद्धूताम् swept by the gentle breeze, निस्स्वनाम् silent, सागरस्य ocean's, जलोर्मिमिव like a wave.

114_8.shloka: त्यक्तां यज्ञायुधैः सर्वैरभिरूपैश्च याजकैः।सुत्याकाले सुनिर्वृत्ते वेदिं गतरवामिव।।2.114.8।।
114_8.word_by_word: सर्वैः all, यज्ञायुधैः with sacrificial appliances, अभिरूपैः learned, याजकैः with priests, सुत्याकाले the time of extraction of Soma juice, विनिर्वृते has come to an end, त्यक्ताम् deserted, गतरवाम् sounds ceased, वेदिम् इव like an altar.

114_9.shloka: गोष्ठमध्ये स्थितामार्तामचरन्तीं तृणं नवम्।गोवृषेण परित्यक्तां गवां पक्तिमिवोत्सुकाम्।।2.114.9।।
114_9.translation: the midst of the herd despairs and no longer grazes the new grass.
114_9.word_by_word: गोवृषेण by a bull, परित्यक्ताम् forsaken, उत्सुकाम् longing (for the bull), गवाम् of cows, गोष्ठमध्ये in the midst of the herd, स्थिताम् standing, आर्ताम् despaired, नवं new, तृणम् grass, अचरन्तीं no longer grazing, पक्तिमिव like a cow.

114_10.word_by_word: सुस्निग्धै: by the most glossy, प्रज्वलद्भिरिव by the radiant, उत्तमैः by the excellent ones, जात्यैः by those of the finest class, प्रभाकराद्यैः rubies and other gems, मणिभिः with precious stones, वियुक्ताम् detached, नवाम् new, मुक्तावलीमिव like a pearl necklace.

114_11.shloka: सहसा चलितां स्थानान्महीं पुण्यक्षयाद्गताम्।संवृतद्युतिविस्तारां तारामिव दिवश्च्युताम्।।2.114.11।।
114_11.word_by_word: पुण्यक्षयात् due to exhaustion of merit, स्थानात् from its place, सहसा suddenly, महीम् the earth, गताम् reached, संवृतद्युतिविस्ताराम् with its extensive lustre dimmed, दिवः from the earth, च्युताम् fallen, तारामिव like a star.

114_12.shloka: पुष्पनद्धां वसन्तान्ते मत्तभ्रमरनादिताम्।द्रुतदावाग्नि विप्लुष्टां क्लान्तां वनलतामिव।।2.114.12।।
114_12.translation: with the melodious humming of intoxicated bees and suddenly shrivelling, ravaged by the fastspreading forest fire.
114_12.word_by_word: वसन्तान्ते at the end of spring, द्रुतदावाग्नि विप्लुष्टाम् ravaged by the fastspreading forest fire, पुष्पनद्धाम् laden with flowers, मत्तभ्रमरनादिताम् with the melodious hum of intoxicated bees, क्लान्ताम् withered away, वनलतामिव like a woodland creeper.

114_13.translation: Ayodhya with its markets and shops closed, and its merchants in a daze looked like the sky covered with clouds obscuring the Moon and stars.
114_13.word_by_word: सम्मूढनिगमाम् dazed merchants, स्तब्धाम् stilled, संक्षिप्तविपणापणाम् with markets and shops closed, अम्बुधरैः with clouds, वृताम् covered, प्रच्छन्नशशिनक्षत्राम् obscuring the moon and stars, द्यामिव like the sky.

114_14.translation: (Ayodhya looked) like an uncleansed drinking place with broken pitchers emptied of excellent wine scattered around and with drunkards lying dead in the open.
114_14.word_by_word: आकाशे lying in the open, क्षीणपानोत्तमैः with excellent wine exhausted, भग्नैः by the broken, शरावैः by pitchers, अभिसंवृताम् surrounded by, हताशौण्डाम् with drunkards dead, ध्वस्ताम् scattered, असंस्कृताम् uncleansed, पानभूमि इव like a drinking place.

114_15.shloka: वृक्णभूमितलां निम्नां वृक्णपात्रैस्समावृताम्।उपयुक्तोदकां भग्नां प्रपां निपतितामिव।।2.114.15।।
114_15.translation: (Ayodhya appeared) like a ruined well, its foundations broken and sunken into the earth, its water used up, with broken pots scattered around, its riven surface forming a dale.
114_15.word_by_word: वृक्णभूमितलाम् surface riven, वृक्णपात्रैः with broken pots, समावृताम् scattered around, निम्नाम् like a dale, उपयुक्तोदकाम् water used up, भग्नाम् broken, निपतिताम् sunken, प्रपामिव like a well.

114_16.shloka: विपुलां विततां चैव युक्तपाशां तरस्विनाम्।भूमौ बाणैर्विनिष्कृत्तां पतितां ज्यामिवायुधात्।।2.114.16।।
114_16.word_by_word: विपुलाम् extensive, वितताम् stretched, युक्तपाशाम् attached with nooses, तरस्विनाम् of a powerful man, बाणैः with arrows, विनिष्कृत्ताम् severed, आयुधात् from the weapon, भूमौ on the ground, पतिताम् fallen, ज्यामिव like a bowstring.

114_17.shloka: सहसा युद्धशौण्डेन हयारोहेण वाहिताम्।निहतां प्रतिसैन्येन वडवामिव पातिताम्।।2.114.17।।
114_17.word_by_word: युद्धशौण्डेन by a warrior skilled in warfare, हयारोहेण by the rider of a horse, सहसा suddenly, वाहिताम् carried, प्रतिसैन्येन by the enemy army, निहताम् slain, पातिताम् fallen on the ground, वडवामिव like a mare.

114_18.shloka: शुष्कतोयां महामत्स्यैः कूर्मैश्च बहुभिर्वृताम्।प्रभिन्नतटविस्तीर्णां वापीमिव हृतोत्पलाम्।।2.114.18।।
114_18.word_by_word: शुष्कतोयाम् water dried up, बहुभिः a lot of, महामत्सैः with large fishes, कूर्मैश्च with tortoises, वृताम् filled, प्रभिन्नतटविस्तीर्णाम् vast area around the bank split, हृतोत्पलाम् waterlilies withered, वापीमिव like a circular reservoir of water.

114_19.word_by_word: प्रतिषिद्धानुलेपनां with no oil massaged (on the body), शोकेन with grief, सन्तप्ताम् scorched, अभूषणाम् without ornaments, अप्रहृष्टस्य in dejection, पुरुषस्य man's, गात्रयष्टिमिव body like a stick (skeletal).

114_20.word_by_word: प्रविगाढायाम् deep, पावृषि in the rainy season, अभ्रमण्डलम् orb of clouds, प्रविष्टस्य entered, भास्करस्य the Sun's, नीलजीमूतैः by black clouds, प्रच्छन्नाम् obscured, प्रभामिव like the radiance.

114_21.shloka: भरतस्तु रथस्थ स्सन् श्रीमान्दशरथात्मजः।वाहयन्तं रथश्रेष्ठं सारथिं वाक्यमब्रवीत्।।2.114.21।।
114_21.translation: Illustrious Bharata, son of Dasaratha, seated in his chariot, addressed the charioteer as he drove the most excellent of chariots saying:
114_21.word_by_word: श्रीमान् illustrious, दशरथात्मजः son of Dasaratha, भरतस्तु Bharata, रथस्थस्सन् seated in the chariot, रथश्रेष्ठम् the most excellent of chariots, वाहयन्तम् driving, सारथिम् to the charioteer, वाक्यम् these words, अब्रवीत् said.

114_22.shloka: किं नु खल्वद्य गम्भीरो मूर्छितो न निशम्यते।यथापुरमयोध्यायां गीतवादित्रनिस्वनः।।2.114.22।।
114_22.translation: How is it that in Ayodhya, the deep and allpervasive songs and sounds of musical instruments of the former days are not heard now?
114_22.word_by_word: अयोध्यायाम् In Ayodhya, अद्य now, यथापुरम् as in the past, गम्भीरः deep, मूर्छितः allpervasive,गीतवादित्रनिस्वनः songs and sounds of musical instruments, न निशम्यते are not heard, किं नु खलु what could be the reason?

114_23.shloka: वारुणीमदगन्धश्च माल्यगन्धश्च मूर्छितः।धूपितागुरुगन्धश्च न प्रवाति समन्ततः।।2.114.23।।
114_23.translation: The breeze no longer carries the intoxicating odour of spirituous liquor, the pervading fragrance of flower garlands and agaru (incense).
114_23.word_by_word: वारुणीमदगन्धश्च the intoxicating odour of spirituous liquor, माल्यगन्धश्च the fragrance of flower garlands, धूपितागरुगन्धश्च the fragrance of agaru or incense, समन्ततः everywhere, मूर्छितः pervading, न प्रवाति does not blow.

114_24.shloka: यानप्रवरघोषश्च स्निग्धश्च हयनिस्वनः।प्रमत्तगजनादश्च महांश्च रथनिस्वनः।।2.114.24।।नेदानीं श्रूयते पुर्यामस्यां रामे विवासिते।
114_24.translation: After Rama's the exile the clatter of excellent carriages, the pleasing neighing of horses and trumpeting of elephants in rut and the rattle of chariots are no longer heard now.
114_24.word_by_word: रामे Rama, विवासिते having been exiled, इदानीम् now, अस्यां पुर्याम् in this city, यानप्रवरघोषश्च clatter of excellent carriages, स्निग्धः pleasant, हयनिस्वनश्च neighing of horses, प्रमत्तगजनादश्च trumpeting of elephants in rut, महान् great, रथनिस्वनः च rattle of chariots, न श्रूयते are not heard.

114_25.shloka: चन्दनागरुगन्धांश्च महार्हाश्च नवस्रजः।गते हि रामे तरुणा स्संतप्ता नोपभुञ्जते।।2.114.25।।
114_25.translation: Since Rama has departed, the young men in distress do not enjoy expensive incense of agaru and sandalwood paste and garlands of fresh flowers.
114_25.word_by_word: रामे Rama, गते having departed, तरुणाः the young men, संतप्ताः distressed, चन्दनागरुगन्धांश्च   incense of agaru and sandalwood paste, महार्हा: expensive, नवस्रजश्च garlands of fresh flowers, नोपभुञ्जते do not enjoy.

114_26.shloka: बहिर्यात्रां न गच्छन्ति चित्रमाल्यधरा नराः।नोत्सवा स्सम्प्रवर्तन्ते रामशोकार्दिते पुरे।।2.114.27।।
114_26.translation: This city is stricken with grief on account of Rama's departure. Men do not go out on pleasure jaunts wearing garlands of variegated flowers. Festivities are not celebrated.
114_26.word_by_word: रामशोकार्दिते stricken with grief on account of separation from Rama, पुरे in the city, नराः men, चित्रमाल्यधराः wearing garlands of variegated flowers, बहिः outside, यात्राम् pleasure jaunts, न गच्छन्ति do not go, उत्सवाः festivites, न सम्प्रवर्तन्ते are not celebrated.

114_27.shloka: सह नूनं मम भ्रात्रा पुरस्यास्य द्युतिर्गता।न हि राजत्ययोध्येयं सासारेवार्जुनी क्षपा।।2.114.28।।
114_27.translation: Certainly splendour has left along with my brother. Like the night when the rain pours down during the waning of the Moon, Ayodhya shines not.
114_27.word_by_word: अस्य पुरस्य of this city, द्युतिः splendour, मम my, भ्रात्रा सह along with brother, गता had left, नूनम् certainly, इयम् this, अयोध्या Ayodhya, सासारा with rain pouring down, अर्जुनी relating to the waning Moon, क्षपा इव like night, न राजति हि does not gleam.

114_28.shloka: कदा नु खलु मे भ्राता महोत्सव इवाऽगतः।जनयिष्यत्ययोध्यायां हर्षं ग्रीष्म इवाम्बुदः।।2.114.29।।
114_28.translation: When will my brother return to Ayodhya like a carnival and cause delight to every one  like summer clouds?
114_28.word_by_word: मे भ्राता my brother, महोत्सव इव like a carnival, आगतः having returned, ग्रीष्मे in summer,अम्बुदः इव like clouds, अयोध्यायाम् in Ayodhya, हर्षम् delight, कदा when, जनयिष्यति नु खलु  will cause.

114_29.translation: The highways of Ayodhya thronged with groups of elegantly attired young men or adults with their majestic gait, do not shine.
114_29.word_by_word: अयोध्यायाम् in Ayodhya, महापथाः highways, चारुवेषैः by those elegantly attired, उन्नतगामिभिः with their majestic gait, सम्पतद्भिः by those coming together in groups, तरुणैः young men, नरैः men, नाभिभान्ति is not shining.

114_30.shloka: एवं बहुविधं जल्पन्विवेश वसतिं पितुः।तेन हीनां नरेन्द्रेण सिंहहीनां गुहामिव।।2.114.31।।
114_30.translation: Thus mourning in several ways, Bharata entered his fathers' palace (now) bereft of the king like a cave without the lion.
114_30.word_by_word: एवम् thus, बहुविधम् in several ways, जल्पन् talking, तेन by that, नरेन्द्रेण by the king, हीनाम् bereft of, सिंहहीनाम् without a lion, गुहामिव like a cave, पितुः father's, वसतिम् residence,  विवेश entered.

114_31.shloka: तदा तदन्तः पुरमुञ्झितप्रभं सुरैरिवोत्सृष्टमभास्करं दिनम्।निरीक्ष्य सर्वं तु विविक्तमात्मवान्मुमोच बाष्पं भरतः सुदुःखितः।।2.114.32।।
114_31.translation: Selfpossessed Bharata beholding the secluded inner apartment deserted by the gods shorn of splendour, like the day deprived of the Sun shed tears in distress.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे चतुर्दशोत्तरशततमस्सर्गः।Thus ends the hundredfourteenth sarga in Ayodhyakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
114_31.word_by_word: तदा then, आत्मवान् selfpossessed, भरतः Bharata, सुरैः by gods, उत्सृष्टम् deprived of,अभास्करम् without the Sun, दिनमिव like a day, उञ्झितप्रभम् shorn of splendour, विविक्तम् secluded, सर्वम् entire, तत् अन्तःपुरम् that inner apartment, निरीक्ष्य having seen, बाष्पम्tears in distress, मुमोच shed.

115_1.shloka: [Bharata proceeds to Nandigrama along with Satrughna -- Consecration of Rama's sandals.]ततो निक्षिप्य मातृ़ स्स अयोध्यायां दृढ व्रतः।भरत श्शोकसन्तप्तो गुरूनिदमथाब्रवीत्।।2.115.1।।
115_1.translation: After keeping his mothers in Ayodhya, the griefstricken Bharata who was firm in his vows, said to the elders:
115_1.word_by_word: दृढव्रतः firm in his vows, सः भरतः that Bharata, ततः thereafter, मातृ़ mothers, अयोध्यायाम् in Ayodhya, निक्षिप्य having kept, शोकसन्तप्तः striken with grief, गुरून् to the elders, अथ thereafter, अब्रवीत् said.

115_2.shloka: नन्दिग्रामं गमिष्यामि सर्वानामन्त्रयेऽद्य वः।तत्र दुःखमिदं सर्वं सहिष्ये राघवं विना।।2.115.2।।
115_2.translation: I take leave of all of you. I am going to Nandigrama where I shall keep company with grief on account of Rama's absence.
115_2.word_by_word: अद्य now, नन्दिग्रामम् to Nandigrama, गमिष्यामि I am going, वः you, सर्वान् all, आमन्त्रये  seeking leave of, तत्र there, राघवं विना without Rama, इदम् this, सर्वम् all, दुःखम् grief, सहिष्येI will endure.

115_3.shloka: गतश्च वा दिवं राजा वनस्थश्च गुरुर्मम।रामं प्रतीक्षे राज्याय स हि राजा महायशाः।।2.115.3।।
115_3.translation: King Dasaratha has gone to heaven. My elder brother and guru is in the forest. I shall await his return for ruling the kingdom since he alone is the illustrious king of Ayodhya.
115_3.word_by_word: राजा the king, दिवम् to heaven, गतः has gone, मम गुरुः my brother, वनस्थः is in the forest, राज्याय for the kingdom, रामम् for Rama, प्रतीक्षे I am awaiting, महायशाः the illustrious one, सः he, राजा हि alone is the king.

115_4.shloka: एतच्छ्रुत्वा शुभं वाक्यं भरतस्य महात्मनः।अब्रुवन्मन्त्रिणस्सर्वे वसिष्ठश्च पुरोहितः।।2.115.4।।
115_4.translation: Hearing the auspicious words of the magnanimous Bharata the counsellors, priests including Vasistha replied:
115_4.word_by_word: महात्मनः of the great soul, भरतस्य Bharata's, शुभम् auspicious, एतत् these, वाक्यम् words, श्रुत्वा on hearing, सर्वे all, मन्त्रिणः counsellors, पुरोहितः the priest, वसिष्ठश्च also, अब्रुवन् spoke.

115_5.shloka: सुभृशं श्लाघनीयं च यदुक्तं भरत त्वया।वचनं भ्रातृवात्सल्यादनुरूपं तवैव तत्।।2.115.5।।
115_5.translation: O Bharata, the words you have uttered out of devotion to your brother which befityou alone are highly praiseworthy.
115_5.word_by_word: भरतः O Bharata, त्वया by you, भ्रातृवात्सल्यात् out of devotion towards your brother, यत् वचनम् the words, उक्तम् uttered, सुभृशम् highly, श्लाघनीयं praiseworthy, तत् that one, तवैव   you alone, अनुरूपम् befits.

115_6.shloka: नित्यं ते बन्धुलुब्धस्य तिष्ठतो भ्रातृसौहृदे।आर्यमार्गं प्रपन्नस्य नानुमन्येत कः पुमान्।।2.115.6।।
115_6.translation: You are always attached to your relations, firmly established in the welfare of your brothers and are pursuing a noble path. Who would not approve of this?
115_6.word_by_word: बन्धुलुब्धस्य attached to your relations, नित्यम् always, भ्रातृसौहृदे in the welfare of your brothers, तिष्ठतः established, आर्यमार्गम् noble path, प्रपन्नस्य following, ते to you, कः पुमान् which man, नानुमन्येत would not approve?

115_7.shloka: मन्त्रिणां वचनं श्रुत्वा यथाभिलषितं प्रियम्।अब्रवीत्सारथिं वाक्यं रथो मे युज्यतामिति।।2.115.7।।
115_7.translation: On hearing the pleasing words of the counsellors which were in conformity with his desire, Bharata said to his charioteer, 'Harness my chariot'.
115_7.word_by_word: यथाभिलषितम् in accordance with his desire, प्रियम् agreeable, मन्त्रिणाम् counsellors', वचनम् words, श्रुत्वा having heard, सारथिम् to the charioteer, मे रथः my chariot, युज्यताम्  be harnessed, इति thus, वाक्यम् words, अब्रवीत् said.

115_8.shloka: प्रहृष्टवदन स्सर्वा मातृ़ स्समभिवाद्य सः।आरुरोह रथं श्रीमान् शत्रुघ्नेन समन्वितः।।2.115.8।।
115_8.translation: With a cheerful countenance illustrious Bharata paid obeisance to all his mothers and,acompanied by Satrughna, ascended the chariot.
115_8.word_by_word: श्रीमान् illustrious, सः Bharata, प्रहृष्टवदनः with cheerful countenance, सर्वाः all, मातृ़ः mothers, समभिवाद्य paying obeisance, शत्रुघ्न with Satrughna, समन्वितः accompanied by, रथम् the chariot, आरुरोह ascended.

115_9.shloka: आरुह्य च रथं शीघ्रं शत्रुघ्नभरतावुभौ।ययतुः परमप्रीतौ वृतौ मन्त्रिपुरोहितैः।।2.115.9।।
115_9.translation: Highly pleased, Bharata and Satrughna ascended the chariot and, surrounded by counsellors and priests, set out  speedily.
115_9.word_by_word: शत्रुघ्नभरतौ Satrughna and Bharata, उभौ both, शीघ्रम् speedily, रथम् chariot, आरुह्य च having ascended, परमप्रीतौ highly pleased, मन्त्रिपुरोहितैः with counsellors and priests, वृतौ surrounded by, ययतुः proceeded.

115_10.shloka: अग्रतो गुरव: सर्वे वसिष्ठप्रमुखा द्विजाः।प्रययुः प्राङ्ग्मुखा स्सर्वे नन्दिग्रामो यतोऽभवत्।।2.115.10।।
115_10.translation: Preceded by preceptors, like Vasistha and other brahmins, all of them proceeded eastward in the direction of Nandigrama.
115_10.word_by_word: तत्र there, गुरवः preceptors, वसिष्ठप्रमुखाः headed by Vasistha, सर्वे all, द्विजाः brahmins, प्राङ्मुखाः eastward, नन्दिग्रामः Nandigrama, यतः wherever, अभवत् existed, that side, अग्रतः ahead of, प्रययुः went.

115_11.shloka: बलं च तदनाहूतं गजाश्वरथसङ्कुलम्।प्रययौ भरते याते सर्वे च पुरवासिनः।।2.115.11।।
115_11.translation: When Bharata left, the army with hordes of elephants, horses and chariots and  inhabitants of Ayodhya  followed him unbidden.
115_11.word_by_word: भरते Bharata, याते having gone, तदनाहूतम् unbidden, गजाश्वरथसङ्कुलम् crowded with elephants, horses and chariots, बलं च army also, प्रययौ set off, सर्वे all, पुरवासिनः च also the inhabitants of Ayodhya.

115_12.shloka: रथस्थः स तु धर्मात्मा भरतो भ्रातृवत्सलः।नन्दिग्रामं ययौ तूर्णं शिरस्यादाय पादुके।।2.115.12।।
115_12.translation: Righteous Bharata who was deeply attached to his brother proceeded speedily towards Nandigrama on the chariot bearing the sandals of Rama on his head.
115_12.word_by_word: भ्रातृवत्सलः deeply attched to his brother, धर्मात्मा a righteous man, सः भरतः that Bharata, रथस्थः while riding on the chariot, पादुके sandals, शिरसि on head, आदाय bearing, तूर्णम् speedily, नन्दिग्रामम् Nandigrama, ययौ went.

115_13.shloka: ततस्तु भरतः क्षिप्रं नन्दिग्रामं प्रविश्य सः।अवतीर्य रथात्तूर्णं गुरूनिदमुवाच ह।।2.115.13।।
115_13.translation: Bharata entered Nandigrama quickly, alighted from the chariot and then, addressing, the preceptors, said:
115_13.word_by_word: ततः then, सः भरतः that Bharata, क्षिप्रम् swiftly, नन्दिग्रामम् Nandigrama, प्रविश्य having entered, तूर्णम् at once, रथात् from the chariot, अवतीर्य having alighted, गुरून् to the preceptors, इदम् these words, उवाच ह spoke.

115_14.shloka: एतद्राज्यं मम भ्रात्रा दत्तं सन्नयासवत्स्वयम्।योगक्षेमवहे चेमे पादुके हेमभूषिते।।2.115.14।।
115_14.translation: My brother gave me this kingdom as a trust. He gave me the sandals decorated with gold for securing the prosperity and security (of the kingdom).
115_14.word_by_word: एतत् राज्यम् all this kingdom, भ्रात्रा by my brother, स्वयम् by himself, सन्नयासवत् like a trust, मम to me, दत्तम् given, योगक्षेमवहे prosperity and security, हेमभूषिते decorated with gold, इमे पादुके च these sandals also bestowed.

115_15.shloka: भरत श्शिरसा कृत्वा सन्न्यासं पादुके ततः।अब्रवीद्धुःखसंतप्त स्सर्वं प्रकृतिमण्डलम्।।2.115.15।।
115_15.translation: Then Bharata placed the sandals held in trust on his head and, overcome with grief, he addressed the concourse of subjects:
