115_15.word_by_word: ततः then, भरतः Bharata, सन्न्यासम् held in trust, पादुके sandals, शिरसा on head, कृत्वा having placed, दुःखसंतप्तः overcome with grief, सर्वम् all, प्रकृतिमण्डलम् addressing the concourse of subjects, अब्रवीत् said.

115_16.shloka: छत्रं धारयत क्षिप्रमार्यपादाविमौ मतौ।आभ्यां राज्ये स्थितो धर्मः पादुकाभ्यां गुरोर्मम।।2.115.16।।
115_16.translation: Hold the royal paresol now. This is the accepted symbol of the exalted feet of my brother. These sandals shall establish righteousness in the kingdom.
115_16.word_by_word: क्षिप्रम् at once, छत्रम् royal parasol, धारयत you may hold, इमौ these, आर्यपादौ as exalted feet of my brother, मतौ accepted, मम गुरोः my esteemed brother's, आभ्यां पादुकाभ्याम् with  these sandals, राज्ये in the kingdom, धर्मः righteousness, स्थितः is established.

115_17.shloka: भ्रात्रा हि मयि संन्यासो निक्षिप्त स्सौहृदादयम्।तमिमं पालयिष्यामि राघवागमनं प्रति।।2.115.17।।
115_17.translation: This kingdom has been given me by my brother out of affection as a trust. I shall safeguard it until Rama's return.
115_17.word_by_word: भ्रात्रा by my brother Rama, अयम् this (kingdom), संन्यासः on trust, सौहृदात् out of affection, मयि in me, निक्षिप्तः has been deposited, तम् such, इमम् this trust, राघवागमनं प्रति till Rama returns, पालयिष्यामि I will rule.

115_18.shloka: क्षिप्रं संयोजयित्वातु राघवस्य पुनस्स्वयम्।चरणौ तौ तु रामस्य द्रक्ष्यामि सहपादुकौ।।2.115.18।।
115_18.translation: 'I myself shall see soon Rama's feet reunited with these sandals.
115_18.word_by_word: क्षिप्रम् soon, पुनः again, राघवस्य of Rama, स्वयम् by myself, संयोजयित्वा reunited, सहपादुकौwith sandals, रामस्य Rama's, तौ चरणौ those feet, द्रक्ष्यामि shall behold.

115_19.shloka: ततो निक्षिप्तभारोऽहं राघवेण समागतः।निवेद्य गुरवे राज्यं भजिष्ये गुरुवृत्तिताम्।।2.115.19।।
115_19.translation: The burden of this kingdom has been cast on me. On reunion with Rama, I shall hand it over to my brother, my guru and shall be engaged in his service.
115_19.word_by_word: ततः then, निक्षिप्तभारः with the burden cast on me, अहम् I, राघवेण with Rama, समागतः  reunited, राज्यम् kingdom, गुरवे to my guru (Rama), निवेद्य making over, गुरुवृत्तिताम्engaged in serving guru, भजिष्ये I shall obtain.

115_20.shloka: राघवाय च सन्यासं दत्त्वेमे वरपादुके।राज्यं चेदमयोध्यां च धूतपापो भवामि च।।2.115.20।।
115_20.translation: Restoring the sacred sandals, the kingdom and this city of Ayodhya held as a trust by me, I shall be cleansed of the sin.
115_20.word_by_word: सन्यासम् this trust, इमे वरपादुके these sacred sandals, इदं राज्यं च and this kingdom, अयोध्यां च and Ayodhya, राघवाय to Rama, दत्त्वा having given back, धूतपापः cleansed of the sin, भवामि च I shall become.

115_21.shloka: अभिषिक्ते तु काकुत्स्थे प्रहृष्टमुदिते जने।प्रीतिर्मम यशश्चैव भवेद्राज्याच्चतुर्गुणम्।।2.115.21।।
115_21.translation: After Rama is coronated and the people are delighted and pleased, the renown andpleasure for me will be fourfold (what is obtained from ruling the kingdom).
115_21.word_by_word: काकुस्त्थे Rama, अभिषिक्ते having been coronated, जने people, प्रहृष्टमुदिते having been delighted and pleased, मम to me, राज्यात् of the kingdom, चतुर्गुणम् four times, प्रीतिः joy, यशश्चैव and renown, भवेत् will be (greater than by ruling).

115_22.shloka: एवं तु विलपन्दीनो भरत स्समहायशाः।नन्दिग्रामेऽकरोद्राज्यं दुःखितो मन्त्रिभिस्सह।।2.115.22।।
115_22.translation: Thus lamenting in desolation and grief, the illustrious Bharata lived in Nandigrama along with his counsellors and started ruling the kingdom.
115_22.word_by_word: महायशाः illustrious, सः भरतः that Bharata, दीनः lonely, एवम् in this way, विलपन् lamenting, दुःखितः in grief, मन्त्रिभिस्सह along with the counsellors, नन्दिग्रामे from Nandigrama, राज्यम् kingdom, अकरोत् ruled.

115_23.shloka: स वल्कलजटाधारी मुनिवेषधरः प्रभुः।नन्दिग्रामेऽवसद्वीर स्ससैन्यो भरतस्तदा।।2.115.23।।
115_23.translation: Bharata, the warrior and lord, wore bark garments and matted locks and lived the life of an ascetic in Nandigrama along with his army.
115_23.word_by_word: प्रभुः lord, वीरः warrior, सः भरतः that Bharata, तदा then, वल्कलजटाधारी wearing bark garments and matted locks, मुनिवेषधरः dressed as an ascetic, ससैन्यः with his army, नन्दिग्रामे in Nandigrama, अवसत् lived.

115_24.shloka: रामागमनमाकाङ्क्षन्भरतो भ्रातृवत्सलः।भ्रातुर्वचनकारी च प्रतिज्ञापारगस्तथा।।2.115.24।।पादुके त्वभिषिच्याथ नन्दिग्रामेऽवसत्तदा।
115_24.translation: Bharata who was attached to his brother and ever obedient to him, fulfilled his vow. He coronated the sandals and lived at Nandigrama longing for the return of Rama.
115_24.word_by_word: तदा then, भ्रातृवत्सलः attached to his brother, भरतः Bharata, रामागमनम् return of Rama,  आकाङ्क्षन् longing, भ्रातुः brother's, वचनकारी च obeying his word, प्रतिज्ञापारगः fulfilling his vow, अथ thereafter, पादुके to the sandals, अभिषिच्य having coronated, नन्दिग्रामे inNandigrama, तथा like that, अवसत् lived.

115_25.shloka: स वालव्यजनं छत्रं धारयामास स स्वयं।भरत श्शासनं सर्वं पादुकाभ्यां निवेदयन्।।2.115.25।।
115_25.translation: Bharata reported everything relating to the kingdom to the sandals first. Waving the chamaras (a fan made of yak tail) himself, he held the royal parasol over them.
115_25.word_by_word: सः भरतः Bharata, सर्वम् all, शासनम् orders, पादुकाभ्याम् to the sandals, निवेदयन् informing, स्वयम् himself, सवालव्यजनम् along with chamara, छत्रम् royal parasol, धारयामास held.

115_26.shloka: ततस्तु भरत शश्रीमानभिषिच्याऽऽर्यपादुके।तदधीनस्तदा राज्यं कारयामास सर्वदा।।2.115.26।।
115_26.translation: After the coronation of the sandals of his esteemed brother Rama, illustrious Bharata ruled the kingdom, subordianating himself to them.
115_26.word_by_word: ततः then, श्रीमान् illustrious, भरतः Bharata, आर्यपादुके sandals of his esteemed brother, अभिषिच्य having consecrated, सर्वदा always, तदधीनः subordinating himself to them, राज्यम् kingdom, कारयामास ruled.

115_27.shloka: तदा हि यत्कार्यमुपैति किञ्चिदुपायनं चोपहृतं महार्हम्।स पादुकाभ्यां प्रथमं निवेद्य चकार पश्चाद्भरतो यथावत्।।2.115.27।।
115_27.translation: Whenever an issue, however small, arose, Bharata kept the sandals informed. Whenever a valuable gift was presented, he offered it to the sandals before he accepted it.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे पञ्चदशोत्तरशततमस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the hundredfifteenth sarga in Ayodhyakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
115_27.word_by_word: सः भरतः Bharata, तदा then, यत्किञ्चित् however small, कार्यम् deed, उपैति arises, उपहृतम्  brought, महार्हम् expensive, उपायनम् gifts, प्रथमम् at first, पादुकाभ्याम् to the sandals, निवेद्य after offering, पश्चात् later, यथावत् appropriately, चकार carried out the work.

116_1.shloka: [ Apprehensions of ascetics residing at Chitrakuta -- fear of Khara brother of Ravana -- atrocities of rakshasas -- ascetics take leave of Rama and depart.]प्रतिप्रयाते भरते वसन्रामस्तपोवने।लक्षयामास सोद्वेगमथौत्सुक्यं तपस्विनाम्।।2.116.1।।
116_1.translation: After Bharta, had departed, Rama who was living in the penancegrove of ascetics observed that the ascetics were filled with apprehensions, and were eager (to leave that forest).
116_1.word_by_word: भरते Bharata, प्रतिप्रयाते had departed, रामः Rama, तपोवने in the grove of ascetics, अथ then, तपस्विनाम् of ascetics, सोद्वेगम् filled with apprehension, औत्सुक्यम् eagerness (with intense desire to leave that forest), लक्षयामास observed.

116_2.translation: Rama observed that the sages who earlier sought to stay with him near his hermitageunder his protection on chitrakuta were filled with anxiety (now).
116_2.word_by_word: तत्र there, पुरस्तात् in front of, चित्रकूटस्य of Chitrakuta, तापसाश्रमे in the hermitage, रामम् Rama, आश्रित्य sought his protection, निरताः intent on staying, तान् them, उत्सुकान् anxious, अलक्षयत् observed.

116_3.shloka: नयनैर्ब्रुकुटीभिश्च रामं निर्दिश्य शङ्किताः।अन्योन्यमुपजल्पन्त श्शनैश्चक्रुर्मिथः कथाः।।2.116.3।।
116_3.translation: Those sages, glancing at Rama with suspicious eyes, knitting their eyebrows and murmering among themselves, conversed secretly.
116_3.word_by_word: शङ्किताः suspicious, नयनैः with eyes, भृकुटीभिश्च by knitting their eyebrows, रामम् of Rama, निर्दिश्य glancing, अन्योन्यम् to each other, उपजल्पन्तः conversing, मिथः mutually,कथाः incidents, चक्रुः narrated.

116_4.translation: Having observed their anxiety, Rama apprehending somethig in his mind approached  the chief of the hermitage with folded palms and said:
116_4.word_by_word: ततः then, रामस्तु as for Rama, तेषाम् their, औत्सुक्यम् anxiety, आलक्ष्य having observed, स्या स्वात्मनि in his mind, शङ्कितः suspecting, कृताञ्जलिः with folded palms in reverence,  कुलपतिम् the chief of the hermitage, ऋषिम् that sage, इदम् these words, उवाच said.

116_5.shloka: न कच्चिद्भगवन्किञ्चित्पूर्ववृत्तमिदं मयि।दृश्यते विकृतं येन विक्रियन्ते तपस्विनः।।2.116.5।।
116_5.translation: O revered sire, have you seen any change in my conduct? For what reason are the sages looking perturbed?
116_5.word_by_word: भगवत् O revered one, मयि in me, पूर्ववृत्तम् earlier conduct, किञ्चित् nothing, इदम् this, विकृतम् change, न दृश्यते कच्चित् not noticed, येन by what, तपस्विनः sages, विक्रियन्ते are perturbed.

116_6.translation: Have the sages found my younger brother Lakshmana doing something unbecoming of him through inadvertence?
116_6.word_by_word: मे अवरजस्य my younger brother's, लक्ष्मणस्य of Lakshmana, प्रमादात् through inadvertance, आत्मनः himself, नानुरूपं unbefitting, चरितम् conduct, ऋषिभिः by sages, दृष्टं कच्चित् has  been seen.

116_7.shloka: कच्चिच्छुश्रूषमाणा व श्शुश्रूषणपरा मयि।प्रमदाऽभ्युचितां वृत्तिं सीता युक्तं न वर्तते।।2.116.7।।
116_7.translation: Has Sita devoted in her service to me and engaged in serving you failed to follow the conduct befitting a woman?
116_7.word_by_word: वः to you, शुश्रूषमाणा engaged in serving, मयि in me, शुश्रूषणपरा devoted to service, सीता by Sita, प्रमदाभ्युचिताम् befitting a woman, वृत्तिम् conduct, युक्तम् properly, न वर्तते कच्छित् is not following.

116_8.shloka: अथर्षिर्जरया वृद्धस्तपसा च जरां गतः।वेपमान इवोवाच रामं भूतदयापरम्।।2.116.8।।
116_8.translation: Hearing those words, an ascetic old in age and austerities, as though trembling said  to Rama who is compassionate to all beings:
116_8.word_by_word: अथ then, जरया in old age, वृद्धः grown old, तपसा च also in austerities, जराम् old age, गतः attained, ऋषिः ascetic, वेपमान इव as though trembling, भूतदयापरम् compassionate to all beings, रामम्  to Rama, उवाच said.

116_9.shloka: कुतः कल्याणसत्त्वायाः कल्याणाभिरतेस्तथा।चलनं तात वैदेह्यास्तपस्विषु विशेषतः।।2.116.9।।
116_9.translation: O dear child, how can goodnatured Sita who is always engaged in performing auspicious deeds, especially towards ascetics be associated with violation of duty?
116_9.word_by_word: तात O dear child, कल्याणसत्त्वायाः of a lady of auspicious nature, तथा also, कल्याणाभिरतेः  ever engaged in performing auspicious deeds, वैदेह्याः Sita's, चलनम् violation of duty, विशेषतः especially, तपस्विषु in respect of ascetics, कुतः how ?

116_10.shloka: त्वन्निमित्तमिदं तावत्तापसान्प्रतिवर्तते।रक्षोभ्यस्तेन संविग्नाः कथयन्ति मिथः कथाः।।2.116.10।।
116_10.translation: There is apprehension for ascetics from the demons on acount of your presence here. That is why they are conversing with one another about the likely fallout.
116_10.word_by_word: त्वन्निमित्तम् for your sake, रक्षोभ्यः on account of  rakshasas, तापसान् to ascetics, इदम् this fear, प्रतिवर्तते तावत् is arising, तेन by that, संविग्नाः they are scared, मिथ: mutually, कथाः incidents, कथयन्ति are exchanging.

116_11.shloka: रावणावरजः कश्चित् खरो नामेह राक्षसः।उत्पाट्य तापसान्सर्वाञ्जनस्थाननिकेतनान्।।2.116.11।।धृष्टश्च जितकाशी च नृशंसः पुरुषादकः।अवलिप्तश्च पापश्च त्वां च तात न मृष्यते।।2.116.12।।
116_11.translation: O dear child, Khara, one of the brothers of Ravana is dwelling in nearby 'Janasthana'. He is impudent, reportedly winner of battles, cruel, sinful, a maneater and haughty.He has uprooted all the ascetics  from Janasthana. He will not tolerate even you.
116_11.word_by_word: तात O dear child, इह here, रावणावरजः Ravana's brother, धृष्टश्च impudent, जितकाशी च appearing victorious, नृशंसः cruel one, पुरुषादकः cannibal, अवलिप्तश्च haughty, पापश्च a sinner, खरो नाम by name Khara, जनस्थाननिकेतनान् residents of 'Janasthanam', सर्वान् all, तापसान् ascetics, उत्पाट्य having uprooted, त्वां च you also, न मृष्यते will not pardon.

116_12.shloka: त्वं यदाप्रभृति ह्यस्मिन्नाश्रमे तात वर्तसे।तदाप्रभृति रक्षांसि विप्रकुर्वन्ति तापसान्।।2.116.13।।
116_12.translation: O dear child, ever since you started residing in this hermitage rakshasas have been  tormenting the ascetics.
116_12.word_by_word: तात O dear child, त्वम् you, यदाप्रभृति from the time, अस्मिन् आश्रमे in this hermitage, वर्तसे started residing, तदाप्रभृति since that time, रक्षांसि rakshasas, तापसान् the ascetics,विप्रकुर्वन्ति are tormenting.

116_13.translation: They appear in various distorted forms now rapacious, now fearful, now deformed.
116_13.word_by_word: बीभत्सैः in distorted appearance, क्रूरैः by cruel, भीषणकैरपि by frightening, नानारूपैः in various forms, विरूपैश्च by deformaed appearance, विकृतदर्शनैः detestable looks, रूपैः in forms, दर्शयन्ति they exhibit.

116_14.translation: Those wicked rakshasas employ forbidden and dirty means against ascetics and kill them by suddenly appearing in front of them.
116_14.word_by_word: अनार्याः the wicked rakshasas, पुरतः in front of, स्थिताः standing, तापसान् ascetics, अप्रशस्तै: forbidden, अशुचिभिः dirty things, सम्प्रयोज्य employing, अपरान् some other ascetics, प्रतिघ्नन्ति are killing.

116_15.shloka: तेषु तेष्वाश्रमस्थानेष्वबुद्धमवलीय च।रमन्ते तापसां स्तत्र नाशयन्तोऽल्पचेतसः।।2.116.16।।
116_15.translation: These debased rakshasas, concealing themselves in various ashram sites takedelight  in harassing and killing the ascetics.
116_15.word_by_word: अल्पचेतसः debased ones, तेषु तेषु in different, स्थानेषु in ashram sites, अबुद्धम् without being perceived, अवलीय च after concealing themselves, तत्र there, तापसान् the ascetics, नाशयन्तः while destroying, रमन्ते are taking delight.

116_16.shloka: अपक्षिपन्ति स्रुग्भाण्डानग्नीस्निञ्चन्ति वारिणा।कलशांश्च प्रमध्नन्ति हवने समुपस्थिते।।2.116.17।।
116_16.translation: When sacrifices are about to start, they throw away the sacrificial ladels and vessels containing sacrificial materials and sprinkle water on sacrificial fire. They also break down the earthen vessels used in the sacrifice.
116_16.word_by_word: हवने the sacrifices, समुपस्थिते are about to commence, स्रुग्भाण्डान् the sacrificial ladels and vessels containing sacrificial materials, अवक्षिपन्ति throw away, वारिणा with water, अग्नीन्    the fire for oblation, सिञ्चन्ति are drenching, कलशांश्च waterpots, प्रमदेन्तीध्नन्ति destroy.

116_17.translation: Now all these sages are urging me to abandon this hermitage infested by these wicked rakshasas and move to another region.
116_17.word_by_word: अद्य now, ऋषयः sages, दुरात्मभिः by those beings of wicked nature, तैः by those rakshasas, अमृष्टान् infested with, आश्रमान् the hermitages, प्रजिहासवः those who want to flee, अन्यदेशस्य to another region, गमनाय to go, माम् me, चोदयन्ति are urging.

116_18.shloka: तत्पुरा राम शारीरामुपहिंसां तपस्विषु।दर्शयन्ति हि दुष्टास्ते त्यक्ष्याम इममाश्रमम्।।2.116.19।।
116_18.translation: O Rama, those vile creatures resort to physical violence against ascetics, we have therefore, resolved to quit this ashram.
116_18.word_by_word: राम O Rama, ते दुष्टाः those vile creatures, तपस्विषु to these sages, शारीराम् physical, उपहिंसाम् violence, पुरा दर्शयन्ति हि they show in the begining, तत् for that reason, इमम् आश्रमम् this ashram, त्यक्ष्यामः we are going to quit.

116_19.shloka: बहुमूलफलं चित्रमविदूरादितो वनम्।पुराणाश्रममेवाहं श्रयिष्ये सगणः पुनः।।2.116.20।।
116_19.translation: Not very far from here stands an ancient ashram in a lovely forest abounding in roots and fruits and I with my companions will seek shelter there.
116_19.word_by_word: इतः from here, अविदूरात् not very far, बहुमूलफलम् abounding in roots and fruits, चित्रम् वनम् lovely woods, अहम् I, पुनः again, सगणः with my companions, पुराणाश्रममेव the ancient ashram, श्रयिष्ये I will seek shelter.

116_20.shloka: खरस्त्वय्यपि चायुक्तं पुरा तात प्रवर्तते।सहास्माभिरितो गच्छ यदि बुद्धिः प्रवर्तते।।2.116.21।।
116_20.translation: Dear child, Khara will also misbehave with you as usual. (Therefore), if you so decide you may come along with us.
116_20.word_by_word: तात O dear child, खरः Khara, त्वय्यपि च with you also, अयुक्तम् improperly, पुरा प्रवर्तते   behaves at the outset, बुद्धि: प्रवर्तते यदि if you so like, इतः from here, अस्माभिः सह along with us, गच्छ you may go.

116_21.shloka: सकलत्रस्य सन्देहो नित्यं यत्तस्य राघव।समर्थस्यापि हि सतो वासो दुःखमिहाद्य ते।।2.116.22।।
116_21.translation: O Rama, even though you are always vigilant and capable in all possible ways to defend youself, a doubt arises in our mind. It is perilous for you to live here with your wife.
116_21.word_by_word: राघव O Rama, नित्यम् always, यत्तस्य since for a man, समर्थस्यापि हि सतः even thoughcapable, सकलत्रस्य a man accompanied by his wife, ते to you, सन्देहः doubtful, अद्य now, इह here, वासः living, दुःखम् is painful.

116_22.translation: It was not possible for prince Rama to hold back by mere words that ascetic who was saying like this and was anxious to quit the hermitage.
116_22.word_by_word: राजपुत्रः son of a king, राम Rama, इति thus, उक्तवन्तम् saying this, समुत्सुकम् anxious, तं तपस्विनम् that sage, उत्तरैः in the form of a reply, वाक्यैः by words, अवरोद्धुम् to hold him back, न शशाक was unable.

116_23.shloka: अभिनन्द्य समापृच्छ्य समाधाय च राघवम्।स जगामाश्रमं त्यक्त्वा कुलैः कुलपतिस्सह।।2.116.24।।
116_23.translation: The leader of the group quit the hermitage along with his companions after paying  respect to Rama, convincing him and taking leave of him.
116_23.word_by_word: सः कुलपतिः that chief of ascetics, राघवम् to Rama, अभिनन्द्य having greeted, समापृच्छ्य  having taken leave, समाधाय having convinced, कुलैस्सह along with his group, आश्रमम् hermitage, त्यक्त्वा after abandoning, जगाम  went.

116_24.shloka: रामः संसाद्य ऋषिगणमनुगमनाद्देशात्तस्मात्कुलपतिमभिवाद्य ऋषिम्।सम्यक्प्रीतैस्तैरनुमत उपदिष्टार्थः पुण्यं वासाय स्वनिलयमुपसम्पेदे।।2.116.25।।
116_24.translation: Rama, followed the sages for some distance to bid them farewell. He paid obeisance to the chief of the group and having grasped the instruction of the highly pleased  sages, he with their consent returned to his holy hermitage.
116_24.word_by_word: रामः Rama, तस्मात् देशात् from that region, अनुगमनात् by following them for some distance, ऋषिगणम् the sages, संसाध्य bidding them farewell, कुलपतिम् chief of the groups,ऋषिम् that sage, अभिवाद्य having paid obeisance, सम्यक् properly, प्रीतैः by the pleased, तैः by them, अनुमतः having been consented, उपदिष्टार्थः having grasped their instruction, वासाय to reside, पुण्यम् holy, स्वं निलयम् his own hermitage, उपसम्पेदे approached.

116_25.shloka: आश्रममृषिविरहितं प्रभुः क्षणमपिन जहौ स राघवः।राघवं हि सततमनुगता स्तापसाश्चार्षचरित धृतगुणाः।।2.116.26।।
116_25.translation: Lord Rama, did not leave that hermitage deserted by the sages even for a moment. Those who had adopted the traditions of the sages and  had acquired many virtues followed Rama.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे षोडशोत्तरशततमस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the hundredsixteenth sarga in Ayodhyakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
116_25.word_by_word: प्रभुः the lord, सः राघवः that Rama, ऋषिविरहितम् deserted by the sages, आश्रमम् hermitage, क्षणमपि for a moment also, न जहौ did not leave, आर्षचरिते following the tradition of sages, धृतगुणाः fixed in many virtues, तापसाश्च even the sages, सततम् always, राघवम् to Rama, अनुगताः हि followed remained.

117_1.shloka: [Rama and Sita depart from Chitrakuta -- meet sage Atri and Anasuya.]राघव स्त्वथ यातेषु तपस्विषु विचिन्तयन्।न तत्रारोचयद्वासं कारणैर्बहुभिस्तदा।।2.117.1।।
117_1.translation: When the ascetics had departed, Rama thought over the matter well and did not like to reside there for many reasons.
117_1.word_by_word: अथ then, राघवस्तु as for Rama, तपस्विषु ascetics, यातेषु when departed, विचिन्तयन् thinking over, बहुभिः for many, कारणैः reasons, तदा then, तत्र there, वासम् to reside, नारोचयत् did not like.

117_2.shloka: इह मे भरतो दृष्टो मातरश्च सनागराः।सा च मे स्मृतिरन्वेति तान्नित्यमनुशोचतः।।2.117.2।।
117_2.translation: It is here that Bharata, mothers along with citizens of Ayodhya have visited me. That  memory soaked with grief is chasing me.
117_2.word_by_word: मे to me, इह here, भरतः Bharata, दृष्टः has been seen, सनागराः with the citzens of Ayodhya, मातरश्च mothers also, नित्यम् always, तान् about them, अनुशोचतः filled with grief, मे to me, सा स्मृतिः च that memory, अन्वेति is chasing.

117_3.shloka: स्कन्धावारनिवेशेन तेन तस्य महात्मनः।हयहस्तिकरीषैश्च उपमर्दः कृतो भृशम्।।2.117.3।।
117_3.translation: Due to the encampment of the army of the magnanimous Bharata (here), this place has been filled with the dung of horses and elephants and made exceedingly dirty.
117_3.word_by_word: महात्मनः magnanimous, तस्य Bharata's, तेन by that, स्कन्धावारनिवेशेन with the encampment of army, हयहस्तिकरीषैश्च with the dung of horses and elephants, भृशम् exceedingly, उपमर्थः dirty, कृतः has been made.

117_4.shloka: तस्मादन्यत्र गच्छाम इति सञ्चिन्त्य राघवः।प्रातिष्ठत स वैदेह्या लक्ष्मणेन च सङ्गतः।।2.117.4।।
117_4.translation: We shall, therefore, go to some other place, having resolved thus, Rama accompanied by Sita and Lakshmana set forth.
117_4.word_by_word: तस्मात् therefore, अन्यत्र to some other place, गच्छाम let us go, इति thus, सञ्चिन्त्य having resolved, सः that, राघवः Rama, वैदेह्या with Sita, लक्ष्मणेन with Lakshmana, सङ्गतःaccompanied by, प्रातिष्ठत set forth.

117_5.shloka: सोऽत्रेराश्रममासाद्य तं ववन्दे महायशाः।तं चापि भगवानत्रिः पुत्रवत्प्रत्यपद्यत।।2.117.5।।
117_5.translation: Having reached the hermitage of the revered sage Atri, illustrious Rama prostrated before him and Atri also received him as his son.
117_5.word_by_word: महायशाः illustrious one, सः रामः that Rama, अत्रेः Atri's, आश्रमम् hermitage, आसाद्य having reached, तम् to that sage, ववन्दे prostrated, भगवान् the revered, अत्रिः Atri, अपि also, तं  him as well, पुत्रवत् like a son, प्रत्यपद्यत received.

117_6.shloka: स्वयमातिथ्यमादिश्य सर्वमन्यत्सुसत्कृतम्।सौमित्रिं च महाभागां सीतां च समसान्त्वयत्।।2.117.6।।
117_6.translation: That sage Atri himself extended to Rama the hospitality befitting him in all possible ways and treated Lakshmana and highly virtuous Sita with kind words.
117_6.word_by_word: (अस्य of Rama), सुसत्कृतम् rendered befitting hospitality, सर्वम् in all ways, आतिथ्यम् hospitality, स्वयम् himself, आदिश्य च having ordered, महाभागाम् highly virtuous, सीतां च Sita, सौमित्रिं च also Lakshmana, समसान्त्वयत् treated with kind words.

117_7.shloka: पत्नीं च समनुप्राप्तां वृद्धामामन्त्र्य सत्कृताम्।सान्त्वयामास धर्मज्ञः सर्वभूतहिते रतः।।2.117.7।।
117_7.translation: Conversant in the ways of righteousness and eagaged in the welfate of all beings, sage Atri called out his aged wife who is revered by all and spoke kind words to her.
117_7.word_by_word: धर्मज्ञः knower of the ways of righteousness, सर्वभूतहिते in the welfare of all beings, रतः engaged, समनुप्राप्ताम् who had just come there, सत्कृताम् revered by all, वृद्धाम् aged, पत्नी चhis wife also, आमन्त्र्य called out, सान्त्वयामास said kind words.

117_8.shloka: आनसूयां महाभागां तापसीं धर्मचारिणीम्प्रतिगृह्णीष्व वैदेहीमब्रवीदृषिसत्तमः।रामाय चाऽचचक्षे तां तापसीं धर्मचारिणीम्।।2.117.8।।
117_8.translation: Atri, who was excellent among the sages said to his ascetic wife who was highly virtuous and an adherent of righteousness, Welcome Sita. Thereafter, he related to Rama a story about his asetic wife who follows the ways of righteousness.
117_8.word_by_word: ऋषिसत्तमः excellent among the sages (Atri), वैदेहीम् Sita, प्रतिगृह्णीष्व receive, महाभागाम्  highly virtuous, तापसीम् female ascetic, धर्मचारिणीम् who adheres to righteousness, अनसूयाम् to Anasuya, अब्रवीत् said, धर्मचारिणीम् who followed the ways of righteousness, तां  तापसीम् about his ascetic wife Anasuya, रामाय to Rama, आचचक्षे च related.

117_9.shloka: दश वर्षाण्यनावृष्ट्या दग्धे लोके निरन्तरम्।।2.117.9।।यया मूलफले सृष्टे जाह्नवी च प्रवर्तिता।उग्रेण तपसा युक्ता नियमैश्चाप्यलङ्कृता।।2.117.10।।दश वर्ष सहास्राणि तया तप्तं महत्तपः।अनसूया व्रतै स्स्नाता प्रत्यूहाश्च निवर्तिताः।।2.117.11।।देवकार्यनिमित्तं च यया सन्त्वरमाणया।दशरात्रं कृता रात्रि स्सेयं मातेव तेऽनघ।।2.117.12।।
117_9.translation: O blameless one (Rama), once this world was consecutively ravaged by drought for ten years. It was the virtuous Anasuya who created roots and fruits and caused Ganga to flow. She was engaged in severe mortifications and selfimposed religious observances. She practised severe asceticism for ten thousand years bathed in her vows. Solicited on behalf of the gods, she removed all impediments and converted ten nights into one. She is like a your mother to you.
117_9.word_by_word: अनघ O blameless one (Rama), लोके in this world, दशवर्षाणि ten years, अनावृष्ट्या bydrought, निरन्तरम् constantly, दग्धे devastated, यया by whom, मूलफले roots and fruits, सृष्टे were created, जाह्नवी च Ganga, प्रवर्तिता caused to flow, उग्रेण rigid, तपसा withmortifications, युक्ता engaged, नियमैश्च अपि with selfimposed religious observances, अलङ्कृता decorated, यया by whom, दशवर्षसहस्राणि for ten thousand years,  महत् severe, तपः asceticism, तप्तम् was practised, देवकार्यनिमित्तम् for the sake of gods, सन्त्वरमाणया by her eagerly, यया by whom, प्रत्यूहां impediments, निवर्तिताः have been averted, दशरात्रं ten nights, रात्रिः as night, कृता was converted, सा such, व्रतैः स्नाता bathed in her vow, इयम् अनसूया this Anasuya, ते to you, मातेव like a mother.

She was engaged in severe mortifications and selfimposed religious observances. She practised severe asceticism for ten thousand years bathed in her vows. Solicited on behalf of the gods, she removed all impediments and converted ten nights into one. She is like a your mother to you.

117_11.shloka: दश वर्षाण्यनावृष्ट्या दग्धे लोके निरन्तरम्।।2.117.9।।यया मूलफले सृष्टे जाह्नवी च प्रवर्तिता।उग्रेण तपसा युक्ता नियमैश्चाप्यलङ्कृता।।2.117.10।।दश वर्ष सहास्राणि तया तप्तं महत्तपः।अनसूया व्रतै स्स्नाता प्रत्यूहाश्च निवर्तिताः।।2.117.11।।देवकार्यनिमित्तं च यया सन्त्वरमाणया।दशरात्रं कृता रात्रि स्सेयं मातेव तेऽनघ।।2.117.12।।
117_11.translation: O blameless one (Rama), once this world was consecutively ravaged by drought for ten years. It was the virtuous Anasuya who created roots and fruits and caused Ganga to flow. She was engaged in severe mortifications and selfimposed religious observances. She practised severe asceticism for ten thousand years bathed in her vows. Solicited on behalf of the gods, she removed all impediments and converted ten nights into one. She is like a your mother to you.
117_11.word_by_word: अनघ O blameless one (Rama), लोके in this world, दशवर्षाणि ten years, अनावृष्ट्या bydrought, निरन्तरम् constantly, दग्धे devastated, यया by whom, मूलफले roots and fruits, सृष्टे were created, जाह्नवी च Ganga, प्रवर्तिता caused to flow, उग्रेण rigid, तपसा withmortifications, युक्ता engaged, नियमैश्च अपि with selfimposed religious observances, अलङ्कृता decorated, यया by whom, दशवर्षसहस्राणि for ten thousand years,  महत् severe, तपः asceticism, तप्तम् was practised, देवकार्यनिमित्तम् for the sake of gods, सन्त्वरमाणया by her eagerly, यया by whom, प्रत्यूहां impediments, निवर्तिताः have been averted, दशरात्रं ten nights, रात्रिः as night, कृता was converted, सा such, व्रतैः स्नाता bathed in her vow, इयम् अनसूया this Anasuya, ते to you, मातेव like a mother.

117_12.shloka: तामिमां सर्वभूतानां नमस्कार्यां यशस्विनीम्अभिगच्छतु वैदेही वृद्धामक्रोधनां सदा।अनसूयेति या लोके कर्मभिः ख्यातिमागता।।2.117.13।।
117_12.translation: 'She is renowned throughout this world for her deeds as Anasuya, (one who is free from anger). Aged, illustrious she is free frm anger, worthy of adoration by all beings. Let Sita approach her'.
117_12.word_by_word: सर्वभूतानाम् for all beings, नमस्कार्याम् worthy of adoration, यशस्विनीम् illustrious lady, वृद्धाम्  aged, सदा always, अक्रोधनाम् free from anger, ताम् to such a woman, इमाम् this Anasuya, वैदेही Sita, अभिगच्छतु let her approach, या who, कर्मभिः with deeds, आनसूयेति as Anasuya, ख्यातिम्  renown, आगता has acquired.

117_13.shloka: एवं ब्रुवाणं तमृषिं तथेत्युक्त्वा स राघवः।सीतामुवाच धर्मज्ञामिदं वचनमुत्तमम्।।2.117.14।।
117_13.translation: Hearing those words of the sage, Rama said be it so and said to righteous Sita these choice words.
117_13.word_by_word: सः राघवः that Rama, एवम् in this way, ब्रुवाणम् speaking,  तम् ऋषिम् that sage, तथेति be itso, उक्त्वा having said, धर्मज्ञाम् wise in the ways of righteousness, सीताम् Sita, उत्तमम् excellent, इदं वचनम् these words, उवाच said.

117_14.translation: O princess, you have heard the message of the sage. Without delay approach the ascetic (Anasuya) for your welfare.
117_14.word_by_word: राजपुत्रि O princess (Sita), अस्य मुनेः of this sage, इदं समीरितम् this saying, श्रुतम् has been heard, आत्मनः for your, श्रेयोऽर्थम् for your welfare, शीघ्रम् without delay, तपस्विनीम् ascetic, अभिगच्छ you may approach.

117_15.shloka: सीता त्वेतद वचः श्रुत्वा राघवस्य हितैषिणः।तामत्रिपन्तीं धर्मज्ञामभिचक्राम मैथिली।।2.117.16।।
117_15.translation: Having heard the words of Rama, intended for her welfare, Sita, daughter of the king of Mithila, approached the consort of Atri (Devi Anasuya), knower of righteousness, and reverently circumambulated her.
117_15.word_by_word: मैथिली daughter of the king of Mithila, सीता तु Sita, हितैषिणः  wishing her welfare, राघवस्य Rama's, एतद्वचः words, शृत्वा hearing, धर्मज्ञाम् knower of righteousness, ताम् to that,          अत्रिपत्नीम् wife of Atri (Devi Anasuya), अभिचक्राम circumamabulated in reverence.

117_16.shloka: शिथिलां वलितां वृद्धां जरापाण्डुरमूर्धजाम्।सततं वेपमानाङ्गीं प्रवाते कदलीं यथा।। 2.117.17।।तां तु सीता महाभागामनसूयां पतिव्रताम्।अभ्यवादयदव्यग्रा स्वं नाम समुदाहरत्।।2.117.18।।
117_16.translation: Highly chaste and fortunate Anasuya was very old and feeble. Her skin was wrinkled and her hair turned grey due to old age. Her body was constantly trembling like a plantain tree in a stormy wind. Pronouncing her name to such Anasuya, Sita made obeisance to her with utmost concentration.
117_16.word_by_word: सीता Sita, शिथिलाम् feeble, वलिताम् with wrinkles, वृद्धाम् old, जरापाण्डुरमूर्धजाम् hair turned  grey due to old age, प्रवाते in stormy wind, कदलीं यथा like a plantain tree, सततम्  constantly, वेपमानाङ्गीम् her body trembling, महाभागाम् highly fortunate, पतिव्रताम् chaste woman, ताम् अनसूयाम् that Anasuya, अव्यग्रा without haste, अभ्यवादयत् made obeisance, स्वनाम her name, समुदाहरत् pronounced.

117_17.shloka: शिथिलां वलितां वृद्धां जरापाण्डुरमूर्धजाम्।सततं वेपमानाङ्गीं प्रवाते कदलीं यथा।। 2.117.17।।तां तु सीता महाभागामनसूयां पतिव्रताम्।अभ्यवादयदव्यग्रा स्वंनाम समुदाहरत्।।2.117.18।।
117_17.translation: Highly chaste and fortunate Anasuya was very old and feeble. Her skin was wrinkled and her hair turned grey due to old age. Her body was constantly trembling like a plantain tree in a stormy wind. Pronouncing her name to such Anasuya, Sita made obeisance to her with utmost concentration.
117_17.word_by_word: सीता Sita, शिथिलाम् feeble, वलिताम् with wrinkles, वृद्धाम् old, जरापाण्डुरमूर्धजाम् hair turned  grey due to old age, प्रवाते in stormy wind, कदलीं यथा like a plantain tree, सततम्  constantly, वेपमानाङ्गीम् her body trembling, महाभागाम् highly fortunate, पतिव्रताम् chaste woman, ताम् अनसूयाम् that Anasuya, अव्यग्रा without haste, अभ्यवादयत् made obeisance, स्वनाम her name, समुदाहरत् pronounced.

117_18.shloka: अभिवाद्य च वैदेही तापसीं तामनिन्दिताम्।बद्धाञ्जलिपुटा हृष्टा पर्यपृच्छदनामयम्।।2.117.19।।
117_18.translation: Sita offered her obeisance to the blameless ascetic, Anasuya, folding her palms and enquired of her wellbeing in delight.
117_18.word_by_word: वैदेही Sita, अनिन्दिताम् blameless, तां तापसीम् to that asceetic (Anasuya), अभिवाद्य after paying her homage, बद्धाञ्जलिपुटा folding the palms, हृष्टा delighted lady, अनामयम् wellbeing, पर्यपृच्छत् enquired.

117_19.shloka: ततस्सीतां महाभागां दृष्ट्वा तां धर्मचारिणीम्।सान्त्वयन्त्यब्रवीद्धृष्टा दिष्ट्या धर्ममवेक्षसे।।2.117.20।।
117_19.translation: Anasuya was delighted  to see the glorious Sita who was always engaged in righteous acts and  said in kind words, You are fortunate. You are observing your rightful duty.
117_19.word_by_word: ततः then, महाभागाम् glorious lady, धर्मचारिणीम् engaged in righteous acts, तां सीताम् thatSita, सान्त्वयन्ती consoling, हृष्टा in delight, अब्रवीत् said, दिष्ट्या fortunately, धर्मम् rightful duty, अवेक्षसे you are observing.

117_20.shloka: त्यक्त्वा ज्ञातिजनं सीते मानमृद्धं च भामिनि।अवरुद्धं वने रामं दिष्ट्या त्वमनुगच्छसि।।2.117.21।।
117_20.translation: O noble Sita, by the grace of heaven you are following Rama, forsaking your kinsmen and wealth and confining yourself to the forest.
117_20.word_by_word: भामिनः सीते O noble Sita, त्वम् you, दिष्ट्या by the grace of heaven, ज्ञातिजनम् your kins, मानम् pride, ऋद्धं च wealth, त्यक्त्वा after forsaking, वने in the forest, अवरुद्धम् confined, रामम् Rama, अनुगच्छसि you are following.

117_21.shloka: नगरस्थो वनस्थो वा पापो वा यदि वा शुभः।यासां स्त्रीणां प्रियो भर्ता तासां लोका महोदयाः।।2.117.22।।
117_21.translation: One who is devoted to her husband, whether he be in the city or in the forest, whether  he is sinful or virtuous, will attain the most prosperous worlds.
117_21.word_by_word: यासाम् those, स्त्रीणाम् women, नगरस्थः in the city, वनस्थो वा or in the forest, पापो वा or sinful, यदि वा or, शुभः virtuous, भर्ता husband, प्रियः dear, तासाम् for them, महोदयाः highly promising, लोकः worlds.

117_22.shloka: दुश्शीलः कामवृत्तो वा धनैर्वा परिवर्जितः।स्त्रीणामार्यस्वभावानां परमं दैवतं पतिः।।2.117.23।।
117_22.translation: For a woman of noble nature her husband, whether he be licentious or of bad character or devoid of riches, is her supreme lord.
117_22.word_by_word: आर्यस्वभावानाम् of noble nature, स्त्रीणाम् for women, दुश्शीलः a man of bad character, कामवृत्तो वा or licentious, धनैः with riches, परिवर्जितो वा or devoid of, पतिः husband, परमम् is supreme, दैवतम् is deity.

117_23.shloka: नातो विशिष्टं पश्यामि बान्धवं विमृशन्त्यहम्।सर्वत्र योग्यं वैदेहि तपः कृतमिवाव्ययम्।।2.117.24।।
117_23.translation: O Sita, on reflection I know of none who is a better friend than the husband. He, like an imperishable penance, once acquired is never lost.
117_23.word_by_word: वैदेहि Sita, अहम् I, सर्वत्र all over, विमृशन्ती reflecting, कृतम् performed, अव्ययम् imperishable,  योग्यम् befitting, तपः इव like austerities, अतः more than husband, विशिष्टम् better, बान्धवम् relation, न पश्यामि I do not see.

117_24.translation: Those wicked women whose minds are overpowered by carnal desires, ranging at will as lords of their husbands, do not understand about vice and virtue.
117_24.word_by_word: याः those women, कामवक्तव्यहृदयाः with minds overpowerd by carnal desires, भर्तृनाथाः as lords of their husbands, चरन्ति ranging at will, असत्त्स्रियः such wicked women, एवम् in this way, गुणदोषम् vice and virtue, न अवगच्छन्ति do not understand.

117_25.shloka: प्राप्नुवन्त्य यशश्चैव धर्मभ्रंशं च मैथिलि।अकार्यवशमापन्नाः स्त्रियो याः खलु तद्विधाः।।2.117.26।।
117_25.translation: O Sita, those women  under the control of unworthy acts are dislodged from the pathof righteousness and get infamy.
117_25.word_by_word: मैथिलि O Sita, तद्विधाः such, स्त्रियः women, अकार्यवशम् the influence of unworthy acts, आपन्नः having obtained, अयशश्च infamy, पाप्नुवन्ति are obtaining, धर्मभ्रंशं च dislodged from the state of righteousness.

117_26.shloka: त्वद्विधास्तु गुणैर्युक्ता दृष्ट लोक परावराः।स्त्रिय स्स्वर्गे चरिष्यन्ति यथा धर्मकृतस्तथा।।2.117.27।।
117_26.translation: Women like you who are endowed with virtues and can distinguish between good and bad in this world, like those who  perform  virtuous deeds, will move about in heaven.
117_26.word_by_word: गुणैः with virtues, युक्ताः endowed with, दृष्टलोकपरावरा who can distinguish between good and bad in the world, त्वद्विधाः like you, स्त्रियस्तु women, धर्मकृतः doing virtuous deeds, यथाas to how, तथा that way, स्वर्गे in heaven, चरिष्यन्ति will range about.

117_27.shloka: तदेवमेनं त्वमनुव्रता सती पतिव्रतानां समयानुवर्तिनी।भव स्वभर्तु स्सहधर्मचारिणी यशश्च धर्मं च तत स्समाप्स्यसि।।2.117.28।।
117_27.translation: Therefore, always following your husband, upholding the traditions of chaste women, carrying out worthy and timely duties, be a virtuous wife to your husband. You will thus obtain renown and virtue.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे सप्तदशोत्तरशततमस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the hundredseventeenth sarga in Ayodhyakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
117_27.word_by_word: तत् for that reason, त्वम् you, एनम् this (Rama), अनुव्रता सती being devoted to your husband, पतिव्रतानाम् of chaste women, समयानुवर्तिनी following at all times, स्वभर्तुः to your husband, सहधर्मचरिणी भव be a virtuous wife, ततः from that, यशश्च renown, धर्मं च and virtue, समाप्स्यसि will obtain.

118_1.shloka: [Sita relates the story of her marriage to Anasuya -- Anasuya bestows Sita with divine gifts.]सात्वेवमुक्ता वैदेही अनसूयाऽनसूयया।प्रतिपूज्य वचो मन्दं प्रवक्तुमुपचक्रमे।।2.118.1।।
118_1.translation: When Anasuya thus addressed Vaidehi who is free from any malice, she worshipped  Anasuya  and started speaking in a gentle tone.
118_1.word_by_word: अनसूया one who is free from malice, सा वैदेही that Vaidehi, अनसूयया by Anasuya, एवम् in this way, उक्ता when  addressed, वचः those words, प्रतिपूज्य having worshipped, मन्दम् ina gentle tone, प्रवक्तुम् to tell, उपचक्रमे commenced.

118_2.shloka: नैतदाश्चर्यमार्याया यन्मां त्वमभिभाषसे।विदितन्तु ममाप्येतद्यथा नार्याः पतिर्गुरुः।।2.118.2।।
118_2.translation: It is no wonder that a noble lady like you should  instruct me this way. It is known to me that a husband is a guru to his wife.
118_2.word_by_word: त्वम् you, माम् to me, यत् अभिभाषसे you are instructing, एतत् all this, आर्यायाः for a noble lady like you, आश्चर्यम् wonder, न not, नार्या for a woman, पतिः husband, गुरुः the revered one, यथा as, एतत् all this, ममापि to me, विदितं तु also known.

118_3.shloka: यद्यप्येष भवेद्भर्ता ममाऽर्ये वृत्तवर्जितः।अद्वैधमुपचर्तव्यस्तथाप्येष मया भवेत्।।2.118.3।।
118_3.translation: O noble lady, even if my husband is devoid of good conduct, he should be obeyed without showing any hesitation.
118_3.word_by_word: आर्ये O noble lady, एषः मम भर्ता my husband, वृत्तवर्जितः  devoid of good conduct, यद्यपि भवेत् even if it happens, तथापि even then, एषः he, मया by me, अद्वैधम् without hesitation, उपचर्तव्यः should be obeyed.

118_4.shloka: किं पुनर्यो गुणश्लाघ्य स्सानुक्रोशो जितेन्द्रियः।स्थिरानुरागो धर्मात्मा मातृवत्पितृवत्प्रियः।।2.118.4।।
118_4.translation: What to speak of a husband if he is worthy of applause for his virtues, is compassionate, a subduer of the senses, righteous and ever affectionate like a mother and a father?
118_4.word_by_word: यः such a man, गुणश्लाघ्यः is worthy of applause for his virtues, सानुक्रोश: compassionate, जितेन्द्रियः subdued his senses, स्थिरानुरागः ever affectionate, धर्मात्मा righteous man, मातृवत्like a mother, पितृवत् like a father, प्रियः is dear, किं पुनः where is the need to say.

118_5.shloka: यां वृत्तिं वर्तते रामः कौसल्यायां महाबलः।तामेव नृपनारीणामन्यासामपि वर्तते।।2.118.5।।
118_5.translation: Mighty Rama shows the same behaviour and treatment towards the other consorts of the king as he does towards his own mother Kausalya.
118_5.word_by_word: महाबलः mighty, रामः Rama, कौसल्यायाम् in Kausalya, यां वृत्तिम् such treatment, वर्तते behaves, अन्यासाम् with others, नृपनारीणामपि consorts of  the king, तामेव the same way, वर्तते behaves.

118_6.shloka: सकृद्दृष्टास्वपि स्त्रिषु नृपेण नृपवत्सलः।मातृवद्वर्तते वीरो मानमुत्सृज्य धर्मवित्।।2.118.6।।
118_6.translation: Heroic Rama is affectionate towards king Dasaratha and is conversant with righteousness. Renouncing the sense of selfrespect he honours all the women on whom his father had cast his glance even once just as his own mother.
118_6.word_by_word: नृपवत्सलः affectionate towards king Dasaratha, धर्मवित् one who is conversant with righteousness, वीरः heroic Rama, नृपेण by king, सकृत् only once, दृष्टासु seen, स्त्रिष्वपि in any woman, मानम् pride, उत्सृज्य setting aside, मातृवत् like a mother, वर्तते abides.

118_7.shloka: आगच्छन्त्याश्च विजनं वनमेवं भयावहम्।समाहितं मे श्वश्र्वा च हृदये तद्धृतं महत्।।2.118.7।।
118_7.translation: When departing for this frightful and desolate forest, the great (advice) imparted by my motherinlaw is firmly fixed in my mind.
118_7.word_by_word: एवम् in this way, भयावहम् frightful, विजनम् desolate, वनम् forest, आगच्छन्त्याः when I was coming, मे to me, श्वश्वा by motherinlaw, समाहितम् imparted, तत् that, महत् wiseinstruction, हृदये in my heart, धृतम् is firmly grasped.

118_8.shloka: पाणिप्रदानकाले च यत्पुरात्वग्नि सन्निधौ।अनुशिष्टा जनन्याऽस्मि वाक्यं तदपि मे धृतम्।।2.118.8।।
118_8.translation: When I have been taught by my mother earlier, at the time of bestowal of my hand to Rama in the presence of the sacrificial fire (as witness) is etched in my mind.
118_8.word_by_word: पुरा formerly, पाणिप्रदानकाले च at the time of bestowal of my hand to Rama, अग्नि सन्निधौ in the presence of sacrificial marriage fire, जनन्या by my mother, यत् वाक्यम् that word,  अनुशिष्टा आस्मि I have been taught, तदपि that also, मे to me, धृतम् hold

118_9.shloka: नवीकृतं तु तत्सर्वं वाक्यैस्ते धर्मचारिणि।पतिशुश्रूषणान्नार्यास्तपो नान्यद्विधीयते।।2.118.9।।
118_9.translation: O righteous one (Anasuya), after listening to your words the instructions given by mymotherinlaw and my mother are renewed (remembered again). For a woman, no other penance is laid down (in scriptures) except service to her husband.
118_9.word_by_word: धर्मचारिणि O follower of righteous duty (Anasuya), ते वाक्यैः your words, तत् सर्वम् all that, नवीकृतम् renewed (reminded afresh), नार्याः for women, पतिशुश्रूषणात् more than obedience to her husband, अन्यत् other, तपः ascetic practice, न विधीयते is not laid down.

118_10.shloka: सावित्री पतिशुश्रूषां कृत्वा स्वर्गे महीयते।तथावृत्तिश्च याता त्वं पतिशुश्रूषया दिवम्।।2.118.10।।
118_10.translation: Having served her husband (faithfully), Savitri is honoured in heaven. You also, byfollowing the same path of serving your husband, shall reach the heaven.
118_10.word_by_word: पतिशुश्रूषाम् service to her husband, कृत्वा having rendered, सावित्री Savitri, स्वर्गे in heaven, महीयते is honoured, तथावृत्ति: having followed the same path, त्वं च you also, पतिशुश्रूषया through serving your husband, दिवम् to heaven, याता shall go.

118_11.shloka: वरिष्ठा सर्वनारीणामेषा च दिवि देवता।रोहिणी न विनाचन्द्रं मुहूर्तमपि दृश्यते।।2.118.11।।
118_11.translation: Rohini, the very best among all women and the goddess of heaven, is never seen in the sky separated from the moon even for a moment.
118_11.word_by_word: सर्वनारीणाम् among  all women, वरिष्ठा the very best, देवता goddess, एषा रोहिणी this Rohini, दिवि in the sky, चन्द्रं विना without the Moon, मुहूर्तमपि even for a moment, न दृश्यते is not seen.

118_12.shloka: एवंविधाश्च प्रवराः स्त्रियो भर्तृदृढव्रताः।देवलोके महीयन्ते पुण्येन स्वेन कर्मणा।।2.118.12।।
118_12.translation: Execellent women such as these, firm in their vows to their husband are highly revered in the world of gods through their own meritorious deeds.
118_12.word_by_word: एवंविधाः such women, प्रवराः excellent, भर्तृदृढव्रताः firm in their vows to their husbands, स्त्रियः women, पुण्येन by merit, स्वेन by their own, कर्मणा deeds, देवलोके in the world of the gods, महीयन्ते are highly revered.

118_13.shloka: ततोऽनसूया संहृष्टा श्रुत्वोक्तं सीतया वचः।शिरस्याघ्राय चोवाच मैथिलीं हर्षयन्त्युत।।2.118.13।।
118_13.translation: Thereafter hearing Sita's words, Anasuya affectionately kissed her forehead and saidthis in order to make her happy:
118_13.word_by_word: ततः thereafter, सीतया by Sita, उक्तम् spoken, वचः words, श्रुत्वा having heard, अनसूया Anasuya, संहृष्टा highly rejoiced, मैथिलीम् to Sita, शिरसि on her forehead, अघ्राय having kissed, हर्षयन्ती in order to make her happy, उवाच said.

118_14.shloka: नियमैर्विविधैराप्तं तपो हि महदस्ति मे।तत्संश्रित्य बलं सीते छन्दये त्वां शुचिव्रते।।2.118.14।।
118_14.translation: O Sita of pure conduct, I have great ascetic power obtained through practising various austerities. With its strength I shall give what you want for your enjoyment.
118_14.word_by_word: शुचिव्रते O woman of pure conduct, सीते O Sita, विविधैः by various, नियमैः by austerities, आप्तम् obtained, महत् great, तपः ascetic power, मे to me, अस्ति हि is there to my credit, तत् बलम् that ascetic power, संश्रित्य having resorted to, त्वाम् you, छन्दये I shall cause your enjoyment.

118_15.shloka: उपपन्नं मनोज्ञं च वचनं तव मैथिलि।प्रीता चास्म्युचितं किं ते करवाणि ब्रवीहि मे।।2.118.15।।
118_15.translation: O Sita, I am glad to hear your befitting and pleasing words. Tell me what appropriate  thing you desire and I shall give you.
118_15.word_by_word: मैथिलि O Sita, तव वचनम् your words, उपपन्नम् are befitting, मनोज्ञं च also pleasing, प्रीता आस्मि I am pleased, उचितम् appropriate thing, किं what, ते to you, करवाणि shall I do, मे to me, ब्रवीहि  tell.

118_16.shloka: तस्यास्तद्  वचनं श्रूत्वा विस्मिता मन्दविस्मया।कृतमित्यब्रवीत् सीता तपोबलसमन्विताम्।।2.118.16।।
118_16.translation: On hearing her words Sita was surprised. With a gentle smile she said, to Anasuya who was endowed with ascetic power, 'I think you have already granted me theboons'.
118_16.word_by_word: सीता Sita, तस्याः her, तद्वचनम् those words, शुत्वा having heard, विस्मिता was surprised, मन्दविस्मया with a gentle smile, तपोबलसमन्विताम् endowed with ascetic power, कृतमिति has been done, अब्रवीत् said.

118_17.shloka: सा त्वेवमुक्ता धर्मज्ञा तया प्रीततराऽभवत्।सफलं च प्रहर्षं ते हन्त सीते करोम्यहम्।।2.118.17।।
118_17.translation: When Sita said so, Anasuya who knew her righteous duty was immensely pleased. and replied, 'What a joy I shall make the words you have spoken come true'.
118_17.word_by_word: धर्मज्ञा knower of righteous ways, सा she (Anasuya), तया by Sita, एवम् in this way, उक्ता having been addressed, प्रीततरा अभवत् she was immensely pleased, सीते O Sita, हन्त what a joy, प्रहर्षम् my delight, ते to you, सफलम् fruitful, अहम् I, करोमि shall do.

118_18.shloka: इदं दिव्यं वरं माल्यं वस्त्रमाभरणानि च।अङ्गरागं च वैदेहि महार्हं चानुलेपनम्।।2.118.18।।मया दत्तमिदं सीते तव गात्राणि शोभयेत्।अनुरूपमसंक्लिष्टं नित्यमेव भविष्यति।।2.118.19।।
118_18.translation: O princess of Videha, O  Sita, I bestow on you this best garland of the gods, raiment, jewellery, fragrant unguents, and precious ointment for anointing your body with. All this will beautify your limbs. It is convenient (to use) and will never fade.
118_18.word_by_word: वैदेहि O princess of Videha, सीते Sita, दिव्यम् divine, वरम् best, इदं माल्यम् this garland,  वस्त्रम् raiment, आभरणानि च jewellery, अङ्गरागं च fragrant unguents, महार्हम् precious, अनुलेपनं च ointment for anointing the body, मया by me, दत्तम् is bestowed, इदम् all this, तव to your, गात्राणि limbs, शोभयेत् will beautify, नित्यम् always, अनुरूपम् convenient,असंक्लिष्टम् भविष्यति will never impair.

118_19.shloka: अङ्गरागेण दिव्येन लिप्ताङ्गी जनकात्मजे।शोभयिष्यसि भर्तारं यथा श्रीर्विष्णुमव्ययम्।।2.118.20।।
118_19.translation: O daughter of Janaka, you will enhance the glory of your husband by anointing your body with this divine, fragrant unguent to your body like Lakshmi enhancing the glory of eternal Visnu.
118_19.word_by_word: जनकात्मजे O daughter of Janaka, दिव्ये O divine lady, अङ्गरागेण with fragrant unguent, लिप्ताङ्गी anointing to your body, श्रीः Lakshmi, अव्ययम् imperishable, विष्णुम् Vishnu, यथाhow, भर्तारम् your husband, शोभयिष्यसि you will enhance the glory.

118_20.shloka: सा वस्त्रमङ्गरागं च भूषणानि स्रजस्तथा।मैथिली प्रतिजग्राह प्रीतिदानमनुत्तमम्।।2.118.21।।
118_20.translation: That princess from Mithila accepted the incomparable gifts of love, the raiment, fragrant unguents, jewellery and also the garland.
118_20.word_by_word: सा मैथिली that princess from Mithila, वस्त्रम् raiment, अङ्गरागं च fragrant unguent, भूषणानि jewellery, तथा and, स्रजः garlands, अनुत्तमम् incomparable, प्रीतिदानम् gifts of love, प्रतिजग्राह accepted.

118_21.shloka: प्रतिगृह्य च तत्सीता प्रीतिदानं यशस्विनी।श्लिष्टाञ्जलिपुटा तत्र समुपास्त तपोधनाम्।।2.118.22।।
118_21.translation: Illustrious Sita accepted the gifts of love and with palms folded in reverence sat beside her, an ascetic.
118_21.word_by_word: यशस्विनी illustrious lady, सीता Sita, तत् that, प्रीतिदानम् gifts of love, प्रतिगृह्य having accepted, श्लिष्टाञ्जलिपुटा with hands folded like a dish in reverence, तत्र there, तपोधनाम्ascetic, समुपास्त sat beside her.

118_22.translation: Anasuya who was firm in her vows commenced to ask Sita this way about a certain tale (that was close to her heart).
118_22.word_by_word: दृढव्रता firm in her vows, अनसूया Anasuya, तथा in that way, उपासीनाम् sitting, सीताम् Sita,कांचित् certain, प्रियकथामनु relating to a dear tale (that was close to her heart), प्रष्टुम् to ask, वचनम् these words, आरेभे commenced.

118_23.shloka: स्वयं वरे किल प्राप्ता त्वमनेन यशस्विना।राघवेणेति मे सिते कथा श्रुतिमुपागता।।2.118.24।।
118_23.translation: O Sita, I have heard that you have been won by the illustrious Rama in the swayamvara. At least that is the story which reached my ears.
118_23.word_by_word: सीते O Sita, त्वम् you, यशस्विना by the illustrious one, राघवेण by Rama, स्वयंवरे in the swayamvara (the choice of the husband by a princess in the public), प्राप्ता किल are obtained, इति कथा so runs the story, मे my, श्रुतिम् my ear, उपागता reached.

118_24.shloka: तां कथां श्रोतुमिच्छामि विस्तरेण च मैथिलि।यथाऽनुभूतं कार्त्स्न्येन तन्मे त्वं वक्तुमर्हसि।।2.118.25।।
118_24.translation: O daughter of Mithila, I would like to hear the story in detail. You should tell me the whole story as you experienced it.
118_24.word_by_word: मैथिलि O daughter of the king of Mithila,  ताम् that story,  विस्तरेण in detail, श्रोतुम् to hear, इच्छामि I wish, तत् that one, त्वम् you, यथाऽनुभूतम् as you experienced, कात्स्न्येन entirely, वक्तुम् अर्हसि  you should tell me.

118_25.shloka: एवमुक्ता तु सा सीता तां ततो धर्मचारिणीम्।श्रूयतामिति चोक्त्वा वै कथयामास तां कथाम्।।2.118.26।।
118_25.translation: 'Listen' said Sita, thus addressed, and began relating the story to Anasuya, a performer of austerities.
118_25.word_by_word: एवम् thus, उक्ता  addressed, सा सीता that Sita, ततः then, श्रूयताम् इति  listen, उक्त्वा having said, ताम् that, धर्मचारिणीम् to one who practiced righteousness, तां कथाम् that story, कथयामास related.

118_26.shloka: मिथिलाधिपतिर्वीरो जनको नाम धर्मवित्।क्षत्रधर्मे ह्यभिरतो न्यायतश्शास्ति मेदिनीम्।।2.118.27।।
118_26.translation: There is a king in Mithila, Janaka by name. He is heroic and is conversant with  righteousness. Engaged in the duties of a kshatriya, he is rules the earth with justice.
118_26.word_by_word: मिथिलाधिपतिः king of Mithila, वीरः a warrior, धर्मवित् one conversant wtih righteousness, जनको नाम by name Janaka, क्षत्रधर्मे in the duties of kshatriya, अभिरतः engaged, न्यायतः  rightly, मेदिनीम् this earth, शास्ति was ruling.

118_27.shloka: तस्य लाङ्गलहस्तन्य कर्षतः क्षेत्रमण्डलम्।अहं किलोत्थिता भित्वा जगतीं नृपतेस्सुता।।2.118.28।।
118_27.translation: When he was ploughing the circular plot of land for performing a sacrifice, it is said I emerged from the earth by breaking it and therefore I became his dauhghter.
118_27.word_by_word: तस्य his, लाङ्गलहस्तस्य of a man holding a plough in hand, क्षेत्रमण्डलम् the circular plot of land for performing sacrifice, कर्षतः while ploughing, अहम् I, नृपतेः king's, सुता as daughter, जगतीम् the earth, भित्वा breaking, उत्थिता किल arose, as they say.

118_28.translation: Engaged in sowing fistfuls of seeds, king Janaka found me covered with dust andwas astonished.
118_28.word_by_word: मुष्टिविक्षेपतत्परः eager to sow fistfuls of seeds, नरपतिः king, सः जनकः that Janaka, पांसुकुण्ठितसर्वाङ्गीं with my body covered with dust, माम् me, दृष्ट्वा having seen, विस्मितः अभवत् was astonished.

118_29.shloka: अनपत्येन च स्नेहादङ्कमारोप्य च स्वयम्।ममेयं तनयेत्युक्त्वा स्नेहो मयि निपातितः।।2.118.30।।
118_29.translation: As he had no children, he, on his own accord, lifted me up and placing me on his lap, saying, This is my daughter, he began showering (lots of) love on me.
118_29.word_by_word: अनपत्येन being childless, स्वयम् himself, स्नेहात् out of affection, अङ्कम् in his lap, आरोप्य placing, इयम् this one, मम तनया is my daughter, इति thus, उक्त्वा having said, मयि in me,  स्नेहः affection, निपातितः showered

118_30.shloka: अन्तरिक्षे च वागुक्ताऽप्रतिमाऽमानुषी किल।एवमेतन्नरपते धर्मेण तनया तव।।2.118.31।।
118_30.translation: 'O king, she is an incomparable divine being. By right she is your daughter'. These were the words (Janaka) heard from out of the sky.
118_30.word_by_word: नरपते O king, एतत् this, एवम् in this way, अप्रतिमा incomparable, अमानुषी not a human being, तव to you, धर्मेण by right, तनया daughter, अन्तरिक्षे from out of the sky, वाक् word, उक्ता  was uttered.

118_31.shloka: ततः प्रहृष्टो धर्मात्मा पिता मे मिथिलाधिपः।अवाप्तो विपुलां बुद्धिं मामवाप्य नराधिपः।।2.118.32।।
118_31.translation: Thereafter, my father and the righteous lord of Mithila was delighted in possessing  me when a noble thought struck his mind.
118_31.word_by_word: ततः thereafter, धर्मात्मा righteous, नराधिप: the king, मिथिलाधिपः the lord of Mithila, मे पिता my father, प्रहृष्टः was delighted, माम् me, अवाप्य having got, विपुलाम् noble, बुद्धिम् thought, अवाप्तः obtained.

118_32.shloka: दत्ता चास्मीष्टवद्देव्यै ज्येष्ठायै पुण्यकर्मणा।तया सम्भाविता चास्मि स्निग्धया मातृसौहृदात्।।2.118.33।।
118_32.translation: Bestowed as the choicest one of meritorious acts on the chief queen, I was brought up by her, by nature affectionate, with the love of a mother.
118_32.word_by_word: पुण्यकर्मणा by a man of meritorious acts, ज्येष्ठायै to the chief, देव्यैः queen, इष्टवत् as the choicest one, दत्ता अस्मि I was given, स्निग्धया by a lady endowed with affection, तया by her, मातृसौहृदात् with the love of a mother, सम्भाविता अस्मि I was nourished.

118_33.shloka: पतिसंयोगसुलभं वयो दृष्ट्वा तु मे पिता।चिन्तामभ्यगमद्धीनो वित्तनाशादिवाधनः।।2.118.34।।
118_33.translation: When my father saw I had attained  the marriageable age, he was immersed in sorrow like an indigent man who had lost all his wealth.
118_33.word_by_word: मे पिता my father, पतिसंयोगसुलभम् a proper time for uniting with a husband, वयः age,         दृष्ट्वा having observed, दीनः desolate, वित्तनाशात् due to loss of wealth, अधनः इव like an poor man, चिन्ताम् sorrow, अभ्यगमत् obtained.

118_34.shloka: सदृशाच्चापकृष्टाच्च लोके कन्यापिता जनात्।प्रधर्षणामवाप्नोति शक्रेणापि समो भुवि।।2.118.35।।
118_34.translation: Even though he was an Indra on earth, as a father of  an unmarried girl he would be humiliated by men who are his equal or inferior in this world.
118_34.word_by_word: भुवि on earth, शक्रेण with Indra, समोऽपि though equal, कन्यापिता the father of an unmarried girl, सदृशाः equal, अपकृष्टात् by an inferior, जनात् from men, लोके in this world, प्रधर्षणाम् humiliation, अवाप्नोति will receive.

118_35.shloka: तां धर्षणामदूरस्थां दृष्ट्वा चात्मनि पार्थिवः।चिन्तार्णवगतः पारं नाससादाप्लवो यथा।।2.118.36।।
118_35.translation: Having perceived that the humiliation is not very far, king Janaka was plunged in a sea of sorrow like one who cannot reach the shore without a float.
118_35.word_by_word: पार्थिवः the king, तां धर्षणाम् that humiliation, आत्मनि in him, अदूरस्थाम् not very far, दृष्ट्वा having observed, चिन्तार्णवगतः submerged in a sea of sorrow, अप्लवो यथा like one without a float, पारम् the shore, नाससाद did not reach.

118_36.shloka: अयोनिजां हि मां ज्ञात्वा नाध्यगच्छद्विचिन्तयन्।सदृशं चानुरूपं च महीपालः पतिं मम।।2.118.37।।
118_36.translation: The ruler of the earth knew that I was not born from a woman's womb, and could not find a suitable husband for me after deep reflection.
118_36.word_by_word: महीपालः the ruler of earth, माम् me, अयोनिजाम् not born from the womb, ज्ञात्वा having known, मम for me, सदृशम् equal, अनुरूपं च suitable, पतिम् husband, विचिन्तयन् thinking over, नाध्यगच्छत् did not find.

118_37.shloka: तस्य बुद्धिरियं जाता चिन्तयानस्य सन्ततम्।स्वयंवरं तनूजायाः करिष्यामीति धीमतः।।2.118.38।।
118_37.translation: After constantly pondering over the matter, the wise king arrived at the decision to perform a swayamvara for his daughter.
118_37.word_by_word: सन्ततम् constantly, चिन्तयानस्य pondering deeply, धीमतः wise, तस्य his, तनूजायाः for the daughter, स्वयंवरम् swayamvara, करिष्यामि I shall perform, इति thus, इयं बुद्धि: this thought, जाता was born.

118_38.shloka: महायज्ञे तदा तस्य वरुणेन महात्मना।दत्तं धनुर्वरं प्रीत्या तूणी चाक्षयसायकौ।।2.118.39।।
118_38.translation: Magnanimous Varuna out of his affection had given him, on the occasion of a great sacrifice, an excellent bow with inexhaustible arrows and a pair of quivers.
118_38.word_by_word: तदा then, महायज्ञे at a great sacrifice, तस्य to him, महात्मना by the magnanimous, वरुणेनby Varuna, प्रीत्या with affection, धनुर्वरम् an excellent bow, दत्तम् was given, अक्षयसायकौ with two inexhaustible arrows, तूणी च and two quivers.

118_39.shloka: असञ्चाल्यं मनुष्यैश्च यत्नेनापि च गौरवात्।तन्न शक्ता नमयितुं स्वप्नेष्वपि नराधिपाः।।2.118.40।।
118_39.translation: Because of its weight, no human could move that bow despite great effort nor were the kings capable of bending it even in their dreams.
118_39.word_by_word: गौरवात् because of weight, मनुष्यैः by a human, यत्नेनापि even with great effort,  असञ्चाल्यम् cannot be moved, तत् that bow, नराधिपाः lords of men, स्वप्नेष्वपि even in their dreams, नमयितुम् to bend, न शक्ताः were not capable.

118_40.shloka: तद्धनुः प्राप्य मे पित्रा व्याहृतं सत्यवादिना।समवाये नरेन्द्राणां पूर्वमामन्त्र्य पार्थिवान्।।2.118.41।।
118_40.translation: My truthful father, after having acquired the bow, invited all the princes and placed the great bow before them in the assembly where he declared:
118_40.word_by_word: सत्यवादिना by a truthful man, मे पित्रा by my father, पूर्वम् previously, पार्थिवान् kings, आमन्त्र्य having invited, नरेन्द्राणाम् of kings, समवाये in the assembly, तत् धनुः that bow, प्राप्य havingacquired, व्याहृतम् addressed them.

118_41.shloka: इदं च धनुरुद्यम्य सज्यं यः कुरुते नरः।तस्य मे दुहिता भार्या भविष्यति न संशयः।।2.118.42।।
118_41.word_by_word: यः नर: any man, इदं धनुः this bow, उद्यम्य having lifted, सज्यं च string the bow, कुरुते whocould do, तस्य to him, मे दुहिता my daughter, भार्या wife, भविष्यति shall become, संशयः न no doubt about it.

118_42.shloka: तच्च दृष्ट्वा धनुश्श्रेष्ठं गौरवाद्गिरिसन्निभम्।अभिवाद्य नृपा जग्मुरशक्तास्तस्य तोलने।।2.118.43।।
118_42.translation: Beholding the mighty bow resembling a mountain in weight, the kings, unable to lift it, paid their homage and left.
118_42.word_by_word: नृपाः the kings, गौरवात् due to heavy weight, गिरिसन्निभम् resembling a mountain, तत् धनुः श्रेष्ठम् that mighty bow, दृष्ट्वा beholding, तस्य its, तोलने in lifting, अशक्ताः were unable, अभिवाद्य paying obeisance, जग्मुः went away.

118_43.shloka: सुदीर्घस्य तु कालस्य राघवोऽयं महाद्युतिः।विश्वामित्रेण सहितो यज्ञं द्रष्टुं समागतः।।2.118.44।।लक्ष्मणेन सह भ्रात्रा राम स्सत्यपराक्रमः।
118_43.translation: After a long time, resplendent Rama whose prowess was truth, arrived along with  his brother Lakshman and sage Viswamitra in order to witness the sacrifice.
118_43.word_by_word: सुदीर्घस्य कालस्य after a long time, राघवः Rama, महाद्युतिः resplendent, सत्यपराक्रमः whose prowess was truth, अयं रामः this Rama, भ्रात्रा with his brother, लक्ष्मणेन सह along withLakshmana, विश्वामित्रेण सहितः together with Viswamitra, यज्ञम् the sacrifice, द्रष्टुम् to observe, समागतः arrived.

118_44.shloka: विश्वामित्रस्तु धर्मात्मा मम पित्रा सुपूजितः।।2.118.45।।प्रोवाच पितरं तत्र भ्रातरौ रामलक्ष्मणौ।
118_44.translation: Having accepted the honour extended by my father, righteous Viswamitra spoke to him about those two brothers, Rama and Lakshmana.
118_44.word_by_word: धर्मात्मा the righteous man, विश्वामित्रस्तु as for Viswamitra, मम पित्रा by my father, सुपूजितः wellhonoured, तत्र there, भ्रातरौ brothers, रामलक्ष्मणौ to Rama and Lakshmana, पितरम् tomy father, प्रोवाच uttered.

118_45.shloka: सुतौ दशरथस्येमौ धनुर्दर्शकाङ्क्षिणौ।धनुर्दर्शय रामाय राजपुत्राय दैविकम्।।2.118.46।।
118_45.translation: 'Both these sons of king Dasaratha wish to see the bow. Show the divine bow to prince  Rama'.
118_45.word_by_word: दशरथस्य king Dasaratha's, सुतौ sons, इमौ both these, धनुर्दर्शकाङ्क्षिणौ are desirous of seeing the bow, राजपुत्राय to this king's son, रामाय to Rama, दैविकम् divine, धनुः bow, दर्शय show.

118_46.shloka: इत्युक्तस्तेन विप्रेण तद्धनुस्समुपानयत्।।2.118.47।।निमेषान्तरमात्रेण तदाऽनम्य महाबलः।ज्यां समारोप्य झडिति पूरयामास वीर्यवान्।।2.118.48।।
118_46.translation: At the words of that ascetic, my father brought out the bow. Mighty and valiant Rama bent it and strung it and drew it in the twinkling of an eye.
118_46.word_by_word: तेन विप्रेण by that ascetic, इति thus, उक्तः uttered, ततो then, धनुः bow, उपानयत् brought,महाबलः mighty one, वीर्यवान् valiant man, निमेषान्तरमात्रेण in the twinkling of an eye, तत् that one, आनम्य having bent, झडिति instantly, ज्याम् the string, समारोप्य pulling it, पूरयामास drew it.

118_47.shloka: तेन पूरयता वेगान्मध्ये भग्नं द्विधा धनुः।तस्य शब्दो भवद्भीमः पतितस्याशनेरिव।।2.118.49।।
118_47.translation: When Rama was stringing the bow with force, it was broken into two in the middle and fell down with a dreadful sound like that of thunder.
118_47.word_by_word: पूरयता while stringing, तेन by Rama, वेगात् with force, धनुः bow, मध्ये in the middle, द्विधाinto two, भग्नम् was broken, तस्य its, भीमः dreadful, शब्दः sound, पतितस्य fallen, अशनेरिव like that of a thunder, अभवत् arose.

118_48.shloka: ततोऽहं तत्र रामाय पित्रा सत्याभिसन्धिना।निश्चिता दातुमुद्यम्य जलभाजनमुत्तमम्।।2.118.50।।
118_48.translation: Then, my father steadfast in truth, held a vessel of pure water and declared his decision to offer me to Rama.
118_48.word_by_word: ततः then, तत्र there, सत्याभिसन्धिना by one steadfast in truth, पित्रा by my father, उत्तमम् pure, जलभाजनम् watervessel, उद्यम्य having raised, अहम् I, रामाय to Rama , दातुम् to give, निश्चिता decided.

118_49.shloka: दीयमानां न तु तदा प्रतिजग्राह राघवः।अविज्ञाय पितुश्छन्दमयोध्याऽधिपतेः प्रभोः।।2.118.51।।
118_49.translation: Then Rama did not accept the offer of my father straightaway before he knew the opinion of his father Dasaratha,  king of Ayodhya.
118_49.word_by_word: तदा then, राघवः Rama, अयोध्याऽधिपतेः of the king of Ayodhya, प्रभोः lord, पितुः his father's, छन्दम् opinion, अविज्ञाय without knowing, दीयमानाम् being offered by father, न तु प्रतिजग्राहdid not accept.

118_50.shloka: तत श्श्वशुरमामन्त्र्य वृद्धं दशरथं नृपम्।मम पित्रा त्वहं दत्ता रामाय विदितात्मने।।2.118.52।।
118_50.translation: Thereafter, my fatherinlaw, the aged king Dasaratha was invited and my father  offered me to Rama  known for his sagacity.
118_50.word_by_word: ततः then, मम पित्रा by my father, श्वशुरम् fatherinlaw, वृद्धम् aged, दशरथं नृपम् kingDasaratha, आमन्त्र्य having invited, अहम् I, विदितात्मन: of a man who is known for his sagacity, रामाय to Rama, दत्ता I was given.

118_51.shloka: मम चैवानुजा साध्वी ऊर्मिला प्रियदर्शना।भार्यार्थे लक्ष्मणस्यापि दत्ता पित्रा मम स्वयम्।।2.118.53।।
118_51.translation: My father, on his own accord, bestowed Urmila, my younger sister of chaste and of  pleasing appearance as wife to Lakshmana.
118_51.word_by_word: मम my, अनुजा younger sister, साध्वी chaste, प्रियदर्शना pleasing appearance, ऊर्मिला Urmila, भार्यार्थे as wife, मम पित्रा by my father, स्वयम् of his own accord, लक्ष्मणस्यापि for Lakshman, दत्ता was given.

118_52.shloka: एवं दत्ताऽस्मि रामाय तदा तस्मिन्स्वयंवरे।अनुरक्ताऽस्मि धर्मेण पतिं वीर्यवतां वरम्।।2.118.54।।
118_52.translation: In this way my father bestowed me on Rama in that swayamvara and I remain devoted to my husband who is the foremost among the valiant in treading the path of  righteousness.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे अष्टादशोत्तरशततमस्सर्गः।Thus ends the one hundredeighteenth sarga in Ayodhyakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
118_52.word_by_word: तदा then, तस्मिन् स्वयंवरे in that swayamvara, रामाय for Rama, एवम् in this way, दत्ता अस्मि was bestowed, वीर्यवताम् among valiant, वरम् foremost, पतिम् husband, धर्मेण in accordance with righteousness, अनुरक्ता अस्मि I remain devoted.

119_1.shloka: [Rama, Lakshmana and Sita take leave of Atri and Anasuya -- enter the Dandaka forest.]अनसूया तु धर्मज्ञा श्रुत्वा तां महतीं कथाम्।पर्यष्वजत बाहुभ्यां शिरस्याघ्राय मैथिलीम्।।2.119.1।।
119_1.translation: Then righteous Anasuya, having heard the great story of Sita, kissed her on the forehead and embraced her with both the arms.
119_1.word_by_word: धर्मज्ञा knower of righteousness, अनसूया तु Anasuya on her part, ताम् all that, महतीं कथाम्  great narrative, श्रुत्वा having heard, मैथिलीम् Sita, शिरसि on head, आघ्राय having smelt, बाहुभ्याम् with arms, पर्यष्वजत embraced.

119_2.shloka: व्यक्ताक्षरपदं चित्रं भाषितं मधुरं त्वया।यथा स्वयंवरं वृत्तं तत्सर्वं हि श्रुतं मया।।2.119.2।।रमेऽहं कथया ते तु दृढं मधुरभाषिणि।
119_2.translation: You have related wonderfully and sweetly your Swayamvara with each word and each syllable uttered clearly. I have heard everything as it happened. O sweetspeaking Sita, I have greatly enjoyed your story.
119_2.word_by_word: त्वया by you, व्यक्ताक्षरपदम् with each word and each syllable uttered clearly, चित्रम्   wonderful, मधुरम् sweet, भाषितम् spoken, स्वयंवरम् the ceremony in which the bride chooses the groom of her own accord, यथा as, वृत्तम् it happened, तत्सर्वं all that, मया by me, श्रुतं हि has been heard, मधुरभाषिणि O sweetspeaking, Sita, ते your, कथया in the story, अहम् I, दृढम् रमे I enjoy  greatly.

119_3.shloka: रविरस्तङ्गतश्श्रीमानुपोह्य रजनीं शिवाम्।।2.119.3।।दिवसं प्रतिकीर्णानामाहारार्थं पतत्रिणाम्।सन्ध्याकाले निलीनानां निद्रार्थं श्रूयते ध्वनिः।।2.119.4।।
119_3.translation: The resplendent Sun has set. The auspcious night is drawing near. The birds who forage far and wide for food during the day return to their nests to rest for the night. You can hear them twittering.
119_3.word_by_word: श्रीमान् resplendent, रविः Sun, शिवाम् auspicious, रजनीम् night, उपोह्य after drawing near, अस्तगतः has set, दिवसम् during day, आहारार्थम् for the sake of food, प्रतिकीर्णानाम् forage far and wide, सन्ध्याकाले in the twilight, निद्रार्थम् for the sake of sleep, निलीनानाम् resting, पतत्रिणाम् of birds, ध्वनिः sound, श्रूयते is heard.

119_4.shloka: एते चाप्यभिषेकार्द्रा मुनयः कलशोद्यताः।सहिता उपवर्तन्ते सलिलाप्लुतवल्कलाः।।2.119.5।।
119_4.translation: The sages also  are returning in groups with waterpitchers filled with water and their bark robes soaked with water after their ceremonial bath.
119_4.word_by_word: एते मुनयः च these sages, अभिषेकार्द्राः wet through ablution, कलशोद्यताः carrying waterpitchers, सलिलाप्लुतवल्कलाः their bark robes soaked with water, सहिता: in groups, उपवर्तन्ते are returning.

119_5.shloka: ऋषीणामग्निहोत्रेषु हुतेषु विधिपूर्वकम्।कपोताङ्गारुणो धूमो दृश्यते पवनोद्धतः।।2.119.6।।
119_5.translation: The ascetics have duly offered oblations to the fire in Agnihotra sacrifices and the smoke, tawny like the pigeon's body, emanates wafted by the wind.
119_5.word_by_word: ऋषीणाम् of the ascetics, अग्निहोत्रेषु  in Agnihotra sacrifices, विधिपूर्वकम् duly, हुतेषु oblations offered, कपोताङ्गारुणः tawny like the pigeon's body, धूमः smoke, पवनोद्धतः raised by the wind, दृश्यते is seen.

119_6.shloka: अल्पपर्णा हि तरवो घनीभूतास्समन्ततः।विप्रकृष्टेन्द्रिये देशेऽस्मिन्न प्रकाशन्ति वै दिशः।।2.119.7।।
119_6.translation: The trees with sparse leaves all over have grown dense, the quarters in the distant region are no longer discernible by the senses.
119_6.word_by_word: समन्ततः on all sides, अल्पपर्णाः with sparse leaves, तरवः trees, घनीभूताः have grown dense, विप्रकृष्टेन्द्रिये with disturbed senses, अस्मिन् देशे in this region, दिशः the four quarters, न प्रकाशन्ति वै no longer look bright.

119_7.shloka: रजनीचरसत्त्वानि प्रचरन्ति समन्ततः।तपोवनमृगा ह्येते वेदितीर्थेषु शेरते।।2.119.8।।
119_7.translation: The night rangers have started moving everywhere and the deer in the penance  grove are beginning to sleep around the sacred altars.
119_7.word_by_word: रजनीचरसत्वानि the beings that range by night, समन्ततः everywhere, प्रचरन्ति are wandering, एते तपोवनमृगाः these deer of the penance grove, वेदितीर्थेषु around sacred altars, शेरते are sleeping.

119_8.translation: O Sita, adorned with stars, the night has commenced. You can see the moon rising in the sky spreading his mantle of light.
119_8.word_by_word: सीते O Sita, नक्षत्रसमलङ्कृता adorned with stars, निशा night, सम्प्रवृत्ता has commenced, ज्योत्स्नाप्रावरणः spread with the mantle of moonlight, चन्द्रः moon, अम्बरे in the sky, अभ्युदितः is rising, दृश्यते is appearing.

119_9.shloka: गम्यतामनुजानामि रामस्यानुचरी भव।कथायन्त्या हि मधुरं त्वयाऽहं परितोषिता।।2.119.10।।
119_9.translation: With my permission you may go now and be a companion of Rama. I am thoroughly contented  with your story told so sweetly.
119_9.word_by_word: गम्यताम् you may go now, अनुजानामि I give you my consent, रामस्य to Rama, अनुचरी भव be his companion, मधुरम् sweetly, कथयन्त्या storytelling, त्वया by you, अहम् I, परितोषिता  thoroughly contented.

119_10.shloka: अलङ्कुरु च तावत्त्वं प्रत्यक्षं मम मैथिलि।प्रीतिं जनय मे वत्से दिव्यालङ्कारशोभिता।।2.119.11।।
119_10.translation: O Sita, adorn yourself in my presence. Dear child, permit me the pleasure of  adorning  you with these divine ornaments.
119_10.word_by_word: मैथिलि O Sita, त्वम् you, मम my, प्रत्यक्षं तावत् in my presence, अलङ्कुरु adorn yourself, वत्से dear child, दिव्यालङ्कारशोभिता adorned with divine ornaments, मे to me, प्रीतिम् delight, जनय cause me.

119_11.shloka: सा तथा समलङ्कृत्य सीता सुरसुतोपमा।प्रणम्य शिरसा तस्यै रामं त्वभिमुखी ययौ।।2.119.12।।
119_11.translation: Sita, adorned, looked like the daughter of a god. She bowed at the feet of Anasuya in reverence and set out to meet Rama.
119_11.word_by_word: सुरसुतोपमा resembling the daughter of a god, सा सीता that Sita, तथा in that way, समलङ्कुत्य having adorned, तस्यै to her, शिरसा with her head, प्रणम्य saluting with reverence, रामम् to Rama, अभिमुखी towards, ययौ went.

119_12.shloka: तथा तु भूषितां सीतां ददर्श वदतां वरः।राघवः प्रीतिदानेन तपस्विन्या जहर्ष च।।2.119.13।।
119_12.translation: Rama, the most eloquent among men, saw Sita adorned, and rejoiced at the gifts of love given by the ascetic Anasuya.
119_12.word_by_word: वदताम् among those eloquent one, वरः excellent, राघवः Rama, तथा in that way, भूषिताम्  adorned, सीताम् Sita, ददर्श beheld, तपस्विन्याः of the female ascetic, प्रीतिदानेन with gifts oflove, जहर्ष च rejoiced.

119_13.shloka: न्यवेदयत्ततस्सर्वं सीता रामाय मैथिली।प्रीतिदानं तपस्विन्या वसनाभरणस्रजम्।।2.119.14।।
119_13.translation: Sita the princess of Mithila related everything to Rama and showed him the gifts of love given by ascetic Anasuya -- raiment, jewellery and garlands.
119_13.word_by_word: मैथिली the princess of Mithila, सीता Sita, ततः there after, तपस्विन्याः of ascetic Anasuya, प्रीतिदानम् gifts of love, वसनाभरणस्रजम् raiment, jewellery and garlands, सर्वम् everything, रामाय to Rama, न्यवेदयत् related.

119_14.shloka: प्रहृष्टस्त्वभवद्रामो लक्ष्मणश्च महारथः।मैथिल्यास्सत्क्रियां दृष्ट्वा मानुषेषु सुदुर्लभाम्।।2.119.15।।
119_14.translation: Rama the great charioteer and Lakshmana were exceedingly gratified to see the honour conferred on Sita, rare among mortals.
119_14.word_by_word: रामः Rama, महारथः great charioteer, लक्ष्मणश्च Lakshmana also, मानुषेषु among mortals, सुदुर्लभाम् very difficult to obtain, मैथिल्याः to Sita, सत्क्रियाम् the honour, दृष्ट्वा having seen, प्रहृष्टः अभवत् was gratified.

119_15.shloka: ततस्तां शर्वरीं प्रीतः पुण्यां शशिनिभाननः।अर्चितस्तापसै स्सिद्धैरुवास रघुनन्दनः।।2.119.16।।
119_15.translation: Thereafter, the descendant of Raghu, whose countenance resembled the Moon, having received the hospitality of the accomplished ascetics, passed that holy night in delight.
119_15.word_by_word: ततः thereafter, शशिनिभाननः face like the Moon, रघुनन्दनः the descendant of Raghu, सिद्धैःby the acomplished, तापसैः by ascetics, अर्चितः hospitality having been extended, प्रीतः indelight, पुण्याम् holy, तां शर्वरीम् that night, उवास passed.

119_16.shloka: तस्यां रात्र्यां व्यतीतायामभिषिच्य हुताग्निकान्।आपृच्छेतां नरव्याघ्रौ तापसान्वनगोचरान्।।2.119.17।।
119_16.translation: Night over, the two best men, Rama and Lakshmana, after their ablution took leave of the ascetics inhabiting the forest who offered morning oblations to the fire .
119_16.word_by_word: तस्याम् that, रात्र्याम् night, व्यतीतायाम् had passed away, नरव्याघ्रौ the two great men, अभिषिच्य having bathed, हुताग्निकान् who performed their fireofferings, वनगोचरान् inhabiting the  forest, तापसान् ascetics, अपृच्छेताम् took leave of.

119_17.shloka: तावूचुस्ते वनचरास्तापसा धर्मचारिणः।वनस्य तस्य सञ्चारं राक्षसैस्समभिप्लुतम्।।2.119.18।।
119_17.translation: The righteous ascetics dwelling in the forest informed both Rama and Lakshmana  that  part of the forest infested by demons.
119_17.word_by_word: वनचराः dwellers in the forest, धर्मचारिणः following the righteousness, ते तापसाः those ascetics, तस्य वनस्य of that forest, सञ्चारम् movement, राक्षसैः with demons, समभिप्लुतम्   inundated, तौ addressing both of them, ऊचुः said.

119_18.shloka: रक्षांसि पुरुषादानि नानारूपाणि राघव।वसन्त्यस्मिन्महारण्ये व्यालाश्च रुधिराशनाः।।2.119.19।।
119_18.translation: O Rama, this great forest is haunted by carnivorous demons who can assume anyform and by blooddrinking wild animals.
119_18.word_by_word: राघव O Rama, अस्मिन् महारण्ये in this great forest, पुरुषादानि maneaters, नानारूपाणि in various forms, रक्षांसि demons, रुधिराशनाः blooddrinking, व्यालाश्च wild animals, वसन्ति areliving.

119_19.shloka: उच्छिष्टं वा प्रमत्तं वा तापसं धर्मचारिणम्।अदन्त्यस्मिन्महारण्ये तान्निवारय राघव।।2.119.20।।
119_19.translation: O Rama, in this great forest demons will devour the  ascetics if they find them impure or intoxicated or indolent. Prevent them.
119_19.word_by_word: राघव Rama, अस्मिन् महारण्ये in this great forest, उच्छिष्टं वा or impure, प्रमत्तं वा or not alert, तापसम् an ascetic, अदन्ति they (eat) devour, तान् them, निवारय prevent them.

119_20.shloka: एष पन्था महर्षीणां फलान्याहरतां वने।अनेन तु वनं दुर्गं गन्तुं राघव ते क्षमम्।।2.119.21।।
119_20.translation: O Rama, this is the one path in the forest used by the ascetics to gather fruits. You can safely cross the otherwise impassable forest through this path.
119_20.word_by_word: राघव Rama, एषः वने in the forest, फलानि fruits, आहरताम् of those gathering, महर्षीणाम् ascetics, एष पन्थाः this path, अनेन through this path, दुर्गम् impassable, वनम् the forest, गन्तुम् to go, ते to you, क्षमम् is safe.

119_21.shloka: इतीव तैः प्राञ्जलिभिस्तपस्विभिर्द्विजैः कृतस्वस्त्ययनः परन्तपः।वनं सभार्यः प्रविवेश राघवस्सलक्ष्मणस्सूर्य इवाभ्रमण्डलम्।।2.119.22।।
119_21.translation: The ascetics offered their blessings to Rama the tormentor of enemies. Thereafter,accompanied by his wife and Lakshmana, he entered the great forest like the Sun entering the mass of clouds.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे श्रीमद्वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये चतुर्विंशत्सहस्रिकायां संहितयां श्रीमदयोध्याकाण्डे एकोनविंशत्युत्तरशततमस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the hundrednineteenth sarga in Ayodhyakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
119_21.word_by_word: प्राञ्जलिभिः (paying obeisance) with folded hands, तपस्विभिः by ascetics, तैः द्विजैः by those brahmins, इतीव thus, कृतस्वस्त्ययनः obtaining their blessings, परन्तपः tormentor of enemies, राघवः Rama, सभार्यः with his wife, सलक्ष्मणः with Lakshmana, सूर्यः Sun, अभ्रमण्डलम् इव like entering the mass of clouds, वनम् forest, प्रविवेश entered.
